processed_title: worldwide trend in hypertension prevalence and progress in treatment and control from 1990 to 2019 a pooled analysis of 1201 populationrepresentative study with 104 million participant
processed_abstract: background hypertension can be detected at the primary healthcare level and lowcost treatment can effectively control hypertension we aimed to measure the prevalence of hypertension and progress in it detection treatment and control from 1990 to 2019 for 200 country and territory method we used data from 1990 to 2019 on people aged 3079 year from populationrepresentative study with measurement of blood pressure and data on blood pressure treatment we defined hypertension a having systolic blood pressure 140 mm hg or greater diastolic blood pressure 90 mm hg or greater or taking medication for hypertension we applied a bayesian hierarchical model to estimate the prevalence of hypertension and the proportion of people with hypertension who had a previous diagnosis detection who were taking medication for hypertension treatment and whose hypertension wa controlled to below 14090 mm hg control the model allowed for trend over time to be nonlinear and to vary by age finding the number of people aged 3079 year with hypertension doubled from 1990 to 2019 from 331 95 credible interval 306359 million woman and 317 292344 million men in 1990 to 626 584668 million woman and 652 604698 million men in 2019 despite stable global agestandardised prevalence in 2019 agestandardised hypertension prevalence wa lowest in canada and peru for both men and woman in taiwan south korea japan and some country in western europe including switzerland spain and the uk for woman and in several lowincome and middleincome country such a eritrea bangladesh ethiopia and solomon island for men hypertension prevalence surpassed 50 for woman in two country and men in nine country in central and eastern europe central asia oceania and latin america globally 59 5562 of woman and 49 4652 of men with hypertension reported a previous diagnosis of hypertension in 2019 and 47 4351 of woman and 38 3541 of men were treated control rate among people with hypertension in 2019 were 23 2027 for woman and 18 1621 for men in 2019 treatment and control rate were highest in south korea canada and iceland treatment 70 control 50 followed by the usa costa rica germany portugal and taiwan treatment rate were less than 25 for woman and less than 20 for men in nepal indonesia and some country in subsaharan africa and oceania control rate were below 10 for woman and men in these country and for men in some country in north africa central and south asia and eastern europe treatment and control rate have improved in most country since 1990 but we found little change in most country in subsaharan africa and oceania improvement were largest in highincome country central europe and some uppermiddleincome and recently highincome country including costa rica taiwan kazakhstan south africa brazil chile turkey and iran interpretation improvement in the detection treatment and control of hypertension have varied substantially across country with some middleincome country now outperforming most highincome nation the dual approach of reducing hypertension prevalence through primary prevention and enhancing it treatment and control is achievable not only in highincome country but also in lowincome and middleincome setting funding who

processed_title: inflammation immunity and hypertension
processed_abstract: the immune system inflammation and hypertension are related to each other innate and adaptive immunity system trigger an inflammatory process in which blood pressure may increase stimulating organ damage cell in innate immune system produce ro such a superoxide and hydrogen peroxide which aimed at killing pathogen longterm inflammation process increase ro production causing oxidative stress which lead to endothelial dysfunction endothelial function is to regulate blood vessel tone and structure when inflammation last no bioavailability decrease disrupting it main function a vasodilator so that blood vessel relaxation and vasodilatation are absent effector t cell and regulatory lymphocyte part of the adaptive immune system play role in blood vessel constriction in hypertension signal from central nervous system and apc activates effector t lymphocyte differentiation and accelerate through th1 and th17 phenotype th1 and th17 effector participate in inflammation which lead to increased blood pressure one part of cd4 is the regulatory t cell tregs that suppress immune response activation a they produce immunosuppressive cytokine such a tgfbeta and il10 adoptive transfer of tregs cell can reduce oxidative stress in blood vessel endothelial dysfunction infiltration of aortic macrophage and t cell a well a proinflammatory cytokine level in plasma circulation

processed_title: pulmonary arterial hypertension in indonesia current status and local application of international guideline
processed_abstract: recent advance in the diagnosis and management of pulmonary arterial hypertension pah have led to a significant improvement in the outcome for patient with pah however prompt and accurate diagnosis of pah remains an unmet challenge due to lack of awareness and lack of meticulous data to profile the etiology and pathophysiology of this rare progressive disease especially in low and middleincome country in indonesia the true prevalence and incidence of different subtypes of pah in general population is still unknown the congenital heart disease in adult and pulmonary hypertension cohardph registry wa the first singlecenter prospective registry in indonesia which indicated that almost 80 of adult patient with congenital heart disease chd had experienced pah and even eisenmenger syndrome due to delayed diagnosis screening for early detection of asymptomatic chd in child is yet to be systematically established in indonesia leading to undiagnosed and uncorrected chd in adulthood there are no specific national guideline focusing on diagnostic workup and treatment of pah in indonesia furthermore the lack of adequate diagnostic facility limited treatment availability and limited drug coverage under the national health insurance scheme are key issue that remain unaddressed this review focus on the diagnosis treatment and management of pah associated with chd in indonesia a per international guideline we have proposed recommendation to effectively control and prevent pah associated with chd in indonesia the paper should be of interest to reader in the area of medical management and policy maker especially in low and middleincome country key highlight pulmonary arterial hypertension pah is a rare progressive subtype of pulmonary hypertension with poor overall prognosis and outcomesprompt and accurate diagnosis of pah remains an unmet challenge in low and middleincome country due to poor knowledge about the etiology and pathophysiology of this syndrome also the symptom and sign of earlystage pah are usually nonspecific or undetectable in newborn and infant thus presenting a challenge for physician to establish early diagnosis of pahthe challenging factor in low and middleincome country especially indonesia archipelago are limitation of healthcare infrastructure limited expertise lack of awareness lack of timely pah screening strategy poor antenatal care and unpredictable availability of pah medicationsthere are no specific national guideline focusing on diagnostic workup and treatment of pah in indonesia underutilization of treatment guideline and lack of adequate diagnostic treatment facility have resulted in suboptimal management of pah patient in indonesiaadherence to international guideline is an important aspect of pah management in indonesia updated disease and functional classification of pah a per international guideline along with new research finding on prognostic factor can help in making better management decision for pah patient at different stage of the disease

processed_title: asian management of hypertension current status home blood pressure and specific concern in indonesia
processed_abstract: over onethird of the population in indonesia ha hypertension almost twothirds of treated patient have uncontrolled blood pressure bp and the majority of patient with hypertension also have comorbidities home bp monitoring hbpm is a useful tool for diagnosing and managing hypertension the use of hbpm is recommended by the latest consensus from the indonesian society of hypertension 2019 and nearly all doctor recommend hbpm for hypertensive patient however the use of hbpm in indonesia is limited by the cost of device and a perception that these device are unreliable in addition knowledge about proper procedure is lacking withdrawal of mercury sphygmomanometer from the end of 2018 is expected to encourage the use of digital sphygmomanometer and the implementation of hbpm the most common antihypertensive agent used in indonesia varies by patient age being angiotensinconverting enzyme ace inhibitor in those aged 4060 year and calcium channel blocker ccbs in older patient across all age group combination therapy with a ccb plus an angiotensin receptor blocker wa common 4142 of patient the high prevalence of hypertension in indonesia ha an important economic impact and approach to increase awareness of the disease and adherence to therapy are needed particularly given data showing the benefit of strict bp control

processed_title: global burden of hypertension and systolic blood pressure of at least 110 to 115 mm hg 19902015
processed_abstract: importance elevated systolic blood sbp pressure is a leading global health risk quantifying the level of sbp is important to guide prevention policy and intervention objective to estimate the association between sbp of at least 110 to 115 mm hg and sbp of 140 mm hg or higher and the burden of different cause of death and disability by age and sex for 195 country and territory 19902015 design a comparative risk assessment of health loss related to sbp estimated distribution of sbp wa based on 844 study from 154 country published 19802015 of 869 million participant spatiotemporal gaussian process regression wa used to generate estimate of mean sbp and adjusted variance for each age sex country and year disease with sufficient evidence for a causal relationship with high sbp eg ischemic heart disease ischemic stroke and hemorrhagic stroke were included in the primary analysis main outcome and measure mean sbp level causespecific death and health burden related to sbp 110115 mm hg and also 140 mm hg by age sex country and year result between 19902015 the rate of sbp of at least 110 to 115 mm hg increased from 73 119 95 uncertainty interval ui 67 94978 241 to 81 373 95 ui 76 81485 770 per 100 000 and sbp of 140 mm hg or higher increased from 17 307 95 ui 17 11717 492 to 20 526 95 ui 20 28320 746 per 100 000 the estimated annual death rate per 100 000 associated with sbp of at least 110 to 115 mm hg increased from 1356 95 ui 12241481 to 1452 95 ui 13031599 and the rate for sbp of 140 mm hg or higher increased from 979 95 ui 8751081 to 1063 95 ui 9461181 for loss of dalys associated with systolic blood pressure of 140 mm hg or higher the loss increased from 959 million 95 uncertainty interval ui 8701049 million to 1430 million 95 ui 13021570 million corrected and for sbp of 140 mm hg or higher the loss increased from 52 million 95 ui 4657 million to 78 million 95 ui 7087 million the largest number of sbprelated death were caused by ischemic heart disease 49 million 95 ui 4057 million 545 hemorrhagic stroke 20 million 95 ui 1623 million 583 and ischemic stroke 15 million 95 ui 1218 million 500 in 2015 china india russia indonesia and the united state accounted for more than half of the global dalys related to sbp of at least 110 to 115 mm hg conclusion and relevance in international survey although there is uncertainty in some estimate the rate of elevated sbp 110115 and 140 mm hg increased substantially between 1990 and 2015 and dalys and death associated with elevated sbp also increased projection based on this sample suggest that in 2015 an estimated 35 billion adult had sbp of at least 110 to 115 mm hg and 874 million adult had sbp of 140 mm hg or higher

processed_title: application of artificial intelligence for hypertension management
processed_abstract: the prevalence of hypertension is increasing along with an aging population causing million of premature death annually worldwide low awareness of blood pressure bp elevation and suboptimal hypertension diagnosis serve a the major hurdle in effective hypertension management the advent of artificial intelligence ai however shed the light of new strategy for hypertension management such a remote support from telemedicine and big dataderived prediction there is considerable evidence demonstrating the feasibility of ai application in hypertension management a foreseeable trend wa observed in integrating bp measurement with various wearable sensor and smartphones so a to permit continuous and convenient monitoring in the meantime further investigation are advised to validate the novel prediction and prognostic tool these revolutionary development have made a stride toward the future model for digital management of chronic disease

processed_title: prevalence awareness treatment and control of hypertension among older adult in the philippine
processed_abstract: background little is known about the current prevalence and management of hypertension among older filipino to address this gap we examined the prevalence awareness treatment and control of hypertension a well a their correlate among older filipino method we analyzed a nationally representative survey of filipino aged 60 year and older n 5 985 in the philippine blood pressure bp measurement were taken using a digital bp apparatus people with hypertension included those with a systolic bp 140 mmhg or a diastolic bp 90 mmhg or those who reported current use of antihypertensive medication people with undiagnosed hypertension were those who had measured hypertension but had not been diagnosed by a doctor a having hypertension while people with untreated hypertension were those who had measured hypertension but not taking medication among those who were taking antihypertensive medication respondent with measured hypertension were considered to have uncontrolled bp result result showed that 691 of older filipino had hypertension but only 616 of people with hypertension were aware of their hypertension and 515 were untreated sociodemographic factor such a age sex education and living arrangement were significantly associated with hypertension prevalence hypertension awareness lack of treatment for hypertension andor suboptimal bp control conclusion we observed a high prevalence of hypertension among older filipino and a relatively low level of awareness and treatment of hypertension among them while there are government effort to address the growing prevalence of hypertension in the country more effort should be made to bring these government program to older filipino

processed_title: the gut microbiota microbiome in cardiovascular disease and it therapeutic regulation
processed_abstract: in the last two decade considerable interest ha been shown in understanding the development of the gut microbiota and it internal and external effect on the intestine a well a the risk factor for cardiovascular disease cvds such a metabolic syndrome the intestinal microbiota play a pivotal role in human health and disease recent study revealed that the gut microbiota can affect the host body cvds are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality and patient favor death over chronic kidney disease for the function of gut microbiota in the host molecule have to penetrate the intestinal epithelium or the surface cell of the host gut microbiota can utilize trimethylamine noxide shortchain fatty acid and primary and secondary bile acid pathway by affecting these living cell the gut microbiota can cause heart failure atherosclerosis hypertension myocardial fibrosis myocardial infarction and coronary artery disease previous study of the gut microbiota and it relation to stroke pathogenesis and it consequence can provide new therapeutic prospect this review highlight the interplay between the microbiota and it metabolite and address related intervention for the treatment of cvds

processed_title: work hour and the risk of hypertension the case of indonesia
processed_abstract: background individual working excessive hour is a worldwide phenomenon in indonesia over 32 million people work more than 40 h per week contributing to around 26 of the workforce excessive working may affect health increasing the risk of cardiovascular disease such a hypertension hypertension affected around 34 of indonesian adult approximately 633 million people and led to about 427000 death in 2018 and the prevalence remains high at 292 in 2023 this study aim to analyze the relationship between work hour and the risk of hypertension among working individual in indonesia method this study used a pooled crosssectional data from the indonesian family life survey ifls wave 4 2007 and wave 5 2014 and performed a logit regression analysis to examine the likelihood of a working individual having hypertension based on the individual work hour a dummy variable of hypertension is created based on the result of blood pressure measurement the sample consists of 22500 working individual in indonesia this study controlled for job characteristic sociodemographic status and healthbehavioral risk factor such a bmi and smoking behavior and performed additional regression analysis for alternative model to check for robustness result our finding showed that there is a higher probability of having hypertension for worker who work longer hour by 006 point for each additional hour of work p 001 other factor such a physical activity and smoking behavior have also been demonstrated to be significantly correlated to the risk of hypertension conclusion this study revealed a positive relationship between work hour and hypertension although this study can not suggest causality the strongly significant correlation may provide an idea and an overview regarding the risk of hypertension among working individual in indonesia the indonesian government could consider conducting further study to implement and promote flexible working arrangement initiative and incentive program to improve worker health outcome

processed_title: geospatial analysis of type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension in south sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: the spatial variation of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and hypertension and their potential linkage were explored in south sulawesi province indonesia the global morans i and regression analysis were utilized to identify the characteristic involved the method were performed based on t2dm and hypertension data from 2017 and 2018 acquired from social health insurance administration in indonesia the spatial variation of t2dm and hypertension showed that the prevalence rate of t2dm and hypertension tends to occur randomly p 0678 p 0711 respectively by utilizing generalized poisson regression analysis our study showed a significant relationship between t2dm and hypertension p 0001 this research could help policy maker to plan and support project with the aim of overcoming the risk of t2dm and hypertension

processed_title: the association between height and hypertension in indonesia
processed_abstract: there is growing interest in the influence of earlylife condition on the development of disease among disease in adulthood hypertension is particularly important for the developing world because considerably more people there are and will be afflicted with the disease than in the developed world and hypertensive there are often unaware of their disease status we employed height a a proxy for the influence of earlylife condition and estimated the relation between height and hypertension status in indonesia we analysed 9597 men and 10143 woman aged 2570 we employed a linear probability model to relate height to hypertension status by sex and age when we controlled for an array of covariates a 10cm increase in height wa related to an approximately 7 point reduction in the likelihood of being hypertensive for both men and woman this is about a quarter of the prevalence of hypertension in indonesia this relation wa linear and stronger among older individual in addition the pre and postpubertal environment measured by leg and trunk length respectively contributed similarly to hypertension further evidence suggests that woman are more likely to be hypertensive at older age because they are on average shorter than men

processed_title: districtlevel inequality in hypertension among adult in indonesia a crosssectional analysis by sex and age group
processed_abstract: background an estimated 128 billion adult 3079 year old had hypertension globally in 2021 of which twothirds lived in low and middleincome country lmics previous study on geographic and socioeconomic inequality in hypertension among adult have limitation a most study used individuallevel data while evidence from localitylevel data is also crucial for policymaking b study from lmics are limited thus our study examines geographic and socioeconomic inequality in hypertension among adult across district in indonesia method we combined geospatial and quantitative analysis to assess the inequality in hypertension across 514 district in indonesia hypertension data were obtained from the indonesian basic health survey riskesdas 2018 socioeconomic data were obtained from the world bank six dependent variable included hypertension prevalence among all adult 18 year male adult female adult young adult 1824 year adult 2559 year and older adult 60 year result we also found significant geographic and socioeconomic inequality in hypertension among adult across 514 district all hypertension indicator were higher in the most developed region than in the least developed region district in the java region had up to 50 higher prevalence of hypertension among all adult male female young adult adult and older adult notably district in the kalimantan region had the highest prevalence of hypertension even compared to those in java moreover income level wa positively associated with hypertension the wealthiest district had higher hypertension than the poorest district by up to 30 but only among male and older adult were statistically significant conclusion there were significant inequality in hypertension among adult across 514 district in the country policy to reduce such inequality may need to prioritize more affluent urban area and rural area with a higher burden

processed_title: effectiveness of communitybased diabetes and hypertension prevention and management programme in indonesia and viet nam a quasiexperimental study
processed_abstract: introduction noncommunicable disease ncds have surpassed infectious disease a the leading global cause of death with the southeast asian region experiencing a significant rise in ncd prevalence over the past decade despite the escalating burden screening for ncds remains at very low level resulting in undetected case premature mortality and high public healthcare cost we investigate whether communitybased ncd prevention and management programme are an effective solution method in indonesia we compare participant in the communitybased ncd screening and management programme po pembinaan terpadupenyakit tidak menular with matched nonparticipant with respect to their uptake of screening activity healthrelated behaviour and knowledge and metabolic risk factor we use statistical matching to redress a possible selection bias n1669 in viet nam we compare member of intergenerational selfhelp club which were offered similar ncd health service with member of other community group where such service were not offered we can rely on two wave of data and use a doubledifference approach to redress a possible selection bias and to measure the impact of participation n1710 we discus strength and weakness of the two approach in indonesia and viet nam result in indonesia participant have significantly higher uptake of screening for hypertension and diabetes 13 from a control mean of 88 95 ci 9 to 17 93 from a control mean of 48 95 ci 79 to 108 in both country participant show a higher knowledge about risk factor symptom and complication of ncds indonesia 029 sd 013045 viet nam 017 sd 003030 yet the improved knowledge is only partly reflected in improved health behaviour viet nam fruit consumption 033 sd 015051 vegetable consumption 027 sd 004050 body mass index bmi viet nam bmi 007 sd 013 to 000 or metabolic risk factor indonesia systolic blood pressure 013 sd 026 to 000 conclusion communitybased ncd programme are well suited to increase screening and to transmit health knowledge due to their extensive outreach within the community they can serve a a valuable complement to the screening service provided at the primary healthcare level yet limited coverage insufficient resource and a high staff turnover remain a problem trial registration number nct05239572

processed_title: enhancing adolescent hypertension prevention in indonesia through interactive multimedia model development and validation
processed_abstract: adolescent hypertension is emerging a a significant health challenge peerled intervention utilizing engaging multimedia platform have demonstrated the potential to enhance prevention behavior among adolescent however there remains a gap in the literature comparing the effectiveness of multimedia intervention with traditional lecturebased approach in adolescent hypertension prevention in indonesia the aim of this study wa to compare the traditional lecturebased approach and interactive multimedia intervention emodule animated video and infographics on adolescent knowledge attitude and practice regarding adolescent hypertension prevention a quasiexperimental study with pretest and posttest control group study wa conducted from june to december 2023 in two senior high school in district of pedurungan and kedungmundu semarang central java indonesia to prepare the multimedia model the analysis design development implementation and evaluation addie framework and mapping intervention approach were employed to ensure effective decisionmaking at each step a total of 100 high school student were involved with 50 assigned to the intervention group and 50 to the control group the intervention group received a multimedia model from the peer educator while the control group received a traditional powerpointbased presentation from the community healthcare worker the hypertension prevention knowledge attitude and practice were assessed using validated questionnaire with 20 15 and 15 item respectively this study found that after model implementation significant improvement were observed in student knowledge attitude and practice regarding hypertension prevention all had p0001 specifically knowledge score increased by 478 point attitude score by 1064 point and practice score by 29 point this study highlight that multimedia intervention could significantly improve hypertension prevention behavior among adolescent by enhancing their knowledge attitude and practice through engaging and interactive multimedia material

processed_title: socioeconomic inequality in the utilisation of hypertension and type 2 diabetes management service in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to describe socioeconomic inequality in the utilisation of hypertension and type 2 diabetes t2d management service in the indonesian population and to determine whether education level and geographical location contribute to inequality method crosssectional study using data from the 2014 indonesia family life survey n 30 762 for hypertension n 6758 for t2d socioeconomic status wa measured by household consumption the prevalence of hypertension and t2d wa determined using internationally standardised clinical measurement while disease management wa defined by participation in screening and current use of medication the relative index of inequality rii wa used to estimate inequality adjusted to education level and geographical location result for all household consumption quintiles we observed low rate of screening participation for t2d and low medication use in both hypertension and t2d we found socioeconomic inequality in screening participation for hypertension rii 268 95 ci 242296 and t2d rii 730 95 ci 548972 and also for medication use in hypertension rii 309 95 ci 228418 and t2d rii 281 95 ci 109727 education level contributed to socioeconomic inequality in screening utilisation for both hypertension and t2d geographical location contributed to inequality in screening utilisation and medication use for t2d socioeconomic inequality in medication use for hypertension and t2d were larger among men than woman conclusion large socioeconomic inequality were found in the utilisation of hypertension and t2d management service in indonesia improving affordability availability and approachability of service is crucial to reduce such inequality

processed_title: difference risk factor for hypertension among elderly woman in rural and urban indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction hypertension is a major risk factor for cardiovascular disease a high prevalence of hypertension is found in elderly woman rural area have different characteristic from urban area therefore it is necessary to identify risk factor for hypertension in rural and urban elderly woman for optimal therapy management method this crosssectional study wa conducted in rural banyuwangi district and urban surabaya city area east java indonesia the study wa carried out in 20152016 in woman aged 45 year residing in an area for 10 year and willing to collect urine for 24 hour respondent consisted of 54 older adult from rural area and 51 older adult from urban area who actively participate in the integrated healthcare center for the elderly the independent ttest and multivariate logistic regression were used to analyze the data result the prevalence of hypertension in the rural area wa 278 and in the urban area wa 3725 the risk factor for hypertension in the urban area were urine sodium level aor102 95 ci1001104 pvalue0043 urine potassium level aor088 95 ci0780999 pvalue0022 and body mass index aor126 95 ci106149 pvalue0008 meanwhile the factor associated with hypertension in the rural area wa age aor108 95 ci1003116 pvalue0042 conclusion the prevalence of hypertension in the urban area wa higher than in the rural area there were difference in risk factor for hypertension that occurred both in rural and urban area however risk factor in both area are equally important to overcome collaboration from multiple stakeholder and sector is urgently needed such a the public health center integrated assistance post for noncommunicable disease and the local health office

processed_title: the effect of educational program on hypertension management toward knowledge and attitude among uncontrolled hypertension patient in rural area of indonesia
processed_abstract: background hypertension is a major public health threat affecting adult worldwide the low hypertension management knowledge cause uncontrolled high blood pressure and it a complication it requires patient with uncontrolled hypertension to increase adherence to either pharmacological therapy or nonpharmacological therapy aimed at achieving normal blood pressure purpose the purpose of this study wa to examine the effectiveness of a shortterm educational program on hypertension management related knowledge and attitude among uncontrolled hypertension patient in malang indonesia method the research design used a quasiexperimental study with the design of one group preposttest the participant were 41 uncontrolled hypertension patient chosen by purposive sampling at the ciptomulyo public health center the questionnaire were used to collect the data the hypertension knowledgelevel scale hkls questionnaire wa used to determine the knowledge of uncontrolled hypertension patient kap questionnaire wa used to determine the attitude of the participant the data were analyzed statistically using the wilcoxon signed rank test result the majority of respondent were aged 5565 54 female 83 housewife 76 graduated elementary school 71 and long suffered from hypertension 1 year 68 the result showed that the provision of the educational program increase knowledge p 0000 and attitude p 0008 of patient on the management of hypertension conclusion health education could improve hypertension management knowledge and attitude among uncontrolled hypertension in the rural area furthermore health provider should consider giving the education among uncontrolled hypertension

processed_title: modifiable and nonmodifiable factor associated with low awareness of hypertension treatment in indonesia a crosssectional populationbased national survey
processed_abstract: introduction low awareness about hypertension treatment is recognized a a significant cause of treatment failure therefore identifying it underlying factor is essential for developing effective intervention strategy this study aim to identify the modifiable and nonmodifiable factor associated with low awareness about hypertension treatment method this national crosssectional populationbased survey used publicly available data from the indonesian family life survey ifls5 for 2014 among respondent with hypertension aged 15 year depression and insomnia a modifiable factor were assessed using the centre for epidemiologic studiesdepression cesd and the patientrecorded outcome measurement information system promis questionnaire respectively nonmodifiable factor such a sociodemographic information were obtained from selfreported data logistic regression analysis wa used to assess the association between these factor and low awareness about hypertension treatment odds ratio or with 95 confidence interval ci were reported result the study recruited 7920 respondent the majority of whom were female 538 and aged 60 year 711 the prevalence of low awareness of hypertension treatment wa 871 518 in woman and 482 in men being an elderly or 160 95ci 136188 being irregularly blood pressure control or 440 95 ci 378513 having depressive symptom or 135 95 ci 112162 having insomnia or 131 95 ci 111153 and having low satisfaction with health care or 128 95 ci 108151 were associated with low awareness of hypertension treatment surprisingly respondent with strong religiosity or 162 95 ci 125209 were more likely to display low awareness of hypertension treatment conclusion the main factor associated with low awareness of hypertension treatment are modifiable thus health care professional should integrate more patientspecific factor when designing tailored intervention

processed_title: hypertension and chronic kidney disease in asian population
processed_abstract: the country of asia are home to multiple ethnicity there are ethnic difference in diet culture and attitude towards health screening access to care and treatment of chronic disease chronic kidney disease ckd and endstage kidney disease eskd have rising incidence and prevalence due to increased affliction with noncommunicable disease of diabetes and hypertension to prevent the expensive complication of eskd one of the most important risk factor to control is hypertension in patient with ckd we performed a narrative review on the prevalence of ckd in patient with hypertension the prevalence and control of hypertension in patient with ckd and the dietary sodium intake in ckd population

processed_title: the implementation of communitybased diabetes and hypertension management care program in indonesia
processed_abstract: since 2010 indonesian government ha initiated a chronic disease management program prolanis program pengendalian penyakit kronis targeted for diabetes and hypertension the program is continued at the commencement of universal health coverage uhc in 2014 this study aimed to report the utilization and cost of the implementation of prolanis in indonesia from 2014 to 2016 or two year since the commencement of indonesian universal health coverage secondary data analysis wa performed using publicly available data and data obtained from the national health insurance agency bpjs while data on disease prevalence were collected from basic national health survey there wa an increase trend of prolanis participant from around 11000 participant in 2014 to more than 250000 in 2016 more than 70 of participant were adult living in java however the acceptance rate wa very low in other area across different activity in prolanis physical activity wa the most participated one in comparison to other region region in java were the most active area the total expenditure for prolanis program in 2016 increased almost triple from the annual cost in 2014 however the cost per person wa actually decreased more than 50 within two year of uhc implementation there were increase covered participant and total cost but cost per individual wa decreased and there wa significant difference in of cost between java and outside java further study and routine monitoringevaluation process by health authority is needed to assess whether the cost difference would affect the service quality

processed_title: gender difference in prevalence and risk factor for hypertension among adult population a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: although hypertension is among the main public health concern in indonesia due to the scarcity of data few study have investigated the factor associated with hypertension in men and woman this study aimed to examine the prevalence of and factor associated with hypertension among adult men and woman in indonesia the 2018 survey of the sleman health demographic and surveillance system wa utilized consisting of 4328 individual aged 18 year multivariable logistic regression analysis wa performed to determine the sociodemographic and health behavior factor of hypertension overall the prevalence of hypertension wa 40 42 in men and 38 in woman age abdominal obesity and chronic noncommunicable disease were the common predictor of hypertension in men and woman p 005 the odds ratio of hypertension among men with low education wa lower than among those with high education or 052 95 ci 029094 for woman being in the poorest socioeconomic condition increased the risk of hypertension by 167 time compared to the richest 95 ci 121232 gender difference in the prevalence of and factor associated with hypertension were observed among adult population in sleman district yogyakarta indonesia therefore a genderbased approach in the health prevention strategy to control hypertension for men and woman is needed

processed_title: hypertension and dementia a comprehensive review from the hope asia network
processed_abstract: approximately 365 million people in asia were classified a elderly in 2017 this number is rising and expected to reach approximately 520 million by 2030 the risk of hypertension and cognitive impairmentdementia increase with age recent data also show that the prevalence of hypertension and agerelated dementia are rising in asian country moreover not many people in asian country are aware of the relationship between hypertension and cognitive impairmentdementia furthermore hypertension control is poorer in asia than in developed country hypertension is known to be a major risk factor for damage to target organ including the brain decreased cognitive function can indicate the presence of target organ damage in the brain twentyfourhour blood pressure profile and blood pressure variability have been associated with cognitive impairment andor silent cerebral disease such a silent cerebral infarction or white matter lesion which are predisposing condition for cognitive impairment and dementia hypertension that occurs in midlife also affect the incidence of cognitive impairment in later life managing and controlling blood pressure could preserve cognitive function such a by reducing the risk of vascular dementia and by reducing the global burden of stroke which also affect cognitive function

processed_title: participation in communitybased health care intervention cbhis and it association with hypertension awareness control and treatment in indonesia
processed_abstract: background little attention ha been paid to whether cbhis improve awareness treatment and control of hypertension in the context of low and middle income country lmics this study therefore aim to examine participation in cbhis for noncommunicable disease ncds and it association with awareness treatment and control of hypertension among indonesian method this study used data from the 2014 indonesia family life survey ifls drawn from 30351 respondent aged 18 year and older participation in cbhis wa measured by respondent participation in cbhis for ncds posbindu ptm and posbindu lansia during the 12 month prior to the survey logistic regression were used to identify the relationship between participation in cbhis for ncds and awareness treatment and control of blood pressure among respondent with hypertension result the ageadjusted prevalence of hypertension wa 312 and 292 in urban and rural area respectively the overall ageadjusted prevalence wa 302 approximately 418 of respondent with hypertension were aware of their condition and only 66 of respondent were receiving treatment participation in cbhis for ncds wa associated with 50 higher odds of being aware and 118 higher odds of receiving treatment among adult with hypertension there wa no significant association between participation in cbhis for ncds and controlled hypertension conclusion our data emphasise the importance of cbhis for ncds to improve the awareness and treatment of hypertension in the indonesian population

processed_title: disaster hypertension and cardiovascular event in disaster and covid19 pandemic
processed_abstract: the incidence of large disaster ha been increasing worldwide this ha led to a growing interest in disaster medicine in this review we report current evidence related to disaster and coronavirus disease2019 covid19 pandemic such a cardiovascular disease during disaster management of disaster hypertension and cardiovascular disease associated with covid19 this review summarizes the time course and mechanism of disasterrelated disease it also discusses the use of information and communication technology ict a a cardiovascular risk management strategy to prevent cardiovascular event during the 2011 great east japan earthquake we used the disaster cardiovascular prevention system that wa employed for blood pressure bp monitoring and risk management using ict we introduced an ictbased bp monitoring device at evacuation center and shared patient bp value in the database to support bp management by remote monitoring which led to improved bp control effective use of telemedicine using ict is important for risk management of cardiovascular disease during disaster and pandemic in the future

processed_title: the congenital heart disease in adult and pulmonary hypertension cohardph registry a descriptive study from singlecenter hospital registry of adult congenital heart disease and pulmonary hypertension in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the congenital heart disease in adult and pulmonary hypertension cohardph registry is the first registry for congenital heart disease chd and chdrelated pulmonary hypertension ph in adult in indonesia the study aim to describe the demographic clinical presentation and hemodynamics data of adult chd and chdrelated ph in indonesia method the cohardph registry is a hospitalbased singlecenter and prospective registry which includes adult patient with chd and chdrelated ph the patient were enrolled consecutively for this study we evaluated the registry patient from july 2012 until july 2019 the enrolled patient underwent clinical examination electrocardiography chest xray 6min walking test laboratory measurement and transthoracic and transesophageal echocardiography right heart catheterization wa performed to measure hemodynamics and confirm the diagnosis of pulmonary artery hypertension pah result we registered 1012 patient during the study the majority were young adult female the majority of chd wa secundum asd 734 the main symptom wa dyspnea on effort the majority of patient 771 had already developed sign of ph assessed by echocardiography the eisenmenger syndrome wa encountered in 187 of the patient based on the right heart catheterization 669 of patient had developed pah patient with pah were significantly older had lower peripheral oxygen saturation had lower 6min walking distance and higher ntprobnp the ntprobnp level independently predicted the development of pah among chd conclusion the cohardph registry is the first indonesian adultchd and chdrelated ph registry the demographic clinical presentation and hemodynamics dataof this registry reflect the situation in developing country which need to be compared with similar registry from developed country

processed_title: diversity of and initiative for hypertension management in asiawhy we need the hope asia network
processed_abstract: the hypertension cardiovascular outcome prevention and evidence in asia hope asia network wa set up to improve the management of hypertension in asia with the ultimate goal of achieving zero cardiovascular event asia is a diverse continent and the prevalence of hypertension ha increased over the last 30 year there are a number of asiaspecific feature of hypertension and hypertensionrelated cardiovascular complication which mean that a regionspecific approach is needed whitecoat hypertension will become more of an issue over time a asian population age and masked hypertension is more prevalent in asian than in western country identifying and treating masked hypertension is important to reduce cardiovascular risk abnormal pattern of blood pressure bp variability common in asia include exaggerated early morning bp surge and nocturnal hypertension these are also important cardiovascular risk factor that need to be managed home blood pressure monitoring hbpm is an important tool for detecting whitecoat and masked hypertension and monitoring bp variability and practice in asia are variable use of hbpm is important given the asiaspecific feature of hypertension and strategy are needed to improve and standardize hbpm usage development of hbpm device capable of measuring nocturnal bp along with other information and communication technologybased strategy are key development in the widespread implementation of anticipation medicine strategy to detect and prevent cardiovascular event in patient with hypertension regionwide difference in hypertension prevalence control and management practice in asia highlight the importance of information sharing to facilitate best practice

processed_title: identifying relevant diabetes and hypertension control management guideline in primary healthcare and community setting in indonesia a delphi survey
processed_abstract: the burden of noncommunicable disease ncds in indonesia is increasing a evidenced by the latest indonesian national health research which show an increase in diabetes prevalence from 69 in 2013 to 109 in 2018 and hypertension from 258 in 2013 to 341 in 2018 hence effective action in community and primary health care phc facility setting are necessary to tackle the burden of diabetes and hypertension especially in low and middleincome country the indonesian government ha issued numerous guideline regarding ncds however not all these guideline can be applied to community or phcs this study aimed to identify priority guideline to support the community and phc for ncd management using the delphi survey method these prioritized guideline will serve a valuable resource for developing relevant operational and comprehensive module for community cadre and phc staff involved in ncd management the delphi survey involved 25 expert and comprised three round using a questionnaire 1 identification and assessment of guideline 2 assessment of the importance of guideline and 3 nomination of the three main priority guideline the result revealed three priority guideline ncd management guideline technical guideline for po pembinaan terpadu posbindu ncds and integrated service for ncds in phc facility additionally priority guideline were used to develop operational module for community cadre and phc staff in ncds management in conclusion utilizing the delphi method serf a a scientific approach to identify priority guideline crucial for supporting the community and phc in managing ncds particularly in country with context similar to indonesia

processed_title: association between triglycerideglucose index and hypertension a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: the triglycerideglucose tyg index is a simple and reliable indicator of insulin resistance which is an important contributor to the development of hypertension the aim of this metaanalysis wa to determine the doseresponse association between the tyg index and the incidence of hypertension an extensive search wa conducted through several database including pubmed embase sciencedirect and scopus until june 1 2024 the tyg index wa used a the exposure and the incidence of hypertension wa measured throughout the tyg index interval the effect estimate were presented a odds ratio or in both the unadjusted and adjusted model adjusted or were carried out from all included study to eliminate the possibility of confounding factor being involved in the incidence of hypertension a total of 108936 participant mean age 482 year old male 47 mean body mass index 239 kgm2 from 14 observational study were included the tyg index in the most eminent category wa related to a higher risk of hypertension in both unadjusted or 259 95ci 203331 p0001 i2 971 p0001 and adjusted model or 174 95ci 139219 p0001 i2 922 p0001 the doseresponse metaanalysis for the adjusted or showed that the linear association analysis wa not significant per 01 increase in the tyg index the doseresponse curve became increasingly steeper at the tyg index above 85 in conclusion the tyg index wa shown to be strongly linked with hypertension in a nonlinear doseresponse manner

processed_title: prevalence of hypertension and it risk factor among cotton textile worker in low and middleincome country a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective the objective of this study wa to evaluate the prevalence of hypertension and it risk factor among adult cotton textile worker in low and middleincome country lmics study design systematic review method a review of english article wa performed between january 1 2000 and december 31 2021 using the following database pubmedmedline scopus web of science and cochrane library study that measure the prevalence and risk factor of hypertension among adult cotton textile worker in lmics were included extraction of article and quality assessment of included study were performed independently by two author using the mixed method appraisal tool checklist result of 2476 title screened after duplication 50 study were shortlisted for fulltext review and a total of 10 study were included of those 10 study seven were carried out in india one in indonesia iraq and iran using stata version 6 the pooled prevalence of hypertension among the cotton textile worker wa 180 95 confidence interval 110250 random effect model i2 9712 classic risk factor including age family history of hypertension alcohol consumption body mass index and high waisttohip ratio were recounted whereas peculiar to the setting noise level improper use of earplug duration of noise exposure working duration and working in weaving section were reported conclusion the limited available evidence indicates a significant prevalence of hypertension among cotton worker in lmics in the wave of double burden of noncommunicable disease in developing country considering contextspecific risk factor is critical in controlling hypertension by prioritizing organizational plan and policy to optimize worker health prospero registration number crd42020167175

processed_title: difference in knowledge attitude and practice regarding hypertension by access to a communitybased screening program posbindu a crosssectional study from four district in indonesia
processed_abstract: background a high prevalence of hypertension is found in low and middleincome country lmics including in indonesia however hypertension awareness treatment and control are relativity poor a communitybased program to screen and educate people on noncommunicable disease prevention posbindu wa launched by the indonesian government however the association between participation in the posbindu program with increasing knowledge attitude and practice of hypertension ha not been widely assessed in this study we compared the knowledge attitude and practice among people who accessed the posbindu and those who did not access the posbindu program subsequently factor associated with the knowledge attitude and practice among people who accessed the posbindu and those who did not access the posbindu were explored method this wa an observational study with a crosssectional design measuring the knowledge attitude and practice for hypertension control in four district in indonesia from october 2019 to january 2020 a total of 1988 respondent were included in this study a questionnaire wa used to assess the knowledge attitude and practice of hypertension simple logistic regression wa used to investigate the correlation between the characteristic of respondent and knowledge attitude and practice status multiple logistic regression test were conducted to investigate factor associated with knowledge attitude and practice status result we found that people who accessed posbindu had higher odds of having better knowledge aor14 95ci1218 however accessed to posbindu wa associated with lower attitude aor06 85ci 0507 and had no association with hypertensionrelated practice conclusion people who accessed posbindu have an association with good knowledge but the association with good attitude and practice wa less clear therefore an improvement in the posbindu program is needed to increase the attitude and practice of hypertension

processed_title: intrauterine growth retardation and development of hypertension
processed_abstract: low birth weight lbw is defined a a birth weight of a liveborn infant of 2500 gram in developed country lbw is commonly caused by preterm birth while in developing country it is mostly due to intrauterine growth retardation the concept of developmental origin of adult disease particularly on lateonset disease such a hypertension and kidney disease implies that there is a correlation between intrauterine milieu intrauterine growth retardation premature birth and infant feeding the fetal origin hypothesis suggests that metabolic disease are directly related to poor nutritional status in early lifethere is an inverse association between lbw and later risk of hypertension the pathomechanism that link lbw and hypertension is multifactorial including delayed nephrogenesis genetic factor sympathetic hyperactivity endothel dysfunction elastin deficiency insulin resistance and activation of reninangiotension system

processed_title: mental health problem and hypertension in the elderly review from the hope asia network
processed_abstract: the triple burden of aging population hypertension and mental health problem making elderly in asia is more vulnerable there is evidence of a bidirectional relationship between mental health and hypertension which result in lower quality of life lower rate of treatment adherence and higher mortality among elderly individual it is essential to overcome known barrier and care for the elderly with highrisk factor in order to address these burden this review revealed that elderly with hypertension were more likely to suffer from depression and anxiety therefore debunking myth creating awareness regarding mental health and increasing access to mental health resource through holistic communitybased program would greatly reduce such problem and optimize the chance of success in controlling hypertensionrelated problem

processed_title: prevalence and determinant of obesity among individual with diabetes in indonesia
processed_abstract: background obesity and diabetes mellitus dm both individually or simultaneously increase the risk of morbidity and mortality the present study aimed to determine the prevalence and determinant of obesity among diabetic individual in indonesia method data were extracted based on 2018 indonesian basic health survey riset kesehatan dasarriskesdas this study involved all individual with dm and categorized obesity based on body mass index after data clearing this study analyzed 3911 dm subject of the 33905 subject acquired from the 2018 riskesdas the study also observed demographic data diabetes control parameter history of hypertension lipid profile and food consumption pattern these variable were involved in a chisquare test and related variable were then involved in the binary logistic regression to define the independent determinant of obesity among dm subject result of the 3911 dm subject included the study found an obesity prevalence of 329 this study found that female prevalence odds ratio por215 95 ci 176262 age 1544 year por246 95 ci 183333 urban residence por149 95 ci 125177 history of hypertension por125 95 ci 104151 high diastolic blood pressure por190 95 ci 158229 high ldl por144 95 ci 113184 high hdl por060 95 ci 046078 and high triglyceride por127 95 ci 107150 were the risk factor of obesity among dm subject while higher education por064 95 ci 053078 and married por073 95 ci 059090 were protective factor of obesity among dm subject conclusion the study concluded that almost onethird of dm subject in indonesia were obese female age urban residence education level history of hypertension diastolic blood pressure and lipid profile were all associated with obesity among dm subject in indonesia these finding suggest that monitoring and controlling of related determinant is needed to prevent complication caused by the doubled burden of diabetes and obesity

processed_title: national consensus on portal hypertension management in indonesia
processed_abstract: portal hypertension is a clinical syndrome that consists of hypersplenism ascites gastroesophageal varix and encephalopathy this condition is marked by increased portal pressure gradient and may occur with or without liver cirrhosis to date portal hypertension remains a the leading cause of severe complication and death of a patient with chronic liver disease especially liver cirrhosis therefore thorough understanding about management of portal hypertension is strongly required especially considering that many complication of portal hypertension require early diagnosis and treatment to improve the prognosis of the patient additionally although hepatic venous pressure gradient hvpg measurement ha become a gold standard procedure for measuring portal pressure in the last twenty year utilization of this method in indonesia ha been hindered by reluctance of the patient due to it invasiveness high cost and limited availability this consensus is developed with evidencebased medicine principle to provide a guideline for portal hypertension management for general practitioner specialist and consultant to achieve better clinical outcome of portal hypertension in indonesia keywords portal hypertension liver cirrhosis chronic liver disease

processed_title: role of dietary potassium and salt substitution in the prevention and management of hypertension
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease cvd continue to be the leading cause of death and disability worldwide and the major contributor is hypertension despite all the improvement in detecting hypertension together with technological advance and affordable efficacious and relatively free of adverse effect antihypertensive agent we continue to struggle to prevent the onset of hypertension and to control blood pressure bp to acceptable target the poor control of hypertension is commonly due to nonadherence to medication another reason is the failure to adopt diet and lifestyle change reduction of dietary salt intake is important for lowering bp but the role of potassium intake is also important globally the intake of sodium is double that of the recommended 2 gm per day equivalent to 5 gm of sodium chloridesalt and half that of the daily recommended intake of potassium of 3500 mgday giving a sodiumtopotassium ratio of 1 when ideally it should be 1 many study have shown that a higher potassium intake is associated with lower bps particularly when coupled concurrently with a lower sodium intake giving a lower sodium to potassium ratio most hypertension guideline while recommending reduction of salt intake to a set target do not specifically recommend a target for potassium intake nor potassium supplementation here we review the role of potassium and salt substitution with potassium in the management of hypertension hence the focus of dietary change to lower bp and improve bp control should not be on reduction of salt intake alone but more importantly should include an increase in potassium intake

processed_title: association between food consumptiondietary habit and the risk of obesity type 2 diabetes and hypertension a crosssectional study in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: backgroundobjectives this study aimed to assess the current mean daily intake of 10 food group analyze the sociodemographic factor associated with food consumption and determine the association between food consumptiondietary intake and the prevalence rate of obesity type 2 diabetes t2d and hypertension htn in jakarta indonesia subjectsmethods a total of 600 participant aged 2085 yr were included in this crosssectional study food consumption and dietary habit were assessed using a food frequency questionnaire to determine the association between food consumptiondietary habit and the abovementioned disease logistic regression analysis wa performed result the average vegetable and fruit intake wa lower while sugar and salt consumption were higher than that recommended by indonesia national dietary guideline a high intake of ultraprocessed food upfs wa associated with young age men single status a high education level and employment with a high monthly income obesity and t2d were positively correlated with high intake of cereal and tuber upfs sugar fat and oil conversely an inverse association wa found between legume vegetable and fruit consumption and obesity risk an inverse correlation wa also observed between vegetable consumption and t2d risk moreover a high salt intake wa inversely correlated with fruit consumption in term of htn risk nonindulgence in habitual latenight snacking and refrainment from consuming more than one dish at each meal were also negatively related to the prevalence of obesity t2d and htn inverse correlation were also observed between the prevalence rate of t2d and htn and abstaining from adding sugar to beverage conclusion food high in fat sugar and sodium were strongly associated with the risk of obesity t2d and htn additionally poor eating habit were also associated with disease development

processed_title: prevalence and associated factor for prehypertension and hypertension among indonesian adolescent a crosssectional community survey
processed_abstract: objective to estimate the prevalence and determine the associated factor for developing prehypertension and hypertension among indonesian adolescent design national crosssectional study setting this study wa conducted in all the province in indonesia participant the population in this study were all household member in basic health research 2013 aged 1519 year the sample wa all member of the 2013 riskesdas household aged 1519 year with the criterion of not having physical and mental disability and having complete data the number of sample analysed wa 2735 comprising men n1319 and woman n1416 main outcome dependent variable were prehypertension and hypertension in adolescent based on blood pressure measurement result the result of the analysis showed that the prevalence of prehypertension in adolescent wa 168 and hypertension wa 26 in all adolescent the risk factor for prehypertension were boy adjusted or aor 148 95 ci 110 to 197 18 year old aor 1464 95 ci 939 to 2280 and 19 year old aor 1989 95 ci 1241 to 3188 and obese aor 216 95 ci 102 to 458 risk factor for hypertension in all adolescent included the age of 18 year old aor 306 95 ci 128 to 734 and 19 year aor 325 95 ci 125 to 841 and obesity aor 569 95 ci 220 to 148 in adolescent girl the chance of developing prehypertension increased with increasing age and lowdensity lipoprotein ldl cholesterol level several risk factor for hypertension in adolescent boy were age central obesity and ldl cholesterol level conclusion this study show that the trend of prehypertension in adolescent ha appeared besides hypertension there are distinct pattern of factor that influence it in adolescent girl and boy which can be useful to sharpen of planning and implementing health programme

processed_title: comparison of guideline for the management of hypertension similarity and difference between international and asian country perspective from hopeasia network
processed_abstract: guideline on the management of hypertension have been developed by various professional body and institution to primarily address the issue of diagnosis treatment and control in order to rationalize and improve the management of hypertension hypertension guideline across the world have recently been updated following the new and controversial lower blood pressure threshold of 13080 mmhg for the diagnosis of hypertension adopted by the american while there are difference between the major a well a between the asian national guideline there were also many similarity this paper discusses and highlight the difference and similarity between the major international guideline of the american college of cardiologyamerican heart association of the european society of cardiologyeuropean society of hypertension and of the international society of hypertension and also compare them with the asian guideline

processed_title: determinant of hypertension amongst rice farmer in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: the hypertension rate in indonesia ha increased significantly in the past five year but there is limited information about the hypertension risk of farmer our study assesses the prevalence of hypertension in this population and examines the proportional risk of various work environment and lifestyle factor among farmer a crosssectional study wa conducted in high and low heat stress agriculture area of west java indonesia there were 354 male farmer aged 25 to 73 year old who participated in the study we measured blood pressure and used a questionnaire on selfreported use of antihypertension drug or diagnosis by a medical professional to define hypertension we assessed occupational factor including farming method heat stress and pesticide use and personal factor including obesity food intake smoking status alcohol consumption multivariate analysis wa used to evaluate factor potentially associated with prevalence of hypertension fortysix percent of farmer experience hypertension farming in a location with higher heat stress wbgt wa significantly associated with increased risk of hypertension adjusted prevalence ratio apr 141 95 confidence interval ci 101 195 farmer who used pesticide sprayer had an increased risk of hypertension apr 190 95 ci 093 387 no personallifestyle characteristic were significantly associated with hypertension although ever smoking and ever consuming alcohol had an increased prevalence of hypertension this study show the importance of work environmental factor in the prevalence of hypertension and the necessity of public health education identification and treatment of this silent killer among indonesian farmer

processed_title: relationship of angiotensin converting enzyme gene polymorphism and hypertension in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to evaluate the association between ace gene polymorphism id and hypertension in yogyakarta population method this study is a crosssectional sample wa taken by random sampling method from hypertensive prehypertensve and normotensive subject from that were obtained 125 subject 97 subject and 108 subject consecutively ace gene polymorphism id wa examined by pcr genotype wa classified a ii id or dd based on positive or negative insertiondelation allele result this study show significant difference of three group age body mass index bmi and family history of hypertension and total cholesterol level in blood which tends to have greater value in the hypertension group frequency of genotype ii id dd are 85 68 39 312 1 08 in hypertension 66 611 38 352 4 37 in normotension and 56 577 37 381 4 41 in prehypertension subject consecutively chisquare analysis show statistically significant association between iddd v ii genotype and hypertension multiple logistic regression analysis show four variable that significantly influence to hypertension namely age family history of hypertension bmi and ace gene polymorphism conclusion ace iddd genotype ha significant relationship with hypertension in melati population sleman yogyakarta indonesia

processed_title: hypertension and erectile dysfunction the role of endovascular therapy in asia
processed_abstract: the prevalence of erectile dysfunction ed is above 40 in both asian and nonasian male population after the age of 40 year the prevalence of ed among hypertensive patient is approximately double than that in normotensive population pelvic arterial insufficiency is the predominant cause of ed in men aged over 50 year stenosis in any segment of the iliacpudendalpenile arterial system which is considered an erectilerelated arterial axis could lead to ed pharmacotherapy with lifestyle modification is effective in alleviating sexual dysfunction yet a substantial number of patient still develop ed given the established applicability of angioplasty for the entire iliacpudendalpenile arterial system penile duplex ultrasound and pelvic computed tomography angiography could be considered a the routine screening tool in ed patient with poor response to phosphodiesterase5 inhibitor endovascular therapy for pelvic arterial insufficiencyrelated ed ha been shown to be a safe and effective treatment option in patient who have anatomically suitable vessel and functionally significant stenosis clinical improvement wa achieved in over 60 of patient at one year following pelvic angioplasty in the perfect registry from taiwan a 3040 restenosis rate in distal internal pudendal and penile artery remains a hurdle angioplasty for pelvic arterial occlusive disease could be considered a a viable approach to arteriogenic ed

processed_title: factor affecting selfreported medication adherence and hypertension knowledge a crosssectional study in rural village yogyakarta province indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study assessed medication adherence and hypertension knowledge and their predictive factor in people with hypertension living in rural community in indonesia method data were acquired from 384 people living in eight rural village via a researcheradministered questionnaire a validated adherence scale and a standardized hypertension knowledge survey multivariate analysis wa used to identify the predictor of adherence and knowledge result fiftynine 15 participant had good hypertension knowledge score 8 out of 10 compared to participant with poor knowledge these participant had higher formal education odds ratio 27 95 confidence interval 1547 and lived closer to a community health center odds ratio 18 95 confidence interval 1033 knowledge gap about the need for longterm medication hypertension complication and the target blood pressure were identified good hypertension knowledge predicted good adherence to medication odds ratio 71 95 confidence interval 33152 only 42 11 participant were considered to have good adherence reason for intentional nonadherence were belief that medicine should be taken only when symptom are evident limited access to healthcare service and a preference using traditional medicine conclusion strategy for addressing knowledge gap and misconception about hypertension medication are needed particularly for people with a low educational level and those living some distance from healthcare facility

processed_title: impact of coming demographic change on the number of adult in need of care for hypertension in brazil china india indonesia mexico and south africa
processed_abstract: over the coming decade middleincome country are expected to undergo substantial demographic change we estimated the consequence of these change on the number of adult in need of hypertension care between 2015 and 2050 using nationally representative householdsurvey data collected in brazil china india indonesia mexico and south africa n770 121 to reflect unmet need for healthcare we defined hypertension a systolic blood pressure 140 mm hg or diastolic blood pressure 90 mm hg regardless of treatment status using a mathematical disease projection equation we calculated the change in the number of individual in need of hypertension care in each country that wa due to change in population size age composition and agespecific prevalence under various epidemiological scenario if the current agespecific prevalence schedule of hypertension remains unchanged until 2050 demographic change alone will increase the number of adult in need of hypertension care by 3197 million individual ranging from a relative growth of 55 in china to 151 in mexico even if the agespecific prevalence of hypertension is reduced by 25 by 2050 among adult aged 40 year the number of individual in need of hypertension care will still increase by 1459 million individual with relative increase ranging from 16 in china to 88 in mexico overall our result suggest that coming demographic change in middleincome country will overpower even ideal prevention effort middleincome country will need to massively expand healthcare service for agingrelated disease such a hypertension if they are to meet the virtually inevitable future increase in care need for these condition

processed_title: the influence of the ambient temperature on blood pressure and how it will affect the epidemiology of hypertension in asia
processed_abstract: epidemiologic study have consistently demonstrated an increased risk of cardiovascular disease during colder temperature hemodynamic change associated with cold temperature and an increase in thrombogenicity may both account for the increase in cardiovascular risk and mortality study using both inoffice and outofoffice bp measurement have consistently shown an elevation in bp during the colder season the large difference in bp between cold and warm month may increase the incidence of hypertension and reduce the hypertension control rate potentially resulting in increased cardiovascular risk especially among those at risk of cardiovascular disease the current trend in global warming and climate change may have a profound impact on the epidemiology of hypertension and cardiovascular disease a change in the climate may significantly affect both bp variability and cardiovascular disease especially in those with high cardiovascular risk and the elderly furthermore climate change could have a significant influence on hypertension in asia considering the unique characteristic of hypertensive patient in asia a an increase in ambient temperature decrease the mean daytime average and morning surge in bp but increase the nocturnal bp it is difficult to predict how environmental change will affect the epidemiology and prognosis of hypertension in the asianpacific region however these seasonal variation in bp could be minimized by adjusting the housing condition and using anticipation medicine in this review we discus the impact of seasonal variation in the ambient temperature on hypertension and cardiovascular disease and discus how this may impact the epidemiology of hypertension and cardiovascular disease

processed_title: prevalence awareness treatment and control of hypertension in indonesian adult aged 40 year finding from the indonesia family life survey ifls
processed_abstract: objective hypertension is the major driver of the cardiovascular epidemic facing indonesia in the 21st century understanding the socioeconomic inequality associated with hypertension is essential for designing effective intervention strategy the aim of the current study wa to use subnationally representative survey data to examine sociodemographic inequality in the prevalence diagnosis and management of hypertension in indonesian adult method we investigated factor associated with hypertension prevalence diagnosis treatment and control using data on selfreported diagnosis and treatment and blood pressure measurement collected from 9755 respondent aged 40 year and up in the 2007 indonesian family life survey ifls 4 result agestandardized prevalence of hypertension among the study participant wa 478 95 ci 468 489 of which almost 70 were undiagnosed hypertension wa significantly higher in woman than men 523 versus 431 pvalue0001 prevalence of hypertension increased significantly with ageing pfor trend 0001 over 91 men 921 woman 900 of hypertension case were uncontrolled gender education and socioeconomic status had differential impact on the diagnosis of hypertension and in receiving treatment conclusion overall less than a third were aware of their hypertension and a quarter of those on medication had their blood pressure effectively controlled men and those of younger age were more vulnerable to have undiagnosed and untreated hypertension substantial effort should be given to improve awareness about the condition and making provision for early diagnosis and treatment

processed_title: sick but unaware hypertension in indonesia
processed_abstract: discrepancy between selfreported and measured hypertension pose a great risk to health because they prevent timely treatment analyzing the indonesian family life survey we compared selfreported and measured hypertension to assess the extent of the misclassification of hypertension building on this we estimated factor related to selfreported and measured hypertension our result show that different factor were involved in each case suggesting that they are two different phenomenon more importantly we estimated factor that increased awareness of hypertension and found that visiting a health facility wa a very effective way of increasing awareness of hypertension among hypertensive patient

processed_title: comparison between the world health organization who and international society of hypertension ish guideline for hypertension
