processed_abstract: the global burden of hypertension remains an unsolved problem especially in low and middleincome country lmics for this reason clinical practice guideline containing the latest evidencebased recommendation are crucial in the management of hypertension it is noteworthy that guideline simply translated from those of highincome country hics are not the solution to the problem of hypertension in lmics among the numerous guideline available those of the world health organisation and the international society of hypertension are the latest to be published a of the writing of this article in this review we conducted both general and specific comparison between the recommendation supplied by both guideline difference in aspect of hypertension management such a the timing of antihypertensive initiation assessment of comorbidities and cardiovascular risk factor pharmacological therapy selection and blood pressure target and reassessment are explored lastly the implication of the difference found between the two guideline in both lmics and hics are discussedkey messagescurrently with low treatment and control rate hypertension remains a burden in low and middleincome country lmicsthe lack of customised guideline for lmics can not be solved simply by adopting guideline from highincome countriesthe world health organisation who recently published a clinical guideline for the pharmacological management of hypertension in lmics we compare select recommendation from the guideline to those published by the international society of hypertension

processed_title: association of general and central obesity with hypertension
processed_abstract: background aim hypertension a a risk factor for cardiovascular disease ha growing prevalence an increase in body weight is typically followed by an increase in blood pressure this study aimed to investigate the association of general and central obesity with hypertension in indonesian woman using who and indonesian classification system method crosssectional study of indonesian woman aged 18 year or and more 313714 participant using national level indonesia national basic health research 2013 result the prevalence of hypertension in indonesian woman in this study wa 328 based on logistic regression analysis hypertension wa significantly associated with residential area educational attainment selfreported smoking status cardiovascular disease chronic kidney disease diabetes mellitus body mass index and waist circumference furthermore the odds of having hypertension for general and central obesity according to who classification were adjusted odds ration aor 261 95 ci 252270 and aor 150 95 ci 146153 by indonesian classification were aor 221 95 ci 216226 and aor 148 95 ci 145151 conclusion by using international who and standard indonesia classification system general and central obesity were associated with hypertension in indonesia woman thus not only general obesity but also central obesity should be used to assess obesity in indonesian woman

processed_title: clinical finding and electrocardiography predicted mortality among covid19 patient with preexisting hypertension a crosssectional study of east java province indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to evaluate the factor associated with mortality among coronavirus disease2019 patient with preexisting hypertension method the retrospective crosssectional study wa conducted from june 15 to july 7 2021 after approval from dr soetomo general province hospital indonesia and comprised data from the coronavirus disease2019 registry in the east java province of indonesia from march 2020 to june 2021 data wa collected for adult patient infected by coronavirus disease2019 with preexisting hypertension data wa analysed using spss 23 result of the 2732 patient in the registry 425156 with median age 565 year interquartile range 5064 year had preexisting hypertension of them 2515906 were male and 110259 had died while in hospital mortality wa associated with older age higher white blood cell count at admission and lower platelet count p005 in addition electrocardiogram parameter associated with mortality were faster heart rate and st abnormality p005 conclusion older age high white blood cell level lower platelet count faster heart rate and st abnormality at admission were found to be the predictor of mortality among hospitalised coronavirus disease2019 patient with preexisting hypertension

processed_title: seeking treatment profile of male shift worker with hypertension and diabetes
processed_abstract: objective this study wa identified seeking treatment for hypertension and diabetes among male shift worker method this retrospective cohort study included nine large company in japan data were collected from health checkup health insurance record and selfadministered questionnaire in 2017 and 2020 data were analyzed using kaplanmeier curve and cox regression result persondays shift worker and day worker seeking treatment for hypertension were 41604 and 327301 respectively and for diabetes were 7326 and 60735 respectively the log rank were statistically significant shift worker were 46 and 56 less likely to seek treatment for hypertension and diabetes respectively than day worker were after adjustment for age marital status education level and intention to modify lifestyle model 2 p 001 conclusion male shift worker are less likely to seek treatment for hypertension and diabetes compared with day worker

processed_title: trend and cause of maternal mortality in indonesia a systematic review
processed_abstract: background the maternal mortality ratio mmr in indonesia is among the highest in southeast asia we aim to describe trend in the mmr and cause of maternal death in indonesia over the past decade regionally and nationally method we performed a systematic review and conducted a search using pubmed embase global health cinahl cochrane portal garuda and google scholar from the inception of the database to april 2023 we included all study on the incidence andor the cause of maternal death in indonesia the mmr wa defined a the number of maternal death per 100000 live birth maternal death cause were assessed and reclassified according to the who international classification of disease maternal mortality icdmm result we included 63 study that reported the mmr 54 study andor the cause of maternal death 44 study in indonesia from 1970 to 2022 with a total of 254796 maternal death the national mmr declined from 450 to 249 45 between 1990 and 2020 great difference in mmr exist across the country with the lowest in javabali and the highest more than twice the national mmr in sulawesi and eastern indonesia between 1990 and 2022 the proportion of death due to hemorrhage and sepsis decreased respectively from 48 to 18 and 155 while the share of death due to hypertensive disorder and nonobstetric cause increased respectively from 8 to 19 and 1049 conclusion despite the steady decline of maternal death in indonesia it remains one of the highest in southeast asia with enormous disparity within the country hypertensive disorder and noncommunicable disease make up a growing share of maternal death making maternal death reduction strategy increasingly challenging national maternal death surveillance and response need to be prioritized to eliminate preventable maternal death in indonesia registration of systematic review prospero crd42022320213

processed_title: phytochemistry and pharmacology of medicinal plant used by the tenggerese society in java island of indonesia
processed_abstract: the archipelagic country of indonesia is inhabited by 300 ethnic group including the indigenous people of tengger based on the reported list of medicinal plant used by the tengger community we have reviewed each of them for their phytochemical constituent and pharmacological activity out of a total of 41 medicinal plant used by the tengerrese people 33 specie were studied for their phytochemical and pharmacological property more than 554 phytochemical with diverse molecular structure belonging to different chemical class including flavonoid terpenoids saponin and volatile were identified from these studied 34 medicinal plant many of these medicinal plant and their compound have been tested for various pharmacological activity including antiinflammatory antimicrobial wound healing headache antimalarial and hypertension five popularly used medicinal plant by the healer were garcinia mangostana apium graveolens cayratia clematidea drymocallis arguta and elaeocarpus longifolius only a graviolens were previously studied with the outcome supporting the pharmacological claim to treat hypertension few unexplored medicinal plant are physalis lagascae piper amplum rosa tomentosa and tagetes tenuifolia and they present great potential for biodiscovery and drug lead identification

processed_title: prevention and management of hypertension in middleaged and elderly through screening and education prepost intervention
processed_abstract: maintaining quality of life and physical health in the elderly is crucial for their overall wellbeing hypertension a prevalent condition among the elderly in indonesia requires targeted intervention to mitigate it impact a quasiexperimental prepost intervention study wa conducted in bandar lor kediri city indonesia involving 106 elderly participant the paguyuban raga paruh baya lansia sejahtera purabaya a senior wellness group program aimed to improve hypertension management through educational session on physical activity nutrition and hypertension management exercise the program significantly increased participant knowledge of physical activity median increase from 5962 to 8269 and nutrition median increase from 8051 to 9538 systolic blood pressure decreased markedly median from 17386 mmhg to 14253 mmhg indicating improved hypertension control however there wa no significant change in diastolic blood pressure the finding underscore the effectiveness of targeted educational intervention in enhancing health literacy and managing systolic blood pressure among the elderly the purabaya program success suggests it potential for scalability and adaptation to broader public health initiative

processed_title: core healthcomponents contextual factor and program element of communitybased intervention in southeast asia a realist synthesis regarding hypertension and diabetes
processed_abstract: background in southeast asia diabetes and hypertension are on the rise and have become major cause of death communitybased intervention can achieve the required behavioural change for better prevention the aim of this review are 1 to assess the core healthcomponents of communitybased intervention and 2 to assess which contextual factor and program element affect their impact in southeast asia method a realist review wa conducted combining empirical evidence with theoretical understanding document published between 2009 and 2019 were systematically searched in pubmedmedline web of science cochrane library google scholar and psycinfo and local database document were included if they reported on communitybased intervention aimed at hypertension andor diabetes in southeast asian context and had a healthrelated outcome andor described contextual factor andor program element result we retrieved 67 scientific document and 12 grey literature document we identified twelve core healthcomponents community health worker family support educational activity comprehensive program physical exercise telehealth peer support empowerment activity to achieve selfefficacy lifestyle advice activity aimed at establishing trust and storytelling in addition we found ten contextual factor and program element that may affect the impact implementation problem organized in group cultural sensitivity synergy access family healthworker support gender involvement of stakeholder and referral and education service when giving lifestyle advice conclusion we identified a considerable number of core healthcomponents contextual influence and program element of communitybased intervention to improve diabetes and hypertension prevention the main innovative outcome were that telehealth can substitute primary healthcare in rural area storytelling is a useful contextadaptable component and comprehensive intervention can improve healthrelated outcome this extends the understanding of promising core healthcomponents including which element and in what southeast asian context

processed_title: predicting change in systolic and diastolic blood pressure of hypertensive patient in indonesia using machine learning
processed_abstract: purpose of review this retrospective study investigated factor that influence the occurrence of decreased systolic and diastolic blood pressure including sociodemographic and economic factor hypertension duration cigarette consumption alcohol consumption duration of smoking type of cigarette exercise salt consumption sleeping pill consumption insomnia and diabetes these factor were applied to predict the reality of systolic and diastolic decrease using the machine learning algorithm naive bayes artificial neural network logistic regression and decision tree recent finding the increase in blood pressure both systolic and diastolic is very harmful to the health because uncontrolled high systolic and diastolic blood pressure can cause various disease such a congestive heart failure kidney failure and cardiovascular disease there have been many study examining the factor that influence the occurrence of hypertension but few study have used machine learning to predict hypertension the machine learning model performed well and can be used for predicting whether a person with hypertension with certain characteristic will experience a decrease in their systolic or diastolic blood pressure after treatment with antihypertensive drug

processed_title: an overview of hypertension and cardiac involvement in asia focus on heart failure
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease cvd is the leading cause of death worldwide contributing to about 30 of all death half of the case of cvd are estimated in asia the world most populous continent hypertension a major modifiable risk factor for cvd result in more death than any other cv risk factor in the asian region the total number of patient with hypertension is likely to grow a the population age the proportion of the elderly population aged 65 year or more in asia is expected to increase from 74 in 2015 to 109 in 2030 it is important to note that more than half 54 of the world population live in asia aside of being the biggest single risk factor for global death hypertension is also an important precursor and most common risk factor of heart failure hf an increase in hf prevalence is clearly related to the rapid epidemiological transition caused by change in lifestyle in asian country however the availability of data on hf burden and health care delivery is limited in asia compared with europe and north america this reality ha driven the working group of asian expert for example the hope asia network to concentrate on hypertension a risk factor for cvd with the mission to improve the management of hypertension resulting in organ protection toward a goal of achieving zero cv event in asia this paper aim to give an overview regarding the heart problem caused by hypertension in asia focus on hf

processed_title: isolated systolic hypertension in asia
processed_abstract: isolated systolic hypertension ish is the most common type of essential hypertension in the elderly and young adult with rapid industrialization and population aging the prevalence of ish in asia will rise substantially asian population have distinct epidemiological feature risk factor and are especially vulnerable to ish there is a pressing need for asian country to formulate their unique strategy for control of ish in this review we focus on the 1 epidemiology and pathophysiology 2 risk factor and impact on outcome and 3 treatment goal and strategy for ish in asia

processed_title: chronic kidney disease care in indonesia challenge and opportunity
processed_abstract: the burden of chronic kidney disease ckd is a significant global health concern previous study reported that the ckd incidence reached 200 case per million per year in many country with the prevalence 115 48 in stage 12 and 67 in stage 35 other study further reported that the estimate prevalence of ckd wa 15 higher in low and middleincome country compared to the highincome country however there are limited statistic available on the epidemiology of ckd in indonesia according to the basic health research riset kesehatan dasar riskesdas 2018 the prevalence of ckd in indonesia increased from 02 in 2013 to 03 in 2018 these result may understate the true prevalence of ckd in our population despite the limited data on the ckd prevalence the number of patient receiving kidney replacement treatment krt primarily in the form of hemodialysis is rapidly rising ie more than 132000 in 2018a comprehensive nephrology referral system is also a challenge we can argue this statement with evidence from the tertiary care where it wa reported that most kidney failure patient 83 commenced dialysis with an urgent start along with late referral to nephrologist 90 started dialysis with temporary catheter 952 and the median egfr to start dialysis wa 53 range 06 146 mlminute173 m2 however individual awareness a well a an effective screening and prevention program for highrisk group are also a significant hurdle since 2022 the ministry of health ha initiated a health transformation program to improve the health system to address health disparity both within the country and between country one of the health transformation program which specify in nephrology care is the implementation of the uronephrology support program program pengampuan uronefrologi with the aim to strengthen service provide equal distribution of service and increase the latest technology for the diagnosis and treatment of urologynephrology disease in indonesia this program included secondary and tertiary care to improve the extent and quality of care to slowing the ckd progression improving kidney replacement therapy hemodialysis peritoneal dialysis and kidney transplant access and treatment a well a to provide dialysis training program for health care worker providing highquality nephrology care that all indonesian can access is challenging yet step have already been taken in the direction of service enhancement thus there is hope for better kidney health in indonesia government academic medical centre nephrology society a well a the citizen will all need to work together and take consistent effort to make a sustainable and comprehensive kidney care

processed_title: the emergence of noncommunicable disease in indonesia
processed_abstract: based on data from the indonesian ministry of health information center the estimated population of indonesia in 2016 wa approximately 258704986 people consisted of 129988690 men and 128716296 woman this number of indonesian population represents young population since the proportion of population aged 014 year is more than that aged 14 year meanwhile the proportion of population aged 50 year and above is significantly reduced which is thought to be due to high mortality rate in the middleaged population the mortality rate in indonesia is dominated by noncommunicable disease ncd alteration in environment technology and lifestyle have changed the pattern of disease in indonesia to be dominated by ncd such a dm heart disease dyslipidemia obesity kidney disease lung disease and malignancyaccording to the 2014 indonesian sample registration system the 10 most common disease were stroke 211 heart disease 129 diabetes mellitus 67 tuberculosis 57 complication of high blood pressure 53 chronic lung disease 49 liver disease 27 traffic accident 26 pneumonia 21 and combined diarrhea and gastroenteritis due to infection 19 furthermore according to indonesia basic health research 2018 most of ncd such a cancer stroke kidney disease joint disease dm heart disease hypertension and overweight obesity showed an increasing trend compared to the previous report in 2013noncommunicable disease are chronic often asymptomatic and progressive thus patient usually did not realize having the disease until the sign and symptom of it complication occur this problem drive the need of early screening for highrisk population early treatment and periodic monitoring furthermore ongoing epidemiological study are also done to evaluate both established and unknown risk factor pattern of noncommunicable disease development in certain area and the treatment response

processed_title: potential and challenge for an integrated management of tuberculosis diabetes mellitus and hypertension a scoping review protocol
processed_abstract: in many low and middleincome country lmics the epidemiological transition is characterized by an increased burden of noncommunicable disease ncds and the persistent challenge of infectious disease the transmission of tuberculosis one of the leading infectious disease can be halted through active screening of risk group and early case finding study have reported comorbidities between tuberculosis tb and ncds which necessitates the development of an integrated disease management model this scoping review discusses the possibility and problem of integration in managing tb and ncds with a particular emphasis on diabetic mellitus dm and hypertension screening and control we will conduct this review following arksey and omalleys framework for scoping review we will use key term related to integrated management ie screening diagnosis treatment and care of tb dm and hypertension in pubmed scopus database and sciencedirect for research published from january 2005 to july 2021 this review will also consider grey literature including unpublished literature and international disease management guideline on tb dm and hypertension from who or other health professional organization we will export the search result to citation manager software endnote we will remove duplicate and apply the inclusion and exclusion criterion to identify the set of paper for the review after screening the title and abstract two author will independently review the full text of selected study and extract the data we will synthesize all selected study qualitatively and the result will be discussed with the expert the result will be used a the basis of the development of a guideline for integrated tb dm and hypertension management

processed_title: the use of oral contraceptive and the risk of developing prehypertension and hypertension in woman of reproductive age finding from a populationbased survey in indonesia
processed_abstract: background although the underlying mechanism of the effect of oral contraceptive ocs on blood pressure bp remains unclear previous research showed that ocs are associated with an increased risk of elevated bp this study aim to analyze the association between ocs and the risk of prehypertension and hypertension in woman of reproductive age in indonesia using longitudinal data from the indonesian family life survey ifls 5 20142015 method a crosssectional study wa conducted on 10279 subject using data from ifls5 the study included all woman of reproductive age 1549 year with complete data on contraceptive use and bp sociodemographic factor physical activity dietary habit depressive symptom history of tobacco use and comorbidities were covariates multivariate logistic regression analysis were conducted to estimate odds ratio or along with 95 confidence interval 95 ci and pvalues comparing woman using ocs to those not using contraceptive and those using other modern contraceptive method subanalyses were conducted for the duration of oc use result the result indicated that oc use wa associated with a significantly increased risk of both prehypertension and hypertension the adjusted odds ratio aor for prehypertension and hypertension were 142 95 ci 116173 p 0001 and 172 95 ci 145205 p 0001 respectively compared to nonusers when compared to user of other modern contraceptive method the aors for prehypertension and hypertension were 174 95 ci 121251 p 0003 and 180 95 ci 131248 p 0001 subanalyses showed that the odds of hypertension increased with longer duration of oc use but no significant association wa found for prehypertension conclusion there is a statistically significant moderate increase in the risk of prehypertension and hypertension among woman of reproductive age in indonesia who use ocs with the risk of hypertension increasing with longer duration of oc use this finding highlight the need for healthcare provider to carefully assess risk when prescribing contraceptive particularly for woman with cardiovascular risk factor

processed_title: hypertension is associated with antibody response and breakthrough infection in health care worker following vaccination with inactivated sarscov2
processed_abstract: several type of vaccine have been developed to prevent the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 it is important to understand whether demographic and clinical variable affect the effectiveness of various type of vaccine this study analysed the association between demographicclinical factor antibody response and vaccine effectiveness in healthcare worker vaccinated with inactivated virus we enrolled 101 healthcare worker who received two dos of inactivated viral vaccine coronavac blood sample were analysed at 1 3 and 5 month after the second dose of vaccination data regarding demographic characteristic medical history and clinical parameter were collected by interview and medical examination in a separate retrospective study we analysed the incidence of vaccine breakthrough infection on 2714 healthcare worker who received two dos of inactivated viral vaccine medical history and demographic data were collected using a structured selfreported questionnaire we found that antibody titre markedly increased at 1 month after vaccination but gradually decreased at 35 month postvaccination we observed a significant association between age 40 year and antibody level whereas sex and body mass index bmi exhibited no effect on antibody titre amongst clinical variable analysed high blood pressure and history of hypertension were significantly correlated with lower antibody titre consistently we found a significant association in the retrospective study between hypertension and the incidence of breakthrough infection in conclusion our result showed that hypertension is associated with lower antibody titre and breakthrough infection following covid19 vaccination thus blood pressure control might be important to improve the efficacy of inactivated virus vaccine

processed_title: betablocker efficacy for intra and interdialytic hypertension patient a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: purpose intradialytic hypertension affect 515 of hemodialysis patient yet relevant study are relatively scarce it is also associated with higher interdialytic blood pressure betablockers can be preferred a antihypertensive drug due to their superior blood pressure control decreased risk of cardiovascular event improved endothelial cell function and decreased noradrenaline level through this study betablocker antihypertensive effect in intra and interdialytic hypertension were analyzed method systematic review and metaanalysis were performed following prisma guideline we registered our prospero protocol registration id crd42023446184 and included relevant fulltext clinical trial or rcts from 2008 to 2023 with predetermined keywords and criterion from multiple database including pubmed cochrane scopus and citation searching seven eligible article were included in this review study result four study with 82 participant for intradialytic hypertension evaluation were included metaanalysis showed a decrease in sbp in intradialytic hypertensive patient after betablocker intervention with a significant estimated mean difference of 1519 mmhg p 000001 95 ci 1947 to 1091 supporting previous data sbp remains constant between pre and postdialysis with betablocker therapy with an insignificant estimated mean difference of 272 mmhg p 029 95 ci 780 to 236 whereas five study with 142 participant were included for interdialytic hypertension evaluation metaanalysis show a significant decrease in sbp before to after therapy with an estimated mean difference of 1092 p 00001 95 ci 1633 to 551 conclusion betablocker treatment resulted in significant reduction in posthemodialysis systolic blood pressure among intra and interdialytic hypertensive patient

processed_title: clinical manifestation of covid19 in patient with asthma hypertension and diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: the clinical symptom of covid19 infection differ from one patient to another requiring different management this study intended to characterize the clinical manifestation of covid19 in patient with asthma hypertension and diabetes mellitus dm we analyzed data from 540 medical record of patient with comorbidities like asthma hypertension and dm diagnosed with covid19 looking at vital sign upon admission chest xray and laboratory result most patient were male 570 the most prevalent comorbidity wa hypertension 463 and dm 463 followed by asthma 74 273 patient had improved condition 506 patient with hypertension had the most extended length of stay compared to other comorbidities group 13085 day there were significant difference in the oxygen saturation and respiration rate between the three group p0002 p00001 respectively the mean lymphocyte p0028 and hematocrit count p0001 were significantly different between the three comorbid group with the hypertension group having the highest mean lymphocyte 15189 and hematocrit 38769 count covid19 had a significant impact on patient with asthma hypertension and diabetes comorbidities concerning the final condition length of stay oxygen saturation and respiratory rate and also on the hematology level mainly lymphocyte and hematocrit treatment age and infection might be determinant factor for different outcome in each type of comorbidity

processed_title: clinical significance of nocturnal home blood pressure monitoring and nocturnal hypertension in asia
processed_abstract: nocturnal home blood pressure bp monitoring ha been used in clinical practice for 20 year the author recently showed that nocturnal systolic bp sbp measured by a home bp monitoring hbpm device in a japanese general practice population wa a significant predictor of incident cardiovascular disease cvd event independent of office and morning home sbp level and that masked nocturnal hypertension obtained by hbpm defined a nocturnal home bp 12070 mmhg and average morning and evening bp 13585 mmhg wa associated with an increased risk of cvd event compared with controlled bp nocturnal home bp 12070 mmhg and average morning and evening bp 13585 mmhg this evidence revealed that a it is feasible to use a nocturnal hbpm device for monitoring nocturnal bp level and b such a device may offer an alternative to ambulatory bp monitoring which ha been the gold standard for the measurement of nocturnal bp however many unresolved clinical problem remain such a the measurement schedule and condition for the use of nocturnal hbpm further investigation of the measurement of nocturnal bp using an hbpm device and assessment of the prognostic value are thus warranted asian are at high risk of developing nocturnal hypertension due to high salt sensitivity and salt intake and the precise management of their nocturnal bp level is important information and communication technologybased monitoring device are expected to facilitate the management of nocturnal hypertension in asian population

processed_title: carotid intimamedia thickness hypertension and dyslipidemia in obese adolescent
processed_abstract: introduction obesity is a global health problem with growing prevalence in developing country obesity cause chronic inflammation due to imbalance between pro and antiinflammatory cytokine this cause metabolic complication such a dyslipidemia hypertension and cardiovascular disorder carotid intimamedia thickness cimt is a predictor of atherosclerosis which could be measured easily and noninvasively early detection of cardiovascular disease in obese adolescent at risk is hoped to improve outcome method this is a crosssectional study on obese adolescent aged 1316 year old at pediatric clinic of dr soetomo general hospital obesity is defined a body mass index higher than 95th percentile according to cdc 2000 dyslipidemia is diagnosed when either an increase in cholesterol ldl triglyceride or a decrease in hdl level is found a recommended by ncpe and american academy of pediatrics hypertension is defined a an increase of blood pressure p95 according to age and gender the difference of cimt based on dyslipidemia hypertension and gender were analyzed with wilcoxon mann whitney with significant p value p 0005 result this study included 59 obese adolescent consisting of 32 542 male adolescent and 35 593 female adolescent dyslipidemia wa found on 38 644 adolescent and hypertension wa found on 35 593 adolescent no difference of cimt wa found between obese adolescent with and without dyslipidemia and with and without hypertension based on gender p 005 conclusion no difference of cimt based on gender between adolescent aged below 18 the high number of dyslipidemia and hypertension in obese adolescent need an early detection of cardiovascular complication

processed_title: effect of different type of aerobic exercise on individual with and without hypertension an updated systematic review
processed_abstract: high blood pressure bp is one of the main modifiable risk factor for cardiovascular disease cvd and preventing it greatly reduces the vascular consequence of aging and along with intensive treatment of hypertension eliminates a large portion of the burden of cvdrelated mortality many metaanalyses and study proved that regular aerobic exercise ae reduces bp but most of these study consider only hypertensive population or only ae but not resistant exercise or their combination in this review we aimed to study the effect of different type of physical activity paae on various population including normotensive prehypertensive primary hypertensive and resistant hypertensive with different comorbidities we searched pubmed web of science and google scholar for english article with keywords for physical activity aerobic exercise and blood pressure from january 2010 until september 2021 finally 24 study were included result showed that chronic or acute ae longterm or shortterm either alone or a combined with different session and program can reduce systolic and diastolic bp in every group including normotensive prehypertensive primary hypertensive resistant hypertensive individual and diabetic patient and those with kidney problem but not in people with chronic heart failure isometric exercise training showed to be useful in reducing bp in all group either a low intensity or a high intensity but the rate of reduction wa different in term of gender ae showed to be effective in term of bp reduction in a different age range it can be seen that different type and duration of ae independent of the modality and program and independent of the bp medical situation of individual have been successful in term of bp reduction for those with chronic heart failure more concern and help might be needed to decrease bp via exercise

processed_title: obstructive sleep apnea and atherosclerosis
processed_abstract: obstructive sleep apnea osa is a sleep respiratory disorder characterized by recurrent episode of complete or partial airway obstruction resulting in apnea or hypopnea osa could contribute to atherosclerosis through direct and indirect mechanism endothelial dysfunction sympathetic stimulation and proinflammatory cytokine modulation caused by osa play significant role to an atherosclesrotic event other risk factor of atherosclerosis like hypertension and diabetes mellitus also associated with osa animal and clinical study recently showed promising data to prove association between osa atherosclerosis and it risk factor however provided data ha not showed consistent result in the future demand of further research both basic and clinical science need to be fulfilled

processed_title: the prevalence of edentulism and their related factor in indonesia 201415
processed_abstract: background little information exists about the loss of all one teeth edentulism among older adult in indonesia the aim of this study wa to investigate the prevalence of edentulism and associated factor among older adult in indonesia method this study examines the selfreported prevalence of edentulism and associated factor among older adult 50 year and older in a crosssectional national study using the indonesia family life survey ifls5 201415 the communitybased study us a multistage stratified sampling design to interview and assess household member with a household response rate of over 90 result the overall prevalence of edentulism wa 72 298 in 80 year and older and 118 in those with no formal education in adjusted poisson regression analysis older age living in five major island group and having functional disability were associated with edentulism in addition among men having quit and current tobacco use and among woman having low social capital were associated with edentulism further in adjusted analysis among men edentulism wa positively associated with hypertension and negatively associated with diabetes and among woman edentulism wa associated with functional disability conclusion result suggest that overall andor among men or woman that older age living in five major island group having functional disability tobacco quitter and user and those with low social capital wa associated with edentulism the identified associated factor of edentulism may be utilized in oral health programme targeting older adult in indonesia

processed_title: family selfmanagement program for hypertension management and sodium consumption adherence a parallel randomized control trial among family caregiver and people with hypertension
processed_abstract: background hypertension htn ha become a serious health problem in developing country the family ha an important role in maintaining blood pressure bp at home and sodium diet compliance in people with htn need to be developed therefore this research aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a family selfmanagement program fsmp in htn management and compliance with sodium consumption in rural area of indonesia study design a parallelgroup singleblind randomized controlled trial method one hundred twentysix eligible participant were randomly allocated to an intervention n63 and a control group n63 participant in the intervention group received a 24week 6month fsmp intervention the primary outcome measure included the systolic and diastolic bp the score sodium questionnaire ssq and the morisky medication adherence scale 8 mmas8 the knowledge of health care for htn questionnaire and the efficacy and behavior toward health care for patient with htn questionnaire were used to assess the secondary outcome result the final result were analyzed from 121 participant n61 intervention and n60 control group the repeated analysis of variance anova test result demonstrated significant effect on the management of htn and adherence to sodium consumption a indicated by systolic p0004 and diastolic bp p0006 ssq p0001 mmas 8 p0001 caregiver knowledge p0001 caregiver selfefficacy p0001 and caregiver behavior p0005 conclusion the fmsp emerges a a promising strategy for managing bp and adherence to sodium consumption in people with htn through the support of family caregiver and selfmanagement activity

processed_title: correlation of ace insertiondeletion gene polymorphism with captopril effectiveness in indonesian hypertensive patient
processed_abstract: background hypertension is a prevalent health concern in indonesia with a high percentage of patient unresponsive to ace inhibitor treatment method this multicenter casecontrol study investigated the correlation between ace id and captopril effectiveness in indonesian hypertensive patient hypertensive patient were divided into control n 69 and case n 73 group ace id wa identified using pcr and electrophoresisresults no significant difference in genotype frequency or allele distribution were observed the difference of blood pressure reduction among the three genotype also lacked statistical significanceconclusion ace id is not significantly associated with blood pressure reduction following captopril therapy in indonesian hypertensive patient these result underscore the limited predictive utility of ace id in managing hypertension with captopril

processed_title: current insight and future perspective of flavonoid a promising antihypertensive approach
processed_abstract: hypertension or high blood pressure bp is a complex disease influenced by various risk factor it is characterized by persistent elevation of bp level typically exceeding 14090 mmhg endothelial dysfunction and reduced nitric oxide no bioavailability play crucial role in hypertension development lngnitro arginine methyl ester lname an analog of larginine inhibits endothelial no synthase enos enzyme leading to decreased no production and increased bp animal model exposed to lname manifest hypertension making it a useful design for studying the hypertension condition natural product have gained interest a alternative approach for managing hypertension flavonoid abundant in fruit vegetable and other plant source have potential cardiovascular benefit including antihypertensive effect flavonoid have been extensively studied in cell culture animal model and to lesser extent in human trial to evaluate their effectiveness against lnameinduced hypertension this comprehensive review summarizes the antihypertensive activity of specific flavonoid including quercetin luteolin rutin troxerutin apigenin and chrysin in lnameinduced hypertension model flavonoid possess antioxidant property that mitigate oxidative stress a major contributor to endothelial dysfunction and hypertension they enhance endothelial function by promoting no bioavailability vasodilation and the preservation of vascular homeostasis flavonoid also modulate vasoactive factor involved in bp regulation such a angiotensinconverting enzyme ace and endothelin1 moreover they exhibit antiinflammatory effect attenuating inflammationmediated hypertension this review provides compelling evidence for the antihypertensive potential of flavonoid against lnameinduced hypertension their multifaceted mechanism of action suggest their ability to target multiple pathway involved in hypertension development nonetheless the reviewed study contribute to the evidence supporting the useful of flavonoid for hypertension prevention and treatment in conclusion flavonoid represent a promising class of natural compound for combating hypertension this comprehensive review serf a a valuable resource summarizing the current knowledge on the antihypertensive effect of specific flavonoid facilitating further investigation and guiding the development of novel therapeutic strategy for hypertension management

processed_title: missed opportunity in hypertension risk factor screening in indonesia a mixedmethods evaluation of integrated health post posbindu implementation
processed_abstract: objective to assess the implementation and contextual barrier of posbindu a communitybased activity focusing on screening of noncommunicable disease ncds mainly hypertension and diabetes in indonesia design this wa a concurrent mixedmethods study with a crosssectional analysis of secondary data and focus group discussion fgds on stakeholder of posbindu setting the study wa conducted in seven district in three province in indonesia with approximately 50 of the primary healthcare phc were selected a area for data collection n phc100 participant from 475 posbindu site we collected secondary data from 54 224 participant for the qualitative approach 21 fgds and 2 indepth interview were held among a total of 223 informant primary outcome and measure proportion of posbindu visitor getting the hypertension screening and risk factor assessment and barrier of posbindu implementation result out of the 114 581 posbindu visit by 54 224 participant most 80 were woman and adult over 50 year old 50 showing a suboptimal coverage of men and younger adult approximately 951 of visitor got their blood pressure measured during their first visit 353 of whom had elevated blood pressure less than 25 of the visitor reported to be interviewed for ncds risk factor during their first visit less than 80 had anthropometric measurement and less than 15 had blood cholesterol examination we revealed lack of resource and limited time to perform the complexity of activity and reporting a main barrier for effective hypertension screening in indonesia conclusion this study showed missed opportunity in hypertension risk factor screening in indonesia the barrier include a lack of access and implementation barrier capability resource and protocol

processed_title: management of hypertension in pregnancy
processed_abstract: hypertensionrelated maternal mortality reach 16 when it is compared to other cause of maternal mortality such a sepsis bleeding or abortus pregnant woman with hypertension disorder are at increased risk for experiencing numerous complication including disseminated intravascular coagulation dic cerebral hemorrhage liver dysfunction and acute renal failure while to the fetus it may cause intrauterine growth retardation prematurity and perinatal mortality hypertension in pregnancy should be managed appropriately to reduce maternal and fetal morbidity and mortality rate ie by preventing woman from getting the risk of increased blood pressure preventing disease progression and preventing the development of seizure and considering termination of pregnancy in lifethreatening situation for maternal and fetal health

processed_title: hypertension and covid19 potential use of betablockers and a call for randomized evidence
processed_abstract: hypertension is one of the most common morbidity in covid19 previous study demonstrated that hypertension increase composite poor outcome in patient with covid19 betablockers is widely used a one of the most common antihypertensive agent betablockers may hold potential benefit in covid19 treatment with current evidence of the potential mechanism of betablockers remains scarce however several mechanism were suggested including decreasing raas pathway activity and lowering the ace2 level reducing cytokine storm and may be beneficial in reducing mortality in ards related covid19 further largescale randomized clinical trial should be conducted before a definite recommendation can be drawn

processed_title: relationship between anxiety and spiritual wellbeing of the elderly with hypertension during the covid19 pandemic
processed_abstract: objective to study the relationship between anxiety and the spiritual wellbeing of hypertensive elderly patient during the corona virus disease2019 pandemic method the crosssectional correlational analytical study wa conducted from march to may 2022 in lamongan regency east java indonesia after approval from the faculty of nursing universitas airlangga surabaya indonesia and comprised elderly hypertensive subject aged 45 year who had good cognitive skill data wa collected using the geriatric anxiety scale and the spiritual wellbeing scale anxiety wa the independent variable while spiritual wellbeing wa the dependent variable data wa analysed using univariate and bivariate analysis result of the 200 subject 107535 were female and 93465 were male overall 97485 were aged 4549 year 81405 had completed primary school 9648 were farmer 121605 had moderate anxiety and 8040 had moderate spiritual wellbeing there wa a significant relationship between anxiety and spiritual wellbeing p005 age education and occupation of the subject had significant association with both anxiety and spiritual wellbeing p005 conclusion the coronavirus disease2019 led to decreased anxiety and increased spiritual wellbeing among the hypertensive elderly

processed_title: predicting length of stay and mortality among hospitalized patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension
processed_abstract: background type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and hypertension htn both noncommunicable disease are leading cause of death globally with more imbalance in lower middleincome country furthermore poor treatment and management are known to lead to intensified healthcare utilization and increased medical care cost and impose a significant societal burden in these country including indonesia predicting future clinical outcome can determine the line of treatment and value of healthcare cost while ensuring effective patient care in this paper we present the prediction of length of stay los and mortality among hospitalized patient at a tertiary referral hospital in tasikmalaya indonesia between 2016 and 2019 we also aimed to determine how sociodemographic characteristic and t2dm or htnrelated comorbidities affect inpatient los and mortality method we analyzed insurance claim data of 4376 patient with t2dm or htn hospitalized in the referral hospital we used four prediction model based on machinelearning algorithm for los prediction in relation to disease severity physicianincharge room type comorbidities and type of procedure performed we used five classifier based on multilayer perceptron mlp to predict inpatient mortality and compared them according to training time testing time and area under receiver operative curve auroc classifier accuracy measure which included positive predictive value ppv negative predictive value npv fmeasure and recall were used a performance evaluation method result a random forest best predicted inpatient los r2 070 root mean square error rmse 196 mean absolute error mae 0935 and the gradient boosting regression model also performed similarly r2 069 rmse 196 mae 0935 for inpatient mortality best result were observed using mlp with back propagation auroc 0899 6933 and 9861 for ppv and npv respectively the other classifier stochastic gradient descent with regression loss function huber and random forest model all showed an average performance conclusion linear regression model best predicted los and mortality wa best predicted using mlp patient with primary disease such a t2dm or htn may have comorbidities that can prolong inpatient los physician play an important role in disseminating health related information these prediction could assist in the development of health policy and strategy that reduce disease burden in resourcelimited setting

processed_title: treatment intensification and therapeutic inertia of antihypertensive therapy among patient with type 2 diabetes and hypertension with uncontrolled blood pressure
processed_abstract: treatment intensification is essential to ensure guideline target are attained in diabetes patient the failure to intensify treatment when the target are not achieved is therapeutic inertia this study aimed to determine the proportion and factor associated with treatment intensification and therapeutic inertia of antihypertensive therapy in type 2 diabetes patient with uncontrolled hypertension in malaysia a retrospective cohort analysis wa conducted utilising registry data diabetes hypertensive patient with uncontrolled baseline systolic or diastolic blood pressure were included treatment intensification wa the increase in the number of antihypertensive agent from the index treatment therapeutic inertia wa the absence of treatment intensification when the second blood pressure reading wa still uncontrolled about 6956 patient were followed up over 25 11 personyears treatment intensification wa observed in 298 of patient while 386 had therapeutic inertia chinese indian and others ethnic group retinopathy more antihypertensive agent and higher systolic blood pressure were associated with therapeutic inertia underweight overweight patient and those with dyslipidaemia had lower risk for therapeutic inertia the result indicate suboptimal quality of care in public health clinic in malaysia further study are needed to determine the underlying cause to formulate precise intervention to tackle the problem in malaysia

processed_title: development of the saltreduction and efficacymaintenance program in indonesia
processed_abstract: we conducted a randomized controlled trial to examine the effect of a saltreduction and efficacymaintenance program on the improvement and maintenance of selfcare and selfefficacy in reducing the salt intake of older people with high blood pressure a total of 51 participant with hypertensionprehypertension in indonesia were randomly assigned to a control group or one of two intervention group saltreduction training or saltreduction and efficacymaintenance the saltreduction and efficacymaintenance group received educational training and a maintenance meeting the participant knowledge attitude selfcare practice and selfefficacy significantly improved after training and were maintained after the maintenance meeting participant in the saltreduction training group showed significant effect for the same variable however their food salt concentration rebounded after the maintenance meeting no significant improvement wa found in the control group the saltreduction and efficacymaintenance group participant reported positive effect of salt reduction and different practice based on who prepared their meal the saltreduction and efficacymaintenance group program wa effective in improving and maintaining knowledge attitude and selfefficacy of saltreduction practice and could be applied with communitydwelling older people with high blood pressure

processed_title: hypertension in a multiethnic asian population of singapore
processed_abstract: the prevalence of hypertension varies by country and region but it remains a leading yet modifiable risk factor of cardiovascular disease there are many factor that contribute to the burden of hypertension in asia a region with diverse ethnicity it ha been shown that sociodemographic variability is related to ethnic difference thereby emphasizing the importance of hypertension screening and educating atrisk or vulnerable group in this review we describe the ethnic difference in genetic variant dietary choice and lifestyle habit a well a it association with sociodemographic difference hypertension awareness and treatment control

processed_title: hypertension diagnostic problem challenge and dilemma
processed_abstract: an elevated arterial pressure is probably the most important public health problem the prevalence of hypertension depends on both the racial composition of the population studied and the criterion used to define the condition patient with hypertension die prematurely the most common cause of death is heart disease stroke and renal failure the jnc7 report ha introduced a new classification that includes term prehypertension the new classification may make a new dilemma in the management since the main treatment of prehypertension is the lifestyle change what do we recommend to lean patient with prehypertension who are already following a prudent lifestyle the ultimate public health goal of antihypertensive therapy is the reduction of cardiovascular and renal morbidity and mortality the question is what should the blood pressure goal be for patient without any compiling condition it wa assumed that 14090 mmhg wa desired treatment target level for diabetic patient it is reasonable to target a blood pressure well within the normal range at most 13080 mmhg some newer study suggest that the target of treatment may force the recommended goal even lower even for the patient without any compiling condition for elderly individual a goal of 14090 mmhg is appropriate hypertension during pregnancy is one of important aspect since blood pressure during pregnancy may change related to the gestational age this is always subject of discussion because there is no evidence that pharmacologic treatment result in improved neonatal outcome lower blood pressure may in fact uteroplacental perfusion and thereby jeopardize fetal development it mean that more attention is needed for hypertensive patient not only for treatment regimen choice but also the blood pressure target the accurate measurement of blood pressure is the sine qua non for successful management of hypertension the operator should be trained and regularly retrained in the standardized technique to avoid the chance of mismanagement

processed_title: the association of depression and central obesity on hypertension in indonesian province a path analysis of the indonesian baseline health research 2018 data
processed_abstract: purpose this study aim to analyse the direct and indirect relationship between the prevalence of depression and hypertension through central obesity in the indonesian populationmaterial and method this quantitative analytical observational study is based on secondary data with a crosssectional design the data is taken from the indonesian baseline health research of the health research and development agency in 2018 which is aggregated data from survey result on household member in 34 indonesian province we used path analysis and the sobel test using amos 230 program to assess the direct and indirect relationship of depression and obesity to hypertension multiple linear regression analysis wa used to determine the effect of confounding factor on hypertensionresults the average prevalence sd of depression central obesity and hypertension in 2018 wa 621 230 3126 480 and 3107 476 there wa an indirect positive relationship between depression and hypertension through central obesity p 0041 the direct effect of depression wa associated with a 17 chance of being centrally obese p 0009 and the direct effect of depression and central obesity wa associated with a 327 chance of becoming hypertensive p 0001 there is no significant direct relationship between depression and hypertension the effect of confounding factor on hypertension wa 219 p 0007 lower than the effect of depression and central obesityconclusion central obesity might be an intermediate variable linking depression and hypertension

processed_title: a retrospective cohort study of hypertension cardiovascular disease and metabolic syndrome risk in woman with history of preterm and term preeclampsia five year after delivery
processed_abstract: objective to evaluate maternal hypertension risk of cardiovascular disease cvd and metabolic syndrome five year after delivery in preterm preeclampsia ppe term preeclampsia tpe and normal pregnancy study design this wa a retrospective cohort study of woman who delivered at dr soetomo academic hospital indonesia in 2013 with a diagnosis of pe and were compared with woman with normal pregnancy main outcome measure blood pressure national cholesterol education program adult treatment panel iii criterion for metabolic syndrome nceatp iii and framingham risk score fr result in this study 92 woman participated they were divided into the ppe 27 tpe 35 and control group 30 woman with a history of pe ppe or tpe had higher blood pressure five year after delivery than those in the control group p 005 systolic blood pressure sbp 140 mmhg wa seen in 667 of ppe and 257 of tpe while 556 of ppe and 343 of tpe had diastolic blood pressure dbp 90 mmhg p 005 woman with ppe had the highest risk of developing hypertension relative risk rr 20 95 confidence interval ci 28513992 woman with history of ppe rr 185 95 ci 077441 tpe rr 128 95 ci 051319 and total pe rr 153 95 ci 068343 had an increased risk of positive necpatp iii five year after delivery woman with history of ppe rr 517 95 ci 02610322 p 0282 and tpe rr 603 95 ci 03211222 p 0228 are at a greater risk of having an fr 10 compared to the control group p 004 conclusion history of pe ppe and tpe increased the risk of hypertension and cvd five year after delivery the result also showed a tendency toward an increased risk of metabolic syndrome in woman with a previous history of pe and ppe

processed_title: longitudinal evidence on treatment discontinuation adherence and loss of hypertension control in four middleincome country
processed_abstract: managing hypertension is a highly dynamic process yet current evidence on hypertension control in middleincome country mics is largely based on crosssectional data using multiple wave of populationbased cohort data from four mics china indonesia mexico and south africa we undertook a longitudinal investigation into how individual with hypertension move through care over time we classified adult aged 40 year and over n 8527 into care stage at both baseline and followup wave and estimated the probability of transitioning between stage using poisson regression model over a 5 to 9year followup period only around 30 of undiagnosed individual became diagnosed mexico 27 95 confidence interval 23 31 china 30 26 33 indonesia 30 28 32 and south africa 36 31 41 and one in four untreated individual became treated indonesia 11 10 12 mexico 24 20 28 china 26 23 29 and south africa 33 29 38 the probability of reaching blood pressure bp control wa lower indonesia 2 1 2 china 9 7 11 mexico 12 9 14 and south africa 24 20 28 regardless of treatment status a substantial proportion of individual discontinued treatment indonesia 70 67 73 china 36 32 40 mexico 34 29 39 and south africa 20 15 25 and most individual lost bp control by followup indonesia 92 89 96 mexico 77 71 83 china 76 69 83 and south africa 45 36 54 our result highlight that policy solely aimed at improving diagnosis or initiating treatment may not lead to longterm hypertension control improvement in mics

processed_title: prevalence and distribution of metabolic syndrome and it component among province and ethnic group in indonesia
processed_abstract: background global increase of metabolic syndrome mets may have affected indonesia however lack of data in this multiethnic group country warrant a nationwide study for mets and it component this study aim to determine the prevalence of metabolic syndrome and it component among indonesian people based on the province and ethnic group method we obtained 8573 subject from the indonesian family life survey wave 4 ifls4 spread over 20 province in indonesia and consisting of 27 ethnic group mets wa operationalized according to an adapted harmonized mets definition prevalence ratio with 95 confidence interval were estimated using logbinomial regression result the prevalence of mets in indonesia is 2166 with provincial prevalence ranging from 0 to 50 while the ethnic prevalence ranging from 0 to 4545 significant higher mets prevalence ratio were found in jakarta pr 1826 95ci 16282048 west nusa tenggara pr 1412 95ci 12221630 west sumatra pr 1404 95ci 12021641 east java province pr 1109 95ci 10011229 and in sasak pr 1532 95ci13041800 minangkabau pr 1469 95ci12511726 betawi pr 1597 95ci13461895 acehnese ethnic group pr 2101 95ci10994020 while significant lower prevalence ratio were observed in central java pr 0668 95ci 05800770 yogyakarta pr 0695 95ci 05750840 banten pr 0718 95ci 05330968 bali province pr 0724 95ci 05900889 and in javanese pr 0855 95ci07880928 also balinese ethnic group pr 0669 95ci05350836 the highest prevalence of mets component among indonesian wa low hdl cholesterol 6641 followed by hypertension 6445 and central obesity 4321 conclusion the prevalence of mets in indonesia is moderate with provincial and ethnic prevalence varied provincial and ethnic group difference in mets prevalence ratio were observed the top two most prevalent mets component in indonesian were low hdl cholesterol and hypertension

processed_title: assessing socioeconomic inequality of hypertension among woman in indonesia major city
processed_abstract: although hypertension ha been recognized a one of the major public health problem few study address economic inequality of hypertension among urban woman in developing country to assess this issue we analysed data for 1400 woman from four of indonesia major city jakarta surabaya medan and bandung woman were aged 15 year mean age 354 year and were participant in the 20072008 indonesia family life survey the prevalence of hypertension measured by digital sphygmomanometer among this population wa 31 using a multivariable logistic regression model socioeconomic disadvantage based on household asset and characteristic a well a age body mass index and economic condition were significantly associated with hypertension p005 applying the fairlie decomposition model result showed that 14 of the inequality between less and more economically advantaged group could be accounted for by the distribution of socioeconomic characteristic education wa the strongest contributor to inequality with lower education level increasing the predicted probability of hypertension among less economically advantaged group this work highlight the importance of socioeconomic inequality in the development of hypertension and particularly the effect of education level

processed_title: designing optimal foodbased recommendation and nutrientdense canteen menu for oil and gas worker using linear programming a preliminary study in oil and gas worksite in east kalimantan indonesia
processed_abstract: the objective of this study is to identify problem nutrient and to develop foodbased recommendation fbrs and nutrientdense menu based on the nutrient gap this study wa conducted among male worker n 31 in an oil and gas worksite in east kalimantan indonesia body weight height waist circumference a well a systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured weekly food consumption pattern were assessed using 1 day 24 h dietary recall 24hr 1 day weighed food record wfr and 5 day food tally linear programming lp analysis using who optifood software wa used to identify problem nutrient and develop fbrs the identified nutrient gap were inserted in the nutrientdense menu for the worksite canteen obesity central obesity and hypertension were reported in 645 484 and 32 of the worker calcium folate total pufa n6 pufa and dietary fiber were identified a problem nutrient the fbrs can improve the intake of problem nutrient from 20 of recommended nutrient intake rni in the nonoptimized diet to 5070 rni in the optimized diet while controlling the intake of sodium and saturated fat within an acceptable range the remaining nutrient gap calcium total pufa n6 pufa and dietary fiber were inserted into the 14day modified canteen snack menu this study provides initial evidence that a combination of fbrs and a modified canteen menu can optimize the diet of the worker further study assessing the effectiveness of the developed fbrs and modified menu are needed

processed_title: hypertension care in demographic surveillance site a crosssectional study in bangladesh india indonesia malaysia viet nam
processed_abstract: objective to determine the proportion of adult with hypertension who reported i having been previously diagnosed with hypertension ii taking blood pressurelowering medication and iii having achieved hypertension control in five health and demographic surveillance system site across five country in asia method data were collected during household survey conducted between 2016 and 2020 in the five surveillance site in bangladesh india indonesia malaysia and viet nam we defined hypertension a systolic blood pressure 140 mmhg diastolic blood pressure 90 mmhg or taking blood pressurelowering medication we defined hypertension control a systolic blood pressure 140 mmhg and diastolic blood pressure 90 mmhg we disaggregated hypertension awareness treatment and control by surveillance site and within each site by sex age group education body mass index and smoking status finding of 22 142 participant 11 137 had hypertension bangladesh 211 india 487 indonesia 1641 malaysia 8164 and viet nam 634 the mean age of participant with hypertension wa 60 year range 19101 year only in the malaysian site were more than half of individual with hypertension aware of their condition hypertension treatment ranged from 208 3411641 95 ci 188228 in the indonesian site to 447 36498164 95 ci 436458 in the malaysian site less than one in four participant with hypertension had achieved hypertension control in any site hypertension awareness treatment and control were generally higher among woman and older adult conclusion while hypertension awareness and treatment varied widely across surveillance site hypertension control wa low in all site

processed_title: plasma brain derived neurotrophic factor level a a modifying factor for trans fat intake and hypertension
processed_abstract: background aim longterm consumption of transfat ha been linked with it incorporation in brain neural membrane that could lead into alteration of signalling pathway including brain derived neurotrophic factor bdnf a an ubiquitous neurotrophin bdnf is believed to play a role in the regulation of blood pressure yet prior study shown conflicting result to it effect moreover direct effect of trans fat intake to hypertension ha not yet been elucidated this study aimed to investigate the role of bdnf and it association between transfat intake and hypertension material method we conducted a population study in natuna regency which once reportedly ha the highest prevalence of hypertension from indonesian national health survey subject with hypertension and those without hypertension were recruited for the study demographic data physical examination and food recall were collected the level of bdnf from all subject were obtained through analysis of blood sample result a total of 181 participant were included in this study comprising 134 74 hypertensive subject and 47 26 normotensive subject median of daily transfat intake of hypertensive subject wa higher compared to normotensive subject 0013 00003007 v 0010 00006006 of total energyday p 0021 interaction analysis showed significant result for plasma bdnf level in relationship of transfat intake and hypertension p 0011 transfat intake association to hypertension in overall subject showed odds ratio or of 185 95ci 105326 p 0034 while in those with lowmiddle tercile bdnf level the or wa 335 95ci 146768 p 0004 conclusion plasma bdnf level ha a modifying effect in the association between transfat intake and hypertension subject with high transfat intake while having low bdnf level have the highest probability for hypertension

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor for chronic kidney disease in indonesia an analysis of the national basic health survey 2018
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of chronic kidney disease ckd in indonesia is rising but the exact extent of the burden of ckd in indonesia is unknown to design a screening program for individual at highrisk more knowledge is required regarding the prevalence and risk factor of ckd in indonesia the latter could have a big impact on the prevention and management of patient with ckd in indonesia method for this purpose we analysed data from the national basic health survey 2018 riset kesehatan dasar riskesdas 2018 a descriptive crosssectional study in 34 province 416 district and 98 city in indonesia we included subject aged 18 year and analysed the prevalence of ckd using multiple logistic regression we investigated the association between ckd and potential risk factor such a demographic factor age gender occupational status level of education lifestyle and behaviour consumption of salty food consumption of fruit and vegetable smoking alcohol consumption carbonated drink consumption physical activity comorbid condition hypertension heart disease diabetes mellitus hepatitis stroke nutritional status and others clean water supply pregnancy complication access to health care result we included 389 093 subject in this study out of 713 783 subject that participated in riskesdas 2018 survey the prevalence of ckd wa 05 the survey included mostly younger adult age 1859 year 831 with a mean sd age of 443 151 year the majority of subject were female 603 unemployed 584 and the proportion of obese subject wa 254 hypertension wa the major comorbid condition 408 while the proportion of diabetes mellitus dm heart disease stroke and hepatitis were quite low 33 26 17 and 05 respectively despite the high proportion of hypertension only 362 of subject did receive a prescription for antihypertensive medication of which only 217 used this medication regularly the multiple logistic regression analysis demonstrated that hepatitis wa the strongest risk factor of ckd odds ratio or 3406 95 confidence interval ci 24964648 exceeding the risk of ckd in patient with physical inactivity or 1236 95 ci 11281354 low education status or 1307 95 ci 11911434 male or 1527 95 ci 13981668 stroke or 1916 95 ci 15702338 heart disease or 2941 95 ci 23563671 and dm or 2462 95 ci 19793063 we also observed that dm or 4280 95 ci 37564876 and male subject or 1474 95 ci 13521606 were identified a independent risk factor for ckd in hepatitispositive subject conclusion this populationbased survey confirmed the increasing burden of ckd in indonesia and suggested that besides traditional metabolic risk factor viral hepatitis ha proven to be an independent risk factor for ckd in indonesia furthermore the risk of ckd is greater in male hepatitis patient with dm the result of this study demonstrates the need for an aggressive screening program for patient with a high risk for the development of ckd apart from patient with traditional cardiometabolic risk factor such a program should include patient with viral hepatitis

processed_title: what is new in the 2018 chinese hypertension guideline and the implication for the management of hypertension in asia
processed_abstract: the new chinese hypertension guideline comprehensively cover almost all major aspect in the management of hypertension in this new guideline hypertension remains defined a a systolicdiastolic blood pressure of at least 14090 mm hg for risk assessment a qualitative approach is used similarly a in previous chinese guideline according to the blood pressure level and the presence or absence of other risk factor target organ damage cardiovascular complication and comorbid disease the therapeutic target is 14090 mm hg in general and if tolerated especially in highrisk patient can be more stringent that is 13080 mm hg however a less stringent target that is 15090 mm hg is used in the younger 6579 year if tolerated 14090 mm hg and older elderly 80 year five class of antihypertensive drug including betablockers can be used either in initial monotherapy or combination the guideline also provided information on the management of hypertension in several special group of patient and in the presence of secondary cause of hypertension to implement the guideline recommendation several nationwide hypertension control initiative are being undertaken with new technology the new technological platform hopefully will help improve the management of hypertension and generate scientific evidence for future hypertension guideline including a possible asian hypertension guideline in the near future

processed_title: neurodegenerative disease and blood pressure variability a comprehensive review from hope asia
processed_abstract: asia ha an enormous number of older people and is the primary contributor to the rise in neurodegenerative disease such a alzheimers and parkinson disease the therapy of many neurodegenerative disease ha not yet progressed to the point where it is possible to alter the course of the disease midlife hypertension is an important predictor of laterlife cognitive impairment and brain neurodegenerative condition these finding highlight the pivotal role of preventing and managing hypertension a a risk factor for neurodegenerative disease autonomic dysfunction neuropsychiatric and sleep disturbance can arise in neurodegenerative disease resulting in blood pressure variability bpv the bpv itself can worsen the progression of the disease in older people with neurodegenerative disease and hypertension it is critical to consider 24h blood pressure monitoring and personalized blood pressure therapy

processed_title: clinical characteristic and factor associated with covid19related mortality and hospital admission during the first two epidemic wave in 5 rural province in indonesia a retrospective cohort study
processed_abstract: background data on coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 clinical characteristic and severity from resourcelimited setting are limited this study examined clinical characteristic and factor associated with covid19 mortality and hospitalisation in rural setting of indonesia from 1 january to 31 july 2021 method this retrospective cohort included individual diagnosed with covid19 based on polymerase chain reaction or rapid antigen diagnostic test from five rural province in indonesia we extracted demographic and clinical data including hospitalisation and mortality from a new piloted covid19 information system named sistem informasi surveilans epidemiologi sisugi we used mixedeffect logistic regression to examine factor associated with covid19related mortality and hospitalisation result of 6583 confirmed case 205 31 died and 1727 262 were hospitalised the median age wa 37 year interquartile range 2651 with 825 126 under 20 year and 3371 512 female most case were symptomatic 4533 689 319 49 had a clinical diagnosis of pneumonia and 945 143 presented with at least one preexisting comorbidity agespecific mortality rate were 09 2215 for 04 year 0 0112 for 59 year 0 1498 for 1019 year 08 111385 for 2029 year 09 121382 for 3039 year 21 231095 for 4049 year 54 571064 for 5059 year 108 62576 for 6069 year 159 37232 for 70 year older age preexisting diabetes chronic kidney disease liver disease malignancy and pneumonia were associated with higher risk of mortality and hospitalisation preexisting hypertension cardiac disease copd and immunocompromised condition were associated with risk of hospitalisation but not with mortality there wa no association between provincelevel density of healthcare worker with mortality and hospitalisation conclusion the risk of covid19related mortality and hospitalisation wa associated with higher age preexisting chronic comorbidities and clinical pneumonia the finding highlight the need for prioritising enhanced contextspecific public health action to reduce mortality and hospitalisation risk among older and comorbid rural population

processed_title: sociodemographic characteristic and health access associated with covid19 infection and death a crosssectional study in malang district indonesia
