processed_abstract: objective this study aim to examine sociodemographic characteristic and health access associated with covid19 infection and death in malang district indonesia design a nonrandom crosssectional study setting population in 390 village in malang district east java province indonesia participant we used malang district government covid19 contact tracing data from 14 264 individual spanning from 1 march 2020 to 29 july 2020 primary outcome measure the outcome variable in this study are covid19 infection and covid19 death the association between sociodemographic characteristic and health access of covid19 infection and death were analysed using multilevel logistic regression result among the 14 264 sample 551 individual were confirmed a being infected with covid19 62 individual died of covid19 woman individual with direct contact with confirmed covid19 case and individual with hypertension constituted the group most vulnerable to covid19 infection among respondent with confirmed covid19 case men individual aged 61 year and older individual with hypertension and those diagnosed with pneumonia and respiratory failure were at higher risk of death the number of communitybased healthcare intervention wa significantly associated with lower covid19 infection and covid19 mortality greater distance to a covid19 referral hospital increased risk of covid19 mortality conclusion covid19 infection and death were related not only to sociodemographic characteristic of individual but also to the presence of communitybased healthcare intervention and access to hospital care strategy in public health including improving healthcare access are required to reduce covid19 infection among the most susceptible group in indonesia

processed_title: applying system thinking to identify enablers and challenge to scaleup intervention for hypertension and diabetes in lowincome and middleincome country protocol for a longitudinal mixedmethods study
processed_abstract: introduction there is an urgent need to reduce the burden of noncommunicable disease ncds particularly in lowand middleincome country where the greatest burden lie yet there is little research concerning the specific issue involved in scaling up ncd intervention targeting lowresource setting we propose to examine this gap in up to 27 collaborative project which were funded by the global alliance for chronic disease gacd 2019 scale up call reflecting a total funding investment of approximately us50 million these project represent diverse country context and adopt varied approach and study design to scaleup complex evidencebased intervention to improve hypertension and diabetes outcome a systematic inquiry of these project will provide necessary scientific insight into the enablers and challenge in the scale up of complex ncd intervention method and analysis we will apply system thinking a holistic approach to analyse the interrelationship between constituent part of scaleup intervention and the context in which the intervention are implemented and adopt a longitudinal mixedmethods study design to explore the planning and early implementation phase of scale up project data will be gathered at three time period namely at planning tp initiation of implementation t0 and 1year postinitiation t1 we will extract projectrelated data from secondary document at tp and conduct multistakeholder qualitative interview to gather data at t0 and t1 we will undertake descriptive statistical analysis of tp data and analyse t0 and t1 data using inductive thematic coding the data extraction tool and interview guide were developed based on a literature review of scaleup framework ethic and dissemination the current protocol wa approved by the monash university human research ethic committee hrec number 23482 informed consent will be obtained from all participant the study finding will be disseminated through peerreviewed publication and more broadly through the gacd network

processed_title: hypertensive emergency in asia a brief review
processed_abstract: hypertensive emergency is one of the most challenging condition to treat in the emergency department ed from previous study about 13 of hypertensive individual experienced hypertensive emergency it prevalence varied by country and region throughout asia asian population have more different biological and cultural background than caucasian and even within asian country however there is a scarcity of research on clinical feature treatment and outcome in multinational asian population the author aimed to review the current evidence about epidemiology clinical characteristic and outcome and practice guideline in asia five observational study and nine clinical practice guideline across asia were reviewed the prevalence of hypertensive emergency ranged from 1 to 15 stroke wa the most common target organ involvement in asian who presented with hypertensive emergency although most hypertensive emergency patient required hospitalization the mortality rate wa low given the current lack of data among asian country a multinational data repository and asian guideline on hypertensive emergency management are mandatory

processed_title: nocturnal hypertension neglected issue in comprehensive hypertension management
processed_abstract: the body circardian rhythm affect blood pressure variability at day and night therefore blood pressure at day and night might be different nocturnal hypertension is defined a increase of blood pressure 12070mmhg at night which is caused by disturbed circadian rhythm and associated with higher cardiovascular and cerebrovascular event also mortality in hypertensive patient nocturnal hypertension and declining blood pressure pattern can only be detected by continuous examination for 24 hour also known a ambulatory blood pressure measurement abpm chronotherapy ha become a strategy for managing the hypertensive nocturnal patient by taking hypertensive medication at night to obtain normal blood pressure decrease in accordance with the normal circadian rhythm and improving blood pressure control

processed_title: association between the severity of hardtotreat psoriasis and the prevalence of metabolic syndrome a hospitalbased crosssectional study in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: psoriatic lesion on the scalp face intertriginous genitals palmssoles and nail are often delay diagnosed hardtotreat and cause disability metabolic syndrome mets is one of the most frequent and significant comorbidities in psoriasis many study have discovered a link between psoriasis and mets but none have specifically assessed the hardtotreat psoriasis in indonesian population this is a multicenter study involving four dermatology referral hospital to investigate the association between psoriasis severity that ha hardtotreat lesion with the prevalence of mets in jakarta indonesia data wa collected from april to october 2022 the severity of 84 hardtotreat psoriasis patient wa measured by psoriasis area severity index pasi score the participant divided into pasi score 10 severe and 10 mildmoderate group mets wa identified based on the modified national cholesterol education program adult treatment panel iii mets wa found in 643 of patient patient with a pasi score10 had a significantly higher risk of metabolic syndrome compared to those with a score 10 786 v 50 or 3667 95 ci 14139514 p 0006 the prevalence of hypertension p 0028 low level of highdensity lipoprotein hdl cholesterol p 001 mean fasting blood sugar p 0018 and triglyceride level p 0044 between the two group differed significantly this study found most frequent component of mets were abdominal obesity decreased level of hdl cholesterol hypertension hyperglycemia and hypertriglyceridemia respectively individual with severe hardtotreat psoriasis had a 367 time more likely to have mets rather than the mildmoderate group

processed_title: maternal and perinatal outcome related to severity of chronic hypertension in pregnancy
processed_abstract: objective chronic hypertension in pregnancy is an important cause of maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality the aim of this study wa to determine the effect of severity of chronic hypertension in pregnancy on maternal and perinatal outcome in an indonesian population study design this study wa performed in dr soetomo general hospital a tertiary center in east java indonesia over the period of 20132017 chronic hypertension ch wa divided using jnc vii criterion a stage 1 blood pressure 14090 mmhg and stage 2 bp 160110 mmhg hypertension main outcome measure the primary outcome were maternal and perinatal outcome data wa statistically analyzed using chisquare fischer exact test and mannwhitney test program spss r23 result over these 5 year 352 patient were diagnosed with ch the stage 2 of ch wa associated with worse maternal outcome maternal death 56 v 08 p 0016 laboratory value of urinary protein 3 67 v 215 p 0001 and 4 123 v 04 p 0001 ldh 600 iul 113 v 53 p 004 alt 70 iul 113 v 41 p 001 ast 70 iul 123 v 53 p 002 bun 25 mgdl 274 v 81 p 0001 sk 11 mgdl 292 v 65 p 0001 and albumin 3 gdl 651 v 102 p 0001 need for icu admission 764 v 366 p 0001 mechanical ventilation 481 v 211 p 0001 and occurrence of complication 726 v 577 p 0006 stage 2 ch in pregnancy wa associated with an increased risk of maternal death or 722 95 ci 1433636 p 0016 stage 2 ch wa also associated with worse perinatal outcome in term of lower birth weight 1635 86327 v 206374 93543 p 0001 lower apgar score p 0001 and number of intra uterine complication such a iugr stillbirth and placental abruption 274 v 118 p 0001 conclusion stage 2 ch in pregnancy is associated with worse maternal and perinatal outcome compared with stage 1 intervention to prevent disease progression to stage 2 before pregnancy may improve maternal and perinatal outcome during pregnancy

processed_title: effectiveness of physiotherapy intervention in brain plasticity balance and functional ability in stroke survivor a randomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: background brain injury such a stroke cause damage and death of the neuron cell physiotherapy intervention help to improve patient performance and ability however this is only theorized but the impact of the physiotherapy intervention on brain plasticity is not known objective the present study aimed to investigate the effect of physiotherapy intervention on brain neuroplasticity by evaluating the brain plasticity regeneration balance and functional ability method a randomized controlled trial wa conducted with 64 stroke patient from three hospital in the surakarta region indonesia control group n 32 received conventional physiotherapy and intervention group n 32 received neurorestoration protocol which both lasted for seven day efficacy of the intervention were measured on brainderived neurotropic factor serum analysis berg balance scale and barthel index respectively result both group showed improvement in all parameter but only balance and functional performance had a statistically significant outcome conclusion neurorestoration protocol that combined several established physiotherapy intervention wa effective in improving balance and functional ability of stroke patient in only a seven day period

processed_title: global regional and national burden of stroke and it risk factor 19902021 a systematic analysis for the global burden of disease study 2021
processed_abstract: background uptodate estimate of stroke burden and attributable risk and their trend at global regional and national level are essential for evidencebased health care prevention and resource allocation planning we aimed to provide such estimate for the period 19902021 method we estimated incidence prevalence death and disabilityadjusted lifeyear daly count and agestandardised rate per 100 000 people per year for overall stroke ischaemic stroke intracerebral haemorrhage and subarachnoid haemorrhage for 204 country and territory from 1990 to 2021 we also calculated burden of stroke attributable to 23 risk factor and six risk cluster air pollution tobacco smoking behavioural dietary environmental and metabolic risk at the global and regional level 21 gbd region and sociodemographic index sdi quintiles using the standard gbd methodology 95 uncertainty interval uis for each individual future estimate were derived from the 25th and 975th percentile of distribution generated from propagating 500 draw through the multistage computational pipeline finding in 2021 stroke wa the third most common gbd level 3 cause of death 73 million 95 ui 6678 death 107 98113 of all death after ischaemic heart disease and covid19 and the fourth most common cause of dalys 1605 million 14781716 dalys 56 5061 of all dalys in 2021 there were 938 million 890993 prevalent and 119 million 107132 incident stroke we found disparity in stroke burden and risk factor by gbd region country or territory and sdi a well a a stagnation in the reduction of incidence from 2015 onwards and even some increase in the stroke incidence death prevalence and daly rate in southeast asia east asia and oceania country with lower sdi and people younger than 70 year globally ischaemic stroke constituted 653 624677 intracerebral haemorrhage constituted 288 283288 and subarachnoid haemorrhage constituted 58 5760 of incident stroke there were substantial increase in dalys attributable to high bmi 882 5341177 high ambient temperature 724 511 to 1795 high fasting plasma glucose 321 267381 diet high in sugarsweetened beverage 234 127357 low physical activity 113 18349 high systolic blood pressure 67 25116 lead exposure 65 45112 and diet low in omega6 polyunsaturated fatty acid 53 05105 interpretation stroke burden ha increased from 1990 to 2021 and the contribution of several risk factor ha also increased effective accessible and affordable measure to improve stroke surveillance prevention with the emphasis on blood pressure lifestyle and environmental factor acute care and rehabilitation need to be urgently implemented across all country to reduce stroke burden funding bill melinda gate foundation

processed_title: stroke burden and stroke service in indonesia
processed_abstract: stroke is a major cause of death and disability in indonesia stroke requires highquality fast and precise management to prevent and avoid disability and death stroke can be prevented by adequately controlling the risk factor and encouraging healthy lifestyle effort are needed to organize health promotion program at the community level more and a better distribution of neurologist and neurointerventionalists is needed all hospital should have a ct scan machine and stroke unit telemedicine for stroke patient is a very promising endeavor for an integrated acute stroke management system

processed_title: hypertension and stroke in asia a comprehensive review from hope asia
processed_abstract: stroke is the primary cause of disability and vascular death worldwide including asia asian characteristic that differ from the west lead to higher stroke incidence stroke epidemiology study in asia have shown varying level of mortality incidence prevalence and burden of disease hypertension is the most prevalent risk factor found in asia besides ethnicity that is associated with stroke incidence both systolic blood pressure diastolic blood pressure and blood pressure variability are positively correlated with stroke incidence poststroke cognitive impairment is one of the sequela that affect onethird of stroke survivor and ha become a significant public health concern that is often neglected despite it increasing prevalence therefore it is very important to prevent recurrence by treating stroke optimally and effectively increasing awareness and treatment adherence to hypertension the leading risk factor for stroke became the main goal in several country in asia

processed_title: endovascular thrombectomy for acute ischemic stroke in indonesia challenging and strategic planning
processed_abstract: high rate of morbidity and mortality indicate that stroke is a major health concern unfortunately the management of ischemic stroke is hindered by several obstacle particularly in developing country such a indonesia where the burden of morbidity and mortality remains high in this literature review we intend to conduct a thorough investigation and analysis of the obstacle to stroke thrombectomy in developing country with a focus on indonesia even though numerous study and recent advance in thrombectomy technique have been developed many center around the world continue to struggle to implement them the majority of these institution are located in developing nation like indonesia it face numerous obstacle including a lack of public awareness infrastructure human resource and financial difficulty the absence of early education and largescale campaign contributes to the dearth of public awareness inadequate imaging facility prehospital and referral system a well a disparity in healthcare expenditure and accessibility contribute to the absence of infrastructure inadequate number of neurointerventionists neurologist and neurosurgeon a well a a disparate distribution of these professional contribute to human resource issue inadequate national insurance coverage high import tariff on medical device and the high cost of healthcare have a negative impact on the financial situation we provide related strategy regarding the current situation in indonesia based on the recent evidence and comparison with developed country academic institution medical association and government agency must collaborate to overcome these challenge

processed_title: the burden of dementia due to down syndrome parkinson disease stroke and traumatic brain injury a systematic analysis for the global burden of disease study 2019
processed_abstract: background in light of the increasing trend in the global number of individual affected by dementia and the lack of any available diseasemodifying therapy it is necessary to fully understand and quantify the global burden of dementia this work aimed to estimate the proportion of dementia due to down syndrome parkinson disease clinical stroke and traumatic brain injury tbi globally and by world region in order to better understand the contribution of clinical disease to dementia prevalence method through literature review we obtained data on the relative risk of dementia with each condition and estimated relative risk by age using a bayesian metaregression tool we then calculated population attributable fraction pafs or the proportion of dementia attributable to each condition using the estimate of relative risk and prevalence estimate for each condition from the global burden of disease study 2019 finally we multiplied these estimate by dementia prevalence to calculate the number of dementia case attributable to each condition finding for each clinical condition the relative risk of dementia decreased with age relative risk were highest for down syndrome followed by parkinson disease stroke and tbi however due to the high prevalence of stroke the paf for dementia due to stroke wa highest together down syndrome parkinson disease stroke and tbi explained 100 95 ui 60165 of the global prevalence of dementia interpretation ten percent of dementia prevalence globally could be explained by down syndrome parkinson disease stroke and tbi the quantification of the proportion of dementia attributable to these 4 condition constitutes a small contribution to our overall understanding of what cause dementia however epidemiological research into modifiable risk factor a well a basic science research focused on elucidating intervention approach to prevent or delay the neuropathological change that commonly characterize dementia will be critically important in future effort to prevent and treat disease

processed_title: association among disability depression anxiety stress and quality of life between stroke survivor and their family caregiver an actorpartner interdependence model
processed_abstract: aim to explore the effect of disability depressive anxiety and stress symptom on patient and their partner quality of life qol using the actorpartner interdependence model apim design a crosssectional study using actorpartner interdependence model method we recruited 183 dyad of stroke survivor and their family caregiver in indonesia the world health organization disability assessment whodas 20 depression anxiety and stress dass42 and rand short form health survey sf36 were used to measure disability depressive anxiety and stress symptom and qol of stroke survivor and family caregiver the actorpartner interdependence model wa tested using multilevel modelling the actorpartner interdependence mediation model apimem wa applied to estimate the direct and indirect effect result disability had actor effect on stroke survivor overall qol and partner effect on family caregiver overall qol more severe disability of stroke survivor wa associated with a lower overall qol of their own and that of family caregiver overall qol depressive symptom of stroke survivor had actor effect on stroke survivor overall qol and partner effect on family caregiver overall qol actor and partner effect also exist on family caregiver depression symptom to their own overall qol and stroke survivor overall qol moreover higher anxiety symptom were associated with lower level of their own and partner overall qol in both stroke survivor and family caregiver stroke survivor stress symptom also negatively associated with their own and family caregiver overall qol however a family caregiver stress without a partner effect on stroke survivor overall qol the apimem analysis showed that disability of stroke survivor directly decreased their own overall physical pc and mental qol mc also disability mediated by stroke survivor depression anxiety and stress symptom decreased both stroke survivor and family caregiver physical pc and mental qol mc conclusion the finding suggest that stroke survivor and family caregiver may influence each other during the caregiving process and social life the disability of stroke survivor and the depression anxiety and stress symptom of stroke survivor and family caregiver affect their own qol and their partner qol disability of stroke survivor directly decreased their own overall physical pc and mental qol mc also it indirectly via stroke survivor depression anxiety and stress symptom decreased both stroke survivor and family caregiver physical pc and mental qol mc impact dyadic actorpartner interdependence model have shown promising potential to predict the qol among patient and family caregiver the dyadic effect of disability depression anxiety and stress symptom on the qol of stroke survivor and family caregiver can be applied to guide the future development of nursing intervention addressed decreasing depression anxiety and stress symptom to optimize health outcome among stroke survivor and their family caregiver

processed_title: role and problem of stroke caregiver a qualitative study in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background caregiver play a central role in poststroke patient care however the role of and problem managed by caregiver have not been widely studied particularly in indonesia this study aim to explore the role and problem of caregiver in post stroke patient care method this wa a qualitative study seven caregiver of poststroke patient from the homecare clinic of dr sardjito general hospital were purposely selected during january 2017 to june 2018 focus group discussion were conducted to explore the role and problem of caregiving result theme related to caregiver role were connecting patient with medical personnel and other family member maintaining patient health condition by fulfilling basic need and assisting rehabilitation a well a maintaining patient psychological condition by encouraging conversation telling joke or recreation on the other hand theme related to caregiver problem were lack of knowledge caused by education inadequacy underappreciated and unconcerned family suboptimal service including limited physiotherapy and pharmacy resource unthorough administration lack of communication physical limitation and burnout a well a uncooperative patient conclusion caregiver play essential role a communicator and help to maintain patient health condition common problem are related to a lack of knowledge about stroke and a lack of attention from family further research to study the effect of these finding on the quality of life of both patient and their caregiver a well a how to handle the caregiver issue should be investigated

processed_title: factor associated with prehospital and inhospital delay in acute ischaemic stroke care in indonesia a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective this systematic review examines prehospital and inhospital delay in acute stroke care in indonesia design systematic review adhering to preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses guideline data source we conducted a thorough search across 11 database clinicaltrialsgov registry and three preprint repository up until october 2024 eligibility criterion study that examined risk variable associated with hospital delay in the treatment of acute stroke in indonesian individual were included data extraction and synthesis two reviewer each carried out the data extraction and riskofbias evaluation separately the quality of the study wa evaluated using the risk of bias in nonrandomised study of exposure tool the combining p value approach and albatross plot were used to synthesise the finding result a total of 27 study with 3610 patient were included key factor contributing to prehospital delay included low educational level p0014 6 study low socioeconomic status p0003 5 study cultural belief affecting decisionmaking p0001 3 study significant clinical manifestation such a a low glasgow coma scale score 8 p0001 2 study and a high national institute of health stroke scale score 16 p0002 5 study and transportation challenge such a extended travel distance 15 km p0009 5 study and lack of ambulance use p0005 9 study inhospital delay were prominent with male sex p0046 dyslipidaemia p0045 and arrival time p0007 linked to thrombolysis delay while ct location affected doortoct time p005 conclusion socioeconomic cultural clinical severity and logistical factor were significantly associated with hospital delay in acute ischaemic stroke care in indonesia targeted intervention can mitigate these challenge and improve stroke management and result prospero registration number crd42024494954

processed_title: economic burden of stroke disease a systematic review
processed_abstract: globally one of the main cause of noncommunicable disease a a cause of death every year is stroke the objective of this study wa to analyze the burden in consequence of stroke this research used a systematic review method furthermore a search for article wa carried out in junejuly 2020 four database were used to search article from 2015 to 2020 eligible study were identified analyzed and reported following the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma guideline the inclusion criterion were prospective cost study retrospective cost study database analysis mathematical model survey and coi study that assess burden of stroke in primary and referral healthcare hospitalbased the result showed that from four database 9270 article were obtained and 13 article were qualified a total of 9270 article had the identified search keywords but only 13 article met the set criterion for inclusion the criterion for inclusion were stroke patient the economic burden of stroke disease based on cost of illness method which is approximately equal to usd 18095132510884 direct cost 862 and indirect cost 138 those that used the health expenditure method did not present the total cost instead only either direct or indirect cost of health expenditure were reported for most hospital admission due to stroke los length of stay wa the dominant cost the high economic burden to manage stroke justifies the promotion and preventive effort by the policymakers and motivates the practice of healthy lifestyle by the people

processed_title: clopidogrel resistance among ischemic stroke patient and it risk factor in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective clopidogrel is a common antiplatelet used a secondary prevention of ischemic stroke known to have better efficacy than aspirin with a equivalent safety profile however clopidogrel resistance is not uncommon but ha not been widely studied in asia this study will further assess clopidogrel resistance and it risk factor material and method a crosssectional study wa conducted at rumah sakit universitas indonesia and rumah sakit cipto mangunkusumo indonesia in 20202021 all patient had had at least one episode of ischemic stroke clopidogrel resistance wa assessed using a verifynow assay result 57 subject were enrolled in this study we found 158 of subject were clopidogrel resistant gender wa significantly associated with clopidogrel resistance with male having 80 lower clopidogrel resistance or 02 95 ci 0022 0638 p0006 meanwhile smoking wa not associated with clopidogrel responsiveness p0051 we found no association between haemoglobin blood glucose hba1c cholesterol liver enzyme serum urea concentration or creatinine level and clopidogrel resistance conclusion clopidogrel remains an effective treatment to prevent recurrent ischemic stroke in indonesia further study are needed to assess gene polymorphism and clopidogrel resistance which may explain the finding of this study

processed_title: awareness of being at risk of stroke and it determinant factor among hypertensive patient in banyumas indonesia
processed_abstract: background the global burden of stroke is still high particularly in developing country with hypertension serving a the main risk factor the awareness of stroke among hypertensive patient is crucial for stroke prevention this study wa aimed at identifying the awareness of being at risk of stroke and it determinant factor among hypertensive patient in banyumas indonesia method this wa a crosssectional study conducted in primary health center phcs in banyumas regency indonesia from april to august 2019 a simple random sampling technique wa used to select the representative phcs hypertensive patient who came regularly to the phcs were consecutively recruited data were collected through a selfreported questionnaire and medical record the main outcome wa the level of participant awareness of being at risk of stroke multivariate logistic regression analysis wa performed to measure determinant factor associated with the level of awareness result out of 457 patient investigated 7746 had a low level of awareness low knowledge of hypertension low income and no history of previous stroke were associated with a lowlevel of awareness odds ratio or 1942 95 ci 11953158 p 0007 or 2321 95 ci 13264064 p 0003 and or 6033 95 ci 245014858 p 0001 respectively conclusion majority of hypertensive patient were unaware of being at risk of stroke knowledge of hypertension income and history of previous stroke are factor that may influence the awareness of being at risk of stroke among them this emphasizes the need to provide better campaign and education program to raise the awareness of stroke in a community setting particularly for the population at risk

processed_title: body mass index asian population category and stroke and heart disease in the adult population a longitudinal study of the indonesia family life survey ifls 2007 and 2014
processed_abstract: background a substantially elevated body mass index bmi is one of the largest global modifiable risk factor for stroke and heart disease most study classify bmi according to the who bmi cutoff point in stroke and heart disease study however there is a limited understanding of the association between the bmi cutoff point in the asian population category and stroke and heart disease this study aimed to investigate the incidence rate ratio of stroke and heart disease by bmi category for the asian population method a 7year prospective longitudinal study 20072014 wa conducted on 6688 adult indonesian individual 35 year residing across 13 different province in indonesia during the survey period data on bmi were collected in 2007 information on stroke and heart disease wa obtained in both 2007 and in 2014 a multivariateadjusted poisson regression model wa used to estimate the incidence rate ratio irr and 95 confidence interval ci of either stroke or heart disease or both stroke and heart disease by bmi result among the 6688 eligible participant 334 5 were judged a stroke and heart disease in 2014 the irr 95 ci of stroke and heart disease for participant with obesity wa 257 164404 compared with those within normal weight this incidence rate ratio wa more pronounced among middleaged adult 55 year rather than the older adult 55 yearsthe irr of stroke and heart disease among obese middleaged adult wa 418 95 ci 210831 conclusion an association wa observed between obesity and the risk of stroke and heart disease especially in middleaged adult these finding suggest that lowering bmi through the adoption of healthy dietary habit and increasing physical activity particularly among middleaged adult with high education occupational employment and residence in either urban or rural area may be beneficial for preventing stroke and heart disease

processed_title: global impact of the covid19 pandemic on stroke volume and cerebrovascular event a 1year followup
processed_abstract: background and objective decline in stroke admission iv thrombolysis ivt and mechanical thrombectomy volume were reported during the first wave of the covid19 pandemic there is a paucity of data on the longerterm effect of the pandemic on stroke volume over the course of a year and through the second wave of the pandemic we sought to measure the effect of the covid19 pandemic on the volume of stroke admission intracranial hemorrhage ich ivt and mechanical thrombectomy over a 1year period at the onset of the pandemic march 1 2020 to february 28 2021 compared with the immediately preceding year march 1 2019 to february 29 2020 method we conducted a longitudinal retrospective study across 6 continent 56 country and 275 stroke center we collected volume data for covid19 admission and 4 stroke metric ischemic stroke admission ich admission ivt treatment and mechanical thrombectomy procedure diagnosis were identified by their icd10 code or classification in stroke database result there were 148895 stroke admission in the 1 year immediately before compared with 138453 admission during the 1year pandemic representing a 7 decline 95 ci 95 ci 7169 p 00001 ich volume declined from 29585 to 28156 48 5146 p 00001 and ivt volume from 24584 to 23077 61 6458 p 00001 larger decline were observed at highvolume compared with lowvolume center all p 00001 there wa no significant change in mechanical thrombectomy volume 07 0609 p 049 stroke wa diagnosed in 13 131138 of 406792 covid19 hospitalization sarscov2 infection wa present in 29 282297 5656195539 of all stroke hospitalization discussion there wa a global decline and shift to lowervolume center of stroke admission volume ich volume and ivt volume during the 1st year of the covid19 pandemic compared with the prior year mechanical thrombectomy volume were preserved these result suggest preservation in the stroke care of higher severity of disease through the first pandemic year trial registration information this study is registered under nct04934020

processed_title: prevalence of stroke and associated risk factor in sleman district of yogyakarta special region indonesia
processed_abstract: background stroke remains one of the most common noncommunicable disease among indonesian population this study aimed to identify the prevalence of stroke and it associated risk factor in the sleman district of yogyakarta special region indonesia method this study wa a secondary analysis of communitybased data collected by the sleman health and demographic surveillance system hdss in 2016 basic demographic and socioeconomic data were collected additional question about history of stroke and other chronic disease were interviewed a a selfreported diagnosis history of hormonal contraceptive use and dietary pattern were also collected we examined the association between the prevalence of stroke and risk factor namely age gender selfreported history of chronic disease hormonal contraceptive use and highrisk dietary pattern result the survey included 4996 household composed of 20465 individual data regarding stroke incident were available from 13605 subject aged 20 year old among them a total of 4884 subject also have data regarding stroke risk factor the overall prevalence of stroke in sleman district wa 14 05 men and 090 woman the prevalence increased with additional decade of age p0001 in a multivariable model increasing age selfreported history of hypertension or837 95ci 476 to 1469 and selfreported history of diabetes mellitus or287 95ci 154 to 535 were significantly associated with stroke conclusion a communitybased survey in indonesia showed a high prevalence of stroke which wa associated with increasing age hypertension and diabetes mellitus these finding suggest that preventive action against the aforementioned modifiable risk factor should be prioritized

processed_title: occurrence of stroke in child and young adult in indonesia a multicenter private hospital study
processed_abstract: background most study that estimate the occurrence of childhood stroke use heterogeneous method and rely on international classification of disease code a strategy that may be unreliable purpose this study aimed to estimate the occurrence of childhood stroke in indonesia using imaging and clinical data from a private hospital network method this crosssectional study used consecutive retrospective multicenter data sample collected in 2019 2023 the study cohort included child aged 28 day to young adult aged 24 year with confirmed ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke on computed tomography ct or magnetic resonance imaging mri the 1year occurrence wa calculated and the data analysis wa performed using ibm spss statistic ver 260 result over 5 year the performance of 8987 ct and 6133 mri scan resulted in the identification of 1074 stroke case the average patient age wa 14870 year stroke occurrence wa highest in 2021 908 and lowest in 2022 591 male patient accounted for 679 of case with hemorrhagic stroke accounting for 834 of the total primarily resulting from accident 732 and predominantly occurring in the frontal region 371 a significant majority of case 667 were reported in java male had a relative risk of 193 95 confidence interval 148252 p0001 for hemorrhagic stroke versus female conclusion the incidence of childhood stroke revealed critical epidemiological trend and disparity emphasizing the need for targeted public health intervention and enhanced stroke prevention strategy in indonesia

processed_title: stroke epidemiology in south east and southeast asia a review
processed_abstract: asia which hold 60 of the world population comprises some developing country which are in economic transition this paper review the epidemiology of stroke in south east and southeast asia data on the epidemiology of stroke in south east and southeast asia were derived from the global burden of disease study mortality disabilityadjusted lifeyears dalys lost because of stroke world health organization vascular risk factor in the community and publication in pubmed incidence prevalence subtypes vascular risk factor among hospitalized stroke patient age and sexstandardized mortality is the lowest in japan and highest in mongolia communitybased incidence data of only a few country are available with the lowest rate being observed in malaysia and the highest in japan and taiwan the availability of prevalence data is higher than incidence data but different study method were used for casefinding with different age band for dalys japan ha the lowest rate and mongolia the highest for community a high prevalence of hypertension is seen in mongolia and pakistan diabetes mellitus in papua new guinea pakistan and mongolia hypercholesterolemia in japan singapore and brunei inactivity in malaysia obesity in brunei papua new guinea and mongolia tobacco smoking in indonesia hypertension is the most frequent risk factor followed by diabetes mellitus and smoking ischemic stroke occurs more frequently than hemorrhagic stroke and subarachnoid hemorrhage are uncommon there are variation in the stroke epidemiology between country in south east and southeast asia further research on stroke burden is required

processed_title: prevalence of atrial fibrillation in ischemic stroke and associated risk factor a hospitalbased study in indonesia
processed_abstract: context the prevalence of ischemic stroke increase each year one such important factor is the presence of atrial fibrillation af but data regarding this are scarce in indonesia aim this study aimed to understand the prevalence of af in ischemic stroke and it associated risk factor setting and design a crosssectional study wa conducted from january 2021 to 2023 in fatima hospital through medical record subject and method subject were ischemic stroke patient aged 18 year additional data included demographic characteristic congestive heart failure chf hypertension diabetes mellitus stroke history vascular disease af dyslipidemia glasgow coma scale and anticoagulant usage statistical analysis used data were analyzed using chisquare fisher student ttest mannwhitney and logistic regression result out of 148 subject af wa detected in 16 108 among these 14 875 had a cha2ds2vasc score of 2 and were given anticoagulant therapy a higher proportion of subject aged over 75 year wa observed in the af group 312 v 38 p 0001 a similar pattern wa seen with chf and dyslipidemia chf 563 v 83 p 0000 dyslipidemia 937 v 583 p 0005 chf and dyslipidemia increased the risk of af by 27fold p 0001 odds ratio or 27400 and 21fold p 0013 or 21812 respectively conclusion these finding underscore the importance of vigilant screening for af in ischemic stroke particularly in patient with chf and dyslipidemia to guide appropriate anticoagulation therapy and reduce the risk of recurrent stroke this study wa limited by it singlecenter design and small sample size a larger multicenter study is recommended

processed_title: global impact of covid19 on stroke care and iv thrombolysis
processed_abstract: objective to measure the global impact of covid19 pandemic on volume of iv thrombolysis ivt ivt transfer and stroke hospitalization over 4 month at the height of the pandemic march 1 to june 30 2020 compared with 2 control 4month period method we conducted a crosssectional observational retrospective study across 6 continent 70 country and 457 stroke center diagnosis were identified by their icd10 code or classification in stroke database result there were 91373 stroke admission in the 4 month immediately before compared to 80894 admission during the pandemic month representing an 115 95 confidence interval ci 117 to 113 p 00001 decline there were 13334 ivt therapy in the 4 month preceding compared to 11570 procedure during the pandemic representing a 132 95 ci 138 to 127 p 00001 drop interfacility ivt transfer decreased from 1337 to 1178 or an 119 decrease 95 ci 137 to 103 p 0001 recovery of stroke hospitalization volume 95 95 ci 9298 p 00001 wa noted over the 2 later may june v the 2 earlier march april pandemic month there wa a 148 stroke rate across 119967 covid19 hospitalization severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 infection wa noted in 33 172252026 of all stroke admission conclusion the covid19 pandemic wa associated with a global decline in the volume of stroke hospitalization ivt and interfacility ivt transfer primary stroke center and center with higher covid19 inpatient volume experienced steeper decline recovery of stroke hospitalization wa noted in the later pandemic month

processed_title: knowledge of stroke and medication adherence among patient with recurrent stroke or transient ischemic attack in indonesia a multicenter crosssectional study
processed_abstract: backgroundthere is a limited data in indonesia regarding the stroke knowledge and medication adherence among stroke survivorsobjectiveto assess the level of stroke knowledge and medication adherence along with their relationship among stroke survivorssettingtwo tertiarycare hospital in surabaya east java indonesiamethodsa prospective crosssectional study wa conducted among 215 stroke survivor stroke knowledge test and the morisky green levine adherence scale questionnaire were used to evaluate stroke knowledge and medication adherence respectively binary logistic regression wa performed to assess the rela tionship between stroke knowledge and medication adherence main outcome measuresrelationship between stroke knowledge and medication adherenceresultsa total of 215 patient with mean age of 5634 869 year were recruited into this study mean stroke knowledge test score wa 789 338 with 767 had low level of stroke knowledge mean morisky green levine adherence scale wa 305 111 with 521 had low to medium medication adherence education and duration of stroke correlated with stroke knowledge level spearmans correlation coefficient 0307 p 0001 and 0128 p 0041 respectively age and disability correlated with medication adherence spearmans correlation coefficient 0169 p 0013 and 0171 p 0012 respectively after adjustment for covariates stroke knowledge level wa independently associated with medication adherence adjusted or 437 95 ci 200953 p 0001conclusionstroke knowledge wa low among indonesian stroke survivor and independently related to medication adherence attempt should be made to increase stroke knowledge which may improve medication adherence among stroke survivor

processed_title: knowledge and awareness of stroke in rural and urban community
processed_abstract: introduction the average stroke morbidity rate especially in rural community is higher when compared to the national average objective identify the profile of knowledge and awareness of stroke in rural and urban community and analyze the difference between the two method respondent who met the requirement answered a questionnaire containing a total of 41 item regarding knowledge and awareness of stroke characteristic data obtained includes age gender education occupation and ethnicity difference in characteristic were analyzed using mannwhitney and the profile of knowledge and awareness of stroke in rural and urban group were analyzed using independent t test to see difference between the two result difference in the characteristic of rural and urban group were only in education p 0036 and occupation p 0021 the mean score of the knowledge domain for the rural group wa 7253 sd 1104 for the urban group it wa 8106 sd 1112 the mean score awareness of stroke domain in the rural group wa 7218 sd 1101 the urban group wa 8551 sd 1167 the profile of knowledge and awareness of stroke in rural community wa significantly lower than in urban community the significance value wa p 0004 for knowledge and p 0002 for awareness of stroke conclusion based on the finding it is reasonable to suspect that educational and occupational factor contribute to difference in the profile of knowledge and awareness of stroke in the two group therefore the stroke awareness campaign strategy for rural community need to be specifically designed by emphasizingconsidering educational and occupational factor

processed_title: fibrinogen and ldl influence on blood viscosity and outcome of acute ischemic stroke patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background to assess the role of risk factor of metabolic syndrome on blood viscosity and the prognosis of acute ischemic stroke in indonesia based on the national institute of health stroke scale nihss and modified rankin scale mr method this study included 135 patient with acute ischemic stroke patient underwent measurement of viscosity and risk factor assessment analysis wa performed to assess the role of these risk factor for blood viscosity and outcome of acute ischemic stroke with nihss and mr a indicator nihss wa assessed at 3 day after onset and 7 day after onset while mr wa assessed 1 month post treatment bivariate analysis wa performed using chisquare test and variable with p 025 were further analyzed in multivariate analysis using logistic regression result factor affecting blood viscosity are fibrinogen lowdensity lipoprotein ldl and hematocrit factor affecting nihss and mr are fibrinogen and ldl conclusion fibrinogen and ldl affect the viscosity of blood and outcome in acute ischemic stroke patient so it is necessary to treat in the primary and secondary prevention of ischemic stroke

processed_title: toast subtypes of ischemic stroke and it risk factor a hospitalbased study at cipto mangunkusumo hospital indonesia
processed_abstract: background and purpose stroke is a leading cause of death and disability with ischemic stroke a the highest prevalent case in indonesia ischemic stroke can be classified further into five subtypes according to toast classification numerous study have revealed that stroke risk factor ha variable correlation with different stroke subtype currently there is no data regarding this phenomenon in indonesia the aim of study is to identify characteristic of ischemic stroke subtypes and the risk factor in toast classification method a retrospective crosssectional study of patient diagnosed with ischemic stroke at cipto mangunkusumo hospital from january till december 2016 demographic data ischemic stroke subtypes risk factor and other relevant data were documented bivariate and multivariate analysis wa done using spss 23 result 235 recorded data patient were included large artery atherosclerosis laa wa the most prevalent stroke subtypes at 596 followed with small vessel disease svd at 267 undetermined etiology at 98 cardioembolism ce at 21 and other determined etiology at 09 hypertension wa the most common vascular risk factor however it wa only significant in svd p0023 and undetermined etiology subtypes p0001 significant risk factor in laa wa diabetes 55 p0016 while in ce subtypes wa atrial fibrillation 60p0001 in multivariate analysis hypertension or 3 95 ci 112805 wa the only variable that wa related to svd while in ce it wa atrial fibrillation or 1135 95 ci 1369465 conclusion laa wa the most common stroke ischemic subtypes associated risk factor in laa wa diabetes while in svd and undetermined etiology subtypes it wa hypertension atrial fibrillation wa associated with cardioembolism

processed_title: selfefficacy and selfcare a risk factor for ischemic stroke development and validation of a nomogram
processed_abstract: background this study address the knowledge gap on how selfefficacy and selfcare affect stroke risk a factor and develops a valuable tool for clinician to assess stroke risk method from january 2022 to january 2023 this nestedcase control study wa conducted medical data including gender age ethnicity locality education marital status employment caregiver social environment blood viscosity barthel index modified rankin scale mr stroke risk score selfcare score and selfefficacy score were collected logistic regression wa used to predict stroke risk and a nomogram wa developed and validated result 240 patient were included in the analysis stroke risk score or 3513 p 0005 selfefficacy score or 0753 p 0048 and selfcare score or 0817 p 0018 were predictor of ischemic stroke internal validation wa carried out with a cindex of 0774 and the hosmerlemeshow test indicated a good fit p 092 the calibration plot also show that this nomogram model ha good calibration ability the decision curve analysis dca result show a threshold probability range of 1095 conclusion a nomogram ha been developed with good validity calibration and clinical utility including selfcare and selfefficacy a risk factor for predicting ischemic stroke

processed_title: impact of medication nonadherence to major modifiable strokerelated disease on stroke prevention and mortality a metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background medication adherence is one of the crucial attempt in primary stroke prevention the available evidence lack comprehensive review exploring the association of medication adherence with stroke prevention objective to investigate the effect of nonadherence to medication used to treat the modifiable risk of disease on strokeassociated outcome in primary stroke prevention method study record were searched from pubmed embase and cinahl those study reported risk relevant to strokeassociated outcome and medication nonadherence for patient diagnosed with four modifiable strokerelated disease atrial fibrillation af hyperlipidemia hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus but without stroke history were included for metaanalysis and further subgroup sensitivity and publication bias analysis a random effect model wa performed to analyse the pooled risk estimate of relative risk rr and 95 confidence interval ci result thirtynine study with 2117789 participant in total designed a cohort or casecontrol study were included those patient presenting with four strokerelated disease and categorised a medication nonadherent tended to result in stroke andor associated death all pooled rr 1 and 95 ci did not include 1 the finding of stratification and sensitivity analysis for each strokerelated disease showed a similar trend nonadherent patient with af were prone to stroke occurrence rr 1852 95 ci 15832166 but inclined to reduced bleeding rr 0894 95 ci 08030996 the existence of publication bias warrant further interpretation conclusion nonadherence to medication for the four strokerelated disease contributes to the development of stroke andor mortality in primary stroke prevention more effort are needed to improve patient medication adherence

processed_title: depression and functional disability in stroke patient
processed_abstract: background stroke patient often suffer from depression a mental disorder that worsens their condition and slows down the recovery process depression is the leading cause of functional disability due to inability to cope with daily stressor and to function independently in their activity the purpose of this study is to analyze the relationship between depression and functional disability level in poststroke patient design and method this is an analytic observational research with a crosssectional approach the population in exam consisted of all 412 week poststroke patient in the hospital about 139 patient the study focused on 104 respondent who were selected using simple random sampling technique result the result show that 625 stroke patient suffered mild depressive episode after the stroke while 587 experienced mild disability analysis result using the pearson product moment test obtained p0000 this show there is a relationship between the level of depression and the degree of functional disability in poststroke patient conclusion it can be concluded that there is a significant relationship between the level of poststroke depression and the functional disability family are expected to provide a safe supportive and comfortable environment to lessen the level of depression

processed_title: stroke in critically ill patient with respiratory failure due to covid19 disparity between lowmiddle and highincome country
processed_abstract: purpose we aimed to compare the incidence of stroke in lowand middleincome country lmics versus highincome country hics in critically ill patient with covid19 and it impact on inhospital mortality method international observational study conducted in 43 country stroke and mortality incidence rate and rate ratio irr were calculated per admitted day using poisson regression inverse probability weighting ipw wa used to address the hics v lmics imbalance for confounders result 23738 patient 20511864 hics v 3227136 lmics were included the incidence stroke1000 admitteddays wa 357 95 ci 284449 lmics and 176 95 ci 158197 hics ischemic 947 95 ci 657137 lmics 197 95 ci 153 255 hics hemorrhagic 718 95 ci 473109 lmics and 252 95 ci 200316 hics unspecified stroke type 116 95 ci 775173 lmics 899 95 ci 770105 hics in regression with ipw lmics v hics had irr 178 95 ci 131242 p 0001 patient from lmics were more likely to die than those from hics 436 v 292 relative risk rr 259 95 ci 229293 p 0001 patient with stroke were more likely to die than those without stroke rr 143 95 ci 119172 p 0001 conclusion stroke incidence wa low in hics and lmics although the stroke risk wa higher in lmics both lmic status and stroke increased the risk of death improving early diagnosis of stroke and redistribution of healthcare resource should be a priority trial registration actrn12620000421932 registered on 30032020

processed_title: use of complementary and alternative medicine and adherence to medication therapy among stroke patient a metaanalysis and systematic review
processed_abstract: purpose to identify the use pattern of complementary and alternative medicine cam and it impact on medication adherence among patient with stroke method a systematic search through science direct google scholar and pubmed wa performed to identify potential study up to june 2021the primary outcome wa cam use and the secondary outcome wa medication adherence among patient with stroke article included in the review met the following criterion 1 patient with stroke 18 year old on prescribed medication and 2 medication adherence reported status metaanalyses were conducted to estimate the pooled prevalence of complementary and alternative medicine and adherence in stroke patient using a randomeffects model result a total of 1330 study were screened of which 22 were included in the final analysis the type of study included were crosssectional survey cohort study retrospective study and prospective survey the pooled prevalence of cam usage wa at 38 2948 ci and medication nonadherence among stroke patient wa at 29 2048 ci the most common reason for inadequate stroke therapy and higher dependence on cam wa the patient lack of knowledge and the regimen complexity of the medication other factor for medication nonadherence were forgetfulness side effect cost and lack of doctorpatient communication conclusion a low prevalence of cam usage and nonadherence to medication wa observed among patient with stroke study investigating the association between cam usage and medication adherence among patient with stroke are scarce and future research are needed to explore the influence of cam use on stroke medication adherence

processed_title: effect of telehealth intervention on performing activity of daily living and maintaining balance in stroke survivor a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomised controlled study
processed_abstract: background stroke is one of the most common cause of disability worldwide in recent year diverse telehealth programme for stroke survivor have suggested that this mode of rehabilitation could improve stroke survivor ability to perform activity of daily living adls and maintain balance although increasingly utilised in clinical and community setting the effectiveness of telehealth intervention in stroke survivor remains inconclusive this warrant investigation so that telehealth intervention are evidencebased and are not merely modality of convenience aim to identify the effect of telehealth intervention on the ability to perform adls and maintain balance in stroke survivor design a systematic literature review and metaanalysis were conducted in accordance with prisma guideline method a systematic literature search wa performed using seven database for literature dated up to april 25 2021 the revised cochrane risk of bias tool for randomised trial wa used to assess the methodological quality of the included study a metaanalysis wa performed using a randomeffects model to calculate the pooled effect of telehealth intervention stata 160 wa used for the statistical analysis result a total of 14 study with 1367 participant were included in the analysis overall telehealth intervention were effective in improving stroke survivor ability to carry out their adls standardised mean difference 45 95 confidence interval 12 to 78 however no significant effect were found on balance conclusion telehealth intervention are beneficial for improving stroke survivor performance of their adls future telehealth intervention trial should focus on identifying essential intervention delivery component that facilitate intervention adoption by clinician and stroke survivor and sustain the positive effect on stroke survivor performance of their adls in different setting relevance to clinical practice it is essential to build flexibility in the telehealthbased intervention delivery protocol to meet individual stroke survivor need to motivate and enhance their adl performance

processed_title: comparison of characteristic of strokeassociated pneumonia in stroke care unit in indonesia and japan
processed_abstract: background pneumonia is one of the most common medical complication after stroke incidence and risk factor analysis of strokeassociated pneumonia sap in stroke care unit scus are limited sap incidence comparison across country can identify the most effective treatment to reduce this incidence method this wa a retrospective study including consecutive patient with acute stroke in scus in 2 hospital 105 patient mean age 782 58 from the national cerebral and cardiovascular center ncvc in osaka japan from july to august 2015 and 105 patient mean age 60 58 from the national brain centre nbc hospital in jakarta indonesia from may to september 2015 we used descriptive statistic and a logistic regression model for statistical analysis result the incidence of sap in the scu nbc hospital wa higher than that in the scu ncvc 229 versus 124 p 0466 in the scu nbc hospital dysphagia odds ratio or 1520 95 confidence interval ci 17713073 and severe neurological deficit on admission or 531 95 ci 1601760 were significantly associated with sap whereas in the scu ncvc dysphagia or 1442 95 ci 2348898 and diabetes mellitus or 716 95 ci 1274018 were the risk factor when the patient of both hospital were analyzed together severe neurological deficit on admission or 336 95 ci 131864 and dysphagia or 1262 95 ci 3754245 were significant determinant for developing sap conclusion the incidence of sap wa higher in the indonesian hospital than in the japanese one our finding support other epidemiological data of a high incidence of sap with severe neurological deficit on admission and dysphagia in an scu setting

processed_title: hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke in patient with coronavirus disease 2019 incidence risk factor and pathogenesis a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background in this study we aimed to determine the global prevalence chronological order of symptom appearance and mortality rate with regard to hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke in patient with coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 and to discus possible pathogeneses of hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke in individual with the disease method we searched the pubmed scopus and web of science database for relevant article published up to november 8 2020 data regarding study characteristic hemorrhagic stroke ischemic stroke and covid19 were retrieved in accordance with the prisma guideline the newcastleottawa scale wa used to assess the quality of the eligible study the pooled prevalence and mortality rate of hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke were calculated result the pooled estimate of prevalence of hemorrhagic stroke wa 046 95 ci 040053 i 2 8981 among 67155 covid19 patient and that of ischemic stroke wa 111 95 ci 103122 i 2 9407 among 58104 covid19 patient ischemic stroke wa more predominant incidence 7158 than hemorrhagic stroke incidence 2842 in covid19 patient who experienced a stroke in covid19 patient who experienced a stroke hospital admission with respiratory symptom wa more commonly reported than that with neurological symptom 2083 for hemorrhagic stroke and 551 for ischemic stroke versus 694 for hemorrhagic stroke and 533 for ischemic stroke respectively the pooled mortality rate of covid19 patient who experienced a hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke wa 4472 95 ci 36735298 and 3623 95 ci 30634224 respectively conclusion although the occurrence of hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke is low the mortality rate of both stroke type in patient with covid19 are concerning and therefore despite several potential pathogeneses that have been proposed study aimed at definitively elucidating the mechanism of hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke in individual with covid19 are warranted prospero registration crd42020224470 041220

processed_title: effect of videoconferencing intervention on stroke survivor a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomised controlled study
processed_abstract: background videoconferencing ha been proposed a an innovative telerehabilitation approach for stroke survivor demand for which is growing aim to evaluate the efficacy of a videoconferencing intervention for stroke survivor design systematic review and metaanalysis method we conducted a systematic review of the literature in the database academic search complete cinahl cochrane library embase medline pubmed ovid and it companion uptodate and web of science published from january 1 2002 to may 27 2021 the methodologic quality of the included study wa evaluated using version 2 of the cochrane riskofbias tool a metaanalysis using a randomeffects model calculated the pooled standardised mean difference smd for using a videoconferencing intervention with stroke survivor and for the ability of survivor to perform activity of daily living adls and to maintain balance the stata software application version 160 statacorp lp wa used for the statistical analysis result nine study with 603 participant were included in the analysis videoconferencing intervention were observed to be effective in improving the ability of stroke survivor to carry out their adls smd 057 95 confidence interval ci 013 to 101 and to recover their balance smd 196 95 ci 127 to 266 conclusion stroke survivor were able effectively to improve their adl and balancing ability further study could consider the frequency duration and standard protocol for videoconferencing intervention relevance to clinical practice this study could change the approach to patient support in future clinical practice and might constitute an alternative for improving care for stroke survivor in their home or in longterm care facility

processed_title: factor associated with depression among family caregiver of patient with stroke in indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background stroke may lead to increased dependency which may impact the daily life of patient with stroke and their family caregiver caring for a poststroke family member in indonesia may differ from other country in term of extending beyond the provision of handson care contradiction and gap in the factor affecting caregiver depression have been highlighted in a review of the relevant literature few study have examined comprehensively the contradictory factor uncovered factor and cultural and spiritual value affecting this phenomenon purpose this study wa designed to identify the factor associated with depression in family caregiver of patient with stroke in indonesia we examined the following factor related to caregiver depression demographic characteristic of the caregiver and care recipient functional ability of the patient caregiver selfefficacy knowledge regarding stroke care and spiritual value method in this crosssectional study 157 primary caregiver completed questionnaire involving depression factor during facetoface interview the data were analyzed using multiple logistic regression result the prevalence of depression among the participant wa 567 the overall mean age of the participant and their care recipient were 436 and 571 year respectively in this study 656 of the participant were female and 701 lacked knowledge regarding stroke care in the early caregiving phase caregiver depression wa more likely to occur in female caregiver with back pain and long care hour selfefficacy in achieving respite time wa found to be associated with a lower risk of depression conclusionsimplications for practice caregiver gender presence of back pain sufficient respite time and time since stroke occurrence should be considered when providing knowledge skill and coping strategy to caregiver to help them adapt to their caregiving role maintain their quality of life and prevent the onset of depression understanding the factor influencing caregiver depression may help nursing professional identify individual at a higher risk of depression early on and provide critical followup and early access to supportive counseling

processed_title: burden of stroke in indonesia
processed_abstract: stroke is the leading cause of death among indonesian above five year of age comprising 154 of all death agegenderstandardised death rate 99100 000 and agegenderstandardised disabilityadjusted life year lost 685100 000 stroke prevalence is 00017 in rural indonesia 0022 in urban indonesia 05 among urban jakarta adult and 08 overall frequent risk factor include hypertension smoking and hypercholesterolaemia the mean age of stroke patient is 588 year subarachnoid haemorrhage is found in 14 of patient intracerebral haemorrhage in 185 and ischaemic stroke in 429 only city hospital have neurology neurosurgery and neuroimaging service indonesia ha 40 stroke unit commonly used medication for stroke are easily available hospitalbased rehabilitative service are available in large hospital traditional medicine is widely practiced effort to combat stroke include education more stroke unit and rehabilitative service especially in the rural area

processed_title: stroke epidemiology in asia
processed_abstract: background stroke is a major cause of death and disability globally with different stroke burden in different region this paper review the epidemiology of stroke in asia summary there is a wide range in age and sexstandardised stroke incidence highest in china lowest in bhutan geographically incidence is highest in east asia lowest in south asia stroke mortality is highest in papua new guinea lowest in singapore there are variation in mortality within region in east asia it is higher in mongolia and north korea lowest in japan in south asia it is higher in bangladesh and pakistan lowest in sri lanka in southeast asia it is higher in papua new guinea and indonesia lowest in singapore stroke disabilityadjusted life year dalys lost is highest in papua new guinea lowest in singapore there is intraregional variation in east asia it is higher in mongolia and north korea lowest in japan in south asia higher in bangladesh and pakistan lowest in sri lanka in southeast asia it is highest in papua new guinea lowest in singapore among the stroke subtypes ischaemic stroke is ha the highest incidence intracerebral haemorrhage ich is second subarachnoid haemorrhage sah is third is incidence is highest in china lowest in bhutan the burden due to ich is highest in mongolia ich incidence is lowest in sri lanka mortality and dalys are lowest in japan sah ha a high incidence in japan singapore brunei and republic of korea in hospitalbased registry the frequency of ich wa highest in myanmar low in mongolia among is based on the trial of org 10172 in acute stroke treatment classification large artery atherosclerosis laa is more frequent in some country eg china india indonesia japan pakistan and republic of korea but small artery occlusion sao in most others bangladesh nepal singapore sri lanka taiwan thailand and vietnam cardioembolism is third of the stroke risk factor hypertension is the most frequent diabetes mellitus dm is usually second with varying position for hyperlipidaemia smoking and prior stroke or transient ischaemic attack obesity and insufficient physical activity key message asia carry a particularly heavy burden of stroke higher in some country is is the most common subtype among is the more common mechanism are laa and sao hypertension and dm are the more common risk factor a greater understanding of stroke epidemiology and risk factor will help in healthcare planning for the prevention and management of stroke

processed_title: improving caregiver preparedness in the care transition of stroke patient a scoping review
processed_abstract: stroke is a lifethreatening condition caused by the rupture of a brain blood vessel potentially causing brain damage within minute severe disability and even death after initial hospitalization and rehabilitation most stroke survivor return home relying on their family member a caregiver for activity of daily living and treatment this scoping review aimed to evaluate caregiver readiness for transitioning stroke patient care to a home environment we conducted a comprehensive search on scopus pubmed sciencedirect and google scholar database followed by a secondary search to identify article based on predefined criterion a total of 14 article were synthesized leading to a series of finding 1 there is a need to assess and identify caregiver need 2 the process need relevant information 3 caregiver are involved in the care process until the patient are discharged from the hospital and 4 there is a need to offer support to caregiver these result indicate that implementing strategy to enhance caregiver preparedness is crucial for the effective homebased care of stroke survivor

processed_title: robotic arm use for upper limb rehabilitation after stroke a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: several study have reported the effect of robotic arm on improving upper limb function in patient with stroke however previous study have reported inconsistent finding that may lead to incorrect application of robotic arm use six database were searched for relevant randomized controlled trial metaanalyses were performed for upper limb performance measure including subgroup analysis of pooled upper limb rehabilitation data such a stroke stage and intervention delivery dose furthermore the cochrane riskofbias tool for randomized trial version 2 rob 2 and sensitivity analysis were used to assess methodology and determine publication bias the final analysis included 18 study robotic arm improved upper limb and hand function in patient with stroke subgroup analysis revealed that robotic arm intervention lasting 3060 min per session significantly improved upper limb function however no significant improvement wa observed in shoulder and elbow or wrist and hand movement this review may help develop applicable rehabilitation robot and collaboration between clinician

processed_title: neurological manifestation of covid19 in indonesia assessment of the role of sex and age
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 can manifest in multiple organ while the primary manifestation of covid19 occur in the respiratory system other organ system are also involved including nervous system that cause neurological symptom the aim of this study wa to determine the neurological manifestation of covid19 patient and to assess the role of age and sex on neurological manifestation incidence a crosssectional study wa conducted at pelamonia hospital makassar indonesia among inpatient covid19 case using a total sampling method demographic data and neurological manifestation of the covid19 patient were collected the association between age and sex with the incidence of neurological symptom were analyzed using the chisquared test out of 424 inpatient with covid19 case 623 were female with the highest age group wa 2040 year 427 the neurological symptom were reported in 232 patient accounting for approximately 547 the most frequently reported neurological symptom wa headache n104 448 followed by anosmia n44 189 ageusia n48 206 myopathy n14 6 stroke n10 43 seizure n5 21 and altered consciousness n7 3 an association wa found between sex and the incidence of headache myopathy stroke and altered consciousness there wa also an association between age and the incidence of headache and stroke the study highlight that covid19 patient commonly exhibit neurological implication affecting the central nervous system and peripheral nervous system therefore it is crucial for the early detection of neurological symptom in covid19 case to have better management

processed_title: clinical outcome and safety of stem cell therapy for ischemic stroke a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background several report on stem cell administration have emerged proving it to be an ideal therapeutic approach for improving neurological function in ischemic stroke patient however some study also show disappointing result with some reporting no statistically significant improvement among several different parameter several challenge also arise relating to safety and nonscientific aspect such a ethic method we performed a systematic review and metaanalysis to evaluate the effect of stem cell therapy on the clinical outcome of ischemic stroke patient a systematic review and metaanalysis were performed according to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma guideline a thorough literature search wa conducted on pubmed scopus and cochrane database article were selected systematically based on the prisma protocol and reviewed completely a total of 19 publication pertaining to stem cell therapy on the ischemic route were included and reviewed efficacy outcome were measured with the national institute of health stroke scale modified rankin scale or barthel index result the result of the metaanalysis indicate that the efficacy outcome suggest favorable result after stem cell therapy although not all study result are statistically significant stem cell therapy in stroke case showed a better outcome than standard conservative therapy alone although our analysis show that many factor can influence this outcome and significant effect can only be seen after several month conclusion the result of this study show promising and satisfying efficacy and a relatively low rate of serious adverse event

processed_title: trend in death and disabilityadjusted lifeyears of stroke attributable to high bodymass index worldwide 19902019
