processed_abstract: background high body mass index hbmi is an independent risk factor for stroke previous study on the incremental burden of the rapid growth of stroke attributable to hbmi are incomplete and lag behind we aim to assess the global burden of stroke attributable to hbmi based on a public database online material and method study data were taken from the global burden of disease injury and risk factor study death the disabilityadjusted lifeyears dalys and their agestandardized rate were screened the join point regression wa used wherein agestandardized rate were referred to a temporal trend in disease burden result death from stroke attributable to hbmi worldwide were on the rise during 19902019 with an increase of 8875 agestandardized dalys were on the rise during 19902003 but declined during 20032013 with a turning point in 2013 and an increasing trend since then the annual percentage change apc 030 p 005 china india indonesia the russian federation and the united state of america shared in sequence the rate of leading death and dalys in 2019 the sociodemographic index sdi wa associated with an increasing trend in agestandardized death r 024 p 0001 and agestandardized dalys r 022 p 00018 conclusion a range of indicator for the global burden of stroke attributable to hbmi have been on the rise for the past three decade tremendous effort worldwide should be in place to control and treat stroke attributable to hbmi especially in region with highmiddle and middle sdis and among middleaged and aged population

processed_title: correlation between hypercoagulable state and severity level of ischemic stroke with covid19 infection
processed_abstract: background hypercoagulable state in acute ischemic stroke patient with covid19 wa found to occur in most case may affect the severity and clinical outcome of acute ischemic stroke with covid19 ischemic stroke patient with covid19 infection have worsen prognosis in mortality regarding hypercoagulable state condition objective the study aim to determine the relationship between the hypercoagulable state and the severity of acute ischemic stroke patient with covid19 method this study is a retrospective analytic study using a crosssectional method in acute ischemic stroke who meet the criterion must have focal clinical symptom or global dysfunction lasting more than 24 hour be caused by vascular factor be confirmed positive for covid19 nihss admission and discharge and have an examination of ddimer andor fibrinogen chisquare is used for data processing relationship analysis result a total of 32 patient met the inclusion and exclusion criterion of this study elevated ddimer andor fibrinogen were found in 28 patient 875 confirming a hypercoagulable state in this study the average value of ddimer wa 53 mgml and fibrinogen wa 479 mgdl based on the admission nihss score it wa found that most of the patient had moderate stroke with an average nihss score of 12 the chisquare test result showed no relationship between the hypercoagulable state and the severity of acute ischemic stroke a measured by nihss admission p0333 but it wa closely related to nihss exit p002 the finding support that 4062 of acute ischemic stroke patient with covid19 confirmed to have a hypercoagulable state had a death discharge status conclusion there is no significant relationship between hypercoagulable state and stroke severity on admission but it closely related to nihss on discharge and high mortality in acute ischemic stroke patient with covid19

processed_title: exploring the selfefficacy and selfcarebased stroke care model for risk factor modification in mildtomoderate stroke patient
processed_abstract: context the worldwide burden of stroke is projected to grow unless proper stroke education is implemented information alone can not promote patient selfefficacy and selfcare and reduce risk factor aim this trial aimed to test selfefficacy and selfcarebased stroke education sse on change in selfefficacy selfcare and risk factor modification design setting and participant this study is a singlecenter doubleblinded interventional twoarm randomized controlled trial with a 1 and 3month followup in indonesia between january 2022 and october 2022 120 patient were prospectively enrolled from cipto mangunkusumo national hospital indonesia participant were assigned using a computergenerated random number list intervention sse wa given before discharge from the hospital primary outcome measure selfcare selfefficacy and stroke risk score wa measured 1 month and 3 month after discharge secondary outcome measure modified rankin scale barthel index and blood viscosity wa measured at 1 month and 3 month after discharge result a total of 120 patient intervention n 60 standard care n 60 were randomized in the 1st month the intervention group showed a more significant change in selfcare 456 95 ci 057 856 selfefficacy 495 95 ci 084 906 and stroke risk 233 95 ci319 147 compared to the controlled group in the 3rd month the intervention group also showed a more significant change in selfcare 1928 95 ci 1601 2256 selfefficacy 1995 95 ci 1661 2328 and stroke risk 383 95 ci 465 301 compared to the controlled group conclusion sse may boost selfcare and selfefficacy adjust risk factor enhance functional outcome and decrease blood viscosity clinical trial registration isrctn11495822

processed_title: genetic polymorphism of ischemic stroke in asian
processed_abstract: the increasing incidence of ischemic stroke emphasizes the necessity for early detection and preventive strategy diagnostic biomarkers currently available for ischemic stroke only become detectable shortly before the manifestation of stroke symptom genetic variant associated with ischemic stroke offer a potential solution to address this diagnostic limitation however it is crucial to acknowledge that genetic variant can not be modified in the same way a epigenetic change nevertheless individual carrying risk or protective variant can modify their lifestyle to potentially influence the associated epigenetic factor this study aim to summarize specific variant relevant to asian population that may aid in the early detection of ischemic stroke and explore their impact on the disease pathophysiology these variant give u important information about the gene that play a role in ischemic stroke by affecting thing like atherosclerosis pathway blood coagulation pathway homocysteine metabolism transporter function transcription and the activity of neuron regulation it is important to recognize the variation in genetic variant among different ethnicity and avoid generalizing the pathogenesis of ischemic stroke

processed_title: repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation in central poststroke pain current status and future perspective
processed_abstract: central poststroke pain cpsp is an incapacitating disorder that impact a substantial proportion of stroke survivor and can diminish their quality of life conventional therapy for cpsp including tricyclic antidepressant anticonvulsant and opioids are frequently ineffective necessitating the investigation of alternative therapeutic strategy repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation rtms is now recognized a a promising noninvasive pain management method for cpsp rtms modulates neural activity through the administration of magnetic pulse to specific cortical region trial analyzing the effect of rtms on cpsp have generated various outcome but the evidence suggests possible analgesic benefit in cpsp and other neuropathic pain condition highfrequency rtms targeting the primary motor cortex m1 with figureeight coil ha demonstrated significant pain alleviation due to it associaton with analgesic benefit m1 is the most frequently targeted area the duration and frequency of rtms session a well a the stimulation intensity have been studied in an effort to optimize treatment outcome the shortterm pain relief effect of rtms have been observed but the longterm effect 3 month require further investigation aspect such a stimulation frequency location and treatment period can influence the efficacy of rtms and ought to be considered while planning the procedure standardized guideline for using rtms in cpsp would optimize therapy protocol and improve patient outcome this review article provides an uptodate overview of the incidence clinical characteristic outcome of rtms in cpsp patient and future perspective in the field

processed_title: global insight on prehospital stroke care a comprehensive review of challenge and solution in low and middleincome country
processed_abstract: stroke is a leading cause of disability and mortality worldwide and it disproportionately affect low and middleincome country lmics which account for 88 of stroke fatality prehospital stroke care delay are a crucial obstacle to successful treatment in these setting especially given the limited therapeutic window for thrombolytic treatment which may greatly improve recovery chance when initiated early after stroke onset these delay are caused by a lack of public understanding of stroke symptom sociodemographic and cultural variable and insufficient healthcare infrastructure this review discusses these issue in detail emphasizing the disparity in stroke awareness and reaction time between location and socioeconomic class innovative option for reducing these delay include the deployment of mobile stroke unit and communitybased educational campaign this review also discusses how technology improvement and personalized educational initiative might improve stroke awareness and response in lmics the primary goal is to give a thorough assessment of the challenge and potential remedy that might serve a the foundation for policy reform and healthcare improvement in lmics eventually improving stroke care and lowering diseaserelated mortality and disability

processed_title: tobacco smoking and risk of allcause mortality in indonesia
processed_abstract: tobacco is well known a a risk factor for early morbidity and mortality worldwide however the relative risk of mortality and the effect of smoking vary among the country indonesia a one of the world largest market for smoking tobacco is significantly affected by tobaccorelated illness previous research ha shown that smoking cause several disease including stroke neoplasm and coronary heart disease there ha to date been no research on the hazard risk of smoking for allcause mortality in indonesia this study aimed to identify the association between smoking and allcause mortality rate in indonesia information from a total of 3353 respondent aged 40 year and older wa collected in this study the data were taken from the indonesian family life survey ifls wave 4 2007 to collect personal information and determine smoking status and from wave 5 2015 to collect information about death current smoker make up 403 of indonesia population current smoker were more likely to have a higher risk of allcause death hazard ratio 148 95 confidence interval 111 to 198 than noncurrent smoker the number of smoker in indonesia remains high and is expected to increase gradually every year a firm government policy is needed to reduce the number of smoker in indonesia which would automatically reduce the health problem of smokingrelated illness in the future

processed_title: dynamic prevalence of sleep disorder following stroke or transient ischemic attack systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background and purpose the exact prevalence of sleep disorder following stroke or transient ischemic attack tia remains unclear we aimed to determine the prevalence of sleepdisordered breathing insomnia periodic leg movement during sleep and restless leg syndrome following stroke or tia in acute subacute and chronic phase and examine the moderating effect of patient characteristic eg age and methodological feature eg study quality on the prevalence method we performed a systematic review and metaanalysis embase and pubmed were searched from inception to december 18 2019 we included 64 047 adult in 169 study prospective retrospective casecontrol and crosssectional study design reporting the prevalence of sleep disorder following stroke or tia result in the acute phase the overall prevalence of mild moderate and severe sleepdisordered breathing wa 668 503 and 316 95 ci 638697 419587 and 249391 in the subacute phase the prevalence of mild moderate and severe sleepdisordered breathing wa 655 443 and 361 95 ci 589715 361528 and 222528 in the chronic phase the summary prevalence of mild moderate and severe sleepdisordered breathing wa 662 331 and 251 95 ci 586731 248426 and 109476 the prevalence rate of insomnia in the acute subacute and chronic phase were 407 426 and 359 95 ci 318503 317541 and 286440 the pooled prevalence of periodic leg movement during sleep in the acute subacute and chronic phase wa 320 273 and 482 95 ci 74735 116517 and 331635 the summary prevalence of restless leg syndrome in the acute and chronic phase wa 104 and 137 95 ci 64164 and 23518 age sex comorbidities smoking history and study region had significant moderating effect on the prevalence of sleep disorder conclusion sleep disorder following stroke or tia are highly prevalent over time our finding indicate the importance of early screening and treating sleep disorder following stroke or tia

processed_title: dress and ischemic stroke
processed_abstract: dress drug rash eosinophilia and systemic symptom is a life threatening condition characterized by skin rash fever leucocytosis with eosinophilia or atypical lymphocytosis lymphadenopathy and internal organ involvement this case report would like to describe an interesting case of dress coincidence with ischemic stroke a 38 year old woman had been admitted with skin rash and fever since four day before four week before admission she received antibiotic and multivitamin for one week the patient looked ill with body temperature 380 degree c marked physical finding were cervical lymphadenopathy and hepatomegaly dermatological examination finding wa generalized exanthema laboratory evaluation showed leucocytosis eosinophilia and increased level of alt and ast during hospitalization the patient also suffered from ischemic stroke treatment administered in this patient were oxygen adequate intravenous fluid parenteral nutrition methyl prednisolone cethirizin bid ranitidin bid and antibiotic the antibiotic treatment in this case wa performed with graded challenge or test dosing

processed_title: poststroke cognitive impairment and dementia research in southeast asia a scoping review
processed_abstract: introduction the incidence of stroke remains high in southeast asia sea according to the 2021 global burden of disease study stroke can lead to cognitive impairment and dementia highlighting the need for evidencebased management aim to chart the research on poststroke cognitive impairment and dementia pscid in sea method the review wa conducted and reported using the prismascr a comprehensive search wa performed across six database cinahl scopus embase pubmed web of science and apa psycinfo the last search date wa september 15 2024 result 9118 reference were identified and 103 article from 78 study published between 1992 and 2024 were included singapore contributed 42 article followed by indonesia with 28 malaysia with 17 and thailand with 15 35 article each were from cohort and crosssectional study and 13 were casecontrol design article in indonesia the prevalence of poststroke cognitive impairment psci ranged from 276 to 812 in malaysia it wa between 216 and 76 in singapore it varied from 12 to 572 and in thailand between 503 and 55 the prevalence of posttroke dementia varied between 28 and 484 in the source the most risk factor associated with pscid included increasing age and low level of education mixed finding on the effectiveness of the limited management strategy for psci were reported the region lack research from low and lowermiddleincome country llmics moreover thorough research on how pscid affect survivor quality of life qol is deficient conclusion pscid is common in sea requiring urgent intervention for improved qol for survivor more research focusing on low and middleincome country is needed

processed_title: high socioeconomic status is associated with stroke severity among stroke patient in the national brain centre hospital jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: rapid economic growth ha widened the gap between the rich and the poor contributing to inequality in socioeconomic status s in indonesia and possibly inequality in health care here we aimed to assess the potential association between s and stroke severity in indonesia one of the largest low and middleincome country patient diagnosed with stroke at national brain centre nbc hospital jakarta indonesia in 2020 were included in the study s wa measured based on marital status occupation education level source of payment and hospitalized class with smoking status and sex a confounder stroke severity wa classified based on the national institute of health stroke scale score into minor stroke adam et al 1993 amarenco et al 2014 andersen and olsen 2018 austin and steyerberg 2017 and moderate to severe stroke 4 a total of 2443 patient with moderate to severe stroke 58 were analyzed currently employed patient had a lower adjusted or aor of 065 95 confidence interval ci 051083 than unemployed patient patient with the highest education level at least a diploma degree had a lower aor of 067 95 ci 049092 than those with an elementary or no education our finding showed that patient with a higher s had a lower risk of more severe stroke than those with a lower s hence we must focus on improving s a part of stroke management

processed_title: increasing of cortisol level and neutrophillymphocyteratio are associated with severity level and sleep disturbance in acute ischemic stroke
processed_abstract: background acute ischemic stroke can cause sleep disturbance these complaint involve various factor such a disturbance of the hormone cortisol and neutrophillymphocyteratio nlr that can cause increasing severity level in acute ischemic stroke patient this study aimed to determine the relationship between cortisol level and nlr with severity level and sleep disturbance in acute ischemic stroke patient method a crosssectional analytic observational study wa conducted on acute ischemic stroke patient during agustus december 2022 examine cortisol level using the elisa method nlr from blood test ass severity level using the national institute of health stroke scale nihss and the pittsburgh sleep questionnaire index psqi is used a a measure for the initial screening of sleep disturbancesstatistical analysis using spearman correlation result total study subject were 48 patient with the majority 625 woman the mean age of study subject wa above 60 year 563 and the most common type of stroke wa large artery atherosclerotic stroke 771 the highest nihss score wa in the moderate category 854 the most common risk factor is hypertension 644 and basal ganglion area is the most common ischemic stroke location 521 there wa a positive correlation between cortisol level with nihss r0874 pvalue 0001 nlr with sleep disturbance r0829 pvalue0001 nlr with nihss r0893 pvalue0001 and nihss with psqi r0836 pvalue0001 conclusion there were a positive correlation between cortisol level nlr level and nihss score with sleep quality disturbance based on psqi in acute ischemic stroke patient

processed_title: pathomechanism and management of stroke in covid19 review of immunopathogenesis coagulopathy endothelial dysfunction and downregulation of ace2
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 can reportedly manifest a an acute stroke with most case presenting a large vessel ischemic stroke in patient with or without comorbidities the exact pathomechanism of stroke in covid19 remains ambiguous the finding of previous study indicate that the most likely underlying mechanism are cerebrovascular pathological condition following viral infection inflammationinduced endothelial dysfunction and hypercoagulability acute endothelial damage due to inflammation trigger a coagulation cascade thrombosis propagation and destabilization of atherosclerosis plaque leading to largevessel occlusion and plaque ulceration with concomitant thromboemboli and manifest a ischemic stroke another possible mechanism is the downregulation of angiotensinconverting enzyme 2 a the target action of severe acute respiratory syndromecoronavirus2 sarscov2 acute stroke management protocol need to be modified during the covid19 pandemic in order to adequately manage stroke patient with covid19

processed_title: association between hydrocarbon exposure and risk of stroke a systematic literature review
processed_abstract: background hydrocarbon exposure including polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon pahs and volatile organic compound vocs is increasingly linked to vascular dysfunction and stroke a leading cause of morbidity and mortality globally common in occupational and environmental context hydrocarbon induce oxidative stress systemic inflammation and endothelial dysfunction disrupting vascular health this systematic review examines the association between hydrocarbon exposure and stroke emphasizing specific metabolite and their cerebrovascular effect method a comprehensive search across pubmed embase and web of science wa conducted through december 10 2024 identifying observational study exploring hydrocarbon exposure and stroke risk study meeting predefined inclusion criterion excluding those with major methodological flaw were synthesized narratively variation in hydrocarbon type population demographic and stroke outcome were considered result six study including five crosssectional and one retrospective cohort with sample size ranging from 5537 to 283666 participant demonstrated significant association between hydrocarbon exposure and stroke risk key finding revealed strong association for metabolite like 1hydroxynaphthalene or 189 95 ci 162220 and 2hydroxyfluorene or 194 95 ci 166226 however variability in finding wa noted attributed to difference in study design exposure level and population studied conclusion this review highlight a complex relationship between hydrocarbon exposure and stroke risk with some study indicating significant association and others reporting inconsistency standardized largescale research is essential to clarify this relationship identify highrisk population and guide public health strategy to mitigate exposure and prevent stroke clinical trial number not applicable

processed_title: endovascular treatment in acute ischemic stroke adoption and practice a singlecenter indonesian experience
processed_abstract: indonesia is facing increasing stroke prevalence in the past 5 year ischemic stroke imposes economic and productivity burden if it is not addressed properly endovascular treatment study are conducted in developed country where facility and cost do not count in therapy consideration if it is indicated developing country like indonesia should work hard to provide the best hyperacute stroke care with protocol deviation and limitation this is the first review on endovascular treatment practice in a top singlecenter hospital in indonesia further improvement is needed to catch up with stateoftheart hyperacute ischemic stroke treatment

processed_title: telerehabilitation in poststroke care a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: objective this metaanalysis introduces telemedicine in timesensitive condition like stroke and the challenge hindering athome rehabilitation it aim to consolidate evidence supporting telerehabilitation effectiveness in poststroke patient with a focus on adl balance mobility and motor control method we conducted a metaanalysis using the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma 2020 guideline a comprehensive search of pubmed google scholar and cochrane central database wa conducted inclusion criterion involved study that employed randomized controlled trial rct design specifically evaluating various telerehabilitation model in patient diagnosed with a stroke excluding those with mixed etiology and nonrandomized or singlearm design two independent reviewer assessed study quality and bias using cochrane risk of bias 2 before inclusion result we included 10 study n 417 with a predominantly male sample n 196 the mean age of the pooled sample of 8 study wa 6487 1301 year our metaanalysis showed that telerehabilitation may have modest effect on berg balance scale smd 008 023 040 p 054 and trunk impairment scale smd 026 100 152 p 005 slightly inferior effect on barthel index smd 034 100 032 p 031 but demonstrated a favorable impact on trunk impairment smd 021 118 076 p 002 conclusion we found that telerehabilitation may have modest effect on balance and mobility and slightly inferior result in activity of daily living but may have a positive effect on trunk impairment however more study with larger cohort are needed to confirm our result

processed_title: high creactive protein albumin ratio predicts mortality and hemorrhage in stroke patient undergoing mechanical thrombectomy a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background stroke outcome are multifactorial and the creactive protein to albumin ratio car ha emerged a a potential prognostic marker this study aim to evaluate car prognostic significance in stroke method systematic search across sciencedirect medline and cochrane database identified longitudinal study unfavorable outcome including poor prognosis modified rankin scale 2 mortality and severe complication like hemorrhage or restenosis were considered analysis for unfavorable outcome were conducted based on prior intervention stroke type and outcome type result the metaanalysis included 12 cohort study comprising 5042 participant elevated car or 172 95 confidence interval ci 117252 p 001 and crp or 191 95 ci 131277 p 0001 level on admission were associated with unfavorable outcome no such association wa observed for albumin or 066 95ci 024180 p 042 elevated car level were associated with unfavorable outcome in patient undergoing mechanical thrombectomy odds ratio or 270 95 ci 114638 p 002 and those with ischemic stroke or 199 95 ci 124318 p 0001 but no significant association wa found in patient with hemorrhagic stroke furthermore concerning specific outcome high car level were associated with mortality or 171 95 ci 100295 p 005 and hemorrhage or 602 95 ci 1612387 p 005 the area under the curve for car wa 072 068076 with a sensitivity of 061 049071 and specificity of 073 064081 conclusion elevated car emerges a an effective marker in assessing unfavorable outcome in stroke patient with moderately high sensitivity and specificity high car level exhibited statistically significant mortality and hemorrhage in stroke patient undergoing mechanical thrombectomy

processed_title: degree of covid19 severity and mortality in stroke correlation of clinical and laboratory parameter
processed_abstract: background stroke is one of the neurological manifestation of covid19 leading to a significant risk of morbidity and mortality clinical manifestation and laboratory parameter were investigated to determine mortality predictor in this case method the case control study wa conducted at dr sardjito general hospitalyogyakarta indonesia with data collected between july 2020 and august 2021 all recorded clinical and laboratory data from acute stroke patient with confirmed covid19 were collected baseline characteristic bivariate and multivariate analysis were assessed to determine significant predictor for mortality result this study involved 72 subject with covid19 and stroke the majority experienced ischemic stroke with hypertension a the most prevalent comorbidity notably 458 of subject p 005 loss of consciousness and 722 of exhibited motor deficit p 005 severe degree of covid19 wa observed in 528 of patient with respiratory distress and death rate of 569 and 583 comparison of surviving and deceased group highlighted significant difference in various clinical and laboratory characteristic difference hazard ratio hr analysis identified loss of consciousness hr 268 p 001 motor deficit hr 234 p 003 respiratory distress hr 8151 p 0001 and monocyte count hr1002 p 004 a significant predictor of mortality conclusion mortality in covid19 patient with stroke wa significantly associated with loss of consciousness motor deficit respiratory distress and raised monocyte count the risk of mortality is heightened when multiple factor coexist

processed_title: comparison of the administration route of stem cell therapy for ischemic stroke a systematic review and metaanalysis of the clinical outcome and safety
processed_abstract: stem cell treatment is emerging a an appealing alternative for stroke patient but there still need to be an agreement on the protocol in place including the route of administration this systematic review aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of the administration route of stem cell treatment for ischemic stroke a systematic review wa performed according to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma guideline a comprehensive literature search wa undertaken using the pubmed scopus and cochrane database a total of 21 publication on stem cell therapy for ischemic stroke were included efficacy outcome were measured using the national institute of health stroke scale nihss the modified rankin scale mr and the barthel index bi intracerebral administration showed a better outcome than other route but a greater number of adverse event followed due to it invasiveness adverse event were shown to be related to the natural history of stroke not to the treatment however further investigation is required since study have yet to compare the different administration method directly

processed_title: prevalence and predictor of current and former tobacco use among older adult in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose the study aim to describe sociodemographic and health variable index related to current and former tobacco use among older adult who participated in the indonesia family life survey ifls5 in 201415 material and method a national populationbased crosssectional study wa conducted with a probability sample of 8001 aged 50 year or older indonesian result the overall prevalence of current tobacco use wa 333 622 in men and 65 in woman and former tobacco use wa 98 174 among men and 28 in woman of which 644 quit tobacco use when 50 year and older in multinomial regression analysis sociodemographic factor being male lower education lower economic status living in java and rural residence and health variable cancer or malignant tumour depression symptom functional disability and inadequate fruit and vegetable consumption were associated with current tobacco use in addition being overweight or obese having had a stroke and other lung condition were inversely associated with current tobacco use further in adjusted analysis sociodemographic factor being 70 year and older being male living in sumatra and having chronic condition dyslipidemia heart problem asthma stomach or digestive disease and functional disability were associated with former tobacco use conclusion a high rate of current tobacco use and low rate of former tobacco use wa found particularly among men the identified risk factor may help to better target this vulnerable population with tobacco cessation programme

processed_title: use of mobilestroke risk scale and lifestyle guidance promote healthy lifestyle and decrease stroke risk factor
processed_abstract: objective the purpose of this study wa to determine the effectiveness of mobilestroke risk scale and life style guidance msrsguide in promoting a healthy lifestyle and reducing stroke risk factor in atrisk person method this research wa an clinical trial with a pretest and posttest control group design the accessible population is person at risk of stroke in the community west and east kalimantan province indonesia thirtytwo participant in the intervention group and 32 participant in the control group participated in this study the sampling method wa systematic random sampling we allocate the sample into the intervention and control group using a randomized block design the intervention group used the msrsguide the control group used manual book for a selfassessment of stroke risk the measurement of a healthy lifestyle and the stroke risk factor wa performed before and six month after the intervention result there are no significant difference in healthy lifestyle and stroke risk factor between the two group after the intervention p 005 analysis of healthy lifestyle behavior assessment item in the intervention group showed an increase in healthy diet activity pattern and stress control after the use of the msrsguide p 001 conclusion the use of msrsguide is effective in promoting a healthy lifestyle

processed_title: analysis of ischemic stroke burden in asia from 1990 to 2019 based on the global burden of disease 2019 data
processed_abstract: background ischemic stroke ha the characteristic of high morbidity mortality and recurrence rate this study aimed to describe and assess the burden of ischemic stroke in asia based on the global burden of disease gbd 2019 data and provide a crucial scientific foundation for the prevention and control of this lifethreatening disease method this study used the gbd 2019 data to assess the burden of ischemic stroke the indicator used in this study were derived from the following method i the incidence of ischemic stroke wa estimated using the disability model for the global burden of disease studymixed effect regression dismodmr a bayesian metaregression disease modeling tool ii the nonspecific code of all available data on mortality were corrected and used to estimate mortality rate for ischemic stroke and the cause of death ensemble model wa used to estimate mortality rate and iii the disabilityadjusted life year dalys is the sum of year lived with disability yld and the year of life lost yll which quantifies the health loss due to specific disease and injury in addition the joinpoint regression model wa adopted to analyze the temporal trend of ischemic stroke from 1990 to 2019 in asia result this study found an increase in the burden of ischemic stroke in 2019 compared to 1990 moreover the agestandardized incidence rate asir of ischemic stroke showed a gradual upward trend over the specific period the agestandardized mortality rate asmr showed a downward trend in asia from 1990 to 2019 the burden of ischemic stroke wa more concentrated on older age group particularly those older than 65 year east asia had the highest burden of ischemic stroke compared to other region in asia particularly china india indonesia and japan had the highest burden of ischemic stroke among the asian country and region however the population with the highest burden of ischemic stroke wa still the elderly group conclusion based on our study it is evident that the burden of ischemic stroke exists substantially and exhibit variation in the aspect of age gender and geographical region in asia without targeted implementation of populationwide primary strategy for prevention and control the burden of ischemic stroke is likely to worsen significantly in the future

processed_title: correlation between knowledge and selfefficacy with family skill in exercising range of motion for poststroke
processed_abstract: introduction stroke is the third largest cause of death after heart disease and cancer poststroke patient who have disability will lose independence and become dependent on others the role of the family is significant in helping patient meet psychological social and spiritual need in addition the family play a role in recovery and optimizing the client motor skill a family member is the primary support system of direct service provider in every situation this study aimed to examine the relationship between knowledge selfefficacy and family skill in doing a range of motion exercise poststroke method correlational research method with a crosssectional study approach with poststroke client family research sample wa taken in total sampling with 55 respondent analysis using bivariate analysis with spearmansrho correlation test result the result showed that family knowledge wa above average with a median value of 1500 iqr 2 family selfefficacy wa above average with a mean value of 5147 sd 1167 and family skill were above average with a mean value of 773 sd 270 discussion the result of bivariate analysis stated that there wa a relationship between family knowledge and family skill in doing a range of motion exercise with pvalue 000 r 0613 and there wa a relationship between family selfefficacy and family skill in doing a range of motion exercise with pvalue 000 r 0497 this research ha implication for community nurse to provide intervention and enhance visite to family member with poststroke

processed_title: depression among older adult in indonesia prevalence role of chronic condition and other associated factor
processed_abstract: background depression is one of the most common illness worldwide with a prevalence of 57 among older adult aged over 60 depression is a severe health condition that can significantly affect the quality of life objective the objective of this study is to investigate the determinant factor of depression among older adult in indonesia method data of 4236 adult of 60 year old and over were taken from the fifth wave of the indonesian family life survey ifls5 sociodemographic and multiple healthrelated variable collected through interview and measurement were analyzed multivariate logistic regression wa used to evaluate depression and it associated factor result the prevalence of depression assessed using ten question from the center for epidemiologic study depression scale cesd 10 wa 163 significant associated factor for depression were moderate and low subjective economic status living in java or other region outside sumatra and java no life satisfaction selfperceived a having poor health having dependency iadl score and experienced fall and insomnia among chronic condition stroke arthritis and hearing impairment were also more common in depressed older adult conclusion predictor of depression identified in this study may be used to help prevent and improve depression in indonesian older adult especially those who live on java improvement in healthcare especially in the prevention and rehabilitation of stroke arthritis possible frailty fall and dependency hearing impairment and insomnia concurrent with early detection of depression in these chronic condition may help create a better quality of life among indonesian older adult

processed_title: a systematic search and review of registered pharmacological therapy investigated to improve outcome after a stroke
processed_abstract: introduction stroke burden is largely due to longterm impairment requiring prolonged care and loss of productivity we aim to identify and assess study of different registered pharmacological therapy a treatment for improving poststroke impairment andor disability method in a systematic search and review prospero registration crd42022376973 study of treatment that have been investigated a recoveryenhancing or recoverypromoting treatment in adult patient who had suffered a stroke will be searched for screened and reviewed based on the following participant p adult human aged 18 year or older diagnosed with stroke intervention i registered or marketed pharmacological therapy that have been investigated a recoveryenhancing or recoverypromoting treatment in stroke comparators c active or placebo or no comparator outcome o strokerelated neurological impairment and functionaldisability assessment data will be extracted from included paper including patient demographic study method keystroke inclusion criterion detail of intervention and control and the reported outcome result the best available study based on study design study size andor date of publication for different therapy and stroke subtypes will be selected and graded for level of evidence by consensus conclusion there are conflicting study result of pharmacological intervention after an acute stroke to enhance recovery this systematic search and review will identify the best evidence and knowledge gap in the pharmacological treatment of poststroke patient a well a guide clinical decisionmaking and planning of future study

processed_title: mesenchymal stem cell and their extracellular vesicle a emerging therapeutic tool in the treatment of ischemic stroke
processed_abstract: ischemic stroke is is a neurological condition characterized by severe longterm consequence and an unfavorable prognosis for numerous patient despite advancement in stroke treatment existing therapeutic approach possess certain limitation however accumulating evidence suggests that mesenchymal stemstromal cell msc hold promise a a potential therapy for various neurological disorder including is owing to their advantageous property such a immunomodulation and tissue regeneration additionally msc primarily exert their therapeutic effect through the release of extracellular vesicle ev highlighting the significance of their paracrine activity these ev are small doublelayered phospholipid membrane vesicle carrying a diverse cargo of protein lipid and mirnas that enable effective celltocell communication notably ev have emerged a attractive substitute for stem cell therapy due to their reduced immunogenicity lower tumorigenic potential and ease of administration and handling hence this review summarizes the current preclinical and clinical study performed to investigate the safety and therapeutic potential of msc and their ev derived from different source including bone marrow adipose tissue umbilical cord blood and wharton jelly in is

processed_title: telestroke strategy to enhance acute stroke management in rural setting a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background the potential of telestroke implementation in resourcelimited area ha yet to be systematically evaluated this study aim to investigate the implementation of telestroke on acute stroke care in rural area method eligible study published up to november 2019 were included in this study randomized trial were further evaluated for risk of bias with cochrane rob 2 while nonrandomized study with robinsi tool random effect model wa utilized to estimate effect size and the certainty of evidence wa assessed using the grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation grade tool result the search yielded 19 study involving a total of 28496 subject comprising of prehospital and inhospital telestroke intervention in the form of mobile stroke unit and hubandspoke hospital network respectively telestroke successfully increased the proportion of patient treated 3 hr or 215 95 ci 137340 i2 0 and better threemonth functional outcome or 129 95 ci 101163 i2 44 without increasing symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage rate or 127 065249 i2 0 furthermore telestroke wa also associated with shorter onsettotreatment time mean difference 2797 min 95 ci 3551 2042 i2 63 and lower inhospital mortality rate or 067 95 ci 052087 i2 0 grade assessment yielded lowtomoderate certainty of body evidence conclusion telestroke implementation in rural area wa associated with better clinical outcome a compared to usual care it integration in both prehospital and inhospital setting could help optimize emergency stroke approach further study with higherlevel evidence are needed to confirm these finding

processed_title: the role of homocysteine level a a risk factor of ischemic stroke event a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: introduction among numerous risk factor homocysteine hcy ha been linked to cerebral infarction however result have been inconsistent this review aimed to conduct a metaanalysis of published study to investigate the relationship between plasma hcy level and the risk of ischemic stroke method a systematic literature search wa conducted until november 2022 to obtain article reporting hcy level in ischemic stroke patient review manager software wa used to perform all statistical analysis version 53 result initial investigation yielded 283 article the final evaluation included 21 article including two prospective study one retrospective cohort and 18 casecontrol study these study included 9888 participant of which 5031 were admitted patient with ischemic stroke an integrated analysis revealed that ischemic stroke patient had significantly higher level of hcy than control mean difference md 370 95 confidence interval ci 242581 p 0001 conclusion this metaanalysis and systematic review indicate that ischemic stroke patient have significantly higher homocysteine level than control detecting hyperhomocysteinemia and reducing homocysteine level should be explored among individual at increased risk for ischemic stroke

processed_title: physical activity and depression in indonesian adult with stroke a nationwide survey
processed_abstract: purpose to examine the association between physical activity and depressive symptom in adult with stroke design we conducted a crosssectional study involving the data of 3234 adult with stroke obtained from the 2018 basic health research riset kesehatan dasar riskesdas method physical activity level in metabolic equivalentsminutes per week were determined using the global physical activity questionnaire according to the world health organization who guideline on physical activity and sedentary behavior recommendation depression wa assessed using the miniinternational neuropsychiatric interview multivariate binomial logistic regression analysis wa performed to examine the predictive role of physical activity for depression after adjusting for confounders result adult with stroke who met the who recommendation of physical activity were independently and significantly associated with lower odds of depression after adjustment for confounders adjusted or 0757 p 0017 conclusion performing physical activity according to the who recommendation is associated with a lower likelihood of depression among indonesian adult with stroke clinical relevance clinician should be informed by the finding of this study and prescribe exercise intervention or plan physical activity to optimize recovery and prevent poststroke depression

processed_title: a prototype worldwide survey of diagnostic and treatment modality for stroke
processed_abstract: stroke is a global health problem however very little is known about stroke care in low to middleincome country obtaining countryspecific information could enable u to develop targeted program to improve stroke care we surveyed neurologist from 12 country chile georgia nigeria qatar india lithuania kazakhstan indonesia denmark brazil belgium and bangladesh using a webbased survey tool data were analyzed both for individual country and by income classification low income lower middle income upper middle income and high income six percent n 200 of 3123 targeted physician completed the survey there wa a significant correlation between income classification and access and affordability of head computed tomography scan rho 215 p 002 transthoracic echocardiogram rho 181 p 012 extracranial carotid doppler ultrasound rho 312 p 000 cardiac telemetry rho 353 p 000 and stroke treatment such a intravenous thrombolysis rho 276 p 001 and carotid endarterectomy rho 214 p 004 stroke quality measure such a venous thromboembolism prophylaxis during hospital stay rho 163 p 022 discharge from hospital on antithrombotic therapy rho 266 p 000 consideration for acute thrombolytic therapy rho 358 p 000 and antithrombotic therapy prescribed by end of hospital day 2 rho 334 p 000 however there wa no significant correlation between income classification and the access and affordability of antiplatelet agent vitamin k antagonist and statin anticoagulation for atrial fibrillationflutter statin medication stroke education and assessment for rehabilitation our study show that it is possible to get an overview of stroke treatment measure in different country by conducting an internetbased survey the generalizability of the finding may be limited by the low survey response rate

processed_title: positive correlation between left hemisphere lesion and erectile dysfunction in poststroke patient
processed_abstract: background stroke is a serious health condition and the leading cause of disability including erectile dysfunction ed the mechanism and factor that predict ed in stroke are not fully elucidated several study have shown a relationship between the location of the lesion in stroke with the onset of ed the left hemispheric lesion wa believed to disrupt the parasympathetic nervous system which is responsible for the regulation of erection stroke attack in this region therefore can be the underlying reason for ed however there are still contradictory finding in this area and very few study attempted to look at this problem particularly among asian male aim we would like to evaluate the association between left hemisphere lesion after ischemic stroke and the subsequent risk of developing ed method the study wa conducted in the neurology polyclinic of sanglah and wangaya hospital from february to august 2013 subject are all poststroke patient who visited the neurology polyclinic of sanglah and wangaya hospital that met inclusion and exclusion criterion result there is a significant positive correlation p 005 between left hemisphere lesion and ed in stroke patient with a correlation coefficient r 0361 which mean weak correlation and p 0032 conclusion left hemisphere lesion positively correlated with ed in stroke patient further longitudinal research is needed to see whether left hemisphere lesion in poststroke patient is a risk factor for ed

processed_title: current state of acute stroke care in southeast asian country
processed_abstract: acute stroke care system in southeast asian country are at various stage of development with disparate treatment availability and practice in term of intravenous thrombolysis and endovascular therapy with the advent of successful endovascular therapy stroke trial over the past decade the pressure to revise and advance acute stroke management ha greatly intensified southeast asian patient exhibit unique stroke feature such a increased susceptibility to intracranial atherosclerosis and higher prevalence of intracranial haemorrhage likely secondary to modified vascular risk factor from differing dietary and lifestyle habit accordingly the practice of acute endovascular stroke intervention need to take into account these consideration acute stroke care system in southeast asia also face a unique challenge of huge stroke burden against a background of ageing population differing political landscape and healthcare system in these country building on existing published data further complemented by multinational interaction and collaboration over the past few year the current state of acute stroke care system with existing endovascular therapy service in southeast asian country are consolidated and analysed in this review the challenge facing acute stroke care strategy in this region are discussed

processed_title: impact of air pollution and seasonal haze on neurological condition
processed_abstract: introduction air pollution is a global problem and seasonal haze from forest clearing and peat land burning in indonesia is an annual phenomenon in southeast asia a neurological disorder comprise 63 of the burden of disease globally we reviewed evidence of the association between common neurological condition and air pollution exposure and summarised existing data on the impact of the haze phenomenon in southeast asia material and method a pubmed search for relevant study on air pollution alzheimers disease ad dementia epilepsy haze headache migraine stroke parkinson disease pd and neuromuscular condition wa performed there were 52 article which were relevant and were reviewed result there were association between shortterm air pollution exposure with ad epilepsy ischaemic stroke and migraine longterm air pollution exposure wa associated with ad amyotrophic lateral sclerosis dementia and ischaemic stroke evidence on the link between air pollution and pd wa inconsistent currently there is no specific data on the effect haze ha on neurological condition in southeast asia conclusion air pollution is associated with increased risk of certain common neurological disorder more specific study are needed to investigate the impact of seasonal haze on neurological condition in southeast asia

processed_title: young adult rehabilitation experience and need following stroke yarn a scoping review of the rehabilitation care experience and outcome of young adult poststroke
processed_abstract: background stroke is one of the leading disabling condition in the united kingdom while an increasing focus on the rehabilitation care for stroke survivor ha been noted practice guideline target and service tend to be tailored for the elderly population rather than young adult objective this scoping review aimed to map the existing literature on the rehabilitation care experience and outcome of young adult poststroke aged between 18 and 45 year within acute and social care setting method and analysis a scoping review wa conducted to identify existing practice and published academic and evidencebased literature related to the topic arksey and omalleys framework guided the review and reporting followed the prismascr checklist electronic database and grey literature were searched to capture the potentially recent and relevant literature available in english from year 20002022 the database included cinahl medline embase psycinfo assia amed pedro cochrane library and web of science grey literature wa searched from the following source google scholar website of network organisation and charity related to stroke hand search were performed on the reference list of the included article and grey literature to find relevant reference data were extracted on young adult experience of stroke and rehabilitation care and their outcome and experience of a particular stroke rehabilitation programme in acute and social care setting result eightyfive article were included in this review in most instance stroke wa reported to negatively impact young adult although positive consequence were also documented the focus and the outcome of stroke rehabilitation were predominantly physical especially in the area of movement communication and memory young adult experienced a lack of ageadapted stroke rehabilitation in acute and social care setting conclusion our result highlight the unmet need of young adult in their stroke recovery journey effective rehabilitation programme and intervention should be developed to support young adult following stroke and meet their agespecific need

processed_title: a systematicsearchandreview of registered pharmacological therapy investigated to improve neurorecovery after a stroke
processed_abstract: background stroke burden is largely due to longterm impairment requiring prolonged care with loss of productivity we aimed to identify and assess study of different registered pharmacological therapy a treatment to improve poststroke impairment andor disability method we performed a systematicsearchandreview of treatment that have been investigated a recoveryenhancing or recoverypromoting therapy in adult patient with stroke the treatment must have received registration or market authorization in any country regardless of primary indication outcome included in the review were neurological impairment and functionaldisability assessment the best available study based on study design study size andor date of publication were selected and graded for level of evidence loe by consensus result our systematic search yielded 7801 citation and we reviewed 665 fulltext paper fiftyeight publication were selected a the best study across 25 pharmacological class 31 on ischemic stroke 21 on ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke 4 on intracerebral hemorrhage and 2 on subarachnoid hemorrhage sah twentysix were systematic reviewsmetaanalyses 29 were randomized clinical trial rcts and three were cohort study only nimodipine for sah had loe a of benefit systematic review and network metaanalysis many study some of which showed treatment effect were assessed a loe cld mainly due to small sample size or poor quality seven intervention had loe br systematic reviewmetaanalysis or rct of treatment effect conclusion only one commercially available treatment ha loe a for routine use in stroke further study of putative neuroprotective drug a adjunctive treatment to revascularization procedure and more confirmatory trial on recoverypromoting therapy will enhance the certainty of their benefit the decision on their use must be guided by the clinical profile neurological impairment and target outcome based on the available evidence systematic review registration httpswwwcrdyorkacukprosperodisplay_recordphprecordid376973 prospero crd42022376973

processed_title: comparison of mean vegfa expression between acute ischemic stroke patient and nonischemic stroke subject
processed_abstract: background glucose and oxygen supply to neuron are disrupted during acute ischemic stroke resulting in hypoxia this event in turn activates the transcription of hypoxiainducible factor hif1 which is responsible for activating gene responsible for angiogenesis including vascular endothelial growth factor vegf vegf and their receptor system exert complex mechanism of angiogenesis including the stimulator inhibitor angiogenic and modulator vegfa is the primary regulator of angiogenesis both during physiological and pathological condition nevertheless the role of vegf on the prognosis of hypoxia remains controversial aim the purpose of this study wa to address if there is any difference between the mean expression of vegfa between acute ischemic patient and nonischemic stroke subject method this wa an observational study with a crosssectional design the population in this research is the acute ischemic stroke patient and nonischemic stroke subject which were admitted on emergency room and later treated in the stroke unit dr sardjito general hospital yogyakarta indonesia subject were recruited using the purposive method yielding a total of 64 subject on both group diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke wa established using a head ct scan patient who meet the inclusion criterion and willing to participate in the study were asked to provide informed consent laboratory analysis wa conducted during the first 24 hour after being treated at stroke unit dr sardjito general hospital yogyakarta indonesia with venous blood wa withdrawn vegfa level between acute ischemic stroke and nonischemic stroke subject were subsequently compared categorical variable including gender were tested using either chisquare or fisher exact test interval data wa examined using student ttest if data distribution wa normal result a many a 35 acute ischemic stroke and 35 nonischemic stroke patient were included in the study among whom were 18 men 5143 and 17 woman 4857 among stroke patient and 21 60 men and 14 40 woman among subject without stroke the average of the subject age on stroke and nonischemic stroke group wa 5851 and 4857 year old vegfa level were significantly higher in the nonstroke group 56177 37792 compared with stroke group 39778 18153 with p 002 conclusion expression of vegfa in acute ischemic stroke group wa lower when compared with the nonstroke group

processed_title: correlation of neutrophiltolymphocyte ratio and clinical outcome of acute thrombotic stroke in patient with covid19
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic ha caused million of death worldwide acute ischemic stroke is a lifethreatening risk factor for covid19 infection neutrophiltolymphocyte ratio nlr is one of the predictor of poor prognosis in acute ischemic stroke the aim of this study wa to assess the correlation between nlr value and the clinical outcome of acute thrombotic stroke patient with covid19 that wa measured using the national institute of health stroke scale nihss a cross sectional hospitalbased study wa conducted in dr soetomo general hospital surabaya indonesia patient with acute thrombotic stroke and covid19 admitted between 1 march 2020 and 31 may 2021 were recruited the nlr value and the nihss score were assessed during the admission and the correlation between nlr and nihss score wa calculated this study included 21 patient with acute thrombotic stroke and covid19 consisting of 12 male and 9 female the mean age wa 576 year old the mean nlr value wa 83367 and the nihss score ranging from 1 to 33 our data suggested a positive correlation between nlr value and nihss score r045 with p0041 in conclusion the nlr value is potentially to be used a a predictor of the clinical outcome in acute thrombotic stroke patient with covid19 however further study is warranted to validate this finding

processed_title: global epidemiology of atrial fibrillation
processed_abstract: atrial fibrillation af is a major public health burden worldwide and it prevalence is set to increase owing to widespread population ageing especially in rapidly developing country such a brazil china india and indonesia despite the availability of epidemiological data on the prevalence of af in north america and western europe corresponding data are limited in africa asia and south america moreover other observation suggest that the prevalence of af might be underestimatednot only in lowincome and middleincome country but also in their highincome counterpart future study are required to provide precise estimation of the global af burden identify important risk factor in various region worldwide and take into consideration regional and ethnic variation in af furthermore in response to the increasing prevalence of af additional resource will need to be allocated globally for prevention and treatment of af and it associated complication in this review we discus the available data on the global prevalence risk factor management financial cost and clinical burden of af and highlight the current worldwide inadequacy of it treatment

processed_title: longterm exposure to low air pollutant concentration and the relationship with allcause mortality and stroke in older men
processed_abstract: background longterm air pollution exposure ha been associated with increased risk of mortality and stroke less is known about the risk at lower concentration the association of longterm exposure to pm25 pm25 absorbance no2 and nox with allcause mortality and stroke wa investigated in a cohort of men aged 65 year who lived in metropolitan perth western australia method land use regression model were used to estimate longterm exposure to air pollutant at participant home address n 11627 over 16 year different metric of exposure were assigned baseline year before the outcome event and average exposure across followup period the mortality register and hospital morbidity data from the western australia data linkage system were used to ascertain mortality and stroke case hazard ratio hr and 95 confidence interval were estimated using cox proportional hazard model adjusting for age smoking education and body mass index for allcause mortality for fatal and hospitalized stroke the model included variable controlled for allcause mortality plus hypertension result fiftyfour percent of allparticipants died 3 suffered a fatal stroke and 14 were hospitalized stroke case pm25 absorbance increased the risk of allcause mortality with adjusted hr of 112 102123 for baseline and average exposure and 114 102124 for pastyear exposure there were no association between pm25 absorbance no2 and nox and stroke outcome however pm25 wa associated with reduced risk of fatal stroke conclusion longterm exposure to pm25 absorbance wa associated with allcause mortality among older men exposed to low concentration and exposure to pm25 wa associated with reduced risk of fatal stroke

processed_title: the impact of thyroid disorder on cardiovascular disease unraveling the connection and implication for patient care
processed_abstract: the thyroid gland is responsible for metabolism a well a cardiac function and the peripheral vascular system thyroid dysfunction are associated with an increase in the risk of cardiovascular disease including heart failure and coronary heart disease atrial fibrillation by impairing heart contractility stroke volume heart rate peripheral vascular resistance and electrical activity thyroid dysfunction also alter several cardiovascular risk factor such a atherosclerosis hypertension and dyslipidemia a well a causing stroke which is associated with atrial fibrillation an antiarrhythmic drug amiodarone may also induce both thyrotoxicosis and hypothyroidism so it use requires serial thyroid function testing every cvd patient is recommended to be screened and treated for any possible thyroid dysfunction to reduce the patient mortality and morbidity

processed_title: combination of vitamin a and d supplementation for ischemic stroke effect on interleukin1ss and clinical outcome
processed_abstract: aim accumulated evidence suggests that vitamin a and d agonist can alleviate the development of atherosclerosis therefore the aim of this study wa to determine the effect of vitamin a and d combination supplement on interleukin1beta il1beta and clinical outcome in ischemic stroke method a singleblind randomized controlled trial wa conducted on ischemic stroke patient at adam malik hospital between march 2018 to february 2019 the patient were randomized into 4 group of the treatment consisting of supplementation using vitamin a or d only combination of vitamin a and d and placebo group all given for 12 week clinical outcome wa determined using the national institute of health stroke scale nihss at the time of admission and after the treatment wa completed all patient were measured for vitamin a vitamin d and il1beta serum level and nihss score result from the total of 120 patient in the combination group there were significant increment on both vitamin a p004 and vitamin d p001 serum level after 12 week of the treatment compared to the other group in conjunction il1beta serum level showed a significant decrement in the combination group p0001 lastly the biggest improvement of nihss could be seen in the combination group which wa marked by the highest decrement of nihss score p0001 conclusion administration of combination of vitamin a and d supplementation can significantly increase vitamin a and d serum level decrease il1beta serum level and ultimately improve clinical outcome in ischemic stroke patient

processed_title: association of coagulation factor profile with clinical outcome in patient with covid19 and acute stroke a second wave cohort study
processed_abstract: introduction the second wave of covid19 in indonesia occurred due to delta variant transmission with up to 2266 case this variant could cause higher rate of morbidity and mortality this study reported coagulation profile of covid19 patient with acute stroke and it association with patient outcome method this is a cohortretrospective study conducted during the second wave of covid19 juneaugust 2021 in cipto mangunkusumo general hospital inclusion criterion were adult patient with confirmed covid19 and diagnosed with acute stroke confirmed by radiological evidence exclusion criterion were covid19 patient with prior diagnosis of acute stroke coagulation factor were analyzed and presented with table and graph result a total of 33 patient included in this study with majority experienced ischemic stroke 848 followed by ischemic with haemorrhagic transformation 91 and the rest with haemorrhagic stroke the median of fibrinogen and ddimer wa 48711478943mgdl and 211025035200ugl respectively prothrombin time pt ratio wa 09508213 and activated partial thromboplastin time aptt ratio wa 101064272 on observation 333 died during hospitalization ddimer value in these patient wa significantly higher with 9940ugl compared to those who survived with 1160uglp 0009 the highest ddimer value during hospitalization wa also significantly higher with the median of 14395ugl compared to 3740 ugl p 0014 discussion ddimer value on initial assessment and it highest value during hospitalization were significantly higher in patient with poor outcome showing that ddimer can be one predictor of mortality in covid19 patient with acute stroke

processed_title: rapid atrial fibrillation in the emergency department
processed_abstract: atrial fibrillation af is the most common rhythm disorder seen in doctor office and emergency department ed in both setting an af holistic pathway including anticoagulation or stroke avoidance better symptom management and cardiovascular and comorbidity optimization should be followed however other consideration need to be assessed in the ed such a haemodynamic instability the onset of af the presence of acute heart failure and preexcitation although the advanced cardiovascular life support guideline european society of cardiology guideline acute cardiac care associationeuropean heart rhythm association position statement and several recent af publication have greatly assisted physician in treating af with rapid ventricular response in the ed further practical clinical guidance is required to improve physician skill and knowledge in providing the best treatment for patient herein we combine multiple strategy with supporting evidencebased treatment and experience encountered in clinical practice into practical stepwise approach we hope that the stepwise algorithm may assist resident and physician in managing af in the ed

processed_title: the modifiable risk factor of uncontrolled hypertension in stroke a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective this review aimed at figuring out the risk factor of uncontrolled hypertension in stroke method this study systematically analyzed the hypertension risk factor available in the proquest ebsco and pubmed database published between 2010 and december 2019 the risk factor pooled odds ratio por included in this research wa calculated using both fixed and randomeffect model the metadata analysis wa processed using the review manager 53 rev man 53 result of 1868 article seven study were included in this review searched using specific keywords based on the analysis result there were 7 risk factor of uncontrolled hypertension in stroke medication nonadherence por 223 95 ci 171289 p 0342 i 2 67 use of antihypertensive drug por 113 95 ci 119159 p 0001 i 2 909 stage of hypertension por 114 95 ci 102127 p 0001 i 2 971 diabetes mellitus por 071 95 ci 052099 p 0001 i 2 965 atrial fibrillation por 174 95 ci 148204 p 0001 i 2 931 triglyceride por 147 95 ci 123175 p 0879 i 2 0 and age por 103 95 ci 089118 p 0001 i 2 975 there were no bias publication among study medication nonadherence and triglyceride had homogeneous variation while the others had heterogeneous variation conclusion medication nonadherence triglyceride stage of hypertension atrial fibrillation and use of antihypertensive drug significantly affect the uncontrolled hypertension in stroke

processed_title: projection of diabetes morbidity and mortality till 2045 in indonesia based on risk factor and ncd prevention and control program
processed_abstract: diabetes mellitus is one of the biggest health problem in indonesia but the research on the disease projection is still limited this study aimed to make a projection model of prevalence and mortality of diabetes in indonesia based on risk factor and ncd program the study wa a quantitative nonexperimental study through multiple linear regression model and system dynamic the baseline projection wa created by 2018 data and projection until 2045 involved the dynamization of risk factor and program population and case fatality rate the model wa created from 205 district data this study used secondary data from basic health research bpjs kesehatan ncd program and ministry of health the prevalence of diabetes in indonesia is estimated to increase from 919 in 2020 1869 million case to 1609 in 2045 407 million case the prevalence will be lower to 1568 396 million if intervention of program were carried out and to 922 232 million if the program were added with prevention of risk factor the projected number of death due to diabetes increase from 433752 in 2020 to 944468 in 2045 death due to stroke among diabetes increase from 52397 to 114092 in the same period death from ihd among diabetes increase from 35351 to 76974 and death from chronic kidney disease among diabetes increase from 29061 to 63279 diabetes prevalence and mortality in indonesia rise significantly in indonesia and can be reduced by intervention of several program and risk factor this study finding could be source of planning and evaluation of diabetes prevention and control program at national and provincial level in the future related to risk factor control and program development

processed_title: cerebral small vessel disease in indonesia lacunar infarction study from indonesian stroke registry 20122014
processed_abstract: background and purpose stroke is the number one cause of morbidity and mortality in indonesia lacunar infarction is one of cerebral small vessel disease spectrum this study aimed to present stroke epidemiology in indonesia and risk factor associated with cerebral small vessel disease method a multicenter prospective crosssectional study of 18 hospital in indonesia wa conducted using stroke case report form from 2012 to 2014 stroke wa diagnosed based on clinical finding confirmed with noncontrast computed tomography of the brain subject were classified into two large group ischemic lacunar and nonlacunar and hemorrhagic intracranial and subarachnoid hemorrhage other risk factor were assessed on admission result we enrolled 5411 patient of whom 3627 6703 had ischemic stroke and 1784 3297 had hemorrhagic stroke male patient were prevalent in both large group although found less in subarachnoid hemorrhage group among patient with hemorrhagic stroke 1603 8954 of them had intracerebral hemorrhage and 181 1046 had subarachnoid hemorrhage from 3627 ischemic stroke patient 1635 4507 of them had lacunar infarction we found that age above 55 year old male gender hypertension dyslipidemia and diabetes were important risk factor associated with lacunar stroke p 005 conclusion ischemic stroke wa the leading cause of stroke in indonesia in total 45 of the total ischemic stroke patient had lacunar infarction important risk factor associated with lacunar infarction were hypertension dyslipidemia diabetes age over 55 and male population

processed_title: association between working memory impairment and activity of daily living in poststroke patient
processed_abstract: aim stroke is one of the leading cause of adult disability and functional impairment worldwide cognitive impairment including memory dysfunction are common after stroke and may have a negative impact to the functional status and activity of daily living adl the study aimed to determine the impact of working memory impairment after stroke on adl method this crosssectional study involved poststroke patient who underwent neurologic examination and mini mental state examination mmse forward digit span fds and backward digit span bd to assess cognitive function and assessment of daily life activity adl and instrumental activity of daily living iadl scale result this study included 38 patient 23 605 male and 15 395 female the mean mmse fds and bd score were 2460449 4871166 and 3471158 respectively there were 17 447 patient with cognitive impairment mmse score wa lower than 24 the mean adl and iadl score were significantly higher in patient with cognitive impairment showing greater dependency in this group of patient there wa a significant negative correlation between global cognitive function working memory and adl and iadl score in poststroke patient conclusion cognitive impairment ha a negative impact on daily life activity in poststroke patient

processed_title: biomarkers of atrial fibrillation which one is a true marker
processed_abstract: atrial fibrillation af is the most common sustained cardiac arrhythmia and associated with the risk of stroke and death continuous development of the diagnostic tool and prognostic stratification may lead to optimal management of af the use of biomarkers in the management of af ha been grown a an interesting topic however the af biomarkers are not yet well established in the major guideline among these biomarkers a lot of data show troponin and brain natriuretic peptide are promising for the prediction of future event the troponin elevation in af patient may not necessarily be diagnosed a myocardial infarction or significant coronary artery stenosis and brain natriuretic peptide elevation may not necessarily confirm heart failure troponin t and troponin i may predict postoperative af furthermore troponin and brain natriuretic peptide gave better prognostic performance when compared with the risk score available today

processed_title: coagulation and hemorheology profile of patient with stroke and covid19 a case series during second wave pandemic
processed_abstract: in 2021 the delta variant wa discovered heralding the start of the second pandemic wave this case series aim to analyse and compare the coagulation and hemorheology profile of covid19 patient diagnosed with acute stroke during the pandemic second wave and ascertain the effect on patient outcome this case series report 4 case with their respective characteristic case 1 report on covid19 patient without comorbidities case 2 with comorbidities case 3 with stroke in young patient and case 4 with stroke in elderly patient all case had abnormal coagulation and hemorheology factor with mixed outcome coagulation and hemorheology factor tend to be higher in covid19 patient with acute stroke the value of coagulation and hemorheology factor can be a prognostic outcome in covid19 patient with severe disease especially in patient associated with acute stroke

processed_title: home rehabilitation using androidbased system a booster on the independence of stroke patient in local government hospital in aceh indonesia
