processed_abstract: background and aim the independence of stroke patient played the main role in not only preventing the asymptomatic attack which delayed assistance but also enhancing their quality of life by reducing their dependence on family member or caregiver however the inaccessibility and expense of treatment prevented stroke patient from continuing their rehabilitation and exercise after returning home thus the purpose of this study wa to provide an efficient system for alternative home rehabilitation to boost the selfcare independence of stroke patient by designing androidbased home rehabilitation method the quantitative research wa conducted using a nonrandomized trial where the patient were purposively sampled 70 participant were joined and divided into two group the control and intervention group the intervention group will have simtroke application on their smartphone a the home rehabilitation process where control group would not have simtroke installed the effect of home rehabilitation wa assessed by univariate bivariate analysis and the correlation matrix to analyze home rehabilitation effect to the participant self independence result the result showed that the independent intervention in poststroke patient ha a significant effect on increasing the independence of stroke patient to improve their quality of life of stroke patient the highest improvement were found in urination and toileting followed by defecation dressing active and phase motion range selfcare stepping to stair mobilization showering and eating ability conclusion the result proved that home rehabilitation utilizing an androidbased system could be employed a an alternate method to assist stroke patient in improving their independence and quality of life wwwactabiomedicait

processed_title: prevalence of mental health disorder among elderly diabetic and associated risk factor in indonesia
processed_abstract: this crosssectional study aimed to explore mental health disorder mhd prevalence among elderly diabetic in indonesia data were extracted from the 2018 national basic health survey in indonesia abbreviated a riskesdas the survey involved household randomly selected from 34 province 416 district and 98 city in indonesia with 1017290 respondent the number of subject selected in this study wa 2818 elderly diabetic subject mhd wa determined by selfreporting assessment secondary data acquired from riskesdas 2018 data involved age sex urbanrural residence status marital status educational level employment status obesity hypertension heart disease stroke family history of mhd and dm duration binary logistic regression with a backward stepwise method wa used to analyze the risk factor related to mhd mhd prevalence among elderly diabetic in indonesia wa 193 factor associated with mhd among elderly diabetic were being female prevalence odds ratio por 164 95 ci 11262394 married por 005 95 ci 00310084 less education por 337 95 ci 159810355 and stroke por 161 95 ci 11832269 mhd prevalence among elderly diabetic in indonesia wa 193 suggesting that screening for psychological problem and educating elderly diabetic patient is essential unmarried female elderly diabetic with less education and stroke were altogether more likely to experience mhd

processed_title: targeting inflammation and immune system in acute myocardial infarction
processed_abstract: over more than two decade the concept of atherosclerosis ha developed and lead to inflammatory hypothesis inflammation play an important role on pathogenesis of atherothrombosis and coronary heart disease chd including acute coronary syndrome ac although the management of ac ha been demonstrated to be beneficial for secondary prevention of coronary heart disease such a using statin and aspirin and also seemed to have positive effect on inflammation the identification of effective management specifically targeting inflammation ha been not been comprehensively understoodthe canakinumab antiinflammatory thrombosis outcome study canto supported targeting inflammation a a potential effective treatment for chronic coronary heart disease in the canto study canakinumab a monoclonal antibody that inhibits interleukin1beta reduced the level of hscrp and caused lower risk of composite endpoint of death due to cardiovascular disease myocardial infarct or stroke compared to placebo however nonspecific antiinflammatory treatment using methotrexate in the cardiovascular inflammation reduction trial cirt study did not show any reduced hscrp and demonstrated that there is no benefit associated with cardiovascular outcome which left u with a question whether direct intervention on inflammation could improve cardiovascular outcome

processed_title: clinical significance of platelettowhite blood cell ratio pwr and national institute of health stroke scale nihss in acute ischemic stroke
processed_abstract: introduction ischemic stroke can occur due to disruption of blood and oxygen supply to brain tissue white blood cell and platelet play an important role in the pathogenesis of ischemic stroke several study have concluded that the lower the platelet count and the higher the number of white blood cell in ischemic stroke patient will result in a more severe stroke and had worsen prognosis platelet and white blood cell count can be converted into platelettowhite blood cell ratio pwr which is a comparison between the number of platelet and white blood cell so the higher pwr will provide better clinical outcome here we examined correlation between pwr and clinical outcome in acute ischemic stroke using nihss tool method this research method wa a retrospective analytic from 503 medical record of ischemic stroke patient from january 2015 to december 2017 ischemic stroke divided into 2 group cardioembolic stroke and atherothrombotic stroke based on medical record we calculated pwr and national institute of health stroke scale nihss for assessing clinical outcome statistical significance calculated with spearman rank test anova and multiple logistic regression result a total of 391 research subject consisting of 213 female 545 and 178 male 455 the mean age of 5714 year and 82 subject had hypertension a risk factor mean pwr of atherothrombotic stroke subject were higher than cardioembolic stroke 3302 v 2673 but had lower mean of nihss 581 v 1031 and had strong negative significant correlation between pwr and nihss r 09603 p 0001 from logistic regression we found that pwr and platelet wa statistically significance correlate with nihss p 005 the coefficient if pwr is the highest absolute value among other independent variablesit show that pwr ha positive effect on clinical outcome using nihss tool in acute ischemic stroke patient conclusion cardioembolic stroke had higher pwr compared with atherothrombotic stroke pwr had a strong correlation with nihss the higher pwr will provide higher nihss and pwr ha positive effect on clinical outcome using nihss tool in acute ischemic stroke patient

processed_title: a singlecenter experience of correlation of pulse pressure to mortality of stroke hemorrhage patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the relationship between pulse pressure and mortality in acute stroke hemorrhage patient is a subject of debate to investigate this relationship in the indonesian context a study wa conducted due to the increasing prevalence of stroke in the country method the study sample consisted of 111 patient with acute stroke hemorrhage admitted to the hospital between january 1 2016 and december 31 2019 patient with sepsis cancer or other hematology disorder were excluded a were those who were lost to followup statistical analysis wa performed using spss 22 and correlation were evaluated between various patient characteristic and laboratory value result it wa revealed that patient with a wider pulse pressure were more likely to die adjusted odds ratio 3070 than those with a normal or constricted pulse pressure conclusion pulse pressure had an impact on the mortality of patient with acute hemorrhagic stroke

processed_title: noncontrast mri sequence for ischemic stroke a concise overview for clinical radiologist
processed_abstract: ischemic stroke is the second leading cause of mortality and morbidity worldwide due to the urgency of implementing immediate therapy acute stroke necessitates prompt diagnosis the current gold standard for vascular imaging in stroke include computed tomography angiography cta digital subtraction angiography dsa and magnetic resonance angiography mra however the contrast agent used in these method can be costly and pose risk for patient with renal impairment or allergy the aim of this paper is to provide a comprehensive overview of current mri technique and sequence for evaluating ischemic stroke emphasizing the importance of noncontrast option and their clinical implication for radiologist in the diagnosis and management of ischemic stroke standard mri sequencessuch a t1weighted imaging t1wi t2weighted imaging t2wi fluidattenuated inversion recovery flair diffusionweighted imaging dwi dwiflair mismatch and apparent diffusion coefficient adcare essential for determining infarct location volume and age additionally incorporating susceptibilityweighted imaging swi sequence aid in identifying sign of hemorrhagic transformation within the infarcted region advanced technique like arterial spin labeling asl can serve a a noncontrast alternative for mapping cerebral blood flow cbf and allowing for comparison between infarcted and healthy brain area adding asl to the routine sequence allows asldwi mismatch analysis that is useful for quantifying salvageable tissue volume and facilitate timely recanalization while timeofflight tof mra and magnetic resonance venography mrv help assess venous thrombosis stenosis or arterial occlusion finally mr spectroscopy can provide insight into critical brain metabolite including nacetylaspartate naa and lactate lac to determine patient prognosis current mri technology provides a myriad of sequence option for the comprehensive evaluation of ischemic stroke without the need for contrast material a thorough understanding of the advantage and limitation of each sequence is crucial for it optimal implementation in diagnosis and treatment

processed_title: trend in ischemic heart disease among female in lowand middleincome country from 1990 to 2019
processed_abstract: background ischemic heart disease ihd is a major contributor to mortality in lowand middleincomecountries lmics however trend in ihd in female in lmics are not well described method we analyzed the global burden of disease gbd study from 1990 to 2019 for male and female with ihd from the ten mostpopulous lmics india indonesia pakistan nigeria ethiopia philippine egypt vietnam iran and afghanistan result in female ihd incidence increased from 950000 casesyear to 16 millionyear ihd prevalence increased from 8 million to 225 million 181 increase and ihd mortality from 428320 to 1040817 143 increase ihd accounted for 62 of all death among female in 1990 doubling to 132 in 2019 ihd mortality for each country increased with the greatest shift in aapc seen in the philippine 58 95 ci 5461 and india 37 95 ci 3044 notably reduction in asmr were greater for male than female in afghanistan iran egypt ethiopia and nigeria all p 0001 conclusion the burden of ihd among female in lmic ha increased considerably in lmics from 1990 to 2019 while the asmr from ihd across most country is declining this wa not uniformly noted furthermore several country noted lesser improvement in asmr among female compared to male

processed_title: guiding principle for chronic total occlusion percutaneous coronary intervention
processed_abstract: outcome of chronic total occlusion cto percutaneous coronary intervention pci have improved because of advancement in equipment and technique with global collaboration and knowledge sharing we have identified 7 common principle that are widely accepted a best practice for ctopci 1 ischemic symptom improvement is the primary indication for ctopci 2 dual coronary angiography and indepth and structured review of the angiogram and if available coronary computed tomography angiography are key for planning and safely performing ctopci 3 use of a microcatheter is essential for optimal guidewire manipulation and exchange 4 antegrade wiring antegrade dissection and reentry and the retrograde approach are all complementary and necessary crossing strategy antegrade wiring is the most common initial technique whereas retrograde and antegrade dissection and reentry are often required for more complex ctos 5 if the initially selected crossing strategy fails efficient change to an alternative crossing technique increase the likelihood of eventual pci success shortens procedure time and lower radiation and contrast use 6 specific ctopci expertise and volume and the availability of specialized equipment will increase the likelihood of crossing success and facilitate prevention and management of complication such a perforation 7 meticulous attention to lesion preparation and stenting technique often requiring intracoronary imaging is required to ensure optimum stent expansion and minimize the risk of short and longterm adverse event these principle have been widely adopted by experienced ctopci operator and center currently achieving high success and acceptable complication rate outcome are less optimal at less experienced center highlighting the need for broader adoption of the aforementioned 7 guiding principle along with the development of additional simple and safe cto crossing and revascularization strategy through ongoing research education and training

processed_title: selfefficacy in selfcare and it related factor among patient with coronary heart disease in indonesia a rasch analysis
processed_abstract: background low selfefficacy se can impact decreasing health status poor selfcare and quality of life among patient with coronary heart disease chd many factor can affect se however study on se in chd patient with rasch model analysis have not been carried out widely purpose this study aim to identify the se in selfcare and it related factor that correlate se among chd patient patient and method crosssectional study wa conducted on 104 adult patient 18 year diagnosed with chd selection of the sample using convenience sampling technique with several predetermined criterion se wa measured using the seqchdm questionnaire with high validity and reliability result data were analyzed using the rasch model and chisquare test result the result showed that most respondent had a moderate se 515 care unit p0003 and duration of illness p0049 were significantly correlated to se among patient with chd maintaining an ideal body weight is the most challenging thing on the other hand stop smoking is the most confident thing to be performed by the respondent conclusion we conclude that chd patient in the acute care unit and patient with a duration of illness 6 month have a lower tendency for se health intervention such a raising awareness about the disease modifying health behavior and immediately screening can improve patient se besides that proper diagnosis and ongoing treatment are crucial to improving se and chd care outcome

processed_title: microalbuminuria and mortality in individual with coronary heart disease a metaanalysis of a prospective study
processed_abstract: aim microalbuminuria ha been elevated a an outcome predictor in cardiovascular medicine however due to the small number of study investigating the association of microalbuminuria and mortality in the coronary heart disease chd population the prognosis value of microalbuminuria in chd remains under debate the objective of this metaanalysis wa to investigate the relationship between microalbuminuria and mortality in individual with chd method a comprehensive literature search wa performed using pubmed europmc science direct and google scholar from 2000 to september 2022 only prospective study investigating microalbuminuria and mortality in chd patient were selected the pooled effect estimate wa reported a risk ratio rr result 5176 patient from eight prospective observational study were included in this metaanalysis individual with chd have a greater overall risk of allcause mortality acm rr 207 95 ci 170244 p 00003 i2 00 a well a cardiovascular mortality cvm rr 323 95 ci 206439 p 00001 i2 00 subgroup analysis based on followup duration and a subset of chd patient were similarly associated with an increased risk of acm conclusion this metaanalysis indicates that microalbuminuria is associated with a higher risk of mortality in individual with chd microalbuminuria can serve a a predictor of poor outcome in chd patient

processed_title: cell sheet transplantation for ischemic heart disease a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective cell sheet transplantation is emerging a an appealing alternative for ischemic heart disease patient a it potentially can increase stem cell viability and retention but the outcome and safety of this treatment are still limited in literature and the result varies widely we conduct a systematic review to look at the efficacy and safety of this promising transplantation method method a systematic review wa performed according to prisma guideline a comprehensive literature search wa undertaken using the pubmed scopus and embase database article were thoroughly evaluated and analyzed result seven publication about cell sheet transplantation for ischemic heart disease patient were included the primary outcome measured were left ventricular ejection fraction lvef and new york heart association nyha class safety measurement wa depicted by cardiacrelated readmission and death the followup time ranged from 3 to 36 month for clinical outcome and 85 year for safety outcome cell sheet transplantation showed improvement in lvef and nyha class in most study cardiacrelated readmission and adverse event of cell sheet transplantation range from 0 to 304 all were nonfatal a no cardiacrelated death wa reported patient preoperative status seems can affect the patient response to cell sheet therapy conclusion cell sheet transplantation can safely improve lvef and nyha class in ischemic heart disease patient even in very low ejection fraction patient with unsuccessful standard therapy before further study with better patient inclusion larger population and longterm followup required to confirm these result

processed_title: illness perception and cardiovascular health behaviour among person with ischemic heart disease in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective a study wa conducted to explore the level of illness perception the level of cardiovascular health behaviour and the relationship between illness perception and cardiovascular health behaviour among person with ischemic heart disease ihd in a community setting method the participant comprised 235 person with ihd the instrument used were a follows 1 demographic data and health information 2 the brief illness perception questionnaire brief ipq 3 the openended questionnaire oeq and 4 the modified cardiac health behaviour scale mchbs finding from the oeq are used to assess indepth illness perception and to extend the information obtained from the brief ipq the design of the study wa descriptive correlational the data were analysed using descriptive statistic to present the demographic data and health information inferential statistic wa used to resolve the relationship between illness perception and cardiovascular health behaviour by using pearsons product moment correlation result the mean score of illness perception wa at a moderate level m 4365 sd 393 whereas the mean score of cardiovascular health behaviour wa at a high level m 8029 sd 542 a significant positive relationship existed between illness perception and cardiovascular health behaviour among person with ihd r 038 p 001 conclusion person with higher illness perception showed a positive correlation with higher cardiovascular health behaviour at a significant level of 001 result provided important information for nurse to develop an intervention program to promoting appropriate illness perception and cardiovascular health behaviour among person with ihd

processed_title: evaluating the quality of evidence for diagnosing ischemic heart disease from verbal autopsy in indonesia
processed_abstract: background mortality and cause of death data are fundamental to health policy development civil registration and vital statistic system are the ideal data source but the system is still under development in indonesia a national sample registration system sr ha provided nationally representative mortality data from 128 subdistricts since 2014 verbal autopsy va is used in the sr to obtain cause of death the quality of va data must be evaluated a part of the sr data quality assessment aim to assess the strength of evidence used in the assignment of ischaemic heart disease ihd a cause of death from va method the sample frame for this study is the 4070 death that had ihd assigned a the underlying cause in the sr 2016 database from these 400 case were randomly selected a data extraction form and data entry template were designed to collect relevant data about ihd from va questionnaire a standardised categorisation wa designed to assess the strength of evidence used to infer ihd a a cause of death a pilot test of 50 case wa carried out ibm spss software wa used in this study result strong evidence of ihd a a cause of death wa assigned based on surgery for coronary heart disease chest pain and two out of sudden death history of heart disease medical diagnosis of heart disease or terminal shortness of breath more than half 53 of the questionnaire contained strong evidence for death outside health facility va questionnaire for male death contained acceptable evidence in significantly higher proportion a compared to those for female death p 0001 nearly half of all ihd death were concentrated in the 5069 year age group 4840 and a further 3610 were aged 70 year or more nearly twothirds of the deceased were male 5840 smoking behaviour wa found in 4411 of ihd death but this figure wa 7382 among male conclusion more than half of the va questionnaire from the study sample were found to contain strong evidence to infer ihd a the cause of death result from medical record such a electrocardiogram coronary angiography and load test could have improved the strength of evidence and contributed to ihd cause of death diagnosis

processed_title: trend of ischemic heart disease mortality attributable to smoking in the five country with the highest number of smoker during 19902019 an ageperiodcohort analysis
processed_abstract: introduction smoking increase the risk of various cardiovascular disease including ischemic heart disease ihd this study aimed to assess the impact of age period and cohort on longterm trend in ihd mortality in china india indonesia the united state and russia the five country with the highest number of smoker from 1990 to 2019 material and method the data were obtained from the global burden of disease gbd study 2019 and the agestandardized mortality rate asmr wa calculated joinpoint regression analysis wa used to assess the magnitude and direction of trend in smokingattributable mortality from ihd ageperiodcohort apc study were used to estimate net drift estimated annual percentage change eapcs local drift agespecific eapcs and independent trend in age period and cohort effect result the analysis revealed a significant downward trend in asmrs attributable to ihd a a result of smoking in the united state india and russia indonesia and china showed an upward trend age effect were increasing for both country and sex with china showing the most significant increase in the older age group period effect were decreasing in all country except indonesia and cohort effect were increasing only in indonesia and china conclusion from 1990 to 2019 mortality from ihd caused by smoking showed a downward trend in these five country however the pattern of increased mortality from ihd in woman caused by smoking warrant further study

processed_title: bacteroides vulgatus and bacteroides dorei reduce gut microbial lipopolysaccharide production and inhibit atherosclerosis
processed_abstract: background it is increasingly recognized that gut microbiota play a pivotal role in the development of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease previously we have reported that the abundance of genus bacteroides is lower in patient with coronary artery disease cad than in patient without cad with coronary risk factor or in healthy volunteer however it remains unclear which and how specific gut bacteria contribute to the progression of atherosclerosis method we recruited patient with cad patient and control without cad with coronary risk factor we then compared gut microbial composition using 16 ribosomal rna gene sequencing in fecal sample to detect specie with differential abundance between 2 group subsequently we used atherosclerosisprone mouse to study the mechanism underlying the relationship between such specie and atherosclerosis result human fecal 16 ribosomal rna gene sequencing revealed a significantly lower abundance of bacteroides vulgatus and bacteroides dorei in patient with cad this significant differential abundance wa confirmed by quantitative polymerase chain reaction gavage with live b vulgatus and b dorei attenuated atherosclerotic lesion formation in atherosclerosisprone mouse markedly ameliorating endotoxemia followed by decreasing gut microbial lipopolysaccharide production effectively suppressing proinflammatory immune response furthermore fecal lipopolysaccharide level in patient with cad were significantly higher and negatively correlated with the abundance of b vulgatus and b dorei conclusion our translational research finding identify a previously unknown link between specific gut bacteria and atherosclerosis treatment with live b vulgatus and b dorei may help prevent cad clinical trial registration url httpsuploaduminacjpcgiopenbinctr_ectr_viewcgirecptnor000018051 unique identifier umin000015703

processed_title: variation in secondary prevention of coronary heart disease the interaspire study
processed_abstract: background and aim interaspire is an international study of coronary heart disease chd patient designed to measure if guideline standard for secondary prevention and cardiac rehabilitation are being achieved in a timely manner method between 2020 and 2023 adult hospitalized in the preceding 624 month with incident or recurrent chd were sampled in 14 country from all 6 world health organization region and invited for a standardized interview and examination direct age and sex standardization wa used for countrylevel prevalence estimation result overall 4548 211 female chd patient were interviewed a median of 105 interquartile range 76145 year after index hospitalization among all participant 246 were obese 407 centrally only 386 achieved a blood pressure bp 13080 mmhg and 166 a ldl cholesterol ldlc of 14 mmoll of those smoking at hospitalization 48 persisted at interview of those with known diabetes 552 achieved glycated haemoglobin hba1c of 70 a further 98 had undetected diabetes and 269 impaired glucose tolerance female were less likely to achieve the target bp female 368 male 389 ldlc female 120 male 179 and hba1c in diabetes female 477 male 575 overall just 90 intercountry range 38200 reported attending cardiac rehabilitation and 10 intercountry range 024 achieved the study definition of optimal guideline adherence conclusion interaspire demonstrates inadequate and heterogeneous international implementation of guideline standard for secondary prevention in the first year after chd hospitalization with geographic and sex disparity investment aimed at reducing betweencountry and betweenindividual variability in secondary prevention will promote equity in global effort to reduce the burden of chd

processed_title: evaluation of a clinical pharmacist intervention on clinical and drugrelated problem among coronary heart disease inpatient a preexperimental prospective study at a general hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to evaluate the role of a clinical pharmacist intervention in decreasing subsequent clinical and drugrelated problem drps among coronary heart disease chd inpatient with at least one previous drp method this preexperimental study with a prepost design wa carried out from january to april 2017 among inpatient with at least one previous drp at a general hospital in tangerang district banten indonesia clinical and drps were documented prospectively by a clinical pharmacist with drps classified using version 62 of the drp classification scheme of the pharmaceutical care network europe foundation the intervention consisted of a discussion of identified drps with physician patient pharmaceutical logistics clerk nurse and nutritionist following this any subsequent clinical and drps were reidentified and further intervention were conducted a necessary result a total of 75 inpatient were included in the study preintervention there were 443 drps and 202 clinical problem the most frequent drps were adverse drug reaction 526 followed by drug effect 418 most drps were of moderate severity and would have resulted in moderate consequence had the pharmacist not intervened the intervention resulted in a significant reduction in the number of drps type of drps and number of clinical problem p 005 each patient with complication were 26047 time more likely to have no reduction or an increased number of clinical problem compared to patient without complication p 005 conclusion clinical pharmacist intervention were found to reduce subsequent drps and clinical problem among chd patient with at least one previous drp

processed_title: the potential of single nucleotide polymorphism snp a biomarkers and their association with the increased risk of coronary heart disease a systematic review
processed_abstract: human genetic analysis and epidemiological study showed a potential association between several type of gene polymorphism and the development of coronary heart disease chd many study on this pertinent topic need to be investigated further to reach an evidencebased conclusion therefore in this current review we describe several type of gene polymorphism that are potentially linked to chd a systematic review using the database ebsco pubmed and sciencedirect database wa searched until october of 2022 to find relevant study on the topic of gene polymorphism on risk factor for chd especially for the factor associated with single nucleotide polymorphism snp the risk of bias and quality assessment wa evaluated by joanna briggs institute jbi guideline from keyword search result a total of 6243 article were identified which were subsequently narrowed to 14 article using prespecified inclusion criterion the result suggested that there were 33 single nucleotide polymorphism snp that can potentially increase the risk factor and clinical symptom of chd this study also indicated that gene polymorphism had a potential role in increasing chd risk factor that were causally associated with atherosclerosis increased homocysteine immuneinflammatory response lowdensity lipoprotein ldl arterial lesion and reduction of therapeutic effectiveness in conclusion the finding of this study indicate that snp may increase risk factor for chd and snp show different effect between individual this demonstrates that knowledge of snp on chd risk factor can be used to develop biomarkers for diagnostics and therapeutic response prediction to decide successful therapy and become the basis for defining personalized medicine in future

processed_title: multicentre randomized comparison of twostent and provisional stenting technique in patient with complex coronary bifurcation lesion the definition ii trial
processed_abstract: aim the present study aimed to assess the benefit of twostent technique for patient with definition criteriadefined complex coronary bifurcation lesion method and result in total 653 patient with complex bifurcation lesion at 49 international centre were randomly assigned to undergo the systematic twostent technique twostent group or provisional stenting provisional group the primary endpoint wa the composite of target lesion failure tlf at the 1year followup including cardiac death target vessel myocardial infarction tvmi and clinically driven target lesion revascularization tlr the safety endpoint wa definite or probable stent thrombosis at the 1year followup tlf occurred in 37 114 and 20 61 patient in the provisional and twostent group respectively 778 doublekissing crush hazard ratio hr 052 95 confidence interval ci 030090 p 0019 largely driven by increased tvmi 71 hr 043 95 ci 020090 p 0025 and clinically driven tlr 55 hr 043 95 ci 019100 p 0049 in the provisional group at the 1 year after indexed procedure the incidence of cardiac death wa 25 in the provisional group nonsignificant to 21 in the twostent group hr 086 95 ci 031237 p 0772 conclusion for definition criteriadefined complex coronary bifurcation lesion the systematic twostent approach wa associated with a significant improvement in clinical outcome compared with the provisional stenting approach further study is urgently warranted to identify the mechanism contributing to the increased rate of tvmi after provisional stenting study registration httpwwwclinicaltrialscom identifier nct02284750

processed_title: the validity and reliability of the macnew heart disease health related quality of life questionnaire the indonesian version
processed_abstract: background the macnew heart disease health related quality of life tool is used widely in the cardiac population to evaluate the impact of disease and intervention including rehabilitation in addition to the english version it is also available for several other language except the indonesian language therefore the purpose of this study were 1 to translate the macnew questionnaire from the english version to the indonesian language and 2 to estimate the preliminary validity and reliability of the indonesian macnew for patient with coronary artery disease method forward and backward translation procedure wa used to develop the indonesian macnew the indonesian macnew wa administered to 24 patient after one week of revascularization surgery reliability wa assessed by internal consistency and testretest reliability to evaluate concurrent validity the correlation of the compatible domain of the indonesian macnew and sf36 wa assessed result internal consistency reliability of the indonesian macnew wa confirmed with cronbachs alpha of the global scale and all three subscales exceeding 095 test retest reliability wa acceptable with intraclass correlation coefficient of 066 for the global score furthermore an acceptable concurrent validity wa established with statistically significant correlation between indonesian macnew and sf36 pearson correlation ranging from 047 to 071 conclusion the first result of the indonesian macnew indicate acceptable validity and reliability a a measurement tool to assess health related quality of life of indonesian patient with coronary artery disease

processed_title: drugcoated balloon angioplasty of the side branch during provisional stenting the multicenter randomized dcbbif trial
processed_abstract: background side branch stenting is often required during provisional stenting leading to suboptimal result drugcoated balloon dcb for the compromised side branch have emerged a an attractive strategy however the benefit of dcb for coronary bifurcation remains unclear objective this study aimed to investigate whether dcb compared with a noncompliant balloon ncb for the pinched side branch improves the outcome of provisional stenting in patient with simple true coronary bifurcation method in this multicenter randomized controlled trial patient with true coronary bifurcation who had side branch diameter stenosis of 70 after main vessel stenting at 22 center in china indonesia italy and korea were randomly assigned to either dcb or ncb intervention the primary endpoint wa major adverse cardiac event a composite of cardiac death target vessel myocardial infarction or clinically driven targetlesion revascularization at the 1year followup result between september 8 2020 and june 2 2023 784 patient with true coronary bifurcation lesion undergoing main vessel stenting and having a severely compromised side branch were randomly assigned to the dcb n 391 or ncb n 393 group oneyear followup wa completed in all patient the primary endpoint occurred in 28 patient in the dcb group and 49 patient in the ncb group kaplanmeier rate 72 v 125 hr 056 95 ci 035088 p 0013 driven by a reduction in myocardial infarction there were no significant difference between group in procedural success crossover to a 2stent approach allcause death revascularization or stent thrombosis conclusion in patient with simple and true coronary bifurcation lesion undergoing provisional stenting main vessel stenting with a dcb for the compromised side branch resulted in a lower 1year rate of the composite outcome compared with an ncb intervention for the side branch the high rate of periprocedural myocardial infarction which occurred early and did not lead to revascularization are of unclear clinical significance

processed_title: spirituality and negative emotion in individual with coronary heart disease
processed_abstract: many individual with coronary heart disease chd experience diseaserelated anxiety depressive symptom and anger spirituality may be helpful to cope with these negative emotion research finding on the role of spirituality in dealing with negative emotion are inconsistent in this study we examined the association between 7 dimension of spirituality ie meaningfulness trust acceptance caring for others connectedness with nature transcendent experience and spiritual activity and negative emotion among individual with chd in indonesia controlling for perceived social support a well a demographic and clinical characteristic in total 293 individual with chd were recruited from the 3 largest hospital in bandung indonesia they completed the spiritual attitude and involvement list the beck depression inventoryii the trait anxiety scale of the state trait anxiety inventory the multidimensional anger inventory and the multidimensional scale of perceived social support hierarchical linear regression analysis indicated that a higher overall level of spirituality wa associated with lower level of depressive symptom less anxiety and less anger specifically a higher level of trust wa significantly associated with both less depressive symptom and less anxiety higher level of caring for others and spiritual activity were associated with less anxiety and a higher level of connectedness with nature wa associated with less anger these finding underscore the importance of specific dimension of spirituality a a potentially independent buffer against negative emotion in individual with chd

processed_title: health and productivity burden of coronary heart disease in the working indonesian population using lifetable modelling
processed_abstract: objective the impact of coronary heart disease chd and it effect on work productivity at a population level remains unknown in indonesia this study estimate the health and productivity lost to chd in term of year of life qualityadjusted life year qalys and productivityadjusted life year palys setting and participant a lifetable model wa constructed to simulate the experience of indonesian currently aged 1554 year working age with chd followedup to 55 year retirement age the lifetable analysis wa then repeated assuming that the cohort did not have chd difference in the result reflected the impact of chd demographical prevalence and mortality data were based on the 2017 global burden of disease study and 2018 indonesian national health survey cost productivity index and utility were derived from published source the cost of each paly wa assumed to be equivalent to gross domestic product per equivalent fulltime worker us11 765 future cost and outcome were discounted by 3 annually primary and secondary outcome measure difference in total death year of life and palys represented the impact of chd result at present 1 954 543 145 indonesian of workingage have chd by retirement age it wa estimated that chd resulted in 32 492 366 excess death 128 132 05 year of life lost 2 331 495 105 qalys lost and 1 589 490 69 palys lost the economic impact of lost productivity amounted to us333 billion and healthcare cost to us139 billion conclusion the health and economic burden of chd in indonesia loom large this highlight the importance of it prevention and control strategy for which if effective will deliver financial return

processed_title: understanding arteriosclerotic heart disease patient using electronic health record a machine learning and shapley additive explanation approach
processed_abstract: objective the number of death from cardiovascular disease is projected to reach 233 million by 2030 a a contribution to preventing this phenomenon this paper proposed a machine learning ml model to predict patient with arteriosclerotic heart disease ahd we also interpreted the prediction model result based on the ml approach and deployed modelagnostic ml method to identify informative feature and their interpretation method we used a hematology electronic health record ehr with information on erythrocyte hematocrit hemoglobin mean corpuscular hemoglobin mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration leukocyte thrombocyte age and sex to detect and predict ahd we explored random forest rf xgboost and adaboost model we examined the prediction model result based on the confusion matrix and accuracy measure we used the shapley additive explanation shap framework to interpret the ml model and quantify the contribution of feature to prediction result our study included data from 6837 patient with 4702 record from patient diagnosed with ahd and 2135 record from patient without an ahd diagnosis adaboost outperformed rf and xgboost achieving an accuracy of 078 precision of 082 f1score of 085 and recall of 088 according to the shap summary bar plot method hemoglobin wa the most important attribute for detecting and predicting ahd patient the shap local interpretability bar plot revealed that hemoglobin and mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration had positive impact on ahd prediction based on a single observation conclusion ml model based on real clinical data can be used to predict ahd

processed_title: global chronic total occlusion crossing algorithm jacc stateoftheart review
processed_abstract: the author developed a global chronic total occlusion crossing algorithm following 10 step 1 dual angiography 2 careful angiographic review focusing on proximal cap morphology occlusion segment distal vessel quality and collateral circulation 3 approaching proximal cap ambiguity using intravascular ultrasound retrograde and movethecap technique 4 approaching poor distal vessel quality using the retrograde approach and bifurcation at the distal cap by use of a duallumen catheter and intravascular ultrasound 5 feasibility of retrograde crossing through graft and septal and epicardial collateral vessel 6 antegrade wiring strategy 7 retrograde approach 8 changing strategy when failing to achieve progress 9 considering performing an investment procedure if crossing attempt fail and 10 stopping when reaching high radiation or contrast dose or in case of long procedural time occurrence of a serious complication operator and patient fatigue or lack of expertise or equipment this algorithm can improve outcome and expand discussion research and collaboration

processed_title: smartphonebased cardiac rehabilitation program improves functional capacity in coronary heart disease patient a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: cardiac rehabilitation cr reduces mortality and morbidity in coronary heart disease chd however patient show a lack of adherence to cr alternatively telehealth intervention have shown promising result for improving target outcome in cr this study aimed to review the effect of smartphonebased cr on the functional capacity of chd patient a literature search wa performed using pubmed medline embase and cochrane library on 21 march 2022 to find randomised controlled trial on smartphone usage in cr to improve functional capacity outcome included maximal oxygen consumption vo2 max a 6min walk test 6mwt quality of life smoking cessation and modifiable risk factor eleven trial recruiting chd patient were reviewed wearable device connected to smartphone or chatbased application were commonly used for cr delivery most trial managed to provide exercise prescription education on medication adherence and controlling risk factor and psychosocial counselling through the intervention functional capacity improved significantly following smartphonebased cr in chd patient compared to control group a measured by vo2 max and 6mwt patient were more likely to quit smoking compared to traditional care smartphones that delivered cr to chd patient demonstrate superior outcome regarding increasing functional capacity there is no significant improvement on lipid profile blood pressure hba1c body mass index and quality of life it can be used either alone or a an adjunct ultimately the patient preference and circumstance should be considered

processed_title: explaining the increase of incidence and mortality from cardiovascular disease in indonesia a global burden of disease study analysis 20002019
processed_abstract: background in the last two decade there ha been a discernible shift in the distribution of mortality attributed to cardiovascular disease cvd between developing and developed nation in developed nation the percentage of death caused by cvd decreased from 48 in 1990 to 43 in 2010 while in developing nation they increased from 18 to 25 in indonesia cvd death ha increased substantially and remained elevated in the last ten year current behavioral and metabolic risk factor including hyperglycemia obesity dyslipidemia hypertension and smoking enhance the risk of cvd mortality according to several study aim we undertook a study to determine whether the increase in mortality and incidence of cvd can be attributed to change in the most common metabolic and behavioral risk factor from 2000 to 2019 across 34 indonesian province material and method data from 34 province for cvd incidence and mortality and data on change in metabolic and behavioural risk factor between 2000 and 2019 in indonesia were obtained from the global burden study gbd by the institute of health metric and evaluation ihme a statistical model wa applied to calculate the fatality attributable to the risk factor change using population attributable fraction paf and baseline year death number furthermore we ran multivariate regression on summary exposure value of risk factor associated with the increasing mortality incidence rate in a lag year analysis r software used to measure heteroscedasticityconsistent standard error with coeftest and coefci covariates were added to adjusted model including the sociodemographic index primary health care facility coverage and gdp per caput result the agestandardized mortality rate for cvd from 2000 to 2019 in indonesia increased from 35605 to 41246 death per 100000 population among men and decreased from 35752 to 35407 death per 100000 population among woman resulting in an increase of 270928 per 1000000 inhabitant of cvd death in the same period there wa an increase in exposure to risk factor such a obesity by 9 smoking by 1 dyslipidemia by 13 hyperglycemia by 2 and hypertension by 12 during this time span an additional 14517 men and 17917 woman died from cvd which wa attributable to higher obesity exposure we apply multivariate regression with provincefixed and yearfixed analysis and find strong correlation between hyperglycemia in woman 6 95ci 0 to 12 death per 1point increase in hyperglycemia exposure with an increasing death rate in ischemic heart disease we also performed a year lag analysis and discovered a robust association between high low density lipoprotein ldl level in men and woman and the growing incidence of ischemic heart disease the association between a 10year lag of high ldl and the incidence of ischemic heart disease wa five time stronger than that observed for other risk factor particularly in men 5 95ci 2 to 8 incidence per 1point increase in high ldl exposure conclusion hyperglycemia in woman is an important risk factor associated with increasing mortality due to ischemic heart disease ihd in indonesia this study also revealed that the presence of high ldl in both men and woman were associated with an increase incidence of ihd that manifested several year subsequent to exposure to the risk factor additionally the highest cardiovascular death portion were attributed to obesity these finding suggest that policymakers should control high ldl and hyperglycemia 10 year earlier prior to the occurrence of ihd and employ personalized therapy to regulate associated risk

processed_title: dietary intake and the risk of coronary heart disease among the coconutconsuming minangkabau in west sumatra indonesia
processed_abstract: several nutrition and nonnutritional pathway are recognised in the development and occurrence of cardiovascular disease in many population high intake of saturated fat are associated with elevated serum cholesterol concentration and increased coronary heart disease chd mortality however several study report that hyperlipidaemia and heart disease are not common among population who consume coconut a source of saturated fat a casecontrol study wa conducted among the minangkabau known to be high coconut consumer to examine the difference in food pattern and risk of coronary heart disease chd between the coronary case and their gender and agematched apparently healthy counterpart serving a control eligible subject with chd were identified through the cooperation of five participating hospital located in padang and bukittinggi in west sumatra indonesia a total of 93 eligible case 62 men and 31 woman in the case group and 189 subject 113 men and 76 woman in the control group were recruited information on the intake of individual food and dish over the preceding 12 month wa obtained using a semiquantitative food frequency questionnaire the case group had significantly higher intake of meat egg sugar tea coffee and fruit but lower intake of soy product rice and cereal compared to the control coconut consumption a flesh or milk wa not different between case and control the case had significantly higher intake of protein and cholesterol but lower intake of carbohydrate similar intake of saturated and unsaturated fatty acid between the case and control indicated that the consumption of total fat or saturated fat including that from coconut wa not a predictor for chd in this food culture however the intake of animal food total protein dietary cholesterol and less plant derived carbohydrate were predictor of chd

processed_title: trimetazidine improves left ventricular global longitudinal strain value in patient with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction due to ischemic heart disease
processed_abstract: heart failure with reduced ejection fraction hfref due to ischemic heart disease ihd showed a progressive decline in left ventricular contractile function however no previous study ha examined the left ventricular global longitudinal strain lv gls parameter that represents lv contractile function we investigated whether trimetazidine could improve the lv gls value in patient with hfref due to ihd we performed a doubleblind randomized controlled trial rct including 26 patient with hfref due to stable ihd who were given modifiedrelease trimetazidine 35 mg twice per day n 13 or placebo n 13 for 3 month in addition to standard medication left ventricular systolic function including gls value wa assessed at baseline and after 3 month using echocardiography a total of 25 participant 13 control and 12 trimetazidine group were recruited with a baseline average age of 571 10 year and lv ejection fraction lvef value of 346 44 and a gls value of 74 21 baseline clinical characteristic and echocardiogram were similar between the two group there wa significant gls improvement in the trimetazidine group 69 24 to 84 26 p 0000 but no significant difference were noted in the control group the gls improvement wa significantly higher in the trimetazidine group than the control 15 09 v 07 17 p 0001 no adverse drug reaction from the administration of trimetazidine in this study trimetazidine may improve gls value in patient with hfref due to ihd

processed_title: highlighting exosomes function in cardiovascular disease
processed_abstract: exosomes a one of the extracellular vesicle subgroup played an important role in the cell to cell communication the cargo and surface protein of exosomes have been known to affect the cardiovascular system both positively and negatively in chronic heart failure ischemic heart disease and atherosclerosis there have been several exosomes that emerged a potential diagnostic and prognostic marker in cardiovascular patient however the condition affecting the patient and the method of isolation should be considered to create a standardized normal value of the exosomes and the component cpcderived exosomes adscsderived exosomes and telocyte derived exosomes have been proven to be capable of acting a a therapeutic agent in myocardial infarction model exosomes have the potential to become a diagnostic marker prognostic marker and therapeutic agent in cardiovascular disease

processed_title: the double burden of disease among mining worker in papua indonesia at the crossroad between old and new health paradigm
processed_abstract: background a the global shift toward noncommunicable disease overlap with the unfinished agenda of confronting infectious disease in low and middleincome country epidemiological link across both burden must be recognized this study examined the noncommunicable diseaseinfectious disease overlap in the specific comorbidity rate for key disease in an occupational cohort in papua indonesia method diagnosed case of ischaemic heart disease stroke hypertension diabetes type 1 and 2 chronic obstructive pulmonary disease asthma cancer hiv and aid tuberculosis and malaria were extracted from 22550 patient record 21513 men 1037 woman stored in identical electronic health information system from two clinic site in papua indonesia data were collected a international classification of disease 10th revision entry from record spanning januarydecember 2013 a novel application of circos software wa used to visualize the interconnectedness between the disease burden a overlapping prevalence estimate representing comorbidities result overall ncds represented 38 of all disease case primarily in the form of type 2 diabetes n 1440 and hypertension n 1398 malaria case represented the largest single portion of the disease burden with 5310 recorded case followed by type 2 diabetes with 1400 case tuberculosis occurred most frequently alongside malaria 29 followed by chronic obstructive pulmonary disease 19 asthma 17 and stroke 12 hypertensiontuberculosis 4 tuberculosiscancer 4 and asthmatuberculosis 2 comorbidities were also observed conclusion the high prevalence of multimorbidity preponderance of noncommunicable disease and extensive interweaving of noncommunicable and infectious disease comorbidities highlighted in this cohort of mining worker in papua indonesia reflect the markedly double disease burden increasingly plaguing indonesia and other similar low and middleincome country a challenge with which their overstretched underresourced health system are illequipped to cope integrated personcentered treatment and control strategy rooted in the primary healthcare sector will be critical to reverse this trend

processed_title: fragmented qrs fqrs in acute coronary syndrome is it a more potential marker than predicted
processed_abstract: fragmented qrs fqrs complex are electrocardiographic ecg finding which reflect impaired ventricular depolarization due to heterogeneous electrical activation of ischemic and or injured myocardium therefore it had been associated with many cardiovascular disease both ischemic and nonischemic origin to date fqrs is considered a novel and convenient marker of myocardial scar or fibrosis thus it ha gained more interest to investigate the potential use of fqrs in cardiac disease especially in acute coronary syndrome ac

processed_title: global consensus recommendation on improving the safety of chronic total occlusion intervention
processed_abstract: safety is of critical importance to chronic total occlusion cto percutaneous coronary intervention pci this global consensus statement provides guidance on how to optimise the safety of cto pci addressing the following 12 area 1 setup for safe cto pci 2 guide catheterassociated vessel injury 3 hydraulic dissection extraplaque haematoma expansion and aortic dissection 4 haemodynamic collapse during cto pci 5 side branch occlusion 6 perforation 7 equipment entrapment 8 vascular access consideration 9 contrastinduced acute kidney injury 10 radiation injury 11 when to stop and 12 proctorship this statement complement the global cto crossing algorithm by advising how to prevent and deal with complication this statement aim to facilitate clinical practice research and education relating to cto pci

processed_title: cardiovascular disease risk factor prevalence and estimated 10year cardiovascular risk score in indonesia the smarthealth extend study
processed_abstract: background the brunt of cardiovascular disease cvd burden globally now resides within low and middleincome country including indonesia however little is known regarding cardiovascular health in indonesia this study aimed to estimate the prevalence of elevated cvd risk in a specific region of indonesia method we conducted full household screening for cardiovascular risk factor among adult aged 40 year and older in 8 village in malang district east java province indonesia in 20162017 10year cardiovascular risk score were calculated based on the world health organizationinternational society of hypertension regionspecific chart that use age sex blood pressure diabetes status and smoking behaviour result among 22093 participant 6455 292 had high cardiovascular risk defined a the presence of coronary heart disease stroke or other atherosclerotic disease estimated 10year cvd risk of 30 or estimated 10year cvd risk between 10 to 29 combined with a systolic blood pressure of 140 mmhg the prevalence of high cvd risk wa greater in urban 316 ci 307325 than in semiurban 287 ci 273301 and rural area 262 ci 252272 only 11 and 1 of all the respondent with high cvd risk were on blood pressure lowering and statin treatment respectively conclusion high cardiovascular risk is common among indonesian adult aged 40 year and rate of preventive treatment are low populationbased and clinical approach to preventing cvd should be a priority in both urban and rural area

processed_title: regulatory t cell immunity in atherosclerosis
processed_abstract: atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory disorder involving innate and adaptive immunity process effector t cell teff response promote atherosclerotic disease whereas regulatory t cell tregs have been shown to play a protective role against atherosclerosis by downregulating inflammatory response which include multiple mechanism compelling experimental data suggest that shifting the tregteff balance toward tregs may be a possible therapeutic approach for atherosclerotic disease although the role of tregs in human atherosclerotic disease ha not been fully elucidated in this review we discus recent advance in our understanding of the role of tregs and teff in experimental atherosclerosis a well a human coronary artery disease

processed_title: key lifestyle and health outcome across 16 prevalent chronic disease a network analysis of an international observational study
processed_abstract: background central and bridge node can drive significant overall improvement within their respective network we aimed to identify them in 16 prevalent chronic disease during the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic to guide effective intervention strategy and appropriate resource allocation for most significant holistic lifestyle and health improvement method we surveyed 16 512 adult from july 2020 to august 2021 in 30 territory participant selfreported their medical history and the perceived impact of covid19 on 18 lifestyle factor and 13 health outcome for each disease subgroup we generated lifestyle health outcome and bridge network variable with the highest centrality index in each were identified central or bridge we validated these network using nonparametric and casedropping subset bootstrapping and confirmed central and bridge variable significantly higher index through a centrality difference test finding among the 48 network 44 were validated all correlationstability coefficient 025 six central lifestyle factor were identified less consumption of snack for the chronic disease anxiety less sugary drink cancer gastric ulcer hypertension insomnia and prediabetes less smoking tobacco chronic obstructive pulmonary disease frequency of exercise depression and fatty liver disease duration of exercise irritable bowel syndrome and overall amount of exercise autoimmune disease diabetes eczema heart attack and high cholesterol two central health outcome emerged less emotional distress chronic obstructive pulmonary disease eczema fatty liver disease gastric ulcer heart attack high cholesterol hypertension insomnia and prediabetes and quality of life anxiety autoimmune disease cancer depression diabetes and irritable bowel syndrome four bridge lifestyle were identified consumption of fruit and vegetable diabetes high cholesterol hypertension and insomnia less duration of sitting eczema fatty liver disease and heart attack frequency of exercise autoimmune disease depression and heart attack and overall amount of exercise anxiety gastric ulcer and insomnia the centrality difference test showed the central and bridge variable had significantly higher centrality index than others in their network p 005 conclusion to effectively manage chronic disease during the covid19 pandemic enhanced intervention and optimised resource allocation toward central lifestyle factor health outcome and bridge lifestyle are paramount the key variable shared across chronic disease emphasise the importance of coordinated intervention strategy

processed_title: drugeluting balloon is it useful
processed_abstract: background coronary artery disease is one of the major issue in the medical world around the globe the prevalence tends to increase the use of coronary intervention is one of the way often used in the management of coronary artery disease due to it satisfying result from earlier study nowadays there are several different technique in coronary intervention balloon v stent main body the stentbased vascular intervention are increasingly being used over balloonbased coronary intervention however revascularization intervention using stent often have undesirable longterm effect compared to balloon besides stentbased intervention are also considered more expensive use more complicated technique and use more drug regimen on the other hand percutaneous coronary intervention technique using balloon coated by antiproliferation drug have begun to be glimpsed by many interventionists study have found many benefit that can not be given by stentbased intervention therapy conclusion angioplasty using percutaneous coronary intervention technique reveals satisfying result compared to conservative medical treatment the indication and technique of percutaneous coronary intervention is still evolving until now currently percutaneous coronary intervention using stent either baremetal stent or drugeluting stent is preferred by interventionist nevertheless recent clinical trial favor the using of drugeluting balloon for percutaneous coronary intervention in term of both clinical outcome and complication in several scenario

processed_title: tachycardia and preexisting chronic kidney disease are predictor of the worse clinical outcome in patient recently hospitalized with acute heart failure
processed_abstract: background this study aimed to assess the factor contributing to the outcome of recently hospitalized patient with heart failure hf method a prospective data of 76 adult who were admitted due to acute hf between october 1 2019 and june 30 2020 at our center were analyzed endpoint included survival and rehospitalization within six month after discharge result the mean age wa 649 138 year with a male preponderance 684 approximately 605 of patient had the left ventricular ejection fraction lvef 40 whereas 263 of patient had lvef 50 coronary artery disease 75 arterial hypertension 724 chronic kidney disease 461 and diabetes mellitus 461 were the most frequent comorbidities poor compliance 408 and noncardiac infection 211 were the common precipitating factor for hospitalization the majority of subject had severe symptom indicated by the frequent need of intensive care unit 43 high nterminal prohormone brain natriuretic peptide level ntprobnp median 4765 15397117822 pgml and presence of either atrial fibrillation severe mitral regurgitation or significant pulmonary hypertension in approximately onethird of case even though inhospital mortality wa relatively low 26 the allcause mortality and rehospitalization rate in the next six month after discharge were still high reaching 2254 and 1972 respectively further survival analysis showed that tachycardia on admission and preexisting chronic kidney disease ckd resulted in low sixmonth survival rate among these patient conclusion after hospital discharge patient with hf were still exposed to higher risk of death and readmission albeit with the medication addressed tachycardia on admission and preexisting ckd might predict worse outcome

processed_title: a scoping review of predictor associated with selfefficacy among patient with coronary heart disease
processed_abstract: selfefficacy se is the main predictor of selfcare behaviour in patient with coronary heart disease chd several study identified factor that influence se in chd patient however review study have yet to synthesize these result systematically this review aim to identify se and the factor influencing se in chd patient this scoping review is reported based on the prisma extension for scoping review prismascr we searched using relevant keywords using five database cinahl plus with full text and academic search complete pubmed sciencedirect scopus taylor and francis and one search engine google scholar which wa accessed on june 23 2023 article with an observational design were included without date restriction the quality of evidence wa assessed using the joanna briggs institute critical appraisal checklist and data synthesis used thematic analysis we found 11 article discussing se and the factor influencing se in chd patient in this review most study reported that the se level of chd patient tends to be low to moderate factor associated with se in this population are classified into three category low moderate and high cardiac knowledge and patient activation are the most influential predictor of se in chd patient public health intervention such a raising awareness about heart disease modifying health behaviour early screening diagnosis and appropriate treatment are critical to improving se and cardiac care outcome

processed_title: abnormal sleep duration a predictor for cardiovascular disease a systematic review of prospective study
processed_abstract: method we searched the online database pubmed on 30 august 2020 for our data collection we used the following keywords sleep duration and cardiovascular disease or cardiovascular event and cohort or prospective or retrospective we identified 653 study and after excluding study that were published before 2015 we obtained 306 study after filtering the 306 study through title and abstract screening and applying the inclusion and exclusion criterion we further reviewed fourteen study with fulltext reading we excluded three study because of insufficient data required and included eleven study in this systematic review result a total of 361041 participant from ten study were included in this systematic review the incidence of hypertension myocardial infarction coronary artery disease heart failure cardiovascular event and cardiovascular disease in the short sleep duration group is 4612 059 543 009 718 148 and 68 consecutively while the incidence of hypertension myocardial infarction coronary artery disease and heart failure in the long sleep duration group is 3071 061 655 111 and 604 consecutively nine study reported an association between sleep duration and cardiovascular disease while one study reported no association seven study reported that short sleep duration wa significantly associated with cvd short sleep duration in this study wa associated with hypertension and heart failure atrial fibrillation and coronary artery disease were associated with both short and long sleep duration conclusion abnormal sleep duration short and long sleep duration may act a the predictor of cardiovascular disease the importance of having normal sleep duration should be stressed with other lifestyle modification to avoid the risk of getting cardiovascular disease however further study are needed to overcome the limitation of this systematic review

processed_title: coronary stent infection a systematic review
processed_abstract: coronary stent infection csi is the rarest complication associated with the percutaneous coronary intervention occurring in less than 01 of case so far all reported instance are limited to case report csi present itself in various often confusing way in clinical setting therefore the current systematic review summarizes report of csis clinical presentation causative pathogen diagnosis and treatment this systematic review considered three online database using reference list a an additional source all case report or case series with stent infection in the coronary artery were included however review or commentary article not published in english and article mentioning a history of hemodialysis or any surgery were excluded thirtytwo study on 34 csi patient were included in the final qualitative analysis csi predominantly affected male of a wide range of age the most common symptom were chest pain and fever with various onset interestingly csi usually occurred during the first stent implantation culture and coronary angiography were the most common method used to diagnose csi furthermore drugeluting stent had a higher risk of infection than baremetal stent aneurysm were the most frequent abnormality observed in infected stent the bacteria that most often caused csi were staphylococcus aureus and pseudomonas aeroginosa more than 90 of the report mentioned using various antibiotic and 74 mentioned carrying out surgery finally a mortality rate of 2647 among csi patient wa calculated

processed_title: analysis of the effect of il6 572 cg crp 757 ag and crp 717 tc gene polymorphism il6 level and crp level on chronic periodontitis in coronary artery disease in indonesia
processed_abstract: interleukin 6 il6 and creactive protein crp play an important role in chronic periodontitis with coronary artery disease cad genetic factor can affect a person risk of cad which affect onethird of the population this study investigated the role of il6 572 cg crp 757 ag and crp 717 tc gene polymorphism il6 and crp level on the severity of periodontitis in cad in indonesia were also evaluated this casecontrol study wa conducted with mild and moderatesevere chronic periodontitis group a path analysis test wa conducted with smart pls with a 95 confidence interval to determine the significant variable for chronic periodontitis our study revealed that the effect of il6 572 cg crp 757 ag and crp 717 tc gene polymorphism on il6 level and crp level were not significant il6 and crp level were not significantly different between the two group we found that il6 level had a significant effect on crp level in periodontitis patient with cad path coefficient 0322 p 0003 il6 572 cg crp 757 ag and crp 717 tc gene polymorphism had no effect on the severity of chronic periodontitis in cad patient in the indonesian population we also observed no apparent effect of the influence of gene polymorphism in il6 572 cg crp 757 ag and crp 717 tc gene although the il6 and crp level were not significantly different between the two group il6 level affected crp level in periodontitis patient with cad

processed_title: characteristic and the average 30day and 6month clinical outcome of patient hospitalised with coronary artery disease in a poor southeast asian setting the first cohort from makassar cardiac center indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to provide a detailed description of characteristic at hospital admission and clinical outcome at 30day and 6month followup in patient hospitalised with coronary artery disease cad in a poor southeast asian setting design prospective observational cohort study setting from february 2013 to december 2014 in makassar cardiac center indonesia participant 477 patient with cad acute coronary syndrome and stable cad outcome measure allcause mortality and major adverse cardiovascular event mace result out of 477 patient with cad the proportion of young age 60 year wa 539 and 727 were male at admission 442 of patient were diagnosed with stsegment elevation myocardial infarction stemi 386 with diagnosis or sign of heart failure and 751 had previous hypertension out of 211 patient with stemi only 47 had been treated with primary percutaneous coronary intervention pci and 62 received thrombolysis the time lapse from symptom onset to hospital admission wa 268 iqr 100480 hour and 191 of all patient had undergone either pci or coronary artery bypass graft the survival rate at 6 month wa 789 the rate of allcause mortality at 30 day and 6 month were 134 and 73 respectively the rate of composite mace at 30 day wa 262 and 180 at 6 month conclusion patient with cad from a poor southeast asian setting present themselves with predominantly unstable condition of premature cad these patient show relatively severe illness have significant time delay from symptom onset to admission or intervention and most do not receive the guidelinesrecommended treatment awareness of symptom prompt initial management of acute cvd wellestablished infrastructure and resource both in primary and secondary hospital for cvd should be improved to reduce the high rate of 30day and 6month mortality and adverse outcome in this population

processed_title: a timetoevent analysis on air pollutant with the risk of cardiovascular disease and mortality a systematic review and metaanalysis of 84 cohort study
processed_abstract: objective air pollution is one of the most substantial problem globally aerodynamic toxic of particulate matter with 10 mm in diameter pm10 or 25 mm pm25 a well a nitric dioxide no2 have been linked with health issue we aimed to perform a comprehensive analysis of the timetoevent for different type of air pollutant on cardiovascular disease cvd event based on cohort study method a comprehensive search on topic that assesses air pollution and cardiovascular disease with keywords up until july 2019 wa performed result there were a total of 28 215 394 subject from 84 cohort increased pm25 wa associated with composite cvd hr 110 102 119 acute coronary event hr 115 112 117 stroke hr 113 106 119 and hypertension hr 107 101 114 allcause mortality hr 107 104 109 cvd mortality hr 110 107 112 and ischemic heart disease ihd mortality hr 111 107 116 association with af became significant after removal of a study increased pm10 wa associated with heart failure hr 125 104 150 allcause mortality hr 116 106 127 cvd mortality hr 117 104 130 and ihd mortality hr 103 101 105 increased of no2 wa associated with increased composite cvd hr 115 102 129 atrial fibrillation hr 101 101 102 acute coronary event hr 108 102 113 allcause mortality hr 123 114 132 cvd mortality hr 117 110 125 and ihd mortality hr 105 103 108 conclusion air pollutant are associated with an increased incidence of cardiovascular disease allcause mortality and cvd mortality

processed_title: correlation between peripheral immature platelet level and coronary immature platelet level in coronary artery disease an observational study in cardiac referral centre in east java indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to investigate the correlation between peripheral and coronary immature platelet and factor that may predict coronary immature platelet level method the crosssectional observational analytical study wa conducted at the cardiovascular diagnostic and intervention centre of dr soetomo general academic hospital surabaya indonesia from november 2017 to january 2018 and comprised patient of either gender with coronary artery disease peripheral and coronary blood sample were retrieved during coronary catheterisation immature platelet fraction wa acquired by examining whole blood sample analysed through automated flow cytometry relationship between peripheral and coronary immature platelet fraction and count were analysed using parametric correlation test followed by linear regression analysis model of variable that influenced coronary immature platelet fraction the statistical analysis wa carried out using spss statistic for window version 250 ibm corp armonk ny usa result of the 70 patient 55786 were male and 15214 were female the overall mean age wa 57532 year there were 3550 patient with a history of smoking and 34486 had hypertension and dyslipidaemia mean peripheral immature platelet fraction wa 386184 and mean coronary immature platelet fraction wa 36317 there wa a robust positive and significant correlation r0882 p0001 between immature platelet level in peripheral and coronary blood peripheral immature platelet and glycated haemoglobin 75 were independent predictor of coronary immature platelet p0001 conclusion there wa a strong correlation between immature platelet level in peripheral and coronary blood

processed_title: barrier to participation in cardiac rehabilitation among patient with coronary heart disease after reperfusion therapy a scoping review
processed_abstract: patient with coronary heart disease chd experience many barrier to participate in cardiac rehabilitation cr program several study identify barrier that can affect participation in cr among patient with chd after reperfusion therapy however there ha yet to be a review specifically in this population this review aim to identify the literature systematically that analyzes the barrier that affect the participation of chd patient after reperfusion therapy in implementing the cr program this study used the preferred reporting item for prisma extension for scoping review prismascr with database pubmed sciencedirect ebscohosted academic search complete scopus taylor francis and sage journal the keywords used in english were coronary artery disease or myocardial
