infarction or cardiovascular disease or heart disease and barrier or obstacle and percutaneous coronary intervention or pci or angioplasty or coronary artery bypass graft surgery or cabg and cardiac rehabilitation or rehabilitation or recovery the inclusion criterion in this review were fulltext article in english article with a descriptive crosssectional and cohort design with a minimum of 100 participant that discussed barrier to participation in patient with chd after undergoing reperfusion therapy and the cr phase such a i ii iii and iv have also been identified based on the initial search there are 23 relevant study out of 7400 the result of this study reported that most of the participant from the study analyzed had a low level of participation in cr 50 we classify the factor that affect the level of cr participation into five category individual factor health history environmental logistical and health system the most reported barrier in each category were age comorbidities lack of support from friend family and health worker distance or travel time and cost and economic status professional health worker especially nurse can identify various barrier that patient feel so that they can increase their participation in attending cr

processed_title: the intervention to improve medication adherence in coronary heart disease patient a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective the clinical outcome and quality of life of chd patient are greatly influenced by medication adherence nonadherence of chd patient to treatment result in suboptimal clinical outcome and increasing cost this study aim to describe effectiveness of the intervention to improve the medication adherence in chd patient method systematic review methodology wa used in this study scopus and pubmed were used to search the relevant article systematically the outcome measured wa medication adherence in coronary heart disease patient result final screening wa 31 article that met the inclusion criterion in this study of 788 article selection process the article used the prisma guideline most of the article 15 article use intervention that utilize information technology it a known with mhealth in the form of text message website and smartphonebased application in increasing medication adherence in chd patient the non mhealth intervention developed are in the form of selfefficacy program monitoring and education by health worker or care worker pharmacy care by clinical pharmacist and the use of drug in the form of multicapsules the result of most intervention with mhealth can improve the medication adherence in chd patient effectively education and motivation program by professional health care and multicapsules also increasing the medication adherence in the intervention control there wa a decrease of medication adherence in some article with long time followup that can be attention for the professional health care to manage the patient adherent conclusion the medication adherence in chd patient can be improve by various program modification of mhealth and non mhealth intervention can be resolved to increase the communication motivation and knowledge about medication adherence in chd patient

processed_title: mitochondrial assay using cardiac stem cell
processed_abstract: ischemic heart disease is the leading cause of death worldwide stem cell therapy to repair and regenerate the infarcted myocardium is a promising approach to address this unmet medical need however the poor survival of transplanted cell in the hostile ischemic myocardium ha been a major hurdle in achieving an effective cell therapy against myocardial infarction a such novel strategy to promote the survival of transplanted cell are highly sought after mitochondrion are intimately involved in cell survival and have been the main organelle being targeted for cytoprotection mitochondrial morphology is linked to mitochondrial function and cell viability therefore quantitative methodology to obtain reliable and reproducible result of mitochondrial morphology and function are essential for identifying and developing new cytoprotective strategy to enhance the survival of stem cell posttransplantation here we describe method for assessing mitochondrial morphology mitochondrial membrane potential and mitochondrial reactive oxygen specie production

processed_title: association of physician characteristic with sex difference in ischemic heart disease incidence among patient living with type 2 diabetes in taiwan
processed_abstract: 1 background certain nonbiological factor are suspected to explain the reduced sex difference in cardiovascular risk after diabetes this study aimed to assess whether physician characteristic may account for such reduced sex difference 2 method totally 10105 type 2 diabetes patient including 4962 men and 5143 woman were selected from taiwan national health insurance claim data the threeyear period following the first day of clinical visit for type 2 diabetes in 2000 wa set a the baseline period the followup wa made from the first day after baseline period to date of ischemic heart disease ihd incidence or censoring cox regression model wa used to estimate hazard ratio hr of ihd in relation to physician characteristic 3 result the incidence of ihd for men and woman wa estimated at 1747 and 1596 per 1000 personyears respectively after controlling for sociodemographic variable and comorbidity male patient experienced a significantly higher hr than female for ihd 116 95 confidence interval ci 104 to 129 further adjustment for treatment adherencecontinuity and physician characteristic resulted in essentially the same result 4 conclusion our study provides little support for the notation that physician characteristic may contribute to the reduced sex difference in ihd incidence in patient with type 2 diabetes

processed_title: type d personality is associated with health behavior and perceived social support in individual with coronary heart disease
processed_abstract: this study investigated the role of type d personality in health behavior and perceived social support in individual with coronary heart disease different from other related study this study assessed a broader range of health behavior in an eastern population while controlling for anxiety and depression in all 386 indonesian individual with coronary heart disease completed the measure assessing type d perceived social support depression anxiety and health behavior compared with nontype d type d individual reported more unhealthy behavior less healthy behavior and perceived less social support for those identified a type d tailored intervention might be considered

processed_title: resveratrol a an antiinflammatory agent in coronary artery disease a systematic review metaanalysis and metaregression
processed_abstract: background resveratrol is a nonflavonoid polyphenol that show promise in reducing proinflammatory factor and maintaining endothelial function which hint at it potential role in slowing atherosclerosis and preventing acute coronary event objective to study the cardioprotective effect of resveratrol on inflammatory mediator and endothelial function in patient with coronary artery disease cad method a thorough search wa conducted in database cochrane library proquest pubmed lilac sciencedirect springer taylorfrancis cnki wanfang and weipu until september 24 2023 the vasoproinflammatory mediator endothelial function and outcome related to cardiovascular event were observed title and abstract were assessed and bias wa evaluated with cochrane rob 20 heterogeneity of result wa explored by metaregression certainty of evidence wa assessed by the grade system and conclusive evidence wa enhanced by trial sequence analysis result ten randomized controlled trial and 3 animal study investigated resveratrols impact on inflammatory mediator and endothelial function in primary prevention study metaanalysis showed a significant reduction 95 ci 073 to 020 p00005 in tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha expression with resveratrol demonstrating a dosedependent relationship no significant difference wa observed in interleukin6 il6 expression with p058 for primary prevention and p057 for secondary prevention vascular endothelial nitric oxide synthase enos expression wa significantly increased after resveratrol pretreatment following cad event secondary prevention study yielded no significant result however metaregression identified association between age hypertension and lower dos with the extent of tnfalpha alteration high certainty of evidence supported tnfalpha reduction while evidence for il6 reduction and enos elevation wa deemed low conclusion resveratrol reduces tnfalpha in individual at risk for cad specifically 15 mg per day however it usefulness in patient with confirmed cad is limited due to factor such a age high blood pressure and insufficient dosage due to the small sample size the reduction of il6 is inconclusive animal study suggest that resveratrol enhances endothelial function by increasing enos prospero registration no crd42023465234

processed_title: comparison of various calcium antagonist on vasospastic angina a systematic review
processed_abstract: background coronary artery vasospasm is an abnormal spasm of coronary artery that cause transient or complete occlusion without exertion it cause stable angina to ac however this can be prevented by calcium channel blocker ccbs which suppress ca2 influx into the vascular muscle cell nevertheless several ccbs adverse effect are harmful for these patient selecting the right ccbs would give the best clinical practice method the study were obtained from four major medical database by various keywords inclusion and exclusion criterion were implemented a adult 18 year observational study english language and drug of interest duplicate were eliminated and the remaining study were reviewed final fulltexts assessment wa conducted independently by newcastleottawa scale and revised cochrane result the search found 1378 article however six study were selected after implementing the study criterion diltiazem wa found to decrease angina and increase quality of life until 12th week of treatment however some adverse effect include atrioventricular block and recurrent angina up till 4th week were found meanwhile nifedipine wa found to decrease vasospastic angina vsa by the fourth and eighth week of treatment nevertheless it caused excessive drop in bp and increase heart rate by eighth week in addition slowrelease preparation of both ccbs were found to increase efficacy and compliance lastly amlodipine wa also found to decrease vsa by 17140 and 33 after 6 week but further study needed conclusion diltiazem nifedipine and amlodipine are potent in decreasing vsa however tailoring specific ccbs adverse reaction to patient condition and the drug preparation would be substantially beneficial for the outcome

processed_title: exploring the link between cardiovascular risk factor and manifestation in latent tuberculosis infection a comprehensive literature review
processed_abstract: background the global burden of tuberculosis tb and cardiovascular disease cvd is overt and the prevalence of this double burden disease remains steadily rising particularly in low and middleincome country this review aim to explore the association between latent tuberculosis infection ltbi and the development of cardiovascular disease and risk factor furthermore we elucidated the underlying pathophysiological mechanism that contribute to this relationship main body approximately 25 of the global population carry a dormant form of tuberculosis tb infection during this latent stage certain subset of mycobacteria actively reproduce and recent research suggests that latent tb infection ltbi is connected to persistent longterm lowgrade inflammation that can potentially contribute to the development of atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease cvd the presence of ltbi can be confirmed through a positive result on either a tuberculin skin test tst or an interferongamma release assay igra several plausible explanation for the association between ltbi and cvd include increased inflammation autoimmunity related to heat shock protein hsp and the presence of pathogen within the developing atherosclerotic plaque the most commonly observed cardiovascular event and risk factor associated with ltbi are acute myocardial infarction coronary artery stenosis diabetes mellitus and hypertension conclusion this article highlight the critical role of ltbi in perpetuating the tuberculosis disease cycle and it association with cardiovascular risk factor chronic and persistent low inflammation underlined the association identifying highrisk ltbi patient and providing targeted preventive medication are crucial strategy for global tb eradication and interrupting transmission chain

processed_title: association between cardiovascular disease and covid19 pneumonia outcome in indonesia a multicenter cohort study
processed_abstract: background covid19 is a pandemic affecting 185 country including indonesia cardiovascular disease cvd in covid19 patient were linked to worse clinical outcome however the association remained inconclusive due to limited data in indonesia this study aimed to determine the association between cvd in covid19 pneumonia patient with it clinical outcome method this retrospective cohort study wa conducted in four indonesian hospital enrolling 584 adult covid19 pneumonia patient from september 2020 to july 2021 patient were categorized into two group noncvd and cvd hypertension coronary artery disease cad chronic heart failure chf hypertensive heart disease hhd arrhythmia cardiomegaly left ventricular hypertrophy lvh mitral regurgitation mr and myocardial injury mi clinical outcome include inhospital mortality intensive care unit admission ventilator use earlier death and prolonged hospital stay mannwhitney test wa used for analysis result the most common cvd wa hypertension 481 followed by mi 106 cad 92 chf 68 hhd 31 arrhythmia 17 and others 07 the inhospital mortality rate wa 24 and patient were hospitalized for a median of 12 day mi wa the only cvd that increased inhospital mortality rr 2105 it wa also significantly increased in patient with diabetes mellitus rr 1475 and chronic kidney disease rr 2079 meanwhile prolonged hospital stay wa associated with any cvd rr 1553 hypertension rr 1511 mi rr 1969 chf rr 1595 diabetes mellitus rr 1359 and cerebrovascular disease rr 2203 conclusion covid19 pneumonia in patient with cvd specifically mi and hypertension worsens the covid19 clinical outcome

processed_title: overweight obesity and cardiovascular disease in heterozygous familial hypercholesterolaemia the ea fh study collaboration registry
processed_abstract: background and aim overweight and obesity are modifiable risk factor for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease ascvd in the general population but their prevalence in individual with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolaemia hefh and whether they confer additional risk of ascvd independent of ldl cholesterol ldlc remains unclear method crosssectional analysis wa conducted in 35 540 patient with hefh across 50 country in the ea fh study collaboration registry prevalence of world health organizationdefined body mass index category wa investigated in adult n 29 265 and childrenadolescents n 6275 and their association with prevalent ascvd result globally 52 of adult and 27 of child with hefh were overweight or obese with the highest prevalence noted in northern africawestern asia a higher overweightobesity prevalence wa found in nonhighincome v highincome country median age at familial hypercholesterolaemia diagnosis in adult with obesity wa 9 year older than in normal weight adult obesity wa associated with a more atherogenic lipid profile independent of lipidlowering medication prevalence of coronary artery disease increased progressively across body mass index category in both child and adult compared with normal weight obesity wa associated with higher odds of coronary artery disease in child odds ratio 928 95 confidence interval 1774877 adjusted for age sex lipid and lipidlowering medication and coronary artery disease and stroke in adult odds ratio 235 95 confidence interval 210263 and odds ratio 165 95 confidence interval 127214 respectively but less consistently with peripheral artery disease adjusting for diabetes hypertension and smoking modestly attenuated the association conclusion overweight and obesity are common in patient with hefh and contribute to ascvd risk from childhood independent of ldlc and lipidlowering medication sustained body weight management is needed to reduce the risk of ascvd in hefh

processed_title: risk factor and clinical characteristic of acute kidney injury in patient with covid19 a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: acute kidney injury aki is associated with a worse prognosis in coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 patient identification of aki particularly in covid19 patient is important for improving patient management the study aim to assess risk factor and comorbidities of aki in covid19 patient we systematically searched pubmed and doaj database for relevant study involving confirmed covid19 patient with data on risk factor and comorbidities of aki the risk factor and comorbidities were compared between aki and nonaki patient a total of 30 study involving 22385 confirmed covid19 patient were included male or 174 147 205 diabetes or 165 154 176 hypertension or 182 112 295 ischemic cardiac disease or 170 148 195 heart failure or 229 201 259 chronic kidney disease ckd or 324 220 479 chronic obstructive pulmonary disease copd or 186 135 257 peripheral vascular disease or 234 120 456 and history of nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug nsaid or 159 129 198 were independent risk factor associated with covid19 patient with aki patient with aki presented with proteinuria or 331 259 423 hematuria or 325 259 408 and invasive mechanical ventilation or 1388 823 2340 for covid19 patient male gender diabetes hypertension ischemic cardiac disease heart failure ckd copd peripheral vascular disease and history of use of nsaid are associated with a higher risk of aki

processed_title: electronic cigarette and atherosclerosis a comprehensive literature review of latest evidence
processed_abstract: coronary artery disease cad also known a coronary heart disease chd are the world leading cause of death the basis of coronary artery disease is the narrowing of the heart coronary artery lumen due to atherosclerosis the use of electronic cigarette ha increased significantly over the year however harmful effect of electronic cigarette are still not firm the aim of this article is to review the impact of electronic cigarette and it role in the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis from recent study the result showed that several chemical compound such a nicotine propylene glycol particulate matter heavy metal and flavoring in electronic cigarette induce atherosclerosis with each molecular mechanism that lead to atherosclerosis progression by formation of ro endothelial dysfunction and inflammation further research is still needed to determine the exact mechanism and provide more clinical evidence

processed_title: expert opinion on the applicability of dyslipidemia guideline in asia and the middle east
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease cvd is a growing burden across the world in asia and the middle east in particular cvd is among the most prevalent and debilitating disease dyslipidemia is an important factor in the development of atherosclerosis and associated cardiovascular event and so effective management strategy are critical to reducing overall cardiovascular risk multiple dyslipidemia guideline have been developed by international body such a the european society of cardiologyeuropean atherosclerosis society and the american college of cardiologyamerican heart association which all have similarity in practice recommendation for the optimal management of dyslipidemia however they differ in certain aspect including pharmacological treatment lifestyle modification and the target level used for lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol the evidence behind these guideline is generally based on data from western population and their applicability to people in asia and the middle east is largely untested a a result practitioner within asia and the middle east continue to rely on international evidence despite population difference in lipid phenotype and cvd risk factor an expert panel wa convened to review the international guideline commonly used in asia and the middle east and determine their applicability to clinical practice in the region with specific recommendation or consideration provided where current guideline recommendation differ from local practice herein we describe the heterogeneous approach and application of current guideline used to manage dyslipidemia in asia and the middle east we provide consensus management recommendation to cover different patient scenario including primary prevention elderly chronic kidney disease type 2 diabetes documented cvd acute coronary syndrome and family history of ischemic heart disease moreover we advocate for country within the asian and middle east region to continue to develop guideline that are appropriate for the local population

processed_title: apixaban an oral direct factorxa inhibitor
processed_abstract: apixaban is a highly selective reversible direct factor xa inhibitor that inhibits both free factor xa and prothrombinase activity and clotbound factor xa activity a predictable pharmacokinetic profile multiple pathway of elimination an improved bleeding profile relative to warfarin with a lack of other significant adverse event and no need for routine anticoagulation monitoring make apixaban appealing apixaban is currently approved for venous thromboembolism vte prophylaxis in total hip replacement and total knee replacement in europe brazil australia and new zealand and ha been preapproved in indonesia and the philippine completed phase 3 trial suggest that apixaban ha promise a an alternative to aspirin and warfarin for prevention of stroke and systemic embolism in patient with atrial fibrillation result of a large phase 3 trial were the first to show a survival benefit for this new class of oral anticoagulant in patient with atrial fibrillation in patient with acute coronary syndrome apixaban added to dual antiplatelet therapy with aspirin and clopidogrel resulted in unacceptably high rate of major bleeding in medically ill patient an extended course of thromboprophylaxis with apixaban wa not superior to a shorter course with enoxaparin and wa associated with significantly more major bleeding event than enoxaparin ongoing phase 3 trial will provide data regarding the efficacy and safety of apixaban for treatment of acute deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism

processed_title: extended dual antiplatelet for diabetic elderly patient after drugeluting stent implantation an evidencebased clinical review
processed_abstract: antiplatelet is an important drug for patient with coronary heart disease undergoing drugeluting stent implantation current guideline recommend dual antiplatelet with aspirin and a p2y12 inhibitor for at least 12 month continuation of dapt beyond 12 month may be considered for preventing very late stent thrombosis several patientrelated factor that contribute to stent thrombosis have been recognized including diabetes and advanced age but the optimal dapt duration for these patient is still controversial this article review the efficacy of extended 12 month compared to standard 12 month dapt for reducing myocardial infarction and stent thrombosis rate especially in diabetic elderly patient literature screening wa conducted at pubmed and cochrane database using dual antiplatelet duration adultonset diabetes mellitus elderly and drugeluting stent a keywords article type were limited to metaanalysis systematic review randomized clinical trial or clinical trial that compared the efficacy of extended to standard duration of dapt clinical outcome used were myocardial infarction and stent thrombosis the initial search wa done to find relevant study specifically assessing diabetic and elderly patient then widened to diabetic and nondiabetic patient of any age above eighteen year a total of 5 clinical trial and 1 metaanalysis were reviewed showing an overall risk reduction of stent thrombosis and myocardial infarction this review ha several limitation such a it potential selection bias and underrepresented proportion of diabetic and elderly patient highrisk subgroup like diabetes mellitus ha a tendency of increased ischemic risk while advanced age could have both increased ischemic risk and bleeding risk this review suggests that it is better to reserve extended dual antiplatelet therapy for patient with high ischemic risk and low bleeding risk tailored therapy

processed_title: indication for percutaneous coronary angioplasty
processed_abstract: percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty ptca or balloon angioplasty wa performed in the united state but the technique remained challenged by the primary problem of restenosis which wa approximately 30 closing of the coronary artery after balloon dilatation when first ptca introduced by gruentzig in 1977 it wa specific directed for patient who have angina documented ischemia single vessel disease and proximal lesion simple lesion but then by the recent advanced in technology including guide wire balloon intravascular ultrasound pharmacological therapy particularly of stent it is than indicated in much more complex lesion the extension of indication of pci to more complex lesion were supported by many study and clinical trial comprehensively indication of pci were summarize in the two most well known guideline following first to european society of cardiology esc 2005 and second to the american heart association aha 2007 american college of cardiology acc and american society of cardiac intervention ascai the latest guideline for appropriateness criterion for coronary revascularization wa just published in jan 2009 by the american college of cardiology society for cardiovascular angiography and intervention and society of thoracic surgery in this guideline indication of coronary revascularization is assessed following 3 category which is appropriate uncertain and inappropriate basically those guideline are the same there are differ in applying classification of recommendation and level of evidence the systematic presentation and the defining appropriateness indication of revascularization

processed_title: aspirin v p2y12 inhibitor rivalry which one can be continued during gastrointestinal bleeding
processed_abstract: dual antiplatelet therapy dapt is the mainstay of secondary prevention treatment for acute coronary syndrome ac and ischemic stroke especially after coronary intervention dapt consists of aspirin and p2y12 receptor inhibitor eg clopidogrel and the use of dapt ha been increased over time the most serious and common adverse effect is gastrointestinal bleeding guideline in managing such condition are available among gastroenterologist society and cardiologist society most guideline are consistent with each other to continue the use of aspirin while withholding p2y12 however european society of cardiologist esc guideline in 2017 recommends p2y12 receptor inhibitor a the preferred antiplatelet for patient with upper gastrointestinal bleeding this review will look on the guideline and other supporting evidence for the justification on the antiplatelet of choice

processed_title: the 30 year of shifting in the indonesian cardiovascular burdenanalysis of the global burden of disease study
processed_abstract: importance cardiovascular disease cvd remains the leading cause of mortality and morbidity compared with disease burden rate in 1990 significant reduction in disabilityadjusted life year dalys burden rate for cvd have been recorded however general dalys rate have not changed in indonesia in the past 30 year thus assessing indonesian cvd burden will be an essential first step in determining primary disease intervention objective to determine the national and provincelevel burden of cvd from 1990 to 2019 in indonesia design setting and participant a retrospective observational study wa conducted using data from the global burden of disease gbd 2019 provided by the institute of health metric and evaluation ihme to analyze trend in the burden of cvd including mortality morbidity and prevalence characteristic of 12 underlying cvds exposure residence in indonesia main outcome and measure mortality incidence prevalence death and dalys of cvd result cvd death have doubled from 278 million in 1990 to 651 million in 2019 all cvds recorded increased death rate except for rheumatic heart disease rhd 69 and congenital heart disease chd 37 based on underlying disease stroke and ischemic heart disease ihd are still the leading cause of mortality and morbidity in indonesia whereas stroke and peripheral artery disease pad are the most prevalent cvds indonesia ha the second worst cvd dalys rate compared to asean country after lao at provincial level the highest cvd daly rate were recorded in bangka belitung south kalimantan and yogyakarta in term of dalys rate change they were recorded in west nusa tenggara 24 south kalimantan 18 and central java 11 regarding sex only rhd and pad burden were dominated by female conclusion cvd mortality morbidity and prevalence rate increased in indonesia from 1990 to 2019 especially for stroke and ischemic heart disease the burden is exceptionally high even when compared to other southeast asian country and the global downward trend gbd ha many limitation however these data could provide policymakers with a broad view of cvd condition in indonesia

processed_title: native t1 and ecv of noninfarcted myocardium and outcome in patient with coronary artery disease
processed_abstract: background coronary artery disease cad remains the major cause of cardiac morbidity and mortality worldwide despite the advance in treatment with coronary revascularization and modern antiremodeling therapy risk stratification in cad patient is primarily based on left ventricular volume ejection fraction lvef risk score and the presence and extent of late gadolinium enhancement lge the prognostic role of t1 mapping in noninfarcted myocardium in cad patient ha not yet been determined objective this study sought to examine prognostic significance of native t1 mapping of noninfarcted myocardium in patient with cad method a prospective observational multicenter longitudinal study of consecutive patient undergoing routine cardiac magnetic resonance imaging with t1 mapping and lge the primary endpoint wa allcause mortality major adverse cardiocerebrovascular event macce cardiac mortality nonfatal acute coronary syndrome stroke and appropriate device discharge are also reported result a total of 34 death and 71 macce n 665 male n 424 median age interquartile range 57 22 year 64 median followup period of 17 11 month were observed native t1 and extracellular volume were univariate predictor of outcome native t1 and lge were stronger predictor of survival and macce compared with extracellular volume lvef cardiac volume and clinical score p 0001 native t1 of noninfarcted myocardium wa the sole independent predictor of allcause mortality chisquare 217 p 0001 which wa accentuated in the absence of lge or lvef 35 for macce native t1 and lge extent were joint independent predictor chisquare 256 p 0001 conclusion characterization of noninfarcted myocardium by native t1 is an important predictor of outcome in cad patient over and above the traditional risk stratifiers the current study result provide a basis for a novel risk stratification model in cad based on a complementary assessment of noninfarcted myocardium and postinfarction scar by native t1 mapping and lge respectively

processed_title: prevention and management of coronary artery disease in patient with diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: diabetes mellitus dm is a common medical problem and a major risk factor for the development of atherosclerotic coronary artery disease cad coronary artery disease is highly prevalent and is the major cause of morbidity and mortality in diabetic patient patient with cad and prediabetic state should undergo lifestyle modification aimed at preventing dm in patient with cad and dm routine use of aspirin and an angiotensinconverting enzyme inhibitor aceiunless contraindicated or not toleratedand strict glycemic blood pressure and lipid control are strongly recommended intense insulin therapy might be needed for glycemic control and highdose statin therapy might be needed for lipid control for blood pressure control aceis and angiotensin receptor blocker are considered a firstline therapy the outcome after revascularization in diabetic patient are usually worse compared with nondiabetic patient advance in pci include the use of drugeluting stent and adjunctive drug therapy such a abciximab glycemic control is an important determinant of outcome after revascularization in diabetic patient improvement in pci and coronary artery bypass graft surgery are leading to better result in diabetic patient and clinical trial are presently comparing contemporary pci with surgery

processed_title: cardiovascular epidemiology in the asiapacific region
processed_abstract: by 2020 noncommunicable disease including cardiovascular disease cvd are expected to account for seven out of every 10 death in the developing country compared with less than half this value today a a proportion of total death from allcauses cvd in the asia pacific region range from less than 20 in country such a thailand philippine and indonesia to 2030 in urban china hong kong japan korea and malaysia country such a new zealand australia and singapore have relatively high rate that exceed 3035 the latter country also rank high for coronary heart disease chd mortality rate more than 150 death per 100000 in contrast death from cerebrovascular disease is higher among east asian country including japan china and taiwan more than 100 per 100000 it is worth noting that a number of country in the region with high proportion of death from cvd have undergone marked declining rate in recent decade for example in australia between 1986 and 1996 mortality from chd in men and woman aged 3069 year declined by 46 and 51 respectively in japan stroke mortality dropped from a high level of 150 per 100000 during the 1920s1940s to the present level of approximately 100 per 100000 nonetheless cvd mortality rate is reportedly on the rise in several country in the region including urban china malaysia korea and taiwan in china cvd mortality increased a a proportion of total death from 128 in 1957 to 358 in 1990 the region is undergoing a rapid pace of urbanization industrialization and major technological and lifestyle change thus monitoring the impact of these change on cardiovascular risk is essential to enable the implementation of appropriate strategy towards countering the rise of cvd mortality

processed_title: retrospective study of the association between platelettolymphocyte ratio in patient with acute coronary syndrome on admission to a rural referral center in east java indonesia and the incidence of new symptomatic heart failure at 6 month
processed_abstract: background this wa a retrospective study conducted at a rural referral center in east java indonesia to evaluate the association between the platelettolymphocyte ratio plr on hospital admission and the incidence of new symptomatic heart failure hf within 6 month in patient with acute coronary syndrome ac material and method the study population consisted of all ac patient who were hospitalized between 1 january and 31 december 2018 at a nonpercutaneous coronary interventioncapable secondary referral hospital and came for a routine followup until 6 month afterwards the diagnosis of new symptomatic hf wa based on international classification of disease 10th revision code i509 result from 126 hospitalized patient 92 patient were included in the analysis the incidence rate of new symptomatic hf at 6 month wa 7065 high plr upon initial admission wa significantly associated with new symptomatic hf incidence odds ratio170 p0001 plr wa also able to discriminate new symptomatic hf incidence at 6 month with area under the curve of 083 p0001 multivariate cox regression analysis showed that plr wa an independent predictor for new symptomatic hf incidence hazard ratio45 p0001 conclusion in a rural center in indonesia the plr wa independently correlated with the onset of new symptomatic hf in patient with ac 6 month after hospital admission the plr may be a supplementary biomarker for clinical outcome in patient with ac for use in resourcelimited region

processed_title: pcsk9 and lrp6 potential combination target to prevent and reduce atherosclerosis
processed_abstract: coronary artery disease cad is a disease characterized by atherosclerosis formation which cause sudden cardiac death the prevalence of cad is expected to increase by 2030 atherosclerosis started from accumulation of ldl in the blood vessel followed by endothelial cell activation and dysfunction pcsk9 is a gene that play an important role in the creation of atherosclerotic plaque through induced degradation of ldlrs inhibition of pcsk9 gene resulted in a decrease of ldlrs degradation and reduction in ldlc level lrp6 a well a it mutation is a coreceptor that contributes to atherosclerosis through the canonical wntbetacatenin pathway by employing emps mediated mirna126 thirdgeneration antisense against mir4943p 3 ga494 and recombinant wnt mouse wnt3a rmwnt3a the inhibition of lrp6 could reduce vsmcs proliferation enhancing antiinflammatory macrophage and diminished bioactive lipid component respectively those mechanism lead to the stabilization and reduction of atherosclerosis plaque

processed_title: mitochondrial fission a drug target for cytoprotection or cytodestruction
processed_abstract: mitochondrion are morphologically dynamic organelle constantly undergoing process of fission and fusion that maintain integrity and bioenergetics of the organelle these process are vital for cell survival disruption in the balance of mitochondrial fusion and fission is thought to play a role in several pathological condition including ischemic heart disease protein involved in regulating the process of mitochondrial fusion and fission are therefore potential target for pharmacological therapy mdivi1 is a small molecule inhibitor of the mitochondrial fission protein drp1 inhibiting mitochondrial fission with mdivi1 ha proven cytoprotective benefit in several cell type involved in a wide array of cardiovascular injury model on the other hand mdivi1 can also exert antiproliferative and cytotoxic effect particularly in hyperproliferative cell in this review we discus these divergent effect of mdivi1 on cell survival a well a the potential and limitation of mdivi1 a a therapeutic agent

processed_title: resistance training in cardiovascular disease a review on it effectiveness in controlling risk factor
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease cvd a term encompassing various disorder affecting the heart and blood vessel includes coronary artery disease cad cad is primarily due to the development of atherosclerotic plaque that disrupt blood flow oxygenation and nutrient delivery to the myocardium risk factor contributing to cad progression include smoking hypertension diabetes mellitus dm dyslipidaemia and obesity while aerobic exercise ae ha shown promising result in controlling cvd risk factor the impact of resistance training rt ha not been extensively investigated this review aim to describe the effect of rt on cvd risk factor based on study retrieved from pubmed and google scholar database both isometric and isotonic rt have been found to decrease systolic blood pressure sbp diastolic blood pressure or mean arterial pressure with sbp showing a more significant reduction hypertensive patient engaging in rt alongside a calorierestricted diet demonstrated significant improvement in blood pressure rt is associated with increased nitric oxide bioavailability sympathetic modulation and enhanced endothelial function in type2 dm patient 812 week of rt led to improvement in fasting blood glucose level insulin secretion metabolic syndrome risk and glucose transporter number combining ae with rt had a more significant impact in reducing insulin resistance and enhancing blood glucose compared to performing exercise separately it also significantly decreased total cholesterol triglyceride and lowdensity lipoprotein level while increasing highdensity lipoprotein within 12 week of application however improvement are considered insignificant when lipid level are already low to normal at baseline the administration of rt resulted in weight loss and improved body mass index with more pronounced effect seen when combining ae with rt and a calorierestricted diet considering these result the administration of rt either alone or in combination with ae prof beneficial in rehabilitating cad patient by improving various risk factor

processed_title: prognostic identifier of cerebrovascular complication in tuberculous meningitis metaanalysis
processed_abstract: introduction cerebrovascular complication could occur in 1557 of patient with tuberculous meningitis tbm it is crucial to rapidly identify tbm patient who are at risk for stroke this study aimed to find predictor of stroke in patient with tbm method this systematic review and metaanalysis were done using literature search through online database up to april 30th 2022 three independent author performed literature screening data extraction and critical appraisal of the study eight study involving 1535 sample were included result we analyzed data regarding demographic comorbidity clinical presentation radiologic and laboratory parameter overall clinical presentation that showed outcome difference wa found in patient with finding of vomiting or 271 95 ci 130563 cranial nerve deficit or 410 95 ci 183921 focal deficit or 556 95 ci 2241379 and altered consciousness or 190 95 ci 124292 some comorbidities showed significant difference such a diabetes mellitus or 258 95 ci 151441 hypertension or 573 95 ci 336977 ischemic heart disease or 218 95 ci 102463 and smoking or 265 95 ci 122577 two radiological change shown to have significantly higher proportion are hydrocephalus or 250 95 ci 174358 and meningeal enhancement or 399 95 ci 173920 conclusion our analysis indicated that clinical presentation of vomiting cranial nerve deficit focal deficit altered consciousness comorbidity of diabetes mellitus hypertension smoking history ischemic heart disease and radiological finding of meningeal enhancement and hydrocephalus showed significant association with stroke incidence in tuberculous meningitis

processed_title: the importance of selecting permanent pacemaker evaluating the heart and assessing quality of life in cardiac patient
processed_abstract: the use of pacemaker is necessary for patient with symptomatic bradycardia pacemaker implantation also act a a lifesaving procedure however there are several report that patient with a pacemaker the most widely used pacemaker is on the right ventricle known a single chamber pacemaker had disturbance in left ventricle contraction lead to left ventricular systolic dysfunction global longitudinal strain gls echocardiography can confirm these left ventricular disturbance echocardiography examination is best carried out before and after singlechamber ppm implantation this study compare ppm placement in apical right ventricle rv and right ventricular outflow tract rvot and compare paced qrs duration 150 m and 150 m pacing burden 40 cause subclinical left ventricular systolic dysfunction after a month of ppm implantation with decreased gls in apical rv pacingthis study give additional information that ppm placement is preferably in rvot with some specific setting however there are many way to reduce the effect of impaired left ventricular function due to lead installation on the ppm singlechamber device by using the ppm device which ha a dual chamber the lead will be placed in rvot and also in the right atrium with atrialventricle synchronization the aim is to avoid impaired left ventricular pump function a supported by a systematic review which state the superiority of dualchamber ppm over singlechamber ppm in reducing atrial fibrillation and pacemaker syndrome in the importance of quality of life related to heart disease the indonesian version of the macnew questionnaire can be used this questionnaire seek the quality of life of patient with coronary heart disease after revascularization surgery and ha undergone rehabilitation another important thing is the suitability of the adaptation to the original english version

processed_title: enhancing prescribing of guidelinerecommended medication for ischaemic heart disease a systematic review and metaanalysis of intervention targeted at healthcare professional
processed_abstract: objective ischaemic heart disease ihds are a leading cause of death worldwide although prescribing according to guideline improves health outcome it remains suboptimal we determined whether intervention targeted at healthcare professional are effective to enhance prescribing and health outcome in patient with ihds method we systematically searched pubmed and embase for study published between 1 january 2000 and 31 august 2017 we included original study of intervention targeted at healthcare professional to enhance prescribing guidelinerecommended medication for ihds we only included randomised controlled trial rcts main outcome were the proportion of eligible patient receiving guidelinerecommended medication the proportion of patient achieving target blood pressure and target lowdensity lipoproteincholesterol ldlccholesterol level and mortality rate metaanalyses were performed using the inversevariance method and the random effect model the quality of evidence wa assessed using the grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation approach result we included 13 study 4 rcts 1869 patient and 9 cluster rcts 15 224 patient 11 out of 13 study were performed in north america and europe intervention were of organisational or professional nature the intervention significantly enhanced prescribing of statinslipidlowering agent or 123 95 ci 107 to 142 p0004 but not other medication aspirinantiplatelet agent betablockers ace inhibitorsangiotensin ii receptor blocker and the composite of medication there wa no significant association between the intervention and improved health outcome target ldlc and mortality except for target blood pressure or 146 95 ci 111 to 193 p0008 the evidence wa of moderate or high quality for all outcome conclusion organisational and professional intervention improved prescribing of statinslipidlowering agent and target blood pressure in patient with ihds but there wa little evidence of change in other outcome prospero registration number crd42016039188

processed_title: longterm incidence and risk factor of cardiovascular event in asian population systematic review and metaanalysis of populationbased cohort study
processed_abstract: background scientific study on cardiovascular disease cvd burden and risk factor are predominantly based on shortterm risk in westerner population and such information may not be applicable to asian population especially over the longer term this review aim to estimate the longterm 10 year cvd burden including coronary heart disease chd and stroke a well a associated risk factor in asian population method pubmed embase and web of science were systematically searched and hit screened on asian adult free of cvd at baseline cohort study design followup 10 year primary outcome were fatal and nonfatal cvd event pooled estimate and betweenstudy heterogeneity were calculated using random effect model q and i2 statistic result overall 32 study were eligible for inclusion followup 1129 year the average longterm rate of fatal cvd is 368 per 1000 personyears 95 ci 284453 the longterm cumulative risk 635 95 ci 469801 mean 2013 year and the cumulative fatal strokechd risk ratio 151 important risk factor for longterm fatal cvd rr 95 ci were male gender 149 136164 age over 6065 year 755 5591019 and current smoking 168 126224 high nonhdlc and beta and gammatocopherol serum were associated only with chd hr 246 95 ci 129471 and 247 110561 respectively while stage 1 and 2 hypertension were associated only with fatal stroke 202 119344 and 289 168496 respectively conclusion over a 10 year followup period asian subject had a higher risk of stroke than chd contrary to cvd prevention in western country strategy should also consider stroke instead of chd only

processed_title: coal in a burning world the dark side of energy still rule
processed_abstract: the world registered record temperature in the last year with 2024 being the hottest year ever recorded and the first one to surpass the 15 masculinec limit defined by the paris agreement coal wa key to the industrial revolution and along with petroleum wa essential to world development however coal is the most pollutant of fossil fuel generating more co2 and particulate material coalderived air pollution is associated with several disease including respiratory disease such a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and lower respiratory infection cerebrovascular disease ischaemic heart disease and lung cancer air pollution caused by coal and other fossil fuel cause million of death a year despite it negative impact on human health and climate change coal ha been extensively used for electricity generation in the last four decade and is still responsible for more than 35 of all the electricity produced in the world with country like australia indonesia poland india and china showing a much higher coal dependency from 45 to 75 in 2023 however country like uk denmark portugal and spain heavily reduced coal use showing that a transition away from coal is possible and could be used by other nation

processed_title: 2021 asian pacific society of cardiology consensus recommendation on the use of p2y12 receptor antagonist in the asiapacific region special population
processed_abstract: advanced age diabetes and chronic kidney disease not only increase the risk for ischaemic event in chronic coronary syndrome cc but also confer a high bleeding risk during antiplatelet therapy these special population may warrant modification of therapy especially among asian who have displayed characteristic that are clinically distinct from western patient previous guidance ha been provided regarding the classification of highrisk cc and the use of newergeneration p2y12 inhibitor ie ticagrelor and prasugrel after acute coronary syndrome ac in asia the author summarise evidence on the use of these p2y12 inhibitor during the transition from ac to cc and among special population specifically they present recommendation on the role of standard dual antiplatelet therapy shortened dual antiplatelet therapy and single antiplatelet therapy among patient with coronary artery disease who are either transitioning from ac to cc elderly or with chronic kidney disease diabetes multivessel coronary artery disease and bleeding event during therapy

processed_title: preventable death attributable to secondhand smoke in southeast asiaanalysis of the global burden of disease study 2019
processed_abstract: objective in addition to harm caused to individual who smoke secondhand smoke shs or passive smoke is an important public health issue we aim to estimate the extent of preventable death due to tobacco and shs exposure in southeast asia method data were from the global burden of disease study 2019 we analysed data from southeast asia including cambodia indonesia lao malaysia maldives mauritius myanmar philippine seychelles sri lanka thailand timorleste and vietnam result in 2019 there were 728500 death attributable to tobacco in southeast asia with 128200 death attributed to shs exposure the leading cause of preventable death were ischemic heart disease stroke diabetes mellitus lower respiratory infection chronic obstructive pulmonary disease tracheal bronchus and lung cancer among death attributable to tobacco female had higher proportion of death attributable to shs exposure than male in southeast asia conclusion the burden of preventable death in a year due to shs exposure in southeast asia is substantial the implementation and enforcement of smokefree policy should be prioritized to reduce the disease burden attributed to passive smoking in southeast asia

processed_title: the role of optimism in manifesting recovery outcome after coronary artery bypass graft surgery a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective coronary artery bypass graft cabg is a major surgery conducted in coronary heart disease management postoperative recovery is a crucial process for patient undergoing cabg this systematic review evaluates current evidence regarding the association between trait optimism and recovery outcome in patient following coronary artery bypass graft surgery method this review followed the preferred reporting item of systematic review and metaanalysis prisma 2020 guideline the inclusion criterion focused on observational study that examined study participant aged 18 year old undergoing elective cabg and measurement of trait optimism with validated method ie lot lotr and at least one recovery outcome study in nonenglish language and duplicate were excluded a systematic literature search wa carried out on pubmed scopus and web of science electronic database search result were screened based on the eligibility criterion the newcastleottawa scale wa used to assess the quality of each included study result the search yielded a total of 1853 article in which 7 article fulfilled the eligibility criterion and were subsequently included in the analysis measurement of trait optimism wa conducted on 1276 patient who underwent a nonemergencyelective cabg optimism wa significantly associated with several category of recovery including reduced rehospitalization rate complication pain and physical symptom along with improved quality of life rate of return to normal life and psychological status conclusion our review showed that trait optimism wa associated with recovery outcome following cabg surgery however the heterogeneity of recovery outcome may hamper the clinical benefit of trait optimism in cabg prospero crd42022301882

processed_title: 3d printing technology and it revolutionary role in stent implementation in cardiovascular disease
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease cvd exemplified by coronary artery disease cad is a global health concern escalating in prevalence and burden the etiology of cad is intricate involving different risk factor cvd remains a significant cause of mortality driving the need for innovative intervention like percutaneous coronary intervention and vascular stent these stent aim to minimize restenosis thrombosis and neointimal hyperplasia while providing mechanical support notably the challenge of achieving ideal stent characteristic persist an emerging avenue to address this involves enhancing the mechanical performance of polymeric bioresorbable stent using additive manufacturing technique and threedimensional 3d printing encompassing various manufacturing technology ha transcended it initial concept to become a tangible reality in the medical field the technology evolution present a significant opportunity for pharmaceutical and medical industry enabling the creation of targeted drug and swift production of medical implant it revolutionizes medical procedure transforming the strategy of doctor and surgeon patientspecific 3dprinted anatomical model are now pivotal in precision medicine and personalized treatment approach despite it ongoing development additive manufacturing in healthcare is already integrated into various medical application offering substantial benefit to a sector under pressure for performance and cost reduction in this review primarily emphasizes stent technology different type of stent highlighting it application with some potential complication here we also address their benefit potential issue effectiveness indication and contraindication in future it can potentially reduce complication and help in improving patient outcome 3dp technology offer the promise to customize solution for complex cvd condition and help or fostering a new era of precision medicine in cardiology

processed_title: intramyocardial stem cell transplantation during coronary artery bypass surgery safely improves cardiac function metaanalysis of 20 randomized clinical trial
processed_abstract: imsc transplantation during cabg is considered one of the most promising method to effectively deliver stem cell and ha been widely studied in many trial but the result of outcome and safety of this modality still vary widely we conducted this metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial rcts to evaluate not only the outcome but also the safety of this promising method a metaanalysis wa performed according to preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma guideline a comprehensive literature search wa undertaken using the pubmed scopus and cochrane database article were thoroughly evaluated and analyzed twenty publication about imsc during cabg were included primary outcome were measured using lvef lvesv lvesvi lvesd lvedv lvedvi lvedd wmsi and 6mwt safety measure were depicted by total death mace crd cva myocardial infarction ventricular arrhythmia and cardiacrelated readmission imsc transplantation during cabg significantly improved lvef md 389 95 ci 131 to 646 p 0003 and wmsi md 028 95 ci 001056 p 004 most of the other outcome showed favorable result for the imsc group but were not statistically significant the safety analysis also showed no significant risk difference for imsc transplantation compared to cabg alone imsc during cabg can safely improve cardiac function and tend to improve cardiac volume and dimension the analysis and application of influencing factor that increase patient response to imsc transplantation are important to achieve longterm improvement

processed_title: coronary artery sequel of kawasaki disease in adulthood a concern for internist and cardiologist
processed_abstract: young adult suffered from acute cardiac event such a acute coronary syndrome ischemicassociated arrhythmia and sudden death are frequently encountered without known etiology and significant risk factor coronary vasculitis due to kawasaki disease contributes to be a risk factor in young adult population to develop acute coronary event afflicted predominantly during childhood kawasaki disease give rise to vasculitis of coronary artery which becomes major concern since it lead to coronary aneurysm and stenosis selflimited nature of kawasaki disease make those suffered in childhood survive into adult life accelerated coronary atherosclerosis in the kawasaki diseaserelated lesion occurring in young adult and subsequent acute coronary syndrome and sudden death in this population are devastating impact of the sequel of kawasaki disease it is expected that internist and adult cardiologist become familiar with this sequel and provide better care for the patient

processed_title: clinicodemographic profile and outcome of type 2 diabetes mellitus in the indonesian cohort of discover a 3year prospective cohort study
processed_abstract: background indonesia is amongst the top 10 country with the highest prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm at 108 however the distinguishable feature of t2dm in indonesia remain obscure therefore the discover study aimed to describe the characteristic of t2dm patient associated vascular complication and treatment in indonesia methodology discover study is a multicountry multicenter prospective cohort study over 3 year in the present study the data were collected from 13 site from clinical practice hospital and public health facility in indonesia result a total of 221 subject were recruited with a mean age of 556 98 year and body mass index bmi of 264 44 kgm2 over 40 of patient had hypertension andor hyperlipidemia the mean duration of t2dm wa 583 620 month while the mean hba1c level wa 92 2 in total 824 completed the study within a 36month followup period bmi remained elevated ie 25 kgm2 a significant reduction wa observed in hba1c level a compared to baseline 92 2 to 81 18 t2dmassociated microvascular complication such a peripheral neuropathy albuminuria and chronic kidney disease were observed in 172 macrovascular complication including coronary artery disease and heart failure were seen in 262 of patient we also found that more than 70 of patient were on metformin andor sulfonylurea conclusion the feature of patient with t2dm in indonesia were high bmi with hypertension and hyperlipidemia a comorbidities metformin and sulfonylurea were the most common treatment hba1c reduction during followup did not reach recommended target thus early detection and intervention using available glucoselowering medication and aggressive management of risk factor and complication are essential to improve outcome of diabetes management in indonesia

processed_title: comparison between provisional and dual systematic stenting approach for left main bifurcation disease a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: despite recent advancement challenge persist in determining the optimal stenting strategy for lm bifurcation disease hence this systematic review aim to compare single provisional and systematic dual stenting for managing lm bifurcation disease a systematic search wa performed until january 14 2024 for the effect measure risk ratio rrs wa calculated this study included 22 study with 10776 participant the allcause mortality and cardiovascular mortality revealed comparable outcome between provisional and dualsystematic stenting rr 113 ci95 087147 p 036 i2 59 rr 116 ci95 073184 p 063 i2 80 in addition mace mi tlr tvr and in stent thrombosis also showed similar finding subgroup analysis revealed that cohort study wa the source of heterogeneity in allcause mortality stent thrombosis and tlr this metaanalysis suggests comparable outcome between provisional and dualsystematic stenting in managing lm bifurcation disease further study is needed to validate the outcome of novel technique

processed_title: antiaggregation effect of clopidogrel in coronary heart disease patient using omeprazole
processed_abstract: background antiplatelet agent used in coronary heart disease chd cause gastrointestinal side effect omeprazole can prevent and cure these antiplatelet side effect clopidogrel combined with aspirin increase the risk of gastrointestinal tract ulcer and bleeding this research studied the effect of omeprazole on the antiplatelet effect of clopidogrel method chd patient using clopidogrel and aspirin receive omeprazole 20 mg in a single dose for 10 day platelet antiaggregation point for clopidogrel wa measured using verifynow p2y12 the cutoff point used were low on treatment platelet reactivity lpr 85 p2y12 reaction unit pru normal on treatment platelet reactivity npr 85208 pru and high on treatment platelet reactivity hpr 208 pru result using the paired ttest pru point pre and postomeprazole were 154 8589 pru and 1694 5615 pru respectively the pru point were consistent or decreased from the previous pru point below the hpr cutoff p 0215 005 before omeprazole use five patient were categorized a npr two patient a lpr and three patient a hpr after omeprazole use two patient each from hpr and npr category had a pru point 208 the rest showed result below the hpr point conclusion in this study the pru point of clopidogrel after omeprazole use showed a pru 208 the hypothesis that omeprazole may reduce the antiaggregation effect of clopidogrel a shown by the increase in pru above the cutoff point 208 pru hpr wa not proven

processed_title: increased heart rate variability following elective percutaneous coronary intervention in patient with stable coronary artery disease and preprocedural anxiety
processed_abstract: background there is a strong association between chronic ischemia and autonomic imbalance percutaneous coronary intervention pci may restore autonomic balance in patient with stable coronary artery disease scad which is characterized by increased heart rate variability hrv anxiety is often found in patient who are going to undergo invasive procedure and ha been identified to induce autonomic imbalance the aim of our study is to identify the impact of preprocedural anxiety on increased hrv following an elective pci method our study wa a pretest and posttest correlation study involving 44 scad patient who underwent elective pci at cipto mangunkusumo national hospital the hrv wa measured before and after pci anxiety symptom were evaluated using hospital anxiety depression score hads questionnaire result we found a higher increase on hrv parameter following the pci of subject in the nonanxiety group compared with the anxiety group median 911 v 283 u 15400 p0043 conclusion preprocedural anxiety may inhibit hrv increase following pci procedure

processed_title: characterisation of the singlecell human cardiomyocytes taken from the excess heart tissue of the right ventricular outlet in congenital heart disease
processed_abstract: cardiovascular disease is the second highest cause of death across the globe myocardial infarction is one of the heart disease that cause permanent impairment of the heart wall lead to heart failure cellular therapy might give hope to regenerate the damaged myocardium single cell isolated from an excess heart tissue obtained from the correction of the right ventricular hypertrophy in patient with tetralogy of fallot for future heart study were investigated method once resected the heart tissue were transported at 37 degree c in dulbeccos modified eagle medium dmem 45 gl1 antibioticantimycotic 3x prp10 vv to reach the lab within 30 min weighted and grouped into less than 500 mg and more than 1000 mg n 4 each sample wa digested with 250 uml1 collagenase type v and 4uml1 proteinase xxiv in the mac ctube milltenyi germany then dissociated using the mac octo dissociator with heater milltenyi germany for 60 min at 37 degree c result all cell isolated were rodshaped cell viability wa up to 90 the cell density obtained from the 500 mg group were 4867 899 cellsmg1 tissue weight significantly higher compared to the 1000 mg group had 557 490 cellsmg1 tissue weight mean of n 3 95 cl the isolated cell were analyzed using facs bd flowcytometer expressed ctnt 1338 pecam1 vcam1 3225 ckit 785 icam 8553 indicating the cardiomyocyte progenitor cell conclusion cardiomyocytes taken from the wasted heart tissue might be a candidate of cardiomyocytes source to study intervention to the heart a it contained up to 1338 cardiomyocytes and 3225 of cardiac progenitor cell moreover perhaps when cardiac cell therapy need autologous cardiomyocytes less than 500 mg tissue weight can be considered a sufficient

processed_title: factor associated with increased length of stay in post primary percutaneous coronary intervention patient a scoping review
processed_abstract: several study identify factor affecting increased length of stay los in patient with postprimary percutaneous coronary intervention pci however there ha not been a review study that synthesizes these result this study aimed to describe the duration of los and factor associated with increased los among patient with stemi after ppci this study used scoping review using ebscohost academic search complete pubmed scopus taylor francis and google scholar database the keywords used in english were adult or middleaged and length of stay or hospital stay and primary percutaneous coronary intervention or ppci and myocardial infarction or coronary infarction or cardiovascular disease the inclusion criterion for article were the article wa a fulltext in english the sample wa stemi patient who had undergone a ppci procedure and the article discussed the los we found 13 article discussing the duration and factor affecting los in patient postppci the duration of los wa the fastest 48 hour and the longest of los wa 102 day factor influencing los are categorized into three predictor low moderate and high postprocedure complication after ppci wa the most influential factor in increasing the los duration professional health worker especially nurse can identify various factor that can be modified to prevent complication and worsen disease prognosis to increase los efficiency

processed_title: predicting multivascular disease in patient with coronary artery disease
processed_abstract: background because of it systemic nature the occurrence of atherosclerosis in the coronary artery can also indicate a risk for other vascular disease however screening program targeted for all patient with coronary artery disease cad is highly ineffective and no study have assessed the risk factor for developing multivascular disease in general this study constructed a predictive model and scoring system to enable targeted screening for multivascular disease in cad patient method this crosssectional study includes patient with cad a diagnosed during coronary angiography or percutaneous coronary intervention from march 2021 to december 2021 coronary artery stenosis ca and abdominal aortic aneurysm aaa were diagnosed using doppler ultrasound while peripheral artery disease pad wa diagnosed based on abi score multivariate logistic regression wa conducted to construct the predictive model and risk score validation wa conducted using roc analysis and hosmerlemeshow test result multivariate analysis showed that age of 60 year or 95 ci 1579 11532164 diabetes mellitus or 1412 10361924 cerebrovascular disease or 3656 23265747 and cad3vd or 1960 12503073 increased the odds for multivascular disease the model demonstrated good predictive capability auc 0659 and wa wellcalibrated hosmerlemeshow p 0379 targeted screening for highrisk patient reduced the number needed to screen nns from 6 in the general population to 3 and ha a high specificity of 965 conclusion targeted screening using clinical risk score wa able to decrease nns with good predictive capability and high specificity

processed_title: hydralazine protects the heart against acute ischaemiareperfusion injury by inhibiting drp1mediated mitochondrial fission
processed_abstract: aim genetic and pharmacological inhibition of mitochondrial fission induced by acute myocardial ischaemiareperfusion injury iri ha been shown to reduce myocardial infarct size the clinically used antihypertensive and heart failure medication hydralazine is known to have antioxidant and antiapoptotic effect here we investigated whether hydralazine confers acute cardioprotection by inhibiting drp1mediated mitochondrial fission method and result pretreatment with hydralazine wa shown to inhibit both mitochondrial fission and mitochondrial membrane depolarisation induced by oxidative stress in hela cell in mouse embryonic fibroblast mefs pretreatment with hydralazine attenuated mitochondrial fission and cell death induced by oxidative stress but this effect wa absent in mefs deficient in the mitochondrial fission protein drp1 molecular docking and surface plasmon resonance study demonstrated binding of hydralazine to the gtpase domain of the mitochondrial fission protein drp1 kd 8610 microm and inhibition of drp1 gtpase activity in a dosedependent manner in isolated adult murine cardiomyocytes subjected to simulated iri hydralazine inhibited mitochondrial fission preserved mitochondrial fusion event and reduced cardiomyocyte death hydralazine 24725 v control 34115 p00012 in ex vivo perfused murine heart subjected to acute iri pretreatment with hydralazine reduced myocardial infarct size a left ventricle hydralazine 29665 v vehicle control 54149 p00083 and in the murine heart subjected to in vivo iri the administration of hydralazine at reperfusion decreased myocardial infarct size a areaatrisk hydralazine 28930 v vehicle control 58238 p0001 conclusion we show that in addition to it antioxidant and antiapoptotic effect hydralazine confers acute cardioprotection by inhibiting iriinduced mitochondrial fission raising the possibility of repurposing hydralazine a a novel cardioprotective therapy for improving postinfarction outcome

processed_title: prognostic performance of troponin in covid19 a diagnostic metaanalysis and metaregression
processed_abstract: background cardiac injury is frequently encountered in patient with coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 and is associated with increased risk of mortality elevated troponin may signify myocardial damage and is predictive of mortality this study aimed to assess the prognostic value of troponin above the 99th percentile upper reference limit url for mortality and factor affecting the relationship method a comprehensive literature search of pubmed medline scopus and embase wa undertaken from inception of the database until 16 december 2020 the key exposure wa elevated serum troponin defined a troponin of any type above the 99th percentile url the outcome wa mortality due to any cause result in total 12262 patient from 13 study were included in this systematic review and metaanalysis the mortality rate wa 23 2026 elevated troponin wa observed in 31 2338 of patient elevated troponin wa associated with increased mortality odds ratio or 475 95 confidence interval ci 407553 p 0001 i2 199 metaregression showed that the association did not vary with age p 0218 male gender p 0707 hypertension p 0182 diabetes p 0906 or coronary artery disease p 0864 the association between elevated troponin and mortality had sensitivity of 055 044066 specificity of 080 071086 positive likelihood ratio of 27 2233 negative likelihood ratio of 056 049065 diagnosis odds ratio of 5 45 and area under the curve of 073 069077 the probability of mortality wa 45 in patient with elevated troponin and 14 in patient with nonelevated troponin conclusion elevated troponin wa associated with mortality in patient with covid19 with 55 sensitivity and 80 specificity

processed_title: st2 level before and after treatment of nyha iii and iv heart failure
processed_abstract: aim to find whether st2 can be used to determine clinical improvement in patient with nyha iii and iv heart failure method this is a longitudinal pre and posttest study without a control group study subject are 23 nyha iii and iv heart failure patient st2 wa tested at the start and end of hospital treatment result of 23 heart failure patient 70 were classified a nyha iii while 30 were nyha iv there were more male subject than female 514 v 486 median age for nyha iii heart failure patient wa 52 year and mean age for nyha iv heart failure patient wa 58 year heart failure wa mostly caused by coronary artery disease 52 st2 level did not correlate with age length of care sex and cause of heart failure st2 level in nyha iv heart failure patient 58823736 ngml tended to be higher than the one in nyha iii group 3075 144845 ngml but the difference wa statistically not insignificant p089 st2 level at the start of treatment wa significantly higher than at the end 314 141292 ngml v 184 76778 ngml p0001 this show that clinical improvement is associated with significant reduction of st2 level conclusion st2 can be used a a marker to determine clinical improvement in nyha iii and iv heart failure

processed_title: ischemic preconditioning reduces apoptosis in open heart surgery
processed_abstract: background this study wa performed to assess the role of ischemic preconditioning on cardiomyocyte apoptosis after open heart surgery based on morphology by transmission electron microscopy caspase3 activity biochemical marker and cardiac performance method 12 piglet were divided into 2 equal group an ischemic preconditioning group and a control group ventricular muscle were collected to examine apoptotic ultrastructure morphology and caspase3 activity blood sample from the coronary sinus were obtained for measurement of tumor necrosis factoralpha malondialdehyde and cardiac troponin i aortic blood sample were taken for lactate measurement before and after cardiopulmonary bypass cardiac performance wa measured by echocardiography before and after surgery result cardiomyocyte apoptosis occurred postoperatively a shown by ultrastructure observation caspase3 activity wa less in the ischemic preconditioning group than the control group p 005 measurement of specific marker of cardiomyocyte injury also showed lower increase in the ischemic preconditioning group although not significantly different clinical outcome showed that ischemic preconditioning wa able to preserve cardiac performance in term of ejection fraction cardiac index and stroke volume index these were statistically significant except for lactate concentration conclusion cardiomyocyte apoptosis occurs after open heart surgery ischemic preconditioning can reduce cardiomyocyte apoptosis and improve cardiac performance laboratory finding showed that ischemic preconditioning prevents injury of cardiomyocytes and reduces lactate concentration although not statistically significant

processed_title: potential clinical application of novel cardiac biomarkers for acute myocardial infarction
processed_abstract: coronary heart disease is the leading cause of cardiac related death worldwide therefore early and accurate diagnosis of acute coronary syndrome is required to determine the next clinical step the current gold standard for cardiac marker troponin and ckmb have their downside the delayed increase of detectable circulating level of these marker contribute to delayed diagnosis and therapy novel biomarkers that rise earlier ha a good diagnosis accuracy and ha additional prognostic information are highly needed there are some potential emerging novel biomarkers for acute myocardial infarction high sensitivity troponin have a greater sensitivity and accuracy for detection and early exclusion of myocardial infarction a compared to troponin bnatriuretic peptide bnp and ntpro bnp provide prognostic information in regard of mortality myeloperoxidase identify subject with increased risk of cardiac event in the absence of myocardial necrosis dual marker strategy combining copeptin with troponin t is more accurate assay to diagnose acute myocardial infarction the level of growth differentiation factor15 is correlated with the risk of death or myocardial infarction in the next 6 month while heartfatty acid binding protein assay is an earlier marker for myocardial necrosis and provide valuable prognostic information and can further stratify patient risk novel cardiac biomarkers provide a faster exclusion of acute myocardial infarction yet with very good accuracy however unlike their predecessor the clinical use of these novel cardiac biomarkers are not only limited to establishing the diagnosis of myocardial infarction novel cardiac biomarkers possess additional potential use some of which are to determine patient prognosis and to further stratify patient risk that would determine the next step of therapy
