processed_title: risk and protective factor of poor clinical outcome in heart failure with improved ejection fraction population a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: aim heart failure with improved ejection fraction hfimpef patient could still develop adverse outcome despite ef improvement this study evaluates the risk and protective factor of poor clinical outcome in hfimpef patient method systematic searching wa done to include study that evaluate the risk of developing poor outcome in hfimpef patient hfimpef is defined a improvement of 510 ef within 612 month or normalization of ef 40 poor clinical outcome is defined a a composite of allcause mortality cardiovascular event hf rehospitalization and requirement of lvad transplant odds ratio of outcome are pooled with random effect model a subgroup analysis of multivariate analysisonly study wa also conducted result 32 study comprising 10740 hfimpef patient are included poor clinical outcome followed up for approximately 3 year are seen in 189 of hfimpef patient twelve statistically significant factor that increase the risk of outcome are found among them anemia or 769 ci 3481699 i2 0 and baseline nt probnp or 325 are the two most important predictor other significant risk factor are increasing age ischemic heart disease nyha iiiiv diabetes mellitus atrial fibrillation dyslipidemia cerebrovascular disease hypertension use of diuretic and baseline lvedd alternately protective factor of poor clinical outcome are regression of left atrial diameter lad or 033 ci 018061 p 00003 i2 0 use betablockers sglt 2 inhibitor and baseline lvef level or 060 078 090 respectively conclusion hfimpef patient are not fully recovered and patient stratification based on risk and protective factor is recommended

processed_title: diet and the gut microbiota profile in individual at risk of chronic heart failure a review on the asian population
processed_abstract: background and objective chronic heart failure chf is one of the leading cardiovascular disease cvds particularly in the asian population individual with specific health risk such a obesity type 2 diabetes hypertension dyslipidemia and coronary artery disease cad are more susceptible to developing chf current evidence is limited to understanding the link between gut microbiota dysbiosis and chf therefore this review aim to explore the potential connection between dietary pattern gut microbiota and it metabolite in individual at risk of chf in the asian population method and study design a literature review of crosssectional study wa conducted using primary keywords such a asian obesity type 2 diabetes hypertension dyslipidemia coronary artery disease and chronic heart failure there wa no restriction on sample size result several gut microbiotas were found to correlate with chf risk factor there were increased level of prevotella klebsiella romboutsia catenibacterium clostridium holdemanella ruminococcus coprococcus parabacteroides bacteroides lachnoclostridium streptococcus and megamonas while decreased level of oscillibacter bifidobacterium lactobacillus akkermansia roseburia faecalibacterium pseudobutyrivibrio and eubacterium were reported these microbiota shift were linked to increased tmao production and impaired shortchain fatty acid scfas production dietary intake and microbial metabolite were also identified a contributor to the gut microbiota associated with chf conclusion a potential link exists between the gut microbiota profile and chf risk factor possibly mediated by microbial metabolite dietary pattern may influence chfassociated gut microbiota and metabolite future research is needed to investigate how dietary modification can modulate gut microbiota and it metabolite in chf patient

processed_title: desirable intake of polyunsaturated fatty acid in indonesian adult
processed_abstract: a indonesian advisory group on fatty acid nutrition and health wa established in 2004 to consider the increasing incidence of nutritionallyrelated cardiovascular disease in indonesia emerging international recommendation often focused on dietary fat and may not have been relevant to the national situation traditional dietary pattern were apparently protective against ischaemic heart disease often with fat derived dominantly from a particular source like coconut soy peanut or fish these fat were used in way which promoted the use of potentially cardioprotective food like legume vegetable fruit and aquatic food optimal intake of polyunsaturated fatty acid in indonesia are likely to reflect both absolute intake and the relationship between n3 and n6 fatty acid of longer chain length this leaf some issue for active and continuing review like the intake of trans fatty acid and the regulatory and food labelling implication some study underway and others which need implementation will enable the advisory group to prepare a second report with more basis in indonesian evidence in the meantime the advisory group ha recommended that the aha american heart association and issfal international society for the study of fatty acid and lipid recommendation obtain until the end of 2007

processed_title: high level of midregional proadrenomedullin during stsegment elevation myocardial infarction is an independent predictor of adverse cardiac event within 90day followup
processed_abstract: background and objective the cardiovascular adverse event including mortality and heart failure persist significantly during the first month after the acute phase of stsegment elevation myocardial infarction stemi the increased level of midregional proadrenomedullin mrproadm at hospital presentation in stemi patient is considered an independent predictor of shortterm and longterm mortality and heart failure this study aimed to measure mrproadm level during the acute and recovery phase of stemi and corroborate whether mrproadm level wa associated with the adverse cardiac event after recovering from stemi material and method this prospective study enrolled subject with acute phase stemi admitted to the intensive cardiac care unit after recovering and discharged from hospitalization subject were followedup for 90 day for mrproadm measurement the blood sample during acute phase were withdrawn on hospital admission mrproadm0 and during recovery at the day30 follow up mrproadm30 adverse cardiac event were evaluated at 30day and 90day follow up namely a composite of death chronic heart failure and hospital readmission of any cardiac cause result 83 subject were enrolled the median mrproadm0 wa 331333 pgml and mrproadm30 wa significantly reduced at 29250 pgml p 0001 nineteen subject 229 experienced adverse cardiac event at 30day follow up the mrproadm0 level wa independently associated with 30day adverse cardiac event adjustedor 1002 95ci 10011003 p 0040 after adjustment with other variable in this case 25 subject 325 experienced adverse cardiac event at 90day followup the mrproadm0 level wa independently associated with 90day adverse cardiac event adjustedor 1002 95ci 10011003 p 0049 the higher change of mrproadm0 to mrproadm30 also associated with adverse cardiac event at 90 day conclusion the mrproadm wa significantly increased during the acute phase of stemi and declined during recovery phase the higher mrproadm level during the acute phase of stemi and it change intensity were predictor of adverse cardiac event within the 90day follow up

processed_title: the use of medication in the secondary prevention of coronary artery disease in the asian region
processed_abstract: background cardiovascular disease to which coronary artery disease cad is a significant contributor are a leading cause of longterm morbidity and mortality worldwide in the year ahead it is estimated that approximately half of the world cardiovascular burden will occur in the asian region currently there is a large gap in secondary prevention with unrealized health gain resulting from underuse of evidencebased medication including betablockers angiotensin converting enzyme ace inhibitor angiotensin receptor blocker arb aspirin and other antiplatelet agent and lipidlowering drug despite the almost universal recommendation for these drug in unstable cad their underprescription is well documented for patient with acute heart failure nonobstructive cad and for secondary prevention of cad objective this article review the burden of cad in asian country together with guideline supporting evidencebased medication use from a secondary prevention perspective method the medline database wa searched from 2000 to 2013 inclusive for countryspecific data related to cad and supplemented with unpublished registry data result in the postdischarge setting following hospital admission for acute coronary syndrome medication prescription rate were low betablocker prescription rate ranged from 49 in china to 99 in singapore aceinhibitorarb prescription rate ranged from 28 in china to 96 in singapore and lipidlowering therapy rate ranged from 47 in china to 97 in singapore aspirinantiplatelet drug prescription rate ranged from 86 in indonesia to 995 in singapore recommendation are provided to improve patient outcome and reduce the disease burden in asia conclusion despite recommendation issued in international and national guideline use of cad medication in asia remains suboptimal in the absence of clear contraindication all patient with unstable cad should receive these agent a secondary prevention this averts the need to target drug use according to risk with highrisk feature paradoxically associated with underprescribing of such drug

processed_title: profile of kawasaki disease in adolescent is it different
processed_abstract: background there is clearly growing population of young adult with potentially important coronary artery disease after kawasaki disease kd during childhood and cardiologist must be prepared to take care for them a kawasaki disease in adolescent and adult is rare and underrecognized it is important to study data on patient presentation which may permit development of diagnostic criterion and treatment guideline for this age groupthis study aimed to compare the clinical profile of kd between adolescent 10 year of age and child 10 year method this is a cross sectional study a total of 1150 kd case age 1192 month during the period of january 2003december 2016 were analyzed the clinical profile of subject aged 10 year adolescent and 10 year child at acute phase of kd were compared result we found 17 case of kd in adolescent among 1150 total case 15 incomplete kd wa more often seen in adolescent compared to child 10 year of age 59 v 29 some clinical feature were more frequently seen in child than in adolescent eg conjunctivitis 85 in 10 year of age v 65 in 10 year mucosal change 94 v 77 rash 86 v 59 and handfoot change 68 v 41 while other clinical feature were more often seen in adolescent eg cervical lymphadenopathy 82 v 39 and coronary dilatation 47 v 29 laboratory result hemoglobin leukocyte erythrocyte sedimentation rate and creactive protein did not differ much between the two group conclusion kawasaki disease in adolescent ha some different clinical profile from that of younger age majority of adolescent patient have incomplete presentation some clinical feature such a conjunctivitis mucosal change rash and handfoot change are more often seen in child 10 year compared to in adolescent while cervical lymphadenopathy and coronary dilatation are more frequently seen in adolescent the ratio of male to female is much higher in adolescent

processed_title: remote ischemic preconditioning reduces the incidence of contrastinduced nephropathy in patient undergoing coronary angiographyintervention systematic review and metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: background contrastinduced nephropathy cin is associated with increased mortality and morbidity in patient undergoing coronary angiography cag and percutaneous coronary intervention pci we aimed to assess the latest evidence on the effect of remote ischemic preconditioning ripc on the incidence of cin in patient undergoing cagpci method we performed a comprehensive search on topic assessing ripc and cin in cagpci patient from inception up until july 2019 through several electronic database result there were a total of 1925 subject from 14 randomized controlled trial remote ischemic preconditioning wa associated with reduced cin incidence in patient undergoing cagpci or 041 030 055 p 001 i2 22 the nephroprotective effect wa also demonstrated in those at moderatehigh risk for cin subgroup or 041 029 058 p 001 i2 26 and pcionly subgroup or 041 029 058 p 001 i2 0 time from ripc to cagpci ha similar effectiveness among 45 60 and 120 min mortality rehospitalization hemodialysis and major adverse event were lower in the ripc group or 050 033 076 p 001 i2 0 grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation grade assessment showed that ripc ha high evidence certainty for reducing cin in patient undergoing pcicag moderatehigh risk subgroup and pcionly subgroup with absolute reduction of 97 per 1000 129 per 1000 and 121 per 1000 respectively harbord test showed no evidence for the presence of smallstudy effect p 157 conclusion remote ischemic preconditioning is an effective procedure to reduce the risk of cin and should be considered in patient with moderatehigh risk at developing cin

processed_title: type 2 diabetes mellitus and cognitive impairment
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is strongly associated with lower performance on multiple domain of cognitive function and with structural abnormality of the brain with the growing epidemic of diabetes and aging population neural complication of diabetes are expected to rise and becoming a challenge for future health implication understanding pathophysiology factor associated with this complication manifestation of cognitive impairment and various metabolic and neuroradiologic marker suggestive of this pathologic condition is crucial for proper management of this potentially debilitating complication of t2dm this review will discus briefly important aspect of cognitive impairment in t2dm

processed_title: type 2 diabetes and it impact on the immune system
processed_abstract: introduction type 2 diabetes t2d is a major health problem worldwide this metabolic disease is indicated by high blood glucose level due to insufficient insulin production by the pancreas an inflammatory response occurs a a result of the immune response to high blood glucose level a well a the presence of inflammatory mediator produced by adipocytes and macrophage in fat tissue this low and chronic inflammation damage the pancreatic beta cell and lead to insufficient insulin production which result in hyperglycemia hyperglycemia in diabetes is thought to cause dysfunction of the immune response which fails to control the spread of invading pathogen in diabetic subject therefore diabetic subject are known to more susceptible to infection the increased prevalence of t2d will increase the incidence of infectious disease and related comorbidities objective this review provides an overview of the immunological aspect of t2d and the possible mechanism that result in increased infection in diabetic conclusion a better understanding of how immune dysfunction occur during hyperglycemia can lead to novel treatment and prevention for infectious disease and t2d comorbidities thus improving the outcome of infectious disease treatment in t2d patient

processed_title: sarcopenia and chronic complication of type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: sarcopenia defined a the loss of skeletal muscle mass and strength andor a decrease in physical performance is classically related to aging however chronic disease including type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm may accelerate the development of sarcopenia previous study found strong association between t2dm and sarcopenia insulin resistance that exists in t2dm is thought to be the key mediator for impaired physical function and mobility which may lead to sarcopenia t2dm may cause sarcopenia through the mediation of insulin resistance inflammation accumulation of advanced glycation endproducts and oxidative stress that may affect muscle mass and strength protein metabolism and vascular and mitochondrial dysfunction on the other hand loss of muscle in sarcopenia may play a role in the development of t2dm through the decreased production of myokines that play a role in glucose and fat metabolism this review highlight the finding of existing literature on the relationship between t2dm and sarcopenia which emphasize the pathophysiology chronic vascular complication and the course of macrovascular and microvascular complication in t2dm

processed_title: global prevalence of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in type 2 diabetes mellitus an updated systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: introduction nonalcoholic fatty liver disease nafld is the leading cause of chronic liver disease with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm a a major predictor insulin resistance and chronic inflammation are key pathway in the pathogenesis of t2dm leading to nafld and vice versa with the synergistic effect of nafld and t2dm increasing morbidity and mortality risk this metaanalysis aim to quantify the prevalence of nafld and the prevalence of clinically significant and advanced fibrosis in people with t2dm method medline and embase database were searched from inception until 13 february 2023 the primary outcome were the prevalence of nafld nonalcoholic steatohepatitis nash and fibrosis in people with t2dm a generalised linear mixed model with clopperpearson interval wa used for the analysis of proportion with sensitivity analysis conducted to explore heterogeneity between study result 156 study met the inclusion criterion and a pooled analysis of 1 832 125 patient determined that the prevalence rate of nafld and nash in t2dm were 6504 95 ci 6179 to 6815 i29990 and 3155 95 ci 1712 to 5070 i29770 respectively 3554 95 ci 1956 to 5556 i210000 of individual with t2dm with nafld had clinically significant fibrosis f2f4 while 1495 95 ci 1103 to 1995 i29900 had advanced fibrosis f3f4 conclusion this study determined a high prevalence of nafld nash and fibrosis in people with t2dm increased effort are required to prevent t2dm to combat the rising burden of nafld prospero registration number crd42022360251

processed_title: the efficacy of vitamin b12 supplementation for treating vitamin b12 deficiency and peripheral neuropathy in metformintreated type 2 diabetes mellitus patient a systematic review
processed_abstract: background and aim metformintreated type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm patient are at higher risk of vitamin b12 deficiency and more severe neuropathy symptom there is still no guideline suggesting vitamin b12 supplementation for this population this study aimed to analyze the efficacy of vitamin b12 supplementation in this population method study reporting the efficacy of vitamin b12 supplementation in metformintreated t2dm patient were systematically searched in pubmed cochrane ebscohost and scopus following the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma guideline additional relevant study were searched manually through citation study quality and risk of bias were assessed using suitable tool result seven clinical trial with a total of 506 participant were included using the cochranes risk of bias 2 tool for clinical trial 4 study were assessed to have high risk of bias and 3 study had low risk of bias there were 5 study that measured change in serum vitamin b12 level all of which reported a statistically significant increase after supplementation significant reduction in homocysteine after supplementation were found in 2 study it effect on neuropathy symptom wa still unclear with 2 study reporting a significant improvement and 1 study reporting no significant effect conclusion the result of this systematic review support the implementation of vitamin b12 supplementation for metformintreated t2dm to prevent or treat vitamin b12 deficiency and neuropathy more highquality clinical study are required to generate quantitative analysis and to encourage supplementation in available guideline

processed_title: the prospect for type 2 diabetes mellitus combined with exercise and synbiotics a perspective
processed_abstract: change in gut microbiome diversity the socalled dysbiosis is correlated with insulin resistance condition exercise is typically the first management for people with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm which is generally wellknown for improving glucose regulation the new prebiotics and probiotic like synbiotics designed to target specific disease require additional study while the effectiveness of exercise combined with synbiotics seems promising this review discusses these agent possibility of increasing the gut microbiotas diversity therefore they could enhance shortchain fatty acid scfa in particular the synbiotic interaction on gut microbiota the exercise mechanism in improving gut microbiota and the prospect of the synergistic effect of the combination of synbiotic and exercise to improve insulin sensitivity are addressed

processed_title: in vitro insulin resistance model a recent update
processed_abstract: insulin resistance which affect insulinsensitive tissue including adipose tissue skeletal muscle and the liver is the central pathophysiological mechanism underlying type 2 diabetes progression decreased glucose uptake in insulinsensitive tissue disrupts insulin signaling pathway particularly the pi3kakt pathway an in vitro model is appropriate for studying the cellular and molecular mechanism underlying insulin resistance because it is easy to maintain and the result can be easily reproduced the application of cellbased model for exploring the pathogenesis of diabetes and insulin resistance a well a for developing drug for these condition is well known however a comprehensive review of in vitro insulin resistance model is lacking therefore this review wa conducted to provide a comprehensive overview and summary of the latest in vitro insulin resistance model particularly 3t3l1 preadipocyte c2c12 skeletal muscle and hepg2 liver cell line induced with palmitic acid high glucose or chronic exposure to insulin

processed_title: relation between glycemic control and cardiac autonomic neuropathy in patient with diabetes mellitus type 2
processed_abstract: background glycemic control is very important in type 2 diabetic patient microangiopathy is the first chronic complication in type 2 diabetic patient cardiac autonomic neuropathy can be used a a tool for early detection of complication in type 2 diabetic that relates well with cardiovascular morbidity and mortality the aim of this study wa to analyze the correlation between glycemic control and cardiac autonomic neuropathy in type 2 diabetic patient method it wa an observational cross sectional with correlative analysis conducted on type 2 diabetic at hasan sadikin hospital within july until august 2019 value of hba1c fasting plasma glucose and post prandial plasma glucose within 2 year were obtained with ngsp standard of examination cardiac autonomic neuropathy wa assessed by cardiovascular autonomic reflex testing cart with bellevere scoring system result the research wa conducted on 39 subject with mean age 56 705 year 487 male and 513 woman median value of the last hba1c wa 76 52129 and mean hba1c in the last 2 year wa 81 188 median cart score wa 5 18 rankspearman correlation analysis showed significant moderately positive correlation between hba1c and cart score r 0454 ci 95 01870772 p 0004 and also mean hba1c within the last 2 year with cart score r 0564 ik 95 02890839 p 0000 multivariate analysis mean hba1c remained correlated significantly with cart score even after adjustment toward age gender duration of diabetes and diabetic therapy conclusion there is significant moderately positive correlation between glycemic control and cardiac autonomic neuropathy in type 2 diabetic patient

processed_title: onceweekly insulin icodec a novel treatment for type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomized clinical trial
processed_abstract: aim the primary objective of this investigation is to examine the efficacy and safety of insulin icodec when compared to regular basal insulin for the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm method a comprehensive search wa conducted on the cochrane library scopus clinicaltrialsgov and medline database up until august 19th 2023 this review incorporates literature that examines the comparison between insulin icodec and basal insulin the risk of bias wa assessed by using rob v2 tool from cochrane collaboration we employed randomeffect model to analyze the mean difference md and odds ratio or for presentation of the outcome result a total of nine trial with 3963 participant were incorporated five included trial had lowrisk of bias whereas the remaining four trial had someconcern risk of bias due to protocol deviation from intended intervention the result of our metaanalysis showed no significant difference in the reduction of hba1c level between insulin icodec and regular basal insulin md 011 95 ci 023 001 p 008 i2 91 the fasting plasma glucose fpg and body weight change from baseline also did not differ significantly between two group meanwhile the total adverse event taes were shown to be higher in the insulin icodec however the serious aes saes and clinically significant hypoglycemia did not differ significantly between insulin icodec and these active control conclusion this study suggests similar efficacy and safety between insulin icodec and regular basal insulin further clinical trial are still needed to confirm the result of our study registration detail crd42023453635

processed_title: the experience and barrier in addressing type 2 diabetes mellitusassociated erectile dysfunction a mixed method systematic review
processed_abstract: introduction experience and determinant connected with type 2 diabetes mellitusassociated erectile dysfunction t2dmed in health appointment are not well understood and infrequently reported this systematic review wa undertaken to synthesise evidence of the experience facilitator and barrier around screening ed in men with t2dm during health service consultation method the review report wa based on the guideline provided by the joanna briggs institute for conducting mixedmethod systematic review eight electronic database were searched including web of science embase via ovid cumulative index to nursing and allied health literature cinahl via ebsco proquest pubmed psychinfo via ovid medline via ovid portal garuda additionally the review manually looked through the reference list of the study we included erectile dysfunction type 2 diabetes mellitus screening and barrier were initially used a keywords in the search strategy all identified primary study written in english and bahasa indonesia and published between 2001 and 2022 were meticulously screened following an agreed set of inclusion criterion finding out of 3468 paper screened only six were chosen for the review these included three crosssectional study two qualitative study and one mixedmethod study the study quality of the included study wa assessed using the joanna briggs institute jbi critical appraisal checklist based on the checklist criterion the study ranged between 510 to 910 in term of quality after synthesizing the finding four main category were identified including the willingness to discus t2dmed the barrier experienced and perceived the limited understanding of t2dmed and the support expected by men with t2dm discussion many men kept quiet about their struggle with t2dmed hoping to bring it up a a topic of discussion during healthcare consultation barrier such a embarrassment a sense of helplessness and reluctance to seek help financial constraint and dismissive healthcare professional hindered them from addressing this issue both the participating men and healthcare professional lacked a comprehensive understanding of t2dmed recommendation it is important to provide education tailored to men specific need and improve awareness about t2dmassociated ed creating a more t2dmedfriendly environment could be a potential solution to increase early screening and management future research should investigate potential barrier that prevent hcps from identifying and addressing t2med since their absence in the identified study highlight this need systematic review registration crd42021292454

processed_title: direct medical cost of type 2 diabetes mellitus and it associated complication in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to estimate the direct medical cost of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and it complication in the indonesian population from a payer perspective using a prevalencebased approach method the direct medical cost in 2016 were estimated using the database of indonesia national health insurance known a jaminan kesehatan nasional which included diagnosisrelated group cost and unbundled cost for patient accessing advanced care the study population included people aged 30 year or older having a diagnosis of t2dm t2dm and it related complication were identified using the international classification of disease 10th revision code hypoglycemia and all complication listed in the diabetes severity complication index were included descriptive analysis wa conducted cost were converted to 2016 u dollar equivalent result of the 189 million jaminan kesehatan nasional member who accessed secondary and tertiary care 812 204 4 were identified with t2dm of which 57 had complication the most common complication wa cardiovascular disease 24 the total direct medical cost wa u 576 million with 56 spent on hospitalization 38 on specialist visit 4 on unbundled nondiabetesrelated medication and 2 on unbundled antihyperglycemic medication approximately 74 of the total cost wa used for the management of people with complication people with complication u 930personyear u 1480personyear incurred twice the cost of those without complication u 421personyear u 745personyear conclusion the direct medical cost for management of people with t2dm in indonesia wa high early diagnosis and optimal management of t2dm to prevent complication may reduce the costly sequela and have a possibility of cost saving

processed_title: review of literature on akkermansia muciniphila and it possible role in the etiopathogenesis and therapy of type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: akkermansia muciniphila is a promising gut microbiota for the treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm a muciniphila stimulates intestinal wall integrity is an antiinflammatory agent and reduces endoplasmic reticulum stress lipogenesis and gluconeogenesis these property make a muciniphila a potential treatment option for t2dm by reducing insulin resistance and increasing insulin sensitivity and glucose tolerance in different tissue this article explores the possible role of a muciniphila in t2dm management along with the various method known to modulate a muciniphila

processed_title: the effect of yoga on healthrelated fitness among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background there is a need for a type of physical activity that could address the challenging cycle of physical inactivity impaired healthrelated fitness and type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm condition yoga could be one type of exercise to overcome the barrier to adhere to regular physical activity the current study aimed to systematically review the effect of yoga on healthrelated fitness including cardiorespiratory fitness muscle strength body composition balance and flexibility among patient with t2dm method we systematically searched four database and two registry pubmed scopus cochrane embase whoitcrp and clinicaltrialsgov in september 2021 following a registered protocol on prospero crd42022276225 study inclusion criterion were t2dm patient with or without complication yoga intervention a a single component or a a complement compared to other kind of exercise or an inactive control healthrelated fitness and a randomized controlled trial or quasiexperimental with control group design the robinsi tool and rob 20 tool were used to assess the risk of bias in the included study a votecounting analysis and metaanalysis computed using random effect model were conducted result a total of 10 record from 3 quasiexperimental and 7 randomized controlled trial with 815 participant in total were included the metaanalysis favored yoga group compared to inactive control in improving muscle strength by 342 95 confidence interval 242 to 443 repetition of chair stand test and improving cardiorespiratory fitness by 66 95 confidence interval 04 to 128 improvement of baseline forced vital capacity the quality of evidence for both outcome wa low conclusion lowquality evidence favored yoga in improving healthrelated fitness particularly muscle strength and cardiorespiratory fitness among patient with t2dm funding all author in this systematic review received no specific grant from any funding agency in the public commercial or notforprofit sector

processed_title: systematic review and metaanalysis of telecoaching for selfcare management among person with type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: background in response to the need for safe care for people with diabetes mellitus in the current outbreak of covid19 it is critical to evaluate the model service delivery feasibility and efficiency of diabetes mellitus telecoaching objective this study aimed to conduct a systematic review and metaanalysis of the model and efficacy of telecoaching to improve selfcare and clinical outcome method this study us the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma we searched on 22 march 2022 using keywords that matched the mesh browser in four database to find relevant study namely pubmedmedline proquest scopus and ebscohost additionally we collected randomized controlled trial rcts on google scholar using the snowball technique a quality assessment wa performed using the cochrane collaboration risk of bias tool rob2 the metaanalysis used the dersimonianlaird randomeffects model to analyze the pooled mean difference md and it pvalue result thirteen rct study were included for the systematic review and metaanalysis with a total number of participant of 3300 the model of telecoaching is a form of using nursesled telephone and mobile apps which are relatively costeffective the metaanalysis showed a positively improved statistically significance in clinical outcome including in hba1c a pooled md of 033 95 ci 051015 p 00003 blood glucose 1899 95 ci 20891709 p 000001 systolic blood pressure 266 95 ci 366166 p 000001 body mass index 079 95 ci 139018 p 001 and weight 216 kg 95 ci 395038 p 002 it wa not however statistically significant in diastolic blood pressure 087 95 ci 202028 p 014 total cholesterol 007 95 ci 026012 p 046 lowdensity lipoprotein 219 95 ci 670231 p 034 triglyceride 1356 95 ci 40461335 p 032 and highdensity protein 040 95 ci 112191 p 061 conclusion the telecoaching with nursesled telephone and mobile apps significantly affected clinical outcome on hba1c systolic blood pressure weight and bmi moreover there wa no significant effect on the total cholesterol lowdensity lipoprotein triglyceride and highdensity lipoprotein thus telecoaching ha the potential a a care model in diabetes mellitus during covid19 and similar pandemic to improve selfcare and clinical outcome but all the study analyzed involved noncovid19 patient limiting the generalizability of the result to covid19

processed_title: medication knowledge and adherence in type 2 diabetes mellitus patient in brunei darussalam a pioneer study in brunei darussalam
processed_abstract: aim the present study measured the medication knowledge and medication adherence in patient with type 2 diabetes in brunei darussalam demographic detail and diabetes knowledge were also evaluated method a crosssectional study conducted via the administration of a structured questionnaire consisting of 4 section via a facetoface interview result a total of 118 participant were interviewed a majority of the participant were aged 40 year or above 106 898 the mean number of total medication that the participant were taking wa 736 287 and the mean number of antidiabetic medication wa 239 106 a for the antidiabetic therapy the largest proportion of the participant were taking oral antidiabetic medication only 87 7373 in the diabetes knowledge section of the questionnaire more than half of the participant 63 5334 scored higher than the acquired mean score family history education level and total medication taken were significantly correlated with diabetes knowledge however in the medication knowledge section of the questionnaire the mean score 337 138 wa below the intended score for good knowledge medication knowledge ha been significantly associated with gender family history and total medication taken a majority of the participant reported nonadherence 74 6271 due to various reason in this study those of the malay race were significantly correlated with adherence to their medication regimen this study also revealed that there is no significant relationship between diabetes knowledge medication knowledge and medication adherence conclusion the present study provides insight in regard to patient with type 2 diabetes in brunei darussalam and their knowledge towards the disease a well a their medication despite the lack of significance between the variable the rate of nonadherence is still alarming further study are required to better understand the barrier to nonadherence in these patient

processed_title: effect of combination of curcumin and piperine supplementation on glycemic profile in patient with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to evaluate the effect of the combination of curcumin and piperine supplementation on fasting plasma glucose fpg homeostatic model of insulin resistance homair and body mass index bmi in patient with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm this review wa done to identify potential herbal remedy that may help improve glycemic parameter leading to better health outcome in combination with current antidiabetic treatment methodology this systematic review wa based on preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma it wa conducted in 2023 with source and database from medline ebscohost sciencedirect and proquest this paper included randomizedcontrolled trial exploring the effect of the combination of curcumin and piperine on patient with prediabetes and t2dm systematic review observational study case report case series conference abstract book section commentarieseditorials nonhuman study and article with unavailable fulltext and written in nonenglish language were excluded the key term for the literature search were curcumin piperine prediabetes and type 2 diabetes mellitus we use cochrane risk of bias rob 2 for quality assessment of the included study and review manager revman 54 to do the metaanalysis result a total of three study were included in this systematic review two study from neta et al and cicero et al showed no significant difference in homair bmi and fpg level between the curcumin piperine and placebo group one study from panahi et al demonstrated a significant difference in bmi level between the curcumin and piperine and placebo group p 001 the metaanalysis showed that fpg level homair and bmi improved among patient with diabetes given in curcumin and piperine with reported mean difference md of 761 95 ci 1526 003 p 005 md 036 95 ci 077 to 005 p 009 and md 041 95 ci 085 to 003 p 007 respectively conclusion the supplementation of curcumin and piperine showed a numerical reduction in fpg homair and bmi but were not statistically significant further research is needed a there is a paucity of study included in the review

processed_title: review of the case report on metformin sulfonylurea and thiazolidinedione therapy in type 2 diabetes mellitus patient
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is the world most common metabolic disease the development of t2dm is mainly caused by a combination of two factor the failure of insulin secretion by the pancreatic betacells and the inability of insulinsensitive tissue to respond to insulin insulin resistance therefore the disease is indicated by a chronic increase in blood glucose t2dm patient can be treated with mono or combined therapy using oral antidiabetic drug and insulinreplaced agent however the medication often lead to various discomfort such a abdominal pain diarrhea or constipation nausea and vomiting and hypersensitivity reaction a biguanide drug metformin ha been used a a firstline drug to reduce blood sugar level sulfonylurea work by blocking the atpsensitive potassium channel directly inducing the release of insulin from pancreatic betacells and thus decreasing blood glucose concentration however the risk of the failure of sulfonylurea a a monotherapy agent is greater than that of metformin or rosiglitazone a thiazolidinedione drug sulfonylurea are used a the firstline drug of choice for dm patient who can not tolerate metformin therapy other antidiabetic drug thiazolidinediones work by activating the peroxisome proliferatoractivated receptor gamma ppargamma decreasing the ir level and increasing the response of betacells towards the glucose level however thiazolidines may increase the risk of cardiovascular disease weight gain water retention and edema this review article aim to discus case report on the use of metformin sulfonylurea and thiazolidinediones in dm patient the literature search wa conducted on the pubmed database using the keywords metformin or sulfonylurea or thiazolidinediones and case report filtered to free full text case report and 10 year publication date in some patient metformin may affect sleep quality and in rare case lead to the occurrence of lactate acidosis thus patient taking this drug should be monitored for their kidney status plasma ph and plasma metformin level sulfonylurea and tzds may cause a higher risk of hypoglycemia and weight gain or edema due to fluid retention tzds may be associated with risk of cardiovascular event in patient with concomitant t2dm and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease therefore patient taking these drug should be closely monitored for adverse effect

processed_title: stroke among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient at haji adam malik general hospital medan indonesia
processed_abstract: background increasing blood sugar level bsl in diabetes meletus can be various microvascular and macrovascular change in the end will cause complication the complication can occur in some organ such a the heart blood vessel eye kidney and nerve stroke is one of the complication from diabetes that is increasing in every year aim the study aim to analyse the relationship between diabetes and the prevalence of stroke at haji adam malik general hospital medan method this study is an analytical study with a crosssectional approach the population wa all integrated inpatient ward at haji adam malik general hospital medan the subject were 180 people chosen by consecutive sampling technique result the result showed that diabetes ha a relationship with the prevalence of stroke p 005 ci 95 the risk of diabetes is 134 time higher than those without diabetes at haji adam malik general hospital medan conclusion based on the result the diabetic patient ha a higher risk of incidence of stroke excellent control for diabetic patient will prevent them from stroke and any complication

processed_title: low social support and risk for depression in people with type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective depression is a frequent complication of type 2 diabetes mellitus this study aimed to investigate the relationship between low social support and risk for depression in people with type 2 diabetes through a metaanalysis method pubmed proquest springerlink sciencedirect scopus the cochrane library embase and google scholar were searched for englishlanguage article published up to 2021 pooled adjusted odds ratio aors were calculated using a randomeffect model with 95 confidence interval ci heterogeneity wa evaluated by using the cochrane q test and i2 statistic the risk of publication bias wa estimated using a funnel plot the egger test and the begg test the joanna briggs institute critical appraisal tool were used to assess the quality of evidence and the risk of bias result eleven study were included in this metaanalysis containing a total of 3151 people with type 2 diabetes mellitus the pooled analysis showed that people with type 2 diabetes mellitus who had low social support had twice a high a risk of depression a those with high social support aor 202 95 ci 151 to 270 plt0001 a randomeffect model wa used because the heterogeneity wa high i2 87 conclusion low social support wa found to increase the risk of depression among people with type 2 diabetes mellitus further investigation into factor that may moderate this relationship is required

processed_title: prevalence and associated factor of female sexual dysfunction among type 2 diabetes patient in indonesia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background and aim female sexual dysfunction fsd is a neglected chronic complication of diabetes however there is a scarcity of data in indonesia which is currently ranked a the 5th in the world for the number of people with type 2 diabetes t2d our study aim to analyze the prevalence and factor of fsd among t2d patient in indonesia method literature searching wa performed in pubmedmedliner cinahlr embaser proquestr scopusr local journal and library all study in searching keywords sexual diabetes and indonesia with medical subject heading mesh term were included without time or language restriction pooled prevalence and odds ratio of associated factor of fsd were analyzed using stata result ten study comprised 572 female with t2d were included in this review the pooled prevalence of fsd reached 52 95 ci 049056 i2 939 p 0001 after removing one study that wa conducted with an unstandardized questionnaire cutoff value the pooled prevalence of fsd wa 62 95 ci 058066 i2 687 p 0001 age more than 45 year old and or menopause and the use of antihypertensive were associated with fsd while hemoglobin a1c hba1c is only correlated with a desire for sexual dysfunction conclusion fsd wa prevalent among t2d patient in indonesia and wa associated with age more than 45 year old menopause and the use of antihypertensive medication

processed_title: effect of resveratrol in melinjo seed gnetum gnemon l extract on type 2 diabetes mellitus patient and it possible mechanism a review
processed_abstract: background and objective diabetes mellitus is the third leading cause of death in indonesia 67 followed by stroke 211 and coronary heart disease 129 the prevalence of diabetes worldwide continues to increase on a yearly basis including in indonesia diabetes is a significant burden for many country due to the high cost of treatment and reduced productivity of diabetes patient comprehensive strategy to prevent and treat diabetes are therefore mandatory oral hypoglycemic drug are the firstline therapy for diabetes mellitus patient however these oral drug still have several side effect therefore it is necessary to conduct study on medicinal plant with hypoglycemic effect to identify substance that have an antidiabetic potential resembling physiological process in the body indonesian people often use herbal medicine empirically but the benefit have not been scientifically documented melinjo gnetum gnemon l is a native indonesian gymnosperm plant and the seed are often processed into food melinjo seed extract contains many polyphenols including transresveratrol conclusion study on the health benefit of resveratrol are widely available including antidiabetes and blood sugar control in patient with type 2 diabetes

processed_title: the effect of vitamin d supplementation on symptom of depression in patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: background the effect of vitamin d supplementation on depressive symptom in people with type 2 diabetes is still up for debate the aim of this paper wa to investigate the effect of vitamin d supplementation on symptom of depression in type 2 diabetic patient method the protocol for this review ha been registered in prosperocrd42021231713 searching for literature wa conducted using pubmed ebscohost and embase randomised controlled trial rcts regarding vitamin d supplementation in type 2 diabetic patient with depression were retrieved through a systematic search the outcome measured wa a change in depressive symptom evaluated with any validated rating scale independent data extraction wa conducted and the study quality wa assessed a metaanalysis wa carried out to calculate the improvement in depressive symptom in the group receiving vitamin d and the control group the available evidence in rcts wa analysed using the prisma approach and clinical significance wa determined using the grade system risk of bias wa assessed using the cochrane risk of bias tool result four rcts were reviewed and three rcts were metaanalysed in two study vitamin d wa statistically effective in improving depressive symptom in type 2 diabetic patient three randomised controlled trial were included in the metaanalysis with 161 subject using depression score a an outcome assessment vitamin d is significantly more effective than placebo 95 ci 070 to 008 p 001 conclusion vitamin d supplementation is effective in improving depressive symptom in type 2 diabetic patient future research with different geographical area and larger sample should be done to further assess the benefit

processed_title: a systematic review on the association between lipid accumulation product index and type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: introduction excess fat accumulation contributes to the development of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm lipid accumulation product lap is an index computed from waist circumference and triglyceride which represents increased lipotoxicity we aim to study the relationship of lap index and t2dm and it utility a a predictor for t2dm development methodology a literature search in pubmed and cochrane database wa performed to retrieve and review study reporting the association between lap and t2dm result two crosssectional study from japan and the united state and one cohort study from iran were obtained a high lap wa associated with a higher risk of t2dm odds ratio or 191 95 confidence interval ci 66555 for woman and or 74 95 ci 51108 for men conclusion lap wa strongly associated with t2dm it utility in predicting the development of t2dm need to be confirmed

processed_title: platelet glycoproteinib gpib may serve a a bridge between type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and atherosclerosis making it a potential target for antiplatelet agent in t2dm patient
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a persistent metabolic condition that contributes to the development of cardiovascular disease numerous study have provided evidence that individual with t2dm are at a greater risk of developing cardiovascular disease typically two to four time more likely than those without t2dm mainly due to an increased risk of atherosclerosis the rupture of an atherosclerotic plaque leading to pathological thrombosis is commonly recognized a a significant factor in advancing cardiovascular disease caused by td2m with platelet inducing the impact of plaque rupture in established atherosclerosis and predisposing to the primary expansion of atherosclerosis study suggest that individual with t2dm have platelet that display higher baseline activation and reactivity than those without the condition the expression enhancement of several platelet receptor is known to regulate platelet activation signaling including platelet glycoproteinib gpib furthermore the high expression of platelet gp1b ha been reported to increase the risk of platelet adhesion plateletleucocyte interaction and thromboinflammatory pathology however the study exploring the role of gp1b in promoting platelet activationinduced cardiovascular disease in t2dm patient is still limited therefore we summarize the important finding regarding pathophysiological continuity between t2dm platelet gpib and atherosclerosis and highlight the potential therapy targeting gpib a a novel antiplatelet agent for preventing further cardiovascular incident in td2m patient

processed_title: exploring dietinduced promoter hypomethylation and pdk4 overexpression implication for type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: background type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a metabolic disorder characterized by limited metabolic flexibility in the body such limitation implicates the pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase 4 pdk4 gene poor nutrition frequently observed among southeast asian usually involves excessive intake of carbohydrate and monosodium glutamate msg that have been frequently linked to an increased risk of t2dm method the 14week study aimed to assess the effect of highcarbohydrate hc highmsg hmsg and a combination of highcarbohydrate and highmsg hchmsg diet on the development of t2dm using male mouse to assess the effect the male mouse were divided into four group control c hc hmsg and hchmsg for 14 week result after 14 week both the hc and hchmsg group showed sign of t2dm 16883 3233 15642 3246 the blood sample from the hmsg hc and hchmsg group 5767 2882 4922 736 489 643 a well a skeletal muscle sample from the hmsg hc and hchmsg group 5778 854 4213 725 3757 1042 exhibited a gradual hypomethylation the hc group particularly displayed significant pdk4 gene expression in skeletal muscle a progressive overexpression of the pdk4 gene wa observed a well in the hmsg hchmsg and hc group 203 3097 321 294 586 254 conclusion these finding suggest that t2dm can be induced by highcarbohydrate and highmsg diet however the sole consumption of high msg did not lead to the development of t2dm further research should focus on conducting longterm study to fully comprehend the impact of a high msg diet on individual with preexisting t2dm

processed_title: practical consideration for the use of sglt2 inhibitor in the asiapacific countriesan expert consensus statement
processed_abstract: recent clinical study have demonstrated the effectiveness of sglt2 inhibitor in reducing the risk of cardiovascular and renal event in both patient with and without type 2 diabetes mellitus consequently many international guideline have begun advocating for the use of sglt2 inhibitor for the purpose of organ protection rather than a simply a glucoselowering agent however despite the consistent clinical benefit and available strong guideline recommendation the utilization of sglt2 inhibitor have been unexpectedly low in many country a trend which is much more noticeable in low resource setting unfamiliarity with the recent focus in their organ protective role and clinical indication concern with potential adverse effect of sglt2 inhibitor including acute kidney injury genitourinary infection euglycemic ketoacidosis and their safety profile in elderly population have been identified a deterring factor to their more widespread use this review serf a a practical guide to clinician managing patient who could benefit from sglt2 inhibitor treatment and instill greater confidence in the initiation of these drug with the aim of optimizing their utilization rate in highrisk population

processed_title: the genetic basis of highcarbohydrate and highmonosodium glutamate diet related to the increase of likelihood of type 2 diabetes mellitus a review
processed_abstract: diabetes is one of the most common metabolic disease aside from the genetic factor previous study stated that other factor such a environment lifestyle and paternalmaternal condition play critical role in diabetes through dna methylation in specific area of the genome one of diabetic case is caused by insulin resistance and changing the homeostasis of blood glucose control so glucose concentration stood beyond normal rate hyperglycemia high fat diet ha been frequently studied and linked to triggering diabetes however most asian consume rice or food with high carbohydrate and food with monosodium glutamate msg this habit could lead to pathophysiology of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2d previous study showed that highcarbohydrate or highmsg diet could change gene expression or modify protein activity in body metabolism this imbalanced metabolism can lead to pleiotropic effect of diabetes mellitus in this study the author have attempted to relate various change in gene expression or protein activity to the highcarbohydrate and highmsginduced diabetes the author have also tried to relate several gene that contribute to pathophysiology of t2d and proposed several idea of gene a marker and target for curing people with t2d these are done by investigating altered activity of various gene that cause or are caused by diabetes these gene are selected based on their role in pathophysiology of t2d

processed_title: helminth hygiene hypothesis and type 2 diabetes
processed_abstract: worldwide there is little overlap between the prevalence of soiltransmitted helminth and type 2 diabetes t2d helminthinduced type 2 immune response and immune regulatory network might modulate the obesityinduced activation of inflammatory pathway that are associated with the development of insulin resistance a strong predictor of the development of t2d however other factor such a helminthassociated change in adiposity and gut microbiome might also contribute to improved metabolic outcome in this review we summarize epidemiological evidence for the link between helminth and t2d and discus the potential mechanism based on finding from experimental study a well a the limited number of study in human

processed_title: factor associated with dietary behaviour among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus in rural indonesia
processed_abstract: background type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is one of the fastestgrowing disease and most serious major health problem worldwide few study have focused on the association of social support with diabetesrelated dietary behaviour objective to examine the relationship between social support and dietary behaviour among patient with diabetes in a rural area of indonesia methodology this wa a descriptive crosssectional study that included 120 physically healthy patient above 18 year old with t2dm for at least 6 month data analysis wa done using a stepwise regression model result the mean age wa 6197 year sd 785 range 5274 867 of the participant were female social support beta 0272 p 0001 diabetes medication beta 0169 p 0003 duration of diabetes beta 0118 p 00047 and presence of diabetes complication beta 0197 p 0008 were significant predictor of dietary behaviour and accounted for 342 of the variance conclusion social support diabetes medication presence of diabetes complication and duration of diabetes were associated with improved dietary behaviour therefore social support should be considered when designing dietary intervention for patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus

processed_title: effectiveness and safety of dlbs3233 in newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus a 12week clinical trial
processed_abstract: background dlbs3233 recognized a an agent enhancing insulin sensitivity ha exhibited promise a a therapeutic option for addressing type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm this study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of dlbs3233 a natural compound in individual newly diagnosed with t2dm method a 12week doubleblind randomized placebocontrolled clinical trial wa conducted with 104 eligible participant they were assigned to receive dlbs3233 or a placebo along with lifestyle modification various metabolic parameter including fasting and postmeal plasma glucose level at two hour fasting insulin level homair adiponectin level lipid profile superoxide dismutase sod activity glut4 concentration and body weight measurement were assessed at baseline week 6 and week 12 safety parameter assessment will include vital sign liver function renal function and adverse event result participant exhibited similar demographic characteristic in both group while no significant change were noted in fasting plasma glucose and most other parameter the dlbs3233 group significantly reduced 2hour postprandial glucose at week 12 p 0026 there were no substantial difference in a1c level fasting insulin insulin resistance adiponectin level or lipid profile between the two group at any point in time safety parameter including blood pressure liver enzyme heart rate gamma gt and serum creatinine remained comparable between the group conclusion dlbs3233 showed potential for improving postprandial glucose control in newly diagnosed t2dm individual although significant change were limited the study suggests that dlbs3233 could enhance glycemic regulation the safety evaluation indicated no adverse effect on vital parameter further research with larger sample and more prolonged duration is warranted to comprehensively explore dlbs3233s potential in t2dm management

processed_title: type 2 diabetes mellitus with early dry skin disorder a comparison study between primary and tertiary care in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm in indonesia ha continued to increase over the year management of t2dm is challenging across clinical setting including primary and tertiary care uncontrolled t2dm put patient at risk of the development of t2dm complication especially earlystage dry skin that is neglected by most of the patient this study aimed to investigate the comparison between the t2dm management profile and dry skin clinical profile of t2dm patient in primary care and tertiary care setting method the study wa conducted a a crosssectional epidemiological study by comparing t2dm patient profile in primary and tertiary care the data collected included sociodemographic clinical and laboratory data that were correlated with t2dm and early dry skin relatedt2dm this study included early dry skin within the srrc score of 311 and excluded infection ulcer and severe erythema result the patient in primary and tertiary care presented poorly controlled t2dm with median hba1c level of 78 and 76 the patient in primary care also presented with high triglyceride 179 mgdl furthermore several significant difference were found in the duration of t2dm duration of dry skin and dm treatment oad and insulin conclusion significant difference in the duration of t2dm duration of dry skin and dm treatment oad and insulin might be affected by the parameter of t2dm glycemic control blood pressure bp body mass index bmi hba1c random blood glucose rbg and triglyceride

processed_title: mediating pathway between attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and type 2 diabetes mellitus evidence from a twostep and multivariable mendelian randomization study
processed_abstract: aim type 2 diabetes t2d is a global health burden more prevalent among individual with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd compared to the general population to extend the knowledge base on how adhd link to t2d this study aimed to estimate causal effect of adhd on t2d and to explore mediating pathway method we applied a twostep twosample mendelian randomization mr design using single nucleotide polymorphism to genetically predict adhd and a range of potential mediator first a wide range of univariable mr method wa used to investigate association between genetically predicted adhd and t2d and between adhd and the purported mediator body mass index bmi childhood obesity childhood bmi sedentary behaviour daily hour of tv watching blood pressure systolic blood pressure diastolic blood pressure creactive protein and educational attainment ea a mixtureofexperts method wa then applied to select the mr method most likely to return a reliable estimate we used estimate derived from multivariable mr to estimate indirect effect of adhd on t2d through mediator result genetically predicted adhd liability associated with 10 higher odds of t2d or 110 95 ci 102 118 from nine purported mediator studied three showed significant individual mediation effect ea 3944 mediation 95 ci 2900 4973 bmi 4423 mediation 95 ci 3434 5203 and tv watching 4410 mediation 95 ci 3076 5780 the combination of bmi and ea explained the largest mediating effect 5331 95 ci 199 11038 of the adhdt2d association conclusion these finding suggest a potentially causal positive relationship between adhd liability and t2d with mediation through higher bmi more tv watching and lower ea intervention on these factor may thus have beneficial effect on t2d risk in individual with adhd

processed_title: the association between triglycerideglucose index and the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitusa systematic review and doseresponse metaanalysis of cohort study
processed_abstract: abstarct aim we aimed to assess the doseresponse relationship between triglycerideglucose tyg index and the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm method we performed a comprehensive systematic literature search using pubmed scopus and embase for record published from inception until 9 february 2021 the effect estimate were reported a relative risk rrs result 270229 subject from 14 study were included in this systematic review and metaanalysis the pooled incidence of t2dm wa 9 metaregression analysis indicates that baseline age coefficient 067 p 0026 drinking coefficient 003 p 0035 and hdl coefficient 089 p 0035 affected the incidence of t2dm in future high tyg index wa associated with increased incidence of t2dm in pooled unadjusted rr 468 301 729 p 0001 i2 966 and adjusted model adjusted rr 354 275 454 p 0001 i2 837 doseresponse metaanalysis for the adjusted rr showed that the linear association analysis wa not significant per 01 increase in tyg index rr 101 099 103 p 0223 there is a nonlinear trend p 0001 for the association between tyg index and incidence of t2dm the doseresponse curve became increasingly steeper at tyg index above 86 conclusion tyg index wa associated with the incidence of t2dm in a nonlinear fashion

processed_title: risk of cardiovascular complication among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient in medan indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background cardiovascular disease cvd is a disease associated with impaired heart and blood vessel function the occurrence of diabetes mellitus dm is due to an imbalance in blood glucose that could cause damage to large and small blood vessel and increase platelet aggregation contributing to atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease it could be attributed to high blood pressure smoking diabetes lack of movement obesity high cholesterol unbalanced diet cvd can be prevented especially in atrisk group with risk assessment utilizing the framingham risk score fr objective the study aimed to to analyze the risk of cvd according to the framingham risk score fr in type 2 dm patient in medan method the data were collected with the framingham risk score which consisted of subvariables of age total cholesterol hdl cholesterol systolic blood pressure sbm history of dm and history of smoking which were assessed by gender it wa a crosssectional analytic study with consecutive sampling on 252 respondent namely dm patient who came for treatment or control to the health center in medan and fulfilled the inclusion and exclusion criterion the data were then analyzed with spss result the respondent consisted of 197 woman 782 and 55 men 218 the result were predominated with high risk patient 139 552 followed by those with medium risk 80 317 and low risk 33 131 chisquare test yielded a significant association between each subvariable of cvd risk factor and the risk based on fr in type 2 dm patient conclusion each subvariable of cvd risk factor and the risk on fr among type 2 dm patient in future study it is recommended to include that a larger number of sample in the community with a balanced proportion of men and woman

processed_title: exploring the experience and need of patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus in sleman regency yogyakarta indonesia protocol for a qualitative study
processed_abstract: background type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a chronic disease that can cause adverse effect if not managed effectively the prevalence of t2dm will continue to rise every year and data from the international diabetes federation show that the number of patient diagnosed with t2dm in indonesia is predicted to increase from 103 million in 2017 to 167 million in 2045 managing t2dm properly is a challenge for the patient because they need to implement lifestyle change that involve the selfmonitoring of blood glucose consuming prescribed medication properly maintaining a healthy diet getting sufficient physical training keeping a healthy sleeping pattern managing stress properly and consulting medical professional regularly the worldwide intervention for t2dm focus on selfmanagement education the varied result in study about intervention show that no particular intervention method can be regarded a the most effective in indonesia there are limited study on educational intervention to improve the quality of life and health of patient with t2dm objective this study aim to explore the experience and need of patient with t2dm in sleman regency yogyakarta indonesia to develop effective selfmanagement education method the study will use the phenomenology method with purposive sampling to collect data the inclusion criterion are patient in the chronic disease selfmanagement program at the sleman regency public health center who are aged 18 year diagnosed with t2dm for more than a year with hemoglobin a1c level 75 and 75 capable of communicating verbally and literate in the indonesian language not deaf and willing to participate the data collection is based on the social cognitive theory which involves selecting assessment target and analyzing personal factor environment and behavior that determine the knowledge attitude and adherence of person with t2dm researcher will collect the data through indepth facetoface interview to learn about knowledge selfefficacy outcome expectancy outcome experience worry illness belief treatment belief diet physical activity medicine intake treatment pattern support system a well a ethnic and cultural influence the result will be taken from unstructured and openended question written in indonesian according to the interview guideline the data analysis process will go through several stage reading the data thoroughly coding sorting the category creating the theme making general description and presenting the data in chart narrative and recorded quotation from the interview result this study received a grant in may 2021 and gained permission from the medical and health research ethic committee of universitas gadjah mada indonesia on july 1 2021 data collection started on august 12 2021 and the result are expected to be published in 2022 conclusion the result of this study will be used to design an educational intervention model to improve the knowledge attitude and adherence of patient with t2dm international registered report identifier irrid derr110219637528

processed_title: glucodynamics and glucocracy in type 2 diabetes mellitus clinical evidence and practicebased opinion on modern sulfonylurea use from an international expert group south asia middle east africa via modified delphi method
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a global epidemic according to international guideline the management protocol of t2dm includes lowering of blood glucose along with preventing diseaserelated complication and maintaining optimal quality of life further the guideline recommend the use of a patientcentric approach for the management of t2dm however asian population is underrepresented in landmark cardiovascular outcome trial cvots there are several guideline available today for the diagnosis and management of t2dm and hence there is much confusion among practitioner about which guideline to follow a group of thirty international clinical expert comprising of endocrinologist diabetologists and cardiologist from south asia middle east and africa met at new delhi india on february 8 and 9 2020 and developed an international expert opinion statement via a structured modified delphi method on the glucodynamic property of oads and the glucocratic treatment approach for the management of t2dm in this modified delphi consensus report we document the glucodynamic property of modern sus in term of glucoconfidence glucosafety and gluconomics according to glucodynamics theory an ideal antidiabetic drug should be efficacious safe and affordable modern sus a a class of oads that have demonstrated optimal glucodynamics in term of glucoconfidence glucosafety and gluconomics hence modern sus are most suitable second line drug after metformin for developing country based on the current evidence we recommend a glucocratic approach for the treatment of t2dm where an individualized treatment plan with phenotype lifestyle environmental social and cultural factor should be considered for person with t2dm in the south asian middle eastern and african region

processed_title: use of sglt2 inhibitor in patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus and abdominal obesity an asian perspective and expert recommendation
processed_abstract: the prevalence of obesity in asia is of epidemic proportion with an estimated 1 billion overweightobese individual in the region the majority of patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm are overweightobese which increase the risk of cardiorenal outcome in these patient hence sustained reduction in body weight and visceral adiposity are important management goal however most of the glucoselowering therapy such a insulin sulfonylurea glinides and thiazolidinediones induce weight gain which make the management of overweightobese t2dm patient challenging sodiumglucose cotransporter2 sglt2 inhibitor are the only oral glucoselowering agent that have been shown to reduce body weight and visceral adiposity in addition sglt2 inhibitor therapy reduces ectopic fat deposition and improves adipose tissue function and weightrelated quality of life in this article we aim to consolidate the existing literature on the effect of sglt2 inhibitor in asian patient with t2dm and to produce clinical recommendation on their use in overweight or obese patient with t2dm recommendation from international and regional guideline a well a published data from clinical trial in asian population and cardiovascular outcome trial are reviewed based on the available data sglt2 inhibitor represent an evidencebased therapeutic option for the management of overweightobese patient with t2dm

processed_title: quality of life on type 2 diabetes patient in indonesia systematic review
processed_abstract: objective to review various quality of life questionnaire related to patient of type 2 diabetes mellitus method the systematic review comprised search on sage pubmed proquest ebsco and google scholar database for study using quality of life questionnaire related to patient of type 2 diabetes mellitus published between january 2012 and january 2022 in either english or bhasha language data extraction and assessment wa done in line with the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses checklist result of the 25 study reviewed 23922 were in the english language they were conducted in 17515 of the 33 province in indonesia the questionnaire used were 36item short form 832 euroqol 5dimension 5level scale 624 world health organisation quality of lifebrief version 624 diabetes quality of life 312 and diabetes quality of life clinical trial questionnaire 28 variable associated with the quality of life of the diabetic included education gender and age the internal factor included glycaemic control psychological condition selfefficacy perception of illness selfcare management medication adherence neutrophillymphocyte ratio and complication the external factor included family support medication counselling and pharmacist intervention conclusion many instrument measure quality of life related to patient of diabetes mellitus country with different sociocultural form have different quality of life perspective and the assessment tool should be picked accordingly

processed_title: use of sodiumglucose cotransporter2 inhibitor in patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus and multiple cardiovascular risk factor an asian perspective and expert recommendation
processed_abstract: diabetes mellitus in asia account for more than half of the global prevalence there is a high prevalence of cardiovascular disease cvd in the region among people with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and it is often associated with multiple risk factor including hypertension renal disease and obesity the early onset of t2dm and the eventual long disease duration portends an increasing proportion of the population to premature cvd in addition to lowering blood glucose sodiumglucose cotransporter2 sglt2 inhibitor exert favourable effect on multiple risk factor including blood pressure body weight and renal function and provide an opportunity to reduce the risk of cvd in patient with t2dm in this article we consolidated the existing literature on sglt2 inhibitor use in asian patient with t2dm and established contemporary guidance for clinician we extensively reviewed recommendation from international and regional guideline published data from clinical trial in the asian population dapagliflozin canagliflozin empagliflozin ipragliflozin luseogliflozin and tofogliflozin cvd outcome trial emparegoutcome canvas and declaretimi 58 and realworld evidence study cvdreal easel cvdreal 2 and observe4d a series of clinical recommendation on the use of sglt2 inhibitor in asian patient with t2dm wa deliberated among expert with multiple round of review and voting based on the available evidence we conclude that sglt2 inhibitor represent an evidencebased therapeutic option for the primary prevention of heart failure hospitalization and secondary prevention of cvd in patient with t2dm and should be considered early on in the treatment algorithm for patient with multiple risk factor or those with established cvd

processed_title: the difference in healthrelated quality of life between younger and older adult and it associated factor in patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus in indonesia
processed_abstract: background it is well known that diabetes mellitus dm affect healthrelated quality of life hrqol in both younger aged 1864 year and older adult aged 65 year however to date no study ha compared hrqol and it predictor between younger and older adult with dm in indonesia such a comparison is important because the result can guide nurse and clinician to establish evidencebased educational program that are specific and suitable for patient therefore the aim of this study wa to investigate the difference in hrqol and it predictor in younger and older adult with dm in
