indonesia method a crosssectional study wa conducted on 641 patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm who were recruited via simple random sampling from 16 primary health center in banyumas regency indonesia a selfadministered questionnaire containing the summary of diabetes selfcare activity the dds17 bahasa indonesia the beck depression inventory ii the selfefficacy for diabetes scale the family apgar and the 36item shortform health survey wa used to measure diabetes selfmanagement dsm diabetes distress dd depression selfefficacy family support and hrqol respectively independent ttests were used to compare the physical component summary pc and mental component summary mc score between younger and older adult with t2dm hierarchical multiple regression analysis were used to examine the factor associated with hrqol in both group result pc score were significantly different between the two group older adult reported lower pc score than younger adult no difference between the two group were observed in the mc score the hierarchical multiple regression analysis showed that level of education employment status number of diabetesrelated complication dsm dd depression and selfefficacy were significant predictor of hrqol in younger adult while income depression dd and selfefficacy were significant predictor of hrqol in older adult dd wa the strongest predictor of hrqol in younger adult and depression wa the strongest predictor in older adult conclusion older adult patient had lower pc score than younger adult patient this study is the first to show that the predictor of hrqol differ between younger and older adult with t2dm it provides insight for nurse and clinician in indonesia to establish evidencebased agespecific educational program

processed_title: low muscle mass and inflammation among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction chronic inflammation a observed in type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is associated with complication how chronic inflammation influence body composition in patient with t2dm remains to be investigated our study aimed to evaluate the difference of skeletal muscle mass between patient with and without inflammation indicated by plasma high sensitivity creactive protein hscrp method patient with t2dm were recruited from primary health care in sleman district indonesia measurement were performed to obtain information on body weight body mass index waist circumference waisttoheight ratio total body fat subcutaneous fat visceral fat midupper arm circumference and muscle mass spearmans rank correlation wa performed to test the correlation between hscrp level and several component of body composition to test the difference of percent skeletal muscle mass between subject with and without inflammation hscrp 3 or 3 mgdl general linear model wa utilized with adjustment for several variable analysis with p value of less than 005 is considered statistically significant result in all subject hscrp is correlated with skeletal muscle mass r 0343 p 004 total body fat r 0353 p 004 and subcutaneous fat r 0369 p 002 but not visceral fat p 0065 p n significant difference of skeletal muscle mass between subject with and without inflammation wa found in all and female subject after adjustment for covariates conclusion there wa a negative correlation between skeletal muscle mass percentage and inflammation indicated by hscrp in type 2 diabetes patient

processed_title: efficacy and safety of bromocriptineqr a an adjunctive therapy on glycemic control in subject with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: introduction there ha been an increasing awareness of the effect of combining bromocriptineqr with other medication for diabetes mellitus type 2 this study aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of bromocriptineqr a an adjunctive therapy for patient with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus methodology this systematic review is registered at the international prospective register of systematic review crd42022360326 literature search wa done via medline ncbi google scholar science direct europe pmc and cochrane library database we included randomized controlled trial with participant 18 year old and above with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus the primary outcome of interest is the efficacy and safety of bromocriptineqr a an adjunctive therapy for glycemic control case report case series review and animal study were excluded the risk of bias wa reviewed using the cochrane risk of bias tool metaanalysis wa performed using review manager 54 and presented a a weighted mean difference and 95 confidence interval for change from the baseline level result nine study were included in the systematic review with a total of 2709 participant the baseline hba1c in the bromocriptineqr group wa 742 and 751 in the control group the bromocriptineqr group wa favoured outperforming the control group in term of reducing hemoglobin a1chba1c with a statistically significant difference weighted mean difference 06 95 ci 083036 p000001 the most common side effect were nausea 3375 v 692 fatigue 1311 v 594 and headache 1117 v 687 conclusion administration of bromocriptineqr at a dose range of 16 to 48 mgday a an adjunctive therapy reduced hba1c and fbg in patient with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm however there were also statistically greater odds of the occurrence of adverse event such a nausea vomiting and headache compared to control

processed_title: integrated diabetes selfmanagement idsm mobile application to improve selfmanagement and glycemic control among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm in indonesia a mixed method study protocol
processed_abstract: the number of patient with diabetes in indonesia reach 1947 million in 2021 mostly is caused by the adoption of sedentary and unhealthy lifestyle continuous selfmanagement is important in diabetes care it requires optimal coordination and communication between patient family and health care provider the use of communication technology could be solution to the problem this study aim to initiate an androidbased mobile apps technology a a tool for patient family and healthcare provider to optimize patient with t2dm treatment this study will be conducted in public health center phcs in yogyakarta using an exploratory sequential mixedmethods design which is divided into three phase the first phase will use qualitative descriptive method patient with t2dm family nurse physician and health social security agency officer in indonesia will be involved in a focus group discussion fgd and indepth interview to understand their need in optimizing the treatment the second phase will be the development of an androidbased application on the first phase result the apps will be usability tested by involving expert heuristic evaluation and user think aloud method to ensure that the apps really meet targeted user need in the third phase we will collect feedback from user after using this apps for three month the effectiveness of the apps will be measured by selfmanagement improvement and glycemic control of patient with t2dm the nonequivalent control group design will be applied using a prerepeated posttest control group the result of this study will be an androidbased application which will be called integrated diabetes selfmanagement idsm app to optimize the implementation of diabetes selfmanagement which can improve glycemic control of patient with t2dm a one of the indicator of the indonesian chronic disease management program at phcs

processed_title: indonesia diaramadan study a reallife prospective and observational of gliclazide mr in type2 diabetes patient during ramadan fasting
processed_abstract: background sulfonylurea sus have been widely used in many country for t2dm treatment gliclazide is one of the sus with the lowest risk of hypoglycemia however the safety and effectiveness of gliclazide mr during ramadan ha not yet been reported in indonesia this study aimed to assess safety efficacy and tolerability of gliclazide modified release mr during ramadan fasting method the study wa a part of diaramadan study a prospective observational study with subject of t2dm patient aged 18 year who had either controlled or suboptimally controlled blood glucose level performed ramadan fasting subject had been treated with gliclazide mr for at least 90 day prior the study and were examined for their body mass index bmi fasting plasma glucose fpg and hba1c level 6 to 8 week before ramadan v0 and 4 to 6 week after the end of ramadan v1 result out of 198 subject participating in the study there were only two subject 10 who reported symptomatic he either confirmed or not confirmed and no severe he had been reported there were no significant change in hba1c and fpg level p005 interestingly there wa a reduction of bodyweight 04kg from pre to postramadan p 0001 almost no subject reported discontinuation of gliclazide mr throughout the entire study however there wa one subject who reported a change of diabetic treatment into diet only conclusion gliclazide mr is safe well tolerated and can maintain glycemic control effectively for indonesian patient with t2dm who perform ramadan fasting

processed_title: prevalence and correlate of diabetes distress and depressive symptom among individual with type2 diabetes mellitus during ramadan fasting a crosssectional study in bangladesh amid the covid19
processed_abstract: aim psychological concern relating to diabetes distress dd and depressive symptom d in individual with type2 diabetes mellitus t2dm may negatively impact adherence to medical treatment and overall mental health thus this study wa undertaken to investigate d and dd in relation to fasting during the month of ramadan method a crosssectional survey wa conducted among 735 patient with t2dm in 2021 dd and d were measured by the problem area in diabetes scale and patient health questionnaire9 respectively logistic regression and correlation analysis were executed result more than onethird of the participant 412 had dd and d 369 d wa significantly higher in participant who did not fast p 0027 participant who had higher dietary diversity were less likely to have dd p 0004 and d p 0001 female aor 189 95 ci 125285 and those who lived alone aor 189 95 ci 125285 were more likely to have d participant with diabetesrelated complication were more likely to experience d aor 217 95 ci 15313 and dd aor 346 95 ci 242495 dd wa also associated with being younger p 0003 having hypertension p 0030 having heart disease p 0012 and taking insulin p 0010 conclusion individual with t2dm who were not fasting experienced more mental health concern psychosocial support and other intervention from health professional should be examined and empirical intervention should be implemented to promote the mental health and wellbeing of individual with t2dm

processed_title: the association between drugrelated problem and length of stay of type 2 diabetes mellitus patient
processed_abstract: introduction drugrelated problem drps are treatmentrelated occurrence that affect therapeutic efficacy in a previous study approximately 279 out of 330 845 patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm had experienced at least one drp including nonoptimal drug effect n 240 527 and indication without medication n 137 301 patient who were hospitalised for 510 day had the highest number of drps therefore this study investigates the association between drps and length of stay los in patient with t2dm method a crosssectional study wa conducted from january 2020 to may 2023 at rumah sakit akademik universitas gadjah mada yogyakarta indonesia clinical pharmacist reviewed electronic health data to examine drps the fisher exact test evaluated the association between drps and los result a total of 607 n 17 of the participant were female with the majority falling into the age group 65 year old n 11 297 a significant portion experienced los 7 day n 17 607 antidiabetic monotherapy wa predominant and the category of drps included adverse drug reaction n 15 405 dosage too high n 6 162 wrong drug n 6 162 nonadherence n 4 108 need for additional therapy n 4 108 and dosage too low n 2 54 a significant association wa observed between nonadherence and los p 0016 the possibility of experiencing los of 17 day increased by 343 time with improved nonadherence or 343 95 ci 183 639 in this context nonadherence refers to drps associated with the noncompliance of patient with the prescribed treatment plan conclusion this study concludes that nonadherence wa significantly associated with hospital los

processed_title: synergistic interaction of insufficient physical activity and a high systemic immuneinflammation index on psychological problem in indonesian with type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: background highgrade inflammation represents a critical contribution to the onset of depression and might be manageable by physical activity pa nevertheless no study ha examined synergistic interaction of insufficient pa and high value of the systemic immuneinflammation index sii on psychological problem objective we investigated independent and synergistic interaction of insufficient pa and high sii level on stress anxiety and depression in t2dm patient method a crosssectional research design with 294 t2dm patient wa conducted an xp100 automated hematology analyzer wa used to evaluate inflammatory biomarkers depression anxiety and stress scale21 item and a standardized questionnaire about pa were respectively used to measure psychological problem and metabolic equivalent of task methweek result a multiple linear regression demonstrated that patient with insufficient pa were significantly more likely to have higher stress beta 184 95 confidence interval ci 103265 anxiety beta 188 95 ci 181296 and depression beta 253 95 ci 082424 than those with active pa a high sii level wa a key predictor and wa most strongly associated with stress beta 261 95 ci 202320 anxiety beta 316 95 ci 237394 and depression beta 372 95 ci 249496 compared to those who had low sii level notably additive interaction result showed that combining insufficient pa and a high sii level had a significantly escalated 171fold risk of stress 182fold risk of anxiety and 269fold risk of depression conclusion active pa and a low sii had a positive synergistic effect of decreasing psychological problem

processed_title: attitude towards deprescribing and patientrelated factor associated with willingness to stop medication among older patient with type 2 diabetes t2d in indonesia a crosssectional survey study
processed_abstract: background deprescribing of preventive medication is recommended in older patient with polypharmacy including people with type 2 diabetes t2d it seems that many patient in lowmiddleincome country are not willing to have their medicine deprescribed this study aim to assess attitude of indonesian patient with t2d towards deprescribing in general and regarding specific cardiometabolic medicine and factor influencing their willingness to stop medicine method primary care patient with t2d of 60 year in indonesia completed the revised patient attitude towards deprescribing rpatd questionnaire attitude in general and for cardiometabolic medicine were reported descriptively proportion of patient willing to stop one or more medicine when recommended by different healthcare professional were compared with chisquare test multiple regression analysis wa used to analyse the influence between patientrelated factor and the willingness to stop medicine result the survey wa completed by 196 participant median age 69 year 73 female the percentage willing to stop medicine were 69 67 and 41 when the general practitioner gp the specialist or the pharmacist initiate the process pvalue 0001 higher perceived burden of medicine pvalue 003 and less concern about stopping pvalue 0001 were associated with a higher willingness to stop medicine if proposed by the gp patient using multiple glucoseregulating medicine were less willing to stop pvalue 002 using complementary or alternative medicine wa not associated with the willingness to stop if proposed by their pharmacist patient without substantial education were more willing to stop than educated patient conclusion only twothirds of older people with t2d in indonesia were willing to stop one or more of their medicine if the gp or specialist recommended this and even less when the pharmacist proposed this attention should be given to concern about stopping specific medicine especially among patient using multiple glucoselowering medicine who may be more eligible but were less willing to accept deprescribing

processed_title: expert opinion on diabetes management challenge and role of basal insulinglp1 ra fixedratio combination in people with type 2 diabetes from indonesia
processed_abstract: indonesia is struggling with a rapidly growing burden of diabetes due to rapid socioeconomic transition people with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm need appropriate treatment strategy to maintain glycemic control new modality with simplicity such a fixedratio combination of basal insulin and glucagonlike peptide1 receptor agonist glp1 ra further referred to a frc have proven to be an effective and practical therapeutic approach that may address this issue in january 2021 a scientific expert meeting wa held with the participation of endocrinologist from indonesia to provide expert opinion regarding the optimal practical use of the frc basal insulinglp1ra topic discussed in the meeting included the challenge in diabetes management clinical inertia with insulin therapy local and international guideline positioning initiation titration and switching of basal insulin and glp1 ra including frc and the management of t2dm

processed_title: physical activity and it synergistic interaction with low plateletlymphocyte ratio level increasing the sleep quality in type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: purpose the purpose of the study wa to explore the effect of synergistic interaction and the independence of physical activity and inflammatory marker including plateletlymphocyte ratio plr and neutrophiltolymphocyte ratio nlr on sleep quality in person with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm method this descriptive crosssectional study included 294 person with t2dm in east java indonesia fasting blood wa analyzed for inflammation marker including nlr and plr physical activity and sleep quality were assessed using metabolic equivalent of task and pittsburgh sleep quality index respectively multivariate logistic regression chisquare test and independent t test were performed result there wa an independently significant relationship between physical activity nlr and plr with sleep quality person with both active physical activity and low plrs were 1252 time more likely to have high sleep quality score than those with low physical activity and high plrs a positive additive interaction of active physical activity and low plrs for high sleep quality score wa identified conclusion physical activity nlr and plr revealed an independently significant relationship with sleep quality person with both active physical activity level and low plr were the most substantial synergistic effect of high sleep quality further study are necessary to examine the problem and solution for sleep quality in this population

processed_title: effect of moderate intensity continuous training and slow type interval training to gene expression of tgfbeta in type 2 diabetes mellitus model wistar rat
processed_abstract: background physical exercise is a process of increasing contraction of skeletal muscle involving several organ system to increase energy formation and it is one of the pillar for the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus tdm2 t2dm affect the expression of the tgfbeta gene objective this study aim to determine the effect of moderate intensity continuous training and slow interval training in expression of tgfbeta gene in wistar rat t2dm model method a moderate intensity continuous training physical activity given to the diabetic rat group in the form of running on a treadmill with a running speed of 20 mmin for 30 minute while the slow type interval training physical activity given to the diabetic rat group wa in the form of running on a treadmill with a running speed of 20 mminute for 10 repetition session with a duration of 2 minute per session with interspersed active break for 1 minute tgfbeta gene expression wa measured using realtime method result the result in the continuous group tgfbeta significant decreased p 005 in the interval group tgf beta insignificant decreased p 005 moderate intensity continuous training wa insignificantly better at decreasing the expression of the tgfbeta gene conclusion this research concluded that there is an effect of moderate intensity continuous training and slow interval training on the expression of tgfbeta gene in wistar rat t2dm

processed_title: costeffectiveness analysis of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm treatment in patient with complication of kidney and peripheral vascular disease in indonesia
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a chronic disease with highcost treatment this study aimed to analyze the costeffectiveness of t2dm treatment in hospitalized patient with complication of kidney and peripheral vascular disease pvd in indonesia by focusing on patient of health social security agency bpjs kesehatan an observational study wa applied by collecting data retrospectively from patient medical record at the biggest public hospital in west java province indonesia two perspective of payer and healthcare provider were applied to estimate the treatment cost we considered following inclusion criterion i hospitalized t2dm patient without complication with complication of kidney and pvd during 20142017 ii member of bpjs kesehatan iii 18 year old patient and iv patient with complete medical record data the result showed that the majority patient were female 5672 4564 year old 6940 and had a length of stay at 410 day 5448 the greatest contribution in the total treatment cost were found to be hospital room medical service and medicine for the treatment of t2dm without complication with complication of kidney and pvd respectively from the perspective of payer the incremental costeffectiveness ratio icers of t2dm treatment with complication of kidney and pvd would be idr 215723 and idr 234591 per 1 mgdl blood glucose reduction respectively from the perspective of healthcare provider the icers of t2dm treatment with complication of kidney and pvd would be idr 166289 and idr 681853 per 1 mgdl blood glucose reduction in both perspective 1 u idr 13451 in a comparison with t2dm without complication reducing 1 mgdl blood glucose in t2dm treatment with complication of pvd would require higher cost than in t2dm treatment with complication of kidney from both perspective

processed_title: prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension in patient visiting the conservative dentistry and endodontics department a crosssectional study in surabaya city
processed_abstract: background this descriptive crosssectional study focus on the prevalence of hypertension htn and type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm amongst patient who visited the conservative dentistry and endodontics department recognizing these incidence statistic is critical for improving endodontic therapy delivery and assuring highquality dental care with positive treatment outcome method in advance of getting dental care all patient visiting the department were advised to get their blood sugar and blood pressure level checked at random measurement were taken with digital equipment and individual with high level were encouraged to seek medical advice before undergoing dental procedure the obtained data wa imported into excel and analyzed with ibm spss software version 21 result the investigation had 1100 participant 558 female and 442 male with an average age of 4458 1277 year of the individual 406 were referred for type 2 diabetes 126 for hypertension and 240 for both disease there wa a significant correlation p 005 between referral status and gender the average blood pressure and random blood sugar reading were 14102 mmhg 5628 mmhg systolic 7983 mmhg 1068 mmhg diastolic and 12668 mgdl 1536 mgdl respectively there wa a substantial p 005 difference in mean systolic blood pressure between men and woman furthermore age wa strongly connected with random blood sugar level p 005 and systolic and diastolic blood pressure p 005 there were significant p 005 variation in mean blood pressure and blood sugar level between referred and nonreferred individual conclusion age had a relationship with higher random blood sugar level systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure dentist should consider patient age while planning treatment a type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension require unique technique to emphasize patient safety and produce excellent outcome

processed_title: effect of pharmacist intervention on medication adherence and clinical outcome of type 2 diabetes mellitus outpatient in primary healthcare in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective in indonesia the role of pharmacist in primary healthcare is still very limited or even absent this study evaluates the effectiveness of program delivered for type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm patient by pharmacist in primary healthcare through counseling short message service sm reminder and medication booklet method a quasiexperimental study with a pretestposttest design wa conducted from april to august 2018 at merdeka and dempo primary healthcare center palembang south sumatra province indonesia counseling and medication booklet were distributed three time during the study period while sm reminder were sent once a week counseling wa given for the management of diabetes mellitus dm including during the ramadan fasting period together with management for acute and chronic complication the medication adherence level wa measured using a medication adherence questionnaire maq and pill count adherence pca the study sample comprised 80 t2dm patient who were allocated into either the control group cg n 40 or intervention group ig n 40 clinical outcome were determined by measuring glycated hemoglobin hba1c blood pressure and lipid profile finding after the intervention the ig showed significant improvement in most parameter except for highdensity lipoprotein cholesterol and systolic and diastolic blood pressure hba1c level were reduced while maq score and pca score were improved lipid parameter were significantly reduced total cholesterol tc lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol ldlc and triglyceride tg compared with the cg most parameter were significantly improved in the ig pharmacist counseling significantly improved almost all clinical parameter hba1c tc ldlc and tg pharmacist counseling wa 71 time greater in lowering hba1c compared with no counseling after adjusted by other variable the variable that most influenced the lowering of hba1c wa infrequent not often consumption of unhealthy food or 149 95 ci 35637 conclusion the pharmacist primary healthcare intervention program implemented in this study significantly improved hba1c tc ldlc tg and medication adherence in outpatient with t2dm

processed_title: computational study of asian propolis compound a potential antitype 2 diabetes mellitus agent by using inverse virtual screening with the diadb web server tanimoto similarity analysis and molecular dynamic simulation
processed_abstract: propolis contains a wide range of pharmacological activity because of their various bioactive compound the beneficial effect of propolis is interesting for treating type2 diabetes mellitus t2dm owing to dysregulation of multiple metabolic process in this study 275 of 658 asian propolis compound were evaluated a potential antit2dm agent using the diadb web server towards 18 known antidiabetes protein target more than 20 of all compound could bind to more than five diabetes target with high binding affinity 90 kcalmol filtering with physicochemical and pharmacokinetic property including admet parameter 12 compound were identified a potential antit2dm with favorable admet property six of those compound 2r74dihydroxy5methoxy8methylflavone rr3senecioylkhellactone 246trihydroxy chalcone alpinetin pinobanksin3obutyrate and pinocembrin5methyl ether were first reported a antit2dm agent we identified the significant t2dm target of asian propolis namely retinolbinding protein4 rbp4 and aldose reductase akr1b1 that have important role in insulin sensitivity and diabetes complication respectively molecular dynamic simulation showed stable interaction of selected propolis compound in the active site of rbp4 and akr1b1 these finding suggest that asian propolis compound may be effective for treatment of t2dm by targeting rbp4 and akr1b1

processed_title: advance in delivery method of arthrospira platensis spirulina for enhanced therapeutic outcome
processed_abstract: arthrospira platensis a platensis aqueous extract ha massive amount of natural product that can be used a future drug such a cphycocyanin allophycocyanin etc this extract wa chosen because of it high adaptability which reflects it resolute genetic composition the proactive role of cyanobacteria particularly in the medical field have been discussed in this review including the history previous food and drug administration fda report health benefit and the various dosedependent therapeutic function that a platensis possesses including it role in fighting against lethal disease such a cancer sarscov2covid19 etc however the remedy will not present it maximal effect without the proper delivery to the targeted place for deposition the goal of this research is to maximize the bioavailability and delivery efficiency of a platensis constituent through selected site for effective therapeutic outcome the solution reviewed are mainly on parenteral and tablet formulation moreover suggested enteric polymer were discussed with minor composition variation applied for better storage in high humid country alongside minor variation in the polymer design were processed_title: acute effect of breakfast fruit meal sequence and postprandial exercise on the blood glucose level and dpp4 activity among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient a pilot study
processed_abstract: objective type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is a major global public health issue diet and physical exercise are modifiable factor that influence the glycaemic status of patient with t2dm we aimed to investigate the acute effect of breakfast fruit meal sequence and postprandial exercise on the blood glucose level and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 dpp4 activity among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient method a randomized pilot study recruited patient with t2dm who attended two primary health care centre in tasikmadu district karanganyar regency and kartasura district sukoharjo regency central java indonesia from july to october 2016 eligible patient 4 men and 32 woman were randomly divided into four treatment group venous blood sample were analyzed for fasting and onehour postprandial blood glucose fbg and 1 h ppg level and dpp4 activity blood glucose level were measured using a routine hexokinase method and serum dpp4 activity wa determined spectrophotometrically after incubation with the glypropnitroanilide substrate result fruit last meal decreased fbg level whilst fruit first meal did not significantly decrease 1 h ppg level both treatment had no acute effect on dpp4 activity but the addition of postprandial exercise helped lower dpp4 activity fruit last and first meal showed significant opposite effect on mean change of fbg level p 005 conclusion this preliminary report of fruit meal sequence is potentially involved in acute regulation of blood glucose level and that it might be independent of dpp4 activity in indonesian patient with t2dm moreover postprandial exercise may be an important intervention for t2dm through the mediation of dpp4 but ha no acute effect on the regulation of blood glucose level further study are required to investigate whether or not different type of fruit and longer treatment interval can affect blood glucose level and dpp4 activity differently this study also give an insight into the feasibility of conducting food order modification with or without the combination of postprandial exercise in a primary health setting for our next study

processed_title: the knowledge attitude practice and predictor of complementary and alternative medicine use among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the prevalence of complementary and alternative medicine cam usage among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm in indonesia is high however to date little is known about why indonesian t2dm patient choose cam therapy how their knowledge attitude and practice kap of cam affect their choice or how demographic correlate with patient choice therefore this study aimed to investigate the kap and predictor of cam usage in t2dm patient in indonesia method this wa an observational crosssectional study patient were interviewed using a questionnaire chisquare test or fisher exact test were used to compare demographic and clinical data a well a kap assessment between t2dm patient who use and do not use cam multivariate logistic regression analysis were used to investigate predictor of cam usage result a total of 628 t2dm patient were enrolled in the study cam therapy were used by 341 patient 543 the most common therapy were herb and spiritual healing used by 1000 and 683 of camusing patient respectively cam therapy were frequently recommended by family member 915 and cam user had significantly more knowledge and more positive attitude toward cam therapy than nonusers among user 66 said they would not follow their healthcare provider instruction to not use cam therapy and 695 said they would not disclose their plan to use cam therapy with their healthcare provider neither demographic nor clinical characteristic were associated with cam use the factor that best predicted the use of cam therapy were their availability and low cost odds ratio or 459 95 confidence interval ci 301701 the belief that cam therapy were safe or 204 95 ci 140295 the belief that cam therapy could help with diabetes control or 175 95 ci 115266 and the belief that cam therapy could help maintain physical health or 168 95 ci 113249 conclusion cam therapy user were more knowledgeable and had more positive attitude toward cam but most of them chose not to disclose their cam use to their healthcare provider cam use in indonesia wa associated with it accessibility affordability safety and effectivity but not with any demographic or clinical characteristic this study provided new evidence and insight for nurse and physician in indonesia that will help to design educational program about the safety and efficacy of cam therapy

processed_title: genomics proteomics and metabolomics approach for predicting diabetic nephropathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus patient
processed_abstract: background there is a continuous rise in the prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm worldwide and most patient are unaware of the presence of this chronic disease at the early stage t2dm is associated with complication related to longterm damage and failure of multiple organ system caused by vascular change associated with glycated end product oxidative stress mild inflammation and neovascularization among the most frequent complication of t2dm observed in about 2040 of t2dm patient is diabetes nephropathy dn method a literature search wa made in view of highlighting the novel application of genomics proteomics and metabolomics a the new prospective strategy for predicting dn in t2dm patient result the complexity of dn requires a comprehensive and unbiased approach to investigate the main cause of disease and identify the most important mechanism underlying it development with the help of evolving throughput technology rapidly evolving information can now be applied to clinical practice discussion dn is also the leading cause of endstage renal disease and comorbidity independent of t2dm in term of the comorbidity level dn ha many phenotype therefore timely diagnosis is required to prevent these complication currently urine albumintocreatinine ratio and estimated glomerular filtration rate egfr are gold standard for assessing glomerular damage and change in renal function however gfr estimation based on creatinine is limited to hyperfiltration status therefore this make albuminuria and egfr indicator less reliable for earlystage diagnosis of dn conclusion the combination of genomics proteomics and metabolomics assay a suitable biological system can provide new and deeper insight into the pathogenesis of diabetes a well a discover prospect for developing suitable and targeted intervention

processed_title: carotid intimamedia thickness among normoglycemia and normotension firstdegree relative of type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: introduction theoretically firstdegree relative fdr of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm are predisposed to have earlier and more severe atherosclerosis than nonfdr due to hereditary insulin resistance a previous study reported that atherosclerotic plaque were found in 452 of young adult fdr of t2dm but the study did not include nonfdr a control group the aim of this study wa to compare subclinical atherosclerosis carotid intimamedia thickness cimt between fdr of t2dm and nonfdr method this wa a crosssectional study involving 16 fdr subject and 16 agesex matched nonfdr subject aged 1940 year with normal glucose tolerance and no hypertension collected data included demographic characteristic anthropometric measurement bmi and waist circumference laboratory analysis fasting blood glucose hba1c lipid profile and cimt examination using bmode ultrasound result the mean of cimt in the fdr group wa higher than that in the nonfdr group 044 mm v 038 mm p0005 after adjusting for waist circumference bmi lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol and triglyceride cimt maintained significant difference between fdr and nonfdr subject bmi and waist circumference showed moderate correlation with cimt conclusion cimt in young adult fdr of t2dm is thicker than that in ageand sexmatched nonfdr population

processed_title: different dos of imeglimin for management of type 2 diabetes mellitus a systematic review metaanalysis and metaregression of randomized clinical trial
processed_abstract: background a new medication for type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm called imeglimin can target all three organ involved in the pathogenesis of dm namely the liver skeletal muscle and pancreas this research seek to examine the most efficacious and safe dose of imeglimin for the management of t2dm research design and method using particular keywords we searched the central medline scopus and clinicaltrialsgov database for pertinent literature the result of continuous variable were pooled into the mean difference md and dichotomous variable into odds ratio or along with their 95 confidence interval 95 ci using fixedeffect model result our pooled analysis revealed that imeglimin 1000 mg twice daily md 090 p 000001 and 1500 mg twice daily md 084 p 00003 a monotherapy wa associated with a higher reduction in the hba1c compared to placebo this superiority wa still maintained when given a combination therapy regrettably there wa an observed escalation in gastrointestinal aes a the dosage of imeglimin wa raised despite the absence of a corresponding improvement in it efficacy in decreasing hba1c level conclusion our study suggests that imeglimin 1000 mg twice daily may offer the most optimum therapeutic effect for glycemic control without compromising it safety profile

processed_title: association between depression and hba1c level in the elderly population with type 2 diabetes mellitus during covid19 pandemic
processed_abstract: diabetes mellitus is a chronic progressive disease affecting the metabolic hormonal system and it prevalence in the elderly population is high depression is one of the psychiatric disorder in diabetic patient in particular during the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic people with depression are more susceptible to leading an unhealthy lifestyle therefore depression and diabetes have a negative influence on life quality and aggravate complication and symptom the aim of this study wa to determine the association between depression and hemoglobin a1c hba1c level in elderly with type 2 diabetes mellitus patient a crosssectional study wa conducted where a total of 42 diabetic patient from the puskesmas belakang padang batam of indonesia wa recruited the hba1c level the main determinant of optimum glycemic control wa measured using ionexchange highperformance liquid chromatography while the level of depression wa assessed using geriatric depression scale15 gds15 the association between depression and hba1c level wa analyzed using the chisquared test our study found that that 69 of the elderly with diabetes experienced a depression classified a mild 405 moderate 214 and severe 71 there were 619 of the subject had poor hba1c control our data suggested that the depression level wa associated with hba1c p 0002 in conclusion there is a significant association between depression and hba1c level in the elderly with type 2 diabetes mellitus

processed_title: the association between fibroblast growth factor 21 with diabetes retinopathy among type 2 diabetes mellitus patient a systematic review metaanalysis and metaregression
processed_abstract: background diabetic retinopathy dr a leading cause of vision loss worldwide is a common complication of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm driven by chronic hyperglycemia and microvascular damage fibroblast growth factor 21 fgf21 is crucial in blood sugar regulation and ha been linked to dr incidence and severity while some study suggest that fgf21 level may contribute to the dr incidence others propose a protective role this discrepancy necessitates further analysis prompting this study to evaluate the association between fgf21 level and dr incidence and severity in t2dm patient method a systematic search wa conducted through medline web of science scopus and embase up to may 2024 for study evaluating the association between fgf21 and dr incidence and severity a randomeffect model metaanalysis wa performed to calculate the pooled standardized mean difference smd and 95 confidence interval ci a univariate metaregression wa performed to analyze factor influencing pooled size estimate all statistical analysis were performed using stata 17 software result this systematic review and metaanalysis of 5852 participant revealed that fgf21 wa positively correlated with dr smd 311 95 ci 092530 p 0005 and sightthreatening dr stdr incidence smd 361 95 ci 082641 p 001 there wa no significant difference in fgf21 level in dr v stdr p 079 subgroup analysis revealed a significant difference in dr incidence between ldl group with higher dr incidence in the group with lowdensity lipoprotein ldl level 100 p 000001 metaregression revealed no variable significantly influenced the pooled size estimate conclusion a higher level of fgf21 wa associated with higher dr and stdr incidence among t2dm patient highlighting it potential utilization a a biomarker for dr detection and enabling the exploration of fgf21based treatment strategy however variable independently predicting dr among patient with elevated fgf21 level shall be explored further prospero id crd42024559142

processed_title: prevalence of the effect of anxiety and depression on people with type 2 diabetes mellitus an analysis of health policy study in improving the quality of life of poor family in the urban area of west lombok indonesia
processed_abstract: background to explore the tendency of the effect of anxiety and depression that occur in type 2 diabetes patient especially poor patient who live in the urban area with poor economic condition who do not have health access from the government and live away from the hospital method it is a crosssectional study which aimed to determine the number of patient who experienced anxiety and depression problem due to the declining health condition caused by diabetes a sample size of 98 diabetic experiencing anxiety and depression when the treatment wa carried out wa included the study design included a qualitative study with indepth interview with respondent who were at risk of diabetes a well a to determine the level of anxiety and depression that occurred when medical care wa provided and the feeling experienced by the respondent after the completion of treatment result diabetic patient are generally unaware that their illness is a chronic disease that take a long time to treat when the patient are sick most of them do not immediately go to the hospital or a specialist to get their health examination and treatment because the hospital is far from the patient residence furthermore some patient still use traditional medicine and nonmedical treatment so when the patient with critical condition are taken to the hospital they already have chronic diabetes conclusion the lack of access to health for chronic patient with poor economic condition who live far from the hospital and the scarcity of medical staff to carry out treatment of chronic disease such a diabetes for poor patient in urban area certainly have an impact on increasing the number of patient with chronic disease therefore the government is expected to be able to provide easy health policy to remote rural community in order to achieve optimal community welfare and health

processed_title: multidiscipline care for type 2 diabetes patient from general to asian population
processed_abstract: multidiscipline care is defined a a care consisting of at least a physician a nurse and other healthcare worker eg dietician multidiscipline care ha generated benefit both in medical aspect eg increasing patient compliance and nonmedical aspect eg more costeffective than conventional treatment there are several model of multidiscpline care however which model is more suitable for type 2 diabetes care is not clear yet in this review we aimed to identify and compare multidiscipline care method for reducing glycated hemoglobin hba1c level in type 2 diabetes patient particularly asian patient because they have greater tendency to develop type 2 diabetes at lower degree of obesity and at younger age than caucasian ethnic group there were limited number of study examining multidiscipline care for type 2 diabetes patient moreover for asian patient they showed mixed result on the efficacy of multidiscipline care in achieving hba1c target healthcare personnel visit either personal or group session appeared effective both for general and asian t2dm patient it need further study to clarify which model are most effective for practice of varying culture socioeconomic condition and healthcare setting

processed_title: risk factor of severe hypoglycemia among patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus in outpatient clinic of tertiary hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: this study aimed to describe risk factor of severe hypoglycemia in type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm patient in a tertiary care hospital in indonesia this study wa a retrospective cohort study in the endocrinology outpatient clinic of dr cipto mangunkusumo national general hospital jakarta indonesia all subject more than 18 year old who had been visiting the clinic for at least a year were included subject were interviewed whether they had any severe hypoglycemia event within the past year while data on risk factor variable of severe hypoglycemia wa taken from medical record one year before data collection we recruited 291 subject among whom 254 suffered at least one episode of severe hypoglycemia within one year history of severe hypoglycemia or 5864 p 0001 egfr less than 60 mlmin173m2 or 1976 p 0028 and insulin use or 2257 p 0021 were associated with increased risk of severe hypoglycemia in conclusion history of previous severe hypoglycemia egfr less than 60 mlmin173m2 and insulin use were associated with severe hypoglycemia

processed_title: parasitic helminth and their beneficial impact on type 1 and type 2 diabetes
processed_abstract: it is estimated that by the year 2035 almost 600 million people will suffer from diabetes in the case of type 2 diabetes the strongest increase of diabetes incidence occurs in developing and newly industrialized country this increase correlate not only with a progressing sedentary lifestyle and nutritional change but also environmental change similarly the increase of type 1 diabetes incidence in industrialized country over the past decade can not be explained by genetic factor alone suggesting that environmental change are also involved one such environmental change is a reduced exposure to pathogen because of improved hygiene parasitic helminth modulate the immune system of their host and induce type 2 a well a regulatory immune response a proinflammatory immune response are crucial for the onset of both type 1 and type 2 diabetes helminthinduced immunomodulation may prevent diabetes onset and ameliorate insulin sensitivity several epidemiological study in human and experimental animal model support such a protective effect of helminth for autoimmune diabetes recent study further suggest that helminth may also provide such a beneficial effect for type 2 diabetes in this review we summarize study that investigated parasitic helminth and helminthderived product and their impact on both type 1 and type 2 diabetes highlighting potential protective mechanism

processed_title: selfmanagement based coaching program to improve diabetes mellitus selfmanagement practice and metabolic marker among uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus in indonesia a quasiexperimental study
processed_abstract: diabetes mellitus selfmanagement practice is an essential part of diabetes management among uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm this study aimed to examine the effectiveness of the diabetes mellitus selfmanagement dmsm based coaching program on improvement of the dmsm practice and metabolic marker a quasiexperimental study pretest and posttest design with the nonequivalent control group were applied in this study sixty sample were selected and were randomly assigned to both the experimental group and the control group the diabetes selfmanagement questionnaire dsmq wa used to measure the dmsm practice while metabolic biomarkers were assessed by using the laboratory test we conducted and compared the dmsm practice and clinical value at baseline and 12 week after completing the program the dmsm based coaching program wa a 12week program with several strategy based on a selfmanagement model the finding showed that patient who received the dmsm based coaching program have a positive effect on dmsm practice and metabolic marker except for body mass index bmi this study revealed that the dmsm based coaching program wa practical and feasible for implementation in a broad population with uncontrolled t2dm in indonesia

processed_title: helminth infection and type 2 diabetes a clusterrandomized placebo controlled sugarspin trial in nangapanda flores indonesia
processed_abstract: background insulin resistance is a strong predictor of the development of type 2 diabetes mellitus chronic helminth infection might protect against insulin resistance via a caloric restriction state and indirectly via thelper2 polarization of the immune system therefore the elimination of helminth might remove this beneficial effect on insulin resistance methodsdesign to determine whether soiltransmitted helminth infection are associated with a better wholebody insulin sensitivity and whether this protection is reversible by anthelmintic treatment a householdbased clusterrandomized double blind placebocontrolled trial wa conducted in the area of nangapanda on flores island indonesia an area endemic for soiltransmitted helminth infection the trial incorporates three monthly treatment with albendazole or matching placebo for one year whereby each treatment round consists of three consecutive day of supervised drug intake the presence of soiltransmitted helminth will be evaluated in faeces using microscopy andor pcr the primary outcome of the study will be change in insulin resistance a assessed by homair while the secondary outcome will be change in body mass index waist circumference fasting blood glucose 2 hglucose level after oral glucose tolerance test hba1c serum lipid level immunological parameter and efficacy of anthelmintic treatment discussion the study will provide data on the effect of helminth infection on insulin resistance it will assess the relationship between helminth infection status and immune response a well a metabolic parameter allowing the establishment of a link between inflammation and wholebody metabolic homeostasis in addition it will give information on anthelmintic treatment efficacy and effectiveness trial registration this study ha been approved by the ethical committee of faculty of medicine universitas indonesia ref 549h2f1etik2013 and ha been filed by the ethic committee of leiden university medical center clinical trial number isrctn75636394 the study is reported in accordance with the consort guideline for clusterrandomised trial

processed_title: effect of angiotensin receptor blocker and angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor on kidney function and blood potassium level in indonesian type 2 diabetes mellitus with hypertension a threemonth cohort study
processed_abstract: purpose national formulary restriction in indonesia 2019 require estimated glomerular filtration rate egfr of less than 60 mlmin173 m2 to be able to prescribe telmisartan and valsartan and acei intolerance to be able to prescribe irbesartan and candesartan these restriction are based on economic consideration and differ from american diabetes association ada 2020 guideline which allow equal use of angiotensin ii receptor blocker arb and angiotensinconverting enzyme inhibitor acei without restriction since there is a need to evaluate the different effect of acei and arb in the indonesian hypertensive type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm population we compare their effect on urine albumintocreatinine ratio uacr estimated glomerular filtration rate egfr and blood potassium level patient and method a prospective cohort study at rsupn dr cipto mangunkusumo hospital wa conducted in 123 t2dm patient we followed the study subject prospectively for three month using a validated questionnaire health record and laboratory data result after 3 month of observation there were no significant change except increased bmi value p 0046 in the acei group and decreased ldl value p 0016 and hdl value p 0004 in the arb group multivariate analysis showed that the consumption of acei or arb wa not associated with a decreaseconstant of uacr or increase potassium level even after adjusting by confounding variable interestingly we found arb wa more likely to increase egfr but the significance wa lost once the duration of aceiarb use wa entered into the model in addition bmi 25 kgm2 wa a significant factor associated with decreasedconstant uacr maleness wa significant for increased egfr and declining systolic blood pressure for increase in potassium level conclusion acei and arb have a similar effect on uacr and blood potassium level but arb slightly increased egfr compared to acei within three month of consumption

processed_title: efficacy and safety of pioglitazone in type 2 diabetes mellitus a postmarketing observational study
processed_abstract: aim to assess the effectiveness and safety profile of pioglitazone in indonesian type 2 diabetic patient method type 2 diabetic patient naive or under oral antidiabetic with uncontrolled fasting fbg or postprandial blood glucose ppbg were enrolled from september 2009 to december 2010 from 23 city in indonesia pioglitazone actosr 15 mg or 30 mg daily wa prescribed by the physician and performed observation for 12 week body weight bw body mass index bmi fbg and ppbg were measured every 4 week and serum transaminase sgpt wa measured at the beginning and at the end of the study change from baseline to each visit were analyzed using wilcoxontest result 190 patient 92 male and 98 female aged 563 2880 year were included mean fbg decreased from 1918 mgdl at baseline to 1559 1410 and 1273 mgdl at week 4 8 and 12 respectively p0001 mean ppbg decreased from 2673 mgdl at baseline to 2097 1882 and 1749 at week 4 8 and 12 respectively p0001 bw slightly increased from 673 range 4098 kg at baseline to 677 420985 and 678 430990 kg at week 8 and 12 respectively p0001 and bmi increased from 256 162386 kgm2 at baseline to 257 170363 and 257 174366 kgm2 at week 8 and 12 respectively p0001 sgpt value were not significantly changed 356ul at baseline and 355ul at week 12 p093 conclusion pioglitazone is effective in controlling blood glucose without harmful effect on the liver however there wa a slight but statistically significant increase in body weight that mandate the precaution when using this drug in patient with heart failure or other condition with water retention

processed_title: trend and disabilityattributable risk factor of type 2 diabetes mellitus in southeast asia 19902019 an indepth 30year analysis from the global burden of disease study
processed_abstract: background and aim to provide insight on targeted approach to mitigate diabetes burden this research aim to analyze the trend of prevalence mortality and disability attributable to risk factor for type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm from 1990 to 2019 in the southeast asia sea region method and result agestandardized rate for prevalence aspr mortality asmr and disabilityadjusted life year dalys from 1990 to 2019 from the global burden of disease study were assessed dalysrelated risk factor were estimated using multivariate regression analysis and estimated annual percentage change eapc wa calculated to quantify the temporal trend over 30 year the sea region experienced a 595 rise in t2dm aspr 1733 in asmr and 2697 in dalys the t2dm dalys rate per 100000 population wa 100291 88523113240 in 1990 and 127342 110392145241 in 2019 increasing by 27 cambodia and indonesia had the highest worsening in three parameter while most significant improvement in all parameter wa observed in singapore the curvilinear association wa demonstrated between asmr and dalys to gross domestic product gdp per caput prominent risk factor affecting dalys increase were high fasting plasma glucose fpg p 0001 high body mass index bmi p 0001 tobacco use p 0012 and household pollution p 003 men were more affected than woman conclusion the burden of t2dm in the sea region ha increased significantly during the 30year period policymakers should address high bmi high fpg smoking and air pollution to regulate t2dm burden in sea

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor of fatigue in type 1 and type 2 diabetes a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: purpose this metaanalysis wa conducted to determine the prevalence and risk factor of fatigue in type 1 and type 2 diabetes mellitus dm method observational study reporting the prevalence and risk factor of fatigue in type 1 or 2 dm were systematically searched for in pubmed embase cinahl plus cochrane trial and proquest dissertation and thesis database data were extracted by two independent reviewer a randomeffect model wa used for data analysis finding we included 19 study involving 7131 patient with type 1 dm and 32 study involving 34994 patient with type 2 dm in the study the pooled prevalence of fatigue in type 1 and type 2 dm wa 44 and 50 respectively the asiapacific region eg japan and australia south america and africa lacked report regarding fatigue prevalence in type 1 dm and north asia and southeast asia lacked report of fatigue prevalence in type 2 dm depression and physical activity were the only two variable significantly correlated with fatigue in both type 1 and type 2 dm all p 005 conclusion approximately half of the patient with type 1 or type 2 dm experienced fatigue with the prevalence of 44 and 50 respectively our finding regarding it risk factor can provide an evidencebased approach for managing fatigue in dm patient clinical relevance this metaanalysis emphasizes the importance of fatigue management in patient with type 1 and type 2 dm most significantly our result on risk factor related to fatigue in diabetes can contribute to the development of evidencebased strategy for managing fatigue in individual with dm

processed_title: early detection of macrovascular complication in type 2 diabetes mellitus in medan north sumatera indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background macrovascular complication occur very frequently in patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm with a high mortality rate due to the development of cardiovascular disease cvd such a stroke atherosclerosis acceleration and atrial fibrillation t2dm is a significant risk factor for cvd and ha become the leading cause of death the purpose of this study wa to detect the early risk of macrovascular complication by using the ankle brachial index abi a a marker method this study wa an analytic study with a crosssectional approach the study population wa patient with t2dm from several primary health care center in medan in total 89 subject who met the inclusion and exclusion criterion were recruited with consecutive sampling abi wa determined a the ratio of systolic blood pressure in the brachial artery to the posterior tibial artery after the subject had been relaxed and felt comfortable in a supine position examination of vitamin d and lipid profile wa derived from examination of venous blood data were processed using spss and analyzed with oneway anova result the study found that there wa a relationship between ldlc triglyceride and vitamin d 25ohd based on the abi p 005 conclusion abi can be used for an early detection of macrovascular complication apart from being easy to perform abi wa noninvasive some other risk factor that can also be used to assess complication and have relationship with abi were ldlc triglyceride and vitamin d 25ohd complication in t2dm patient can be prevented with reasonable blood sugar control and lifestyle change education and motivation need to be given to patient so that they become more independent in controlling their disease and improving their quality of life

processed_title: analysis of hmgb1 level before and after providing atorvastatin standard therapy in coronary artery disease patient with type2 diabetes mellitus compared to without type2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: objective coronary artery disease cad is one of the main cause of death from cardiovascular disease because heart attack result in atherosclerosis which cause narrowing of the artery atorvastatin ha a pleiotropic effect a antiinflammatory through one of the target level of high mobility group box1 hmgb1 this prospective observational study aimed to analyze the effect of atorvastatin on serum hmgb1 level in cad method sample were collected from prospective observation prepost study in mayjuly 2018 with consecutive sampling method serum hmgb1 level were measured in patient with cad who were given atorvastatin for cad with type2 diabetes mellitus compared without type2 diabetes mellitus in a patient ward blood wa collected on admission day and before the patient left the hospital after centrifugation serum sample were stored at 80 degree c before measurement we used an elisa kit ibl international to determine hmgb1 concentration this research protocol ha been approved by the ethical committee of dr soetomo general hospital surabaya result we enrolled 38 patient and divided them into two group which 19 patient on cad with type2 diabetes mellitus and 19 patient without diabetes mellitus serum hmgb1 level in cad with type2 diabetes mellitus were increased significantly p 0049 and not significantly decreased in cad without type2 diabetes mellitus p 0480 the hmgb1 level wa not significantly different between the two group p 0210 conclusion hmgb1 level after providing atorvastatin in cad with type2 diabetes mellitus increased significantly meanwhile in cad without type2 diabetes mellitus did not decrease significantly the hmgb1 level wa not significantly different between the two group longer time and more point for the collected sample needed for further research

processed_title: early recognition of type 2 diabetes complication and use of sglt2i in multidisciplinary approach indonesian perspective an expert opinion
processed_abstract: indonesia rank seventh with the highest number of case of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm t2dm is associated with major undesirable complication including cardiovascular disease and chronic kidney disease kidney play a major role in maintaining glucose homeostasis leading the development of sodium glucose transporter inhibitor sglt2i these inhibitor block renal sodium and glucose reabsorption several cardiovascular trial proved that sglt2i have cardioprotective and renoprotective role and have been suggested a a drug of choice in primary and secondary prevention and management of cardiorenal complication associated with t2dm this review highlight the need for a multidisciplinary recommendation for t2dm management in indonesian population additionally it is vital to provide the perspective of indonesian medical expert in term of screening diagnosis and treatment a the outcome differs geographically an expert panel of 6 member from indonesia wa convened to review the existing literature and develop an expertbased review summary on this topic member were chosen for their proficiency in diabetes kidney disease and cardiovascular disease the expert opined that the early use of sglt2i will be effective in preventing and minimising the progression of cardiorenal complication moreover a consistent multidimensional approach is necessary for improved outcome

processed_title: cardiovascular selfmanagement support program for preventing cardiovascular complication behavior and clinical outcome in the elderly with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus in indonesia a pilot study
processed_abstract: aim the aim of the study wa to determine the feasibility and to evaluate the effect of a cardiovascular selfmanagement support program by applying the 5as selfmanagement support program on preventing cardiovascular complication behavior and to assess the clinical outcome in the elderly with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus dm method this pilot study used a quasiexperimental study design twelve elderly person with poorly controlled type 2 dm were assigned into either a control or experimental group with six participant in each group the preventing cardiovascular complication behavior pccb wa measured by the preventing cardiovascular complication behavior questionnaire while the clinical outcome were measured by clinical device that were provided these measurement were conducted and compared at baseline and 6 week after the completion of the program the selfmanagement support program wa a 6 week program with several implementation method based on the 5as selfmanagement support program result the participant who received the cardiovascular selfmanagement support program reported a significant improvement in their pccb and clinical outcome compared to those receiving the usual care conclusion this study revealed that a cardiovascular selfmanagement support program that applies the 5as selfmanagement support program is feasible for implementation

processed_title: phardiacare program for improved medication adherence and clinical outcome of type 2 diabetes mellitus patient in community health center
processed_abstract: background the role of pharmacist in middleincome country such a indonesia is still not optimal in this study we developed a program called phardiacare a specific pharmacistled program for type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm patient objective the objective of this study is to assess the effectiveness of the application of the phardiacare program in improving medication adherence and clinical outcome in t2dm patient method the study wa quasiexperimental with a pretestposttest design and wa conducted prospectively from july to october 2019 at the matraman and jatinegara district health center jakarta indonesia the study comprised 33 t2dm patient in an intervention group ig who received the phardiacare program and 33 patient in a control group cg assessment wa performed of hba1c fbg ldl hdl total cholesterol triglyceride and blood pressure result hba1c after intervention in the ig wa lower than that of the cg p 005 intragroup mean difference showed improvement in the clinical parameter of fbg triglyceride and diastolic blood pressure in the ig p 005 but not in the cg other clinical parameter did not show significant improvement the result of the multivariate analysis showed that the phardiacare program had a 16 time greater effect in reducing level of hba1c in the ig 95 ci 399567113 p 0001 compared to the cg even after controlling for confounding variable conclusion the phardiacare program wa effective in improving patient medication adherence by decreasing hba1c and fbg but it did not have a significant effect on ldl hdl total cholesterol and systolic blood pressure therefore the implementation of phardiacare program in the management of chronic disease especially t2dm should be considered

processed_title: the impact of the indonesian chronic disease management program prolanis on metabolic control and renal function of type 2 diabetes mellitus patient in primary care setting
processed_abstract: background indonesia through it government national health insurance system ha launched a noncommunicable and chronic disease management program named indonesian chronic disease management program prolanis with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and hypertension a the main focus however study that evaluates the clinical impact of prolanis in patient with t2dm is still scarce to this date this study aim to evaluate the metabolic control and renal function of prolanis participant with t2dm every six month within the first 18months of implementation method this study wa a retrospective cohort study conducted at wates subdistrict east java using secondary data from prolanis group report from april 2018 to october 2019 the study population wa t2dm patient who voluntarily joined the prolanis group in april 2018 the sixmonthevaluation included metabolic parameter body mass index bmi blood pressure hemoglobin a1c total cholesterol highdensity lipid lowdensity lipid and triglyceride tg and renal parameter blood urea nitrogen bun creatinine serum and urinary microalbumin paired ttest and wilcoxon signedrank test wa used for the analysis and the pvalue wa adjusted using bonferroni correction a pvalue 0015 wa considered statistically significant while a pvalue between 0015 and 003 wa considered a marginally significant result a total of 30 participant were included in the analysis following the prolanis implementation the only parameter of metabolic control that showed significant improvement wa tg serum level p 001 despite the worsening status of other metabolic parameter the change were not statistically significant except for bmi that wa marginally significant p 002 from renal function only bun serum level wa significantly deteriorated p 001 while the others did not significantly change conclusion prolanis implementation in our study population seems to be ineffective future study with more primary healthcare center need to be done to scrutinize the clinical impact of this program nationwide

processed_title: effect of garcinia mangostana pericarp extract on glial nfkappab level and expression of serum inflammation marker in an obesetype 2 diabetes mellitus animal model
processed_abstract: type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm is an agerelated disease associated with cerebral inflammation and alzheimers disease garcinia mangostana pericarp gmp possesses antihyperglycemic antidiabetic and antiinflammatory effect the aim of the present study wa to evaluate the effect of gmp extract on cerebral inflammation in wistar rat with t2dm by examining the expression level of glial nuclear factorkappab nfkappab interleukin il6 tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha and superoxide dismutase sod a total of 36 810weekold male wistar rat were randomly divided into six group and provided a standard diet normal control c1 highfat diet hfd with 200 gkg gmp extract bwday gmp control c2 hfd with streptozotocinnicotinamide diabetic control c3 and hfd with 100 m1 200 m2 or 400 gkg body weight bwday m3 gmp extract for wistar rat with diabetes gmp extract wa administered for 8 week after induction of t2dm wa confirmed glial nfkappab activity wa assessed by immunohistochemical staining and by measuring il6 level tnfalpha level and sod activity in the serum using elisa bw significantly increased following hfd treatment after 7 week the bw remained significantly higher compared with the normal control and gmp extracttreated group but decreased continuously in the t2dm group glial nfkappab immunoreaction in the hippocampal region wa significantly higher in the diabetic wistar rat compared with the normal control wistar rat and 200 gkg bwday gmp significantly reduced it activity the t2dm wistar rat showed significantly higher expression level of serum il6 and tnfalpha and lower activity of sod compared with the normal control wistar rat meanwhile rat in gmp group m1 m2 and m3 exhibited significant reduction in the level of il6 and tnfalpha expression and increase in sod activity gmp extract treatment effectively reduced hippocampal nfkappab il6 and tnfalpha level and increased antioxidant sod activity these result suggest that gmp extract prevents cerebral inflammation in t2dm wistar rat

processed_title: cardiovascular and mortality outcome of dpp4 inhibitor v sulfonylurea a metformin addon therapy in patient with type 2 diabetes a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background type 2 diabetes significantly increase the risk of cardiovascular disease and mortality this systematic review and metaanalysis compared cardiovascular and mortality outcome in type 2 diabetes patient receiving dipeptidyl peptidase4 inhibitor dpp4is plus metformin versus sulfonylurea sus plus metformin a addon therapy method pubmed web of science cochrane central register of controlled trial embase google scholar and scopus were searched through january 1 2025 for study comparing dpp4is plus metformin versus sus plus metformin in type 2 diabetes patient outcome of interest were major adverse cardiovascular event and allcause mortality heterogeneity wa assessed using cochran q test and i2 statistic publication bias wa evaluated with beggs and egger test study quality wa assessed with the jadad scale for randomized controlled trial and the newcastleottawa scale for observational study result twentyseven study 20122024 encompassing 1505821 participant were included in the analysis major adverse cardiovascular event were reported in 21 study and allcause mortality data were available from 19 study metaanalysis revealed a significantly lower risk of both major adverse cardiovascular event risk ratio rr 079 95 confidence interval ci 073084 p 0001 and allcause mortality rr 079 95 ci 071088 p 0001 in patient with diabetes treated with dpp4 inhibitor plus metformin compared to those treated with sus plus metformin no publication bias wa detected conclusion in type 2 diabetes patient treated with metformin adding a dpp4is is associated with significantly lower risk of major adverse cardiovascular event and allcause mortality compared to adding an sus these finding underscore the potential cardiovascular benefit of dpp4is and their role in improving patient outcome

processed_title: absence of association between serum mutant p53 with hba1c and insulin in brain tumor patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus
processed_abstract: aim this study aim to determine the prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm in primary brain tumor bt subject and assess the relationship between serum mutant p53 serum and hba1c and insulin background t2dm is known to increase the risk of various type of cancer which are thought to be caused by hyperglycemia hyperinsulinemia and inflammation a cohort study that looked at more than 500000 subject with dm over 11 year showed an increased risk of different type of cancer including brain tumor however several recent study have shown the opposite one of the important pathway in the pathogenesis of brain tumor is the p53 pathway in which mutation in the tp53 gene can cause brain cell growth abnormality objective the first stage involved taking subject data for the period january 2017november 2020 from the medical record of the rsupn dr cipto mangunkusumo hospital indonesia to assess the prevalence of t2dm in bt subject the second stage wa an observational study with a crosssectional design that collected primary data on subject n86 to assess the relationship between serum mutant p53 serum and hba1c and insulin method the analysis of serum mutant p53 serum and insulin wa made using the elisa method while measurement of hba1c wa made using the boronate affinity method result the result show the prevalence of t2dm in bt subject at dr cipto mangunkusumo hospital indonesia wa relatively low 9 serum mutant p53 level in t2dm 153 ngml 060 were significantly higher than in btt2dm and bt p 0001 the hba1c value wa significantly lower in bt 515 044 compared to btt2dm and t2dm p 0001 while t2dm insulin level 3954 iuml 191 were significantly higher than btt2dm and bt p 0001 there wa no correlation between serum mutant p53 level and hba1c and insulin in the three group conclusion the study concludes that the prevalence of bt with t2dm is relatively low 9 and that serum level of mutant p53 in t2dm subject are higher than in subject with bt but there is no correlation between serum mutant p53 level and hba1c and insulin value further research need to be conducted by analyzing p53 mutant from other specimen such a brain tumor tissue

processed_title: macrophylloflavone a new biflavonoid from garcinia macrophylla mart clusiaceae for antibacterial antioxidant and antitype 2 diabetes mellitus activity
processed_abstract: investigation of antibacterial antioxidant and antitype 2 diabetes mellitus activity have been carried out on garcinia macrophylla mart plant extract fraction an isolate from a fraction of ethyl acetate extract wa characterized with spectroscopic data a new biflavonoid compound wa found to have a skeleton of 5745734heptahydroxyflavanone36 flavone which wa named macrophylloflavone 1 the compound wa evaluated for it antibacterial activity against escherichia coli atcc 25922 and staphylococcus aureus atcc 25923 with cephazolin a a positive control antioxidant assay against 22 diphenyl1picrylhydrazyl dpph with ascorbic acid a the positive control and antitype 2 diabetes mellitus treatment with metformin a a positive control the biflavonoid compound exhibited a good inhibition for bacteria and free radical dpph furthermore biflavonoid compound treatment on the diabetic rat suggested it ability to decrease the blood glucose level this study provided evidence that the plant ha antibacterial antioxidant and antidiabetic property
