processed_title: childhood acute respiratory infection and household environment in an eastern indonesian urban setting
processed_abstract: this pilot study evaluated the potential effect of household environmental factor such a income maternal characteristic and indoor air pollution on childrens respiratory status in an eastern indonesian community household data were collected from crosssectional n 461 participant and preliminary childhood casecontrol survey pneumonia case 31 diagnosed within three month at a local health clinic control 30 particulate matter pm25 and pm10 wa measured in living room kitchen childrens bedroom and outside area in close proximity once during the casecontrol household interview 55 home and once per hour from 6 am to midnight in 11 home the household survey showed that child were 198 time p 002 more likely to have coughing symptom indicating respiratory infection if mother were not the primary caregiver more child exhibited coughing if they were not exclusively breastfed or 218 p 006 or there wa a possibility that their mother were exposed to environmental tobacco smoke during pregnancy or 205 p 008 this study suggests that household income and mother education have an indirect effect on childhood pneumonia and respiratory illness the concentration of pm25 and pm10 ranged from 05 to 357 microgm3 and 77 to 5757 microgm3 respectively based on grab sample pm wa significantly different between the case and control group p 001 the study also suggests that ambient air may dilute indoor pollution but also introduces pollution into the home from the community environment effective intervention program need to be developed that consider multiple direct and indirect risk factor to protect child

processed_title: respiratory perspective of covid19 in pregnancy
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 wa declared a global pandemic in march 2020 by the world health organization who by february 2022 the disease had infected more than 500 million people globally covid19 frequently manifest a pneumonia and mortality is mainly caused by acute respiratory distress syndrome ards previous study have reported that pregnant woman are at a higher risk of sarscov2 infection and complication can happen due to alteration in the immune response respiratory physiology hypercoagulable state and placental pathology clinician face the challenge of selecting the proper treatment for pregnant patient with different physiological characteristic compared with the nonpregnant population furthermore drug safety for both the patient and the fetus should also be considered effort to prevent covid19 including prioritizing vaccination for pregnant woman are essential to break the chain of covid19 transmission in the pregnant population this review aim to summarize the current literature regarding the effect of covid19 in pregnant woman it clinical manifestation treatment complication and prevention

processed_title: a qualitative study on family role in the care and prevention of acute respiratory infection among child in primary health care
processed_abstract: background acute respiratory infection ari is a common reason that parent seek help to primary health care in 2016 almost 65 644 pneumonia and less than 36 356 nonpneumonia case were found among the child in malang member of family have important role to play in individual health especially the child the aim of this study wa to explore the role of family member in the care and prevention of child with ari method this wa a qualitative study with a phenomenological approach involving 12 informant an indepth interview wa conducted on each informant having child with recurrent ari during a space of 3 month in the primary health care information collected from the interview were transcribed and analyzed into different theme result the 4 theme identified include ari in child parent role influence of family member and family problem different style of parenting were established between the father and mother also between the mother and grandmother on preventing ari the behavior of other family member impact both on the risk and prevention of ari some of the identified problem capable of affecting childrens health include inability to control the child unstable income and the stressed condition of most mother conclusion behavior of family member impact on the prevention of ari among the child problem within the family could affect the mother or caregiver psychology which might in turn impact on the care given to the child infected with ari or in preventing it

processed_title: respiratory syncytial virus infection denominatorbased study in indonesia mozambique nigeria and south africa
processed_abstract: objective to assess the burden of respiratory syncytial virus rsvassociated lower respiratory infection lri in child in four developing country method a who protocol for prospective populationbased surveillance of acute respiratory infection in child aged less than 5 year wa used at site in indonesia mozambique nigeria and south africa rsv antigen wa identified by enzymelinked immunosorbent assay performed on nasopharyngeal specimen from child meeting clinical case definition finding among child aged 5 year the incidence of rsvassociated lri per 1000 childyears wa 34 in indonesia and 94 in nigeria the incidence of rsvassociated severe lri per 1000 childyears wa 5 in mozambique 10 in indonesia and 9 in south africa at all study site the majority of rsv case occurred in infant conclusion these study demonstrate that rsv contributes to a substantial but quite variable burden of lri in child aged 5 year in four developing country the possible explanation for this variation include social factor such a family size and pattern of seeking health care the proportion of child infected by human immunodeficiency syndrome hiv and difference in clinical definition used for obtaining sample the age distribution of case indicates the need for an rsv vaccine that can protect child early in life

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor of acute respiratory infection and diarrhea among child under 5 year old in lowmiddle wealth household indonesia
processed_abstract: background acute respiratory infection ari and diarrhea remain critical public health concern in indonesia various intervention have been implemented to reduce the prevalence of aris and diarrhea among child in low and middleincome household hence the absence of detailed data on the prevalence of aris and diarrhea among child under five in low and middleincome household in indonesia restricts the formulation of targeted health intervention and policy this study sought to evaluate the prevalence of ari and diarrhea while examining modifiable risk factor related to malnutrition sanitation and social protection characteristic in indonesia method this study utilized a crosssectional design based on data from the nutrition status survey 2022 covering 514 districtscities in indonesia it analyzed 289631 child under five year out of 334848 household with low and middle wealth index multivariable binary logistic regression analysis wa employed to calculate the risk associated with case of ari and diarrhea result the prevalence of ari and diarrhea among low and middlewealth household were 57 and 60 respectively with infant under six month being the most vulnerable group to these infection including malnutrition the most significant risk factor for ari and diarrhea are unclean cooking fuel adjusted odds ratio aor 153 95 ci 147160 and shared toilet facility aor 145 95 ci 138151 with household using shared toilet having 145 time higher risk of diarrhea aor 145 95 ci 138151 compared to those with private access additionally household lacking social protection support are also at increased risk for these infection and malnutrition issue conclusion this study revealed a notable prevalence of ari and diarrhea among low and middlewealth household particularly affecting infant under six month vulnerable child especially those who were stunted or underweight and household lacking sanitation and social protection faced heightened risk for these health issue

processed_title: factor related with the incidence of acute respiratory infection in toddler in sleman yogyakarta indonesia evidence from the sleman health and demographic surveillance system
processed_abstract: various factor associated with acute respiratory infection ari in toddler have been widely observed but there are no study using data from the sleman health and demographic surveillance system hdss this study aimed to determine the factor associated with ari in child under five in sleman yogyakarta indonesia this research wa an observational analytic study with a crosssectional design using secondary data from the sleman hdss data of 463 child under five who met the inclusion and exclusion criterion were used in this study inclusion criterion were toddler who have complete observed variable data the variable observed were the characteristic of child under five the attribute of the mother the physical condition of the house the use of mosquito coil sanitation facility and source of drinking water the exclusion criterion were toddler with pulmonary tuberculosis in the past year data analysis used chisquared test for bivariate analysis and multivariate logistic regression analysis the result showed that working mother had a greater risk of ari under five child with or 146 95 ci 101211 and groundwater a a water source wa a protective factor against the occurrence of ari in toddler with or 046 95 ci 026081 after a logistic regression analysis wa performed only the drinking water source variable had a statistically significant relationship with the incidence of ari in child under five with or 047 95 ci 02680827 research on the relationship between water quality and the incidence of ari in child under five is needed to follow up on these finding

processed_title: virological characteristic of the sarscov2 omicron eg51 variant
processed_abstract: in middle to late 2023 a sublineage of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 omicron xbb eg51 a progeny of xbb192 is spreading rapidly around the world we performed multiscale investigation including phylogenetic analysis epidemic dynamic modeling infection experiment using pseudoviruses clinical isolates and recombinant virus in cell culture and experimental animal and the use of human serum and antiviral compound to reveal the virological feature of the newly emerging eg51 variant our phylogenetic analysis and epidemic dynamic modeling suggested that two hallmark substitution of eg51 sf456l and orf9bi5t are critical to it increased viral fitness experimental investigation on the growth kinetics sensitivity to clinically available antiviral fusogenicity and pathogenicity of eg51 suggested that the virological feature of eg51 are comparable to those of xbb15 however cryoelectron microscopy revealed structural difference between the spike protein of eg51 and xbb15 we further assessed the impact of orf9bi5t on viral feature but it wa almost negligible in our experimental setup our multiscale investigation provide knowledge for understanding the evolutionary trait of newly emerging pathogenic virus including eg51 in the human population

processed_title: analysis of adrenocorticotropic hormone and cortisol level in acute respiratory distress syndrome covid19 patient
processed_abstract: objective sarscov2 infection may cause multiple organ failure however scarce information can be found on the impact on the endocrine system this study wa conducted to determine plasma adrenocorticotropic hormone acth and plasma cortisol level in a cohort of covid19 patient with acute respiratory distress syndrome ards method a prospective cohort study wa conducted on covid19 patient who manifested ards and were admitted to the icu of dr soetomo tertiary hospital surabaya indonesia morning plasma acth and plasma total cortisol were measured on 45 recruited patient the outcome of the patient wa justified based on the survivance on day 7th and 30th during the followup with grouping of surviving for survived patient and nonsurvive for deceased patient result the acth and cortisol median were 106 056457 pgml and 1761 07875 mugdl respectively both parameter were assembled to allow the allocation of the 45 subject into the survive and nonsurvive group there wa a moderate correlation between acth and cortisol level in all group r 046 p 0002 and particularly acth and cortisol level in covid19 patient who survived on the 7thday and 30thday followup r 0518 and r 0568 respectively with p 005 it is important to note that there wa no correlation for an individual parameter either acth only or cortisol only compared to the outcome among patient with various comorbid conclusion acth or cortisol alone ha no correlation to the outcome of these patient therefore further study of the potential use of corticosteroid treatment guided by acth and cortisol level in reducing the risk of ards warrant further investigation

processed_title: antiviral effect of phytochemical against severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 and their mechanism of action a review
processed_abstract: the worldwide spreading of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 ha posed a serious threat to health economic environmental and social aspect of human life currently there are no approved treatment that can effectively block the virus although several existing antimalarial and antiviral agent have been repurposed and allowed use during the pandemic under the emergency use authorization eua status this review give an updated overview of the antiviral effect of phytochemical including alkaloid flavonoid and terpenoids against the covid19 virus and their mechanism of action search for natural lead molecule against sarscov2 ha been focusing on virtual screening and in vitro study on phytochemical that have shown great promise against other coronaviruses such a sarscov until now there is limited data on in vivo investigation to examine the antiviral activity of plant in sarscov2infected animal model and the study were performed using crude extract further experimental and preclinical investigation on the in vivo effect of phytochemical have to be performed to provide sufficient efficacy and safety data before clinical study can be performed to develop them into covid19 drug phytochemical are potential source of new chemical lead for the development of safe and potent antisarscov2 agent

processed_title: development of a short course on management of critically ill patient with acute respiratory infection and impact on clinician knowledge in resourcelimited intensive care unit
processed_abstract: background the 2009 influenza a h1n1 pandemic caused surge of patient in intensive care unit icu in resourcelimited setting several ministry of health requested clinical management guidance from the world health organization who which had not previously developed guidance regarding critically ill patient objective to assess the acceptability and impact on knowledge of a short course about the management of critically ill patient with acute respiratory infection complicated by sepsis or acute respiratory distress syndrome delivered to clinician in resourcelimited icu method over 4 year 20092013 who led the development piloting implementation and preliminary evaluation of a 3day course that emphasized patient management based on evidencebased guideline and used interactive adultlearner teaching methodology international content expert n 35 and instructional designer contributed to development we assessed participant satisfaction and content knowledge before and after the course result the course wa piloted among clinician in trinidad and tobago n 29 indonesia n 38 and vietnam n 86 feedback from these course contributed to the final version in 2013 inaugural national course were delivered in tajikistan n 28 uzbekistan n 39 and azerbaijan n 30 participant rated the course highly and demonstrated increased immediate content knowledge after v before course completion p 001 conclusion we found that it wa feasible to create and deliver a focused critical care short course to clinician in low and middleincome country collaboration between who clinical expert instructional designer ministry of health and local clinicianleaders facilitated course delivery future work should assess it impact on longerterm knowledge retention and on process and outcome of care

processed_title: analysis of factor influencing acute respiratory infection among underfive child in sering public health centre medan tembung subdistrict
processed_abstract: introduction nowadays acute respiratory infection ari is the most common cause of high morbidity and mortality rate in child ari is defined a an infection either in the upper or lower respiratory tract that last for 14 day and caused by either virus or bacteria the incidence of ari in 2017 is 2054 with the most prominent characteristic in child aged 1 to 4 year factor that affect ari frequency are gender birth weight nutritional status immunization status vitamin a status exclusive breastfeeding smoke exposure family income and mother formal education aim this study aim to find out risk factor that potentiate ari among child from age 1 to 5 material and method this study used a descriptiveanalytical method with a crosssectional study approach the data is taken by consecutive sampling method with a questionnaire a the tool result the bivariate analysis result using fisher exact test show that there is no relation between sex p0642 birth weight p0683 completion of immunization p0195 vitamin a supplementation p1000 exclusive breastfeeding p0157 crowding p1000 family income p0658 knowledge p1000 attitude p0156 and behavior p1000 with the frequency of ari the bivariate analysis result using kruskalwallis test show that there is no significant difference between group in each factor of smoke exposure p0988 and mother formal education p0899 with the frequency of ari conclusion there is no relation between each factor with ari frequency and there is no significant difference between group in each factor with ari frequency

processed_title: estimated incidence of influenzaassociated severe acute respiratory infection in indonesia 20132016
processed_abstract: background indonesia hospitalbased severe acute respiratory infection sari surveillance system surveilans infeksi saluran pernafasan akut berat indonesia sibi wa established in 2013 while respiratory illness such a sari pose a significant problem there are limited incidencebased data on influenza disease burden in indonesia this study aimed to estimate the incidence of influenzaassociated sari in indonesia during 20132016 at three existing sibi surveillance site method from may 2013 to april 2016 inpatient from sentinel hospital in three district of indonesia gunung kidul balikpapan deli serdang were screened for sari respiratory specimen were collected from eligible inpatient and screened for influenza virus annual incidence rate were calculated using these sibienrolled influenzapositive sari case a a numerator with a denominator catchment population defined through hospital admission survey ha to identify respiratorycoded admission by age to hospital in the sentinel site district result from may 2013 to april 2016 there were 1527 sari case enrolled of whom 1392 91 had specimen tested and 199 14 were influenzapositive the overall estimated annual incidence of influenzaassociated sari ranged from 13 to 19 per 100 000 population incidence wa highest in child aged 04 year 82114 per 100 000 population followed by child 514 year 2236 per 100 000 population conclusion incidence rate of influenzaassociated sari in these district indicate a substantial burden of influenza hospitalization in young child in indonesia further study are needed to examine the influenza burden in other potential risk group such a pregnant woman and the elderly

processed_title: infectionrelated mortality and infection control practice in childhood acute myeloid leukemia in a limited resource setting experience with the indonesian national protocol
processed_abstract: background in resourcelimited setting addressing infection remains a substantial challenge in the management of child with acute myeloid leukemia aml in indonesia infectionrelated mortality irm is thought to be high compared to highincome country however there ha been no previous study of infection profile and irm in indonesian patient with aml objective this study aimed to describe infection and irm in child with aml treated according to the indonesian national aml protocol and to describe the implementation of infection control practice in resourcelimited setting method this retrospective observational study used secondary data from the medical record of pediatric patient with aml treated with the national protocol at dr sardjito hospital yogyakarta indonesia from april 2012 to september 2018 essential patient characteristic time of irm and cause of death were recorded and infection control practice were observed data were analyzed using descriptive statistic result 113 patient with aml were treated with the national protocol and 83 met the inclusion criterion infection occurred in 69 83 patient with a total of 123 episode mean 18patient death wa seen in 48 58 patient with 19 23 irm the majority of infection were in the gastrointestinal tract n 51 305 sepsis n 29 17 and respiratory tract n 28 17 infection mostly occurred during the first induction 41 there were 90 73 episode of clinically documented infection and 33 27 episode of microbiologically documented infection the positivity rate of blood culture wa only 27 the majority of bacteria detected were gramnegative n 25 69 and among them were klebsiella pneumonia 19 and escherichia coli 19 candida albicans wa detected in 1 2 culture suboptimal infection prevention and control were found in the clinical practice conclusion infection and infectionrelated mortality in child with aml treated using the national protocol were frequent mainly occurring during the first induction phase compliance with infection prevention and control measure need improvement urgent attention is required for better supportive care including isolation room antibiotic and antifungal the predominance of gramnegative bacterial infection highlight the necessity for further research into effective prophylaxis enhanced healthcare and nursing professional vigilance and tailored antibiotic strategy are vital improving compliance and ensuring adequate supportive care resource are essential emphasizing nursing pivotal role further research is crucial to drive advancement in infection control strategy

processed_title: relationship between anal swab pcr for sarscov2 with gastrointestinal clinical manifestation and severity of covid19 infection in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 case caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 in indonesia remain high the virus can bind with ace2 receptor which is not only found in the lung but also in the digestive tract thus it allows sarscov2 infection in the gastrointestinal tract gastrointestinal manifestation and detection of viral rna on anal swab using polymerase chain reaction pcr there hasnt been similar study about the role of anal swab in indonesia yet therefore this study aim to determine the relationship between sarscov2 anal swab pcr with gastrointestinal clinical manifestation and the severity of covid19 in indonesia method this is an analytical study with crosssectional design sample were obtained from hospitalized covid19 patient from july 2020 to january 2021 demographic data clinical manifestation severity and sarscov2 anal swab pcr were collected using case report form result a total of136 patient were analyzed 52 patient 382 had positive sarscov2 anal swab pcr and 84 patient 618 had negative result the most common gastrointestinal clinical manifestation were nausea and vomiting in 69 patient 507 anorexia in 62 patient 456 and abdominal pain in 31 patient 228 there were 114 patient 838 classified a mildmoderate symptom and 22 patient 162 classified a severecritical symptom there wa a statistically significant relationship between the gastrointestinal tract sarscov2 infection and gastrointestinal clinical manifestation p0031 there wa no statistically significant relationship between the gastrointestinal sarscov2 infection and the severity of covid19 infection p 0844 conclusion this study showed there is a significant relationship between sarscov2 anal swab pcr with gastrointestinal clinical manifestation there is no significant relationship between anal swab pcr with the severity of covid19 infection

processed_title: exposure to fine particulate matter and acute upper and lowerrespiratory tract infection auri and alri in child under five year of age in india
processed_abstract: a one of the world polluted region we assessed the association between ambient pm25 level and acute lower and upper respiratory infection in india we assessed 55118 child from the 20152016 demographic health survey in india using the information on level of pm25 in 2015 and 2016 from the atmospheric composition analysis group we used the generalized estimating equation for the analysis reported a odds ratio and 95 confidence interval for every 10 microgm3 increase and quartile in pm25 every 10 microgm3 increase in level of pm25 associated with acute upper respiratory infection or 102 95ci 102103 and acute lower respiratory infection or 105 95ci 103106 this association wa confirmed by quartile exposure assessment mitigation effort must be continued implementing higher restriction in india to ensure safe level of air

processed_title: significance of chronic disease and smoking behavior in the development of acute respiratory distress syndrome among hospitalized covid19 patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: acute respiratory distress syndrome ards is one of the main cause of high mortality among coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 patient this study aimed at determining the association between presence of chronic disease and smoking behavior with the development of ards among hospitalized covid19 patient in indonesia this study wa carried out in 15 muhammadiyahaisyiyahaffiliated covid19 referral hospital in indonesia four hundred ninety participant who tested positive for the covid19 were recruited in this study demographic data history of chronic disease and the development of ards were retrieved from hospital patient record information about the smoking behavior wa collected after respondent were discharged from the hospital presence of chronic disease such a diabetes chronic heart disease hypertension and chronic liver disease were significantly associated with the development of ards in a similar regard patient who currently smoked had a 5 time greater risk of developing ards compared with those who never smoked

processed_title: severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus2 detection in domestic animal a a reservoir for the virus transmission to human in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background and aim the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus2 sarscov2 that attack the respiratory and digestive tract the sarscov2 showed systemic characteristic with various clinical symptom from subclinical to fatal causing death transmission of sarscov2 ha been reported to occur from human to pet cat dog tiger ferret and poultry knowledge about the role of domestic animal in the transmission of sarscov2 to human and a reservoir of this virus need to be investigated further this study aimed to detect the presence of sarscov2 in domestic animal such a dog cat pig cow bird and bat that are often in contact with human material and method a total of 157 sample which included nasopharyngeal and oropharyngeal swab along with serum sample from domestic animal such a cat pig cow bird and bat were taken from veterinary hospital veterinary clinic and farm around the yogyakarta region detection of the virus wa done using rapid detection of viral antigen antibody and reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction rtpcr technique result the result showed that 5157 31 sample found positive against the covid19 virus using a rapid antibody test however the result were negative on the rapid antigen and rtpcr test antibodypositive sample came from animal that had a history of household covid19 human infection conclusion thus finding of the present study conclude that there is a potential for transmission of the covid19 virus between animal and human

processed_title: investigation on the risk factor of acute respiratory infection aris among underfive child in depok city indonesia
processed_abstract: background acute respiratory infection are caused by pathogen that spread rapidly acute respiratory infection include upper respiratory tract infection and lower respiratory tract infection according to the world health organization 2019 acute respiratory infection rank fourth among disease that affect child with high morbidity indonesia underfive mortality rate due to acute respiratory infection rank first among the association of southeast asian nation underfive mortality due to acute respiratory infection in indonesia account for 2230 of the total underfive mortality case study design and method this crosssectional study wa conducted with a total of 100 mother and child pair selected by simple random sampling internal and external factor including nutritional status maternal age maternal education level presence of a smoker in the house house ownership household size temperature humidity lighting ceiling floor wall and ventilation were investigated a the risk factor of acute respiratory infection among underfive child in this study result our crosssectional study found that 68 out of 100 underfive child in this study were infected with acute respiratory infection during the study period among the risk factor our multivariate analysis suggests that presence of smoker maternal age and inadequate ceiling condition were the potential determinant of acute respiratory infection among underfive child in depok city conclusion despite the limitation of this study we believe our result could give a comprehensive overview of the risk factor of acute respiratory infection in underfive child

processed_title: acute respiratory illness incidence and death among child under two year of age on lombok island indonesia
processed_abstract: no childhood pneumonia incidence data for indonesia exist and few data exist for asia a a whole from february 1 1998 to january 31 1999 we conducted acute respiratory illness ari surveillance among child 24 month of age in 50 mainly rural village on lombok island indonesia the total number of childyears at risk during the study period wa 17015 the documented incidence of simple severe hospitalized and radiologically confirmed alveolar pneumonia were 21 83 53 and 18 per 100 childyears of observation respectively for all outcome the incidence wa higher among younger and rural child all cause and arispecific infant mortality rate were 84 and 33 per 1000 live birth respectively more than 65 of death due to ari occurred outside of a hospital setting the incidence of pneumonia is high in lombok intervention should include introducing vaccine to prevent infection leading to pneumonia and increasing the access of critically ill infant to the health care system

processed_title: guideline for the prevention and management of child and adolescent with covid19
processed_abstract: child are the future of the world but their health and future are facing great uncertainty because of the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic in order to improve the management of child with covid19 an international multidisciplinary panel of expert developed a rapid advice guideline at the beginning of the outbreak of covid19 in 2020 after publishing the first version of the rapid advice guideline the panel ha updated the guideline by including additional stakeholder in the panel and a comprehensive search of the latest evidence all recommendation were supported by systematic review and graded using the grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation grade system expert judgment wa used to develop good practice statement supplementary to the graded evidencebased recommendation the updated guideline comprises nine recommendation and one good practice statement it focus on the key recommendation pertinent to the following issue identification of prognostic factor for death or pediatric intensive care unit admission the use of remdesivir systemic glucocorticoid and antipyretic intravenous immunoglobulin ivig for multisystem inflammatory syndrome in child and highflow oxygen by nasal cannula or noninvasive ventilation for acute hypoxemic respiratory failure breastfeeding vaccination and the management of pediatric mental health conclusion this updated evidencebased guideline intends to provide clinician pediatrician patient and other stakeholder with evidencebased recommendation for the prevention and management of covid19 in child and adolescent larger study with longer followup to determine the effectiveness and safety of systemic glucocorticoid ivig noninvasive ventilation and the vaccine for covid19 in child and adolescent are encouraged what is known several clinical practice guideline for child with covid19 have been developed but only few of them have been recently updated we developed an evidencebased guideline at the beginning of the covid19 outbreak and have now updated it based on the result of a comprehensive search of the latest evidence what is new the updated guideline provides key recommendation pertinent to the following issue identification of prognostic factor for death or pediatric intensive care unit admission the use of remdesivir systemic glucocorticoid and antipyretic intravenous immunoglobulin for multisystem inflammatory syndrome in child and highflow oxygen by nasal cannula or noninvasive ventilation for acute hypoxemic respiratory failure breastfeeding vaccination and the management of pediatric mental health

processed_title: the impact of government pandemic policy on the vulnerability of healthcare worker to sarscov2 infection and mortality in jakarta province indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction healthcare worker hcws are on the frontlines of the covid19 pandemic putting them at a higher risk of infection and disease than nonhcws we analysed the effect of government policy for the public and for hcws on the likelihood of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 infection and mortality among hcws during the first 8 month of the pandemic in jakarta province the capital city and covid19 hotspot in indonesia method we conducted a retrospective cohort study using secondary data from the jakarta provincial government from march to october 2020 which included sociodemographic characteristic symptom comorbidities and covid19 diagnosis history for all case a generalized linear mixedeffect regression model wa used to determine the effect of each month on the odds ratio or of covid19 case and death for hcw compared with nonhcw assuming that monthly trend were influenced by varying government policy result a total of 894487 suspected and confirmed covid19 case in health facility in jakarta province were analysed the or of confirmed case for hcw wa 204 95 ci 200208 p 001 compared to nonhcw despite this higher or for infection the case fatality rate 232 per 100 and or 102 95 ci 093111 p 65 of covid19 death for hcw were similar to those of nonhcw we observed a trend towards a lower number of covid19 patient in hospital and lower odds of covid19 case among hcws during the apriltojuly 2020 phase compared to the augusttooctober phase this chronologically aligned with more extensive policy to support hospitalbased communitybased and wellbeingrelated action to protect hcw conclusion hcw had higher odds of having sarscov2 infection yet similar odds of death from covid19 a compared to nonhcw government policy with collective effort to prevent hospital overcapacity during high transmission and burden period of the pandemic should be prioritized

processed_title: effectiveness of prone position in acute respiratory distress syndrome and moderating factor of obesity class and treatment duration for covid19 patient a metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective to examine the effectiveness of prone positioning on covid19 patient with acute respiratory distress syndrome with moderating factor in both traditional prone positioning invasive mechanical ventilation and awake selfprone positioning patient noninvasive ventilation research methodology a comprehensive search wa conducted in cinahl cochrane library embase medlineovid ncbi sarscov2 resource proquest scopus and web of science without language restriction all study with prospective and experimental design evaluating the effect of prone position patient with covid19 related to acute respiratory distress syndrome were included pooled standardised mean difference were calculated after prone position for primary pao2fio2 and secondary outcome spo2 and pao2 result a total of 15 article were eligible and included in the final analysis prone position had a statistically significant effect in improving pao2fio2 with standardised mean difference of 110 95ci 060159 spo2 with standardised mean difference of 339 95 ci 130548 and pao2 with standardised mean difference of 077 95 ci 019135 patient with higher body mass index and longer durationday are associated with larger standardised mean difference effect size for prone positioning conclusion our finding demonstrate that prone position significantly improved oxygen saturation in covid19 patient with acute respiratory distress syndrome in both traditional prone positioning and awake selfprone positioning patient prone position should be recommended for patient with higher body mass index and longer duration to obtain the maximum effect

processed_title: covid19 screening score for patient without acute respiratory symptom undergoing emergency medical procedure in indonesia
processed_abstract: to rule out coronavirus disease2019 covid19 in patient scheduled to undergo emergency medical procedure sarscov2 reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr must be performed in developing country the use of sarscov2 rtpcr ha been limited by it unavailability and long processing time hence a quick screening score to predict covid19 may help healthcare practitioner determine which patient without acute respiratory symptom can safely undergo an emergency medical procedure we conducted a crosssectional study of adult patient without acute respiratory symptom who were admitted to the emergency department and underwent an emergency medical procedure within 24 hour after admittance we collected baseline demographic data covid19 screening variable and sarscov2 rtpcr a the gold standard for covid19 diagnosis bivariate and multivariate analysis were performed and a scoring system wa developed using statistically significant variable from the multivariate analysis with data from 357 patient multivariate backward stepwise logistic regression analysis resulted in two significant covid19 predictor the presence of sarscov2igm antibody adjusted odds ratio aor 702 95 ci 1493296 and typical chest xray aor 2321 95 ci 10015378 a scoring system wa developed using these predictor with an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve of 071 95 ci 064078 for a cutoff point of 2 the scoring system showed 425 sensitivity and 971 specificity but had poor calibration hosmerlemeshow test p value 0001 we believe that the development of this covid19 quick screening score may be helpful in a resourcelimited clinical setting but it moderate discrimination and poor calibration hinder it use a a replacement for the sarscov2 rtpcr test for covid19 screening

processed_title: sarscov2 infection during pregnancy and pregnancyrelated condition concern challenge management and mitigation strategiesa narrative review
processed_abstract: the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 is a global public health problem the sarscov2 trigger hyperactivation of inflammatory and immune response resulting in cytokine storm and increased inflammatory response on several organ like lung kidney intestine and placenta although sarscov2 affect individual of all age group and physiological status immunecompromised individual such a pregnant woman are considered a a highly vulnerable group this review aim to raise the concern of high risk of infection morbidity and mortality of covid19 in pregnant woman and provides critical review of pathophysiology and pathobiology of how sarscov2 infection potentially increase the severity and fatality during pregnancy this article also provides a discussion of current evidence on vertical transmission of sarscov2 during pregnancy and breastfeeding lastly guideline on management treatment preventive and mitigation strategy of sarscov2 infection during pregnancy and pregnancyrelated condition such a delivery and breastfeeding are discussed

processed_title: the role of the kynurenine pathway in covid19 neuropathogenesis
processed_abstract: the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 is the causative agent of the highly contagious respiratory disease corona virus disease 2019 covid19 that may lead to various neurological and psychological disorder that can be acute lasting day to week or month and possibly longer the latter is known a longcovid or more recently postacute sequela of covid pasc during acute covid19 infection a strong inflammatory response known a the cytokine storm occurs in some patient the level of interferongamma ifngamma interferonbeta ifnbeta interleukin6 il6 and tumour necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha are particularly increased these cytokine are known to activate the enzyme indoleamine 23dioxygenase 1 ido1 catalysing the first step of tryptophan trp catabolism through the kynurenine pathway kp leading to the production of several neurotoxic and immunosuppressive metabolite there is already data showing elevation in kp metabolite both acutely and in pasc especially regarding cognitive impairment thus it is likely that kp involvement is significant in sarscov2 pathogenesis especially neurologically

processed_title: understanding the potential impact of different drug property on severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 transmission and disease burden a modelling analysis
processed_abstract: background the public health impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic ha motivated a rapid search for potential therapeutic with some key success however the potential impact of different treatment and consequently research and procurement priority have not been clear method using a mathematical model of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 transmission covid19 disease and clinical care we explore the publichealth impact of different potential therapeutic under a range of scenario varying healthcare capacity epidemic trajectory and drug efficacy in the absence of supportive care result the impact of drug like dexamethasone delivered to the most criticallyill in hospital and whose therapeutic benefit is expected to depend on the availability of supportive care such a oxygen and mechanical ventilation is likely to be limited in setting where healthcare capacity is lowest or where uncontrolled epidemic result in hospital being overwhelmed a such it may avert 22 of death in highincome country but only 8 in lowincome country assuming r 135 therapeutic for different patient population those not in hospital early in the course of infection and type of benefit reducing disease severity or infectiousness preventing hospitalization could have much greater benefit particularly in resourcepoor setting facing large epidemic conclusion advance in the treatment of covid19 to date have been focused on hospitalizedpatients and predicated on an assumption of adequate access to supportive care therapeutic delivered earlier in the course of infection that reduce the need for healthcare or reduce infectiousness could have significant impact and research into their efficacy and mean of delivery should be a priority

processed_title: global and regional burden of hospital admission for severe acute lower respiratory infection in young child in 2010 a systematic analysis
processed_abstract: background the annual number of hospital admission and inhospital death due to severe acute lower respiratory infection alri in young child worldwide is unknown we aimed to estimate the incidence of admission and death for such infection in child younger than 5 year in 2010 method we estimated the incidence of admission for severe and very severe alri in child younger than 5 year stratified by age and region with data from a systematic review of study published between jan 1 1990 and march 31 2012 and from 28 unpublished populationbased study we applied these incidence estimate to population estimate for 2010 to calculate the global and regional burden in child admitted with severe alri in that year we estimated inhospital mortality due to severe and very severe alri by combining incidence estimate with case fatality ratio from hospitalbased study finding we identified 89 eligible study and estimated that in 2010 119 million 95 ci 103139 million episode of severe and 30 million 2142 million episode of very severe alri resulted in hospital admission in young child worldwide incidence wa higher in boy than in girl the sex disparity being greatest in south asian study on the basis of data from 37 hospital study reporting case fatality ratio for severe alri we estimated that roughly 265000 95 ci 160000450000 inhospital death took place in young child with 99 of these death in developing country therefore the data suggest that although 62 of child with severe alri are treated in hospital 81 of death happen outside hospital interpretation severe alri is a substantial burden on health service worldwide and a major cause of hospital referral and admission in young child improved hospital access and reduced inequity such a those related to sex and rural status could substantially decrease mortality related to such infection communitybased management of severe disease could be an important complementary strategy to reduce pneumonia mortality and health inequity funding who

processed_title: viral shedding and the durability of immunoglobulin g antibody to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2
processed_abstract: we followed 45 participant in surabaya indonesia for 10 month and compared their pcr and severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 immunoglobulin g igg result a much a 13 out of 45 participant were igg seropositive at least once while the remaining 32 stayed igg seronegative throughout the study among 13 seropositive participant 9 were consecutively seropositive at least twice and were eligible for igg longevity evaluation the duration of igg detection varied from 47 to 233 day we observed intermittent repositive pcr result suggestive of viral shedding in participant with a longer duration of igg detection

processed_title: housing sanitation and acute respiratory tract infection among undergraduate student in indonesia
processed_abstract: acute respiratory tract infection is a common infectious disease in student living in crowded housing in indonesia the aim of this study wa to investigate the association between air quality in boarding house and ari occurrence in student a cross sectional study wa undertaken on 89 house occupied by student in mulyorejo village mulyorejo subdistrict surabaya determined by using a systemic random sampling method population density ventilation temperature and humidity were measured the study concludes that there is significant association between the population density ventilation humidity and ari occurrence but not temperature therefore student boarding house should provide good air quality and sanitation to reduce the incidence of acute respiratory tract infection

processed_title: orbital cellulitis clinically mimicking rhabdomyosarcoma
processed_abstract: introduction proptosis in child with acuteonset accompanied by sign of inflammation is commonly caused by orbital cellulitis however the possibility of rhabdomyosarcoma should always be considered by the clinician this is a case report of a fiveyearold boy presenting with an acuteonset of proptosis without a history of trauma and systemic infection our clinical differential diagnosis included orbital cellulitis and orbital rhabdomyosarcoma purpose to report a case of orbital cellulitis that clinically and radiologically mimic rhabdomyosarcoma case presentation a fiveyearold boy presented with rapidonset proptosis periorbital edema pain and visual loss in the left eye for two week without a history of trauma upper respiratory tract infection sinusitis or immunosuppression our clinical differential diagnosis includes rhabdomyosarcoma and orbital cellulitis complete blood count reveals a leukocytosis multislice computed tomography msct scan show lesion involving the lateral orbit and the retro bulbar space antibiotic combination and adjunct antiinflammatory intravenously show excellent clinical resolution conclusion the study demonstrates difficulty in differentiating acute orbital cellulitis from rhabdomyosarcoma based on clinical finding in addition the case highlight that antibiotic combination of cephalosporin and aminoglycosides together with an adjuvant corticosteroid a an antiinflammatory wa effective in the case of acute orbital cellulitis

processed_title: the recent reemergence of human monkeypox would it become endemic beyond africa
processed_abstract: viral outbreak still become global health challenge for instance influenza a virus japanese encephalitis ebola virus yellow fever and severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 since 7 may 2022 another outbreak of monkeypox also ha been reported in european country and the united state meanwhile the monkeypox virus is previously endemic only in the western and central part of africa monkeypox is a zoonotic disease although the primary animal reservoir remains unknown this article concisely review the monkeypox virus it transmission pathogenesis and clinical manifestation it changing global epidemiology before and during the current outbreak and possible driving factor of the recent outbreak furthermore we also discus whether the monkeypox virus would become endemic beyond africa even though the available data suggests that humantohuman transmission is currently happening and unconnected cluster exist many effort have been made to tackle this outbreak such a active case detection contact tracing isolation and postexposure vaccination

processed_title: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 a literature review
processed_abstract: in early december 2019 an outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 caused by a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 occurred in wuhan city hubei province china on january 30 2020 the world health organization declared the outbreak a a public health emergency of international concern a of february 14 2020 49053 laboratoryconfirmed and 1381 death have been reported globally perceived risk of acquiring disease ha led many government to institute a variety of control measure we conducted a literature review of publicly available information to summarize knowledge about the pathogen and the current epidemic in this literature review the causative agent pathogenesis and immune response epidemiology diagnosis treatment and management of the disease control and prevention strategy are all reviewed

processed_title: sarscov2 reinfection and implication for vaccine development
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic continues to constitute a public health emergency of international concern multiple vaccine candidate for covid19 which is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 have entered clinical trial however some evidence suggests that patient who have recovered from covid19 can be reinfected for example in china two discharged covid19 patient who had recovered and fulfilled the discharge criterion for covid19 were retested positive to a reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr assay for the virus this finding is critical and could hamper covid19 vaccine development this review offer literaturebased evidence of reinfection with sarscov2 provides explanation for the possibility of sarscov2 reinfection both from the agent and host point of view and discusses it implication for covid19 vaccine development

processed_title: mother knowledge of breastfeeding and infant feeding type affect acute respiratory infection
processed_abstract: introduction world health organization who recommends exclusive breastfeeding for newborn until 6 month of age however exclusive breastfeeding in indonesia only reached 523 in 2014 and 6516 in 2018 it is known that administration of infant formula and nonformula supplement to infant aged less than 6 month increase the risk of acute respiratory infection aris in addition the high prevalence of aris in infant in sleman regency indonesia indicates the need of optimal early prevention therefore we conducted this study to confirm that mother knowledge of breastfeeding and infant feeding type affect the prevalence of acute respiratory infection aris method data were collected through questionnaire from 50 mother with infant aged 712 month who had experienced aris in the last 3 month case group and 50 mother with healthy infant control group collected data were then analysed using chisquare logistic regression lambda and somers d test result the result showed that type of infant feeding are associated with the prevalence of aris nonbreastfed infant were 14 time riskier to contract aris mother knowledge of exclusive breastfeeding influenced their preference of feeding practice however their attitude towards breastfeeding did not appear to significantly affect their choice of feeding practice conclusion exclusive breastfeeding during the first 6 month of an infant life can lower the prevalence of aris for when they are older mother good knowledge of breastfeeding is associated with it practice

processed_title: a systematic review of clinical prediction rule for the diagnosis of influenza
processed_abstract: background clinical prediction rule cpr can assist clinician by focusing their clinical evaluation on the most important sign and symptom and if used properly can reduce the need for diagnostic testing this study aim to perform an updated systematic review of clinical prediction rule and classification and regression tree cart model for the diagnosis of influenza method we searched pubmed cinahl and embase database we identified prospective study of patient presenting with suspected influenza or respiratory infection and that reported a cpr in the form of a risk score or cartbased algorithm study had to report at a minimum the percentage of patient in each risk group with influenza study were evaluated for inclusion and data were extracted by reviewer working in parallel accuracy wa summarized descriptively where not reported by the author the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve aurocc predictive value and likelihood ratio were calculated result we identified 10 study that presented 14 cpr the most commonly included predictor variable were cough fever chill andor sweat myalgia and acute onset all which can be ascertained by phone or telehealth visit most cpr had an aurocc between 07 and 08 indicating good discrimination however only 1 rule ha undergone prospective external validation with limited success data reporting by the original study wa in some case inadequate to determine measure of accuracy conclusion welldesigned validation study study of interrater reliability between telehealth an inperson assessment and study using novel data mining and artificial intelligence strategy are needed to improve diagnosis of this common and important infection

processed_title: coronavirus disease 2019 vaccine development an overview
processed_abstract: to this day the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic ha not shown sign of abating moreover the virus responsible for the pandemic severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 ha evolved into three different variant this phenomenon highlight an even greater need to develop drug and vaccine to control the rate of infection and spread of the disease a of july 7 2020 at least 160 vaccine candidate 21 of which have entered the clinical trial phase have been developed this article describes the latest advance in development reliable platform strategy used and challenge that remain in developing covid19 vaccine

processed_title: molecular mechanism of acute sarcopenia in elderly patient with covid 19
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 case fatality rate ha been on the rise among older adult muscle loss is a consequence of several chronic disease chronic sarcopenia and recent theory also suggested that acute sarcopenia may caused by acute significant stressor such a an acute illness surgery infection trauma or burn including covid19 infection leading to further muscle loss in elderly cytokine storm the hallmark of covid19 pathogenesis will induce various proinflammatory cytokine such a il1 and il6 causing acute sarcopenia by activating negative regulator like nfkappab atrogin1 murf1 long standing chronic inflammation also known a inflammaging along with acute inflammation during covid19 in elderly will cause reticulum endoplasmic and mitochondrion stress activating caspase and finally increase both cytosolic and nuclear level of aif and endog to induce acute sarcopenia several precipitating factor shared same molecular pathway like physical inactivity and hormonal dysregulation which act through igf1aktmtor pathway physical inactivity during covid19 infection also induced myostatin and atrogin1 mafbx murf pathway this review provides recent research advance dealing with molecular pathway modulating muscle mass in acute sarcopenia during covid19 infection

processed_title: outcome in early v late intubation among covid19 patient with acute respiratory distress syndrome an updated systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: timing of endotracheal intubation in covid19 patient with acute respiratory distress syndrome ards remains controversial regarding it risk and benefit in patient outcome our study aim to elucidate early versus late intubation outcome among covid19 patient with ards a protocol of this study is registered at the international prospective register of systematic review prospero crd42021230272 we report our systematic review based on prisma and moose guideline we searched the cochrane library ebscohost embase grey literature report opengrey proquest pubmed and sciencedirect from inception until 4 december 2021 title and abstract were reviewed for their relevance the risk of bias in each study wa evaluated using the risk of bias in nonrandomised studiesof intervention robinsi guideline trial sequential analysis is done to elucidate firm evidence we retrieved 20 observational study that assessed an intervention early v late intubation metaanalysis for inhospital mortality reduction showed 119 fewer death per 1000 patient in early intubation early intubation reduces 281 day of icu length of stay los and 212 day of ventilation duration benefit for mortality and icu los reduction were based on study with low to moderate risk of bias while ventilation duration wa based on low disease burden setting according to the contextualized approach the benefit of mortality reduction showed a trivial effect while icu los and ventilation duration showed a small effect grade certainty of evidence for mortality reduction in early intubation is moderate the certainty of evidence for icu length of stay ventilation duration ventilatorfree day and continuous renal replacement therapy are very low this updated systematic review provided new evidence that early intubation might provide benefit in treating covid19 patient with ards the benefit of early intubation appear to have an important but small effect based on contextualized approach for icu los and ventilation duration in reducing inhospital mortality the early intubation effect wa present but only trivial based on contextualized approach tsa showed that more study are needed to elucidate firmer evidence

processed_title: pulmonary fibrosis caused by severe covid19 infection discharge may not be the end of treatment
processed_abstract: since december 2019 covid19 caused by sarscov2 infection ha been spread rapidly in the world beside acute respiratory distress syndrome found in acute phase of infection there is also pulmonary fibrosis a a chronic complication due to covid19 with the global pandemic of covid19 more and more autopsy and puncture histopathological result have been publisheduntil now there is no specific therapy to handle postinflammatory pulmonary fibrosis due to covid19 infection several study are ongoing to determine an effective treatment for this chronic complication while ards appears to be the main cause of pulmonary fibrosis in covid19 the pathogenesis of ards caused by sarscov2 is different from the typical ards some therapy may be considered for reducing the fibrosis process in lung after covi19 infection namely pirfenidone nintedanib and mesenchymal stem cell many patient are still recovering spontaneously in the first six week after acute covid19 infection and do not generally require fasttrack entry into a pulmonary rehabilitation programme however those who have significantly persistent respiratory illness may need to be supported by pulmonary rehabilitation multidisciplinary intervention based on personalized evaluation and treatment which includes exercise training education and behavioral modification can be given to improve the physical and psychological condition of patient with postcovid pulmonary fibrosis

processed_title: evaluation of rational drug use for acute pharyngitis associated with the incidence and prevalence of the disease at two community health center in indonesia
processed_abstract: according to indonesia result of basic health research of 2013 prevalence of acute respiratory infection in 2007 and 2013 were not significantly different 255 and 250 respectively identifying the cause of acute pharyngitis is a key point in determining the optimal treatment the main purpose is to evaluate the rational use of drug and it irrational impact a well a the correlation of the drug use with the incidence and prevalence of acute pharyngitis this study wa a descriptive and observational study carried out retrospectively and concurrently at two community health center located in bandung and cimahi indonesia there wa overprescription of antibiotic in 8001 of prescription case with a total of 898 being nontreatment option and 6243 being irrational use of corticosteroid the incidence and prevalence of acute pharyngitis at one health center in bandung were 245 and 231 respectively with an irrationality rate of 8382 those recorded at one health center in cimahi were 211 incidence and 200 prevalence with an irrational rate of 9129 it can be concluded that there is still an irrational use of medicine in the treatment of acute pharyngitis in community health center the higher incidence and prevalence might indicate the declining quality of health service

processed_title: psychiatric sequela in covid19 survivor a narrative review
processed_abstract: in december 2019 a novel coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus2 sarscov2 wa initially reported in wuhan china previous epidemic including sars and middle east respiratory syndrome raise concern that covid19 infection may pose a significant threat to the mental health of affected individual study and review have shown the acute psychiatric manifestation in covid19 patient although long term psychiatric sequela are predicted there are only few review study about the long term psychiatry outcome in covid19 survivor clinically significant posttraumatic stress disorder anxiety andor depression among covid19 survivor during 1490 d were observed following the diagnosis risk of anxiety or depression were higher in patient with more severe illness at 6 mo followup early convalescence and at 1 mo followup diagnosis of covid19 led to more first diagnosis and relapse of psychiatric illness during the first 1490 d after covid19 diagnosis the possible underlying mechanism of psychiatric sequela in covid19 infection are neurotropism immune response to sarscov2 hypothalamopituitaryadrenal axis hyperactivity disrupted neuronal circuit in several brain region increased stress level neuroinflammation and neuronal death this study will review the psychiatric sequela in previous coronavirus pandemic current study risk factor and thorough explanation on pathophysiology of the psychiatric sequalae in covid19 survivor

processed_title: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 update from metabolic reprogramming to immunometabolism
processed_abstract: the field of immunometabolism investigates and describes the effect of metabolic rewiring in immune cell throughout activation and the fate of these cell recently it ha been appreciated that immunometabolism play an essential role in the progression of viral infection cancer and autoimmune disease regarding covid19 the aberrant immune response underlying the progression of disease establishes two major respiratory pathology including acute respiratory distress syndrome ards or pneumoniainduced acute lung injury ali both innate and adaptive immunity t cellbased were impaired in the course of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 infection current finding have deciphered that macrophage innate immune cell are involved in the inflammatory response seen in covid19 it ha been demonstrated that immune system cell can change metabolic reprogramming in some condition including autoimmune disease cancer and infectious disease including covid19 the growing finding on metabolic reprogramming in covid19 allow an exploration of metabolite with immunomodulatory property a future therapy to combat this hyperinflammatory response the elucidation of the exact role and mechanism underlying this metabolic reprograming in immune cell could help apply more precise approach to initial diagnosis prognosis and inhospital therapy this report discusses the latest finding from covid19 on host metabolic reprogramming and immunometabolic response

processed_title: the effect of mouth rinsing and gargling with mouthwash containing povidoneiodine and hydrogen peroxide on the cycle threshold value of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 a randomized controlled trial of asymptomatic and mildly symptomatic patient
processed_abstract: background coronavirus disease 2019 can spread rapidly surgery in the oral cavity pose a high risk of transmission of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 the american dental association and the center for disease control and prevention recommend the use of mouthwash containing 15 hydrogen peroxide h 2o 2 or 02 povidone iodine pi to reduce the viral load in the upper respiratory tract and decrease the risk of transmission the aim of the present study wa to analyze the effect of mouth rinsing and gargling with mouthwash containing 1 pi 05 pi 3 h 2o 2 or 15 h 2o 2 and water on the cycle threshold ct value obtained by realtime reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr method this study is a randomized single blind controlled clinical trial which ha been registered in the international standard randomized controlled trial number isrctn registry on the 3 rd february 2022 registration number isrctn18356379 in total 69 subject recruited from persahabatan general hospital who met the inclusion criterion were randomly assigned to one of four treatment group or the control group the subject were instructed to gargle with 15 ml of mouthwash for 30 s in the oral cavity followed by 30 s in the back of the throat three time per day for 5 day ct value were collected on postprocedural day 1 3 and 5 result the result of the friedman test significantly differed among the group n15 the ct value increased from baseline day 0 to postprocedural day 1 3 and 5 conclusion mouth rinsing and gargling with mouthwash containing 1 pi 05 pi 3 h 2o 2 or 15 h 2o 2 and water increased the ct value

processed_title: diagnosis and management of latent tuberculosis infection in asia review of current status and challenge
processed_abstract: asia ha the highest burden of tuberculosis tb and latent tb infection ltbi in the world optimizing the diagnosis and treatment of ltbi is one of the key strategy for achieving the who end tb target we report the discussion from the asia latent tuberculosis alter expert panel meeting held in 2018 in singapore in this meeting a group of 13 tb expert from bangladesh cambodia hong kong india indonesia malaysia myanmar the philippine singapore taiwan thailand and vietnam convened to review the literature discus the barrier and propose strategy to improve the management of ltbi in asia strategy for the optimization of risk group prioritization diagnosis treatment and research of ltbi are reported the perspective presented herein may help national program and professional society of the respective country enhance the adoption of the who guideline scaleup the implementation of national guideline based on the regional need and provide optimal guidance to clinician for the programmatic management of ltbi

processed_title: sarscov2 covid19 and the debunking of conspiracy theory
processed_abstract: the emergence of a novel human coronavirus severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 ha engaged considerable awareness and attention around the world the associated disease coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 ha now involved virtually all 200 country the total number of confirmed case ha been much more than in the two previous outbreak of human coronaviruses that is sarscov and middle east respiratory syndrome coronavirus in line with the outbreak escalation false information about sarscov2 and it associated disease disseminated globally particularly through online and social medium believer in conspiracy theory promote misinformation that the virus is not contagious is the result of laboratory manipulation or is created to gain profit by distributing new vaccine the most dangerous effect of this widely disseminated misinformation is it will negatively influence the attitude and behaviour for preventive measure to contain the outbreak in this review i discus common conspiracy theory associated with sarscov2 and covid19 and consider how we can address and counterbalance these issue based on scientific information and study

processed_title: global burden of influenzaassociated lower respiratory tract infection and hospitalization among adult a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background influenza illness burden is substantial particularly among young child older adult and those with underlying condition initiative are underway to develop better global estimate for influenzaassociated hospitalization and death knowledge gap remain regarding the role of influenza virus in severe respiratory disease and hospitalization among adult particularly in lowerincome setting method and finding we aggregated published data from a systematic review and unpublished data from surveillance platform to generate global metaanalytic estimate for the proportion of acute respiratory hospitalization associated with influenza virus among adult we searched 9 online database medline embase cinahl cochrane library scopus global health lilac wholis and cnki 1 january 199631 december 2016 to identify observational study of influenzaassociated hospitalization in adult and assessed eligible paper for bias using a simplified newcastleottawa scale for observational data we applied metaanalytic proportion to global estimate of lower respiratory infection lris and hospitalization from the global burden of disease study in adult 20 year and by age group 2064 year and 65 year to obtain the number of influenzaassociated lri episode and hospitalization for 2016 data from 63 source showed that influenza wa associated with 141 95 ci 121165 of acute respiratory hospitalization among all adult with no significant difference by age group the 63 data source represent published observational study n 28 and unpublished surveillance data n 35 from all world health organization region africa n 8 america n 11 eastern mediterranean n 7 europe n 8 southeast asia n 11 western pacific n 18 data quality for published data source wa predominantly moderate or high 75 n 5675 we estimate 32126000 95 ci 2048400046129000 influenzaassociated lri episode and 5678000 95 ci 32050009432000 lri hospitalization occur each year among adult while adult 65 year contribute most influenzaassociated lri hospitalization and episode 3464000 95 ci 18850005978000 lri hospitalization and 31087000 95 ci 1998700044444000 lri episode hospitalization rate were highest in those 65 year 437100000 personyears 95 ci 265612100000 personyears for this analysis published article were limited in their inclusion of stratified testing data by year and age group lack of information regarding influenza vaccination of the study population wa also a limitation across both type of data source conclusion in this metaanalysis we estimated that influenza virus are associated with over 5 million hospitalization worldwide per year inclusion of both published and unpublished finding allowed for increased power to generate stratified estimate and improved representation from lowerincome country together the available data demonstrate the importance of influenza virus a a cause of severe disease and hospitalization in younger and older adult worldwide

processed_title: perspective on targeting il6 a a potential therapeutic strategy for covid19
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 and ha been a major threat to global public health in indonesia the case have rapidly increased and the case fatality rate remains high with covid19 most of the death have been caused by acute respiratory distress syndrome and dysregulation of the immune response a lung biopsy from a patient with covid19 showed inflammatory cellular infiltration with diffuse alveolar damage massive pulmonary destruction ha also been reported a a result of highly increased level of proinflammatory cytokine such a tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha interleukin6 il6 il1beta interferongamma ifngamma induced protein 10 ip10 and monocyte chemoattractant protein1 mcp1 il6 is an inflammatory cytokine produced by various cell type including immune cell and nonleukocytes such a endothelial cell fibroblast epithelial cell type ii pneumocytes and certain tumor cell several study have shown that il6 contributes to the severity and mortality of covid19 in this review we would like to explore the immune response in covid19 and the role of il6 in the immunopathogenesis of covid19

processed_title: sexual dimorphism in sarscov2 infection
processed_abstract: previous study have demonstrated that female patient with coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 demonstrate more favorable prognosis relative to male patient in this article we elaborate the possible role of estrogen in the modulation of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 infection severity the potential interplay between several factor including inherently lower estradiol e2 and slightly higher estrogen receptor beta erbeta level in male with inflammatory mediator are described altogether there seems to be a sexually dimorphic response towards sarscov2 infection and a possibility that covid19 severity is dependent on both e2 level and eralphaerbeta expression ratio in lymphoid and lung cell

processed_title: immunological dysfunction and mast cell activation syndrome in long covid
processed_abstract: at least 65 million people around the world suffer from long covid19 with the majority of case occurring in the productive age 3650 year old individual with long covid19 are confounded with multiple organ system dysfunction longterm organ injury sequela and a decreased quality of life there is an overlapping of risk factor between long covid19 and other postviral infection syndrome so advance in research could also benefit other group of patient long covid19 is the consequence of multiple immune system dysregulation such a tcell depletion innate immune cell hyperactivity lack of naive t and b cell and elevated signature of proinflammatory cytokine together with persistent severe acute respiratory syndromecoronavirus 2 reservoir and other consequence of acute infection there is an activated condition of mast cell in long covid19 with abnormal granulation and excessive inflammatory cytokine release a study by weinstock et al indicates that patient with long covid19 suffer the same clinical syndrome a patient with mast cell activation syndrome mcas diagnosis and treatment of mcas in patient with long covid19 will provide further symptomatic relief and manage mast cellmediated hyperinflammation state which could be useful in the longterm control and recovery of such patient

processed_title: respiratory infection following earthquakeinduced tsunami transmission risk factor and lesson learned for disaster risk management
