processed_abstract: earthquakeinduced tsunami have the potential to cause extensive damage to natural and built environment and are often associated with fatality injury and infectious disease outbreak this review aim to examine the occurrence of respiratory infection ri and to elucidate the risk factor of ri transmission following tsunami which were induced by earthquake in the last 20 year fortyseven article were included in this review and referred to the ri emergence following the 2004 sumatraandaman the 2009 samoa and the 2011 japan earthquake polymicrobial ri were commonly detected among neardrowned tsunami survivor influenza outbreak were commonly detected during the influenza transmission period overcrowded condition in evacuation center contributed to increased acute ri incidence rate measles transmission and tuberculosis detection destruction of health care infrastructure overcrowded evacuation shelter exposure to high pathogen density aggravating weather condition regional disease endemicity and low vaccination coverage were the major triggering factor of ri occurrence in posttsunami disaster setting knowledge of risk factor underlying ri emergence following earthquakeinduced tsunami can contribute to the implementation of appropriate disaster prevention and preparedness plan characterized by sufficient environmental planning resistant infrastructure resilient health care facility and wellestablished evacuation center global and local disease surveillance is a key prerequisite for early warning and protection against ri emergence and transmission in tsunamiprone area

processed_title: postcovid syndrome prevalence a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background since the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic began the number of individual recovering from covid19 infection have increased postcovid syndrome or pc which is defined a sign and symptom that develop during or after infection in line with covid19 continue beyond 12 week and are not explained by an alternative diagnosis ha also gained attention we systematically reviewed and determined the pooled prevalence estimate of pc worldwide based on published literature method relevant article from the web of science scopus pubmed cochrane library and ovid medline database were screened using a preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysesguided systematic search process the included study were in english published from january 2020 to april 2024 had overall pc prevalence a one of the outcome studied involved a human population with confirmed covid19 diagnosis and undergone assessment at 12 week postcovid infection or beyond a the primary outcome measured the pooled prevalence of pc wa estimated from a metaanalysis of the pc prevalence data extracted from individual study which wa conducted via the randomeffects model this study ha been registered on prospero crd42023435280 result forty eight study met the eligibility criterion and were included in this review 16 were accepted for metaanalysis to estimate the pooled prevalence for pc worldwide which wa 4179 95 confidence interval ci 39704388 i2 51 p 003 based on different assessment or followup timepoints after acute covid19 infection pc prevalence estimated at 3rd 6th and 12th month timepoints were each 4506 95 ci 41254887 4130 95 ci 34374824 and 4132 95 ci 39274337 respectively sexstratified pc prevalence wa estimated at 4723 95 ci 44035042 in male and 5277 95 ci 49585597 in female based on continental region pooled pc prevalence wa estimated at 4628 95 ci 39535303 in europe 4629 95 ci 35825677 in america 4979 95 ci 30056954 in asia and 4241 95 ci 0009006 in australia conclusion the prevalence estimate in this metaanalysis could be used in further comprehensive study on pc which might enable the development of better pc management plan to reduce the effect of pc on population health and the related economic burden

processed_title: global role and burden of influenza in pediatric respiratory hospitalization 19822012 a systematic analysis
processed_abstract: background the global burden of pediatric severe respiratory illness is substantial and influenza virus contribute to this burden systematic surveillance and testing for influenza among hospitalized child ha expanded globally over the past decade however only a fraction of the data ha been used to estimate influenza burden in this analysis we use surveillance data to provide an estimate of influenzaassociated hospitalization among child worldwide method and finding we aggregated data from a systematic review n 108 and surveillance platform n 37 to calculate a pooled estimate of the proportion of sample collected from child hospitalized with respiratory illness and positive for influenza by age group 6 mo 1 y 2 y 5 y 517 y and 18 y we applied this proportion to global estimate of acute lower respiratory infection hospitalization among child aged 1 y and 5 y to obtain the number and per caput rate of influenzaassociated hospitalization by geographic region and socioeconomic status influenza wa associated with 10 95 ci 811 of respiratory hospitalization in child 18 y worldwide ranging from 5 95 ci 37 among child 6 mo to 16 95 ci 1420 among child 517 y on average we estimated that influenza result in approximately 374000 95 ci 264000 to 539000 hospitalization in child 1 yof which 228000 95 ci 150000 to 344000 occur in child 6 moand 870000 95 ci 610000 to 1237000 hospitalization in child 5 y annually influenzaassociated hospitalization rate were more than three time higher in developing country than in industrialized country 150100000 childrenyear versus 48100000 however difference in hospitalization practice between setting are an important limitation in interpreting these finding conclusion influenza is an important contributor to respiratory hospitalization among young child worldwide increasing influenza vaccination coverage among young child and pregnant woman could reduce this burden and protect infant 6 mo

processed_title: maternal agency influence the prevalence of diarrhea and acute respiratory tract infection among young indonesian child
processed_abstract: to examine the relationship between measure of mother caretaking practice and individual agency on acute diarrhea and respiratory tract infection artis of indonesian child using populationbased household data from the indonesian demographic health survey for 20022003 n 9151 child and 2007 n 9714 child we selected 28 indicator related to mother caretaking and applied principal component analysis to derive index for access to care practice and experience and agency the association between index quartile level 14 and the prevalence of diarrhea and artis in the youngest child 5 year of age wa assessed with multivariate logistic regression adjusting for socioeconomic status residence type mother age and education family size child age and sex immunization status and received vitamin a supplementation moderate level level 3 of practice and experience were associated with decreased diarrheal risk adjusted or 086 95 ci 075098 but not for artis child of mother with higher level level 4 of agency were protected against both diarrhea adjusted or 068 95 ci 060077 and artis adjusted or 077 95 ci 066091 stratified analysis with child age and mother education and test of interaction showed that agency had a stronger effect on diarrhea and artis prevalence in child 2 year of age maternal caretaking especially agency is strongly associated with lower prevalence of diarrhea and artis in younger child intervention specifically designed to promote maternal autonomy and decisionmaking may lead to improved child health

processed_title: coronavirus disease 2019 and cardiovascular system a narrative review
processed_abstract: at the end of 2019 a viral pneumonia disease called coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 which is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus2 sarscov2 emerged in wuhan china this novel disease rapidly spread at an alarming rate that a a result it ha now been declared pandemic by the world health organization although this infective disease is mostly characterized by respiratory tract symptom increasing number of evidence had shown considerable amount of patient with cardiovascular involvement and these were associated with higher mortality among covid19 patient cardiac involvement a a possible late phenomenon of the viral respiratory infection is an issue that should be anticipated in patient with covid19 cardiovascular manifestation in covid19 patient include myocardial injury mi arrhythmia cardiac arrest heart failure and coagulation abnormality ranging from 72 up to 33 the mechanism of cardiac involvement in covid19 patient involves direct injury to myocardial cell mediated by angiotensinconverting enzyme 2 ace2 receptor a suggested by some study while the other study suggest that systemic inflammation causing indirect myocyte injury may also play a role combination of proper triage close monitoring and avoidance of some drug that have cardiovascular toxicity are important in the management of cardiovascular system involvement in covid19 patient the involvement of the cardiovascular system in covid19 patient is prevalent variable and debilitating therefore it requires our attention and comprehensive management

processed_title: covid19 pandemic in indonesia situation and challenge of rehabilitation medicine in indonesia
processed_abstract: abstrakcovid19 telah menjadi pandemik di indonesia sejak ditemukannya kasus pertama pada tanggal 2 maret 2020 di depok peningkatan kasus perhari semakin tinggi sejak akhir agustus 2020 yang mencapai lebih dari 2000 kasus per hari sistem kesehatan di indonesia perlu ditingkatkan dalam hal kapasitas termasuk rehabilitasi medik yang harus dilibatkan dari fase akut hingga jangka panjang dalam penanganan pasien covid19 rehabilitasi medik juga diperlukan untuk pasien lain yang bukan covid19 pentingnya keterlibatan pelayanan rehabilitasi medik dan implementasinya dimasa pandemic covid19 memerlukan strategi tersendiri yang harus dilakukan baik oleh pekerja kesehatannya rumah sakit dan kebijakan pemerintah hal ini diperlukan untuk percepatan peningkatan kesehatan pasien percepatan pemulangan dan menghindari readmisi pasien dan juga pengoptimalan program kembali bekerja untuk pasien yang sembuh dari covid19abstractcovid19 ha become a pandemic in indonesia since the first case have been positively diagnosed on 2 march 2020 in depok the case have been increased gradually since the end of august 2020 that ha reached 1000 case per day the health system in indonesia need to be improved in term of capacity including rehabilitation medicine that should be involved in all health phase from acute to longterm in managing patient with covid19 rehabilitation is also still needed for other noncovid19 patient the importance of involvement and implementation of rehabilitation service during the covid19 pandemic will need special strategy that should be done by rehabilitation professional hospital and government these are necessary to accelerate the improvement of patient health discharge and avoid readmission a well a optimize returntowork for patient who are recovered from covid19

processed_title: coinfection of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 and polyomavirus in a patient with coronavirus disease 2019 detected by enrichment nextgeneration sequencing a case report
processed_abstract: background severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 wa found first in wuhan and declared a pandemic by the world health organization coinfection with other respiratory virus may occur complicating the diagnosis and treatment of coronavirus disease 2019 herein we identified a karolinska institute polyomavirus stockholm 60 present in a nasopharyngeal swab of a patient with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 infection using nextgeneration sequencing with an enrichment method case presentation a 24yearold indonesian woman wa admitted to our institution due to a cough cold and sore throat she had no family history of hypertension and diabetes mellitus and she wa well her vital sign were a follows heart rate 84 beat per minute respiratory rate 22 breath per minute temperature 39 degree c and pulse oximetry 96 on room air she had runny nose and slightly inflamed pharynx her nasopharyngeal swab and realtime polymerase chain reaction were positive for the coronavirus disease 2019 nucleocapsid and open reading frame gene with cycle threshold value of 3233 and 3374 respectively wholegenome sequencing of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 wa performed using the nextera dna flex for enrichment using the respiratory virus oligos panel illumina miseq instrument and illumina miseq reagent v3 150 cycle 2 x 75 cycle the full genome were aligned to the reference genome nc_0455122 by the burrowwheeler aligner algorithm the wholegenome sequencing showed coinfection of karolinska institute polyomavirus stockholm 60 nc_0092381 with an overall coverage of 3561x the patient wa given acetaminophen vitamin c vitamin d and zinc for the treatment and discharged uneventfully from the hospital 4 day after admission then 2 week after discharge she visited the outpatient clinic without any further concern conclusion this report present a case of karolinska institute polyomavirus and severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 coinfection in a patient with nonspecific clinical manifestation further study with a larger sample size are mandatory to clarify the association between severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 and karolinska institute polyomavirus coinfection particularly on patient outcome moreover the result propose the usefulness of enrichmentbased nextgeneration sequencing in detecting viral coinfection in patient with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2

processed_title: acute respiratory illness in child under five year in indramayu west java indonesia a rapid ethnographic assessment
processed_abstract: a rapid focused ethnographic study wa carried out in a rural area of west java indonesia to identify local belief perception and practice surrounding acute respiratory infection ari in infant and young child the study incorporates key informant interview openended interview and structured data collection from fifty mother of young child selected to represent the geographical settlement pattern in the area structured interview with biomedical and indigenous health care provider and structured interview with fifty mother who sought health care for an infant or young child with a respiratory illness the most commonly perceived cause for ari in child wa air entering the body through some type of chill exposure to draft or breeze or change of weather when fever or difficult breathing wa present mother tended to increase the number and diversity the type of medicine used mother recognized difficult a well a rapid breathing both being described a difficult breathing more concern wa expressed about fever than about difficulty in breathing effective medical care wa more likely to be delayed for infant than for older child infant were also more likely to be taken to an indigenous healer a the firstchoice provider infant were less likely to receive an effective drug regimen even if appropriate medication wa prescribed because mother commonly take the drug in order to deliver them to the infant through breast milk

processed_title: immunotherapy and immunomodulatory approach in clinical trial a mini review
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease covid19 pandemic caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 ha created havoc worldwide due to the nonavailability of any vaccine or drug against covid19 immunotherapy involving convalescent plasma immunoglobulin antibody monoclonal or polyclonal and the use of immunomodulatory agent to enhance immunity are valuable alternative option cellbased therapy including natural killer cell t cell stem cell along with cytokine and tolllike receptor tlrs based therapy are also being exploited potentially against covid19 future research need to strengthen the field of developing effective immunotherapeutics and immunomodulators with a thrust of providing appropriate affordable convenient and costeffective prophylactic and treatment regimen to combat global covid19 crisis that ha led to a state of medical emergency enforcing entire country of the world to devote their research infrastructure and manpower in tackling this pandemic

processed_title: humoral immune mechanism involved in protective and pathological immunity during covid19
processed_abstract: the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 causing covid19 is associated with excessive inflammation a a main reason for severe condition and death increased inflammatory cytokine and humoral response to sarscov2 correlate with covid19 immunity and pathogenesis importantly the level of proinflammatory cytokine that increase profoundly in systemic circulation appear a part of the clinical picture of two overlapping condition sepsis and the hemophagocytic syndrome both condition can develop lethal inflammatory response that lead to tissue damage however in many patient hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis hlh can be differentiated from sepsis this is a key issue because the lifesaving aggressive immunosuppressive treatment required in the hlh therapy is absent in sepsis guideline this paper aim to describe the pathophysiology and clinical relevance of these distinct entity in the course of covid19 that resemble sepsis and further highlight two effector arm of the humoral immune response inflammatory cytokine and immunoglobulin production during covid19 infection

processed_title: the prevalence predictor and outcome of acute liver injury among patient with covid19 a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: the data on the predictor and prognosis of acute liver injury ali among patient in coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 patient are limited the aim of this study wa to determine the prevalence predictor and outcome of ali among patient with covid19 a systematic review wa conducted up to 10 june 2021 the relevant paper were searched from pubmed embase cochrane and web of science and the data were analysed using a z test a total of 1331 paper were identified and 16 paper consisting of 1254 covid19 with ali and 4999 covid19 without ali were analysed the cumulative prevalence of ali among patient with covid19 wa 228 male and having low lymphocyte level were more likely to be associated with ali compared with female and having higher lymphocyte level odds ratio or 270 95 confidence interval ci 203 360 and mean difference md 125 95 ci 207 43 respectively covid19 patient with ali had higher risk of developing severe covid19 compared with those without ali or 361 95 ci 260 502 our finding may serve a the additional evaluation for the management of ali in covid19 patient

processed_title: inflammatory mechanism and clinical implication of asthma in covid19
processed_abstract: asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease of the respiratory tract that ha become a public health problem in various country referring to the global initiative for asthma the prevalence of asthma continues to increase especially in child coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 that ha declared a pandemic by the world health organization on march 2020 for many year it ha been known that people with asthma have a worse impact on respiratory viral infection asthma ha been listed by the center for disease control and prevention a one of the risk factor for covid19 although several study have different result sarscov2 utilizes angiotensinconverting enzyme 2 ace2 a it cellular receptor and it ha been known that the expression of the ace2 receptor is reduced in asthma patient this reduced expression could also be accounted from the therapy of asthma this paper aim to discus the pathophysiology of asthma and covid19 and the susceptibility of asthma patient in contracting covid19

processed_title: national consensus on geriatric immunization 2011
processed_abstract: a the growth of elderly population increase the number of geriatric patient who may demand health care service is also increasing since the elderly are more vulnerable to various condition of acute illness upper respiratory tract infection are the leading cause of death and the most significant cause that impairs quality of life in the elderly upper respiratory tract infection and influenza are common in the elderly and may develop into pneumonia considering the high morbidity and mortality rate related to pneumonia in the elderly it is important to have prevention strategy a delay in diagnosis due to nonspecific sign and symptom of pneumonia in the elderly ha demanded greater concern on the importance of pneumonia prevention strategy influenza and pneumonia impair quality of life in the elderly resulted in decreased functional status adl score during infection and recovery period with increasing antibiotic resistance the management may be complicated a it may lead to condition that reduce quality of life and cause high mortality rate therefore immunization is very important a the prevention strategy against influenza and or pneumonia reducing the incidence a well a the complication the consensus ha been made in order to provide immunization against influenza and pneumonia for elderly population in indonesia it is expected that by 2025 about 60 of the elderly in indonesia would have immunization against influenza and 50 of them would have immunization against pneumonia annually

processed_title: potency of mesenchymal stem cell and it secretome in treating covid19
processed_abstract: abstract the covid19 disease which is caused by the novel coronavirus sarscov2 ha affected the world by increasing the mortality rate in 2020 currently there is no definite treatment for covid19 patient several clinical trial have been proposed to overcome this disease and many are still under investigation in this review we will be focusing on the potency of mesenchymal stem cell msc and mscderived secretome for treating covid19 patient fever cough headache dizziness and fatigue are the common clinical manifestation in covid19 patient in mild and severe case cytokine are released hyperactively which cause a cytokine storm leading to acute respiratory distress syndrome ards in order to maintain the lung microenvironment in covid19 patient msc are used a cellbased therapy approach a they can act a cell manager which accelerate the immune system to prevent the cytokine storm and promote endogenous repair besides msc have shown minimal expression of ace2 or tmprss2 and hence msc are free from sarscov2 infection numerous clinical study have started worldwide and demonstrated that msc have great potential for ards treatment in covid19 patient preliminary data have shown that msc and mscderived secretome appear to be promising in the treatment of covid19 lay summary the covid19 disease is an infection disease which affect the world in 2020 currently there is no definite treatment for covid19 patient however several clinical trial have been proposed to overcome this disease and one of them is using mesenchymal stem cell msc and mscderived secretome for treating covid19 patient during the infection cytokine are released hyperactively which cause a cytokine storm msc play an important role in maintaining the lung microenvironment in covid19 patient they can act a cell manager which accelerate the immune system to prevent the cytokine storm and promote the endogenous repair therefore it is important to explore the clinical trial in the world for treating the covid19 disease using msc and mscderived secretome

processed_title: antibiotic resistance evaluation of levofloxacin treatment in acute respiratory tract infection case at the tasikmalaya city health center indonesia
processed_abstract: acute respiratory tract infection artis are an acute inflammation of the upper and lower respiratory tract caused by the infection of microorganism or bacteria virus without or accompanied by inflammation of the lung parenchyma the use of antibiotic is one way to treat respiratory disease this study aim to determine the level of resistance of levofloxacin antibiotic to clinical isolates from artis patient at the tasikmalaya health center indonesia the stage of the research included rejuvenation of clinical single isolates from artis patient identification of bacteria and antibiotic resistance testing using the paperdisc method the result of resistance test from 142 single clinical isolates of acute respiratory infection showed that levofloxacin antibiotic had high level of resistance of 500 3095 of resistance with intermediate level and 1904 were still sensitive bacterial identification test result showed bacteria that have been resistant to levofloxacin are from the genus haemophillus streptococcus corynebacterium staphylococcus and bordetella treatment of artis with the antibiotic levofloxacin show that there ha been a relatively large resistance where the result of the identification of all bacteria showed the bacteria that cause artis

processed_title: covid19 and dengue double punch for dengueendemic country in asia
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 is an international public health crisis with devastating effect in particular this pandemic ha further exacerbated the burden in tropical and subtropical region of the world where dengue fever caused by dengue virus denv is already endemic to the population the similar clinical manifestation shared by covid19 and dengue fever have raised concern especially in dengueendemic country with limited resource leading to diagnostic challenge in addition crossreactivity of the immune response in these infection is an emerging concern a preexisting denvantibodies might potentially affect covid19 through antibodydependent enhancement in this review article we aimed to raise the issue of covid19 and dengue fever misdiagnosis not only in a clinical setting but also with regard to crossreactivity between sarscov2 and denv antibody we also have discussed the potential consequence of overlapping immunological cascade between dengue and covid19 on disease severity and vaccine development

processed_title: can the sarscov2 omicron variant confer natural immunity against covid19
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic is still ongoing with no sign of abatement in sight the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 which is the causative agent of this pandemic and ha claimed over 5 million life is still mutating resulting in numerous variant one of the newest variant is omicron which show an increase in it transmissibility but also reportedly reduces hospitalization rate and show milder symptom such a in those who have been vaccinated a a result many believe that omicron provides a natural vaccination which is the first step toward ending the covid19 pandemic based on published research and scientific evidence we review and discus how the end of this pandemic is predicted to occur a a result of omicron variant being surpassed in the community in light of the finding of our research we believe that it is most likely true that the omicron variant is a natural way of vaccinating the mass and slowing the spread of this deadly pandemic while the mutation that cause the omicron variant is encouraging subsequent mutation do not guarantee that the disease it cause will be less severe a the virus continues to evolve human must constantly adapt by increasing their immunity through vaccination

processed_title: clinical characteristic and outcome of covid19 patient in bali indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the spectrum of illness and outcome of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 patient may vary this study report the characteristic of covid19 patient in bali indonesia and evaluates the diagnostic value of their clinical symptom method this observational study wa conducted in eight hospital the patient were classified a nonsevere covid19 severe covid19 and noncovid19 demographic clinical laboratory and radiologic characteristic and outcome of covid19 patient were collected factor associated with the severity and outcome were assessed using the chisquared test or anova when appropriate we also compared the clinical feature of nonsevere covid19 and noncovid19 patient to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy result this study included 92 patient 41 noncovid19 and 51 covid19 patient comprising 45 nonsevere and six severe case the most common symptom of covid19 were cough 471 fever 310 and dyspnea 253 cough fatigue and anosmia have high accuracy and combining these complaint in clinical diagnostics offered a higher accuracy in predicting covid19 patient 601 we found lower lymphocyte count and interleukin1r level and higher level of creactive protein interleukin6 and interleukin8 in severe compared than in nonsevere covid19 patient lactate dehydrogenase wa associated with intensive care unit admission and ventilator use while other marker such a neutrophillymphocyte ratio creactive protein and interleukin6 were not conclusion a battery of symptom including cough fatigue and anosmia is likely associated with covid19 in bali clinician should be aware of these symptom to ensure a prompt diagnostic test for covid19 beyond other cause of acute febrile illness

processed_title: dengue a minireview
processed_abstract: dengue caused by infection of any of four dengue virus serotypes denv1 to denv4 is a mosquitoborne disease of major public health concern associated with significant morbidity mortality and economic cost particularly in developing country dengue incidence ha increased 30fold in the last 50 year and over 50 of the world population in more than 100 country live in area at risk of denv infection we review denv biology epidemiology transmission dynamic including circulating serotypes and genotype the immune response the pathogenesis of the disease a well a updated diagnostic method treatment vector control and vaccine development

processed_title: climate variability and dengue fever in makassar indonesia bayesian spatiotemporal modelling
processed_abstract: a range of bayesian model have been used to describe spatial and temporal pattern of disease in areal unit data in this study we applied two bayesian spatiotemporal conditional autoregressive st car model one of which allows discontinuity in risk between neighbouring area creating group to examine dengue fever pattern data on annual 20022017 and monthly january 2013 december 2017 dengue case and climatic factor over 14 geographic area were obtained for makassar indonesia combination of covariates and model formulation were compared considering credible interval overall goodness of fit and the grouping structure for annual data an st car localised model incorporating average humidity provided the best fit while for monthly data a singlegroup st car autoregressive model incorporating rainfall and average humidity wa preferred using appropriate bayesian spatiotemporal model enables identification of different group of area and the impact of climatic covariates which may help inform policy decision

processed_title: the need for active and integrated involvement of the community and health professional in the prevention and control of dengue hemorrhagic fever in indonesia
processed_abstract: successful control and prevention of dengue fever requires active involvement from all party for this reason three innovative program are needed namely i increasing knowledge attitude and practice kap of the community and health professional a capital in controlling dengue fever in a sustainable manner ii application of 3m plus to suppress vector breeding in household setting iii promotion of the jumantik program a an effective community empowerment approach to prevent and control dengue fever based on community independence it wa concluded that successful control of dengue fever requires integration of the community and health worker through various innovative program

processed_title: efficacy of wolbachiainfected mosquito deployment for the control of dengue
processed_abstract: background aedes aegypti mosquito infected with the wmel strain of wolbachia pipientis are less susceptible than wildtype a aegypti to dengue virus infection method we conducted a clusterrandomized trial involving release of wmelinfected a aegypti mosquito for the control of dengue in yogyakarta indonesia we randomly assigned 12 geographic cluster to receive deployment of wmelinfected a aegypti intervention cluster and 12 cluster to receive no deployment control cluster all cluster practiced local mosquitocontrol measure a usual a testnegative design wa used to assess the efficacy of the intervention patient with acute undifferentiated fever who presented to local primary care clinic and were 3 to 45 year of age were recruited laboratory testing wa used to identify participant who had virologically confirmed dengue vcd and those who were testnegative control the primary end point wa symptomatic vcd of any severity caused by any dengue virus serotype result after successful introgression of wmel into the intervention cluster 8144 participant were enrolled 3721 lived in intervention cluster and 4423 lived in control cluster in the intentiontotreat analysis vcd occurred in 67 of 2905 participant 23 in the intervention cluster and in 318 of 3401 94 in the control cluster aggregate odds ratio for vcd 023 95 confidence interval ci 015 to 035 p 0004 the protective efficacy of the intervention wa 771 95 ci 653 to 849 and wa similar against the four dengue virus serotypes the incidence of hospitalization for vcd wa lower among participant who lived in intervention cluster 13 of 2905 participant 04 than among those who lived in control cluster 102 of 3401 30 protective efficacy 862 95 ci 662 to 943 conclusion introgression of wmel into a aegypti population wa effective in reducing the incidence of symptomatic dengue and resulted in fewer hospitalization for dengue among the participant funded by the tahija foundation and others awed clinicaltrialsgov number nct03055585 indonesia registry number inaa7ob6tw

processed_title: efficacy and longterm safety of a dengue vaccine in region of endemic disease
processed_abstract: background a candidate tetravalent dengue vaccine is being assessed in three clinical trial involving more than 35000 child between the age of 2 and 16 year in asianpacific and latin american country we report the result of longterm followup interim analysis and integrated efficacy analysis method we are assessing the incidence of hospitalization for virologically confirmed dengue a a surrogate safety end point during followup in year 3 to 6 of two phase 3 trial cyd14 and cyd15 and a phase 2b trial cyd2357 we estimated vaccine efficacy using pooled data from the first 25 month of cyd14 and cyd15 result followup data were available for 10165 of 10275 participant 99 in cyd14 and 19898 of 20869 participant 95 in cyd15 data were available for 3203 of the 4002 participant 80 in the cyd23 trial included in cyd57 during year 3 in the cyd14 cyd15 and cyd57 trial combined hospitalization for virologically confirmed dengue occurred in 65 of 22177 participant in the vaccine group and 39 of 11089 participant in the control group pooled relative risk of hospitalization for dengue were 084 95 confidence interval ci 056 to 124 among all participant 158 95 ci 083 to 302 among those under the age of 9 year and 050 95 ci 029 to 086 among those 9 year of age or older during year 3 hospitalization for severe dengue a defined by the independent data monitoring committee criterion occurred in 18 of 22177 participant in the vaccine group and 6 of 11089 participant in the control group pooled rate of efficacy for symptomatic dengue during the first 25 month were 603 95 ci 557 to 645 for all participant 656 95 ci 607 to 699 for those 9 year of age or older and 446 95 ci 316 to 550 for those younger than 9 year of age conclusion although the unexplained higher incidence of hospitalization for dengue in year 3 among child younger than 9 year of age need to be carefully monitored during longterm followup the risk among child 2 to 16 year of age wa lower in the vaccine group than in the control group funded by sanofi pasteur clinicaltrialsgov number nct00842530 nct01983553 nct01373281 and nct01374516

processed_title: temporal trend and spatial clustering of the dengue fever prevalence in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue fever is a notable vectorborne viral disease currently becoming the most dreaded worldwide health problem in term of the number of people affected a data set of confirmed dengue incidence collected in the province of west java ha allowed u to explore dengue temporal trend and spatial distribution to obtain more obvious insight into it spatialtemporal evolution we utilized the richards model to estimate the growth rate and detect the peak or turning point of the dengue infection wave by identifying the temporal progression at each location using spatial analysis of georeferenced data from a local perspective we investigated the change in the spatial cluster of dengue case and detected hot spot and cold spot in each weekly cycle we found that the trend of confirmed dengue incidence significantly increase from january to march more than twothird 704 of the region in west java had their dengue infection turning point ranging from the first week of january to the second week of march this trend clearly coincides with the peak of precipitation level during the rainy season further the spatial analysis identified the hot spot distributed across central northern northeastern and southeastern region in west java the densely populated area were likewise seen to be associated with the highrisk area of dengue exposure recognizing the peak of epidemic and geographical distribution of dengue case might provide important insight that may help local authority optimize their dengue prevention and intervention program

processed_title: climate variability and dengue hemorrhagic fever in southeast sulawesi province indonesia
processed_abstract: to determine the association of climatic factor and dengue hemorrhagic fever and to develop the prediction approach of future dengue transmission the study used totally monthly dengue hemorrhagic fever case at health office kendari southeast sulawesi indonesia monthly meteorological data consisting of temperature rainfall and humidity wa obtained from the meteorology climatology and geophysics agency in kendari district all data analysis including spearman and poisson distribution wa carried out in r studio version 332 utilizing the r statistical language version 215 the highest rate of dengue hemorrhagic fever case wa found in january february and march temperature average at lag 2 p 053 p 00001 lag 3 p 059 p 00001 and lag 4 p 041 p 001 correlated with the incident rate of dhf the average temperature at lag 2 wa found to have a positive impact on the incidence of dhf by poisson function this study provides preliminary evidence of the influence of climatic factor on dengue transmission

processed_title: climate and visitor a the influencing factor of dengue fever in badung district of bali indonesia
processed_abstract: badung district ha recorded the highest dengue fever df in bali province this research present the distribution of df in badung district and analysis it association with climate and visitor the monthly data of df climate and number of visitor during january 2013 to december 2017 were analysed using poisson regression a total of 10689 new df case were notified from january 2013 to december 2017 df in 2016 wa recorded a the heaviest incidence monthly df case have positive association with average temperature 059 95 ci 05662 precipitation 57 x 104 95 ci 38 x 104 76 x 104 humidity 014 95 ci 0003025 and local visitor 740 x 106 95 ci 588 x 106 891 x 106 negative association wa shown between df case with foreign visitor 218 x 106 95 ci 250 x 106 187 x 106 this study underline the urgency to integrate climate and tourism for df surveillance

processed_title: cytokine profile in dengue fever and dengue hemorrhagic fever a study from indonesia
processed_abstract: recent study have demonstrated that cytokine dysregulation ha a critical role in the pathogenesis of dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf and dengue shock syndrome ds the aim of this study wa to investigate the association between tumor necrosis factor tnf alpha interleukin 6 il6 interleukin 10 il10 and interleukin 17 il17 with infection status and severity of dengue a prospective crosssectional study wa conducted at three hospital in gianyar regency and denpasar municipality bali indonesia from june to december 2022 sixtyfour dengue infected patient were involved patient serum wa tested for dengue infection using ns1 antigen rapid test dengue virus immunoglobulin m igm and immunoglobulin g igg test and reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr cytokine level tnfalpha il6 il10 and il17 were measured using enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa infection status wa determined by combining serological and rtpcr result categorizing patient into primary and secondary infection the present study found that df patient had lower tnfalpha il6 and il17 but higher il10 level compared to dhf patient p0001 elevated tnfalpha il6 and il17 level were higher in secondary infection while il10 level wa higher in primary infection p0001 in conclusion cytokine play a crucial role in the interplay between cytokine dysregulation and dengue infection dynamic

processed_title: the threat of emerging and reemerging infection in indonesia
processed_abstract: human immunodeficiency virus hiv is one example of an emerging infection with total of 386 district of all province in indonesia reported having such infection with cumulative number of hiv infected patient from the year 1987 to 2014 is 150296 while aid is 55799 patient the access to care only available for 153887 patient among all hivaids patient of whom 70 are eligible for antiretroviral arv treatment and of these only half adhered to arv treatment in addition to that there is an increased risk of other emerging disease such a zika virus monkey pox or hanta pulmonary syndrome since a sporadic case were reported around the regionbeside new disease tuberculosis dengue virus malaria and diphteria are continuously reported in indonesia and classified a reemerging illness on this edition data on diphteria epidemiology in indonesia will be shown by karyanti et al6 a recent outbreak of diphteria in indonesia which involved almost all province in the country ha led to a response named ori outbreak response of immunization regardless of immunization proper treatment including the distribution of antitoxin and antibiotic are needed to stop the spread of this particular bacteria further decreasing the mortality rate in conclusion the author of this paper mentioned that immunization gap need to be handle systematically immunization data released on 2017 showed that complete immunization wa given only to 20 of targeted group while almost 75 were either unvaccinated or unknown during the outbreak of diphteria in indonesia the who also reported several country with similar problem such a bangladesh haiti and yamen it wa shown that a coordination between doctor in clinichospital with public health officer to conduct an epidemiological investigation in conjunction with giving prophylaxis and assuring the logistics of antidiphteria toxin and antibiotic were accessible were the key of success in eliminating diphteria like it wa in bangladeshadherence to treatment are multifactorial for all illness first is the duration of treatment and the potential adverse event due to the medication the ministry of health of the republic of indonesia ha support the early diagnosis of hiv and delivering treatment a soon a possible in order to avoid transmission of the disease second looking at another side of the story for hiv infected patient receiving arv treatment a a long life treatment could possibly cause an adverse event somewhere along the line budiman etal reported factor that might contribute to liver injury his study show that measuring baseline liver function test ast routinely might minimize the toxicity of arv to patient particularly with a low body mass index last despite the adherence to treatment and procedure in minimizing the risk of adverse event to medication we are now facing the primary resistance virus that transmitted in the community a mentioned by megasari et al8 on her report regarding the transmission of drug resistance hiv virus to naive patient in balithe indonesian government through the indonesian ministry of health ha established a collaboration and one health approach to tackle the threat of disease in the country particularly in infectious disease

processed_title: correlation between google trend on dengue fever and national surveillance report in indonesia
processed_abstract: background digital trace are rapidly used for health monitoring purpose in recent year this approach is growing a the consequence of increased use of mobile phone internet and machine learning many study reported the use of google trend data a a potential data source to assist traditional surveillance system the rise of internet penetration 547 and the huge utilization of google 98 indicate the potential use of google trend in indonesia no study wa performed to measure the correlation between country wide official dengue report and google trend data in indonesia objective this study aim to measure the correlation between google trend data on dengue fever and the indonesian national surveillance report method this research wa a quantitative study using time series data 20122016 two set of data were analyzed using moving average analysis in microsoft excel pearson and time lag correlation were also used to measure the correlation between those data result moving average analysis showed that google trend data have a linear time series pattern with official dengue report pearson correlation indicated high correlation for three defined search term with rvalue range from 0921 to 0937 p 005 overall period which showed increasing trend in epidemic period 20152016 time lag correlation also indicated that google trend data can potentially be used for an early warning system and novel tool to monitor public reaction before the increase of dengue case and during the outbreak conclusion google trend data have a linear time series pattern and statistically correlated with annual official dengue report identification of informationseeking behavior is needed to support the use of google trend for disease surveillance in indonesia

processed_title: wolbachiacarrying aedes mosquito for preventing dengue infection
processed_abstract: background dengue is a global health problem of high significance with 39 billion people at risk of infection the geographic expansion of dengue virus denv infection ha resulted in increased frequency and severity of the disease and the number of death ha increased in recent year wolbachiaan intracellular bacterial endosymbiont ha been under investigation for several year a a novel denguecontrol strategy some dengue vector aedes mosquito can be transinfected with specific strain of wolbachia which decrease their fitness ability to survive and mate and their ability to reproduce inhibiting the replication of dengue both laboratory and field study have demonstrated the potential effect of wolbachia deployment on reducing dengue transmission and modelling study have suggested that this may be a selfsustaining strategy for dengue prevention although longterm effect are yet to be elucidated objective to assess the efficacy of wolbachiacarrying aedes speciesdeployments specifically wmel wmelpop and walbb strain of wolbachia for preventing dengue virus infection search method we searched central medline embase four other database and two trial registry up to 24 january 2024 selection criterion randomized controlled trial rcts including clusterrandomized controlled trial crcts conducted in dengue endemic or epidemicprone setting were eligible we sought study that investigated the impact of wolbachiacarrying aedes deployment on epidemiological or entomological denguerelated outcome utilizing either the population replacement or population suppression strategy data collection and analysis two review author independently selected eligible study extracted data and assessed the risk of bias using the cochrane rob 2 tool we used odds ratio or with the corresponding 95 confidence interval ci a the effect measure for dichotomous outcome for countrate outcome we planned to use the rate ratio with 95 ci a the effect measure we used adjusted measure of effect for crcts we assessed the certainty of evidence using grade main result one completed crct met our inclusion criterion and we identified two further ongoing crcts the included trial wa conducted in an urban setting in yogyakarta indonesia it utilized a nested testnegative study design whereby all participant aged three to 45 year who presented at healthcare centre with a fever were enrolled in the study provided they had resided in the study area for the previous 10 night the trial showed that wmelwolbachia infected ae aegypti deployment probably reduce the odds of contracting virologically confirmed dengue by 77 or 023 95 ci 015 to 035 1 trial 6306 participant moderatecertainty evidence the clusterlevel prevalence of wmel wolbachiacarrying mosquito remained high over two year in the intervention arm of the trial reported a 958 interquartile range 915 to 978 across 27 month in cluster receiving wmelwolbachia ae aegypti deployment but there were no reliable comparative data for this outcome other primary outcome were the incidence of virologically confirmed dengue the prevalence of dengue ribonucleic acid in the mosquito population and mosquito density but there were no data for these outcome additionally there were no data on adverse event author conclusion the included trial demonstrates the potential significant impact of wmelwolbachiacarrying ae aegypti mosquito on preventing dengue infection in an endemic setting and support evidence reported in nonrandomized and uncontrolled study further trial across a greater diversity of setting are required to confirm whether these finding apply to other location and country setting and greater reporting of acceptability and cost are important

processed_title: dengue fever and severe dengue in barbados 20082016
processed_abstract: analysis of the temporal seasonal and demographic distribution of dengue virus denv infection in barbados wa conducted using national surveillance data from a total of 3994 confirmed dengue case diagnosis wa confirmed either by denvspecific real time reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction rrtpcr or nonstructural protein 1 ns1 antigen or enzyme linked immunosorbent assay elisa test a case fatality rate of 04 103994 wa observed the prevalence rate of dengue fever df varied from 275 to 4539 case per 100000 population among febrile patient who sought medical attention annually df case occurred throughout the year with low level of transmission observed during the dry season december to june then increased transmission during rainy season july to november peaking in october three major dengue epidemic occurred in barbados during 2010 2013 and possibly 2016 with an emerging threeyear interval df prevalence rate among febrile patient who sought medical attention overall wa highest among the 1019 year old age group the highest df hospitalisation prevalence rate wa observed in 2013 multiple serotypes circulated during the study period and dengue virus serotype 2 denv2 wa the most prevalent serotype during 2010 whilst denv1 wa the most prevalent serotype in 2013 two denv1 strain from the 2013 denv epidemic were genetically more closely related to south east asian strain than caribbean or south american strain and represent the first ever sequencing of denv strain in barbados however the small sample size n 2 limit any meaningful conclusion df prevalence rate were not significantly different between female and male public health planning should consider denv interepidemic periodicity the current covid19 pandemic and similar clinical symptomology between df and covid19 the implementation of routine sequencing of denv strain to obtain critical data can aid in battling denv epidemic in barbados

processed_title: dengue vaccine acceptance and willingness to pay
processed_abstract: the introduction of new vaccine is accompanied by a variety of challenge among these very important one concern the question whether the public is willing to accept and willing to purchase the vaccine here we discus factor associated with these question in the context of vaccine that are becoming available against dengue virus infection we reviewed published study available from pubmed and embase conducting a metaanalysis when possible and narrative review when the data did not qualify for metaanalysis we found that attitude toward vaccination and socioeconomic level had significant association with dengue vaccine acceptance in addition socioeconomic level knowledge attitude and practice regarding dengue fever having personally experienced dengue fever and vaccine price were associated with willingness to pay for dengue vaccine to improve acceptance and willingness to pay for dengue vaccine welldesigned introduction program that address the associated factor in a contextspecific manner are essential

processed_title: dengue virus circulating in indonesia a systematic review and phylogenetic analysis of data from five decade
processed_abstract: although epidemiological and molecular epidemiological serotype genotype and lineage information data are available for several major city in indonesia there is yet to be a comprehensive national study of dengue in indonesia over time this study wa conducted to provide a comprehensive epidemiology of circulating dengue virus denv in indonesia between 1973 and 2016 this wa conducted through a systematic review of the literature and phylogenetic analysis of available denv sequence available data from national disease surveillance system have indicated an increasing trend of dengue incidence in indonesia over the past 50 year incidence rate appear to be cyclic peaking approximately every 6 to 8 year in contrast the case fatality rate ha decreased approximately by half with each decade since 1980 over this 50year time span serotype shift genotype displacement within denv1 and denv2 and introduction of denv1 and denv3 genotype from other country occurred these event were associated with increased incidence of dengue case our study also provides a valuable national snapshot of denv genetic diversity in indonesia that may contribute to development of more effective dengue vaccine composition for the region

processed_title: assessment of dengue and covid19 antibody rapid diagnostic test crossreactivity in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic remains ongoing around the world including in area where dengue is endemic dengue and covid19 to some extent have similar clinical and laboratory feature which can lead to misdiagnosis delayed treatment and patient isolation the use of rapid diagnostic test rdt is easy and convenient for fast diagnosis however there may be issue with crossreactivity with antibody for other pathogen method we assessed the possibility of crossreactivity between sarscov2 and dengue antibody by 1 testing five brand of covid19 igg igm rdts on 60 rtpcrconfirmed dengue sample 2 testing 95 rtpcrconfirmed covid19 sample on dengue rdt and 3 testing sample positive for covid19 igg andor igm on dengue rdt result we observed a high specificity across all five brand of covid19 rdts ranging from 983 to 100 out of the confirmed covid19 sample one patient tested positive for dengue igm only another tested positive for dengue igg only one patient tested positive for dengue igg igm and ns1 suggesting a coinfection in covid19 igg andor igm sample 63 of covid19 iggpositive sample also tested positive for dengue igg while 211 of covid19 igmpositive sample also tested positive for dengue igg conclusion despite the high specificity of the covid19 rdt we observed crossreactions and falsepositive result between dengue and covid19 dengue and covid19 coinfection wa also found health practitioner in dengue endemic area should be careful when using antibody rdt for the diagnosis of dengue during the covid19 pandemic to avoid misdiagnosis

processed_title: spatial model of dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf risk scoping review
processed_abstract: background creating a spatial model of dengue fever risk is challenging duet to many interrelated factor that could affect dengue therefore it is crucial to understand how these critical factor interact and to create reliable predictive model that can be used to mitigate and control the spread of dengue method this scoping review aim to provide a comprehensive overview of the important predictor and spatial modelling tool capable of producing dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf risk map we conducted a methodical exploration utilizing diverse source ie pubmed scopus science direct and google scholar the following data were extracted from article published between january 2011 to august 2022 country region administrative level type of scale spatial model dengue data use and category of predictor applying the eligibility criterion 45 out of 1349 article were selected result a variety of model and technique were used to identify dhf risk area with an arrangement of various multiplecriteria decisionmaking statistical and machine learning technique we found that there wa no pattern of predictor use associated with particular approach instead a wide range of predictor wa used to create the dhf risk map these predictor may include climatology factor eg temperature rainfall humidity epidemiological factor population demographic socioeconomic previous dhf case environmental factor landuse elevation and relevant factor conclusion dhf risk spatial model are useful tool for detecting highrisk location and driving proactive public health initiative relying on geographical and environmental element these model ignored the impact of human behaviour and social dynamic to improve the prediction accuracy there is a need for a more comprehensive approach to understand dhf transmission dynamic

processed_title: clinical and virological characteristic of dengue in surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue disease is still a major health problem in indonesia surabaya the second largest city in the country is endemic for dengue we report here on dengue disease in surabaya investigating the clinical manifestation the distribution of dengue virus denv serotypes and the relationship between clinical manifestation and the genetic characteristic of denv a total of 148 patient suspected of having dengue were recruited during februaryaugust 2012 one hundred one 68 of them were child and 47 32 were adult dengue fever df and dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf were equally manifested in all of the patient we performed denv serotyping on all of the sample using realtime rtpcr of 148 79 53 sample were detected a denv positive with denv1 a the predominant serotype 73 followed by denv2 8 denv4 8 and denv3 6 while 5 were mixed infection based on the envelope gene sequence we performed phylogenetic analysis of 24 isolates to genotype the denv circulating in surabaya in 2012 and the analysis revealed that denv1 consisted of genotype i and iv denv2 wa of the cosmopolitan genotype the denv3 virus were of genotype i and denv4 wa detected a genotype ii we correlated the infecting denv serotypes with clinical manifestation and laboratory parameter however no significant correlation were found amino acid analysis of envelope protein did not find any unique mutation related to disease severity

processed_title: costeffectiveness and budget impact analysis of dengue vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: despite the fact that the incidence and mortality rate due to dengue virus denv infection in indonesia are relatively high dengue vaccination ha not yet been introduced this study aimed to analyse the costeffectiveness and the budget impact of dengue vaccination in indonesia by taking the potential of prevaccination screening into account an agestructured decision tree model wa developed to assess the costeffectiveness value by applying a single cohort of 4710100 child that wa followedup in a 10year time horizon within a 1year analytical cycle the budget impact wa analysed in a 5year period 20202024 by considering province readiness to introduce dengue vaccine and their incidence rate of denv infection in the last 10 year vaccination that wa coupled with prevaccination screening would reduce dengue fever df dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf and dengue shock syndrome ds by 188142 148089 and 426 case respectively it would save treatment cost at 23433695 and 14091642 from the healthcare and payer perspective respectively the incremental costeffectiveness ratio icers would be 5733 and 5791 per qualityadjustedlifeyear qaly gained from both perspective the most influential parameter affecting the icers were probability of denv infection vaccine efficacy underreporting factor vaccine price case fatality rate and screening cost it can be concluded that dengue vaccination and prevaccination screening would be costeffective to be implemented in indonesia nevertheless it seems unaffordable to be implemented since the total required cost for the nationwide vaccination would be 9444 of routine immunization budget

processed_title: predictor and outcome of dengueassociated acute kidney injury
processed_abstract: dengue viral infection present with a wide clinical spectrum ranging from asymptomatic to severe manifestation with organ involvement the term expanded dengue syndrome ha been commonly used to illustrate the unusual or atypical manifestation acute kidney injury aki is one of the atypical manifestation of this syndrome the use of heterogeneous criterion to determine the presence of aki in dengue patient due to the vast diversity in population led to difficulty in assessing the true incidence of dengueassociated aki this review present a variable but often high frequency of dengueassociated aki among vastly diverse population with various disease severity dengueassociated aki is not an uncommon complication and it importance ha often been neglected during the management of dengue patient the risk factor and certain clinical and laboratory finding commonly reported among dengue patient with aki should be considered to support a timely diagnosis and case management this review highlight the need for clinician to be aware of dengueassociated aki to reduce the morbidity and mortality associated with this common and important tropical disease

processed_title: tenyears trend of dengue research in indonesia and southeast asian country a bibliometric analysis
processed_abstract: background dengue fever is a mosquitoborne viral disease with high incidence in over 128 country who estimate 500000 people with severe dengue are hospitalized annually and 25 of those affected die indonesia is a hyperendemic country for dengue with an increasing number of case in the last decade unfortunately the trend of indonesian dengue research are relatively unknown objective this research aimed to depict bibliographic trend and knowledge structure of dengue publication in indonesia relative to that of southeast asia sea from 2007 to 2016 method bibliographic data were collected from pubmed filtered by indonesia country affiliation the annual growth rate of publication wa measured and compared with neighborhood country in the sea region network analysis wa used to visualize emerging research issue result about 1625 denguerelated document originated from sea region of which indonesia contributed 590 the publication growth rate in indonesia however is the highest in asean region 2887 total citation for document published from indonesia wa 980 with an average of 14 citation per publication and hindex of 16 within the first five year the main research topic were related to insect vector and diagnostic method while insect vector remained dominant in the last five year other topic such a disease outbreak dengue virus and dengue vaccine started emerging conclusion in the last 10 year dengue publication growth from indonesia in international journal improved significantly despite less number of publication compared to other sea country effort should be made to improve the quantity and quality of publication from indonesia the research topic related to dengue in indonesia are in line with study in sea stakeholder and policy maker are encouraged to develop a roadmap for dengue research in the future

processed_title: phylogenetic and evolutionary analysis of dengue virus isolated in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue ha affected indonesia for the last five decade and become a major health problem in many city in the country jakarta the capital of indonesia report dengue case annually with several outbreak documented to gain information on the dynamic and evolutionary history of dengue virus denv in jakarta we conducted phylogenetic and evolutionary analysis of denv isolated in 2009 three hundred thirtythree denguesuspected patient were recruited our data revealed that dengue predominantly affected young adult and the majority of case were due to secondary infection a total of 171 virus isolates were successfully serotyped all four denv serotypes were circulating in the city and denv1 wa the predominant serotype the denv genotyping of 17 isolates revealed the presence of genotype i and iv in denv1 while denv2 isolates were grouped into the cosmopolitan genotype the grouping of isolates into genotype i and ii wa seen for denv3 and denv4 respectively evolutionary analysis revealed the relatedness of jakarta isolates with other isolates from other city in indonesia and isolates from imported case in other country we revealed the endemicity of denv and the role of jakarta a the potential source of imported dengue case in other country our study provides genetic information regarding denv from jakarta which will be useful for upstream application such a the study of denv epidemiology and evolution and transmission dynamic

processed_title: expanded dengue
processed_abstract: the world health organization who ha coined the term expanded dengue to describe case which do not fall into either dengue shock syndrome or dengue hemorrhagic fever this ha incorporated several atypical finding of dengue dengue virus ha not been enlisted a a common etiological agent in several condition like encephalitis guillain barre syndrome moreover it is a great mimic of coexisting epidemic like malaria chikungunya and zika virus disease which are also mosquitoborne disease the atypical manifestation noted in dengue can be mutisystemic and multifacetal in clinical practice the occurrence of atypical presentation should prompt u to investigate for dengue knowledge of expanded dengue help to clinch the diagnosis of dengue early especially during ongoing epidemic avoiding further battery of investigation dengue ha proved to be the epidemic with the ability to recur and ha a diverse array of presentation a seen in large series from india srilanka indonesia and taiwan who ha given the case definition of dengue fever in their comprehensive guideline accordingly a probable case is defined a acute febrile illness with two or more of any finding viz headache retroorbital pain myalgia arthralgia rash hemorrhagic manifestation leucopenia and supportive serology there have been case of patient admitted with fever altered mentation with or without neck stiffness and pyramidal tract sign some had seizure or status epilepticus a presentation when they were tested for serology dengue wa positive after ruling out other cause dengue remained the only culprit we have come across varied presentation of dengue fever in clinical practice and the present article throw light on atypical manifestation of dengue

processed_title: the autoimmune mechanism in dengue hemorrhagic fever
processed_abstract: the immune response of dengue feverdengue hemorrhagic fever is a series of immunopathogenesis process starting from viral infection to the target on monocyte and macrophage it may consequently cause a cascade of viremia in the circulation that stimulates the afferent efferent and effector mechanism by the interaction of the humoral and complement system the cascade result in inflammatory substance that will affect capillary permeability and activate coagulation factor leading to further effect on endothelial level the mechanism involving pathogenesis of dhfdss is still vague so far a theory of heterologous infection ha been developed which explains that on second infection there is subneutralization that induce viral replication the autoimmune mechanism development lead to the better understanding of dhf it also explains the autoimmune response of the viral infection which consists of molecular mimicry bystander activation and viral persistence the development of the autoimmune pathomechanism is related to the role of autoantibody and endothelial dysfunction that may have role in worsening dhf

processed_title: climate and vectorborne disease in indonesia a systematic literature review and critical appraisal of evidence
processed_abstract: climate is widely known a an important driver to transmit vectorborne disease vbd however evidence of the role of climate variability on vbd risk in indonesia ha not been adequately understood we conducted a systematic literature review to collate and critically review study on the relationship between climate variability and vbd in indonesia we searched article on pubmed scopus and google scholar database that are published until december 2021 study that reported the relationship of climate and vbd such a dengue chikungunya zika and malaria were included for the reporting we followed the guideline of the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma statement a total of 66 out of 284 study were reviewed fiftytwo 788 paper investigated dengue 13 197 paper studied malaria one 15 paper discussed chikungunya and no 0 paper reported on zika the study were predominantly conducted in western indonesian city most study have examined the shortterm effect of climate variability on the incidence of vbd at national subnational and local level rainfall n 6066 909 mean temperature tmean n 5066 758 and relative humidity rh n 5066 758 were the common climatic factor employed in the study the effect of climate on the incidence of vbd wa heterogenous across location only a few study have investigated the longterm effect of climate on the distribution and incidence of vbd the paucity of highquality epidemiological data and variation in methodology are two major issue that limit the generalizability of evidence a unified framework is required for future research to assess the impact of climate on vbd in indonesia to provide reliable evidence for better policymaking

processed_title: bayesian spatial survival modelling for dengue fever in makassar indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to understand the spatial pattern of dengue fever df patient survival and investigated factor influencing df patient survival method a bayesian spatial survival method via a conditional autoregressive approach wa used to analyze the factor that influence df patient survival in 14 subdistricts from january 2015 to may 2017 in makassar city indonesia bayesian spatial and a nonspatial model were compared by using deviance information criterion result the spatial model wa more suitable than a nonspatial model under the bayesian spatial model there wa a substantive relationship between age grade and df patient survival time conclusion the relative risk map and related factor of df patient survival can indicate the health policy maker to give special attention to the high risk area in order to faster and more targeted treatment

processed_title: cost of dengue illness in indonesia across hospital ambulatory and not medically attended setting
processed_abstract: informed decision concerning emerging technology against dengue require knowledge about the disease economic cost and each stakeholder potential benefit from better control to generate such data for indonesia we reviewed recent literature analyzed expenditure and utilization data from two hospital and two primary care facility in yogyakarta city and interviewed 67 dengue patient from hospital ambulatory and not medically attended setting we derived the cost of a dengue episode by outcome setting and the breakdown by payer we then calculated aggregate yogyakarta and national cost and 95 uncertainty interval 95 uis dengue cost per nonfatal case in hospital ambulatory not medically attended and overall average setting were us31624 95 ui 2423039018 us2245 95 ui 14123077 us748 95 ui 2361260 and us5041 95 ui 35756507 respectively cost of nonfatal episode were borne by the patient household 37 social contributor relative and friend 20 national health insurance 25 and other source government charity and private insurance 18 after including fatal case the average cost per episode became 9041 95 ui 727911235 indonesia had an estimated 7535 95 ui 131916513 million dengue episode in 2017 giving national aggregate cost of 68126 95 ui 23228237156 million unlike most previous research that examined only the formal medical sector this study included the estimated 63 of national dengue episode that were not medically attended also this study used actual cost rather than charge which generally understate dengue economic burden in public facility overall this study found that indonesia aggregate cost of dengue wa 73 higher than previously estimated strengthening the need for effective control

processed_title: the molecular and clinical feature of dengue during outbreak in jambi indonesia in 2015
processed_abstract: dengue is hyperendemic in indonesia in 2015 reported case of dengue fever doubled those of 2014 in the jambi municipality of sumatra we examined viral aetiology and it relationship with disease outcome in jambi denguesuspected patient serum were collected and ns1 detection and igmigg serology were performed dengue virus denv serotyping wa performed using realtime rtpcr envelope gene were sequenced to determine the genotype of denv clinical haematologic and demographic data were recorded of 210 denguesuspected patient 107 were confirmed the disease manifested a dengue fever 62 dengue haemorrhagic fever 36 and dengue shock syndrome 2 the serotypes of 94 denv were determined all denv serotypes were detected with denv1 a the predominant serotype 66 genotypically the denv1 virus belong to genotype i denv2 wa of cosmopolitan genotype denv3 a genotype i and denv4 belonged to genotype ii comparison with historical data revealed serotype predominance switched from denv3 to denv1 and the replacement of genotype iv of denv1 with genotype i in summary denv1 predominated during the 2015 dengue outbreak in jambi the full spectrum of dengue disease occurred and wa characterized by a switch in predominant serotypes

processed_title: dengue vaccine acceptance and associated factor in indonesia a communitybased crosssectional survey in aceh
processed_abstract: background the first dengue vaccine dv ha been licensed in some country but an assessment of the public acceptance of dv is widely lacking this study aimed to explore and understand dv acceptance and it associated explanatory variable among healthy inhabitant of aceh indonesia method a communitybased crosssectional survey wa conducted from november 2014 to march 2015 in nine regency of aceh that were selected randomly a set of validated questionnaire covering a range of explanatory variable and dv acceptance wa used to conduct the interview a multistep logistic regression analysis and spearmans rank correlation were employed to assess the role of explanatory variable in dv acceptance result we included 652 community member in the final analysis and found that 773 of them were willing to accept the dv gender monthly income socioeconomic status s attitude toward dengue fever df and attitude toward vaccination practice were associated with dv acceptance in bivariate analysis p005 a correlation analysis confirmed that attitude toward vaccination practice and attitude toward df were strongly correlated with dv acceptance rs041 and rs039 respectively p0001 the multivariate analysis revealed that a high monthly income high s and a good attitude toward vaccination practice and toward df were independent predictor of dv acceptance conclusion the acceptance rate of the dv among inhabitant of aceh indonesia wa relatively high and the strongest associated factor of higher support for the dv were a good attitude toward vaccination practice and a good attitude toward df

processed_title: climate factor and dengue fever occurrence in makassar during period of 20112017
processed_abstract: objective dengue fever is a global burden because of high case number climate factor became determinant of the mosquito growth this study aimed to analyze the relationship between climate factor humidity temperature wind speed rainfall and dengue case in makassar during 20112017 method it wa quantitative study located in makassar data were analyzed by general estimating equation gee gee wa used to showing the model of variable this study used secondary data from health district office of makassar to get dengue case data and meteorological climatological and geophysical agency of makassar for monthly climate data result the result showed significant correlation between climate variable that have been researched which were temperature humidity rainfall and wind speed to dengue fever case conclusion a conclusion the humidity had strongest correlation to dengue fever case it also showed positive correlation while others showed negative correlation

processed_title: using dengue epidemic and local weather in bali indonesia to predict imported dengue in australia
