processed_abstract: background although the association between dengue in bali indonesia and imported dengue in australia ha been widely asserted no study ha quantified this association so far method monthly data on dengue and climatic factor over the past decade for bali and jakarta a well a monthly data on imported dengue in australia underwent a threestage analysis stage i a quasipoisson regression with distributed lag nonlinear model wa used to assess the association of climatic factor with dengue in bali stage ii a generalized additive model wa used to quantify the association of dengue in bali with imported dengue in australia with and without including the number of traveler in log scale a an offset stage iii the association of mean temperature and rainfall two climatic factor identified in stage i in bali with imported dengue in australia were examined using stage i approach result the number of dengue case in bali increased with increasing mean temperature and up to a certain level it also increased with increasing rainfall but dropped off for high level of rainfall above a monthly incidence of 105 case per 100000 dengue in bali wa almost linearly associated with imported dengue in australia at a lag of one month mean temperature relative risk rr per 05 degree c increase 295 95 confidence interval ci 187 466 and rainfall rr per 75 mm increase 342 95 ci 107 1092 in bali were significantly associated with imported dengue in australia at a lag of four month conclusion this study suggests that climatic factor ie mean temperature and rainfall known to be conducive of dengue transmission in bali can provide an early warning with 4month lead time for australia in order to mitigate future outbreak of local dengue in australia this study also provides a template and framework for future surveillance of travelrelated infectious disease globally

processed_title: nonstructural protein 1 and hematology parameter a predictor of dengue virus infection severity in indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue virus infection dvi remains a significant health challenge and diagnosis must still be considered nonstructural protein 1 ns1 is a potential marker of the dengue virus that can help diagnose dvi the study aimed to assess the role of ns1 a a predictor of the severity of dvi we utilized dengue pcrconfirmed sample and employed semiquantitative ns1ag elisa for ns1 examination adhering to the world health organization southeast asia region whosearo 2011 criterion for dvi we included dvi patient from indonesia aged 165 year secondary infection had more severe clinical condition than primary infection leukocyte and platelet level had a more significant effect on ns1 positivity 619 19302 p0001 190 11417 p0015 respectively multivariate analysis revealed leukocyte a a more significant predictor of ns1 value than platelet with an odds ratio of 538 contributing to 305 of the ns1 value variation the ns1 value could distinguish undifferentiated fever and dengue fever in the child group with a sensitivity of 760 and specificity of 875 p0015 the number of ns1 in the severe dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf group wa higher than ns1 denv4 type and primary infection were dominant in this study although they did not significantly differ from the ns1 value ns1 value can be used a a predictor to determine the severity of dvi in child but not in the adult group the level of leukocyte and platelet influenced the ns1 value

processed_title: unraveling dengue virus diversity in asia an epidemiological study through genetic sequence and phylogenetic analysis
processed_abstract: dengue virus denv is the causative agent of dengue although most infected individual are asymptomatic or present with only mild symptom severe manifestation could potentially devastate human population in tropical and subtropical region in hyperendemic region such a south asia and southeast asia sea all four denv serotypes denv1 denv2 denv3 and denv4 have been prevalent for several decade each denv serotype is further divided into multiple genotype reflecting the extensive diversity of denv historically specific denv genotype were associated with particular geographical distribution within endemic region however this epidemiological pattern ha changed due to urbanization globalization and climate change this review comprehensively trace the historical and recent genetic epidemiology of denv in asia from the first time denv wa identified in the 1950s to the present we analyzed envelope sequence from a database covering 16 endemic country across three distinct geographic region in asia these country included bangladesh bhutan india maldives nepal pakistan and sri lanka from south asia cambodia lao myanmar thailand and vietnam from mainland sea and indonesia the philippine malaysia and singapore from maritime sea additionally we describe the phylogenetic relationship among denv genotype within each serotype along with their geographic distribution to enhance the understanding of denv dynamic

processed_title: a review of hantavirus research in indonesia prevalence in human and rodent and the discovery of serang virus
processed_abstract: dengue and other common tropical infectious disease of similar clinical presentation are endemic in indonesia which may lead to an underestimation of the prevalence of hantavirus htv infection in the country to better understand the current burden of htv infection this study aimed to both identify acute htv infection among hospitalized patient with fever and to determine the overall seroprevalence of htv these result were further considered within the context of previously reported htv infection in human and animal in indonesia by conducting a review of published literature a part of an observational cohort study of acute febrile illness this substudy retrospectively analyzed blood specimen obtained during admission during the 24week convalescent period and three month after admission convalescent specimen from patient with clinical sign and symptom of htv infection were first screened for htv igg when positive convalescent specimen and paired acute specimen were screened for htv igm and paired acute specimen were tested for htv by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr a literature review of htv in indonesia wa conducted on manuscript manually reviewed for relevance after identification from a search using the term hantavirusseoul virus and indonesia from patient at eight hospital in seven provincial capital htv igg seroprevalence wa 116 38327 with the highest being in denpasar 163 743 and the lowest being in yogyakarta 34 131 antihtv igg wa most prevalent in adult 135 33244 and male 156 29186 acute htv infection were identified in two subject both of whom had seoul virus in indonesia htvs have been studied in human and animal since 1984 over the past 35 year the reported seroprevalences in rodent ranged from 0 to 34 and in human from 0 to 13 fourteen acute infection have been reported including one in a tourist returning to germany but only two have been confirmed by rtpcr almost all rodent and human surveillance result demonstrated serological and molecular evidence of seoul virus infection however in semarang antipuumala virus igm ha been detected in human and puumala rna in one rodent in serang a new virus named serang virus wa identified due to it difference from seoul virus in maumere htv and leptospira spp were identified simultaneously in rodent the burden of htv infection in indonesia is underestimated and additional study are needed to understand the true prevalence seroprevalence data reported here previous observation of htv coinfections in rodent and the prevalence of rodentborne bacterial infection in indonesia suggest that the population may be routinely encountering htvs while seoul virus appears to be the most prevalent htv in the country further study are needed to understand which htvs are circulating

processed_title: discrepancy in dengue burden estimate a comparative analysis of reported case and global burden of disease study 20102019
processed_abstract: background dengue is a significant mosquitoborne disease several study have utilized estimate from the global burden of disease gbd study to assess the global regional or national burden of dengue over time however our recent investigation suggests that gbds estimate for dengue case in taiwan are unrealistically high the current study extends the scope to compare reported dengue case with gbd estimate across 30 highburden country and territory aiming to assess the accuracy and interpretability of the gbds dengue estimate method data for this study were sourced from the gbd 2019 study and various national and international database documenting reported dengue case the analysis targeted the top 30 country and territory with the highest 10year average of reported case from 2010 to 2019 discrepancy were quantified by computing absolute difference and ratio between the 10year average of reported case and gbd estimate coefficient of variation cv and estimated annual percentage change eapcs were calculated to assess variation and trend in the two data source result significant discrepancy were noted between reported data and gbd estimate in the number of dengue case incidence rate and eapcs gbd estimate were substantially higher than reported case for many entity with the most notable difference found in china 5700fold india 3030fold bangladesh 1154fold taiwan 855fold and indonesia 232fold furthermore the gbds estimate did not accurately reflect the extensive yearly fluctuation in dengue outbreak particularly in nonendemic region such a taiwan china and argentina a evidenced by high cv conclusion this study reveals substantial discrepancy between gbd estimate and reported dengue case underscoring the imperative for comprehensive analysis in area with pronounced disparity the failure of gbd estimate to represent the considerable annual fluctuation in dengue outbreak highlight the critical need for improvement in disease burden estimation methodology for dengue

processed_title: epidemic dengue hemorrhagic fever in rural indonesia i virological and epidemiological study
processed_abstract: virological study were carried out during an epidemic of dengue hemorrhagic fever in central java indonesia in 1976 dengue virus wa isolated from the acute serum of 45 of 69 patient 65 the isolation rate wa higher in primary than secondary case dengue 3 wa the predominant serotype being transmitted 27 isolates but both dengue 1 8 isolates and dengue 4 10 isolates were also being transmitted a composite picture of magnitude and duration of viremia showed that many patient were circulating over 108 mid50 per milliliter dengue 3 virus for the first 3 day of illness and that viremia persisted for 56 day in some person if all shock case were considered there wa no relationship between dengue serotype and severity of disease all three confirmed fatal case however were associated with dengue type 3 infection

processed_title: endemic and emerging acute virus infection in indonesia an overview of the past decade and implication for the future
processed_abstract: being the largest archipelago country in the world with a tropical climate and a unique flora and fauna indonesia habitat one of the most diverse biome in the world these characteristic make indonesia a popular travel destination with tourism number increasing yearly these characteristic also facilitate the transmission of zoonosis and provide ideal living and breading circumstance for arthropod known vector for viral disease a review of the past 10 year of literature report of the ministry of health republic of indonesia and promedmail show a significant increase in dengue infection incidence furthermore chikungunya japanese encephalitis and rabies are proven to be endemic in indonesia the combination of cohort study governmental data and promedmail reveals an integrated overview for those working in travel medicine and public health focusing on both endemic and emerging acute virus infection this review summarizes the epidemiology of acute virus infection in indonesia including outbreak report a well a public health response measurement and their potential or efficacy knowledge about human behaviour animal reservoir climate factor environment and their role in emerging virus infection are discussed we aim to support public health authority and health care policy maker in a one health approach

processed_title: early detection of plasma leakage in dengue hemorrhagic fever
processed_abstract: dengue viral infection remains a major public health problem a many a 400 million people are infected yearly even though the vaccine is available the use of dengue vaccine is still limited due to some concern among patient infected with dengue viral infection early recognition of the virus and prompt supportive treatment are important to avoid complication and mortalitythe clinical spectrum of dengue viral infection is diverse ranging from undifferentiated fever to dengue shock syndrome characterized by plasma leak and hemoconcentration no specific antiviral therapy is available therefore anticipation of complication should be performed adequatelythe most dangerous complication of dengue infection is shock syndrome hypothetically the occurrence of shock is a result of secondary viral infection the manifestation of increased vascular permeability and low intravascular volume lead to the development of shock in addition to that another complex mechanism underlies the occurrence of shock such a endothelial dysfunction that could happened abruptly no specific method exists to identify this condition a early a possibleduring dengue infection fever can be last between 2 and 7 day the localized plasma leakage could happen and manifested a a pleural effusion fluid accumulation in abdominal cavity or hemoconcentration this will only last for 48 hour and will be resolved later spontaneously severity of leakage varies among patient and the unanticipated of leakage due to failure to recognize and treat this manifestation related to mortalitymost of the fatal case of dengue are related to late detection of the illness a shown by massive hemorrhage and severe intravascular volume depletion the role of dendritic cell is a the initiator of immune response that facilitate virus uptake on the other hand the nonneutralize cross reactive antibody will increase virus uptake and resulted in more viral replication some study showed higher ns1 protein were found in patient with more severe disease in addition to that antibody to ns1 could bind to the endothelial cell and lead to apoptosis of these cell both host and viral factor contribute to the severity of the illnessone of the important factor for dengue viral infection is the capacity of clinician to identify the risk factor for shock study reported that female infant elderly patient with concomitant disease are prone to have more severe infection virus serotype and genetic susceptibility may also contribute but the evidence is still limited so those are not sensitive enough be used in clinical settingbesides those after the diagnosis of with dengue infection based on who criterion and confirmation by serology detection or viral material in the blood no specific sign and symptom are available to determine any potential severity there were study performed to monitor the plasma leakage using mean arterial blood pressure map instead of hematocrit value rapid intervention can be administered by monitoring map to avoid deleterious consequencesthe classification of who 1997 or 2009 were not able to detect the plasma leakage earlier nainggolan et al presented the resulted of their observation among early dengue infection which wa the occurrence of gallbladder wall thickening a a manifestation of plasma leakage ultrasonographic measurement is valuable and applicable to detect plasma leakage in earlier phase with positive likelihood ratio 214 95 ci 112 412 similar report from indonesia also showed the role of ultrasonography in dengue

processed_title: dengue incidence and length of viremia by rtpcr in a prospective observational community contact cluster study from 20052009 in indonesia
processed_abstract: background dengue ha become a major global health threat since being recognized three century ago important gap remain in understanding the transmission dynamic of dengue virus denv infection this study report the result of a prospective observational cluster study that investigated the incidence of symptomatic and asymptomatic infection and length of viremia among close community contact of hospitalized denvinfected patient methodologyprincipal finding between 2005 and 2009 dengueconfirmed case n 97 admitted to hasan sadikin hospital in bandung indonesia were enrolled a index case subsequently twenty close community contact n 1928 living with and around the index case were included and followed up for up to 14 day body temperature wa measured daily blood sample were collected every 34 day and when reported fever denv infection wa confirmed using reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction rtpcr igm rapid test and enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa among the 1928 community contact a total of 72 37 acute denv infection were diagnosed which equates to an incidence of 636 case per 1000 personyears 95 confidence interval ci 588 to 687 case per 1000 personyears twentynine case 40 were symptomatic 22 dengue fever df 7 dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf and 43 60 were asymptomatic primary and secondary denv infection were detected in 18 25 and 54 75 subject among the rtpcr positive viremia wa observed a early a seven day before fever onset and converted to negative a late a seven day after the onset of fever conclusion denv infection are common among close community contact of hospitalized dengue patient the high number of asymptomatic infection and the observation that viremia precedes the onset of fever for up to seven day highlight the importance of unrecognized dengue transmission and the need for improved transmission control

processed_title: economic burden of dengue in indonesia
processed_abstract: background dengue is associated with significant economic expenditure and it is estimated that the asia pacific region account for 50 of the global cost indonesia ha one of the world highest dengue burden aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus are the primary and secondary vector in the absence of local data on disease cost this study estimated the annual economic burden during 2015 of both hospitalized and ambulatory dengue case in indonesia method total 2015 dengue cost were calculated using both prospective and retrospective method using data from public and private hospital and health centre in three province yogyakarta bali and jakarta direct cost were extracted from billing system and claim a patient survey captured indirect and outofpocket cost at discharge and 2 week later adjustment across site based on similar clinical practice and healthcare landscape were performed to fill gap in cost estimate the national burden of dengue wa extrapolated from provincial data using data from the three site and applying an empiricallyderived epidemiological expansion factor result total direct and indirect cost per dengue case assessed at yogyakarta bali and jakarta were us791 us1241 and us1250 respectively total 2015 economic burden of dengue in indonesia wa estimated at us38115 million which comprised us3552 million for hospitalized and us262 million for ambulatory care case conclusion dengue imposes a substantial economic burden for indonesian public payer and society complemented with an appropriate weighting method and by accounting for local specificity and practice these data may support national level public health decision making for preventioncontrol of dengue in public health priority list

processed_title: genomic analysis and growth characteristic of dengue virus from makassar indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue fever is currently the most important mosquitoborne viral disease in indonesia in south sulawesi province most region report dengue case including the capital city makassar currently no information is available on the serotypes and genotype of the virus circulating in the area to understand the dynamic of dengue disease in makassar we carried out dengue fever surveillance study during 20072010 a total of 455 patient were recruited in which antigen and serological detection revealed the confirmed dengue case in 433 of patient molecular detection confirmed the dengue case in 277 of patient demonstrating that dengue place a significant disease burden on the community serotyping revealed that dengue virus serotype 1 denv1 wa the most predominant serotype followed by denv2 3 and 4 to determine the molecular evolution of the virus we conducted wholegenome sequencing of 80 isolates phylogenetic analysis grouped denv2 3 and 4 to the cosmopolitan genotype genotype i and genotype ii respectively intriguingly each serotype paint a different picture of evolution and transmission denv1 appears to be undergoing a clade replacement with genotype iv being supplanted by genotype i the cosmopolitan denv2 isolates were found to be regionally endemic and is frequently being exchanged between country in the region by contrast denv3 and denv4 isolates were related to strain with a long history in indonesia although the denv3 strain appear to have been following a distinct evolutionary path since approximately 1998 to assess whether the various denv serotypesgenotypes possess different growth characteristic we performed growth kinetic assay on selected virus we observed the relatively higher rate of replication for denv1 and 2 compared to denv3 and 4 within the denv1 virus from genotype i grow faster than that of genotype iv this higher replication rate may underlie their ability to replace the circulation of genotype iv in the community

processed_title: carica papaya extract in dengue a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background carica papaya cp extract is becoming popular a an unlicensed herbal remedy purported to hasten recovery in dengue infection mostly based on observation that it may increase platelet count this systematic review and metaanalysis aim to critically analyze the evidence from controlled clinical trial on the efficacy and safety of cp extract in the treatment of dengue infection method pubmed lilac and google scholar were searched for randomized or nonrandomized trial enrolling patient with suspected or confirmed dengue where cp extract wa compared a a treatment measure against standard treatment recovery of platelet count a well a other clinical indicator of favourable outcome duration of hospital stay prevention of plasma leakage life threatening complication and mortality were assessed result nine study india6 pakistan1 indonesia1 malaysia1 met the inclusion criterion seven study showed an increase in platelet count in patient receiving cp extract while one study showed no significant difference between the two group and direct comparison wa not possible in the remaining study serious adverse event were not reported cp extract may reduce the duration of hospital stay mean difference 198 day 95 confidence interval 183 to 212 3 study 580 participant low quality evidence and cause improvement in mean platelet count between the first and fifth day of treatment mean difference 3545 95 confidence interval 2374 to 4715 3 study 129 participant low quality evidence no evidence wa available regarding other clinical outcome conclusion the clinical value of improvement in platelet count or early discharge is unclear in the absence of more robust indicator of favourable clinical outcome current evidence is insufficient to comment on the role of cp extract in dengue there is a need for further well designed clinical trial examining the effect of cp on platelet count plasma leakage other serious manifestation of dengue and mortality with clearly defined outcome measure

processed_title: analysis of temperature and humidity on dengue hemorrhagic fever in manado municipality
processed_abstract: objective the aim research wa to analyze the association between temperature and humidity and the incidence of dengue fever in manado municipality method the research design used analytical descriptive with a crosssectional survey approach data were analyzed using the spearman rank test result the highest temperature wa in august 287 degree c the highest humidity wa january 88 and the most dhf incidence wa in january 409 case there is a significant association between temperature and the prevalence of dhf p0000 r0845 humidity with the prevalence of dhf p0000 r0873 conclusion it wa found that two variable had a significant association between temperature and humidity on the prevalence of dhf in manado municipality based on observation of pattern of temperature and humidity characteristic every month during 2019

processed_title: geographical heterogeneity and socioecological risk profile of dengue in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: the aim of this study wa to assess the role of climate variability on the incidence of dengue fever df an endemic arboviral infection existing in jakarta indonesia the work carried out included analysis of the spatial distribution of confirmed df case from january 2007 to december 2018 characterising the sociodemographical and ecological factor in df highrisk area spearmans rank correlation wa used to examine the relationship between df incidence and climatic factor spatial clustering and hotspot of df were examined using global morans i statistic and the local indicator for spatial association analysis classification and regression tree cart analysis wa performed to compare and identify demographical and socioecological characteristic of the identified hotspot and lowrisk cluster the seasonality of df incidence wa correlated with precipitation r0254 p001 humidity r0340 p001 dipole mode index r 0459 p001 and tmin r 0181 p005 df incidence wa spatially clustered at the village level i0294 p0001 and 22 hotspot were identified with a concentration in the central and eastern part of jakarta cart analysis showed that age and occupation were the most important factor explaining df clustering areaspecific and populationtargeted intervention are needed to improve the situation among those living in the identified df highrisk area in jakarta

processed_title: the knowledge attitude and practice of community people on dengue fever in central nepal a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background since 2006 nepal ha experienced frequent dengue fever df outbreak up to now there have been no knowledge attitude and practice kap study carried out on df in nepal that have included qualitative indepth and quantitative data thus we aimed to explore and compare the kap of people residing in the lowland 1500 m and highland 1500 m area of nepal method a crosssectional mixedmethod study wa conducted in six district of central nepal in septemberoctober 2018 including both quantitative 660 household survey and qualitative data 12 focus group discussion and 27 indepth interview the kap assessment wa executed using a scoring system and defined a high or low based on 80 cutoff point logistic regression wa used to investigate the associated factor in quantitative analysis the deductive followed by inductive approach wa adopted to identify the theme in the qualitative data result the study revealed that both the awareness about df and prevention measure were low among the surveyed participant 406 had previously heard about df with a significantly higher number in the lowland area similarly idi and fgd participant from the lowland area were aware about df and it associated symptom hence they were adopting better preventive practice against df the finding of both the qualitative and quantitative data indicate that people residing in the lowland area had better knowledge on df compared to people in highland area all idi participant perceived a higher chance of increasing future dengue outbreak due to increasing temperature and the mobility of infected people from endemic to nonendemic area the most quoted source of information were the television 718 and radio 515 overall only 23 of the hhs participant obtained high knowledge score 741 obtained high attitude score and 212 obtained high preventive practice score on df among the sociodemographic variable the area of residence educational level age monthly income s and occupation were independent predictor of knowledge level while the education level of the participant wa an independent predictor of the attitude level conclusion our study found a very low level of knowledge and insufficient preventive practice this highlight an urgent need for extensive dengue prevention program in both highland and lowland community of nepal

processed_title: dengue viral infection in indonesia epidemiology diagnostic challenge and mutation from an observational cohort study
processed_abstract: background dengue virus denv infection is a major cause of acute febrile illness in indonesia diagnostic inaccuracy may occur due to it varied and nonspecific presentation characterization of denv epidemiology clinical presentation and virology will facilitate appropriate clinical management and public health policy methodologyprincipal finding a multicenter observational cohort study wa conducted in indonesia to assess cause of acute fever requiring hospitalization clinical information and specimen were collected at enrollment 1428 day and 3 month from 1486 child and adult total of 468 319 case of denv infection were confirmed by reference laboratory assay of these 414 885 were accurately diagnosed and 54 had been misdiagnosed a another infection by site one hundred initially suspected dengue case were finally classified a nondengue other pathogen were identified in 58 of those case mortality of denv infection wa low 06 prior denv exposure wa found in 923 of subject 12 year denv circulated yearround in all city with higher incidence from january to march denv3 and denv1 were the predominant serotypes this study identified denv1 with ts119ct substitution in the serotyping primer annealing site leading to failure of serotype determination conclusionssignificance denv is a common etiology of acute febrile illness requiring hospitalization in indonesia diagnostic accuracy at clinical site merit optimization since misdiagnosis of denv infection and overestimation of dengue can negatively impact management and outcome mutation at the annealing site of the serotyping primer may confound diagnosis clinician should consider following diagnostic algorithm that include denv confirmatory testing policymakers should prioritize development of laboratory capacity for diagnosis of denv

processed_title: epidemiology of dengue hemorrhagic fever in indonesia analysis of five decade data from the national disease surveillance
processed_abstract: objective to provide a national incidence rate and case fatality rate of dengue hemorrhagic fever in indonesia through an analysis of the national disease surveillance database from the directorate general of disease prevention and control of ministry of health result available data ha indicated an increasing trend of dengue hemorrhagic fever incidence in indonesia over the past 50 year incidence rate appear to be cyclic peaking approximately every 68 year in contrast the case fatality rate ha decreased approximately by half each decade since 1980 java island contributed the highest average number of dengue hemorrhagic fever case each year in recent year bali and borneo kalimantan have had the highest incidence while papua island the easternmost region of the indonesian archipelago ha had the lowest incidence

processed_title: benefit and barrier of community participation in dengue control a systematic review
processed_abstract: dengue is a global health problem community participation play a crucial role in the prevention and control of dengue this systematic review aim to examine the benefit and barrier of community participation in controlling dengue fever searching several journal database including pubmed sciencedirect scopus proquest and web of science from 2013 to 2023 various activity involving community participation in controlling dengue fever have proven to be beneficial such a reducing vector density and increasing knowledge attitude and behavior regarding dengue fever control in the community various barrier in increasing community participation in dengue control include individual factor community factor and societal factor it is important to develop program that consistently involve the community in the prevention and control of dengue fever a well a overcome barrier that may influence community involvement in the prevention and control of dengue fever

processed_title: economic and disease burden of dengue in southeast asia
processed_abstract: background dengue pose a substantial economic and disease burden in southeast asia sea quantifying this burden is critical to set policy priority and diseasecontrol strategy method and finding we estimated the economic and disease burden of dengue in 12 country in sea bhutan brunei cambodia easttimor indonesia lao malaysia myanmar philippine singapore thailand and viet nam we obtained reported case from multiple sourcessurveillance data world health organization who and published studiesand adjusted for underreporting using expansion factor from previous literature we obtained unit cost per episode through a systematic literature review and completed missing data using linear regression we excluded cost such a prevention and vector control and longterm sequela of dengue over the decade of 20012010 we obtained an annual average of 29 million m dengue episode and 5906 death the annual economic burden with 95 certainty level wa us950m us610mus1384m or about us165 us106us241 per caput the annual number of disabilityadjusted life year dalys based on the original 1994 definition wa 214000 120000299000 which is equivalent to 372 210520 dalys per million inhabitant conclusion dengue pose a substantial economic and disease burden in sea with a daly burden per million inhabitant in the region this burden is higher than that of 17 other condition including japanese encephalitis upper respiratory infection and hepatitis b

processed_title: chikungunya in indonesia epidemiology and diagnostic challenge
processed_abstract: background chikungunya virus chikv is often overlooked a an etiology of fever in tropical and subtropical region lack of diagnostic testing capacity in these area combined with cocirculation of clinically similar pathogen such a dengue virus denv hinders chikv diagnosis to better address chikv in indonesia an improved understanding of epidemiology clinical presentation and diagnostic approach is needed methodologyprincipal finding acutely hospitalized febrile patient 1yearold were enrolled in a multisite observational cohort study conducted in indonesia from 2013 to 2016 demographic and clinical data were collected at enrollment blood specimen were collected at enrollment once during day 14 to 28 and three month after enrollment plasma sample negative for denv by serology andor molecular assay were screened for evidence of acute chikv infection aci by serology and molecular assay to address the coinfection of denv and chikv denv case were selected randomly to be screened for evidence of aci aci wa confirmed in 401089 37 screened subject all of whom were denv negative all 40 case initially received other diagnosis most commonly dengue fever typhoid fever and leptospirosis aci wa found at five of the seven study city though evidence of prior chikv exposure wa observed in 252 to 459 of subject across site all subject were assessed during hospitalization a mildly or moderately ill consistent with the asian genotype of chikv subject with aci had clinical presentation that overlapped with other common syndrome atypical manifestation of disease or persistent or falsepositive igm against salmonella typhi two of the 40 case were possibly secondary aci conclusionssignificance chikv remains an underdiagnosed acute febrile illness in indonesia public health measure should support development of chikv diagnostic capacity improved access to pointofcare diagnostic test and clinical training on presentation of aci will facilitate appropriate case management such a avoiding unneccessary treatment or antibiotic early response to control mosquito population and eventually reducing disease transmission

processed_title: cocirculation of chikungunya and multiple denv serotypes and genotype western indonesia 20152016
processed_abstract: dengue is a mosquitoborne disease of public health concern affecting tropical and subtropical country including indonesia although study on dengue epidemiology have been undertaken in indonesia data are lacking in many area of the country the aim of this study wa to determine dengue virus denv and chikungunya virus chikv molecular epidemiology in western region of the indonesian archipelago a oneyear prospective study wa conducted in aceh and jambi in 2015 and 2016 respectively where patient with denguelike illness were enrolled of 205 patient recruited 29 and 27 were confirmed with dengue in aceh and jambi respectively and three from jambi were confirmed with chikungunya denv1 wa the predominant serotype identified in aceh while denv2 wa predominant in jambi all denv1 and denv2 from both region were classified a genotype i and cosmopolitan genotype respectively and all denv3 virus from jambi were genotype i some virus in particular denv1 displayed a distinct lineage distribution where two denv1 lineage from aceh were more closely related to virus from china instead of jambi highlighting the role of travel and flight pattern on denv transmission in the region denv2 from both aceh and jambi and denv3 from jambi were all closely related to indonesian local strain all three chikv belonged to asian genotype and clustered closely with indonesian chikv strain including those previously circulating in jambi in 2015 confirming continuous and sustainable transmission of chikv in the region the study result emphasize the importance of continuous epidemiological surveillance of arbovirus in indonesia and simultaneous testing for chikv among denguesuspected patient

processed_title: a comparison of the accuracy of handheld hemoglobinometer and hematocrit measurement for detecting plasma leakage in dengue hemorrhagic fever
processed_abstract: purpose practical method for detecting plasma leakage should be readily available in all area where dengue is endemic we compared the accuracy of measurement obtained with a handheld hemocuer hb 201 instrument used for hemoglobin pointofcare testing hbpoct with that of measurement of hematocrit ht level for detecting plasma leakage in dengue patient patient and method we performed both measurement using the hemocuer hb201 system and microhematocrit method on edta blood taken from dengue patient at three time point during their hospitalization ascites pleural effusion or gallbladder thickening determined through ultrasound examination were considered the gold standard for determining dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf versus dengue fever df result close agreement between hbpoct and ht measurement wa indicated by an r square value of 0845 in a linear regression the sensitivity result for distinguishing between dhf and df at admission were similar for hbpoct 636 and ht 667 kappa 075 using the optimal cutoff point determined via roc analysis delta difference in percentage for hbpoct and ht between the highest and lowest value showed lower sensitivity 455 and 485 respectively kappa 060 when the optimal cutoff point wa applied recommended cutoff of 20 to confirm plasma leakage provided a slightly higher sensitivity using hbpoct 182 compared with the sensitivity obtained using ht 152 with kappa value of 979 conclusion our result showed that the accuracy of hb poct measurement wa similar and not inferior to ht measurement for detecting plasma leakage in patient with dhf we recommend that further evaluation are conducted to determine the optimal cutoff point given the low sensitivity associated with using 20 hbpoct or ht increase to determine hemoconcentration

processed_title: dengue virus population genetics in yogyakarta indonesia prior to citywide wolbachia deployment
processed_abstract: dengue ha been endemic in yogyakarta indonesia for decade here we report the dengue epidemiology entomology and virology in yogyakarta in 20162017 prior to the commencement of the applying wolbachia to eliminate dengue awed randomized trial dengue epidemiological data were compiled and blood sample from denguesuspected patient were tested for dengue virus denv ae aegypti mosquito sample were caught from the field using bgsentinel trap and tested for the presence of denv infection sequencing of the denv e gene wa used to determine the phylogeny and genotype of circulating denv within the last decade the 20162017 dengue incidence wa considered very high among the 649 plasma sample collected between march 2016february 2017 and 36910 mosquito sample collected between december 2016may 2017 a total of 197 and 38 sample were denvpositive by qrtpcr respectively all four denv serotypes were detected with denv3 n 88 4467 and denv1 n 87 4416 a the predominant serotype followed by denv4 n 12 609 and denv2 n 10 508 the yogyakarta denv1 isolates were classified into genotype i and iv while denv2 denv3 and denv4 isolates were classified into the cosmopolitan genotype genotype i and genotype ii respectively yogyakarta denv isolates were closely related to indonesian strain from neighboring javanese city consistent with the endemic circulation of denv on this highly populous island our study provides comprehensive baseline information on the denv population genetic characteristic in yogyakarta which are useful a baseline data for the awed trial and the future denv surveillance in the city in the presence of a wolbachiainfected ae aegypti population

processed_title: dengue in bali clinical characteristic and genetic diversity of circulating dengue virus
processed_abstract: a high number of dengue case are reported annually in bali despite the endemicity limited data on dengue is available for bali locality molecular surveillance study wa conducted to explore the clinical and virological characteristic of dengue patient in urban denpasar and rural gianyar area in bali during the peak season in 2015 a total of 205 adult denguesuspected patient were recruited in a prospective crosssectional study demographic and clinical information were obtained and dengue screening wa performed using ns1 and igmigg elisa viral rna wa subsequently extracted from patient serum for serotyping using conventional rtpcr and simplexa dengue realtime rtpcr followed by genotyping with sequencing method we confirmed 161 patient a having dengue by ns1 and rtpcr among 154 sample successfully serotyped the denv3 wa predominant followed by denv1 denv2 and denv4 serotype predominance wa different between denpasar and gianyar genotyping result classify denv1 isolates into genotype i and denv2 a cosmopolitan genotype the classification grouped isolates into genotype i and ii for denv3 and denv4 respectively clinical parameter showed no relationship between infecting serotypes and severity we observed the genetic diversity of circulating denv isolates and their relatedness with historical data and importation to other country our data highlight the role of this tourist destination a a potential source of dengue transmission in the region

processed_title: chikungunya detection during dengue outbreak in sumatra indonesia clinical manifestation and virological profile
processed_abstract: chikungunya fever chik is an acute viral infection caused by infection with chikungunya virus chikv the disease affect people in area where certain aedes specie mosquito vector are present especially in tropical and subtropical country indonesia ha witnessed chik disease since the early 1970s with sporadic outbreak occurring throughout the year the chik clinical manifestation characterized by fever headache and joint pain is similar to that of dengue den disease during a molecular study of a den outbreak in jambi sumatra in early 2015 denvnegative sample were evaluated for evidence of chikv infection among 103 denvnegative sample eight sample were confirmed 78 a positive for chikv by both molecular detection and virus isolation the mean age of the chik patient wa 213 91 range 1135 year the clinical manifestation of the chik patient were mild and mimicked den with fever and headache a the main symptom only three out of eight patient presented with classical joint pain sequencing of the envelope glycoprotein e1 gene and phylogenetic analysis identified all chikv isolates a belonging to the asian genotype overall our study confirms sustained endemic chikv transmission and the presence of multiple arbovirus circulating during a den outbreak in indonesia the cocirculation of arbovirus pose a public health threat and is likely to cause misdiagnosis and underreporting of chik in denendemic area such a indonesia

processed_title: costeffectiveness of dengue vaccination in indonesia considering integrated program with wolbachiainfected mosquito and health education
processed_abstract: despite the fact that morbidity and mortality rate due to dengue infection in indonesia are relatively high a dengue vaccination ha not yet been introduced next to vaccination wolbachiainfected mosquito and health education have been considered to be potential intervention to prevent dengue infection in indonesia this study wa aimed to analyse the costeffectiveness of dengue vaccination in indonesia whilst taking wolbachia and health education program into account an agestructured decision tree model wa developed to assess the costeffectiveness approximately 4701100 child were followedup in a 10year time horizon within a 1year analytical cycle we compared three vaccination strategy one focussing on vaccination only another combining vaccination and a wolbachia program and a third scenario combining vaccination and health education all scenario were compared with a nointervention strategy the result showed that only vaccination would reduce dengue fever df dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf and dengue shock syndrome ds by 123203 97140 and 283 case respectively it would save treatment cost at 103 million and 62 million from the healthcare and payer perspective respectively the combination of vaccination and a wolbachia program would reduce df dhf and ds by 292488 230541 and 672 case respectively it would also save treatment cost at 243 million and 146 million from the healthcare and payer perspective respectively the combination of vaccination and health education would reduce df dhf and ds by 187986 148220 and 432 case respectively it would save treatment cost at 156 million and 94 million from the healthcare and payer perspective respectively the incremental costeffectiveness ratio icers from the healthcare perspective were estimated to be 9995 4460 and 6399 per qualityadjusted life year qaly gained for the respective scenario icers from the payer perspective were slightly higher it can be concluded that vaccination combined with a wolbachia program wa confirmed to be the most costeffective intervention dengue infection rate vaccine efficacy cost of wolbachia program underreporting factor for hospitalization vaccine price and mortality rate were considered to be the most influential parameter affecting the icers

processed_title: clinical feature and virological confirmation of perinatal dengue infection in jambi indonesia a case report
processed_abstract: the hyperendemicity of dengue in indonesia pose a significant threat of dengue virus denv vertical transmission during pregnancy a 29yearold female at 38 week of pregnancy presented to hospital with acute fever and later confirmed with denv infection due to sign of fetal distress the neonate wa delivered by emergency caesarean section the mother developed a dengue critical phase postcaesarean with excessive bleeding and required blood transfusion during the 6th day of life the neonate wa diagnosed and later confirmed with dengue nextgeneration sequencing of denv rna isolated directly from serum of both mother and neonate revealed identical denv2 wholegenome sequence plaque reduction neutralization test prnt detected antidengue antibody in both mother and neonate altogether our data confirmed the occurrence of vertical transmission dengue vertical transmission during pregnancy may lead to severe manifestation hence early diagnosis close monitoring and prompt intervention are critical

processed_title: coinfection with sarscov2 and dengue virus a case report highlighting diagnostic challenge
processed_abstract: background since it emergence in china sarscov2 ha infected more than 240 million people worldwide including in region where dengue virus denv is hyperendemic such a latin america and southeast asia including indonesia diagnosis of covid19 in dengue endemic region a well a denv and sarscov2 coinfection can be challenging case presentation we describe a 68yearold woman with diabetes mellitus type ii who wa admitted to the tangerang district hospital on 14 april 2020 she lived in a neighborhood where a few people were contracting dengue fever she presented with five day of fever malaise anorexia nausea myalgia and arthralgia hematology revealed anemia thrombocytopenia normal leukocyte count increased neutrophil proportion and decreased lymphocyte proportion and absolute lymphocyte her chest xray showed right pericardial infiltrates although dengue wa clinically suspected she wa also tested for sarscov2 infection a she met screening criterion after being confirmed sarscov2 positive by rtpcr she wa treated with ceftriaxone paracetamol azithromycin oseltamivir and chloroquine she wa clinically improved four day later and discharged from the hospital on 25 april 2020 after sarscov2 rtpcr wa negative on two consecutive sample dengue wa diagnosed retrospectively based on seroconversion of dengue igm and a very high dengue igg index elisa focus diagnosticsr cypress ca usa and seroconversion of dengue igm and positive igg rapid test panbio rdengue duo cassette inverness medical innovation qld au which wa equivalent to high hemagglutination inhibition hi antibody titer 1280 found in secondary dengue infection conclusion the overlapping clinical presentation of covid19 and dengue limited diagnostic capacity of laboratory in resource constrained setting and complexity of interpreting result make identification of covid19 in the dengue endemic setting challenging clinician in endemic area must be aware of diagnostic challenge and maintain a high index of suspicion for covid19 coinfection with denv and other tropical pathogen

processed_title: an integrated behavioral model approach to the control of dengue hemorrhagic fever and the role of waste management a systematic review
processed_abstract: waste management practice are a concern for public health and environmental protection this research examines the relationship between waste management and the incidence of dengue fever using the integrated behavioral model ibm approach the study adopted a systematic review methodology which involved scanning multiple journal database including pubmed sciencedirect scopus web of science and proquest and following the requirement of the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma checklist we discovered 642 paper between 2018 and 2023 article derived from review systematic review and metaanalyses were among the exclusion criterion in this study in contrast original study englishlanguage publication and open access were the inclusion criterion the result indicate that the management of trash and the prevention of dengue disease are closely related in order to accomplish integrated urban waste management for the prevention of dengue fever local government must understand the community concern preference knowledge and behaviour and involve them in the process of providing municipal trash infrastructure

processed_title: cost of dengue outbreak literature review and country case study
processed_abstract: background dengue disease surveillance and vector surveillance are presumed to detect dengue outbreak at an early stage and to savethrough early response activitiesresources and reduce the social and economic impact of outbreak on individual health system and economy the aim of this study is to unveil evidence on the cost of dengue outbreak method economic evidence on dengue outbreak wa gathered by conducting a literature review and collecting information on the cost of recent dengue outbreak in 4 country peru dominican republic vietnam and indonesia the literature review distinguished between cost of dengue illness including cost of dengue outbreak cost of intervention and costeffectiveness of intervention result seventeen publication on cost of dengue showed a large range of cost from 02 million u in venezuela to 1352 million u in brazil however these figure were not standardized to make them comparable furthermore dengue outbreak cost are calculated differently across the publication and cost of dengue illness is used interchangeably with cost of dengue outbreak only one paper from australia analysed the resource saved through active dengue surveillance cost of vector control intervention have been reported in 4 study indicating that the cost of such intervention are lower than those of actual outbreak nine paper focussed on the costeffectiveness of dengue vaccine or dengue vector control they do not provide any direct information on cost of dengue outbreak but their modelling methodology could guide future research on costeffectiveness of national surveillance systemsthe country case studiesconducted in very different geographic and health system setting unveiled rough estimate for 2011 outbreak cost of 12 million u in vietnam 675 million u in indonesia 45 million u in peru and 28 million u in dominican republic all in 2012 u the proportion of the different cost component vector control surveillance information education and communication direct medical and indirect cost a percentage of total cost differed across the respective country resource used for dengue disease control and treatment were country specific conclusion the evidence so far collected further confirms the methodological challenge in this field 1 to define technically dengue outbreak what do we measure and 2 to measure accurately the cost in prospective field study how do we measure currently consensus on the technical definition of an outbreak is sought through the international research consortium on dengue risk assessment management and surveillance idams best practice guideline should be further developed also to improve the quality and comparability of cost study finding modelling the cost of dengue outbreak and validating these model through field study should guide further research

processed_title: willingness to pay for a dengue vaccine and it associated determinant in indonesia a communitybased crosssectional survey in aceh
processed_abstract: vaccination strategy are being considered a a part of dengue prevention program in endemic country to accelerate the introduction of dengue vaccine into the public sector program and private market understanding the private economic benefit of a dengue vaccine is therefore essential the aim of this study wa to assess the willingness to pay wtp for a dengue vaccine among community member in indonesia and it associated explanatory variable a communitybased crosssectional survey wa conducted in nine regency of aceh province indonesia from november 2014 to march 2015 a pretested validated questionnaire wa used to facilitate the interview to assess the explanatory variable influencing participant wtp for a dengue vaccine a linear regression analysis wa employed we interviewed 677 healthy community member 476 participant 875 of the total were included in the final analysis an average individual wa willing to pay around u 4 mean u 404 median u 397 for a dengue vaccine our final multivariate model revealed that working a a civil servant living in the city and having good knowledge on dengue virus a good attitude towards dengue and good preventive practice against dengue virus infection were associated with a higher wtp p005 our model suggests that marketing effort should be directed to community member who are working in the suburb especially a farmer in addition the result of our study underscore the need for lowcost quality vaccine public sector subsidy for vaccination and intensifying effort to further educate and encourage household regarding other dengue preventive measure using trusted individual a facilitator

processed_title: worldwide dynamic biogeography of zoonotic and anthroponotic dengue
processed_abstract: dengue is a viral disease transmitted by mosquito the rapid spread of dengue could lead to a global pandemic and so the geographical extent of this spread need to be assessed and predicted there are also reason to suggest that transmission of dengue from nonhuman primate in tropical forest cycle is being underestimated we investigate the finescale geographic change in transmission risk since the late 20th century and take into account for the first time the potential role that primate biogeography and sylvatic vector play in increasing the disease transmission risk we apply a biogeographic framework to the most recent global dataset of dengue case temporally stratified model describing favorable area for vector presence and for disease transmission are combined our model were validated for predictive capacity and point to a significant broadening of vector presence in tropical and nontropical area globally we show that dengue transmission is likely to spread to affected area in china papua new guinea australia usa colombia venezuela madagascar a well a to city in europe and japan these model also suggest that dengue transmission is likely to spread to region where there are presently no or very few report of occurrence according to our result sylvatic dengue cycle account for a small percentage of the global extent of the human case record but could be increasing in relevance in asia africa and south america the spatial distribution of factor favoring transmission risk in different region of the world allows for distinct management strategy to be prepared

processed_title: knowledge attitude and practice regarding dengue virus infection among inhabitant of aceh indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background the indonesian region of aceh wa the area most severely affected by the earthquake and tsunami of 26 december 2004 department of health data reveal an upward trend of dengue case in aceh since the event of the tsunami despite the increasing incidence of dengue in the region there is limited understanding of dengue among the general population of aceh the aim of this study wa to assess the knowledge attitude and practice kap regarding dengue among the people of aceh indonesia in order to design intervention strategy for an effective dengue prevention program method a communitybased crosssectional study wa conducted in aceh between november 2014 and march 2015 with a total of 609 participant living in seven regency and two municipality information on the sociodemographic characteristic of participant and their kap regarding dengue wa collected using a pretested structured questionnaire the kap status good v poor of participant with different sociodemographic characteristic wa compared using chi squaretest anova or fisher exact test a appropriate logistic regression analysis wa used to determine the predictor of each kap domain result we found that 45 of participant had good knowledge regarding dengue and only 32 had good attitude and good dengue preventive practice there wa a significant positive correlation between knowledge and attitude knowledge and practice and attitude and practice in addition people who had good knowledge were 27 time more likely to have good attitude and people who had good attitude were 22 time more likely to have good practice regarding dengue the level of education occupation marital status monthly income socioeconomic status s and living in the city were associated with the knowledge level occupation s and having experienced dengue fever were associated with attitude education occupation s and type of residence were associated with preventive practice conclusion our study suggests that dengue prevention program are required to increase kap level regarding dengue in the community of aceh

processed_title: serological crossreaction and coinfection of dengue and covid19 in asia experience from indonesia
processed_abstract: similar symptom and laboratory finding between dengue and coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pose a diagnostic challenge in some dengueendemic country in asia in this study we reported three case of suspected covid19dengue coinfection in hospital of bali indonesia serological data demonstrated that patient with positive result for dengue virus denv ns1 antigen and antidengue igm were also reactive to covid19 rapid antibody test suggesting denguecovid19 coinfection however two patient were later confirmed negative for sarscov2 by qrtpcr implying a plausible crossreactivity of antidengue and anticovid19 antibody in the serological test coinfection of dengue and covid19 wa evident in one patient following confirmation of sarscov2 by qrtpcr and denv infection using the ns1 antigen serology test this case wa the first case of dengue and covid19 coinfection in indonesia and revealed possible crossreactivity between sarscov2 and denv antibody based on rapid serological test our study indicates a public health concern regarding covid19 and dengue detection in indonesia a well a in other dengueendemic country and it is important for these nation to manage both pathogen concurrently

processed_title: the effect of climate factor population density and vector density on the incidence of dengue hemorrhagic fever in south jakarta administrative city 20162020 an ecological study
processed_abstract: background and aim dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf is an infectious disease caused by the dengue virus denv and is transmitted through the bite of the aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus mosquito this study aim to analyze the relationship between the incidence of dhf which can be influenced by climatic factor in the same month nontime lag climatic factor with a lag of 1 month time lag 1 climatic factor with a lag of 2 month time lag 2 population density and vector density method the study design used is an ecological study the data is sourced from the south jakarta city administration of health the south jakarta city administration of central statistic and the meteorology climatology and geophysics agency data were analyzed using correlation test result the result showed that the incidence of dhf wa related to nontime lag rainfall time lag 1 and time lag 2 air temperature time lag 2 air humidity nontime lag time lag 1 and time lag 2 population density and number of mosquito larva free index abj conclusion dhf is still a disease that need to be watched out for in the south jakarta administrative city requiring the government and the people of the south jakarta administration to continue to increase effort to prevent and control dhf

processed_title: four dengue virus serotypes found circulating during an outbreak of dengue fever and dengue haemorrhagic fever in jakarta indonesia during 2004
processed_abstract: periodic outbreak of dengue have emerged in indonesia since 1968 with the severity of resulting disease increasing in subsequent year in early 2004 a purported dengue outbreak erupted across the archipelago with over 50000 case and 603 death reported to confirm the disease aetiology and to provide an epidemiological framework of this epidemic an investigation wa conducted in ten hospital within the capital city of jakarta clinical and laboratory finding were determined from a cohort of 272 hospitalised patient exposure to dengue virus wa determined in 180 662 patient when clinically assessed 100 556 of the 180 patient were classified a having dengue fever df 31 172 a df with haemorrhagic manifestation and 49 272 a dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf evidence from haemagglutination inhibition assay suggested that 3340 825 of those with dhf from which laboratory evidence wa available suffered from a secondary dengue infection all four dengue virus were identified upon viral isolation with den3 being the most predominant serotype recovered followed by den4 den2 and den1 in summary the 2004 outbreak of dengue in jakarta indonesia wa characterised by the circulation of multiple virus serotypes and resulted in a relatively high percentage of a representative population of hospitalised patient developing dhf

processed_title: dengue infection in international traveller visiting bali indonesia
processed_abstract: background dengue an acute febrile illness caused by infection with dengue virus denv is endemic in bali indonesia a one of the world most popular tourist destination bali is regularly visited by domestic and international traveller who are prone to infection by endemic pathogen including denv currently limited data are available on the characteristic of dengue in traveller visiting bali information on the epidemiology and virological aspect of dengue in these tourist is important to gain a better understanding of the dengue disease in international traveller method we performed a prospective crosssectional dengue study involving foreign traveller visiting bali indonesia in the period of 201517 patient presenting at kasih ibu hospital with fever and clinical symptom of dengue were asked to participate in the study clinical and laboratory assessment were performed and serum were collected for molecular analysis which included denv serotyping genome sequencing and phylogenetic analysis result among the 201 patient recruited dengue wa confirmed in 133 662 of them based on detection of ns1 antigen andor viral rna of these 115 865 manifested dengue fever df and 18 135 dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf the temporal predominance of infecting denv serotype wa denv2 487 followed by denv3 361 denv1 92 and denv4 34 phylogenetic analysis of denv based on envelope gene sequence revealed that the source of denvs wa local endemic virus conclusion our study confirms that dengue is one of the cause of fever in traveller visiting bali although it is a cause of significant morbidity the majority of patient only experienced mild df with only a small proportion developing dhf we revealed that denvs isolated were autochthonous accurate diagnosis preventive measure and continuous disease surveillance will be useful for better management of dengue infection in traveller

processed_title: dengue and covid19 infection in the asean region a concurrent outbreak of viral disease
processed_abstract: member country of the association of southeast asian nation asean have faced dengue outbreak for decade and the region ha one of the highest rate of dengue globally outbreak continue to occur concurrently with the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic in the 10 asean country both infectious disease pose a tremendous burden in these country related to both infection control and the economy increase in the number of dengue case occurred in part due to disruption in the pathogenhostvector relationship caused by change in human behaviour in response to the covid19 pandemic the spread of dengue wa further aggravated by the implementation of lockdown and social distancing policy these measure limited the coverage of dengue preventive program and delayed the medical management of both disease due to coinfection and misdiagnosis it is of the utmost importance for the population to remain aware of both disease and dengue vector control strategy must be devised to properly address outbreak using digitalization and remote surveillance similarly critical triage algorithm and further research are also needed to combat coinfection and misdiagnosis controlling the spread of covid19 though vaccination should also be undertaken to reduce the impact of the pandemic

processed_title: estimating the burden of dengue and the impact of release of wmel wolbachiainfected mosquito in indonesia a modelling study
processed_abstract: background wolbachiainfected mosquito reduce dengue virus transmission and citywide release in yogyakarta city indonesia are showing promising entomological result accurate estimate of the burden of dengue it spatial distribution and the potential impact of wolbachia are critical in guiding funder and government decision on it future wider use method here we combine multiple modelling method for burden estimation to predict national case burden disaggregated by severity and map the distribution of burden across the country using three separate data source an ensemble of transmission model then predicts the estimated reduction in dengue transmission following a nationwide rollout of wmel wolbachia result we estimate that 78 million 95 uncertainty interval ui 18177 million symptomatic dengue case occurred in indonesia in 2015 and were associated with 332865 ui 94175754203 lost disabilityadjusted life year dalys the majority of dengue burden wa due to nonsevere case that did not seek treatment or were challenging to diagnose in outpatient setting leading to substantial underreporting estimated burden wa highly concentrated in a small number of large city with 90 of dengue case occurring in 153 of land area implementing a nationwide wolbachia population replacement programme wa estimated to avert 862 ui 362999 of case over a longterm average conclusion these result suggest intervention targeted to the highest burden city can have a disproportionate impact on dengue burden areawide intervention such a wolbachia that are deployed based on the area covered could protect people more efficiently than individualbased intervention such a vaccine in such dense environment

processed_title: forest cover and climate a potential driver for dengue fever in sumatra and kalimantan 20062016 a spatiotemporal analysis
processed_abstract: objective to describe and quantify spatiotemporal trend of dengue fever at district level in sumatra and kalimantan indonesia in relation to forest cover and climatic factor method a spatial ecological study design wa used to analyse monthly surveillance data of notified dengue fever case from january 2006 to december 2016 in the 154 district of sumatra and 56 district of kalimantan a multivariate zeroinflated poisson regression model wa developed with a conditional autoregressive prior structure with posterior parameter estimated using bayesian markov chain monte carlo simulation with gibbs sampling result there were 230 745 case in sumatra and 132 186 case in kalimantan during the study period in sumatra the risk of dengue fever decreased by 9 95 credible interval cri 8595 for a 1 increase in forest cover and by 122 95 cri 119126 for a 1 increase in relative humidity in kalimantan dengue fever risk fell by 176 95 cri 171181 for a 1 increase in relative humidity and rose by 76 95 cri 6984 for a 1 degree c increase in minimum temperature there wa no significant residual spatial clustering in sumatra after accounting for climate and demographic variable in kalimantan high residual risk area were primarily centred in north and east of the island conclusion dengue fever in sumatra and kalimantan wa highly seasonal and associated with climate factor and deforestation incorporation of climate indicator into riskbased surveillance might be warranted for dengue fever in indonesia

processed_title: facilitator and barrier to engaging community in health service research on dengue control in indopacific region a systematic review
processed_abstract: background dengue is a public health problem in the indopacific country there are concern over the facilitator and barrier to community engagement in health service research aimed at dengue control the objective of his study wa to identify and synthesize facilitator and barrier to community engagement in health service research aimed at dengue control methodology the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma checklist wa used to perform this review healthrelated database including pubmed ovid and google scholar were searched for relevant study a consolidated framework with five domain wa developed after undertaking a sixphase reflective thematic assessment of the data result thirteen study were identified spanning eight lowand middleincome country of the indopacific region including cambodia india indonesia myanmar philippine sri lanka thailand and vietnam the study in this review covered the period from 2002 to 2021 a broad range of study design and objective were revealed across these 13 study an array of community such a the local government projectrelated health staff local health service staff community leader local communitiesresidencesgeneral public head of household community health volunteer school teacher and schoolchildren participated in these dengue related study the five consolidated framework for implementation research cfir domain of intervention characteristic inner setting outer setting individual characteristic and program implementation were used to identify and describe barrier and facilitator conclusion the finding indicate a range of barrier and facilitator to community engagement in dengue control in the selected lmic in the indopacific country future health service research on dengue control approach should be carefully planned methodologically constructed aligned with community engagement principle and involve considerable community participation at all stage of the research

processed_title: hyperendemic dengue and possible zika circulation in the westernmost region of the indonesian archipelago
processed_abstract: the transmission of dengue and other medically important mosquitoborne virus in the westernmost region of indonesia is not well described we assessed dengue and zika virus seroprevalence in aceh province the westernmost area of the indonesian archipelago serum sample collected from 199 randomly sampled healthy resident of aceh jaya in 2017 were analyzed for neutralizing antibody by plaque reduction neutralization test prnt almost all study participant 198199 995 presented with multitypic profile of neutralizing antibody to two or more denv serotypes indicating transmission of multiple denv in the region prior to 2017 all resident were exposed to one or more denv serotypes by the age of 30 year the highest geometric mean titer were measured for denv4 followed by denv1 denv2 and denv3 among a subset of 116 serum 27 neutralized zikv with a high stringency 20 with prnt90 10 and 7 with prnt90 40 this study showed that denv is hyperendemic in the westernmost region of the indonesian archipelago and suggested that zikv may have circulated prior to 2017

processed_title: resistance status of aedes mosquito a dengue vector and the potential of plant larvicide from indonesia for biological control a narrative review
processed_abstract: dengue fever remains a major public health threat in indonesia exacerbated by rising insecticide resistance in aedes aegypti strategy relying on chemical insecticide while initially effective have led to widespread resistance in mosquito population this resistance is particularly pronounced in area such a java where the extensive use of insecticide including organophosphate and pyrethroids ha been documented to address this challenge one promising alternative is the utilization of biolarvicides derived from local indonesian plant material biolarvicides are environmentally friendly safe and have the potential to mitigate the adverse impact associated with chemical insecticide numerous study have explored the larvicidal property of indigenous plant native to indonesia demonstrating their efficacy against a aegypti the aim of this study wa to examine insecticide resistance in aedes mosquito across indonesia highlighting geographical variation and underexplored region and exploring plant based biolarvicides a sustainable alternative biolarvicides derived from native indonesian plant could be ecofriendly alternative for dengue vector management their integration into existing control strategy could significantly enhance effort to control dengue while reducing the environmental and health risk posed by chemical insecticide

processed_title: investigation of severe dengue outbreak in maumere east nusa tenggara indonesia clinical serological and virological feature
processed_abstract: background dengue an acute febrile disease caused by dengue virus denv infection is endemic to indonesia during early 2020 an outbreak of severe dengue occurred in maumere east nusa tenggara province a region with low dengue endemicity with limited data on the characteristic of the circulating denv by 18 march 2020 1396 case were reported with 14 fatality investigation wa conducted to understand the cause and characteristic of the outbreak method serum were collected from 133 patient with denguelike symptom through random sampling at tc hillers hospital maumere during outbreak between february and june 2020 dengue wa confirmed using ns1 andor rtpcr detection serological status wa determined using iggigm elisa and plaque reduction neutralization test prnt denv serotyping and genome sequencing were performed to identify the denv serotype and genotype result we recruited suspected dengue patient attending the hospital during the outbreak dengue wa confirmed in 722 96133 while 188 25133 were diagnosed a probable dengue child under 18 year old accounted for 851 103121 of dengue case severe dengue accounted for 942 8186 of case secondary infection made up 926 112121 of case serotyping detected 873 6271 a denv3 70 571 a denv4 28 271 a denv1 and 28 271 a denv2 phylogenetic analysis revealed close evolutionary relationship of maumere denv to virus from other indonesian region especially bali and kupang prnt on denv3 secondary infection patient detected the presence of denv2 and denv4 neutralizing antibody conclusion the severe dengue outbreak in maumere is caused by denv3 introduced from nearby island the high proportion of secondary infection likely contributes to the severity of the disease the high percentage of antidengue neutralizing antibody for multiple serotypes and the high proportion of antidengue igg in young child suggests a history of dengue transmission with a high infection rate in the area

processed_title: a computational framework to solve the nonlinear dengue fever sir system
