processed_abstract: this study is relevant to present the numerical form of the nonlinear dengue fever sir system are presented using the artificial neural network along with the levenbergmarquardt backpropagation technique ie annslmb the procedure of annslmb are applied with three different sample data scale based on testing training and authentication the statistic to solve three case of the nonlinear dengue fever based on susceptible infected and recovered system are selected with 75 15 and 10 for training validation and testing respectively to find the numerical result of the nonlinear dengue fever system the reference dataset is designed on the basis of adam scheme for the numerical solution the numerical result based on the nonlinear dengue fever system are obtained through the annslmb to reduce the mean square error in order to check the exactness reliability effectiveness and competence of the proposed annslmb the numerical outcome are proficient to the proportional measure using the topography of the fitness attained in mean squared error sense correlation error histogram and regression

processed_title: improving dengue surveillance system with administrative claim data in indonesia opportunity and challenge
processed_abstract: administrative claim data is believed a one of the promising data set to augment the mandatory surveillance system which suffered from underreporting and delay in reporting therefore this study aim to examine whether the indonesian national health insurance inhi sample data could complement dengue casebased surveillance system in a more practical way afterwards this analysis also identified several future opportunity and challenge in improving the dengue surveillance system we utilized the referral care table linked with capitation and noncapitationbased primary care service table from 20152016 data cleaning query and visualization were performed using tableau public and microsoft power bi result show that dengue referral pattern is indicating the opportunity to detect dengue case in an earlier stage and high utilization of referral care disclose the patient behaviour therefore anonymous inhi sample data set potentially to complement dengue traditional surveillance system a huge number of health facility a data provider bridging and interoperability chance and opportunity of early detection are identified a future opportunity however we also determine challenge involving how to provide the mechanism for the quick and interoperable reporting system how to construct supportive regulation and anticipatory approach regarding the change in dengue diagnosis criterion a the implementation of icd 11 code thus practical approach should be prepared to support the utilization of inhi sample data

processed_title: temporal correlation between urban microclimate vector mosquito abundance and dengue case
processed_abstract: dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf is a major mosquitoborne viral disease study have reported a strong correlation between weather the abundance of aedes aegypti the vector of dhf virus and dengue incidence however this conclusion ha been based on the general climate pattern of wide region in general however the human population level of infrastructure and landuse change in rural and urban area often produce localized climate pattern that may influence the interaction between climate vector abundance and dengue incidence thoroughly understanding this correlation will allow the development of a customized and precise local early warning system to achieve this purpose we conducted a cohort study during januarydecember 2017 in 16 district in bandung west java indonesia in the selected area local weather station and modified light mosquito trap were set up to obtain data regarding daily weather and the abundance of adult female ae aegypti a generalized linear model wa applied to analyze the effect of local weather and female adult ae aegypti on the number of dengue case the result showed a significant nonlinear correlation among mosquito abundance maximum temperature and dengue case using our model the data showed that the addition of a single adult ae aegypti mosquito increased the risk of dengue infection by 18 while increasing the maximum temperature by one degree decreased the risk by 17 this finding suggests specific actionable insight needed to supplement existing mosquito eradication program

processed_title: natural compound and their analog a antiviral against dengue virus a review
processed_abstract: dengue virus denv continues to pose a significant global health challenge causing disease such a dengue fever dengue hemorrhagic fever and dengue shock syndrome while effort in vaccine development and antiviral drug discovery are ongoing effective therapeutic option remain limited in this review we highlight natural compound and the analog that demonstrated antiviral activity against denv in in vitro and in vivo study specifically these study examine alkaloid phenolic acid phenol flavonoid terpenoids and glycoside which have shown potential in inhibiting denv entry replication and reducing the cytokine storm by focusing on these bioactive compound and the analog a comprehensive overview of their promising role is provided to advance therapeutic strategy for combating denv infection

processed_title: geographic variation in dengue seroprevalence and force of infection in the urban paediatric population of indonesia
processed_abstract: understanding the heterogeneous nature of dengue transmission is important for prioritizing and guiding the implementation of prevention strategy however passive surveillance data in endemic country are rarely adequately informative we analyzed data from a clustersample crosssectional seroprevalence study in 118 yearolds to investigate geographic difference in dengue seroprevalence and force of infection in indonesia we used catalytic model to estimate the force of infection in each of the 30 randomly selected subdistricts based on these estimate we determined the proportion of subdistricts expected to reach seroprevalence level of 50 70 and 90 by year of age we used population averaged generalized estimating equation model to investigate individual and clusterlevel determinant of dengue seropositivity dengue force of infection varied substantially across indonesia ranging from 43 to 300 between subdistricts by age nine 60 of subdistricts are expected to have a seroprevalence 70 rising to 83 by age 11 higher odds of seropositivity were associated with higher population density or 154 per 10fold rise in population density 95 ci 103232 and with city relative to regency administrative status or 192 95 ci 132279 our finding highlight the substantial variation in dengue endemicity within indonesia and the importance of understanding spatial heterogeneity in dengue transmission intensity for optimal dengue prevention strategy including future implementation of dengue vaccination programme

processed_title: the changing incidence of dengue haemorrhagic fever in indonesia a 45year registrybased analysis
processed_abstract: background increase in human population size dengue vectordensity and human mobility cause rapid spread of dengue virus in indonesia we investigated the change in dengue haemorrhagic fever dhf incidence in indonesia over a 45year period and determined agespecific trend in annual dhf incidence method using an ongoing nationwide dengue surveillance program starting in 1968 we evaluated all dhf case and related death longitudinally up to 2013 population demographic were used to calculate annual incidence and case fatality ratio cfrs agespecific data on dhf available from 1993 onwards were used to assess trend in dhf agedistribution timedependency of dhf incidence and cfrs wa assessed using the cochranearmitage trend test result the annual dhf incidence increased from 005100000 in 1968 to 3540100000 in 2013 with superimposed epidemic demonstrating a similar increasing trend with the highest epidemic occurring in 2010 8570100000 p 001 the cfr declined from 41 in 1968 to 073 in 2013 p 001 mean age of dhf case increased during the observation period highest incidence of dhf wa observed among child aged 5 to 14 year up to 1998 but declined thereafter p 001 in those aged 15 year or over dhf incidence increased p 001 and surpassed that of 5 to 14 year old from 1999 onwards conclusion incidence of dhf over the past 45 year in indonesia increased rapidly with peak incidence shifting from young child to older age group the shifting age pattern should have consequence for targeted surveillance and prevention

processed_title: dengue encephalopathy
processed_abstract: dengue encephalopathy or dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf with cns involvement used to be considered a relatively rare condition but the number of case reported in human study ha been increasing every year diagnosis of dengue encephalopathy is based on clinically diagnosed dhf according to the who criterion 1980 with cns manifestation consisting of abrupt onset of hyperpyrexia nontransient alteration of consciousness headache vomitingwith or without seizuresand normal csf many factor may be considered to be directly or indirectly associated with cns sign and symptom in dhf the main pathology being leakage of plasma into serous space and abnormal hemostasis leading to hypovolemic shock and hemorrhage in many organ of the body acute liver failure is considered to be one of the main factor causing brain pathology one hundred fiftytwo case of dengue encephalopathy admitted during 3 period at the cipto mangunkusumo hospital in jakarta were studied retrospectively the overall incidence wa 152 out of 2441 dhf case or 62 the most pronounced symptom were hyperpyrexia alteration of consciousness and convulsion laboratory examination showed an unusually high increase of serum transaminase hyponatremia and hypoxia neurologic abnormality detected were hemiparesis and tetraparesis of the extremity and second nerve atrophy such abnormality were found in 10 out of the 152 case or 65

processed_title: dengue hemorrhagic fever in infant research opportunity ignored
processed_abstract: the age distribution of case of dengue hemorrhagic fever and dengue shock syndrome dhfdss in infant under the age of 1 year are reported from bangkok thailand and for the first time for ho chi minh city vietnam yangon myanmar and surabaya indonesia the four dengue virus were isolated from thai infant all of whom were having a primary dengue infection progress studying the immunologically distinct infant dhfdss ha been limited most contemporary research ha centered on dhfdss accompanying secondary dengue infection in designing research result obtained in study on a congruent animal model feline infectious peritonitis virus fipv infection of kitten born to fipvimmune queen should be considered research challenge presented by infant dhfdss are discussed

processed_title: paediatric dengue infection in cirebon indonesia a temporal and spatial analysis of notified dengue incidence to inform surveillance
processed_abstract: background the recent situation of dengue infection in cirebon district is concerning due to an upsurge trend since the year 2010 the largest dengue outbreak wa reported in 2016 which ha affected more than 1600 child a study wa conducted to explore the temporal variability of dengue outbreak in cirebons child population in during 20112017 and to assess the shortterm effect of climatic and environmental factor on dengue incidence in addition the spatial pattern of dengue incidence in child and highrisk village were investigated method a total of 4597 confirmed dengue case in child notified from january 2011 to december 2017 were analysed seasonal decomposition analysis wa carried out to examine the annual seasonality a generalized linear model glm wa applied to assess the shortterm effect of climate and normalized difference vegetation index ndvi on dengue incidence the incidence rate ratio irr of the final model wa reported spatial analysis were conducted by using morans i and local indicator of spatial association lisa analysis to explore geographical clustering in incidence and to identify highrisk village for dengue respectively result an annual dengue epidemic period wa observed with peak occurring every januaryfebruary based on the glm temperature at a lag 4 month irr 127 95 confidence interval 95 ci 122131 p 0001 rainfall at a lag 2 month irr 099 95 ci 099099 p 0001 humidity at lag 0 month irr 105 95 ci 104106 p 0001 and ndvi at a lag 1 month irr 307 95 ci 194486 p 0001 were associated with dengue incidence in child the dengue incidence in child wa spatially varied and clustered at the village level across cirebon during 20112017 a total of 38 highrisk village for dengue were identified which were mainly located in the northern part of cirebon conclusion seasonal pattern of dengue incidence in child in cirebon were strongly associated with rainfall temperature humidity and ndvi variability suggesting that climatic and environmental data could be used to help predict dengue outbreak our spatial analysis revealed a clustered pattern in dengue incidence and highrisk village for dengue across cirebon suggesting that effective intervention such a vector surveillance and schoolbased campaign should be prioritized around the identified highrisk village temporal and spatial analytical tool could be utilized to support local health authority to apply timely and targeted public health intervention and help better planning and decisionmaking in order to minimize the impact of dengue outbreak

processed_title: transmission of epidemic dengue hemorrhagic fever in easternmost indonesia
processed_abstract: in april 2001 a second suspected outbreak of dengue hemorrhagic fever in the easternmost region of indonesia wa investigated in merauke a town located in the southeastern corner of papua by the indonesian ministry of health and the u naval medical research unit no 2 principal case criterion of hemorrhagic disease provided for a study enrollment of 15 clinically acute and 37 convalescing subject additionally 32 comparable agesex control were selected from neighboring household laboratory diagnosis involved three testing methodology virus isolation by cell culture a reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction rtpcr assay and serologic assay antibody igm to dengue virus wa detected in 27 of the acute clinical case 30 of the convalescing case and only 3 of the matched control dengue 3 wa the only viral serotype detected from acute serum sample by the rtpcr the mean sd age of the acute and convalescing case wa 78 54 year overall hospital record accounted for 172 suspected outbreak case all urban resident of merauke with no recent travel history outside the area the estimated outbreakassociated case fatality rate among all suspected dengue case wa 12 a sevenyear retrospective review of hospital record in merauke showed negligible disease reporting involving hemorrhagic disease prior to the outbreak

processed_title: is there any association between body mass index and severity of dengue infection
processed_abstract: background dengue an acute infectious disease caused by a flavivirus is a threat to global health there is sparse evidence exploring obesity and the development of more severe dengue case in adult with increasing prevalence of obesity in area with a high risk of dengue infection obesity may increase the burden and mortality related to dengue infection our study aimed to determine the association between obesity and the development of more severe dengue infection in primary healthcare setting and whether these association were modified by dengue fever phase method a cohort study wa conducted among laboratoryconfirmed dengue patient aged 18 y in the central region of peninsular malaysia from may 2016 to november 2017 we collected demographic clinical history physical examination and laboratory examination information using a standardized form dengue severity d wa defined a either dengue with warning sign or severe dengue participant underwent daily followup during which we recorded their vital sign warning sign and full blood count result incidence of d wa modeled using mixedeffects logistic regression change in platelet count and hematocrit were modeled using mixedeffects linear regression the final multivariable model were adjusted for age gender ethnicity and previous dengue infection result a total of 173 patient were enrolled and followed up the mean body mass index bmi wa 3741375 kgm2 the majority of patient were malay 659 followed by chinese 173 indian 127 and other ethnic group 41 a total of 90 patient 520 were male while 36 patient 208 had a previous history of dengue infection bmi wa significantly associated with d adjusted or117 95 ci 104 to 134 and hematocrit abeta009 95 ci 001 to 016 but not with platelet count x103microl abeta001 95 ci 084 to 081 in the dose response analysis we found that a bmi increase the odds of d hematocrit level and platelet level increase during the first phase of dengue fever conclusion higher bmi and higher hematocrit level were associated with higher odds of d among those with high bmi the development of d wa observed during phase one of dengue fever instead of during phase two these novel result could be used by clinician to help them riskstratify dengue patient for closer monitoring and subsequent prevention of severe dengue complication

processed_title: stegomyia index and risk of dengue transmission a lack of correlation
processed_abstract: dengue is present in 128 country worldwide and is still expanding there is currently no treatment or universally approved vaccine available therefore prevention and control of mosquito vector remain the most efficient way of managing the risk of dengue outbreak the stegomyia index have been developed a quantitative indicator of the risk of dengue outbreak however conflictual data are circulating about their reliability we report in this article the first extensive study on stegomyia index covering 78 location of differing environmental and socioeconomic condition climate and population density across indonesia from west sumatra to papua a total of 65876 mosquito larva and pupa were collected for the study a correlation wa found between incidence and human population density no correlation wa found between the incidence of dengue and the stegomyia index

processed_title: correlation between complement component level and disease severity in dengue patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf is a severe form of dengue fever df recent in vitro study indicate that complement reduces the infectionenhancing activity of dengue antibody suggesting it in vivo role in controlling viremia level and disease severity in this study the complement hemolytic activity ch50 and level of complement component and related factor in dengue patient in indonesia were assessed based on the number of day since fever onset df patient were compared with patient at the dhf precritical phase who showed deterioration within 2 day the mean ch50 value and level of c2 c4 and factor b and h in the dhf precritical phase group were significantly lower than those in the df group the mean ch50 value were significantly correlated with c4 factor b or factor h level indicating their responsibility for reduced ch50 value furthermore a significantly higher proportion of the dhf precritical phase group 78 than the df group 33 wa positive for the nonstructural protein 1 ns1 antigen these result suggested that antibodydependent enhancement of infection occurs during a period of low complement activity which is associated with ns1 level during the acute phase in some patient thereby leading to increased viremia level and greater disease severity

processed_title: the immunogenicity and safety of cydtetravalent dengue vaccine cydtdv in child and adolescent a systematic review
processed_abstract: aim to assess the immunogenicity and safety of cydtetravalent dengue vaccine cydtdv in child method comprehensive literature search were conducted on various database randomizedcontrolled trial on child with cydtdv a intervention were selected based on inclusion and exclusion criterion data extracted from selected trial included safety of vaccine and immunogenicity in term of geometric mean titre gmt of antibody result six clinical trial were selected based on preset criterion gmt value were obtained using 50 plaque reduction neutralization test prnt and safety wa semiquantitatively assessed based on adverse effect additional data processing wa done to obtain a better understanding on the trend among the study the result showed that the group vaccinated with cydtdv showed higher immunogenicity against dengue virus antigen than the control group safety result were satisfactory in all trial and most severe side effect were unrelated to the vaccine conclusion cydtdv is both effective and safe for patient in endemic region this give promise for further development and largescale research on this vaccine to assess it efficacy in decreasing dengue prevalence and it pervasive implementation in endemic country such a indonesia

processed_title: dengue seroprevalence study in bali
processed_abstract: introduction dengue infection pose significant public health problem in tropical and subtropical region worldwide the clinical manifestation of dengue vary from asymptomatic to severe dengue manifestation this serological survey highlighted the high incidence of asymptomatic case this study aimed to determine the prevalence of dengue in healthy and ill adult in bali method crosssectional seroprevalence survey were performed between july 2020 and june 2021 among healthy and ill adult in denpasar bali blood sample were collected from 539 randomly selected urban site in denpasar immunoglobulin g antibody against the dengue virus were detected in serum using a commercial enzymelinked immunosorbent assay kit result overall the dengue seroprevalence rate among the 539 clinically healthy and ill adult wa high 855 the median age wa 341 18861 most of the participant in the study were younger than 40 year 612 men were the dominant sex 545 the study found a significant association between dengue seropositivity among people aged 40 year and healthy status p 0005 odds ratio or 0459 and p 0001 or 0336 respectively the study reported that a many a 60 of the subject had a history of previously suspected dengue infection this study reflected the proportion of asymptomatic dengue patient requiring better assessment with a serological test conclusion the current study highlighted that real case of dengue infection may be higher than reported with a high prevalence of dengue seropositivity and a relatively dominant proportion of asymptomatic case the study guide physician to be aware of every dengue infection in tropical country and prevent the spread of the disease

processed_title: causality analysis of google trend and dengue incidence in bandung indonesia with linkage of digital data modeling longitudinal observational study
processed_abstract: background the popularity of dengue can be inferred from google trend that summarizes google search of related topic both the disease and it google trend have a similar source of causation in the dengue virus leading u to hypothesize that dengue incidence and google trend result have a longrun equilibrium objective this research aimed to investigate the property of this longrun equilibrium in the hope of using the information derived from google trend for the early detection of upcoming dengue outbreak method this research used the cointegration method to assess a longrun equilibrium between dengue incidence and google trend result the longrun equilibrium wa characterized by their linear combination that generated a stationary process the dickeyfuller test wa adopted to check the stationarity of the process an error correction model ecm wa then adopted to measure deviation from the longrun equilibrium to examine the shortterm and longterm effect the resulting model were used to determine the granger causality between the two process additional information about the two process wa obtained by examining the impulse response function and variance decomposition result the dickeyfuller test supported an implicit null hypothesis that the dengue incidence and google trend result are nonstationary process p01 a further test showed that the process were cointegrated p01 indicating that their particular linear combination is a stationary process these result permitted u to construct ecm the model showed the direction of causality of the two process indicating that google trend result will grangercause dengue incidence not in the reverse order conclusion various hypothesis testing result in this research concluded that google trend result can be used a an initial indicator of upcoming dengue outbreak

processed_title: autochthonous dengue outbreak in italy 2020 clinical virological and entomological finding
processed_abstract: background in august 2020 in the context of covid19 pandemic an autochthonous dengue outbreak wa identified for the first time in italy method following the reporting of the index case of autochthonous dengue epidemiological investigation vector control and substance of human origin safety measure were immediately activated according to the national arbovirus surveillance plan dengue case were followedup with weekly visit and laboratory test until recovery and clearance of viral rna from blood result the primary dengue case wa identified in a young woman who developed fever after returning from indonesia to northern italy on 27 july 2020 she spent the mandatory quarantine for covid19 at home with relative six of whom developed dengue within two week epidemiological investigation identified further five autochthonous dengue case among people who lived or stayed near the residence of the primary case the last case of the outbreak developed fever on 29 september 2020 dengue case had a mild febrile illness except one with persistent asthenia and myalgia denv1 rna wa detected in blood andor urine in all autochthonous case up to 35 day after fever onset all case developed igm and igg antibody which crossreacted with west nile virus wnv and other flavivirus sequencing of the full viral genome from blood sample showed over 99 nucleotide identity with denv1 strain isolated in china in 20142015 phylogenetic analysis classified the virus within genotype i entomological site inspection identified a high density of aedes albopictus mosquito which conceivably sustained local denv1 transmission aedes koreicus mosquito were also collected in the site conclusion area in europe with high density of aedes mosquito should be considered at risk for dengue transmission the presence of endemic flavivirus such a wnv might pose problem in the laboratory diagnosis

processed_title: homogeneity and possible replacement of population of the dengue vector aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus in indonesia
processed_abstract: currently aedes aegypti the principal vector of dengue virus in indonesia ha spread throughout the archipelago aedes albopictus is also present invasion and high adaptability of the aedes mosquito to all of these area are closely related to their ecology and biology between june 2016 and july 2017 larval and adult mosquito collection were conducted in 43 location in 25 province of indonesia using standardized sampling method for dengue vector surveillance the sample collected were analyzed for polymorphism and phylogenetic relationship using the mitochondrial cox1 gene and the nuclear ribosomal internal transcribed spacer 2 its2 almost all ae aegypti sample collected in this study 89 belonged to the same haplotype a similar situation is observed with the nuclear its2 marker population of ae aegypti characterized few year ago were genetically different a closely related observation wa made with aedes albopictus for which the current population are different from those described earlier ae aegypti population were found to be highly homogenous all over indonesia with all sample belonging to the same maternal lineage although difficult to demonstrate formally there is a possibility of population replacement although to a lower extent a similar conclusion wa reached with ae albopictus

processed_title: exploring community need in combating aedes mosquito and dengue fever a study with urban community in the recurrent hotspot area
processed_abstract: background aedes mosquito are the main vector of dengue infection a global health threat affecting million of people annually conventional prevention and control method against dengue outbreak have only achieved marginal success recognizing the complex issue at hand a multilevel participatory approach is crucial thus alternative strategy that involve community engagement are increasingly being considered and attempted while communitybased vector control program have been conducted sustaining behavioral change among the population remains a challenge this study aimed to identify the specific community need in combating aedes mosquito and dengue fever a a basis to guide the development of communitydriven initiative and foster a deeper sense of ownership in the fight against dengue method between 1 august 2022 and 30 november 2022 we conducted a study in hulu langat district selangor using a mixedmethod design all participant consented to the study which comprised 27 participant fgds and 15 participant idis the idis included two participant with a history of dengue fever one community leader one faith leader seven local authority and four district health officer semistructured interview and discussion were performed among stakeholder and community member recruited via purposive and snowball sampling technique all interview were audiorecorded before being analyzed using reflexive thematic analysis result these result derived from qualitative data explored the perspective and need of community in combating aedes mosquito and dengue fever interview were conducted with various stakeholder including community member leader and health officer the study identified the necessity of decisive action by authority to address the impact of the dengue epidemic the importance of community engagement through partnership and participatory approach the potential benefit of incentive and reward to enhance community participation and the need for sustained community engagement and education especially via the involvement of young people in prevention effort these finding provide valuable insight into the design of effective strategy against aedes mosquito and dengue fever conclusion in short there is an urgent need for a comprehensive approach involving multiple stakeholder in the fight against aedes mosquito and dengue fever the approach should incorporate effort to raise awareness provide practical resource and foster community responsibility the active involvement of teenager a volunteer can contribute to longterm prevention effort collaboration resource allocation and community engagement are crucial for effective dengue control and a healthier environment

processed_title: predicting potential area at risk of the dengue hemorrhagic fever in jakarta indonesiaanalyzing the accuracy of predictive hot spot analysis in the absence of small geographical area data
processed_abstract: dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf a more severe form of dengue is one of the most rapidly spreading mosquitoborne disease in the world this study is motivated by the rising dhf incidence in jakarta the capital city of indonesia we mainly utilized hot spot analysis which employ spatial statistic to find atrisk area for dhf outbreak in jakarta five municipality however producing informative result from hot spot analysis requires a complete set of data on each of jakarta 42 district which is not available we thus propose the idea of using small area estimation sae and machine learning to make up for the lack of data to evaluate whether this proposed method is effective we compare the hot spot result from the estimation with the actual data of each district the result show that the estimated hot spot map is similar to the hot spot map from the actual data this implies that it is possible to find potential atrisk area of dengue fever without a complete dataset in every small geographic area we expect that this research can increase the performance of dhf control measure at the district level even in the absence of small area data

processed_title: symptomatic dengue in child in 10 asian and latin american country
processed_abstract: background the control group in two phase 3 trial of dengue vaccine efficacy included two large regional cohort that were followed up for dengue infection these cohort provided a sample for epidemiologic analysis of symptomatic dengue in child across 10 country in southeast asia and latin america in which dengue is endemic method we monitored acute febrile illness and virologically confirmed dengue vcd in 3424 healthy child 2 to 16 year of age in asia indonesia malaysia the philippine thailand and vietnam from june 2011 through december 2013 and in 6939 child 9 to 18 year of age in latin america brazil colombia honduras mexico and puerto rico from june 2011 through april 2014 acute febrile episode were determined to be vcd by mean of a nonstructural protein 1 antigen immunoassay and reversetranscriptasepolymerasechainreaction assay dengue hemorrhagic fever wa defined according to 1997 world health organization criterion result approximately 10 of the febrile episode in each cohort were confirmed to be vcd with 319 vcd episode 46 episode per 100 personyears occurring in the asian cohort and 389 vcd episode 29 episode per 100 personyears occurring in the latin american cohort no trend according to age group wa observed the incidence of dengue hemorrhagic fever wa less than 03 episode per 100 personyears in each cohort the percentage of vcd episode requiring hospitalization wa 191 in the asian cohort and 111 in the latin american cohort in comparable age group 9 to 12 year and 13 to 16 year the burden of dengue wa higher in asia than in latin america conclusion the burden of dengue were substantial in the two region and in all age group burden varied widely according to country but the rate were generally higher and the disease more frequently severe in asian country than in latin american country funded by sanofi pasteur cyd14 and cyd15 clinicaltrialsgov number nct01373281 and nct01374516

processed_title: public acceptance and willingnesstopay for a future dengue vaccine a communitybased survey in bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background all four serotypes of dengue virus are endemic in indonesia where the population at risk for infection exceeds 200 million people despite continuous control effort that were initiated more than four decade ago indonesia still suffers from multiannual cycle of dengue outbreak and dengue remains a a major public health problem dengue vaccine have been viewed a a promising solution for controlling dengue in indonesia but thus far it potential acceptability ha not been assessed methodologyprincipal finding we conducted a household survey in the city of bandung indonesia by administering a questionnaire to examine i acceptance of a hypothetical pediatric dengue vaccine ii participant willingnesstopay wtp for the vaccine had it not been provided for free and iii whether people think vector control would be unnecessary if the vaccine wa available a proportional odds model and an interval regression model were employed to identify determinant of acceptance and wtp respectively we demonstrated that out of 500 head of household being interviewed 942 would agree to vaccinate their child with the vaccine of all participant 946 were willing to pay for the vaccine with a median wtp of us194 in addition 72 stated that vector control would not be necessary had there been a dengue vaccination program conclusionssignificance our result suggest that future dengue vaccine can have a very high uptake even when delivered through the private market this however can be influenced by vaccine characteristic and price in addition reduction in community vector control effort may be observed following vaccine introduction but it potential impact in the transmission of dengue and other vectorborne disease requires further study

processed_title: effect of vitamin d supplementation on resolution of fever and cough in child with pulmonary tuberculosis a randomized doubleblind controlled trial in indonesia
processed_abstract: background various study in adult have shown a strong association between vitamin d and tuberculosis tb both in term of vitamin d status and the benefit of vitamin d in managing tb study on vitamin d and it relationship with childhood tb still lack in indonesia a a country with the secondhighest tb incidence globally this study evaluated the effect of vitamin d supplementation on resolution of cough and fever in indonesian child with pulmonary tb method we conducted a randomized controlled trial of vitamin d supplementation in child with pulmonary tb and vitamin d insufficiency patient were randomly allocated with 11 ratio to receive either 1000 iu vitamin d or placebo daily after starting standard tb treatment the primary outcome in this study wa the resolution of fever and cough symptom reviewed weekly after starting the treatment until the symptom are resolved the secondary outcome in this study wa 25hydroxyvitamin d serum level and nutritional status which wa reviewed at the end of the trial intention to treat analysis were applied difference in clinical outcome between two group were calculated using mannwhitney u test or chi2 test where appropriate finding a total of 84 patient met the inclusion criterion aged 6 to 18 year old newly diagnosed with pulmonary tb and vitamin d insufficiency eighty patient 952 completed the six month followup faster resolution of fever cough improved malnutrition status and higher vitamin d level were found in the intervention group compared to the placebo group all p 0001 conclusion vitamin d is beneficial in improving fever and cough resolution and improving nutritional status in child with pulmonary tb and vitamin d insufficiency determination of adequate supplementation level of more than 1000 iu requires further research to achieve normal vitamin d level during the duration of treatment for pulmonary tb in child trial registration clinicaltrialsgov nct05073965

processed_title: nonnutritional anemia malaria thalassemia g6pd deficiency and tuberculosis in indonesia
processed_abstract: anemia affect people worldwide and result in increased morbidity and mortality particularly in child and reproductiveage woman anemia is caused by an imbalance between red blood cell rbc loss and production erythropoiesis which can be caused by not only nutritional factor but also nonnutritional factor such a inflammation and genetics understanding the complex and varied etiology of anemia is crucial for developing effective intervention and monitoring anemia control program this review focusses on two interrelated nonnutritional cause of anemia malaria infection and rbc disorder thalassemia and g6pd deficiency a well a tuberculosis according to the haldane hypothesis thalassemia occurs a a protective trait toward malaria infection whereas g6pdd arises in malariaendemic region because of positive selection indonesia is a malariaendemic region thus the frequency of thalassemia and g6pd deficiency is high which contributes to a greater risk for nonnutritional anemia a indonesia is the second global contributor to the newly diagnosed tuberculosis and active pulmonary tuberculosis patient are more anemic tuberculosis is also contributes to the increasing risk of anemia therefore to reduce anemia rate in indonesia authority must consider nonnutritional cause that might influence the local incidence of anemia and apply comanagement of endemic infectious disease such a malaria and tuberculosis and of genetic disease ie thalassemia and g6pdd

processed_title: clinical and economic burden of drugsusceptible tuberculosis in indonesia national trend 201719
processed_abstract: background the global incidence of tuberculosis is decreasing yet it remains high in indonesia the indonesian national tuberculosis program facilitates mandatory notification which enables early detection and treatment minimises complication prevents transmission and decrease death this study aimed to assess the characteristic trend and economic burden of notified drugsusceptible tuberculosis case registered in this system from 2017 to 2019 method we performed a multiyear crosssectional study focusing on drugsusceptible tuberculosis notified case incidence geographical tuberculosis case distribution treatment outcome and cost in indonesia using data from sistem informasi tuberkulosis 201719 the setting were indonesian healthcare facility that provide tuberculosis control programme and service eligible patient were those who were diagnosed with drugsusceptible tuberculosis and notified to sistem informasi tuberkulosis finding between 2017 and 2019 notified case increased from 429 219 to 523 614 individual corresponding to an increase in incidence from 167 case per 100 000 to 196 case per 100 000 in 2019 more than 250 case per 100 000 inhabitant were notified in jakarta north sulawesi gorontalo and papua treatment success rate increased from 363 098 8460 of 429 219 in 2017 to 452 966 8651 of 523 614 in 2019 with a relatively stable mortality changing from 315 to 305 hiv status wa increasingly confirmed with unknown status decreasing from 6621 to 4368 the cost of visit and monitoring and drug regimen were relatively stable with total direct medical cost slightly increasing from us3940 to 4040 per case interpretation progress wa made on drugsusceptible tuberculosis management in indonesia however further intensified effort including casefinding optimising diagnosis and costeffective tuberculosis management are required if indonesia is to achieve the 2025 who end tuberculosis strategy target incidence of fewer than 55 case per 100 000 people these data are an important starting point for understanding drugsusceptible tuberculosis dynamic in indonesia and optimising it management funding directorate general of higher education ministry of education culture research and technology of the republic of indonesia

processed_title: xpert ultra stool testing to diagnose tuberculosis in child in ethiopia and indonesia a modelbased costeffectiveness analysis
processed_abstract: objective the who currently recommends stool testing using genexpert mtbrif xpert for the diagnosis of paediatric tuberculosis tb the simple onestep so stool method enables processing for xpert testing at the primary healthcare phc level we modelled the impact and costeffectiveness of implementing the so stool method at phc for the diagnosis of paediatric tb in ethiopia and indonesia compared with the standard of care setting all child age 15 year presenting with presumptive tb at primary healthcare or hospital level in ethiopia and indonesia primary outcome costeffectiveness estimated a incremental cost compared with incremental disabilityadjusted lifeyears dalys saved method decision tree modelling wa used to represent pathway of patient care and referral we based model parameter on ongoing study and surveillance systematic literature review and expert opinion we estimated cost using data available publicly and obtained through incountry expert consultation health outcome were based on modelled mortality and discounted lifeyears lost result the intervention increased the sensitivity of tb diagnosis by 1925 in both country leading to a 1420 relative reduction in mortality under the intervention fewer child seeking care at phc were referred or selfreferred to higher level of care the number of child initiating antitb treatment att increased by 1825 and more child 85 initiated att at phc level cost increased under the intervention compared with a base case using smear microscopy in the standard of care resulting in incremental costeffectiveness ratio of us132 and us94 per daly averted in ethiopia and indonesia respectively at a costeffectiveness threshold of 05xgross domestic product per caput the projected probability of the intervention being costeffective in ethiopia and indonesia wa 87 and 96 respectively the intervention remained costeffective under sensitivity analysis conclusion the addition of the so stool method to national algorithm for diagnosing tb in child is likely to be costeffective in both ethiopia and indonesia

processed_title: tuberculosis
processed_abstract: tuberculosis is a leading cause of death globally given the airborne transmission of tuberculosis anybody can be infected but people in highincidence setting are more exposed risk of progression to disease is higher in the first year after infection and in people with undernourishment immunosuppression or who smoke drink alcohol or have diabetes although cough fever and weight loss are hallmark symptom people with tuberculosis can be asymptomatic so a high index of suspicion is required prompt diagnosis can be made by sputum examination ideally with rapid molecular test but chest radiography can be helpful most people with disease can be treated with regimen of 6 month or less longer regimen may be necessary for those with drug resistance central to successful treatment is comprehensive personcentred care including addressing key determinant such a undernourishment smoking and alcohol use and optimising management of comorbidities such a diabetes and hiv care should continue after treatment end a longterm sequela are common prevention relies mostly on treatment with rifamycinbased regimen current vaccine have limited efficacy ongoing research on shorter and safer regimen for infection and disease treatment and simpler and more accurate diagnostic method will be key for tuberculosis elimination

processed_title: tuberculosis and other cause of uveitis in indonesia
processed_abstract: purposethe purpose of this study is to assess the cause of uveitis in indonesia and determine the importance of tuberculosis tb a a cause of uveitispatients and methodsprospective cohort study examining 146 consecutive new human immunodeficiency virusnegative patient with active uveitis between june 2014 and may 2015 we assessed the anatomic location and specific cause of uveitis a well a association with infectious and noninfectious systemic disease we determined the prevalence of positive quantiferon tb gold test qft result in indonesian patient with uveitis and calculated the number of patient with active systemic tbresultsposterior and panuveitis were the most common anatomic entity 38 each infection represented the most frequent cause of uveitis 33 the most prevalent were toxoplasmosis 19 and active systemic tb 8 the majority of patient were qft positive 61 a specific diagnosis could not be established in 45 of the patient at first presentation to the ophthalmologist the majority of patient 66 had a visual acuity of less than finger counting at 3 m and already exhibited various complication of uveitis when classifying the qftpositive patient with unexplained uveitis into a tbrelated group the percentage of tbassociated uveitis case increased from 848 highly elevated qft level were observed in patient with uveitis of unknown cause and no sign of active systemic tbconclusionsin indonesia infectious uveitis wa the most common type of uveitis and the leading cause consisted of toxoplasmosis and tb the association observed between highly elevated qft result and uveitis of otherwise unexplained origin indicates that a link exists between the latent tb infection and the development of uveitis

processed_title: the prevalence and risk factor for tuberculosis among healthcare worker in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: healthcare worker hcws are at risk of contracting tb particularly when in high tuberculosis tb burden setting routine surveillance data and evidence are limited on the burden of tb amongst hcws in indonesia we aimed to measure the prevalence of tb infection tbi and disease among hcws in four healthcare facility in yogyakarta province in indonesia and explore risk factor for tbi a crosssectional tb screening study targeted all hcws from four preselected facility 1 hospital 3 primary care in yogyakarta indonesia voluntary screening included symptom assessment chest xray cxr xpert mtbrif if indicated and tuberculin skin test tst analysis were descriptive and included multivariable logistic regression of 792 hcws 681 consented 86 to the screening 59 n 401 were female 62 were medical staff n 421 77 worked in the one participating hospital n 524 and the median time working in the health sector wa 13 year iqr 625 year nearly half had provided service for people with tb 46 n 316 and 9 reported ever having tb n 60 among participant with presumptive tb 15 n 99662 none were diagnosed microbiologically or clinically with active tb disease tbi wa detected in 25 95 ci 2230 n 112441 of eligible hcws with a tst result a significant association wa found between tb infection and being male adjusted odds ratio aor 202 95ci 129317 currently working in the participating hospital compared to primary care aor 315 95ci 175566 and older age 105 or increase per year of life between 1973 year 95ci 102106 this study support prioritisation of hcws a a highrisk group for tb infection and disease and the need for comprehensive prevention and control program in indonesia further it identifies characteristic of hcws in yogyakarta at higher risk of tbi who could be prioritised in screening program if universal coverage of prevention and control measure can not be achieved

processed_title: variation of tuberculosis prevalence across diagnostic approach and geographical area of indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb ha contributed to a significant disease burden and economic loss worldwide given no gold standard for diagnosis early identification of tb infection ha been challenging this study aimed to comparatively investigate the prevalence of tb across diagnostic approach sputum afb sputum culture sputum genetic test and chest xray and geographical area of indonesia method participant demographic variable and tb screening test result were obtained from the tuberculosis unit health research and development agency ministry of health hrdamoh the prevalence of pulmonary tb in population aged 15 year and over wa calculated using tb case a a numerator and population aged 15 year and over a a denominator variation across geographical area and diagnostic approach were expressed a prevalence and 95 confidence interval ci result a total of 67944 record were reviewed based on bacteriological evidence the prevalence of tb per 100000 in indonesia wa 759 95 ci 58979608 with variation across area 913 95 ci 696711767 sumatra 593 95 ci 44727706 javabali and 842 95 ci 634710918 other island also the prevalence of tb varied across diagnostic approach 2565 sputum afb 545 sputum culture 7522 chest xray and 8949 sputum genetic test based on sputum afb the tb prevalence varied from 2166 95 ci 14652868 javabali 2599 95 ci 18423356 other island to 3074 95 ci 20834065 sumatra based on sputum culture the tb prevalence ranged from 4879 95 ci 43365486 javabali 6359 95 ci 56497151 sumatra to 21298 95 ci 1664027356 other island based on chest xray the tb prevalence varied from 1521 95 ci 14791563 javabali 1592 95 ci 15411643 sumatra to 864 95 ci 8099214 other island based on sputum genetic test the tb prevalence ranged from 8387 95 ci 74849008 javabali 875 95 ci 77549342 sumatra to 9412 95 ci 66369923 other island conclusion the variation of tb prevalence across geographical region could be confounded by the diagnostic approach trial registration this study wa approved by the institutional review board of chulalongkorn university irb no 68463

processed_title: stigma towards people with tuberculosis a crosscultural adaptation and validation of a scale in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction tuberculosis tb remains a highly stigmatised disease that can cause or exacerbate mental health disorder despite increased awareness of the importance of reducing tb stigma validated tool to measure tb stigma remain scarce this study aimed to culturally adapt and validate the van rie tb stigma scale in indonesia a country with the second largest tb incidence worldwide method we validated the scale in three phase translation cultural adaptation and psychometric evaluation we invited diverse expert to an interdisciplinary panel for the crosscultural adaptation then performed a psychometric evaluation of the scale exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis reliability analysis and correlation analysis with patient health questionnaire 9 phq9 result we culturally adapted the original scale language and content during the translation and cultural adaptation phase after psychometric evaluation with 401 participant in seven province of indonesia we removed two item the new scale had two form a patient and b community perspective form both form had good internal consistency with respective cronbachs alpha value of 0738 and 0807 we identified three loading factor in form a disclosure isolation and guilty and two loading factor in form b isolation and distancing the scale showed correlation with phq9 form a r 0347 p 0001 form b r 0 conclusion the culturally adapted indonesian version of van ries tb stigma scale is comprehensive reliable internally consistent and valid the scale is now ready for applied scaleup in research and practice to measure tbstigma and evaluate the impact of tbstigma reduction intervention in indonesia

processed_title: characteristic of drugsensitive and drugresistant tuberculosis case among adult at tuberculosis referral hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: a indonesia rifampin resistance testing rate are lower than global testing rate per the 2020 who global tuberculosis tb report prevalence of multidrugresistant tb may be underestimated our study aimed to evaluate prevalence and pattern of tb drug resistance dr within indonesia we conducted a crosssectional analysis of baseline data collected from 20172018 a part of a cohort study of adult with presumed pulmonary tb at 7 drtb referral hospital in indonesia bacteriological examination acidfast bacillus genexpert sputum culture and drugsusceptibility testing were performed following the guideline of the national tb program of 447 participant with complete bacteriological examination 312 698 had positive sputum culture for mycobacterium tuberculosis the proportion of mdr and preextensively drugresistant wa higher in previously treated compared with newly diagnosed participant 525 73139 versus 15 26173 compared with drugsensitive case drugresistant tb wa associated with cavity given the difference between rate of dr in tb referral hospital from our study compared with the who survey in 2019 that showed 177 and 33 dr among previously treated and newly diagnosed participant globally further characterization of indonesia tb epidemiology in the general population is needed strategy including public policy to optimize case finding strengthen capacity for resistance testing and prevent loss to followup will be critical to reduce the burden of tb in indonesia

processed_title: determinant of quality of life among people with hiv and tuberculosis in an underserved area in indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: introduction human immunodeficiency virus hiv and tuberculosis tb remain global health problem and impose a substantial reduction in people s quality of life qol this study aimed to assess and compare the qol in hiv and tb patient and factor associated with qol between those group method a crosssectional study wa conducted at a hospital clinic in jayapura indonesia between december 2022 and march 2023 those who were aged above 18 year diagnosed with hiv or tb infection have been taking hiv or tb medication for at least 3 month and provided informed consent were eligible to participate patient qol wa measured using the bahasa indonesia version of a validated 26item world health organization quality of life brief whoqolbref questionnaire result a total of 365 patient with hiv and 125 with tb were included the majority of participant were papuan 759 and aged 20 65 year 929 more than half of the participant were female 565 employed 508 married 655 and had family support 649 education level and social support were predictor of poor physical health in the hiv group while ethnicity wa a predictor in the tb group patient age wa associated with poor psychological health in hiv whereas sex wa the associated factor in tb patient ethnicity wa the only predictor of poor social relationship in those with tb whereas patient age wa a predictor of poor environmental health in the hiv group marital status and education were predictor in the tb group finally only social support wa associated with poor general qol in tb patient conclusion tuberculosis tb patient had poorer qol than those with hiv there is a need for more awareness to support those receiving tb treatment in addition further research is needed to understand in more detail the determinant of patient with drugresistant tb tb with hiv and drugresistant tbhiv to ensure that intervention are designed to help them

processed_title: acceptability and feasibility of tuberculosisdiabetes mellitus screening implementation in private primary care clinic in yogyakarta indonesia a qualitative study
processed_abstract: background the relationship between tuberculosis tb and diabetes mellitus dm is intricate and intertwined posing significant global health challenge in addition the increasing prevalence of dm worldwide raise concern regarding the potential resurgence of tuberculosis the implementation of tuberculosis prevention strategy is of the utmost importance especially in country like indonesia that encounter a dual burden of tb and dm the significance of tb screening in private primary care setting for patient with diabetes can not be overstated implementing tb screening protocol in private primary care setting can assist in identifying diabetic patient with tuberculosis therefore this study aim to explore the acceptability and feasibility of tuberculosisdiabetes mellitus screening implementation in private primary care clinic method we conducted implementation research with an exploratory qualitative design fifteen healthcare professional from five private primary health care clinic in yogyakarta indonesia participated in five focus group the discussion were audio recorded transcribed verbatim and thematically analyzed a part of the feasibility assessment survey were conducted in each clinic we conducted a thematic analysis in accordance with the theoretical framework of acceptability and the feasibility assessment result we identified that most private primary care clinic deemed the implementation of tb screening in dm patient acceptable and practicable we revealed that the majority of diabetes patient enthusiastically accepted tbdm screening service in addition we found that the healthcare professional at the clinic are aware of the nature of the intervention and demonstrates a positive attitude despite a subtle burden the stigma associated with covid19 ha emerged a a new implementation barrier joining tb stigma lack of resource and regulatory issue we identify concealed and tiered screening a a potential method for enhancing the implementation of tbdm screening conclusion the implementation of tb screening in dm patient in private primary care clinic had the potential to be acceptable and feasible to achieve a successful implementation consideration should be given to supporting factor hindering factor and strategy to improve tb screening in dm patient

processed_title: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of highdose isoniazid for the treatment of rifampicin or multidrugresistant tuberculosis in indonesia
processed_abstract: background pharmacokinetic data on highdose isoniazid for the treatment of rifampicinmultidrugresistant tuberculosis rrmdrtb are limited we aimed to describe the pharmacokinetics of highdose isoniazid estimate exposure target attainment identify predictor of exposure and explore exposureresponse relationship in rrmdrtb patient method we performed an observational pharmacokinetic study with exploratory pharmacokineticpharmacodynamic analysis in indonesian adult aged 1865 year treated for pulmonary rrmdrtb with standardized regimen containing highdose isoniazid 1015 mgkgday for 911 month intensive pharmacokinetic sampling wa performed after 2 week of treatment total plasma drug exposure auc024 and peak concentration cmax were assessed using noncompartmental analysis auc024mic ratio of 85 and cmaxmic ratio of 175 were used a exposure target multivariable linear and logistic regression analysis were used to identify predictor of drug exposure and response respectively result we consecutively enrolled 40 patient median age 375 year the geometric mean isoniazid auc024 and cmax were 354 hmgl and 85 mgl respectively lower auc024 and cmax value were associated p 005 with nonslow acetylator phenotype and lower cmax value were associated with male sex of the 26 patient with mic data less than 25 achieved the proposed target for isoniazid auc024mic n 626 and cmaxmic n 526 lower isoniazid auc024 value were associated with delayed sputum culture conversion 2 month of treatment adjusted or 018 95 ci 004089 conclusion isoniazid exposure below target were observed in most patient and certain risk group for low isoniazid exposure may require dose adjustment the effect of low isoniazid exposure on delayed culture conversion deserves attention

processed_title: high risk of mycobacterium tuberculosis infection among medical and nursing student in indonesia a 1year prospective study
processed_abstract: background medical and nursing student entering their clinical programme are at increased risk for tuberculosis tb in tbendemic setting relatively little is known about mycobacterium tuberculosis infection among such student in highendemic country method we examined m tuberculosis infection among medical and nursing student starting clinical training in bandung indonesia using interferongamma release assay igra quantiferontb gold plus igranegative student had a repeat test after 1 y and logistic regression wa used to identify factor associated with igra positivity or conversion result there were 379 student included in this study 248 654 were medical student and 131 346 were nursing student of 379 student 70 185 were igra positive at baseline of 293 igranegative student with 1y result 26 89 underwent igra conversion being a medical student adjusted relative risk arr 515 95 confidence interval ci 182 to 1459 p0002 and participation in sputum collection or bronchoscopy were associated with igra conversion arr 274 95 ci 129 to 579 p0008 conclusion medical and nursing student entering clinical training are at high risk of m tuberculosis infection and need improved infection prevention and control strategy

processed_title: cost and affordability of scaling up tuberculosis diagnosis using xpert mtbrif testing in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: in indonesia a significant number of tuberculosis tb case may be missed due to the low sensitivity and specificity of the currently used diagnostic algorithm in this regard the rapid molecular test using xpert mtbrif which ha recently been introduced in indonesia can improve case detection thus this study determined the cost and affordability of incorporating xpert mtbrif testing for tb diagnosis for this purpose we estimated the cost from the health system and societal perspective of reaching the tb detection target in depok municipality and applied the finding to the west java province of indonesia the resource available for the health and tb program were also analyzed to support the decision to scale up the tb diagnosis using xpert mtbrif testing according to the result the unit cost for tb diagnosis per person wa usd 2722 and usd 7016 from the health system and societal perspective respectively to reach the target of 109843 tb case for the 20202024 time period depok municipality would need usd 2989927 and usd 2549455 from the health system viewpoint assuming the machine lifespan of five and 10 year respectively extrapolating these result to the west java province usd 56353833 would be necessary to test 2076413 case from 2019 to 2024 however in order to accelerate the case detection target up to 2024 west java requires additional fund the implication of the finding is that the central government must consider local capacity to accelerate tb case detection and ensure that the installation of xpert mtbrif machine is included in the overall cost

processed_title: improving diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis among hivaids patient literature review and experience in a teaching hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: hiv infection hamper diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis ptb because many pathogen cause pulmonary infection in hiv people and the load of mycobacterium tuberculosis is lower in hiv patient we conducted a literature review and prospectively examined clinical radiological and laboratory diagnosis of ptb in 71 hivpatients 29 inpatient and 42 outpatient in a teaching hospital in west java indonesia for both in and outpatient sign and symptom were sensitive but not specific for ptb chest xray cxr wa sensitive but less specific among hospitalized ptb suspect 288 could not expectorate sputum compared to culture zn had a sensitivity of 111 and 667 for in and outpatient respectively from the literature fluorescence microscopy liquid culture and nucleic acid assay can improve diagnosis of ptb in hiv while ifngrelease assay lack sensitivity especially in advanced hiv the current practice of using cxr and microscopy lack sensitivity for diagnosing ptb in hiv patient sputum culture is more sensitive but slow fluorescence microscopy might be a quick relatively sensitive and feasible option in indonesia however because of the frequent absence of sputum especially in patient with advanced hivaids patient there is an urgent need for alternative diagnostic method using blood or urine

processed_title: nonadherence to antituberculosis treatment reason and associated factor among pulmonary tuberculosis patient in the community in indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb is the world major public health problem we assessed the proportion reason and associated factor for antitb treatment nonadherence in the community in indonesia method this national coverage crosssectional survey wa conducted from 2013 to 2014 with stratified multistage cluster sampling based on the region and ruralurban location the 156 cluster were distributed in 136 districtscities throughout 33 province divided into three area an eligible population of age 15 wa interviewed to find tb symptom and screened with a thorax xray those whose filtered result detected positive followed an assessment of sputum microscopy lj culture and xpert mtbrif census officer asked all participant about their history of tb and their treatmentdefined nonadherence a discontinuation of antituberculosis treatment for 6 month data were analyzed using stata 140 college station tx usa result nonadherence to antitb treatment proportion wa 2724 multivariate analysis identified behavioral factor significantly associated with antitb treatment nonadherence such a smoking or 178 95 ci 147216 place of first treatment received government hospital or 145 95 ci106199 private hospital or 193 95 ci 138272 private practitioner or 224 95 ci 156323 sociodemographic and tb status included region sumatera or 144 95 ci 105198 other area or 184 95 ci 130261 low level of education or 160 95 ci 127203 and current tb positive status or 217 95 ci 126373 conclusion nonadherence to antitb drug wa highly related to the personal perception of the respondent despite smoking current tb status a place for the first treatment education and region the position of the first tb treatment at the private practitioner wa significantly associated with the risk of nonadherence to treatment

processed_title: clinical feature and predictor of treatment outcome in patient with ocular tuberculosis from the netherlands and indonesia the ocular tb in low versus high endemic country ortec study
processed_abstract: purpose to describe and compare clinical feature treatment approach and treatment outcome of ocular tuberculosis otb patient in the netherlands a low tuberculosis tbendemic country and indonesia a high tbendemic country we also aimed to identify predictor of treatment outcome method a medical chart review of 339 otb patient n 93 from the netherlands and n 246 from indonesia wa performed the primary outcome wa response to treatment whether with or without antitubercular treatment after six month of treatment initiation good versus poor responder result indonesian otb patient displayed a higher prevalence of chest radiograph finding indicative of tb infection p 0001 and concurrent active systemic tb p 0011 indonesian cohort exhibited a more acute and severe disease profile including uveitis duration 3 month p 0001 blindness p 0001 anterior chamber ac cell 2 p 0001 and posterior synechiae p 0001 overall proportion of good responder to treatment were 676 in the netherlands and 715 in indonesia presence of ac cell 2 adjusted odds ratio aor 212 95 ci 109414 choroidal lesion other than serpiginouslike choroiditis slc or tuberculoma aor 447 95 ci 1181690 and retinal vasculitis aor 232 95 ci 110490 at baseline were predictor for poor response to treatment conclusion despite a more severe initial clinical presentation in the indonesian cohort the overall treatment outcome of otb wa comparable in both cohort three baseline clinical feature were identified a predictor of treatment outcome

processed_title: pulmonary tuberculosis case in pregnancy perinatal outcome and health promotion challenge in indonesia
processed_abstract: tuberculosis remains a serious health problem in pregnant woman tuberculosis during pregnancy is related to poor perinatal outcome including low birth weight insufficient growth relative to gestational age perinatal mortality and maternal morbidity and mortality additionally diabetes mellitus in pregnant woman with tuberculosis is associated with a higher risk of maternal and fetal complication such a preeclampsia preterm birth hypoglycemia and giant baby we report two perinatal outcome of 1 pregnancy during tuberculosis treatment and 2 tuberculosis in a pregnant woman with diabetes mellitus both woman completed antituberculosis treatment this report emphasizes the importance of health promotion through family planning among woman with tuberculosis this case report also underscore the increased risk of developing tuberculosis in pregnant woman with diabetes mellitus early diagnosis of tuberculosis in pregnant woman is vital a it affect the health of both mother and child

processed_title: development and validation of assessment instrument for the perception and attitude toward tuberculosis among the general population in indonesia a rasch analysis of psychometric property
processed_abstract: introduction tuberculosis tbrelated knowledge is an important evaluation metric for health education intervention factor analysis is limited when used on ordinal scale and doe not provide indepth item function examination whereas rasch analysis address these limitation and offer potential advantage such a generalizability testing of unidimensionality producing an ordered set of item and identifying poorly functioning item therefore this research aim to develop a reliable and valid measure of perception and attitude toward tb patt for public application use rasch analysis method a questionnairebased survey wa conducted on the indonesian general population using the google form platform rasch analysis wa then employed to examine the psychometric property and develop the final item of patt result expert from across the tb community participated in the patt development producing an initial scale of 16 item up to 1616 participant completed the patt questionnaire where 748 were female and 5 had a tb history the final unidimensional 16item scale ha an item reliability of 100 for the two component perception and attitude a person reliability index of 087 and 060 a well a a cronbachs test reliability of 088 and 088 for perception and attitude respectively conclusion the patt is a unidimensional scale with good construct validity and internal consistency it ha the potential to be useful for the assessment of tb perception and attitude in research and clinical practice

processed_title: development and performance of cuhasrobust application for pulmonary rifampicinresistance tuberculosis screening in indonesia
processed_abstract: background and objective diagnosis of pulmonary rifampicin resistant tuberculosis rrtb with the drugsusceptibility test dst is costly and timeconsuming furthermore genexpert for rapid diagnosis is not widely available in indonesia this study aim to develop and evaluate the cuhasrobust model performance an artificialintelligencebased rrtb screening tool method a crosssectional study involved suspected all type of rrtb patient with complete sputum lowenstein jensen dst reference and 19 clinical laboratory and radiology parameter result retrieved from medical record in hospital under the faculty of medicine hasanuddin university indonesia from january 2015december 2019 the artificial neural network ann model were built along with other classifier the model wa tested on participant recruited from january 2020october 2020 and deployed into cuhasrobust index test application sensitivity specificity and accuracy were obtained for assessment result a total of 487 participant 32 multidrugresistantmdr 57 rrtb 398 drugsensitive were recruited for model building and 157 participant 23 mdr and 21 rr in prospective testing the ann full model yield the highest value of accuracy 88 95 ci 8591 and sensitivity 84 95 ci 7689 compare to other model that show sensitivity below 80 logistic regression 32 decision tree 44 random forest 25 extreme gradient boost 25 however this ann ha lower specificity among other model 90 95 ci 8693 where logistic regression demonstrates the highest 99 95 ci 9799 this ann model wa selected for the cuhasrobust application although still lower than the sensitivity of global genexpert result 875 conclusion the anncuhas robust outperforms other ai classifier model in detecting all type of rrtb and by deploying into the application the health staff can utilize the tool for screening purpose particularly at the primary care level where the genexpert examination is not available trial registration nct04208789

processed_title: genetic variation of abcb1 rs1128503 rs1045642 and cyp2e1 rs3813867 with the duration of tuberculosis therapy a pilot study among tuberculosis patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the risk of contracting tuberculosis tb and the efficacy of tb therapy are affected by several factor including genetic variation among population in the indonesian population data on the gene involved in drug transport and metabolism of tb therapy are limited the aim of this study wa to identify the genetic profile of the abcb1 gene rs1128503 and rs1045642 and cyp2e1 gene rs3813867 in indonesian with tb this study wa a crosssectional study of 50 tb outpatient in jambi city indonesia sociodemographic characteristic were obtained from medical record whole blood wa collected and genomic dna wa isolated single nucleotide polymorphism were determined using polymerase chain reactionrestriction fragment length polymorphism with haeiii mboi and psti for rs1128503 rs1045642 abcb1 and rs3813867 cyp2e1 respectively result the frequency of allele of each gene wa analyzed by hardyweinberg equilibrium the genetic profile of abcb1 rs1128503 and rs1045642 were varied cc ct tt while cyp2e1 rs3813867 wa present in cc wild type the genetic variation of abcb1 and cyp2e1 may have no significant correlation with the duration of tb therapy nevertheless this study may provide a preliminary result for the genetic profile of abcb1 rs1128503 rs1045642 and cyp2e1 rs3813867 in the indonesia population

processed_title: estimation of subnational tuberculosis burden generation and application of a new tool in indonesia
processed_abstract: setting in many high tuberculosis tb burden country there is substantial geographical heterogeneity in tb burden in addition decision on tb funding and policy are highly decentralised subnational estimate of burden however are usually unavailable for planning and target settingobjective and design we developed a statistical model termed subset to estimate the distribution of the national tb incidence through a weighted score using selected variable and applied the model to the 514 district in indonesia which have substantial policy and budgetary autonomy in tb estimated incidence wa compared to reported facility and domicilebased notification to estimate the case detection rate cdr local stakeholder led model development and disseminationresults the final subset model included district population size level of urbanisation socioeconomic indicator living floor space and high school completion human immunodeficiency virus prevalence and air pollution we estimated districtlevel tb incidence to be between 201 and 2485100 000year the facilitybased cdr varied between 0 and 190 with high variation between neighbouring district suggesting strong crossdistrict health utilisation which wa confirmed by domicilebased cdr estimation subset result informed districtlevel tb action plan across indonesiaconclusion the subset model could be used to estimate the subnational burden in highburden country and inform tb policymaking at the relevant decentralised administrative level

processed_title: active and latent tuberculosis among hivpositive injecting drug user in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction injecting drug use idu is associated with tuberculosis but few data are available from lowincome setting we examined idu in relation to active and latent tuberculosis ltbi among hivpositive individual in indonesia which ha a high burden of tuberculosis and a rapidly growing hiv epidemic strongly driven by idu method active tuberculosis wa measured prospectively among 1900 consecutive antiretroviral treatment artnaive adult patient entering care in a clinic in west java prevalence of ltbi wa determined crosssectionally in a subset of 518 artexperienced patient using an interferongamma release assay result patient with a history of idu 531 more often reported a history of tuberculosis treatment 348 v 219 p 0001 more often received tuberculosis treatment during followup adjusted hr 171 95 ci 125235 and more often had bacteriologically confirmed tuberculosis or 167 95 ci 094296 ltbi wa equally prevalent among people with and without a history of idu 291 v 304 n the risk estimate did not change after adjustment for cd4 cell count or art conclusion hivpositive individual with a history of idu in indonesia have more active tuberculosis with similar rate of ltbi within the hiv clinic ltbi screening and isoniazid preventive therapy may be prioritized to patient with a history of idu
