processed_title: the path to impact of operational research on tuberculosis control policy and practice in indonesia
processed_abstract: background operational research is currently one of the pillar of the global strategy to control tuberculosis indonesia initiated capacity building for operational research on tuberculosis over the last decade although publication of the research in peerreviewed journal is an important indicator for measuring the success of this endeavor the influence of operational research on policy and practice is considered even more important however little is known about the process by which operational research influence tuberculosis control policy and practice objective we aimed to investigate the influence of operational research on tuberculosis control policy and practice in indonesia between 2004 and 2014 design using a qualitative study design we conducted indepth interview of 50 researcher and 30 policy makersprogram manager and performed document review transcript of these interview were evaluated while applying content analysis result operational research contributed to tuberculosis control policy and practice improvement including development of new policy introduction of new practice and reinforcement of current program policy and practice however most of these development had limited sustainability the path from the dissemination of research result and recommendation to policy and practice change wa long and complex the skill interest and political power of researcher and policy maker a well a health system response could influence the process conclusion operational research contributed to improving tuberculosis control policy and practice a systematic approach to improve the sustainability of the impact of operational research should be explored

processed_title: tuberculosis treatment outcome and associated factor a retrospective study in west nusa tenggara indonesia
processed_abstract: successfully treating tuberculosis tb could significantly help reduce it spread the aim of this study wa to identify factor associated with successful tb treatment a retrospective study wa conducted in west nusa tenggara indonesia using data from the national tb information system sitb covering patient from january 1 to december 31 2022 patient were classified into two group those with successful treatment outcome cured or completed treatment and those with unsuccessful outcome including treatment failure loss to followup or death univariate and multivariate logistic regression analysis were performed to identify factor associated with treatment outcome providing odds ratio or and adjusted odds ratio aor with 95 confidence interval ci a total of 2225 tb patient 1382 male and 843 female were included in the study of these 2048 921 achieved successful treatment outcome univariate analysis indicated that older age or 047 95ci 028078 and a high number of afb in sputum smear or 023 95ci 009066 were associated with a higher likelihood of unsuccessful tb treatment in contrast having no hiv infection or 1344 95ci 6222908 clinical tb case diagnosed clinically rather than bacteriologically or 150 95ci 104220 and longer duration of tb treatment were associated with successful treatment outcome multivariate analysis suggested that the tb treatment duration of 46 month aor 125695 95ci 43189365819 and 712 month aor 5755 95ci 991334206 were associated with a significantly higher likelihood of success compared to duration of 03 month in conclusion this study highlight that a minimum treatment duration of three month wa crucial for increasing the likelihood of successful tb treatment these finding emphasize the importance of comprehensive support program to ensure adherence to treatment guideline and improve outcome

processed_title: evaluation of xpert mtbrif guided diagnosis and treatment of rifampicinresistant tuberculosis in indonesia a retrospective cohort study
processed_abstract: background rifampicinresistant tuberculosis rrtb is largely underdetected in indonesia xpert mtbrif xpert ha recently been introduced prioritizing patient at risk of rrtb followed by phenotypic drugsusceptibility dst if rifampicin resistance is detected objective this study investigated xpertbased management of presumptive rrtb case under routine practice in west java indonesia method we examined all record of patient tested with xpert in the referral hospital for west java in 20152016 we measured loss across a limited cascade of care time to xpert diagnosis and the commencement of initial secondline treatment and identified factor associated with diagnostic and treatment delay additionally we analyzed the appropriateness of treatment according to dst result result of 3415 patient with presumptive rrtb 3215 94 were tested by xpert of whom 339 105 were diagnosed a rrtb 288 85 of 339 rrtb patient started initial secondline tb treatment with 48 14 patient being lost between diagnosis and pretreatment assessment secondline treatment wa commenced at a median of 41 day iqr 2970 after rrtb diagnosis delay in both diagnosis and treatment initiation were observed in 104 52 of 201 rrtb patient with identifiable referral date rural residence wa associated with delay to diagnosis adjusted or 27 95ci 1552 and treatment initiation adjusted or 20 1234 of 162 patient with available dst result 107 66 had multidrugresistant tuberculosis mdrtb and 32 20 had either preextensively drug resistant prexdr or extensively drug resistant tuberculosis xdrtb we estimated that with the current algorithm 41 of prexdr or xdrtb patient are diagnosed and 33 of them started on an appropriate treatment regimen conclusion many patient with xpertdiagnosed rrtb either do not start mdrtb treatment or encountered diagnostic and treatment delay under programmatic condition in indonesia and most prexdr and xdrtb case remain undiagnosed further expansion and ongoing quality improvement of rrtb service are urgently needed

processed_title: molecular epidemiology study of mycobacterium tuberculosis and it susceptibility to antituberculosis drug in indonesia
processed_abstract: background genotyping of mycobacterium tuberculosis help to understand the molecular epidemiology of tuberculosis and to address evolutionary question about the disease spread certain genotype also have implication for the spread of infection and treatment indonesia is a very diverse country with a population with multiple ethnicity and culture and a history of many trade and tourism route this study describes the first attempt to map the molecular epidemiology of tb in the indonesian archipelago method from 2008 to 2011 404 clinical specimen from sputumsmear s tb patient age 15 year were collected from 16 tb referral primary health center phc in 16 provincial capital in indonesia susceptibility testing to first line drug wa conducted for 262 sample using the agar proportion method a per who guideline spoligotyping wa done on all sample result ninetythree of the 404 sample 23 were from the beijing family making it the predominant family in the country however the geographic distribution of the family varied by region with 86294 293 in the western region 672 83 in the central region and 272 28 in the eastern region p 0001 the predominant genotype in the central and eastern region wa from the eastafricanindian eai family comprising 153 1172 and 263 1038 of the isolates respectively drug susceptibility to firstline antitb drug wa tested in 262 isolates 162 618 isolates were susceptible to all tb drug 70 267 were monoresistant 16 61 were polyresistant and 14 54 were multidrug resistant mdr the proportion of beijing family isolates in the susceptible monoresistant polyresistant and mdr group wa 33162 204 2870 400 616 375 and 314 214 respectively overall resistance of the beijing family isolates to any of the first line tb drug wa significantly higher than nonbeijing family 3771 521 v 63191 330 pvalue 0003 conclusion the distribution of mycobacterium tuberculosis genotype in indonesia showed high genetic diversity and tended to vary by geographic region drug susceptibility testing confirmed that the beijing family of mtb in indonesia exhibited greater resistance to first line antitb drug than did other family

processed_title: smoking cessation and smokefree environment for tuberculosis patient in indonesiaa cohort study
processed_abstract: background research indicates that smoking substantially increase the risk of tuberculosis tb delay in diagnosis failure of tb treatment and death from tb quitting smoking is one of the best way to prevent unwanted outcome exposure to secondhand smoke increase the risk of both tb infection and development of active tb disease among child and adult tb patient who smoke in the home are also placing their family at a greater risk of tb infection it is very important to keep home smokefree the present study assessed the implementation and effectiveness of an intervention that promotes smoking cessation and smokefree environment for tb patient method all consecutive new sputum smearpositive tb patient aged 15 year old diagnosed and registered in 17 health centre between 1 january 2011 and 31 december 2012 were enrolled the abc aask bbrief advice ccessation support intervention wa offered for 5 to 10 minute within dot service at each visit smoking status and smokefree environment at home were assessed at the first visit each monthly follow up and at month six factor associated with quitting were analysed by univariable and multivariable analysis result of the 750 tb patient registered 582 776 were current smoker 40 53 were exsmokers and 128 171 were never smoker of the 582 current smoker 668 had quit smoking at month six a time from waking to first cigarette of 30 minute having a smokefree home and the display of no smoking signage at home at month six were significantly associated with quitting of the 750 tb patient 861 had created a smokefree home at six month followup compared with 185 at baseline all 80 health facility were 100 tobaccofree at the end of 2012 compared with only 52 65 when the intervention began in march 2011 conclusion brief advice of 510 minute with minimal cessation support at every visit of tb patient resulted in high quit rate and higher awareness of adverse health effect of secondhand smoke exposure which led patient to make their home smokefree and health provider to make health care tobaccofree

processed_title: the tuberculosis and covid19 coinfection a report of two case at a tertiary referral in indonesia
processed_abstract: covid19 case are still rising globally in the middle of the tuberculosis epidemic several country have reported tbcovid19 coinfection that could pose a double burden in the health care facility in developing country we reported two pulmonary tuberculosis patient coinfected with covid19 with an overlapping clinical manifestation of tuberculosis and covid19 with a good prognosis at the end of covid19 treatment this paper aim to discus tb patient susceptibility against sarscov2 infection the clinical profile of tbcovid19 coinfection and the disease prognosis the clinician should be aware of both common disease symptom that appear in a patient and should be confirmed and treat promptly

processed_title: the wholegenome sequencing in predicting mycobacterium tuberculosis drug susceptibility and resistance in papua indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis is one of the deadliest disease caused by mycobacterium tuberculosis it treatment still becomes a burden for many country including indonesia drug resistance is one of the problem in tb treatment however a development in the molecular field through wholegenome sequencing wgs can be used a a solution in detecting mutation associated with tb drug this investigation intended to implement this data for supporting the scientific community in deeply understanding any tb epidemiology and evolution in papua along with detecting any mutation in gene associated with tbdrugs result a wholegenome sequencing wa performed on the random sample from tb referral laboratory in papua utilizing miseq 600 cycle reagent kit v3 furthermore tbprofiler wa used for genome analysis rast server wa employed for annotation while gview server wa applied for blast genome mapping and a microscope server wa implemented for region of genomic plasticity rgp the largest genome of m tuberculosis obtained wa at the size of 4396040 bp with subsystem number at 309 and the number of coding sequence at 4326 one sample tb751 contained one rgp the drug resistance analysis revealed that several mutation associated with tbdrug resistance existed in detail mutation of rpob gene which were identified a s450l d435y h445y l430p and q432k had caused the reduced effectiveness of rifampicin while the mutases in katg s315t kasa 312s inha i21v and rv1482cfabg1 c15 t gene had contributed to the resistance in isoniazid in streptomycin the resistance wa triggered by the mutation in rpsl k43r and rrs a514c a514t gene and in amikacin it resistance wa led by mutation in rrs a514c gene additionally in ethambutol and pyrazinamide their reduced effectiveness wa provoked by embb gene mutases m306l m306v d1024n and pnca w119r conclusion the result from wholegenome sequencing of tb clinical sample in papua indonesia could contribute to the surveillance of tbdrug resistance in the drug resistance profile there were 15 multi drug resistance mdr sample however extensively drugresistant xdr sample have not been found but sample were resistant to only amikacin a secondline drug

processed_title: mycobacterium tuberculosis genotypic drug resistance pattern and clustering in jayapura papua indonesia
processed_abstract: background little is known about drugresistant tuberculosis tb and it transmission in papua which ha one of the highest rate of tb in indonesia design we examined genotypic drug resistance pattern using multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification and the degree of molecular clustering using 24locus mycobacterial interspersed repetitive unitsvariable number of tandem repeat miruvntr among 199 consecutive pulmonary tb patient in jayapura papua result drug resistance mutation were present in 30198 152 patient 16144 111 primary case and 1451 275 retreatment case genotypic resistance to rifampicin wa found in 15 76 patient to isoniazid in 19 96 to ethambutol in 7 35 and to streptomycin and secondline injectable drug in 5 25 patient eight 40 patient had multidrugresistant tb while no mutation were found for fluoroquinolones the most common lineage found among all isolates wa eastafrican indian n 66 337 followed by euroamerican n 38 194 drug resistance mutation were more common among beijing strain than other lineage of the 30 drugresistant isolates 12 400 fell into four cluster that were separate from drugsusceptible cluster a determined using miruvntr conclusion these are the first genotypic drug resistance data from jayapura papua showing moderate rate of resistance to firstline drug and likely transmission of drugresistant tb

processed_title: viral load and cd4 marker a determinant of tuberculosis coinfection among people living with hivaids in papua indonesia
processed_abstract: tuberculosis tb infection cause mortality among people living with hiv plhiv so the treatment of tbhiv coinfection is crucial the study aimed to identify the determinant contributing to tb coinfection among plhiv in papua it is a descriptiveanalytic study with a crosssectional design involving 188 plhiv at the four hospital in papua cd4 wa carried out using cd4 counter and viral load using the qpcr technique a logistic regression test and r statistic with a significance level of 005 were used to analyze the determinant of tb coinfection among plhiv plhiv having cd4 count of fewer than 350 cellsmm3 had a 178 time higher risk for tbhiv coinfection pvalue 00 in addition a viral load of more than 10 000 copiesml will be 121 time more likely to be coinfected with tbhiv compared to those who have a viral load of fewer than 10 000 copiesml pvalue 00 cd4 marker and viral load are factor that play a role in tb coinfection among plhiv in papua province

processed_title: the socioeconomic impact of multidrug resistant tuberculosis on patient result from ethiopia indonesia and kazakhstan
processed_abstract: background one of the main goal of the post2015 global tuberculosis tb strategy is that no family affected by tb face catastrophic cost we revised an existing tb patient cost measurement tool to specifically also measure multidrug resistant mdr tb patient cost and applied it in ethiopia indonesia and kazakhstan method through structured interview with tb and mdrtb patient in different stage of treatment we collected data on the direct out of pocket and indirect loss of income cost of patient and their family related to the diagnosis and treatment of tb and mdrtb direct cost included cost for hospitalization followup test transport cost for health care visit and food supplement calculation of indirect cost wa based on time needed for diagnosis and treatment cost were extrapolated over the patient total treatment phase result in total 406 mdrtb patient and 197 other tb patient were included in the survey 169 mdrtb patient and 25 other tb patient in ethiopia 143 mdrtb patient and 118 tb patient in indonesia and 94 mdrtb patient and 54 other tb patient in kazakhstan total cost for diagnosis and current treatment episode for tb patient were estimated to be usd 260 in ethiopia usd 169 in indonesia and usd 929 in kazakhstan compared to usd 1838 usd 2342 and usd 3125 for mdrtb patient respectively these cost represented 08246 month of pretreatment household income for tb patient and 93249 month for mdrtb patient importantly 3892 reported income loss and 2676 of tb patient lost their job due to mdr tb illness further aggravating the financial burden conclusion the financial burden of mdrtb is alarming although all tb patient experienced substantial socioeconomic impact of the disease if the patient is the breadwinner of the family the combination of lost income and extra cost is generally catastrophic therefore it should be a priority of the government to relieve the financial burden based on the cost mitigation option identified

processed_title: clinical feature adverse event and treatment outcome of multidrugrifampicinresistant tuberculosis in child and adolescent an eightyear retrospective cohort study in bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background data on childhood and adolescent multidrugrifampicinresistant tuberculosis mdrrrtb in indonesia are lacking we aimed to assess clinical feature adverse event aes and treatment outcome of childhood and adolescent mdrrrtb method a retrospective cohort study wa performed in child and adolescent 18 year old treated for mdrrrtb at hasan sadikin general hospital in bandung indonesia between june 2016 and march 2024 multivariable logistic regression analysis were used to calculate adjusted odds ratio aor for predictor of allcause mortality result among 84 included patient 69 82 were adolescent 1017 year of age 54 64 were female 54 64 were malnourished and 55 65 had cultureconfirmed disease among 69 82 patient with known outcome 48 70 were successfully treated 14 20 died including 5 pretreatment death and 7 10 were lost to followup ltfu including 5 pretreatment ltfu predictor of allcause mortality included shortness of breath on admission aor 64 95 confidence interval ci 13491 high bacillary burden on xpert mtbrif assay aor 170 95 ci 162605 and the presence of lung cavity on chest radiograph aor 48 95 ci 11233 among 74 patient who initiated treatment 39 53 had at least one grade 12 ae and 4 5 had one grade 34 ae each including hepatotoxicity qt prolongation hearing loss and rashhyperpigmentation conclusion younger child were underrepresented among those treated for mdrrrtb indicating reduced access to care severe aes were uncommon during mdrrrtb treatment baseline indicator of extensive disease were associated with allcause mortality the high proportion of pretreatment mortality and ltfu may reflect complex patient pathway limiting access to care

processed_title: the profile of multidrug tuberculosis regimen and treatment outcome in pulmonary mdrtb patient at the tertiary referral hospital dr soetomo east java indonesia a sevenyear retrospective study on bedaquiline
processed_abstract: background the use of bedaquiline ha been reported to minimize the number of lost to followup and fewer rejection from the patient this study is the first to depict the use of bedaquiline it aim to provide information related to the profile of the mdrtb drug regimen in the last 7 year with the treatment outcome of pulmonary mdrtb patient at a tertiary referral hospital in east java method this study wa a retrospective descriptive and data analysis on 1053 pulmonary mdrtb patient in tertiary referral hospital dr soetomo east java indonesia with the spss software version 25 and microsoft excel 2021 result the study analyzed the mdrtb treatment regimen following the latest guideline from who 2020 at a tertiary referral hospital in east java this study show that a bedaquilinecontaining regimen started in january 2015 to july 2022 with the percentage of distribution 1 3 11 4 18 13 29 21 consecutively in the regimen the treatment outcome profile of mdrtb patient show the average percentage of cured 15 died 12 losttofollowup case 27 moved to an individualized regimen or a different health facility 42 and currently in the evaluation stage 4 overall from january 2017 to july 2022 the number of ltfu case decreased 42 46 29 19 8 4 however the cured case fluctuated between 20172022 16 28 26 32 respectively after bdq started to be included in the regimen regularly for treating rrmdrtb conclusion after seven year of study we revealed an association between adding bedaquiline to the regimen and the treatment success and decreasing losttofollowup case

processed_title: impact of pharmacist counseling and leaflet on the adherence of pulmonary tuberculosis patient in lung hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: background one of the goal of counseling in patient with chronic disease including tuberculosis patient is to improve adherence to taking medication by patient adherence therapeutic result are more optimal additional counseling alternative such a leaflet may be needed to make easier for patient to obtain information about their treatment this study aimed to analyze the effectiveness of counseling with and without leaflet on the adherence on taking tuberculosis tb drug method this study wa a quantitative research conducted using a quasiexperiment method with a control group for pretest and posttest design data wa taken by consecutive sampling the number of sample in this study wa 75 respondent which divided into three group counseling counseling with leaflet and control that is a usual care in hospital the inclusion criterion were patient diagnosed with pulmonary tuberculosis with age 2555 year who ha been taking tb medicine for at least one month and can communicate well data wa analyzed using wilcoxon and kruskalwallis with post hoc mannwhitney due to abnormality of the distributed data result before the intervention of 20 respondent 426 out of 75 respondent were obedient to their tb medicine whereas after the intervention the number of obedient patient wa 33 respondent 702 there wa a significant increase in adherence between before and after two week of counseling intervention with a pvalue of 0029 before and after two week of counseling with leaflet with a pvalue of 0003 counseling and counseling with leaflet improved patient adherence compare to control group with pvalues of 0028 and 0001 respectively conclusion counseling and counseling with leaflet impact in patient adherence to tuberculosis medication

processed_title: characteristic profile of antibody response to ppd esat6 and cfp10 of mycobacterium tuberculosis in pulmonary tuberculosis suspected case in surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: accurate and rapid diagnostic tool are important aspect of managing tuberculosis tb case appropriately however the sensitivity and specificity of diagnostic kit based on immune response such a the tuberculin skin test tst and interferon gamma release assay igra are still debated thus the exploration and assessment of specific biomarkertargeted antibody are needed for the development of an accurate and rapid diagnostic tool the present study wa conducted in patient with a respiratory problem suspected to be tb at dr soetomo hospital surabaya indonesia among 102 patient tested by genexpert and afb 59 serum sample were from case retrospectively determined to have active tb a total of 102 serum of healthy control hc wa also collected the ppd antigen and the recombinant cfp10 and esat6 protein were prepared antibody response against these protein were evaluated by elisa all sample were also screened for the possibility of mycobacterium aviumintracellulare complex mac infection using capilla mac kit the result showed that tb patient had a significantly higher concentration of igg antibody in response to ppd than the hc in addition the receiver operating characteristic roc curve analysis showed that ppd wa acceptable for diagnostic purpose with an auc value of 0835 95 ci 07700900 p 00001 however esat6 and cfp10 had low auc and 32 sample from both group showed a low concentration of iga antibody against all antigen the mac detection result also showed that the concentration of iga in the hc group wa the highest the current result indicate that ppd is a better antigen for antibodybased detection of tb than esat6 and cfp10 based on the mac detection assay 53 people in the hc group were probably infected with rapidly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria ntm although antibody response to ppd wa low

processed_title: analysis of healthrelated quality of life and incurred cost among human immunodeficiency virus tuberculosis and tuberculosishiv coinfected outpatient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective a growing interest in healthcare cost and patient healthrelated quality of life hrqol exists in the context of the increasing importance of health technology assessment in country with high number of the hiv and tuberculosis tb patient population such a indonesia this study aimed to analyze the hrqol and outofpocket oop cost of hiv tb and tbhiv coinfected participant in a city in indonesia with a high prevalence of hiv and tb method a crosssectional survey wa conducted in the voluntary counseling and testing and lung clinic of bekasi city public hospital indonesia from january to march 2018 patient hrqol wa measured using the eq5d5l questionnaire whereas oop cost were extracted from a semistructured questionnaire result of the 460 eligible participant 82 resided in the city 48 of them were married and their median age wa 34 year less than half were insured and more than half had no source of income the median value of health utility for participant with hiv tb and tbhiv were perceived a potentially high 10 09 and 08 respectively the tbhiv coinfected outpatient had the highest oop cost us945 with the largest contribution coming from direct medical oop expenditure taking loan from family member wa adopted a a financial strategy to overcome inadequate household income and high treatment cost conclusion this study suggests that tbhiv coinfection potentially lower hrqol and increase healthcare cost and the need for economic analysis to underpin costeffective treatment in such patient

processed_title: good agreement between an interferon gamma release assay and tuberculin skin test in testing for latent tuberculosis infection among hivinfected patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background latent tuberculosis infection is a condition where there is a persistent immune response to mycobacterium tuberculosis without clinical manifestation of tuberculosis currently there is no gold standard to diagnose latent tuberculosis infection the tuberculin skin test and interferongamma release assay are currently used to diagnose latent tuberculosis infection however study have shown inconsistency regarding the level of agreement between these test in different setting in this study we aimed to evaluate the agreement between these two test for diagnosing latent tuberculosis infection in human immunodeficiency virus hivinfected individual method we screened hiv patient with no clinical symptom of tuberculosis a normal chest xray and no history of tuberculosis or use of antituberculous drug participant were tested with tuberculin skin test tst and tspottb an interferon gamma release assay simultaneously participant hiv stage wa determined by measuring the level of cd4 tlymphocytes tuberculosis status wa confirmed by sputum examination using genexpert the level of agreement between the tst and tspottb result wa measured using cohens kappa coefficient result of the 112 participant 20 had a positive tspottb test result and 21 had a positive tst result the tst and tspottb test result showed a high level of agreement kappa 0648 p 0001 performance of the test did not vary with cd4 level however in participant with cd4 200 cellsmm3 tspottb detected more latent tuberculosis infection than the tst conclusion there wa good agreement between the tst and tspottb result of latent tuberculosis infection in participant tst is the preferred test for diagnosing latent tuberculosis infection in hivinfected patient especially in resourcelimited setting because it is simple and costeffective however tspottb may be useful to rule out latent tuberculosis infection in patient with severe immunodeficiency

processed_title: histoplasma antigen detection in unconfirmed pulmonary tuberculosis and crossreactivity with aspergillus antigen in patient and in food in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose h capsulatum is endemic in indonesia but the value of histoplasma antigen detection ha not been studied patient and method histoplasma galactomannan gm elisa wa applied to serum of patient with unproven pulmonary tuberculosis tb and patient with a positive aspergillus gm both histoplasma and aspergillus gm test were performed to determine any possible crossreaction with certain food result fourteen of 122 115 serum of patient with newly diagnosed clinical tb were positive for histoplasma gm the positivity rate in the serum of patient 56 and 12 month after tb diagnosis wa 38 and 35 respectively of 88 positive aspergillus gm serum 63 716 were also positive for histoplasma gm all tested food were positive for aspergillus gm while 65 of food were positive for histoplasma gm conclusion galactomannan is widespread in serum and food in jakarta possibly related to food consumption histoplasma and aspergillus antigen detection for the diagnosis will require additional mean of confirming the diagnosis negative test may be more helpful for ruling out invasive histoplasmosis and aspergillosis

processed_title: the effect of a structured clinical algorithm on glycemic control in patient with combined tuberculosis and diabetes in indonesia a randomized trial
processed_abstract: aim diabetes mellitus dm is associated with worse tuberculosis tb treatment outcome especially among those with poor glycemic control we examined whether a structured clinical algorithm could improve glycemic control in tb patient with dm method in an open label randomized trial tbdm patient were randomized to scheduled counselling glucose monitoring and adjustment of medication using a structured clinical algorithm intervention arm or routine dm management control arm with glycated hemoglobin hba1c at month 6 a the primary end point result we randomized 150 pulmonary tbdm patient 92 culture positive 513 male mean age 53 year baseline mean hba1c wa 110 in the intervention arm n 76 and 116 in the control arm n 74 at 6 month hba1c had decreased more in the intervention arm compared with the control arm a difference of 182 hba1c 95 ci 082283 p 0001 five patient were hospitalized in the intervention arm and seven in the control arm there wa more hypoglycemia 350 v 118 p 0002 in the intervention arm two death occurred in the intervention arm one due to cardiorespiratory failure and one because of suspected septic shock and multiorgan failure conclusion regular monitoring and algorithmic adjustment of dm treatment led to improved glycemic control

processed_title: sensitivity and specificity of routine diagnostic workup for tuberculosis in lung clinic in yogyakarta indonesia a cohort study
processed_abstract: background establishing a correct diagnosis is challenging we aimed to investigate the sensitivity and specificity of routine tuberculosis tb diagnostic workup in lung clinic in indonesia a country with the third highest tb burden and the second highest gap between notification of tb case and the best estimate of incident case in the world method in the lung clinic of the province of yogyakarta indonesia we recruited all consecutive patient with symptom suggesting tb aged 18 year routine tb examination consisted of clinical evaluation sputum smear microscopy and chest radiography for research purpose we added sputum culture human immunodeficiency virus hiv testing and followup for 15 year or 25 year if culture result disagreed with the initial clinical diagnosis the initial diagnosis wa considered incorrect if patient did not respond to treatment we calculated sensitivity and specificity of the tb routine examination using culture and a composite reference standard cr a combination of routine examination culture and followup a the reference standard all analysis were conducted with ibm spss statistic 25 ibm corp armonk ny usa result between 2013 and 2015 we included 360 participant and 21 were excluded due to incomplete data among those analyzed 115 were initially diagnosed with smearpositive tb 12 with smearnegative tb and 212 nontb in 15 study participant the diagnosis wa changed after median 45 range 14870 day 14 participant initially not diagnosed with tb were later diagnosed with tb while one subject initially diagnosed with tb actually did not have tb compared with culture and cr tb routine examination had sensitivity of 85 95ci 7791 and 90 95ci 8494 and specificity of 863 95ci 8191 and 995 95ci 97100 respectively conclusion a combination of clinical evaluation with sputum microscopy and chest radiography provided high sensitivity and specificity in diagnosing tb in lung clinic in only 44 the diagnosis wa incorrect there is a need to improve routine tb diagnostic work by using clinical evaluation sputum smear microscopy and chest radiography all together in other setting such a in primary health center trial registration nct02219945 clinicaltrialsgov registered 19 august 2014 retrospectively registered

processed_title: spatiotemporal distribution of covid19 case and tuberculosis in four province of sumatra island indonesia
processed_abstract: background the covid19 pandemic disrupted national tuberculosis program in highburden country we hypothesize that covid19 occurrence had a delayed effect on tuberculosis case report from the indonesia ministry of health also known a the tuberculosis case notification the objective of this study are 1 to describe the potential effect of the reported covid19 case on the spatial distribution of tuberculosis in four province of sumatra island aceh north sumatra west sumatra and riau province indonesia 2 to estimate the temporal lag effect of the occurrence of covid19 on tuberculosis case notification method we retrieved data from the indonesian ministry of health and the indonesia covid19 task force we also examined the monthly tuberculosis and covid19 case notification we identified time series cluster of tuberculosis case notification and used lag nonlinear model to assess the delayed effect of the occurrence of covid19 case on tuberculosis case notification result the secondary data included 217593 tuberculosis case notification january 2019 to december 2022 and 373671 reported covid19 case january 2020 to december 2022 time series cluster analysis revealed 5 cluster each for monthly tuberculosis case notification and monthly reported covid19 case there wa a negative association with a 0month lag in more than 10000 reported covid19 case rr 095 95ci 091098 conclusion the finding suggested that indonesia national tuberculosis program in four province of sumatra island wa disrupted during the covid19 pandemic lag analysis showed that covid19 case occurrence had an immediate effect on tuberculosis case notification clinical trial not applicable

processed_title: perinatal tuberculosis a diagnostic and treatment challenge in a remote area of asmat regency of south papua indonesia case report
processed_abstract: perinatal tuberculosis tb is a rare infectious disease the diagnosis of perinatal tb is challenging due to it nonspecific clinical manifestation make it difficult to differentiate from other infection resulting in a high mortality rate of 4060 here we report a 26dayold neonate with fever cough fast breathing poor feeding subcostal retraction bilateral crackle hepatomegaly and sign of shock clinically septic shock and pneumonia were suspected respiratory distress worsened despite broadspectrum antibiotic and kept getting worse up to the point that intubation and assisted mechanical ventilation were needed the examination of acidfast bacteria afb stain on the endotracheal aspirate showed a positive result the patient wa diagnosed a having perinatal tb then treated with antitb regimen isoniazid rifampicin pyrazinamide ethambutol a well a prednisone and other supportive medical care recurrent septic shock laryngeal edema and a possibility of ventilatorassociated pneumonia vap worsened the patient condition the patient eventually passed away on the 71st day of care in conclusion perinatal tb should be suspected in any neonate with fever respiratory distress and hepatosplenomegaly particularly in those from endemic area which fail to respond to broadspectrum antibiotic early diagnosis and treatment are crucial to improve the prognosis of perinatal tb

processed_title: experience and number of patient a associated factor toward clinical confidence among nursing student in caring for tuberculosis patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background nurse and nursing student are at greater risk of tuberculosis tb exposure due to their higher intensity contact with patient in indonesia a country with high tb incidence it is crucial to assess undergraduate nursing student clinical confidence during their clinical practicums purpose this study aimed to explore factor associated with nursing student clinical confidence in caring for tb patient method this crosssectional study utilized an internet survey based on the united state national tb curriculum consortium ntcc in september and november 2020 the survey question focused on tb knowledge belief about the value of tb instruction and clinical confidence in caring for tb patient descriptive statistic ttest anova pearsons correlation coefficient and hierarchical regression were used for data analysis the indonesian version of the original ntcc survey wa used result the study found that nursing student knowledge about tb increased with their year of study r 0290 p 001 however student perceived tb instruction a less valuable a they neared graduation r 0233 p 001 and with more frequent practice in the tb unit r 0162 p 001 student who spent more time learning about tb outside of class perceived the tb instruction in the nursing curriculum more positively r 0181 p 004 the study also found a significant difference between nursing student belief in the value of tb education and their clinical confidence in caring for tb patient f 5711 p 001 furthermore experience caring for tb patient and the number of tb patient cared for predicted clinical confidence conclusionsimplications this study highlight the need for improved curriculum content and teaching method regarding tb for nursing student it also suggests that experience caring for tb patient and the number of tb patient cared for can improve clinical confidence in nursing student given the high incidence of tb in indonesia this study finding could have important implication for the country healthcare system

processed_title: catastrophic total cost in tuberculosisaffected household and their determinant since indonesia implementation of universal health coverage
processed_abstract: background a well a imposing an economic burden on affected household the high cost related to tuberculosis tb can create access and adherence barrier this highlight the particular urgency of achieving one of the end tb strategy target that no tbaffected household have to face catastrophic cost by 2020 in indonesia a elsewhere there is also an emerging need to provide social protection by implementing universal health coverage uhc we therefore assessed the incidence of catastrophic total cost due to tb and their determinant since the implementation of uhc method we interviewed adult tb and multidrugresistant tb mdrtb patient in urban suburban and rural area of indonesia who had been treated for at least one month or had finished treatment no more than one month earlier following the who recommendation we assessed the incidence of catastrophic total cost due to tb we also analyzed the sensitivity of incidence relative to several threshold and measured difference between poor and nonpoor household in the incidence of catastrophic cost generalized linear mixedmodel analysis wa used to identify determinant of the catastrophic total cost result we analyzed 282 tb and 64 mdrtb patient for tbrelated service the median interquartile range of total cost incurred by household wa 133 usd 55576 for mdrtbrelated service it wa 2804 usd 10084325 the incidence of catastrophic total cost in all tbaffected household wa 36 43 in poor household and 25 in nonpoor household for mdrtbaffected household the incidence wa 83 83 and 83 in tbaffected household the determinant of catastrophic total cost were poor household adjusted odds ratio aor 37 95 confidence interval ci 1778 being a breadwinner aor 29 95 ci 1366 job loss aor 212 95 ci 83539 and previous tb treatment aor 29 95 ci 1461 in mdrtbaffected household having an incomeearning job before diagnosis wa the only determinant of catastrophic total cost aor 87 95 ci 18417 conclusion despite the implementation of uhc tbaffected household still risk catastrophic total cost and further impoverishment a well a ensuring access to healthcare a costmitigation policy and additional financial protection should be provided to protect the poor and relieve income loss

processed_title: laboratory finding and clinical characteristic of pneumocystis pneumonia and tuberculosis infection among hivinfected patient with pulmonary infiltrates in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: pneumocystis pneumonia pcp and pulmonary tuberculosis infection ptb are important opportunistic infection in hivinfected patient the diagnosis remains challenging since pneumocystis jirovecii can not be cultured and expectoratedsputum is frequently difficult to obtain the monoclonalantibody detection for p jirovecii from induced sputum is promising in diagnosing pcp this study determined the percentage of pcp in hivinfected patient with pulmonary infiltrates at three government hospital in jakarta the concurrent infection of ptb wa carefully documented a well this crosssectional study wa carried out by documenting the clinical symptom laboratory finding chest xray while clinical outcome were evaluated during hospitalization the sputum induction wa conducted for p jirovecii with monoclonal antibody detection at the laboratory of parasitology department faculty of medicine universitas indonesia a well a ziehlnielsen staining for ptb the result indicated that of 55 hivinfected patient with pulmonary infiltrates the positive monoclonal antibody for p jirovecii wa detected in eight patient 146 weight loss fever shortness of breath and crackle were found in all pcp patient while dry cough in five patient moreover ptb case with positive acidfast bacillus afb wa detected in five patient 91 the ptb case with negative afb wa 436 24 out of 55 patient and the rest 26 patient 473 were not proven to have ptb the concurrent infection of pcp and ptb were documented in three out of five positive afb patient the clinical outcome of eight pcp patient showed improvement in five patient but the other three patient died laboratory finding play an important role in the diagnosis of pcp and ptb along with clinical characteristic and radiological feature low cd4 cell count wa considered a possible risk factor for pcp and poor clinical outcome

processed_title: nontuberculous mycobacterial specie and mycobacterium tuberculosis complex coinfection in patient with pulmonary tuberculosis in dr soetomo hospital surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: objectivebackground the aim of this study wa to analyze the detection of nontuberculous mycobacterial ntm specie derived from sputum specimen of pulmonary tuberculosis tb suspect increasing prevalence and incidence of pulmonary infection by ntm specie have widely been reported in several country with geographical variation material and method between january 2014 and september 2015 sputum specimen from chronic pulmonary tb suspect patient were analyzed laboratory examination of mycobacteria wa conducted in the tb laboratory department of clinical microbiology dr soetomo hospital surabaya detection and identification of mycobacteria were performed by the standard culture method using the bactec mgit 960 system bd and lowensteinjensen medium identification of positive mycobacterium tuberculosis complex mtbc wa based on positive acidfast bacillus microscopic smear positive niacin accumulation and positive tb ag mpt 64 test result sd bioline if the growth of positive culture and acidfast bacillus microscopic smear wa positive but niacin accumulation and tb ag mpt 64 sd bioline result were negative then the isolates were categorized a ntm specie mtbc isolates were also tested for their sensitivity toward firstline antitb drug using isoniazid rifampin ethambutol and streptomycin result from 2440 sputum specimen of pulmonary tb suspect patient 459 isolates 1881 were detected a mtbc and 141 578 a ntm specie conclusion from the analyzed sputum specimen 1881 were detected a mtbc and 578 a ntm specie each pulmonary tb suspect patient needed clinical setting to suspect causative agent of mtbc andor ntm specie clinician have to understand the local epidemiological data for the evaluation of cause of lung infection to determine appropriate therapy

processed_title: predominance of modern mycobacterium tuberculosis strain and active transmission of beijing sublineage in jayapura indonesia papua
processed_abstract: mycobacterium tuberculosis genotype distribution is different between west and central indonesia but there are no data on the most eastern part papua we aimed to identify the predominant genotype of m tuberculosis responsible for tuberculosis in coastal papua their transmission and the association with patient characteristic a total of 199 m tuberculosis isolates were collected spoligotyping wa applied to describe the population structure of m tuberculosis lineage identification wa performed using a combination of lineagespecific marker and genotypic cluster were identified using a combination of 24locusmiruvntr and spoligotyping a high degree of genetic diversity wa observed among isolates based on their spoligopatterns strain from modern lineage 4 made up almost half of strain 469 being more abundant than the ancient lineage 1 337 and modern lineage 2 194 thirtyfive percent of strain belonged to genotypic cluster especially strain in the beijing genotype previous tb treatment and mutation associated with drug resistance were more common in patient infected with strain of the beijing genotype papua show a different distribution of m tuberculosis genotype compared to other part of indonesia clustering and drug resistance of modern strain recently introduced to papua may contribute to the high tuberculosis burden in this region

processed_title: life of a partnership the process of collaboration between the national tuberculosis program and the hospital in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: publicprivate partnership ppp for improving the health of population are currently attracting attention in many country with limited resource the publicprivate mix for tuberculosis control is an example of an internationally supported ppp that aim to engage all provider including hospital to implement standardized diagnosis and treatment this paper explores mainly the local actor view and experience of the process of ppp in delivering tb care in hospital in yogyakarta province indonesia the study used a qualitative research design by maximum variation sampling 33 informant were purposefully selected the informant were involved in the publicprivate mix for tuberculosis control in yogyakarta province data were collected during 20082009 by indepth interview and analyzed using content analysis technique triangulation reference group checking and peer debriefing were conducted to improve the trustworthiness of the data this analysis showed that the process of partnership wa dynamic in the early phase of partnership the national tuberculosis program and hospital actor perceived barrier to interaction such a low enthusiasm lack of confidence mistrust and inequality of relationship the existence of an intermediary actor wa important for approaching the national tuberculosis program and hospital after intensive interaction compromise and acceptance were reached among the actor and even enabled the growth of mutual respect and feeling of programme ownership however the partnership faced declining interaction when faced with scarce resource and weak governance the strategy power and interaction between actor are important aspect of the process of collaboration we conclude that good partnership governance is needed for the partnership to be effective and sustainable

processed_title: investigating the risk factor for contraction and diagnosis of human tuberculosis in indonesia using data from the fifth wave of rand indonesian family life survey ifls5
processed_abstract: tuberculosis tb is a globally widespread disease with approximately a quarter of the world population currently infected who 2018 some risk factor such a hiv status nutrition and body mass index have already been thoroughly investigated however little attention ha been given to behavioural andor psychological risk factor such a stress and education level this study investigated the risk factor for tb diagnosis by statistical analysis of publicly available data from the most recent wave of the indonesian family life survey ifls5 conducted in 2015 out of 34249 respondent there were 328 who reported having tb for comparison and completeness variable were divided into level individual household and communitylevel variable the most prominent and interesting variable found to influence tb diagnosis status on each level were investigated and a logistic regression wa subsequently developed to understand the extent to which each risk factor act a a predictor for being diagnosed with tb age health benefit or insurance stress at work and living in a rural area all showed significant association with tb diagnosis status this study finding suggest that suitable control measure such a scheme for improving mental healthstress reduction and improved access to health care in rural area should be implemented in indonesia to address each of the key factor identified

processed_title: the association between climate variable and tuberculosis in kolaka district southeast sulawesi province indonesia 20132020 a bayesian autoregressive model
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis is one of the disease that requires comprehensive treatment this disease is highly contagious and can be transmitted through the air climate factor play a role in the increasing case of tuberculosis this study aimed to determine the correlation between climatic variable and tb in kolaka district southeast sulawesi province indonesia method this research wa modeled using an autoregressive ar bayesian model with three possible likelihood gaussian poisson and negative binomial response result minimum temperature and average temperature a coefficient of 4234 suggests that for every 1 degree increase in minimum temperature there is an estimated increase of approximately four case assuming other variable remain constant maximum temperature a coefficient of 17851 suggests that for every 1 degree increase in maximum temperature there is an estimated increase of around 1718 case assuming other variable remain constant humidity a coefficient of 13413 suggests that for every 1 increase in humidity there is an estimated decrease of around 13 case assuming other variable remain constant rainfall a coefficient of 0327 suggests that for every 1 mm increase in rainfall there is an estimated decrease of around 0327 case assuming other variable remain constant light a coefficient of 4322 suggests that for every 1hour increase in light duration there is an estimated decrease of around four case assuming other variable remain constant conclusion climate change ha a significant impact on tuberculosis through temperaturerelated factor these factor influence the prevalence spread and vulnerability to tb addressing these challenge requires a holistic approach involving adaptation planning strong public health system and healthcare infrastructure can help mitigate the risk and impact of climate changerelated tuberculosis

processed_title: risk of infection and disease with mycobacterium tuberculosis among child identified through prospective communitybased contact screening in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to identify characteristic of the child contact index case or environment that are associated with infection or tuberculosis in child contact in an urban community in indonesia method child who were close contact of an index case with pulmonary tuberculosis were screened for infection and disease in yogyakarta indonesia from august 2010 to december 2012 data of the index case and child were collected prospectively and all child contact had clinical assessment tuberculin skin test tst and chest xray performed those with clinically suspected tuberculosis also had sputum examined by xpert mtbrif and culture child contact were managed according to national guideline followed for 12 month and had a final classification of either tuberculosis disease latent tuberculous infection ltbi or exposed only result about 269 child of 141 index case were investigated final classification wa tuberculosis in 25 9 and ltbi in 121 45 the risk of infection wa significantly greater if the source case wa female aor 17 95 ci 1028 had sputum smearpositive tuberculosis aor 30 95 ci 1560 or slept in the same room aor 17 95 ci 1029 a positive tst wa independently associated with a diagnosis of tuberculosis aor 73 95 ci 2422 conclusion this study highlight the high risk and the risk factor associated with tuberculosis and ltbi among child contact in indonesia

processed_title: diagnostic workup and loss of tuberculosis suspect in jogjakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background early and accurate diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis tb is critical for successful tb control to assist in the diagnosis of smearnegative pulmonary tb the world health organisation who recommends the use of a diagnostic algorithm our study evaluated the implementation of the national tuberculosis programme diagnostic algorithm in routine health care setting in jogjakarta indonesia the diagnostic algorithm is based on the who tb diagnostic algorithm which had already been implemented in the health facility method we prospectively documented the diagnostic workup of all new tuberculosis suspect until a diagnosis wa reached we used clinical audit form to record each step chronologically data on the patient gender age symptom examination type date and result and final diagnosis were collected result information wa recorded for 754 tb suspect 435 of whom were lost during the diagnostic workup in health centre 0 in lung clinic among the tb suspect who completed diagnostic workups 511 and 1000 were diagnosed without following the national tb diagnostic algorithm in health centre and lung clinic respectively however the workup in the health centre and lung clinic generally conformed to international standard for tuberculosis care istc diagnostic delay were significantly longer in health centre compared to lung clinic conclusion the high rate of patient lost in health centre need to be addressed through the implementation of tb suspect tracing and better programme supervision the national tb algorithm need to be revised and differentiated according to the level of care

processed_title: emerging evidence to reduce the burden of tuberculosis in child and young people
processed_abstract: tuberculosis tb remains a major global health challenge child adolescent and young mother are highrisk population for tb with unique challenge and need child are often misdiagnosed or diagnosed too late resulting in longterm sequela or mortality while adolescent despite having more recognizable adulttype tb and being an important source of community transmission can be difficult to engage in care a they often fall between pediatric and adult model of care tb during pregnancy pose significant risk to the motherinfant pair yet antenatal screening to ensure timely treatment initiation is often inadequate recent research advancement to address these challenge include more accessible tb management aid shorter effective drug regimen childfriendly drug formulation strategy for active case finding to expand treatment coverage including of asymptomatic disease and more option for preventive therapy these advance have informed global policy and guideline however major gap in translation from policy to practice remain this narrative review discusses the progress and identifies potential solution with insight from the asiapacific region to ongoing challenge in tb detection treatment and prevention in child and young people with a view to tb elimination

processed_title: screening diabetes mellitus patient for pulmonary tuberculosis a multisite study in indonesia peru romania and south africa
processed_abstract: background diabetes mellitus dm patient are three time more likely to develop tuberculosis tb than the general population active tb screening in people with dm is part of a bidirectional approach the aim of this study wa to conduct pragmatic active tb screening among dm patient in four country to inform policy method dm patient were recruited in indonesia n809 peru n600 romania n603 and south africa n51 tb case were diagnosed using an algorithm including clinical symptom and chest xray presumptive tb patient were examined with sputum smear and culture result a total of 171 83 individual reported ever having had tb south africa 26 indonesia 12 peru 7 romania 4 15 of whom were already on tb treatment overall 14 073 95 confidence interval 040 to 123 tb case were identified from screening poor glucose control smoking lower body mass index education and socioeconomic status were associated with newly diagnosedcurrent tb thirteen of the 14 tb case diagnosed from this screening would have been found using a symptombased approach conclusion these data support the world health organization recommendation for routine symptombased screening for tb in known dm patient in high tbburden country dm patient with any symptom consistent with tb should be investigated and diagnostic tool should be easily accessible

processed_title: health and tuberculosis system resilience the role of the private sector and pandemic preparedness insight from a crosscountry qualitative study with policymakers in india indonesia and nigeria
processed_abstract: introduction the covid19 pandemic wa an unprecedented challenge to health system worldwide and had a severe impact on tuberculosis tb case notification and service delivery india indonesia and nigeria are high tbburden country where the majority of initial careseeking happens in the private health sector the objective of this study were to 1 explore policymakers perspective on the impact of the covid19 pandemic on private sector tb service delivery in india indonesia and nigeria and 2 identify crosscutting insight for pandemic preparedness with respect to tb service delivery method from may to november 2021 33 interview were conducted with key policymakers involved in health service administration tb service delivery andor the covid19 response in india indonesia and nigeria n11 in each country interview focused on the impact of covid19 on tb service and lesson learnt for pandemic preparedness with respect to tb in each study context data were analysed thematically using a hybrid inductivedeductive approach informed by haldane et al determinant of health system resilience framework result policymakers highlighted the crucial role of intersectoral collaboration effective governance innovative financing strategy health workforce reallocation and technological advancement such a virtual consultation and mhealth in strengthening tb service delivery amid the covid19 pandemic india relied on patientprovider support agency to implement a joint strategy for tb care across sector and state indonesia engaged network of private provider professional association to facilitate coordination of the covid19 response nigeria implemented a pandemic policy for publicprivate referral for the continuity of tb care conclusion country implemented varied measure to support tb service delivery during the covid19 pandemic this study present insight from three country india indonesia and nigeria that together offer a menu of possibility for supporting pandemic preparedness with respect to tb care visavis strengthening health system resilience

processed_title: tuberculosis coinfection among covid19 patient clinical presentation and mortality in a tertiary lung hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb and coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 are the top two killer of infectious disease we aimed to determine the association of tb coinfection with the inhospital mortality of covid19 patient in indonesia a a tbendemic country method we conducted a retrospective cohort study in a tertiary lung hospital in indonesia all tbcoinfected covid19 patient who were hospitalized between january 2020 and december 2021 were included in the study covid19 patient without tb were randomly selected for the control group clinical characteristic and laboratory result were assessed survival analysis wa performed to determine the estimated death rate and median survival time mst multivariate cox regression analysis wa conducted to define the association of tb coinfection with the inhospital mortality of covid19 result we included 86 83 tb coinfections among 1034 confirmed covid19 patient tb coinfection patient had younger age malnutrition and different symptom compared to the covid19 group tbcoinfected patient had a lower estimated death rate than the covid19 group 65 v 188 per 1000 population mst in the covid19 group wa 38 interquartile range 1647 day whereas the same observation time failed to determine the mst in the tb coinfection group tb coinfection had a crude hazard ratio of mortality 037 95 confidence interval ci 015094 p 0 004 the final model analysis including age sex and lymphocyte a confounding factor resulted in an adjusted hr of mortality 031 95 ci 0109 conclusion this study showed tb coinfection wa negatively associated with the inhospital mortality of covid19

processed_title: detection of katg inha and ahpc gene mutation in clinical isolates of isoniazidresistant mycobacterium tuberculosis in makassar city south sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb is an airborne disease caused by mycobacterium tuberculosis m tuberculosis the world is currently facing challenge due to the spread of antituberculosis drugresistant of m tuberculosis isoniazidresistant inh is one of the firstline antituberculosis agent that ha a high resistance case this study used multiplex allelespecific polymerase chain reaction maspcr to detect the most common mutation associated with isoniazid resistance on inha katg and ahpc gene method this study used sample from clinical isolates of m tuberculosis which had been tested for their antibiotic sensitivity of firstline antituberculosis drug the dna extraction process wa carried out using the boiling method and then amplified with specific primer for inha katg and ahpc gene using the maspcr method the result are then read on the electrophoretic gel with an interpretation of the mutation gene when the target gene dna band were absent according to the allelespecific fragment target result a total of 200 isolates were tested in this study consisting of isoniazidresistant and susceptible with the largest distribution of multidrug resistant mdr isolates with a total of 146 isolates 73 the most significant gene mutation wa on the ahpc gene in 61 isolates 305 and the combination mutation of the katg ahpc gene in 52 isolates 26 with sensitivity and specificity of the test reaching 87 and 42 for the detection of inhresistant conclusion mutation on the ahpc gene ha the highest percentage in this study ahpc gene can be considered one of the essential gene to be tested for the cause of isoniazidresistant using maspcr for detecting gene mutation in isoniazidresistant wa simple and easy it ha the potential to be widely used a a rapid screening molecular test

processed_title: chest xray comparison between drugresistant and drugsensitive pulmonary tuberculosis in child
processed_abstract: introduction chest xray cxr remains one of the tool used in diagnosing tuberculosis tb however few study about such tool exist specifically in child in indonesia we aim to investigate and compare the cxr finding of child with pulmonary drugresistant tb drtb and drugsensitive tb dstb that could help in the evaluation and management of tb case in child method retrospective analysis with crosssectional approach wa conducted in child 18 year old diagnosed with pulmonary drtb and dstb from january 2018 to december 2021 documented data were collected from the paediatric respirology registry and tuberculosis information system at dr hasan sadikin general hospital bandung characteristic of child cxr finding and tb severity were assessed and compared using the chisquare and fisher exact test with significance level set at p value 005 result sixtynine child drtb 31 child v dstb 38 child were assessed of the 31 child with drtb 65 were classified a multidrugresistant tb mdrtb followed by rifampicinresistant tb rrtb preextensively drugresistant tb prexdrtb and extensively drugresistant tb xdrtb the most common cxr finding in drtb are consolidation 68 fibrosis 42 and cavity 29 whereas in dstb it is pleura effusion 37 severe tb account for 50 of drtb p 0008 conclusion consolidation fibrosis cavity and finding of severe tb are most common in drtb pleural effusion is the most common in dstb these finding have the potential to be considered in further examination of child with pulmonary drtb and dstb hence more extensive study are needed to confirm these result

processed_title: improving knowledge and behaviour related to the cause transmission and prevention of tuberculosis and early case detection a descriptive study of community led tuberculosis program in flores indonesia
processed_abstract: background the community awareness of tuberculosis tb and delay in health care seeking remain important issue in indonesia despite the extensive effort of communitybased tb program delivered by a nongovernment organisation ngo this study explored the knowledge and behaviour in relation to tb and early diagnosis before and after an assetbased intervention designed to improve these issue method six village in flores indonesia were purposively selected to participate in this study three village served a intervention village and the other three village provided a comparison group data collection included interview group discussion observation field note and audit of record result in total 50 participant across six village were interviewed and three group discussion were conducted in the intervention village supplemented by 1 5 h of observation during monthly visit overall participant in all village had limited knowledge regarding the cause and transmission of tb before the intervention the delay in health seeking behaviour wa mainly influenced by ignorance of tb symptom health care provider also contributed to delayed diagnosis by ignoring the symptom of tb suspect at the first visit and failing to examine tb suspect with sputum test stigmatisation of tb patient by the community wa reported although this did not seem to be common early case detection wa less than 50 in four of the six village before the assetbased intervention knowledge of tb improved after the intervention in the intervention village alongside improved education activity early case detection also increased in the intervention village following this intervention the behaviour change related to prevention of tb were also obvious in the intervention village but not the comparison group conclusion this small project demonstrated that an assetbased intervention can result in positive change in community knowledge and behaviour in relation to tb and early case detection a continuing education process is like to be required to maintain this outcome and to reach a wider community promoting community involvement and local initiative and engaging health care provider were important element in the communitybased tb program implemented

processed_title: being safe feeling safe and stigmatizing attitude among primary health care staff in providing multidrugresistant tuberculosis care in bantul district yogyakarta province indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction patientcentered care approach in multidrugresistant tuberculosis care requires health worker safety that cover both being safe and feeling safe to conduct the service stigma ha been argued a a barrier to patientcentered care however there ha been relatively little research addressing the issue of safety and stigma among health staff this paper explored the issue of being safe feeling safe and stigmatizing attitude among health staff working with multidrugresistant tuberculosis case in primary health care facility in indonesia method using a mixed method research design data wa collected with structured questionnaire among 123 staff observation of infection control in 17 primary health care facility and indepth interview among 22 staff result the finding showed suboptimal infection control infrastructure for the primary health care facility the knowledge and motivation to follow multidrugresistant tuberculosis care protocol are suboptimal feeling unsafe is related to stigmatizing attitude in providing multidrugresistant tuberculosis care conclusion being safe feeling unsafe and stigmatizing attitude are challenge in providing patientcentered multidrugresistant tuberculosis care in primary health care facility in indonesia serious effort are needed on all level to ensure safety and prevent irrational stigma

processed_title: codeveloping a communitybased peerled psychosocial support intervention to reduce stigma and depression among people with tuberculosis and their household in indonesia a mixedmethods participatory action study
processed_abstract: evidence relating to peer support and communitybased psychological and social psychosocial intervention to reduce stigma and depression among people with tuberculosis tb and their household is limited this study aimed to engage with multisectoral stakeholder in indonesia to codevelop a peerled communitybased psychosocial intervention that is replicable acceptable and sustainable we used a participatory action design and engaged key national multisectoral stakeholder to ensure that the intervention codesign wa relevant and appropriate to the tb health system and the sociocultural context of indonesia the codesign of the intervention evolved through four phase 1 a scoping review to identify a long list of potential tb stigma reduction intervention 2 a modified delphi survey to define a shortlist of the potential intervention 3 a national multisectoral participatory workshop to identify and prefinalize the most viable element of psychosocial support to distill into a single multifaceted intervention and 4 finalization of the intervention activity the scoping review identified 12 potential intervention activity these were then reduced to a shortlist of six potential intervention activity through a modified delphi survey completed by 22 multisectoral stakeholder representative at the national participatory workshop the suitability acceptability and feasibility of the six potential intervention activity were discussed by the key stakeholder and consensus reached on the final four activity to be integrated into the psychosocial support intervention these activity consisted of individual psychological assessment and counselling monthly peerled group counselling peerled individual support and communitybased tb talk in indonesia meaningful participation of multisectoral stakeholder facilitated codesign of a communitybased peerled intervention to reduce tb stigma and depression amongst people with tb and their household the intervention wa considered to be locally appropriate and viable and is being implemented and evaluated a part of the tbcaps intervention study

processed_title: correlation between clinical manifestation and radiological finding in pulmonary tuberculosishuman immunodeficiency virus coinfection patient in sanglah hospital bali indonesia
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb monoinfection ha radiological feature and typical clinical manifestation that are easily recognized by clinician these radiological feature and clinical manifestation are often found to show atypical feature in subject coinfected with tuberculosis human immunodeficiency virus hiv making tb diagnosis and early management challenging to establish objective the aim of this study wa to determine the relationship between the clinical and radiological presentation of pulmonary tb patient with hiv coinfection at the central general hospital sanglah bali method this research wa an observational analytic study with a crosssectional method a total of 54 tbhiv coinfected patient were analyzed to their sociodemographic characteristic clinical manifestation and chest radiographic feature result the majority of subject were of productive age 2661 year male 648 and belonged to the heterosexual group 907 weight loss 759 cough 648 and oral candidiasis 537 are the most common clinical manifestation found in subject especially in subject with cd4 200 cellsmm3 atypical radiological feature such a infiltrationconsolidation 593 fibrosis 167 and hillar lymphadenopathy 148 are the most commonly obtained radiological feature of the subject from the result of the bivariate analysis it wa found that radiological feature in the form of infiltrationconsolidation were more commonly found in subject with cd4 200 cellsmm3 or1254 95 ci 10591568 conclusion based on the research that ha been done it can be concluded that there are no typical radiological feature and clinical manifestation in patient with tbhiv infection

processed_title: the economic burden of tuberculosis in indonesia
processed_abstract: setting indonesia ha a high prevalence of tuberculosis tb and is one of the 22 country with the highest tb burden in the world objective to understand the economic burden of tb in indonesia design tb data for 2015 were combined with cost data using a simple type of costbenefit analysis in a decision tree model to show the economic burden under different scenario result in indonesia there were an estimated 1 017 378 new active tb case in 2015 including multidrugresistant tb it is estimated that 417 976 of these case would be treated and cured 160 830 would be unsuccessfully treated and would die 131 571 would be untreated and would achieve cure spontaneously and 307 000 would be untreated and would die the total economic burden related to treated and untreated case would be approximately us69 billion loss of productivity due to premature death would be by far the largest element comprising us60 billion discounted which represents 866 of the total cost loss of productivity due to illness would be us700 million 101 provider medical cost us156 million 22 and direct nonmedical cost incurred by patient and their household us74 million 11 conclusion the economic burden of tb in indonesia is extremely high detecting and treating more case would result not only in major reduction in suffering but also in economic saving to society

processed_title: pregnant woman and healthcare worker perception on tuberculosis and screening a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background there is a scarcity of study regarding the obstacle in tuberculosis tb screening in pregnant woman this study aimed to assess the perception of tb a a disease and tb screening among pregnant woman and healthcare worker describe pregnant womens perception on specific tb screening method and explore association between the perception of tb with the intention to have tb screening by pregnant woman method a crosssectional study wa conducted at six primary healthcare centre in yogyakarta municipality indonesia among 240 pregnant woman and 126 healthcare worker interviewed with a structured questionnaire about their perception perception were analysed a percentage and associated factor were tested by multivariable logistic regression result most pregnant woman and healthcare worker supported tb screening in pregnant woman based on their perception of the susceptibility to or severity of tb and the benefit and risk of tb screening woman who perceived the high susceptibility of tb disease and the benefit of tb screening were significantly more likely to have high intention to accept tb screening in the future conclusion pregnant womens perception of tb and tb screening influenced their intention to be screened however appropriate testing method for universal tb screening in pregnant woman in area with a high prevalence of tb require further study

processed_title: tuberculosis mortality differential in indonesia during 20072008 evidence for health policy and monitoring
