processed_abstract: background indonesia bear the third highest tuberculosis tb burden in the world current mortality estimate are based on notification and case fatality rate derived from the national tb control programme objective to report tb mortality measure for 20072008 based on death registration system in selected population in five province of indonesia method data were compiled from site in central java lampung gorontalo west kalimantan and papua in 20072008 covering 25 million people overall mortality level and tb mortality indicator were computed data quality wa assessed in term of completeness of death registration and strength of evidence in verbal autopsy questionnaire result a total of 1547 tb death were diagnosed in the five province there wa direct or indirect evidence of incomplete death registration at all site more than 90 of tb diagnosis from verbal autopsy were based on strong evidence the result demonstrate high tb death rate in papua and significant mortality differential across province conclusion the measurement of causespecific mortality is feasible by strengthening death registration in indonesia observed tb mortality rate from five site are baseline evidence for monitoring tb control programme sustained effort are required to develop death registration a a routine annual source of mortality data for indonesia

processed_title: the burden and treatment of hiv in tuberculosis patient in papua province indonesia a prospective observational study
processed_abstract: background new diagnosis of tuberculosis tb present important opportunity to detect and treat hiv rate of hiv and tb in indonesia easternmost papua province exceed national figure but data on coinfection rate and outcome are lacking we aimed to measure tbhiv coinfection rate examine longitudinal trend compare management with world health organisation who recommendation and document progress and outcome method adult with newlydiagnosed smearpositive pulmonary tb managed at the timika tb clinic papua province were offered voluntary counselling and testing for hiv in accordance with indonesian national guideline using a pointofcare antibody test positive test were confirmed with 2 further rapid test study participant were assessed using clinical bacteriological functional and radiological measure and followed up for 6 month result of 162 participant hiv status wa determined in 138 852 of whom 18 130 were hiv indigenous papuan were significantly more likely to be hiv than nonpapuans odds ratio or 442 95 confidence interval ci 1381423 hiv prevalence among people with tb wa significantly higher than during a 20034 survey at the same tb clinic and substantially higher than the indonesian national estimate of 3 compared with hiv study participant those with tbhiv coinfection had significantly lower exercise tolerance median difference in 6minute walk test 25 m p 004 haemoglobin mean difference 13 gdl p 0002 and likelihood of cavitary disease or 035 95 ci 012101 and increased occurrence of pleural effusion or 360 95 ci 170758 higher rate of hospitalisation or death or 1180 95 ci 1827643 but no difference in the likelihood of successful 6month treatment outcome adherence to who guideline wa limited by the absence of integration of tb and hiv service specifically with no onsite art prescriber available only six people had cd4 tcell count recorded 11 were prescribed cotrimoxazole and 4 received art before during or after tb treatment despite art being indicated in 14 according to 2006 who guideline conclusion tbhiv coinfection in southern papua indonesia is a serious emerging problem especially among the indigenous population and ha risen rapidly in the last 5 year major effort are required to incorporate new who recommendation on tbhiv management into national guideline and support their implementation in community setting

processed_title: influence of radiographic silicosis and drug supervisor on the development of multi drug resistanttuberculosis in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia is among country with a high incidence of multi drugresistant tuberculosis mdrtb globally in this study we aim to determine the prevalence of silicotuberculosis among tb patient and to investigate the association of radiographic silicosis and the role of drug supervisor a well a other socioclinical factor in the development of mdrtb in indonesia method a hospitalbased study in west java among 148 mdrtb patient case and 164 drugsensitivedstb patient control wa conducted chest xrays were evaluated by two radiologist and one niosh b reader according to the ilo classification facetoface interview were conducted using structured questionnaire to collect patient information including the task of drug supervisor result finding indicate that supportive drug supervisor reduces the risk of developing mdrtb but silicosis showed no significant association nevertheless in this study we found that 17 case 54 had silicotuberculosis mostly exhibited a ilo profusion 3 predominated by q shape 529 with large opacity and dominated by size a other factor significantly associated with the risk of developing mdrtb were marital status low income longer traveling time to hospital unsuccessful previous treatment and suffering drug side effect conclusion this study reveals that one of preventive healthcare strategy to protect tb patient from developing mdrtb is supportive drug supervisor while the development of mdrtb wa not significantly influenced by silicosis however there is a notable prevalence of silicosis a determined by chest radiography highlighting the critical need for dust control occupational hygiene and health screening for highrisk population

processed_title: epidemiological model and costeffectiveness analysis of tuberculosis treatment programme in indonesia
processed_abstract: an epidemiological model of tuberculosis based on the natural history of tuberculosis and the control programme in indonesia wa constructed this model wa used for estimating future tuberculosisprevented case and cost for three treatment strategiesthe 100 standard course the 100 short course and the existing strategy a combination of 65 standard course and 35 short coursein accordance with the master plan of the indonesian government tuberculosis control programme a costeffectiveness analysis of the three strategy confirmed that the shortcourse strategy wa the most costeffective sensitivity analysis which applied a broad range of parameter continued to confirm the shortcourse strategy a the most costeffective if the shortcourse strategy had been applied in 1980 instead of the existing strategy using the most likely parameter the shortcourse strategy would prevent 18 million sputumpositive case and would save 610 million dollar by the year 2000

processed_title: female genital tuberculosis and infertility serial case report in bandung indonesia and literature review
processed_abstract: background female genital tuberculosis fgtb is a mycobacterium infection in the reproductive organ which often lead to infertility fgtb is either asymptomatic or cause uncharacteristic clinical presentation making an early diagnosis is challenging our aim were to evaluate the clinical presentation the process to confirm the diagnosis and followedup the patient who had undergone laparoscopy at our center fgtb ha been reported from many country but ha never been reported from indonesia here we present case study to document the presence of fgtb in indonesia case presentation there were three patient admitted to our center two patient were admitted with irregular menstrual cycle a their chief complaint while one patient came due to infertility the result from laparoscopy were suggestive of fgtb including the presence of caseating granuloma surrounded by epithelioid cell lymphocyte plasma cell and langhans giant cell additionally pcr testing confirmed presence of mtb subsequent to diagnosis continuous tb medication wa administered with excellent clinical outcome in two patient pregnant in 18 month after under gone laparoscopy the infertile patient remain in one of the treated patient above conclusion in infertile patient who live in country where tuberculosis is an endemic disease such a indonesia a comprehensive history taking along with ultrasonography result can be used to diagnose fgtb confirmation of this diagnosis can be achieved through polymerase chain reaction result timely diagnosis and treatment are imperative to prevent any permanent injury to patient reproductive organ

processed_title: tuberculin skin test and interferongamma release assay agreement and associated factor with latent tuberculosis infection in medical and nursing student in bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background no gold standard diagnostic test exists for latent tuberculosis infection ltbi the intradermal tuberculin skin test tst ha known limitation and interferongamma release assay igra have been developed a an alternative we aimed to assess agreement between igra and tst and risk factor for test positivity in indonesian healthcare student method medical and nursing student starting their clinical training were screened using igra and tst agreement between the two test wa measured using cohens kappa coefficient logistic regression wa used to identify factor associated with test positivity result of 266 student 43 162 were igra positive and 85 319 tst positive agreement between the two test wa 747 kappa 033 95 ci 021045 p00001 student who had direct contact with family or friend with tb were less likely to be test positive using igra aor 018 95 ci 005064 and using tst aor 051 95 ci 026099 conclusion test positivity for ltbi wa lower when measured by igra than by tst with poor agreement between the two test known close tb contact wa unexpectedly negatively associated with positivity by either test longitudinal study may be required to help determine the best test for ltbi in healthcare student in indonesia

processed_title: serious fungal disease incidence and prevalence in indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia is a tropical country warm and humid with numerous environmental fungi data on fungal disease burden help policymakers and clinician objective we have estimated the incidence and prevalence of serious fungal disease method we found all published and unpublished data and estimated the incidence and prevalence of fungal disease based on population at risk hiv data were derived from unaids 2017 pulmonary tuberculosis ptb data from 20132019 data on chronic pulmonary aspergillosis cpa were used to estimate cpa prevalence and likely death copd data from hammond 2020 lung cancer incidence wa from globocan 2018 and fungal rhinosinusitis wa estimated using community data from india result overall 77 million indonesian 289 have a serious fungal infection each year the annual incidence of cryptococcosis in aid wa 7540 pneumocystis pneumonia incidence wa estimated at 15400 in hiv and an equal number in nonhiv patient an estimated 1 and 02 of new aid patient have disseminated histoplasmosis or talaromyces marneffei infection the incidence of candidaemia is 26710 the annual incidence of invasive aspergillosis wa estimated at 49500 and the prevalence of cpa is at 378700 case allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis prevalence in adult is estimated at 336200 severe asthma with fungal sensitisation at 443800 and fungal rhinosinusitis at 294000 recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis is estimated at 5 millionyear 1550 year old the incidence of fungal keratitis around 40050 tinea capitis prevalence in schoolchildren about 729000 conclusion indonesia ha a high burden of fungal infection

processed_title: effect of introducing xpert mtbrif on diagnosis and treatment of drugresistant tuberculosis patient in indonesia a prepost intervention study
processed_abstract: background in march 2012 the xpert mtbrif assay xpert wa introduced in three provincial public hospital in indonesia a a novel diagnostic to detect tuberculosis and rifampicin resistance among high risk individual objective this study assessed the effect of using xpert in place of conventional solid and liquid culture and drugsusceptibility testing on case detection rate treatment initiation rate and health system delay among drugresistant tuberculosis tb patient method cohort data on registration test result and treatment initiation were collected from routine presumptive patient register one year before and one year after xpert wa introduced proportion of case detection and treatment initiation were compared using the pearson chi square test and median time delay using the mood median test result a total of 975 individual at risk of drugresistant tb were registered in the preintervention year and 1442 in the postintervention year after xpert introduction tb positivity rate increased by 15 while rifampicin resistance rate reduced by 23 among tb positive case and by 9 among all tested secondline tb treatment initiation rate among rifampicin resistant patient increased by 19 time from client registration to diagnosis wa reduced by 74 day to a median of a single day iqr 04 and time from diagnosis to treatment start wa reduced by 27 day to a median of 15 day iqr 751 all finding were significant with p0001 conclusion compared to solid and liquid culture and drugsusceptibility testing xpert detected more tb and less rifampicin resistance increased secondline treatment initiation rate and shortened time to diagnosis and treatment this test hold promise to improve rapid case finding and management of drugresistant tb patient in indonesia

processed_title: comparison of individual regimen containing bedaquiline with delamanid and bedaquiline without delamanid on efficacy and safety in multidrugresistant tuberculosis patient implementation in dr soetomo general academic hospital indonesia
processed_abstract: background bedaquiline is one of the core drug used to treat multidrugresistant tb mdrtb delamanid is one of the companion drug in group c which is used to complete the treatment regimen when drug in group a and b can not be used this study wa conducted to analyze the efficacy and safety between individual regimen containing bedaquiline with delamanid and bedaquiline without delamanid method this wa an observational analytic study with a retrospective design in mdrtb patient treated with individual regimen containing bedaquiline with delamanid bedaquilinedelamanid group and bedaquiline without delamanid bedaquiline group efficacy wa measured according to the time to acid fast bacillus afb conversion and mycobacterium tuberculosis culture conversion while safety wa measured specifically on qtc interval prolongation result the median range time to afb conversion in bedaquilinedelamanid group wa faster than bedaquiline group although there wa no significant difference 15 14 month v 1 16 month p0429 the median time to culture conversion in bedaquilinedelamanid group also faster than bedaquiline group although there wa no significant difference 1 16 month v 2 16 month p0089 the incidence of qtc interval prolongation in bedaquilinedelamanid group wa less than bedaquiline group although there wa no significant difference 269 v 403 p0223 conclusion individual regimen containing bedaquiline with delamanid wa proven to provide similar efficacy and safety profile with individual regimen containing bedaquiline without delamanid delamanid should be preferred when selecting drug to complete the treatment regimen when drug in group a and b can not be used

processed_title: malnutrition and sociodemographic factor associated with pulmonary tuberculosis in timor and rote island indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to identify nutritional and sociodemographic factor for the development of tuberculosis tb in timor and rote island indonesia so that intervention programme can be developed to address these factor method in a casecontrol study we enrolled new sputum smearpositive pulmonary tb patient a case and neighbour matched for sex and age a control data obtained included history of tb sociodemographic factor and nutritional status result in the study 121 tb patient and 371 control participated the mean age wa 30 year 563 were male and 437 female of the tb patient 87 had malnutrition compared to 33 among control the mean body mass index bmi of the patient wa significantly lower than that of the control 161 23 kgm2 v 194 30 kgm2 factor associated with the development of tb were bmi or 05 95ci 0406 family history of tb or 32 95ci 1664 living in an extended family or 27 95ci 1548 being nonindigenous to timor and rote island or 29 95ci 1268 and being unemployed or 38 95ci 1786 conclusion among patient with active pulmonary tb the prevalence of malnutrition wa very high malnutrition which is a general problem for the whole community and particularly among people not indigenous to timor and rote should be addressed in the fight against tb

processed_title: mycobacterium tuberculosis atpe gene profile of bedaquilinetreated pulmonary tuberculosis patient at the referral hospital dr soetomo indonesia
processed_abstract: background the atpe gene is a target for bedaquiline bdqactivating drug action and mutation in the gene are fixed to cause resistance however change in the amino acid of atpase have been little reported from a clinical setting since it wa first used in 2015 in indonesia this study aim to observe the sequence of nucleotide and amino acid from rifampicinresistant rr pulmonary tuberculosis tb patient both new and relapse case treated with bdq method this is an observational descriptive study performed in the referral hospital dr soetomo indonesia at august 2022november 2022 we performed sanger sequencing and comparison of the atpe gene from the patient sputum from august to november 2022 to wildtype mycobacterium tuberculosis h37rv and specie of mycobacteria using bioedit version 72 and blast ncbi software we also conducted an epidemiological study on patient characteristic this study us a descriptive statistic to show the percentage of data result the total of 12 m tuberculosis isolates showed that the atpe gene sequence wa 100 similar to the wildtype m tuberculosis h37rv no singlenucleotide polymorphism or mutation were found and no change in the amino acid structure at position 28 asp 61 glu 63 ala and 66 ile the percentage identity of atpe to m tuberculosis h37rv and m tuberculosis complex wa 99100 while the similarity with the other mycobacteria specie other than tb mycobacterium avium complex mycobacterium abscessus and mycobacterium lepraemurium wa 8891 conclusion this study revealed m tuberculosis atpe gene sequence profile of rrtb patient had no mutation a the specific gene region and no change in the amino acid structure therefore bdq can be continually trusted a an effective antitubercular drug in rrtb patient

processed_title: clinical tuberculosis problem and management
processed_abstract: tuberculosis tb is a chronic disease caused by m tuberculosis who world health organization 1993 ha estimated that one third of world population ha been infected by m tuberculosis bacillus it is also estimated that 8 million people contract the disease annually and two to three million death occur every year due to tb major factor that have aggravated the spread of tb are 1 ineffective tb control program leading to the development of multi drug resistant bacillus 2 co infection with hiv human immunodeficiency virus where tb progress rapidly and deadly3 existence of other comorbid that need higher expert internist etc vaccination with bcg doe not seem to protect the adult population consistently and effectively from developing pulmonary tb and ha had no significant impact on the global tb epidemiology tuberculosis in indonesia result in high death rate because it is the second highest infection with national prevalence rate of 024 effective medicine standard of antituberculosis is available but many obstacle in the program from lack of knowledge among health officer low consciousness and compliance of person with tuberculosis to carry out the treatment schedule and so on make the success of tb eradication unsatisfied clinical appearance of tb are multiple with nonspecific symptom the case that are exposed to similar source of infection but will show different clinical consequence from mild to severe nevertheless with the rise of multi drug resistance strain of m tuberculosis the spread of hiv infection and the variation of bcg efficacy the search for more powerful drug more effective vaccine better diagnostics and other intervention strategy have become an urgent goal worldwide also written here how to diagnose choose of category of treatment cocktail anti tb according the category and some clue in handling problem during treatment

processed_title: effectiveness of spatially targeted intervention for control of hiv tuberculosis leprosy and malaria a systematic review
processed_abstract: background a infectious disease approach global elimination target spatial targeting is increasingly important to identify community hotspot of transmission and effectively target intervention we aimed to synthesise relevant evidence to define best practice approach and identify policy and research gap objective to systematically appraise evidence for the effectiveness of spatially targeted community public health intervention for hiv tuberculosis tb leprosy and malaria design systematic review data source we searched medline embase global health web of science and cochrane database of systematic review between 1 january 1993 and 22 march 2021 study selection the study had to include hiv or tb or leprosy or malaria and spatial hotspot definition and community intervention data extraction and synthesis a data extraction tool wa used for each study we summarised approach to identifying hotpot intervention design and effectiveness of the intervention result ten study including one cluster randomised trial and nine with alternative design beforeafter comparator area satisfied our inclusion criterion spatially targeted intervention for hiv one usa study tb three usa and leprosy two brazil one federated state of micronesia each used household location and disease density to define hotspot followed by communitybased screening malaria study one each from india indonesia and kenya used household location and disease density for hotspot identification followed by complex intervention typically combining community screening larviciding of stagnant water body indoor residual spraying and mass drug administration evidence of effect wa mixed conclusion study investigating spatially targeted intervention were few in number and mostly underpowered or otherwise limited methodologically affecting interpretation of intervention impact applying advanced epidemiological methodology supporting more robust hotspot identification and larger or more intensive intervention would strengthen the evidencebase for this increasingly important approach prospero registration number crd42019130133

processed_title: the correlation between cd4 tlymphocyte count and tuberculosis form in tbhiv coinfected patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to find whether there is a correlation between cd4 count and tb form in tbhiv coinfected patient in indonesia method this is a crosssectional study of the tbhiv patient at national hiv center pokdisus cipto mangunkusumo hospital in 20082011 we classified tb form a pulmonary tb extrapulmonary tb milliary tb and combination form the data were analyzed by spearman and lambda correlation test we also did partial correlation test to eliminate some counfounding factor including demography and clinical characteristic that had been determinated before result there were 122 tbhiv patient aged median 31 1834 80 male included in this study the most common tb form wa pulmonary tb 712 then extrapulmonary tb 74 the combined type 189 and milliary tb 25 median of cd4 count wa 40 cellsml iqr 1751006 there wa a very weak correlation between cd4 count and tb form in tbhiv patient in indonesia r0185 p0042 the other factor that also showed a significant correlation to tb form is hiv staging r0289 p0001 after adjusting those factor we found an increase on correlation between cd4 count and tb form r0353 p0000 conclusion there wa a correlation between cd4 count and tb form in tbhiv patient in indonesia but in a very weak correlation

processed_title: missed opportunity for standardized diagnosis and treatment among adult tuberculosis patient in hospital involved in publicprivate mix for directly observed treatment shortcourse strategy in indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background the engagement of hospital in publicprivate mix ppm for directly observed treatment shortcourse dot strategy ha increased rapidly internationally including in indonesia in view of the rapid global scalingup of hospital engagement we aimed to estimate the proportion of outpatient adult tuberculosis patient who received standardized diagnosis and treatment at outpatient unit of hospital involved in the ppmdots strategy method a crosssectional study using morbidity report for outpatient laboratory register and tuberculosis patient register from 1 january 2005 to 31 december 2005 by quota sampling 62 hospital were selected poststratification analysis wa conducted to estimate the proportion of tuberculosis case receiving standardized management according to the dot strategy result nineteen to 53 of tuberculosis case and 418 of sputum smear positive tuberculosis case in hospital that participated in the ppmdots strategy were not treated with standardized diagnosis and treatment a in dot conclusion this study found that a substantial proportion of tb patient cared for at ppmdots hospital are not managed under the dot strategy this represents a missed opportunity for standardized diagnosis and treatment a combination of strong individual commitment of health professional organizational support leadership and relevant policy in hospital and national tuberculosis programme may be required to strengthen dot implementation in hospital

processed_title: prevalence of tuberculosis in indonesia singapore brunei darussalam and the philippine
processed_abstract: tuberculosis remains a major health problem in southeast asia and rank high in the list of cause of morbidity and mortality there are still many smearpositive case about half a million in indonesia and almost 400000 in the philippine and these are a reservoir of infection cooperation between country in this region is required for the control of tuberculosis

processed_title: high tuberculosis incidence among people living with diabetes in indonesia
processed_abstract: background data regarding the incidence of tuberculosis tb among people living with diabetes plwd in tbendemic setting are scarce we examined tb incidence among plwd in indonesia who had previously been screened for latent tb infection ltbi and tb disease method plwd 18 y of age in an urban setting were examined a mean 34 y after they had been screened for active tb and ltbi data on subsequent tb diagnosis were collected by interview and with chest xray sputum smear and mycobacterium tuberculosis culture tb incidence rate were stratified for baseline ltbi status a determined by the quantiferon interferongamma release assay igra result of 590 plwd 101 had died and 163 could not be contacted or refused among the 326 who were reexamined 6 18 95 confidence interval ci 07 to 40 reported being diagnosed already and a further 5 were diagnosed with active tb 15 95 ci 050 to 35 the tb incidence rate wa 985 95 ci 403 to 1568 per 1000 personyears tb incidence wa higher among plwd with baseline ltbi 1713 95 ci 525 to 29001000 personyears compared with those without ltbi 479 95 ci 063 to 1021 with an incidence rate ratio of 357 95 ci 086 to 2092 p0054 conclusion plwd with ltbi in indonesia and similar setting are likely to benefit from tb preventive therapy

processed_title: strategic priority for tb control in bangladesh indonesia and the philippine comparative analysis of national tb prevalence survey
processed_abstract: background philippine indonesia and bangladesh are three high tuberculosis tb burden country in asia which account for 18 of the estimated global tb incidence 18 million and 15 of tb related death 192000 in 2017 alone approximately 785000 of the incident tb case in these country remained missing including diagnosed but not notified method we reviewed the published data from the most recent tb prevalence survey conducted in bangladesh indonesia and the philippine the prevalence rate established by the survey were used to estimate the disease burden of these country for 2017 the global tb report 2017 and world health organization who global tb database were sourced for collection of incidence and notification data by age group and type of tb to estimate prevalence to notification gap 2017 result according to the survey the estimated prevalence rate of bacteriologically confirmed tb and smearpositive tb are 287 and 113 for bangladesh 201516 759 and 256 for indonesia 201314 and 1159 and 434 for the philippine 2016 per 100000 population over the age of 15 year the overall national tb prevalence estimate for all form is 260 for bangladesh 660 for indonesia and 970 for the philippine 2016 compared with the incidence rate the proportion of total notified case is 67 for bangladesh 52 for indonesia and 55 for the philippine bangladesh ha been able to detect almost 100 of the prevalent pulmonary tb while indonesia and philippine have detected only 30 and 22 of these infectious case respectively although notification ha been improving over the year there is no impact on the incidence rate since a large proportion of the undiagnosed case and delayed diagnosis continue to feed the transmission process conclusion the survey have provided data that is critical for developing realistic strategy for these country to eliminate tb in general this paper recommends intervention for strengthening diagnosis of pulmonary tb implementing targeted communication program and active case finding to reduce patient level delay expanding publicprivate partnership to increase access to tb service using rapid diagnostics and providing social protection for vulnerable population these measure can accelerate these country progress towards achieving end tb goal

processed_title: association of hlaa b and drb1 with pulmonary tuberculosis in western javanese indonesia
processed_abstract: genetic study of pulmonary tuberculosis ptb including those of human leukocyte antigen hla gene have been reported in several population some study also have reported these gene to have a stronger role in severe tuberculosis we investigated hla class i and ii allele and haplotype to ascertain their role in susceptibility and resistance to new and recurrent ptb in 257 ptb patient 216 new and 41 recurrent ptb patient and 236 healthy control in western javanese indonesia hlab4006 wa associated with new ptb p 0044 padj n whereas hlab1802 hlab4001 and hladrb11101 were associated with recurrent ptb p 0013 padj 0016 p 0015 padj 0028 and p 0008 padj 0027 for new ptb v recurrent ptb respectively except for hlab4006 those association remained significant after adjustment for age and gender by logistic regression analysis although they disappeared after correction for multiple testing haplotype hlab1802drb11202 wa associated with susceptibility to recurrent ptb p 0014 odds ratio 38 95 confidence interval 1181227 in contrast hladrb11202 in the absence of hlab1802 showed a significant association with resistance to recurrent ptb p 82 x 104 odds ratio 032 95 confidence interval 016064 suggesting that stronger susceptibility effect of hlab1802 masked the protective effect of hladrb11202 further study using larger number of patient with recurrent ptb will be needed to confirm our finding

processed_title: varied trend of tuberculosis and hiv dual epidemic among different country during 20002020 lesson from an ecological timetrend study of 9 country
processed_abstract: background while human immunodeficiency virus hiv infection is a wellestablished risk factor for tuberculosis tb the effect of hiv infection on tb incidence varies across country given difference in local epidemiological factor and disparate progress with respect to tb elimination goal method in this descriptive epidemiological study we explored the countryspecific association between hiv prevalence and tb incidence in nine country representing four who region using data between 2000 and 2020 for each of these country we 1 described the trend of tb incidence and hiv prevalence and 2 examined countrylevel association between tb incidence and hiv prevalence using negative binomial regression result the trend of tb incidence and hiv prevalence and the countrylevel association varied across the study country angola thailand and zimbabwe showed parallel tb incidence and hiv prevalence trend while the two trend diverged in brazil liberia and indonesia during the study period additionally the strength of association between hiv prevalence and tb incidence varied widely between country with the risk ratio ranging from 042 95 ci 036 049 in indonesia to 278 95 ci 257 302 in thailand conclusion the association of hiv infection with tb incidence varied across high burden setting suggesting that hiv is not a ubiquitous driver of tb incidence without acknowledging the local driver of tb epidemic across country the end tb strategy can not be adapted at the country level the finding from this analysis can inform the design of future study to identify countryspecific driver of tb using individuallevel data

processed_title: quality tuberculosis care in indonesia using patient pathway analysis to optimize publicprivate collaboration
processed_abstract: background tuberculosis tb is the fourth leading cause of death in indonesia in 2015 the world health organization estimated that nearly twothirds of the tb patient in indonesia had not been notified and the status of their care remained unknown a such indonesia is home to nearly 20 of the world missing tb patient understanding where patient go for care may enable strategic planning of service to better reach them method a patient pathway analysis ppa wa conducted to assess the alignment between patient care seeking and the availability of tb diagnostic and treatment service at the national and subnational level in indonesia result the ppa result revealed that only 20 of patient encountered diagnostic capacity at the location where they first sought care most initial care seeking occurred in the private sector and case notification lagged behind diagnostic confirmation in the public sector conclusion the ppa result emphasize the role that the private sector play in tb patient care seeking and suggested a need for differentiated approach by province to respond to variance in careseeking pattern and the capacity of public and private provider

processed_title: immune correlate of early clearance of mycobacterium tuberculosis among tuberculosis household contact in indonesia
processed_abstract: some individual even when heavily exposed to an infectious tuberculosis patient do not develop a specific tcell response a measured by interferongamma release assay igra this could be explained by an ifngammaindependent adaptive immune response or an effective innate host response clearing mycobacterium tuberculosis mtb without adaptive immunity in heavily exposed indonesian tuberculosis household contact n 1347 a persistently igra negative status wa associated with presence of a bcg scar and especially among those with a bcg scar with altered innate immune cell dynamic higher heterologous escherichia coliinduced proinflammatory cytokine production and higher inflammatory protein in the igra mitogen tube neither circulating concentration of mtbspecific antibody nor functional antibody activity associated with igra status at baseline or followup in a cohort of adult in a low tuberculosis incidence setting bcg vaccination induced heterologous innate cytokine production but only marginally affected mtbspecific antibody profile our finding suggest that a more efficient host innate immune response rather than a humoral response mediates early clearance of mtb the protective effect of bcg vaccination against mtb infection may be linked to innate immune priming also termed trained immunity

processed_title: the comanagement of tuberculosisdiabetes comorbidities in indonesia under the national tuberculosis control program result from a crosssectional study from 2017 to 2019
processed_abstract: background indonesia suffers from a high burden of tuberculosis tb and diabetes dm the government initiated national tbdm comanagement activity under the national tb control program in 2017 this study investigates the detection and treatment outcome of tbdm in jakarta after implementing these activity and identifies the main factor associated with these outcome method a crosssectional study wa conducted using tb registry data in two district of jakarta east jakarta lowincome and south jakarta highincome a 5step cascade analysis wa used diagnosed tb patient tb patient tested for dm diagnosed tbdm patient and patient received and completed tb treatmentcured we conducted descriptive analysis to understand the characteristic of tb and tbdm patient and used a twolevel mixedeffect logistic regression to explore factor associated with having a dm test and completing tb treatmentbeing cured result over the study period 20172019 508 of the new pulmonary tb patient aged over 15 were tested for dm the percentage increased from 417 in 20172018 to 601 in 2019 of the tb patient tested for dm 208 were diagnosed with dm over 90 of the detected tbdm patient received standard tb treatment 863 of whom completed treatmentwere cured patient in east jakarta were more likely to be tested for dm and to complete standard tb treatmentbe cured than patient in south jakarta p 0001 bacteriologically positive tb patient were more likely to be tested for dm or 137 95 ci 117160 patient diagnosed in subdistrict level healthcare center had a higher likelihood of being tested for dm than those in government and private hospital p 005 receiving dm treatment wa associated with a higher likelihood of completing tb treatmentbeing cured or 182 95 ci 120 277 conclusion tbdm case detection significantly improved in 2019 after introducing tbdm comanagement activity in jakarta while gap in tbdm comanagement existed between bacteriologically positive and clinically diagnosed tb patient and across different type of health facility collaboration between tb and dm department should be strengthened and more resource need to be mobilized to further improve the comanagement of tbdm in indonesia

processed_title: challenge opportunity and potential role of the private primary care provider in tuberculosis and diabetes mellitus collaborative care and control a qualitative study
processed_abstract: introduction the comorbidity of tuberculosis and diabetes mellitus tbdm is a looming global coepidemic problem despite the indonesian government ongoing effort to impose regulation for collaborative tbdm management the involvement of private primary care provider ppcs ha not been considered before the covid19 pandemic this study aimed to capture the ppcs existing practice and explore their challenge opportunity and potential role in the collaborative tbdm service and control method a descriptive qualitative research design wa used to collect data two focus group discussion fgds were conducted with 13 healthcare worker hcws from different private clinic and eight privatesolo general practitioner gps from yogyakarta city indonesia we triangulated these data with data from fgds of hcws community health center chcs and indepth interview of three regional health regulator five hospital staff member and a representative of national health insurance the discussion were audiorecorded transcribed verbatim and subjected to thematic analysis result ppcs have not been initiated into the implementation of the collaborative tbdm programme the theme identified in this study were health systemrelated barrier knowledge and perception of hcws lack of implementation of bidirectional screening and need of multisector role the potential role identified for ppcs include involvement in health promotion bidirectional screening patient referral and data reporting according to the tbdm programme indicator however more thorough improvement of ppcs capacity and logistic supply are needed to provide comprehensive tb treatment conclusion although ppcs involvement in implementing collaborative tbdm service ha yet to be considered their potential role should not be neglected therefore it is essential to increase their involvement by enhancing their capacity and improving the publicprivate mix ppcs engagement should be initiated and maintained to ensure the sustainability of the programme

processed_title: voluntary counselling and testing uptake and hiv prevalence among tuberculosis patient in jogjakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: we aimed to establish hiv prevalence and uptake of unlinked anonymous testing and voluntary counselling and testing vct among tuberculosis tb patient in jogjakarta indonesia we introduced unlinked anonymous hiv testing for tb patient attending directly observed treatment shortcourse service between april and december 2006 patient were additionally offered vct service of 1269 tb patient who were offered unlinked anonymous testing 989 779 95 ci 756801 accepted hiv prevalence wa 19 95 ci 1622 hiv infection were less frequently diagnosed among tb patient who attended a public health centre odds ratio or 015 95 ci 003070 rather than public hospital they were more frequent in tb patient with a university education background or 516 95 ci 1012663 or a history of hiv testing or 5787 95 ci 94235562 of the 989 patient who accepted unlinked anonymous testing only 133 134 95 ci 115157 expressed interest in vct of these 52 391 95 ci 312476 attended vct but interest wa higher among student and those offered vct by public health centre the hiv prevalence in jogjakarta is higher than expected and need to be monitored cautiously unlinked anonymous hiv testing is well accepted and can be implemented with modest additional effort

processed_title: high tuberculosis notification and treatment success rate through community participation in central sulawesi republic of indonesia
processed_abstract: setting central sulawesi province republic of indonesia objective to increase tuberculosis case notification and maintain high treatment success rate through community participation in a tuberculosis field programme design comparison of tuberculosis case notification and treatment result in a community based tuberculosis programme cbtp before and after introduction of the programme and between area where the programme wa and wa not introduced result during 1998 the cbtp wa introduced in two of the four rural district of the central sulawesi province covering 224 29 of the 772 village and 362700 33 of the 1109100 population in these district in the cbtp village the notification rate of new smearpositive patient per 100000 population increased from si in 1996 and 48 in 1997 to 166 in 1998 in the 548 noncbtp village the rate were 62 60 and 70 respectively the sputum conversion rate at the end of the first 2 month of the treatment wa over 85 in both the cbtp and the noncbtp village in the cbtp village the treatment success rate cure and treatment completion wa 904 895 and 937 in 1996 1997 and 1998 for the noncbtp village these rate were respectively 854 868 and 859 in 1998 the sputum conversion and treatment success rate were significantly higher in the cbtp village than in the noncbtp village conclusion through community participation the notification of new smearsmear positive patient increased substantially while sputum conversion and treatment success rate remained high

processed_title: drug resistance among tuberculosis patient attending diagnostic and treatment centre in makassar indonesia
processed_abstract: setting government tuberculosis tb diagnostic and treatment centre makassar indonesia objective to determine the proportion and pattern of resistance to commonly used tb drug isoniazid inh rifampicin ethambutol and streptomycin among pulmonary tb patient and assess potential risk factor for drug resistance design crosssectional study result of 657 recruited patient 234 were culturepositive drug susceptibility testing dst result were available for 216 patient among these 197 were infected with mycobacterium tuberculosis complex 145 new and 52 previously treated isolates from 89 new 614 and 31 previously treated 596 patient were susceptible to all four drug resistance to inh wa high among both patient group 283 of new v 346 of previously treated multidrugresistant tb mdrtb case accounted for respectively 41 and 192 of these patient resistance to 2 drug wa high among previously treated patient 192 mdrtb case were more likely to have a history of excess alcohol use adjusted or 401 95ci 1281253 and previous tb treatment adjusted or 628 95ci 2011964 conclusion regardless of previous treatment history many culturepositive tb patient were infected with inhresistant isolates and a significant proportion of previously treated patient were infected with mdrtb treating culturepositive tb patient especially previously treated patient based on dst result should therefore be considered

processed_title: covid19 vaccine current status and implication for use in indonesia
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 ha inflicted catastrophic damage in public health economic and social stabilityputting life globally on hold in 2020 and presumably a year more indonesia bear a heavy burden of the pandemic counting the highest case prevalence and fatality rate in all of southeast asia one hope remains in the groundbreaking universal effort in search of a vaccine against the causative virus sarscov2 which ha shown success unparalleled in human vaccine development thus far an array of modality including novel technique are being utilized a vaccine platform with the closest to phase iii clinical trial completion being mrna manufactured by moderna and biontechpfizer inactivated virus sinovac sinopharm viral vector oxfordastrazeneca gamaleya janssenjohnsonjohnson cansino and protein subunit novavax the vaccine produced by biontechpfizer ha been deployed to the public a the first ever licensed covid19 vaccine in this review we will review all of these modality on their safety and immunogenicity phase iiiii trial result of the nine vaccine candidate and current situation a of 29 december 2020 a well a the implication for use and distribution in indonesia covid19 vaccine progress however is moving exceedingly fast and new advance are unfolding on a daily basis to which we hope an update to this review can be published in early 2021

processed_title: realtime polymerase chain reaction current technique application and role in covid19 diagnosis
processed_abstract: successful detection of the first sarscov2 case using the realtime polymerase chain reaction realtime pcr method reflects the power and usefulness of this technique realtime pcr is a variation of the pcr assay to allow monitoring of the pcr progress in actual time pcr itself is a molecular process used to enzymatically synthesize copy in multiple amount of a selected dna region for various purpose realtime pcr is currently one of the most powerful molecular approach and is widely used in biological science and medicine because it is quantitative accurate sensitive and rapid current application of realtime pcr include gene expression analysis mutation detection detection and quantification of pathogen detection of genetically modified organism detection of allergen monitoring of microbial degradation specie identification and determination of parasite fitness the technique ha been used a a gold standard for covid19 diagnosis modification of the standard realtime pcr method have also been developed for particular application this review aim to provide an overview of the current application of the realtime pcr technique including it role in detecting emerging virus such a sarscov2

processed_title: covid19 and indonesia
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic is an ongoing problem in more than 200 country in the world indonesia ha been greatly affected by covid19 with case fatality rate cfr being 89 in the end of march 2020 we have some room for improvement related to the unreadingess of healthcare facility and the major step taken by the government it is suggested that the country should have stricter stayathome notice suppress the spread by imposing lockdown on a large scale improve healthcare service and increase the availability of personal protective equipment ppe it is important to avoid an epidemic peak that potentially overwhelms healthcare service by quarantining the case contact lockdown may prolong the epidemic doubling time significantly demand of health system is likely to grow since the number of covid19 case is likely to rise effective procedure for protecting medical staff from infection are essential scientific research in indonesia is also crucial to provide suggestion and recommendation pertinent to covid19

processed_title: covid19 in indonesia where are we
processed_abstract: since the 1st case officially confirmed on the last march 2020 indonesia recorded more than 1000 new case daily the national trend show no sign of decrease a 19 september 2020 the report set a new mark of 4000 new case in a day the concept of controlling disease transmission relies on contact suppression and on the longer end relies on vaccination a 27 september 2020 no vaccine is approved for use in the general population until then country should implement early widespread and strict disease mitigation strategy while much remains to be learned on covid19 global evidence assert at least three strategy at the population level contributes to flatten the curve mobility restriction testing and isolation and rigorous contacttracingindonesia is not on entire absence of action but the epidemic call for more the central government called for social distancing two week after the first case confirmed and regulation on the large scale social distancing pembatasan sosial berskala besar psbb that restrict nonessential population mobility is enacted by april 2020 recent evidence outline test tracing and isolation are effective in suppressing covid19 transmission minimizing testing and tracing delay less than four day with coverage of 80 close contact could prevent and reduce onwards transmissionthat we need to more is indisputable the vaccine is not a magic bullet it is a longterm control measure and should be a complete series of careful and precise examination indonesia will also likely require high coverage of vaccination to achieve herd immunity at present if there is no significant improvement in the coverage of preventive measure in the population and disease surveillance system our hospital will be overwhelmed and case fatality will be devastating

processed_title: health literacy on covid19 and covid19 vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction health literacy on the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 affect people capability to ascertain their health and health care quality during the pandemic the objective of this study wa to determine the level of health literacy about covid19 vaccine and vaccination vaccine and vaccination literacyvl in the indonesian adult general population assessing the perception of the respondent about current adult immunization and belief about vaccination in general and analyzing correlation of these variable with the vl level method a crosssectional study using a rapid survey wa administered via the internet data were analyzed using descriptive and inferential statistic the internal consistency of the vl scale wa evaluated using cronbachs alpha coefficient the intercorrelation between the functional and interactivecritical vl question the underlying component factor and each question load on the component were identified using a principal component analysis pca an alpha level lesser than 005 wa considered significant result response to functional and interactive critical vl question were acceptable and showed internal consistency cronbachs alpha 0817 and 0699 respectively lowest value observed were 0806 for functional scale and 0640 for the interactivecritical scale the pca demonstrated that there were two component accounting for 5245 of the total variability approximately 60 of respondent were female n686 almost all respondent used the internet to seek information regarding covid19 and covid19 vaccination many used at least one social medium actively with 744 of respondent sometimes believing the validity of this information conclusion high score were observed in both functional and interactive criticalvl and were quite in a balance between sex in the prior vl and higher in female for the latter these were also closely related to the educational level and age group it is crucial to increase public health literacy in managing the pandemic

processed_title: transmission and profile of covid19 in child in north sumatera indonesia
processed_abstract: background in december 2019 a cluster of viral pneumonia case later identified a coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 wa first reported in wuhan china and then continued to spread to other part of the world covid19 is thought to be more prevalent in adult than child therefore information about covid19 burden and characteristic in child is lacking method we gathered data on the profile and transmission in child with covid19 from data collected by the north sumatera provincial health office team data were presented a meansd and percentage statistical analysis wa performed using stata version 150 result from april to october 2020 there were 1125 confirmed covid19 case in child in north sumatera representing approximately 89 of all case death occurred in 062 of the patient and the child who died had underlying disease four major cluster of covid19 infection in child were found in three islamic boarding school and one refugee shelter conclusion a high number of child in north sumatera were affected by covid19 and mortality wa found to be higher in child with underlying disease major cluster were found in place with prolonged and repeated activity in close contact such a boarding school and a refugee shelter

processed_title: correlation between weather and covid19 pandemic in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: this study aim to analyze the correlation between weather and covid19 pandemic in jakarta indonesia this study employed a secondary data analysis of surveillance data of covid19 from the ministry of health of the republic of indonesia and weather from the meteorological department of the republic of indonesia the component of weather include minimum temperature degree c maximum temperature degree c temperature average degree c humidity and amount of rainfall mm spearmanrank correlation test wa used for data analysis among the component of the weather only temperature average degree c wa significantly correlated with covid19 pandemic r 0392 p 01 the finding serf a an input to reduce the incidence rate of covid19 in indonesia

processed_title: covid19 infection prevention and control for hospital worker in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the outbreak of sarscov2 in 2019 led to a global pandemic posing unprecedented challenge to healthcare system particularly in hospital purpose this study explores the intricacy of strategy employed for preventing and controlling covid19 in indonesian hospital with a particular focus on the protocol challenge and solution faced by healthcare professional method using a crosssectional analysis we examined 27 hospital and uncovered disparity in their preparedness level during our investigation we observed the robust implementation of infection prevention measure which encompassed stringent protocol adequate ventilation and proper use of personal protective equipment however shortcoming were identified in area such a surveillance mental health support and patient management discussion this study underscore the importance of addressing these gap suggesting tailored intervention and continuous training for healthcare staff effective leadership positive team dynamic and adherence to comprehensive policy emerge a pivotal factor hospital should strengthen weak area ensure the ethical execution of emergency protocol and integrate technology for tracking and improving standard operating procedure by enhancing the knowledge and skill of healthcare worker and maintaining strong management practice hospital can optimize their effort in covid19 prevention and control thereby safeguarding the wellbeing of professional patient and community

processed_title: institutionalising wastewater surveillance system to minimise the impact of covid19 case of indonesia japan and viet nam
processed_abstract: this mini review describes the current status and challenge regarding institutionalisation of wastewater surveillance system against covid19 monitoring sarscov2 in wastewater ha been proposed to be a potential tool to understand the actual prevalence of covid19 in the community and it could be an effective approach to monitor the trend during the covid19 pandemic however challenge to institutionalise wastewater surveillance system are still abundant and unfolding at a rapid rate given that the international understanding regarding the scientific knowledge and sociopolitical impact of covid19 are in the developing stage to better understand the existing challenge and bottleneck a comparative study between japan viet nam and indonesia wa carried out in the present study through gaining a better understanding of common issue a well a issue specific to each country we hope to contribute to building a robust multistakeholder system to monitor sarscov2 in wastewater a an effective disease surveillance system for covid19

processed_title: maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality among pregnant woman with and without covid19 infection the intercovid multinational cohort study
processed_abstract: importance detailed information about the association of covid19 with outcome in pregnant individual compared with notinfected pregnant individual is much needed objective to evaluate the risk associated with covid19 in pregnancy on maternal and neonatal outcome compared with notinfected concomitant pregnant individual design setting and participant in this cohort study that took place from march to october 2020 involving 43 institution in 18 country 2 unmatched consecutive notinfected woman were concomitantly enrolled immediately after each infected woman wa identified at any stage of pregnancy or delivery and at the same level of care to minimize bias woman and neonate were followed up until hospital discharge exposure covid19 in pregnancy determined by laboratory confirmation of covid19 andor radiological pulmonary finding or 2 or more predefined covid19 symptom main outcome and measure the primary outcome measure were index of maternal and severe neonatalperinatal morbidity and mortality the individual component of these index were secondary outcome model for these outcome were adjusted for country month entering study maternal age and history of morbidity result a total of 706 pregnant woman with covid19 diagnosis and 1424 pregnant woman without covid19 diagnosis were enrolled all with broadly similar demographic characteristic mean sd age 302 61 year overweight early in pregnancy occurred in 323 woman 486 with covid19 diagnosis and 554 woman 402 without woman with covid19 diagnosis were at higher risk for preeclampsiaeclampsia relative risk rr 176 95 ci 127243 severe infection rr 338 95 ci 163701 intensive care unit admission rr 504 95 ci 313810 maternal mortality rr 223 95 ci 288172 preterm birth rr 159 95 ci 130194 medically indicated preterm birth rr 197 95 ci 156251 severe neonatal morbidity index rr 266 95 ci 169418 and severe perinatal morbidity and mortality index rr 214 95 ci 166275 fever and shortness of breath for any duration wa associated with increased risk of severe maternal complication rr 256 95 ci 192340 and neonatal complication rr 497 95 ci 2111169 asymptomatic woman with covid19 diagnosis remained at higher risk only for maternal morbidity rr 124 95 ci 100154 and preeclampsia rr 163 95 ci 101263 among woman who tested positive 981 by realtime polymerase chain reaction 54 13 of their neonate tested positive cesarean delivery rr 215 95 ci 118391 but not breastfeeding rr 110 95 ci 066185 wa associated with increased risk for neonatal test positivity conclusion and relevance in this multinational cohort study covid19 in pregnancy wa associated with consistent and substantial increase in severe maternal morbidity and mortality and neonatal complication when pregnant woman with and without covid19 diagnosis were compared the finding should alert pregnant individual and clinician to implement strictly all the recommended covid19 preventive measure

processed_title: dilemma of prioritising health and the economy during covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: since the detection of the first confirmed case of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 in early march 2020 248852 case have been detected in indonesia by 21 september 2020 at least 100 doctor have died from covid19 nationwide full largescale social restriction wa a temporary measure followed by an early transition to the new normal era during the neverending first wave in the country worker in industrial retail transport and tourism field suffered a significant decrease in work many country are however in dilemma of protecting the health of the citizen and prioritising economy health should be prioritised because it is an important aspect of our life for our economy poor health is estimated to reduce global gross domestic product gdp by 15 annually through premature death and potential loss of productivity of the workingage citizen pandemic also depress economy through decrease in both supply and demand data from flu pandemic a century ago suggested the importance of aggressiveness and speed of intervention taiwan early action led to beneficial effect on sarscov2 infection rate and economy recovery the target of enhancement of containment measure provision of personal protective equipment and testing and isolation facility should be achieved earlier and be more than the projected demand

processed_title: question about tosepu et al 2020 correlation between weather and covid19 pandemic in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: a critical review of tosepu et al 2020a correlation between weather and covid19 pandemic in jakarta indonesia identifies five question about the data analysis and interpretation of their result these question are the number of day and date of data that go into the analysis interpretation of the rapid increase in covid19 0 degree c value of temperature suspected to be missing data no time lag between the weather on the day of infection and the date the case wa recorded in the database and the significance of their result the scientific community would benefit from reading answer to the five question from tosepu et al

processed_title: vaccine hesitancy and equity lesson learned from the past and how they affect the covid19 countermeasure in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction indonesia ha made progress in increasing vaccine coverage but equitable access remains challenging especially in remote area despite including vaccine in the national immunization program nip coverage ha not met who and unicef target with childhood immunization decreasing during the covid19 pandemic covid19 vaccination ha also experienced hesitancy slowing effort to end the pandemic scope this article address the issue of vaccine hesitancy and it impact on vaccination initiative amidst the covid19 pandemic this article utilizes the vaccine hesitancy framework to analyze previous outbreak of vaccinepreventable disease and their underlying cause ultimately providing recommendation for addressing the current situation the analysis considers the difference between the prepandemic circumstance and the present and considers the implementation of basic and advanced strategy key finding and conclusion vaccine hesitancy is a significant challenge in the covid19 pandemic and public health campaign and community engagement effort are needed to promote vaccine acceptance and uptake effort to address vaccine hesitancy promote trust in healthcare system and increase the likelihood of individual seeking preventive health service vaccine hesitancy requires a comprehensive culturally sensitive approach that considers local context and reality strategy should be tailored to specific cultural and societal context and monitored and evaluated

processed_title: diabetes and covid19 the past the present and the future
processed_abstract: diabetes one of the most prevalent chronic disease in the world is strongly associated with a poor prognosis in covid19 scrupulous blood sugar management is crucial since the worse outcome are closely associated with higher blood sugar level in covid19 infection although recent observational study showed that insulin wa associated with mortality it should not deter insulin use in hospitalized patient requiring tight glucose control back and forth dilemma in the past with regard to continuediscontinue certain medication used in diabetes have been mostly resolved the initial fear of consequence related to continuing certain medication have been largely dispelled covid19 also necessitates the transformation in diabetes care through the integration of technology recent advance in healthrelated technology notably telemedicine and remote continuous glucose monitoring have become essential in the management of diabetes during the pandemic today these technology have changed the landscape of medicine and become more important than ever being a highrisk population patient with type 1 or type 2 diabetes should be prioritized for vaccination in the future a the pandemic fade the prevalence of noncommunicable disease is expected to rise due to lifestyle change and medical issuesdilemma encountered during the pandemic

processed_title: political partisanship trust and attitude toward covid19 vaccine in indonesia
processed_abstract: context this study examines the extent to which political partisanshipmeasured a support for either the incumbent candidate for indonesia presidency joko widodo popularly known a jokowi or for jokowis challenger prabowoaffects individual risk perception of covid19 and covid19 vaccine hesitancy and refusal a well a belief about the safety and efficacy of the covid19 vaccine method the author performed multinomial logistic and ordinary least square regression analysis on a nationally representative sample of a national survey on public trust in covid19 vaccine and vaccination that wa conducted in december 2020 finding individual who voted for prabowo in the 2019 presidential election were more likely to have a lower level of willingness and a higher level of hesitancy to get the covid19 vaccine than those who cast their ballot for jokowi a the indonesian president conclusion political partisanship doe matter in shaping individual hesitancy or refusal to receive the covid19 vaccine in indonesia the effect of partisanship is also significant in shaping individual trust in the efficacy and safety of the covid19 vaccine but it is not significantly associated with individual risk perception

processed_title: knowledge attitude and practice related to covid19 in indonesia a post delta variant wave crosssectional study
processed_abstract: introduction public information and regulation related to the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 have been widely published and continuously changed the indonesian government ha responded to the emerging evidence by regularly updating it unprecedented and preventive measure against the transmission of covid19 to the public it is important to understand how the public responded to these update this study aimed to investigate the knowledge attitude and practice of indonesian toward covid19 after the emergence of the delta variant wave method a crosssectional study wa conducted among the adult population of nonhealthcare worker in indonesia through an online questionnaire using the surveymonkey platform a total of 1859 respondent completed this survey from september to october 2021 the knowledge attitude and practice data were analyzed descriptively to find their frequency and percentage a multivariate analysis wa conducted to confirm the factor affecting the respondent knowledge attitude and practice with a pvalue of 005 set a significant result being female having a higher education level and having a higher frequency of access to covid19 news showed significant impact on knowledge attitude and practice p0001 older age stratification influenced the knowledge level p005 but had no significant effect on people attitude and practice toward covid19 respondent perceived probability of being exposed to covid19 p 005 and their covid19 infection frequency p 0001 significantly influenced their knowledge household income and respondent knowledge significantly affected their attitude toward covid19 furthermore only their attitude had a significant impact on the respondent practice perceived severity perceived susceptibility and vaccination status did not significantly influence their knowledge attitude and practice p 005 conclusion after more than a year of the covid19 pandemic indonesian maintain their high level of knowledge attitude and practice covid19 disinformation must be combatted by strengthening authorized medium empowering community and improving governance among institution during and postpandemic

processed_title: extrapulmonary manifestation covid19
processed_abstract: after being declared a a pandemic on march 11 2020 by the world health organization covid19 ha affected 497 million people worldwide a of 9 april 2022 covid19 is a disease with a plethora of clinical manifestation which extends to those beyond pulmonary sign and symptom study that report on the clinical presentation of covid19 rarely report specifically on case with only extrapulmonary manifestation of covid19 extrapulmonary clinical presentation of covid19 without pulmonary sign and symptom is rare and in such case covid19 is rarely suspectedwe herewith describe four patient with extrapulmonary manifestation of covid19 with positive sarscov2 pcr when the test wa performed for initial patient screening the first patient is a 44yearold female who developed painful ulcer with burning sensation at the lateral side of the tongue along with low grade fever this symptom appeared after the initial complaint of coughing and nasal congestion subsided the second patient is a 37yearold male who complained of red eye with itchiness and increased tear production for 3 day before seeing an ophthalmologist the third patient is a 44yearold female who developed burning sensation and soreness on her throat upon swallowing with fever and chill these symptom appear consecutively without any respiratory complaint the fourth patient is a previously healthy 30yearold female with a normal weight and bmi and without any comorbidity cardiovascular risk and neither personal nor family history of cardiovascular disease in these 4 patient covid19 stomatitis conjunctivitis pharyngitis and covid19associated atrial fibrillation wa subsequently diagnosed respectivelyin the pandemic stage of covid19 covid19 screening ha often been routinely performed due to the high risk of transmission however the decrease in the number of covid19 case may prompt physician to perform sarscov2 testing based on clinical suspicion it is imperative to consider the likelihood of covid19 and perform sarscov2 pcr in patient with extrapulmonary complaint that have persisting complaint despite treatment

processed_title: seafood consumption change and covid19 impact index in west nusa tenggara indonesia
processed_abstract: this empirical study examines seafood consumption pattern in the province of west nusa tenggara indonesia at the regency level and analyzes change in consumption pattern during the covid19 sarscov2 virus outbreak we used a stratified semirandom general population survey administered online through mobile device from november 24thdecember 31st 2020 for rapid assessment and dissemination which received 1518 respondent our finding enabled u to generate a covid19 impact index at the regency level indicating an urbantorural gradient in the degree of change in seafood consumption pattern with rural area incurring more change during covid19 61 of respondent ate less seafood than normal 66 stated seafood wa more expensive and 37 stated that the seafood they normally buy wa not available respondent also bought 5 less fresh or raw seafood and 43 more precooked seafood product during the pandemic traditional market mobile vendor and food stand remain the most frequent access point for seafood although access decreased during the pandemic for all with mini and supermarket access slightly increasing raw and fresh seafood purchase from travelling merchant decreased 125 during the pandemic a larger percentage of woman 10 more than men eat fish at least once per week and woman eat a larger diversity of seafood product however men classified themselves on average in a higher income class than woman both before and during the pandemic and men were significantly more likely to agree that they had enough money to buy the food they wanted during the pandemic overall respondent who indicated eating a higher frequency of fish per week were significantly more likely to agree that they ate less fish during the pandemic respondent on sumbawa island were significantly more likely to agree that the fishery product were not available during the pandemic

processed_title: covid19 prevalence among healthcare worker in jakarta and neighbouring area in indonesia during early 2020 pandemic
processed_abstract: background the covid19 disease ha overwhelmed and disrupted healthcare service worldwide particularly healthcare worker hcw hcw are essential worker performing any job in a healthcare setting who are potentially directly or indirectly exposed to infectious material our retrospective cohort study aimed to determine the prevalence of covid19 infection among hcw in jakarta and neighbouring area during the first three month of the pandemic method nasopharyngealoropharyngeal swab specimen from hcw working at private and public hospital in jakarta and neighbouring area were screened for sarscov2 between march and may 2020 data on demography clinical symptom contact history and personal protective equipment ppe use were collected using standardised form result among 1201 specimen 79 were confirmed positive for sarscov2 with the majority coming from medical doctor 484 and nurse 442 642 of the positive case reported to have contact with suspectconfirmed covid19 case including 32 522 with patient and 3 66 with coworker the symptomatic hcw had a significantly lower median ct value a compared to their asymptomatic counterpart p 001 tendency to have a higher prevalence of pneumonia wa observed in the age group of 40 49 and 50 year old conclusion our finding highlighted the necessity to implement proper preventive and surveillance strategy for this highrisk population including adherence to strict ppe protocol and appropriate trainingkey messagehealthcare worker hcw defined a those handling any job in a healthcare setting are at the frontline of risk of infection a sarscov2 is easily transmitted through airborne droplet and direct contact with contaminated surface the aim of our study is to attain a more comprehensive and accurate picture of the impact of covid19 on hcw during the earlier phase of the outbreak in indonesia to develop effective strategy that protect the health and safety of this workforce our finding highlighted that covid19 infection in hcw were mostly acquired in healthcare setting with significant consequence of pneumonia and hospitalisation occurring across all age group

processed_title: the covid19 pandemic and healthcare worker psychological wellbeing a crosssectional survey in indonesia
processed_abstract: aim this study wa conducted to investigate the relationship amongst psychological wellbeing pwb emotional intelligence and coping strategy design this study employed a crosssectional survey design method a total of 146 healthcare worker hcws were enrolled in this study they were asked to finish several questionnaire including the wong and law emotional intelligence scale the briefcoping orientation to problem experienced scale and the pwb scale the obtained data were analysed using partial least square structural equation modelling employee smartpls to estimate the contribution of influencing factor and evaluate the moderating effect of coping strategy c on the relationship between emotional intelligence and pwb result result revealed that emotional intelligence influenced pwb and c moderated both emotional intelligence and pwb furthermore c play an essential role in improving pwb related to emotional intelligence amongst hcws during the covid19 outbreak

processed_title: spatial and temporal analysis of covid19 case in west java indonesia and it influencing factor
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 spread quickly and reached epidemic level worldwide west java is indonesia most populous province and ha a high susceptibility to the transmission of the disease resulting in a significant number of covid19 case therefore this research aimed to determine the influencing factor a well a the spatial and temporal distribution of covid19 in west java data on covid19 case in west java obtained from pikobar were used spatial distribution wa described using a choropleth while the influencing factor were evaluated with regression analysis to determine whether covid19s policy and event affected it temporal distribution the case detected were graphed daily or biweekly with information on those two variable furthermore the cumulative incidence wa described in the linear regression analysis model a being significantly influenced by vaccination and greatly elevated by population density the biweekly chart had a random pattern with sharp decrease or spike in cumulative incidence change spatial and temporal analysis help greatly in understanding distribution pattern and their influencing factor specifically at the beginning of the pandemic plan and strategy for control and assessment program may be supported by this study material

processed_title: epidemiology of covid19 in indonesia common source and propagated source a a cause for outbreak
