processed_abstract: introduction the covid19 outbreak first occurred in china and ha developed throughout the world including indonesia the indonesian government report that up to may 22 2020 there have been 21430 confirmed case the purpose of this study is to describe the epidemiology clinical symptom and comorbidities of covid19 a well a the various government intervention to reduce the rate of incidence methodology a retrospective cohort study wa designed the population in this study is based data from the official indonesian government website run by the task force for the acceleration of handling covid19 the sample wa observed b march 2 to april 24 2020 the total sample included 8211 case of patient diagnosed with covid19 among these 1002 recovered and 689 died data analysis used percentage from various recorded epidemiological variable result the result showed that covid19 epidemiological feature were mostly observed in men 565 and patient of productive age 3159 of age by 575 most death were recorded in patient aged 60 year 436 the most recurrent clinical symptom wa cough 778 the most recurrent comorbidity wa hypertension 524 and the province with the highest covid19 incidence wa dki jakarta 343 conclusion the combination of common source and propagated source wa observed during the covid19 outbreak in indonesia special attention should be given to protecting vulnerable population such a child health care provider and the elderly the community is expected to participate in preventing the transmission of covid19 by complying with health protocol

processed_title: quality of national disease surveillance reporting before and during covid19 a mixedmethod study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background global covid19 outbreak in early 2020 have burdened health worker among them surveillance worker who have the responsibility to undertake routine disease surveillance activity the aim of this study wa to describe the quality of the implementation of indonesia early warning and response alert system ewars for disease surveillance and to measure the burden of disease surveillance reporting quality before and during the covid19 epidemic in indonesia method a mixedmethod approach wa used a total of 38 informant from regional health office participated in focus group discussion fgd and indepth interview idi for informant from ministry of health the fgd and idi were conducted using online video communication yearly completeness and timeliness of reporting of 34 province were collected from the application qualitative data were analyzed thematically and quantitative data were analyzed descriptively result major implementation gap were found in poorly distributed human resource and regional infrastructure inequity national reporting from 20172019 showed an increasing trend of completeness 55 64 and 75 respectively and timeliness 55 64 and 75 respectively however the quality of the reporting dropped to 53 and 34 in 2020 concomitant with the sarscov2 epidemic conclusion report completeness and timeliness are likely related to regional infrastructure inequity and the covid19 epidemic it is recommended to increase report capacity with an automatic ewars application linked system in hospital and laboratory

processed_title: public perception and hand hygiene behavior during covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: hand hygiene practice are important not only during the corona virus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic but also critical to prevent the possible spread of other infectious disease this study aim to examine the current hand hygiene behavior during the covid19 pandemic post pandemic behavior intention and the relationship between behavior psychosocial and contextual factor a crosssectional online survey wa conducted from 28 may to 12 june 2020 with 896 valid response obtained from indonesian citizen over 18 year old the survey question included demographic characteristic individual practice risk perception attitude norm factor and ability factor related to hand hygiene during the covid19 pandemic descriptive analysis chi square and multiple logistic regression test were used to analyse the data the result showed that 8232 of female respondent and 7337 male respondent reported handwashing practice 8 time or more per day during covid19 pandemic participant who perceived themselves at higher risk of contracting sarscov2 or 708 2262217 had less negative perception toward the practice or 193 132282 perceived handwashing a an effective preventive measure or 177 123254 were female or 171 121241 perceived a more supportive norm or 168 115244 and noticed more barrier in access to handwashing facility or 157 105236 were more likely to engage in hand hygiene practice more frequently during the pandemic in conclusion the majority of respondent did increase their frequency of hand hygiene practice during covid19 pandemic in line with previous study in other pandemic context sex perceived susceptibility and effectiveness are important predictor of hand hygiene practice which are similar to finding from previous study in other pandemic context addressing social norm related to the perceived hand hygiene practice of friend and important people is a potential health promotion strategy by creating hand hygiene norm in the community

processed_title: predisposing enabling and reinforcing factor of covid19 prevention behavior in indonesia a mixedmethods study
processed_abstract: objective to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 behavior such a maskwearing social distancing decreasing mobility and avoiding crowd have been suggested especially in highrisk country such a indonesia unfortunately the level of compliance with those practice ha been low this study wa conducted to determine the predisposing enabling and reinforcing factor of covid19 prevention behavior in indonesia method this crosssectional study used a mixedmethods approach the participant were 264 adult from 21 province in indonesia recruited through convenience sampling data were collected using a google form and indepth interview statistical analysis included univariate bivariate and multivariate logistic regression furthermore qualitative data analysis wa done through content analysis and qualitative data management using atlasti software result overall 4432 of respondent were noncompliant with recommended covid19 prevention behavior in multivariate logistic regression analysis lowtomedium education level poor attitude insufficient involvement of leader and insufficient regulation were also associated with decreased community compliance based on indepth interview with informant the negligence of the indonesian government in the initial stage of the covid19 pandemic may have contributed to the unpreparedness of the community to face the pandemic a people were not aware of the importance of preventive practice conclusion education level is not the only factor influencing community compliance with recommended covid19 prevention behavior changing attitude through health promotion to increase public awareness and encouraging voluntary community participation through active risk communication are necessary regulation and role leader are also required to improve covid19 prevention behavior

processed_title: covid19 vaccination and clinical outcome at a secondary referral hospital during the delta variantdominant period in west sumatra indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the second wave of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 case in indonesia during which the delta variant predominated took place after a vaccination program had been initiated in the country this study wa conducted to assess the impact of covid19 vaccination on unfavorable clinical outcome including hospitalization severe covid19 intensive care unit icu admission and death using a realworld model method this singlecenter retrospective cohort study involved patient with covid19 aged 18 year who presented to the covid19 emergency room at a secondary referral teaching hospital between june 1 2021 and august 31 2021 we used a binary logistic regression model to assess the effect of covid19 vaccination on unfavorable clinical outcome with age sex and comorbidities a confounding variable result a total of 716 patient were included 321 of whom were vaccinated the elderly participant 65 year had the lowest vaccine coverage among age group vaccination had an effectiveness of 50 95 confidence interval ci 25 to 66 for preventing hospitalization 97 95 ci 77 to 99 for preventing severe covid19 95 95 ci 56 to 99 for preventing icu admission and 90 95 ci 22 to 99 for preventing death interestingly patient with type 2 diabetes had a 2fold to 4fold elevated risk of unfavorable outcome conclusion among adult covid19 vaccination ha a moderate preventive impact on hospitalization but a high preventive impact on severe covid19 icu admission and death the author suggest that relevant party increase covid19 vaccination coverage especially in the elderly population

processed_title: household food security during the covid19 pandemic in urban and semiurban area in indonesia
processed_abstract: background one of the impact of the covid19 pandemic wa the weakening of the community economic condition the weak economy of the community will have an impact on household food security this study aim to determine food security in the covid19 pandemic situation and the impact of the pandemic on food security in urban and semiurban area method a crosssectional study with a total sample of 517 people who live in urban jakarta and semiurban depok area the research data wa collected online and purposively through posyandu cadre who have access to familycommunity food security wa measured using hfias household food insecurity access scale method while impact of covid19 pandemic wa categorized into two category impacted reduced income and laid off and less impacted not reduced income and laid off data analysis used the chisquare test and multiple logistic regression result there were 650 of household with various level of food insecurity during the covid19 pandemic the result of the multivariate analysis showed that family income during the covid19 pandemic aor 42 ci 2767 the type of impact of the covid19 pandemic ie reduced income and stopped working aor 26 ci 1641 and the age of the respondent aor 17 ci 1125 were significantly related to household food security during the pandemic after being controlled by husband work status household with lower income had 4 time higher risk to experience food insecurity compared to those with higher income heavily impacted household through reduced income and stopped working had 3 time higher risk to experience food insecurity compared to those who did not additionally we found that household with younger respondent 31 year old had 2 time higher risk to experience food insecurity compared to those older counterpart conclusion the covid19 pandemic impacted household food security in both urban and semiurban area through worsening employment status and income condition

processed_title: oral antiviral treatment for covid19 opportunity and challenge
processed_abstract: the use of antiviral covid19 medication can successfully inhibit sarscov2 replication and prevent disease progression to a more severe form however the timing of antiviral treatment play a crucial role in this regard oral antiviral drug provide an opportunity to manage sarscov2 infection without a need for hospital admission easing the general burden that covid19 can have on the healthcare system this review paper i present the potential pharmaceutical antiviral target including various hostbased target and viralbased target ii characterizes the firstgeneration antisarscov2 oral drug nirmatrelvirritonavir and molnupiravir iii summarizes the clinical progress of other oral antiviral for use in covid19 iv discusses ethical issue in such clinical trial and v present challenge associated with the use of oral antiviral in clinical practice oral covid19 antiviral represent a part of the strategy to adapt to longterm coexistence with sarscov2 in a manner that prevents healthcare from being overwhelmed it is pivotal to ensure equal and fair global access to the currently available oral antiviral and those authorized in the future

processed_title: covid19 pandemictoendemic transition in indonesia what doe the future hold
processed_abstract: since first reported in december 2019 sars2 coronavirus sarscov2 infection ha become a worldclass pandemic overwhelming every aspect of the global system globally 526 billion confirmed case with 63 billion death case were reported by world health organization who by 31 may 2022 in that period indonesia ha reported 6 billion confirmed case with a case fatality rate reaching 258 the number of new weekly case and new weekly death have continued the declining trend observed since it peak in january 2022 ie 3 decrease of new weekly case and 11 decrease of new weekly death a compared to the previous week in response to the current epidemiology improvement country including indonesia have relaxed some regulation on covid19 a the preparation for pandemictoendemic transitionendemic is not equal to harmless commonly endemic is falsely interpreted a the end of covid19 bringing to a false complacency endemic label on an infectious disease such a malaria hiv infection tuberculosis in certain region of the world mean the overall rate of infection are static neither rising nor falling endemic label defines nothing about time duration to reach disease end or how many population will still be susceptible to the disease therefore transition for pandemictoendemic of covid19 could not simply translated into the end of either public and health service awareness or research on covid19 it then should add new emerging perspective on covid19 research a wa mandated by who one example of which is evidencebased strategy for infection prevention control and personal protective equipment for infection control deescalation in relation to covid19 pandemic scaling backin the spirit of nurturing research and publication in this transition for pandemictoendemic era the indonesian journal of internal medicine published various covid19 associatedoriginal article systematic review and case series across various covid19 condition atici et al and tunjungputri et al report article on factor and treatment that is associated with higher covid19 survival corticosteroid interleukin6 inhibitor and anticoagulant administered to the proper subset of covid19 population are several beneficial treatment among limited evidencebased proven treatment available today these supportive treatment whenever indicated at the proper time should be considered in managing every covid19 patient in addition high antibiotic use in covid19 patient despite low secondary bacterial infection ha been widely reported chen et al report a similar situation in indonesia and should raise the awareness of antimicrobial resistance thread now and in the future together with proper diagnostic stewardship the simple predictor of secondary bacterial infection that have been concluded could potentially be used to reduce liberal antibiotic use while optimizing the use in indicated patient prabowo et al enriched our understanding on usage of telemedicine to monitor post covid19 condition in indonesian populationshigh quality research ha and will again save the livelihood of people across the world while future pandemic could not be completely prevented the research infrastructure that have built during last 2 year could be used a a strong modality to be better prepared and coordinated in future outbreak pandemic response by detecting and preventing the emerging disease at their very early stage waste in covid19 research and multiple covid19 associated research article retraction should caution researcher a evidenceproducer and clinician a evidenceuser in prioritizing the scientific inquiry and questioning individual conflict of interest insightful article addressing the multitude aspect of the covid19 pandemictoendemic transition related topic are still needed in the future

processed_title: determinant factor of mortality in preelderly and elderly patient with covid19 in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to identify risk factor associated with coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 mortality in preelderly and elderly individual in jakarta indonesia method we employed a casecontrol study design utilizing secondary data from the epidemiology surveillance immunization prevention and disease control section of the dki jakarta provincial health office collected from december 2020 to january 2021 the study included 188 case and an equal number of control case were covid19 patient confirmed to have died a reported by hospital and community and subsequently verified by healthcare worker control subject were patient who completed a 14day isolation period and had been officially declared recovered by healthcare professional the dependent variable wa the mortality of covid19 patient in the january 2021 period the independent variable consisted of demographic data age and sex clinical symptom cough runny nose anosmia diarrhea headache abdominal pain muscle pain and nauseavomiting and comorbidities hypertension heart disease and diabetes multivariate analysis wa conducted using multiple logistic regression result the multiple logistic regression analysis revealed several factor associated with covid19 fatality in jakarta age of 60 year or older odds ratio or 484 95 ci 300 to 780 male or 238 95 ci 241 to 368 dyspnea or 393 95 ci 204 to 755 anosmia or 013 95 ci 004 to 046 and heart disease or 438 95 ci 104 to 1846 conclusion the control and prevention of covid19 among elderly individual require particular vigilance when a covid19 case is detected within this demographic prompt treatment and medication administration are crucial to mitigate the presenting symptom

processed_title: lesson learned from covid19 vaccination in indonesia experience challenge and opportunity
processed_abstract: the development of safe and effective covid19 vaccine a well a their delivery to people arm are the best hope for ending the covid19 pandemic however the implementation of vaccination varies greatly across country with the developing country lagging behind this study investigates indonesia vaccination experience challenge and acceleration over the course of implementation period this study provides simulation to estimate the vaccination rate using timeseries forecasting machine learning we use administrative data and survey result in our analysis our finding suggest limited vaccine availability had caused lowcoverage vaccination implementation in the early stage of vaccination implementation period however following the increased availability of vaccine the vaccination rate accelerates up to 600 time the government of indonesia utilized strategic public place public and private office and engaging private sector in the phase two implementation to accelerate the vaccination implementation indonesia might reach 631 million individual vaccinated at the end of march 2022 or 35 of the targeted population with up to april 2021 vaccination rate to accelerate government introduced a number of new strategy including doortodoor persuasion through neighborhood association rt educating individual and providing transportation from their home to the vaccination facility we expect new strategy could further improve vaccination speed by around 14 million to 35 million individual per day

processed_title: covid19 impact on sdgs and the fiscal measure case of indonesia
processed_abstract: the implication of the ongoing covid19 pandemic have stretched far beyond human health and wellbeing causing serious setback for the achievement of the sustainable development goal sdgs although government worldwide have implemented different fiscal stimulus measure to mitigate the implication of covid19 it is important to develop a precise understanding of their focus area to ensure if the progress of sdgs is on track for a specific case of indonesia this study establishes a thorough understanding of the covid19 implication on sdgs and it fiscal stimulus package through a literature review and semiformal interview with the core stakeholder in indonesia the study result highlighted that covid19 ha varyingly affected the progress of all sdgs in indonesia amongst the four pillar of sustainable development in indonesia the sdgs on the social and economic development pillar are stated to be the most impacted a for the fiscal stimulus it is perceived that it can help maintain the sdgs attainment progress to a certain extent although there are several concern on it implementation deriving lesson from the conducted research the study put forward key suggestion for the effective implementation of sdgs in the postcovid19 era

processed_title: monoclonal antibody for covid19 treatment is it an option in indonesia
processed_abstract: more than three year after coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 an infectious disease caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 wa declared pandemic by world health organization report of covid19 hospitalization and death have been decreasing even though covid19 a global health emergency ha been declared end research in finding and evaluating modality that can decrease severity and mortality from covid19 infection are still on goinguntil now there have been more than 380000 publication in pubmed with search term covid 19 excessive inflammatory activation is an important part of covid19 pathogenesis which can be caused by interaction of the virus with the host and modulation of host immune response2 better understanding on covid19 pathogenesis could improve the strategy to manage covid19 infection monoclonal antibody is one treatment modality that can be used to target the virus itself or modulate dysregulated immune response in covid19 monoclonal antibody mabs can halt progression of covid19 in highrisk patient however considering the limited production and high cost is this treatment modality an option in indonesiamany thing have been learned from this pandemic and can be a lesson for preparing the next pandemic or other emerging disease various therapeutic development to treat covid19 have been studied for hospitalized patient and outpatient setting one of which is the use of variety monoclonal antibody that showed overall moderate efficacy in decreasing severity and mortality from covid19 infection and also good safety unfortunately besides variable efficacy across variant the cost for monoclonal antibody mabs are still high which make the access for this treatment option for managing covid19 might be limited in low to middle income country feasibility and economical sustainability of mabs against sarscov2 seem to be optimal in localized epidemic or small outbreak

processed_title: clinical characteristic and outcome of hospitalized covid19 patient with diabetes mellitus in east java indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: introduction diabetes mellitus ha been perceived a the worsening factor for coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 where diabetes mellitus patient with preexisting inflammatory condition could develop acute respiratory disease syndrome a well a multiorgan dysfunction managing diabetes mellitus amidst severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 infection is also a matter of concern a several antidiabetic therapy could affect the progression of covid19 this study aimed to provide the clinical characteristic and outcome of patient with both covid19 and diabetes mellitus receiving blood glucose lowering therapy and covid19 symptomatic treatment method this retrospective study wa performed on 260 medical record of patient hospitalized between may 2020 to february 2021 in east java indonesia patient were confirmed covid19 positive based on the result from real time polymerase chain reaction rtpcr using nasal swab sample collected on hospital admission data included were demographic characteristic covid19 symptom severity of covid19 comorbidities other than diabetes mellitus fasting blood glucose fbg and 2hours postprandial blood glucose 2hpbg and outcome result most of the patient had age range of 4160 year old 761 with more than a half of the subject 60 were obese patient with uncontrolled diabetes were distributed evenly among the covid19 severity 743 in asymptomatic group 736 in mild group and 741 in moderate group there were reduction in fbg and 2hpbg level measured before 210758138 and 271191007 mgdl respectively and after the treatment 18103689 and 222018696 mgdl respectively all patient received multivitamin and symptomatic treatment for covid19 oral antidiabetic drug 576 and insulin 288 were administered to lower the blood glucose level of the patient a many a 969 patient survived while 31 died conclusion covid19 could affect the blood glucose level suggesting the importance of antihyperglycemic therapy among patient with both covid19 and diabetes mellitus

processed_title: covid19 vaccination willingness in four asian country a comparative study including thailand indonesia the philippine and vietnam
processed_abstract: globally 67 of the population ha received at least one covid19 vaccine dose but coverage varies across country this study aimed to compare people willingness to receive covid19 vaccination across thailand indonesia philippine and vietnam where vaccination intention tends to be high to determine factor associated with willingness and to obtain suggestion for developing strategy we conducted a secondary data analysis of the japan international cooperation agency survey building resilience covid19 impact and response in urban areascase of southeast asia including1842 unvaccinated participant from thailand n 461 indonesia n 246 the philippine n 609 and vietnam n 526 vaccination willingness wa high in all country 696 but the social and psychological factor motivating people to undergo vaccination differed among these country the highest vaccination willingness wa in the philippine followed by vietnam and indonesia whereas the lowest vaccination willingness wa in thailand vaccination willingness wa affected by not only sociodemographic attribute but also risk perception and belief which in turn were shaped by social factor such a infection trend and vaccine policy to achieve effective vaccination promotion program a system allowing the flexible modification of promotion method in response to social condition must be established

processed_title: sarscov2 persistence and infectivity in covid19 corps a systematic review
processed_abstract: the persistence and infectivity of sarscov2 in different postmortem covid19 specimen remain unclear despite numerous published study this information is essential to improve corps management related to clinical biosafety and viral transmission in medical staff and the public community we aim to understand sarscov2 persistence and infectivity in covid19 corps we conducted a systematic review according to preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma protocol a systematic literature search wa performed in pubmed science direct scopus and google scholar database using specific keywords we critically reviewed the collected study and selected the article that met the criterion we included 33 scientific paper that involved 491 covid19 corps the persistence rate and maximum postmortem interval pmi range of the sarscov2 finding were reported in the lung 138155 890 4 month followed by the vitreous humor 737 189 3 month nasopharynxoropharynx 156248 629 41 day abdominal organ 67110 609 17 day skin 1424 583 17 day brain 1431 452 17 day bone marrow 22 100 12 day heart 3169 449 6 day muscle tissue 983 108 6 day trachea 920 450 5 day and perioral tissue 2124 875 35 day sarscov2 infectivity rate in viral culture study were detected in the lung 915 60 trachea 24 50 oropharynx 14 25 and perioral 14 25 at a maximum pmi range of 17 day the sarscov2 persists in the human body month after death and should be infectious for week this data should be helpful for postmortem covid19 management and viral transmission preventive strategy

processed_title: comparing of covid19 response framework in the uk usa and indonesia what can we learn from the psychosocial factor
processed_abstract: it is possible to identify sociodemographic and psychological factor for preventing strategy covid19 research on the impact of covid19 predominantly focus on clinical and demographic factor but ignores psychosocial factor psychosocial factor wa shaped by the pandemic response include public perception and attitude to the crisis support effective government communication and the socioeconomic impact experienced understanding psychosocial factor is critical for effective planning for mental health service communication and coping with the psychological impact of the pandemic therefore this study recommends considering psychosocial factor to design effective prevention strategy from the uk usa and indonesian response framework and facilitate efficient management of the pandemic

processed_title: study on awareness of covid19 and compliance with social distancing during covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: public compliance with social distancing policy is necessary to slow down the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 one of the factor that contribute to compliance with social distancing policy is awareness of covid19 this study aimed to examine the relationship between awareness of covid19 and compliance with social distancing policy the study used an online survey through google form to 404 respondent aged 1863 year the data were collected by using awareness on the covid19 scale and compliance with the social distancing scale the data were analyzed using the spearman correlation and kruskalwallis followed by mannwhitney u with bonferroni correction the awareness of covid19 wa significantly and positively associated with compliance with social distancing order based on demographic variable found that the awareness wa significantly higher in postgraduate the awareness of covid19 wa also significantly higher in working participant the compliance with social distancing order wa found higher in woman the study primary result is that the awareness of covid19 positively correlate with public compliance on social distancing order in particular there is a need to provide mean and intervention to raise public awareness of this challenging situation

processed_title: strengthening government response to covid19 in indonesia a modified delphi study of medical and health academic
processed_abstract: the indonesian government ha issued various policy to control covid19 however covid19 new case continued to increase and there remain uncertainty a to the future trajectory we aimed to investigate how medical and health academic view the indonesian government handling of covid19 and which area of health system need to be prioritized to improve the government response to covid19 we conducted a modified delphi study adapting the covid19 assessment scorecard covidscore a the measurement criterion we invited medical and health academic from ten university across indonesia to take part in the tworound delphi study in the first round participant were presented with 20 statement of covidscore and asked to rate their agreement with each statement using a fivepoint likert scale all participant who completed the first cycle were invited to participate in the second cycle they had the opportunity to revise their answer based on the previous cycle result and ranked a list of action to improve government response we achieved a moderate consensus level for five statement a low consensus level for 13 statement and no consensus for two statement the prioritization suggested that top priority for improving the government response to covid19 in indonesia encompass 1 strengthening capacity to ensure consistent credible and targeted communication while adopting a more inclusive and empathic communication style to address public concern 2 ensuring universal access to reliable covid19 testing by expanding lab infrastructure facilitating operational readiness and scaling up implementation of proven alternativecomplementary test to rtpcr and 3 boosting contact tracing implementation capacity and facilitating contact tracing for all positive case involving key stakeholder in further development of the existing contact tracing system ie pedulilindungi a well a it evaluation and quality assurance ultimately our study highlight the importance of strengthening health system function during the pandemic and improving health system resilience for dealing with future public health emergency

processed_title: willingnesstopay for a covid19 vaccine and it associated determinant in indonesia
processed_abstract: how country particularly low and middleincome economy should pay the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 vaccine is an important and understudied issue we undertook an online survey to measure the willingnesstopay wtp for a covid19 vaccine and it determinant in indonesia the wtp wa assessed using a simple dichotomous contingent valuation approach and a linear regression model wa used to assess it associated determinant there were 1359 respondent who completed the survey in total 783 1065 were willing to pay for the covid19 vaccine with a mean and median wtp of u 5720 95ci u 5456 u 5985 and u 3094 95ci u 3094 u 3094 respectively being a healthcare worker having a high income and having high perceived risk were associated with higher wtp these finding suggest that the wtp for a covid19 vaccine is relatively high in indonesia this wtp information can be used to construct a payment model for a covid19 vaccine in the country nevertheless to attain higher vaccine coverage it may be necessary to partially subsidize the vaccine for those who are less wealthy and to design health promotion material to increase the perceived risk for covid19 in the country

processed_title: policy and cultural belief community perception about covid19 vaccine hesitancy in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective vaccine hesitancy is a global concern and a significant threat to covid19 vaccination program this study aimed to explore vaccine hesitancy from the perspective of the indonesian community related to policy and cultural belief design a descriptive qualitative approach wa utilized in this study sample twenty participant were recruited from various setting to ensure the representation of experience in different context in indonesia measurement audiorecorded semistructured individual indepth interview were carried out content analysis wa performed to identify the main key theme result twenty participant were recruited from various region of java island indonesia the participant revealed hesitancy about the covid19 vaccine including the theme of mistrust controversy and the culture and belief of the community conclusion this study highlight covid19 vaccine hesitancy in indonesia which may have implication for the community perception and belief regarding the uptake of the covid19 vaccine the trust issue remains a major challenge to convincing the community to accept the vaccine at the grassroots level targeted education and communication strategy are essential in addressing trust issue surrounding covid19 vaccine among critical stakeholder and religious leader in indonesia public health nursing play a crucial role in fostering community acceptance and ensuring the success of vaccination program

processed_title: the impact of covid19 lockdown on diabetes complication and diabetes management in people with diabetes in indonesia
processed_abstract: aim a the country with the seventh largest number of people with diabetes pwd in the world the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic and the large social scale restriction lssr policy taken by the indonesian government to reduce the number of covid19 transmission is estimated to interfere diabetes management and will increase the incidence of diabetes complication this study aim to determine the difficulty of diabetes management and it impact on diabetes morbidity during the covid19 pandemic in indonesia method this study is a crosssectional study using a national scale web survey this research wa conducted in indonesia enrolling 1124 pwd aged 18 year or older diabetes complication are defined a selfassessed incidence of hypoglycemia or diabetic foot ulcer dfu or hospital admission experienced by pwd in indonesia during the covid19 pandemic the correlation between diabetes management difficulty and diabetesrelated complication wa measured using a modified cox regression test result diabetes management difficulty were experienced by 698 of pwd in indonesia the difficulty include attending diabetes consultation 301 access to diabetes medication 124 checking blood glucose level 95 controlling diet 238 and performing regular exercise 365 diabetesrelated complication occurred in 246 of subject those who had diabetes management difficulty during the covid19 pandemic are prone to have diabetes complication by 14 time greater pr 141 95 ci 109183 than those who did not conclusion the covid19 pandemic and lssr have impact on diabetes management and diabetesrelated complication a assessed by pwd in indonesia

processed_title: from archipelago to pandemic battleground unveiling indonesia covid19 crisis
processed_abstract: the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic ha posed unprecedented challenge to country worldwide including indonesia with it unique archipelagic geography consisting of more than 17000 thousand island indonesia face unique complexity in managing the spread of the virus based on existing literature this review article elaborates on key issue that have shaped indonesia covid19 response the article begin by examining the early stage of the covid19 pandemic in indonesia along with the implementation of various preventive measure and the impact of the virus on public health this article examines how indonesia socioeconomic factor have generally influenced it healthcare system and further delf into the covid19 response strategy implemented by the indonesian government and public health authority a well a overall crisis preparedness it discusses the action taken to control the spread of the virus including testing strategy and vaccination effort the difficulty encountered in implementing these measure are presented in conclusion this review article provides a comprehensive understanding of the covid19 crisis in indonesia covering fact on multiple dimension ranging from the timeline of the pandemic to vaccination effort epidemiology socioeconomic implication testing strategy mobility pattern public holiday the impact of working from home and the utilization of complementary and alternative medicine in addition to the standard of care for covid19 the insight gained from this article can complement future strategy for pandemic management and response in indonesia and other country facing similar challenge

processed_title: knowledge attitude and practice related to the covid19 pandemic among undergraduate medical student in indonesia a nationwide crosssectional study
processed_abstract: introduction the potential role of medical student in raising awareness during public health emergency ha been acknowledged to further explore their potential a public educator and role model for the community during the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic this study aim to assess the knowledge attitude and practice of these student toward covid19 method an online crosssectional survey wa conducted among undergraduate medical student in indonesia sociodemographics characteristic social interaction history informationseeking behavior a well a knowledge attitude and practice toward covid19 were collected through a selfreported questionnaire a pvalue of 005 indicated statistical significance result out of 4870 respondent 649 had positive attitude and 515 had positive practice toward covid19 while only 298 had adequate knowledge knowledge wa slightly positively correlated with attitude and practice rho 0074 and rho 0054 respectively both p0001 while attitude wa weakly correlated with practice rho 0234 p0001 several factor including age sex place of residence institution type academic level family income history of chronic illness prior volunteering experience and perceptual awareness on covid19 were significantly associated with either knowledge attitude andor practice toward covid19 furthermore health institution and the government press release a well a health expert opinion were deemed a the most reliable source of covid19related informationyet trivially none of these source were associated with knowledge attitude and practice in the study population conclusion many undergraduate medical student in indonesia had positive attitude and practice against covid19 yet only a few had adequate knowledge this warrant further intervention to keep them updated with covid19 evidence to maximize their potential in raising public awareness on covid19

processed_title: the dynamic of circulating sarscov2 lineage in bogor and surrounding area reflect variant shifting during the first and second wave of covid19 in indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia is one of the southeast asian country with high case number of covid19 with up to 42 million confirmed case by 29 october 2021 understanding the genome of sarscov2 is crucial for delivering public health intervention a certain variant may have different attribute that can potentially affect their transmissibility a well a the performance of diagnostics vaccine and therapeutic objective we aimed to investigate the dynamic of circulating sarscov2 variant over a 15month period in bogor and it surrounding area in correlation with the first and second wave of covid19 in indonesia method nasopharyngeal and oropharyngeal swab sample collected from suspected patient from bogor jakarta and tangerang were confirmed for sarscov2 infection with rtpcr rna sample of those confirmed patient were subjected to whole genome sequencing using the artic network protocol and sequencer platform from oxford nanopore technology ont result we successfully identified 16 lineage and six clade out of 202 sample male n 116 female n 86 genome analysis revealed that indonesian lineage b14662 dominated during the first wave n 48 238 while delta variant ay23 ay24 ay39 ay42 ay43 dan ay79 were dominant during the second wave n 53 262 following the highest number of confirmed case in indonesia in the spike protein gene s_d614g and s_p681r change were dominant in both b14662 and delta variant while n439k wa only observed in b14662 n 44 and b1470 n 1 additionally the s_t19r s_e156g s_f157del s_r158del s_l452r s_t478k s_d950n and s_v1264l change were only detected in delta variant consistent with those change being characteristic of delta variant in general conclusion we demonstrated a shift in sarscov2 variant from the first wave of covid19 to delta variant in the second wave during which the number of confirmed case surpassed those in the first wave of covid19 pandemic higher proportion of unique mutation detected in delta variant compared to the first wave variant indicated potential mutational effect on viral transmissibility that correlated with a higher incidence of confirmed case genomic surveillance of circulating variant especially those with higher transmissibility should be continuously conducted to rapidly inform decision making and support outbreak preparedness prevention and public health response

processed_title: evaluation of healthrelated quality of life and mental health in 729 medical student in indonesia during the covid19 pandemic
processed_abstract: background the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic ha impacted the healthrelated quality of life hrqol and mental health worldwide however it impact on medical student in indonesia ha not been well documented this study aimed to evaluate hrqol and mental health in 729 indonesian medical student during the covid19 pandemic material and method we conducted a crosssectional study from 31 august to 30 september 2021 the study instrument wa an online questionnaire that wa distributed via social medium platform the 12item short form version 2 sf12v2 wa used to measure hrqol and the 21item depression anxiety and stress scale dass21 wa used to measure mental health result from 729 indonesian medical student included in the analysis 373 had impaired physical component and 669 had impaired mental component of hrqol the determinant were medical student island of residence history of hospitalization and family member hospitalization and death due to covid19 concerning mental health the prevalence of reported symptom of depression anxiety and stress were 454 652 and 609 respectively sex study method grade previous covid19 disease severity comorbidities previous learning experience and history of family isolation were identified a the determinant of mental health conclusion this study highlight the adverse effect of covid19 on hrqol and mental health in indonesian medical student the result identified key association including sarscov2 infection and comorbidities experienced by the student the health of their family including grief following bereavement and the effect of social isolation during the pandemic

processed_title: value and preference of the general population in indonesia in relation to rapid covid19 antigen selftests a crosssectional survey
processed_abstract: objective home diagnostics are essential to assist member of the general population become active agent of case detection in indonesia a country with an overburdened healthcare system individual could use rapid sarscov2 antigen test to selfdetect covid19 to assess the general population value and attitude towards sarscov2 selftesting a survey wa conducted in mid2021 in jakarta and the province of banten and north sulawesi method this wa a quantitative survey that approached respondent in 600 randomly selected streetpoints in the three study geography in julyaugust 2021 a 35item questionnaire wa used to collect data on key variable such a likelihood to use a sarscov2 selftest willingness to pay for a selftest device and likely action following a positive selftest result bivariate and multivariate regression analysis were performed result of 630 respondent 318 were female 1553 knew about covid19 selftesting while 6270 agreed with the idea of people being able to selftest at home unassisted for covid19 if selftests were available in indonesia 60 of respondent would use them if they felt it necessary and would undertake regular selftesting for example weekly if recommended upon receiving a positive selftest result most respondent would communicate it 8603 request posttest counselling 8079 selfisolate 9746 andor warn their close contact 9048 conclusion the use of rapid sarscov2 antigen detection test for selftesting appears acceptable to a majority of the indonesian public to learn whether they have covid19 selftesting should be prioritised to complement to an overburdened healthcare system by helping the public asymptomatic individual included become agent of change in epidemiological surveillance of sarscov2 in their community

processed_title: postcovid depression and it multiple factor doe favipiravir have a protective effect a longitudinal study of indonesia covid19 patient
processed_abstract: background coronavirus disease covid19 not only ha a longterm effect on it survivor it also affect their quality of life including inducing depression a a possible manifestation of central nervous system disruption favipiravir show promising efficacy a an antiviral drug for the treatment of covid19 however it effect on the sequela of covid19 ha not been explored therefore this study aim to assess the impact of favipiravir and address the factor associated with postcovid depression in indonesia method this cohort study conducted a postcovid19 survey on indonesian patient who were diagnosed by using realtime polymerase chain reaction rtpcr and antigen test until january 2022 an online questionnaire wa distributed to obtain information on demographic comorbidities health behavior symptom and treatment the propensity technique wa used to allocate the participant into the favipiravir and nonrecipient group 11 the patient health questionnaire9 phq9 wa used for outcome measurement the cohort wa followed up biweekly for 60 day after onsetdiagnosis to determine the occurrence of depression cox regression analysis with an adjusted odds ratio and 95 confidence interval wa used to estimate the effect of favipiravir on postcovid19 depression result the data included the information of 712 participant of whom 1854 had depression within 60 day after onsetdiagnosis depression wa higher in the nonrecipient group 2106 than in the favipiravir group 1601 after adjustment by other factor favipiravir prescription wa found to be associated with depression aor 0488 95 ci 03390701 p 0001 in accordance with the phq9 subset favipiravir exerted a significant protective effect against depressive mood and loss of interest however patient living alone were prone to experiencing loss of interest aor 2253 95 ci 13293818 p 0003 conclusion the data obtained in this preliminary survey suggested that favipiravir may be useful for preventing postcovid depression however further study is needed moreover the provision of mental health support particularly to those who live alone must be ensured trial registration registry nct05060562

processed_title: understanding covid19 vaccine hesitancy a crosssectional study in malang district indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction vaccine hesitancy could undermine effort to reduce incidence of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 understanding covid19 vaccine hesitancy is crucial to tailoring strategy to increase vaccination acceptance this study aim to investigate the prevalence of and the reason for covid19 vaccine hesitancy in malang district indonesia method data come from a crosssectional study among individual aged 1785 year old n 3014 multivariate ordered logistic regression wa used to identify factor associated with postponing or refusing covid19 vaccine the oxford covid19 vaccine hesitancy scale wa used to measure vaccine hesitancy a wide range of reason for hesitancy including coronavirus vaccine confidence and complacency vaccination knowledge trust and attitude in health worker and health provider coronavirus conspiracy anger reaction and need for chaos populist view lifestyle and religious influence wa examined result and discussion the result show that 602 of the respondent were hesitant to receive the covid19 vaccine low confidence and complacency belief about the vaccine or 1229 95 ci 11951264 and more general source of mistrust within the community particularly regarding health provider or 1064 95 ci 10261102 and vaccine developer or 1054 95 ci 10271082 are associated with higher level of covid19 vaccine hesitancy vaccine hesitancy is also associated with anger reaction or 1019 95 ci 09981040 need for chaos or 1044 95 ci 10221067 and populist view or 1028 95 ci 1001056 the finding were adjusted for sociodemographic factor including age sex education marital status working status type of family household income religious belief and residency the result suggest the need for an effective health promotion program to improve community knowledge of the covid19 vaccine while effective strategy to tackle infodemics are needed to address hesitancy during a new vaccine introduction program

processed_title: path analysis of covid19 vaccine adherence among adolescent across indonesia in the malukupapua island eastern indonesia and on java island
processed_abstract: background covid19 incidence in indonesia wa high among adolescent but vaccine acceptance remains low the unequal geographical distribution of the health workforce and health facility in indonesia including a lower number of health worker and facility in malukupapua resulted in a low rate of vaccine acceptance knowledge attitude belief in the vaccine comorbidity congenital status are related to vaccine adherence but mediation analysis of factor remains lacking we aimed to analyze path analysis of knowledge congenital comorbidity belief and attitude to covid19 vaccine adherence among adolescent in indonesia malukupapua island and java island method a nationwide crosssectional study wa undertaken among 7604 adolescent a path analysis to investigate mediating effect between variable combined with bootstrapping wa utilized to determine statistical significance result knowledge congenital status comorbidity belief and attitude were significantly positively associated with covid19 vaccine adherence among adolescent in malukupapua island p 001 n 4761 java island p 001 n 1573 and indonesia p 005 n 7604 congenital status belief and attitude negatively mediated the relationship between knowledge of and adherence to covid19 vaccine p 001 in indonesia and among the subgroup on malukupapua island p 001 but a positive mediation p 004 in our subgroup analysis of java island comorbidity status belief and attitude negatively mediated relationship between knowledge and adherence to covid19 vaccine in indonesia p 001 and malukupapua p 000 but no mediation role wa found in java island p 058 conclusion comorbidity congenital illness status belief in and attitude to covid19 vaccine negatively mediated the relationship between knowledge of and adherence to covid19 vaccine among adolescent in indonesia and our subgroup on malukupapua island but not on java island practical implication massive improvement in healthcare facility equality play an important role in indonesia gaining covid19 vaccine adherence

processed_title: maternal vaccination against covid19 and neonatal outcome during omicron intercovid2022 study
processed_abstract: background in early 2023 when omicron wa the variant of concern we showed that vaccinating pregnant woman decreased the risk for severe covid19related complication and maternal morbidity and mortality objective this study aimed to analyze the impact of covid19 during pregnancy on newborn and the effect of maternal covid19 vaccination on neonatal outcome when omicron wa the variant of concern study design intercovid2022 wa a large prospective observational study conducted in 40 hospital across 18 country from november 27 2021 the day after the world health organization declared omicron the variant of concern to june 30 2022 to assess the effect of covid19 in pregnancy on maternal and neonatal outcome and to assess vaccine effectiveness woman diagnosed with laboratoryconfirmed covid19 during pregnancy were compared with 2 nondiagnosed unmatched woman recruited concomitantly and consecutively during pregnancy or at delivery mothernewborn dyad were followed until hospital discharge the primary outcome were a neonatal positive test for covid19 severe neonatal morbidity index severe perinatal morbidity and mortality index preterm birth neonatal death referral to neonatal intensive care unit and disease during the neonatal period vaccine effectiveness wa estimated with adjustment for maternal risk profile result we enrolled 4707 neonate born to 1577 335 mother diagnosed with covid19 and 3130 665 nondiagnosed mother among the diagnosed mother 642 407 were not vaccinated 147 93 were partially vaccinated 551 349 were completely vaccinated and 237 150 also had a booster vaccine neonate of boostervaccinated mother had less than half relative risk 046 95 confidence interval 023091 the risk of being diagnosed with covid19 when compared with those of unvaccinated mother they also had the lowest rate of preterm birth medically indicated preterm birth respiratory distress syndrome and number of day in the neonatal intensive care unit newborn of unvaccinated mother had double the risk for neonatal death relative risk 206 95 confidence interval 106400 when compared with those of nondiagnosed mother vaccination wa not associated with any congenital malformation although all vaccine provided protection against neonatal test positivity newborn of boostervaccinated mother had the highest vaccine effectiveness 64 95 confidence interval 1086 vaccine effectiveness wa not a high for messenger rna vaccine only vaccine effectiveness against moderate or severe neonatal outcome wa much lower namely 13 in the boostervaccinated group all vaccine and 25 and 28 in the completely and boostervaccinated group respectively messenger rna vaccine only vaccine were fairly effective in protecting neonate when given to pregnant woman 100 day 14 week before birth thereafter the risk increased and wa much higher after 200 day 29 week finally none of the neonatal practice studied including skintoskin contact and direct breastfeeding increased the risk for infecting newborn conclusion when omicron wa the variant of concern newborn of unvaccinated mother had an increased risk for neonatal death neonate of vaccinated mother had a decreased risk for preterm birth and adverse neonatal outcome because the protective effect of covid19 vaccination decrease with time to ensure that newborn are maximally protected against covid19 mother should receive a vaccine or booster dose no more than 14 week before the expected date of delivery

processed_title: mental health and healthrelated quality of life among healthcare worker in indonesia during the covid19 pandemic a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: objective healthcare worker hcws are the front line during the covid19 pandemic they are more exposed to covid19 than other profession study from other country have shown that the mental health and healthrelated quality of life hrqol of hcws were affected during this pandemic however study on mental health in indonesia remain scarce and no study ha evaluated the hrqol among hcws thus this study wa designed to explore the mental health status and hrqol among hcws in indonesia design this wa a crosssectional study setting this wa an open online survey in indonesia conducted from december 2020 to february 2021 participant this study involved hcws who worked during the covid19 pandemic of the 502 respondent who accessed the online questionnaire 392 were included in the analysis outcome mental health status wa measured using the 21item depression anxiety and stress scale and hrqol wa measured using the second version of the 12item shortform health survey sf12v2 result the prevalence of depression anxiety and stress among hcws wa 294 449 and 318 respectively using the sf12v2 questionnaire 354 903 hcws were found to have impaired physical component and 156 398 hcws have impaired mental component conclusion the prevalence of mental health problem among hcws wa high in indonesia hrqol particularly the physical component wa affected in most hcws thus policymakers should give more attention to the mental health and hrqol of hcws during the covid19 pandemic

processed_title: is knowledge about covid19 associated with willingness to receive vaccine vaccine uptake and vaccine booster uptake in rural malang indonesia
processed_abstract: background lack of knowledge regarding the coronavirus disease covid19 and covid19 vaccine is a key barrier to covid19 vaccine uptake in low and middleincome country lmics aim to examine factor associated with knowledge about covid19 and the association between knowledge of covid19 willingness to receive a covid19 vaccine and vaccine uptake in malang east java indonesia method a crosssectional study among individual aged 1599 year wa conducted in malang java timur indonesia between november 2022 and january 2023 of 10050 potential respondent 10007 were able to complete the survey the main independent variable wa knowledge about covid19 which wa assessed using a sixitem questionnaire the dependent variable were covid19 vaccine uptake and covid19 booster vaccine uptake the mediating variable wa respondent willingness to receive a covid19 vaccine linear regression wa used to examine factor associated with knowledge about covid19 logistic regression wa employed to examine the association of knowledge about covid19 with vaccine uptake generalized structural equation modeling gsem wa performed to examine whether willingness to receive a vaccine mediated the association between knowledge about covid19 and vaccination uptake finding the percentage of respondent who reported having received at least one dose of a covid19 vaccine wa 948 while the percentage of those who reported having received at least three dos wa 885 these number are higher than the national average for covid19 vaccine and booster vaccine uptake most respondent answered about four of six knowledge item correctly m 460 sd 11 among respondent who had not received a vaccine 831 expressed willingness to receive a vaccine when it became available to them older more educated employed respondent and those with higher economic status demonstrated more accurate knowledge about covid19 than younger less educated unemployed respondent and those with lower economic status respondent who demonstrated more accurate knowledge about covid19 were more likely to have received a vaccine or 1528 95 ci 14281634 and a booster vaccine or 1260 95 ci 11961328 willingness to receive a vaccine mediated the association between knowledge about covid19 and vaccine uptake coef 0426 95 ci 03790473 implication intervention and public health program aiming to improve knowledge about covid19 can be implemented to improve individual willingness to receive covid19 vaccination and to improve covid19 vaccine uptake among the general population

processed_title: what message appeal and messenger are most persuasive for covid19 vaccine uptake result from a 5country survey in india indonesia kenya nigeria and ukraine
processed_abstract: effective strategy to encourage covid19 vaccination should consider how health communication can be tailored to specific context our study aimed to evaluate the influence of three specific messaging appeal from two kind of messenger on covid19 vaccine acceptance in diverse country we surveyed 953 online participant in five country india indonesia kenya nigeria and ukraine we assessed participant perception of three messaging appeal of vaccinationcovid19 disease health outcome social norm related to covid19 vaccination and economic impact of covid19from two messenger healthcare provider hcp and peer we examined participant ad preference and vaccine hesitancy using multivariable multinomial logistic regression participant expressed a high level of approval for all the ad the healthcare outcomehealthcare provider ad wa most preferred among participant from india indonesia nigeria and ukraine participant in kenya reported a preference for the health outcomepeer ad the majority of participant in each country expressed high level of vaccine hesitancy however in a final logistic regression model participant characteristic were not significantly related to vaccine hesitancy these finding suggest that appeal related to health outcome economic benefit and social norm are all acceptable to diverse general population while specific audience segment ie mother younger adult etc may have preference for specific appeal over others tailored approach or approach that are developed with the target audience concern and preference in mind will be more effective than broadbased or mass appeal

processed_title: hashtag a a new weapon to resist the covid19 vaccination policy a qualitative study of the antivaccine movement in brazil usa and indonesia
processed_abstract: in 2019 the world health organization who named the antivaccine movement one of the top 10 global health threat this trend ha shown that it can diminish public faith in government and increase public distrust of scientific result in the health sector including the use of the covid19 vaccine the purpose of this study is to examine the antivaccine movement on twitter social medium platform which us hashtag to protest vaccination regulation in the covid19 pandemic the content analysis relationship analysis and word cloud analysis model were used in this study which used a descriptive qualitative approach the primary data source for this study is hashtag which are used to focus on three aspect first establish which information in brazil the united state and indonesia lead the antivaccine covid19 narrative second how doe the hashtag link between each country work third which narrative dominates the use of hashtag in each of the three country according to the finding of this study in brazil 692 of twitter hashtag associated to the covid19 vaccination were negative compared to 594 in the usa and 628 in indonesia in general the hashtag used in the three country to oppose covid19 vaccination policy have a clear and significant relationship in brazil the hashtag covidiots wa the most popular while in the united state covivaccine wa the most popular and in indonesia antivaccine wa the most popular

processed_title: assessment of mental health and quality of life status of undergraduate student in indonesia during covid19 outbreak a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: the covid19 pandemic globally impacted physical spiritual and mental health mh the consequence significantly affected student quality of life qol too this crosssectional study assessed mh status and it relationship to the qol of college student in indonesia this study collected data september 2021april 2022 online using the depression anxiety and stress scale21 dass21 to measure mh and the world health organization qualityoflife scale whoqolbref to measure the qol the data were analysed using spss with a bivariate and multivariate linear regression test a total of 606 respondent participated in this study with the majority being woman 810 aged 2127 year 443 and unmarried 985 respondent we observed 244 n 148 moderate depression 183 n 111 very severe anxiety and 211 n 128 moderate stress status the qol measurement determined that a moderate qol in the physical and environmental health domain 70 and poor qol in the psychological health domain 583 were found gender age family support history of covid19 diagnosis family with covid19 diagnosis vaccination status and physical symptom are significantly associated with mh status and qol pvalue 005 this study demonstrated that covid19 wa negatively related to college student mh and qol targeted intervention may be needed to ameliorate both mh and qol

processed_title: stigma associated with covid19 among health care worker in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the aim of this study wa to assess the stigma associated with coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 among health care worker hcws in indonesia during the early phase of the pandemic method a crosssectional study wa conducted in 12 hospital across the country in march 2020 a logistic regression wa employed to assess the association between stigma and explanatory variable result in total 288 hcws were surveyed of which 934 had never experienced any outbreak approximately 219 of the respondent had stigma associated with covid19 hcws who were doctor had not participated in training related to covid19 worked in the capital of the province worked at private hospital or worked at a hospital with covid19 triage protocol were likely to have no stigma associated with covid19 conclusion the stigma associated with covid19 is relatively high among hcws in the early phase of the covid19 pandemic in indonesia adequate dissemination of knowledge and adequate protection are necessary to reduce stigma among hcws

processed_title: increased risk of poor clinical outcome in covid19 patient with diabetes mellitus and inhospital mortality predictor a retrospective cohort from a tertiary hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to determine association between diabetes in confirmed case of covid19 and intensive care admission and inhospital mortality evaluate several laboratory parameter a mortality predictor and develop predictor of inhospital mortality among diabetic with covid19 method this retrospective cohort recruited all case of covid19 hospitalized in fatmawati general hospital from march to october 2020 inclusion criterion wa rtpcr confirmed case of covid19 who aged 18 year and older while exclusion criterion were incomplete medical record or can not be found and pregnant woman result we enrolled 506 participant to this study with median age of 51 year iqr22 female 5632 and diabetes 2846 diabetes increased intensive care admission adjusted or 257 95 ci 3521043 and inhospital mortality adjusted or 250 95 ci 161389 in predicting inhospital mortality ferritin and lactate dehydrogenase offered an acceptable discrimination auc 071 95 ci 062079 and auc 070 95 ci 061078 respectively the optimal cutoff of predicting mortality for ferritin wa 786 gml and for ldh wa 51494 ul factor include age above 70 year old rbgs level on admission above 250 mgdl or below 140 mgdl ferritin level above 786 ngml and presence of ards increased the odds of mortality among individual with diabetes conclusion diabetes increase risk intensive care admission and in hospital mortality in covid19 multivariate analysis showed that older age rbg on admission high ferritin level presence of ards increased the odds of mortality among individual with diabetes

processed_title: hospital service utilisation and cost before and after covid19 hospital treatment evidence from indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to estimate hospital service utilisation and cost among the indonesian population enrolled in the national health insurance nhi program before and after covid19 hospital treatment method 28159 indonesian nhi enrolees treated with laboratoryconfirmed covid19 in hospital between may and august 2020 were compared to 8995 individual never diagnosed with covid19 in 2020 a differenceindifference approach is used to contrast the monthly allcause utilisation rate and total claim of hospital service between these two group a period of nine month before and three to six month after hospital treatment were included in the analysis result a substantial shortterm increase in hospital service utilisation and cost before and after covid19 treatment wa observed using the fifth month before treatment a the reference period we observed an increased outpatient visit rate in 13 calendar month before and up to 24 month after treatment p0001 among the covid19 group compared to the comparison group we also found a higher admission rate in 12 month before and one month after treatment p0001 consequently increased hospital cost were observed in 13 calendar month before and 14 calendar month after the treatment p0001 the elevated hospital resource utilisation wa more prominent among individual older than 40 overall no substantial increase in hospital outpatient visit admission and cost beyond four month after and five month before covid19 treatment conclusion individual with covid19 who required hospital treatment had considerably higher healthcare resource utilisation in the shortterm before and after the treatment these finding indicated that the total cost of treating covid19 patient might include the pre and postacute period

processed_title: efficacy and safety of the rbddimerbased covid19 vaccine zf2001 in adult
processed_abstract: background the zf2001 vaccine which contains a dimeric form of the receptorbinding domain of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 and aluminum hydroxide a an adjuvant wa shown to be safe with an acceptable sideeffect profile and immunogenic in adult in phase 1 and 2 clinical trial method we conducted a randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled phase 3 trial to investigate the efficacy and confirm the safety of zf2001 the trial wa performed at 31 clinical center across uzbekistan indonesia pakistan and ecuador an additional center in china wa included in the safety analysis only adult participant 18 year of age were randomly assigned in a 11 ratio to receive a total of three 25mug dos 30 day apart of zf2001 or placebo the primary end point wa the occurrence of symptomatic coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 a confirmed on polymerasechainreaction assay at least 7 day after receipt of the third dose a key secondary efficacy end point wa the occurrence of severetocritical covid19 including covid19related death at least 7 day after receipt of the third dose result between december 12 2020 and december 15 2021 a total of 28873 participant received at least one dose of zf2001 or placebo and were included in the safety analysis 25193 participant who had completed the threedose regimen for whom there were approximately 6 month of followup data were included in the updated primary efficacy analysis that wa conducted at the second data cutoff date of december 15 2021 in the updated analysis primary endpoint case were reported in 158 of 12625 participant in the zf2001 group and in 580 of 12568 participant in the placebo group for a vaccine efficacy of 757 95 confidence interval ci 710 to 798 severetocritical covid19 occurred in 6 participant in the zf2001 group and in 43 in the placebo group for a vaccine efficacy of 876 95 ci 706 to 957 covid19related death occurred in 2 and 12 participant respectively for a vaccine efficacy of 865 95 ci 389 to 985 the incidence of adverse event and serious adverse event wa balanced in the two group and there were no vaccinerelated death most adverse reaction 985 were of grade 1 or 2 conclusion in a large cohort of adult the zf2001 vaccine wa shown to be safe and effective against symptomatic and severetocritical covid19 for at least 6 month after full vaccination funded by the national science and technology major project and others clinicaltrialsgov number nct04646590

processed_title: the potential role of pharmacy medication sale data to augment the syndromic surveillance system in response to covid19 and preparedness for other future infectious disease outbreak in indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia face a continuous threat from communicable disease outbreak the current covid19 outbreak the previous one of sars and many other infectious outbreak encountered in the country warn of the need to develop comprehensive early warning system to enable timely health response in the long run in this article we argue that over the counter medication sale data at community pharmacy in indonesia can potentially augment and increase the detection power of the current syndromic surveillance system particularly in dealing with covid19 and other future infectious disease outbreak in the country main body this article discusses the experience of other country in employing pharmacy medication sale data to serve a potential syndromic surveillance platform and contribute to pandemic response we argue why it is worth considering utilising medication sale data from pharmacy in indonesia to support the current surveillance system which enables the provision of early warning of disease outbreak we then discus the potential challenge of operationalising these data and suggest a way forward for the development and implementation of the syndromic surveillance system at community pharmacy setting in indonesia conclusion while there are several challenge in developing a workable system in indonesia that need to be addressed introducing a syndromic surveillance system using pharmacysetting medication sale data is worth investigating in the country

processed_title: a systematic review of the case finding testing and management of covid19
processed_abstract: background mass testing and adequate management are essential to terminate the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 this testing is due to the possibility of unidentified case especially one without covid19 related symptom this review aimed to examine the outcome of the existing study on the way of identifying covid19 case and determine the population at risk symptom and diagnostic test management of covid19 method the article reviewed were scientific publication on the pubmed science direct proquest and scopus database the keywords used to obtain the data were covid19 severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 and case detection case management or diagnostic test we applied the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma and population intervention control and outcome pico approach result a total of 21 article from 13 country met the inclusion criterion and were further analyzed qualitatively however 62 of the article used a rapid antibody test for screening rather than a rapid antigen test according to the rapid antigen test 513 were positive with men aged above 50 year recording the highest number of case furthermore 571 of patient were symptomatic while diagnostic test sensitivity and specificity increased to 100 in 14 day after the onset conclusion realtime polymerase chain reaction rtpcr is recommended by the world health organization for detection of covid19 suppose it is unavailable the rapid antigen test is used a an alternative rather than the rapid antibody test diagnosis is expected to be confirmed using the pcr and serological assay to achieve an early diagnosis of covid19 according to disease progression gradual rapid test can be used such a rapid antigen in an earlier week and antibody test confirmed by rtpcr and serological assay in the second week of covid19

processed_title: immunogenicity and safety in healthy adult of full dose versus half dos of covid19 vaccine chadox1s or bnt162b2 or fulldose coronavac administered a a booster dose after priming with coronavac a randomised observermasked controlled trial in indonesia
processed_abstract: background inactivated covid19 vaccine effectively prevent death but their effectiveness for preventing infection or severe illness is known to decrease within 36 month following the second priming dose here we aimed to evaluate the immunogenicity and safety of three potential booster vaccine administered a a fulldose homologous booster or fulldose or halfdose heterologous booster among individual primed with coronavac method we did an observer and participant masked randomised controlled trial study of healthy indonesian adult from five recruitment site in bandung and jakarta indonesia aged 18 year and older who had previously received two dos of coronavac within 3 to less than 6 month or 6 to 9 month before the booster dose participant were randomly assigned 11111 by mean of stratified randomisation with random block size to a homologous booster with fulldose coronavac or heterologous booster with chadox1s or bnt162b2 in full dose or half dose the primary outcome wa to evaluate the seropositive seroconversion rate and the geometric mean titre of igg antispikereceptor binding domain and neutralising antibody 28 day after booster dose vaccination in the perprotocol population safety wa assessed a a secondary outcome in all vaccinated booster participant by the incidence rate and intensity of adverse event within 24 h 7 day and 28 day after the booster dose this study is registered with inaregistryorg inago0hlgb and is complete finding between nov 26 and dec 16 2021 1015 people were screened and 960 healthy adult were enrolled 190193 were
