included in each group 28 day after receiving the booster combining the 3 to less than 6 month and 6 to 9 month group the proportion of seroconversion rate in each vaccine group were chadox1s 75 82 of 92 to 87 88 of 99 for full dose and half dose bnt162b2 92 92 of 100 to 90 98 of 92 for full dose and half dose and coronavac in 38 41 of 92 to 65 66 of 98 all booster group achieved 100 seropositivity 28 day after the booster dose participant in the 6 to 9 month priming group achieved higher titre compared with participant in the 3 to less than 6 month priming group the geometric mean titre in participant in the 6 to 9 month priming group in each vaccine group were chadox1s 1125869 95624313 25585 and 785304 669892920600 for full dose and half dose bnt162b2 1999984 17 7205822 57225 and 17 01762 14 6944019 70816 for full dose and half dose and coronavac 144055 117281176942 achieved higher titre compared with participant in the 3 to less than 6 month priming group which in each vaccine group were chadox1s 773039 640187933460 and 668434 567894786773 for full dose and half dose bnt162b2 1659408 13 9930819 67855 and 12 12167 99252114 80419 for full dose and half dose and coronavac 121023 97649149992 the median percentage inhibition for the surrogate virus neutralisation test against the delta b16172 and wildtype wt variant before the booster and 28 day after the booster dose wa very high in all group p0001 all with greater than 90 inhibition against both delta and wt strain no serious adverse event were associated with the vaccine within the heterologous booster group the adverse event rate in the halfdose group were lower compared with the fulldose group interpretation geometric mean titre value between participant in the 6 to 9 month priming group and the 3 to less than 6 month priming group before the booster dose and between halfdose and fulldose group 28 day before the booster were not significantly different for halfdose chadox1s fulldose bnt162b2 and coronavac and were significantly different for fulldose chadox1s and halfdose bnt162b2 among individual primed with coronavac boosting with bnt162b2 full dose or half dose or chadox1s full dose or half dose produce substantially better immune response than in those boosted with coronavac fulldose and halfdose boosting with either bnt162b2 or chadox1s produced similar response heterologous booster with halfdose might be considered in adult primed with two dos of coronavac vaccine funding ministry of health indonesia translation for the indonesian translation of the abstract see supplementary material section

processed_title: efficacy and safety of convalescent plasma therapy in patient with moderatetosevere covid19 a nonrandomized comparative study with historical control in a referral hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: background study to confirm the efficacy and safety of convalescent plasma cp a an adjunctive treatment for covid19 are still required especially for the country where standard treatment are unevenly distributed method a nonrandomized comparative study wa done from june september 2020 in dr sardjito hospital yogyakarta indonesia plasma with antisarscov2 specific igg titer of 1320 were used primary end point were clinical and laboratory parameter outcome including bga chest xray ct value crp procalcitonin il6 ddimer and alc examined on day 1 2 and 7 posttransfusion result the experimental arm of this study consisted of 15 patient who received cp 3 20 with moderate covid19 and 12 80 with severe covid19 there were 15 historical control in this study ten recipient survived and 5 deceased survival rate wa 667 there were higher rate of pneumonia resolution or 154 ci95 033723 ards resolution or 120 ci95 025584 and shorter median length of stay 20 v 22 day p 041 among recipient compared to control lower mortality rate wa observed in recipient v control 333 v 467 or 075 ci95 017333 median death onset wa longer in recipient v control 7th v 1st day p 013 survival analysis showed protective effect of cp hr 069 ci 95 021227 p 0545 higher ct value improvement p 051 and negative conversion rate or120 ci95 025584 were observed in recipient compared to control subanalysis showed more number of comorbidities higher procalcitonin and higher ddimer among cp recipient who did not survive p 002 and p 002 respectively lower crp and procalcitonin and higher alc were found in survivor compared to nonsurvivors p 00437 p 00049 and p 00002 respectively conclusion this study showed promising result for cp marked by improvement in clinical outcome a well a significant reduction of inflammatory marker among recipient

processed_title: willingness to volunteer and readiness to practice of undergraduate medical student during the covid19 pandemic a crosssectional survey in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the question to involve or restrict medical student involvement in the coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic response remains contentious a their state of preparation and perception in volunteering during this pandemic have yet to be investigated this study aim to evaluate indonesian medical student willingness to volunteer and readiness to practice during the covid19 pandemic method a webbased survey wa conducted among undergraduate medical student throughout indonesia sociodemographic and social interaction information in addition to willingness to volunteer and readiness to practice were obtained using a selfreported questionnaire the significance level wa set at 5 result among 4870 participant 2374 487 expressed their willingness to volunteer while only 906 186 had adequate readiness to practice male student student with prior volunteering experience in health or nonhealth sector and student from public university or living in central indonesia v java had higher score of willingness and readiness to volunteer student from sumatra also had better preparedness odds ratio or 156 95 confidence interval ci 115212 p 0004 while the opposite occurred for student from eastern indonesia or 063 95 ci 044089 p 0002when compared to student from java in addition compared to student with high family income student from lowermiddle income family were less willing to volunteer or 076 95 ci 059098 p 0034 though those with low family income had better readiness or 151 95 ci 110208 p 0011 shortage of medical personnel sense of duty and solicitation by stakeholder were the main reason increasing the student willingness to volunteer whereas contrarily fear for owns health absence of a cure and fear of harming patient were the primary factor diminishing their willingness to volunteer conclusion our finding indicated that many indonesian medical student are willing to volunteer yet only few of them were ready to practice indicating that further preparation are required to maximize their potential and minimize their exposure to hazard we suggest that their potential a a firm support system during the pandemic should not be overlooked and that the integration of relevant course to the medical curriculum are imperative to prepare for future public health emergency

processed_title: adolescent physical activity and sedentary behaviour in indonesia during the covid19 pandemic a qualitative study of mother perspective
processed_abstract: background sociobehavioural adaptation during the covid19 pandemic may have significantly affected adolescent lifestyle this study aimed to explore possible reason affecting change in physical activity and sedentary behaviour in indonesian adolescent during the pandemic based on mother perspective method we recruited parent n 20 from the yogyakarta region of indonesia julyaugust 2020 using purposive and snowball sampling individual interview were audiorecorded transcribed verbatim and anonymised data were imported into nvivo software for a reflexive thematic analysis result the interview lasted between 38 and 113 min m 65 min participant age ranged between 36 and 54 year m 426 year participant child ranged in age from 12 to 15 year m 137 year female 9 male 11 theme related to change in physical activity during the pandemic were 1 selfdetermination and enjoyment 2 support from others and 3 physical activity facility and equipment theme related to change in sedentary behaviour during the pandemic included 1 educational demand 2 psychological effect due to the pandemic 3 device and internet availability 4 parental control and 5 social facilitator conclusion during the pandemic mother perceived their child to be less active and using more screenbased device either for educational or recreational purpose compared to before the present theme might be useful when developing intervention and policy promoting physical activity and reducing sedentary behaviour in adolescent intervention could for example consider increasing parent and adolescent awareness on current activity guideline providing education on healthier recreational screen time and involving parent peer and teacher increasing the accessibility of physical activity facility and equipment making use of adolescent favourite program and social medium for intervention and providing activity that are fun and enjoyable may also important

processed_title: clinical radiological feature and outcome of covid19 patient in a secondary hospital in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the number of people infected with sarscov2 in indonesia especially in jakarta a the epicenter continue to rise limited published clinical data scarcity and long turn over time of diagnostic testing put clinician in dilemma to make diagnosis methodology this is an observational case series study from confirmed covid19 patient in our hospital from first case admission on 17 march 30 april 2020 we collected patient demography symptom comorbidities therapy laboratory chest xray and ecg consecutively result between 17 march 2020 and 30 april 2020 there were 30 confirmed covid19 case 16 533 were male clinical symptom were dyspnea in 22 733 and dry cough 16 533 comorbidities were diabetes in 14 466 hypertension 10 333 and coronary artery disease cad in 10 333 patient respectively laboratory finding showed lymphopenia in 21 70 patient increased inflammation marker in erythrocyte sedimentation rate esr creactive protein crp and lactate dehydrogenase ldh 21 70 23 766 and 12 40 patient respectively twentyseven 90 case had abnormal chest xray cxr and mostly severe 18 60 descriptive finding for image included consolidation 16 533 and ground glass opacity ggo in 10 333 patient conclusion based on our finding most case of covid19 admitted in secondary referral hospital were already in moderate to severe stage this is most likely due to late referral from primary care and unspecific clinical feature resemblance of other infectious disease inflammation marker and cxr are cost effective finding and can be used a marker to determine further referral

processed_title: impact of covid19 on the gut a review of the manifestation pathology management and challenge
processed_abstract: sarscov2 is a virus that can enter it host through the angiotensin converting enzyme2 ace2 receptor ace2 is mainly expressed in cell of the gastrointestinal tract such a the esophageal epithelium and enterocytes from the ileumcolon coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 ha varying clinical symptom and present differently in individual ranging from asymptomatic carrier to moderate clinical spectrum with mild pneumonia clinical feature and to a severe clinical presentation with dyspnea and hypoxia leading to death due to respiratory or multiorgan failure covid19 infection can also manifest themselves in the form of gastrointestinal symptom such a diarrhea vomiting nausea and abdominal pain severe complication of gastrointestinal covid19 infection include hemorrhage or perforation of the gastrointestinal tract and severe inflammation which can adversely affect the intestinal immune system and therefore the systemic immune system of the host furthermore covid19 ha also shown to affect microbiota homeostasis in the digestive tract to date no clear explanation is available regarding the pathophysiology of gastrointestinal sarscov2 infection fecal rna detection and the possibility of fecaloral transmission of sarscov2 this review aim to discus the effect of sarscov2 infection on the digestive tract microbiota and lung and the possibility of fecaloral transmission in covid19

processed_title: risk perception of covid19 in indonesia during the first stage of the pandemic
processed_abstract: community perception of earlystage pandemic may have significant implication for subsequent disease control and management perception of covid19 among indonesian citizen were assessed 2 month after the first reported case in the country the study used an online survey tool which wa adapted from a standardized questionnaire for risk perception of an infectious disease outbreak the question of the survey involved respondent perceived level of knowledge preparedness efficacy of control measure newness infectiousness seriousness motivating and hindering factor and effectiveness of prevention method a well a question that assessed actual level of knowledge of respondent such a causative agent mode of transmission number of total case and available control measure a total of 1043 respondent participated in this study the main source of information of respondent were social medium 852 and online news 822 nearly all respondent were aware that covid19 is a viral disease with saliva droplet 971 and contaminated surface 865 being it main mode of transmission participant showed a good level of knowledge pertaining to control measure an adequate level of belief toward their efficacy and a willingness to implement such measure more than 95 of the respondent perceived covid19 to be either serious or very serious however the level of anxiety among respondent wa moderate suggesting the presence of risk tolerance in the community individual characteristic such a gender educational background and occupation were found to have a statistically significant relationship with risk perception and tolerance but voluntary participation in control measure wa high and similar this indicates that the covid19 health campaign during early pandemic in indonesia wa a success this research also revealed certain area where health promotion education and awareness might be improved

processed_title: prioritizing pregnant woman for covid19 vaccination
processed_abstract: despite emerging evidence on safety and efficacy most country do not offer covid19 vaccine to pregnant woman even though they are at higher risk of complication from covid19 we performed a web search of covid19 vaccination policy for pregnant woman under two category country bearing a high burden of covid19 case and country with a high burden of maternal and underfive mortality of the top 20 country affected by covid19 11 allow vaccination of pregnant woman of which two have deemed it safe to vaccinate pregnant woman a a highrisk group in contrast only five of the 20 country with high underfive mortality and maternal mortality allow vaccination of pregnant woman and none of these country ha included them a part of a highrisk group that should be vaccinated india and indonesia with onefifth of the world population fall under both category but do not include pregnant woman a a priority group for covid19 vaccination to prevent covid19 from further aggravating the already heavy burden of maternal and underfive mortality there is a strong case for including pregnant woman a a highpriority group for covid19 vaccination we recommend including covid19 vaccination in routine antenatal care in all country particularly india and indonesia in view of their high dual burden

processed_title: plantbased vaccine and antibody to combat covid19 current status and prospect
processed_abstract: globally researcher are undertaking significant effort to design and develop effective vaccine therapeutic and antiviral drug to curb the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 plant have been used for the production of vaccine monoclonal antibody immunomodulatory protein drug and pharmaceutical via molecular farmingtransient expression system and are considered a bioreactors or factory for their bulk production these biological product are stable safe effective easily available and affordable plant molecular farming could facilitate rapid production of biologics on an industrial scale and ha the potential to fulfill emergency demand such a in the present situation of the covid19 pandemic this article aim to describe the methodology and basic of plant biopharming in addition to it prospective application for developing effective vaccine and antibody to counter covid19

processed_title: efficacy and safety of tixagevimabcilgavimab a preexposure prophylaxis for covid19 a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: some proportion of population such a immunocompromised patient and organ transplant recipient might have inadequate immune response to the vaccine for coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 for these group of population administering monoclonal antibody might offer some additional protection this review sought to analyze the effectiveness and safety of tixagevimabcilgavimab evusheld a preexposure prophylaxis against covid19 we used specific keywords to comprehensively search for potential study on pubmed scopus europe pmc and clinicaltrialsgov source until 3 september 2022 we collected all published article that analyzed tixagevimabcilgavimab on the course of covid19 review manager 54 wa utilized for statistical analysis six study were included our pooled analysis revealed that tixagevimabcilgavimab prophylaxis may decrease the rate of sarscov2 infection or 024 95 ci 015040 p 000001 i2 75 lower covid19 hospitalization rate or 013 95 ci 007024 p 000001 i2 0 decrease the severity risk or 013 95 ci 007024 p 000001 i2 0 and lower covid19 death or 017 95 ci 003099 p 005 i2 72 in the included study no major adverse event were reported this study proposes that tixagevimabcilgavimab wa effective and safe for preventing covid19 tixagevimabcilgavimab may be offered to those who can not be vaccinated or have inadequate immune response from the covid19 vaccine to give additional protection

processed_title: marketing of commercial milk formula during covid19 in indonesia
processed_abstract: baby food marketing pose a substantial barrier to breastfeeding which adversely affect mother and childrens health over the last decade the baby food industry ha utilised various marketing tactic in indonesia including direct marketing to mother and promoting product in public space and within the healthcare system this study examined the marketing of commercial milk formula cmf and other breastmilk substitute product during the covid19 pandemic in indonesia using a local communitybased reporting platform information on publicly reported violation of the international code of marketing of breastmilk substitute and subsequent world health assembly resolution the code wa collected it wa found that a total of 889 reported case of unethical marketing of such product were recorded primarily through social medium from may 20 through december 31 2021 our result suggest that the covid19 pandemic ha provided more opportunity for the baby food industry in indonesia to attempt to circumvent the code aggressively through online marketing strategy these aggressive marketing activity include online advertisement maternal child health and nutrition webinars instagram session with expert and heavy engagement of health professional and social medium influencers moreover product donation and assistance with covid19 vaccination service were commonly used to create a positive image of the baby food industry in violation of the code therefore there is an urgent need to regulate the online marketing of milk formula and all food and beverage product for child under the age of 3

processed_title: inclusivity of person with disability in the work sector during the covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the covid19 pandemic ha had a significant impact on all level of society including people with disability who in the prepandemic period faced obstacle in various sector of life that affected effort to fulfill basic living need due to difficulty in accessing employment objective the objective of this study wa to identify various factor and causal interaction pattern that affect the inclusiveness of worker with disability in pandemic situation a dynamic system is needed to capture causal interaction pattern related to the inclusiveness of worker with disability in pandemic situation method this study used a causal loop diagram approach which is part of a dynamic system that begin with determining the interaction of causal variable the process of identifying and extracting data wa carried out through a literature review and indepth interview with informant who met the principle of appropriateness and adequacy criterion result the interaction pattern between the factor that influence the inclusiveness of disabled worker wa depicted in three causal loop diagram covering three major domain namely social educational and economic aspect the three causal loop diagram showed an increasingly dynamic interaction pattern during the covid19 pandemic considering that worker with disability have greater vulnerability which impact their level of acceptance and inclusiveness at work recommendation there need to be a specific policy to expand the acceptance of worker with disability by strengthening crosssectoral collaboration and company commitment the existence of a policy that prioritizes education increase the budget and procures adequate infrastructure for people with disability is a government commitment that is demanded to be fulfilled during the covid19 pandemic

processed_title: cutaneous manifestation in covid19 a lesson over 2 year into the pandemic
processed_abstract: cutaneous manifestation related to coronavirus disease19 covid19 have been reported over 2 year since the pandemic began this research aimed to review article published in english that describe cutaneous manifestation related to covid19sarscov2 a data search for case report original study and review article from the onset of the current covid19 pandemic to december 31 2022 wa performed using pubmed cochrane library researchgate and google search engine keywords were coronavirus novel coronavirus 2019 covid19 sarscov2 and 2019ncov in combination with cutaneous skin and dermatology the extracted data included author region sex age number of participant with skin sign cutaneous sign it location symptom extracutaneousassociated symptom suspected or confirmed status for covid19 timeline and healing duration six author independently reviewed the abstract and fulltexts to identify publication providing these detail concerning cutaneous manifestation related to covid19 a total of 139 publication with full text 122 case report 10 case series and 7 review article that reported cutaneous manifestation were identified and reviewed from 5 continent the most common cutaneous manifestation of covid19 were maculopapular followed by chilblainlike lesion urticarial livedoidnecrotic vesicular and othernondescript rashesskin lesion after 2 year into the covid19 pandemic we can conclude that there is no pathognomonic cutaneous manifestation of covid19 since it can be also found in other viral infection

processed_title: nurse experience of emergency department triage during the covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose to explore the experience of nurse working in emergency department in selecting and triaging patient during the covid19 pandemic design descriptive phenomenology wa applied in this study method data were collected from nurse working at hospital in indonesia using snowball sampling and telephone interview a total of 10 emergency nurse participated and colaizzis method of data analysis wa applied finding six theme and 10 subthemes emerged the main theme were extreme challenge in triage feeling of responsibility under uncontrolled spread and infection physical and psychological exhaustion discovering strategy under difficult circumstance looking for positive reinforcement and optimism in togetherness nurse had to deal with the challenge of covid19 in the ed triage interestingly so the nurse they have shown the development of professional responsibility nurse are also experienced in finding patient selection and triage strategy and the sense of optimism that may influence strategy and practice during the covid19 pandemic conclusion this finding identify nurse experience in dealing with the extreme challenge of emergency department triage a well a their associated strategy and optimism clinical relevance providing support to emergency nurse improving emergency department triage and community empowerment are suggested a strategy to improve nursing care during the covid19 pandemic

processed_title: social support through religion and psychological wellbeing covid19 and coping strategy in indonesia
processed_abstract: the coronavirus pandemic covid19 originated in china at the end of 2019 the virus festered there for four month before spreading globally impacting the developed and developing world including indonesia it ha transformed social economic and political practice social life everyday habit and government policy with multidimensional consequence on human life the present study endeavour to explore the relationship between religiosity social capital and psychological wellbeing of the general public particularly in term of coping with the pandemic in addition to this the study aim to highlight the importance of public awareness regarding social distancing use of religion a a coping mechanism and living a healthy lifestyle during pandemic for knowing the perception of the mass an online survey by using a selfadministered questionnaire wa carried out among coronavirus patient the general public social medium activist student and professional across indonesia the finding indicate that the pandemic ha altered the lifestyle of the mass in different way and that people have varied perception towards this virus regarding it spread and preventive measure the study also reveals that social capital beta 418 p 001 psychological wellbeing beta 343 p 001 and religious coping beta 145 p 01 have a significant amount of the variance of coronavirus situational stress f 6977 p 001 r2 0485 lastly the study suggests that adopting preventative measure standard operating procedure that are sustainable and healthy form of coping with the pandemic will be equally a important a medical care in order to contain and eventually eradicate the virus

processed_title: determinant of covid19 severity and mortality in child a retrospective and multicenter cohort study in medan indonesia
processed_abstract: this study investigated indicator of the severity and mortality of covid19 in child in medan sumatera utara province indonesia the aim of this study wa to identify determinant of severity and outcome of child with covid19 a the lesson learned from the covid19 pandemic particularly the limited health facility in indonesia this retrospective cohort study wa conducted in 2020 2021 and 2022 at multiple center inpatient and outpatient child confirmed to be sarscov2 positive were randomly recruited in the selected hospital baseline data demographic clinical laboratory and radiological data were collected and outcome were classified a recovereddeceased for the inpatient group or returned to the hospital for the outpatient group severity status wa identified based on the indonesia covid19 guideline the laboratory data were categorized according to international standard and data were analyzed using univariate analyzes followed by multivariate logistic regression a total of 303 inpatient and 114 outpatient child were included in the analysis out of the total inpatient case nine patient died with 29 mortality rate our final multivariate indicated that the presence of shortness of breath sob anemia and abnormal creactive protein crp level were significantly associated with the severity or the presence of emergency sign while the presence of sob and comorbidities were significantly associated with mortality in inpatient child with covid19 the presence of fever cough sob muscle ache and diarrhea were the reason why the child were returned to the hospital from selfisolation at home among outpatient covid19 case however the cough wa the only significant factor in the final multivariate mode this study highlight important determinant of covid19 severity and mortality in child which should be considered during clinical decisionmaking in lowresource setting of healthcare center in indonesia

processed_title: knowledge attitude and practice of undergraduate medical student in indonesia on the covid19 prevention
processed_abstract: background coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 caused a global pandemic since march 2020 undergraduate medical student were encouraged to educate indonesian society about covid19 this study aimed to evaluate the knowledge attitude and practice of indonesian student on covid19 prevention method an online crosssectional study wa conducted online between august 22 and september 2 2020 with a minimum sample size of 1068 subject the questionnaire wa sent to 86 faculty of medicine fom in indonesia the questionnaire consisted of knowledge attitude and practice section with the score above median were considered a sufficient knowledge positive attitude and positive practice association between knowledge attitude and practice which were dependent variable with gender year of study location of fom and source of information which were independent variable were tested using chisquare test correlation among knowledge attitude and practice score wa tested using spearman rank test result among 1390 participated student 514 557 and 563 had sufficient knowledge positive attitude and positive practice respectively there were association between knowledge and gender p 0005 year of study p 0000 location of fom p0000 and source of information p 0000 between attitude and gender p 0022 year of study p 0004 and source of information p 0015 and between practice and gender p 0000 and source of information p 0000 there were weak correlation between knowledge and attitude r 0246 p0001 and between attitude and practice r 0272 p 0001 conclusion half of indonesian medical student showed sufficient knowledge positive attitude and positive practice on covid19 prevention hence improvement towards covid19 prevention is required

processed_title: molnupiravir and nirmatrelvirritonavir the new available antiviral option for covid19
processed_abstract: coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 is a respiratory tract disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 with the complexity of multimorbidity in indonesia it is crucial to find another line of antiviral for covid19 this article aim to review two antiviral molnupiravir and nirmatrelvirritonavir that have been studied extensively in treating covid19 with promising result and their availability in indonesia molnupiravir and nirmatrelvirritonavir are two of many repurposed drug in clinical trial which have been reported to have a mechanism in quick clearance of sarscov2 reduction in viral load and fast symptom recovery time in phase 1 and 2 clinical trial phase 23 clinical study in covid19 patient without any indication for hospitalization showed that molnupiravir and nirmatrelvirritonavir significantly reduced the risk of hospitalization and death

processed_title: prevalence and epidemiological characteristic of covid19 after one year of pandemic in jakarta and neighbouring area indonesia a single center study
processed_abstract: we determined the prevalence and epidemiological characteristic of covid19 in jakarta and neighboring area indonesia from march 2020 to february 2021 based on nasopharyngealoropharyngeal npop swab specimen that were tested at the eijkman institute for molecular biology jakarta npop swab specimen were collected from covid19 suspect or individual in contact tracing program from primary healthcare center phc and hospital the specimen were screened for the sarscov2 by qrtpcr demography data and clinical symptom were collected using national standardized laboratory form of 64364 specimen 10130 157 were confirmed positive for sarscov2 with the peak prevalence of infection in march 2020 263 follow by in january 2021 239 and february 2021 218 we found that the positivity rate of the specimen from jakarta west java and banten wa 163 133 and 168 respectively positivity rate wa higher in specimen from hospital 169 than phc 94 of the positive specimen 296 were from individual aged 60 year old followed by individual aged 4160 year old 242 among symptomatic case of sarscov2 the most common symptom were cough fever and a combination of both cough fever in conclusion this study illustrates the prevalence and epidemiological characteristic from one covid19 diagnostic center in jakarta and neighbouring area in indonesia

processed_title: community action and insight in the battle against covid19 at the start of the pandemic a district study observation from medan indonesia
processed_abstract: background a of 17 june 2020 the who confirmed 8061550 covid19 case globally with indonesia reporting 40400 case and north sumatra over 932 case the rising infection rate have led to increased death highlighting the urgency for public understanding of virus transmission despite information dissemination effort north sumatra ha not seen a reduction in case emphasizing the need for a unified approach to combat the pandemic objective this study aim to investigate the relationship between public perception and practice regarding covid19 prevention in medan north sumatra method a crosssectional study will be conducted using a combined questionnaire from two previous study conducted at the start of the pandemic result among 200 participant social medium wa the favored source for prevention information participant exhibited aboveaverage knowledge 675 but predominantly belowaverage attitude toward prevention 645 however most resident practiced correct prevention measure 755 conclusion despite possessing adequate knowledge negative attitude toward prevention suggest a need for educational intervention to address misconception and promote positive behavior such intervention could enhance the community response to covid19 transmission during the pandemic

processed_title: selffetal wellbeing monitoring and antenatal care during the covid19 pandemic a qualitative descriptive study among pregnant woman in indonesia
processed_abstract: pregnant woman are expected to have a high level of awareness when it come to checking their fetal health and ensuring their welfare this study explored the experience of pregnant woman in indonesia who were monitoring their fetal wellbeing during the covid19 pandemic a qualitativedescriptive study design with a constructivist paradigm wa used twentytwo pregnant woman were recruited and participated in a semistructured interview analysis of the transcribed interview used a content thematic and comparative process three theme emerged from the analysis feelingsand response change to the ante natal care service during the covid19 pandemic and the fetal wellbeing monitoring tool and method used advice on how pregnant woman should conduct fetal wellbeing monitoring during covid19 is urgently needed the result of this study indicate there is a need for intervention to help pregnant woman carry out selffetal wellbeing monitoring in time where they have fewer contact with health professional such a during the covid19 pandemic

processed_title: impact of early detection and vaccination strategy in covid19 eradication program in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective several essential factor have played a crucial role in the spreading mechanism of covid19 coronavirus disease 2019 in the human population these factor include undetected case asymptomatic case and several nonpharmaceutical intervention because of the rapid spread of covid19 worldwide understanding the significance of these factor is crucial in determining whether covid19 will be eradicated or persist in the population hence in this study we establish a new mathematical model to predict the spread of covid19 considering mentioned factor result infection detection and vaccination have the potential to eradicate covid19 from jakarta from the sensitivity analysis we find that rapid testing is crucial in reducing the basic reproduction number when covid19 is endemic in the population rather than contact trace furthermore our result indicate that a vaccination strategy ha the potential to relax social distancing rule while maintaining the basic reproduction number at the minimum possible and also eradicate covid19 from the population with a higher vaccination rate in conclusion our model proposed a mathematical model that can be used by jakarta government to relax social distancing policy by relying on future covid19 vaccine potential

processed_title: outcome finding of covid19 vaccine among 31 977 pregnant woman in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective we provide an overview of the safety of messenger rna and inactivated coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 vaccine and monitoring of pregnant woman after covid19 vaccination the vaccine safety outcome profile is beneficial for further recommendation of covid19 vaccination in pregnancy method this research wa conducted a descriptive research sampling wa performed using an online questionnaire to be filled out voluntarily and distributed to all pregnant woman in indonesia who received the covid19 vaccination data collection wa performed and descriptive statistic were obtained result among 31 977 pregnant woman 24 212 757 received the first dose 7619 238 received the second dose and 146 45 received the third dose of the covid19 vaccine sinovac vaccine is the most administered vaccine to pregnant woman 27 122 84 most pregnant woman 787 who were vaccinated had no adverse effect after immunization while the most reported adverse effect were mild symptom conclusion the current study contributed evidence that covid19 vaccination during pregnancy ha minimal adverse effect these finding may help pregnant woman and healthcare provider to make informed decision regarding vaccination

processed_title: recent finding and application of biomedical engineering for covid19 diagnosis a critical review
processed_abstract: covid19 is one of the most severe global health crisis that humanity ha ever faced researcher have restlessly focused on developing solution for monitoring and tracing the viral culprit sarscov2 a vital step to break the chain of infection even though biomedical engineering bme is considered a rising field of medical science it ha demonstrated it pivotal role in nurturing the maturation of covid19 diagnostic technology within a very short period of time bme research applied to covid19 diagnosis ha advanced with everincreasing knowledge and invention especially in adapting available virus detection technology into clinical practice and exploiting the power of interdisciplinary research to design novel diagnostic tool or improve the detection efficiency to assist the development of bme in covid19 diagnosis this review highlight the most recent diagnostic approach and evaluates the potential of each research direction in the context of the pandemic

processed_title: mrna covid19 vaccine in pregnancy a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective pregnancy is a known risk factor for severe coronavirus disease 2019 it is important to develop safe vaccine that elicit strong maternal and fetal antibody response method registry clinicaltrialsgov the who clinical trial registry and the european union clinical trial registry and database medline sciencedirect cochrane library proquest springer medrxiv and biorxiv were systematically searched in june 2022 2021 for research article pertaining to covid19 and pregnancy manual search of biorxiv and medrxiv were also conducted inclusion criterion were study that focused on covid19 vaccination among pregnant woman while review article and nonhuman study were excluded infection rate maternal antibody response transplacental antibody transfer and adverse event were described result there were 13 observational study with a total of 48039 pregnant woman who received mrna vaccine of those three study investigated infection rate six study investigated maternal antibody response seven study investigated antibody transfer three study reported local adverse event and five study reported systemic adverse event the available data suggested that the mrnabased vaccine pfizerbiontech and moderna can prevent future sarscov2 infection these vaccine did not show clear harm in pregnancy the most commonly encountered adverse reaction were pain at the injection site fatigue and headache but these were transient antibody response were rapid after the first vaccine dose after the booster antibody response were stronger and associated with better transplacental antibody transfer longer interval between first vaccination dose and delivery were also associated with higher antibody fetal igg and a better antibody transfer ratio conclusion the sarscov2 mrna vaccine are encouraged for pregnancy these vaccine can be a safe option for pregnant woman and their fetus two vaccine dos are recommended for more robust maternal and fetal antibody response longer latency is associated with higher fetal antibody response further research about it longterm effect on pregnancy is needed systematic review registration prospero crd42021261684

processed_title: importance of moderatetovigorous physical activity during the covid19 pandemic a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: moderatetovigorous physical activity mvpa ha been shown to have a favorable effect on many disease a a complementary therapy and is a critical component of healthy living during the pandemic era physical activity ha been promoted for resistance against coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 however there is scarce evidence on whether mvpa could reduce the infectivity and susceptibility to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 sarscov2 the objective of this metaanalysis wa to determine the effect of mvpa on morbidity mortality and duration of hospitalization in covid19 patient we performed a comprehensive search of five online database for eligible study up to september 9 2021 metaanalyses were conducted to determine the association between mvpa and covid19related morbidity hospitalization and mortality the odds ratio or wa applied a the summary statistic for the primary outcome secondary analysis were conducted to evaluate the difference in the metabolic equivalent of task mets between the outcome and nonoutcome group with the mean difference a the pooled effect this metaanalysis included eight observational study we found that mvpa significantly reduced the odds of contracting sarscov2 infection or088 95 confidence interval ci 085092 hospitalization or056 95 ci035092 and mortality or042 95 ci021081 due to covid19 compared to no physical activity mets500 minweek were linked to decreased morbidity and mortality of covid19 or094 95 ci090098 or056 95 ci038083 covid19 patient with mvpa demonstrated a lower risk of covid19related morbidity hospitalization and mortality compared to those who were less active highlighting the importance of an active lifestyle despite the pandemic situation where such activity are limited

processed_title: plasma convalescent decrease mortality in covid19 patient a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective to investigate the role of convalescent plasma cp in reducing mortality of covid19 patient material and method a systematic literature search wa conducted from pubmed embase medrxiv and google scholar from april and finalized in december 2020 using the following term covid19 convalescent plasma cp ccp copla the study were screened extracted and evaluated by two author independently comparative retrospective or prospective study with a control group were included mortality wa defined a the outcome of interest research article not published in the english language not available in full text review article no measured outcome of interest were excluded from this study result eighteen study were included in this metaanalysis there were 5658 patient with 2092 patient treated with cp and 3536 patient a a control group forest plot showed cp use wa associated with decreased mortality with or 064 95 ci 049 to 084 p0001 and heterogeneity i2 2762 few patient experienced an adverse event but no fatal case wa reported conclusion convalescent plasma is effective in reducing mortality of severe and critical covid19 with tolerable adverse effect

processed_title: policymaking and the role of government in promoting public health during covid19 in indonesia
processed_abstract: the global covid19 pandemic ha significantly impacted inadequate physical activity which ha an impact on public health government policy are critical in supporting public health and encouraging physical activity during covid19 in addition collaboration between public and health authority influencers and government is essential in implementing public education campaign to promote physical activity and healthy behavior in indonesia strategy to encourage physical activity among child can include homebased physical activity program online physical education class and outdoor activity that adhere to social distancing guideline

processed_title: avian influenza h5n1 virus epidemiology and it effect on backyard poultry in indonesia a review
processed_abstract: avian influenza ai is a zoonotic viral endemic disease that affect poultry swine and mammal including human highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai is caused by influenza type a virus subtypes h5 and h7 which are naturally carried by a wild bird and often affect domestic poultry avian influenza ai is a major problem worldwide that cause significant economic loss in the poultry sector since 2003 the widespread h5n1 hpai in poultry ha led to high mortality resulting in huge economic loss in the poultry sector in indonesia domestic poultry is a key source of income that contributes to economic growth both directly and indirectly by reducing poverty among the people living in rural community furthermore in many developing country including indonesia rural people meet a portion of their food need through backyard poultry nevertheless this sector is strongly affected by biosecurity hazard particularly in indonesia by hpai infection avian influenza ai subtype h5n1 ha zoonotic significance posing major risk to public health and poultry due to close interaction between wild migratory bird and duck the domestic poultry sector in indonesia is directly affected by this virus this virus continues to be ubiquitous in indonesia a a result of the unpredictable mutation produced by antigenic drift and shift which can persist from a few day to several year in this review the epidemiology and impact of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 subtype virus infection on backyard poultry in indonesia were discussed

processed_title: the panzootic spread of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 sublineage 2344b a critical appraisal of one health preparedness and prevention
processed_abstract: change in the epidemiology and ecology of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza are devastating wild bird and poultry population farm and community and wild mammal worldwide having originated in farmed poultry h5n1 virus are now spread globally by wild bird with transmission to many mammal and avian specie resulting in 2024 in transmission among dairy cattle with associated human case these ecological change pose challenge to mitigating the impact of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza on wildlife ecosystem domestic animal food security and human h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza highlight the need for one health approach to pandemic prevention and preparedness emphasising multisectoral collaboration among animal environmental and public health sector action is needed to reduce future pandemic risk by preventing transmission of highly pathogenic avian influenza among domestic and wild animal and people focusing on upstream driver of outbreak and ensuring rapid response and risk assessment for zoonotic outbreak political commitment and sustainable funding are crucial to implementing and maintaining prevention programme surveillance and outbreak response

processed_title: reassortments among avian influenza ah5n1 virus circulating in indonesia 20152016
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai ah5n1 virus have been circulating since 2003 in indonesia with major impact on poultry health severe economic loss and 168 fatal laboratoryconfirmed human case we performed phylogenetic analysis on 39 fullgenome h5n1 virus sample collected during outbreak among poultry in 20152016 in west java and compared them with recently published sequence from indonesia phylogenetic analysis revealed that the hemagglutinin gene of all sample belonged to 2 genetic group in clade 2321c we also observed these group for the neuraminidase nucleoprotein polymerase and polymerase basic 1 gene matrix nonstructural protein and polymerase basic 2 gene of some hpai were most closely related to clade 213 instead of clade 2321c and a polymerase basic 2 gene wa most closely related to eurasian low pathogenicity avian influenza our result detected a total of 13 reassortment type among hpai in indonesia mostly in backyard chicken in indramayu

processed_title: phylogeography of h5n1 avian influenza virus in indonesia
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus of the h5n1 subtype are a major concern to human and animal health in indonesia this study aimed to characterize transmission dynamic of h5n1 over time using novel bayesian phylogeography method to identify factor which have influenced the spread of h5n1 in indonesia we used publicly available hemagglutinin sequence data sampled between 2003 and 2016 to model ancestral state reconstruction of hpai h5n1 evolution we found strong support for h5n1 transmission route between province in java island and interisland transmission such a between nusa tenggara and kalimantan island not previously described the spread is consistent with wild bird flyway and poultry trading route h5n1 migration wa associated with the region of high chicken density and low human development index these result can be used to inform more targeted planning of h5n1 control and prevention activity in indonesia

processed_title: h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza in indonesia retrospective consideration
processed_abstract: indonesia is one of the five country where highly pathogenic avian influenza virus of the h5n1 subtype h5n1 hpai remain endemic in poultry importantly it is one of the country where the virus cause human infection who data indicate that a of 2 may 2012 189 human case of influenza a h5n1 had been reported in indonesia with 157 human death these human case included a small number in which limited humantohuman transmission could have occurred hence there remains a critical need in indonesia for a more effective one health approach to the control and prevention of this disease in people and in poultry this chapter explores a number of aspect of the evolution of this disease in indonesia the virus that cause it and the control and preventive measure introduced focusing on the success and shortcoming of veterinary and one health approach indonesia provides many example of situation where this latter approach ha been successful and others where further work is needed to maximize the benefit from coordinated response to this disease leading to effective management of the risk to human health

processed_title: seasonal influenza and avian influenza ah5n1 virus surveillance among inpatient and outpatient east jakarta indonesia 20112014
processed_abstract: during october 2011september 2014 we screened respiratory specimen for seasonal and avian influenza ah5n1 virus infection among outpatient with influenzalike illness and inpatient with severe acute respiratory infection sari in east jakarta an indonesia district with high incidence of h5n1 virus infection among poultry in total 31 18756008 of influenzalike illness casepatients and 15 5713811 of sari casepatients tested positive for influenza virus influenza ah1n1pdm09 influenza ah3n2 and influenza b virus infection were detected in all 3 year and the epidemic season extended from november through may although 28 281010135 of casepatients reported exposure to poultry only 1 sari casepatient with an h5n1 virus infection wa detected therefore targeted screening among casepatients with highrisk poultry exposure eg a recent visit to a live bird market or close proximity to sick or dead poultry may be a more efficient routine surveillance strategy for h5n1 virus in these type of setting

processed_title: vaccine efficacy against indonesian highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: indonesia ha implemented multiple strategy to control highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 hpaih5n1 including the licensure and use of multiple vaccine formulation the continuous drift of indonesian hpaih5n1 virus and emergence of a new clade in 2012 that became dominant in 2016 demand the assessment of commercial vaccine formulation against indonesian field virus seven database were explored to identify relevant literature reporting performance of commercial vaccine against indonesian hpaih5n1 virus after methodological assessment data were collated and analyzed to report immunogenicity and vaccine efficacy ve to prevent respiratory and cloacal viral shedding 2day post challenge and death at the end of the followup period metaanalyses were performed to assess ve consistency of alternative formulation and to explore source of heterogeneity in ve in total 65 study and 46 vaccine formulation from 13 article were grouped per oies ve protocol group 1 and variation of it group 234 we found that concurrence of vaccineseed and challengeviruses in a clade designation might be a better proxy of ve than current estimate based on vaccinehomologous hi antibody titer particularly against current fourth order clade virus group 12 primeboosting wa efficacious across different chicken breed group 3 and early vaccination may increase the risk of death group 4 one indonesian vaccine wa tested against the new dominant clade conferring consistent protection in chicken but not in duck metaanalyses revealed high inconsistency i275 and inefficacy of lpai formulation against current field virus while potential source of inconsistent ve were formulation of seedhomologous vaccine and the specie vaccinated we conclude that the ve of commercial vaccine in indonesia change a indonesian hpaih5n1 evolve into new clade which should warrant continuous matching between vaccineseeds and emerging hpaih5n1 furthermore given the characteristic of the new indonesian dominant hpaih5n1 clade further study to confirm ve across specie are warranted

processed_title: wholegenome sequence and genesis of an avian influenza virus h5n1 isolated from a healthy chicken in a live bird market in indonesia accumulation of mammalian adaptation marker in avian host
processed_abstract: background influenza a virus are a major pathogen that cause significant clinical and economic harm to many animal in indonesia the highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 virus ha been endemic in poultry since 2003 and ha caused sporadic deadly infection in human the genetic base that determine host range have not yet been fully elucidated we analyzed the wholegenome sequence of a recent h5 isolate to reveal the evolution toward it mammalian adaptation method we determined the wholegenome sequence of achickeneast javaav19552022 hereafter av1955 from a healthy chicken in april 2022 and conducted phylogenetic and mutational analysis result phylogenetic analysis revealed that av1955 belonged to the h5n1 clade 2321c eurasian lineage the six gene segment pb1 pb2 ha np na and n out of the eight segment derived from virus of h5n1 eurasian lineage one pb2 from the h3n6 subtype and the remaining one m from the h5n1 clade 2132b indonesian lineage the donor of the pb2 segment wa a reassortant among three virus of h5n1 eurasian and indonesian lineage and the h3n6 subtype the ha amino acid sequence contained multiple basic amino acid at the cleavage site mutation analysis revealed that av1955 possessed the maximal number of mammalian adaptation marker mutation conclusion av1955 wa a virus of h5n1 eurasian lineage the ha protein contains an hpai h5n1type cleavage site sequence while the virus wa isolated from a healthy chicken suggesting it low pathogenicity nature the virus ha increased mammalian adaptation marker by mutation and intra and intersubtype reassortment gathering gene segment possessing the most abundant maker mutation among previously circulating virus the increasing mammalian adaptation mutation in avian host suggests that they might be adaptive to infection in mammalian and avian host it highlight the importance of genomic surveillance and adequate control measure for h5n1 infection in live poultry market

processed_title: genetic diversity and host adaptation of avian h5n1 influenza virus during human infection
processed_abstract: the continuing pandemic threat posed by avian influenza ah5n1 virus call for improved insight into their evolution during human infection we performed whole genome deep sequencing of respiratory specimen from 44 h5n1infected individual from indonesia and found substantial withinhost viral diversity at nearly 30 of genome position multiple amino acid were observed within or across sample including position implicated in aerosol transmission between ferret amino acid variant detected our cohort were often found more frequently in available h5n1 sequence of human than avian isolates we additionally identified previously unreported amino acid variant and multiple variant that increased in proportion over time in available sequential sample given the importance of the polymerase complex for host adaptation we tested 121 amino acid variant found in the pb2 pb1 and pa subunit for their effect on polymerase activity in human cell we identified multiple single amino acid variant in all three polymerase subunit that substantially increase polymerase activity including some with effect comparable to that of the widely recognized adaption and virulence marker pb2e627 k these result indicate highly dynamic evolutionary process during human h5n1 virus infection and the potential existence of previously undocumented adaptive pathway

processed_title: how human ecology landscape shape the circulation of h5n1 avian influenza a case study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus consistently threatens global public health a better understanding of the virus circulation mechanism is needed for future epidemic prevention previous study have focused on the correlation between the presence of h5n1 virus and wild bird population domestic poultry production and sociodemographic factor however human cultural landscape and their impact on h5n1 spread have not been adequately explored method using 196 ha gene sequence of h5n1 influenza virus from indonesia with districtlevel geographic information we performed monmonier barrier and louvain community detection analysis to explore how human ecological factor impact the circulation of virus and identify barrier to or corridor of dispersal result spatial discontinuity in the genetic characteristic identified by the monmonier algorithm were found to mirror the difference in key landscape factor our louvain community detection analysis also found the coexistence of different geographic circulation pattern the community detection analysis suggests that direct humanrelated interaction such a poultry transportation between remote area may result in similar virus spreading in two distant region whilst dense locality supported genetically heterogeneous virus in geographically adjacent area conclusion human ecological landscape shape the circulation mechanism of h5n1 virus in multiple way contingent upon local context physical and cultural barrier may impede it movement between adjacent area while natural or humaninduced corridor such a wild bird flyway and poultry production network facilitate it spread between geographically distant area further focus on the importance of cultural landscape ha great potential for increasing our understanding of the circulation of pathogenic h5n1 avian influenza virus in southeast asia

processed_title: highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus clade 2344b in domestic duck indonesia 2022
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 clade 2344b virus were isolated from domestic duck in south kalimantan indonesia during april 2022 the virus were genetically similar to those detected in east asia during 20212022 molecular surveillance of wild bird is needed to detect potential pandemic threat from avian influenza virus

processed_title: evolutionary dynamic of highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 ha clade and vaccine implementation in vietnam
processed_abstract: based on hemagglutinin ha and neuraminidase na influenza a virus is divided into 18 different ha h1 to h18 and 11 na type n1 to n11 opening the possibility for reassortment between the ha and na gene to generate new hxny subtypes where x could be any ha and y is any na possibly in recent four year since 2010 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus of h5n1 subtype hpai ah5n1 have become highly enzootic and dynamically evolved to form multiple h5 ha clade particularly in china vietnam indonesia egypt cambodia and bangladesh so far after more than 10 year emerged in vietnam since late 2003 hpai ah5n1 is still posing a potential risk of causing outbreak in poultry with high frequency of annual endemic intragenic variation referred to a antigenic drift in ha eg h5 ha given rise to form numerous clade typically marking the major timeline of the evolutionary status and vaccine application in each period the dominance of genetically and antigenically diversified clade 2321 of subgroup a b c clade 11 111112 and reemergence of clade 7172 at present ha urged vietnam to the need for dynamically applied antigenicitymatching vaccine ie the plan of importing re6 vaccine for use in 2014 in parallel use of re1re5 since 2006 in this review we summarize evolutionary feature of hpai ah5n1 virus and clade formation during recent 10 year 20042014 dynamic of vaccine implementation in vienam is also remarked

processed_title: genetic and antigenic characterization of influenza ah5n1 virus isolated from patient in indonesia 20082015
processed_abstract: since the initial detection in 2003 indonesia ha reported 200 human case of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 hpai h5n1 associated with an exceptionally high case fatality rate 84 compared to other geographical region affected by other genetic clade of the virus however there is limited information on the genetic diversity of hpai h5n1 virus especially those isolated from human in indonesia in this study the genetic and antigenic characteristic of 35 hpai h5n1 virus isolated from human were analyzed full genome sequence were analyzed for the presence of substitution in the receptor binding site and polymerase complex a marker for virulence or human adaptation a well a antiviral drug resistance substitution only a few substitution associated with human adaptation were observed a remarkably low prevalence of the human adaptive substitution pb2e627k which is common during human infection with other h5n1 clade and a known virulence marker for avian influenza virus during human infection in addition the antigenic profile of these indonesian hpai h5n1 virus wa determined using serological analysis and antigenic cartography antigenic characterization showed two distinct antigenic cluster a observed previously for avian isolates these two antigenic cluster were not clearly associated with time of virus isolation this study provides better insight in genetic diversity of h5n1 virus during human infection and the presence of human adaptive marker these finding highlight the importance of evaluating virus genetics for hpai h5n1 virus to estimate the risk to human health and the need for increased effort to monitor the evolution of h5n1 virus across indonesia

processed_title: highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 outbreak in west java indonesia 20152016 clinical manifestation and associated risk factor
processed_abstract: knowledge of outbreak and associated risk factor is helpful to improve control of the highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus hpai in indonesia this study wa conducted to detect outbreak of hpai h5n1 in endemically infected region by enhanced passive surveillance to describe the clinical manifestation of these outbreak and identify associated risk factor from november 2015 to november 2016 hpai outbreak investigation were conducted in seven district of west java in total 64 outbreak were confirmed out of 75 reported suspicion and outbreak characteristic were recorded the highest mortality wa reported in backyard chicken average 59 ci95 4969 dermal apoptosis and lesion 64 ci95 5276 and respiratory sign 39 ci95 2751 were the clinical sign observed overall most frequently while neurological sign were most frequently observed in duck 68 ci95 4790 in comparison with 60 noninfected control farm the rate of visitor contact onto a farm wa associated with the odds of hpai infection moreover duck farm had higher odds of being infected than backyard farm and larger farm had lower odds than small farm result indicate that better external biosecurity is needed to reduce transmission of hpai ah5n1 in indonesia

processed_title: phylodynamics of h5n1 avian influenza virus in indonesia
processed_abstract: understanding how pathogen invade and become established in novel host population is central to the ecology and evolution of infectious disease influenza virus provide unique opportunity to study these process in nature because of their rapid evolution extensive surveillance large data set and propensity to jump specie boundary h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv is a major animal pathogen and public health threat the virus is of particular importance in indonesia causing severe outbreak among poultry and sporadic human infection since 2003 however little is known about how h5n1 hpaiv emerged and established in indonesia to address these question we analysed indonesian h5n1 hpaiv gene sequence isolated during 20032007 we find that the virus originated from a single introduction into east java between november 2002 and october 2003 this invasion wa characterized by an initially rapid burst of viral genetic diversity followed by a steady rate of lineage replacement and the maintenance of genetic diversity several antigenic site in the haemagglutinin gene were subject to positive selection during the early phase suggesting that hostimmunedriven selection played a role in host adaptation and expansion phylogeographic analysis show that after the initial invasion of h5n1 genetic variant moved both eastward and westward across java possibly involving longdistance transportation by human the phylodynamics we uncover share similarity with other recently studied viral invasion thereby shedding light on the ecological and evolutionary process that determine disease emergence in a new geographical region

processed_title: licensed h5n1 vaccine generate crossneutralizing antibody against highly pathogenic h5n1 clade 2344b influenza virus
processed_abstract: the emergence of highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 clade 2344b virus and their transmission to dairy cattle and animal including human pose a major global public health threat therefore the development of effective vaccine and therapeutic against h5n1 clade 2344b virus is considered a public health priority in the united state three h5n1 vaccine derived from earlier strain of hpai h5n1 avietnam clade 1 and aindonesia clade 21 virus with mf59 or as03 or without adjuvant are licensed and stockpiled for prepandemic preparedness but whether they can elicit neutralizing antibody against circulating h5n1 clade 2344b virus is unknown in this study we evaluated the binding hemagglutination inhibition and neutralizing antibody response generated after vaccination of adult with the three licensed vaccine individual vaccinated with the two adjuvanted licensed h5n1 vaccine generated crossreactive binding and crossneutralizing antibody against the hpai clade 2344b aastrakhan32122020 virus seroconversion rate of 6095 against h5 clade 2344b were observed after two dos of as03adjuvantedaindonesia or three dos of mf59adjuvantedavietnam vaccine these finding suggest that the stockpiled uslicensed adjuvanted h5n1 vaccine generate crossneutralizing antibody against circulating hpai h5n1 clade 2344b in human and may be useful a bridging vaccine until updated h5n1 vaccine become available

processed_title: longlasting heterologous antibody response after sequential vaccination with aindonesia52005 and avietnam12032004 prepandemic influenza ah5n1 virus vaccine
processed_abstract: background avian influenza ah5n1 virus have caused sporadic infection in human and thus they pose a significant global health threat among symptomatic patient the case fatality rate ha been ca 50 h5n1 virus exist in multiple clade and subclades and several candidate vaccine have been developed to prevent ah5n1 infection a a principal measure for preventing the disease method serum antibody against various influenza ah5n1 clade virus were measured in adult by elisabased microneutralization and haemagglutination inhibition test before and after vaccination with two different ah5n1 vaccine in 2009 and 2011 result two dos of as03adjuvanted aindonesia52005 vaccine induced good homologous but poor heterologous neutralizing antibody response against different clade virus however nonadjuvanted avietnam12032004 booster vaccination in 2011 induced very strong and longlasting homologous and heterologous antibody response while homologous response remained weak in naive subject conclusion sequential vaccination with two different ah5n1 prepandemic vaccine induced longlasting high level crossclade immunity against influenza ah5n1 strain thus supporting a primeboost vaccination strategy in pandemic preparedness plan

processed_title: vaccination of gallinaceous poultry for h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza current question and new technology
processed_abstract: vaccination of poultry for avian influenza virus aiv is a complex topic a there are numerous technical logistic and regulatory aspect which must be considered historically control of high pathogenicity hp aiv infection in poultry ha been accomplished by eradication and stamping out when outbreak occur locally since the h5n1 hpaiv from asia ha spread and become enzootic vaccination ha been used on a longterm basis by some country to control the virus other country have used it temporarily to aid eradication effort while others have not used it at all currently h5n1 hpaiv is considered enzootic in china egypt viet nam india bangladesh and indonesia all but bangladesh and india have instituted vaccination program for poultry importantly the specific of these program differ to accommodate different situation resource and industry structure in each country the current vaccine most commonly used are inactivated whole virus vaccine but vectored vaccine use is increasing numerous technical improvement to these platform and novel vaccine platform for h5n1 vaccine have been reported but most are not ready to be implemented in the field

processed_title: phylodynamics of highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus circulating in indonesian poultry
processed_abstract: after it first detection in 1996 the highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5nx virus ha spread extensively worldwide hpaiv ah5n1 wa first detected in indonesia in 2003 and ha been endemic in poultry in this country ever since however indonesia ha limited information related to the phylodynamics of hpaiv ah5n1 in poultry the present study aimed to increase the understanding of the evolution and temporal dynamic of hpaiv h5n1 in indonesian poultry between 2003 and 2016 to this end hpaiv ah5n1 hemagglutinin sequence of virus collected from 2003 to 2016 were analyzed using bayesian evolutionary analysis sampling tree result indicated that the common ancestor of indonesian poultry hpaiv h5n1 arose approximately five year after the common ancestor worldwide of hpai ah5nx in addition this study indicated that only two introduction of hpaiv ah5n1 occurred after which these virus continued to evolve due to extensive spread among poultry furthermore this study revealed the divergence of h5n1 clade 2321c from h5n1 clade 2321b both clade 2321c and 2321b share a common ancestor clade 1 suggesting that clade 2321 originated and diverged from china and other asian country since there wa limited sequence and surveillance data for the hpaiv ah5n1 from wild bird in indonesia the exact role of wild bird in the spread of hpaiv in indonesia is currently unknown the evolutionary dynamic of the indonesian hpaiv ah5n1 highlight the importance of continuing and improved genomic surveillance and adequate control measure in the different region of both the poultry and wild bird spatial genomic surveillance is useful to take adequate control measure therefore it will help to prevent the future evolution of hpai ah5n1 and pandemic threat

processed_title: h5n1 avian influenza
processed_abstract: during the last month of 2003 outbreak of avian flu caused by influenza a h5n1 virus were described in eight asian country and ha paralleled an epidemic of human influenza caused by the same avian virus a h5n1 between december 26 2003 and october 13 2005 there had been 117 documented human infection and 60 death mortality 51 in four asian country vietnam thailand cambodia and indonesia human influenza sustained by h5n1 virus is usually characterized by a severe lower respiratory tract infection leading to a progressive respiratory failure and several extrarespiratory complication infected bird have been the primary source of influenza h5n1 infection in human in asia but transmission from poultry to human is very limited at present and requires a direct exposure to live bird whereas there wa no significant risk related to eating wellcooked poultry meat humantohuman transmission of h5n1 virus ha been suggested in several household cluster but it seems very uncommon at present all the viral gene of human h5n1 isolates were of avian influenza origin which indicates absence of reassortment with human influenza virus but h5n1 continue to evolve and persistent monitoring is requested to identify any increase in viral adaptation to man which could lead to a human pandemic

processed_title: immunopathological immunohistochemical study of low pathogenic avian influenza virus h5n1 infection in lovebird agapornis spp in indonesia
processed_abstract: background and aim to date persistent infection with low pathogenic avian influenza virus aiv subtype h5n1 lpai h5n1 in chicken is widespread in indonesia commercially available ornamental bird on market play an important role in triggering the occurrence of aiv outbreak thus the presence of aiv in ornamental bird such a lovebird need to be closely monitored here the presence of lpai h5n1 wa investigated in lovebird with no clinical sign that although apparently healthy can be a continuous source of aiv transmission to other sensitive bird such a chicken and even human material and method in the present study 30 lovebird were necropsied the immunopathology of the lung which had hemorrhage wa immunohistochemically studied using the streptavidinbiotin sb method to stain for lpai h5n1 polyclonal antibody against the nucleoprotein or monoclonal antibody against the hemagglutinin of the aiv subtype h5n1 were used to identify these antigen in lung tissue sample result lpai h5n1 wa detected in the lung of all lovebird according to the brownish colored deposit in the histological sample the highest intensity of the sb staining wa found in the lumen of vascular capillary and the cell membrane of air capillary the discovery of lpai h5n1 in lovebird increase the environmental health risk and raise the possibility of exposure to aiv thus it is very important to improve the mechanism that control the traffic of ornamental bird between region and island a well a the aiv vaccination strategy related to the prevention control and eradication of aiv in indonesia and these procedure should be reevaluated conclusion the present study prof that lovebird are infected with lpai subtype h5n1 even if ornamental bird such a lovebird do not show any clinical sign they are likely to be a persistently infected with lpai h5n1 therefore ornamental bird might be a continuous source of lpai h5n1 infection in other sensitive bird including poultry and may also be responsible for virus transmission to human

processed_title: a comparison of the pathogenicity of avian and swine h5n1 influenza virus in indonesia
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus are circulating in many country we recently discovered that these virus have been transmitted to pig on multiple occasion in indonesia to investigate whether avian h5n1 influenza virus adapted to mammal through their introduction into pig we examined the growth of avian and swine isolates in cell culture and compared their pathogenicity in mouse we found that swine isolates were less virulent to mouse than avian isolates suggesting that the virus became attenuated during their replication in pig continuous surveillance of h5n1 virus among pig is clearly warranted

processed_title: phylogeography and gene pool analysis of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus reported in india from 2006 to 2021
