processed_abstract: india ha reported highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 virus outbreak since 2006 with the first human case reported in 2021 these included virus belonging to the clade 22 222 2221 2321a and 2321c there are currently no data on the gene pool of hpai h5n1 virus in india molecular clock and phylogeography analysis of the ha and na gene and phylogenetic analysis of the internal gene of h5n1 virus from india were carried out sequence reported from 2006 to 2015 and sequence from 2021 that were available in online database were used in the analysis five separate introduction of h5n1 virus into india were observed via indonesia or korea 2002 bangladesh 2009 bhutan 2010 and china 2013 2018 clade 22 222 2221 2321a 2321c and 2344b phylogenetic analysis revealed eight reassortant genotype the h5n1 virus isolated from the human case showed a unique reassortant genotype amino acid marker associated with adaptation to mammal were also present this is the first report of the spatiotemporal origin and gene pool analysis of h5n1 virus from india highlighting the need for increased molecular surveillance

processed_title: molecular epidemiology of h5n1 avian influenza
processed_abstract: the highly pathogenic asian h5n1 influenza virus that wa first detected in guangdong in the people republic of china china in 1996 is unique in having spread to human and other mammalian specie to date this virus ha not consistently transmitted between any mammalian specie but the continued spread and evolution of these virus in domestic poultry across eurasia present a continuing pandemic threat these virus have caused devastation in domestic poultry and have killed over 60 of infected human the h5n1 virus are unique in having evolved into multiple clade and subclades by reassortment with other influenza virus in the epicentre of southern china and accumulation of point mutation ha resulted in antigenic difference between the clade three wave of spread have occurred wave one to east asia and southeast asia wave two through qinghai lake china to europe india and africa and wave three to southeast asia again this paper deal with the molecular epidemiology of the evolution of the multiplicity of h5n1 clade the continuing evolution of these h5n1 virus and the possible establishment of secondary epicentre in indonesia egypt and nigeria present a continuing threat to poultry and people globally

processed_title: h5n1 influenza virus outbreak and biological property
processed_abstract: all known subtypes of influenza a virus are maintained in wild waterfowl the natural reservoir of these virus influenza a virus are isolated from a variety of animal specie with varying morbidity and mortality rate more importantly influenza a virus cause respiratory disease in human with potentially fatal outcome local or global outbreak in human are typically characterized by excess hospitalization and death in 1997 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus of the h5n1 subtype emerged in hong kong that transmitted to human resulting in the first documented case of human death by avian influenza virus infection a new outbreak started in july 2003 in poultry in vietnam indonesia and thailand and highly pathogenic avian h5n1 influenza virus have since spread throughout asia and into europe and africa these virus continue to infect human with a high mortality rate and cause worldwide concern of a looming pandemic moreover h5n1 virus outbreak have had devastating effect on the poultry industry throughout asia since h5n1 virus outbreak appear to originate from southern china we here examine h5n1 influenza virus in china with an emphasis on their biological property

processed_title: field effectiveness of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 vaccination in commercial layer in indonesia
processed_abstract: although vaccination of poultry for control of highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv h5n1 ha been practiced during the last decade in several country it effectiveness under field condition remains largely unquantified effective hpai vaccination is however essential in preventing incursion silent infection and generation of new h5n1 antigenic variant the objective of this study wa to ass the level and duration of vaccine induced immunity in commercial layer in indonesia titre of h5n1 haemagglutination inhibition hi antibody were followed in individual bird from sixteen flock age 1868 week old wo the study revealed that h5n1 vaccination had highly variable outcome including vaccination failure and wa largely ineffective in providing long lasting protective immunity flock were vaccinated with seven different vaccine administer at various time that could be grouped into three regime in regime a flock n 8 were vaccinated two or three time before 19 wo in regime b n 2 two time before and once after 19 wo and in regime c n 6 three to four time before and two to three time after 19 wo hi titre in regime c bird were significantly higher during the entire observation period in comparison to titre of regime a or b bird which also differed significantly from each other the hi titre of individual bird in each flock differed significantly from bird in other flock indicating that the effectiveness of field vaccination wa highly variable and farm related protective hi titre of 4log2 were present in the majority of flock at 18 wo declined thereafter at variable rate and only two regime c flock had protective hi titre at 68 wo laboratory challenge with hpaiv h5n1 of bird from regime a and c flock confirmed that protective immunity differed significantly between flock vaccinated by these two regime the study revealed that effectiveness of the currently applied h5n1 vaccination could be improved and measure to achieve this are discussed

processed_title: analysis of antibody response to an epitope in the haemagglutinin subunit 2 of avian influenza virus h5n1 for differentiation of infected and vaccinated chicken
processed_abstract: the h5n1 subtype of highly pathogenic avian influenza virus ha been circulating in poultry in indonesia since 2003 and vaccination ha been used a a strategy to eradicate the disease however monitoring of vaccinated poultry flock for h5n1 infection by serological mean ha been difficult a vaccine antibody are not readily distinguishable from those induced by field virus therefore a test that differentiates infected and vaccinated animal diva would be essential currently no simple and specific diva test is available for screening of a large number of vaccinated chicken several epitope on e29 domain of the haemagglutinin h5n1 subunit 2 ha2 have recently been examined for their antigenicity and potential a possible marker for diva in chicken in this study the potential of e29 a an antigen for diva wa evaluated in detail three different form of fulllength e29 peptide a truncated e29 peptide e15 and a recombinant e29 were compared for their ability to detect antie29 antibody preliminary elisa experiment using monospecific chicken and rabbit e29 serum and a mouse monoclonal antibody revealed that the linear e29 peptide wa the most antigenic further examination of the e29 antigenicity in elisa using several serum from experimentally infected or vaccinated chicken revealed that the fulllength e29 peptide had the greatest discrimination power between infected and vaccinated chicken serum while providing the least nonspecific reaction this study demonstrates the usefulness of the hpai h5n1 ha2 e29 epitope a a diva antigen in hpai h5n1vaccinated and infected chickensresearch highlight e29 ha2 position 488516 epitope is antigenic in chickensantibodies to e29 are elicited following live h5n1 virus infection in chickense29 epitope is a potential diva antigen for use in elisa

processed_title: revised and updated nomenclature for highly pathogenic avian influenza a h5n1 virus
processed_abstract: the divergence of the hemagglutinin gene of agooseguangdong11996lineage h5n1 virus during 2011 and 2012 807 new sequence collected through december 31 2012 wa analyzed by phylogenetic and pdistance method to define new clade using the preestablished nomenclature system eight new clade designation were recommended based on division of clade 11 mekong river delta 2132 indonesia 222 indiabangladesh 2211 egyptisrael and 2321 asia a simplification to the previously defined criterion which add a letter rather than number to the rightmost digit of fifthorder clade wa proposed to facilitate this and future update

processed_title: metapopulation dynamic and determinant of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza outbreak in indonesian poultry
processed_abstract: in 2008 the indonesian government implemented a revised villagelevel participatory disease surveillance and response pdsr program to gain a better understanding of both the magnitude and spatial distribution of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai outbreak in backyard poultry to date there ha been considerable collection of data but limited publically available analysis this study utilizes data collected by the pdsr program between april 2008 and september 2010 for java bali and the lampung province of sumatra the analysis employ hierarchical bayesian occurrence model to quantify spatial and temporal dynamic in backyard hpai infection report at the district level in 90 day time period and relates the probability of hpai occurrence to pdsrreported village hpai infection status and human and poultry density the probability of infection in a district wa assumed to be dependent on the status of the district in the previous 90 day time period and described by either a colonization probability the probability of hpai infection in a district given there had not been infection in the previous 90 day time period or a persistence probability the probability of hpai infection being maintained in the district from the previous to current 90 day period result suggest that the number of surveillance activity in a district had little relationship to outbreak occurrence probability but human and poultry density were found to have nonlinear relationship to outbreak occurrence probability we found significant spatial dependency among neighboring district indicating that there are latent spatial process that are not captured by the covariates available for this study but which nonetheless impact outbreak dynamic the result of this work may help improve understanding of the seasonal nature of h5n1 in poultry and the potential role of poultry density in enabling endemicity to occur a well a to assist the government of indonesia target scarce resource to region and time period when outbreak of hpai in poultry are most likely to occur

processed_title: avian influenza h5n1 transmission in household indonesia
processed_abstract: background disease transmission pattern are needed to inform public health intervention but remain largely unknown for avian influenza h5n1 virus infection a recent study on the 139 outbreak detected in indonesia between 2005 and 2009 found that the type of exposure to source of h5n1 virus for both the index case and their household member impacted the risk of additional case in the household this study describes the disease transmission pattern in those outbreak household methodologyprincipal finding we compared case n 177 and contact n 496 in the 113 sporadic and 26 cluster outbreak detected between july 2005 and july 2009 to estimate attack rate and disease interval we used final size household model to fit transmission parameter to data on household size case and bloodrelated household contact to assess the relative contribution of zoonotic and humantohuman transmission of the virus a well a the reproduction number for human virus transmission the overall household attack rate wa 183 and secondary attack rate wa 55 secondary attack rate remained stable a household size increased the mean interval between onset of subsequent case in outbreak wa 56 day the transmission model found that human transmission wa very rare with a reproduction number between 01 and 025 and the upper confidence bound below 04 transmission model fit wa best when the denominator population wa restricted to bloodrelated household contact of index case conclusionssignificance the study only found strong support for human transmission of the virus when a single large cluster wa included in the transmission model the reproduction number wa well below the threshold for sustained transmission this study provides baseline information on the transmission dynamic for the current zoonotic virus and can be used to detect and define signature of a virus with increasing capacity for humantohuman transmission

processed_title: genetic characterization of clade 2321 avian influenza ah5n1 virus indonesia 2012
processed_abstract: after report of unusually high mortality rate among duck on farm in java island indonesia in september 2012 influenza ah5n1 virus were detected and characterized sequence analysis revealed all gene clustered with contemporary clade 2321 virus rather than enzootic clade 213 virus indicating the introduction of an exotic h5n1 clade into indonesia

processed_title: evolutionary and transmission dynamic of reassortant h5n1 influenza virus in indonesia
processed_abstract: h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus have seriously affected the asian poultry industry since their recurrence in 2003 the virus pose a threat of emergence of a global pandemic influenza through point mutation or reassortment leading to a strain that can effectively transmit among human in this study we present phylogenetic evidence for the interlineage reassortment among h5n1 hpai virus isolated from human cat and bird in indonesia and identify the potential genetic parent of the reassorted genome segment parsimony analysis of viral phylogeography suggest that the reassortant virus may have originated from greater jakarta and surroundings and subsequently spread to other region in the west java province in addition bayesian method were used to elucidate the genetic diversity dynamic of the reassortant strain and one of it genetic parent which revealed a more rapid initial growth of genetic diversity in the reassortant virus relative to their genetic parent these result demonstrate that interlineage exchange of genetic information may play a pivotal role in determining viral genetic diversity in a focal population moreover our study also revealed significantly stronger diversifying selection on the m1 and pb2 gene in the lineage preceding and subsequent to the emergence of the reassortant virus respectively we discus how the corresponding mutation might drive the adaptation and onward transmission of the newly formed reassortant virus

processed_title: comparison of virulence and lethality in mouse for avian influenza virus of two ah5n1 and one ah3n6 isolated from poultry during year 20132014 in indonesia
processed_abstract: in indonesia the highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus ha become endemic and ha been linked with direct transmission to human from 2013 to 2014 we isolated avian influenza ah5n1 and ah3n6 virus from poultry in indonesia this study aimed to reveal their pathogenicity in mammal using a mouse model three of the isolates av154 of ah5n1 clade 2321c av240 of ah5n1 clade 2132b and av39 of ah3n6 were inoculated into balbc mouse to assess morbidity and mortality we measured body weight daily and monitored survival for 20 d av154 and av240infected mouse lost 25 of their starting body weight by day 7 while av39infected mouse did not most of the av154infected mouse died on day 8 while the majority of the av240infected mouse survived until day 20 a 50 mouse lethal dose wa calculated to be 20 x 101 50 egg infectious dos for av154 11 x 105 for av240 and 32 x 106 for av39 the av154 virus wa highly virulent and lethal in mouse without prior adaptation suggesting it high pathogenic potential in mammal the av240 virus wa highly virulent but modestly lethal whereas the av39 virus wa neither virulent nor lethal several mammalian adaptive marker of amino acid residue were associated with the highly virulent and lethal phenotype of the av154 virus

processed_title: crossimmunity and age pattern of influenza ah5n1 infection
processed_abstract: the age distribution of influenza ah5n1 case reported during 20062013 varied substantially between country a well a underlying demographic profile it is possible that crossimmunity contributed to the age distribution of reported case seasonal influenza ah1n1 and avian influenza ah5n1 share the same neuraminidase subtype n1 using a mechanistic model we measured the extent to which population age distribution and heterosubtypic crossimmunity could explain the observed age pattern in cambodia china egypt indonesia and vietnam our result support experimental evidence that prior infection with h1n1 confers partial crossimmunity to h5n1 and suggest that more than 50 of spillover event did not lead to reported case of infection a a result we also identified age group that have additional risk factor for influenza ah5n1 not captured by demography or infection history

processed_title: attenuation of highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus in indonesia following the reassortment and acquisition of gene from low pathogenicity avian influenza a virus progenitor
processed_abstract: the highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai ah5n1 virus is endemic in indonesian poultry and ha caused sporadic human infection in indonesia since 2005 surveillance of h5n1 virus in live bird market lbms during 2012 and 2013 wa carried out to provide epidemiologic and virologic information regarding viral circulation and the risk of human exposure realtime rtpcr of avian cloacal swab and environmental sample revealed influenza apositive specimen which were then subjected to virus isolation and genomic sequencing genetic analysis of specimen collected at multiple lbms in indonesia identified both low pathogenicity avian influenza lpai ah3n8 and hpai ah5n1 virus belonging to clade 2132a comparison of internal gene segment among the lpai and hpai virus revealed that the latter had acquired the pb2 pb1 and n gene from lpai progenitor and other virus containing a wild type wt genomic constellation comparison of murine infectivity of the lpai ah3n8 wt hpai ah5n1 and reassortant hpai ah5n1 virus showed that the acquisition of lpai internal gene attenuated the reassortant hpai virus producing a mouse infectivityvirulence phenotype comparable to that of the lpai virus comparison of molecular marker in each viral gene segment suggested that mutation in pb2 and ns1 may facilitate attenuation the discovery of an attenuated hpai ah5n1 virus in mouse that resulted from reassortment may have implication for the capability of these virus to transmit and cause disease in addition surveillance suggests that lbms in indonesia may play a role in the generation of reassortant ah5 virus and should be monitored

processed_title: physician knowledge attitude and practice regarding seasonal influenza pandemic influenza and highly pathogenic avian influenza a h5n1 virus infection of human in indonesia
processed_abstract: indonesia ha reported highest number of fatal human case of highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai a h5n1 virus infection worldwide since 2005 there are limited data available on seasonal and pandemic influenza in indonesia during 2012 we conducted a survey of clinician in two district in western java indonesia to assess knowledge attitude and practice kap of clinical diagnosis testing and treatment of patient with seasonal influenza pandemic influenza or hpai h5n1 virus infection overall a very low percentage of physician participant reported ever diagnosing hospitalized patient with seasonal pandemic or hpai h5n1 influenza use of influenza testing wa low in outpatient and hospitalized patient and use of antiviral treatment wa very low for clinically diagnosed influenza patient further research is needed to explore health system barrier for influenza diagnostic testing and availability of antiviral for treatment of influenza in indonesia

processed_title: identifying risk factor of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 subtype in indonesia
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai subtype h5n1 wa first officially reported in indonesia in 2004 since then the disease ha spread and is now endemic in large part of the country this study investigated the statistical relationship between a set of risk factor and the presence or absence of hpai in indonesia during 2006 and 2007 hpai wa evaluated through participatory disease surveillance pd in backyard village chicken the study population and risk factor included descriptor of people and poultry distribution separating chicken duck and production sector poultry movement pattern and agroecological condition the study showed that the risk factor elevation human population density and rice cropping were significant in accounting for the spatial variation of the pdsdefined hpai case these finding were consistent with earlier study in thailand and vietnam in addition commercial poultry population and two indicator of market location and transport human settlement and road length were identified a significant risk factor in the model in contrast to several previous study carried out in southeast asia domestic backyard duck were not found to be a significant risk factor in indonesia the study used surrogate estimate of market location and marketing chain and further work should focus on the actual location of the live bird market and on the flow of live poultry and poultry product between them so that pattern of possible transmission and region of particular risk could be better inferred

processed_title: bone marrowderived mesenchymal stem cell attenuate pulmonary inflammation and lung damage caused by highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus in balbc mouse
processed_abstract: background the highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus is one of the causative agent of acute lung injury ali with high mortality rate study on therapeutic administration of bone marrowderived mesenchymal stem cell msc in ali caused by the viral infection have been limited in number and have shown conflicting result the aim of the present investigation is to evaluate the therapeutic potential of msc administration in ah5n1caused ali using a mouse model method msc were prepared from the bone marrow of 9 to 12 weekold balbc mouse an h5n1 virus of aturkeyeast javaav1542013 wa intranasally inoculated into balbc mouse on day 2 4 and 6 after virus inoculation msc were intravenously administered into the mouse to evaluate effect of the treatment we examined for lung alveolar protein a an indicator for lung injury pao2fio2 ratio for lung functioning and lung histopathology expression of nfkappab rage transmembrane receptor for damage associated molecular pattern tnfalpha il1beta sftpc alveolar cell type ii marker and aqp5 alveolar cell type i marker were examined by immunohistochemistry in addition body weight virus growth in lung and brain and duration of survival were measured result the administration of msc lowered the level of lung damage in the virusinfected mouse a shown by measuring lung alveolar protein pao2fio2 ratio and histopathological score in the msctreated group the expression of nfkappab rage tnfalpha and il1beta were significantly suppressed in comparison with a mocktreated group while those of sftpc and aqp5 were enhanced body weight virus growth and survival period were not significantly different between the group conclusion the administration of msc prevented further lung injury and inflammation and enhanced alveolar cell type ii and i regeneration while it did not significantly affect viral proliferation and mouse morbidity and mortality the result suggested that msc administration wa a promissing strategy for treatment of acute lung injury caused by the highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus although further optimization and combination use of antiviral drug will be obviously required to achieve the goal of reducing mortality

processed_title: environmental sampling for avian influenza virus a h5n1 in livebird market indonesia
processed_abstract: to identify environmental site commonly contaminated by avian influenza virus a h5n1 in livebird market in indonesia we investigated 83 market in 3 province in indonesia at each market sample were collected from up to 27 poultryrelated site to assess the extent of contamination sample were tested by using realtime reverse transcriptionpcr and virus isolation a questionnaire wa used to ascertain type of bird in the market general infrastructure and work practice thirtynine 47 market showed contamination with avian influenza virus in 1 of the site sampled risk factor were slaughtering bird in the market and being located in west java province protective factor included daily removal of waste and zoning that segregated poultryrelated work flow area these result can aid in the design of evidencebased program concerning environmental sanitation food safety and surveillance to reduce the risk for avian influenza virus a h5n1 transmission in livebird market

processed_title: success factor for avian influenza vaccine use in poultry and potential impact at the wild birdagricultural interface
processed_abstract: thirtytwo epizootics of high pathogenicity avian influenza hpai have been reported in poultry and other bird since 1959 the ongoing h5n1 hpai epizootic that began in 1996 ha also spilled over to infect wild bird traditional stampingout program in poultry have resulted in eradication of most hpai epizootics however vaccination of poultry wa added a a control tool in 1995 and ha been used during five epizootics over 113 billion dos of ai vaccine have been used in poultry from 2002 to 2010 a oilemulsified inactivated whole aiv vaccine 955 and live vectored vaccine 45 over 99 of the vaccine ha been used in the four h5n1 hpai enzootic country china including hong kong 91 egypt 47 indonesia 23 and vietnam 14 where vaccination program have been nationwide and routine to all poultry ten other country used vaccine in poultry in a focused riskbased manner but this accounted for less than 1 of the vaccine used most vaccine failure have resulted from problem in the vaccination process ie failure to adequately administer the vaccine to atrisk poultry resulting in lack of population immunity while fewer failure have resulted from antigenic drift of field virus away from the vaccine virus it is currently not feasible to vaccinate wild bird against h5n1 hpai but naturally occurring infection with h5 low pathogenicity avian influenza virus may generate crossprotective immunity against h5n1 hpai the most feasible method to prevent and control h5n1 hpai in wild bird is through control of the disease in poultry with use of vaccine to reduce environmental burden of h5n1 hpaiv and eventual eradication of the virus in domestic poultry especially in domestic duck which are raised in enzootic country on range or in other outdoor system having contact with wild aquatic and periurban terrestrial bird

processed_title: impact of vaccine and vaccination on global control of avian influenza
processed_abstract: there are 30 recorded epizootics of h5 or h7 high pathogenicity avian influenza hpai from 1959 to early 2012 the largest of these epizootics affecting more bird and country than the other 29 epizootics combined ha been the h5n1 hpai which began in guangdong china in 1996 and ha killed or resulted in culling of over 250 million poultry andor wild bird in 63 country most country have used stampingout program in poultry to eradicate h5n1 hpai however 15 affected country have utilized vaccination a a part of the control strategy greater than 113 billion dos were used from 2002 to 2010 five country have utilized nationwide routine vaccination program which account for 99 of vaccine used 1 china 909 2 egypt 46 3 indonesia 23 4 vietnam 14 and 5 hong kong special administrative region 001 mongolia kazakhstan france the netherlands cote divoire sudan north korea israel russia and pakistan used 1 of the avian influenza ai vaccine and the ai vaccine wa targeted to either preventive or emergency vaccination program inactivated ai vaccine have accounted for 955 of vaccine used and live recombinant virus vaccine have accounted for 45 of vaccine used the latter are primarily recombinant newcastle disease vectored vaccine with h5 influenza gene insert china indonesia egypt and vietnam implemented vaccination after h5n1 hpai became enzootic in domestic poultry bangladesh and eastern india have enzootic h5n1 hpai and have not used vaccination in their control program clinical disease and mortality have been prevented in chicken human case have been reduced and rural livelihood and food security have been maintained by using vaccine during hpai outbreak however field outbreak have occurred in vaccinating country primarily because of inadequate coverage in the target specie but vaccine failure have occurred following antigenic drift in field virus within china egypt indonesia hong kong and vietnam the primary strategy for hpai and h5h7 low pathogenicity notifiable avian influenza control will continue to be immediate eradication using a fourcomponent strategy 1 education 2 biosecurity 3 rapid diagnostics and surveillance and 4 elimination of infected poultry under some circumstance vaccination can be added a an additional tool within a wider control strategy when immediate eradication is not feasible which will maintain livelihood and food security and control clinical disease until a primary strategy can be developed and implemented to achieve eradication

processed_title: highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus in feather
processed_abstract: h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus cause high mortality of infected bird with infection in multiple organ including in feather feather have been proposed a sample for diagnosis of hpai infection in bird and this study is part of a broader investigation validating the use of feather for diagnostic purpose to understand and characterize the morphological basis for feather infection section from 7 different skin tract of duck and chicken infected with 3 different clade of h5n1 hpai virus from indonesia and vietnam were examined histologically result showed that in duck lesion and viral antigen were mainly detected in the epidermis of feather and follicle whereas in chicken they were mostly found in the dermis of these structure abundant viral antigen wa found in nearly all the feather examined from chicken and there wa no apparent difference between virus isolates or skin tract in the proportion of feather that were antigen positive by immunohistochemistry the majority of feather from most skin tract from duck infected with a vietnamese h5n1 hpai virus contained abundant level of viral antigen while few feather were antigen positive from duck infected with 2 indonesian virus these result support and inform the use of feather for diagnostic detection of h5n1 hpai virus in bird

processed_title: community preparedness for highly pathogenic avian influenza on bali and lombok indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the asiapacific region is the likeliest location for the next significant outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai indonesia ha experienced hpai h5n1 outbreak in poultry and human each year since 2003 and ha had the highest case fatality rate for human case the purpose of this study were to capture the knowledge of avian influenza and of poultryraising practice in two region of indonesia and to evaluate the impact and extent of activity undertaken to 2010 through the national strategic plan for avian influenza control at the village level method a combination of quantitative and qualitative method wa used to investigate the multiple influence on behaviour decision and action taken by poultryraising household and by village and community regarding the threat of hpai between june 2010 and may 2011 a structured survey of 400 household wa conducted on lombok and of 402 on bali inviting sector 3 smallscale independent commercial poultry farm and sector 4 village household poultry raiser to participate focus group and indepth interview were convened with key stakeholder including livestock and animal health and public health official community leader and villager result from the focus group and indepth interview it appears that the flow of information through the national hpai control program ha been efficient at the top level from national to provincial then to district and subdistricts however these finding show that effective transmission of information from subdistrict to rural village level and from village leader to community member ha been limited the degree of community preparedness for hpai on bali and lombok appears minimal knowledge of government activity wa more extensive at bali site while only limited government program and activity occurred at the village level on lombok activity conducted by government agency from provincial to village level were limited in scope and need to be further developed to ensure safe poultryhandling practice and biosecurity measure on both bali and lombok community respondent knew the sign and symptom of sick bird but did not differentiate well between hpai and other bird disease on both island more than 60 of respondent were reluctant to report sudden death of poultry the lack of a government compensation program for destroyed flock contributed to this unwillingness to report conclusion while the indonesian government planning effort for hpai are commendable the plan ha not been effective a it depends on the cooperative action of people with small rural farm who have not been consulted in the development of the plan have not been adequately instructed on the nature of the plan and perceive no benefit to themselves from prevention effort contextappropriate mechanism for communicating zoonotic risk and option for risk mitigation that do not result in net loss to poor household are also needed

processed_title: avian influenza ah5n1 virus outbreak investigation application of the faooiewho fourway linking framework in indonesia
processed_abstract: who fao and oie developed a fourway linking framework to enhance the crosssectoral sharing of epidemiological and virological information in responding to zoonotic disease outbreak in indonesia outbreak response challenge include completeness of data shared between human and animal health authority the fourway linking framework human health laboratoryepidemiology and animal health laboratoryepidemiology wa applied in the investigation of the 193 rd human case of avian influenza ah5n1 virus infection a recommended by the framework outbreak investigation and risk assessment finding were shared on 18 june 2013 a hospital in west java province reported a suspect h5n1 case in a 2yearold male the case wa laboratoryconfirmed that evening and the information wa immediately shared with the ministry of agriculture the human health epidemiologylaboratory team investigated the outbreak and conducted an initial risk assessment on 19 june the likelihood of secondary case wa deemed low a none of the case contact were sick by 3 july no secondary case associated with the outbreak were identified the animal health epidemiologylaboratory investigation wa conducted on 1925 june and found that a live bird market visited by the case wa positive for h5n1 virus once both human and market virus isolates were sequenced a second risk assessment wa conducted jointly by the human health and animal health epidemiologylaboratory team this assessment concluded that the likelihood of additional human case associated with this outbreak wa low but that future sporadic human infection could not be ruled out because of challenge in controlling h5n1 virus contamination in market finding from the outbreak investigation and risk assessment were shared with stakeholder at both ministry the fourway linking framework clarified the type of data to be shared both human health and animal health team made ample data available and there wa cooperation to achieve risk assessment objective

processed_title: evolution and adaptation of h5n1 influenza virus in avian and human host in indonesia and vietnam
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza virus h5n1 is endemic in poultry in east and southeast asia with disease outbreak recently spreading to part of central asia europe and africa continued interspecies transmission to human ha been reported in vietnam thailand cambodia indonesia and china causing pandemic concern here we genetically characterize 82 h5n1 virus isolated from poultry throughout indonesia and vietnam and 11 human isolates from southern vietnam together with sequence data available in public database to address question relevant to virus introduction endemicity and evolution phylogenetic analysis show that all virus from indonesia form a distinct sublineage of h5n1 genotype z virus suggesting this outbreak likely originated from a single introduction that spread throughout the country during the past two year continued virus activity in indonesia were attributed to transmission via poultry movement within the country rather than through repeated introduction by bird migration within indonesia and vietnam h5n1 virus have evolved over time into geographically distinct group within each country molecular analysis of the h5n1 genotype z genome show that only the m2 and pb1f2 gene were under positive selection suggesting that these gene might be involved in adaptation of this virus to new host following interspecies transmission at the amino acid level 12 residue were under positive selection in those genotype z virus in the ha and pb1f2 protein some of these residue were more frequently observed in human isolates than in avian isolates and are related to viral antigenicity and receptor binding our study provides insight into the ongoing evolution of h5n1 influenza virus that are transmitting in diverse avian specie and at the interface between avian and human host

processed_title: risk factor for cluster outbreak of avian influenza a h5n1 infection indonesia
processed_abstract: background by 30 july 2009 indonesia had reported 139 outbreak of avian influenza ai h5n1 infection in human risk factor for case clustering remain largely unknown this study assesses risk factor for cluster outbreak and for secondary case infection method the 113 sporadic and 26 cluster outbreak were compared on household and individual level variable variable assessed include those never reported previously including household size and genealogical relationship between case and their contact result cluster outbreak had larger household and more bloodrelated contact especially firstdegree relative compared with sporadic case outbreak risk factor for cluster outbreak were the number of firstdegree bloodrelatives to the index case adjusted odds ratio aor 150 95 confidence interval ci 120186 and index case having direct exposure to source of ai h5n1 virus aor 320 95 ci 115890 risk factor for secondary case infection were being aged between 5 and 17 year aor 832 95 ci 1724025 or 18 and 30 year aor 604 95 ci 1213008 having direct exposure to source of ai h5n1 virus aor 348 95 ci 128946 and being a firstdegree relative to an index case aor 110 95 ci 1438466 sibling to index case were 5 time more likely to become secondary case or 472 95 ci 1671335 conclusion the type of exposure and the genealogical relationship between index case and their contact impact the risk of clustering the study add evidence that ai h5n1 infection is influenced by and may even depend on host genetic susceptibility

processed_title: the intersection of care seeking and clinical capacity for patient with highly pathogenic avian influenza a h5n1 virus in indonesia knowledge and treatment practice of the public and physician
processed_abstract: background indonesia ha the highest human mortality from highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai a h5n1 virus infection in the world method a survey of household n2520 measured treatment source and belief among symptomatic household member a survey of physician n554 in various type of health care facility measured knowledge assessment and testing behavior and perceived clinical capacity result household reported confidence in health care system capacity but infrequently sought treatment for potential hpai h5n1 signssymptoms more clinician were confident in their knowledge of diagnosis and treatment than in the adequacy of related equipment and resource at their facility physician expressed awareness of the hpai h5n1 suspect case definition yet expressed only moderate knowledge in questioning symptomatic patient about exposure selfreported likelihood of testing for hpai h5n1 virus wa high after learning of certain exposure knowledge of antiviral treatment wa moderate but it wa higher among clinician in puskesmas physician in private outpatient clinic the most heavily used facility reported the lowest confidence in their diagnostic and treatment capability conclusion educational campaign can encourage recall of possible poultry exposure when patient are experiencing signssymptoms and can raise awareness of the effectiveness of antiviral to drive people to seek health care clinician may benefit from training regarding exposure assessment and referral procedure particularly in private clinic disaster med public health preparedness 201610838847

processed_title: evolution of highly pathogenic h5n1 influenza a virus in the central nervous system of ferret
processed_abstract: central nervous system cns disease is the most common extrarespiratory tract complication of influenza a virus infection in human remarkably zoonotic highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 virus infection are more often associated with cns disease than infection with seasonal influenza virus evolution of avian influenza virus ha been extensively studied in the context of respiratory infection but evolutionary process in cns infection remain poorly understood we have previously observed that the ability of hpai aindonesia52005 h5n1 virus to replicate in and spread throughout the cns varies widely between individual ferret based on these observation we sought to understand the impact of entrance into and replication within the cns on the evolutionary dynamic of virus population first we identified and characterized three substitutionspb1 e177g and a652t and np i119m detected in the cns of a ferret infected with influenza aindonesia52005 h5n1 virus that developed a severe meningoencephalitis we found that some of these substitution individually or collectively resulted in increased polymerase activity in vitro nevertheless in vivo the virus bearing the cnsassociated mutation retained it capacity to infect the cns but showed reduced dispersion to other anatomical site analysis of viral diversity in the nasal turbinate and olfactory bulb revealed the lack of a genetic bottleneck acting on virus population accessing the cns via this route furthermore virus population bearing the cnsassociated mutation showed sign of positive selection in the brainstem these feature of dispersion to the cns are consistent with the action of selective process underlining the potential for h5n1 virus to adapt to the cns

processed_title: clinical course of avian influenza ah5n1 in patient at the persahabatan hospital jakarta indonesia 20052008
processed_abstract: background limited understanding of the presentation and course of influenza ah5n1 infection in human hinders evidencebased management method we reviewed the case record of patient admitted to the persahabatan hospital rsp jakarta indonesia with influenza ah5n1 confirmed by realtime polymerase chain reaction result twentytwo previously well patient aged 3 to 47 year median 245 year were identified all attended a clinic or hospital after a median of 2 day of illness range 07 time to first dose of oseltamivir three died before receiving oseltamivir were 2 to 12 day median 7 day administered mostly n 15 at rsp nineteen patient required mechanical ventilation death numbered 18 case fatality 82 occurring within hour to 6 day of rsp admission corresponding to 6 to 16 day of illness admission hyperglycemia or 140 mgdl unrelated to steroid or known underlying diabetes mellitus and elevated ddimer level 08152 mgl upper limit of normal 05 mgl were present in 1421 67 and 2021 95 patient respectively fibrinogen concentration were mostly lownormal at 1299 to 5179 mgdl median 2411 normal 200400 mgdl whereas creactive protein 911 and ferritin 68 level were increased risk factor for death univariate analysis included 1 increased ddimers 2 hyperglycema 3 increased urea 4 more extensive chest radiograph shadowing and 5 lower admission oxygen saturation conclusion early diagnosis and effective treatment of human influenza ah5n1 infection remains challenging most patient were referred late with advanced disease oseltamivir had limited clinical impact elevated ddimer level consistent with fibrinolysis and hyperglycemia warrant more research to determine their underlying mechanism and optimal treatment

processed_title: h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza in southeast asia
processed_abstract: since the first h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv infection in the region in august 2003 cambodia lao malaysia myanmar indonesia thailand and vietnam have all recorded outbreak of the disease the hpaiv continues to occur in some country in southeast asia despite control programme encompassing surveillance vaccination and stamping out strategy a number of strain have been circulating in the region since the first outbreak in 2003 and although the source of the initial outbreak in domestic poultry is not known the continuing propagation of disease in the region is primarily the result of the movement of domestic poultry and poultry product and people a comprehensive approach using all the strategy available to break the chain of transmission of the virus in poultry will be needed to achieve lasting disease control

processed_title: seroevidence for a high prevalence of subclinical infection with avian influenza ah5n1 virus among worker in a livepoultry market in indonesia
processed_abstract: background in indonesia highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 virus ha become endemic in poultry and ha caused sporadic deadly infection in human since 2012 we have conducted fixedpoint surveillance of avian influenza virus at a livepoultry market in east java indonesia in this study we examined the seroprevalence of avian influenza ah5n1 virus infection among market worker method serum were collected from 101 worker in early 2014 and examined for antibody activity against avian ah5n1 eurasian lineage virus by a hemagglutinationinhibition hi assay result by the hi assay 84 of the serum tested positive for antibody activity against the avian virus further analysis revealed that the average hi titer in 2014 wa 29fold higher than in 2012 and that seroconversion occurred in 44 of paired serum 11 of 25 between 2012 and 2014 a medical history survey wa performed in 2016 response to questionnaire indicated that none of worker had had severe acute respiratory illness during 2013 conclusion this study provides evidence of a high prevalence of avian ah5n1 virus infection in 2013 among worker at a livepoultry market however because no instance of hospitalization were reported we can conclude the virus did not manifest any clinical symptom in worker

processed_title: avian influenza a h5n1 infection in bali province indonesia a behavioral virological and seroepidemiological study
processed_abstract: background bali province wa affected by avian influenza h5n1 outbreak in bird in october 2003 despite ongoing circulation of the virus no human infection had been identified by december 2005 objective to assess behavioral pattern associated with poultry rearing in bali and to identify potential risk factor for h5n1 infection in human and in household chicken duck and pig method a behavioral virological and seroepidemiologic survey in 38 village and three live bird market wa completed in december 2005 a multistage cluster design wa used to select 291 household with 841 participant from all nine district in bali specimen were collected from participant a well a a maximum of three pig chicken and duck from each household eightyseven market vendor participated where specimen were collected from participant a well a chicken and duck result twenty out of the 38 village sampled had h5n1 outbreak despite exposure to h5n1 outbreak none of the participant from village or market were seropositive for h5n1 none of the pig tested were positive for h5n1 virus isolation rate in duck and chicken in market wa higher than in household transport of poultry in or out of village wa a risk factor for outbreak in household chicken and duck conclusion the study highlighted that the market chain and associated behavior may play a role in maintaining the virus in household flock the study add evidence that transmission of h5n1 to human remains a rare event despite high level handling of both healthy and sick bird

processed_title: intranasal administration of inactivated avian influenza virus of h5n1 subtype vaccineinduced systemic immune response in chicken and mouse
processed_abstract: aim the need for nonparenteral administration of inactivated avian influenza virus of h5n1 subtype aivh5n1 vaccine is paramount here we provide preliminary data on the immune response of chicken and mouse after intranasal administration of aivh5n1inactivated vaccine with iscoms inmunair inm and combined iscoms and inm a an adjuvant material and method the aiv isolate of achickendenpasar012004 h5n1 wa cultivated in specific pathogenfree chicken egg and inactivated with formaldehyde the vaccine preparation wa added with those adjuvant for intranasal administration and aluminum hydroxide for subcutaneous injection the chicken and mouse were vaccinated at the age of 3 week or 1 month and repeated 2 week thereafter in one experiment chicken wa injected with newcastle disease virus ndv at the same time with aiv vaccine the serum were collected at one serum 1 and 2 w serum 2 after booster vaccination the antiaivh5 and ndv antibody in chicken serum were detected using hemagglutination inhibition hi assay mouse igg antiaivh5n1 antibody wa detected using elisa result the result show that the geometric mean titer gmt of chicken serum of intranasal vaccinated with inactivated aivh5n1 vaccine with mixed iscom inm a adjuvant were 200 and 227 unit hiunit hiu in serum 1 and serum 2 respectively the gmt of the positive control group were 237 and 257 hiu in serum 1 and serum 2 respectively the result of the second experiment show that igg antiaivh5n1 wa detected in mouse serum in the third experiment the gmt of antindv in chicken vaccinated subsequently with inactivated ndv vaccine and aivh5n1 with mixed iscomsinm administrated intranasally and aluminum hydroxide adjuvant administrated through subcutaneous injection a well a positive control group receiving ndv vaccine only were 280 280 and 274 hiu in serum 1 while were 296 292 and 282 hiu in serum 2 respectively conclusion intranasal administration of inactivated aivh5n1 vaccineinduced a systemic immune response in chicken and mouse after adding iscoms andor inm a adjuvant the adjuvant and the intranasal administration caused no immunosuppressive effect on the chicken immune response to ndv vaccine

processed_title: towards mutual trust transparency and equity in virus sharing mechanism the avian influenza case of indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction a the country hardest hit by avian influenza both in poultry and in human indonesia decision to withhold sample of avian influenza virus a h5n1 ha fired up a global controversy the objective of this paper is to describe the position taken by indonesia in the event leading to the decision and in those conducted to resolve the situation method the source for this paper are the indonesian human influenza ah5n1 case report and study result summary minute and report of national and international meeting of virus sharing and other related indonesian and who document result the international health regulation 2005 have been applied in different way based on different interpretation while one party insists on the importance of free nonconditional virus sharing for risk assessment and risk response indonesiaas supported by most of the developing countriesstresses on the more basic principle such a sovereignty of a country over it biological material transparency of the global system and equity between developed and developing nation conclusion this event demonstrates the unresolved imbalance between the affluent hightech country and the poor agriculturebased country regional global and incountry meeting must continue to be conducted to find solution acceptable to all

processed_title: an h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus isolated from a local tree sparrow in indonesia
processed_abstract: the isolation of an h5n1 influenza a virus from a tree sparrow passer montanus captured in east java indonesia in 2010 is reported here it hemagglutinin and neuraminidase were genetically similar to those of human isolates from 20062007 in indonesia the finding of a tree sparrow h5n1 virus that possesses genetically similar surface molecule to those of human virus highlight the importance of monitoring resident wild bird a well a migratory bird for pandemic preparedness

processed_title: antibody persistence and booster response to splitvirion h5n1 avian influenza vaccine in young and elderly adult
processed_abstract: avian influenza continues to circulate and remains a global health threat not least because of the associated high mortality in this study antibody persistence booster vaccine response and crossclade immune response between two influenza ah5n1 vaccine were compared participant aged over 18years who had previously been immunized with a clade 1 avietnam vaccine were reimmunized at 6months with 75 mug of the homologous strain or at 22months with a clade 2 alumadjuvanted aindonesia vaccine blood sampled at 6 15 and 22months after the primary course wa used to assess antibody persistence antibody concentration 6months after primary immunisation with either avietnam vaccine 30 mug alumadjuvanted vaccine or 75 mug dose vaccine were lower than 21days after the primary course and waned further with time reimmunization with the clade 2 30 mug alumadjuvanted vaccine confirmed crossclade reactogenicity antibody crossreactivity between ah5n1 clade suggests that in principle a primeboost vaccination strategy may provide both early protection at the start of a pandemic and improved antibody response to specific vaccination once available trial registration clinicaltrialsgov nct00415129

processed_title: dosesparing h5n1 aindonesia052005 prepandemic influenza vaccine in adult and elderly adult a phase iii placebocontrolled randomized study
processed_abstract: background highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus remain a threat to human health with potential to become pandemic agent method this phase iii placebocontrolled observerblinded study evaluated the immunogenicity crossreactivity safety and lot consistency of 2 dos of oilinwater as03a adjuvanted h5n1 aindonesia052005 375 mug hemagglutinin antigen prepandemic candidate vaccine in 4561 adult aged 1891 year result humoral antibody response in the h5n1 vaccine group fulfilled u and european immunogenicity licensure criterion for pandemic vaccine in all age stratum 21 day after the second dose at 6 month after the administration of the primary dose serum antibody seroconversion rate continued to fulfill licensure criterion neutralizing crossclade immune response were demonstrated against clade 1 avietnam11942004 consistency wa demonstrated for 3 consecutive h5n1 vaccine lot temporary injectionsite pain wa more frequent with h5n1 vaccine than placebo 893 and 707 in the 1864 and 65 year stratum v 222 and 144 in the placebo group unsolicited adverse event frequency including medically attended and serious event wa similar between group through day 364 conclusion in adult and elderly adult as03aadjuvanted h5n1 candidate vaccine wa highly immunogenic for aindonesia052005 with crossreactivity against avietnam11942004 temporary injection site reaction were more frequent with h5n1 vaccine than placebo although the h5n1 vaccine wa well tolerated overall clinical trial registration nct00616928

processed_title: flagellinha vaccine protect ferret and mouse against h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv infection
processed_abstract: in order to meet the global demand for rapid production of pandemic influenza vaccine we have developed a recombinant fusion vaccine platform in which the globular head of hemagglutinin ha antigen is genetically fused to bacterial flagellin a tlr5 ligand these flagellinha fusion vaccine candidate elicit highly protective immunity against a lethal challenge with 2009 pandemic h1n1 liu et al plo one 2011 6e20928 or h5n1 influenza avietnam120304 avn infection in mouse song et al vaccine 200927587588 here we provide the first evidence showing that two avn vaccine candidate elicited haspecific igg reduced nasal virus shedding and conferred full protection against a lethal avn infection in ferret furthermore we show that similar flagellinha vaccine candidate of two other h5n1 hpaiv are immunogenic andor efficacious in mouse vaccine of aindonesia505 ain induced significant hai titer to homologous and heterologous aanhui105 aan h5n1 virus two subcutaneous immunization with dos of either 03 mug or 3 mug of ain candidate resulted in 25 log10 unit reduction in day 5 lung virus titer and 90100 protection against a lethal ain challenge in mouse both r3ha5 in and r32xha5 in vaccine elicited robust neutralizing antibody response that last for at least 9 month and demonstrated a significant anamnestic antibody response upon further booster immunization finally we found that two vaccine candidate of aan induced significant hai titer in mouse taken together our recombinant flagellinha platform ha been successfully used to generate potent h5n1 hpaiv vaccine candidate these promising preclinical result justify the advancement of these candidate into the clinic

processed_title: a comparative evaluation of feather oropharyngeal swab and cloacal swab for the detection of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus infection in experimentally infected chicken and duck
processed_abstract: oropharyngeal and cloacal swab have been widely used for the detection of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza a virus hpai virus in bird previous study have shown that the feather calamus is a site of h5n1 virus replication and therefore ha potential for diagnosis of avian influenza however study characterizing the value of feather for this purpose are not available to our knowledge herein we present a study investigating feather for detection of h5n1 virus duck and chicken were experimentally infected with h5n1 hpai virus belonging to 1 of 3 clade indonesian clade 211 and 213 vietnamese clade 1 different type of feather and oropharyngeal and cloacal swab sample were compared by virus isolation in chicken virus wa detected from all sample type oral and cloacal swab and immature pectorosternal flight and tail feather during clinical disease the viral titer were higher in feather than swab in duck the proportion of viruspositive sample wa variable depending on viral strain and time from challenge cloacal swab and mature pectorosternal feather were clearly inferior to oral swab and immature pectorosternal tail and flight feather in duck infected with indonesian strain in which most bird did not develop clinical sign all sampling method gave intermittent positive result 323 of immature pectorosternal feather were positive during the acute infection period oropharyngeal swab had slightly higher positivity during early infection while feather performed better during late infection our result indicate that immature feather are an alternative sample for the diagnosis of hpai in chicken and duck

processed_title: estimating the transmissibility of h5n1 and the effect of vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: the spread of h5n1 avian influenza continues to pose an economic burden and a public health risk worldwide despite this estimate of the transmissibility of infection exist in only a handful of setting and vary considerably using final size method and flocklevel infection data from a field trial of mass vaccination we obtained the first estimate of the transmissibility of infection between and within flock in indonesia we also found that outbreak in area designated a vaccination zone were less transmissible than in nonvaccination zone however this reduction is only comparable with a limited degree of protective vaccination coverage quantifying the overall effect of vaccination in these zone remains challenging however this result would appear to imply that although the intervention applied in vaccination zone were not sufficient to completely prevent transmission in all area when outbreak occur they are less transmissible than those in area where vaccination wa not applied this could be either a direct or an indirect effect of vaccination given the dynamism of smallscale poultry production in indonesia more regular vaccination may be required to ensure that infection is fully controlled in vaccination zone

processed_title: an aptamer that bind efficiently to the hemagglutinins of highly pathogenic avian influenza virus h5n1 and h7n7 and inhibits hemagglutininglycan interaction
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5 and h7 virus have ravaged the poultry industry in numerous country in asia europe africa and the middle east and have resulted in the death of million of bird although hpai h5n1 virus currently remain avian virus they are continuously evolving and have the potential to become pandemictype virus capable of humanhuman transmission to develop specific reagent to allow better preparedness against this threat we selected an aptamer 83 from a completely random rna pool that bind with high affinity approximately kd 170pm to the hemagglutinins ha derived from hpai h5n1 ah5n1vietnam11942004 and ah5n1indonesia052005 and h7n7 ah7n7netherlands2192003 influenza a virus aptamer 83 wa able to efficiently distinguish ha derived from subtypes of influenza a virus other than h5 and h7 aptamer 83 wa analyzed further to assess it ability to interfere with haglycan interaction using our previously established sprbased competitive assay and we found that aptamer 83 efficiently interferes with haglycan binding ec50 approximately 25 nm to derive shorter variant for other application aptamer 83 wa shortened to a 44mer by deletion analysis the shortened aptamer 83s retains the fulllength aptamers affinity and specificity for it cognate ha and also interferes with haglycan interaction these study suggest that aptamer 83s should be studied further to explore it potential application not only in surveillance and diagnosis but also in the development of h5n1 and h7n7specific virucidal product that interfere with virushost interaction to contain future h5n1 and h7n7 pandemic

processed_title: identification of the progenitor of indonesian and vietnamese avian influenza a h5n1 virus from southern china
processed_abstract: the transmission of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus to southeast asian country triggered the first major outbreak and transmission wave in late 2003 accelerating the pandemic threat to the world due to the lack of influenza surveillance prior to these outbreak the genetic diversity and the transmission pathway of h5n1 virus from this period remain undefined to determine the possible source of the wave 1 h5n1 virus we recently conducted further sequencing and analysis of sample collected in livepoultry market from guangdong hunan and yunnan in southern china from 2001 to 2004 phylogenetic analysis of the hemagglutinin and neuraminidase gene of 73 h5n1 isolates from this period revealed a greater genetic diversity in southern china than previously reported moreover result show that eight virus isolated from yunnan in 2002 and 2003 were most closely related to the clade 1 virus sublineage from vietnam thailand and malaysia while two virus from hunan in 2002 and 2003 were most closely related to virus from indonesia clade 21 further phylogenetic analysis of the six internal gene showed that all 10 of those virus maintained similar phylogenetic relationship a the surface gene the 10 progenitor virus were genotype z and shared high similarity 99 with their corresponding descendant virus in most gene segment these result suggest a direct transmission link for h5n1 virus between yunnan and vietnam and also between hunan and indonesia during 2002 and 2003 poultry trade may be responsible for virus introduction to vietnam while the transmission route from hunan to indonesia remains unclear

processed_title: a systematic review and metaanalysis of crossreactivity of antibody induced by oilinwater emulsion adjuvanted influenza h5n1 virus monovalent vaccine
processed_abstract: background crossclade immunogenic stockpiled h5n1 vaccine may decrease the morbidity and transmission of infection during the initial phase of influenza pandemic metaanalysis of crossreactive antibody induced by oilinwater emulsion adjuvanted owea influenza h5n1 virus monovalent vaccine with circulating heterologous h5n1 virus strain isolated from human infection wa performed method literature search of medline embase web of knowledge the cochrane library clinicaltrialsgov and international standard randomised controlled trial number registry wa conducted up through december 1 2015 methodologically qualified study were included for 1 use of two dos of licensed owea as03 or mf59 eggderived inactivated influenza h5n1 virus monovalent vaccine 2 participant age between 18 and 64years and 3 evaluation of immunogenicity outcome for one or more subclade metaanalysis assessed the crossreactivity of antibody elicited by clade 1 adjuvanted vaccine strain against clade 21 virus strain avietnam11942004 v aindonesia052005 and separately against clade 22 virus strain avietnam11942004 v aturkeyturkey105 and clade 21 adjuvanted vaccine strain against clade 1 virus strain aindonesia052005 v avietnam11942004 quantitative publication bias and influence analysis wa conducted to evaluate potential impact of unpublished or new study on the robustness of metaanalysis result of 960 article 53 qualified for quality assessment and 15 study met the inclusion criterion all assessed clade pair elicited crossreactive antibody clade 1 against clade 21 and 22 clade 21 against clade 1 22 and 23 heterologous strain of same subclade are likely to elicit higher crossreactive antibody conclusion owea influenza h5n1 virus monovalent vaccine exhibit broad crossclade immunogenicity a desired feature for vaccine stockpiling not yet demonstrated by unadjuvanted vaccine in case of an impending h5n1 virus pandemic stockpiled owea influenza h5n1 virus monovalent vaccine may allow population priming that could slow down the course of pandemic and could offer additional time needed for development of an effective strain specific vaccine supply

processed_title: antibody titer ha positive predictive value for vaccine protection against challenge with natural antigenicdrift variant of h5n1 highpathogenicity avian influenza virus from indonesia
processed_abstract: vaccine are used in integrated control strategy to protect poultry against h5n1 highpathogenicity avian influenza hpai h5n1 hpai wa first reported in indonesia in 2003 and vaccination wa initiated in 2004 but report of vaccine failure began to emerge in mid2005 this study investigated the role of indonesian licensed vaccine specific vaccine seed strain and emerging variant field virus a cause of vaccine failure eleven of 14 licensed vaccine contained the manufacturer listed vaccine seed strain but 3 vaccine contained a seed strain different from that listed on the label vaccine containing aturkeywisconsin1968 wi68 achickenmexico281592321994 mex94 and aturkeyenglandn281973 seed strain had high serological potency in chicken geometric mean hemagglutination inhibition hi titer 1169 but vaccine containing strain achickenguangdong11996 generated by reverse genetics rg rggd96 achickenlegok2003 legok03 achickenvietnamc572004 generated by rg rgvn04 or achickenlegok2003 generated by rg rglegok03 had lower serological potency geometric mean hi titer 195 in challenge study chicken immunized with any of the h5 avian influenza vaccine were protected against achickenwest javasmihamd2006 smihamd06 and were partially protected against achickenpapuata52006 papua06 but were not protected against achickenwest javapwtwij2006 pwt06 experimental inactivated vaccine made with pwt06 hpai virus or rggenerated pwt06 lowpathogenicity avian influenza lpai virus seed strain protected chicken from lethal challenge a did a combination of a commercially available live fowl poxvirus vaccine expressing the h5 influenza virus gene and inactivated legok03 vaccine these study indicate that antigenic variant did emerge in indonesia following widespread h5 avian influenza vaccine usage and efficacious inactivated vaccine can be developed using antigenic variant wildtype virus or rggenerated lpai virus seed strain containing the hemagglutinin and neuraminidase gene of wildtype virus importance h5n1 highpathogenicity avian influenza hpai virus ha become endemic in indonesian poultry and such poultry are the source of virus for bird and mammal including human vaccination ha become a part of the poultry control strategy but vaccine failure have occurred in the field this study identified possible cause of vaccine failure which included the use of an unlicensed virus seed strain and induction of low level of protective antibody because of an insufficient quantity of vaccine antigen however the most important cause of vaccine failure wa the appearance of drift variant field virus that partially or completely overcame commercial vaccineinduced immunity furthermore experimental vaccine using inactivated wildtype virus or reverse geneticsgenerated vaccine containing the hemagglutinin and neuraminidase gene of wildtype drift variant field virus were protective these study indicate the need for surveillance to identify drift variant virus in the field and update licensed vaccine when such variant appear

processed_title: characterization of the m2e antibody response following highly pathogenic h5n1 avian influenza virus infection and reliability of m2e elisa for identifying infected among vaccinated chicken
processed_abstract: a surveillance method able to differentiate between vaccinated and infected poultry is required for those country that practice vaccination against highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 the external domain of the m2 protein m2e of influenza virus is a potentially useful differentiatinginfected from vaccinated animal diva antigen but little is known about the m2e antibody response and factor influencing it detection in this study the m2e antibody response wa characterized in layer bird vaccinated and challenged with an indonesian h5n1 virus isolate using a single m2e peptide or fourbranched multiple antigenic peptide form of m2e mapm2e a antigen in two separate elisa antim2e antibody were absent in chick with high level of maternal haemagglutination inhibition antibody and also in all layer vaccinated once twice or three time with an inactivated commercial h5n1 vaccine in contrast antim2e antibody were detected in vaccinated layer challenged with h5n1 virus and their presence wa associated with virus isolation and an increase in haemagglutination inhibition titre the number of bird that developed m2e antibody a well a the strength and duration of the m2e antibody response were strongly influenced by the length of the interval between vaccination and challenge bird challenged at six week after vaccination all developed m2e antibody by 14 day that lasted until at least 56 day after infection in bird challenged at two week after vaccination only a proportion of bird developed m2e antibody by 14 day that lasted only until 28 day postinfection both single m2e peptide and mapm2e elisa had high diagnostic specificity but the diagnostic sensitivity of mapm2e elisa wa significantly higher and more effective in detecting m2e antibody in immune and infected bird the result show that mapm2e elisa would be useful for surveillance in country using vaccination to control highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1

processed_title: intranasal seasonal influenza vaccine and a tlr3 agonist rintatolimod induced crossreactive iga antibody formation against avian h5n1 and h7n9 influenza ha in human
processed_abstract: the intranasal use of rintatolimod a specific tlr3 agonist combined with trivalent seasonal influenza vaccine generated crossprotection against highly pathogenic h5n1 avian influenza in mouse the purpose of this clinical trial is to assess the safety and impact of rintatolimod on intranasal influenza vaccine in healthy adult during stage i of this phase iii clinical trial 12 volunteer were immunized intranasally with 3 dos of flumist seasonal influenza vaccine on day 0 28 and 56 followed by intranasal rintatolimod 50 mug 200 mug or 500 mug 3 day later parotid saliva and nasal wash sample were collected at baseline and on day 25 53 84 and 417 the sample were tested for iga and igg specific antibody ab directed against the homologous flumist viral hemagglutinins ha in addition viral specific response against influenza a ha were tested for iga ab crossreactivity against 3 h5 clade ha h5n1 aindonesia52005 ha h5n1 ahong kong48397 and ha h5n1 avietnam11942004 a well a two h7 strain ha h7n9 ashanghai22013 and ha h7n3 achickenjaliscocpa1 the combination of the intranasal flumist along with the rintatolimod generated specific secretory iga response of at least 4fold over baseline against at least one of the homologous vaccine strain included in the vaccine in 92 of the vaccinee additionally this vaccination strategy induced crossreactive secretory iga against highly pathogenic avian influenza virus strain h5n1 h7n9 and h7n3 with pandemic potential for human the combination of rintatolimod and flumist wa welltolerated

processed_title: observation from a live bird market in indonesia following a contained outbreak of avian influenza a h5n1
processed_abstract: live bird market are considered highrisk environment facilitating viral transfer and replication of influenza a h5n1 in indonesia these market have been the source for multiple human infection of h5n1 resulting in death and thus have been the focus of governmentled intervention this paper examines the aftermath of an intervention in one market in bali indonesia it highlight the social and economic factor influencing the adoption of risk prevention behaviour and concludes by arguing for further qualitative research to understand why atrisk individual fail to adopt biosecurity measure even after recently experiencing an outbreak of avian influenza

processed_title: intersubtype reassortments of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus isolated from quail
processed_abstract: h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus are considered a threat to national animal industry causing production loss and high mortality in domestic poultry in recent year quail ha become a popular terrestrial poultry specie raised for production of meat and egg in asia in this study to better understand the role of quail in h5n1 viral evolution two h5n1positive sample designated aquailvietnamcvvi492010 cvvi492010 and aquailvietnamcvvi502014 cvvi502014 were isolated from quail during h5n1 outbreak in vietnam and their whole genome were analyzed the phylogenetic analysis reveals new evolutionary variation in the worldwide h5n1 virus the quail ha gene were clustered into clade 111 cvvi492010 and clade 2321c cvvi502014 which may have evolved from virus circulating from chicken andor duck in cambodia mainland of china taiwan indonesia and south korea in recent year interestingly the m2 gene of the cvvi492010 strain contained amino acid substitution at position 26li and 31sn that are related to amantadineresistance in particular the cvvi502014 strain revealed evidence of multiple intersubtype reassortment event between virus clade 2321c 2321b and 2321a data from this study support the possible role of quail a an important intermediate host in avian influenza virus evolution therefore additional surveillance is needed to monitor these hpai virus both serologically and virologically in quail

processed_title: assessing the risk of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 transmission through poultry movement in bali indonesia
processed_abstract: indonesia continues to report the highest number of human and poultry case of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 the disease is considered to be endemic on the island of bali live bird market are integral in the poultry supply chain on bali and are important nutritionally and culturally for the rural and urban human population due to the lack of biosecurity practiced along the supply chain from producer to live bird market there is a need to understand the risk associated with the spread of h5n1 through live bird movement for effective control resource to control h5n1 in indonesia are very limited and cost effective strategy are needed we assessed the probability a live bird market is infected through live poultry movement and assessed the effect of implementing two simple and low cost control measure on this risk result suggest there is a high risk a live bird market is infected 078 and risk mitigation strategy such a detecting and removing infected poultry from market reduce this risk somewhat range 067076 the study demonstrates the key role live poultry movement play in transmitting h5n1 and the need to implement a variety of control measure to reduce disease spread

processed_title: cocirculation and characterization of hpaih5n1 and lpaih9n2 recovered from a duck farm yogyakarta indonesia
