processed_abstract: in july 2016 an avian influenza outbreak in duck farm in yogyakarta province wa reported to disease investigation center dic wates indonesia with approximately 1000 duck died or culled in this study two avian influenza ai virus subtypes aduckbantul04161291or2016 h5n1 and aduckbantul04161291op2016 h9n2 isolated from duck in the same farm during an ai outbreak in bantul district yogyakarta province were sequenced and characterized our result showed that h5n1 virus wa closely related to the highly pathogenic ai hpai h5n1 of clade 2321c while the h9n2 virus wa clustered with lpai virus from china vietnam and indonesia h9n2 cvi lineage genetic analysis revealed virulence characteristic for both in avian and in mammalian specie in summary cocirculation of hpaih5n1 of clade 2321c and lpaih9n2 wa identified in a duck farm during an ai outbreak in yogyakarta province indonesia our finding raise a concern of the potential risk of the virus which could increase viral transmission andor threat to human health routine surveillance of avian influenza virus should be continuously conducted to understand the dynamic and diversity of the virus for influenza prevention and control in indonesia and sea region

processed_title: neurotropism of highly pathogenic avian influenza virus achickenindonesia2003 h5n1 in experimentally infected pigeon columbia livia f domestica
processed_abstract: this investigation assessed the susceptibility of experimentally infected pigeon to the highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv h5n1 that caused recent outbreak of avian influenza in bird and human in several country of asia for this purpose 14 pigeon were infected ocularly and nasally with 108 eid50 and clinical sign were recorded and compared with five chicken infected simultaneously a positive control the chicken demonstrated anorexia depression and 100 mortality within 2 day postinoculation three of the pigeon died after a history of depression and severe neurological sign consisting of paresis to paralysis mild enteric hemorrhage resulting in a mortality of 21 gross lesion in these pigeon were mild and inconsistent occasionally subcutaneous hyperemia and hemorrhage and cerebral malacia were observed microscopic lesion and detection of viral antigen were confined to the central nervous system of these pigeon in the cerebrum and to a minor extent in the brain stem a lymphohistiocytic meningoencephalitis with disseminated neuronal and glial cell necrosis perivascular cuffing glial nodule and in one bird focally extensive liquefactive necrosis could be observed the remaining nine pigeon showed neither clinical sign nor gross or histological lesion associated with avian influenza although seroconversion against h5 indicated that they had been infected these result confirm that pigeon are susceptible to hpaiv achickenindonesia2003 h5n1 and that the disease is associated with the neurotropism of this virus although sentinel chicken and most pigeon did not develop disease further experiment have to elucidate whether or not columbiformes are involved in transmission and spread of highly pathogenic avian influenza

processed_title: phylogenetic characterization of h5n1 avian influenza virus isolated in indonesia from 20032007
processed_abstract: the wide distribution of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus is a global threat to human health indonesia ha had the largest number of human infection and fatality caused by these virus to understand the enzootic condition of the virus in indonesia twentyfour h5n1 virus isolated from poultry from 2003 to 2007 were phylogenetically characterized although previous study exclusively classified the indonesian virus into clade 211213 our phylogenetic analysis showed a new sublineage that did not belong to any of the present clade in addition novel reassortant virus were identified that emerged between this new sublineage and other clade in 20052006 on java island h5n1 virus were introduced from java island to sulawesi kalimantan and sumatra island on multiple occasion from 20032007 causing the geographical expansion of these virus in indonesia these finding identify java island a the epicenter of the indonesian h5n1 virus expansion

processed_title: agespecific and sexspecific morbidity and mortality from avian influenza ah7n9
processed_abstract: we used data on age and sex for 136 laboratory confirmed human ah7n9 case reported a of 11 august 2013 to compare agespecific and sexspecific pattern of morbidity and mortality from the avian influenza ah7n9 virus with those of the avian influenza ah5n1 virus human ah7n9 case exhibit high degree of age and sex bias mortality is heavily biased toward male 50 year no death have been reported among individual 25 year old and relatively few case documented among child or adolescent the proportion of fatal case pfc for human ah7n9 case a of 11 august 2013 wa 32 compared to a cumulative pfc for ah5n1 of 83 in indonesia and 36 in egypt approximately 75 of case of all ah7n9 case occurred among individual 45 year old morbidity and mortality from ah7n9 are lowest among individual between 10 and 29 year the age group which exhibit the highest cumulative morbidity and case fatality rate from ah5n1 although individual 20 year old comprise nearly 50 of all human ah5n1 case only 7 of all reported ah7n9 case and no death have been reported among individual in this age group only 4 of ah7n9 case occurred among children5 year old and only one case from the 10 to 20 year age group age and sexrelated difference in morbidity and mortality from emerging zoonotic disease can provide insight into ecological economic and cultural factor that may contribute to the emergence and proliferation of novel zoonotic disease in human population

processed_title: the east jakarta project surveillance for highly pathogenic avian influenza ah5n1 and seasonal influenza virus in patient seeking care for respiratory disease jakarta indonesia october 2011september 2012
processed_abstract: indonesia ha reported the most human infection with highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai ah5n1 virus worldwide we implemented enhanced surveillance in four outpatient clinic and six hospital for hpai h5n1 and seasonal influenza virus in east jakarta district to assess the public health impact of influenza in indonesia epidemiological and clinical data were collected from outpatient with influenzalike illness ili and hospitalized patient with severe acute respiratory infection sari respiratory specimen were obtained for influenza testing by realtime reverse transcriptionpolymerase chain reaction during october 2011september 2012 11313278 specimen from ili case 345 and 2761787 specimen from sari case 154 tested positive for seasonal influenza virus the prevalence of influenza virus infection wa highest during decembermay and the proportion testing positive wa 76 for ili and 36 for sari during their respective week of peak activity no hpai h5n1 virus infection were identified including hundred of ili and sari patient with recent poultry exposure whereas seasonal influenza wa an important contributor to acute respiratory disease in east jakarta overall 668 47 of influenza virus were influenza b 384 27 were ah1n1pdm09 and 359 25 were h3 while additional data over multiple year are needed our finding suggest that seasonal influenza prevention effort including influenza vaccination should target the month preceding the rainy season

processed_title: influenza a h5n1 virus from pig indonesia
processed_abstract: pig have long been considered potential intermediate host in which avian influenza virus can adapt to human to determine whether this potential exists for pig in indonesia we conducted surveillance during 20052009 we found that 52 pig in 4 province were infected during 20052007 but not 20082009 phylogenetic analysis showed that the virus had been introduced into the pig population in indonesia on at least 3 occasion one isolate had acquired the ability to recognize a humantype receptor no infected pig had influenzalike symptom indicating that influenza a h5n1 virus can replicate undetected for prolonged period facilitating avian virus adaptation to mammalian host our data suggest that pig are at risk for infection during outbreak of influenza virus a h5n1 and can serve a intermediate host in which this avian virus can adapt to mammal

processed_title: risk factor modelling of the spatiotemporal pattern of highly pathogenic avian influenza hpaiv h5n1 a review
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza virus hpaiv h5n1 continues to impact on smallholder livelihood to constrain development of the poultry production sector and to cause occasional human fatality hpai h5n1 outbreak have occurred in a variety of ecological system with economic agricultural and environmental difference this review aimed to identify common risk factor amongst spatial modelling study conducted in these different agroecological system and to identify gap in our understanding of the disease spatial epidemiology three type of variable with similar statistical association with hpai h5n1 presence across study and region were identified domestic waterfowl several anthropogenic variable human population density distance to road and indicator of water presence variable on socioeconomic condition poultry trade wild bird distribution and movement were comparatively rarely considered few study have analysed the hpai h5n1 distribution in country such a egypt and indonesia where hpaiv h5n1 continues to circulate extensively

processed_title: experimental and field result regarding immunity induced by a recombinant turkey herpesvirus h5 vector vaccine against h5n1 and other h5 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus challenge
processed_abstract: vaccination against h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza ai virus hpaiv is one of the possible complementary mean available for affected country to control ai when the disease ha become or with a high risk of becoming endemic efficacy of the vaccination against ai relies essentially but not exclusively on the capacity of the vaccine to induce immunity against the targeted virus which is prone to undergo antigenic variation a well a it capacity to overcome interference with maternal immunity transmitted by immunized breeding hen to their progeny this property of the vaccine is a prerequisite for it administration at the hatchery which assures higher and more reliable vaccine coverage of the population than vaccination at the farm a recombinant vector vaccine vectormuner ai based on turkey herpesvirus expressing the hemagglutinin gene of an h5n1 hpaiv a an insert ha been used in several experiment conducted in different research laboratory a well a in controlled field trial the result have demonstrated a high degree of homologous and cross protection against different genetic clade of the h5n1 hpaiv furthermore vaccineinduced immunity wa not impaired by the presence of passive immunity but on the contrary cumulated with it for improved early protection the demonstrated level of protection against the different challenge virus exhibited variation in term of postchallenge mortality a well a challenge virus shedding the data presented here highlight the advantage of this vaccine a a useful and reliable tool to complement biosecurity and sanitary policy for better controlling the disease due to hpaiv of h5 subtypes when the vaccination is applied a a control measure

processed_title: summary of avian influenza activity in europe asia and africa 20062009
processed_abstract: event during the period extending from 2006 to 2009 have been overshadowed by the ongoing panzootic with h5n1 highly pathogenic notifiable avian influenza hpnai which ha afflicted 63 country and three continent africa asia and europe during the review period two country indonesia and egypt have formally declared the disease endemic to the world organisation for animal health while others have used a variety of approach aimed at containment control and eradication these approach have achieved variable success but in 2009 several country that had previously declared themselves free of hpnai became reinfected in addition the virus continued to be detected widely in wild bird population even in the absence of local poultry outbreak other poultry outbreak with hpnai have been reported in south africa in ostrich with h5n2 in 2006 and the uk in chicken with h7n7 in 2008 also notable wa the report of h5n2 hpnai in wild bird population in north africa in 2007 improved active surveillance system and vigilance for notifiable avian influenza nai in domestic poultry especially in host grouping in which clinical sign following infection may be inapparent eg domestic waterfowl have inevitably resulted in the detection and reporting of other activity low pathogenicity nai h5 or h7 virus were isolateddetected from poultry in belgium h5n2 2008 chinese taipei h5n2 2008 denmark h5n2 2006 h7n1 2008 france h5n2 2007 germany h7n3 2008 italy h7n7 2006 h7n3 200708 the netherlands h7n7 2006 portugal h5n2 2007 h5n3 2007 the republic of korea h7n8 2007 h5n2 2008 and the uk h7n3 2006 h7n2 2007 in addition there ha also been significant activity with h6 and h9 virus in poultry population especially in asia

processed_title: immunogenicity and efficacy of fowlpoxvectored and inactivated avian influenza vaccine alone or in a primeboost schedule in chicken with maternal antibody
processed_abstract: inactivated and fowlpox virus fpvectored vaccine have been used to control h5 avian influenza ai in poultry in h5 ai endemic country breeder flock are vaccinated and therefore maternallyderived antibody mda are transferred to their progeny result of three immunogenicity and one efficacy study performed in bird with or without mda indicated that the immunogenicity of an inactivated vaccine based on a h5n9 ai isolate inh5n9 wa severely impaired in chick hatched from inh5n9vaccinated breeder this mda interference wa lower when breeder received only one administration of the same vaccine and could be overcome by priming the chick at dayofage with a live recombinant fpvectored vaccine with h5 avian influenza gene insert fpai the interference of antifp mda wa of lower intensity than the interference of antiai mda the highest interference observed on the primeboost immunogenicity wa in chick hatched from breeder vaccinated with the same primeboost scheme the level of protection against an antigenic variant h5n1 highly pathogenic ai isolate from indonesia against which the fpai or inh5n9 alone wa poorly protective could be circumvented by the primeboost regimen in bird with either fp or ai mda thus the immunogenicity of vaccine in young chick with mda depends on the vaccination scheme and the type of vaccine used in their parent flock the heterologous primeboost in bird with mda may at least partially overcome mda interference on inactivated vaccine

processed_title: demographic and ecological risk factor for human influenza a virus infection in rural indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia ha the world highest reported mortality for human infection with highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai ah5n1 virus indonesia is an agriculturally driven country where humananimal mixing is common and provides a unique environment for zoonotic influenza a virus transmission objective to identify potential demographic and ecological risk factor for human infection with seasonal influenza a virus in rural indonesia a populationbased study wa conducted in cileunyi and soreang subdistricts near bandung in western java from 2008 to 2011 method passive influenza surveillance with rtpcr confirmation of influenza a viral rna in respiratory specimen wa utilized for case ascertainment a population census and mapping were utilized for population data collection the presence of influenza ah3n2 and ah1n1pdm09 virus infection in a household wa modeled using generalized estimating equation result each additional child aged 5 year in a household increased the odds of h3n2 approximately 5 time or459 95ci 330624 and h1n1pdm09 by 35 time or353 95ci 251496 in addition the presence of 1630 bird in the house wa associated with an increased odds of h3n2 or508 95ci 2001292 and h1n1pdm09 or1251 95ci 6232513 conclusion our finding suggest an increase in influenza a virus infection in rural indonesian household with young child and poultry

processed_title: preclinical and clinical development of plantmade viruslike particle vaccine against avian h5n1 influenza
processed_abstract: the recent swine h1n1 influenza outbreak demonstrated that eggbased vaccine manufacturing ha an achilles heel it inability to provide a large number of dos quickly using a novel manufacturing platform based on transient expression of influenza surface glycoprotein in nicotiana benthamiana we have recently demonstrated that a candidate viruslike particle vlp vaccine can be generated within 3 week of release of sequence information herein we report that alumadjuvanted plantmade vlps containing the hemagglutinin ha protein of h5n1 influenza aindonesia505 can induce crossreactive antibody in ferret even low dos of this vaccine prevented pathology and reduced viral load following heterotypic lethal challenge we further report on safety and immunogenicity from a phase i clinical study of the plantmade h5 vlp vaccine in healthy adult 1860 year of age who received 2 dos 21 day apart of 5 10 or 20 microg of alumadjuvanted h5 vlp vaccine or placebo alum the vaccine wa well tolerated at all dos adverse event ae were mildtomoderate and selflimited pain at the injection site wa the most frequent ae reported in 70 of vaccinated subject versus 50 of the placebo recipient no allergic reaction were reported and the plantmade vaccine did not significantly increase the level of naturally occurring serum antibody to plantspecific sugar moiety the immunogenicity of the h5 vlp vaccine wa evaluated by hemagglutinationinhibition hi single radial hemolysis srh and microneutralisation mn result from these three assay were highly correlated and showed similar trend across dos there wa a clear doseresponse in all measure of immunogenicity and almost 96 of those in the higher dose group 2 x 10 or 20 microg mounted detectable mn response evidence of striking crossprotection in ferret combined with a good safety profile and promising immunogenicity in human suggest that plantbased vlp vaccine should be further evaluated for use in prepandemic or pandemic situation trial registration clinicaltrialsgov nct00984945

processed_title: safety reactogenicity and immunogenicity of inactivated monovalent influenza ah5n1 virus vaccine administered with or without as03 adjuvant
processed_abstract: background the national stockpile for influenza pandemic preparedness includes vaccine against an array of strain and adjuvant that could be utilized to induce immunologic priming a a pandemic wave emerges we assessed the feasibility of a strategy that allows the flexibility of postmanufacture mixture of vaccine and adjuvant at the point of care method we conducted a randomized doubleblind multicenter trial among healthy adult aged 1849 year who received 2 dos of inactivated influenza aindonesia052005 h5n1 clade 223 virus vaccine containing either 375 75 or 15 microg of hemagglutinin ha with or without as03 adjuvant administered 21 day apart subject were observed for local injection site and systemic reactogenicity and adverse event serum were tested for hemagglutination inhibition hai and microneutralization mn antibody level against the homologous strain and 4 heterologous avian strain result vaccine containing aso3 adjuvant wa associated with significantly more local reaction compared with nonadjuvanted vaccine but these were shortlived and resolved spontaneously although the immune response to nonadjuvanted vaccine wa poor 2 dos of as03adjuvanted vaccine containing a little a 375 microg of ha elicited robust immune response resulting in seroprotective titer 140 to the homologous strain in 86 of subject by hai and in 95 of subject by mn crossclade antibody response were also observed with as03adjuvanted vaccine but not nonadjuvanted vaccine conclusion as03 adjuvant formulated with inactivated vaccine at the administration site significantly enhanced the immune response to h5n1 vaccine and ha the potential to markedly improve vaccine response and accelerate delivery during an influenza pandemic clinical trial registration nct01317758

processed_title: experience in participatory surveillance and communitybased reporting system for h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza a case study approach
processed_abstract: participatory surveillance p is the application of participatory rural appraisal method to the collection of epidemiological information to inform decisionmaking and action it wa applied in africa and asia a part of emergency program to address the h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai pandemic the approach resulted in markedly increased case detection in country experiencing hpai and a better understanding of the epidemiological situation where hpai wa absent and p wa implemented the method did not result in false positive and contributed to the overall epidemiological assessment that the country wa free of disease it wa noted that clarity of surveillance objective and resulting data need at the outset wa essential to optimize the balance of surveillance method size of the program and cost the quality of training program and adherence to international guideline on good p training practice were important for assuring the competence of p practitioner orientation of senior decisionmakers wa an important step in assuring effective program management and appropriate use of result a a problemsolving methodology p is best used to rapidly assess situation and inform strategy several country continued p after the end of project and went on to apply p to other health challenge

processed_title: persistence of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus defined by agroecological niche
processed_abstract: the highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 virus ha spread across eurasia and into africa it persistence in a number of country continues to disrupt poultry production impairs smallholder livelihood and raise the risk a genotype adapted to humantohuman transmission may emerge while previous study identified domestic duck reservoir a a primary risk factor associated with hpai h5n1 persistence in poultry in southeast asia little is known of such factor in country with different agroecological condition and no study ha investigated the impact of such condition on hpai h5n1 epidemiology at the global scale this study explores the pattern of hpai h5n1 persistence worldwide and for china indonesia and india includes individual province that have reported hpai h5n1 presence during the 20042008 period multivariate analysis of a set of 14 agricultural environmental climatic and socioeconomic factor demonstrates in quantitative term that a combination of six variable discriminates the area with human case and persistence agricultural population density duck density duck by chicken density chicken density the product of agricultural population density and chicken outputinput ratio and purchasing power per caput the analysis identifies five agroecological cluster or niche representing varying degree of disease persistence the agroecological distance of all study area to the medoid of the niche with the greatest number of human case are used to map hpai h5n1 risk globally the result indicate that few country remain where hpai h5n1 would likely persist should it be introduced

processed_title: avian and pandemic human influenza policy in southeast asia the interface between economic and public health imperative
processed_abstract: the aim of this study wa to analyse the contemporary policy regarding avian and human pandemic influenza control in three southeast asia country thailand indonesia and vietnam an analysis of poultry vaccination policy wa used to explore the broader policy of influenza a h5n1 control in the region the policy of antiviral stockpiling with oseltamivir a scarce regional resource wa used to explore human pandemic influenza preparedness policy several policy analysis theory were applied to analyse the debate on the use of vaccination for poultry and stockpiling of antiviral drug in each country case study we conducted a comparative analysis across emergent theme the study found that whilst indonesia and vietnam introduced poultry vaccination programme thailand rejected this policy approach by contrast all three country adopted similar strategic policy for antiviral stockpiling in preparation in relation to highly pathogenic avian influenza economic imperative are of critical importance whilst thailand poultry industry is large and principally an export economy vietnam and indonesia are for domestic consumption the introduction of a poultry vaccination policy in thailand would have threatened it potential to trade and had a major impact on it economy powerful domestic stakeholder in vietnam and indonesia by contrast were concerned less about international trade and more about maintaining a healthy domestic poultry population evidence on vaccination wa drawn upon differently depending upon strategic economic positioning either to support or oppose the policy with influenza a h5n1 endemic in some country of the region these policy difference raise question around regional coherence of policy and the pursuit of an agreed overarching goal be that eradication or mitigation moreover whilst economic imperative have been critically important in guiding policy formulation in the agriculture sector question arise regarding whether agriculture sectoral policy is coherent with public health sectoral policy across the region

processed_title: evolutionary dynamic and emergence of panzootic h5n1 influenza virus
processed_abstract: the highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 virus lineage ha undergone extensive genetic reassortment with virus from different source to produce numerous h5n1 genotype and also developed into multiple genetically distinct sublineages in china from there the virus ha spread to over 60 country the ecological success of this virus in diverse specie of both poultry and wild bird with frequent introduction to human suggests that it is a likely source of the next human pandemic therefore the evolutionary and ecological characteristic of it emergence from wild bird into poultry are of considerable interest here we apply the latest analytical technique to infer the early evolutionary dynamic of h5n1 virus in the population from which it emerged wild bird and domestic poultry by estimating the time of most recent common ancestor of each gene segment we show that the h5n1 prototype virus wa likely introduced from wild bird into poultry a a nonreassortant low pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus and wa not generated by reassortment in poultry in contrast more recent h5n1 genotype were generated locally in aquatic poultry after the prototype virus agooseguangdong196 introduction occurred ie they were not a result of additional emergence from wild bird we show that the h5n1 virus wa introduced into indonesia and vietnam 36 month prior to detection of the first outbreak in those country population dynamic analysis revealed a rapid increase in the genetic diversity of agooseguangdong196 lineage virus from mid1999 to early 2000 our result suggest that the transmission of reassortant virus through the mixed poultry population in farm and market in china ha selected hpai h5n1 virus that are well adapted to multiple host and reduced the interspecies transmission barrier of those virus

processed_title: purification immunoglobulin yolk anti avian influenza h5n1 in poultry using hydrophobic interaction chromatography
processed_abstract: avian influenza is a significant threat to the poultry industry and it ha become an outbreak in many country because of it mortality and morbidity concern about the history of avian influenza outbreak ha prompted all country to enhance their independence in pharmaceutical and biological component a a preparedness measure for any potential occurrence the production of antibody such a igy is a potential alternative the potential of igy biomaterials can be utilized a bioreceptors in diagnostic tool this research aimed to purify igy antiavian influenza h5n1 produced from chicken egg igy antiavian influenza h5n1 can be obtained from chicken vaccinated at 05 ml per bird dose using inactivated h5n1 vaccine with a purification stage from graded peg hydrophobic interaction chromatography and concentrated using an ultrafilter the present study show that the igy antiavian influenza h5n1 can be obtained from chicken vaccinated with an inactivated h5n1 vaccine from 4 chicken egg with a total protein content of 4001 mg it ha biological activity with hi titer activity of 49152 hi unit and a recovery value of 24 with hydrophobic interaction chromatography therefore the purification process with hydrophobic interaction chromatography doe not remove the igy biological antibody further development will be required to perform antibody potency a a bioreceptor for diagnostic purpose

processed_title: comparative efficacy of north american and antigenically matched reverse genetics derived h5n9 diva marker vaccine against highly pathogenic asian h5n1 avian influenza virus in chicken
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic hp h5n1 avian influenza ha become endemic in several country in asia and africa and vaccination is being widely used a a control tool however there is a need for efficacious vaccine preferably utilizing a diva differentiate infected from vaccinated animal marker strategy to allow for improved surveillance of influenza in vaccinated poultry using a reverse genetics approach we generated asian rgh5n9 vaccine strain deriving the hemagglutinin gene from achickenindonesia72003 h5n1 with modification of the cleavage site to be low pathogenic lp and n9 neuraminidase gene from the north american lp aturkeywisconsin1968 h5n9 virus the recombinant rgh5n9 aturkeywisconsin1968 h5n9 achickenhidalgo2321994 h5n2 and wild type hp achickenindonesia72003 h5n1 virus were used to prepare inactivated oilemulsified whole virus vaccine two week after vaccination chicken were challenged with either asian hp h5n1 virus achickenindonesia72003 who clade 21 or achickensupranburi thailand22004 who clade 10 the h5 ha1 of the north american vaccine strain exhibited 12 amino acid difference including amino acid change in the major antigenic site a compared to the asian hp h5n1 challenge virus serologically exhibited substantial antigenic difference but still provided 100 protection from mortality however challenge virus shedding wa significantly higher in chicken immunized with antigenically distinct american lineage vaccine a compared to the antigenically matched asian rgh5n9 and the wild type asian h5n1 vaccine the antibody response to the heterologous subtype neuraminidase protein were discriminated in vaccinated and infected chicken using a rapid fluorescent 24methylumbelliferylalphadnacetylneuraminic acid sodium salt a substrate for neuraminidase inhibition assay this study demonstrates the value of using a vaccine containing antigenically matched h5 hemagglutinin for control of hp h5n1 avian influenza in poultry and the potential utility of a heterologous neuraminidase a a diva marker

processed_title: susceptibility of highly pathogenic ah5n1 avian influenza virus to the neuraminidase inhibitor and adamantanes
processed_abstract: since 2003 highly pathogenic ah5n1 influenza virus have been the cause of largescale death in poultry and the subsequent infection and death of over 140 human a group of 55 influenza ah5n1 virus isolated from various region of south east asia between 2004 and 2006 were tested for their susceptibility to the antiinfluenza drug the neuraminidase inhibitor and adamantanes the majority of strain were found to be fully sensitive to the neuraminidase inhibitor oseltamivir carboxylate zanamivir and peramivir however two strain demonstrated increased ic50 value sequence analysis of these strain revealed mutation in the normally highly conserved residue 116 and 117 of the n1 neuraminidase sequence analysis of the m2 gene showed that all of the ah5n1 virus from vietnam malaysia and cambodia contained mutation l26i and s31n associated with resistance to the adamantane drug rimantadine and amantadine while strain from indonesia were found to be a mix of both adamantane resistant s31n and sensitive virus none of the ah5n1 virus from myanmar contained mutation known to confer adamantane resistance these result support the use of neuraminidase inhibitor a the most appropriate class of antiviral drug to prevent or treat human ah5n1 virus infection

processed_title: seroprevalence of avian influenza ah5n1 among poultry farmer in rural indonesia 2007
processed_abstract: since 2003 about a third 150 case of human case of highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai ah5n1 worldwide are reported from indonesia we measured the seroprevalence of h5n1 among indonesian poultry farmer and assessed the risk factor for and knowledge of h5n1 infection in 2007 poultry worker and farm resident were interviewed about risk factor for knowledge of and then examined for the seropositivity of h5n1 virus four hundred ninetyfive of 622 farmer 80 from 12 farm participated in the study of these 71 were male with a median age of 29 year none tested positive for h5n1 virus mask were never worn by 54 of participant 86 were afraid of becoming infected for the preceding six month 1 farm wa confirmed a having poultry infected with h5n1 virus no evidence of subclinical infection with avian influenza ah5n1 virus wa found among poultry farmer although exposure of the farmer to this virus may have been limited however we recommend sustaining ongoing surveillance and control effort

processed_title: genetic characterization of h5n1 influenza virus isolated from chicken in indonesia in 2010
processed_abstract: since 2003 highly pathogenic h5n1 avian influenza virus have caused outbreak among poultry in indonesia every year producing the highest number of human victim worldwide however little is known about the h5n1 influenza virus that have been circulating there in recent year we therefore conducted surveillance study and isolated eight h5n1 virus from chicken phylogenic analysis of their hemagglutinin and neuraminidase gene revealed that all eight virus belonged to clade 213 however on the basis of nucleotide difference these virus could be divided into two group other virus genetically closely related to these two group of virus were all indonesian isolates suggesting that these new isolates have been evolving within indonesia among these virus two distinct virus circulated in the kalimantan island during the same season in 2010 our data reveal the continued evolution of h5n1 virus in indonesia

processed_title: neuraminidasebased recombinant viruslike particle protect against lethal avian influenza ah5n1 virus infection in ferret
processed_abstract: avian influenza a h5n1 virus represent a growing threat for an influenza pandemic the presence of widespread avian influenza virus infection further emphasizes the need for vaccine strategy for control of prepandemic h5n1 and other avian influenza subtypes influenza neuraminidase na vaccine represent a potential strategy for improving vaccine against avian influenza h5n1 virus to evaluate a strategy for na vaccination we generated a recombinant influenza viruslike particle vlp vaccine comprised of the na protein of aindonesia052005 h5n1 virus ferret vaccinated with influenza n1 na vlps elicited hightiter serum nainhibition ni antibody titer and were protected from lethal challenge with aindonesia052005 virus moreover n1immune ferret shed less infectious virus than similarly challenged control animal in contrast ferret administered control n2 na vlps were not protected against h5n1 virus challenge these result provide support for continued development of nabased vaccine against influenza h5n1 virus

processed_title: molecular analysis of hemagglutinin1 fragment of avian influenza h5n1 virus isolated from chicken farm in indonesia from 2008 to 2010
processed_abstract: highly pathogenic avian influenza virus of subtype h5n1 aivh5n1 ha been circulating in indonesia since 2003 to understand the genetic diversity of these virus and to predict vaccine efficacy the hemaglutinin1 ha1 fragment of virus isolated from chicken farm in indonesia from 2008 to 2010 wa sequenced and analyzed the effect of these molecular change were investigated in challenge experiment and hi assay of homologous and heterologous strain molecular analysis showed that these aivh5n1 isolates had evolved into three distinct sublineages from an ancestor circulating since 2003 although no significant positive selection of residue wa detected 12 negatively selected site were identified p005 moreover four site showed evidence of significant episodic diversifying selection the finding indicated complete protectivity and high hi titer with homologous strain compared with protectivity ranging from 40 to 100 and lower hi titer with heterologous strain resulting from polymorphism at antigenic site our finding provide valuable insight into the molecular evolution of aiv and have important implication for vaccine efficacy and future vaccination strategy

processed_title: participatory disease surveillance and response in indonesia strengthening veterinary service and empowering community to prevent and control highly pathogenic avian influenza
processed_abstract: the participatory disease surveillance and response pdsr approach to highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai in indonesia ha evolved significantly from the participatory disease surveillance pd system developed for rinderpest eradication in africa and pakistan the first phase of the pdsr project emphasized the detection and control of hpai by separate pd and participatory disease response team primarily in sector 4 poultry at the household level lesson learned during the first phase were taken into account in the design of the second phase of the project which ha sought to further strengthen management of disease prevention and control activity by improving technical approach increasing active participation of key stakeholder including local and central government and focusing on the village level the ongoing evolution of the pdsr program aim to establish a sustainable communitybased program within provincial and district livestock service that enhances the prevention and control of not only hpai but also other zoonotic and priority animal disease

processed_title: summary of avian influenza activity in europe asia africa and australasia 20022006
processed_abstract: between december 2003 and january 2004 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai h5n1 infection of poultry were declared in china japan south korea lao thailand cambodia vietnam and indonesia in 2004 an outbreak wa reported in malaysia in 2005 h5n1 outbreak were recorded in poultry in russia kazakhstan mongolia romania turkey and ukraine and virus wa isolated from swan in croatia in 2004 hpai h5n1 virus wa isolated from smuggled eagle detected at the brussels airport and in 2005 imported caged bird held in quarantine in england in 2006 hpai wa reported in poultry in iraq india azerbaijan pakistan myanmar afghanistan and israel in asia albania france and sweden in europe and nigeria cameroon and niger in africa a well a in wild bird in some 24 country across asia and europe in 2003 over 25000000 bird were slaughtered because of 241 outbreak of hpai caused by virus of h7n7 subtype in the netherlands the virus spread into belgium eight outbreak and germany one outbreak hpai h5n2 virus wa responsible for outbreak in ostrich in south africa during 2005 hpai h7n3 virus wa isolated in pakistan in 2004 lowpathogenicity avian influenza lpai h5 or h7 virus were isolated from poultry in italy h7n3 20022003 h5n2 2005 the netherlands h7n3 2002 france h5n2 2003 denmark h5n7 2003 taiwan h5n2 2004 and japan h5n2 2005 many isolation of lpai virus of other subtypes were reported from domestic and wild bird infection with h9n2 subtype virus have been widespread across asia during 200206

processed_title: silent spread of highly pathogenic avian influenza h5n1 virus amongst vaccinated commercial layer
processed_abstract: the aim of this study wa to determine whether a single vaccination of commercial layer type chicken with an inactivated vaccine containing highly pathogenic avian influenza virus strain h5n1 achickenlegok2003 carried out on the farm wa sufficient to protect against infection with the homologous virus strain a transmission experiment wa carried out with pair of chicken of which one wa inoculated with h5n1 virus and the other contactexposed result showed that the majority of the vaccinated bird developed haemagglutination inhibition hi titre below 4log2 no clinical sign were observed in the vaccinated bird and virus shedding wa limited however nearly all vaccinated bird showed a fourfold or higher increase of hi titre after challenge or contactexposure which is an indication of infection this implies that virus transmission most likely ha occurred this study showed that a single vaccination applied under field condition induced clinical protection but wa insufficient to induce protection against virus transmission suggesting that silent spread of virus in vaccinated commercial flock may occur

processed_title: a molecular and antigenic survey of h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza virus isolates from smallholder duck farm in central java indonesia during 20072008
processed_abstract: background indonesia is one of the country most severely affected by h5n1 highly pathogenic avian influenza hpai virus in term of poultry and human health however there is little information on the diversity of h5n1 virus circulating in backyard farm where chicken and duck often intermingle in this study h5n1 virus infection occurring in 96 smallholder duck farm in central java indonesia from 20072008 wa investigated and the molecular and antigenic characteristic of h5n1 virus isolated from these farm were analysed result all 84 characterised virus belonged to h5n1 clade 21 with three virus sublineages being identified clade 211 1 clade 213 80 and idn605like virus 3 that did not belong to any of the present clade all three clade were found in duck while only clade 213 wa isolated from chicken there were no significant amino acid mutation of the hemagglutinin ha and neuraminidase na site of the virus including the receptor binding glycosylation antigenic and catalytic site and na inhibitor target all the virus had polybasic amino acid at the ha cleavage site no evidence of major antigenic variant wa detected based on the ha gene identical virus variant could be found on different farm across the study site and multiple genetic variant could be isolated from hpai outbreak simultaneously or at different time point from single farm hpai virus wa isolated from both duck and chicken however the proportion of surviving duck case wa considerably higher than in chicken conclusion the 213 clade wa the most common lineage found in this study all the virus had sequence characteristic of hpai but negligible variation in other recognized amino acid at the ha and na protein which determine virus phenotype multiple genetic variant appeared to be circulating simultaneously within poultry community the high proportion of live duck case compared to chicken over the study period suggests that duck are more likely to survive infection and they may better suit the role of longterm maintenance host for h5n1 a some virus were isolated from dead bird there wa no clear correlation between genetic variation and pathogenicity of these virus

processed_title: outbreak of avian influenza a h5n1 in asia and interim recommendation for evaluation and reporting of suspected casesunited state 2004
processed_abstract: during december 2003february 2004 outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza a h5n1 among poultry were reported in cambodia china indonesia japan lao south korea thailand and vietnam a of february 9 2004 a total of 23 case of laboratoryconfirmed influenza a h5n1 virus infection in human resulting in 18 death had been reported in thailand and vietnam in addition approximately 100 suspected case in human are under investigation by national health authority in thailand and vietnam cdc the world health organization who and national health authority in asian country are working to assess and monitor the situation provide epidemiologic and laboratory support and assist with control effort this report summarizes information about the human infection and avian outbreak in asia and provides recommendation to guide influenza a h5n1 surveillance diagnosis and testing in the united state

processed_title: inactivated north american and european h5n2 avian influenza virus vaccine protect chicken from asian h5n1 high pathogenicity avian influenza virus
processed_abstract: highpathogenicity hp avian influenza ai virus of the h5n1 subtype ha caused an unprecedented epizootic in bird within nine asian countriesregions since it wa first reported in 1996 vaccination ha emerged a a tool for use in managing the infection in view of future eradication this study wa undertaken to determine whether two divergent h5n2 commercial vaccine strain one based on a european and the other a north american lowpathogenicity ai virus could protect chicken against a recent asian h5n1 hpai virus the north american and european vaccine virus had 84 and 91 deduced amino acid sequence similarity to the ha1 segment of haemagglutinin protein of indonesia h5n1 hpai challenge virus respectively both vaccine strain provided complete protection from clinical sign and death the vaccine reduced the number of chicken infected and shedding virus from the respiratory and intestinal tract at the peak of virus replication in addition the quantity of virus shed wa reduced by 104 to 105 median embryo infectious dos the use of specific neuraminidase inhibition test allowed identification of infected chicken within the vaccinated group these data indicate that the currently available h5 vaccine of european and north american lineage will protect chicken against the asian h5n1 hpai virus and reduce environmental contamination by the h5n1 hpai virus they will be an adjunct to biosecurity measure to reduce virus transmission

processed_title: reemerging trend of mpox infection the indonesia experience and review
processed_abstract: background since monkeypox mpox had an outbreak on 6th may 2022 in 75 country it ha been declared by the world health organization who that mpox is a public health of international emergency concern pheic who declared mpox a pheic again in august 204 indonesia wa also affected by the mpox outbreak with most of the case coming from vulnerable population this study aimed to give an overview of mpox a well a the recent outbreak situation and management in indonesia method in this narrative review using pubmed scopus and cochrane database combined with country national official report and grey literature we discussed an overview of mpox including epidemiology morphology transmission symptom treatment and prevention the management of mpox in indonesia wa specifically reviewed result mpox is an infectious disease caused by the mpox virus which ha infected 79231 individual globally in indonesia the first mpox case wa detected in august 2022 with 0 death and 88 confirmed case a of august 2024 the virus is transmitted via respiratory droplet or direct contact with contaminated object surface or mucocutaneous lesion of an infected individual which could lead to symptom such a epidermal papulespustules and clinical characteristic of classical smallpox although antiviral such a tecovirimat cidofovir and brincidofovir have been raised a potential treatment for mpox these agent were only considered in severe case in indonesia conclusion mpox is a contagious disease that could cause major health problem if left uncontrolled especially in specific vulnerable population due to it high morbidity and mortality therefore particular measure must be performed especially in indonesia

processed_title: mpox skin lesion
processed_abstract: mpox is caused by the monkeypox virus which belongs to the orthopoxvirus genus and poxviridae family the monkeypox virus wa first identified a a cause of disease in human in the 1970s in the democratic republic of the congo mpox wa considered endemic in several african country a global outbreak of mpox wa first recognized in europe in may 2022 and wa declared a public health emergency of international concern on july 23 2022 the first reported mpox case in indonesia wa in october 2022 which wa identified a an imported case there were no new confirmed mpox case until 13 october 2023 since then there were 72 case of confirmed mpox case in indonesia by the end of 2023 distributed across 6 province mostly in the java islandwe present two different spectrum of mpox skin lesion in patient living with hiv with a positive polymerase chain reaction test for mpox the first patient is a 48yearold male who developed a maculopapular lesion that wa initially noticed on the face the lesion were then spread to the back and hand he identifies a men who have sex with men and living with hiv for the past 18 year there were no lesion on the genitalia or mucosa the second patient is a 28yearold male the initial symptom wa fever followed by skin lesion after around 1 week of fever the lesion initially appears a pustule on the face and then spread throughout the whole body the lesion also grow larger and become pseudopustules and ulcer there were also mucosal involvement in the mouth making oral intake difficult this patient also identified a men who have sex with men with multiple partner hiv status wa not known at the initial presentation hiv screening wa done with positive result

processed_title: monkeypox immune response vaccination and preventive effort
processed_abstract: infectious threat to human are continuously emerging the 2022 worldwide monkeypox outbreak is the latest of these threat with the virus rapidly spreading to 106 country by the end of september 2022 the burden of the ongoing monkeypox outbreak is manifested by 68000 cumulative confirmed case and 26 death although monkeypox is usually a selflimited disease patient can suffer from extremely painful skin lesion and complication can occur with reported mortality the antigenic similarity between the smallpox virus variola virus and monkeypox virus can be utilized to prevent monkeypox using smallpox vaccine treatment is also based on antiviral initially designed to treat smallpox however further study are needed to fully decipher the immune response to monkeypox virus and the immune evasion mechanism in this review we provide an uptodate discussion of the current state of knowledge regarding monkeypox virus with a special focus on innate immune response immune evasion mechanism and vaccination against the virus

processed_title: monkeypox a comprehensive review
processed_abstract: the 2022 multicountry monkeypox outbreak in human ha brought new public health adversity on top of the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 pandemic the disease ha spread to 104 country throughout six continent of the world with the highest burden in north america and europe the etiologic agent monkeypox virus mpxv ha been known since 1959 after isolation from infected monkey and virulence among human ha been reported since the 1970s mainly in endemic country in west and central africa however the disease ha reemerged in 2022 at an unprecedented pace with particular concern on it humantohuman transmissibility and community spread in nonendemic region a a mitigation effort healthcare worker public health policymakers and the general public worldwide need to be wellinformed on this relatively neglected viral disease here we provide a comprehensive and uptodate overview of monkeypox including the following aspect epidemiology etiology pathogenesis clinical feature diagnosis and management in addition the current review discusses the preventive and control measure the latest vaccine development and the future research area in this reemerging viral disease that wa declared a a public health emergency of international concern

processed_title: exploring the potential treatment for mpox
processed_abstract: monkeypox mpox is a virus that originally infected only animal caused by the monkeypox virus this infection present with symptom similar to smallpox although two year have passed since the 2022 outbreak new case continue to emerge monthly initially human case of mpox were confined to outbreak in central and western africa however the virus ha recently spread globally possibly due to a decline in vaccination rate in this context evidence for effective therapy such a antiviral is urgently needed three antiviralstecovirimat brincidofovir and cidofovirare known to have activity against the mpox virus their use is currently limited to expanded access for treating nonvariola orthopoxvirus infection with ongoing phase 3 trial this review will discus the mechanism of action clinical use and efficacy of these antiviral

processed_title: prevention and treatment of monkeypox a systematic review of preclinical study
processed_abstract: the outbreak of monkeypox coupled with the onslaught of the covid19 pandemic is a critical communicable disease this study aimed to systematically identify and review research done on preclinical study focusing on the potential monkeypox treatment and immunization the presented juxtaposition of efficacy of potential treatment and vaccination that had been tested in preclinical trial could serve a a useful primer of monkeypox virus the literature identified using key term such a monkeypox virus or management or vaccine stringed using boolean operator wa systematically reviewed pubmed scopus cochrane and preprint database were used and screening wa performed in accordance with prisma guideline a total of 467 result from registered database and 116 from grey literature database were screened of these result 72 study from registered database and three grey literature study underwent fulltext screening for eligibility in this systematic review a total of 27 article were eligible according to the inclusion criterion and were used tecovirimat known a tpoxx or st246 is an antiviral drug indicated for smallpox infection whereas brincidofovir inhibits the viral dna polymerase after incorporation into viral dna the ability of tecovirimat in providing protection to poxviruschallenged animal from death had been demonstrated in a number of animal study noninferior with regard to immunogenicity wa reported for the live smallpoxmonkeypox vaccine compared with a single dose of a licensed live smallpox vaccine the trial involving the live vaccine showed a geometric mean titre of vaccinianeutralizing antibody post two week of the second dose of the live smallpoxmonkeypox vaccine of note up to the third generation of smallpox vaccinesparticularly jynneos and lc16m8have been developed a preventive measure for mpxv infection and these vaccine had been demonstrated to have improved safety compared to the earlier generation

processed_title: knowledge attitude and worry in the kurdistan region of iraq during the mpox monkeypox outbreak in 2022 an online crosssectional study
processed_abstract: the rapid spread of monkeypox mpox ha been declared a a public health emergency of international concern pheic the present study aimed to assess the knowledge attitude and worry level of the general population in the kurdistan region of iraq regarding the ongoing mpox multicountry outbreak an online crosssectional survey wa conducted between 2730 july 2022 using a convenience sampling method the questionnaire wa adapted from previous study addressing the same topic the independent student ttest oneway anova and logistic regression were used to assess possible factor associated with knowledge attitude and worry toward mpox a total of 510 respondent were included in the final analysis the participant showed a moderate level of mpox knowledge a neutral attitude towards mpox and a relatively moderate worry level the logistic regression analysis showed that age gender marital status religion level of education and place of residence were associated with mpox knowledge however the significant variable in the multivariate regression analysis were gender religion level of education and residential area gender and residential area were associated with attitude toward mpox however the significant variable in the multivariate regression analysis were gender and residential area the worry toward mpox wa influenced by gender marital status religion and place of residence yet the significant variable in the multivariate regression analysis were gender religion educational level and residential area in conclusion the kurdish population had moderate knowledge a neutral attitude and a moderate level of worry about mpox considering the continuous rapid rise in mpox case in several country and it possible risk a pandemic amid the ongoing covid19 pandemic proactive control measure adequate disease prevention strategy and preparedness plan need to be formulated and immediately implemented to tackle the appearance of fear among people and to safeguard the mental health of the public

processed_title: challenge and strategy for controlling indonesia emerging and reemerging infection disease eidreids
processed_abstract: this review aim to highlight the occurrence of several emerging and reemerging infectious disease particularly 13 type under surveillance of indonesia emerging contagious disease task force these disease are considered potentially epidemic due to the nature of tropical climate and high humidity of indonesia area several factor contribute to the emergence of these disease in conjunction with human behavior most of these disease are zoonotic specifically spread by virus the latest emerging infectious disease in indonesia is monkeypox controlling the management of eidreids present a major obstacle for international health initiative particularly in indonesia because of it extensive population varied geographical landscape and constrained resource overcoming these obstacle demand tactic like prioritizing indonesian policy bolstering disease monitoring system upgrading diagnostic capacity fortifying public health facility fostering community involvement and education and executing efficient prevention and management protocol these strategy should be implemented in collaboration with international partner and organization to effectively control and prevent the spread of emerging and reemerging infectious disease in indonesia

processed_title: monkeypox diagnosis in clinical setting a comprehensive review of best laboratory practice
processed_abstract: an outbreak of monkeypox mpox wa reported in more than 40 country in early 2022 accurate diagnosis of mpox can be challenging but history clinical finding and laboratory diagnosis can establish the diagnosis the preanalytic phase of testing includes collecting storing and transporting specimen it is advised to swab the lesion site with virus transport medium vtm containing dacron or polyester flock swab from two different site blood urine and semen sample may also be used timely sampling is necessary to obtain a sufficient amount of virus or antibody the analytical phase of infectious disease control involves diagnostic tool to determine the presence of the virus while polymerase chain reaction pcr is the gold standard for detecting mpox genome sequencing is for identifying new or modified virus a a complement to these method isothermal amplification method have been designed elisa assay are also available for the determination of antibody electron microscopy is another effective diagnostic method for tissue identification of the virus wastewater fingerprinting provides some of the most effective diagnostic method for virus identification at the community level the advantage and disadvantage of these method are further discussed postanalytic phase requires proper interpretation of test result and the preparation of accurate patient report that include relevant medical history clinical guideline and recommendation for followup testing or treatment

processed_title: gastrointestinal symptom of monkeypox infection a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: since early may 2022 outbreak of monkeypox mpox case have emerged and become a global concern study exploring the gastrointestinal symptom andor liver injury of mpox are still very limited this systematic review and metaanalysis is the first to summarize the gastrointestinal symptom reported by mpox patient we searched for mpox study published until october 21 2022 in medline embase scopus and organization website mpox study were observational study that reported at least one of either gastrointestinal symptom andor liver injury in mpox patient metaanalysis wa done to obtain the pooled prevalence of gastrointestinal symptom in mpox patient subgroup analysis were done based on the study location age group and mpox clade the quality of included study wa assessed using the nih quality assessment tool overall 31 study that reported gastrointestinal symptom andor liver injury in mpox patient were included the reported gastrointestinal symptom were abdominal pain anorexia diarrhea nausea and vomiting there is a lack of reporting for liver injury the most prevalent gastrointestinal symptom in mpox patient were anorexia 47 95 confidence interval ci 4153 followed by vomiting 12 95 ci 1113 nausea 10 95 ci 911 abdominal pain 9 95 ci 810 and diarrhea 5 95 ci 46 additionally the prevalence of proctitis rectalanal pain and rectal bleeding were 11 95 ci 1112 25 95 ci 2427 and 12 95 ci 1113 respectively anorexia wa the most frequently reported gastrointestinal symptom in mpox patient followed by vomiting nausea abdominal pain and diarrhea proctitis is a novel presentation of mpox in the 2022 outbreak

processed_title: navigating monkeypox identifying risk and implementing solution
processed_abstract: monkeypox is a zoonotic disease caused by the orthopox virus a doublestranded dna virus that belongs the poxviridae virus family it is known to infect both animal especially monkey and rodent and human and cause a rash similar to smallpox human can become infected with monkeypox virus mpxv when they get in close contact with infected animal zoonotic transmission or other infected people humanhuman transmission through their body fluid such a mucus saliva or even skin sore frequently observed symptom of this disease include fever headache muscle ache and a rash that initially look like a tiny bump before becoming a lump that is filled with fluid monkeypox symptom also include an incubation period of 521 day divided into prodromal and eruption phase several contributing factor such a smallpox vaccine discontinuation widespread intake of infected animal product a a source of protein and high population density amongst others have been linked to an increase in the frequency of monkeypox outbreak the best course of action for diagnosing individual who may be suffering from active monkeypox is to collect a sample of skin from the lesion and perform pcr molecular testing monkeypox doe not presently have a specific therapy however supportive care can assist in managing symptom such a medication to lower body temperature and pain three major orthopoxvirus vaccine have been approved to serve a a preventive measure against monkeypox lc16 jynneos and acam2000 the discovery that the monkeypox outbreak is communicable both among human and within a population ha sparked new public health worry on the possibility of the outbreak of another viral pandemic research and study are still being conducted to gain a deeper understanding of this zoonotic viral disease this review is therefore focused on deciphering monkeypox it etiology pathogenesis transmission risk factor and control

processed_title: epidemiological and clinical characteristic of mpox in jakarta indonesia during october 2023 to february 2024
processed_abstract: objective mpox a zoonotic disease ha emerged a a significant international public health concern due to an increase in the number of case diagnosed in nonendemic country to support public health response effort to interrupt mpox transmission in the community this study aim to identify epidemiological and clinical aspect of mpox in jakarta indonesia method the study collected mpox data from the provincial health department in jakarta indonesia from october 2023 to february 2024 this included the symptom characteristic and demographic of polymerase chain reaction pcrconfirmed and pcrnegative mpox case which were then compared using the chi2 test result of the pcrconfirmed total of 58 mpox case most were male 966 5658 of these 672 3958 reported recent sexual activity within the 21 day prior to the disease onset date with 414 2458 reporting only 1 sexual partner during that period among pcrconfirmed mpox case common symptom included fever 811 4758 rash 638 3758 and lesion 931 5458 conclusion the predominance of male mpox case indicates transmission within men who have sex with men msm network while higher prevalence among individual with hiv or syphilis is due to shared behavior highlighting the need for surveillance contact tracing and targeted public health intervention

processed_title: global prevalence and determinant associated with the acceptance of monkeypox vaccination
processed_abstract: assessing the acceptance of the monkeypox vaccine is crucial for the success of vaccination program yet the prevalence report remain inconclusive the aim of this study wa to determine the global prevalence of monkeypox vaccine acceptance and identify it associated factor a metaanalysis wa conducted with a comprehensive search strategy on the following database including scopus embase and pubmed for article published up to april 5 2024 this study utilizes a singlearm metaanalysis to calculate the pooled prevalence of monkeypox vaccine acceptance a ztest wa employed to identify factor associated with the vaccine acceptance our study analyzed 51 article encompassing 98746 participant revealing an overall monkeypox vaccine acceptance rate of 65 notably the highest acceptance rate were observed among men who have sex with men msms while healthcare worker hcws showed the lowest acceptance rate additionally our finding indicated an increased acceptance in individual with educational attainment beyond a bachelor degree a history of covid19 and influenza vaccination homosexual orientation and hivpositive status conversely lower acceptance risk wa associated with those with educational attainment below a bachelor degree heterosexual orientation and bisexual orientation in conclusion our current study ha determined the rate of monkeypox vaccine acceptance and identified it associated factor these finding offer valuable insight a the foundation for targeted policy to manage and increase acceptance rate

processed_title: overcoming stigma the human side of monkeypox virus
processed_abstract: monkeypox mpox virus is a zoonotic disease that wa recently declared a public health emergency of international concern pheic by the world health organization who symptom of mpox include fever headache muscle pain and a rash which start on the face and spread to the rest of the body the stigma surrounding the mpox virus ha been one of the greatest challenge in dealing with the disease people with mpox have been often shunned by their community and many are afraid to seek medical care for fear of ostracism for those affected by the virus this stigma can significantly impact their mental health and quality of life it is further fueled by misinformation and societal norm hence a multifaceted approach that includes education awareness campaign and community engagement is needed to overcome the stigma associated with mpox effective communication strategy are critical to the dispelling of rumor and the reduction of fear interventional measure need to be shaped according to the need of those affected

processed_title: diabetes mellitus lesson from covid19 for monkeypox infection
processed_abstract: background and aim type 2 diabetes mellitus is known to be linked to malfunctioning antiviral defense however it association with the severity of monkeypox is poorly understood in this review we discus key immunological mechanism in the antiviral response affected by poor glucose control that could impact the susceptibility and severity of monkeypox infection leading to a heightened emphasis on the use of the available antidiabetic drug method we searched pubmed and google scholar for article published from january 1985 to august 2022 no criterion for publication data were set and all article in english were included result currently there are no study about the risk or consequence of monkeypox infection in the diabetic population a high incidence of diabetes is reported in country such a china india pakistan eua indonesia brazil mexico bangladesh japan and egypt where unfortunately imported case of monkeypox have been reported and the infection continues to spread conclusion high incidence of diabetes together with the cessation of smallpox vaccination ha left large number of the human population unprotected against monkeypox the best option for the population remains confined to the prevention of infection a well a the use of hypoglycemic agent that have also been shown to improve immune mechanism associated with viral protection

processed_title: monkeypox outbreak 2022 what we know so far and it potential drug target and management strategy
processed_abstract: monkeypox is a rare zoonotic disease caused by infection with the monkeypox virus the disease can result in flulike symptom fever and a persistent rash the disease is currently spreading throughout the world and prevention and treatment effort are being intensified although there is no treatment that ha been specifically approved for monkeypox virus infection infected patient may benefit from using certain antiviral medication that are typically prescribed for the treatment of smallpox the drug are tecovirimat brincidofovir and cidofovir all of which are currently in short supply due to the spread of the monkeypox virus resistance is also a concern a widespread replication of the monkeypox virus can lead to mutation that produce monkeypox virus that are resistant to the currently available treatment this article discusses monkeypox disease potential drug target and management strategy to overcome monkeypox disease with the discovery of new drug it is hoped that the problem of insufficient drug will be resolved and it is not anticipated that drug resistance will become a major issue in the near future

processed_title: epidemiology and clinical feature of mpox in jakarta indonesia august 2022december 2023
processed_abstract: backgroundobjective this study explores the epidemiology and clinical feature of reemerging mpox in jakarta indonesia method this study used a retrospective study design to describe the epidemiological data clinical feature and mortality of mpox patient from august 2022 to december 2023 in addition this study also aim to identify the difference in both the epidemiology and clinical feature of mpox in people living with hiv plhiv and in nonhiv patient nonplhiv result our study show that a of the end of december 2023 59 mpox case were treated in jakarta all of the mpox case in jakarta were diagnosed in male mainly found in msm 915 and plhiv 78 most patient would manifest with fever rash and skin lesion syphilis wa found a a concomitant infection in this group 2259 372 severe manifestation were found among plhiv without antiretroviral therapy art conclusion mpox case in jakarta were all found in male and most of them were plhiv there are various manifestation of mpox however since immunosuppressed patient could present differently a strong surveillance and vaccine notification system cautious management and spreading vaccination awareness are needed to prevent and treat mpox

processed_title: integrated bioinformatics approach to investigate alteration in transcriptomic profile of monkeypox infected human cell line model
processed_abstract: background the recent reemergence of the monkeypox mpox epidemic in nonendemic region ha raised concern regarding a potential global outbreak the mpox virus mpv is a smallpoxlike virus belonging to the genus orthopoxvirus family poxviridae although study suggest that mpv infection suppresses the tolllike receptor3 and tumor necrosis factoralpharelated signaling pathway whether mpv regulates other immunerelated pathway remains unclear method in this study two distinct temporal pattern were used for establishing an mpvinfected human immortal epithelial cancer cell line hela these two duration 2 and 12 h of incubation were selected to identify the coregulated gene and pathway affected by mpv infection result the use of the gene ontology framework kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome database and metacore software yielded valuable insight specifically various pathway were found to be enriched in hela cell infected with mpv for 2 and 12 h these pathway included notch cd40 cd95 hypoxiainducible factor1alpha interleukin il 1 il6 phosphoinositide 3kinase nuclear factorkappab mitogenactivated protein kinase and oxidative stressinduced signalling pathway cluster and pathway of metabolism and viral replication cycle were significantly associated with the 2hour infection group this association wa identified based on the regulation of gene such a hspg2 rhpn2 myl1 asphd2 ca9 vipr1 snx12 mgc2752 slc25a1 pex19 and areg furthermore cluster and pathway related to immunity and cell movement were found to be associated with the 12hour infection group this association wa identified based on the regulation of gene such a c1orf21 c19orf48 hrk il8 gulp1 scand2 atp5c1 fez1 sgsh tacc2 cyp4x1 mmp1 cpb1 p2ry13 wdr27 prpf4 and endod1 conclusion this study can improve our understanding of the mechanism underlying the pathophysiology and postinfection sequela of mpox our finding provide valuable insight into the various mode of mpv infection

processed_title: mapping the mpox discourse a network and sentiment analysis
processed_abstract: mpox a zoonotic disease reemerging from animal to human pose a risk of evolving into a global pandemic due to it high infectivity and potential asymptomatic transmission this study map the structure and configuration of mpoxrelated discussion on twitterx identifies key influencers and top hashtags and analyzes public sentiment data were collected using nodexl pro from may 7 2022 to january 15 2023 with the keyword monkeypox and visualized using gephi social network analysis ranked node by betweenness centrality score to highlight key communicator and the yifanhu layout algorithm visualized the network influential user source topic and hashtags were identified and sentiment analysis wa conducted using azure machine learning tool the analysis identified 11397 mpoxrelated tweet the network structure resembled a community with diverse participant influential user included health and science journalist writer academic medical doctor and public figure news medium and organizational website were the top information source emphasizing the need for accessible scientific information monkeypox and mpox were the most prevalent hashtags negative sentiment dominated the discussion this analysis provides insight into network structure key influencers information source and public sentiment aiding tailored health initiative to address misinformation and advocate valid health information and emergency response

processed_title: comparison of transcriptomic signature between monkeypoxinfected monkey and human cell line
processed_abstract: monkeypox virus mpv is a smallpoxlike virus belonging to the genus orthopoxvirus of the family poxviridae unlike smallpox with no animal reservoir identified and patient suffering from milder symptom with less mortality several animal were confirmed to serve a natural host of mpv the reemergence of a recently reported monkeypox epidemic outbreak in nonendemic country ha raised concern about a global outburst since the underlying mechanism of animaltohuman transmission remains largely unknown comprehensive analysis to discover principal difference in gene signature during disease progression have become ever more critical in this study two mpvinfected in vitro model including human immortal epithelial cancer hela cell and rhesus monkey macaca mulatta kidney epithelial mk2 cell were chosen a the two subject to identify alteration in gene expression profile together with coregulated gene and pathway that are affected during monkeypox disease progression using gene ontology go kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome kegg and metacore analysis we discovered that elevated expression of gene associated with interleukin il g proteincoupled receptor gpcrs heat shock protein hsps tolllike receptor tlrs and metabolicrelated pathway play major role in disease progression of both monkeypoxinfected monkey mk2 and human hela cell line interestingly our analytical result also revealed that a cluster of differentiation 40 cd40 plasmin and histamine served a major regulator in the monkeypoxinfected monkey mk2 cell line model while interferon ifns macrophage and neutrophilrelated signaling pathway dominated the monkeypoxinfected human hela cell line model among immune pathway of interest apart from traditional monkeypoxregulated signaling pathway such a nuclear factor nfkappab mitogenactivated protein kinase mapks and tumor necrosis factor tnf we also identified highly significantly expressed gene in both monkey and human model that played pivotal role during the progression of monkeypox infection including cxcl1 tnfaip3 birc3 il6 ccl2 zc3h12a il11 csf2 lif ptx3 ier3 egr1 adora2a and duox1 together with several epigenetic regulator such a histone cluster family gene member hist1h3d hist1h2bj etc these finding might contribute to specific underlying mechanism related to the pathophysiology and provide suggestion regarding mode of transmission postinfectious sequela and vaccine development for monkeypox in the future

processed_title: acceptance and willingness to pay for a hypothetical vaccine against monkeypox viral infection among frontline physician a crosssectional study in indonesia
