processed_abstract: background a clinical trial is ongoing to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a monkeypox vaccine among healthcare worker hcws the critical question that need to be addressed is whether hcws are willing to accept and purchase this vaccine the objective of this study wa to evaluate the acceptance and willingness to pay wtp for the vaccine among hcws method from may to july 2019 a crosssectional study wa conducted among registered general practitioner gps in indonesia a contingent valuation method wa employed to evaluate the wtp besides acceptance and wtp various explanatory variable were also collected and assessed a logistic regression and a multivariable linear regression were used to explore the explanatory variable influencing acceptance and wtp respectively result among 407 respondent 391 960 expressed acceptance of a free vaccination the mean and median wtp wa u 37095cius 3276us 4123 and u 179095cius 1790us 1790 respectively in an unadjusted analysis those 30 year old or younger had 294 time greater odds of vaccine acceptance compared to those who were older 95ci 107808 location of alma mater type of workplace length of individual medical experience and monthly income of gps were all significantly associated with wtp conclusion although the vast majority of gps would accept a freely provided vaccine they were also somewhat price sensitive this finding indicates that partial subsidy maybe required to achieve high vaccine coverage particularly among gps at community health centre or those with a shorter duration of medical practice

processed_title: the biosafety research road map the search for evidence to support practice in the laboratorympoxmonkeypox virus
processed_abstract: introduction the virus formerly known a monkeypox virus now called mpoxv belongs to the orthopoxvirus genus and can cause mpox disease through both animaltohuman and humantohuman transmission the unexpected spread of mpoxv among human ha prompted the world health organization who to declare a public health emergency of international concern pheic method we conducted a literature search to identify the gap in biosafety focusing on five main area how the infection enters the body and spread how much of the virus is needed to cause infection infection acquired in the lab accidental release of the virus and strategy for disinfecting and decontaminating the area discussion the recent pheic ha shown that there are gap in our knowledge of biosafety when it come to mpoxv we need to better understand where this virus might be found how much of it can spread from persontoperson what are the effective control measure and how to safely clean up contaminated area by gathering more biosafety evidence we can make better decision to protect people from this zoonotic agent which ha recently become more common in the human population

processed_title: global research profile on monkeypoxrelated literature 19622022 a bibliometric analysis
processed_abstract: the recent monkeypox or mpox outbreak ha been a global concern the present study evaluated the global research output research trend and topic of published research on monkeypox using a bibliometric approach the scopus database wa searched for term associated with monkeypox or monkey pox up until 19 november 2022 map and bibliometric indicator of the retrieved document were shown and analyzed a total of 1422 document were obtained from scopus other than monkeypox the most commonly used term included epidemic disease outbreak smallpox vaccine and orthopoxvirus in total 903 of the document were published between 2002 and 2022 the united state the united kingdom and india were the top three country in term of productivity most of the institution were from the united state the international journal of surgery the journal of medical virology and the travel medicine and infectious disease are some of the top journal currently publishing research on monkeypox tecovirimat coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 homosexuality and pandemic are emerging topic related to monkeypox

processed_title: clinical characteristic of suspected case of human mpox monkeypox in katakokombe democratic republic of the congo 2023 challenge and key response
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to describe the clinical and epidemiologic characteristic of suspected case of human mpox in one of the most affected health zone katakokombe sankuru province in the democratic republic of the congo also to identify key challenge to prevent and improve the health of the affected community method between january 26 2023 and november 30 2023 the drc reported it highest incidence of mpox caseswith a total of 12569 suspected case in 156 health zone from 22 of the 26 country province the katakokombe health zone registered 369 suspected case and 17 death making it one of the hotspot of the outbreak result ten village and centre were affected with an attack rate at of 215 per thousand and a case fatality rate cfr of 46 epicurves showed an increase in clinical case from january to may 2023 followed by a decrease until august 2023 and a resurgence of case in september 2023 with a reproduction rate of 129 furthermore the occurrence of complication appeared to increase the cfr with 7 14 11 1803 and 9 2368 for encephalitis anemia and pulmonary complication respectively conclusion at cfr and transmission rate appeared to be lower in the current epidemic than in previous outbreak and in clade i critically delayed medical care increase the incidence of complication and cfr therefore mpox requires early diagnosis and prompt public health response including the possibility of mpox in the differential diagnosis of patient presenting with a vesicular or pustular rash is suggested

processed_title: knowledge of human monkeypox viral infection among general practitioner a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: after the first imported laboratoryconfirmed case of monkeypox in human wa reported in singapore on may 2019 country in asia started to strengthen disease surveillance system one challenge in preventing monkeypox is a lack of knowledge particularly among healthcare worker the aim of this study wa to assess the knowledge of monkeypox among general practitioner gps in indonesia a crosssectional online survey wa conducted the survey collected participant knowledge on a 21item scale and explanatory variable a twostep logistic regression analysis wa employed to assess the predictor of knowledge of monkeypox a total of 432 gps were included 100 and 365 of them had a good knowledge using an 80 and 70 cutoff point for knowledge domain respectively no explanatory variable were associated with knowledge when using 80 cutoff point using the lower cutoff there wa lower knowledge among gps who graduated from university located in sumatra or other island versus java adjusted odds ratio aor 053 95ci 028097 p 0041 and among those were older than 30 year compared to younger gps aor 061 95ci 039096 p 0033 gps working in private clinic had less knowledge compared to gps in community health center aor 055 95ci 031099 p 0047 in conclusion knowledge of monkeypox among gps in indonesia is relatively low in all group increasing knowledge of monkeypox will be key to improving the capacity of gps to respond to human monkeypox case and to report into a disease surveillance system

processed_title: systematic review characteristic of myocarditis followed by fixed drug eruption and dry eye syndrome in patient who have been vaccinated with monkeypox in child and adult
processed_abstract: background the monkeypox virus mpox ha caused a surge in viral infection leading to the who recognizing it a a public health emergency of international concern mpox infection share clinical similarity with smallpox but can cause complication like myocarditis anorectal pain ocular lesion kidney damage or soft tissue superinfection the study aim to understand the characteristic of myocarditis fixed drug eruption and dry eye syndrome in monkeypox patient method this review wa conducted based on prisma preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses and the cochrane handbook for systematic review of intervention the data wa obtained from scopus and international journal database by conducting combined keyword search restricted to englishlanguage publication result the study examined 25 case of monkeypox primarily involving male aged 329 year and experiencing chest pain the prognosis wa generally good with no reported death risk factor for infection include sexual activity std diagnosis sexual encounter and workplace exposure to orthopoxviruses most case were male and involved chest pain myocarditis an inflammation in the myocardium can cause dilated cardiomyopathy acute arrhythmia and heart failure the pathophysiology of myocarditis in monkeypox patient is not yet determined due to rarity of case conclusion mpox infection present unique complication like myocarditis necessitating research for vaccine antiviral drug and infection prevention measure early screening for chest pain and investigating mpxv infection pathogenesis and clinical feature are crucial for differential diagnosis during outbreak this systematic review can determine mpox infection outcome and prepare appropriate treatment for patient with complication

processed_title: effectiveness of tecovirimat in mpox case a systematic review of current evidence
processed_abstract: mpox formerly known a monkeypox ha reemerged a a significant global health concern particularly during the widespread outbreak of 2022 a an orthopoxvirus related to the eradicated smallpox virus mpox ha been primarily managed with smallpox vaccine and treatment including the antiviral agent tecovirimat this systematic review aim to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of tecovirimat in treating mpox focusing on it use during the 2022 outbreak especially among highrisk population including men who have sex with men and people living with hiv we conducted a comprehensive search across database such a embase pubmed and web of science up to august 30 2024 the selection involved a twostage review process utilizing the nested knowledge platform which helped streamline the screening and data extraction we included study that focused on the clinical efficacy and safety of tecovirimat in human patient with confirmed mpox infection our analysis mainly synthesized data narratively due to the heterogeneity of study design and outcome fifteen study met the inclusion criterion providing data on 1031 mpox case the preliminary analysis of the palm 007 rct indicated that tecovirimat did not significantly outperform placebo in lesion resolution for all patient lesion healed faster than expected regardless of tecovirimat or placebo treatment a lower mortality rate of 17 among those enrolled in the palm 007 rct wa observed compared to the general mpox mortality rate of 36 or higher in the drc observational study revealed that early administration of tecovirimat especially within the first week of symptom onset significantly improves symptom resolution reduces the severity of the disease and decrease the likelihood of hospitalization and complication in observational study however the impact on viral clearance wa inconsistent and some study suggested limited efficacy in severely immunocompromised patient regarding safety tecovirimat wa generally welltolerated a indicated by the rct however mild adverse effect such a fatigue headache and nausea were commonly reported among observational study serious adverse event were rare but included elevated liver enzyme and psychiatric symptom particularly in patient with preexisting condition tecovirimat demonstrates some potential benefit in treating mpox particularly when administered early the palm 007 rct failed to meet the efficacy point tecovirimat is generally welltolerated with a favorable safety profile although monitoring is advisable for those with existing liver or renal condition despite promising result further largescale randomized controlled trial are needed to fully ascertain the drug effectiveness across diverse population and to explore it impact on viral clearance and transmission dynamic

processed_title: knowledge of human monkeypox and it relation to conspiracy belief among student in jordanian health school filling the knowledge gap on emerging zoonotic virus
processed_abstract: background and objective the recent multicountry outbreak of human monkeypox hmpx in nonendemic region pose an emerging public health concern university student in health schoolsfaculties represent a core knowledgeable group that can be helpful to study from a public health point of view a future healthcare worker assessment of their knowledge and attitude towards emerging zoonotic viral infection can be helpful to assess their taught material and course with potential improvement if gap in knowledge were identified therefore we aimed to evaluate the level of hmpx knowledge conspiracy belief regarding emerging virus infection a well a their associated determinant among university student studying medicine nursing dentistry pharmacy medical laboratory science and rehabilitation in jordanian health schoolsfaculties in addition we sought to evaluate the correlation between hmpx knowledge and the extent of holding conspiracy belief regarding emerging viral infection material and method a convenient sample of university student wa obtained through an electronic survey distributed in late may 2022 using the chainreferral approach assessment of hmpx knowledge and general attitude towards emerging virus infection wa based on survey item adopted from previously published literature result the study sample comprised 615 student with a mean age of 20 year and a majority of female 432 702 and medical student n 351 571 out of eleven monkeypox knowledge item three were identified correctly by 70 of the respondent only 262 of the respondent n 161 knew that vaccination to prevent monkeypox is available age wa significantly associated with better hmpx knowledge for a majority of item older age female and affiliation to nonmedical schoolsfaculties were associated with harboring higher level of conspiracy belief regarding emerging virus infection our data also indicate that lower level of hmpx knowledge were associated with higher level of conspiracy belief conclusion the current study pointed to generally unsatisfactory level of knowledge regarding the emerging hmpx among university student in jordanian health schoolsfaculties conspiracy belief regarding emerging virus infection were widely prevalent and it potential detrimental impact on health behavior should be evaluated in future study

processed_title: assessing healthcare worker knowledge and their confidence in the diagnosis and management of human monkeypox a crosssectional study in a middle eastern country
processed_abstract: the ongoing multicountry human monkeypox hmpx outbreak wa declared a a public health emergency of international concern considering the key role of healthcare worker hcws in mitigating the hmpx outbreak we aimed to assess their level of knowledge and their confidence in diagnosis and management of the disease besides the assessment of their attitude towards emerging virus infection from a conspiracy point of view an online survey wa distributed among hcws in jordan a middle eastern country during mayjuly 2022 using a questionnaire published in a previous study among university student in health school in jordan the study sample comprised 606 hcws with about twothirds being either physician n 204 337 or nurse n 190 314 four out of the 11 hmpx knowledge item had 50 correct response with only 333 of the study respondent having previous knowledge that vaccination is available to prevent hmpx a majority of study respondent n 356 587 strongly agreed agreed or somewhat agreed that the spread of hmpx is related to a role of male homosexual confidence in the ability of diagnosis based on the available monkeypox virus diagnostic test wa reported by 502 of the respondent while the confidence level were lower for the ability to manage 389 and to diagnose 380 hmpx case based on their current level of knowledge and skill higher confidence level for hmpx diagnosis and management were found among physician compared to nurse the endorsement of conspiracy belief about virus emergence wa associated with lower hmpx knowledge the belief in the role of male homosexual in hmpx spread and with lower diagnosis and management confidence level the current study highlighted the gap in knowledge regarding hmpx among hcws in jordan a well a the lack of confidence to diagnose and manage case among physician and nurse raising the awareness about the disease is needed urgently considering the rapid escalation in the number of case worldwide with reported case in the middle east the attitude towards male homosexual role in hmpx spread necessitates proper intervention measure to prevent stigma and discrimination among this risk group the adoption of conspiratorial belief regarding virus emergence wa widely prevalent and this issue need to be addressed with proper and accurate knowledge considering it potential harmful impact

processed_title: unveiling the outcome of mpox in pregnancy a systematic review and singlearm metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background the global resurgence of mpox formerly monkeypox pose an emerging threat to pregnant woman due to immunological change and potential vertical transmission yet it impact on pregnancy remains underexplored this study aim to pioneer a comprehensive assessment of pregnancy outcome and the risk of vertical transmission associated with mpox infection during pregnancy material and method following preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses guideline we searched three database up to september 2024 for study on pregnant woman with mpox confirmed by quantitative polymerase chain reaction primary outcome were composite adverse pregnancy outcome miscarriage or fetal death congenital anomaly and chorioamnionitis the secondary outcome wa vertical transmission study quality wa assessed using joanna briggs institute tool statistical analysis employed r software using a oneproportion model with freemantukey transformation and randomeffects metaanalysis restricted maximumlikelihood estimator knapphartung adjustment presenting estimated proportion with 95 confidence interval ci result six study three case series three case report comprising 11 singleton pregnancy were included diagnosis occurred in the first 273 second 454 and third trimester 273 among the five genotypically identified mpox case 200 were classified clade i and 800 a clade ii metaanalysis indicated that an estimated 63 95 ci 4383 of pregnancy experienced composite adverse pregnancy outcome specifically miscarriage or fetal death occurred in 62 95 ci 21102 congenital anomaly in 50 95 ci 2180 and chorioamnionitis in 78 95 ci 4496 vertical transmission wa observed in 79 95 ci 6151 despite small sample size leading to wide confidence interval high estimated proportion suggest that mpox severely impact pregnancy outcome likely linked to maternal inflammation placental invasion and significant fetal risk from vertical transmission conclusion mpox infection during pregnancy appears to be associated with high rate of adverse pregnancy outcome and vertical transmission further largescale study are warranted to confirm these finding and develop preventive and management strategy mitigating this emerging threat

processed_title: confidence in managing human monkeypox case in asia a crosssectional survey among general practitioner in indonesia
processed_abstract: the current reemergence of human monkeypox hmpx is a global concern for endemic and nonendemic country but healthcare worker in some region like asia have less experience with identifying and treating hmpx case this study aimed to assess the confidence and it predictor in hmpx case management among general practitioner gps the frontline doctor in indonesia and to explore their perspective on hmpx between may and july 2019 gps in indonesia completed an onlinebased survey the questionnaire collected information on gps confidence perspective sociodemographic workplace and professional characteristic exposure to hmpx information and knowledge on hmpx a logistic regression analysis wa employed to explore the explanatory variable influencing the confidence and the perspective we included 395 gps in our analysis 774 out of 510 response received of which 101 and 349 were classified having good confidence using an 80 and 70 cutoff for confidence score respectively in the adjusted analysis receiving information about hmpx during medical training wa the only variable significantly associated with good confidence adjusted odds ratio 274 95 confidence interval 157 to 478 and p 0001 approximately 736 and 779 of gps agreed that hmpx is an important infectious disease and it ha potential to detrimentally impact the indonesian economy respectively in addition 888 of gps suggested that the disease should be incorporated into the national medical curriculum of indonesia in conclusion in case of hmpx outbreak majority of the gps in indonesia seem to be less confident in diagnosing and treating case using their current knowledge skill and their workplace facility therefore a systematic strategy to improve their confidence in managing hmpx is required

processed_title: physician willingness to be vaccinated with a smallpox vaccine to prevent monkeypox viral infection a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background although there is no licensed vaccine for monkeypox smallpox vaccine ha been shown to be 85 effective in preventing the monkeypox this study wa conducted to assess the willingness of frontline healthcare provider to be vaccinated with smallpox vaccine to prevent monkeypox method a crosssectional study wa conducted in indonesia the willingness wa assessed under two scenario fully subsidized and nonsubsidized vaccine explanatory variable such a sociodemographic profile workplace and professional characteristic and knowledge of monkeypox were collected a logistic regression assessed the influence of these explanatory variable on participant willingness result out of 510 received participant response 407 798 were analyzed with a fully subsidized vaccine scenario 381 936 of the participant were willing to be vaccinated and in an unadjusted analysis gender education monthly income and type of workplace were associated with willingness with a nonsubsidized vaccine ie the vaccine price wa u 179 the proportion who were willing to be vaccinated decreased to 719 in adjusted analysis for both scenario gender wa the only independent predictor for willingness men were less willing to be vaccinated than woman adjusted odds ratio aor 037 95 confidence interval ci 016 087 and aor 042 95ci 027 067 respectively for subsidized and nonsubsidized scenario conclusion vaccine price and gender are important factor for physician willingness to be vaccinated for smallpox vaccine prevent monkeypox in indonesia these finding indicate that achieving high vaccine converge may require partially or fully subsidized vaccine along with a clear guideline and recommendation from authority

processed_title: the silent rapidly unfolding threat of mpox spread via international travel to southeast asia are we ready
processed_abstract: the 2022 mpox monkeypox outbreak ha been surprisingly large and ha raised several novel question about this disease new information such a atypical clinical manifestation and transmission via sexual activity have been identified these pose a potential risk of widespread outbreak due to unusual clinical manifestation and failure to consider mpox a a diagnosis by physician and the sexual behaviour of some tourist in southeast asia since southeast asia is a popular tourist destination there is substantial potential for the silent spread of mpox in this region consequently there is an urgent need for effective surveillance measure at point of entry of international traveler to identify suspected case and their close contact in order to limit the spread of mpox in southeast asia

processed_title: a fractional order monkeypox model with protected traveler using the fixed point theorem and newton polynomial interpolation
processed_abstract: this study formulates a monkeypox model with protected traveler the fixed point theorem is used to obtain the existence and uniqueness of the solution with ulamhyers stability for the analysis of the solution to the model the newton polynomial interpolation scheme is employed to solve an approximate solution of the fractional monkeypox model the numerical simulation and the graphical representation suggest that the fractional order affect the dynamic of the monkeypox the fractional order show other underlining transmission trend of the monkeypox disease we conclude that the result obtained for each compartment conforms to reality a the fractional order approach unity

processed_title: an adult patient with suspected of monkeypox infection differential diagnosed to chickenpox
processed_abstract: background monkeypox is a zoonosis the disease ha a similar appearance to chickenpox caused by the varicellazoster virus vzv on may 9th 2019 there wa one laboratoryconfirmed case of monkeypox reported in singapore a man wa also suspected of having monkeypox on june 1st 2019 in surabaya indonesia a neighboring country objective to report on a suspected case of monkeypox with differential diagnosis to chickenpox case a 51yearold male wa suspected of having monkeypox after a differential diagnosis of chickenpox his chief complaint wa multiple blister on his body from the dermatological status on his facial trunk and extremity region there were multiple pleiomorphic vesicle some with umbilication with a centripetal distribution and crust method and result a pcr using vzv specific primer followed by genome sequencing showed homology of more than 99 to other vzvs and less than 50 to monkeypox sequence conclusion molecular laboratory technique have confirmed the case a chickenpox

processed_title: antiscience vaccine hesitancy and pandemic response highlight from the asia pacific summit on infectious disease and immunization
processed_abstract: the recent resurgence of mpox highlight the urgent need for rethinking vaccination strategy globally underscored by the painful memory of past public health crisis where delayed response and inequitable vaccine distribution exacerbated the spread of infectious disease the inaugural apicadva asia pacific summit on infectious disease and immunization themed vaccination for all access confidence and equity ace wa held in singapore from 31 october to 1 november 2023 in an attempt to present best practice and hardwon insight from battling covid19 and other pandemic in the asiapacific region this summit wa coconvened by the asiapacific immunization coalition apic and asia dengue voice and action adva local regional and international expert from academia research and representative from the ministry of health the world health organization who and the international vaccine institute ivi participated in the 2 day summit with more than 230 speaker and delegate from over 15 country and 4 symposium over 2 full day the first apicadva asia pacific summit on infectious disease and immunization highlighted critical issue affecting vaccine access confidence and equity and emphasized the importance of safeguarding the world from existing infection and future pandemic through immunization

processed_title: conspiratorial attitude of the general public in jordan towards emerging virus infection a crosssectional study amid the 2022 monkeypox outbreak
processed_abstract: conspiracy theory accompany the emergence of infectious disease and the 2022 multicountry monkeypox mpx outbreak is no exception it is possible that the adoption of conspiracy belief negatively impact health behavior we aimed to assess the prevalence of conspiratorial attitude towards emerging virus infection evis and the response measure aiming to control these infection among the general public in jordan in addition we assessed mpx knowledge and the belief in the role of men who have sex with men msm in virus spread the online survey data were collected during 24 may 202228 june 2022 the survey instrument wa based on previously published scale designed to measure mpx knowledge and evi conspiracy a total of 611 respondent formed the final study sample with a mean age of 44 year and a majority of female n 433 709 on a scale ranging from 10 to 10 the median mpx knowledge score in the study sample wa 3 interquartile range 1 to 5 educational level wa a determinant of mpx knowledge in multivariate analysis more than 50 of the participant agreed at least to some extent with 9 out of 12 of the evi conspiracy item multivariate analysis showed that embracing conspiracy belief about evis wa associated with being female and agreeing with or having no opinion regarding the role of msm in mpx spread the current study revealed the high prevalence of belief in conspiracy surrounding evis and it accompanying intervention measure among the general public in jordan in addition a lower level of mpx knowledge wa observed compared to previous study among university student and health professional in the country we recommend evaluating the impact of the widely prevalent conspiracy belief on health aspect in future study this aim is particularly relevant in the middle eastern country where embracing specific conspiracy idea is a common occurrence

processed_title: global diversity and antimicrobial resistance of typhoid fever pathogen insight from a metaanalysis of 13000 salmonella typhi genome
processed_abstract: background the global typhoid genomics consortium wa established to bring together the typhoid research community to aggregate and analyse salmonella enterica serovar typhi typhi genomic data to inform public health action this analysis which mark 22 year since the publication of the first typhi genome represents the largest typhi genome sequence collection to date n13000 method this is a metaanalysis of global genotype and antimicrobial resistance amr determinant extracted from previously sequenced genome data and analysed using consistent method implemented in open analysis platform genotyphi and pathogenwatch result compared with previous global snapshot the data highlight that genotype 431 h58 ha not spread beyond asia and easternsouthern africa in other region distinct genotype dominate and have independently evolved amr data gap remain in many part of the world and we show the potential of travelassociated sequence to provide informal sentinel surveillance for such location the data indicate that ciprofloxacin nonsusceptibility 1 resistance determinant is widespread across geography and genotype with highlevel ciprofloxacin resistance 3 determinant reaching 20 prevalence in south asia extensively drugresistant xdr typhoid ha become dominant in pakistan 70 in 2020 but ha not yet become established elsewhere ceftriaxone resistance ha emerged in eight nonxdr genotype including a ciprofloxacinresistant lineage 43121 in india azithromycin resistance mutation were detected at low prevalence in south asia including in two common ciprofloxacinresistant genotype conclusion the consortium aim is to encourage continued data sharing and collaboration to monitor the emergence and global spread of amr typhi and to inform decisionmaking around the introduction of typhoid conjugate vaccine tcvs and other prevention and control strategy funding no specific funding wa awarded for this metaanalysis coordinator were supported by fellowship from the european union zad received funding from the european union horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the marie sklodowskacurie grant agreement no 845681 the wellcome trust sb wellcome trust senior fellowship and the national health and medical research council dji is supported by an nhmrc investigator grant gnt1195210

processed_title: global burden of bacterial antimicrobial resistance 19902021 a systematic analysis with forecast to 2050
processed_abstract: background antimicrobial resistance amr pose an important global health challenge in the 21st century a previous study ha quantified the global and regional burden of amr for 2019 followed with additional publication that provided more detailed estimate for several who region by country to date there have been no study that produce comprehensive estimate of amr burden across location that encompass historical trend and future forecast method we estimated allage and agespecific death and disabilityadjusted lifeyears dalys attributable to and associated with bacterial amr for 22 pathogen 84 pathogendrug combination and 11 infectious syndrome in 204 country and territory from 1990 to 2021 we collected and used multiple cause of death data hospital discharge data microbiology data literature study single drug resistance profile pharmaceutical sale antibiotic use survey mortality surveillance linkage data outpatient and inpatient insurance claim data and previously published data covering 520 million individual record or isolates and 19 513 studylocationyears we used statistical modelling to produce estimate of amr burden for all location including those with no data our approach leverage the estimation of five broad component quantity the number of death involving sepsis the proportion of infectious death attributable to a given infectious syndrome the proportion of infectious syndrome death attributable to a given pathogen the percentage of a given pathogen resistant to an antibiotic of interest and the excess risk of death or duration of an infection associated with this resistance using these component we estimated disease burden attributable to and associated with amr which we define based on two counterfactuals respectively an alternative scenario in which all drugresistant infection are replaced by drugsusceptible infection and an alternative scenario in which all drugresistant infection were replaced by no infection additionally we produced global and regional forecast of amr burden until 2050 for three scenario a reference scenario that is a probabilistic forecast of the most likely future a gramnegative drug scenario that assumes future drug development that target gramnegative pathogen and a better care scenario that assumes future improvement in healthcare quality and access to appropriate antimicrobial we present final estimate aggregated to the global superregional and regional level finding in 2021 we estimated 471 million 95 ui 423519 death were associated with bacterial amr including 114 million 100128 death attributable to bacterial amr trend in amr mortality over the past 31 year varied substantially by age and location from 1990 to 2021 death from amr decreased by more than 50 among child younger than 5 year yet increased by over 80 for adult 70 year and older amr mortality decreased for child younger than 5 year in all superregions whereas amr mortality in people 5 year and older increased in all superregions for both death associated with and death attributable to amr meticillinresistant staphylococcus aureus increased the most globally from 261 000 associated death 95 ui 150 000372 000 and 57 200 attributable death 34 10080 300 in 1990 to 550 000 associated death 500 000600 000 and 130 000 attributable death 113 000146 000 in 2021 among gramnegative bacteria resistance to carbapenems increased more than any other antibiotic class rising from 619 000 associated death 405 000834 000 in 1990 to 103 million associated death 909 000116 million in 2021 and from 127 000 attributable death 82 100171 000 in 1990 to 216 000 168 000264 000 attributable death in 2021 there wa a notable decrease in noncovidrelated infectious disease in 2020 and 2021 our forecast show that an estimated 191 million 156226 death attributable to amr and 822 million 685965 death associated with amr could occur globally in 2050 superregions with the highest allage amr mortality rate in 2050 are forecasted to be south asia and latin america and the caribbean increase in death attributable to amr will be largest among those 70 year and older 659 612698 of allage death attributable to amr in 2050 in stark contrast to the strong increase in number of death due to amr of 696 515892 from 2022 to 2050 the number of dalys showed a much smaller increase of 94 69 to 290 to 465 million 377 to 573 in 2050 under the better care scenario across all age group 920 million death 8281020 could be cumulatively averted between 2025 and 2050 through better care of severe infection and improved access to antibiotic and under the gramnegative drug scenario 111 million amr death 908132 could be averted through the development of a gramnegative drug pipeline to prevent amr death interpretation this study present the first comprehensive assessment of the global burden of amr from 1990 to 2021 with result forecasted until 2050 evaluating changing trend in amr mortality across time and location is necessary to understand how this important global health threat is developing and prepares u to make informed decision regarding intervention our finding show the importance of infection prevention a shown by the reduction of amr death in those younger than 5 year simultaneously our result underscore the concerning trend of amr burden among those older than 70 year alongside a rapidly ageing global community the opposing trend in the burden of amr death between younger and older individual explains the moderate future increase in global number of dalys versus number of death given the high variability of amr burden by location and age it is important that intervention combine infection prevention vaccination minimisation of inappropriate antibiotic use in farming and human and research into new antibiotic to mitigate the number of amr death that are forecasted for 2050 funding uk department of health and social care fleming fund using uk aid and the wellcome trust

processed_title: typhoid fever in jakarta indonesia 20172023 spatial clustering and seasonality of hospitalization data to inform better intervention
processed_abstract: typhoid fever is one of the common enteric fever in developing country especially in emerging metropolitan area in indonesia yet study on spatial and temporal distribution of tyhoid fever are lacking this study wa conducted to analyze retrospective hospitalbased data at the village level over the period 20172023 to understand the spatial and temporal variation of typhoid fever in jakarta spatial analysis were performed by morans i and local indicator of spatial association lisa to examine spatial clustering of typhoid incidence and to identify highrisk village for typhoid fever respectively seasonal decomposition analysis wa performed to investigate the seasonality of this infection a total of 57468 typhoid case resulting in a cumulative incidence of 53399 per 100000 people were reported during the study period the incidence wa significantly clustered i0548 p0001 at the village level across jakarta statistically significant highrisk cluster were detected in the south and east of jakarta that were heterogeneous over time we identified seven persistent highrisk cluster in the eastern part of the city and two in the southern part moreover the typhoid incidence showed a strong seasonality trend significantly associated with monthly total rainfall p0018 the study revealed a significant spatial variation with strong seasonality in typhoid incidence across the city suggesting a variation in transmission intensity and need for effective public health intervention especially in the highrisk area improvement in water and sanitation facility hygiene awareness and surveillance are essential to help reduce typhoid transmission in jakarta

processed_title: helicobacter pylorus infection and typhoid fever in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: we evaluated the association between typhoid fever and helicobacter pylorus infection a the latter microorganism may influence gastric acid secretion and consequently increase susceptibility to salmonella typhi infection antih pylorus igg and iga antibody titre elisa and gastrin concentration ria were determined in the plasma of 87 blood cultureconfirmed typhoid fever case collected after clinical recovery and 232 random healthy control without a history of typhoid fever in the jatinegara district jakarta patient with typhoid fever more often than control were seropositive for h pylorus igg 67 v 50 p0008 when antibody titre were dichotomized around median titre observed in control h pylorus iga seropositivity wa not associated with typhoid fever plasma gastrin concentration indicative of hypochlorhydria ie gastrin or 25 or or 100 ngl were not significantly elevated in typhoid fever case compared to control p054 and p027 respectively in a multivariate analysis typhoid fever wa independently associated with young age 33 year median age of the control odds ratio or 793 95 confidence interval ci 3901610 and h pylorus igg seropositivity or 193 95 ci 110340 typhoid fever wa independently associated with h pylorus igg seropositivity but not with elevated gastrin concentration therefore the association suggests a common risk of environmental exposure to both bacteria eg poor hygiene rather than a causal relationship via reduced gastric acid production

processed_title: typhoid fever a a triggering factor in acute and intractable bronchial asthma attack
processed_abstract: typhoid fever is an enteric infection caused by salmonella typhi in indonesia typhoid fever is endemic with high incidence of the disease in daily practice we frequently have patient with bronchial asthma and it is becoming worse when these patient get typhoid fever after oral ingestion salmonella typhi invades the the intestine mucosa after conducted by microbial binding to epithelial cell destroying the microfold cell m cell then passed through the lamina propria and detected by dendritic cell dc which express a variety of pathogen recognition receptor on the surface including tolllike receptor tlr expressed on macrophage and on intestinal epithelial cell inducing degradation of ib and translocation of nfb nuclear factorkappa beta this process initiate the induction of proinflammatory gene expression profile adhesion molecule chemokines adhesion molecule and other protein that induce and perpetuate the inflammation in host cell then will induce acute ant intractable attack of bronchial asthma the role of typhoid fever in bronchial asthma especially in person with acute attack of bronchial asthma is not well understood in this article we will discus the role of typhoid fever in the bronchial asthma patient which may cause bronchial asthma significantly become more severe even triggering the acute and intractable attack of bronchial asthma this fact make an important point to treat completely the typhoid fever in patient with bronchial asthma

processed_title: risk factor for typhoid and paratyphoid fever in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: context the proportion of paratyphoid fever case to typhoid fever case may change due to urbanization and increased dependency on food purchased from street vendor for containment of paratyphoid a different strategy may be needed than for typhoid because risk factor for disease may not coincide and current typhoid vaccine do not protect against paratyphoid fever objective to determine risk factor for typhoid and paratyphoid fever in an endemic area design setting and participant communitybased casecontrol study conducted from june 2001 to february 2003 in hospital and outpatient health center in jatinegara district jakarta indonesia enrolled participant were 1019 consecutive patient with fever lasting 3 or more day from which 69 blood cultureconfirmed typhoid case 24 confirmed paratyphoid case and 289 control patient with fever but without salmonella bacteremia were interviewed plus 378 randomly selected community control main outcome measure blood cultureconfirmed typhoid or paratyphoid fever risk factor for both disease result in 1019 fever patient we identified 88 9 salmonella typhi and 26 3 salmonella paratyphi a infection paratyphoid fever among case wa independently associated with consumption of food from street vendor comparison with community control odds ratio or 334 95 confidence interval ci 141791 with fever control or 517 95 ci 2121260 and flooding comparison with community control or 452 95 ci 1901073 with fever control or 325 95 ci 131802 by contrast independent risk factor for typhoid fever using the community control group were mostly related to the household ie to recent typhoid fever in the household or 238 95 ci 103548 no use of soap for handwashing or 191 95 ci 106346 sharing food from the same plate or 193 95 ci 110337 and no toilet in the household or 220 95 ci 106455 also typhoid fever wa associated with young age in year or 096 95 ci 094098 in comparison with fever control risk factor for typhoid fever were use of ice cube or 227 95 ci 131393 and female sex or 179 95 ci 104306 fecal contamination of drinking water wa not associated with typhoid or paratyphoid fever we did not detect fecal carrier among food handler in the household conclusion in jakarta typhoid and paratyphoid fever are associated with distinct route of transmission with the risk factor for disease either mainly within the household typhoid or outside the household paratyphoid

processed_title: vaccine for preventing typhoid fever
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever and paratyphoid fever continue to be important cause of illness and death particularly among child and adolescent in southcentral and southeast asia two typhoid vaccine are commercially available ty21a oral and vi polysaccharide parenteral but neither is used routinely other vaccine such a a new modified conjugated vi vaccine called virepa are in development objective to evaluate the efficacy and adverse effect of vaccine used to prevent typhoid fever search method in june 2013 we searched the cochrane infectious disease group specialized register central medline embase lilac and mrct we also searched relevant conference proceeding up to 2013 and scanned the reference list of all included trial selection criterion randomized and quasirandomized controlled trial rcts comparing typhoid fever vaccine with other typhoid fever vaccine or with an inactive agent placebo or vaccine for a different disease data collection and analysis two review author independently applied inclusion criterion and extracted data we computed vaccine efficacy per year of followup and cumulative threeyear efficacy stratifying for vaccine type and dose the outcome addressed wa typhoid fever defined a isolation of salmonella typhi in blood we calculated risk ratio rrs and efficacy 1rr a a percentage with 95 confidence interval ci main result in total 18 rcts were included in this review 12 evaluated efficacy ty21a five trial vi polysaccharide six trial virepa one trial and 11 reported on adverse event ty21a vaccine oral vaccine three dos a processed_title: the cost of typhoid illness in low and middleincome country a scoping review of the literature
processed_abstract: typhoid fever is responsible for a substantial health burden in low and middleincome country lmics new mean of prevention became available with the prequalification of typhoid conjugate vaccine tcv by the world health organization who in 2018 policymakers require evidence to inform decision about tcv the economic burden related to typhoid fever can be considerable both for healthcare provider and household and should be accounted for in the decisionmaking process we aimed to understand the breadth of the evidence on the cost of typhoid fever by undertaking a scoping review of the published literature we searched scientific database with term referring to typhoid fever cost of illness to identify published study for the period january 1st 2000 to may 24th 2024 we also conferred with stakeholder engaged in typhoid research to identify study pending completion or publication we identified 13 published study reporting empirical data for 11 country most of them located in asia the total cost of a typhoid episode ranged from 23 in india to 884 in indonesia current 2022 united state dollar usd household expenditure related to typhoid fever were characterized a catastrophic in 9 study we identified 5 study pending completion or publication which will provide evidence for 9 country most of them located in africa alignment in study characteristic and method would increase the usefulness of the evidence generated and facilitate crosscountry and regional comparison the gap in evidence across region should be mitigated when study undertaken in african country are published there remains a lack of evidence on the cost to treat typhoid in the context of increasing antimicrobial resistance decisionmakers should consider the available evidence on the economic burden of typhoid particularly a risk factor related to antimicrobial resistance and climate change increase typhoid risk additional study should address typhoid illness cost using standardized method and accounting for the cost of antimicrobial resistance

processed_title: validation of the nelwan score a a screening tool for the diagnosis of typhoid fever in adult in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction typhoid fever diagnosis is challenging for clinician in area with limited laboratory facility scoring method based on sign and symptom are useful for screening for probable case of typhoid fever the nelwan score variable are derived from the clinical sign and symptom of patient with suspected typhoid we validated the nelwan score compared to laboratory test a the gold standard method this crosssectional study wa conducted between july 2017 and january 2018 in five hospital and two primary health care center in jakarta and tangerang indonesia patient with fever for 314 day and gastrointestinal symptom were evaluated using the nelwan score blood culture sample for polymerase chain reaction testing and additional rectal swab culture were collected simultaneously to confirm the diagnosis of typhoid data were analyzed using a contingency table to measure sensitivity specificity positive predictive value ppv and negative predictive value npv and the optimal cutoff of the nelwan score for typhoid diagnosis wa determined using a receiveroperating characteristic curve result typhoid wa confirmed in 11 of the 233 patient 47 with suspected typhoid among laboratoryconfirmed typhoid case the median nelwan score wa 11 range 913 and the optimal cutoff value wa 10 with an area under the curve of 713 sensitivity of 818 specificity of 608 ppv of 93 and npv of 985 conclusion a nelwan score of 10 is the best cutoff value for screening for typhoid fever it is useful a screening tool for typhoid fever where laboratory resource are limited and could help to decrease irrational antibiotic use

processed_title: identification of typhoid fever and paratyphoid fever case at presentation in outpatient clinic in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: in jakarta indonesia over 80 of patient with typhoid fever or paratyphoid fever are treated in outpatient setting in a communitybased prospective passive surveillance study we identified 59 typhoid 23 paratyphoid fever and 259 nonenteric fever outpatient all blood cultureconfirmed we compared their symptom with the aim of developing a clinical prediction rule that may help direct empirical antibiotic treatment to case with suspected paratyphoid fever rather than all febrile patient or refer patient for additional diagnostic test paratyphoid fever salmonella paratyphi a could not be distinguished clinically from typhoid fever decision on empirical antibiotic treatment and advice on hygiene measure in patient with suspected paratyphoid fever should take into account chill and absence of cough in the first week of fever and delirium in the second week of illness this prediction rule increase the likelihood of paratyphoid fever from 110 in the first week to at most 23 in the second week of a febrile illness however we were not able to propose a robust clinical prediction rule that could be used a absolute screening method for decision on additional diagnostic test because of the low sensitivity of presenting symptom in paratyphoid fever

processed_title: typhoid fever in ujung pandang indonesiahighrisk group and highrisk behaviour
processed_abstract: we performed a hospitalbased casecontrol study to identify high risk group and route of transmission of typhoid fever in the city of ujung pandang on the island of sulawesi indonesia the annual incidence of this disease in southern sulawesi is estimated at 311000 and the case fatality at 51 case were 50 patient over 13 year of age admitted to stella mari hospital with a diagnosis of typhoid fever between june and september 1991 diagnosis wa made on clinical ground and in 90 of case confirmed by a widal test control were 42 patient admitted for noninfectious disorder during the same period and individually matched by age and sex control did not have a history of typhoid fever interview took place in hospital analysis wa by unconditional logistic regression highrisk group consisted of those who were single unemployed and those who had a university education median age of case wa 22 year consumption of food from warungs food stall in the street wa strongly associated with risk or 45 both case and control washed hand after use of the toilet and before meal but case used soap significantly less often or 30 the result of this study can be used to take preventive measure against this severe disease of educated and single young adult by targetting them for iecactivities emphasizing the importance of thorough handwashing and the need to take care in the selection of streetfoods

processed_title: characteristic and risk factor for typhoid fever after the tsunami earthquake and under normal condition in indonesia
processed_abstract: background although typhoid transmitted by food and water is a common problem in daily life it characteristic and risk factor may differ in disasteraffected area which reinforces the need for rapid public health intervention survey were carried out posttsunami in banda aceh postearthquake in yogyakarta and under normal condition in bandung indonesia logistic regression analysis wa used to assess the risk factor with the dependent variable of typhoid fever with or without complication finding characteristic typhoid fever with complication wa found in 5 patient 119 affected by the tsunami in aceh 8 205 after the earthquake in yogyakarta and 13 186 in bandung after the tsunami in aceh clean water or 005 95ci 001047 and drug availability or 023 95ci 002243 are significant independent risk factor while for the earthquake in yogyakarta contact with other typhoid patient or 2030 95ci 19321302 and education or 008 95ci 001098 were significant risk factor under normal condition in bandung hand washing or 007 95ci 001050 and education or 008 95ci 001064 emerged a significant risk factor conclusion the change in risk factor for typhoid complication after the tsunami in aceh and the earthquake in yogyakarta emphasizes the need for rapid public health intervention in natural disaster in indonesia

processed_title: sepsis and disseminated intravascular coagulation are rare complication of typhoid fever a case report
processed_abstract: introduction and importance typhoid fever is an infection caused by salmonella typhi the common complication are intestinal perforation and typhoid encephalopathy case of typhoid fever with sepsis andor disseminated intravascular coagulation dic are rarely reported even though typhoid fever is endemic in indonesia case presentation a 4yearold male referral case from a district hospital wa experiencing fever decrease of consciousness and massive bleeding from his gastrointestinal tract and nose investigation revealed result from the igm typhoid test using tubexrtf with the score of 8 pelod 2 score wa 10 and psofa wa 5 dic score wa 7 based on these finding the patient wa diagnosed with typhoid fever with dic and sepsis being the complication of the typhoid fever clinical discussion dic is mostly a subclinical event and severe bleeding complication found in typhoid fever are uncommon although dic score which indicate an imbalance of coagulation and fibrinolysis are markedly elevated in patient with typhoid dic can be a part of multiorgan dysfunction due to sepsis syndrome acute infection can also result in systemic activation of coagulation conclusion sepsis and dic are rare complication of typhoid fever typhoid fever can be presented with profound bleeding manifestation other than gastrointestinal bleeding since it is a common symptom of typhoid fever further research should be conducted to postulate association between typhoid fever and dic

processed_title: oral immunisation against typhoid fever in indonesia with ty21a vaccine
processed_abstract: when tested under condition of moderate transmission of typhoid fever a liquid formulation of the oral typhoid fever vaccine ty21a had a protective efficacy of 96 in egypt and an enteric coated capsule formulation had an efficacy of 67 in chile we compared the two formulation under condition of intense transmission of typhoid fever in indonesia in a randomised doubleblind trial 20543 subject age range 344 year received either three dos of enteric coated capsule containing placebo or live ty21a or three dos of lyophilised placebo or live ty21a reconstituted with phosphate buffer during 30 month of followup the rate of bloodculturepositive typhoid fever among control wa 810100000 per year rate of typhoid fever were 379100000 per year for subject who received the liquid formulation of vaccine and 468100000 per year for subject who received enteric coated capsule the protective efficacy of the liquid and enteric coated formulation were 53 and 42 respectively neither formulation protected against infection with salmonella paratyphi a no major sideeffects were noted but the overall incidence of sideeffects wa greater in the vaccine group under condition of intense transmission ty21a protected against typhoid fever however because ty21a will not protect all individual there is a need for additional approach to prevent the disease

processed_title: outcome in three group of patient with typhoid fever in indonesia between 1948 and 1990
processed_abstract: the outcome in three group of patient with bacteriologically confirmed typhoid fever caused by salmonella typhi treated during three episode between 1948 and 1990 in java indonesia wa compared by retrospective analysis of hospital record the study population consisted of three group of patient group i n 50 wa treated in batavia the present jakarta from 1948 to 1950 group ii n 61 in yogyakarta from 1952 to 1956 group iii n 105 in semarang from 1989 to 1990 main outcome measure were day until defervescence early relapse during hospitalization duration of hospital stay complication and mortality group i received supportive treatment only group ii low dos of chloramphenicol total 125 g and group iii full dos of chloramphenicol total 27 g occasionally other antibiotic were used in group i ii and iii the mean number of day until defervescence wa 16 8 and 6 and the mean number of day in hospital 43 47 and 15 respectively mortality wa 26 10 and 5 and complication occurred in 38 18 and 13 respectively between group i and group ii the difference in mortality and complication were statistically significant p 005 compared to group i the proportion of early relapse wa higher in group ii but wa zero in group iii there were significantly fewer gastrointestinal complication in group ii than in group i p 001 and even fewer in group iii when no antibiotic against s typhi wa available typhoid fever had a protracted course and only 74 of patient survived even with low dosage of chloramphenicol defervescence wa earlier and mortality and complication decreased dramatically but early relapse were frequent full dos of chloramphenicol for a sufficient period of time only slightly reduced mortality and complication further but eliminated early relapse completely

processed_title: a study of typhoid fever in five asian country disease burden and implication for control
processed_abstract: objective to inform policymakers about introduction of preventive intervention against typhoid including vaccination method a populationbased prospective surveillance design wa used study site where typhoid wa considered a problem by local authority were established in china india indonesia pakistan and viet nam standardized clinical laboratory and surveillance method were used to investigate case of fever of or 3 day duration for a oneyear period a total of 441435 person were under surveillance 159856 of whom were aged 515 year finding a total of 21874 episode of fever were detected salmonella typhi wa isolated from 475 2 blood culture 57 273475 of which were from 515 yearolds the annual typhoid incidence per 100000 person year among this age group varied from 242 and 293 in site in viet nam and china respectively to 1803 in the site in indonesia and to 4129 and 4935 in site in pakistan and india respectively altogether 23 96413 of isolates were multidrug resistant chloramphenicol ampicillin and trimethoprimsulfamethoxazole conclusion the incidence of typhoid varied substantially between site being high in india and pakistan intermediate in indonesia and low in china and viet nam these finding highlight the considerable but geographically heterogeneous burden of typhoid fever in endemic area of asia and underscore the importance of evidence on disease burden in making policy decision about intervention to control this disease

processed_title: evaluation of a simple and rapid dipstick assay for the diagnosis of typhoid fever in indonesia
processed_abstract: to support the clinical diagnosis of typhoid fever in indonesia where most hospital and health centre have no facility for culture a rapid dipstick assay for the detection of salmonella typhispecific igm antibody wa evaluated on serum sample from 127 patient clinically suspected of having typhoid fever in a single blood sample collected on admission to hospital the sensitivity of the dipstick assay wa 698 when compared with bone marrow culture and 865 when compared with blood culture the specificity a calculated for the group of patient with suspected typhoid fever but a negative culture result wa calculated to be 889 of 80 patient with febrile illness other than typhoid fever reactivity wa observed in only three patient with dengue haemorrhagic fever the assay us stabilised component that can be stored outside the refrigerator doe not require special equipment and may be of use in remote health facility that have no culture facility

processed_title: poor food hygiene and housing a risk factor for typhoid fever in semarang indonesia
processed_abstract: to identify risk factor for typhoid fever in semarang city and it surroundings 75 cultureproven typhoid fever patient discharged 2 week earlier from hospital and 75 control were studied control subject were neighbour of case with no history of typhoid fever not family member randomly selected and matched for gender and age both case and control were interviewed at home by the same trained interviewer using a standardized questionnaire a structured observation of their living environment inside and outside the house wa performed during the visit and home drinking water sample were tested bacteriologically univariate analysis showed the following risk factor for typhoid fever never or rarely washing hand before eating or 328 95 ci 141765 eating outdoors at least once a week or 300 95 ci 109825 eating outdoors at a street food stall or mobile food vendor or 386 95 ci 1301148 consuming ice cube in beverage in the 2week period before getting ill or 300 95 ci 109825 and buying ice cube from a street vendor or 582 95 ci 1692012 water quality and living environment of case were worse than that of control eg case less often used clean water for taking a bath or 650 95 ci 1472880 for brushing teeth or 433 95 ci 1251520 and for drinking or 367 95 ci 1021314 case tended to live in house without water supply from the municipal network or1100 95 ci 142852 with open sewer or 280 95 ci 10777 and without tile in the kitchen or 267 95 ci 104681 multivariate analysis showed that living in a house without water supply from the municipal network or 2918 95 ci 2124008 and with open sewer or 719 95 ci 1333882 wa associated with typhoid fever never or rarely washing hand before eating or 397 95 ci 1221293 and being unemployed or having a parttime job or 313 95 ci 3083174 also were risk factor in this population typhoid fever wa associated with poor housing and inadequate food and personal hygiene

processed_title: low and declining attack rate of imported typhoid fever in the netherlands 19972014 in spite of a restricted vaccination policy
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever mainly occurs in sub tropical region where sanitary condition remain poor in other region it occurs mainly among returning traveler or their direct contact the aim of this study wa to evaluate the current dutch guideline for typhoid vaccination method crude annual attack rate ar per 100000 dutch traveler were calculated during the period 1997 to 2014 by dividing the number of typhoid fever case by the estimated total number of traveler to a specific country or region region of exposure and possible risk factor were evaluated result during the study period 607 case of typhoid fever were reported most case were imported from asia 60 almost half of the case were ethnically related to typhoid risk region and 37 were case visiting friend and relative the overall ar for traveler to all region declined significantly country with the highest ar were india 29 per 100000 indonesia 8 per 100000 and morocco 10 per 100000 there wa a significant decline in ar among traveler to popular travel destination such a morocco turkey and indonesia ar among traveler to intermediaterisk area according to the dutch guideline such a latin america or subsaharan africa remained very low despite the restricted vaccination policy for these area compared to many other guideline conclusion the overall ar of typhoid fever among traveler returning to the netherlands is very low and ha declined in the past 20 year the dutch vaccination policy not to vaccinate shortterm traveler to latinamerica subsaharan africa thailand and malaysia seems to be justified because the ar for these destination remain very low these result suggest that further restriction of the dutch vaccination policy is justified

processed_title: comparative effectiveness study of chloramphenicol and ceftriaxone in the treatment of typhoid fever in child admitted to putri hijau kesdam ibb hospital medan
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever is a disease caused by salmonella typhi bacteria especially attacking the digestive tract chloramphenicol is the main drug of choice for the treatment of typhoid fever but along with the advancement of the medical field other medicine were developed ceftriaxone is an effective drug for the treatment of typhoid fever in the short term but the price of ceftriaxone is more expensive aim the aim of this study wa comparative effectiveness study of chloramphenicol and ceftriaxone in the treatment of typhoid fever in child admitted to putri hijau kesdam ibb hospital medan method this study wa conducted crosssectionally about the treatment of typhoid fever in child who were hospitalized at tk ii putrihijau hospital kesdam ibb medan the patient used cloramfenikol antibiotic in 13 patient and used ceftriaxone in 17 patient patient age range from 019 year antibiotic analysis is the best effectiveness using the acer method result he result of the patient characteristic show that the child of patient who suffer from typhoid fever the highest age is 1216 year 50 by gender male 60 and female 40 patient hospitalized using chloramfenicol averaged 653 day 7 day while ceftriaxon averaged 417 day the average number of direct medical cost in pediatric patient suffering from typhoid fever using cloramfenikol wa 3212776patient while ceftriaxon 1967045patient cost effectiveness analysis using acer method obtained result for cloramenicenicol at 492002day and ceftriaxon 471713day concluson ceftriaxone ha a better treatment effectiveness compared to chloramphenicol in typhoid fever patient in child

processed_title: park2pacrg polymorphism and susceptibility to typhoid and paratyphoid fever
processed_abstract: host genetic factor may contribute to susceptibility to and outcome in infectious disease recently polymorphism in park2pacrg a gene cluster linked to ubiquitination and proteasomemediated protein degradation were found to be associated with manifest infection by m leprae here we address whether these polymorphism are associated with susceptibility to infection with salmonella typhi and s paratyphi a intracellular pathogen that upon infection of human share with mycobacteria aspect of the host immune response the polymorphism of park_e01697 park2_e012599 rs1333955 and rs1040079 were analysed by polymerase chain reaction and restriction fragment length polymorphism in a casecontrol study of typhoid and paratyphoid fever patient in an endemic area in jakarta indonesia for this study sample were obtained from patient with blood cultureconfirmed typhoid fever n90 paratyphoid fever n26 and fever control n337 in a passive communitybased surveillance and compared to those of randomly selected community control n322 from the same city area the park2_e012599 allele t wa significantly associated with typhoid and paratyphoid fever or 151 95ci 102223 but the other polymorphism park2_e01697 rs1333955 and rs1040079 were not associated although within the park2pacrg gene cluster the park2_e012599 allele t wa most strongly associated with leprosy or approximately 35 the association with typhoid is much less strong our finding suggest that this polymorphism in park2pacrg play a small but significant role in susceptibility to the intracellular pathogen s typhi and s paratyphi

processed_title: simple rapid and affordable pointofcare test for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever
processed_abstract: we developed a pointofcare test for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever in the format of an immunochromatographic lateral flow assay the flow assay for typhoid fever is based on the detection of salmonella enterica serotype typhi lipopolysaccharidespecific immunoglobulin m igm antibody the assay wa evaluated on serum sample collected in a hospital in south sulawesi indonesia where typhoid fever is endemic and the result were compared with culture and widal test the sensitivity of this typhoid fever igm flow assay for sample collected at 1st diagnosis from patient with cultureconfirmed typhoid fever wa determined to be 593 the sensitivity ranged from 412 to 895 depending on the duration of illness a specificity of 978 wa calculated based on result obtained for patient with clinical suspicion of typhoid fever that wa later excluded the assay is ideal for use a a pointofcare test in health care center that lack the expertise and facility to perform culture or the less specific widal test because of it simplicity the assay may also be used a a field test in remote area

processed_title: clinical and laboratory manifestation of typhoid fever at persahabatan hospital jakarta
processed_abstract: aim to determine clinical and therapeutic characteristic and antibiotic susceptibility test result for typhoid fever method a retrospective study using data from medical record of all typhoid fever subject which is confirmed by blood culture positive for s typhi or s paratyphi this study wa performed to determine clinical laboratory and therapeutic characteristic statistical analysis wa performed using unpaired student ttest result out of 119 subject 588 were male and 412 were female the average age wa 2498 year sd 1111 predominant symptom were headache epigastric pain nausea anorexia together with fever from the afternoon to night predominant laboratory abnormality were decreased or normal leukocyte count increased of sgotsgpt increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate thrombocytopenia and proteinuria predominant widal test result for antigen o and h were 1320 four time elevation of widal titer were rare in this study typhoid hepatitis typhoid pneumonia typhoid encephalopathy intestinal haemorrhage are the most frequent complication in this study chloramphenicol is still effective for typhoid fever conclusion from this study it can be concluded that headache epigastric pain nausea decreased appetite together with fever in the eveningat night with normaldecreased leukocyte count and abnormal liver function are the most common clinical symptom found in typhoid subject

processed_title: enteric fever burden in north jakarta indonesia a prospective communitybased study
processed_abstract: introduction we undertook a prospective communitybased study in north jakarta indonesia to determine the incidence clinical characteristic seasonality etiologic agent and antimicrobial susceptibility pattern of enteric fever methodology following a census treatment centrebased surveillance for febrile illness wa conducted for twoyears clinical data and a blood culture were obtained from each patient result in a population of 160261 we detected 296 laboratoryconfirmed enteric fever case during the surveillance period of which 221 75 were typhoid fever and 75 25 were paratyphoid fever the overall incidence of typhoid and paratyphoid case wa 14 and 05 per thousand population per year respectively although the incidence of febrile episode evaluated wa highest among child under 5 year of age at 926 per thousand person per year we found that the burden of typhoid fever wa greatest among child between 5 and 20 year of age paratyphoid fever occurred most commonly in child and wa infrequent in adult conclusion enteric fever is a public health problem in north jakarta with a substantial proportion due to paratyphoid fever the result highlight the need for control strategy against enteric fever

processed_title: antibody response in typhoid fever in endemic indonesia and the relevance of serology and culture to diagnosis
processed_abstract: culture and serology were performed on blood and serum sample collected at or shortly after admission from 473 patient presented with suspected clinical typhoid clinical symptom at first presentation including confusion hepatomegaly splenomegaly abdominal pain anemia and gastrointestinal bleeding were nonspecific a they were observed even more often in nontyphoid patient culture confirmed the diagnosis in 653 of the patient with typhoid fever a the final diagnosis the sensitivity 58 and specificity 981 of a rapid dipstick assay for the detection of s typhispecific immunoglobulin m were somewhat lower than those of culture but higher than those of the widal test the dipstick assay thus may well be used in the serodiagnosis of typhoid in situation where culture facility are not available combination of test result of dipstick and culture improved sensitivity to 825 in laboratory that perform blood culture the dipstick assay may be used a a rapid screening test to facilitate a rapid diagnosis sensitivity of the dipstick assay strongly increased with duration of illness and wa higher for culture positive than for culture negative patient duration of illness and different pathogen and host factor including dose of infection pathogenicity and antigenicity and prior antibiotic use are likely to influence the immune response therefore the result of the dipstick assay duration of illness and presence of s typhi in the blood are major factor that determine severity of disease

processed_title: polymorphism in proinflammatory gene and susceptibility to typhoid fever and paratyphoid fever
processed_abstract: host genetic factor are thought to contribute to susceptibility and outcome in infectious disease a polymorphism in a proinflammatory gene tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfa 308 wa recently found to be associated with susceptibility to typhoid fever a the observation wa made in hospitalized patient a potential confounder could be that the tnfa polymorphism is associated with the severity of established illness resulting in hospital admission rather than susceptibility to disease we tested whether the association with tnfa 308 is present also in typhoid fever patient enrolled in a communitybased casecontrol study in an endemic area in indonesia common polymorphism in other proinflammatory gene were assayed a well sample of patient with blood cultureconfirmed typhoid fever n 90 and paratyphoid fever n 26 and fever control n 337 were compared with those of community control n 322 in these group we analyzed polymorphism in tnfa by pcr and rflp polymorphism of ifng il1a il1b il1r1 tnfrsf1a casp1 and crp by sequenom massarray san diego ca and polymorphism in il12b and ifngr1 by fragment length analysis the il1r1 polymorphism were nearly absent in the indonesian population the tnfa 308 polymorphism wa not associated with typhoid fever or 035 95 ci 0110 in this population the polymorphism at tnfa 238 or in ifng il1a il1b il12b tnfrsf1a ifngr1 casp1 and crp were also not associated with typhoid or paratyphoid fever we conclude that polymorphism in proinflammatory gene do not contribute to susceptibility to typhoid fever and in view of earlier finding suggest that the tnfa 308 polymorphism is likely related to severity of established disease rather than to susceptibility per se

processed_title: application of a pointofcare test for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever in nigeria and the need for improved diagnostics
processed_abstract: introduction there is an urgent need for affordable pointofcare diagnostics for the differentiation of febrile illness and the confirmation of typhoid in endemic country methodology blood sample were collected from febrile patient with clinical suspicion of typhoid and screened for typhoid fever using the widal and typhi dri dot test while stool and blood sample were screened for salmonella typhi using the culture method a well a pcr a a confirmatory test result a high proportion of febrile patient from lagos with clinical suspicion of typhoid fever reacted positively in a simple and rapid latex agglutination assay for typhoid fever indicating that this illness is a common and presumably underdiagnosed health problem in this metropolis seropositivity wa 192 in the rapid test compared with 229 in the classical widal test the confirmation of typhoid in these seropositive patient appeared cumbersome because of negative blood culture and low dna yield in molecular testing a review of the literature revealed that in nigeria seroprevalence rate can be high in the normal population and that pathogen other than s typhi are often isolated from the blood of seropositive febrile patient conclusion the simplicity and the relatively high specificity 978 of the rapid test a determined in a study performed in indonesia call for a further validation of this promising test for use in africa
