processed_title: clinical characteristic of enteric fever and performance of tubex tf igm test in indonesian hospital
processed_abstract: background accurate diagnosis of enteric fever is challenging particularly in low and middleincome country due to the overlap of clinical and laboratory feature with other pathogen to better understand the difficulty in enteric fever diagnosis we evaluated the characteristic of patient clinically diagnosed with enteric fever and the realworld performance of tubex tf one of the most used test in indonesia methodologyprincipal finding patient were recruited through the afire etiology of acute febrile illness requiring hospitalization study at eight indonesian hospital blood culture wa performed for all patient and tubex tf wa performed for suspected enteric case salmonella pcr and elisa test were performed at a reference lab sensitivity and specificity of tubex tf and igm and igg anti typhi elisa were determined of 301 patient clinically diagnosed with enteric fever 50 166 were confirmed by blood culture andor pcr confirmed case were mostly schoolaged child presenting with fever anorexia dizziness andor abdominal pain with normal leukocyte count or leukopenia tubex tf demonstrated a sensitivity of 976 to 707 and specificity of 383 to 672 at cutoff of 4 and 6 respectively acute igg demonstrated the best sensitivity and specificity at 907 and 827 respectively and the best roc characteristic conclusionssignificance a substantial proportion of enteric fever wa misdiagnosed at all study hospital likely due to the overlap of clinical characteristic and lab parameter with those of other common pathogen the tubex tf rapid serological assay demonstrated suboptimal performance in our setting and tended to overdiagnose enteric fever the role of igg from acute specimen for identification of enteric fever case merit additional consideration

processed_title: open study on efficacy and tolerability of ciprofloxacin xr compared with ciprofloxacin bid in the treatment of typhoid fever
processed_abstract: aim to compare the efficacy and tolerability of ciproflaxin extendedrelease and ciproflaxin intermediate release in the treatment of typhoid fever method a prospective open labelled clinical trial comparing the safety and efficacy of extendedrelease ciprofloxacin 1000 mg once daily ciprofloxacin xr and ciprofloxacin intermediate release 500 mg two time daily ciprofloxacin bid wa performed in adult with typhoid fever diagnosis for typhoid fever wa based on widal serology test blood culture and polymerase chain reaction pcr for salmonella typhi a twosided student ttest and chisquare or fisher exact test were used for the analysis of clinical response result good clinical response were obtained in 32 subject 14 with intermediate release ciprofloxacin and 18 with extendedrelease ciprofloxacin and there were no failure case 0 day to reach defervescence in ciprofloxacin bid mean 328 day wa similar to ciprofloxacin xr group mean 372 day with p043 mild side effect were noted in 71 of subject who received ciprofloxacin bid compared by 222 in subject who received ciprofloxacin xr with p029 there were no moderate or severe side effect on both drug conclusion clinical outcome were similar for the two treatment and both treatment were well tolerated once daily ciprofloxacin xr wa safe effective and noninferior to twicedaily ciprofloxacin ir in the treatment of typhoid fever

processed_title: immune response of thalassemia major patient in indonesia with and without splenectomy
processed_abstract: aim to describe nonspesific and specific immune response profile in indonesian thalassemia major with and without splenectomy method this study wa held at thalassaemia centre cipto mangunkusumo hospital jakarta on september 2013february 2014 a comparative cross sectional study wa conducted in healthy thalassemia major aged more than 12 year and seronegative hiv they were matched in age and sex for splenectomised and nonsplenectomised group analysing the nonspesific immune response neutrophil count and phagocytosis and specific immune response count and function of cellular immunity infection episode were also analized a immune response in vivo parameter result splenectomised thalassemia major showed increased neutrophil count but significantly decreased nonspesific immune response neutrophil phagocytosis spesific immune response of splenectomised group presented significantly higher absolute lymphocyte lymphocyte t cd4 and cd8 count compared to nonsplenectomised thalassemia major p005 ratio cd4cd8 were similar in these group serum marker of activated cellular imunity function il2 and tnf were similar among two group mild infection episode on splenectomised and nonsplenectomised group were 202 ranged 0 to 12 time and 081 ranged 0 to 8 time p0004 respectively severe infection on splenectomised group were sepsis for 2 week and diarrhea for 1 week whereas on nonsplenectomised group wa typhoid fever for 4 day conclusion there were significant difference on immune response among thalassemia major patient splenectomised thalassemia major showed a greater degree of susceptibility to infection than nonsplenectomised thalassemia major

processed_title: open study on efficacy and safety of levofloxacin in treatment of uncomplicated typhoid fever
processed_abstract: the main objective of this study wa to determine the clinical efficacy and safety of levofloxacin in an open setting for typhoid fever case patient with clinical sign and symptom of typhoid fever without previous antimicrobial treatment admitted to affiliated hospital of the faculty of medicine university indonesia were included in this study adult 18 year or above were screened for any serious underlying condition pregnancy or possible complication of typhoid fever before final enrollment fiftythree subject were screened 48 were enrolled the final diagnosis of enteric fever wa made by positive blood culture polymerase chain reaction or serology wa obtained in 31 case in whom one had a concomitant sinus infection and had to be excluded thirty patient 11 male 19 female aged between 1858 year mean 317 year with a history of fever between 1 and 10 day mean 61 day showed excellent clinical response becoming afebrile at an average of 243 day range 15 day adverse effect noted were nausea in 4 patient vomiting in one and meteorism in another one which were all difficult to distinguish from the enteric infection a pruritic rash occurring in two patient may be related to levofloxacin and insomnia in another patient may be related microbiological clearance wa obtained both immediately after treatment and at one month no carrier state were detected in the case positive for salmonella typhi or paratyphi none of the treated typhoid fever case experienced a clinical relapse in this open study of levofloxacin 500 mgday for one week in treatment of uncomplicated typhoid fever a 100 clinical efficacy wa obtained in 30 patient with minimal adverse reaction warranting more intensive study for this new indication of an old but well known disease in the developing world

processed_title: cost of illness due to typhoid fever in five asian country
processed_abstract: objective to generate communitybased estimate of the public paid by the government and private paid by household cost of blood cultureconfirmed typhoid fever in hechi china north jakarta indonesia kolkata india karachi pakistan and hue vietnam method to measure outofpocket cost of illness and lost earnings family with cultureproven case were surveyed 7 14 and 90 day after onset of illness public cost of treatment were measured at local health facility using a micro costing bottomup method result the cost of hospitalized case ranged from usd 129 in kolkata to usd 432 in north jakarta hospitalization rate varied from 2 in kolkata to 40 in hechi and the cost of nonhospitalized case ranged from usd 13 in kolkata to usd 67 in hechi where cost were highest hechi north jakarta and karachi the bulk of the cost of hospitalized case wa borne by family comprising up to 15 of annual household income conclusion although these estimate may understate true cost due to the fact that higher quality treatment may have been provided earlierthanusual this multicountry communitybased study contributes to evidence on the public and private cost of typhoid fever in developing country these cost estimate were used in a costeffectiveness analysis of typhoid vaccine and will help policymakers respond to world health organization updated typhoid fever immunization recommendation

processed_title: risk factor for typhoid fever in traveler
processed_abstract: background the incidence of typhoid fever in the developing world remains high and ha been estimated at 540 case per 100000 of the population per year international traveler to such area are at risk of infection especially if they travel under low hygienic standard method in order to identify the risk factor leading to infection in traveler and expatriate travel history anamnestic and clinical feature of 31 patient with typhoid fever who presented to a german travel clinic were investigated result compared to the total patient population of the outpatient clinic during the period of investigation n 17029 patient patient who presented with typhoid fever were older 39 year versus 31 year p 001 and traveled longer 58 day versus 19 day p 001 while only 192 of the total patient population had traveled to the indian subcontinent prior to referral 354 of the patient with typhoid fever had acquired the infection there p 001 similar result were obtained for south east asia and indonesia twenty percent of the total patient population traveled there in contrast with 322 of patient with typhoid fever p 001 latin america wa visited by 163 of all patient but only 64 of patient with typhoid p 001

processed_title: a phase ii clinical trial of a vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine in healthy indonesian adolescent and adult onemonth evaluation of safety and immunogenicity
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever is commonly found until today especially in developing country it ha fatal complication and measure must be taken to reduce the incidence of typhoid vaccination are a key factor in prevention this is a phase ii randomized observerblind clinical trial on a novel vidt conjugate vaccine on 200 subject 12 to 40 year of age method subject were screened for eligibility after which a blood sample wa taken and one dose of vaccine wa administered investigational vaccine used wa vidt and control wa vip twentyeight day after vaccination subject visited for providing blood sample to assess immunogenicity and were asked about local and systemic adverse reaction that occurred in the first 28 day result subject had minor adverse reaction pain wa the most common local reaction muscle pain wa the most common systemic reaction there were no serious adverse event up to 28 day post vaccination seroconversion rate were 100 in the vidt group and 9596 in the vip group post vaccination gmt were increased in both group but it wa significantly higher in the vidt group p 0001 conclusion vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine is safe and immunogenic in healthy indonesian subject 12 to 40 year trial registration approved by clinicaltrialsgov clinical trial registration number nct03460405 registered on 09032018 url httpsclinicaltrialsgovct2shownct03460405

processed_title: secondary infection of amoeba and typhoid fever in severe malnourished pediatric patient with type i choledocal cyst a case report
processed_abstract: amebiasis is caused by the protozoan entamoeba histolytica extraintestinal amebiasis manifestation includes liver abscess and other rare manifestation involving the lung heart and brain liver abscess is the most common extraintestinal manifestation only few case of amebic splenic abscess and two case of gall bladder abscess have been reported typhoid fever is an infection caused by salmonella typhi it can cause extraintestinal complication such a myocarditis endocarditis pneumonia empyema osteomyelitis arthritis cholecystitis spleen abscess and liver abscess choledocal cyst is a congenital dilation of the biliary branch if left untreated it can cause morbidity from cholangitis cyst perforation liver failure and malignancy until now there is no publication about double infection of amebic and salmonella infection in a child with choledocal cyst

processed_title: analysis of existence of multidrugresistant h58 gene in salmonella enterica serovar typhi isolated from typhoid fever patient in makassar indonesia
processed_abstract: the surveillance of multidrugresistant mdr h58 typhoid is highly important especially in endemic area mdr strain detection is needed by using a simple pcr technique that only us a pair of primer this is conducted considering the detection of salmonella typhi strain that have been carried out so far are only using antimicrobial sensitivity test to determine microbial resistance phenotypically and to determine genotypically using complex molecular technique we aimed to analyse the existence of salmonella typhi mdr h58 in patient with typhoid fever in makassar indonesia a total of 367 blood sample of typhoid fever patient were collected from april 2018 until april 2019 the blood sample wa cultured then confirmed via simple pcr all of the confirmed sample were tested for susceptibility against antibiotic and molecularly analysed for mdr h58 existence using a simple pcr technique we found 7 27367 of the sample to be positive by both blood culture and pcr all 27 isolates were found to be sensitive to sulfamethoxazoletrimethoprim the lowest drug sensitivity were to amoxicillin at one 37 of 27 isolates and ampicillin at 13 481 of 27 isolates salmonella typhi h58 pcr result showed that one 37 of 27 isolates carried a positive fragment of 993 bp that led to the h58 strain since the deletion flank this fragment the isolate wa also found to be resistant to amoxicillin and fluoroquinolone according to a sensitivity test further molecular analysis need to be conducted to examine the single isolate that carried the 933 bp fragment

processed_title: underdiagnoses of rickettsia in patient hospitalized with acute fever in indonesia observational study result
processed_abstract: background report of human rickettsial infection in indonesia are limited this study sought to characterize the epidemiology of human rickettsioses amongst patient hospitalized with fever at 8 tertiary hospital in indonesia method acute and convalescent blood from 975 hospitalized nondengue patient wa tested for rickettsia igm and igg by elisa specimen from case with seroconversion or increasing igm andor igg titer were tested for rickettsia igm and igg by ifa and rickettsia genome using primer for rickettsia r sp r typhi and orientia tsutsugamushi testing wa performed retrospectively on stored specimen result did not inform patient management result r typhi r rickettsii and o tsutsugamushi igg antibody were identified in 269872 308 36634 57 and 19504 38 of sample respectively for the 103975 106 nondengue patient diagnosed with acute rickettsial infection presenting symptom included nausea 72 headache 69 vomiting 43 lethargy 33 anorexia 32 arthralgia 30 myalgia 28 chill 28 epigastric pain 28 and rash 17 no acute rickettsioses case were suspected during hospitalization discharge diagnosis included typhoid fever 44 dengue fever 20 respiratory infection 7 leptospirosis 6 unknown fever 6 sepsis 5 hepatobiliary infection 3 uti 3 and others 9 fatality occurred in 7 68 patient mostly with comorbidities conclusion rickettsial infection are consistently misdiagnosed often a leptospirosis dengue or salmonella typhi infection clinician should include rickettsioses in their differential diagnosis of fever to guide empiric management laboratory should support evaluation for rickettsial etiology and public policy should be implemented to reduce burden of disease

processed_title: tackling salmonellosis a comprehensive exploration of risk factor impact and solution
processed_abstract: salmonellosis caused by salmonella specie is one of the most common foodborne illness worldwide with an estimated 938 million case and about 15500 fatality in both industrialized and developing nation salmonellosis ha been reported to be one of the most prevalent foodborne zoonosis and is linked with array of illness syndrome such a acute and chronic enteritis and septicaemia the two major and most common salmonella specie implicated in both warmblooded and coldblooded animal are salmonella bongori and salmonella enterica to date more than 2400 s enterica serovars which affect both human and animal have been identified salmonella is further classified into serotypes based on three primary antigenic determinant somatic o flagellum h and capsular k the capacity of nearly all salmonella specie to infect multiply and survive in human host cell with the aid of their pathogenic and virulence arsenal make them deadly and important public health pathogen primarily foodproducing animal such a poultry swine cattle and their product have been identified a important source of salmonellosis additionally raw fruit and vegetable are among other food type that have been linked to the spread of salmonella spp based on the clinical manifestation of human salmonellosis salmonella strain can be categorized a either nontyphoidal salmonella nt and typhoidal salmonella the detection of aseptically collected salmonella in necropsy environmental sample feedstuffs rectal swab and food product serf a the basis for diagnosis in developing nation typhoid fever due to salmonella typhi typically result in the death of 530 of those affected the world health organization who calculated that there are between 16 and 17 million typhoid case worldwide each year with scaring 600000 death a a result the contagiousness of a salmonella outbreak depends on the bacterial strain serovar growth environment and host susceptibility risk factor for salmonella infection include a variety of food for example contaminated chicken beef and pork globally there is a growing incidence and emergence of lifethreatening clinical case especially due to multidrugresistant mdr salmonella spp including strain exhibiting resistance to important antimicrobial such a betalactams fluoroquinolones and thirdgeneration cephalosporin in extreme case especially in situation involving very difficulttotreat strain death usually result the severity of the infection resulting from salmonella pathogen is dependent on the serovar type host susceptibility the type of bacterial strain and growth environment this review therefore aim to detail the nomenclature etiology history pathogenesis reservoir clinical manifestation diagnosis epidemiology transmission risk factor antimicrobial resistance public health importance economic impact treatment and control of salmonellosis

processed_title: policymakers view regarding the introduction of newgeneration vaccine against typhoid fever shigellosis and cholera in asia
processed_abstract: facetoface interview and meeting with more than 160 policymakers and other influential professional in seven large asian country bangladesh china india indonesia pakistan thailand and vietnam were conducted to survey opinion regarding the need for and potential us of newgeneration vaccine against cholera typhoid fever and shigellosis despite several barrier to their uptakenotably uncertainty of the burden of enteric disease preference for water sanitation and other environmental improvement over vaccination for disease control and high price of the current vaccine relative to basic epi vaccine and their moderate protection levelsconsiderable interest wa found in the targeted use of vi typhoid vaccine in most country followed by future shigella and oral cholera vaccine the introduction of these vaccine in asia could be greatly facilitated by countryspecific evidence of disease burden local or regional vaccine production field study demonstrating their safety and efficacy in local population evidence of potential economic saving from vaccination and effective dissemination of research result to all those who make or influence immunization policy

processed_title: response of typhoid fever caused by chloramphenicolsusceptible and chloramphenicolresistant strain of salmonella typhi to treatment with trimethoprimsulfamethoxazole
processed_abstract: chloramphenicol remains the drug of choice for the treatment of typhoid fever in most area despite the risk of relapse and toxicity in a comparison of the efficacy of trimethoprimsulfamethoxazole tmpsmz and chloramphenicol against typhoid fever 60 patient in indonesia were randomly assigned to receive either tmpsmz 320 mg of tmp and 1600 mg of smz daily or chloramphenicol 2 g daily for 14 day tmpsmz wa significantly more effective in sterilizing the blood but the two drug were equally effective with regard to relapse rate frequency of prolonged fever and mortality use of tmpsmz in vietnam for the treatment of typhoid fever caused by chloramphenicolresistant salmonella typhi showed that tmpsmz is a effective a ampicillin likewise a review of other published report suggests that tmpsmz ha an overall record in the treatment of typhoid fever that is equal to or better than the record of other available drug tmpsmz ha emerged a a satisfactory alternative to chloramphenicol for the treatment of typhoid fever and should be especially useful in area where chloramphenicolresistant s typhi ha been isolated

processed_title: laboratory evaluation of a simple and rapid latex agglutination assay for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever
processed_abstract: a latex agglutination assay for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever wa evaluated on sample collected from patient with clinical suspicion of typhoid fever in south sulawesi indonesia where the disease is endemic the latex assay is very easy to use give a rapid result and may be used a a pointofcare diagnostic test for acute phase sample collected on average 6 day after the onset of illness the sensitivity is 425 for cultureconfirmed patient with typhoid fever and the specificity is 969 the sensitivity improved with the duration of illness from 308 for sample collected during the first 45 day of illness to 455 for sample collected between day 7 and 9 and to 846 for the sample collected more than 9 day after the onset of illness testing of followup sample may further improve sensitivity by demonstrating seroconversion

processed_title: prolonged care for presumed typhoid encephalitis in indonesia
processed_abstract: despite advancement in military medical treatment and evacuation soldier in austere environment remain vulnerable to disease and nonbattle injury and may face prolonged evacuation before receiving definitive care in particular arranging care for a soldier presenting with a condition that ha a wide differential diagnosis such a acute altered mental status am can be especially challenging we highlight the case of an otherwise young healthy u soldier serving in indonesia who presented with acute am concerning for undifferentiated infection subsequent workup at the receiving hospital following evacuation revealed salmonella enterica infection more commonly known a typhoid however even with clinical finding of typhoid encephalitis and initiation of empiric treatment medical care proved challenging in the resourcelimited local facility despite multiple escalation of care ultimately the patient wa evacuated to a tertiary facility in singapore where his condition improved and 4 day after initial presentation the patient had no definitive finding of infection on lumbar puncture this case not only highlight the threat of typhoid and other infectious disease in modern operation but also the challenge of suboptimal medical care in both the prehospital and hospital setting when utilizing host nation facility

processed_title: microbiological feature of indigenous typhoid case in taiwan and relatedness to imported case 20012014 a crosssectional analysis
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever wa rare in taiwan but approximately twothirds of the case were indigenous the transmission source of the indigenous case and the relatedness to the imported case remained unknown method patient with any site culture positive for salmonella enterica serovar typhi were identified in a teaching hospital during 20012014 the isolates were determined for antibiotic susceptibility pulsedfield gel electrophoresis pfge type and single nucleotide polymorphism snp type result a total of 64 typhoid episode were identified in 63 patient seventeen episode 266 were imported and a majority 10 588 of them were from indonesia the clinical manifestation outcome of patient and antibiograms of isolates were similar between indigenous and imported case 633 of the isolates were ciprofloxacinresistant the distribution of pfge and snp type did not differ significantly between indigenous and imported isolates either p 0191 and 0124 respectively identical pfge pattern could be identified in indigenous isolates appearing at certain time frame indicating outbreak due to local transmission of certain typhi strain conclusion the imported case of typhoid fever from southeast asia were the major source of indigenous s typhi infection in taiwan smallscale outbreak occurred due to local transmission of the strain after their importation

processed_title: adult perceived prevalence of enteric fever predicts laboratoryvalidated incidence of typhoid fever in child
processed_abstract: this study wa undertaken to develop a model to predict the incidence of typhoid in child based on adult perception of prevalence of enteric fever in the wider community typhoid case among child aged 515 year from epidemic region in five asian country were confirmed with a positive salmonella typhi culture of the blood sample estimate of the prevalence of enteric fever were obtained from random sample of adult in the same study site regression model were used for establishing the prediction equation the percentage of enteric fever reported by adult and case of typhoid incidence per 100000 detected through blood culture were 47 and 2418 for viet nam 38 and 2920 for china 263 and 18033 for indonesia 660 and 45415 for india and 527 and 40718 for pakistan respectively an established prediction equation wa incidence of typhoid 1100000 26946 72296 x reported prevalence of enteric fever f317 p001 r20992 using adult perception of prevalence of disease a the basis for estimating it incidence in child provides a costeffective behavioural epidemiologic method to facilitate prevention and control of the disease

processed_title: simple dipstick assay for the detection of salmonella typhispecific igm antibody and the evolution of the immune response in patient with typhoid fever
processed_abstract: application of a dipstick assay for the detection of salmonella typhispecific igm antibody on sample collected from s typhi or s paratyphi culturepositive patient at the day of admission to the hospital revealed the presence of specific igm antibody in 435 929 and 100 for sample collected 46 day 69 day and 9 day after the onset of fever respectively the mean sensitivity for sample collected an average of 66 day after the onset of fever wa 653 culture wa positive in 659 of the case with a final clinical diagnosis of typhoid fever testing of paired serum sample from culture negative patient with a final clinical diagnosis of typhoid fever resulted in staining of the dipstick in 43 of the sample collected at the day of admission to the hospital and in 766 of the sample collected one week later thereby provided strong supporting evidence of typhoid fever by demonstrating seroconversion in a large proportion of the patient the dipstick assay may thus also be useful for the serodiagnosis of culturenegative patient with clinical sign and symptom consistent with typhoid fever the advantage of the dipstick assay are that the result can be obtained on the same day allowing a prompt treatment that only a small volume of serum is needed and that no special laboratory equipment is needed to perform the assay the stability of the reagent of the dipstick and the simplicity of the assay allows it use in place that lack laboratory facility

processed_title: a novel vidiphtheria toxoid typhoid conjugate vaccine is safe and can induce immunogenicity in healthy indonesian child 211 year a phase ii preliminary report
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever caused by salmonella enteric serovar typhi s typhi is a common cause of morbidity in the world in 2017 143 million case of typhoid and paratyphoid fever occurred globally school age child between 3 to 19 year old are the most affected poor sanitation and multi drug resistance have increased the need for vaccine to reduce the global burden of disease based on previous trial typhoid conjugate vaccine have longer lasting protection higher efficacy require fewer dos and are suitable from infancy that allows them to be incorporated into the routine immunization program our previous phase i trial proved that a novel vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine is safe and immunogenic in subject 25 and 1840 year our phase ii trial consisted of subject 6 month to 40 year our previously published paper on subject 6 to 24 month proved that this vaccine is safe and immunogenic for this age group therefore with this paper we aimed to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity in child 211 year method a randomized observerblind superiority design of vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine compared to vipolysaccharide vaccine vip phase ii study wa conducted from october 2018 to december 2018 where 200 subject aged 211 year were recruited a blood sample prior to vaccination wa taken followed by administration of a single dose of either test vaccine vidt or control vaccine vip and then a second blood sample wa collected 28 day post vaccination adverse reaction were assessed and antibody increment wa evaluated at 28 day post vaccination through collected serum sample result pain wa the most common local reaction fever and muscle pain were the most common systemic reaction both vidt and vip group had roughly the same number of adverse reaction at 28 day post vaccination 100 of subject in the vidt group and 93 of subject in the vip group produced antibody increment 4 time the vidt group produced a higher gmt a compared to vip conclusion vidt vaccine is safe and immunogenic in child 211 year old trial registration trial registration number nct03460405

processed_title: antimicrobial resistance of salmonella enterica serovars typhi and paratyphi isolates from a general hospital in karawaci tangerang indonesia a fiveyear review
processed_abstract: typhoid and paratyphoid fever known a enteric fever pose important global public health problem with 216 million case and approximately 250000 death annually it is a prevalent disease in indonesia but data on the antimicrobial resistance pattern is limited this study aim wa to provide data on the antimicrobial resistance pattern of s typhi and s paratyphi bloodstream isolates in a general hospital in karawaci tangerang banten indonesia during the period of january 2011 to december 2015 susceptibility against antimicrobial wa detected according to the guideline of the clinical and laboratory standard institute clsi out of a total of 168 isolates 554 were s typhi and 446 s paratyphi a most of the isolates 929 were from child aged 618 year and adult population there wa low resistance of s typhi against ampicillin trimethoprimsulfamethoxazole ceftriaxone ciprofloxacin and levofloxacin similar to previous study in indonesia in the 20112015 period resistance rate against most antimicrobial and mdr rate of s typhi and s paratyphi were low emphasizing that there is a distinct epidemiological dynamic of the enteric fever in indonesia

processed_title: environmental surveillance for salmonella typhi to detect the typhoid burden in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background in low and middleincome country lmics understanding the burden of typhoid disease ha been challenging a clinical surveillance based on blood culture data alone often poorly represents the community burden underreported case unclear case definition the presence of a chronic carrier state and emerging antimicrobial resistance necessitate alternative approach to assess disease prevalence and target public health intervention such a vaccine introduction this study aimed to assess the feasibility of wastewater and environmental surveillance wes in measuring the prevalence of typhoid infection in indonesia method between october 11 2022 and august 31 2023 wes wa conducted in 18 location across 3 district in yogyakarta province indonesia sample were collected fortnightly from wastewater treatment plant wwtps manhole a river and public space using grab and passive sampling method salmonella typhi s typhi detection wa conducted using quantitative pcr for s typhi gene ttr tvib and stag all positive result of the 406 sample collected 13 51406 tested positive for s typhi with monthly positivity rate ranging from 2 151 in march 2023 to 47 1634 in october 2022 mean concentration in log10 in ttr tvib and stag in grab sample were 067 sd 099 023 sd 114 and 011 sd 105 the highest detection rate were observed in sample from the river compared to central wwtps or 1268 95 ci 2037920 p 0007 no correlation wa observed between rainfall and s typhi gene detection p 005 for all gene conclusion wes is feasible in indonesia and can be used to monitor typhoid disease burden in an endemic region high positivity rate from the river and septic tank in traditional market support a broad approach to sampling in lmics where formal wastewater management system may not accurately represent community disease prevalence due to it low population coverage wes can be a valuable tool to inform public health response including vaccine introduction

processed_title: the inappropriate use of antibiotic in hospitalized dengue virusinfected child with presumed concurrent bacterial infection in teaching and private hospital in bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background dengue virus infection dvi among child is a leading cause of hospitalization in endemic area hospitalized patient are at risk of receiving unnecessary antibiotic method a retrospective medical review analysis study wa conducted to evaluate the prevalence indication and choice of antibiotic given to hospitalized patient less than 15 year of age with dvi in two different hospital setting teaching and private hospital in the municipality of bandung epidemiological clinical and laboratory data were obtained using a pretested standardized questionnaire from patient medical record admitted from january 1 to december 31 2015 result there were 537 175 out of 3078 case who received antibiotic among 176 case admitted to the teaching hospital presumed bacterial upper respiratory tract infection urti and typhoid fever were found in 1 06 case and 6 03 case in private hospital among 2902 case presumed bacterial urti wa found in 324 112 case typhoid fever in 188 65 case and urinary tract infection uti in 18 06 case the prevalence of urti and typhoid fever were significantly lower in the teaching hospital compared to the private hospital p00001 and p005 respectively the diagnosis of urti in both teaching and private hospital wa merely based on clinical finding amoxicillin wa given to 1 patient in the teaching hospital the 3rd generation of cephalosporin mostly intravenous were given in 247 67 case in private hospital the diagnosis of typhoid fever in the teaching hospital wa based on culture in 1 167 and reactive igm antisalmonella in 5 833 case while in the private hospital they were based on reactive igm antisalmonella in 13 65 case single widal test in 61 325 and without laboratory confirmation in 114 606 case most of the case in both hospital setting were treated mostly with 3rd generation cephalosporin the diagnosis of uti wa based on positive leucocyte esterase and nitrite in urine dipstick test in 7 389 and leucocyturia alone in 11 611 case and wa treated with 3rd generation in 15 833 case amoxicillin chloramphenicol and clarithromycin each in 1 56 case conclusion the use of antibiotic in private hospital wa inappropriate in most case while the use of antibiotic in the teaching hospital wa more accountable this study indicated that intervention such a the implementation of the antibiotic stewardship program are needed especially in private hospital to reduce inappropriate use of antibiotic

processed_title: susceptibility to typhoid fever is associated with a polymorphism in the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator cftr
processed_abstract: the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator cftr is the affected protein in cystic fibrosis cf the high rate of cf carrier ha led to speculation that there must be similar to the sickle cell haemoglobin advantage in malaria a selective advantage for heterozygote such a selective advantage may be conferred through reduced attachment of salmonella typhi to intestinal mucosa thus providing resistance to typhoid fever we tested this hypothesis by genotyping patient and control in a typhoid endemic area in indonesia for two highly polymorphic marker in cftr and the most common cf mutation we found an association between genotype in cftr and susceptibility to typhoid fever or26 these analysis suggest that the role cftr play in vitro in s typhi infection is also important for infection in the human population

processed_title: antimicrobial resistance in salmonella enterica serovar typhi isolates from bangladesh indonesia taiwan and vietnam
processed_abstract: we characterized salmonella enterica serovar typhi isolates from bangladesh indonesia taiwan and vietnam to investigate their genetic relatedness and antimicrobial resistance the isolates from bangladesh and vietnam were genetically closely related but were distant from those from indonesia and taiwan all but a few isolates from indonesia and taiwan were susceptible to all antimicrobial tested the majority of isolates from bangladesh and vietnam were multidrug resistant mdr and belonged to the widespread haplotype h58 clone inchi1 plasmid were detected in all mdr s typhi isolates from vietnam but in only 15 of mdr isolates from bangladesh resistance gene in the majority of mdr s typhi isolates from bangladesh should reside in the chromosome among the isolates from bangladesh 82 and 40 were resistant to various concentration of nalidixic acid and ciprofloxacin respectively several resistance mechanism including alteration in gyrase a the presence of qnrs and enhanced efflux pump were involved in the reduced susceptibility and resistance to fluoroquinolones intensive surveillance is necessary to monitor the spread of chromosomemediated mdr and fluoroquinoloneresistant s typhi emerging in bangladesh

processed_title: enteric fever in endemic area of indonesia an increasing problem of resistance
processed_abstract: reported level of antibiotic resistance in salmonella typhi from south sulawesi indonesia were very low 1 before 2001 and chloramphenicol remained the treatment of choice since 2001 however resistance ha been rising and in 2007 68 of isolates were resistant to all three first line drug ampicillin chloramphenicol and cotrimoxazole ciprofloxacin resistance is currently at 390 at the same time there ha been an increase in the number of reported case this may be because of improved diagnostics or it may be a genuine outbreak of drug resistant s typhi in conclusion drug resistant typhoid fever will become a serious problem in indonesia in the future requiring the use of expensive drug for the treatment of typhoid a concerted effort is needed by the medical service to implement reliable diagnosis so that treatment or vaccination can be used to control the spread of drug resistant typhoid fever

processed_title: hotspot sequence of gyra gyrb parc and pare gene encoded for fluoroquinolones resistance from local salmonella typhi strain in jakarta
processed_abstract: background infection of salmonella enterica subsp enterica serovar typhi is the primary etiology of typhoid fever globally and is common in many developing country especially those with dense population and poor environmental sanitation antibiotic fluoroquinolones were used for the treatment in the 1980s due to the resistance to the firstline antibiotic however many case of treatment failure of fluoroquinolones in typhoidal patient have been reported from numerous country in asia europe africa and america mutation in quinolone resistance determining region qrdr gene gyra gyrb parc and pare are found in fluoroquinoloneresistant salmonella typhi contrast report came from the s typhi isolates in indonesia mainly jakarta and the surroundings obtained from patient with typhoid fever with good sensitivity to the fluoroquinolones ie nalidixic acid ciprofloxacin moxifloxacin and levofloxacin the present study therefore aimed to identify the hotspot sequence of gyra gyrb parc and pare gene of the local s typhi strain based on their susceptibility to fluoroquinolones from patient with typhoid fever in jakarta and it satellite city result a total of 28 isolates were identified a s typhi all isolates were susceptible to nalidixic acid levofloxacin and moxifloxacin twentyseven isolates 964 were susceptible to ciprofloxacin with one isolate 36 being intermediate the hotspot sequence of gyra gyrb parc and pare gene from all isolates were identical to the fluoroquinolonesensitive reference sequence salmonella enterica subsp enterica serovar typhi ty2 ncbi genbank ae0146131 including the isolate with intermediate susceptibility the mutation wa not found and amino acid deduced from all hotspot in susceptible and intermediate isolates showed no replacement in all reported codon conclusion this study showed that the local s typhi strain from jakarta and surroundings were susceptible to fluoroquinolones nalidixic acid ciprofloxacin levofloxacin and moxifloxacin and the hotspot sequence of the gyra gyrb parc and pare gene were all identical to the reference sequence thus the hotspot sequence of the gyra gyrb parc and pare gene seemingly were conserved in jakarta local s typhi strain and could be considered wild type the phenotypic susceptibility wa consistent with the genotypic characteristic without nonsynonymous mutation associated with drug resistance

processed_title: enteric fever in a tertiary paediatric hospital a retrospective sixyear review
processed_abstract: introduction enteric fever is a multisystemic infection which largely affect child this study aimed to analyse the epidemiology clinical presentation treatment and outcome of paediatric enteric fever in singapore material and method a retrospective review of child diagnosed with enteric fever in a tertiary paediatric hospital in singapore wa conducted from january 2006 to january 2012 patient with positive blood culture for salmonella typhi or paratyphi were identified from the microbiology laboratory information system data wa extracted from their case record result of 50 enteric fever case 86 were due to salmonella typhi with 163 being multidrug resistant mdr strain sixtytwo percent of s typhi isolates were of decreased ciprofloxacin susceptibility dc five case were both mdr and dc the remaining 14 were salmonella paratyphi a there were only 3 indigenous case ninetyfour percent had travelled to typhoidendemic country 702 to the indian subcontinent and the rest to indonesia and malaysia all patient infected with mdr strain had travelled to the indian subcontinent anaemia wa a significant finding in child with typhoid a compared to paratyphoid fever p 004 although all child were previously well 14 suffered severe complication including shock pericardial effusion and enterocolitis none had typhoid vaccination prior to their travel to developing country conclusion enteric fever is largely an imported disease in singapore and ha contributed to significant morbidity in child the use of typhoid vaccine a well a education on food and water hygiene to child travelling to developing country need to be emphasised

processed_title: bone marrow aspirate culture superior to streptokinase clot culture and 8 ml 110 bloodtobroth ratio blood culture for diagnosis of typhoid fever
processed_abstract: we compared the sensitivity of bone marrow aspirate culture bmac 3 ml 14 and 8 ml 110 bloodtobroth ratio blood culture bc 8 ml streptokinase clot culture stkcc and rectal swab culture rsc for isolating salmonella typhi and s paratyphi a from 61 patient with typhoid or paratyphoid fever in jakarta indonesia bmac 92 wa significantly more sensitive than 8 ml bc 62 8 ml stkcc 51 3 ml bc 44 rsc 56 and the 19 ml combination of all three bc method 71 the combination of the three bc method and rsc had an isolation rate of 87 in jakarta the diagnosis of typhoid fever can not be confidently excluded unless a bmac is done

processed_title: concurrent dengue hemorrhagic fever and typhoid fever infection in adult case report
processed_abstract: in indonesia a well a in many developing country both typhoid fever and dengue hemorrhagic fever dhf are still endemic and prevalent in indonesia the incidence of dhf in 1994 wa 972100000 population with cfr of 25 and each year about 6400001500000 case of typhoid fever were reported with mortality of 163 the concurrent infection of both disease may occur in one patient

processed_title: a rare case of septic arthritis of the knee caused by salmonella typhi with preexisting typhoid fever in a healthy immunocompetent child a case report
processed_abstract: introduction septic arthritis is a rapid and progressive infection caused by invasion of bacteria into the synovial joint disease of the joint causedby salmonella spp in healthy child is an unusual event with an estimated incidence of 01 to 02 of septic arthritis case among child the incidence of knee septic arthritis caused by salmonella typhi with preexisting typhoid fever is very rare method we reported a case of 2years old boy with a history of saddletype fever 2 week prior to right knee pain typhoid fever wa confirmed by immunoassay test knee septic arthritis wa established from clinical finding increased crp level ultrasonography and joint aspiration culture of the aspirate subsequently grew salmonella typhi this case report had been reported in line with scare criterion result arthrotomy and debridement were immediately performedintravenous piperacillin tazobactam wa given for 6 day and replaced by amoxicillin clavulanic acid after the culture and sensitivity test wa available patient recovered completely 5 month post surgery and showed excellence result with normal range of knee joint motion conclusion this case report suggests that any episode of joint swelling following preexisting typhoid fever should arise the physician awareness toward the possibility of septic arthritis and warrant immediate a well a proper management

processed_title: onemonth follow up of a randomized clinical trialphase ii study in 6 to 24 month old indonesian subject safety and immunogenicity of vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine
processed_abstract: introduction world health organization estimate the annual global incidence of typhoid fever at 1121 million case and approximately 128 000 to 161 000 death the currently used vipolysaccharides vip vaccine have been proven to be safe and efficacious in child 2 year and above however poor immunogenicity of vip wa observed in child below 2 year of age this phase ii study is the continuation of the previously published phase i study that aim to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of a novel vidt typhoid conjugate vaccine bio farma in subject 6 to 24 month method an interventional blinded comparative randomized phase ii study wa conducted from july 2018 until january 2019 there were 200 healthy subject divided into two group trial and control group inactivated poliovirus vaccine wa given to control group immediate and delayed local and systemic reaction up to 28 day post vaccination were recorded antibody titer were measured prior to vaccination v1 and 28 day post vaccination v2 result the study showed that the seroconversion of vidt vaccine 9899 one dose of vidt vaccine induced higher geometric mean titer gmt in all subject compared to that of baseline pain wa the most common immediate and delayed local reaction immediate and delayed systemic reaction that mostly occurred wa fever there were no serious adverse event reported within 28 day post vaccination conclusion the novel typhoid vidt conjugate vaccine is safe and immunogenic in child 6 to 24 month trial registration number nct03460405

processed_title: culture of salmonella typhi and salmonella paratyphi from blood and bone marrow in suspected typhoid fever
processed_abstract: we studied the yield of blood and bone marrow bm culture in 145 patient clinically suspected of typhoid fever tf in indonesia the objective were to compare the positivity of blood culture using 3 ml versus 10 ml of blood and to examine in how far specific antibiotic treatment for tf interfered with the positivity of bm culture blood for culture wa collected before antibiotic treatment wa initiated in hospital and bm 1 to 10 day after the start of treatment culture were performed with oxgall subcultured on s agar seventynine per cent of patient wa treated for 14 day or more with oral chloramphenicol 18 with chloramphenicol followed by ampicillin or cotrimoxazol and 3 with other antibiotic culture were positive for salmonella typhi or sparatyphi a in 57 of the 145 patient 393 when 3 ml of blood wa cultured and in 58 40 when 10 ml of blood wa cultured bm culture wa positive despite antibiotic treatment in 70 patient 482 this positivity wa significantly greater than that of blood culture p 005 when we considered the positivity of bm culture in relation to the number of day on antibiotic in hospital the yield of bm culture remained apparently unchanged during the first 5 day of treatment this may be the consequence of slow elimination of styphi or sparatyphi by the antibiotic used and could be responsible for relapse

processed_title: acute acalculous cholecystitis a rare presentation of typhoid fever in adult
processed_abstract: adult typhoidal acute acalculous cholecystitis is rare with only 2 case having been reported in the english literature we present the case of a previously healthy 36yold female who suffered fever chill epigastralgia and progressive jaundice for 3 d with acute acalculous cholecystitis subsequently diagnosed in addition to antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone open cholecystectomy wa performed however bile and blood culture both showed salmonella typhi growth unexpectedly and ileocolitis wa revealed by colonoscopy careful tracing of the history of the patient recalled a history of travel to indonesia in adult without common risk factor for acalculous cholecystitis a detailed history including travel to endemic area and high index of suspicion for typhoidal acute acalculous cholecystitis are important and appropriate antimicrobial therapy for covering salmonella typhi should be considered

processed_title: typhoid fever in group traveler opportunity for studying vaccine efficacy
processed_abstract: background typhoid fever tf is a rare disease among traveler to endemic area and little is known about it travelrelated epidemiology in addition efficacy data on tf vaccine in traveler is scanty during 3 month of 199495 six case of tf were reported in the netherlands among participant of four package tour to indonesia provided by the same operator the present study wa designed to describe the epidemiology of tf in these group and to assess whether travel group can be used for studying the efficacy of tf vaccine in traveler method questionnairebased historical cohort study of participant of 4 group that stayed in the same hotel along their tour n156 tf wa defined a blood cultureconfirmed salmonella typhi infection submitted isolates were typed by antigen and phage typing immunization status wa considered documented if ascertained by written record result among 110 participant 71 six case of tf were identified group specific attack rate ar 54 three of which were from one travel group ar 120 there were no significant difference by age or sex three submitted s typhi isolates showed three different type two of which were in the same group eightythree percent of respondent reported documented tf vaccination in the preceding 3 year all case occurred in recipient of the oral ty21a vaccine ar 102 95 ci 38208 but difference with nonvaccinees and recipient of the heatinactivated whole cell or viantigen polysaccharide vaccine were not significant conclusion although tf is rare in traveler infection with different strain of s typhi can occur in one travel group travel group offer an opportunity for retrospective assessment of vaccine efficacy provided that equal chance of exposure is largely guaranteed case ascertainment is maximally specific and similar in the vaccine group vaccine status is ascertained accurately and prior immunity by previous exposure to and use of antibiotic effective against the infection are excluded from or controlled for in the analysis

processed_title: new parameter available on sysmex xe5000 hematology analyzer contribute to differentiating dengue from leptospirosis and enteric fever
processed_abstract: introduction distinguishing dengue virus infection from other febrile thrombocytopenic illness such a leptospirosis or enteric fever is important but difficult due to the unavailability of reliable diagnostic test sysmex xe5000 hematology analyzer use fluorescence flow cytometry to quantitate new parameter including cell in the atypical lymphocyte area al highfluorescent lymphocyte count hflc immature granulocyte ig and immature platelet ipf this study aimed to investigate whether these parameter can help to discriminate between the disease material and method we compared hematocytometry performed by a sysmex xe5000 analyzer in indonesian adult with dengue n 93 leptospirosis n 11 and enteric fever n 6 infection and in healthy control n 28 result receiver operating characteristic curve comparing dengue and leptospirosis showed that dengue wa characterized by increased al auc 087 95 ci 070103 hflc auc 089 95 ci 078099 and ipf auc 081 95 ci 065097 while patient with leptospirosis had increased ig auc 086 95 ci 071102 low al hflc and ig supported a diagnosis of enteric fever conclusion the detection of al hflc ig and ipf by sysmex xe5000 hematology analyzer can help to differentiate between common cause of febrile illness with thrombocytopenia in dengue endemic area we recommend further investigating the discriminatory value of these parameter in clinical practice

processed_title: diagnosis of typhoid fever by detection of salmonella typhi antigen in urine
processed_abstract: a monoclonal antibody specific for group d salmonella antigen 9 wa used in an indirect enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa for detecting the antigen in urine specimen collected from patient with clinical typhoid fever in jakarta indonesia the elisa had a sensitivity of 95 in identifying patient in whom salmonella typhi wa isolated from hemocultures 73 in patient in whom s typhi wa isolated from stool specimen and 40 in patient in whom the organism wa isolated from bone marrow culture among patient in whom s typhi wa isolated from blood culture the elisa had a sensitivity of 65 when a single urine specimen wa examined and 95 when serially collected urine specimen were examined a dot blot immunoassay performed on a nitrocellulose filter in parallel had a sensitivity of 85 versus 83 for the plate elisa in which s typhi wa isolated from blood bone marrow andor stool specimen since s typhi antigen is intermittently excreted in the urine of patient with typhoid fever serially collected urine from patient with typhoid should be tested for antigen 9

processed_title: introducing vi polysaccharide typhoid fever vaccine to primary school child in north jakarta indonesia via an existent schoolbased vaccination platform
processed_abstract: objective to report result on coverage safety and logistics of a largescale schoolbased vi polysaccharide immunization campaign in north jakarta method of 443 primary school in north jakarta indonesia 18 public school were randomly selected for this study exclusion criterion were fever 375 degree c or higher at the time of vaccination or a known history of hypersensitivity to any vaccine adverse event were monitored and recorded for 1 month after immunization because this wa a pilot programme resource use wa tracked in detail result during the february 2004 vaccination campaign 4828 student were immunized 91 of the target population another 394 student 7 were vaccinated during mopup programme informed consent wa obtained for 98 of the target population in all 34 adverse event were reported corresponding to seven event per 1000 dos injected none wa serious the manufacturer recommended cold chain wa maintained throughout the programme conclusion this demonstration project in two subdistricts of north jakarta show that a largescale schoolbased typhoid fever vi polysaccharide vaccination campaign is logistically feasible safe and minimally disruptive to regular school activity when used in the context of an existing successful immunization platform the project had high parental acceptance nonetheless policyrelevant question still need to be answered before implementing a widespread vi polysaccharide vaccine programme in indonesia

processed_title: enteric fever among child 50 case in a french tertiary care centre
processed_abstract: background enteric fever in france is primarily travelassociated characteristic of paediatric case are scarce and information from field study in endemic country might not be generalizable to nonendemic country method in this retrospective study we reviewed all case of typhoid and paratyphoid fever treated in a french paediatric tertiary care centre from 1993 to 2015 result fifty case of enteric fever due to salmonella enterica serovar typhi n 44 and paratyphi n 6 were identified sixtyone percent of the child had travelled to africa and 34 to the indian subcontinent among travelassociated case 85 were visiting friend and relative vfr ninetysix percent had high fever associated with gastrointestinal symptom anaemia 66 elevated creactive protein 80 transaminitis 87 and mild hyponatremia 50 were the main biological finding blood culture were positive in 90 of case twelve strain 24 were resistant at least to one antibiotic and all of them had been isolated since 2003 increasing the resistance rate during this last period to 43 1228 ceftriaxone wa administered to 71 patient for a median duration of 6 day interquartile range iqr 48 the median time to apyrexia after the onset of treatment wa 4 day iqr 25 day complication occurred in nine child with five 10 presenting neurologic disorder all 50 patient recovered conclusion in france paediatric enteric fever is mainly a travelassociated disease and occurs in patient returning from a prolonged stay in an endemic area child vfr are at high risk and should be a priority target group for pretravel preventive measure the increase in antibiotic resistance reflects the situation in endemic country and is a major concern

processed_title: laboratory parameter for predicting salmonella bacteraemia a prospective cohort study
processed_abstract: blood culture for a definitive diagnosis of typhoid fever take time and are not routinely available we thus investigated laboratory parameter to predict salmonella bacteraemia we conducted a prospective cohort study in jakarta indonesia patient with suspected typhoid fever admitted to hospital from october 2014 to december 2016 were included out of 187 individual 27 had salmonella typhi and 12 had s paratyphi in blood culture absolute eosinopenia elevated aspartate aminotransferase and elevated creactive protein 40 mgl were positive predictor

processed_title: the role of epidemiology in the introduction of vi polysaccharide typhoid fever vaccine in asia
processed_abstract: despite the availability of at least two licensed typhoid fever vaccinesinjectable subunit vi polysaccharide vaccine and live oral ty21a vaccinefor the last decade these vaccine have not been widely introduced in publichealth programme in country endemic for typhoid fever the goal of the multidisciplinary domi disease of the most impoverished typhoid fever programme is to generate policyrelevant data to support public decisionmaking regarding the introduction of vi polysaccharide typhoid fever immunization programme in china viet nam pakistan india bangladesh and indonesia through epidemiological study the domi programme is generating these data and is offering a model for the accelerated rational introduction of new vaccine into health programme in lowincome country practical and specific example of the role of epidemiology are described in this paper these example cover a selection of available typhoid fever vaccine to be introduced in the programme b generation of policyrelevant data c providing the backbone for the implementation of other multidisciplinary project and d generation of unexpected but useful information relevant for the introduction of vaccine epidemiological study contribute to all stage of development of vaccine evaluation and introduction

processed_title: rapid diagnosis of typhoid fever by pcr assay using one pair of primer from flagellin gene of salmonella typhi
processed_abstract: using the polymerase chain reaction pcr assay we developed a rapid diagnosis method for salmonella typhi infection in blood specimen from patient with typhoid fever primer were designed from the flagellin gene sequence which would give an amplification product of 367 base pair in this study the specificity of the assay with no amplification wa seen for the other salmonella strain with the flagellin gene and not for non salmonella bacteria for the sensitivity test the protocol described allowed the detection of two to three copy of the salmonella typhi genome a determined by serial dilution of genomic dna from salmonella typhi with the pcr technique genomic dna of salmonella typhi wa detected in 46 of 73 blood sample collected from patient with clinically suspected typhoid fever who had fever within 3 day of admission to the general hospital makassar south sulawesi indonesia and who had had no prior antibiotic treatment the pcr result 63 positive case were compared with those of blood culture 137 positive case and the widal test 356 positive case using the same sample from each of the 73 patient admitted to the general hospital in makassar the time taken for pcr analysis of each sample wa less than 12 h compared with 3 to 5 day for blood or clot culture the pcr with one pair of primer can be used a a novel rapid diagnostic method for typhoid fever particularly when result of standard culture assay are negative

processed_title: the effect of curcumin and cotrimoxazole in salmonella typhimurium infection in vivo
processed_abstract: typhoid fever is a disease caused by salmonella typhi and commonly treated by an antimicrobial agent such a cotrimoxazole on the other hand herbal usage ha risen a an adjunctive therapy to treat many disease curcuma curcuma domestica is a commonly used herb which consists of curcumin a it major active compound curcumin ha been known for it antimicrobial effect but there is no proof regarding the usage of curcumin and cotrimoxazole together this research wa conducted by using typhoid fever model in mouse infected by salmonella typhimurium each animal wa treated with curcumin cotrimoxazole or both ileum spleen and liver of each animal were isolated and cultured we found that curcumincotrimoxazole combination therapy lowered the antimicrobial effectivity of cotrimoxazole in both intraintestinal and extraintestinal organ we conclude that curcumincotrimoxazole combination therapy in typhoid fever ha to be reconsidered

processed_title: febrile illness resulting in hospital admission a bacteriological and serological study in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: a study of 741 indonesian patient with fever wa carried out in order to determine what serious febrile illness are prevalent in jakarta all patient were hospitalized primarily because of fever and were studied by bacteriological and serological method bacteremia due to salmonella typhi 150 case s enteritidis 36 case or both 2 case wa common in both child and adult one s enteritidis isolate wa chloramphenicol resistant serological evidence of salmonella infection wa found in 130 additional case without bacteremia serological evidence of arbovirus infection 94 case wa common in child malaria wa found in 12 adult most of whom were probably infected outside jakarta little serological evidence wa found for rickettsial leptospiral brucella toxoplasma gondii or a number of other infection clinical sign and symptom in the febrile patient studed were generally nonspecific and laboratory result reported were very helpful in establishing more accurate diagnosis

processed_title: risk factor of typhoid infection in the indonesian archipelago
processed_abstract: background knowledge of risk factor and their relative importance in different setting is essential to develop effective health education material for the prevention of typhoid in this study we examine the effect of household level and individual behavioural risk factor on the risk of typhoid in three indonesian island sulawesi kalimantan and papua in the eastern indonesian archipelago encompassing rural periurban and urban area method we enrolled 933 patient above 10 year of age in a health facilitybased casecontrol study between june 2010 and june 2011 individual suspected of typhoid were tested using the typhoid igm lateral flow assay for the serodiagnosis of typhoid fever followed by blood culture testing case and control were defined postrecruitment case were individual with a culture or serology positive result n 449 control were individual negative to both serology and culture with or without a diagnosis other than typhoid n 484 logistic regression wa used to examine the effect of household level and individual level behavioural risk factor and we calculated the population attributable fraction paf of removing each risk significant independent behavioural risk factor result washing hand at critical moment of the day and washing hand with soap were strong independent protective factor for typhoid or 038 95 ci 025 to 058 for each unit increase in hand washing frequency score with value between 0 never and 3 always or 316 95 ci 209 to 479 comparing washing hand with soap sometimesnever v often these effect were independent of level of access to water and sanitation up to two third of case could be prevented by compliance to these practice hand washing paf 668 95 ci 614 to 715 use of soap paf 619 95ci 567 to 665 eating food out in food stall or restaurant wa an important risk factor or 69 95ci 441 to 108 for every unit increase in frequency score conclusion major gain could potentially be achieved in reducing the incidence of typhoid by ensuring adherence to adequate handwashing practice alone this confirms that there is a pivotal role for software related intervention to encourage behavior change and create demand for good and service alongside development of water and sanitation infrastructure

processed_title: twentysix year of enteric fever in australia an epidemiological analysis of antibiotic resistance
processed_abstract: objective to determine incidence and trend in antibiotic resistance in australian salmonella enterica subspecies enterica serovars typhi s typhi and paratyphi s paratyphi isolates over the past 26 year design a retrospective analysis of consecutive microbiologically confirmed enteric fever isolates participant and setting all s typhi and s paratyphi isolates from patient diagnosed with enteric fever in australia between 1985 and 2010 main outcome measure incidence and variation in antibiotic resistance over time and according to country of origin result we analysed 2551 isolates which originated from 74 country or region mainly india 33 and indonesia 22 the incidence among australian resident increased from four to five before 2003 to seven case per million personyears after 2003 multidrug resistance chloramphenicol ampicillin trimethoprim and nalidixic acid resistance emerged rapidly from the early 1990s with nalidixic acid resistance increasing to 70 in 20092010 while multidrug resistance wa relatively stable at between 4 and 11 nalidixic acid and multidrug resistance rate are highest in isolates from the indian subcontinent some country in southeast asia such a indonesia had very low rate of resistance however this varied across the region conclusion nalidixic acid resistance ha become widespread in enteric fever isolates from the indian subcontinent and some part of southeast asia justifying the use of ceftriaxone or azithromycin rather than ciprofloxacin a firstline treatment however resistance in some country remains rare potentially allowing treatment to be adjusted according to country of origin

processed_title: salmonella paratyphi a rate asia
processed_abstract: little is known about the cause of enteric fever in asia most case are believed to be caused by salmonella enterica serovar typhi and the remainder by s paratyphi a we compared their incidence by using standardized method from populationbased study in china indonesia india and pakistan

processed_title: adultonset still disease a a differential diagnosis in prolonged fever diagnosis and treatment experience
processed_abstract: adult onset still disease is a rare systemic disease that may involve many organ and may mimick many disease such a infection autoimmune disease and also malignancy the diagnostic approach and treatment strategy have not been well established due to it rarity however there are some diagnostic criterion that may help we present a case of 36year old man who experienced high prolonged fever which firstly thought a infection he also had unilateral wrist and knee joint pain and maculopapular rash laboratory examination showed high leukocyte count with elevated polymorphonuclear neutrophil count high platelet count high ferritin level and negative result of many infection marker typhoid antibody procalcitonin malaria test blood culture urine culture igm pneumonia asto syphilis test antihiv hbsag antihcv etc chest xray joint xray ultrasonography and echocardiography showed normal result the patient wa then diagnosed with adultonset still disease and received intravenous methylprednisolone and the fever wa disappeared in 3 day six month later the arthralgia appeared again methotrexate wa administered and the pain wa then relieved

processed_title: the diagnostic value of the elisaty test for the detection of typhoid fever in child
processed_abstract: a study on the reliability of an enzyme linked immunosorbent assay elisa for the detection of typhoid fever the elisaty test wa conducted comprising 44 child suffering from bacteriologically confirmed typhoid fever based on the finding of a positive blood culture for salmonella typhi 44 child with fever caused by disease other than typhoid fever based on the finding of negative culture of blood urine and stool for s typhi and 120 healthy child a control this elisaty test measure the concentration of igm and of igg against s typhi in serum this test is an indirect elisa test based on a method that make use of a mixture of omps outer membrane protein in equal proportion serving a antigen obtained from different strain of s typhi which are prevalent locally peroxidase goat antihuman igg or igm sigma a conjugate and orthophenylenediamine sigma a chromogen of the substrate the result of the test wa obtained through the assessment of the end product using a micro elisa reader behring at wave length of 490 nm the data revealed that the mean absorbent value found in child with typhoid fever for igm and igg were significantly higher p 005 when compared to those in child with nontyphoid fever a well a to those found in child of the control group the result of this study confirm that the elisaty test ha a high reliability for the detection of typhoid fever in child based on the finding of a degree of diagnostic sensitivity a high a 9545 and 9091 for respectively igm and igg a diagnostic specificity a high a 9333 for igm a well a for igg a high diagnostic efficiency 9432 for igm and 9205 for igg a high diagnostic positive predictive value of 9333 for igm and 9302 for igg high negative predictive value of 9535 for igm and 9111 for igg for use under clinical a well a under field condition

processed_title: persistence of salmonella in blood and bone marrow randomized controlled trial comparing ciprofloxacin and chloramphenicol treatment against enteric fever
processed_abstract: we performed a randomized controlled trial involving 55 adult patient with enteric fever to compare ciprofloxacin and chloramphenicol blood and bone marrow culture and cytokine profile during therapy were done to compare the clinical and bacteriological efficacy of these drug all patient were randomly assigned to receive chloramphenicol 500 mg four time a day orally for 14 day or ciprofloxacin 500 mg twice a day orally for 7 day in each treatment group patient were subsequently randomized to have blood and bone marrow cultured after either 3 or 5 day of treatment twentyseven patient received chloramphenicol and 28 received ciprofloxacin the two group were similar in term of baseline characteristic no significant difference in clinical cure and time to defervescence were found all strain isolated were susceptible to both antibiotic although ciprofloxacin wa more effective in the elimination of salmonella enterica serovars typhi and paratyphi a from bone marrow than chloramphenicol there wa still an impressive persistence of salmonella in the bone marrow culture 67 in the ciprofloxacintreated patient the suppressed cytokine production capacity showed a trend to normalize earlier than in patient treated with chloramphenicol

processed_title: the characteristic of bacteremia among patient with acute febrile illness requiring hospitalization in indonesia
processed_abstract: blood culturing remains the gold standard for bloodstream infection bsi diagnosis but the method is inaccessible to many developing country due to high cost and insufficient resource to better understand the utility of blood culture among patient in indonesia a country where blood culture are not routinely performed we evaluated data from a previous cohort study that included blood culture for all participant an acute febrile illness study wa conducted from july 2013 to june 2016 at eight major hospital in seven provincial capital in indonesia all participant presented with a fever and twosided aerobic blood culture were performed within 48 hour of hospital admission positive culture were further assessed for antimicrobial resistance amr pattern specimen from participant with negative culture result were screened by advanced molecular and serological method for evidence of causal pathogen blood culture were performed for 1459 of 1464 participant and the 706 1030 participant that were negative by dengue ns1 antigen test were included in further analysis bacteremia wa observed in 89 92 participant with the most frequent pathogen being salmonella enterica serovar typhi 41 and paratyphi a 10 escherichia coli 14 and staphylococcus aureus 10 two s paratyphi a case had evidence of amr and several e coli case were multidrug resistant 429 614 or monoresistant 143 214 culture contamination wa observed in 36 37 case molecular and serological assay identified etiological agent in participant having negative culture with 231 to 90 of case being missed by blood culture blood culture are a valuable diagnostic tool for hospitalized patient presenting with fever in indonesia prescreening patient for the most common viral infection such a dengue influenza and chikungunya virus would maximize the benefit to the patient while also conserving resource blood culture should also be supplemented with advanced laboratory test when available

processed_title: the widal slide agglutination test a valuable rapid diagnostic test in typhoid fever patient at the infectious disease hospital of jakarta
processed_abstract: the widal slide agglutination test wa evaluated a a rapid diagnostic test in typhoid fever patient at the infectious disease hospital jakarta indonesia from 19801982 the result of the test can be available within 45 minute of patient admission the study showed that among 229 patient with salmonella typhipositive typhoid fever and 179 control fever patient when the widal o antibody titer wa greater than or equal to 120 the sensitivity wa 53 the specificity 98 the positive predictive value 96 and the negative predictive value 68 a negative widal test o antibody titer less than 120 doe not provide useful information but when the o antibody titer is greater than or equal to 120 the clinician at the infectious disease hospital of jakarta can be 96 certain that the patient ha typhoid fever

processed_title: highthroughput genotyping of salmonella enterica serovar typhi allowing geographical assignment of haplotype and pathotypes within an urban district of jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: highthroughput epidemiological typing system that provide phylogenetic and genotypic information are beneficial for tracking bacterial pathogen in the field the incidence of salmonella enterica serovar typhi infection in indonesia is high and is associated with atypical phenotypic trait such a expression of the j and the z66 flagellum antigen utilizing a highthroughput genotyping platform to investigate known nucleotide polymorphism dispersed around the genome we determined the haplotype of 140 serovar typhi isolates associated with indonesia we identified nine distinct serovar typhi haplotype circulating in indonesia for more than 30 year with eight of these present in a single jakarta suburb within a 2year period one dominant haplotype h59 is associated with j and z66 flagellum expression representing a potential pathotype unique to indonesia phylogenetic analysis suggests that h59 z66 j isolates emerged relatively recently in term of the origin of serovar typhi and are geographically restricted these data demonstrate the potential of highthroughput genotyping platform for analyzing serovar typhi population in the field the study also provides insight into the evolution of serovar typhi and demonstrates the value of a molecular epidemiological technique that is exchangeable that is internet friendly and that ha global utility

processed_title: murine typhus is a common cause of acute febrile illness in bandung indonesia
