processed_abstract: murine typhus mt an infection caused by the gramnegative bacteria rickettsia typhi r typhi is a significant cause of acute febrile illness afi in southeast asia but is rarely reported in indonesia the current study aimed to describe the clinical characteristic of mt case in bandung west java nonconfirmed afi case n 176 from a prospective cohort study of whom paired serum sample acute t1 midterm t2 or convalescent t3 were available were screened using mt serology igg against r typhi wa detected in the t2 or t3 sample using an inhouse elisa positive igg sample were further screened for the presence of igm if both igm and igg were positive the endpoint titer of t1 t2 or t3 wa determined in case with a fourfold increase in titer realtime pcr of t1 sample wa performed to detect r typhi dna in total 71176 403 patient tested positive for igg antibody and 26 afi case were confirmed a mt 23 case by pcr 3 case by fourfold titer increased igg or igm titer the most common clinical symptom in the confirmed case were headache 80 arthralgia 73 malaise 69 and myalgia 54 in these case the presumptive clinical diagnosis were typhoid fever 432 dengue 385 and leptospirosis 192 mt wa not considered in any of the patient and no patient received doxycycline these finding confirmed that mt is an important cause of afi in indonesia mt should be included in the differential diagnosis of afi and empirical treatment with doxycycline should be considered

processed_title: evaluation of a standardised vi polyllysine elisa for serology of vi capsular polysaccharide antibody
processed_abstract: typhoid vaccine based on proteinconjugated capsular vi polysaccharide tcvs prevent typhoid in infant and young child analysis of the serum antivi igg response following immunisation against typhoid confirms the immunogenicity of tcvs and form an important part of the pathway to licensing comparative study could expedite the licencing process and the availability of a standardised elisa method alongside the 1st international standard is 16138 for antityphoid capsular vi polysaccharide igg human will facilitate this process to this end a noncommercial elisa based on a coat of vi and polyllysine vipll elisa wa evaluated by 10 laboratory eight serum sample including is 16138 were tested in the standardised vipll elisa n 10 a commercial vi elisa n 3 and a biotinylated vi elisa n 1 valid estimate of potency relative to is 16138 were obtained for all sample in the vipll elisa and the commercial elisa with good repeatability and reproducibility evident from the study result and concordant estimate obtained by the two elisa method the study demonstrates that the vipll elisa can be used in clinical trial study to determine the immunogenicity of tcvs

processed_title: typhoid fever associated with acute appendicitis caused by an h1j strain of salmonella enterica serotype typhi
processed_abstract: while most strain of salmonella enterica serotype typhi the etiologic agent of typhoid fever have only a phase 1 flagellar antigen h1d variation of the flagellar antigen have been observed although h1j strain one of the flagellar antigen variant account for 10 to 50 of s enterica serotype typhi strain found in indonesia there have been no published data to suggest it existence in other part of the world we describe a case of typhoid fever associated with acute appendicitis caused by an s enterica serotype typhi h1j strain in a chinese woman in hong kong a gramnegative motile rod wa recovered from her blood and stool culture conventional biochemical test and the vitek system gni showed that the bacterium wa s enterica serotype typhi the isolate agglutinated with polyo 9o vi and h1j salmonella antiserum but not with polyh antiserum the patient developed antibody against only s enterica serotype typhi o antigen but not against h1d antigen by the widal test flagellin c gene flic sequencing showed a 261bp deletion in the flic gene of the isolate confirming that the isolate possessed the h1j antigen the patient had no past history of travel to indonesia or personal contact with any indonesian she recovered with appendectomy and antibiotic treatment further study should be performed to determine the prevalence of this unusual s enterica serotype typhi strain in our locality

processed_title: sixmonth follow up of a randomized clinical trialphase i study in indonesian adult and child safety and immunogenicity of salmonella typhi polysaccharidediphtheria toxoid vidt conjugate vaccine
processed_abstract: introduction there is a high global incidence of typhoid fever with an annual mortality rate of 200000 death typhoid fever also affect younger child particularly in resourcelimited setting in endemic country typhoid vaccination is an important prevention tool against typhoid fever however the available polysaccharide typhoid vaccine are not recommended for child under 2 year of age a new typhoid conjugate vidiphtheria toxoid vidt vaccine ha been developed for infant immunization we aimed to define the safety and immunogenicity of the vidt vaccine among adult and child in indonesia method an observational blinded comparative randomized phase i safety study in two age deescalating cohort wa conducted in east jakarta indonesia from april 2017 to february 2018 we enrolled 100 healthy subject in 2 age group adult and child 1840 and 25 year old these group were randomized into study group vidt vaccine and comparator group vipolysaccharide vip vaccine and another additional vaccine which wa administered in 4 week apart subject were followed up to six month result one hundred healthy adult and child subject completed the study the vidt and vip vaccine showed no difference in term of intensity of any immediate local and systemic event within 30 minute postvaccination overall pain wa the most common local reaction and muscle pain wa the most common systemic reaction in the first 72 hour no serious adverse event were deemed related to vaccine administration the first and second dos of the vidt vaccine induced seroconversion and higher geometric mean titer gmt in all subject compared to that of baseline however in term of gmt the second dose of vidt did not induce a booster response conclusion the vidt vaccine is safe and immunogenic in adult and child older than two year a single dose of the vaccine is able to produce seroconversion and high gmt in all individual

processed_title: plasma endotoxin in typhoid fever
processed_abstract: plasma endotoxin content of the patient with sepsis or typhoid fever were measured by two sophisticated chromogenic limulus test endospecy and toxicolor test endospecy test is the endotoxinspecific test and toxicolor is responsible for both endotoxin and 13betadglucan plasma wa pretreated by our new pca method which resolved the problem a to the detection of a lesser amount of plasma endotoxin when pretreated by the conventional pca method although toxicolor value have been reported to exceed more than the endospecy value under complicated pathophysiological situation almost all specimen of these patient had a similar value except in one expired septic shock case in 18 typhoid fever case salmonella typhi wa isolated only from the bile in 5 case however endotoxemia occurred in 11 case 611 within the first 4 day the incidence of endotoxemia wa higher 1014 714 these result suggest that endotoxin assay seemed to be a useful tool for the diagnosis of typhoid fever

processed_title: further consideration of the clonal nature of salmonella typhi evaluation of molecular and clinical characteristic of strain from indonesia and peru
processed_abstract: we examined envelope protein profile chromosomal restriction endonuclease digest pattern and immune response to envelope protein for collection of salmonella typhi strain isolated in peru and indonesia only minor difference in envelope protein pattern were apparent among strain strain from 7 of 20 indonesian patient had a distinct chromosomal digest pattern compared with pattern of peruvian and other indonesian strain strain with this pattern carried the gene for the j flagellar antigen h1j difference in response to envelope protein of j and d strain were noted on immunoblot analysis our data suggest that there are genotypic and phenotypic difference among s typhi strain the clinical importance of these difference remains to be fully evaluated however in this study it wa not possible to show a clear correlation between strain characteristic and disease severity

processed_title: flagellar serotypes of salmonella typhi in indonesia relationship among motility invasiveness and clinical illness
processed_abstract: while the h1d flagellar serotype of salmonella typhi ha been found worldwide the h1j serotype occurs only in indonesia a crosssectional survey in indonesia compared epidemiologic clinical and pathogenetic characteristic of these two serotypes s typhi isolates were collected from patient with acute typhoid fever in four indonesian city flagellar serotype wa determined by polymerase chain reaction amplification of the flic locus of the flg gene of 321 isolates 51 159 were h1j patient with h1j infection were older than those with h1d p 001 among 30 patient with known clinical outcome h1j infection wa associated with milder clinical illness than h1d p 06 in vitro h1j isolates were both less motile on semisolid agar plate p 004 and less invasive of hep2 cell p 002 than h1d isolates the association of decreased severity of illness with decreased motility and invasiveness suggests that flagellar property are a component of s typhis virulence

processed_title: a multicountry cluster randomized controlled effectiveness evaluation to accelerate the introduction of vi polysaccharide typhoid vaccine in developing country in asia rationale and design
processed_abstract: phaseiii vaccine efficacy trial typically employ individually randomized design intended to ensure that measurement of vaccine protective efficacy reflect only direct vaccine effect a a result decision about introducing newly licensed vaccine into public health programme often fail to consider the substantially greater protection that may occur when a vaccine is deployed in public health programme due to the combination of direct plus indirect vaccine protective effect vaccine total protection can be better evaluated with cluster randomized trial such a design wa considered to generate policy relevant data to accelerate the rationale introduction of the licensed typhoid fever vi polysaccharide p vaccine in asia by the disease of the most impoverished domi typhoid fever programme the domis programme multicountry study is one of the largest cluster randomized vaccine trial ever mounted in asia which includes approximately 200000 individual it main objective is to determine the effectiveness of a licensed vi p vaccine the rationale and design of this study are discussed preliminary result are presented that determined the final planning of the trial before immunization important methodological and practical issue regarding vaccine cluster randomized design are illustrated

processed_title: increasing rate and clinical consequence of nalidixic acidresistant isolates causing enteric fever in returned traveller an 18year experience
processed_abstract: the purpose of this study wa to examine the rate and clinical consequence of nalidixic acidresistant nar isolates in traveller with enteric fever presenting to a hospital in a developed country we retrospectively examined microbiologically confirmed case of enteric fever in adult returned traveller over an 18year period presenting to two tertiary referral hospital in melbourne australia there were 59 case of salmonella typhi infection 43 case of s paratyphi a infection and two case of s paratyphi b infection most patient reported recent travel to india 36 or indonesia 29 nar isolates were commonly encountered 41 of all isolates particularly from india 75 pakistan 80 and bangladesh 60 the number of nar isolates increased progressively after 2003 patient with nar isolates had prolonged mean fever clearance time 56 v 33 day p 003 and prolonged hospital stay 79 v 57 day p 002 compared to nonresistant isolates this represents the largest report of nar enteric fever in returned traveller nar isolates predominate in case of enteric fever from south asia and result in prolonged fever clearance time and hospital stay empiric therapy with alternative antibiotic such a ceftriaxone or azithromycin should be considered in patient with suspected enteric fever from this region

processed_title: betaglucan of candida albicans cell wall extract inhibits salmonella typhimurium colonization by potentiating cellular immunity cd8 and cd4 t cell
processed_abstract: introduction antimicrobial resistance ha been reported in the drug used for the treatment of typhoid fever the immunomodulatory substance betaglucan can be used a an alternative therapy a it potentiates host immunity the aim of this study are to observe the effect of candida albicans cell wall ccw extract towards host immunity tcd8 and tcd4 cell in spleen intestinal siga and it capacity to kill salmonella in the intestine and liver of typhoid fever mouse model method typhoid fever mouse model were created by infecting mouse with s typhimurium orally mouse were divided into four group the noninfected infected ccw infected mouse treated with 300 microg ccw extractmouse once a day and ciprofloxacin group infected mouse treated with 15 mgkg bw ciprofloxacin twice a day result secretory iga siga concentration of mouse in the ccw group remained unchanged however their tcd4 and tcd8 cell increased substantially compared to those in the noninfected group in the ciprofloxacin group siga concentration increased markedly compared to those in the noninfected and ccw group tcd4 and tcd8 cell also increased significantly compared to those in the infected group but not significant compared to those in the ccw group colonization of s typhimurium in the intestine and liver decreased significantly in the ccw and ciprofloxacin group compared to that in the infected group with the lowest reduction being found in the ciprofloxacin group conclusion the inhibition of s typhimurium colonization by ccw is associated with the increase in tcd4 and tcd8 cell

processed_title: changing epidemiology of enteric fever in singapore
processed_abstract: introduction we studied the epidemiological trend of enteric fever typhoid and paratyphoid fever in singapore from 1990 to 2009 and carried out a review of the current prevention and control measure material and method epidemiological record of all reported enteric fever maintained by the communicable disease division ministry of health from 1990 to 2009 were analysed result a total of 2464 laboratory confirmed case of enteric fever 1699 case of typhoid and 765 case of paratyphoid were reported of these 75 were imported mainly from india and indonesia there had been a significant fall in the mean annual incidence rate of indigenous enteric fever from 43 per 100000 population in 1990 to 026 per 100000 population in 2009 p 0005 with a corresponding increase in the proportion of imported case from 71 between 1990 and 1993 to 92 between 2006 and 2009 p 00005 imported case involving foreign contract worker increased significantly from 128 between 1990 and 1993 to 404 between 2006 and 2009 p 00005 conclusion singapore ha experienced a marked decline in the incidence of enteric fever that is now comparable to that of other developed country continued vigilance and proactive measure that address the changing epidemiology of enteric fever in singapore are necessary to sustain the milestone achieved in the past 2 decade

processed_title: the costeffectiveness of typhoid vi vaccination program calculation for four urban site in four asian country
processed_abstract: the burden of typhoid fever remains high in impoverished setting and increasing antibiotic resistance is making treatment costly one strategy for reducing the typhoid morbidity and mortality is vaccination with the vi polysaccharide vaccine we use a wealth of new economic and epidemiological data to evaluate the costeffectiveness of vi vaccination against typhoid in site in four asian city kolkata india karachi pakistan north jakarta indonesia and hue vietnam we report result from both a societal a well a a public sector financial perspective baseline disease burden estimate in the four area are 750 case per year in two kolkata neighborhood pop 185000 84 case per year in the city of hue pop 280000 298 case per year in two subdistricts in north jakarta pop 161000 and 538 case per year in three squatter settlement in karachi pop 102000 we estimate that a vaccination program targeting all child 2149 would prevent 456 158 and 258 typhoid case and 46 16 and 26 death and avert 126 44 and 72 disabilityadjusted life year dalys over 3 year in kolkata north jakarta and karachi respectively the net social cost would be us160 and us549 per daly averted in kolkata and north jakarta respectively these program along with a similar program in karachi would be considered very costeffective eg cost per daly averted less than per caput gross national income gni under a wide range of assumption communitybased vaccination program that also target adult in kolkata and jakarta are less costeffective because incidence is lower in adult than child but are also likely to be very costeffective a program targeting schoolaged child in hue vietnam would prevent 21 case avert 6 dalys and not be costeffective us3779 per daly averted because of the low typhoid incidence there

processed_title: salmonellosis in indonesia phage type distribution of salmonella typhi
processed_abstract: the distribution of phage type wa studied among 577 strain of salmonella typhi from indonesia chemotype colicinogeny and tetrathionate reductase activity were also studied for most of these strain the current phage type formula for java wa determined to be a d2 d6 e1a e2 m1 and 46 but two other large group of strain were also found i iv and degraded vi strain significant difference in s typhi strain distribution were noted between two locality on java with respect to phage type and tetrathionate reductase activity comparison were made with past phage typing study in jakarta a well a with more recent study in other part of southeast asia phage type a d1 d2 and e1 persisted at a rather steady level in jakarta for 28 year evidence wa found for epidemiological link to european and asian area antibiotic resistance among these indonesian s typhi strain wa rare

processed_title: cholera
processed_abstract: cholera is an acute watery diarrhoeal disease caused by vibrio cholerae of the o1 or o139 serogroups in the past two century cholera ha emerged and spread from the ganges delta six time and from indonesia once to cause global pandemic rational approach to the case management of cholera with oral and intravenous rehydration therapy have reduced the case fatality of cholera from more than 50 to much less than 1 despite improvement in water quality sanitation and hygiene a well a in the clinical treatment of cholera the disease is still estimated to cause about 100 000 death every year most death occur in choleraendemic setting and virtually all death occur in developing country contemporary understanding of immune protection against cholera which result from local intestinal immunity ha yielded safe and protective orally administered cholera vaccine that are now globally stockpiled for use in the control of both epidemic and endemic cholera

processed_title: direct and indirect cost of acute diarrhea in child under five year of age in indonesia health facility and community survey
processed_abstract: background diarrhea remains a major cause of child morbidity and mortality in low and middleincome country reliable data on the economic burden of diarrhea is required to support the selection of appropriate health intervention program this study aimed to estimate the cost of acute diarrhea in child under five year of age in indonesia a large middleincome country with a substantial diarrheal burden method direct medical cost data were extracted retrospectively for 1050 child under five year of age with acute diarrhea receiving inpatient care across 45 health facility in seven indonesian province during 20172020 direct medical cost for child treated in outpatient setting were estimated by collecting unit cost associated with standard diarrhea case management in child a structured interview of 240 caregiver of inpatient wa also conducted retrospectively to estimate direct nonmedical cost a well a indirect cost from caregiver income loss result the weighted average direct medical cost for treatment of acute diarrhea a an inpatient and outpatient across health facility type wa us998 sd56835 room cost 29 professional fee 26 medication cost 10 diagnostic cost and us76 sd43 34 diagnostic cost 28 medication cost 27 professional fee 10 registration fee respectively the average direct nonmedical household cost for an acute diarrheal admission wa us490 and the indirect cost wa us990 conclusion there is a significant economic burden associated with acute diarrhea in child in indonesia this study based on a wide variety of health care setting and geographical region provides data to inform the economic evaluation of rotavirus vaccine and other diarrheal prevention program funding this work wa supported by a research grant from the murdoch childrens research institute mcri and path and the indonesian technical advisory group on immunization itagi

processed_title: review on a traditional herbal medicine eurycoma longifolia jack tongkat ali it traditional us chemistry evidencebased pharmacology and toxicology
processed_abstract: eurycoma longifolia jack known a tongkat ali a popular traditional herbal medicine is a flowering plant of the family simaroubaceae native to indonesia malaysia vietnam and also cambodia myanmar lao and thailand e longifolia is one of the wellknown folk medicine for aphrodisiac effect a well a intermittent fever malaria in asia decoction of e longifolia leaf are used for washing itch while it fruit are used in curing dysentery it bark is mostly used a a vermifuge while the taproot are used to treat high blood pressure and the root bark is used for the treatment of diarrhea and fever mostly the root extract of e longifolia are used a folk medicine for sexual dysfunction aging malaria cancer diabetes anxiety ache constipation exercise recovery fever increased energy increased strength leukemia osteoporosis stress syphilis and glandular swelling the root are also used a an aphrodisiac antibiotic appetite stimulant and health supplement the plant is reported to be rich in various class of bioactive compound such a quassinoids canthin6one alkaloid betacarboline alkaloid triterpene tirucallane type squalene derivative and biphenyl neolignan eurycolactone laurycolactone and eurycomalactone and bioactive steroid among these phytoconstituents quassinoids account for a major portion of the e longifolia root phytochemical an acute toxicity study ha found that the oral lethal dose 50 ld50 of the alcoholic extract of e longifolia in mouse is between 15002000 mgkg while the oral ld50 of the aqueous extract form is more than 3000 mgkg liver and renal function test showed no adverse change at normal daily dose and chronic use of e longifolia based on established literature on health benefit of e longifolia it is important to focus attention on it more active constituent and the constituent identification determination further development and most importantly the standardization besides the available data more evidence is required regarding it therapeutic efficacy and safety so it can be considered a rich herbal source of new drug candidate it is very important to conserve this valuable medicinal plant for the health benefit of future generation

processed_title: nutritional status exclusive breastfeeding and management of acute respiratory illness and diarrhea in the first 6 month of life in infant from two region of indonesia
processed_abstract: background infant morbidity and mortality rate remain high in indonesia with acute respiratory illness ari and diarrhea the leading two health problem in child under 5 year we aimed to describe the nutritional status feeding practice and case management of ari and diarrhea of infant from two region of indonesia during the first 6 month of life method this study wa an observational study conducted in parallel to an immunogenicity and efficacy trial of an oral rotavirus vaccine rv3bb in the klaten and yogyakarta region indonesia mother were interviewed at 3 time point within the first 6 day of their infant life and at 810 and 2224 week of age question asked included pregnancy history infant nutritional status feeding status and health of infant within up to 2 week prior to the assessment result between february 2013 and january 2014 233 motherinfant pair were recruited 60 136223 of infant were exclusively breastfed ebf until 6 month of age with the strongest support for ebf reported by mother themselves 70 101223 and 25 36223 from their partner at 6 month 6 14223 of infant were underweight and severely underweight 4 8 223 wasted and severely wasted and 12 28223 were stunted and severely stunted nonrecommended medication use wa high with 54 2139 of infant with reported cough within 2 week of an assessment receiving cough medication 70 27 39 an antihistamine 26 1039 a mucolytic and 15 6 39 an oral bronchodilator at age 2224 week infant with reported diarrhea within 2 week of an assessment had low use of oral rehydration solution or 32114 and zinc therapy 2 2110 conclusion in this unique observational study breastfeeding rate of 60 at 6 month were below the indonesian national target of 75 adherence to who guideline for management of ari and diarrhea wa poor with high use of nonrecommended cough medication and oral bronchodilator in the first 6 month of life and low use of or and zinc therapy ongoing education of primary health care worker and parent regarding management of common illness is needed in indonesia

processed_title: acute diarrhea and rotavirus infection in newborn baby and child in yogyakarta indonesia from june 1978 to june 1979
processed_abstract: a longitudinal study of acute diarrhea in child in yogyakarta indonesia june 1978 to june 1979 showed little variation throughout most month of the year in number of child admitted to hospital and in number infected with rotavirus both decreased during november and december coincidentally with seasonal change from dry to wet condition rotavirus particle were identified by electron microscopy in fecal specimen from 126 of 334 38 infant and child with acute diarrhea nosocomial rotavirus infection occurred in 11 of control child admitted to hospital for other reason socioeconomic level and preexisting nutritional status did not influence the incidence of rotavirus excretion rotavirus infection were most common in child aged 6 to 24 month there wa a low incidence of infection in infant less than 6 month old rotavirus infection wa seldom observed in newborn baby delivered in an urban hospital nursery in a rural health center or at home one of 72 newborn baby with diarrhea excreted rotavirus one of 53 healthy newborn baby excreted rotavirus it is concluded that in indonesia rotavirus infection is a major cause of childhood diarrhea throughout the year but is an uncommon cause of diarrhea in newborn baby

processed_title: vibrio cholerae infection
processed_abstract: toxigenic strain of vibrio cholerae are a major cause of acute severe dehydrating diarrhea in low and middleincome country with unsatisfactory hygienic condition and those affected by natural disaster and humanitarian crisis v cholerae is a gramnegative commashaped bacterium that cause acute largevolume watery diarrhea that can result in rapid dehydration and hypovolemia cholera is a rapidly progressing illness and is associated with high mortality rate if not treated promptly the case fatality ratio can exceed 50 without appropriate treatment but decrease to less than 1 when prompt rehydration and antibiotic are administered v cholerae is transmitted through the fecaloral route by contaminated water or food risk factor for acquiring v cholera include poverty inadequate sanitation contaminated water and food case of cholera are commonly underreported for many reason including a lack of appropriate surveillance and resource the world health organization who estimate that annually there are 14 to 40 million case and 21000 to 143000 death worldwide from cholera historically cholera ha been endemic in the asian subcontinent but it ha also established itself in other region and is now endemic in latin and central america and subsaharan africa over the past 2 century v cholerae ha caused 7 pandemic the seventh pandemic which is still ongoing wa first reported in 1961 in sulawesi an island governed by indonesia in 1971 in africa and in 1991 in the america v cholerae is constantly evolving with new genotype and phenotype emerging most likely due to antibiotic pressure cholera continues to be a significant public health threat for many reason it endemicity is expanding outbreak are unpredictable it ha high morbidity and mortality it is underdetected and underreported antimicrobial resistance is increasing and resource for treatment are inadequate the who global task force for cholera control gtfcc a global network of partner coordinated by the who established an initiative with a goal to reduce cholera globally by 90 and eradicate the disease in at least 20 country by 2030 appropriate oral and intravenous rehydration therapy and administering antibiotic and electrolyte are the cornerstone for treating cholera oral cholera vaccine are a significant component of the treatment and control strategy implemented in endemic zone or during an outbreak these vaccine have been shown to be effective in preventing and managing cholera water sanitation and hygiene wash practice are also crucial in preventing the transmission of v cholera

processed_title: hepatitis of unknown origin and etiology acute non hepae hepatitis among child in 20212022 review of the current finding
processed_abstract: several cluster and individual case of acute hepatitis have been reported in the u europe and recently in asia and central america since october 2021 a laboratory investigation of the common viral hepatitis agent hav hbv hcv hdv and hev yielded negative result prompting the use of the term acute non hepae hepatitis to describe this condition the case were characterized by the manifestation of acute hepatitis abdominal pain vomiting diarrhea jaundice and very high level of liver enzyme affecting child with a median age of 34 year the exact underlying etiology ha not been revealed yet however a leading hypothesis is that an infectious agent is the culprit underlying cause or a risk factor for acute non hepae hepatitis occurrence so far laboratory testing ha shown the presence of the group f human adenovirus serotype 41 hadvf41 in about threefourths of the investigated case a of 13 may 2022 more than 450 case were reported worldwide the majority of which were in the uk n 176 the u n 109 13 european country at least 103 case and in argentina brazil canada costa rica indonesia israel japan palestine panama singapore and south korea vigilant surveillance and epidemiologic investigation to identify further case are warranted to delineate the feature of this emergent public health issue the possible role of environmental and toxic agent including foodborne toxin should also be considered specific guideline for identification of further case are necessary particularly in lowincome setting where testing for adenovirus is not considered routinely a genetic analysis of hadvf41 isolates is recommended to assess the potential change in the virus genome with subsequent possible altered virus behavior immunopathogenesis is another possibility that should be evaluated considering the lack of viral structure in liver biopsy of the affected child in the u

processed_title: enteropathogens associated with acute diarrhea in community and hospital patient in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: the prevalence of bacteria parasite and viral pathogen in 3875 patient with diarrhea in community and hospital setting from march 1997 through august 1999 in jakarta indonesia wa determined using routine bacteriology and molecular assay technique bacterial pathogen isolated from hospital patient were in decreasing frequency vibrio cholerae o1 shigella flexneri salmonella spp and campylobacter jejuni while s flexneri v cholerae o1 salmonella spp and c jejuni were isolated from the community patient v cholerae o1 wa isolated more frequently p0005 from the hospital patient than the community patient overall bacterial pathogen were isolated from 538 of 3875 14 enrolled case of diarrhea enterotoxigenic escherichia coli were detected in 218 18 of 1244 rectal swab a small percentage of enterohemorrhagic e coli 1 and of clostridium difficile 13 wa detected parasitic examination of 389 sample resulted in 43 11 positive comprising ascaris lumbricoides 15 blastocystis hominis 57 giardia lamblia 08 trichuris trichiura 21 and endolimax nana 05 rotavirus 375 adenovirus 33 and norwalklike virus 176 were also detected antimicrobial resistance wa observed among some isolates bacterial isolates were susceptible to quinolones with the exception of some isolates of c jejuni which were resistant to ciprofloxacin nalidixic acid and norfloxacin data obtained from this community and hospitalbased study will enable the indonesian ministry of health to plan relevant study on diarrheal disease in the archipelago

processed_title: clinical approach and management of chronic diarrhea
processed_abstract: chronic diarrhea is defined a the passage of loose stool that last for more than 4 week although generally it is estimated that the prevalence of chronic diarrhea only range 35 of population but it pose some specific equally essential challenge compared to acute diarrhea because there are many differential diagnosis that should be considered a the cause of chronic diarrhea one of them includes colorectal cancer and the small intestinal bacterial overgrowth known a sibo in general chronic diarrhea can be categorized into watery malabsorption and inflammatory diarrhea a proper history taking physical examination and laboratory investigation is therefore necessary for clinician in managing chronic diarrhea overall the management of chronic diarrhea includes two type ie supportive and pharmacological management both for infectious and noninfectious etiology pharmacological treatment can also be classified into two kind of treatment including symptomatic and causal treatment which can be achieved through empirical therapy

processed_title: the effect of early nutritional supplementation with a mixture of probiotic prebiotic fiber and micronutrient in infant with acute diarrhea in indonesia
processed_abstract: a randomized double blind clinical trial wa conducted to assess the efficacy of a special infant formula containing lactobacillus rhamnosus lmg p22799 probiotic 5 x 108 cfu100ml inulin prebiotic 015 g100ml dietary fiber soy polysaccharide 02 g100ml and increased amount of zinciron 04 and 06 mg100ml respectively a active ingredient for the early dietary management of 58 indonesian wellnourished male infant aged 312 month suffering from acute diarrhea with moderate dehydration after adequate oral rehydration the patient were randomly assigned to receive either a low lactose infant formula supplemented with added precooked rice 15 g100ml with the above active ingredient study group or a low lactose infant formula with added precooked rice without the above active ingredient supplement control group no antibiotic antisecretory drug or antiemetic wa given at all both study and control group showed similar outcome for weight gain and stool weight the duration of diarrhea wa significantly shorter in the study group than in the control group 163 versus 245 day p005 for the study and control group respectively no treatment failure or other side effect were observed during the course of the study the present study support the evidence for the efficacy of a special antidiarrhea infant formula containing probiotic prebiotic fiber and ironzinc after oral rehydration by shortening the duration of infantile diarrhea in developing country however from the result of our study we can not discern the individual contribution of the active ingredient and also not whether they may act independent from each other or in a synergistic way

processed_title: genotyping and clinical factor in pediatric diarrhea caused by rotavirus oneyear surveillance in surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: background rotavirus infection are a major cause of diarrhea in child in both developed and developing country rotavirus genetics patient immunity and environmental factor are thought to be related to the severity of acute diarrhea due to rotavirus in infant and young child the objective of this study wa to provide a correlation between rotavirus genotype clinical factor and degree of severity of acute diarrhea in child under 5 year old in surabaya indonesia method a crosssectional study wa conducted in child aged 160 month with acute diarrhea hospitalized in soetomo hospital surabaya indonesia from april to december 2013 rotavirus in stool specimen wa identified by elisa and genotyping gtype and ptype using multiplex reverse transcription pcr severity wa measured using the ruuska and vesikari scoring system the clinical factor were investigated included patient age month hydration antibiotic administration nutritional state cobacterial infection and coviral infection result a total of 88 child met the criterion 807 were aged 624 month watery diarrhea wa the most common type 773 and 736 of the subject were coinfected with bacteria of which pathogenic escherichia coli wa the most common 425 the predominant vp7 genotyping gtype wa g2 318 and that of vp4 genotyping ptype wa p4 318 the predominant rotavirus genotype wa g2p4 193 g1p4 and g9p4 were uncommon with a prevalence of 45 there were significant difference between the common genotype and uncommon genotype with respect to the total severity score of diarrhea p 005 g3 g4 and g9 were significantly correlated with severe diarrhea p 0009 in multivariate analysis and with frequency of diarrhea 10 time a day p 0045 in univariate analysis but there wa no significant correlation between p typing and severity of diarrhea for combination genotyping of g and p g2p4 wa significantly correlated with severe diarrhea in multivariate analysis p 0029 conclusion there is a correlation between rotavirus genotype and severity of acute diarrhea in child genotype g2p4 ha the highest prevalence g3 g4 g9 and g2p4 combination genotype were found to be associated with severe diarrhea

processed_title: detection of group a rotavirus strain circulating among child with acute diarrhea in indonesia
processed_abstract: rotavirus is the major cause of severe diarrhea in child under 5 year old in developed and developing country since improvement in sanitation and hygiene have limited impact on reducing the incidence of rotavirus diarrhea implementation of a vaccine will be a better solution we conducted an observational study to determine the disease burden and to identify the genotype of circulating rotavirus in indonesia hospitalized child due to acute diarrhea were enrolled from four teaching hospital in indonesia stool sample were collected based on who protocol and were tested for the presence of group a rotavirus using enzyme immunoassay then rotavirus positive sample were genotyped using rtpcr fisher exact test chi square test and logistic regression were performed to determine difference across hospital and year in rotavirus prevalence and genotype distribution there were 4235 sample from hospitalized child with diarrhea during 2006 2009 and 2010 among them the rotavirus positive were 2220 sample 5242 and incidence rate varied between hospital the g1p8 g1p6 and g2p4 were recognized a the dominant genotype circulating strain in indonesia and the proportion of predominant strain changed by year our study showed the high incidence of rotavirus infection in indonesia with g1p8 g1p6 and g2p4 a the dominant strain circulating in indonesia these result reinforce the need for a continuing surveillance of rotavirus strain in indonesia

processed_title: clinical manifestation of norovirus infection in child aged less than five year old admitted with acute diarrhea in surabaya indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background the objective of this study wa to investigate the clinical manifestation of norovirus infection between norovirus genogroup and severity of acute diarrhea in pediatric patient at the dr soetomo hospital surabaya indonesia method this crosssectional study involved 31 participant aged 160 month admitted to the hospital with acute diarrhea from april 2012 to march 2013 norovirus genogroups gi and ii were identified from patient stool using reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtpcr severity wa measured using the ruuska and vesikari scoring system result in total 94 stool sample were obtained of which 31 19 were norovirus positive norovirus gi wa found in one sample with mild diarrhea norovirus gii wa found in 30 sample 968 one sample with mild diarrhea 33 20 sample with moderate diarrhea 667 and nine sample with severe diarrhea 30 conclusion norovirus gii wa the most prevalent cause of acute diarrhea and 30 of the case manifested a severe diarrhea

processed_title: detection of enteropathogens in human immunodeficiency virus and nonhuman immunodeficiency virusinfected child with acute diarrhea in an indonesian tertiary hospital using multiplex realtime polymerase chain reaction
processed_abstract: purpose diarrhea is one of the leading cause of mortality in child living in developing country the etiology of acute diarrhea in each healthcare center varies depending on place time and population this study aimed to identify pathogen pattern in human immunodeficiency virus hivinfected and nonhiv child suffering from acute diarrhea using multiplex real time reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction rtpcr in an indonesian tertiary hospital method this crosssectional study wa conducted at dr cipto mangunkusumo national hospital from march 2019 to april 2020 result the study showed that multiplex rtpcr result were positive in 589 of the specimen with more positive result in hivinfected child than in nonhivinfected child 70 v 547 altogether 72 enteropathogens were detected from all specimen enteropathogens in nonhiv child with acute diarrhea consisted of bacteria 706 and virus 294 with a predominance of enteroaggregative escherichia coli 254 followed by campylobacter spp 118 enteropathogenic e coli 98 norovirus gii 78 and clostridium difficile 78 enteropathogens in hivinfected child consisted of virus 571 bacteria 286 and parasite 143 comprising norovirus gii 24 cryptosporidium spp 143 campylobacter spp 143 norovirus gi 143 and astrovirus 143 cryptosporidium spp wa the only parasite found in this study and wa found only in hivinfected child in nonhiv child with acute diarrhea most pathogen were invasive bacteria while in hivinfected child more viral and parasite infection occurred primarily caused by opportunistic pathogen conclusion the pattern of enteropathogens can help clinician determine further examination and appropriate empirical antimicrobial therapy for the patient

processed_title: phylogenetic and immunoinformatic analysis of vp4 vp7 and nsp4 gene of rotavirus strain circulating in child with acute gastroenteritis in indonesia
processed_abstract: rotavirus is a major cause of diarrhea in indonesian child however rotavirus vaccine have not been introduced in the national immunization program of indonesia understanding the genetic diversity and conserved antigenic region of circulating strain are therefore essential to assess the potential efficacy of rotavirus vaccine we collected fecal sample from hospitalized child less than 5 year of age with acute diarrhea rotavirus genotyping wa performed by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction followed by sequencing of the vp4 vp7 and nsp4 gene of representative strain phylogenetic analysis wa performed to investigate their relationship with globally circulating strain conservational analysis immunoinformatics and epitope mapping in comparison to vaccine strain were also performed the sequence analysis showed that difference of multiple amino acid residue existed between the vp4 vp7 and nsp4 antigenic region of the vaccine strain and the indonesian isolates however many predicted conserved epitope with higher antigenicity were observed in the vaccine and indonesian strain conferring the importance of these epitope the identified epitope showed a higher potential of rotavirus vaccine to be employed in indonesia it could also be helpful to inform the design of a peptide vaccine based on the conserved region and epitope in the viral protein

processed_title: acute diarrhoeal disease in india and indonesia
processed_abstract: acute diarrhoea is still a leading cause of child mortality and morbidity second only to pneumonia a a killer of child in india and indonesia untreated diarrhoea precipitate malnutrition and is often the underlying cause of marasmus and kwashiorkor shigella and salmonella dysentery are responsible for about 60 of all case in indonesia and india these bacillary agent respond well to trimethoprim amoebiasis responds well to metronidazole most case can be managed in the home even if the exact cause is unknown by giving liquid or a simple rehydration drink diarrhoea can be prevented by improving communal sanitation and personal hygiene and by giving breast a opposed to bottle feeding of infant earlier introduction of supplementary feeding could provide the child with higher energy reserve giving it a better chance of survival when diarrhoeal insult occur

processed_title: acute and subacute toxicity test of goat bile in balbc mouse
processed_abstract: aim the aim of this study wa to investigate the toxicity of goat bile in balbc mouse since some indonesian people consume raw goat gallbladder to treat malaria and increase stamen material and method acute toxicity test wa done in six group of balbc mouse using 100 50 25 125 and 675 of goat bile and negative control the death of mouse wa observed within 14 day in the subacute toxicity test the body weight and hematology parameter on day 0 and day 4 posttreatment were evaluated the mouse were closely observed for 28 day before plasma collection for the blood biochemistry evaluation result mild diarrhea wa observed in acute and subacute toxicity test no death of mouse wa observed in acute test goat bile did not inhibit the increase of the body weight of mouse a slight reduction in hemoglobin and hematocrit level in mouse treated with 25 and 50 goat bile however remained normal in mouse treated with 100 goat bile the red and white blood cell count were not affected liver and kidney function were not affected by goat bile treatment a revealed by the plasma level of aspartate aminotransferase and alanine aminotransferase blood urea nitrogen and creatinine which remained in the normal range conclusion goat bile treatment in balbc mouse caused mild toxicity in mouse hydrophobic bile acid may cause the toxicity of goat bile in mouse therefore it is recommended that goat bile consumption not to be taken oftenly to avoid it harmful effect

processed_title: norovirus and rotavirus infection in child less than five year of age hospitalized with acute gastroenteritis in indonesia
processed_abstract: rotavirus and noroviruses are the most important viral cause of acute gastroenteritis in child while previous study of acute gastroenteritis in indonesia mainly focused on rotavirus here we investigated the burden and epidemiology of norovirus and rotavirus disease child less than five year of age hospitalized with acute gastroenteritis were enrolled in this study from january to december 2015 at three participating hospital rotavirus wa detected by enzyme immunoassay eia followed by genotyping by reverse transcription pcr rtpcr norovirus genogroups were determined by taqmanbased quantitative rtpcr among 406 enrolled child 75 1847 223 5493 and 29 714 case were positive for norovirus rotavirus and both virus mixed infection respectively most case clinically presented with fever diarrhea vomiting and some degree of dehydration the majority n 6975 92 of the noroviruses identified belonged to genogroup ii and several genotype were identified by sequencing a subset of sample among 35 sample tested for rotavirus genotype the most prevalent genotype wa g3p8 n 3035 856 our study suggests that the burden of norovirus disease in indonesian child should not be underestimated it also show the emergence of rotavirus genotype g3p8 in indonesia

processed_title: randomized trial of probiotic and calcium on diarrhea and respiratory tract infection in indonesian child
processed_abstract: objective to investigate the effect of calcium and probiotic on the incidence and duration of acute diarrhea and acute respiratory tract infection artis in lowsocioeconomic community of jakarta indonesia method we conducted a 6month doubleblind placebocontrolled study in 494 healthy child aged 1 to 6 year who received lowlactose milk with low calcium content lc approximately 50 mgday n 124 regular calcium content rc approximately 440 mgday n 126 rc with 5108 colonyforming unit per day of lactobacillus casei crl431 casei n 120 or rc with 5108 colonyforming unit per day of lactobacillus reuteri dsm17938 reuteri n 124 number and duration of diarrhea and artis episode were primary and secondary outcome respectively result incidence of world health organizationdefined diarrhea 3 looseliquid stool in 24 hour wa not significantly different between rc and lc relative risk rr 099 95 confidence interval ci 062158 between casei and rc rr 121 95 ci 076192 or between reuteri and rc rr 076 95 ci 046125 group incidence of all reported diarrhea 2 looseliquid stool in 24 hour wa significantly lower in the reuteri versus rc group rr 068 95 ci 046099 irrespective of the definition used reuteri significantly reduced diarrhea incidence in child with lower nutritional status belowmedian heightandweightforage z score none of the intervention affected artis conclusion rc milk alone or with l casei did not reduce diarrhea or artis in indonesian child l reuteri may prevent diarrhea especially in child with lower nutritional status

processed_title: management of pneumonia in india and indonesia
processed_abstract: although the death rate from neonatal tetanus have been lowered and the death rate from childhood diarrhoea are becoming lower in india and indonesia death rate from pneumonia have not yet begun to fall pneumonia ha become the greatest killer of child and the most important cause of preventable death the reason for this relative rise in significance may lie in the failure to realize that the majority of the most acute case of respiratory illness are not viral but rather bacterial infection which rapidly respond to appropriate antibiotic therapy this paper review recent research on the aetiology of pneumonia it examines age distribution and regional variation in morbidity and mortality and it concludes by suggesting appropriate pneumonia treatment and case management guideline the essential priority is to make procaine penicillin available to child presenting with cough and a respiratory rate over 50 breath per minute this alone would substantially reduce the number of child death in india and indonesia

processed_title: healthcareseeking behavior for child aged 059 month evidence from 20022017 indonesia demographic and health survey
processed_abstract: background and objective healthcareseeking behavior for child is crucial for reducing disease severity such behavior can improve child health outcome and prevent child morbidity and mortality the present study sought to analyze the determinant of mother engagement in healthcareseeking behavior for child with common childhood disease focusing on mother of child aged 059 month in indonesia method this crosssectional study comprised a secondary data analysis using the 20022017 indonesia demographic and health survey idhs database we included all woman surveyed aged 1549 year old who had child under five year of age we weighted the univariate bivariate and multivariate logistic regression analysis of healthcareseeking behavior for child aged 059 month result we analyzed data for 24529 woman whose child were under five year of age at the time of survey common disease such a diarrhea fever and acute respiratory infection ari were the most frequently cited reason for healthcareseeking behavior during 20022017 the proportion of mother seeking healthcare for their child with diarrhea increased from 6770 to 6988 that with fever increased from 6148 to 7164 and that ari increased from 6401 to 7675 multivariate analysis revealed that child age child birth order mother education ability to meet expense distance to nearest healthcare facility wealth index place of residence and region of residence were significantly associated with healthcareseeking behavior conclusion various individual and environmentallevel factor influence healthcareseeking behavior for childhood disease available accessible and affordable health service facility are recommended to assist socioeconomically and geographically disadvantaged family

processed_title: high protective efficacy of probiotic and rice bran against human norovirus infection and diarrhea in gnotobiotic pig
processed_abstract: probiotic have been recognized a vaccine adjuvant and therapeutic agent to treat acute gastroenteritis in child we previously showed that rice bran rb reduced human rotavirus diarrhea in gnotobiotic pig human noroviruses hunovs are the major pathogen causing nonbacterial acute gastroenteritis worldwide in this study lactobacillus rhamnosus gg lgg and escherichia coli nissle 1917 ecn were first screened for their ability to bind hunov p particle and virion derived from clinical sample containing hunov genotype gii3 and gii4 then the effect of lggecn and rb on hunov infection and diarrhea were investigated using the gnotobiotic pig model while lggecn colonization inhibited hunov shedding probiotic cocktail regimen in which rb feeding started 7 day prior to or 1 day after viral inoculation in the lggecn colonized gnotobiotic pig exhibited high protection against hunov diarrhea and shedding characterized by significantly reduced incidence 89 versus 20 and shorter mean duration of diarrhea 22 versus 02 day a well a shorter mean duration of virus shedding 32 versus 10 day in both probiotic cocktail group the diarrhea reduction rate were 78 compared with the control group and diarrhea severity wa reduced a demonstrated by the significantly lower cumulative fecal score the high protective efficacy of the probiotic cocktail regimen wa attributed to stimulation of ifngamma t cell response increased production of intestinal iga and igg and maintenance of healthy intestinal morphology manifested a longer villus compared with the control group therefore probiotic cocktail regimen containing lggecn and rb may represent highly efficacious strategy to prevent and treat hunov gastroenteritis and potentially other human enteric pathogen

processed_title: how sociodemographic water and sanitation factor influence diarrhea in child under five insight from indonesia underdeveloped region
processed_abstract: background despite the decrease in prevalence from 185 in 2013 to 123 in 2018 diarrhea present a major public health challenge in indonesia which lead to significant mortality this study investigated factor influencing diarrhea among child under five year of age in underdeveloped region of indonesia where disparity from other region are significant study design a crosssectional study method this study obtained data from national basic health research conducted in 2018 sixty underdeveloped region of indonesia with a total of 9243 child aged 059 month were included chisquare bivariate and multivariate analysis were conducted to determine factor influencing the prevalence of diarrhea in child under 5 year of age result multivariate analysis revealed that the age category of 1223 month or 173 95 ci 148 202 and 2435 month or 131 95 ci 111 153 awareness of a nearby hospital or 074 95 ci 063 086 and history of acute respiratory infection ari in the past month or 199 95 ci 166 240 were associated with diarrhea in child under the age of five in underdeveloped region of indonesia in contrast the environmental factor analyzed further in the study were not significantly associated with the prevalence of diarrhea in child under five year of age in underdeveloped region of indonesia conclusion these finding suggest that the child age the child history of ari and household awareness of nearby hospital are critical factor associated with the child diarrhea in underdeveloped region of indonesia

processed_title: incidence of norwalklike virus rotavirus and adenovirus infection in patient with acute gastroenteritis in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: norwalklike virus nlvs rotavirus and adenovirus are reportedly responsible from 4 to 42 of nonbacterial acute sporadic gastroenteritis the incidence of nlvs adenovirus and rotavirus infection in indonesia is unclear a total of 402 symptomatic case from indonesian patient with acute gastroenteritis and 102 asymptomatic control that tested negative for bacteria and parasite were screened for the presence of nlvs rotavirus and adenovirus using the reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction rtpcr rotaclone kit and adenoclone kit specific prototype probe were used to ascertain which nlv prototype were present in the area nlvs were detected in 45218 21 rotavirus wa detected in 170402 42 and adenovirus wa detected in 11273 4 sample examined genetic analysis of the rtpcr product using specific prototype probe for nlvs indicated that the prototype were 42 taunton agent and 58 hawaiisnow mountain agent comparative data on patient showed that the incidence of rotavirus infection wa two time greater than the nlvs infection and that adenovirus infection were the least prevalent all of the control sample tested were negative for nlvs and adenovirus however 870 11 of the sample were positive for rotavirus the high incidence of enteric viralrelated infection is a threat among acute diarrheic patient in jakarta indonesia

processed_title: association between severe dehydration in rotavirus diarrhea and exclusive breastfeeding among infant at dr hasan sadikin general hospital bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background rotavirus is the leading cause of severe acute diarrhea in child infant who are exclusively breastfed develop fewer infection and have less severe illness this study aimed to determine association between severe dehydration in rotavirus diarrhea and exclusive breastfeeding method this is a crosssectional study in infant 6 month old with acute diarrhea in dr hasan sadikin hospital bandung indonesia result from 134 infant 6 month old with acute diarrhea enrolled from april 2009 to december 2012 there were 88 656 boy and 46 344 girl in this study rotavirus wa detected in 60 448 32 533 of whom were exclusively breastfed from rotavirus positive subject severe dehydration occurred in 4 126 exclusively breastfed infant and 6 215 not exclusively breastfed infant no significant association wa found between severe dehydration and exclusive breastfeeding p 0491 in rotavirus diarrhea conclusion in rotavirus diarrhea there wa no significant association between exclusive breastfeeding and severe dehydration

processed_title: predominance of norovirus gi4 from child with acute gastroenteritis in jambi indonesia 2019
processed_abstract: norovirus nov is one of the most important viral cause of acute gastroenteritis age in child worldwide only a few study have reported age with novpositive in some city in indonesia this study aimed to investigate the incidence and clinical characteristic of nov infection and also genotype distribution of nov in child with age in jambi a the capital and the largest city of jambi province indonesia stool sample were collected from child 15 year of age with age at three participating hospital in jambi from february to april 2019 the detection of nov and it genotyping were carried out by reversetranscriptase polymerase chain reaction and direct sequencing of the 91 stool sample collected 14 154 were positive for nov fever vomiting and severe diarrhea were commonly observed in age with nov while level of dehydration wa statistically significant difference between child with novpositive and those with novnegative the most prevalent genotype wa gi4 429 followed by gii6 286 and some other genotype interestingly this study found the predominance of gi4 differed from previous report in indonesia continuously investigation of the circulating genotype is needed to control the novinfected age

processed_title: effect of applying the health promotion model in stunting prevention and behavior control in indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is a condition of failure to thrive in child due to chronic malnutrition and recurrent infection this study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of implementing the health promotion model in stunting prevention and control behavior material and method this crosssectional quantitative analytic study wa conducted using a survey method involving 228 mother of stunted child in indonesia cluster random sampling wa used data were collected using a questionnaire with a likert scale and then they were analyzed using univariate analysis multiple linear regression and pathway analysis to determine the direct and indirect effect result all respondent were of nonrisk age 2045 year most had height 150 cm 838 moderate weight 934 multigravida parity 873 middle education 702 unemployed 917 monthly income of less than 1800000 rupiah 899 and exclusive breastfeeding 974 sanitation selfefficacy and social support had a significant effect on stunting prevention and control behavior p 005 socioeconomic and sanitation effect through selfefficacy indirectly had a significant positive while parenting through food or nutritional intake had a significant influence on the stunting incidence p 005 variable that had a significant positive effect on stunting prevention and behavior directly were perceived vulnerability perceived severity perceived obstacle selfefficacy social support community organizing and facilitator p 005 parenting through the health of diarrhea or acute respiratory infection ari had no significant positive effect on the stunting incidence p 0121 conclusion almost all variable have a significant direct and indirect effect on stunting prevention and control behavior a well a the stunting incidence except parenting through the health of diarrhea or ari

processed_title: randomized controlled trial on the effect of partially hydrolyzed guar gum supplementation on diarrhea frequency and gut microbiome count among pelvic radiation patient
processed_abstract: background radiation therapy is the treatment of pelvic cancer with diarrhea often being the most frequent acute side effect this study aimed to determine the efficacy of partially hydrolyzed guar gum phgg usage in reducing radiotherapyinduced diarrhea and improving bacterial count nutrition status and quality of life qol among cancer patient method adult patient undergoing pelvic radiation were recruited and randomly assigned to receive supplementation of either 10 g of phgg or placebo maltodextrin twice daily 14 day prior and 14 day during pelvic radiation diarrhea frequency fecal sample nutrition status and qol were assessed at baseline and day 14 28 2 week after pelvic radiation and 45 at the completion of pelvic radiation 2 week postsupplementation result a total of 30 patient mean age 565 108 year 75 malnourished participated the mean of diarrhea frequency in the intervention group ig wa higher compared with the control group cg from day 14 and 28 but reduced at day 45 there wa a significant intervention effect after controlling for confounders ie baseline diarrhea age nutrition status p 05 bifidobacterium count increased by double among the ig at 14 day of phgg supplementation whereas such trend wa not observed in the cg conclusion supplementation of phgg potentially increased the bifidobacterial count and seemed to have postsupplementation effect by reducing the frequency of diarrhea upon the completion of pelvic radiation treatment

processed_title: risk factor of prolonged diarrhea in child under 2 year old
processed_abstract: background prolonged diarrhea defined a diarrhea lasting longer than 7 day is known to negatively impact childrens growth and development however study of the risk factor of prolonged diarrhea remain limited purpose this study aimed to analyze the risk factor for prolonged diarrhea in child under 2 year of age with acute diarrhea method this 1year nested casecontrol study wa conducted at fatmawati general hospital in 20212022 participant were selected using a consecutive sampling method from among child under 2 year of age with acute diarrhea within the previous 24 day child with diarrhea that lasted 7 day were considered positive for prolonged diarrhea whereas those with acute diarrhea were considered negative child with comorbidities such a malnutrition were excluded clinical information including age breastfeeding history antibiotic exposure history and nutritional status wa recorded complete blood count blood zinc level rotavirus adenovirus and norovirus serology alpha1 antitrypsin aat level and stool analysis were acquired a laboratory data result there were 62 subject in the study and control group overall the median age wa 12 month 624 month most patient were boy a history of antibiotic use odds ratio or 15860 95 confidence interval ci 528647591 p0001 zinc deficiency or 4758 95 ci 171113229 p0003 and elevated fecal aat level or 2677 95 ci 10466850 p0040 were the main risk factor for prolonged diarrhea in child under 2 year of age with acute diarrhea conclusion a history of antibiotic use zinc deficiency and elevated fecal aat level were the main risk factor for prolonged diarrhea in child under 2 year of age with acute diarrhea thorough testing and appropriate antibiotic use are required to prevent prolonged diarrhea in child under 2 year of age

processed_title: prevalence of enterotoxigenic escherichia coli etec in hospitalized acute diarrhea patient in denpasar bali indonesia
processed_abstract: the relationship between enterotoxigenic escherichia coli etec and hospitalized patient with acute diarrhea wa examined in a study conducted in two hospital from june 2000 to may 2001 in denpasar bali indonesia a total of 489 hospitalized patient with acute diarrhea were enrolled and their rectal swab were screened for enteric bacterial pathogen toxin colonization factor antigen cfas in vitro antimicrobial susceptibility and seasonal distribution pattern associated with etec were ascertained the diagnosis of etec infection and cfas association were performed with gm1 elisa and dot blot immunoassay enterotoxigenic escherichia coli wa isolated from the rectal swab of 149 of the patient the distribution of toxin among the etec strain found wa st in 51 699 while lt and stlt were found in 288 and 13 respectively the highest isolation rate for etec wa found among child between the age of 1 and 15 year colonization factor antigen were identified in 288 of the etec strain a high prevalence of cfa wa found among the rectal swab of patient with st isolates high frequency of resistance to ampicillin trimethoprimsulfamethoxazole chloramphenicol tetracycline and cephalothin wa displayed among the etec strain all etec strain were susceptible to norfloxacin ciprofloxacin and nalidixic acid the result of this study document the prevalence of etec in hospitalized patient with acute diarrhea in denpasar bali indonesia data generated in this study depicts the prevalence of etec diarrhea and cfa type among diarrhea patient in the tourist city of denpasar bali indonesia

processed_title: diarrhea among hospitalized child under five a call for inclusion of rotavirus vaccine to the national immunization program in indonesia
processed_abstract: context rotavirus diarrhea is a common disease worldwide which mostly affect child under five year old rotavirus infection cause severe diarrhea and lead to substantial health care cost in indonesia the rotavirus vaccine ha been available since 2011 however it ha not been included into the national immunization program this study aim to describe the proportion of rotavirus in child under 5 in indonesia the clinical characteristic of rotavirus infection and the rotavirus strain circulating in the country during 20102015 method child under five year of age with acute watery diarrhea were prospectively identified and enrolled through the active diarrhea surveillance system in 5 site in four province in indonesia during 20102015 the rotavirus specimen were tested using enzyme immunoassay bivariate logistic regression test were performed to compare rotavirus positive and negative result with respect to the collected demographic and clinical variable result from january 2010 to december 2015 the average annual rotavirus prevalence among child hospitalized with acute watery diarrhea in four province in indonesia wa 475 rotavirus diarrhea occurred mostly in child under 2 year of age of all age group child aged 611 and 1223 month had the highest prevalence of rotavirus diarrhea in all year 542 and 506 respectively this study found that the most prevalent of g and p genotype were g1p8 in 2010 632 2011 641 and 2012 746 and g3p8 in 2013 497 2014 825 and 2015 844 conclusion this study demonstrates that rotavirus is a major cause of diarrhea in hospitalized child in indonesia these finding highlight the need for inclusion of the rotavirus vaccine to the national immunization program in indonesia

processed_title: genotype profile of rotavirus strain in child under 5yearold outpatient with diarrhea in bandung west java indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction diarrhea is a global leading cause of morbidity and mortality among child under five with rotavirus being the most common cause this study aimed to determine the genotype of rotavirus in child under 5 year with diarrhea in bandung indonesia method this crosssectional study wa conducted from 2014 to 2018 on 450 child under five with acute diarrhea in primary health center in bandung indonesia fecal sample were examined for rotavirus antigen using an enzymelinked immunosorbent assay method and genotype wa determined through sequencing using polymerase chain reaction result were statistically analyzed using pearson chisquare in epi info version 354 with p 005 considered statistically significant result rotavirus wa identified in 89 of the subject slightly higher in boy n 24 98 than girl n 16 78 we found that the most rotavirus positive in age group is 1224 month and 2459 month while the highest percentage is at the age of 6 month 118 moderate malnutrition wa observed in more subject 128 vomiting wa more frequent in patient positive 55 p 0013 and fever wa seen in 325 p 0645 no sign of dehydration were seen in most subject 75 p 0227 rotavirus genotype identified were g1p8 18 45 g3p8 14 35 g3p6 4 10 g3p9 2 5 g2p4 1 25 and nontypeable nt 1 25 conclusion the dominant rotavirus genotype is g1p8 followed by g3p8 g3p6 g3p9 g2p4 and nt the most common rotavirus positive in age group is 1224 month and 2459 month while the highest percentage is at the age of 6 month

processed_title: suspected adenovirus causing an emerging hepatitis among child below 10 year a review
processed_abstract: in october 2021 a case of acute hepatic failure without any known cause wa identified in the united state of america upon further investigation other child aged 16 year were reported to have the same liver failure and some of them were positive for adenovirus 41 type f on 21 april 2022 the center for disease control and prevention cdc released an alert after 74 case were identified in united kingdom uk between 5 and 8 april in child below 10 year of age some of whom were also found to be positive for sarscov2 all the patient showed symptom such a vomiting diarrhea jaundice and abdominal pain the patient liver enzyme were remarkably increased a total of 650 case had been reported from 33 country a of 27 may 2022 among which 222 case were reported in the uk alone no connection with sarscov2 or it vaccine ha been found so far however the suspected cause is adenovirus including it genomic variation because it pathogenesis and laboratory investigation have been positively linked until further evidence emerges hygiene precaution could be helpful to prevent it spread

processed_title: composition and preliminary evaluation of a hydrolyzed ricebased oral rehydration solution for the treatment of acute diarrhea in child
processed_abstract: objective the purpose of this study wa to experimentally develop and clinically evaluate the safety and potential usefulness of a ricebased short glucose polymer oral rehydration solution or amylyte in the treatment of acute diarrhea amylyte ha a similar osmolality but a higher caloric density than the who or method different amount of rice were cooked in 500 ml of water containing salt 15 g nacl 600 mg kcl and 150 mg cacl2 with varying amount of thermophilic amylase 252500 modified wohlgemuth unit amylase 25 mg thinned the gluey rice water when 100 g of rice wa cooked in 500 ml of water for 10 minute the volume of the resultant supernatant amylyte wa approximately 250 ml a twopart clinical case study wa performed in study 1 12 child with diarrhea and mild dehydration were studied to determine the safety of amylyte in study 2 amylyte and the who or were given to 24 and 31 male child with acute diarrhea and moderate to severe dehydration respectively result 9296 of the rice amylose and amylopectin were converted to short polymer of glucose 39 molecule of glucose the osmolality of 7994 package used to make the amylyte solution ranged between 277340 mosmkg the mean electrolyte composition wa na 68 meql k 20 meql cl 73 meql the caloric density 425 kcall and rice protein 07 gl in study 1 12 child with diarrhea and mild dehydration were rehydrated successfully with amylyte or and the diarrhea ceased within 48 hour none developed clinical feature of carbohydrate intolerance in study 2 an openlabel clinical case study child with acute diarrhea given amylyte or had significantly less stool output than child given the who or conclusion amylyte or ha the advantage of a higher caloric density than the who or and share a simple preparation of appropriate osmolality and electrolyte composition it can safely and effectively rehydrate child with acute diarrhea and dehydration

processed_title: vitamin a supplementation fails to reduce incidence of acute respiratory illness and diarrhea in preschoolage indonesian child
processed_abstract: vitamin a supplementation of population of vitamin adeficient preschoolage child ha been shown to reduce childhood mortality but the primary preventive effect of such supplement on childhood infectious disease have not been carefully evaluated we conducted an individually randomized placebocontrolled doublemasked trial among 1407 indonesian preschoolage child to measure the effect of high dose vitamin a on acute respiratory and diarrheal illness sign and symptom of morbidity were monitored using every other day home surveillance by trained interviewer high dose vitamin a supplement increased the incidence of acute respiratory illness ari by 8 and acute lower respiratory illness alri by 39 these detrimental effect on acute lower respiratory illness were most marked in child with adequate nutritional status rate ratio 183 95 confidence interval 12572669 in contrast vitamin a tended to be protective of alri in chronically malnourished child rate ratio 071 95 confidence interval 03751331 there wa no overall effect of highdose vitamin a supplement on the incidence of diarrheal disease rate ratio 106 95 confidence interval 09201225 however we found a significant interaction between supplementation and age vitamin a increased the incidence of diarrhea in child 30 mo of age but tended to reduce the incidence in older child the finding of a significant adverse effect of vitamin a supplement in adequately nourished child highlight the need to review the criterion for selecting population of preschoolage child for vitamin a supplementation

processed_title: a double blind randomized trial showing probiotic to be ineffective in acute diarrhea in indonesian child
processed_abstract: objective to investigate the efficacy of probiotic added to oral rehydration solution and zinc in the treatment of acute infectious diarrhea in indonesian child method a prospective randomized double blind placebocontrolled trial wa performed to test the efficacy of a probiotic food supplement in 112 child in the kenari subdistrict central jakarta aged 636 mo with acute infectious diarrhea and moderate dehydration the supplemented group wa given standard therapy oral rehydration solution and zinc and the probiotic strain lactobacillus l rhamnosus r0011 19 x 109 colony forming unit cfu and l acidophilus r0052 01 x 109 cfud for 7 d while the control group wa given standard therapy and placebo result median duration of diarrhea wa 685 h range 13165 in the supplemented and 615 h range 21166 in the control group p 0596 median daily frequency of defecation until diarrhea stopped wa 50 in the supplemented v 55 in the control group p 0795 conclusion this probiotic food supplement tested did not reduce the duration of acute infectious diarrhea a compared to oral rehydration and zinc

processed_title: intrauterine growth retardation iugr a determinant and environment a modulator of infant mortality and morbidity the tanjungsari cohort study in indonesia
