processed_abstract: background cyclospora cayetanensis is a protozoan parasite causing intestinal infection a prolonged course of infection is often observed in immunocompromised individual in europe less than 100 case of c cayetanensis infection have been reported to date almost all of which being diagnosed in individual after travelling abroad finding we described case of three businessmen who developed acute traveller diarrhoea after they returned to poland from indonesia one of the traveller wa a renal transplant recipient having ongoing immunosuppressive treatment in each case acute and prolonged diarrhoea and other intestinal disorder occurred oocysts of c cayetanensis were identified in faecal smear of two of the traveller one immunosuppressed and one immunocompetent diagnosis wa confirmed by the successful amplification of parasite dna 18 rdna a coinfection with blastocystis hominis wa identified in the immunocompetent man conclusion infection of c cayetanensis shall be considered a the cause of prolonged acute diarrhoea in immunocompromised patient returning from endemic region

processed_title: molecular detection of cryptosporidium spp among wild rat in surabaya east java indonesia
processed_abstract: background human and animal who have an acute case of diarrhea can be infected with cryptosporidium spp within the category of waterborne disease it is a zoonotic disease the zoonotic disease cryptosporidium is among the several pathogen carried by wild rat rattus spp the risk of spreading this disease is rather significant in urban environment because rat are often close to people aim this study aim to detect cryptosporidium spp infection in wild rat in surabaya east java indonesia method through necropsy a total of 100 wild rat intestine were sampled for feces microscopic observation of the presence of cryptosporidium wa carried out using the float test with a combination of ziehl neelsen zn staining molecular detection of cryptosporidium spp positive result used the cryptosporidium oocyst wall protein cowp gene with polimerase chain reaction method result the result showed that 69 sample were positive for containing cryptosporidium spp oocysts and with zn staining to confirm the diagnosis the staining result showed cryptosporidium spp oocysts dark pink with a clear cavity inside with a percentage of 9565 in rattus norvegicus and 6103 in rattus tanezumi in residential and densely populated environment the percentage of cryptosporidium spp amounted to 6666 and in the market environment amounted to 7419 the percentage of cryptosporidium spp in the north surabaya region wa 4285 south surabaya 100 west surabaya 375 east surabaya 8139 and central surabaya 6538 molecular detection of cryptosporidium spp positive result were obtained using the cowp gene 550 bp conclusion this study aim to detect cryptosporidium spp infection in wild rat in surabaya east java indonesia the high number of case of cryptosporidiosis in wild rat ha the potential to be a reservoir for the spread of the disease the cryptosporidium spp can detected with cowp in 550 bp in wild rat in surabaya east java indonesia

processed_title: complex interaction with infection and diet may explain seasonal growth response to vitamin a in preschool aged indonesian child
processed_abstract: objective to explore the potential contribution of respiratory infection and vitamin a intake to the seasonal effect of vitamin a supplementation on child growth method data from a randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled trial in which a single high dose of vitamin a or placebo wa given every 4 month to 1405 child aged 648 month were used for the analysis in total 4430 childtreatment cycle were examined and for each cycle the child had their dietary intake weight and height assessed at the start and end linear regression model of the difference in height and weight during each treatment cycle were used and the withinchild correlation wa adjusted using the generalized estimating equation gee other covariables in the model included age sex percentage of day with acute lower respiratory infection and diarrhea and cumulative dos of vitamin a result this study showed that a significant effect of vitamin a supplementation on linear growth wa observed in all season in child with a low burden of respiratory infection that is 215 of day with respiratory illness in each season the highest effect wa found in child with a low burden of respiratory infection and low vitamin a intake that is intake 400 reday child with a high burden of respiratory infection or high vitamin a intake benefited less from vitamin a supplementation for their linear growth than child with a low burden of respiratory infection and low vitamin a intake finally there wa no benefit for linear growth from vitamin a supplementation in child with both a high burden of respiratory infection and high vitamin a intake regardless of the season conclusion the effect of vitamin a supplementation on growth is dependent on season respiratory infection and vitamin a intake are important factor underlying the seasonal effect of vitamin a supplementation on growth

processed_title: small group intervention v formal seminar for improving appropriate drug use
processed_abstract: in an attempt to evaluate the efficacy of different method of intervention to improve the appropriate use of drug for acute diarrhoea a controlled study ha been carried out in 6 district in yogyakarta and central java province indonesia this study wa designed to investigate the impact of two different method of educational intervention ie a small group facetoface intervention and a formal seminar for prescribers on prescribing practice in acute diarrhoea the district were randomly assigned into 3 group and 15 health center were selected from each district prescribers in group 1 underwent a small group facetoface intervention conducted in the respective health center those in group 2 attended a formal seminar conducted at the district level prescribers in group 3 served a the control group both intervention were given on a single occasion without followup supervision or monitoring written information material on the appropriate management of acute diarrhoea were developed and were provided to all prescribers in the intervention group focus group discussion fgds involving prescribers and consumer in the 6 district were carried out to identify various underlying motivation of drug use in acute diarrhoea the finding of the fgds were used a part of the intervention material to evaluate the impact of these intervention on prescribing practice a prescribing survey for patient under five year old with acute diarrhoea wa carried out in health center covering 3month period before and after the intervention the result showed that both intervention were equally effective in improving the level of knowledge of prescribers about the appropriate management of acute diarrhoea they were also partially effective in improving the appropriate use of drug reducing the use of nonrehydration medication there wa a highly significant reduction of antimicrobial usage either after smallgroup facetoface intervention 774 27 to 604 29 p 0001 or formal seminar 823 30 to 723 36 p 0001 and the former caused significantly p 0001 greater reduction than the latter there wa also a significant p 001 reduction in the usage of antidiarrhoeals after both intervention ie from 203 37 to 125 33 p 001 after facetoface intervention and from 485 41 to 270 43 p 001 after seminar however the formal seminar had a significantly p 001 greater impact than the small group facetoface intervention there wa also a trend toward increased oral rehydration solution or usage after both intervention but this did not achieve the level of statistical significance p 005 no change were observed in the control group although the small group facetoface intervention did not appear to offer greater impact over large seminar in improving the appropriate use of drug in acute diarrhoea since the unit cost of training is far less costly than the seminar it might be feasibly implemented in the existing supervisory structure of the health system

processed_title: rotavirus surveillance to determine disease burden and epidemiology in java indonesia august 2001 through april 2004
processed_abstract: this study estimate rotavirus disease burden in child under age 3 year presenting with acute gastroenteritis to hospital in purworejo district and yogyakarta city from august 2001 to april 2004 among a total of 8929 hospitalized child 1397 16 presented with acute gastroenteritis and of the 1321 stool sample tested 705 53 were positive for rotavirus rotavirus infection were most common among child aged 723 month and rotavirus wa more common during the dry season june through august logistic regression analysis showed no difference in socioeconomic indicator between the rotavirus positive and negative admission rotavirus vaccination may prevent a large proportion of all hospitalization of young child under 3 year of age presenting with acute gastroenteritis

processed_title: rapid health assessment in aceh jaya district indonesia following the december 26 tsunami
processed_abstract: objective to rapidly determine the public health impact of the asian tsunami on the population of three community in aceh jaya district indonesia and to prioritize health intervention method rapid health assessment utilizing direct observation interview with key informant a single focus group discussion town mapping a review of medical record and a systematic random sample of the entire town of calang capital of aceh jaya district indonesia result almost 100 of dwelling were destroyed in all three community for the town of calang only 182 of the pretsunami population remained 2 week following the disaster with an estimated 70 of the population having died at the time of impact government estimate of the remaining population were inflated by approximately 250 mortality rate were not elevated posttsunami 100 of the population lacked access to sanitation and clean water 85 of child under 5 year reported diarrhoea over the preceding 2 week period 95 of individual with a medical complaint reported satisfactory access to clinical care acute malnutrition wa not a significant problem and over onefifth of household were hosting an orphan for the village of rigah and sayeung approximately 462 and 860 of the population survived the tsunami impact respectively mortality rate were not elevated post tsunami 100 of the population lacked access to sanitation and clean water diarrhoea wa the main cause of morbidity primary care service were available only in rigah and only rigah had received external assistance conclusion almost twothirds of the population of the three community died a a result of the tsunami impact although mortality rate were not elevated post tsunami significant threat to public health persisted especially waterborne disease priority activity included emergent environmental health intervention mobile clinic to the two village and a more detailed assessment of the need of orphan data were shared with agency better placed to address need in the area of shelter and food aid

processed_title: use of antibiotic for common illness among child aged under 5 year in a rural community in indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background the incidence of antimicrobial resistance ha been increasing worldwide in the past decade which includes resistance to bacteria that cause common childhood illness such a acute respiratory infection and diarrhea numerous child with those common illness are treated with antibiotic however in such case antibiotic treatment is not required communitybased study focusing on antibiotic use among child are still limited this study aimed to identify the prevalence of antibiotic use for common childhood illness and to investigate factor associated with antibiotic use in child under 5 year old a well a female caregiver in a rural community in indonesia method a crosssectional study of 334 child in three village of banten province located in the western part of java island wa conducted in may 2018 female caregiver who were responsible for providing medication to child were interviewed we obtained information such a demographic data any common clinical illness within the last 30 day and antibiotic usage during an episode of illness we excluded child with underlying disease that require a regular followup and child who were hospitalized in the last 30 day in the analysis antibiotic use answered by female caregiver wa verified by checking it package or showing photo of various antibiotic to the female caregiver crushed antibiotic were confirmed with health professional result a total of 203 child had clinical symptom and the most common symptom wa fever and respiratory symptom in total 493 received antibiotic and 66 of them were prescribed by private health professional only two child received antibiotic without a prescription the most common antibiotic used among child wa amoxicillin conclusion the high prevalence of antibiotic use wa observed in child under 5 year of age and the major source to obtain antibiotic wa to consult health professional training on appropriate antibiotic use must be conducted for health professional in not only public but also private sector

processed_title: management of infant diarrhea with highlactose probioticcontaining formula
processed_abstract: to study the influence of highlactose probioticcontaining formula on the course of acute diarrhea an experiment using a randomized controlled clinical trial with patient having acute diarrhea for 3 day wa conducted one hundred patient were allocated into two group that were comparable for age sex and nutritional status the test group wa administered highlactose bifidobacterium bifidumcontaining formula while the control group had no highlactose probiotic until the end of the experiment the degree of subsequent diarrhea and recovery were monitored in both group the result for the test and control group were analyzed and compared using the chisquare test and fisher exact test with a significance level alpha of 005 the study result revealed that there wa no significant difference between the test and control group p005 a well a at positive clinical test 13 and positive floating test 65 however the patient receiving probioticcontaining formula had significantly less frequency of stool when compared with the control group p005

processed_title: breastfeeding performance index a composite index to describe overall breastfeeding performance among infant under 6 month of age
processed_abstract: objective to develop a composite index to describe the overall breastfeeding performance of infants6 month of age and using this index to identify the factor associated with poor breastfeeding practice and the association between breastfeeding and infant morbidity design setting and subject the 2003 demographic and health survey wa a multistage cluster sample survey of 4320 household in timorleste which covered 573 infant aged6 month breastfeeding performance index bpi wa constructed by allocating one point for each of seven infant feeding practice first suckling within an hour of birth absence of prelacteals nonuse of feeding bottle current breastfeeding not receiving liquid not receiving formula or other milk and not receiving solid in the last 24 hour bpi wa treated a the dependent variable in univariate and multivariate analysis to identify the factor associated with poor breastfeeding result exclusive breastfeeding rate wa 299 the bpi mean 44 standard deviation 177 wa categorised a low average and high according to tertiles multivariate analysis indicated that infant from the richest household were 170 95 confidence interval ci 104277 time more likely to have low bpi than the poorest maternal bmi185 kg m2 wa predictive of poor breastfeeding odds ratio179 95 ci 127252 in the low bpi group the incidence of diarrhoea 134 and acute respiratory infection 207 during the previous two week wa significantly higher than in average 43 and 93 and high bpi group 46 and 55 conclusion creating a composite index to assess the overall breastfeeding performance among infants6 month of age is feasible bpi can be effectively used to identify target group for breastfeeding promotion intervention

processed_title: progress toward measles and rubella elimination indonesia 20132022
processed_abstract: in 2019 indonesia and the other country in the world health organization southeast asia region adopted the goal of measles and rubella elimination by 2023 this report describes indonesia progress toward measles and rubella elimination during 20132022 during this period coverage with a first dose of measlescontaining vaccine mcv decreased from 87 to 84 and coverage with a second mcv dose decreased from 76 to 67 after rubella vaccine wa introduced in 2017 coverage with the first dose of rubellacontaining vaccine increased approximately fivefold from 15 in 2017 to 84 in 2022 during 20132021 annual reported measles incidence decreased by 95 from 332 to 14 case per million population reported rubella incidence decreased 89 from 93 to 10 case per million population however a large surge in measles and rubella case occurred in 2022 with a reported measles incidence of 29 case per million and a reported rubella incidence of 3 per million primarily related to disruption in immunization service caused by the covid19 pandemic in 2022 approximately 26 million child an estimated 73 of the target population received a combined measles and rubellacontaining vaccine during supplementary immunization activity completed in 32 province progress toward measles and rubella elimination in indonesia ha been made however continued and urgent effort are needed to restore routine immunization service that were adversely affected by the covid19 pandemic and close immunity gap to accelerate progress toward measles and rubella elimination

processed_title: religion and measles vaccination in indonesia 19912017
processed_abstract: introduction some muslim religious council in indonesia have ruled that measles vaccine contain haram ie forbidden material this study evaluates the change in measles vaccination coverage between 1991 and 2017 and compare vaccination coverage between muslim and nonmuslims in indonesia method a total of 7 crosssectional inperson survey of mother in 19912017 in indonesia were analyzed in 2019 participant were asked about religion in 19912007 and 100 data set of religion were imputed for 2012 and 2017 in this multiple imputation analysis binomial regression model output prevalence difference adjusted for wealth education child sex and mother age a quadratic term for year year x year and an interaction term between year and religion evaluated change in vaccination over time by religion result the 7 data set included 23106 child aged 1223 month with the proportion of those who were muslim ranging between 85 and 89 across the survey year between 1991 and 2017 measles vaccination coverage increased from 57 to 79 among nonmuslims and from 59 to 79 among muslim in the multivariable regression model measles vaccination coverage increased by 16 each year with a quadratic term of 005 indicating some leveling over time at baseline in 1991 nonmuslims had a vaccination coverage of 62 higher than that of muslim but this disparity decreased by 02 each year conclusion measles vaccination increased in both muslim and nonmuslims in indonesia but ha stagnated in recent year because of increased attention among muslim group on haram material in vaccine since 2017 future study should continue to examine the relationship between religion and vaccine uptake in indonesia supplement information this article is part of a supplement entitled global vaccination equity which is sponsored by the global institute for vaccine equity at the university of michigan school of public health

processed_title: when religion prevails examining religious and mainstream news coverage of measlesrubella vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective indonesia measlesrubella mr vaccination campaign faced public refusal due to religious objection the government then lobbied the religious organization to issue a decree to permit the consumption of the mr vaccine which would enhance public approval medium outlet including religious and mainstream medium played a crucial role in promoting the decree and the vaccine learning from this mr vaccination campaign in 2018 this study examined how the mainstream and alternative or religious medium framed the mr vaccination and how it changed before and after the decree study designmethods a content analysis wa performed on 234 news article from indonesian religious and mainstream medium result mainstream medium positively framed mr vaccine which were further amplified after the decree wa issued in contrast religious medium consistently depicted the opposing side of the vaccine and it campaign both medium type also predominantly cited the government and religious leader in their article conclusion while the mainstream medium agenda aligns with the national agenda to promote the mr vaccine religious medium still emphasizes the risk of the vaccine the prevalence of religious leader in alternative medium also suggests that the public including religious leader may not necessarily accept the decree hence more effort should be devoted to encouraging the medium and religious leader to accept the vaccine a they may act a opinion leader

processed_title: childhood immunization and ageappropriate vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: background childhood immunization is a costeffective way to protect individual against communicable disease however although there is a large literature on childhood immunization in indonesia there is a paucity of research on the ageappropriateness on measles and dtwp3 vaccination and the inequity in immunization coverage across indonesia method in this paper using seven wave of data from the nationally representative indonesia demographic and health survey dhs covering the period 1991 2017 we empirically analyse the socioeconomic and demographic factor influencing the uptake of four routine vaccine bcg polio3 dtwp3 and measles specifically using multivariate regression analysis we identify the socioeconomic and demographic factor influencing childhood immunization coverage we further analyse the socioeconomic and demographic correlate of the ageappropriateness of the measles and dtwp3 vaccination coverage result our finding show that parental education and use of healthcare service are strong predictor of full immunization and ageappropriate vaccination this study also find evidence of spatial heterogeneity in both full immunization rate and ageappropriate vaccination for measles and dtwp3 vaccine conclusion our analysis find that despite an improvement in the timing of vaccination over the last two decade a significant proportion of child continue to receive their measles and dtwp vaccination age inappropriately in particular we find that maternal education and maternal engagement with healthcare service are critical in improving age appropriateness of vaccination from a policy perspective these result call for concerted effort by policy maker to address regional gap in access to health service and immunization coverage a well a to improve the ageappropriateness of vaccination

processed_title: correlate of first dose of measles vaccination delivery and uptake in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to determine health systemsrelated familial and cultural factor which influence the delivery and uptake of measles vaccination in indonesia method logistic regression analysis of data collected during the 2007 indonesian demographic and health survey wa undertaken by the author to investigate these factor the 2007 indonesian demographic and health survey dataset is a nationally representative randomly sampled survey containing 15 065 child aged between 9 and 59 month result 728 of child had received the measles vaccine vaccination coverage wa similar for male and female however coverage wa higher amongst urban child 801 compared to 685 in rural area the key finding of the regression analysis were congruent with the result of previous research targeting vaccination coverage after controlling for all other factor maternal age maternal education wealth the use of a skilled birth attendant and postnatal checkup were positively and significantly p 001 correlated with measles vaccination the number of child per household wa negatively correlated p001 conclusion in order to enhance measles vaccination coverage in indonesia delivery to and uptake by rural and low socioeconomic population require substantial improvement mass health education and health system improvement are also required

processed_title: xerophthalmia and measles in kenya
processed_abstract: in many african country measles is considered to be an important cause of blindness on the basis of his observation in kenya and tanzania in 1972 franken presumed however that in the majority of these case xerophthalmia wa the real cause of blindness precipitated by the catalyst measles in order to gain a better understanding of this important complicated problem we performed in the first half of 1974 an investigation in kenya into the prevalence of xerophthalmia in december 1974 we had the opportunity to evaluate our kenyan finding on java in the company of dr j ten doesschate and professor hapc oomen the result of this investigation in kenya and indonesia are presented in this thesis see article 1 xerophthalmia occurred nearly everywhere in kenya in 1974 this demonstrates the prevalence of xerophthalmia in community which do not have rice but have maize for their staplefood 2 xerophthalmia appears to be the main cause of blindness in kenyan child 3 measles often play by mean of local and general catalysing effect an important role in the development of blindness caused by xerophthalmia 4 in wellnourished child measles is of no consequence a a cause of blindness 5 vital staining by 1 rose bengal or 1 lissamine green appears to be a real asset for the early diagnosis of xerophthalmia in health centre and in field survey this method is therefore of great importance for the prevention of severe blindness inducing vitamin a deficiency

processed_title: estimate of potential demand for measles and rubella microarray patch
processed_abstract: global measles vaccine coverage ha stagnated at approximately 85 for over a decade by simplifying vaccine logistics and administration the measles and rubella microarray patch mrmap may improve coverage clinical trial have demonstrated similar safety and immunogenicity in 9monthold infant for mrmaps compared with syringeandneedle vaccination to aid commercialization we present estimate of mrmap demand we created a spreadsheetbased tool to estimate demand for mrmaps using data from 180 who country during 20002016 five immunization scenario were analyzed 1a supplementary immunization activity sias in gavi the vaccine alliance gavieligible country and 1b who country where preventive sias are routinely conducted 2 sias and outbreak response immunization in all who country 3 routine immunization ri and sias in six highburden measles country the democratic republic of the congo ethiopia india indonesia nigeria and pakistan 4 ri and sias in six highburden country and gavieligible country and 5 hardtoreach population mrmap demand varied greatly across scenario forecast for 20252034 estimate from 137 million dos in hardtoreach population scenario 5 to 2587 billion dos for ri and sias in six highburden country and gavieligible country scenario 4 when policymakers and manufacturer assess mrmap demand they may consider multiple scenario to allow for a complete consideration of potential market and public health need

processed_title: measles surveillance in taiwan 20122014 changing epidemiology immune response and circulating genotype
processed_abstract: in taiwan although the coverage rate of two dos of measlescontaining vaccine ha been maintained at over 95 since 2001 measles outbreak occurred in 2002 2009 and 2011 the present study report that 43 case were confirmed by laboratory testing in taiwan in 20122014 and that adult have emerged a one of group susceptible to measles virus mv infection who may have discrepant humoral immune reactionsindicated by the level of igm and igg antibody compared to a naive susceptible measles case thirtyseven of 43 case confirmed by rtpcr were further characterized by genotyping in taiwan genotype h1 wa the major strain in circulation prior to 2010 while d9 wa the most frequently detected mv genotype between 2010 and 2011 the genotyping data collected between 2012 and 2014 revealed that h1 rebounded in 2012 after an absence in 2011 and wa imported from china and vietnam in 2014 genotype b3 first appeared in taiwan following import from the philippine and became the most frequently detected strain genotype d8 linked to importation from various country including india indonesia thailand and vietnam showed sequence divergence d9 wa imported from malaysia in 2014 the mv genotype detected in taiwan reflected the genotype of circulating endemic measles strain in neighboring country a significant rise in the number of measles case and in measles with genotype imported from surrounding country indicated that measles resurged in asia in 2014

processed_title: factor affecting vaccination demand in indonesia a secondary analysis and multimethods national assessment
processed_abstract: objective vaccine hesitancy remains a major barrier to immunisation coverage worldwide we explored influence of hesitancy on coverage and factor contributing to vaccine uptake during a national measlesrubella mr campaign in indonesia design secondary analysis of qualitative and quantitative data set from existing crosssectional study conducted during and around the campaign method quantitative data used in this assessment included daily coverage report generated by health worker district risk profile that indicate precampaign immunisation programme performance and report of campaign cessation due to vaccine hesitancy we used ttest and chi2 test for association the qualitative assessment employed three parallel national and regional study deductive thematic analysis examined factor for acceptance among caregiver health provider and programme manager result coverage data were reported from 6462 health facility across 395 district from 1 august to 31 december 2018 the average district coverage wa 73 with wide variation between district 2100 onethird of district fell below 70 coverage threshold sixtytwo of 395 16 district paused the campaign due to hesitancy coverage among district that never paused campaign activity due to hesitancy wa significantly higher than rate for district everpausing the campaign 81 v 42 p0001 precampaign adequacy of district immunisation programme did not explain coverage gap p0210 qualitative analysis identified acceptance enablers including using digital health monitoring and feedback system increasing caregiver knowledge and awareness making immunisation social norm effective crosssectoral collaboration conducive service environment and positive experience for mother and child barrier included misinformation diffusion on social medium halalharam issue lack of healthcare provider knowledge negative family influence and tradition previous poor experience and misinformation on adverse event conclusion barrier to vaccine uptake contributed to coverage gap during national mr campaign in indonesia a range of supplyrelated and demandrelated strategy were identified to address hesitancy contributor advancing a portfolio of tailored multilevel intervention will be critical to enhance vaccine acceptance

processed_title: measlesrubella microarray patch phase iii clinical trial framework proposal and consideration
processed_abstract: background the measlesrubella microarray patch mrmap is an important technology that is expected to reduce coverage and equity gap for measlescontaining vaccine mcvs reach zerodose child and contribute to elimination of measles and rubella mrmaps are anticipated to be easier to deploy programmatically and could be delivered by lessertrained health worker thereby increasing immunization coverage the most advanced mrmap ha reached clinical proofofconcept through a phase iii trial in the target population of infant and young child the world health organization who and partner have developed the phase iii clinical trial framework for mrmaps presented in this article objective and method the purpose of such framework is to inform the consideration design and approach for the pivotal clinical trial design while considering the anticipated data requirement to inform regulatory approval who prequalification and policy decision result the proposed phase iii trial would compare the immunogenicity and safety of an mrmap with mr vaccine delivered subcutaneously in 9 to 10monthold infant an analysis of noninferiority ni of immunogenicity would occur six week after the first dose should regulatory agency or policy maker require a proportion of infant could receive a second dose of either the same or alternate mr vaccine presentation six month after the first dose with those child returning six week after the second dose for a descriptive assessment of immunogenicity and then followed up six month after the second dose for evaluation of safety and immunogenicity it is anticipated that this proposed pivotal phase iii trial framework would generate the required clinical data for regulatory licensure and who prequalification pq of mrmaps however the trial design would need to be reviewed and confirmed by a national regulatory authority nra that will assess the product for regulatory licensure and the who pq team additional research will likely be required to generate data on concomitant vaccine delivery the safety and immunogenicity of mrmaps in other age group such a child 15 year and infant younger than 9 month of age and the impact of mrmaps on coverage and equity such study could be conducted during or after clinical mrmap development

processed_title: exploring important attribute the potential use case and feasibility of introduction of measles and rubella microarray patch mrmaps insight from nine country
processed_abstract: background microarray patch map are innovative needlefree vaccine delivery system suitable for administration by minimally trained health care worker or trained community health worker their introduction may transform immunization programme particularly for vaccine where high coverage is required for population immunity such a measles and where vaccine delivery is challenging such a in low and middleincome country recognizing the need to understand how best to tailor these product to reflect country priority workshop on measles and rubella map mrmaps were conducted in multiple region to collect insight on need and preference from relevant stakeholder at country level method the capaciti innovation framework wa used to structure stakeholder discussion in nine country in the period from august 2022 to july 2023 the discussion building on the finding from a situation analysis on the barrier related to measles and rubella vaccine delivery followed the fourstep process outlined in the framework result key barrier hindering delivery of measles and rubella vaccine across the country were in the category of human resource management service delivery and demand generation mrmap attribute that stakeholder believed would reduce or eliminate these barrier included ease of preparation and administration improved thermostability fewer ancillary component and singledose presentation some attribute such a the site of administration wear time and storage volume could exacerbate certain barrier based on an understanding of key barrier product attribute and underserved population stakeholder identified several potential use case for mrmaps i delivery at a fixed health post ii delivery through outreach session conducted by health worker and iii administration by community health worker to enable robust national decision making about the introduction of mrmaps and successful implementation global and national evidence on feasibility and acceptability of mrmaps should be generated to prepare for the potential introduction of mrmaps immunization programme should evaluate their immunization policy based on their preferred use case and modify them if needed for example to enable community health worker to administer vaccine along with making programmatic adjustment to waste management and training conclusion mrmaps have the potential to reduce key barrier to mr delivery yet their future impact depends on the ability of global stakeholder to steer the development of mrmaps to be responsive to country need and preference the generation of evidence to enable robust decision making timely modification of vaccine policy and addressing programmatic consideration will be key to successful uptake

processed_title: analysis of specific antibody and cellular immune response to firstdose measles vaccine edmonstonzagreb in 9monthold infant
processed_abstract: background measles vaccination have been suggested to provide immune protection and decreased measles incidence however there wa a limited study evaluating how the measles vaccine elicits specific immune response objective this study aimed to evaluate both humoral and cellular immunity to firstdose measles vaccine edmonstonzagreb ez in 9monthold indonesian infant method a cohort study wa conducted on 9monthold infant who got the firstdose of measles vaccine ez measlesspecific immunoglobulin g igg antibody serum level were measured using plaquereduction microneutralization assay peripheral blood mononuclear cell were stimulated with a measlesspecific peptide to identify a cellular immune response quantification of cd4 and cd8 tcells producing interferongamma ifn and interleukin 17a il17a were conducted by flow cytometry humoral and cellular immune response parameter were analyzed over time result the prevalence of seropositivity rate wa 858 at 1month after vaccination and 1667 at 6months postvaccination measlesspecific igg antibody increased significantly at 1month after measles vaccination however they decreased significantly 6months after vaccination ifn and il17a secreting tcells increased significantly at 1month after measles vaccination interestingly a significant decrease of ifn and il17a secreting cd4 t cell wa noticed 6months postvaccination compared to ifn and il17a secreting cd8 t cell conclusion our study suggests that the firstdose measles vaccine on 9monthsold infant seems to induce both humoral and cellular immune response that decline 6months after vaccination

processed_title: congenital rubella syndrome surveillance after measles rubella vaccination introduction in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background congenital rubella syndrome cr is a fatal disease causing severe congenital defect indonesia had the highest cr case in the world in 2016 with a commitment to achieve elimination of rubella disease by 2020 through the campaign and introduction of measles rubella mr national vaccination program in 2017 and 2018 this study aimed to describe the impact of the national vaccination campaign by conducting surveillance of cr case and comparing the incidence of new cr case before and after the mr vaccination campaign method from july 2015 to july 2020 we conducted surveillance of cr in yogyakarta suspected patient underwent complete clinical examination serology wa tested for the presence of igm and igg antibody against rubella descriptive analysis wa used to characterize the demographic and clinical characteristic of the case before and after the mr vaccination campaign result the study involved 229 infant who were suspected for cr laboratoryconfirmed case were found in 47 of them 2086 most of the laboratoryconfirmed case 553 were reported among 15 month old infant common clinical feature among laboratoryconfirmed case included structural heart defect in 43 914 there wa a significant decrease 609 of cr incidence from 039 per 1000 live birth in the precampaign era to 008 in the postcampaign era p 000 conclusion there ha been a significant declining number of cr case based on pre and postmr vaccination campaign in yogyakarta indonesia an effective surveillance system will help monitor the number of cr case

processed_title: overview of the role and action mechanism of microrna128 in viral infection
processed_abstract: recently in vivo and in vitro study have provided evidence establishing the significance of micrornas mirnas in both physiological and pathological condition in this regard the role of mirna128 mir128 in health and disease ha been found and it critical regulatory role in the context of some viral disease ha been recently identified for instance it ha been found that mir128 can serve a an antiviral mediator and significantly limit the replication and dissemination of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 hiv1 besides it ha been noted that poliovirus receptorrelated 4 pvrl4 is posttranscriptionally regulated by mir128 representing possible mirna target that can modulate measles virus infection of note the downregulation of seminal exosomes ecamir128 is associated with the longterm persistence of equine arteritis virus eav in the reproductive tract and this particular mirna is a putative regulator of chemokine ligand 16 cxc motif a determined by target prediction analysis in this review the latest information on the role and action mechanism of mir128 in viral infection will be summarized and discussed in detail

processed_title: pediatric disease and operational deployment
processed_abstract: many nation now export military health a a proactive arm of the nation contribution to the maintenance of international peace in trouble region of the world and all nation are called upon from time to time in emergency and disaster situation to help out in their region of interest child and young teenager constitute some 50 of warstricken population this paper explores this increasingly important role of military medicine from the point of view of a practicing pediatrician and career doctorsoldier many international operational deployment undertaken in the last 5 year have required the insertion of pediatric clinical and preventive health resource deployment to rwanda the country of the former yugoslavia somalia bougainville in papua new guinea irian jaya in indonesia and the aitape tsunami disaster response the sepik region of papua new guinea have all necessitated major pediatric intervention in some operational deployment in excess of onethird of patient and clinical contact have involved the care of child including clinical treatment ranging from lifesaving resuscitation to the care of child with both tropical and subtropical illness they have also involved mass immunization campaign eg in rwanda to prevent measles and meningococcal septicemia in developing country at any time approximately 1 to 4 teenage and adult woman is pregnant and of these 1 in 15 is suffering a miscarriage during any 2week period the implication of this audit are that service member must be multiskilled not only in the traditional aspect of military medicine and nursing but also in a the developmental aspect of childhood b the prevention of infectious childhood disease by immunization and other mean c the recognition and management of disease of childhood and d the management of the normal neonate and infant especially those orphaned in refugee disaster and other emergency situation doctorsoldiers hold special credential to be advocate for the protection of child caught up in armed conflict and it aftermath in this context advocacy to ban antipersonnel land mine is topical because unfortunately the more than 2000 death and injury each month involve child and their family often injured long after the cessation of hostility pediatric issue are now the business of all who serve in the health discipline in the broader profession of arm

processed_title: measles cluster detection using ordinal scan statistic model
processed_abstract: introduction measles a very contagious disease which responsible for the thousand mortality in the world including indonesia even though vaccination ha been claimed victorious to reduce the transmission but it doe not mean that the world is free from measles gi is offering a powerful method to support the decision maker in generating the measles program aim this research aimed to investigate measles clustering in bantul yogyakarta indonesia by considering population density and income level this study wa essential to support decision maker to develop a proper intervention for preventing measles material and method quantitative approach wa used in this study secondary data that consisted of measles case population density and income level were collected from the district health office and related government office in bantul district ordinal scan statistic model by using satscan v96 wa applied to detect the cluster and to test the association between the case and the variable result this research revealed that population density and income level are the two predictor of measles hotspot cluster people who live in the very highincome level district will have 48 higher possibility to be exposed with measles people who live in the district with medium and high population density predicted to have 45 fewer risk to be infected with measles conclusion there is a correlation between income level and measles case geographic information system gi can contribute to a decision support system for disease prevention such a on measles

processed_title: intralesional measlesmumpsrubella is associated with a higher complete response in cutaneous wart a systematic review and metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial including grade qualification
processed_abstract: introduction wart can be difficult to treat and progressing to chronic and resistant disease several study have reported the successful application of mumpsmeaslesrubella mmr vaccine resulting in clearance of wart via immunomodulation and induction of immune system method we performed a comprehensive search on the role of intralesional mmr in wart from several electronic database complete response is defined a complete clearance of wart lesion result there were a total of 425 subject from five study intralesional injection of mmr wa associated with an increased complete response or 943 578 1537 p 001 i2 5 p 38 subgroup analysis on patient receiving injection for every 2 week for a maximum of five injection revealed an or of 1170 640 2138 p 001 i2 20 p 29 patient receiving intralesional mmr were associated with a lower partial response or 054 033 088 p 01 i2 0 p 66 intralesional mmr wa associated with a reduced noresponse or 016 006 043 p 001 i2 69 p 01 funnel plot analysis for complete response wa asymmetrical indicating the risk of publication bias there were statistically significant smallstudy effect for intralesional mmr on complete response upon analysis using harbords test p 047 grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation grade assessment showed that intralesional mmr injection ha high level of certainty quality of evidence for complete response in wart with an absolute increase of 505 per 1000 conclusion intralesional mmr injection wa associated with a higher complete response and lower noresponse with a high level of certainty

processed_title: investigation of a measles transmission with vaccination a case study in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: measles is a contagious disease caused by the measles virus of genus morbillivirus which ha been spreading in many affected region this infection is characterized by the appearance of rash all over the body and potentially cause serious complication especially among infant and child before measles immunization wa promoted it is one of the endemic disease that caused the most fatality each year in the world this paper aim to analyze and to investigate measles transmission in jakarta via an sihr epidemic model involving vaccination from january to december 2017 jakarta health office collected the observed data of measles incidence we then derived the basic reproduction number a a threshold of disease transmission and obtained the local a well a global stability of the equilibrium under certain condition the unobserved parameter and initial condition were estimated by minimizing error between data and numerical result furthermore a stochastic model wa developed to capture the data and to accommodate the randomness of the transmission sensitivity analysis wa also performed to analyze and to identify the parameter which give significant contribution to the spread of the virus we then obtained simulation of vaccine level coverage the data is shown within a 95 confidence interval of the stochastic solution and the average of the stochastic solution is relatively close to the solution of the deterministic model the most sensitive parameter in the infected compartment is the hospitalized rate which can be considered to be one of the essential factor to reduce the number of case for policymakers we hence proposed a control strategy which is providing treatment access easier for infected individual is better than vaccinating when an outbreak occurs

processed_title: inequity of maternalchild health service in asean member state from 1993 to 2021
processed_abstract: introduction inequity in maternalchild health service is a challenge to global health a it hinders the achievement of sustainable development goal sdgs and universal health coverage though the association of southeast asian nation asean ha made remarkable achievement in maternalchild health there remain gap in reaching global goal this study aimed to compare and investigate the inequity in maternalchild health mch service in asean member state to help guide policy decision to improve equitable health service in the sdg era and beyond method using the who health inequality monitor we identified inequity summary measure for five mch service in asean member state from 1993 to 2021 antenatal care birth attended by skilled health personnel diphtheria tetanus and pertussis dtp3 immunization measles immunization and polio immunization we divided the analysis dimension of inequity into urbanrural inequity economic status inequity and subregional inequity trend of absolute and relative inequity in every dimension of mch service in asean member state were examined with the principal component analysis pca result the mean coverage of mch service are 9880 thailand 8672 cambodia 8454 viet nam 7852 indonesia 7694 timorleste 7240 lao pdr 6810 philippine and 4852 myanmar in 2021 thailand have the lowest mch service absolute inequity index of 1945 followed by vietnam 1449 lao pdr and myanmar have relatively higher mch service absolute inequity index of 0852 and 0054 respectively the service in cambodia indonesia and the philippine is prospecific region with subnational region absolute inequity index of 002 001 and 101 respectively the service in myanmar is prorich with economic status absolute inequity index of 043 the service in lao pdr and timorleste is prourban area prorich and prospecific region conclusion the inequity of mch service in asean persists but is in a declining trend thailand and vietnam have performed well in ensuring mch service equity while lao and myanmar are still facing serious inequity dilemma the progress of mch service equity in myanmar cambodia the philippine and indonesia is uneven it is acceptable to learn from the successful experience of thailand and vietnam to improve the equity in other asean country policy should be developed according to the specific type of mch inequity in member state to improve equity level

processed_title: a case of genital and extragenital wart unresponsive to immunotherapy using measles mumps rubella vaccine
processed_abstract: anogenital wart agws are globally recognized a the most common sexually transmitted infection stis caused by the human papillomavirus hpv particularly type 6 and 11 meanwhile immunotherapy is one of the treatment of choice for patient with extensive agws measles mumps and rubella mmr vaccine induce the production of various t helper 1 cytokine to elicit immune response resulting in the clearance of both treated and untreated wart this study reported a case of extensive genital and extragenital wart in a 53yearold male which had occurred for five year with no pseudokoebner phenomenon the history of mmr vaccination wa uncertain but the patient received oral antibiotic for one week one month before seeking consultation physical examination showed extensive verrucous and hyperkeratotic papule plaque and nodule in the lower abdomen pubic inguinal genital and gluteal region acetowhite test result were positive while polymerase chain reaction pcr result were positive for hpv type 6 and 11 the patient received an intralesional injection of 05 ml mmr vaccine into the largest wart with a 3week interval however during the onemonth followup after the third injection no improvement wa observed in either the size or number of wart based on the result several factor must be considered to determine the best candidate for immunotherapy particularly with mmr vaccine to achieve an optimal outcome these factor include the active state of disease duration of disease a well a a history of sensitization and broadspectrum antibiotic

processed_title: cause and temporal trend of childhood blindness in indonesia study at school for the blind in java
processed_abstract: aim to ascertain the cause of blindness and severe visual impairment blsvi in school for the blind in java to identify preventable and treatable cause and to evaluate temporal trend in the major cause method from a total of 504 student 479 were examined data wa collected using a modified world heath organization prevention of blindness whopbl eye examination record for child result the majority of the student 95 were blind and 46 were severely visually impaired the major anatomical site of blsvi wa whole globe in 359 retina in 189 lens in 164 and cornea in 161 the major underlying aetiology of blsvi wa undeterminedunknown in 327 mainly microphthalmia anterior segment dysgenesis and cataract hereditary factor 319 mainly retinal dystrophy and childhood disorder 285 avoidable cause of blsvi accounted for 599 of the total student whereas measles blindness wa the underlying condition for 231 of the preventable cause cataract and glaucoma accounted for 155 and 82 of the treatable cause respectively exploration on trend of svibl among two different age group 16 year and or 16 year suggested that childhood disorder and corneal factor have declined while hereditary disorder have increased optic nerve disorder although not counted a a major cause of blindness seems to be on the increase conclusion more than half of the blsvi cause are potentially avoidable cataract and corneal disorder related to measles or vitamin a deficiency were the major treatable and preventable cause declining proportion of childhood factor and corneal disorder over a period of 1020 year could reflect improved vitamin a supplementation and measles vaccination coverage in indonesia this finding and the increased proportion of hereditary disease cause could suggest improving level of socioeconomic development and health care service

processed_title: determinant of apparent ruralurban differential in measles vaccination uptake in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction regional difference in vaccination uptake are common in both developed and developing country and are often linked to the availability of healthcare service and socioeconomic factor in 2007 09 million eligible indonesian child missed measles vaccination and 19 456 case of measles were documented among indonesian child the author investigated ruralurban differential in measles vaccination coverage among young indonesian child and sought to identify key factor influencing the probability of a child receiving the first dose of measles vaccination in indonesia method data used in the analysis were sourced from the nationally representative indonesia demographic and health survey 2007 the influence of location of residence household wealth maternal and paternal education total child ever born and use of skilled birth attendant on measles vaccination coverage wa investigated using bivariate analysis and chisquare test the independent effect of these variable were established using binomial logistic regression analysis result indonesia 2007 firstdose measles national vaccination coverage wa at 728 lower than the 2008 global firstdose measles vaccination average coverage of 82 bivariate analysis revealed that the firstdose measles vaccination coverage in rural area of indonesia wa 685 compared with 801 in urban region p 0001 the apparent significance of rural residence in impairing vaccination coverage wa marginal after controlling for the sex of the child maternal age maternal and paternal education wealth and access to skilled health worker conclusion apart from sustainable initiative to increase measles vaccination coverage globally it is important to close the ruralurban gap in indonesia measles vaccination uptake addressing critical determinant of inferior measles vaccination coverage in indonesia rural region will facilitate major improvement in indonesia child health trend this article suggests initiative for addressing three of such determinant in indonesia rural area poverty parental education and access to skilled health worker

processed_title: progress toward measles elimination southeast asia region 20032013
processed_abstract: in 2013 the 66th session of the regional committee of the world health organization who southeast asia region adopted the goal of measles elimination and rubella and congenital rubella syndrome control by 2020 after rigorous prior consultation the recommended strategy include 1 achieving and maintaining 95 coverage with 2 dos of measles and rubellacontaining vaccine in every district through routine or supplementary immunization activity sias 2 developing and sustaining a sensitive and timely casebased measles surveillance system that meet recommended performance indicator 3 developing and maintaining an accredited measles laboratory network and 4 achieving timely identification investigation and response to measles outbreak this report update previous report and summarizes progress toward measles elimination in the southeast asia region during 20032013 within the region coverage with the first dose of a measlescontaining vaccine mcv1 increased from 67 to 78 an estimated 286 million child 95 of the target population were vaccinated in sias measles incidence decreased 73 from 59 to 16 case per million population and estimated measles death decreased 63 to achieve measles elimination in the region additional effort are needed in country with 95 2dose routine mcv coverage particularly in india and indonesia to strengthen routine immunization service conduct periodic highquality sias and strengthen measles casebased surveillance and laboratory diagnosis of measles

processed_title: covid19 immune response in adult post measlesrubella vaccination
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to see how measles mumps and rubella vaccination affected the increase in sarscov2 immunoglobulin level in individual who had received the second dose of the sarscov2 vaccine material and method this research is a quasiexperimental type with a prepost test design the population studied were adult who had received the second dose of the sarscov2 vaccine consisting of 30 people result the result of this study were that most 60 research subject experienced an increase in igm and some subject 466 experienced an increase in antisarscov2 igg level the administration of the mr vaccination had no effect on increasing antisarscov2 igg and igm level this happened because the increase in igm and igg level in the pre and posttests in most research subject wa relatively low conclusion the administration of the mr vaccine to adult who had received a second dose of the sarscov2 vaccine elicited a response with low level of igg and igm sarscov2

processed_title: antiviral traditional medicine against herpes simplex virus hsv1 poliovirus and measles virus in vitro and their therapeutic efficacy for hsv1 infection in mouse
processed_abstract: one hundred fortytwo kind of traditional medicine which have been historically used in china indonesia and japan were examined for the antiviral activity of their hot water hw extract against herpes simplex virus type 1 hsv1 poliovirus type 1 and measles virus by plaque reduction assay thirtytwo 55 and 30 hwextracts of them showed antihsv1 antipoliovirus and antimeasles virus activity respectively among the 32 hwextracts with antihsv1 activity 3 hwextracts had antihsv1 activity alone and the others showed antihsv1 activity with antipoliovirus andor antimeasles virus activity the 32 hwextracts were further examined for their therapeutic efficacy of hsv1 infection in mouse the mouse were infected cutaneously with hsv1 and hwextracts were orally administered three time daily twelve hwextracts currently used for the treatment of various disease other than viral infection were found to be significantly effective in limiting the development of skin lesion andor in prolonging the mean survival time of hsv1infected mouse these result suggested that 12 of 142 hwextracts that exhibited therapeutic efficacy in an animal infection model were possible candidate for antihsv1 traditional medicine

processed_title: health practice and index of a poor urban population in indonesia part ii immunization nutrition and incidence of diarrhea
processed_abstract: this second section in a twopart study of health index and practice among a poor urban population in indonesia focus on problem related to immunization nutrition and incidence of diarrhea through a survey of 690 mother and 593 child in two slum community in jakarta we found that 1 65 of the child were mildly to severely malnourished according to gomez criterion with malnutrition most prevalent among the poorest 2 75 of the mother reported exclusive breastfeeding of their infant during the first four month after birth but breastfeeding decreased sharply with increasing socioeconomic status 3 of the 19 of one to threeyearold child who were incompletely immunized most were likely to be missing their measles and dpt3 immunization and 4 28 of the mother reported that at least one of their underthreeyearold child had diarrhea in the last month with frequency of reporting highest among poor mother and those using water from vendor we concluded that selective intervention should be accompanied by development of a comprehensive health infrastructure that permit uninterrupted service delivery and follow up of those identified a high risk such a comprehensive primary health care system should be part of a multisectoral development strategy

processed_title: occurrence of measles genotype d8 during a 2014 outbreak in banjarmasin south kalimantan indonesia
processed_abstract: objective an outbreak of measles symptom occurring in child in banjarmasin south kalimantan indonesia in 2014 wa investigated method nasal swab were collected from 23 child median age 41 month with fever and other symptom of measles hospitalized in ulin general hospital and islamic hospital banjarmasin south kalimantan viral rna wa extracted for cdna synthesis followed by pcr and sequencing using paramyxovirus family consensus and ngene primer result sixteen measlespositive patient 70 were identified fifteen virus strain belonged to genotype d8 and the remaining one strain wa confirmed a belonging to genotype d9 conclusion measles virus genotype d8 wa detected in an outbreak of measles in south kalimantan indonesia in 2014

processed_title: modified measles with an atypical presentation
processed_abstract: we report symptomatic confirmed modified measles infection in a person with one documented mmr measles mumps rubella vaccination and travel to indonesia no secondary case were identified consistent with other case report of modified measles infection the infectivity of modified measles for contact tracing requirement requires further elucidation

processed_title: progress toward rubella and congenital rubella syndrome control southeast asia region 20002016
processed_abstract: in 2013 the 66th session of the regional committee of the world health organization who southeast asia region sear adopted the goal of elimination of measles and controldagger of rubella and congenital rubella syndrome cr by 2020 1 rubella is the leading vaccinepreventable cause of birth defect although rubella typically cause a mild fever and rash in child and adult rubella virus infection during pregnancy especially during the first trimester can result in miscarriage fetal death or a constellation of congenital malformation known a cr commonly including visual auditory andor cardiac defect and developmental delay 2 rubella and cr control capitalizes on the momentum created by pursuing measles elimination because the effort are programmatically linked rubellacontaining vaccine rcv is administered a a combined measles and rubella vaccine and rubella case are detected through casebased surveillance for measles or fever and rash illness 3 this report summarizes progress toward rubella and cr control in sear during 20002016 estimated coverage with a first rcv dose rcv1 increased from 3 of the birth cohort in 2000 to 15 in 2016 because of rcv introduction in six country rcv1 coverage is expected to increase rapidly with the phased introduction of rcv in india and indonesia beginning in 2017 these country are home to 83 of the sear birth cohort during 20002016 approximately 83 million person were vaccinated through 13 supplemental immunization activity sias conducted in eight country during 20102016 reported rubella incidence decreased by 37 from 86 to 54 case per 1 million population and four country bangladesh maldives sri lanka and thailand reported a decrease in incidence of 95 since 2010 to achieve rubella and cr control in sear sustained investment to increase routine rcv coverage periodic highquality sias to close immunity gap and strengthened rubella and cr surveillance are needed

processed_title: mass vaccination and surveillancecontainment in the eradication of smallpox
processed_abstract: the smallpox eradication program initiated by the who in 1966 wa originally based on mass vaccination the program emphasized surveillance from the beginning largely to track the success of the program and further our understanding of the epidemiology of the disease early observation in west africa bolstered by later data from indonesia and the asian subcontinent showed that smallpox did not spread rapidly and outbreak could be quickly controlled by isolation of patient and vaccination of their contact contact were usually easy to find because transmission of smallpox usually required prolonged facetoface contact the emphasis therefore shifted to active search to find case coupled with contact tracing rigorous isolation of patient and vaccination and surveillance of contact to contain outbreak this shift away from mass vaccination resulted in an acceleration of the program success

processed_title: measles enteritis in infant and child
processed_abstract: the incidence mortality and clinical feature of measles enteritis were reported among 6484 infant and child admitted to the pediatric ward dr pirngadi general hospital medan from 1st january 1987 until 31st december 1988 of these 6484 child 2685 suffered from gastroenteritis and 82 from measles there were 31 case of measles enteritis 12 of all gastroenteritis case or 378 of measles case most of measles enteritis case 742 were in the age group of 624 month and no case wa found under six month old the mortality of measles enteritis with bronchopneumonia and encephalitis wa 250 while the mortality of measles enteritis with bronchopneumonia wa 133 there were no death in child just with measles enteritis alone the overall mortality of measles enteritis with or without accompanying disease wa 129 the age specific death rate of measles enteritis wa highest 231 in the 1324 month age group

processed_title: inequality in measles vaccination coverage in the big six country of the who southeast asia region
processed_abstract: the big six country bangladesh india indonesia myanmar nepal and thailand in the world health organization southeast asia region who sear are currently facing severe challenge in measles elimination and consequent childhood mortality reduction with inadequacy and inequality in the coverage of the measlescontainingvaccine firstdose mcv1 being major obstacle however these issue of inequality in mcv1 coverage have not yet been systematically examined we used data from the latest demographic and health survey and multiple indicator cluster survey to provide a comprehensive picture of existing mcv1 coverage gap data were disaggregated by geographic location a well a by socioeconomic and nutritional dimension national mcv1 coverage ranged from 77 in myanmar to 92 in thailand only nine of the 104 subnational district had achieved the 95 mcv1 coverage goal a set by the who geographic inequality were more pronounced in country with lower coverage level area in cluster with poor mcv1 coverage performance a well a disadvantaged socioeconomic profile require increased attention inequality were evident in all country except thailand and were more pronounced in the sector of wealth education antenatal care anc status and vitamin a supplementation va when compared against the area of gender and urbanrural residence wealthrelated inequality in bangladesh educationrelated inequality in indonesia ancrelated inequality in myanmar and nepal and vasrelated inequality in indonesia and myanmar were all noteworthy equityoriented change in policy focusing on health promotion and integrated intervention among disadvantaged population need to be implemented in order to increase mcv1 coverage and reduce childhood mortality

processed_title: economic evaluation of second measles containing vaccine mcv dose a systematic review of available evidence
processed_abstract: introduction the global measles incidence ha decreased from 145 to 49 case per 1 million population from 2000 to 2018 but evaluating the economic benefit of a second measlescontaining vaccine mcv2 is crucial this study reviewed the evidence and quality of economic evaluation study to guide mcv2 introduction method the systematic review of modelbased economic evaluation study wa conducted following the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses guideline the search yielded 2231 article with 876 duplicate removed and 1355 article screened with nine study included for final analysis result six study reported a positive benefitcost ratio with one resulting in net saving of 116 billion and two study estimated a 2dose mmr vaccination program would save 11924 to prevent one measles case and a second dose could prevent 9200 case at 18 month saving 54819 per case the most sensitive variable were the discount rate and vaccination administration cost conclusion two mcv dos or a second opportunity with an additional dose of mcv were highly costbeneficial and resulted in substantial cost saving compared to a single routine vaccine but further research using highquality modelbased health economic evaluation study of mcv2 should be made available to decisionmakers prospero registration crd42020200669

processed_title: malnutrition and infectious disease morbidity among child missed by the childhood immunization program in indonesia
processed_abstract: although it ha been thought that child immunization program may miss the child who are in greatest need there are little published quantitative data to support this idea we sought to characterize malnutrition and morbidity among child who are missed by the childhood immunization program in indonesia vaccination and morbidity history anthropometry and other data were collected for 286500 child aged 1259 month in rural indonesia seventythree point nine percent of child received complete immunization 3 dos of diphtheriapertussistetanus 3 dos of oral poliovirus and measles 168 had partial coverage 16 of 7 vaccine dos and 93 received no vaccine of child with complete partial and no immunization coverage respectively the prevalence of severe underweight weightforage z score 3 wa 54 99 and 126 severe stunting heightforage z score 3 wa 102 162 and 215 and current diarrhea wa 38 73 and 86 all p 00001 respectively in family where the child had complete partial and no immunization the history of infant mortality wa 64 114 and 165 and underfive child mortality wa 73 134 and 192 both p 00001 expanded programmatic coverage is needed to reach child who are missed by childhood immunization in rural indonesia a missed child are at higher risk of morbidity and mortality

processed_title: epidemiology and etiology of childhood pneumonia
processed_abstract: childhood pneumonia is the leading single cause of mortality in child aged less than 5 year the incidence in this age group is estimated to be 029 episode per childyear in developing and 005 episode per childyear in developed country this translates into about 156 million new episode each year worldwide of which 151 million episode are in the developing world most case occur in india 43 million china 21 million and pakistan 10 million with additional high number in bangladesh indonesia and nigeria 6 million each of all community case 713 are severe enough to be lifethreatening and require hospitalization substantial evidence revealed that the leading risk factor contributing to pneumonia incidence are lack of exclusive breastfeeding undernutrition indoor air pollution low birth weight crowding and lack of measles immunization pneumonia is responsible for about 19 of all death in child aged less than 5 year of which more than 70 take place in subsaharan africa and southeast asia although based on limited available evidence recent study have identified streptococcus pneumoniae haemophilus influenzae and respiratory syncytial virus a the main pathogen associated with childhood pneumonia

processed_title: timeliness of routine childhood vaccination in indonesian infant in the first year of life
processed_abstract: background vaccine have proven to be one of the most effective strategy to control infectious disease and contributed to childhood survival while high vaccine coverage provide individual and herd immunity ageappropriate vaccination or vaccine timeliness is important for maximum vaccine protection but often not evaluated we aimed to describe the timeliness of childhood vaccination for indonesian infant and identify risk factor associated with delayed vaccination method this study wa a substudy of the indonesian pneumonia and vitamin d status ipad study a communitybased cohort study to investigate pneumonia incidence in two district in yogyakarta province indonesia sociodemographic data were obtained from structured interview and vaccine status wa obtained from maternal and child health record timely vaccination wa defined if the vaccine wa received between four day or less before and within 28 day after the recommended age of vaccination result 359 85 out of 422 ipad participant and their immunisation record were included between december 2015 and december 2017 vaccination coverage wa high and ranged from 961 measles to 100 dtphepbhib 1 however two third 67 242359 of all participant had received either early or late vaccine with dose 2 ipv 40 143356 dose 3 ipv 56 196349 and dose 3 dtphepbhib 29 103354 most delayed and only 1 received early dos the main risk factor for untimely vaccination were if the infant wa born in a private practice versus in a public health facility aor 190 95 ci 118307 and rural residence aor 184 95 ci 115294 conclusion despite high vaccine coverage for indonesian infant 95 two third 67 of infant had untimely vaccination with dose 3 ipv 56 the most delayed future strategy should focus on coordination between government health care provider and carers to ensure timely access and vaccination of infant to ensure adherence to vaccination schedule

processed_title: determination factor associated with immune response towards first dose edmonstonzagreb ez measles vaccine in indonesian infant
processed_abstract: background measles outbreak under high coverage of measles vaccination in indonesia is gaining a necessary evaluation of factor associated with measlesvaccine immune response objctive the purpose of recent study were to evaluate the association of sociodemographic and anthropometric parameter and specific immune response towards first dose edmonstonzagreb ez measles vaccine in indonesian infant method a total of 35 infant were enrolled in this cohort study measles immune response were followed up at one and six month after vaccination then analyzed for it association with sociodemographic anthropometric and nutritional parameter the plaquereduction microneutralization assay wa conducted to measure the titer of measles specific igg antibody the level of cd4 and cd8 tcells that exhibiting gamma interferon ifngamma secretion were analyzed by flow cytometry the association between variable wa analyzed by linear regression the difference immune response among variable were analyzed with mannwhitney test result vitamin a supplementation and breastfeeding were predicted a associated factor for humoral and cellular immune response after one month and six month measles vaccination among indonesia infant conclusion nutritional factor is associated with measles vaccination immune response in indonesian infant

processed_title: global routine vaccination coverage 2011
