processed_abstract: in 1974 the world health organization who established the expanded programme on immunization epi to ensure all child had access to routinely recommended vaccine initially those vaccine were limited to bacille calmetteguerin vaccine bcg diphtheriatetanuspertussis vaccine dtp oral poliovirus vaccine and measlescontaining vaccine mcv global coverage with the third dose of dtp dtp3 increased from 5 in 1974 to 79 by 2005 however one fifth of the world child especially those in lowincome country still were not fully vaccinated during the first year of life with the four traditional epi vaccine in 2005 who and the united nation childrens fund unicef developed the global immunization vision and strategy givs to improve national immunization program and decrease vaccinepreventable diseaseassociated morbidity and mortality a goal wa to reach a sustained national dtp3 coverage of 90 in all country this report summarizes global routine vaccination coverage during 2011 an estimated 83 of infant worldwide received at least 3 dos of dtp in 2011 similar to coverage in 2009 82 and 2010 85 among 194 who member state 130 67 achieved 90 national dtp3 coverage more than half of all incompletely vaccinated child ie those who did not receive dtp3 lived in one of three country india 32 nigeria 14 and indonesia 7 strengthening routine immunization service especially in country with the greatest number of undervaccinated child should be a global priority to help achieve the fourth millennium development goal of reducing mortality among child aged 5 year by two third from 1990 to 2015

processed_title: persistent socioeconomic inequality in measles vaccine uptake in ethiopia in the period 2005 to 2016
processed_abstract: objective this study aim to quantify socioeconomic inequalitiesand the factor contributing to these inequalitiesin measles vaccine uptake among child aged 12 to 23 month in ethiopia between 2005 and 2016 method inequality in measles vaccine uptake were investigated based on data from the ethiopian demographic and health survey conducted in 2005 2011 and 2016 concentration curve and concentration index were used to measure the degree of inequality and decomposition analysis wa used to identify factor contributing to these inequality result the overall level of national measles vaccine uptake in ethiopia exhibited an increasing trend between 2005 and 2016 a indicated by the concentration index of measles vaccine uptake however which wa estimated at 0202 p 01 in 2005 0226 p 01 in 2011 and 0223 p 01 in 2016 measles vaccine uptake became consistently more concentrated among child from more affluent household the dominance test of the concentration curve further confirmed the persistence of inequality in measles vaccine uptake over time various factorsincluding maternal educational level antenatal care use institutional delivery and exposure to mediawere identified a the most important contributor to the inequality conclusion although the national measles vaccine uptake showed improvement between 2005 and 2016 socioeconomic inequality in the uptake persisted over time effort to improve the national immunization coverage should be accompanied by appropriate measure to address the inequality

processed_title: the effectiveness of immunization
processed_abstract: this article review the expanded programme on immunization in indonesia pengembangan program imunisasi ppi which wa launched in 1977 we are apt to know what the current situation is after ten year have passed who proposes that epippi be systemically evaluated with respect to their effectiveness which is reflected by a reduction achieved in the incidence of the target disease priority is being accorded to measuring disease trend for three disease ie poliomyelitis measles and neonatal tetanus a considerable effect on target disease had been observed and it wa evident that ppi can reduce the incidence of target disease a goal had been set to eliminate indigenous paralytic poliomyelitis by the end of the fifth five year plan another goal had also been adopted ie neonatal tetanus elimination by 1985 in java and bali the effectiveness of immunization is ascertained and we have the optimism that poliomyelitis and neonatal tetanus elimination goal can be achieved

processed_title: an evaluation of the clinical feature of measles virus infection for diagnosis in child within a limited resource setting
processed_abstract: background measles is a recurrent health problem in both advanced and developed country the world health organization who recommends antimeasles immunoglobulin m ig m a the standard method of detecting the virus however many area still present the inability to perform a serology test of antimeasles igm therefore a typical clinical feature is necessary to establish the diagnosis of measles the objective of this study wa to evaluate hyperpigmented rash and other clinical feature a the diagnostic tool with respect to measles especially in an outbreak setting method in this observational diagnostic study the inclusion criterion were a follows between 6 and 144 month of age fever maculopapular rash for 3 day or more accompanied by a cough or coryza or conjunctivitis those with a prior history of measles vaccination 16 week were excluded in addition to those with history of corticosteroid for 2 week or more and immunocompromised condition the sample were taken from dr soetomo general academic hospital in surabaya indonesia we evaluated the sensitivity specificity the positive predictive value and the negative predictive value of such clinical feature hyperpigmented rash wa validated using kappa and mc nemar test antimeasles ig m wa considered a the gold standard result this study gathered 82 participant the clinical manifestation of all subject included fever cough coryza conjunctivitis koplik spot and maculopapular rash which turn into hyperpigmented rash along the course of the illness most maculopapular rash turn out to be hyperpigmented 89 sensitivity specificity positive predictive value and negative predictive value of the combination of fever maculopapular rash and hyperpigmented rash were found to be at 907 286 932 and 222 respectively the mc nemar and kappa test showed p value of 0774 and 0119 respectively conclusion the combination of fever maculopapular rash and hyperpigmented rash can be used a a screening tool regarding measles infection in an outbreak setting which can then be confirmed by antimeasles ig m cough coryza and kopliks spot can be added to this combination albeit with a slight reduction of sensitivity value

processed_title: serological survey for sv5 measles and herpes simplex infection in newlyimported cynomolgus monkey
processed_abstract: on 592 cynomolgus monkey of newlyimported 14 different group seroepidemiological followup survey of natural infection with sv5 measles mv and herpes simplex hsv were conducted both at the time of arrival and at the end of the 9week quarantine period at tsukuba primate center for medical science tpc at the time of arrival the positive rate of antibody against these virus greatly varied with different country of origin a regard sv5 the positive rate ranged widely from 0 to 949 among different importgroups being markedly low in the philippine monkey group the positive rate of mv antibody wa generally very high varying from 111 to 782 in almost all importgroups except two group from indonesia in which no positive case wa detected concerning hsv every importgroup had a very high positive rate though the average antibody titer wa not so high generally the positive rate of sv5 and mv markedly increased by the end of quarantine period especially mv positive rate reached 100 in almost all of the importgroups however two indonesian group showed no increase of sv5 and mv positive rate during the quarantine period no increase of sv5 positive rate wa detected either with any of three philippine group a for hsv the positive rate remained unchanged or rather decreased during the quarantine period in almost all group except two indonesian group having shown a significant increase

processed_title: measles outbreak associated with international travel indiana 2011
processed_abstract: background endemic measles wa declared eliminated in the united state in 2000 but imported measles case continue to cause outbreak on june 20 2011 5 epidemiologically linked measles case were reported to the indiana state department of health we investigated to identify additional case and to prevent further spread method case finding and contact investigation during the june 3 2011august 13 2011 outbreak identified measles case exposed person and exposure setting laboratory confirmation included measles serology and reversetranscription polymerase chain reaction control measure included evaluating measles immune status and providing postexposure prophylaxis isolation and quarantine result fourteen confirmed measles illness were identified 10 71 female median age 115 year range 15 months27 year the source patient wa an unvaccinated u resident who recently traveled from indonesia twelve patient were unvaccinated member of the source patient extended family two hospitalization and no death were reported among 868 exposed person identified through contact investigation 644 74 had documented measles immunity 153 18 were lost to followup and 71 8 lacked evidence of immunity conclusion misdiagnosis of measles in an unvaccinated patient with recent travel history to a measlesendemic region resulted in the second largest measles outbreak in the united state during 2011 clinician should consider measles among patient presenting with febrile rash illness and history of recent travel and clinician should promptly report suspected illness early identification of infectious patient rapid public health investigation and maintenance of high vaccine coverage are critical for the prevention and control of measles outbreak

processed_title: the global burden of measles in the year 2000a model that us countryspecific indicator
processed_abstract: the estimation of the global burden of measles is challenging in the absence of reliable and comparable surveillance system worldwide a static model is described that enables estimation of measles morbidity mortality and disability for the year 2000 on the basis of countryspecific information ie demographic profile vaccine coverage and estimate of casefatality ratio this approach estimated a global incidence of 399 million measles case 777000 death and 28 million disabilityadjusted life year the world health organization region of africa and southeast asia had 70 of incident case and 84 of measlesrelated death 11 country alone afghanistan burkina faso democratic republic of the congo ethiopia india indonesia niger nigeria pakistan somalia uganda account for 66 of death this approach quantifies the measles burden by considering countryspecific indicator which can be updated permitting an assessment of country regional and global change in the burden associated with measles infection

processed_title: bronchopneumonia with measles in infant and child at the department of child health school of medicine university of north sumateradr pirngadi hospital medan january 1985december 1989
processed_abstract: a retrospective study wa done on patient with bronchopneumonia hospitalized at the dr pirngadi hospital medanschool of medicine university of north sumatera during january 1985 through december 1989 the purpose of this study is to assess the morbidity and mortality of bronchopneumonia with measles and the nutritional status of the patient out of the 14082 patient admitted 1310 child suffered from bronchopneumonia 107 ninetynine of them were also with measles 76 most of the patient with bronchopneumonia without measles were in the age group 01 year 587 the mortality wa 248 and the highest mortality rate wa in the age group of 45 year 346 most of the patient with bronchopneumonia and measles were in the age group of 12 year 303 the mortality rate of bronchopneumonia with measles wa 222 and the highest mortality rate wa in the age group of 34 year 357 bronchopneumonia with or without measles occurred more in malnourished patient rather than in wellnourished case all of the patient who had bronchopneumonia with measles in the present study had never been immunized against measles

processed_title: novel measles virus genotype east timor and australia
processed_abstract: measles outbreak in 1999 in queensland and victoria australia were caused by a novel strain of clade g virus proposed name g3 epidemiologic and molecular evidence support independent circulation of this virus in queensland northern australia in addition to importation of the virus by east timor refugee seeking safe haven in australia

processed_title: evaluation of the safety immunogenicity and faecal shedding of novel oral polio vaccine type 2 in healthy newborn infant in bangladesh a randomised controlled phase 2 clinical trial
processed_abstract: background type 2 circulating vaccinederived poliovirus cvdpv2 from sabin oral poliovirus vaccine opv are the leading cause of poliomyelitis a novel type 2 opv nopv2 ha been developed to be more genetically stable with similar tolerability and immunogenicity to that of sabin type 2 vaccine to mitigate the risk of cvdpv2 we aimed to assess these aspect of nopv2 in poliovirus vaccinenaive newborn infant method in this randomised doubleblind controlled phase 2 trial we enrolled newborn infant at the matlab health research centre chandpur bangladesh we included infant who were healthy and were a single birth after at least 37 week gestation infant were randomly assigned 21 to receive either two dos of nopv2 or placebo administered at age 03 day and at 4 week exclusion criterion included receipt of rotavirus or any other poliovirus vaccine any infection or illness at the time of enrolment vomiting diarrhoea or intolerance to liquid diagnosis or suspicion of any immunodeficiency disorder in the infant or a close family member or any contraindication for venipuncture the primary safety outcome wa safety and tolerability after one and two dos of nopv2 given 4 week apart in poliovirus vaccinenaive newborn infant and the primary immunogenicity outcome wa the seroconversion rate for neutralising antibody against type 2 poliovirus measured 28 day after the first and second vaccination with nopv2 study staff recorded solicited and unsolicited adverse event after each dose during daily home visit for 7 day poliovirus neutralising antibody response were measured in serum drawn at birth and at age 4 week and 8 week this study is registered on clinicaltrialsgov nct04693286 finding between sept 21 2020 and aug 16 2021 we screened 334 newborn infant of whom three 1 were found to be ineligible and one 1 wa withdrawn by the parent the remaining 330 99 infant were assigned to receive nopv2 n220 67 or placebo n110 33 nopv2 wa well tolerated 154 70 of 220 newborn infant in the nopv2 group and 78 71 of 110 in the placebo group had solicited adverse event which were all mild or moderate in severity severe unsolicited adverse event in 11 5 vaccine recipient and five 5 placebo recipient were considered unrelated to vaccination 306 93 of 330 infant had seroprotective maternal antibody against type 2 poliovirus at birth decreasing to 58 56 of 104 in the placebo group at 8 week in the nopv2 group 196 90 of 217 infant seroconverted by week 8 after two dos when 214 99 had seroprotective antibody interpretation nopv2 wa well tolerated and immunogenic in newborn infant with two dos at birth and 4 week resulting in almost 99 of infant having protective neutralising antibody funding bill melinda gate foundation

processed_title: the inception achievement and implication of the china gavi alliance project on hepatitis b immunization
processed_abstract: the china gavi hepatitis b immunization project wa initiated in 2002 with the signing of a memorandum of understanding between gavi and the government of china the project wa one of the three china india and indonesia gaviinitiated special project done to support country too large to receive full gavi support for hepatitis b vaccine and safe injection the project in china wa designed by the chinese government and partner to deliver free hepatitis b vaccine and safe injection to all newborn in the 12 western province and poverty county in 10 province of central china 1301 county with approximately 56 million birth per year eliminating the gap in immunization coverage between wealthier and poorer region of china the project budget usd 76 million wa equally shared by gavi and the chinese government initially planned for 5 year two no cost extension extended the project to 2011 although china produced hepatitis b vaccine before the project the vaccine wa sold to parent who were also charged a user fee for the syringe and vaccine administration basic expanded program on immunization epi vaccine such a bcg dtp polio and measles vaccine were provided free to parent although they were charged a user fee vaccine were sold by china cdc office at provincial prefecture county level and township hospital and village doctor received a substantial portion of their income from the sale of hepatitis b and other vaccine the result of charging for hepatitis b vaccine wa that coverage wa relatively high in eastern and wealthier county in central china 8090 but wa much lower 40 in western china and poverty county where parent could not afford the vaccine the project wa administered by the china moh and china cdc epi program and two project comanagers one from the chinese government and the other an international assignee were chosen the project had an oversight operational advisory group composed of the chinese government who unicef and gavi the initial target of the project a delineated in the initial mou for the project area hepb3 coverage will reach 85 at the county level 75 of newborn at the county level will receive the first dose of hepatitis b within 24h of birth and all immunization injection will be with auto disable ad syrinx were substantially exceeded the differential in vaccine coverage between wealthier and poorer part of china wa eliminated contributing to a great improvement in equity with additional contribution of the chinese government the project wa accomplished substantially under budget allowing for additional catch up immunization of child under 15 year of age more than 5 million health worker were trained in how to deliver hepatitis b vaccine timely birth dose tbd and safe injection and public awareness of hepatitis b and it prevention rose significantly tbd coverage wa expedited by concurrent effort to have woman deliver in township clinic and district hospital instead of at home the effective management of the project with a project office sitting within the china epi and an operational advisory group for oversight could serve a a model for other gavi project worldwide most importantly the carrier rate in chinese child less than 5 year of age ha fallen to 1 from a level of 10 before the inception of the project liver cancer one of the major cancer killer in china 250000300000 annual estimated death will dramatically decline a immunized cohort of chinese child age while hepatitis c and nonalcoholic liver disease also exist in china and can lead to liver cancer and cirrhosis the majority of liver disease in china is hepatitis b related and therefore preventable the author believe that china success in preventing hepatitis b is one of the greatest public health achievement of the 21st century work remains to be done in several key area there are still pocket of home birth in rural province where a tbd is difficult to deliver and china is strengthening it policy of screening pregnant woman for hbsag and delivering hbig plus vaccine to newborn of hbv carrier mother approximately 10 of the adult population of china remain chronic carrier of hepatitis b virus and can not be helped by the vaccine so prevention of liver cancer and cirrhosis in those group remains a future challenge for china

processed_title: oligoclonal band a laboratory diagnosis of subacute sclerosing panencephalitis sspe
processed_abstract: the oligoclonal band indicates presence of antibody specific to the disease possibly due to the activation of certain clone of b lymphocyte this intrathecal immunoglobin synthesis can be persistent for month to year for example in respons to paramyxovirus herpes virus coxsackievirus and treponema pallidum or can be synthesized for life for example in multiple sclerosis and subacute sclerosing panencephalitis sspe we report a case of sspe in a 15yearold male patient the patient had myoclonic jerk that occurred in the thoracal femoral region necessary laboratory test identified reactive antimeasles igg which indicates a previous measles infection or exposure to vaccination this report describes the usefulness of the oligoclonal band in the diagnosis of the neurodegenerative disease sspe that is progressive and fatal to the central nervous system due to persistent measles virus infection in the gray and white matter

processed_title: prevalence of measles antibody among migrant worker in singapore a serological study to identify susceptible population subgroup
processed_abstract: background in 2019 two cluster of measles case were reported in migrant worker dormitory in singapore we conducted a seroprevalence study to measure the level of susceptibility to measles among migrant worker in singapore method our study involved residual serum of migrant worker from seven asian country bangladesh china india indonesia malaysia myanmar and the philippine who had participated in a survey between 2016 and 2019 immunoglobulin g igg antibody level were first measured using a commercial enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa test kit those with equivocal or negative igg result were further evaluated using plaque reduction neutralization test prnt result a total of 2234 migrant worker aged 2049 year were included in the study the overall prevalence of measles igg antibody among migrant worker from the seven asian country wa 905 95 confidence interval 892916 the countryspecific seroprevalence ranged from 803 to 940 the seroprevalence wa significantly higher among migrant worker born in 19651989 than those born in 19901999 953 v 866 p 00005 whereas there wa no significant difference by gender 908 in men v 899 in woman p 0508 195 out of 213 sample with equivocal or negative elisa result were tested positive using prnt conclusion the igg seroprevalence in migrant worker wa below the herd immunity threshold of 95 for measles sporadic outbreak may occur in susceptible individual due to high transmissibility of measles virus seroprevalence survey can help identify susceptible subgroup for vaccination

processed_title: improved growth of toddler fed a milk containing synbiotics
processed_abstract: bifidobacterium longum bl999 lactobacillus rhamonosus lpr prebiotics inulin and fructooligosaccharides and longchain polyunsaturated fatty acid lcpufa are believed to have health benefit in a randomized doubleblind controlled trial we compared growth and development of toddler fed milk containing synbiotics bl999 lpr and prebiotics and lcpufa or a control milk three hundred and ninety three healthy 12 monthold toddler were fed approximately 400 mlday for 12 month anthropometric measurement were taken at 12 14 and 16 month toddler response to measles and hepatitis a vaccine wa measured at 16 month and bayley scale for motor cognitive and behavioral function made at 24 month the primary outcome wa weight gain between 12 and 16 month secondary outcome were gain in length head circumference and body mass index gastrointestinal tolerance stool characteristic stool bacterial count safety antivaccine igg and neurodevelopment weight gain wa greater in the synbiotics group meansd 757413 gday compared with the control group 664408 gday the difference of 093 gday with a 95 confidence interval of 012 to 175 is significant p0025 the gain in the synbiotics group resulted in a change in zscore weightforage closer to who child growth standard there wa a significant increase in lactobacillus and enterococci count between 12 month and 16 month in the synbiotic group we conclude that in healthy toddler milk containing synbiotics and lcpufa provides better growth and promotes favorable gut colonization a shown by higher lactobacillus count

processed_title: immunoinformatics identification of the conserved and crossreactive tcell epitope of sarscov2 with human common cold coronaviruses sarscov merscov and live attenuated vaccine presented by hla allele of indonesian population
processed_abstract: report on tcell crossreactivity against sarscov2 epitope in unexposed individual have been linked with prior exposure to the human common cold coronaviruses hcccs several study suggested that crossreactive tcells response to live attenuated vaccine lav such a bcg bacillus calmetteguerin opv oral polio vaccine and mmr measles mumps and rubella can limit the development and severity of covid19 this study aim to identify potential crossreactivity between sarscov2 hcccs and lav in the context of tcell epitope peptide presented by hla human leukocyte antigen allele of the indonesian population sarscov2 derived tcell epitope were predicted using immunoinformatics tool and assessed for their conservancy variability and population coverage two fully conserved epitope with 100 similarity and nine heterologous epitope with identical tcell receptor tcr contact residue were identified from the orf1ab fragment of sarscov2 and all hcccs crossreactive epitope from various protein of sarscov2 and lav were also identified 15 epitope from bcg 7 epitope from mmr but none from opv a majority of the identified epitope were observed to belong to orf1ab further suggesting the vital role of orf1ab in the coronaviruses family and suggesting it a a candidate for a potential universal coronavirus vaccine that protects against severe disease by inducing cell mediated immunity

processed_title: effect of vitamin a supplementation on measles vaccination in ninemonthold infant
processed_abstract: objective childhood immunization program have been suggested a an infrastructure to deliver vitamin a supplement to child in developing country the effect of giving vitamin a a potent immune enhancer with measles immunization to ninemonthold infant is unknown method a randomized doublemasked placebocontrolled clinical trial of vitamin a 100000 iu at the time of standard titer schwarz measles immunization wa conducted with ninemonthold infant in bogor district west java indonesia antibody titer to measles were measured at baseline and one and six month following immunization result 394 infant received measles immunization and 37 infant 94 had baseline antibody titer 1120 which is consistent with previous natural measles infection of the remaining infant 988 seroconverted to measles and 993 had titer consistent with protection against measles six month postimmunization seroconversion rate were similar in vitamin a and placebo treatment group conclusion high dose vitamin a supplementation can be given without reducing seroconversion to standard titer schwatz measles immunization in ninemonthold infant

processed_title: informing rubella vaccination strategy in east java indonesia through transmission modelling
processed_abstract: an estimated 110000 baby are born with congenital rubella syndrome cr worldwide annually a significant proportion of case occur in southeast asia rubella vaccine program have led to successful control of rubella and cr and even the elimination of disease in many country however if vaccination is poorly implemented it might increase the number of woman reaching childbearing age who remain susceptible to rubella and thereby paradoxically increase cr we used an agestructured transmission model to compare seven alternative vaccine strategy for their impact on reducing cr disease burden in east java a setting which is yet to implement a rubella vaccine program we also investigated the robustness of model prediction to variation in vaccine coverage and other key epidemiological factor without rubella vaccination approximately 700 baby are estimated to be born with cr in east java every year at an incidence of 077 per 1000live birth this incidence could be reduced to 00045 per 1000 live birth associated with 999 annual reduction in rubella infection after 20 year if the existing two dos of measles vaccine are substituted with two dos of measles plus rubella combination vaccine with the same coverage 878 of 9monthold infant and 80 of 6yearold child by comparison a single dose of rubella vaccine will take longer to reduce the burden of rubella and cr and will be less robust to lower vaccine coverage while the finding of this study should be informative for setting similar to east java the conclusion are dependent on vaccine coverage which would need consideration before applying to all of indonesia and elsewhere in asia

processed_title: forecasting highpriority infectious disease surveillance region a socioeconomic model
processed_abstract: background few researcher have assessed the relationship between socioeconomic inequality and infectious disease outbreak at the population level globally we use a socioeconomic model to forecast national annual rate of infectious disease outbreak method we constructed a multivariate mixedeffects poisson model of the number of time a given country wa the origin of an outbreak in a given year the dataset included 389 outbreak of international concern reported in the world health organization disease outbreak news from 1996 to 2008 the initial full model included 9 socioeconomic variable related to education poverty population health urbanization health infrastructure gender equality communication transportation and democracy and 1 composite index population latitude and elevation were included a potential confounders the initial model wa pared down to a final model by a backwards elimination procedure the dependent and independent variable were lagged by 2 year to allow for forecasting future rate result among the socioeconomic variable tested the final model included child measles immunization rate and telephone line density the democratic republic of congo china and brazil were predicted to be at the highest risk for outbreak in 2010 and colombia and indonesia were predicted to have the highest percentage of increase in their risk compared to their average over 19962008 conclusion understanding socioeconomic factor could help improve the understanding of outbreak risk the inclusion of the measles immunization variable suggests that there is a fundamental basis in ensuring adequate public health capacity increased vigilance and expanding public health capacity should be prioritized in the projected highrisk region

processed_title: reduced seroconversion to measles in infant given vitamin a with measles vaccination
processed_abstract: administration of 100000 iu vitamin a at the time of measles immunisation is currently recommended for infant in developing country however the safety and value of giving vitamin a a potent immune enhancer with live measles virus vaccine are unknown we conducted a randomised doubleblind placebocontrolled clinical trial in indonesia to evaluate the effect of simultaneous vitamin a supplementation on the immune response to measles immunisation at six month of age 336 infant received either vitamin a 100000 iu or placebo when immunised with standardtitre schwarz measles vaccine 82 of infant seroconverted to measles in a multiple logistic regression model adjusting for maternal antibody titre vitamin a supplementation wa associated with a lower likelihood of seroconversion to measles odds ratio 040 95 ci 019088 and girl were less likely to seroconvert than boy 034 015076 immunisation with standardtitre schwarz vaccine at six month of age in this study population is characterised by high seroconversion rate however simultaneous highdose vitamin a may interfere with seroconversion to live measles vaccine in infant with maternal antibody

processed_title: detection of antibody to selected human pathogen among wild and pet macaque macaca tonkeana in sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: humantoprimate disease transmission can potentially cause significant morbidity and mortality among wild primate population and thus constitutes an important conservation issue our crosssectional study examines serological evidence of exposure to human pathogen among wild and pet macaque in sulawesi serum sample taken from 11 pet and 15 wild macaque macaca tonkeana were analyzed for antibody to a panel of virus commonly encountered in human population antibody to measles influenza a and parainfluenza 1 were detected in serum of both pet and wild macaque antibody to parainfluenza 2 and 3 were found in the serum of wild macaque only possible route of exposure a well a implication for conservation are discussed

processed_title: urbanrural difference in factor associated with incomplete basic immunization among child in indonesia a nationwide multilevel study
processed_abstract: background identifying risk factor of incomplete immunization among child is crucial to developing relevant policy to improve immunization coverage in this study we investigated factor associated with incomplete immunization among child in indonesia and elucidated difference in risk factor between urban and rural area method the data came from a nationalwide survey the 2017 indonesia demographic health survey in total 3264 child aged 1223 month were included in the study an incomplete immunization status wa defined a a child who did not complete the ten dos of basic vaccination consisting of one dose of bacille calmetteguerin one dose of hepatitis b three dos of pentavalent vaccine diphtheria pertussis tetanus hemophilus influenza type b and hepatitis b vaccine four dos of polio vaccine and one dose of measles vaccine generalized linear mixed model were constructed to examine the effect of different level of risk factor on the incomplete immunization status we further conducted stratified analysis by urban and rural area result about 40 of the 3264 child were incompletely immunized among whom 453 were in urban area and 547 were in rural area eight of the 34 province had incomplete immunization rate exceeding 50 and the papua and maluku region had the highest rate of incomplete child immunization the multivariate analysis showed that when woman attended fewer than four antenatal care session and resided outside the nusa tenggara region their child were more likely to have incomplete immunization in both urban and rural area on the other hand having no health insurance wa positively associated with incomplete immunization in urban area whereas having received a tetanus vaccination during pregnancy wa negatively associated with incomplete immunization in rural area conclusion result of this study suggest that tailored intervention should be developed to address significant risk factor in rural and urban area

processed_title: analysis of risk factor for pneumonia in child less than five year in makassar
processed_abstract: background pneumonia is one of the main cause of mortality in child less than five year worldwide and in makassar city the aim of this study wa to investigate the risk factor for pneumonia in child less than five year in makassar city material and method a casecontrol study design wa used in this research a total of 210 child with consent from the parent were included in this study which consisted of 70 childrens case and the data of the control group were taken by the random sampling method all related data such a immunization record nutritional status birth body weight vitamin a intake in the last sixmonth record and parent education occupation and monthly income were registered a independent and control variable data analysis wa performed by the chisquare and logistic regression model with a p value of 0005 and odds ratio or with a 95 confidence interval ci result incomplete diphtheriapertussistetanushepatitis b and haemophilus influenzae type b dpthbhib immunization at the age of 2 month 3 month and 4 month which had adjusted or aor 9680 p 0001 and malnutrition condition weight for age aor 5486 p 0005 were associated with the incidence of pneumonia in child less than five year whereas incomplete measlesrubella p 0770 low birth weight history p 0403 lack of vitamin a intake p 0720 parent education p 0163 and presence of smoker inside the household p were not associated with the incidence of pneumonia in child less than five year p 0005 in makassar city conclusion incomplete dpthbhib immunization for three dos at the age of 2 month 3 month and 4 month and malnutrition were associated with pneumonia and the highest risk factor for developing pneumonia in child less than five year in makassar city indonesia

processed_title: integration of vitamin a supplementation with the expanded programme on immunization lack of impact on morbidity or infant growth
processed_abstract: vitamin a deficiency is associated with increased morbidity and mortality from diarrheal disease measles and malaria it ha been proposed that vitamin a supplementation could be linked with childhood immunization program to improve child health we conducted a randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled clinical trial to evaluate the impact of linking vitamin a supplementation with the expanded programme on immunization on morbidity and child growth in west java indonesia 467 sixweekold infant were randomized to receive 75 mg retinol equivalent re 15 mg re or placebo with childhood immunization contact at 6 10 and 14 wks and 9 mo of age child growth wa assessed through anthropometry and morbidity history were obtained vitamin a supplementation had no apparent impact upon linear or ponderal growth or infectious disease morbidity in the first 15 mo of age when integrated with the expanded programme on immunization conclusion although improving vitamin a nutriture is of general importance in reducing diarrheal and measles morbidity and mortality in developing country this clinical trial showed no apparent benefit of vitamin a capsule for infant health when given through childhood immunization program

processed_title: using an electronic immunization registry aplikasi sehat indonesiaku in indonesia crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background electronic immunization registry eirs are being increasingly used in low and middleincome country in 2022 indonesia ministry of health introduced it first eir named aplikasi sehat indonesiaku asik a part of a comprehensive nationwide immunization program this marked a conversion from traditional paperbased immunization report to digital routine record encompassing a network of 10000 primary health center puskesmas objective this paper provides an overview of the use of asik a the first eir in indonesia it describes the coverage of the nationwide immunization program bulan imunisasi anak nasional using asik data and assesses the implementation challenge associated with the adoption of the eir in the context of indonesia method data were collected from primary care health worker submitted report using asik the data were reported in real time analyzed and presented using a structured dashboard data on asik use were collected from the asik website a quantitative assessment wa conducted through a crosssectional survey between september 2022 and october 2022 a set of questionnaire wa used to collect feedback from asik user result a total of 935 970810382 of public health center 935 64786928 of subdistricts and 975 501514 of district and city in 34 province reported immunization data using asik with 21 million data point recorded the national coverage for immunization campaign for measlesrubella oral polio vaccine inactivated polio vaccine and diphtheria pertussis tetanus hepatitis b and haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine were 501 1830105736497694 362 9386232595240 307 12766684158289 and 402 13711043407900 respectively the quantitative survey showed that generally user had a good understanding of asik a the eir 650809 803 617 489793 of the user expressed that the user interface and user experience were overall good but could still be improved 54 422781 of user expressed that the asik variable fit their need yet could be improved further and 591 463784 of user observed sporadic system interference challenge faced during the implementation of asik included a heavy workload burden for health worker inadequate access to the internet at some place system integration and readiness and dual reporting using the paperbased format conclusion the eir is beneficial and helpful for monitoring vaccination coverage implementation and adoption of asik a indonesia first eir still face challenge related to human resource and digital infrastructure a the country transition from paperbased report to electronic or digital immunization report continuous improvement collaboration and monitoring effort are crucial to encourage the use of the eir in indonesia

processed_title: measles immunization acceptance in southeast asia past pattern and future challenge
processed_abstract: despite substantial increase in immunization rate measles remains a major health problem in developing country of southeast asia the author of this paper undertook separate investigation which examined factor influencing measles immunization acceptance in the rural philippine central java indonesia and an impoverished neighborhood in bangkok thailand we briefly summarize the finding of our three field investigation before presenting a synthesizing analysis of the psychosocial and demographic factor which affect measles immunization we then review trend influencing measles acceptance in industrialized country to anticipate possible future challenge to measles immunization acceptance in southeast asia in an era of increasing globalization and information transfer we suggest that parental perception of the risk and benefit of immunization philosophical and religious conviction and state and social regulatory policy will profoundly influence measles immunization in the new millennium

processed_title: adolescent use of maternal and child health service in developing country
processed_abstract: context because of high level of early childbearing in developing country pregnancy and childbirth are the leading cause of death among woman aged 1519 use of skilled antenatal and delivery care improves maternal outcome through the prevention management and treatment of obstetric complication and infant immunization prevent many childhood disease method logistic regression analysis of demographic and health survey data for 15 developing country examined adolescent use of antenatal care delivery care and infant immunization service compared with use by older woman result in general the use of maternal and child health care did not vary by mother age in five of the 15 country woman aged 18 or younger were less likely than woman aged 1923 to use either antenatal care or delivery care or both odds ratio 0509 younger mother in six country were less likely than older mother to have their infant immunized particularly for diphtheria pertussis and tetanus and for measles 0508 the association of age and health care use wa largely limited to bangladesh india indonesia nicaragua peru and uganda in latin america controlling for parity allowed difference between adolescent and older woman to emerge except in uganda there were no difference in health care use by mother age in the african country conclusion countryspecific investigation are needed in asia to better understand the reason for difference in service use by age in general further systematic evidence would help identify longterm intervention that will be most effective in increasing adolescent use of maternal and child health service

processed_title: megadose methylprednisolone for immune thrombocytopenia in an infant positive for sarscov2 a case report
processed_abstract: background immune thrombocytopenia itp is rare in infant under 1 year old bleeding often occurs when the platelet count is 20 000ul the disease can progress because of accompanying covid19 disease case report a 9monthold boy weighing 85 kg came to the hospital with petechia on the forehead cheek mouth and extremity the patient had rhinorrhea for 3 day previously and wa febrile pale weak and could not drink he had the measlesrubella vaccination 19 day prior physical examination showed no abnormality of the eye ear nose throat and mouth heart and lung were within normal limit with no organomegaly lymphadenopathy or congenital anomaly of the abdomen laboratory examination showed hemoglobin 127 gdl leukocyte 7420ul platelet count 16 000ul and hematocrit 379 erythrocyte sedimentation rate wa 14 mm at 1 h and 21 mm at 2 h peripheral blood smear showed normal rbc morphology normal leukocyte and few platelet igg wa reactive and igm wa nonreactive on rapid antibody test rtpcr wa positive for sarscov2 chestxray showed pneumonia the diagnosis wa newly diagnosed itp with covid19 patient wa treated with 30 mgkg body weightday of iv methylprednisolone for 3 day 250 mg then 20 mgkg body weightday 175 mg orally for 4 day in 3 divided dos azithromycin 100 mgday zinc 20 mgday and vitamin c 50 mgday orally were also given conclusion covid19 screening is highly recommended during this pandemic to identify it a a potential cause of childhood itp megadose methylprednisolone had an excellent response in alleviating itp with confirmed covid19 in an infant

processed_title: costeffectiveness of an immunization programme in indonisia
processed_abstract: the economic analysis reported below based on hypothetical estimate of the programme impact indicates that an expanded programme of immunization for diphtheria pertussis tetanus and tuberculosis can be expected to be highly costeffective in comparison with treatment sensitivity test illustrate that this conclusion remains valid even when cost are increased by 20 and benefit reduced by 50 a separate analysis wa made of the dpttetanus toxoid and bcg component of the programme the analysis revealed that although the bcg programme may not be justifiable when operated independently it inclusion in a joint immunization programme is strongly justifiable on economic ground assuming a vaccine efficacy of 05 this result confirms one of the basic argument advanced for the who programme of expanded immunization and illustrates that other immunization such a for poliomyelitis and measles which may not be costefficient by themselves may be economically justifiable when included a part of a larger immunization programme

processed_title: doe complete basic immunization correlate with pneumonia incident in child under five year in depok indonesia
processed_abstract: pneumonia is the first globally infectious disease causing death in child under five year of age in which the discovery of case ha increased in indonesia in recent year immunization is a major preventive effort against the disease and is administered through the dpt hib measles pcv and rotavirus vaccine the aim of this study wa to understand the correlation between complete basic immunization administration parental characteristic and the characteristic of child under five year with the incidence of pneumonia among child in this age group in depok indonesia the study used a crosssectional design there were 104 sample chosen by consecutive sampling the study wa conducted at the public health center in depok between april and june of 2018 the data collection used questionnaire parental characteristic characteristic of child under five year and complete basic immunization data for the child which wa arranged by the researcher the questionnaire wa tested for validity and reliability the result of the study showed that complete basic immunization p 0000 alpha 005 age p 0002 alpha 005 and nutritional status p 0043 alpha 005 had a significant correlation with the incidence of pneumonia in child under five year health education about the importance of complete basic immunization and balanced nutrition need to be given to parent who have underfive year of age

processed_title: the oncogenic human papillomavirus involvement a a risk factor of measles mumps and rubella vaccine immunotherapy failure in anogenital wart
processed_abstract: anogenital wart agw including multiple type of human papillomavirus hpv are prevalent in this context oncogenic hpv infection lead to anogenital cancer and the lesion is more persistent several research on agw therapy with measles mumps and rubella mmr vaccine injection have been successful without adverse effect however the effect of mmr immunotherapy for agw on multiple hpv infection have not been reported this research is a case report of agw in a 17yearold male treated with mmr the inclusion criterion specified young age indicative of a strong immunological status meanwhile the exclusion criterion comprised immunocompromised condition such a hiv confirmed to be negative dermatological examination showed that the pubic region and penile shaft presented 51 verrucous papule for 6 month with histopathological result supporting the diagnosis of agw polymerase chain reaction pcr examination reported the inclusion of hpv type 6 11 and 16 the subcutaneous mmr vaccine wa injected into the deltoid area every 2 week for three session meanwhile the treatment response wa assessed by counting the number and measuring the size of the lesion after three session of mmr immunotherapy there wa no improvement in the size or quantity of lesion based on previous report a higher clearance rate for mmr immunotherapy wa found in wart with a duration of 6 month while oncogenic hpv genotype particularly hpv type 16 take longer to clear than others the efficacy of subcutaneous mmr injection for agw treatment wa unfavorable due to oncogenic hpv type agw treated with mmr immunotherapy should investigate oncogenic hpv genotype however further research need to be carried out to justify this conclusion due to the limitation

processed_title: a comparative analysis of avoidable cause of childhood blindness in malaysia with low income middle income and high income country
processed_abstract: to determine the avoidable cause of childhood blindness in malaysia and to compare this to other middle income country low income country and high income country data were obtained from a school of the blind study by patel et al and analysed for avoidable cause of childhood blindness six other study with previously published data on childhood blindness in bangladesh ethiopia nigeria indonesia china and the united kingdom were reviewed for avoidable cause comparison of data and limitation of the study are described prevalence of avoidable cause of childhood blindness in malaysia is 505 of all the case of childhood blindness whilst in the poor income country such a bangladesh ethiopia nigeria and indonesia the prevalence wa in excess of 60 china had a low prevalence but this is largely due to the fact that most school were urban and thus did not represent the situation of the country high income country had the lowest prevalence of avoidable childhood blindness in middle income country such a malaysia cataract and retinopathy of prematurity are the main cause of avoidable childhood blindness low income country continue to struggle with infection such a measles and nutritional deficiency such a vitamin a both of which are the main contributor to childhood blindness in high income country such a the united kingdom these problem are almost nonexistent

processed_title: genetic analysis of asian measles virus strainsnew endemic genotype in nepal
processed_abstract: in many part of asia measles virus mv continues to be endemic however little is known about the genetic characteristic of virus circulating on this continent this study report the molecular epidemiological analysis based on the entire nucleocapsid n and hemagglutinin h gene of the first isolates from nepal and taiwan a well a of recent mv strain from india indonesia and china four isolates collected in various region in nepal during 1999 belonged to a new genotype tentatively called d8 another nepalese isolate and one from india belonged to genotype d4 the diversity of the nepalese strain indicated that measles continues to be endemic in this country the isolate from taiwan grouped with d3 virus and one chinese strain isolated in the netherlands wa assigned to the previously described clade h known to be endemic in mainland china molecular characterization emerges a an important tool for monitoring virus endemicity and vaccination effort

processed_title: better vaccine for healthier life part i conference report of the dcvmn international 14th annual general meeting hanoi vietnam
processed_abstract: the developing country vaccine manufacturer network dcvmn brought together nearly 220 senior representative of governmental and nongovernmental global health organization a well a corporate executive of emerging vaccine manufacturer from 26 country for a twoday tailored lecture qa session ceo panel discussion and networking opportunity followed by a vaccinetechnology symposium and visit to manufacturing facility in hanoi vietnam participant included representative of 38 vaccine manufacturer a well a international partner and collaborating research institution with 39 female participant the viceminister of health to vietnam commended the speaker and participant to this annual general meeting devoted to achieve our common goal of protecting people against infectious disease with better vaccine for a healthier life he reminded the audience that the first vaccine produced in vietnam wa oral polio vaccine opv in the early 1960s and contributed to polio eradication in vietnam in 2000 through it manufacturing resource vietnam eliminated neonatal tetanus in 2005 and ha controlled measles and hepatitis b spread the ministry of health hope that by sharing experience delegate at this conference will foster international cooperation and partnership among organization ceo elaborated on challenge and opportunity for emerging country

processed_title: randomised controlled trial of effectiveness of ampicillin in mild acute respiratory infection in indonesian child
processed_abstract: the recommended treatment for mild acute respiratory infection ari in child is supportive care only but many physician especially in developing country continue to prescribe antibiotic treatment because they believe it prevents progression to more severe ari to find out whether ampicillin treatment conferred any benefit over supportive care alone a randomised controlled trial wa carried out among 889 child under 5 year with mild ari in indonesia 447 were randomly allocated ampicillin 2530 mgkg body weight three time daily for 5 day plus supportive care continued breastfeeding clearing of the nose and paracetamol to control fever 442 were allocated supportive care only the treatment group were almost identical after randomisation in term of age sex level of parental education history of measles immunisation and fever after 1 week the percentage cured were nearly identical 204 46 ampicillin 209 47 control a were the percentage of case progressing to moderate ari 56 13 v 53 12 the effect of treatment wa not modified by age sex measles immunisation status or the educational level of the parent at the 2week followup the percentage cured were 62 277 in the ampicillin group and 58 256 in the control group 14 of both group had progressed to moderate ari and 24 107 and 28 123 respectively still had mild ari none of the difference in outcome between the ampicillin and control group wa statistically significant thus ampicillin plus supportive care offer no benefit over supportive care alone for treatment of mild ari in young indonesian child

processed_title: differential diagnosis of dengue fever beware of measles
processed_abstract: febrile exanthema is a common symptom in returning traveler in addition to cosmopolitan disease etiology specific to the visited country must be considered a an accurate diagnosis is important clinical suspicion should be confirmed by laboratory test the case report of three brother returning from indonesia highlight the possibility of misdiagnosis due to the clinical similarity and serological cross reactivity of dengue fever and measles

processed_title: lowcost onthejob peer training of nurse improved immunization coverage in indonesia
processed_abstract: in indonesia responsibility for immunization is placed on local government health centre and on the nurse who provide the immunization at each centre an onthejob peer training programme for these nurse which wa designed to improve the immunization performance of poorly performing health centre in term of coverage and practice in maluku province wa evaluated experienced immunization nurse were sent to health centre where nurse were inexperienced or performing poorly the experienced nurse spent 12 week providing onthejob training for the less experienced one an evaluation of the 13 centre that participated in the programme and the 95 that did not found that the programme increased both immunization coverage and the quality of practice coverage of diphtheriapertussistetanus dpt polio and measles vaccination rose by about 39 in all 13 participating centre when compared with nonparticipating centre and by about 54 in the 11 centre that had a functioning transportation system during the year after training these result reflect increase in the actual number of dos given and improvement in the accuracy of report potential threat to the study validity were examined and found not to be significant the outofpocket cost of the training programme wa about u 53 per trainee or about u 005 per additional vaccine reported to have been given the marginal cost per additional fully immunized child wa estimated to be u 050

processed_title: seroepidemiology study of rubella antibody among pregnant woman from seven asian country evaluation of the rubella vaccination program in taiwan
processed_abstract: during 20032004 approximately 13 of birth in taiwan wa given by foreignborn female the aim of this study were to compare the seroprevalence of rubella antibody between taiwanborn and foreignborn pregnant woman and evaluate the effect of rubella vaccination program in taiwan we reviewed the rubella antibody test result of 5007 woman during routine pregnancy checkup at fooyin university hospital during 19992002 in taiwanborn woman rubella antibody wa undetectable in 292 73 and 83 of the cohort born before 1971 between 1971 and 1976 and after 1976 respectively in the cohort born between 1971 and 1976 and after 1976 pregnant woman born in china vietnam indonesia and philippine had significant higher chance of being susceptible our result suggested that the voluntary adult vaccination program wa not a effective a the school or wipeout program both taiwanese woman born before 1971 and foreignborn woman were more likely to be susceptible to rubella the introduction of catchup immunization program and enforcement of the checking of immunization record andor blood test before pregnancy for these woman are necessary in preventing cr

processed_title: measles in a dutch hospital introduced by an immunocompromised infant from indonesia infected with a new virus genotype
processed_abstract: a fatal measles case in an immunocompromised indonesian child wa associated with nosocomial transmission to health care worker the virus isolated proved to represent a new genotype within clade g

processed_title: clinical evaluation of encephalitis
processed_abstract: a series of 325 or 3111 child out of 1045 inpatient of neurological case diagnosed a encephalitis wa reviewed in pediatrics neurology subdivision child health department medical school university of north sumateradr pirngadi hospital medan since 1985 to 1988 boy were more than girl with the ratio of 43 most encephalitis case 249 or 7680 of child occurred in the early age namely before 3 year associated disease were respiratory disease in 61 4561 case gastrointestinal disease in 48 3467 case and measles in 13 935 case there were three mayor clinical feature of encephalitis ie sudden fever convulsion and consciousness depression the cerebrospinal fluid investigation might be normal there wa however mild to moderate lymphocitic pleiositosis with cell number varying from 20200 per cubic mm the protein content wa slightly elevated the mortality rate wa 2153 70 case there wa no significant difference p greater than 005 found between mortality rate of boy and girl there wa no significant difference p greater than 005 found between mortality rate below and above 3 year of age

processed_title: clinical feature of severe malnutrition at the pediatric ward of dr pirngadi hospital medan
processed_abstract: a retrospective study on severe malnutrition concerning child hospitalized at the pediatric ward of dr pirngadi hospital medan from january 1 to december 31 1988 wa conducted patient less than five year old were included in this study the purpose of this study wa to know the incidence of severe malnutrition it symptom and sign the immunization status feeding pattern and socioeconomic factor out of the 3370 hospitalized patient 2453 7278 were child under five year old of these 312 12 suffered from severe malnutrition it consisted of marasmus 131 419 marasmic kwashiorkor 94 301 and kwashiorkor 87 278 the highest incidence wa found in the age group of 02 year 58 clinical manifestation of marasmus were old man face 131 or 100 muscular hypotrophy 118 or 719 and decreased subcutaneous fat 116 or 711 in marasmic kwashiorkor child 46 or 50 had their hair easily picked out 45 or 463 showed hyperpigmentation and 48 or 52 had pretibial edema in the kwashiorkor group 29 or 63 had moon face 52 or 604 showed crazy pavement dermatosis 77 or 513 had hepatomegaly and 87 or 48 pretebial edema moon face wa seen in 29 63 crazy pavement dermatosis in 52 604 hepatomegaly in 77 513 and pretebial edema in 87 48 of kwashiorkor case the accompanying disease were mostly diarrhea 95 and bronchopneumonia 22 immunization status showed that bcg comprised 506 while dpt iii and opv iii in 137 and 105 respectively and measles only 064 more than half 596 of them were breastfed up to 6 monthsabstract truncated at 250 word

processed_title: miliary tuberculosis in child a clinical review
processed_abstract: eighty case of miliary tuberculosis admitted to our hospital between january 1981 and december 1984 were reviewed the age of the patient ranged from 3 month to 12 year with an average of 2 year 2 month 265 month nine case 1125 died during hospitalization due to the severe condition at the time of admission only 8 patient 10 were in good nutritional condition seventytwo patient 90 had been visiting the primary health care clinic for several time since 23 month but were never diagnosed a suffering from tuberculosis fever or recurrent fever were found in 78 case 975 anorexia in 65 case 813 chronic andor recurrent cough in 72 case 90 and malaise in 43 538 fortyone 513 denied the presence of a close contact with source of infection hepatomegaly wa found in 44 case 55 19 238 of which were associated with splenomegaly choroidal tubercle wa found in 4 case 1 case with coxitis 1 with brain tuberculoma 1 with ascites 1 with endobronchitis and 1 with hepatitis fortythree 538 were tuberculin negative 24 of which become positive after treatment fourteen case had bcg scar history of measles wa found in 21 case child with longterm and recurrent fever anorexia decrease of body weight and recurrent cough should be suspected of having tb thus enabling to get an early diagnosis

processed_title: lombok hepatitis b model immunization project toward universal infant hepatitis b immunization in indonesia
processed_abstract: the lombok hepatitis b hb model immunization project wa the first mass infant hb immunization project in indonesia key aspect were the procurement of lowcost hb vaccine integration into routine infant immunization service and delivery of the first dose in the home within 1 week of birth the project achieved 90 coverage with 3 dos of vaccine the prevalence of hb surface antigen wa 14 in infant who received 3 dos with the first dose within 7 day of birth and 30 in those who received the first dose 7 day after birth compared with a baseline prevalence of 62 p 001 in each case most vaccine failure occurred in child born to hbe antigenpositive mother antibody prevalence and titer did not correlate with protection hb vaccine can be successfully integrated into the expanded programme on immunization epi strengthening the epi and significantly reducing chronic hb infection

processed_title: apasl clinical practice guideline on hepatitis b reactivation related to the use of immunosuppressive therapy
processed_abstract: background aim hepatitis b reactivation related to the use of immunosuppressive therapy remains a major cause of liverrelated morbidity and mortality in hepatitis b endemic asiapacific region this clinical practice guideline aim to assist clinician in all discipline involved in the use of immunosuppressive therapy to effectively prevent and manage hepatitis b reactivation method all publication related to hepatitis b reactivation with the use of immunosuppressive therapy since 1975 were reviewed advice from key opinion leader in member countriesadministrative region of asianpacific association for the study of the liver wa collected and synchronized immunosuppressive therapy wa riskstratified according to it reported rate of hepatitis b reactivation recommendation we recommend the necessity to screen all patient for hepatitis b prior to the initiation of immunosuppressive therapy and to administer preemptive nucleostide analogue to those patient with a substantial risk of hepatitis and acuteonchronic liver failure due to hepatitis b reactivation

processed_title: liver disease in the asiapacific region a lancet gastroenterology hepatology commission
processed_abstract: the asiapacific region is home to more than half of the global population and accounted for 626 of global death due to liver disease in 2015 543 of global death due to cirrhosis 727 of global death due to hepatocellular carcinoma and more than twothirds of the global burden of acute viral hepatitis occurred in this region in 2015 chronic hepatitis b virus hbv infection caused more than half of the death due to cirrhosis in the region followed by alcohol consumption 208 nonalcoholic fatty liver disease nafld 121 and chronic infection with hepatitis c virus hcv 157 in 2015 hbv accounted for about half the case of hepatocellular carcinoma in the region preventive strategy for viral hepatitisrelated liver disease include increasing access to clean drinking water and sanitation hbv vaccination programme for neonate have been implemented by all country although birthdose coverage is extremely suboptimal in some availability of screening test for blood and tissue donor recall policy and harm reduction strategy are in their initial stage in most country many government have put hbv and hcv drug on their essential medicine list and the availability of generic version of these drug ha reduced cost effort to eliminate viral hepatitis a a public health threat together with the rapid increase in percapita alcohol consumption in country and the epidemic of obesity are expected to change the spectrum of liver disease in the asiapacific region in the near future the increasing burden of alcoholrelated liver disease can be contained through government policy to limit consumption and promote less harmful pattern of alcohol use which are in place in some country but need to be enforced more strictly step are needed to control obesity and nafld including policy to promote healthy lifestyle and regulate the food industry inadequate infrastructure and insufficient healthcare personnel trained in liver disease are issue that also need to be addressed in the asiapacific region the policy response of most government to liver disease ha thus far been inadequate and poorly funded there must be a renewed focus on prevention early detection timely referral and research into the best mean to introduce and improve health intervention to reduce the burden of liver disease in the asiapacific region

processed_title: acuteonchronic liver failure aclf the kyoto consensussteps from asia
processed_abstract: acuteonchronic liver failure aclf is a condition associated with high mortality in the absence of liver transplantation there have been various definition proposed worldwide the first consensus report of the working party of the asian pacific association for the study of the liver apasl set in 2004 on aclf wa published in 2009 and the apasl aclf research consortium aarc wa formed in 2012 the aarc database ha prospectively collected nearly 10500 case of aclf from various country in the asiapacific region this database ha been instrumental in developing the aarc score and grade of aclf the concept of the golden therapeutic window the transplant window and plasmapheresis a a treatment modality also the data ha been key to identifying pediatric aclf the european association for the study of liverchronic liver failure easl clif and the north american association for the study of the end stage liver disease nacseld from the west added the concept of organ failure and infection a precipitant for the development of aclf and clifsequential organ failure assessment sofa and nacseld score for prognostication the chinese group on the study of severe hepatitis b cossh added cosshaclf criterion to manage hepatitis b virusaclf with and without cirrhosis the literature support these definition to be equally effective in their respective cohort in identifying patient with high mortality to overcome the difference and to develop a global consensus apasl took the initiative and invited the global stakeholder including opinion leader from asia easl and aasld and other researcher in the field of aclf to identify the key issue and develop an evidencebased consensus document the consensus document wa presented in a hybrid format at the apasl annual meeting in kyoto in march 2024 the kyoto apasl consensus presented below carry the final recommendation along with the relevant background information and area requiring future study

processed_title: epidemiology of hepatitis b and c in republic of indonesia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv infection pose serious problem in term of public health and clinical intervention in a country with approximately 250 million people who live in more than 17000 island effort to combat hbv and hcv have been made through the implementation of universal infant hepatitis b immunization blood screening and other health promotion action and building epidemiological data to develop intervention strategy a nationwide study in 2013 revealed hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag prevalence of 71 which indicates that indonesia ha moved from high to moderate endemicity of hepatitis b leaving the prevalence of 94 in 2007 the occurrence of new hepatitis b case still continue in early childhood period which may root from low coverage of birthdose hepatitis b immunization in remote island and the potential mothertochild transmission of hbv from hbsagpositive pregnant mother other problem still exist including the high hbv infection rate among young adult in remote island the presence of occult hepatitis b a well a the substantial prevalence of hcv infection in general population who do not have access to diagnosis and treatment effective preventive and control strategy are being developed tailored to the local capacity infrastructure socioeconomics and culture a well a geographical aspect of the country how to cite this article muljono dh epidemiology of hepatitis b and c in republic of indonesia euroasian j hepatogastroenterol 2017715559

processed_title: barrier to and facilitator of hepatitis b vaccination among the adult population in indonesia a mixed method study
processed_abstract: to reach the goal of the global hepatitis elimination 2030 program indonesia is now preparing a new regulation for hepatitis b vaccination for adult population this study aimed to determine the factor influencing vaccine uptake for hepatitis b in the adult population and identify barrier to and facilitator of hepatitis b vaccination programme an explanatory sequential mixed method design wa implemented in this study we conducted a survey involving 893 participant in the general population followed by 14 indepth interview with health provider the survey found that only 15 95 confidence interval 1318 of participant received at least one dose of the hepatitis b vaccine factor associated with vaccine uptake were living in yogyakarta compared to living in aceh having secondary and higher education compared to primary education working a a health worker compared to working in other sector and having health insurance that covered hepatitis b vaccination compared to not having such health insurance our qualitative study also identified several barrier to the adult hepatitis b vaccination programme in indonesia such a the high cost of vaccination lack of vaccine availability in certain area limited human resource to implement the hepatitis b vaccination programme and the ineffective dissemination of hepatitis b vaccination this study highlight that accessibility and affordability of vaccination are important determinant of vaccination uptake that should be taken into account when planning vaccination campaign

processed_title: liver disease and hepatocellular carcinoma in the asiapacific region burden trend challenge and future direction
processed_abstract: globally nearly half of death from cirrhosis and chronic liver disease cld and threequarters of death from hepatocellular carcinoma hcc occur in the asiapacific region chronic hepatitis b is responsible for the vast majority of liverrelated death in the region metabolic dysfunctionassociated steatotic liver disease masld is the most common form of cld affecting an estimated 30 of the adult population compared with people of european descent people from the asiapacific region carry more genetic variant associated with masld and it progression alcohol is a fastgrowing cause of cld and hcc in asia a a result of the rising percapita consumption of alcohol druginduced liver injury is underrecognized and probably ha a high prevalence in this region the epidemiological and outcome data of acuteonchronic liver failure are heterogeneous and nonunified definition across region contribute to this heterogeneity clds are severely underdiagnosed and effective treatment and vaccination are underutilized in this review we highlight trend in the burden of cld and hcc in the asiapacific region and discus the rapidly changing aetiology of liver disease we examine the multiple gap in the care cascade and propose mitigating strategy and future direction

processed_title: progress towards elimination of viral hepatitis a lancet gastroenterology hepatology commission update
processed_abstract: the top 20 highest burdened country in disabilityadjusted life year account for more than 75 of the global burden of viral hepatitis an effective response in these 20 country is crucial if global elimination target are to be achieved in this update of the lancet gastroenterology hepatology commission on accelerating the elimination of viral hepatitis we convene national expert from each of the top 20 highest burdened country to provide an update on progress although the global burden of disease is falling progress towards elimination varies greatly by country by use of a hepatitis elimination policy index conceived a part of the 2019 commission we measure country progress towards elimination progress in elimination policy ha been made in 14 of 20 country with the highest burden since 2018 with the most substantial gain observed in bangladesh india indonesia japan and russia most improvement are attributable to the publication of formalised national action plan for the elimination of viral hepatitis provision of publicly funded screening programme and government subsidisation of antiviral treatment key theme that emerged from discussion between national commissioner from the highest burdened country build on the original recommendation to accelerate the global elimination of viral hepatitis these theme include the need for simplified model of care improved access to appropriate diagnostics financing initiative and rapid implementation of lesson from the covid19 pandemic

processed_title: seroprevalence and incidence of hepatitis a in southeast asia a systematic review
processed_abstract: background a previous review on hepatitis a virus hav seroprevalence in 2005 categorized southeast asia a a low hav endemicity region in 2010 the world health organization modified this from low to lowmedium endemicity pointing out that these estimate were based on limited evidence since then there ha been no attempt to review hav epidemiology from this region we conducted a systematic review of literature to collect information on hav incidence and seroprevalence in select country in the southeast asian region specifically the association of southeast asian nation over the last 20 year methodology this systematic review wa conducted according to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses guideline from the relevant article we extracted data and conducted a risk of bias assessment of individual study result the search yielded 22 and 13 publication on hav seroprevalence and incidence respectively overall our finding point to a very low hav endemicity profile in thailand and singapore and evidence of a shift towards low hav endemicity in indonesia lao people democratic republic malaysia the philippine and vietnam only singapore thailand malaysia and the philippine have existing hav disease surveillance and reported incidence rate below 1 per 100000 several outbreak with varying magnitude documented in the region provide insight into the evolving epidemiology of hav in the region risk of bias assessment of study revealed that the individual study were of low to medium risk conclusionssignificance the available hav endemicity profile in southeast asian country aside from thailand are limited and outdated but suggest an endemicity shift in the region that is not fully documented yet these finding highlight the need to update information on hav epidemiology through strengthening of disease surveillance mechanism to confirm the shift in hav endemicity in the region

processed_title: evaluation of process indicator and challenge of the elimination of mothertochild transmission of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b in bali province indonesia 20192022 a mixed method study
processed_abstract: background this study wa conducted to describe the prevalence of and evaluate the process and challenge in implementing the elimination of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b transmission from mother to child in bali province indonesia method the research method used is a descriptive approach using indicator and a set of process by the who quantitative method using descriptive analysis
