and qualitative method using phenomenological paradigm through indepth interview and fgd with healthcare professional involved in the elimination of mothertochild transmission emtct program result the indicator that have successfully met the target for 4 year are antiretroviral therapy art coverage in badung district 95 and anc coverage at least one visit in buleleng district 95 the study found low prevalence rate of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b among pregnant woman in the three district there are some indicator that show improvement from 2019 to 2022 namely syphilis 6044 to 8698 and hepatitis b 2903 to 9535 screening coverage showed improvement with increasing screening rate observed in buleleng district however adequate treatment coverage for pregnant woman with syphilis decreased in denpasar city in 2022 compared to 2019 100 to 7128 despite data on hepatitis b treatment being unavailable hepatitis b vaccination coverage exceeded the who target in all three district the utilization of the information system is not yet optimal and there is a lack of ability to track case furthermore there is insufficient involvement of the private sector particularly in screening and a lack of standardized procedure in the management of referral for pregnant woman with hepatitis b conclusion the prevalence of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b among pregnant woman ha consistently remained below the ministry of health target for four year despite this there are a lot of target and the indicator emtct process ha yet to reach the who target the challenge for each district in reaching the who target include providing syphilis and hepatitis b reagent and benzatine penicillin increasing private sector involvement and strengthening information system policy and guideline for the management of hepatitis b among pregnant woman in line with who recommendation to achieve emtct

processed_title: hepatitis b virus infection in indonesia
processed_abstract: approximately 240 million people are chronically infected with hepatitis b virus hbv 75 of whom reside in asia approximately 600000 of infected patient die each year due to hbvrelated disease or hepatocellular carcinoma hcc the endemicity of hepatitis surface antigen in indonesia is intermediate to high with a geographical difference the risk of hbv infection is high in hemodialysis hd patient men having sex with men and health care worker occult hbv infection ha been detected in various group such a blood donor hd patient and hivinfected individual and child the most common hbv subgenotype in indonesia is b3 followed by c1 various novel subgenotypes of hbv have been identified throughout indonesia with the novel hbv subgenotypes c6c16 and d6 being successfully isolated although a number of hbv subgenotypes have been discovered in indonesia genotyperelated pathogenicity ha not yet been elucidated in detail therefore genotyperelated difference in the prognosis of liver disease and their effect on treatment need to be determined a previous study conducted in indonesia revealed that hepatic steatosis wa associated with disease progression pres2 mutation and mutation at c1638t and t1753v in hbvb3 have been associated with advanced liver disease including hcc however drug resistance to lamivudine which is prominent in indonesia remains obscure although the number of study on hbv in indonesia ha been increasing adequate database on hbv infection are limited we herein provided an overview of the epidemiology and clinical characteristic of hbv infection in indonesia

processed_title: prevalence of hepatitis a and e virus in wastewater in asian country
processed_abstract: hepatitis a and e virus hav and hev respectively remain a significant global health concern despite advancement in healthcare and vaccination program regular monitoring and vaccine efficacy of hav are still lacking in different country this study aimed to investigate hav and hev prevalence in developed developing and leastdeveloped asian country using wastewater a a surveillance tool a total of 232 untreated wastewater sample were collected from six wastewater treatment plant a sewage treatment plant or an open drainage in six country nepal n 51 indonesia n 37 thailand n 30 vietnam n 27 the philippine n 17 and japan n 70 between april and october 2022 virus in wastewater were concentrated by simple centrifugation or polyethylene glycol precipitation method followed by viral rna extraction and reverse transcriptionquantitative polymerase chain reaction hav and hev rna were detected in the sample from nepal 51 for hav and 2 for hev thailand 3 for both virus and japan 1 for hav and 24 for hev only hav rna wa found in 11 of the sample in indonesia whereas only hev rna wa detected in vietnam and the philippine with a positive ratio of 15 and 12 respectively these result highlighted the geographic variability in hav and hev prevalence underscoring the need for localized public health strategy to address specific viral hepatitis challenge in each country

processed_title: viral hepatitis in indonesia past present and future
processed_abstract: since indonesia is a huge archipelago country the prevalence of hepatitis virus infection highly varies among island in average the prevalence of clinical hepatitis in indonesia wa 06 in the year 2007 of 82 clinical acute hepatitis patient treated in hospital in several city acute hepatitis a accounted for 280 acute hepatitis b 134 and acute hepatitis c 12 354 patient were infected by unknown etiology in 1980s the prevalence of antihav in the age group 10 to 14years wa almost 100 in smaller town and 45 to 60 in big city about 30 year later antihav prevalence decreased to around 13 in the same smaller town outbreak of hepatitis a were reported between 2006 and 2009 in several city in java island the prevalence of hbsag in the island other than java island 85 wa significantly higher than in java island 49 in 1409 viremic subject 4 genotype of hbv were found ie genotype b 60 followed by genotype c 33 genotype d 7 and genotype a 03 in contrast the prevalence of hepatitis c wa much higher in java island compared to other island in blood donor in java island the prevalence of antihcv and hcv rna were 15 and 11 respectively while in other island the prevalence were only 07 and 02 respectively hepatitis d wa very rare in indonesia and so wa hepatitis e outbreak of hepatitis e were reported between 1989 and 1993 in west kalimantan afterward the incidence of hepatitis e wa reported sporadically how to cite this article mulyanto viral hepatitis in indonesia past present and future euroasian j hepatogastroenterol 2016616569

processed_title: current hepatitis b virus infection situation in indonesia and it genetic diversity
processed_abstract: indonesia ha a moderate to high endemicity of hepatitis b virus hbv infection the risk for chronic hbv infection is highest among those infected during infancy since 1997 hepatitis b hepb vaccination of newborn ha been fully integrated into the national immunization program although hbv infection ha been reduced by the universal newborn hepb immunization program it continues to occur in indonesia the low birth dose coverage and the presence of vaccine escape mutant might contribute to this endemicity among child although limited information is available for an analysis of occult hbv infection obi several variation and substitution in the press region have been detected in indonesian hbv strain additionally persistent infection and disease progression of chronic hepatitis b are related to not only viral factor but also the host genome indonesia is one of the most ethnically heterogeneous nation with javanese and sundanese a the two highest ethnic group this multiethnicity make genomic research in indonesia difficult in this article we focused on and reviewed the following aspect the current hepatitis b immunization program and it efficacy obi hbv infection among highrisk patient such a hemodialysis patient and research regarding the host genome in indonesia

processed_title: hepatitis b virus infection among health care worker in indonesia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a global health problem with an estimated 257 million chronically infected people indonesia is a moderately hepatitis bendemic country with 71 prevalence of hepatitis surface antigen hbsag this infection is considered a an important occupational hazard among health care worker hcws who may become further transmitter of this infection the extent of hepatitis b among hcws and specific control strategy are not available in indonesia a study wa done on 644 hcws who were categorized into administration nonintervention and intervention group the prevalence of hbsag antibody to hbv core antigen antihbc and antibody to hbsag antihbs wa 47 185 and 367 respectively while 573 were negative for all seromarkers indicating susceptibility to this infection increasing trend with age wa observed in the exposure to infection antihbc p 0001 and the marker of resolved infection hbsag antihbc antihbs p 0004 suggesting accumulated exposure to hbv infection by increasing age rising trend of exposure rate wa also observed across the administration nonintervention and intervention group p 0001 by length of service period significant escalation of exposure p 0010 and resolved infection p 0001 were also observed suggesting increasing occupational risk to hbv infection there is an urgent need to safeguard the hcws with hepatitis b vaccination and provide continuing education at various health care setup the establishment of a national policy and a roadmap for effective and efficient intervention is required for the prevention diagnosis postexposure management and treatment of hbv infection in this special population how to cite this article muljono dh wijayadi t sjahril r hepatitis b virus infection among health care worker in indonesia euroasian j hepatogastroenterol 2018818892

processed_title: hepatitis b and hepatitis c in southeast and southern asia challenge for government
processed_abstract: in 2015 the coalition to eradicate viral hepatitis in asia pacific gathered leading hepatitis expert from bangladesh india indonesia malaysia pakistan the philippine and thailand to discus common challenge to the burden posed by hepatitis b virus hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv to learn from each others experience and identify sustainable approach in this report we summarise these discussion country differ in their policy response to hbv and hcv however substantial systemic cultural and financial barrier to achievement of elimination of these infection persist in all country common challenge to elimination include limited availability of reliable epidemiological data insufficient public awareness of risk factor and mode of transmission leading to underdiagnosis high rate of transmission through infected blood product including in medical setting limited access to care for people who inject drug prevailing stigma and discrimination against people infected with viral hepatitis and financial barrier to treatment and care despite these challenge promising example of effective programme publicprivate initiative and other innovative approach are evident in all country we studied in asia pacific the draft who global health sector strategy on viral hepatitis 201621 provides a solid framework upon which government can build their local strategy towards viral hepatitis however greater recognition by national government and the international community of the urgency to comprehensively tackle both hbv and hcv are still needed in all country strategic plan and policy goal need to be translated into resource and concrete action with national government at the helm to enable a sustainable response to the rising burden of hepatitis b and c in all country

processed_title: status and progress of hepatitis b control through vaccination in the southeast asia region 19922015
processed_abstract: in 2016 the immunization technical advisory group of the southeast asia region sear endorsed a regional goal to achieve 1 prevalence of hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag among 5yearold child by 2020 chronic hepatitis b virus hbv infection is largely preventable with a birth dose of hepatitis b vaccine hepbbd followed by two to three additional dos we reviewed the progress towards hepatitis b control through vaccination in sear during 19922015 we summarized hepatitis b vaccination data and reviewed the literature to determine the prevalence of chronic hbv infection pre and postvaccine introduction we used a mathematical model to determine postvaccine prevalence of hbsag among 5 year old in country lacking national serosurvey data and estimated the impact of vaccination on disease burden regional coverage with three dos of hepatitis b vaccine hepb3 increased from 56 in 2011 to 87 in 2015 by 2016 7 of 11 country had introduced universal hepbbd regional hepbbd coverage increased from 9 in 2011 to 34 in 2015 in 2015 estimated hbsag among 5 year old wa 11 with variability among country myanmar 38 timorleste 27 indonesia 18 and india 1 had the highest prevalence of hbsag during 19922015 vaccination prevented approximately 16 million chronic hbv infection and 26 million related death in 2015 around 197640 perinatal hbv infection occurred in sear with majority occurring in india 62 bangladesh 24 and myanmar 8 myanmar had the highest rate of perinatal chronic hbv infection at 16 per 1000 live birth despite significant progress in the control of hbv sear need to secure political commitment for elimination and consider additional strategy such a promoting health facility birth universal birth dose administration developing strong coordination between health sector and using alternative vaccine delivery method to improve hepbbd coverage and subsequently achieve hbv control and elimination

processed_title: costeffectiveness of hepatitis a vaccination in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aim to assess the costeffectiveness of hepatitis a immunization in indonesia including an explicit comparison between onedose and twodose vaccine method an agestructured cohort model based on a decision tree wa developed for the 2012 indonesia birth cohort using the model we made a comparison on the use of twodose and onedose vaccine the model involved a 70year time horizon with 1month cycle for child less than 2 year old and annually thereafter monte carlo simulation were used to examine the economic acceptability and affordability of the hepatitis a vaccination result vaccination would save u 3795148 and u 2892920 from the societal perspective for the twodose and onedose vaccine schedule respectively in the context of hepatitis a treatment it also would save 8917 and 6614 discounted qualityadjustedlifeyears qalys respectively with the vaccine price of u 321 per dose the implementation of single dose vaccine would yield an incremental costeffectiveness ratio icer of u 4933 per qaly gained versus no vaccination whereas the twodose versus onedose schedule would cost u 14 568 per qaly gained considering the 2012 grossdomesticproduct gdp per caput in indonesia of u 3557 the result indicate that hepatitis a vaccination would be a costeffective intervention both for the twodose and onedose vaccine schedule in isolation but twodose vaccination would no longer be costeffective if onedose vaccination is a feasible option vaccination would be 100 affordable at budget of u 71408 000 and u 37690000 for the implementation of the twodose and onedose vaccine schedule respectively conclusion the implementation of hepatitis a vaccination in indonesia would be a costeffective health intervention under the market vaccine price given the budget limitation the use of a onedosevaccine schedule would be more realistic to be applied than a twodose schedule the vaccine price mortality rate and discount rate were the most influential parameter impacting the icers

processed_title: factor associated with hepatitis b and hepatitis c among infected patient in indonesia and their knowledge and attitude a multicenter observational study
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b virus hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv infection are global health problem including in indonesia the purpose of this study wa to assess the knowledge and attitude about hbv and hcv infection among infected patient in indonesia method this crosssectional study used a questionnaire survey the questionnaire wa adapted and translated into indonesian language and trialed with 27 hbv and 27 hcv patient the final validated questionnaire wa later used in the target population patient diagnosed with hepatitis b or hepatitis c were included the patient were enrolled from november 2019 until february 2020 in sixteen multicenter location multivariate analysis with logistic regression wa conducted to determine the factor that are associated with the knowledge and attitude among hbv and hcv patient toward their illness result a total of 931 hbv patient and 254 hcv patient were included in this survey the proportion of infected patient with adequate knowledge of hepatitis b and hepatitis c wa 721 and 539 respectively positive attitude about hepatitis b and hepatitis c were 285 and 413 respectively multivariate analysis revealed that higher education level higher income level diagnosis duration of more than 5 year and receiving of antiviral therapy were independent factor associated with adequate knowledge about hepatitis b among hbv patient among hcv patient independent factor associated with adequate knowledge about hepatitis c were being married higher education level higher income level and receiving antiviral therapy moreover older age and receiving of antiviral therapy were independent factor associated with positive attitude towards hepatitis b among hbv patient however only higher education level wa found to be an independent factor associated with positive attitude towards hepatitis c among hcv patient conclusion the knowledge and attitude of patient regarding hbv and hcv were quite low among infected patient in indonesia

processed_title: patient perspective on the elimination mothertochild transmission of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b in bali indonesia a qualitative study
processed_abstract: background this study aimed to explore the facilitator and barrier to the elimination of human immunodeficiency virus hiv syphilis and hepatitis b transmission based on the perspective of mother living with hiv syphilis and hepatitis b method this study employed a descriptive qualitative design semistructured interview were conducted with mother living with hiv syphilis andor hepatitis b virus a total of 25 participant were included in the study this study used a triangulation method conducted by member to enhance the validity and dependability of the finding the study wa conducted at referral hospital and community health center between september 2022 and february 2023 data analysis utilized deductive content analysis and categorized theme based on a socioecological framework result the finding revealed facilitator and barrier across five level of the socioecological framework and 21 subcategories the finding included the following 1 at the policy level facilitator were mandatory testing program and barrier were separating testing service from antenatal care facility 2 at the community level facilitator included the involvement of nongovernmental organization ngo and crosssector support barrier included challenge faced by nonresident and fear of stigma and discrimination 3 at the healthcare system level facilitator included tracking and followup by midwife positive relationship with healthcare provider and satisfaction with healthcare service barrier included prolonged waiting time insufficient information from healthcare provider and administrative limitation 4 at the interpersonal level facilitator included partner and family support open communication and absence of stigma barrier included the reluctance of sexual partner to undergo screening 5 at the individual level facilitator included the desire for a healthy baby adequate knowledge selfacceptance and commitment to a healthy lifestyle barrier included the lack of administrative discipline conclusion mother living with hiv syphilis or hepatitis b require tailored healthcare approach healthcare professional must understand and meet the need of mother within a comprehensive care continuum the finding of this study advocate for the development and implementation of integrated care model that are responsive to the specific challenge and preference of affected mother aiming to improve health outcome for both mother and their child

processed_title: asiapacific clinical practice guideline on the management of hepatocellular carcinoma a 2017 update
processed_abstract: there is great geographical variation in the distribution of hepatocellular carcinoma hcc with the majority of all case worldwide found in the asiapacific region where hcc is one of the leading public health problem since the toward revision of the asian pacific association for the study of the liver apasl hcc guideline meeting held at the 25th annual conference of the apasl in tokyo the newest guideline for the treatment of hcc published by the apasl ha been discussed this latest guideline recommend evidencebased management of hcc and are considered suitable for universal use in the asiapacific region which ha a diversity of medical environment

processed_title: impact of the 2008 economic crisis on the burden of hepatitis b and c disease in southern european country
processed_abstract: background the economic crisis that began in 2008 ha severely affected southern greece italy portugal spain western european swe country of western europe we and may have affected ongoing effort to eliminate viral hepatitis this study wa conducted to investigate the impact of the economic crisis on the burden of hbv and hcv disease method global burden of disease 2019 data were used to analyse the rate of epidemiological metric of hbv and hcv acute and chronic infection in swe and we time series modelling wa performed to quantify the impact of healthcare expenditure on the time trend of hbv and hcv disease burden in 20002019 result declining trend in incidence and prevalence rate of acute hbv ahbv and chronic hbv were observed in swe and we with the pace of decline being slower in the postausterity period 20102019 and mortality due to hbv stabilised in swe acute hcv ahcv metric and chronic hcv incidence and mortality showed a stable trend in swe and we whereas the prevalence of chronic hcv showed an oscillating trend decreasing in we in 20102019 p 0001 liver cancer due to both hepatitis infection showed a stagnant burden over time an inverse association wa observed between health expenditure and metric of both acute and chronic hbv and hcv conclusion epidemiological metric for hbv and hcv showed a slower pace of decline in the postausterity period with better improvement for hbv a stabilisation of mortality and a stagnant burden for liver cancer due to both hepatitis infection the economic crisis of 2008 had a negative impact on the burden of hepatitis b and c elimination of hbv and hcv by 2030 will be a major challenge in the swe country

processed_title: knowledge attitude and practice towards hepatitis b infection prevention and screening among indonesian
processed_abstract: hepatitis b ha been one of the most prevalent infectious disease in the world and specifically in indonesia although the total conversion of hepatitis b virus hbv to chronic disease in indonesia wa reduced by 50 the total number of hepatitis b case increased by 25 time in 2021 ineffective hbv immunization program in indonesia prior to 1997 wa addressed by the ministry of health through a more comprehensive hbv control which among others involved health promotion to increase people knowledge and awareness towards hepatitis b infection prevention in this regard this study aim to identify the level of knowledge attitude and practicebehavior of the indonesian population towards hepatitis b infection prevention and their willingness for screening particularly in area with high prevalence of hepatitis b this study used a quantitative approach in looking at correlation between this set of knowledge attitude and practice mainly by using structural equation model sem and smartpls 333 toolkit in spss through an analysis of online questionnaire result from over 400 respondent in four province dki jakarta west java di yogyakarta and south sulawesi this study show that respondent have a very high level of knowledge about hepatitis b high level of positive attitude and very high level of positive practice towards hepatitis b infection prevention however we also noticed some dissonance between the key aspect namely that knowledge on hepatitis b correlate negatively with the behavior of the respondent and that the behavior also correlate negatively with their willingness for screening in conclusion we suggest that factor such a socioeconomic context and prior informed knowledge on hepatitis b be considered to build a better strategy of health promotion and hepatitis b diagnostic screening among the population

processed_title: prevalence of hepatocellular carcinoma in hepatitis b population within southeast asia a systematic review and metaanalysis of 39050 participant
processed_abstract: background and aim hepatocellular carcinoma hcc is a significant complication of hepatitis b and still pose a global public health concern this systematic review and metaanalysis provide adequate detail on the prevalence of hcc in the hbv population within southeast asian country method following the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis prisma criterion a thorough search for literature discussing the prevalence of hcc in the hbv population within southeast asia wa performed eligible study were subjected to a metaanalysis utilising a dersimonian and laird approach and a random effect model a protocol wa registered with prospero crd42023423953 result our study meticulously recovered 41 article from seven country in southeast asia namely cambodia indonesia malaysia the philippine singapore thailand and vietnam a total of 39050 hbv patient and 7479 hcc case in southeast asia were analysed the pooled prevalence of hcc in hbv case within southeast asia wa 458 95 ci 343578 i2 9951 p 0001 singapore 625 ci 424791 had the highest pooled prevalence of hcc in the hbv population compared to vietnam with the lowest estimate 224 ci 99449 there wa a drop in the pooled prevalence of hcc in hbv from 2016 until now 376 ci 192605 conclusion the finding of this review reveal a high pooled prevalence of hcc in the hbv population and therefore stir the need for routine screening management and surveillance

processed_title: serologic marker of hepatitis a and b in the population of bali indonesia
processed_abstract: a total of 343 serum from balinese subject in different age group and geographic location were tested by radioimmunoassay ria for serum antibody to hepatitis b surface antigen antihbs and hepatitis b core antigen antihbc most serum were also tested for hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag and for antibody to hepatitis a virus antihav one hundred percent of the adult population wa found to have antihav with antibody acquisition beginning in early childhood and reaching a level of 95 by the age of 10 year antibody to hepatitis b virus were also frequent in young child rapidly peaking to near 80 in older child and adolescent then declining to a plateau that fluctuated between 40 and 60 throughout adult life overall antihbc 49 wa detected slightly more often than antihbs 45 but the relative frequency of the 2 antibody varied considerably from group to group despite these high antibody prevalence hbsag wa detected in only 15 of the general population and in no woman of childbearing age in utero infection is thus far less likely to account for the early acquisition of antibody to hepatitis b virus than inapparent percutaneous transmission occurring under condition of close personal contact

processed_title: knowledge vaccination status and reason for avoiding vaccination against hepatitis b in developing country a systematic review
processed_abstract: 1 background the coverage of hepatitis b vaccination remains low in developing country to date this systematic review thus analyzes the determinant of people knowledge and vaccination status a well a the reason why people in developing country chose not to receive the hepatitis b vaccination 2 method we searched four database to identify all study from developing country published within the past 10 year both lowrisk and highrisk population aged older than 15 year old were eligible for the study the quality of study wa assessed by the newcastleottawa scale assessment 3 result this study identified 2443 article 89 of which were included in the analysis monthly income occupational status and profession a a healthcare worker were the strongest predictive factor for both knowledge of hepatitis b and vaccination status in addition strong predictor variable of hepatitis b knowledge were knowing an infected person and level of education while health insurance management protection at workplace infection training and experience of hepatitis b exposure were strong influencing factor for vaccine uptake 4 conclusion exposure to information support from institution and financial support related to vaccination cost have a positive impact on the knowledge about hepatitis b infection and vaccination coverage

processed_title: knowledge and awareness of hepatitis b among household in malaysia a communitybased crosssectional survey
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b hepb is a major public health concern in malaysia yet little is known about knowledge and awareness of this infection in the country such information is essential for designing effective intervention strategy for hepb prevention and control the aim of this study wa to characterize knowledge and awareness regarding hepb in malaysia and to identify their associated sociodemographic determinant method a communitybased crosssectional survey wa conducted between january and may 2016 in selangor state of malaysia a twostage cluster random sampling design wa used and one adult member of selected household wa interviewed facetoface logistic regression wa used to estimate the difference in knowledge and awareness between group result a total of 764 household completed the interview and were included in the final analysis only 369 and 388 of the participant had good knowledge and awareness respectively the factor associated with good knowledge were being in the 3544 year age group malay ethnicity high educational attainment and high family income being chinese being older and having high educational attainment were determinant of having good awareness towards hepb participant who had good knowledge were 25 time more likely to also have good awareness or 241 95 ci 178326 p 0001 conclusion this study reveals a low level of knowledge and awareness of hepb among household in malaysia this finding highlight the need to improve public knowledge and awareness through welldesigned program targeting vulnerable group in order to reduce hepatitis b virus transmission and achieve the governmental target of eliminating viral hepatitis a a public health concern by 2030

processed_title: seroepidemiology and occult hepatitis b virus infection in young adult in banjarmasin indonesia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv infection remains a public health problem in indonesia there ha been limited data regarding hbv infection in young adult population this study aimed to evaluate the seroepidemiology of hbv infection and characterize occult hbv variant in healthy young adult in banjarmasin indonesia who were born before the implementation of the universal infant hepatitis b vaccination serum sample of 195 healthy young adult were tested for hbsag antihbc and antihbs the prevalence of hbsag antihbc and antihbs wa 9 46 62 318 and 96 492 respectively seventy four 379 sample were seronegative for all three parameter indicating the susceptibility to hbv infection among 66 sample positive for hbsag andor antihbc 13 197 were hbv dna positive of these four were hbsag positive and nine were hbsag negative and categorized a occult hbv infection most occult hbv case had highlevel antihbs 100 iul suggesting that blood with positive antihbs and antihbc could not be regarded a noninfectious thirteen amino acid substitution were identified t126s p127s q129r t131n m133t and y161s in the hbsagpositive group p120t t126i g145s y161f e164v and v168f in the occulthbv group and t143s in both group more study are required to provide data on the prevalence and characteristic of mutant to ensure reliable diagnosis the occult hbv infection combined with the hbsag prevalence could indicate the high hbv carriage among young adult in this area the high percentage of individual susceptible to hbv infection reiterates the need for catchup immunization strategy targeted at young adult

processed_title: metaanalysis association between hepatitis b virus pres mutation and hepatocellular carcinoma risk
processed_abstract: previous observational study suggested that hepatitis b virus hbv pres mutation play an important role in the existence of hbvrelated hepatocellular carcinoma hcc however the result are still debatable with an increasing number of study about this topic this study employed a metaanalysis to identify the association between hbv pres mutation and hcc risk we searched for eligible study from pubmed proquest cinahl sciencedirect and springer database to assess the association between hbv mutation and hcc risk this metaanalysis wa conducted using revman 53 to provide pooled estimate for odds ratio or with 95 confidence interval 95 ci twentyone clinical study were included in this metaanalysis study which consisted of 1738 participant with hbvrelated hcc and 3740 hbsagpositive patient without hcc all study used sample of asian population pres deletion wa the most common mutation found in all study we found that or of hbv overall pres deletion wa associated with hcc or 328 95 ci 232465 p 00001 randomeffects model each pres1 and pres2 deletion wa associated with increased risk of hcc with or 242 95 ci 125468 p 008 and 336 95 ci 204555 p 00001 respectively pres2 start codon mutation wa also significantly associated with hcc risk or 247 95 ci 115527 p 02 randomeffect model the result of this metaanalysis suggested that hbv pres deletion all pres1 and pres2 and pres2 start codon mutation might contribute to the increased risk of hbvrelated hcc

processed_title: hepatitis b virus infection in indonesia 15 year after adoption of a universal infant vaccination program possible impact of low birth dose coverage and a vaccineescape mutant
processed_abstract: a universal hepatitis b vaccination program for infant wa adopted in indonesia in 1997 before it implementation the prevalence of hepatitis b surface antigen hbsagpositive individual in the general population wa approximately 510 the study aimed to investigate the hepatitis b virus hbv serological status and molecular profile among child 15 year after adoption of a universal infant vaccination program in indonesia according to the local health office data in five area the percentage of child receiving three dos of hepatitis b vaccine are high 739941 whereas the birth dose coverage is less than 50 among 967 child in those area the seropositive rate of hbsag in preschool and schoolaged child ranged from 21 to 42 and 0 to 59 respectively of the 61 hbv dnapositive sample the predominant genotypesubtype wa badw2 subtype adw3 wa identified in genotype c for the first time in this population six sample 115 had an amino acid substitution within the a determinant of the s gene region and one sample had t140i that wa suggested a a vaccineescape mutant type the low birth dose coverage and the presence of a vaccineescape mutant might contribute to the endemicity of hbv infection among child in indonesia

processed_title: full genome characterization and phylogenetic analysis of hepatitis b virus in gibbon and a caretaker in central kalimantan indonesia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv from gibbon wa characterized and the possibility of horizontal transmission between gibbon and human wa examined in a gibbon rehabilitation center in central kalimantan indonesia ten gibbon that were positive for the hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag on arrival and 13 caretaker for those gibbon were included in this study the duration of stay at the rehabilitation center ranged from 1 to 10 year serological and molecular analysis were performed six gibbon were positive for hbsag whereas hbv dna wa detected in all ten of the gibbon sampled on the other hand hbsag wa detected in only 1 of the 13 caretaker hbv sample from seven gibbon and from the one infected human were chosen for complete genome sequencing a phylogenetic analysis revealed that the cluster of gibbon strain in this study wa distinct from strain previously reported from other country in the pres1 region we found a unique amino acid residue substitution p89k three insertion between t87 and l88 in the genome of three gibbon and a 33nucleotide deletion at the start of pres1 that is common in nonhuman primate the caretaker sample wa identified a hbv subgenotype b3 the most common type in indonesia for the complete hbv sequence the similarity between gibbon in this study and other nonhuman primate and human hbv isolates wa 90919 and 855896 respectively in conclusion the gibbon hbv genotype wa influenced by geographic location and specie to the best of our knowledge this is the first report characterizing the hbv gene and genome of indigenous gibbon in indonesia

processed_title: reactivation of hepatitis b virus associated with chemotherapy and immunosuppressive agent
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv reactivation after chemotherapy or immunosuppressive therapy is a serious cause of liverrelated morbidity and mortality the mechanism of hbv reactivation is still unclear but it is believed due to the suppression of immune response hence increasing the viral load no uniform diagnostic criterion are available hbv reactivation can be confirmed by an increase in serum hbvdna level there are many consensus regarding this issue including the type and duration of nucleoside analogue therapy which need to be understood a not all chronic hepatitis b patient will lead to hbv reactivation recently there ha been an increased awareness of reactivation of occult hepatitis b virus especially in hepatitis b virus endemic area including indonesia a part of asia pacific region preempative antiviral therapy wa the best approach to prevent the hbv reactivation

processed_title: hepatitis b virus genotype in precision medicine of hepatitis brelated hepatocellular carcinoma where we are now
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a major player in chronic hepatitis b that may lead to the development of hepatocellular carcinoma hcc hbv genetics are diverse where it is classified into at least 9 genotype a to i and 1 putative genotype j each with specific geographical distribution and possible different clinical outcome in the patient this diversity may be associated with the precision medicine for hbvrelated hcc and the success of therapeutical approach against hcc related to different pathogenicity of the virus and host response this editorial discusses recent update on whether the classification of hbv genetic diversity is still valid in term of viral oncogenicity to the hcc and it precision medicine in addition to the recent advance in cellular and molecular biology technology

processed_title: evaluating the impact of triple elimination program for mothertochild transmission of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b in indonesia
processed_abstract: indonesian government launched a triple elimination program to eliminate mothertochild transmission mtct of human immunodeficiency virus hiv syphilis and hepatitis b in 2018 aiming to increase screening uptake among pregnant woman during antenatal visit and to reduce the rate of these infection in child less than 50 per 100000 live birth despite this initiative a thorough assessment of it effectiveness particularly in bandung the capital city of west java a one of the most densely populated city in indonesia with a high hiv incidence ha yet to be conducted the aim of this study wa to analyze the impact of this triple elimination program in bandung by assessing the data between 2017 and 2020 monthly data wa obtained from the health office of bandung for four year including number of screening done for hiv syphilis and hepatitis b number of confirmed case and number of pregnant woman treated for those infection additionally data on child under 24 month old afflicted by these infection were also collected our data indicated an increase in screening coverage for hiv syphilis and hbv among pregnant woman however it remained below the national set benchmark for screening coverage only 595 of hivpositive pregnant woman received antiretroviral therapy in 2020 while merely 25 of syphilispositive case were administered benzathine penicillin g syphilis screening wa correlated with an increase in positive case among child suggesting missed opportunity in managing syphilispositive pregnant woman furthermore management of hiv and syphilispositive case had suboptimal outcome data on hepatitis b wa not evaluated since it wa not available to achieve the triple elimination program goal comprehensive coordination among all relevant stakeholder is required a is continuous monitoring and evaluation

processed_title: a very young adult female patient with hepatitis b flare a case report
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a major global health problem it can cause chronic infection and put people at high risk of death from cirrhosis and liver cancer this study aim to present a case of chronic hepatitis b flare in a very young adult patient an 18yearold previously healthy female presented with jaundice developing in one week following the previous complaint of nausea vomiting abdominal pain loss of appetite and tiredness for about three month the patient had no risk factor for getting hbv infection but her hbsagpositive mother wa probably an inactive hbv carrier the hepatitis b serological testing revealed hbsag positivity antihbs seronegativity hbeag positivity antihbe seronegativity antihbc igm seronegativity and high level of hbv dna detected 170 x 108 iuml there wa a sharp increase in serum alt to 5fold uln the abdominal ultrasonography revealed a hepatitis feature unremarkable portal venous flow and an extrahepatic biliary system the liver transient elastography revealed 156 kpa of liver stiffness which wa in accordance with the f3f4 fibrosis stage these feature were typical of a hepatitis b flare the hbeagpositive chronic hepatitis b previously known a the immune reactive phase a longterm nucleostide analog therapy wa programmed with tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg daily

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor of hepatitis b virus infection in bahrain 2000 through 2010
processed_abstract: hepatitis b infection is one of the world major infectious disease with about 350 million chronic carrier because no data is published on the prevalence and risk factor of this important disease in bahrain this article evaluates the available data from 2000 to 2010 to estimate the prevalence of the infection and to evaluate the risk factor epidemiologic data on hbv case were collected from the major hospital and health center in bahrain and statistically analyzed over this indicated decade 877892 individual were screened for hbv infection and 5055 positive case were reported in bahrain the prevalence of hbv infection during that period wa 058 although there wa no significant difference in the prevalence over the period of 10 year the actual number of positive case ha almost doubled in the later year especially in 2007 and 2008 the prevalence wa significantly higher among male 623 p001 most case were associated with non bahraini and the prevalence wa significantly higher among them 683 p001 than it wa among bahraini 317 seventy eight percent 28773690 of non bahraini case were for citizen of six country which are highly endemic for hbv namely india pakistan bangladesh philippine indonesia and ethiopia dental procedure and surgical operation were the main risk factor of infection a 372 and 356 of the patient were probably infected through this route the prevalence of hepatitis b virus infection in bahrain indicates that bahrain had low hbv endemicity for the last 10 year 20002010 our study verifies the significant role played by expatriatesimmigrants in the present epidemiology of hepatitis b in bahrain increasing hbv vaccination of high risk group active educational and medium campaign screening hbv infection during pregnancy and surveillance of hepatitis b infected individual will further decrease the prevalence of the disease in bahrain

processed_title: hepatitis b virus subgenotypes and basal core promoter mutation in indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to identify the distribution of hepatitis b virus hbv subgenotype and basal core promoter bcp mutation among patient with hbvassociated liver disease in indonesia method patient with chronic hepatitis ch n 61 liver cirrhosis lc n 62 and hepatocellular carcinoma hcc n 48 were included in this study hbv subgenotype wa identified based on s or pres gene sequence and mutation in the hbx gene including the overlapping bcp region were examined by direct sequencing result hbv genotype b subgenotypes b2 b3 b4 b5 and b7 the major genotype in the sample accounted for 754 710 and 750 of ch lc and hcc patient respectively while the genotype c subgenotypes c1 c2 and c3 wa detected in 246 290 and 250 of ch lc and hcc patient respectively subgenotypes b3 849 and c1 822 were the main subgenotype in hbv genotype b and c respectively serotype adw2 849 and adrq 894 were the most prevalent in hbv genotype b and c respectively double mutation a1762tg1764a in the bcp wa significantly higher in lc 597 and hcc 542 than in ch 197 suggesting that this mutation wa associated with severity of liver disease the t1753v wa also higher in lc 468 but lower in hcc 229 and ch 180 suggesting that this mutation may be an indicator of cirrhosis conclusion hbv genotype bb3 and cc1 are the major genotype in indonesia mutation in bcp such a a1762tg1764a and t1753v might have an association with manifestation of liver disease

processed_title: assessing the impact of hepatitis b elimination program on maternalinfant health in west java indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b virus hbv infection during pregnancy is a significant concern due to the risk of vertical transmission to the newborn posing serious health complication understanding the effectiveness of intervention program is paramount especially in region where comprehensive research is sparse this study delf into the efficacy of the hbv elimination program in garut regency west java indonesia targeting pregnant woman and their newborn material and method this crosssectional research encompassed 100 hbsagpositive pregnant woman who delivered at a singular facility in garut regency and their 62 offspring clinical data collection wa rigorous and hbsag status wa determined using rapid test kit employing the precision of the 2sided sandwich assay immunochromatography method data interpretation wa multifaceted involving univariate bivariate and multiple regression logistic analysis result notably 1695 of woman previously diagnosed a hbsagnegative by initial health assessment were subsequently diagnosed a positive at the specialized referral hospital a noteworthy finding wa that child administered with the hbv vaccine manifested a significantly diminished positivehbsag status p0029 intriguingly a majority of the maternal variable displayed a direct correlation with the hbsag status of their offspring the protective role of the hbv vaccine against hbv infection stood out distinctly or0326 ci 00195554 p0029 conclusion while our center successfully met the desired hbsag testing coverage in pregnant woman the administration of the hepatitis b vaccine to infant born to hbsagpositive mother lag behind the intended target emphasizing the vaccination vital role our study underscore it significance a a frontline defense for such infant

processed_title: determinant of hepatitis a infection among student a case study of an outbreak in jember indonesia
processed_abstract: background hepatitis a often occurs in school among student in the form of an outbreak the transmission wa through fecaloral common source provided that the epidemic curve is close to propagate the aim of the current study wa to analyze the determinant of hepatitis a infection among student design and method this study wa a casecontrol study which wa conducted at sman plus with a sample size of 80 student chosen by using simple random sampling the data obtained were then analyzed using logistic regression with 95 confidence level alpha 005 while the strength of the relationship between variable wa identified using odds ratio or result most of the student were at the age of 17 to 19 year old 65 and male 575 the average age in the case group wa 171 year old while in the control group wa 1675 year old the habit of consuming raw food p0001 a well a eating and drink at the same time during an activity p0000 had a significant influence on the outbreak of hepatitis a in the curve epidemic of common source conclusion the outbreak is confirmed a transmission occurs through fecaloral which the common source epidemic curve risk factor that have been proven to be related to hepatitis a include consuming raw food eating shared meal during an activity and drinking with shared drinking utensil

processed_title: exploring the impact of hepatitis b immunoglobulin and antiviral intervention to reduce vertical transmission of hepatitis b virus
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a major public health burden in hbv endemic region high prevalence is also correlated with the infection acquired in infancy through perinatal transmission or early childhood exposure to hbv the socalled mothertochild transmission mtct child who are infected with hbv at a young age are at higher risk of developing chronic hbv infection than those infected a adult which may lead to worse clinical outcome to reduce the incidence of hbv mtct several intervention for the infant or the mother or both are already carried out this review explores the newest information and approach available in literature regarding hbv mtct prevalence and it challenge especially in high hbv endemic country this cover hbv screening in pregnant woman prenatal intervention infant immunoprophylaxis and postvaccination serological testing for child

processed_title: the effectiveness of hepatitis b vaccine in toddler based on the fiveyear period national basic health research riskesdas 2007 2013 and 2018 in indonesia
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b is a viral infection that ha a high prevalence in indonesia the ministry of health of indonesia ha conducted a national vaccination program for hepatitis b in order to evaluate the success of the hepatitis b vaccination in indonesia a community study based on basic health research riskesdas wa performed nationwide since 2007 for five year period in 2007 2013 and 2018 method further statistical analysis wa performed specifically for the child under 59 month old toddler immunized in both urban and rural area in 2007 2013 and 2018 based on certain characteristic by examining antibody against hbsag antihbs igg antibody against the core antigen hbcab surface antigen hbsag of hepatitis b virus hbv the data obtained from the data management laboratory of ministry of health indonesia wa analyzed with bivariate analysis with continuity correction chisquare or pearson chisquare using stata software version 16 result this study showed an increase in hepatitis b coverage of complete immunization 30 in 2007 603 in 2013 and 57 in 2018 which wa also influenced by mother level of education pearson chisquare p inverted exclamation mark 005 and access to health service point within 30 minute or 1328 p inverted exclamation mark 005 the trend of the percentage of immune status antihbs wa increased 418 in 2007 561 in 2013 and 791 in 2018 the higher antihbs wa found in complete hepatitis b immunization status or 152 p inverted exclamation mark 005 and in good nutritional status p inverted exclamation mark 005 however the antihbs wa found decreased with increasing age p inverted exclamation mark 005 the trend of positive hbcab exposure to hbv infection showed a decrease gradually of almost ten time from 2007 86135 compared to 2013 26111 and 2018 112 urban area were at higher risk of hepatitis b exposure or 1422 than rural area or 037080 the hbsag data were only available in 2013 and 2018 riskesdas data analysis showed the prevalence of hepatitis b hbsag wa lower in complete immunization status than that in incomplete one p inverted exclamation mark 005 but with an increase from 39 2013 to 93 2018 possibly due to inappropriate implementation of birth dose immunization or a vaccineescape mutant from the hbv variant conclusion the effectiveness of hepatitis b vaccine obtained from the three riskesdas period in indonesia showed an improvement with an increase in immune status reduced exposure to hbv and a lower prevalence of hepatitis b in child with complete vaccination however there is still an increase in hepatitis b infection especially in urban area therefore a longterm evaluation of immunization coverage especially ensuring that the initial dose of immunization wa given within the first 24 h of birth hbsag and hbcab nutritional status genomic surveillance of hbv and other aspect of program quality evaluation are needed to ensure that elimination effort have been implemented properly

processed_title: molecular epidemiology of hepatitis b among indigenous australian in queensland and the torres strait island
processed_abstract: background chronic hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a major health problem for all indigenous australian post2000 hepatitis b surface antigen prevalence ha decreased although remaining four time higher among indigenous compared with nonindigenous people aim this study aimed to characterise the hbv from indigenous population in queensland and the torres strait island method serum sample were collected with consent from people within queensland indigenous community prior to 1990 a part of the queensland health vaccination programme ethic approval wa subsequently obtained to further characterise the hbv from 93 of these stored sample hbv dna wa extracted and genotype wa obtained from 82 sample hbv full genome sequencing wa carried out for a subset of 14 sample result seventyeight sample were identified a genotype c 2 x c12 3 x c13 and 73 x c14 one sample a genotype a a2 and three sample a genotype d 1 x d2 1 x d3 and 1 x d4 the hbvc sequence identified were most closely related to sequence isolated from papua new guinea and indonesia papua province conclusion the hbv isolated from the torres strait islander wa notably different to the hbvc4 strain isolated from indigenous people of mainland northern australia with no evidence of recombination this reflects the difference in culture and origin between torres strait islander and mainland indigenous people

processed_title: waterborne nona nonb hepatitis
processed_abstract: waterborne nona nonb hepatitis nanb is responsible for outbreak of hepatitis with a predilection for young adult the disease is usually mild except in pregnant woman who have a high casefatality rate from fulminant hepatic failure diagnosis is largely based on the epidemiological finding of faecal contamination of drinking water and serological exclusion of hepatitis a and b virus infection histological feature of liver biopsy specimen are characteristic and viruslike particle in the stool are aggregated by antibody present in acute and convalescent phase serum of the test subject nanb is widespread in india and several country of southeast asia it is increasingly recognised in africa and may occur in latin america control measure include provision of clean water supply safe disposal of human excreta and sound personal and food hygiene practice passive immunisation with immunoglobulin derived from healthy donor resident in the country affected by the disease may protect vulnerable group

processed_title: the relationship between perception and selfpaid hepatitis b vaccination a structural equation modeling approach
processed_abstract: background malaysia ha a comprehensive publiclyfunded immunization program for hepatitis b hepb among infant but adult must pay for the vaccine the number of hepb carrier among adult is expected to increase in the future therefore we examined the impact of five construct cue to action perceived barrier perceived benefit perceived severity and perceived susceptibility on adult willingness to pay wtp for hepb vaccine secondarily we examined the association between perceived barrier and perceived benefit method adult were selected through a stratified twostage cluster community sample in selangor malaysia the reliability convergent validity and discriminant validity of the measurement model were assessed before implementing a partial least square structural equation model plssem to evaluate the significance of the structural path result a total of 728 participant were enrolled the five construct all showed adequate internal reliability convergent validity and discriminant validity there wa a significant positive relationship to wtp from construct perceived barrier path coefficient beta 0082 p 0036 perceived susceptibility beta 0214 p0001 and cue to action beta 0166 p0001 and the model all together accounted for 88 of the variation in wtp there wa a significant negative relationship between perceived barrier and perceived benefit beta 0261 p0001 which accounted for 68 of variation in perceived benefit conclusion policy and program should be targeted that can modify individual thought about disease risk their obstacle in obtaining the preventive action and their readiness to obtain a vaccine such program include educational material about disease risk and clinic visit that can pair hepb screening and vaccination

processed_title: clinical and virological characteristic of hepatitis b or c virus coinfection with hiv in indonesian patient
processed_abstract: hepatitis virusrelated liver disease increase substantially the mortality rate of patient with hiv on highly active antiretroviral therapy haart therefore early diagnosis of hepatitis b virus hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv is important however the prevalence of hbv and hcv infection in indonesian patient infected with hiv is unknown therefore this study examined the molecular and clinical characteristic of hbv and hcv in 126 patient infected with hiv mostly on haart at dr sardjito hospital yogyakarta indonesia the rate of triple infection hivhcv coinfection hivhbv coinfection and monoinfection were 48 341 32 and 579 respectively seven hcv genotype were detected with genotype 1a 1b 1c 3a 3k 4a and 6n found in 23 52 1 2 4 9 5 11 7 16 3 6 and 1 2 patient respectively indicating multiple mode of transmission hbvdna wa detected in 210 patient with hepatitis b surface antigen both patient were haart naive univariate analysis revealed that male sex higher education level injection drug use sexual contact alanine aminotransferase 40 iul and aspartate aminotransferasetoplatelet ratio index 05 were associated with hcv coinfection in multivariate analysis injection drug use or 2652 95 ci 35219954 and alanine aminotransferase 40 iul or 636 95 ci 1233289 were independently associated with hcv coinfection hcv coinfection wa common among indonesian patient infected with hiv particularly among injecting drug user and wa a risk factor for disease progression of hiv

processed_title: protectivity and safety following recombinant hepatitis b vaccine with different source of bulk compared to hepatitis b bio farma vaccine in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose indonesia a high populous and the secondhighest country in epidemicity of hepatitis b in southeast asia require maintaining it capacity of monovalent hepatitis b production to keep up with both the national immunization program and global need to keep the sustainability of the vaccine a new bulk is needed to be made available this study aim to evaluate the immunogenicity and safety of bio farma newly formulated recombinant hepatitis b vaccine which came from different source of bulk compared to the already registered hepatitis b vaccine material and method an experimental randomized doubleblind cohort intervention phase ii clinical trial wa conducted on three recombinant hepatitis b vaccine from different bulk source with bio farma registered hepatitis b vaccine a the control group a total of 536 participant around age 10 to 40 year old were thricely vaccinated with twice serological assessment the subject safety wa monitored for 28 day after each vaccination result of 536 enrolled participant 521 finished the vaccination and serology assessment the investigational product were proven not to be inferior to the control all vaccine were well tolerated no difference in rate of local and systemic reaction were seen between the investigational product and control no serious adverse event wa found to be related to the investigational vaccine conclusion investigational vaccine are shown to be equally immunogenic and safe a the control vaccine

processed_title: risk factor for viral hepatitis in pulmonary tuberculosis patient undergoing treatment a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: liver injury in tuberculosis patient associated with noncompliance with treatment is further exacerbated by viral hepatitis which not only directly harm the liver but also increase susceptibility to druginduced liver injury the aim of this study wa to analyze the associated risk factor for viral hepatitis in tuberculosis patient this systematic review and metaanalysis adhere to the prisma 2020 statement and the protocol ha been registered with prospero crd42023477241 screening and selection of article were carried out according to predetermined inclusion and exclusion criterion utilizing four database embase medline scopus and proquest baseline characteristic and patientrelated risk factor from each included study were extracted followed by a meta analysis of factor that potentially had significance with the heterogeneity also being analyzed of the 21 included study out of 6415 identified record 12 potential risk factor for hepatitis b and 15 for hepatitis c were subjected to metaanalysis some key risk factor included for hepatitis b and c were hiv infection or 342 95ci 219 534 and or 699 95ci 509961 respectively smoking or 155 95ci 119202 and or 306 95ci 163575 respectively and alcohol consumption or 238 95ci 106537 and or 432 95ci 276678 respectively furthermore meta analysis indicated that other significant risk factor for hepatitis b andor c include injecting and noninjecting drug use multiple sexual partner tattooing earnose piercing blood transfusion dental intervention homelessness incarceration living with prisoner sexually transmitted disease and diabetes mellitus in conclusion patient with tuberculosis who have risk factor such a smoking hiv or alcohol consumption should be screened for hepatitis b and c to prevent liver injury

processed_title: expert consensus on the diagnosis and treatment of endstage liver disease complicated by infection
processed_abstract: endstage liver disease esld is a lifethreatening clinical syndrome and when complicated with infection the mortality is markedly increased in patient with esld bacterial or fungal infection can induce or aggravate the occurrence or progression of liver decompensation consequently infection are among the most common complication of disease deterioration there is an overwhelming need for standardized protocol for early diagnosis and appropriate management for patient with esld complicated by infection asia pacific region ha the largest number of esld patient due to hepatitis b and the growing population of alcohol and nafld concomitant infection not only add to organ failure and high mortality but also to financial and healthcare burden this consensus document assembled uptodate knowledge and experience from colleague across the asiapacific region providing data on the principle a well a evidencebased current working protocol and practice for the diagnosis and treatment of patient with esld complicated by infection

processed_title: ethnogeographical structure of hepatitis b virus genotype distribution in indonesia and discovery of a new subgenotype b9
processed_abstract: the distribution of hepatitis b virus hbv in the population of island southeast asia is of medical and anthropological interest and is associated with an unusually high genetic diversity this study examined the association of this hbv genetic diversity with the ethnogeography of the population of the indonesian archipelago whole genome analysis of 21 hbv isolates from east nusa tenggara and papua revealed two recently reported hbvb subgenotypes unique to the former b7 7 isolates and b8 5 isolates and uncovered a further novel subgenotype designated b9 4 isolates further isolates were collected from 419 individual with defined ethnic background representing 40 population hbvb wa predominant in austronesianlanguagespeaking population whereas hbvc wa the major genotype in papua and papuainfluenced population of moluccas hbvb3 wa the predominant subgenotype in the western half of the archipelago speaker of the western malayopolynesian wmp branch of austronesian language whereas b7 b8 and b9 were specific to nusa tenggara central malayopolynesian cmp the result provides the first direct evidence that the distribution of hbv genotypessubgenotypes in the indonesian archipelago is related to the ethnic origin of it population and suggests that the hbv distribution is associated with the ancient migratory event in the peopling of the archipelago

processed_title: genotype and subtype analysis of hepatitis b virus hbv and possible coinfection of hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv or hepatitis d virus hdv in blood donor patient with chronic liver disease and patient on hemodialysis in surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: four subtypes adw adr ayw and ayr and eight genotype a to h of the hepatitis b virus hbv have been identified they appear to be associated with particular geographic distribution ethnicity and possibly clinical outcome in this study hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag subtyping and hbv genotyping were carried out on serum obtained from hbsagpositive hbv carrier including healthy blood donor patient with acute hepatitis chronic hepatitis liver cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma and patient on hemodialysis all located in surabaya indonesia we report here that all hbv isolates tested in surabaya belonged to genotype b with more than 90 of them being classified into subtype adw our result also revealed that prevalence of hepatitis c virus hcv coinfection among hbv carrier in surabaya wa approximately 10 for healthy blood donor and patient with chronic liver disease and approximately 60 for patient on maintenance hemodialysis interestingly hbsag titer were lower in hbv carrier with hcv coinfection than in those without hcv coinfection we also found that prevalence of hepatitis d virus hdv coinfection wa 05 among hbv carrier in surabaya

processed_title: baseline serum mac2 binding protein glycosylation isomer a a predictor of hepatocellular carcinoma in chronic hepatitis b patient a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background a minimally invasive tool to promptly predict hepatocellular carcinoma hcc in chronic hepatitis b chb is currently needed in this study we aimed via a metaanalysis to identify the serum mac2 binding protein glycosylation isomer m2bpgi a a novel glycoproteinbased liver fibrosis marker for predicting hcc in chb patient method we conducted a systematic search on pubmed scopus proquest wiley online library and cinahl plus via ebscohost the article were screened based on several eligibility criterion and were further assessed for study quality using the newcastleottawa scale the outcome were presented a standard mean difference smd hazard ratio hr and predictive accuracy parameter of a baseline cutoff index coi for serum m2bpgi result fourteen study involving 5918 chb patient were included in this systematic review and metaanalysis baseline coi serum m2bpgi wa significantly higher in chb patient who developed hcc than in those who did not smd 132 95 confidence interval ci 091172 a significant hcc risk prediction wa also observed multivariate hr 118 95ci 105132 baseline coi serum m2bpgi could predict hcc with a pooled sensitivity of 74 95ci 5089 specificity of 80 95ci 6590 and area under the summary receiver operating characteristic curve of 084 95ci 081087 conclusion high baseline coi serum m2bpgi may predict the development of hcc in chb patient with moderatetohigh accuracy

processed_title: correlation between vitamin d status and hbsag antibody level in indonesian adolescent immunised against hepatitis b
processed_abstract: introduction hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a global health problem antihepatitis b surface antigen hbsag level increase along with vitamin d level in adult however few study have examined this relationship in adolescent few study have examined the relationship between vitamin d and hbsag antibody level especially in indonesia method this crosssectional study examined vitamin d and antihbsag level before and after hepatitis b immunisation all subject blood wa taken to check for vitamin d level this study wa part of the safety and preliminary of immunogenicity following recombinant hepatitis b bio farma vaccine in adult and child phase i trial result this study found that 25hydroxyvitamin d 25ohd status wa primarily deficient based on endocrine criterion the childrens hepatitis b antibody response wa mostly 10 miuml before and 10 miuml after vaccination there wa a relationship between sex and 25ohd status with median 25ohd level higher in female 182 ngml than in male 98 ngml however the relationship between vitamin 25ohd status and antihbsag level pre and postvaccination wa not significant discussion however some research found that vitamin d supplementation after immunisation did not impact vaccine response several study have reported that vitamin d can decrease hbv replication through various mechanism including reducing viral transcription and interfering with viral protein synthesis conclusion there wa no relationship between 25ohd status and antihbsag level further research is needed to elucidate the underlying mechanism and establish optimal treatment strategy

processed_title: hepatocarcinogenesis in viral hepatitis b infection the role of hbx and p53
processed_abstract: infection of hepatitis b virus hbv is a risk factor of chronic active hepatitis cah hepatic cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma hcc infection of hbv may develop to hcc without antecedent hepatic cirrhosis pathogenesis of hbv causing malignant change ha not been fully understood hbx a protein of hbv is an activator of transcription process involved in hepatocarcinogenesis most of human cancer associated with mutation of p53 a tumor suppressor gene a protein serf a cellular protection for growth and cell division which is one of predisposition factor of hepatocarcinoma some study indicate the correlation between mutation inactivation of p53 and hbv protein x hbx in hepatocarcinogenesis in that process hbx will suppress p53 function which will lead to ineffective liver cell division and resulting in hcc

processed_title: willingness to pay for hepatitis b vaccination in selangor malaysia a crosssectional household survey
processed_abstract: background in malaysia one million individual are estimated to be infected with the hepatitis b virus a vaccine for infant ha been compulsory since 1989 whereas those born before 1989 need to spend their own money to be vaccinated in private clinic or hospital the aim of this study wa to investigate and ascertain the determinant of willingness to pay wtp for adult hepatitis b vaccine in selangor malaysia method in 2016 728 household were selected through a stratified two stage cluster sample and interviewed willingness to pay for hepatitis b vaccine wa estimated using the contingent valuation method and factor affecting wtp were modelled with logit regression result we found that 273 375 of the household were willing to pay for hepatitis b vaccination the mean and median of wtp wa estimated at ringgit malaysia rm303 approximately us73 for the three dose series the estimated wtp wa significantly greater in those with higher level of education among malay and chinese compared to others predominantly indian and for those with greater perceived susceptibility to hepatitis b virus infection other factorsperceived severity barrier benefit and cue to actionwere not significantly associated with wtp for adult hepatitis b vaccination conclusion additional resource are needed to cover the household that are not willing to pay for hepatitis b vaccination more awareness particularly in regard to hepatitis b virus susceptibility could change the national perception towards selfpaid hepatitis b virus vaccination and increase hepatitis b vaccine coverage

processed_title: epidemiology of hbv subgenotypes d
processed_abstract: the natural history of hepatitis b virus infection is not uniform and affected from several factor including hbv genotype genotype d is a widely distributed genotype among genotype d several subgenotypes differentiate epidemiologically and probably clinically d1 is predominant in middle east and north africa and characterized by early hbeag seroconversion and low viral load d2 is seen in albania turkey brazil western india lebanon and serbia d3 wa reported from serbia western india and indonesia it is a predominant subgenotype in injection drug userelated acute hbv infection in europe and canada d4 is relatively rare and reported from haiti russia and baltic region brazil kenya morocco and rwanda subgenotype d5 seems to be common in eastern india d6 ha been reported a a rare subgenotype from indonesia kenya russia and baltic region d7 is the main genotype in morocco and tunisia d8 and d9 are recently described subgenotypes and reported from niger and india respectively subgenotypes of genotype d may have clinical andor viral difference more subgenotype study are required to conclude on subgenotype and it clinicalviral characteristic

processed_title: update on organoid model for the study of liver cancer
processed_abstract: liver cancer remains one of the most common cancer worldwide with limited therapy option the main risk factor for hepatocellular carcinoma hcc the most common form of liver cancer include chronic infection with hepatitis b or hepatitis c virus alcohol abuse and metabolic disease current systemic therapy for advanced hccs have greatly improved in the last decade but there is still a need to develop more targeted drug therapy for hccs the development of liver organoids a selforganising and selfrenewal threedimensional cell culture model ha greatly improved cancer research including liver cancer the generation of liver organoids provides a physiologically relevant model to study cancer drug screening and development personalized medicine liver disease modeling and liver regeneration however the advent of organoid development also come with few shortcoming that must be overcome including the high cost of the model the availability of origin tissue and the need for multilineage liver organoids to replicate the true cellular heterogeneity of the liver despite all the limitation liver organoids provide a reliable in vitro model for translational application to develop more effective hcc therapy and to understand the underlying pathogenic mechanism in various liver disease

processed_title: prevalence risk factor and clinical profile of hepatitis d virus in nigeria a systematic review 20092024
processed_abstract: background the world health organization who recommends hepatitis d virus hdv screening among hepatitis b virus hbv infected individual with a focus on priority population in resourcelimited setting like nigeria hdv infection is a growing public health challenge particularly among individual with chronic hepatitis b virus hbv infection hdv accelerates liver disease progression and significantly increase the risk of cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma despite this the epidemiology of hdv in nigeria remains inadequately documented this scoping review critically evaluates the prevalence risk factor and clinical outcome of hdv coinfection among hbv patient in nigeria method we conducted a systematic review following preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma 2020 guideline the review included observational crosssectional study published between 2009 and 2024 we focused on study that used immunoglobulin g igg antibody testing or rnabased diagnostics to assess hdv prevalence we included pubmed google scholar and dimension database due to their broad indexing and coverage of peerreviewed article and accessibility we screened the study for their relevance to hdv prevalence risk factor and clinical outcome while excluding those that only tested for igm or hdv antigen eleven study with a combined sample size of 2308 participant were included in the final analysis we performed a narrative synthesis of the finding considering geographic gender and agebased variation in hdv prevalence and clinical impact result hdv prevalence among hbvinfected individual in nigeria ranged from 20 to 316 the highest prevalence wa reported in the southwest 316 among malaria patient while lower rate were observed in the southeast 28 prevalence wa higher in male particularly those aged 2130 year in the southwest and 3140 year in other region rnabased testing provided more accurate data on active viremia with viremic hdv prevalence rate ranging from 32 to 16 triple infection with hivhbvhdv wa associated with significantly lower cd4 cell count and worse clinical outcome including elevated liver enzyme and rapid progression to liver cancer key risk factor for hdv coinfection included multiple sexual partner sharing of needle and unsafe medical practice coinfected patient demonstrated worse clinical outcome such a elevated liver enzyme decompensated cirrhosis and higher rate of hepatocellular carcinoma conclusion our review underscore the urgent need for routine hdv screening among hbv patient in nigeria especially given the severe clinical consequence of coinfection the recent who guideline recommending hdv screening align with our finding which emphasize the importance of rnabased hdv testing among hbvpositive patient to improve diagnostic accuracy public health effort should prioritize tailored intervention based on geographic age and gender disparity in hdv prevalence triple infection with
