hivhbvhdv requires integrated care model to address both immune suppression a indicated by diminished cd4 cell count and liver disease progression a these patient face worse outcome targeted hdv screening in mostly affected demographic and geography and improved nigeria capacity for cheaper hdv rnapcr diagnostics can reduce liverrelated morbidity and mortality caused by hbv which can be worsened and accelerated by hdv coinfection

processed_title: association of tolllike receptor 2 tlr2 expression in placenta and intrauterine exposure to hepatitis b virus
processed_abstract: introduction the placenta is a specialized organ that only performs during pregnancy and serf a an immunological barrier in preventing pathogen to reach the fetus it ha been known that tolllike receptor tlrs on the placenta respond to antigen such a zymosan lipopolysaccharide and other viral infection this study analyzes the distribution of tlr2 protein and hepatitis b dna virus hbv dna virus identification to gain an understanding of hepatitis b viral transmission from the mother to child method we performed enzymelinked immunoadsorbent assay of hbeag hbsag titer antihbs and antihbc to 59 hbsagpositive pregnant woman and identified hbv dna using nested pcr in their cord blood during delivery for evidence of exposure to hbv dna the expression of tlr2 protein in the placenta wa performed using immunohistochemistry analysis result intrauterine exposure to the hepatitis b virus occurred in 695 of all pregnant woman who were hbsag positive tlr2 expression wa predominantly identified in syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast cell with the highest score in mother aged 2035 year 75 multigravida 583 and mother with term pregnancy 708 statistical analysis result showed that placental tlr2 expression did not indicate any association with hepatitis b virus dna identified in cord blood with a p value of 0730 and an or of 0650 95 ci 01732440 conclusion tlr2 expression is not associated with intrauterine exposure of hepatitis b virus

processed_title: current prevalence of hepatitis b infection among parturient woman in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to determine the current prevalence of hepatitis b infection among parturient woman in jakarta indonesia method a crosssectional study wa conducted in woman giving birth between may and july 2009 recruited by consecutive sampling technique in 2 hospital and 13 public health center in jakarta mother with history of chronic liver disease were excluded data were collected by questionnaire including obstetric history hepatitis b immunization history and the presence of jaundice maternal venous blood sample were taken before parturition for hbsag determination that wa performed by elisa result of 1009 parturient woman screened for hepatitis b infection 22 were found positive giving an overall hepatitis b prevalence of 22 previous 52 in 1985 none of the subject had any symptom of hbv infection the highest hbsag prevalence wa found in the east jakarta study site with predominance in mother aged 20 year and those with multiparities conclusion present prevalence of hbsag among indonesian parturient woman in jakarta wa 22 and markedly reduced compared with prevalence in 1985

processed_title: association between serum cytotoxic t lymphocyte antigen ctla4 level and disease progression in patient with chronic hepatitis b
processed_abstract: backgroud immune impairment marked by increased expression of cytotoxic t lymphocyte antigen ctla4 promotes the disease progression of chronic hepatitis b objective this study aimed to determine the association between serum ctla4 level and disease progression in patient with chronic hepatitis b method a crosssectional study wa conducted at haji adam malik general hospital medan indonesia between october 2021 to september 2022 a total of 150 participant were enrolled patient aged 18 year or older with evidence of chronic hepatitis b hbvrelated liver cirrhosis and hbvrelated hepatocellular carcinoma hcc were enrolled exclusion criterion were history of chronic hepatotoxic drug consumption underlying liver abnormality other than hbv infection and liver injury due to metastasized malignancy from other site serum ctla4 level wa determined from serum using human ctla4 enzyme linked immunosorbent assay kit result most participant were male and aged between 40 and 60 year serum ctla4 level wa positively associated with chronic hepatitis b progression p0001 serum ctla4 level wa negatively correlated with serum platelet p0001 and albumin level p0001 but positively correlated with serum alt p0045 and total bilirubin level p0001 conclusion serum ctla4 level is associated with disease progression in patient with chronic hepatitis b

processed_title: comparison of immunogenicity and safety of diphtheriatetanuspertussishepatitis bhaemophilus influenza b bio farma with pentabior vaccine primed with recombinant hepatitis b at birth using different source of hepatitis b in indonesian infant
processed_abstract: satisfying the need of the national immunization program requires maintaining diphtheriatetanuspertussis dtphepatitis b hbhaemophilus influenza b hib production therefore new hepatitis b source are needed this study aimed to evaluate the immunogenicity of the dtphbhib vaccine bio farma that used a different source of hepatitis b a prospective randomized doubleblind bridging study wa conducted subject were divided into two group with different batch number healthy infant 611 week of age at enrollment were immunized with three dos of the dtphbhib vaccine after a birth dose of hepatitis b vaccine blood sample were obtained prior to vaccination and 28 day after the third dose adverse event were recorded until 28 day after each dose of the 220 subject 205 932 completed the study protocol the proportion of infant with antidiphtheria and antitetanus titer 001 iuml wa 100 with antihbsag titer 10 miuml wa 100 and with polyribosylribitol phosphatetetanus conjugate prptt titer 015 microgml wa 961 the pertussis response rate wa 849 no serious adverse event related to the study vaccine occurred the threedose dtphbhib vaccine bio farma is immunogenic well tolerated and suitable to replace licensedequivalent vaccine

processed_title: high prevalence of hepatitis b virus infection in young adult in ternate eastern indonesia
processed_abstract: the incidence of hepatitis b virus hbv infection ha been declining thanks to the universal hepatitis b infant immunization program nevertheless young adult born before the program implementation might have acquired hbv in early childhood or remain susceptible to infection this study aimed to evaluate hepatitis b epidemiology in asymptomatic young adult population in ternate eastern indonesia serum sample of 376 subject aged 1725 mean 1982 169 year malefemale 138238 were screened for hbv parameter serologically hbv surface antigen hbsag it antibody antihbs anticore antigen antihbc and molecularly hbv dna hbsag antihbc antihbs and hbv dna prevalence were 157 362 242 and 279 respectively with male predominance of all subject 130 were hbsag negative with detectable hbv dna occult hepatitis b ohb and 564 showed negativity for all seromarkers this population showed high hepatitis b prevalence with substantial occurrence of ohb however a high percentage of the population were still susceptible and at risk of hbv infection this study emphasizes the necessity to improve prevention strategy to screen and manage hbv carrier including the adoption of catchup or booster vaccination targeted to young adult population investigation on the role of hostvirus interaction associated with ohb and it implication are warranted

processed_title: hepatitis b virus infection in child of hbvrelated chronic liver disease patient a study of intrafamilial hbv transmission
processed_abstract: background hbvinfected patient are potential source of intrafamilial transmission we studied hbv transmission and molecular characteristic within family of hbvrelated chronic liver disease cld patient method family member index case ic spouse and 118yearold child of hbvrelated cld patient were tested for hbsag antihbc and antihbs hbsagpositive subject were tested for hbeagantihbe antihbcpositive child together with their family member were further investigated for hbv dna sequence of positive isolates were analyzed over surface precore pc and basal core promoter bcp region result among 94 child of 46 ic the prevalence of hbsag antihbc and antihbs wa 10 106 19 202 and 46 489 respectively thirtyeight 404 child were seronegative indicating susceptibility to hbv infection hbv dna wa identified in all ic 4 spouse and 16 child having both parent with hbsag positive and at least two hbv carrier in the household were significant risk factor of intrafamilial transmission hbv genotypesubtype distribution were comparable between child and icsspouses with predominance of genotype b the majority of hbv dna sequence found in child were identical to their corresponding icsparticularly mothersincluding mutation pattern in the surface pc and bcp region recognized mutation associated with hbsag detection andor vaccination failure t140i t143sm g145r and y161f were identified in 20 subject while mutation linked to hbeagdefective variant pc g1896a and bcp a1762tg1764a were found in 7 and 11 subject respectively conclusion child of hbvrelated cld patient were at increased risk of hbv infection through multimodal transmission route despite negative parental hbsag and hbeag status

processed_title: a cautionary note to hepatitis b e antigen hbeagnegative test result in pregnant woman in an area prevalent of hbeagnegative chronic hepatitis b
processed_abstract: maternal hepatitis b e antigen hbeag positivity pose a risk for hepatitis b virus hbv mothertochild transmission mtct in resourceconstrained setting hbeag testing is recommended a an alternative to hbv dna testing to establish antiviral prophylaxis eligibility nevertheless the high prevalence of hbeagnegative chronic hepatitis b echb in many country should not be overlooked we studied hbv characteristic and explored the potential mtct risk among hbeagnegativehbsagpositive expectant mother in an area prevalent of echb among 1348 pregnant mother screened for hbv infection 81 60 were hbsagpositive these woman were examined for hbeag hbv dna and cord blood hbv dna sixteen 198 of the hbsagpositive mother were hbeagpositive whereas 65 802 were hbeagnegative including eight inactive carrier hbsag 100 iuml hbv dna 2000 iuml and alt 40 iul of the remaining 57 hbeagnegative mother ten revealed hbv basal core promoter or precore mutation with three having high viremia hbv dna 200 000 iuml which is associated with a high mtct risk and therefore qualifies them for antiviral prophylaxis this pilot study provides a cautionary note to the interpretation of negative hbeag test result when determining eligibility for mtct antiviral prophylaxis in situation with limited resource and in region where echb is prevalent

processed_title: antituberculosis druginduced liver injury in patient with hepatitis b and cirrhosis a case report
processed_abstract: background pulmonary tuberculosis patient infected with hepatitis b are at high risk for druginduced liver injury case presentation a 42yearold indonesian female complained of sclera icterus teacolored urine vomiting dyspnea and swollen stomach and leg the patient experienced this condition after taking antituberculosis drug for five day her medical history showed hepatitis b and cirrhosis followup examination included chest xray and genexpert supported a diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis however abdominal ultrasonography indicated ascites and cirrhosis we diagnosed the patient with antituberculosis dili cirrhosis childpugh c score 12 related to hepatitis b and pulmonary tuberculosis we decided to stop the antituberculosis drug we treated the patient using tenofovir hepatoprotective drug diuretic and albumin infusion on the third day the patient received new antituberculosis drug including levofloxacin 750 mg ethambutol 1000 mg and streptomycin 1000 mg le the patient condition then gradually improved discussion the dilemma of treating tuberculosis in liver disease is treating tuberculosis without ignoring hepatitis b and cirrhosis conclusion administration of antituberculosis drug based on liver tolerance of hepatotoxic drug in patient with hepatitis b and cirrhosis

processed_title: development of chimeric hepatitis b hbv norovirus nov p particle a candidate vaccine against hepatitis b and norovirus infection
processed_abstract: introduction hepatitis b remains a global problem with no effective treatment here a mucosal vaccine candidate wa developed with hbsag and hbcag to provide both prophylactic and therapeutic protection against hepatitis b the antigen were presented using the p particle of human norovirus hunov a a result the chimeric hbv hunov p particle can act a a dual vaccine for hepatitis b and hunov method the vaccine candidate wa expressed and purified from escherichia coli bl21 de3 cell hbvhunov chimeric p particle were successfully expressed and isolated with size of approximately 2564 nm then the hbvhunov chimeric p particle were evaluated for safety and immunogenicity in mouse and gnotobiotic gn pig after three dos 5 microgdose in mouse and 200 microgdose in gn pig of intranasal immunization humoral and cellular immune response a well a toxicity were evaluated result the vaccine candidate induced strong hbvhunov specific ifngamma producing tcell response in the ileum spleen and blood of gn pig serum igg and iga antibody against hbvhunov chimeric p particle also increased significantly in gn pig increased hbsag and hunovspecific serum igg response were observed in mouse and gn pig although not statistically significant the vaccine candidate did not show any toxicity in mouse conclusion in summary the chimeric hbvhunov p particle vaccine given intranasally wa safe and induced strong cellular and humoral immune response in gn pig modification to the vaccine structure and dosage need to be evaluated in future study to further enhance immunogenicity and induce more balanced humoral and cellular response

processed_title: correlation between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level in hepatitis b e antigenpositive and hepatitis b e antigennegative chronic hepatitis b patient
processed_abstract: background this study aimed to analyze the relationship between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid in hepatitis b e antigenpositive and hepatitis b e antigennegative chronic hepatitis b patient and to determine the best cutoff value for quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen to predict high hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level 2000 iuml method ninetyseven serum from chronic hepatitis b patient were collected in this study hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level were quantified by realtime polymerase chain reaction quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b e antigen level were determined by twosite sandwich chemiluminescence immunoassay alanine transaminase level were measured by the international federation of clinical chemistryapproved method result a significant correlation between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level wa observed in hepatitis b e antigenpositive group r 0453 p 002 but not in hepatitis b e antigennegative group r 0117 p 454 no significant correlation between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and alanine transaminase wa found in the hepatitis b e antigenpositive group r 0521 p 241 however a significant correlation wa shown between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and alanine transaminase level in the hepatitis b e antigennegative group r 0455 p 001 the best cutoff value of quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen for predicting high hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level wa 3422 x 103 iuml conclusion correlation between quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level is significant in the hepatitis b e antigenpositive group quantitative hepatitis b surface antigen can be used to predict high hepatitis b virus deoxyribonucleic acid level in the hepatitis b e antigenpositive group

processed_title: hepatitis b risk and immunisation coverage amongst australian travelling to southeast asia and east asia
processed_abstract: background southeast asia and east asia are regarded a highly endemic region for hepatitis b virus hbv and include many popular destination for australian traveller the objective of this survey were to evaluate the extent of pretravel health advice the prevalence of behaviour with hbv infection risk and the prevalence of hbv vaccination amongst australian traveller to southeast asia and east asia method in 2004 a telephone survey wa conducted amongst australian who had travelled overseas to southeast asia and east asia in the past three year for three night or more result three hundred and nine traveller aged 14 year and over completed the interview including 138 male 45 and 171 female 55 respondent travelled for leisure 64 business 20 and visiting friend and relative vfr 16 the most common destination were indonesia 34 thailand 32 and china 27 about half of the traveller 54 sought vaccination specific health advice before travel of which about half 56 had sought this advice more than six week before travel just over one quarter of traveller reported receiving hbv vaccination 28 of whom most 70 were vaccinated at least three week before travel about half of the traveller 49 had participated in at least one activity with hbv risk during their last overseas trip of those traveller aged 18 year and over who either had no hbv vaccination or who were unsure about half 49 had participated in at least one activity with hbv risk during their last overseas trip conclusion australian traveller to southeast asia and east asia commonly undertake activity with a risk of exposure to hbv hepatitis b vaccination coverage amongst this group remains low it is important that traveller to this region seek travel health advice from a qualified source which will include a risk assessment for hepatitis b vaccination

processed_title: seroprevalence of hepatitis b among hivinfected child and adolescent receiving antiretroviral therapy in the treat asia pediatric hiv observational database
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b hbvhiv coinfection is associated with liver inflammation which can progress to liver fibrosiscirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma we determined hbv seroprevalence in child and adolescent participating in the treat asia pediatric hiv observational database method a multisite crosssectional study wa conducted in hivinfected patient currently 25 year old receiving antiretroviral treatment art who had hbv surface antigen hbsag or hbv surface antibody antihbs or hbv core antibody antihbc tested during 20122013 hbv coinfection wa defined a having either a positive hbsag test or being antihbc positive and antihbs negative reflective of past hbv infection hbv seroprotection wa defined a having a positive antihbs test result a total of 3380 patient from 6 country vietnam thailand cambodia malaysia indonesia and india were included the current median interquartile range age wa 112 78151 year of the 2755 patient 815 with hbsag testing 130 47 were positive of 1558 46 with antihbc testing 77 49 were positive thirteen of 1037 patient with all 3 test were antihbc positive and hbsag and antihbs negative one child wa positive for antihbc and negative for antihbs but did not have hbsag tested the prevalence of hbv coinfection wa 1442759 52 95 confidence interval 4461 of 1093 patient 32 with antihbs testing 257 235 confidence interval 210260 had positive test representing hbv seroprotection conclusion the estimated prevalence of hbv coinfection in this cohort of asian hivinfected child and adolescent on art wa 52 the majority of child and adolescent tested in this cohort 765 did not have protective hbv antibody the finding support hbv screening of hivinfected child and adolescent to guide revaccination the use of art with antihbv activity and future monitoring

processed_title: hepatitis b and c coinfection in hiv patient from the treat asia hiv observational database analysis of risk factor and survival
processed_abstract: background we assessed the effect of hepatitis b hbv or hepatitis c hcv coinfection on outcome of antiretroviral therapy art in hivinfected patient enrolled in the treat asia hiv observational database tahod a multicenter cohort of hivinfected patient in the asiapacific region method patient testing hb antigen ag or hcv antibody ab positive within enrollment into tahod were considered hbv or hcv coinfected factor associated with hbv andor hcv coinfection were assessed by logistic regression model factor associated with postart hiv immunological response cd4 change after six month and virological response hiv rna 400 copiesml after 12 month were also determined survival wa assessed by the kaplanmeier method and log rank test result a total of 7455 subject were recruited by december 2012 of patient tested 5915656 104 were hbsag positive 7945215 152 were hcvab positive and 884966 18 were positive for both marker in multivariate analysis hcv coinfection age route of hiv infection baseline cd4 count baseline hiv rna and hiv1 subtype were associated with immunological recovery age route of hiv infection baseline cd4 count baseline hiv rna art regimen prior art and hiv1 subtype but not hbv or hcv coinfection affected hiv rna suppression risk factor affecting mortality included hcv coinfection age cdc stage baseline cd4 count baseline hiv rna and prior monodual art shortest survival wa seen in subject who were both hbv and hcvpositive conclusion in this asian cohort of hivinfected patient hcv coinfection but not hbv coinfection wa associated with lower cd4 cell recovery after art and increased mortality

processed_title: hepatitis b and c virus infection among hemodialysis patient in yogyakarta indonesia prevalence and molecular evidence for nosocomial transmission
processed_abstract: hemodialysis patient are at an increased risk of acquiring hepatitis b virus hbv and hepatitis c virus hcv infection however the prevalence of hepatitis viral infection and it genotype distribution among hemodialysis patient in indonesia are unclear in order to investigate these issue and the possibility of nosocomial transmission 161 hemodialysis patient and 35 staff member at one of the hemodialysis unit in yogyakarta indonesia were tested for serological and virological marker of both virus hbv surface antigen hbsag wa detected in 18 patient 112 and in two staff member 57 antihcv wa detected in 130 patient 807 but not in any staff member occult hbv and hcv infection were detected in 21 147 and 4 129 patient respectively the overall prevalence rate of hbv and hcv infection among patient were 242 and 832 respectively hcv infection wa independently associated with hemodialysis duration and the number of blood transfusion phylogenetic analysis revealed that 23 of 39 tested hbv strain 59 were genotype b 11 282 were genotype c and 5 128 were genotype a hcv genotype 1a wa dominant 95 among 100 tested hcv strain nosocomial transmission wa suspected because the genotype distribution differed from that of the general population in indonesia and because the viral genome of several strain were identical these finding suggest that hbv and hcv infection is common among hemodialysis patient in yogyakarta and probably occurs through nosocomial infection implementation of strict infectioncontrol program is necessary in hemodialysis unit in indonesia

processed_title: hepatitis a virus declining seroprevalence in child and adolescent in southeast asia
processed_abstract: the prevalence of hepatitis a virus hav in a country largely reflects it standard of hygiene and socioeconomic condition country which undergo socioeconomic development show major change in hav prevalence from high to low endemicity and this is largely reflected in pattern of agerelated seroprevalence this paper present agerelated hav seroprevalence pattern of se asian country and highlight how these pattern have changed over recent decade singapore thailand and malaysia have experienced a decline in childhood and adolescent hav seroprevalence typical of country which undergo socioeconomic development by contrast india ha remained a country of high endemicity with almost universal seroconversion in childhood the philippine and vietnam show agerelated seroprevalence pattern typical of high to moderate endemicity while indonesia show significant regional variation in hav seroprevalence population within country which exhibit major improvement in endemicity and age related hav seroprevalence pattern are at risk of hav epidemic and a paradoxical increase in incidence tends to occur a seroconversion shift from child to adult the resident of these country a significant number of whom are atrisk would benefit from a program of vaccination a would noninfected individual visiting highrisk area

processed_title: viral hepatitis and human immunodeficiency virus coinfections in asia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv hepatitis c virus hcv and human immunodeficiency virus hiv affect many people in asian country although there are geographic difference both hbv and hiv hbvhiv and hcvhiv coinfections are highly prevalent in asia hetero and homosexual injection drug use and geographic area are strong predictor of hbv hcv and hiv serostatus in hbv endemic region the prevalence and genotype distribution of hbvhiv coinfection is almost comparable with that in the general population in japan where hbv ha low endemicity the prevalence of hbvhiv coinfection is approximately 10fold higher than that in the general population and hbv ae is the most common subgenotype among hiv infected individual highly active antiretroviral therapy haart is an effective treatment for hivacquired immune deficiency syndrome lamivudine a component of haart is an effective treatment for hbv hiv and hbvhiv coinfection however cost emerging drug resistance antiretroviralassociated liver toxicity and liverrelated morbidity due to hcv progression are particular concern hcvhiv coinfection may accelerate the clinical progression of both hcv and hiv the high prevalence of hbvhiv and hcvhiv coinfections in asia underscore the need to improve prevention and control measure a fewer evidencebased prevention strategy are available compared with western country in this review the most recent publication on the prevalence of hbvhiv and hcvhiv coinfections and related issue such a therapy and problem in asia are updated and summarized

processed_title: a nationwide molecular epidemiological study on hepatitis b virus in indonesia identification of two novel subgenotypes b8 and c7
processed_abstract: upon phylogenetic analysis of a partial s gene sequence 396 nucleotide nt 928 hepatitis b virus hbv strain obtained from 899 viremic subject in 28 major city on 15 island of indonesia in 19892007 segregated into four hbv genotype genotype b wa predominant 66 followed by genotype c 26 genotype d 7 and genotype a 08 comparative and phylogenetic analysis of the 396nt s gene sequence of 928 hbv isolates and whole genomic sequence of 25 selected hbv isolates revealed a total of 14 subgenotypes within genotype ad two a1 and a2 in genotype a hbva five b2 b3 b5 b7 and a novel subgenotype tentatively designated b8 in hbvb five c1 c2 c5 c6 and another novel subgenotype c7 in hbvc and two d1 and d3 in hbvd the distribution of hbv genotypessubgenotypes including b8 and c7 seems to be associated with ethnological origin in indonesia

processed_title: klrg1 natural killer cell exert a novel antifibrotic function in chronic hepatitis b
processed_abstract: background aim natural killer nk cell are known to exert strong antiviral activity killer cell lectinlike receptor subfamily g member 1 klrg1 is expressed by terminally differentiated nk cell and klrg1expressing lymphocyte are known to expand following chronic viral infection we aimed to elucidate the previously unknown role of klrg1 in the pathogenesis of chronic hepatitis b chb method klrg1 nk cell were taken from the blood and liver of healthy individual and patient with chb the phenotype and function of these cell wa assessed using flow cytometry and in vitro stimulation result patient with chb had a higher frequency of klrg1 nk cell compared to healthy control blood 134 v 23 p 00001 and liver 234 v 26 p 001 klrg1 nk cell were less responsive to k562 and cytokine stimulation but demonstrated enhanced cytotoxicity 90 v 48 p 005 and ifngamma release 80 v 15 p 005 via antibody dependent cellular cytotoxicity compared to their klrg1 counterpart klrg1 nk cell possessed a mature phenotype demonstrating stronger cytolytic activity and ifngamma secretion against hepatic stellate cell hscs than klrg1 nk cell moreover klrg1 nk cell more effectively induced primary hsc apoptosis in a traildependent manner increased klrg1 nk cell frequency in the liver and blood wa associated with lower fibrosis stage f0f1 in patient with chb finally the expression of cd44 degranulation and ifngamma production were all increased in klrg1 nk cell following stimulation with osteopontin the cd44 ligand suggesting that hscderived osteopontin may cause klrg1 nk cell activation conclusion klrg1 nk cell likely play an antifibrotic role during the natural course of chb infection harnessing this antifibrotic function may provide a novel therapeutic approach to treat liver fibrosis in patient with chb lay summary individual that are chronically infected with hepatitis b virus hbv possess an increased number of immune cell called natural killer nk cell expressing the surface marker klrg1 in the blood and liver here we demonstrate that these specific nk cell are able to kill activated stellate cell in the liver because activated stellate cell contribute to liver scarring ie fibrosis and subsequent liver dysfunction in individual with chronic hbv infection klrg1 nk cell are a novel immune cell type that can limit liver scarring

processed_title: analysis of hepatitis b virus genotype and gene mutation in patient with advanced liver disease in east kalimantan indonesia
processed_abstract: liver cirrhosis lc and hepatocellular carcinoma hcc are lifethreatening condition frequently associated with chronic hepatitis b virus hbv infection in asian country including indonesia hbv genotype and several specific mutation are associated with disease progression to clarify the geographical variation in viral characteristic hbv genotype and gene mutation were investigated in patient with advanced liver disease ald in samarinda east kalimantan indonesia serum were collected from 41 patient with ald at abdul wahab sjahranie hospital and hbv carrier from red cross center blood bank in samarinda and screened for hepatitis b surface antigen and hepatitis b eantigen liver function data were obtained from the medical record from each patient hbv genotype and gene mutation were determined by polymerase chain reaction sequencing analysis of hbv isolates indicated that genotype b wa the most frequent genotype at 854 and 978 followed by c at 146 and 22 in patient with ald and in hbv carrier respectively the c1505a mutation in x region t1753v and a1762tg1764a mutation in the basal core promoter region and c1858t in precore pc region were frequent and only detected in patient with ald 289 40 735 and 176 respectively whereas the g1896a mutation in the pc region wa frequently detected in hbv carrier the presence of hbv genotype b and certain hbv gene mutation were characteristic of patient with ald in east kalimantan

processed_title: molecular epidemiology of hepatitis a outbreak in two district in indonesia in 2018 same subtype but different strain
processed_abstract: the present study aimed to analyse molecular epidemiological data from hepatitis a virus hav outbreak in two affected area the association between the knowledge of hepatitis a and incidence of infection wa also determined serum sample were obtained from 88 individual with clinical manifestation of acute hepatitis in lamongan n54 in january 2018 and bangkalan n34 in march 2018 the outbreak investigation wa started one day after the outbreak were reported by the public health office in lamongan and bangkalan antihav immunoglobulin m igm and pcr amplification product of the vp1 capsid proteinp2a protease and vp1vp3 junction were analysed positive pcr product were sequenced and a phylogenetic tree wa constructed using molecular evolutionary genetics analysis x software the control group comprised healthy student and staff member from the two affected area thus 172 response from the control and hepatitis a case group were analysed to assess the association between the student knowledge level and the incidence of hav infection a total of 32 5925 of the 54 individual from lamongan and 19 559 of the 34 participant from bangkalan were positive for antihav igm 26 pcr test were positive in the vp3vp1 andor vp1p2a junction which were identified a hav subgenotype ia the subtype of hav in the two area wa ia similar to those identified previously but the virus did not originate from the same strain a identified by multiple alignment the knowledge level of the student and staff member in lamongan studying and working at a halfday school exhibited a significant association with the incidence however no association wa observed among the student in bangkalan studying at a fullday school with a dormitory

processed_title: hepatitis b and c virus infection in ujung pandang indonesia
processed_abstract: a survey wa performed to investigate hbv and hcv infection in ujung pandang the total number of subject wa 406 196 blood donor 78 case of acute hepatitis 43 of chronic hepatitis 58 of liver cirrhosis and 31 of hepatocellular carcinoma case hbsag antihbs and antihbc a hbv marker and antihcv elisa ortho a an hcv marker were tested positive rate of hbsag and anti hcv among blood donor were 71 and 31 respectively and there wa no significant difference among age group donor negative for all viral marker accounted for 214 of acute hepatitis case 18 231 case were hepatitis a and 8 103 case were hepatitis b one case of which wa considered to be double infection acute exacerbation case of hbv carrier were 16 205 of which 6 case were positive for hcv antibody those diagnosed nona nonb hepatitis were 37 474 of which 3 case where positive for hcv antibody blood sample from all of acute hepatitis case were obtained within 1 week after onset of the disease thus it wa not possible to accurately assess prevalence of hepatitis c positive rate on hbsag among chronic hepatitis liver cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma were 254 328 and 355 respectively while those for hcv antibody were 163 431 and 355 respectively positive rate of hbsag and hcv antibody for overall chronic liver disease were 311 and 326 and 14 106 were positive for both marker

processed_title: global regulatory reform to promote equitable vaccine access in the next pandemic
processed_abstract: there is broad consensus that the global response to the covid19 pandemic wa inadequate leading to unacceptable level of avoidable morbidity and mortality three strategic misstep led to the lack of equitable vaccine access the heavy reliance on commercial vaccine manufacturer in highincome country hics versus low and middleincome country lmics the emergence of vaccine nationalism restricting and delaying the supply of vaccine to lmics and an inadequate support or recognition for lmic national regulatory authority to avoid these inequity in a future pandemic we focus on three successful vaccine development and technology transfer case studiesthe hepatitis b vaccine produced in south korea in the 1980s the meningitis a vaccine for africa led by program for appropriate technology in health path and the world health organization who in the 2000s and a recombinant sars cov2 proteinbased vaccine technology from the texas childrens hospital transferred to india and to indonesia in addition to expanding support for academic or nonprofit product development partnership our analysis find that an essential step is the strengthening of selected lmic regulatory system to become stringent regulatory authority sras together with a reprioritization of the who prequalification pq system to ensure early vaccine availability in lmics especially during pandemic advancing lmic national regulatory authority nra to stringent regulatory authority sras status will require substantial resource but the benefit for future pandemic control and for health in lmic would be immense we call on the who united nation un agency and sras to collaborate and implement a comprehensive roadmap to support lmic regulator to achieve stringent status by 2030

processed_title: role of hepatitis b virus in development of hepatocellular carcinoma focus on covalently closed circular dna
processed_abstract: chronic infection with hepatitis b virus hbv remains a major global health problem especially in developing country it may lead to prolonged liver damage fibrosis cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma persistent chronic hbv infection is related to host immune response and the stability of the covalently closed circular dna cccdna in human hepatocytes in addition to being essential for viral transcription and replication cccdna is also suspected to play a role in persistent hbv infection or hepatitis relapse since cccdna is very stable in nondividing human hepatocytes understanding the pathogenicity and oncogenicity of hbv component would be essential in the development of new diagnostic tool and treatment strategy this review summarizes the role and molecular mechanism of hbv cccdna in hepatocyte transformation and hepatocarcinogenesis and current effort to it detection and targeting

processed_title: recent advance of hepatitis b detection towards paperbased analytical device
processed_abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv still remains a major global public health problem onehalf to onethird of the total hbv infected people died due to late detection of hbv serological antigen and viral hbv detection can help in the diagnosis referral and treatment of hbv available method for hbv detection mostly used bulky instrument miniaturization of device for hbv detection ha been started by narrowing down the size of the device several method have also been proposed to increase the selectivity and sensitivity of the miniaturized method such a sandwich recognition of the biomarkers and the use of nano to microsized material this review present recent hbv detection in the last two decade from laboratorybased instrument towards microfluidic paperbased analytical device micropads for pointofcare testing poct purpose early and routine analysis to detect hbv a early a possible could be achieved by poct especially for area with limited access to a central laboratory andor medical facility

processed_title: indonesia country report on childrens environmental health
processed_abstract: childrens body are in dynamic stage of development that make them more susceptible to harm from exposure to environmental agent childrens physical physiological and behavioral trait can lead to increased exposure to toxic chemical or pathogen in addition the social determinant of health interact with this exposure and create an increasing risk for further disparity among child in indonesia the fourth most populated country in the world child are under threat of exposure to contaminated water air food and soil which can cause gastrointestinal and respiratory disease birth defect and neurodevelopmental disorder a safe and balanced nutrition is still an unmet need for too many child at the same time the prevalence of obesity and the risk of later development of metabolic disease including diabetes and cardiovascular disease are increasing a a consequence of both unhealthy diet and inadequate physical activity the risk of potential longterm toxicity including carcinogenic neurotoxic immunotoxic genotoxic endocrinedisrupting and allergenic effect of many chemical are also close to their life this paper provides an overview of common disease risk in indonesian child including acute hepatitis a diarrheal disease dengue and malaria due to lack of water supply and sanitation vector and parasite asthma bronchopneumonia chronic obstructive pulmonary disease copd and acute respiratory infection aris due to air pollution and climate change some chronic disease caused by toxic and hazardous waste and direct or indirect consequence due to the occurrence of disaster and health emergency

processed_title: oxidative stress sensor keap1 recognizes hbx protein to activate the nrf2are signaling pathway thereby inhibiting hepatitis b virus replication
processed_abstract: the kelchlike echassociated protein 1 keap1nfe2related factor 2 nrf2antioxidant response element are signaling pathway is one of the most important defense mechanism against oxidative stress we previously reported that a cellular hydrogen peroxide scavenger protein peroxiredoxin 1 a target gene of transcription factor nrf2 act a a novel hbv x protein hbxinteracting protein and negatively regulates hepatitis b virus hbv propagation through degradation of hbv rna this study further demonstrates that the nrf2are signaling pathway is activated during hbv infection eventually leading to the suppression of hbv replication we provide evidence suggesting that keap1 interacts with hbx leading to nrf2 activation and inhibition of hbv replication via suppression of hbv core promoter activity this study raise the possibility that activation of the nrf2are signaling pathway is a potential therapeutic strategy against hbv our finding may contribute to an improved understanding of the negative regulation of hbv replication by the antioxidant response

processed_title: hepatitis b virus subtypes and hepatitis c virus genotype in patient with chronic liver disease or on maintenance hemodialysis in indonesia
processed_abstract: hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag and hepatitis c virus hcv rna were surveyed in patient in yogyakarta indonesia and their subtypes and genotype were determined by serological method and polymerase chain reaction with typespecific primer respectively of 149 patient with chronic liver disease including 24 with chronic hepatitis 86 with liver cirrhosis and 39 with primary hepatocellular carcinoma hbsag wa detected in 40 27 and hcv rna in 48 32 one patient wa positive both for hbsag and hcv rna thus the cause of chronic liver disease wa not identified in 62 42 patient of 58 patient on maintenance hemodialysis four 7 were positive for hbsag and 44 76 for hcv rna subtype adw wa found in 34 74 of 46 hbsag sample and adr in five 11 compound subtypes such a adyw and adyr were detected in the remaining seven 15 among hcv rna sample from 48 patient with chronic liver disease 23 48 were of genotype ii 17 35 of genotype iii and one 2 of genotype v in a distribution strikingly different from that of 44 sample from patient on maintenance hemodialysis 39 89 of which were of genotype i and only one 2 of genotype ii genotype were not classifiable in seven 15 patient with liver disease and four 9 patient on hemodialysis despite high hcv rna titer in them all these result indicate that different hcv genotype prevail in patient with distinct disease a well a unclassifiable hcv genotype in indonesia

processed_title: cccdna epigenetic regulator a target for therapeutical vaccine development against hepatitis b
processed_abstract: chronic hepatitis b virus infection chb remains a global health concern with currently available antiviral therapy demonstrating limited effectiveness in preventing hepatocellular carcinoma hcc development two primary challenge in chb treatment include the persistence of the minichromosome covalently closed circular dna cccdna of the hepatitis b virus hbv and the failure of the host immune response to eliminate cccdna recent finding indicate several host and hbv protein involved in the epigenetic regulation of cccdna including hbv core protein hbc and hbv x protein hbx both protein might contribute to the stability of the cccdna minichromosome and interact with viral and host protein to support transcription one potential avenue for chb treatment involves the utilization of therapeutic vaccine this paper explores hbv antigen suitable for epigenetic manipulation of cccdna elucidates their mechanism of action and evaluates their potential a key component of epigeneticallydriven vaccine for chb therapy molecular targeted agent with therapeutic vaccine offer a promising strategy for addressing chb by targeting the virus and enhancing the host immunological response despite challenge the development of these vaccine provides new hope for chb patient by emphasizing the need for hbv antigen that induce effective immune response without causing t cell exhaustion

processed_title: correlation between hepatitis b surface antibody antihbs in maternal blood and cord blood in newborn a study on transplacental acquired maternal antibody
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b virus infection is a global health problem transplacental maternal antibody can protect the infant early in life from infection objective this study investigates the correlation between maternal and infant hepatitis b surface antibody antihbs in pair method this crosssectional study measured antihbs in paired motherinfant sample blood sample were taken from the mother 3 h before delivery and from the newborn immediately after birth by cord blood and they were then examined for antihbs using the chemiluminescent microparticle immunoassay result transplacental transfer of maternal antihbs wa analyzed in 79 motherinfant pair seventeen mother 215 had positive antihbs and all cord blood of newborn from these mother had antihbs detected overall there were 44 557 newborn blood cord that were positive for antihbs the geometric mean of antihbs cord blood titer in newborn with maternal antihbs titer 10 10 100 and 1000 miuml were 5242 19383 43712 and 1000 miu ml respectively this study showed a significant correlation in antihbs between mother and infant cord blood r 0863 p 0001 conclusion antihb antibody measured in mother and infant cord blood were strongly correlated demonstrating efficient transplacental antibody transfer to protect infant against hepatitis b infection hepatitis b vaccination is required for mother to obtain immunogenicity and baby to receive hepatitis b vaccination on time

processed_title: hepatitis b virus prevalence risk factor and genotype distribution in hiv infected patient from west java indonesia
processed_abstract: background indonesia currently face both an increasing hiv incidence and a high hepatitis b virus hbv burden objective the objective of our study is to examine the prevalence risk factor and genotypic distribution of hbv infection among hiv infected patient in west java indonesia study design a cross sectional study wa conducted among a cohort of hiv infected patient in 2008 demographic and disease related variable were compared between hbv negative and positive patient logistic regression wa applied to determine risk factor for hbv coinfection hbv and hiv genotyping wa performed in coinfected patient result of 636 hivinfected patient the rate of hbv coinfection wa 7 the proportion of male wa higher in hbvhiv coinfected patient than in hiv monoinfected patient 93 v 72 p0001 a history of injecting drug use idu but not tattooing wa associated with hbv coinfection p0035 or 241 95 ci 106547 in the hiv and hbv treatment naive patient cd4 cell count 50cellsmm3 hivrna plasma 10000copiesml and ast level above normal were more often found in patient with high hbvdna level 20000iuml a compared to those with low hbv dna 20000iuml p005 a in the general population b3 wa the dominant subtype in hbv coinfected patient conclusion the prevalence of active hbv infection and the genotype distribution among hiv infected individual is similar to the overall population in java however an increased prevalence wa observed in men with a history of idu underlining the need for routine hbv screening and monitoring

processed_title: analysis of genetic and serology of hepatitis a virus infection during and after outbreak in two junior high school in surabaya indonesia
processed_abstract: outbreak of hepatitis a have occurred in some city in indonesia in surabaya the capital city of east java province indonesia hepatitis a outbreak have been reported since2013 with a marked increase in the number of case in 2015 the aim of the present study wa to analyze the genetic and serology of acute symptomatic case early infection during a hepatitis a outbreak and asymptomatic case after the outbreak in two junior high school in surabaya in 2015 to 2016 student with acute symptomatic hepatitis a during the outbreak and other student who were asymptomatic 3 to 4 month after the outbreak were enrolled asymptomatic student had no symptom from the outbreak until they were enrolled serum were collected to identify antihepatitis a virus hav igm by enzymelinked immunosorbent assay and hav genetic variationsgenotypes using polymerase chain reaction pcrsequencing and phylogenetic analysis a total of 33 971 out of 34 serum of student with acute symptom were positive for antihav igm and 18 of them were positive by pcr identified a hav subgenotype ia no prominent amino acid variation were observed from reported hav sequence from indonesia among 38 serum of asymptomatic student most 553 were positive for antihav igm while none were positive by pcr in conclusion havia wa the only subgenotype identified in acute symptomatic case during the outbreak the percentage of havspecific igmpositive case wa very high among acute symptomatic student but that wa also high among asymptomatic student which might contribute a the important source of infection during the outbreak

processed_title: novel subgenotypes of hepatitis b virus genotype c and d in papua indonesia
processed_abstract: eight genotype a to h and nine subtypes adw2 adw4 ayw1 ayw2 ayw3 ayw4 adrq adrq and ayr of hepatitis b virus hbv have been identified worldwide they appear to be associated with geographical distribution virological characteristic and possibly clinical outcome we performed sequence analysis of part of the s gene and the entire precorecore gene of hbv isolates obtained from hbsagpositive blood donor in papua province indonesia phylogenetic analysis of the s gene sequence revealed that 23 852 of the 27 hbv isolates tested belonged to genotype c hbvc and 2 74 each to hbvb and hbvd interestingly 19 826 of the 23 isolates of hbvc clustered in a branch that wa distinct from the previously reported subgenotypes c1 to c5 hbvc1 to hbvc5 similarly two isolates of hbvd clustered in a branch distinct from the reported subgenotypes hbvd1 to hbvd5 phylogenetic analysis of the entire precorecore gene confirmed the consistent presence of the distinct branch in hbvc and hbvd we therefore propose novel subgenotypes designated hbvc6 and hbvd6 the majority of hbvc6 isolates in papua had alanine at position 159 and 177 a159a177 in the hbsag a159a177 is different from the determinant for adrq a159v177 found throughout asia and adrq v159a177 found in new caledonia and polynesia possibly representing a unique antigenic group provisionally referred to a adrq indeterminate in conclusion we have identified two novel hbv subgenotypes hbvc6 and hbvd6 the first of which is the most prevalent subgenotype of hbv in papua indonesia

processed_title: hepatitis b virus genotypessubgenotypes in voluntary blood donor in makassar south sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b virus hbv genotype appears to show varying geographic distribution molecular epidemiological study of hbv in particular area in indonesia is still limited this study wa aimed to identify the prevalence of hbv genotypesubgenotype and mutation in basal core promoter bcp region in voluntary blood donor in makassar one of the biggest city in east part of indonesia a total of 214 hepatitis b surface antigen hbsagpositive sample were enrolled in this study hbv genotypesubgenotype wa identified by genotypespecific pcr method or direct sequencing of pres region mutation in bcp were identified by direct sequencing of the corresponding region result hbvb and hbvc were detected in 6121 and 2523 of the sample while mix of hbvb and hbvc wa found in 1262 of the sample based on pres region among hbvb and hbvc hbvb3 9500 and hbvc1 5882 were predominant interestingly hbvd wa identified in two sample 2216507 and 2225207 complete genome sequence of two hbvd strain 2216507 and 2225207 demonstrated that both strain belong to hbvd6 and the divergence between the two strain were 145 while divergence of both 2216507 and 2225207 strain with reference strain am422939france were 267 a1762tg1764a mutation wa observed in 196 and 536 whereas t1753v mutation wa found in 294 and 179 of hbvb and hbvc respectively conclusion hbvb and hbvc are dominant in makassar similar to most area in indonesia mutation in bcp which might be associated with severity of liver disease are less common

processed_title: challenge to integrating program for the elimination of mothertochild transmission of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b into antenatal care experience from indonesia
processed_abstract: the who asiapacific framework for triple elimination recommends that country evaluate their program for the elimination of mothertochild transmission of hiv syphilis and hepatitis b emtct including identifying gap to improve program planning and the implementation of elimination strategy in antenatal care anc service in 2022 the indonesian ministry of health reported that only 39 of pregnant woman were tested for hiv 14 for syphilis and 28 for hepatitis b respectively we conducted a qualitative study involving a focus group discussion fgd and indepth interview with 25 key stakeholder in bali and west nusa tenggara province to identify specific challenge to testing for hiv syphilis and hepatitis b in anc setting thematic analysis wa used to identify the theme generated from the data health system bottleneck experienced by stakeholder included supply chain management issue involving stock forecasting and stock monitoring stockouts of rapid test reagent which were particularly most frequent and for longer duration for syphilis and hepatitis b high staff turnover lack of staff training on how to perform the test the complexity and time needed to record the data on womens characteristic risk behaviour and testing in both paper format and into the computerbased surveillance system discrepancy in program coverage data from different division of the district health office involved in the reporting system high level of stigma that prevented woman from being followed up challenge in notifying partner and inadequate reporting and referral of woman from private provider to public one for testing intervention addressing the above challenge are worthy of consideration to improve the health system function and integrate emtct into the anc setting

processed_title: novel hepatitis b virus strain developing due to recombination between genotype h and b strain isolated from a japanese patient
processed_abstract: aim in japan genotype b and c are the predominant genotype isolated from patient with chronic hepatitis b while genotype a predominates in patient with acute hepatitis b globalization however appears to have changed the distribution of the hepatitis b virus hbv genotype thus the viral characteristic of hbv genotype other than genotype a b and c were examined method screening of genotype wa performed by enzyme immunoassay andor polymerase chain reaction invader method in 222 patient with hbv the fulllength nucleotide sequence of unusual strain were compared to those in the database followed by construction of a phylogenetic tree result unusual hbv strain were isolated from two patient a 27yearold japanese bisexual man with acute hepatitis b with hiv coinfection and a 52yearold japanese man with chronic hepatitis b the former strain wa classified a genotype h showing an overall identity of 998 to the thailand strain eu498228 while the nucleotide sequence of the latter strain showed similarity to the genotype b strain isolated in malaysia jq027316 and indonesia jq429079 between dr2 and dr1 in the x region with identity of 969 however this strain wa classified a genotype h by fulllength sequence analysis and the sequence between nt2023 and nt2262 showed no similarity to that in any previously reported strain conclusion hbv strain showing recombination between genotype b and h strain were found even in chronic hepatitis patient in japan globalization may yield hbv strain of possible novel genotype containing novel nucleotide sequence in the precorecore region

processed_title: genetic diversity of hepatitis b virus strain derived worldwide genotype subgenotypes and hbsag subtypes
processed_abstract: sequence of 234 complete genome and 631 hepatitis b surface antigen gene were used to assess the worldwide diversity of hepatitis b virus hbv apart from the described two subgenotypes each for a and f also b c and d divided into four subgenotypes each in the analysis of complete genome supported by significant bootstrap value the subgenotypes of b and c differed in their geographical distribution with b1 dominating in japan b2 in china and vietnam b3 confined to indonesia and b4 confined to vietnam all strain specifying subtype ayw1 subgenotype c1 wa common in japan korea and china c2 in china southeast asia and bangladesh and c3 in the oceania comprising strain specifying adrq and c4 specifying ayw3 is encountered in aborigine from australia this pattern of defined geographical distribution wa less evident for d1d4 where the subgenotypes were widely spread in europe africa and asia possibly due to their divergence having occurred a longer time ago than for genotype b and c with d4 being the first split and still the dominating subgenotype of d in the oceania the genetic diversity of hbv and the geographical distribution of it subgenotypes provide a tool to reconstruct the evolutionary history of hbv and may help to complement genetic data in the understanding of the evolution and past migration of man

processed_title: prevalence of hepatic steatosis in chronic hepatitis b patient and it association with disease severity
processed_abstract: aim to know the prevalence of liver steatosis in chronic hepatitis b chb patient and evaluate whether it presence wa associated with a more progressive disease method a crosssectional study wa conducted in cipto mangunkusumo and medistra hospital jakarta on chb patient between 2007 and 2009 data on patient demography anthropometry liver function test and hepatitis b serology were collected hepatic steatosis wa assessed by liver biopsy and graded a mild 33 moderate 3366 or severe 66 fibrosis stage and necroinflammatory activity were assessed according to the metavir system result onehundred and seventy four patient were enrolled 99 569 among them were men patient mean age wa 399 1069 year about 56 of case were hbeag negative the prevalence of liver steatosis wa 299 patient with liver steatosis had significantly higher body mass index 251 33 v 227 333 kgm2 p0001 and waist circumference 883 v 790 cm p0001 no association between liver steatosis and hbeag status p0736 there were no difference of log hbvdna level 572 1993 v 607 2077 p0675 and liver stiffness 83 628 v 95 1018 kpa between patient with and without liver steatosis the presence of significant fibrosis 615 v 697 p0295 and necroinflammation 635 v 656 p0789 wa not differed between patient with and without liver steatosis conclusion liver steatosis wa found in 30 of chronic hepatitis b patient it presence wa mostly associated with central obesity unlike chronic hepatitis c liver steatosis in chronic hepatitis b wa not related to a more progressive disease

processed_title: pres1 mutation alter the large hbsag antigenicity of a hepatitis b virus strain isolated in bangladesh
processed_abstract: mutation in the hepatitis b virus hbv genome can potentially lead to vaccination failure diagnostic escape and disease progression however there are no report on viral gene expression and large hepatitis b surface antigen hbsag antigenicity alteration due to mutation in hbv isolated from a bangladeshi population here we sequenced the full genome of the hbv isolated from a clinically infected patient in bangladesh the open reading frame orfs p s c and x of the isolated hbv strain were successfully amplified and cloned into a mammalian expression vector the hbv isolate wa identified a genotype c subgenotype c2 serotype adr and evolutionarily related to strain isolated in indonesia malaysia and china clinically significant mutation such a pres1 c2964a reverse transcriptase domain i91l and small hbsag n3s were identified the viral p s c and x gene were expressed in hek293t and hepg2 cell by transient transfection with a native subcellular distribution pattern analyzed by immunofluorescence assay western blotting of large hbsag using pres1 antibody showed no staining and pres1 elisa showed a significant reduction in reactivity due to amino acid mutation this mutated pres1 sequence ha been identified in several asian country to our knowledge this is the first report investigating change in large hbsag antigenicity due to pres1 mutation

processed_title: the high prevalence of negative hepatitis b surface antibody antihbs among pregnant woman in bandung indonesia a communitybased study
processed_abstract: background hepatitis b virus hbv infection is a disease that creates a high global burden by affecting approximately 35 of the total world population the main transmission of this disease is from mother to child mtct hbv vaccination program wa already initiated in indonesia in 1987 however after three decade the hbv infection prevalence stay stagnant this study aimed to explore the seroprevalence of hbv marker and the attributable risk factor of pregnant woman at risk of transmitting hbv to their offspring method a crosssectional study wa conducted on pregnant woman from primary midwifery and obstetric clinic across bandung indonesia to assess the hbsag antihbc and antihbs serological marker questionnairebased interview were used to obtain the sociodemographic determinant logistic regression wa applied to assess the association of each determinant factor to positive hbsag or negative antihbs a a dependent variable which wa then reported a odds ratio or result a total of 196 subject were recruited with 12196 61 of them were positive hbsag after exclusion of those with positive hbsag and antihbc 24175 137 woman were isolated a positive antihbs leaving 151175 863 woman with negative antihbs who were susceptible to hbv infection low body mass index bmi less than 185 kgm2 wa a risk factor for positive hbsag with or 5850 95 ci 14662334 p 0012 nevertheless no significant determinant factor wa associated with negative antihbs conclusion most pregnant woman in bandung indonesia are susceptible to hbv infection a marked by the negative antihbs status

processed_title: cellular release of infectious hepatitis c virus particle via endosomal pathway
processed_abstract: hepatitis c virus hcv is a positivesense singlestranded rna virus that cause chronic hepatitis liver cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma the release of infectious hcv particle from infected hepatocytes is a crucial step in viral dissemination and disease progression while the exact mechanism of hcv particle release remain poorly understood emerging evidence suggests that hcv utilizes intracellular membrane trafficking and secretory pathway these pathway include the golgi secretory pathway and the endosomal trafficking pathway such a the recycling endosome pathway and the endosomal sorting complex required for transport escrtdependent multivesicular body mvbs pathway this review provides an overview of recent advance in understanding the release of infectious hcv particle with a particular focus on the involvement of the host cell factor that participate in hcv particle release by summarizing the current knowledge in this area this review aim to contribute to a better understanding of endosomal pathway involved in the extracellular release of hcv particle and the development of novel antiviral strategy

processed_title: high prevalence of hepatitis b virus genotype cc1 in the minangkabau ethnic group in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the minangkabau is one of the major ethnic group in indonesia previous study with a limited number of sample have shown a different prevalence of hbvc in the minangkabau compared to the indonesian population in general the aim of this study wa to assess the hbv genotype distribution pattern and the prevalence of pres t1753v and a1762tg1764a mutation among the minangkabau hbv carrier the sample were collected from padang west sumatera and from western java mixed primer for specific genotype were used to determine the hbv genotype pres or s gene were amplified sequenced and aligned with reference sequence from genbank to derive a phylogenetic tree for subgenotyping pres gene were also analyzed for mutation the basal core promoter bcp region wa amplified and directly sequenced to analyze t1753v and a1762tg1764a mutation result the predominant hbv genotype among the minangkabau hbv carrier n117 wa c 726 followed by b 248 and coinfection with b and c 26 the prevalence of pres mutation including both the pres deletion and pres2 start codon mutation wa 410 and the t1753v and a1762tg1764a mutation were found in 519 and 712 respectively hbvc1 wa the predominant hbv subgenotype in the minangkabau hbv carrier and wa found in 662 followed by b3 b7 c8 b2 b9 c2 and c10 183 70 28 14 14 14 and 14 respectively from sample that were found to be coinfected with hbv b and c two sample were successfully cloned and subgenotyped including one with mixed subgenotypes of b3 and c1 and another one with mixed subgenotypes of b7 c1 putative intergenotypic of ba and ca furthermore three sample from donor of nonminangkabau ethnicity from padang were found to be infected with an intragenotypic recombination form including a putative recombinant of b8b3 and b9b7 conclusion hbvc with subgenotype c1 wa the predominant hbv genotype among hbv carrier of minangkabau ethnicity the prevalence of pres a1762tg1764a and t1753v mutation wa higher among the minangkabau compared to indonesian hbv carrier in general

processed_title: a genomewide association study of hepatitis b vaccine response in an indonesian population reveals multiple independent risk variant in the hla region
processed_abstract: we performed a twostage genomewide association study gwas of antibody titer in 3614 hepatitis b vaccine recipient from indonesia riau archipelago leading to the identification of at least three independent signal within the human leukocyte antigen hla complex these appear to implicate hladr rs3135363 p 653 x 1022 odds ratio or 153 95 confidence interval ci 135174 hladp previously associated with the risk of chronic hepatitis b infection rs9277535 p 291 x 1012 or 072 95 ci 063081 and a gene rich hla class iii interval rs9267665 p 124 x 1017 or 205 ci 164257 the substantial overlap of these variant and those identified by gwas of chronic hepatitis b infection confirms vaccine response a a model for infection while suggesting that the vaccine is least effective in those most at risk of lifelong infection following exposure to the virus

processed_title: facilitator and barrier for the delivery and uptake of cervical cancer screening in indonesia a scoping review
processed_abstract: background cervical cancer cc is the second most common female cancer in indonesia national cc screening coverage is low at 12 highlighting the need to investigate facilitator and barrier to screening objective this review synthesis research on facilitator and barrier to the delivery and uptake of cc screening analysis them in term of supply and demandside factor and their interconnectedness and proposes recommendation for further research method medline ovid cinahl global health neliti sinta and google scholar were searched applying a search string with keywords relevant to screening cc and indonesia in total 34 record were included all were publication on cc screening in indonesia 20002020 in english or indonesian record were analysed to identify finding relevant to the category of barrier and facilitator supplyand demandside factor result demandside facilitator identified included husband family or socialpeer support 14 study information availability knowledge and awareness 12 study positive attitude and strong perception of screening benefit and the seriousness of cc 12 study higher education and socioeconomic status 11 study having health insurance and short distance to screening service 4 study evidence on supplyside wa limited supplyside facilitator included counselling and support 6 study and ease of access 6 study demandside barrier identified focused on lack of knowledgeawareness and lack of confidence in screening 14 study fear fatalism and shame 10 study time and transportation constraint 8 study and lack of husband approval and support 6 study supplyside barrier included lack of skilled screening provider 3 study lack of advocacy and health promotion 3 study resource constraint 3 study and lack of supervision and support for health care provider 3 study conclusion facilitator and barrier were mirrored in the supply and demandside finding the geographical scope and population diversity of existing research is limited and further supplyside research is urgently needed

processed_title: cancer incidence and mortality in a tertiary hospital in indonesia an 18year data review
processed_abstract: background every population regardless of wealth or social development face the major health issue of cancer cancer incidence and mortality differ by region and period thus this study aimed to determine the characteristic incidence and mortality of various cancer at dr wahidin sudirohusodo hospital a referral center hospital in makassar indonesia method this study employed a descriptive research design using secondary data recorded at dr wahidin sudirohusodo hospital in makassar indonesia between january 2002 and december 2019 result we classified the 7824 cancer patient in our study into solid and nonsolid cancer group the incidence of solid cancer 793 wa higher than that of nonsolid cancer 207 causing 1063 death or 617 of all cancerrelated death there were 6083 777 case of cancer survival the cancer with the highest incidence were breast cancer 1008 case 129 leukemia 683 case 87 and cervical cancer 631 case 81 breast cervical and ovarian cancer were the most frequent cancer in female patient leukemia wa the most frequent cancer in male patient followed by colorectal and liver cancer conclusion a regionbased statistical record of cancer incidence and mortality is vital and useful to prioritizing cancer treatment at a given time

processed_title: current status distribution and future direction of natural product against colorectal cancer in indonesia a systematic review
processed_abstract: in 2020 an estimated 193 million new cancer case and nearly 10 million cancer death have occurred worldwide with colorectal cancer ranking a the third most frequently diagnosed 100 several attempt have been conducted against cancer including surgery radiation monoclonal antibody and chemotherapy many people choose natural product a alternative against cancer these product will not only help in human life preservation but also work a a source of uptodate information leading people away from incorrect information we discus the current status distribution and future implication of protecting population with natural product a an alternative against colorectal cancer in indonesia thirtyeight study were included in this review for data extraction the distribution of natural product in indonesia that have potential activity against colorectal cancer cell wa predominated by terpenoids followed by phytosterols phenolic alkaloid and polyisoprenoids the type of cell line utilized in the cytotoxic activity analysis of natural product wa the widr cell line followed by ht29 cell and hct116 cell this review showed that mtt in vitro assay is a general method used to analyze the cytotoxic activity of a natural product against colorectal cancer cell followed by other in vitro and in vivo method the systematic review provided prediction for several secondary metabolite to be utilized a an alternative treatment against colorectal cancer in indonesia it also might be a candidate for a future cochemotherapy agent in safety quality and standardization in addition computational method are being developed to predict the druglikeness of compound thus drug discovery is already on the road towards electronic research and development

processed_title: mapping and visualization of cancer research in indonesia a scientometric analysis
processed_abstract: introduction the incidence of cancer and it prevalence are increasing in indonesia it is crucial to ensure national cancer policy are evidencebased and promote research while cancer research is being conducted across indonesia the extent and focus of research activity are not known with no existing synthesis of the cancer research landscape we seek to address this gap by characterising trend in the extent and type of cancer research conducted in indonesia method scientometric study using descriptive analysis to determine annual growth pattern in publication across all cancer research literature from indonesia we developed a classification system for both research type and study design which wa applied to all included publication a visualisation software tool vosviewer wa used to explore the geographical distribution of research activity the wilcoxon ranksum test wa used to determine the influence of international collaboration on the impact factor of journal in which article were published result we retrieved 1773 cancerrelated article published by indonesiaaffiliated author from 1961 to 2020 with notable yearonyear increase in the annual total number of published article since 2015 most article 840 were published by author affiliated with institution on java island the most commonly published article type wa basic research and discovery science 288 using a onegroup analytical study design 288 international collaboration wa significantly correlated with a higher hindex of the journal in which research wa published p 0001 r 317 conclusion an increase in the number and range of topic explored in cancerrelated publication over time wa identified the summary of the current corpus of cancerrelated research for indonesia can be used to direct the development of the national cancer control plan alongside informing the national cancer research strategy our novel and feasible scientometric approach can be used to direct future national and regional mapping of cancer research

processed_title: risk factor associated with nasopharyngeal cancer incidence in indonesia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective to determine the risk factor associated the incidence of npc particularly in indonesia method this systematic review and metaanalysis wa conducted according to prisma statement database including pubmed scopus science direct web of science and garuda were retrieved newcastleottawa scale wa used to assess the quality of published study and analyse the risk of bias of included study randomeffect model and reported pooled odds ratio or with 95ci wa carried out in our metaanalysis result a pooled of 7 study were included in our study which included 764 participant we found that female gender wa not associated with the incidence of npc or 145 95 ci 061345 p040 and smoking wa highly increased the incidence of npc or 439 95 ci 0792440 but not statistically significant p009 furthermore salted fish consumption and some hla allele were associated with increased risk conclusion the incidence of npc is not associated with female gender nor smoking habit however the risk of npc is higher for those who consume salted fish and have some susceptible hla allele further investigation in larger study are needed to confirm these finding

processed_title: twelve year implementation of cervical and breast cancer screening program in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the study aimed to measure achievement of the national program of cervical and breast cancer screening in indonesia after 12 year implementation and factor associated with the number of the screening method this wa a crosssectional study with descriptive and analytic analysis secondary data wa collected from directorate of non communicable disease control ministry of health result from 2007 to 2018 the program wa implemented in all 34 province at 51 primary health center phc with 3 provider each total woman aged 3050 year screened wa 3664625 98 of the target the number rose gradually from 2007 to 2014 with significant increase from 2015 to 2018 bali province had the highest coverage 31 and papua had the lowest 1 we found a wide disparity of coverage among province there wa 34 of viapositive 161 wa treated with cryotherapy 13 per 1000 of suspected cervical cancer 54 lump in the breast and 07 per 1000 suspected breast cancer factor associated with number of the screening were number of phc providing screening number of gp total provider number of ncd post number of village with ncd post and income of the province conclusion the cervical and breast cancer screening program wa running in all province in more than half of primary health center in indonesia national coverage 98 wa far below the target and varied widely among province number of phc with screening service number of gp number of total provider number of ncd post number of village with ncd post and income of the province have association with cervical and breast cancer screening

processed_title: excess risk of lung cancer among agriculture and construction worker in indonesia
