processed_abstract: background in indonesia many occupation and industry involve a variety of hazardous and toxic material the ilo estimate that about 211 of the tracheal bronchial and lung cancer death among men were attributable to workplace hazardous substance this study investigated the relationship between occupation or workplace exposure and the risk of lung cancer in the country the result will help determine how indonesia can best mitigate the risk for it worker objective this casecontrol study utilizes the indonesian standard of industrial classification indsic 2015 with the aim of exploring the risk of lung cancer among indonesian worker method the study included patient aged 35 year old or older receiving thoracic ct at the radiology department of persahabatan hospital the case were histologicalconfirmed primary lung cancer while the control were negative thoracic ct scan for lung cancer the subject job title and industry were classified according to indsic 2015 and blind to the patient grouping a a case or control logistic regression wa used to determine the odds ratio for lung cancer among all section and some division or group of indsic 2015 finding the mean age wa 581 1023 year for lung cancer patient and 545 1023 year for control the majority of subject 196 worked in section g wholesale and retail trade repair of motor vehicle and motorcycle after adjusting for age gender level of education and smoking habit the risk of lung cancer wa nearly threetimes higher or 28 95 ci 111702 in worker of division a01 crop animal production and hunting and twotimes higher or 19 95 ci 105346 in worker of section f construction compared to the worker in other section or division conclusion the excess risk of lung cancer among certain category of worker confirms the need for improved policy monitoring and control of occupational exposure for primary cancer prevention and worker compensation purpose

processed_title: urologic cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: noncommunicable disease including cancer start to become more common in indonesia according to the government statement incidence of malignant disease increased annually up to 8 in the last decade and these disease become the seventh leading cause of death in indonesia on the basis of the latest globocan report on cancer incidence in indonesia prostate cancer rank sixth followed by bladder 12th and kidney 18th more than half of patient with kidney cancer are diagnosed in the advanced stage besides renal cell carcinoma there are significant number of people affected with squamous cell and transitional cell carcinoma because of kidney stone radical nephrectomy or cytoreductive nephrectomy wa the primary treatment mostly done a an open procedure transitional cell carcinoma is the commonest histology type in bladder cancer case followed by squamous cell carcinoma which almost always related to bladder stone unfortunately 70 of our case were diagnosed with muscle invasive bladder cancer and approximately 60 of these patient refused further radical treatment incidence of prostate cancer is increasing rapidly and it becomes the third most common cancer in men however most of our patient are diagnosed in the advanced stage radical prostatectomy or external beam radiotherapy is the treatment of choice in localized disease nearly 40 of the elderly patient are treated with primary androgen deprivation therapy therefore it requires more research by the indonesian urologist and other healthcare provider to diagnose these cancer in earlier stage a well a community education for prevention

processed_title: advance care planning for patient with cancer and family caregiver in indonesia a qualitative study
processed_abstract: background individual willingness to engage in advance care planning is influenced by factor such a culture and religious belief while most study on advance care planning in asia have been performed in highincome country indonesia is a lowermiddleincome country with a majority of strongly collectivist and religiously devout inhabitant we studied the perspective of indonesian patient with cancer and family caregiver regarding advance care planning by first exploring their experience with medical informationdisclosure decisionmaking and advance care planning and how these experience influence their perspective on advance care planning method we conducted semistructured interview among 16 patient with cancer and 15 family caregiver in a national cancer center in jakarta and a tertiary academic general hospital in yogyakarta we performed an inductive thematic analysis using open axial and selective coding the rigor of the study wa enhanced by reflective journaling dual coding and investigator triangulation result twentysix of 31 participant were younger than 60 year old 20 were muslim and javanese and 17 were college or university graduate four major theme emerged a important in advance care planning 1 participant perception on the importance or harmfulness of cancerrelated information 2 the importance of communicating bad news sensitively through empathetic implicit and mediated communication 3 participant motif for participating in medical decisionmaking decisionmaking seen a patient right or responsibility or patient state of dependency on others and 4 the complexity of future planning eg due to it irrelevance to participant religious belief andor their difficulty in seeing the relevance of future planning conclusion culturally sensitive approach to advance care planning in indonesia should address the importance of facilitating open communication between patient and their family and the various perspective on information provision bad news communication and decisionmaking advance care planning should focus on the exploration of patient value rather than drafting treatment plan in advance

processed_title: type of cancer and complementary and alternative medicine are determinant factor for the patient delay experienced by child with cancer a study in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction most pediatric cancer patient in developing country present at an advanced stage due to delayed diagnosis being an important barrier to effective care the objective of this study wa to evaluate the associated factor of patient delay and explore significant parental practiceassociated risk factor to patient delay method this wa a sequential mixed methodology utilizing data from the indonesian pediatric cancer registry for clinical variable and completed interview with parent using structured questionnaire to obtain their sociodemographic data a binary logistic regression analysis model wa fitted to identify factor associated with patient delay additional semistructured interview related to parental practice of using complementary and alternative medicine cam were administered to 30 parent thematic framework analysis wa performed on qualitative data to explore determinant factor of parental practice of using cam result we interviewed 356 parent with child with cancer the median patient delay wa 14 day interquartile range iqr 6465 day the most extended delay wa in patient with malignant bone tumor median 66 iqr 14126 in multivariable logistic regression analysis solid cancer odds ratio or 522 95 confidence interval ci 279977 p 001 and use of cam or 186 95 ci 113308 p 015 were associated with patient delay qualitative interview highlighted key issue relative to determinant parental factor using cam including vague initial childhood cancer symptom parental healthseeking behavior cam availability and accessibility also barrier of healthcare facility conclusion type of cancer and use of cam are essential factor that cause patient delay it should be addressed in the future childhood cancer awareness and childhood cancer diagnosis pathway

processed_title: temporal and spatial analysis of colorectal cancer incidence in yogyakarta indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: we aimed to explore the districtlevel temporal dynamic and subdistrict level geographical variation of colorectal cancer crc incidence in the special region of yogyakarta province we performed a crosssectional study using data from the yogyakarta populationbased cancer registry pbcr comprised of 1593 crc case diagnosed in 20082019 the agestandardized rate asrs were determined using 2014 population data the temporal trend and geographical distribution of case were analysed using joinpoint regression and morans i statistic during 20082019 crc incidence increased by 1344 annually joinpoints were identified in 2014 and 2017 which were also the period when annual percentage change apc wa the highest throughout the observation period 1884 significant apc change were observed in all district with the highest in kota yogyakarta 1557 the asr of crc incidence per 100000 person year wa 703 in sleman 920 in kota yogyakarta and 707 in bantul district we found a regional variation of crc asr with a concentrated pattern of hotspot in the central subdistricts of the catchment area and a significant positive spatial autocorrelation of crc incidence rate in the province i0581 p0001 the analysis identified four highhigh cluster subdistricts in the central catchment area this is the first indonesian study reported from pbcr data showing an increased annual crc incidence during an extensive observation period in the yogyakarta region a heterogeneous distribution map of crc incidence is included these finding may serve a basis for crc screening implementation and healthcare service improvement

processed_title: sale of anticancer medicine china indonesia kazakhstan malaysia philippine and thailand
processed_abstract: objective to assess sale of anticancer medicine in the 2017 world health organization who model list of essential medicine in china indonesia kazakhstan malaysia philippine and thailand from 2007 2008 for kazakhstan and malaysia to 2017 method we extracted sale volume data for 39 anticancer medicine from the iqvia database we divided the total quantity sold by the reference defined daily dose to estimate the total number of defined daily dos sold per country per year for three type of anticancer therapy traditional chemotherapy targeted therapy and endocrine therapy we adjusted these data by the number of new cancer case in each country for each year finding we observed an increase in sale across all type of anticancer therapy in all country the largest number of defined daily dos of traditional chemotherapy per new cancer case wa sold in thailand however the largest relative increase per new cancer case occurred in indonesia 948fold the largest absolute and relative increase in sale of defined daily dos of targeted therapy per new cancer case occurred in kazakhstan malaysia sold the largest number of adjusted defined daily dos of endocrine therapy in 2017 while china and indonesia more than doubled their adjusted sale volume between 2007 and 2017 conclusion the use of sale data can fill an important knowledge gap in the use of anticancer medicine particularly during period of insurance coverage expansion combined with other data sale volume data can help to monitor effort to improve equitable access to essential medicine

processed_title: delay in the presentation and diagnosis of woman with breast cancer in yogyakarta indonesia a retrospective observational study
processed_abstract: purpose to investigate factor associated with delay in presentation and diagnosis of woman with confirmed breast cancer bc method a crosssectional study nested in an ongoing prospective cohort study of breast cancer patient at dr sardjito hospital yogyakarta indonesia wa employed participant n 150 from the main study were recruited with secondary information on demographic clinical and tumor variable collected from the study database a questionnaire wa used to gather data on other socioeconomic variable herbal consumption number of healthcare visit knowledgeattitudepractice of bc and openended question relating to initial presentation presentation delay time between initial symptom and first consultation wa defined a 3 month diagnosis delay wa defined a 1 month between presentation and diagnosis confirmation impact on disease stage and determinant of both delay were examined a kruskalwallis test wa used to assess the length and distribution of delay by disease stage a multivariable logistic regression analysis wa conducted to explore the association between delay cancer stage and factor result sixtyfive 433 patient had a 3month presentation delay and 97 647 had a diagnosis confirmation by 1 month both presentation and diagnosis delay increased the risk of being diagnosed with cancer stage iiiiv odds ratioor 221 95 ci 097501 p 0059 and or 303 95 ci 128719 p 0012 visit to provider 3 time wa significantly attributed to a reduced diagnosis delay or 015 95 ci 006037 p 0001 while having a family history of cancer wa significantly associated with increased diagnosis delay or 228 95 ci 103504 p 0042 the most frequent reason for delaying presentation were lack of awareness of the cause of symptom 415 low perceived severity 277 and fear of surgery intervention 262 conclusion almost half of bc patient in our setting had a delay in presentation and 647 experienced a delay in diagnosis these delay increased the likelihood of presentation with a more advanced stage of disease future research is required in indonesia to explore the feasibility of evidencebased approach to reducing delay at both level including educational intervention to increase awareness of bc symptom and reducing existing complex and convoluted referral pathway for patient suspected of having cancer

processed_title: quality of life of cancer patient during chemotherapy in indonesia a comparison of eortc qlqc30 and eq5d5l based on patient characteristic
processed_abstract: one of the important outcome to define the success of cancer treatment is the healthrelated quality of life hrqol that can be measured using generic andor specific instrument our study aim to define the cancer patient hrqol in some hospital in indonesia a measured by the european organization for research and treatment for cancer eortc qlqc30 and the eq5d5l to define the difference of cancer patient hrqol referring to patient characteristic and to explore determinant of cancer patient hrqol we recruited 451 cancer patient using a crosssectional design in two referral hospital in central java indonesia using the purposive sampling technique all subject recruited from july 2020 to october 2021 met the inclusion criterion namely adult patient diagnosed with cancer in all stage who willingly participated in the study the indonesian value set wa used to obtain the eq5d5l index score we further analyzed the data based on cancer stage and compared two questionnaire using independent t test we highlighted that most of the cancer patient are female 694 young 86 and at advanced stage of cancer 541 the physical and role function and global health status of the cancer patient are poor and the most severe symptom is fatigue moreover most of them experience severe pain and perform daily activity with difficulty some patient characteristic show significant influence on the hrqol domain in both questionnaire p 005 interestingly both of the questionnaire have shown significant correlation between similar domain and revealed the poor hrqol of advanced cancer patient p 005 our study find that cancer patient still have poor hrqol in some domain we suggest to the health provider that they apply education and psychological intervention to increase their hrqol

processed_title: analyzing socioenvironmental determinant of bone and soft tissue cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: background this study is designed to explore the potential impact of individual and environmental residential factor a risk determinant for bone and soft tissue cancer with a particular focus on the indonesian context while it is widely recognized that our living environment can significantly influence cancer development there ha been a notable scarcity of research into how specific living environment characteristic relate to the risk of bone and soft tissue cancer method in a crosssectional study we analyzed the medical record of oncology patient treated at prof suharso national referral orthopedic hospital the study aimed to assess tumor malignancy level and explore the relationship with socioenvironmental variable including gender distance from the sea sunrise time altitude and population density data were gathered in 2020 from diverse source including medical record google earth and local statistical center the statistical analysis employed chisquare and logistic regression technique with the support of predictive analytics software pasw statistic 18 result both bivariate and multivariate analysis revealed two significant factor associated with the occurrence of bone and soft tissue cancer age exhibited a statistically significant influence or of 5345 and a pvalue of 0000 005 indicating a robust connection between cancer development and age additionally residing within a distance of less than 14 km from the sea significantly affected the likelihood of bone and soft tissue cancer or 5604 and pvalue 0001 005 conclusion the study underscore the strong association between age and the development of these cancer emphasizing the need for heightened vigilance and screening measure in older population moreover proximity to the sea emerges a another noteworthy factor influencing cancer risk suggesting potential environmental factor at play these result highlight the multifaceted nature of cancer causation and underscore the importance of considering socioenvironmental variable when assessing cancer risk factor such insight can inform more targeted prevention and early detection strategy ultimately contributing to improved cancer management and patient outcome

processed_title: breast cancer incidence in yogyakarta indonesia from 20082019 a crosssectional study using trend analysis and geographical information system
processed_abstract: background breast cancer is a significant public health concern worldwide including in indonesia little is known about the spatial and temporal pattern of breast cancer incidence in indonesia this study aimed to analyze temporal and spatial variation of breast cancer incidence in yogyakarta province indonesia method the study used breast cancer case data from the yogyakarta populationbased cancer registry pbcr from 2008 to 2019 the catchment area of the pbcr included the 48 subdistricts of 3 district sleman yogyakarta city and bantul agestandardized incidence rate asr were calculated for each subdistrict joinpoint regression wa used to detect any significant change in trend over time global morans and local indicator of spatial association lisa analysis were performed to identify any spatial cluster or outlier result the subdistricts had a median asr of 419 with a range of 153704 the majority of case were diagnosed at a late stage with yogyakarta city having the highest proportion of diagnosis at stage 4 the study observed a significant increasing trend in breast cancer incidence over the study period the fastest of which is in yogyakarta city with an average annual percentage change of 1877 with sleman having an 1821 and bantul having 894 average change each year p 005 we also found a significant positive spatial autocorrelation of breast cancer incidence rate in the province i 0581 p 0001 lisa analysis identified 11 subdistricts which were highhigh cluster in the central area of yogyakarta city and six lowlow cluster in the southeast region of the catchment area in the bantul and sleman district no spatial outlier were identified conclusion we found significant spatial clustering of bc asr in the yogyakarta province and there wa a trend of increasing asr across the region these finding can inform resource allocation for public health effort to highrisk area and develop targeted prevention and early detection strategy further re is needed to understand the factor driving the observed temporal and spatial pattern of breast cancer incidence in yogyakarta province indonesia

processed_title: knowledge and practice regarding oral cancer a study among dentist in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to assess indonesian dentist knowledge of risk factor and diagnostic procedure related to oral cancer oc and to determine the factor that influenced their level of knowledge method a modified version of a questionnaire that had been used to assess dentist knowledge regarding oc in canada wa used a total of 816 dentist were invited to participate in the study result the total response rate wa 492 however the number of dentist from 5 region in jakarta were equally represented use of tobacco or alcohol and history of previous oc were the top 3 risk factor that were answered correctly by dentist but there wa a high proportion of dentist who considered some without any evidence a risk factor almost half of the dentist did not know the early sign of oc and that erythroplakia and leukoplakia were associated with increased risk of developing oc only about 27 of dentist had a high level of knowledge of risk factor and fewer dentist demonstrated a good knowledge of diagnostic procedure dentist age group year of graduation and experience of continuing education significantly influenced the level of knowledge of diagnostic procedure p 05 conclusion dentist in jakarta had a considerable level of knowledge of major risk factor of oc although some gap in their knowledge especially in diagnostic procedure were present increasing these competency may aid in the prevention and early detection of oc

processed_title: factor associated with positive cancer screening for the uterine cervix and breast in jakarta province indonesia a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: background in many middleincome country cancer incidence and mortality are rapidly increasing but data for developing a strategy of cancer control are rarely collected or analyzed this study aimed to identify factor associated with positive cancer screening for the uterine cervix and breast in jakarta province indonesia method the data of 79660 woman who had visual inspection with acetic acid via and 83043 woman who had clinical breast examination cbe in the jakarta woman cancer screening program in 2019 were included in this study sociodemographic factor reproductive factor lifestyle factor family history and the result of via and cbe were used for analysis binary and multivariate logistic regression analysis were performed to identify factor associated with via positive or cbe positive result the positive rate wa 09 for both via and cbe among the screening participant factor associated with via positive were age 30 year old age at menarche 11 year old remarriage lower educational level having an occupation partner occupation other than being an employee alcohol consumption smoker inadequate physical activity cancer family history and no pap smear history factor associated with cbe positive were age at menarche 11 year old widowed high education having an occupation no breastfeeding history birth control history alcohol consumption smoker inadequate physical activity cancer family history and breast tumor history conclusion factor associated with via positive and cbe positive among indonesian woman were revealed to promote female cancer prevention in indonesia the prevalence of screening should be increased and education about the risk factor should be provided to medical professional

processed_title: diverging likelihood of colon and rectal cancer in yogyakarta indonesia a cross sectional study
processed_abstract: objective colon and rectal cancer are associated with different risk factor and prognostic however this discrepancy ha not been widely explored in the local population this study aimed to investigate the sitespecific likelihood of colorectal cancer crc incidence in the yogyakarta province indonesia method this crosssectional study analysis 1295 crc case diagnosed in 20082019 registered in the yogyakarta populationbased cancer registry pbcr database case were grouped into colon and rectal cancer logbinomial regression wa used to determine the relative risk of either colon or rectal cancer across different gender age group and rurality of residence the agespecific rate were calculated by age group and temporal trend for each group were analyzed using joinpoint regression result female displayed higher odds of colon cancer relative riskrr 120 95ci 102141 and lower odds of rectal cancer rr 092 95ci 085099 elevated odds of colon cancer were observed in younger age group especially 3039 rr 187 95ci 110319 while decreased odds of rectal cancer wa apparent in age group 3039 and 4049 rr 075 95ci 060093 and rr 082 95ci 069098 respectively living in urban or rural area did not significantly influence the odds of either having colon rr 098 95ci 082117 or rectal cancer rr 101 95ci 093110 during 20082019 trend of colon cancer in age 50 increased by 815 annually while rectal cancer displayed a 971 increase annually prior to 2017 followed by a 1723 decrease until 2019 conclusion yogyakarta population show higher odds of youngonset colon cancer especially between age 3039 year old overall observation of trend show increasing incidence in youngonset colon cancer and nonsignificant decrease in rectal cancer

processed_title: the role of oncogene and tumor suppressor gene in determining survival rate of lung cancer patient in the population of north sumatra indonesia
processed_abstract: background gaining a better understanding of molecular alteration in the pathogenesis of lung cancer reveals a significant change in approach to the management and prognosis of lung cancer several oncogene and tumor suppressor gene have been identified and have different role related to survival rate in lung cancer patient this study aim to determine the role of kras egfr and tp53 mutation in the survival rate of lung cancer patient in the population of north sumatra method this is a retrospective cohort study involving 108 subject diagnosed with lung cancer from histopathology specimen dna extraction were performed using ffpe followed by pcr examination for assessing the expression of egfr ra and tp53 protein sequencing analysis wa carried out to determine the mutation of egfr exon 19 and 21 ra protein exon 2 and tp53 exon 56 and 89 data input and analysis were conducted using statistical analysis software for window the survival rate analysis wa presented with kaplan meier result 52 subject completed all procedure in this study most of the subject are male 75 above 60 year old 538 heavy smoker 75 and suffer from adenocarcinoma type of lung cancer 692 no subject showed kras exon 2 mutation overall survival rate increased in patient with egfr mutation 15 month compared to 8 month p0001 and decreased in patient with tp53 mutation 7 month compared to 9 month p0148 also there wa increasing progressionfree survival in patient with egfr mutation 6 month compared to 3 month p019 and decreasing pfs in patient with tp53 mutation 3 month compared to 6 month p007 conclusion there were no kras mutation in this study egfr mutation showed a higher survival rate while tp53 mutation showed a lower survival rate in overall survival and progressionfree survival

processed_title: planning human resource and facility to achieve sustainable development goal a decisionanalytical modelling approach to predict cancer control requirement in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective indonesia aim to achieve universal health coverage uhc and sustainable development goal sdgs including sdg 3 target 4 which focus on cancer control by 2030 this study aimed to forecast the human resource for health hrh and facility required for cancer control in indonesia over an 11year period to support these goal design a twostage markov model wa developed to forecast the demand side of facility and hrh requirement for cancer control in indonesia over an 11year period setting data source used include the indonesia health profile report 2019 the indonesian radiation oncology society database and national cancer control committee document 2019 method the study involved modelling the current availability of hrh and healthcare facility in indonesia and predicting future requirement the gap between the current and the required hrh and facility related to oncology and the cost associated with meeting these requirement were analysed result result indicate the need to increase the number of healthcare facility and hrh to achieve sdg target however uhc for cancer care still may not be achieved a eastern indonesia is predicted to have no tertiary hospital until 2030 the forecast show that indonesia had a median of only 39 of the hrh requirement in 2019 closing the hrh gap requires around a 476 increase in salary expenditure conclusion this study demonstrates the application of decisionanalytical modelling approach to planning hrh and facility in the context of a lowtomiddleincome country scaling up oncology service in indonesia to attain the sdg target will require expansion of the number and capability of healthcare facility and hrh this work allows an indepth understanding of the resource needed to achieve uhc and sdgs and could be utilised in other disease area and context

processed_title: nitrate in drinking water and risk of colorectal cancer in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: nitrate concentration in well water in yogyakarta indonesia and it surroundings tended to increase rapidly from time to time and it may be associated with an elevated risk for several type of cancer the purpose of this study wa to examine the association between nitrate in drinking water and colorectal cancer crc risk occurrence a casecontrol study wa conducted in yogyakarta special province pathologically confirmed 75 crc patient and 75 control were consulted and their individual well water wa sampled and examined for nitrate concentration logistic regression analysis wa conducted to establish the association between nitrate and crc risk development there wa a significant correlation between nitrate in drinking water and crc occurrence and this value wa relatively stable after being adjusted for protein intake smoking history age and family history of cancer these finding demonstrated that the risk of crc development wa fourfold among those with 10 year of nitrate exposure from well water compared with those with 10 year of nitrate exposure consequently a significant association between nitrate in drinking water and occurrence of crc in yogyakarta wa established

processed_title: cancer in indonesia present and future
processed_abstract: cancer control ha been in effect in indonesia since the early 1920s it wa the dutch colonial government who started with the institution for cancer control which wa closed by the japanese occupation administration between 1942 and 1945 after the independence of the republic of indonesia a cancer control foundation wa established in 1962 at present clinical and nonclinical department in government teaching hospital there are 13 teaching hospital usually handle all cancer problem in 1993 dharmais cancer center in jakarta wa established and ha become the top referral cancer hospital for indonesia until now there have been no nationwide accurate data on cancer registration owing to a lack of fund and manpower cancer data collection is usually provided a a relative frequency study from several department of the teaching hospital it is currently estimated that there will be at least 170190 new cancer case annually for each 100 000 people the most frequent and primary cancer are cervix breast lymph node skin and nasopharynx since indonesia is now in a transition phase and ha many problem concerning the economy and health care we suggested a wellplanned cancer control program it includes the primary secondary and tertiary prevention of cancer in city where inhabitant can afford to subsidize a certain proportion of the budget for the implementation of this program

processed_title: difference in diversity and composition of mucosaassociated colonic microbiota in colorectal cancer and noncolorectal cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: background colorectal cancer is the third most common malignancy and the fourth leading cause of cancerrelated death worldwide several study have shown an association between gut microbiota and colorectal cancer gut microbiota is unique and can be influenced by geographic factor and habit this study aimed to determine the diversity and composition of colonic mucosal microbiota in patient with and without colorectal cancer aim to determine the diversity and composition of colonic mucosal microbiota in patient with and without colorectal cancer in indonesia method this casecontrol study included 59 subject 35 colorectal cancer patient and 24 noncolorectal cancer patient indicated for colonoscopy at dr cipto mangunkusumo gastrointestinal endoscopy center and fatmawati hospital microbiota examination wa performed using 16 rrna sequencing bioinformatics analysis wa performed using the wfmetagenomics pipeline from epi2melabs oxford nanopore technology platform result patient with colorectal cancer had a higher median index value on the shannon index 328 v 282 p 005 and a lower value on the simpson index 0050 v 0060 p 005 significant difference in beta diversity were observed at the genus p 0002 and specie level p 0001 firmicutes proteobacteria bacteroidetes and fusobacteria were the dominant phylum the genus bacteroides campylobacter peptostreptococcus and parvimonas were found more frequently in colorectal cancer while faecalibacterium haemophilus and phocaeicola were more frequently found in noncolorectal cancer the relative abundance of fusobacterium nucleatum bacteroides fragilis enterococcus faecalis campylobacter hominis and enterococcus faecalis specie wa significantly elevated in patient with colorectal cancer meanwhile faecalibacterium prausnitzii faecalibacterium duncaniae and prevotella copri were more commonly found in noncolorectal cancer conclusion patient with colorectal cancer exhibit distinct difference in the composition and diversity of their colonic mucosal microbiota compared to those with noncolorectal cancer this study wa reviewed and approved by the ethic committee of faculty of medicine universitas indonesia no ket1517un2f1etikppm00022023

processed_title: vitamin d status in breast cancer case following chemotherapy a pre and post observational study in a tertiary hospital in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to observe pre and posttreatment vitamin d level and it association with treatment and concomitant factor in breast cancer patient treated with chemotherapy method we performed a prepost observational analysis that nested in an ongoing prospective cohort study of breast cancer patient at dr sardjito general hospital yogyakarta indonesia 136 subject were recruited from the main study information on subject sociodemographic characteristic clinical status and tumour profile wa assessed at baseline number of chemotherapy cycle and chemotherapyinduced nausea vomiting cinv were also recorded vitamin d concentration wa measured using elisa method at baseline and posttreatment vitamin d level of 20 ngml and 12 ngml were defined a deficiency and severe deficiency correlation between sociodemographic and clinical profile with baseline vitamin d wa tested using spearman correlation paired ttest wa used to evaluate change in posttreatment vitamin d concentration the odds ratio for a subject to experience posttreatment vitamin d decrease wa assessed based on number of chemotherapy cycle and cinv severity result the mean vitamin d level before chemotherapy wa very low 880364 ngml in the whole panel higher ast level were associated with lower vitamin d level at baseline r 0188 p 0028 severe deficiency wa found in 824 subject at baseline and the rate increased to 890 after chemotherapy eightyfive case showed a decrease level whereas 51 showed a slight improvement overall a significant decrease of the vitamin d level wa observed after chemotherapy median change 313403 ngml p 0001 subject who received 6 cycle of chemotherapy were less likely to experience a decreased level of posttreatment vitamin d or 0436 95 ci 01960968 p 0039 conclusion indonesian breast cancer patient showed preexisting severe vitamin d deficiency and deterioration of vitamin d after chemotherapy future research is needed to explore it implication towards patient survival in the local setting evidencebased approach also need to be taken to address this modifiable condition including increasing awareness of the importance of maintaining vitamin d sufficiency both in patient and the general population

processed_title: dietary intake a determinant nongenetic factor to colorectal cancer incidence and staging progression a study in south sulawesi population indonesia
processed_abstract: report from various populationbased study indicate that the incidence of colorectal cancer may be strongly affected by dietary pattern of the respective population the nature of dietary pattern of specific indonesia population on the risk of colorectal cancer might differ from previously published data with the global population therefore we conducted a study where the dietary pattern in colorectal cancer patient cohort wa compared to age and populationmatched control we documented 89 colorectal cancer case and among 173 individual from the south sulawesi population a series of logistic regression and fisher exact test were utilized to test association of dietary intake and colorectal cancer risk a well a colorectal cancer staging our data demonstrate that vegetable pvalue 870 x 1026 or 049 and fruit pvalue 759x105 or 070 intake are associated with the reduced risk of colorectal cancer incidence conversely acidic food reheated food meat spicy food and alcohol are associated with the increment case of cancer moreover meat intake pvalue 001 show a significant association with cancer staging progression common dietary pattern is a determinant aspect to the colorectal cancer incidence a well a it staging progression

processed_title: the positive effect and mechanism of honey against breast cancer
processed_abstract: background breast cancer is a malignancy that occurs in cell in the breast tissue where cell in the breast divide and grow out of control invade surrounding tissue or spread metastasize to distant area of the body method this review wa systematically carried out through pubmed scopus sciencedirect and google scholar website in english and indonesian using the keyword content of the article obtaining 21 selected article this review demonstrates honey promising mechanism of combined synergistic effect for breast cancer management conclusion antioxidant in honey intercept free radical of phenolic compound which are the main factor responsible for the antioxidant activity of honey the antimicrobial activity in most honey is due to the enzymatic production of hydrogen peroxide and it anticancer property are discussed in this section

processed_title: unmet supportive care need and psychological distress among parent of child with cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the aim of this study wa to investigate the need and associating factor psychological distress of parent when taking care of child with cancer in indonesia method a crosssectional study wa conducted among 100 parent of child with cancer from the pediatric ward of two hospital in indonesia the parent were assessed using the indonesian version of the supportive care need survey for partner and caregiver unmet need and the hospital anxiety depression scale psychological distress the factor associated with unmet need were analyzed using hierarchical linear regression result among the surveyed parent 83 had over 10 unmet need among these unmet need need for information wa the highest one in the selfreport measure using a clinical cutoff 49 of the parent reported sign of anxiety and 25 had sign of depression parent reporting clinically relevant level of anxiety had more unmet need than parent without clinically relevant anxiety having fewer child wa correlated with higher work and social need and higher level of education were correlated with more psychological need however the childrens clinical variable were not associated with the overall need in the regression model conclusion most parent of child with cancer reported a need for more information and reported sign of anxiety and depression parent with fewer child and higher level of education were identified a a vulnerable population due to having greater need the result of this study can be used to improve supportive care for parent of child with cancer in hospital setting

processed_title: anticancer bioprospecting on medicinal plant from indonesia a review
processed_abstract: the indonesian archipelago is home to the second largest biodiversity in the world and is inhabited by more than 300 ethnic group with a total population of more than 270 million the indigenous population still rely on traditional medicine practice especially the use of plantbased remedy although modern sciencebased exploration on indonesian medicinal plant started with the european settlement in the archipelago in the 16th century it wa not until the 1970s that the phytochemistry of indonesian medicinal plant wa recognized for it potency the need for new cancer cure to increase the quality of human life ha led to the bioprospecting of medicinal plant including those of indonesian origin despite published report on the anticancer potency of indonesian medicinal plant to date there ha been no comprehensive review on this topic in this manuscript we review the phytochemical and pharmacological study on medicinal plant from indonesia related to cancer therapy established database garuda scifinder and pubmed were used to collate data from 1990 to 2022 resulting in the description of 134 medicinal plant and their phytochemical and pharmacological property including example containing potent agent against breast leukaemia cervix lung and colon cancer cell line based on in vitro bioassay and in vivo evaluation these finding provide valuable insight into the bioprospecting of indonesian medicinal plant providing direction for future study including the development of new therapeutic both a botanical or by using conventional dosage

processed_title: the role of stromal tumour infiltrating lymphocyte stil intensity and programmed death ligand 1 expression in breast cancer response to neoadjuvant therapy in cipto mangunkusumo hospital cmh indonesia
processed_abstract: background pathological response to neoadjuvant therapy were still relatively poor especially in cmh study had been done to search for predictor of response such a stil intensity and expression which is known to block stil action in killing cancer cell this research assessed stil intensity and expression a predictor of response to neoadjuvant therapy in breast cancer the preliminary data might be used to better tailored breast cancer patient therapy considering the availability of antipd1 pd l1 immunotherapy nowadays objective to assess til intensity expression and their role a pathological predictor of breast cancer response to neoadjuvant therapy in cipto mangunkusumo hospital cmh method this wa an observational analytic retrospective cohort study on breast cancer patient undergoing biopsyreview of biopsy specimen receiving neoadjuvant therapy and mastectomy in cmh from january 2014 to december 2021 sixty case fulfilled the inclusion and exclusion criterion total sampling wa done expression immunohistochemistry clone 22c3 and stil intensity histopathology wa examined in the biopsy specimen linear regression analysis wa done to determine the independent predictor of neoadjuvant therapy response evaluated in the mastectomy specimen with residual cancer burden rcb score result there were 60 female patient median age 46 year old 917 had invasive carcinoma of no special type median stil intensity wa 10 170 583 patient had low stil intensity 10 283 patient had positive expression cps 1 only 83 patient had pcr while 90 patient had rcb class iiiii every 1 increase in stil intensity no lymphovascular invasion and taxane chemotherapy were predicted to lower rcb score by 0058 0781 dan 0594 respectively expression associated with pcrrcb class i p0048 but cps score wa not a predictor of rcb score in linear regression analysis conslusion stil intensity wa an independent predictor of breast cancer response to neoadjuvant therapy in rscm expression associated with pcrrcb class i but cps score wa not a predictor of rcb score

processed_title: the effect of the commashe intervention on the fatigue sleep quality and functional status of child with cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: this study aimed to investigate the effect of the combined music and sleep hygiene education commashe intervention on the fatigue sleep quality and functional status of child with cancer residing in temporary lodge in indonesia the design of this study wa a quasiexperimental prepost test with a control group we recruited child with cancer aged 718 year n 58 using a consecutive sampling method and assigned them to intervention and control group n 29 in each group the intervention group had the commashe intervention while the control group received routine care fatigue sleep quality and functional status were measured on day 1 and 4 using allen fatigue in childhood cancer scale the sleep problem in child scale and the barthel index respectively tdependent and independent test and multivariate analysis of covariance mancova test were performed for the data analysis there were significant difference in fatigue sleep quality and functional status between the intervention and control group after the commashe intervention nonetheless chemotherapy drug contributed to the childrens sleep quality commashe wa found to be more effective than routine care in the reducing fatigue and increasing the sleep quality and functional status of child with cancer

processed_title: correlation analysis of hif1alpha and ca153 in response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in locally advanced breast cancer a cohort study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background breast cancer bc is the most common cancer among woman worldwide and a leading cause of death in indonesia the primary treatment of locally advanced bc is neoadjuvant chemotherapy nac the rapid proliferation of tumor cell in a neoplastic microenvironment is largely due to hypoxia which also encourages the development of chemoresistant bc the master regulator of the hypoxia response is hypoxiainducible factor1alpha hif1alpha the response evaluation criterion in solid tumor recist is an objective response metric that demonstrates the efficacy of a nac based mostly on the size of the tumor ca153 is the protein product of the muc1 gene and is the most widely used serum marker in bc the purpose of this study is to investigate the relationship between hif1alpha and recist and between ca153 and recist and to assess the relationship among all of them in bc method this observational study used the prospective cohort method included 11 patient with histopathologically confirmed bc specifically invasive ductal carcinoma we evaluated the change in hif1alpha and ca153 serum level using elisa and measured tumor lesion with recist the procedure wa carried out twice serum level were measured at baseline and after receiving two cycle of nac 5 week result among the 11 patient included in this study hif1alpha ca153 and recist decreased significantly after nac the change in recist correlated with ca153 each unit decrease in recist score wa associated with a 03unit decrease in ca153 level p 0019 conclusion there wa a decrease in hif1alpha followed by a decrease in ca153 and recist in response to chemotherapy there wa a statistically significant correlation between ca153 and response to chemotherapy this study evidence the relationship between factor that shape the local tumor microenvironment

processed_title: pathological profile and clinical management challenge of breast cancer emerging in young woman in indonesia a hospitalbased study
processed_abstract: background breast cancer diagnosed at a young age is often associated with aggressive biology advanced stage and unfavorable prognosis the median age of breast cancer diagnosis in indonesia is younger 48 v 68 yearsold in europe with a relatively higher proportion of patient younger than 40 year old although prognosis and outcome of young breast cancer are well studied in developed nation research evaluating biological characteristic delivered treatment and clinical outcome is very limited in indonesia method we analyzed all breast cancer patient who underwent surgery at dr sardjito hospital indonesia in 20122017 detail of pathology profile treatment administrated and outcome a well a reproductive factor among patient younger than 40 year old were collected and analyzed kaplanmeier curve wa used to assess conditional survival based on baseline characteristic result from the total of 1259 breast cancer patient median age 51 year 144 114 were younger than 40 year old median age 37 year of these young patient 19 132 were bilateral and 92 64 were diagnosed in advanced stage stage iiiac and iv median tumor diameter wa 55 cm and nodal infiltration wa present in 73 distant metastasis wa found in 16 at the time of diagnosis moderate and poor differentiation of tumor were 208 and 785 respectively and lymphovascular invasion wa found in 903 around 40 were hormone receptorpositive 306 human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive and 382 triple negative patient underwent radical surgery in 121 case 84 and breast conserving surgery in 7 case 49 adjuvant chemotherapy wa administrated in 68 and hormonal therapy in 34 progressionfree survival wa significantly shorter in patient with advanced stage skin and chest wall involvement t4 positive lymph node infiltration positive hormonal receptor and triple negative subtype logrank mantelcox test p 005 conclusion we found a high frequency of young breast cancer with biologically more aggressive tumor late diagnosis frequent relapse and poor prognosis further action to improve clinical management and meet psychosocial need in young breast cancer patient are warranted

processed_title: comparison of the lived experience of family caregiver of patient with dementia and of patient with cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: abstractbackgrounddementia even more than cancer demand longterm care while in indonesia cancer is accepted a a disease requiring caregiving dementia is still considered a normal condition these difference might affect the experience of caregiver especially those relating to social health the subject of our study we aim to describe and compare the lived experience of family caregiver of patient with cancer pwc with those of patient with dementia pwd in yogyakarta indonesia and to explore the role of their social health in these experience method a qualitative design wa applied indepth facetoface interview were conducted with pwc and pwd caregiver in two outpatient clinic of a tertiary hospital the constant comparative method wa applied to analyze the data that were interpreted using the concept of social health to explore the experience of the caregiver we used atlasti software result three theme were identified problem with caregiving dealing with problem and belief in caregiving we found more similarity than difference in the experience of caregiver in both group half of the category were related to social health challenge consequence hiding social support and the caregiver approach the organization of dementia care is characterized by simplicity and direct tie between medical specialist pwd and caregiver whereas cancer care encounter coordination problem conclusion family caregiver of both group mostly had similar experience of the caregiving process gaining a better understanding of the specific experience of caregiver and their social health open new avenue for intervention to improve their quality of life

processed_title: survival outcome and prognostic factor of patient with nasopharyngeal cancer in yogyakarta indonesia a hospitalbased retrospective study
processed_abstract: purpose this study aimed to determine the survival outcome and prognostic factor of patient with nasopharyngeal cancer accessing treatment in yogyakarta indonesia method data on 759 patient with npc diagnosed from 2007 to 2016 at dr sardjito general hospital were included potential prognostic variable included sociodemographic clinicopathology and treatment parameter multivariable analysis were implemented using semiparametric cox proportional hazard modelling and fully parametric survival analysis result the median time of observation wa 1439 month in the whole cohort the median observed survival wa 3108 month in the univariable analysis age education status insurance type bmi ecog index stage and treatment strategy had an impact on overall survival o p value 001 semiparametric multivariable analysis with stage stratification showed that education status ecog index and treatment modality were independent prognostic factor for o p value 005 in the fully parametric model age education status ecog index stage and treatment modality were independent prognostic factor for o p value 005 for both multivariable analysis all treatment strategy were associated with a reduced hazard semiparametric model p value 005 and a better o parametric model p value 005 compared with no treatment furthermore compared with radiation alone or chemotherapy alone a combination of chemotherapy and radiation either in a form of concurrent chemoradiotherapy ccrt sequential chemotherapy and radiation or induction chemotherapy followed by ccrt demonstrated a reduced hazard hazard ratiohr 0226 95 confidence intervalci 00890363 and hr 0390 95ci 02600519 and a better o time ratiotr 3108 95ci 12744942 and tr 2531 95ci 18293233 p value 001 conclusion median o for the cohort wa low compared to those reported in both endemic and nonendemic region by combining the finding of multivariable analysis we showed that age education status ecog index stage and first treatment modality were independent predictor for the o

processed_title: p21 ser31arg and fgfr2 rs2981582 polymorphism a risk factor for early onset of breast cancer in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective breast cancer tend to be more progressive with poorer prognosis in younger patient than those at an older age single nucleotide polymorphism snp of p53 pro72arg mdm2 snp309 p21 ser31arg er snp594 her2 ile655val and fgfr2 rs2981582 have drawn attention a genetic factor associated with cancer risk however there were contradictory result involving different race and their association is still unknown in indonesian population this study wa performed to examine the proportion of these six gene polymorphism and their association with age of onset of breast cancer patient in yogyakarta indonesia method biorepository dna from 199 patient registered at dr sardjito hospital yogyakarta from 20062013 were tested for polymorphism using the pcrrflp method sample were taken from two age group earlyonset 55 year chisquare test with odds ratio were used for data analysis result the mean age of the earlyonset group wa 3642 year while the lateonset group wa 6269 year aa genotype and a allele of p21 and tt genotype and t allele of fgfr2 were significantly more frequent and were associated with an increased risk of earlyonset of breast cancer 95ci 254 and 159 263 and 164 respectively conclusion our study indicates that the a allele of p21 and the allele t of fgfr2 may be associated with an increased risk of earlyonset of breast cancer in yogyakarta indonesia further analysis is needed to confirm the finding

processed_title: contraceptive use with breast cancer incidence in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction breast cancer is the most common cancer in woman worldwide and is a significant threat to public health this study aim to conduct a systematic review of the relationship between hormonal contraceptive use and breast cancer incidence method the search wa conducted using google scholar proquest pubmed and one indonesian database garuda using english and indonesian keywords the inclusion criterion in this study were the publication year of the last five year namely 20192023 english and indonesian language casecontrol observational research using the indonesian population and fulltext access result a total of 165 study were obtained from the google scholar database including 104 study the overall multivariate analysis revealed that there wa a statistically significant association of hormonal contraception with the incidence of breast cancer with or value in the range of 26 conclusion the finding of this systematic study suggest that the use of hormone can contribute to hormonal imbalance that further increase breast cell proliferation and disrupt gene expression resulting in uncontrolled cell developmentcancer in addition the finding recommend increasing the number of study on this topic to obtain more adequate and possibly more diverse information

processed_title: muslim husband role in womens health and cancer the perspective of muslim woman in indonesia
processed_abstract: background breast and cervical cancer are the most common cause of cancer death among woman in the world these cancer are detectable early however only a few woman participate in cancer screening especially in developing country including indonesia family culture and religion can influence why woman have screening husband in muslim family have a significant role in the family health including their wife reproductive health however information about muslim husband role in wife health especially cancer is limited objective the purpose of this study wa to determine muslim husband role in womens health and cancer from the perspective of muslim woman method this study wa a qualitative study using a descriptive exploratory approach purposive sampling wa used to recruit 20 muslim woman 10 from urban area and 10 from rural area of west java province indonesia woman were interviewed using a semistructured interview schedule data from the interview were analyzed using the comparative analysis for interview technique result the study found two main theme emerged from the analysis muslim husband extensive role in promoting womens health and husband have limited action with regard to cancer screening this study also found similarity between rural and urban womens opinion that in general husband actively supported promoting womens health conclusion muslim husband focused on encouraging woman to have healthy lifestyle however a lack of support from husband related to cancer screening this behaviour could be a hindrance to muslim womens participation in prevention and the early detection of cancer there is a need to improve muslim husband awareness in womens cancer

processed_title: feasibility and pilot study of indonesia first telehealth support program for gynecological cancer survivor undergoing chemotherapy
processed_abstract: most indonesian gynecological cancer survivor experience chemotherapy side effect on their physical and mental health a they face unmet need of supportive care which increase the likelihood of discontinuing treatment intervention in telehealth assist survivor in resolving these issue the aim of this pilot study wa to determine the feasibility of fighting distress selfefficacy health effect and sexual forshex intervention and evaluate their potential impact on distress level side effect knowledge and management selfefficacy and sexual quality of life the study involved gynecological cancer survivor who underwent chemotherapy and participated in ten week of individual social mediabased education telecoaching and teleconsultations from september 2023 to june 2024 the study feasibility and pilot outcome were evaluated using descriptive statistic and qualitative thematic analysis of the twelve woman recruited six 50 completed the study filled out pre and postintervention questionnaire and participated in interview fiftyfour virtual education coaching and consultation session were performed individually the statistical result indicated that participant were highly satisfied with the telehealth program which significantly increased their knowledge p 002 health practice p 004 and selfefficacy p 001 the qualitative analysis highlighted participant and coach perspective on the study acceptance barrier and recommendation in conclusion this pilot study suggests that a definitive trial to assess the forshex intervention is feasible acceptable and can be applied not only to gynecological cancer survivor but also to other type of cancer thereby broadening the potential impact of the study

processed_title: oral contraceptive and breast cancer risk a case control study in six referral hospital in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to understand the effect of the use of oral contraceptive to breast cancer risk in six referral hospital in indonesia method the research design wa hospital based casecontrol conducted in 2013 population wa woman patient aged 15 year and above in six cancerreferral hospital in five province total of 762 people were included in this study consisting of 381 who are diagnosed with breast cancer a confirmed by histopathologic examination in inpatient surgery ward and 381 people who are not diagnosed with breast cancer based on interview in outpatient surgery ward a control group a set of data were collected including the use of oral contraceptive age early menarche childbirth status breastfeeding status obesity unhealthy diet history of benign breast tumor family history of breast cancer and age of menopause result result showed that odds ratio or of patient using oral contraceptive 6 year wa 193 95 ci 123 303 and or of those using oral contraceptive 6 year wa 290 95 ci 165 509 a compared to people who did not use oral contraceptive conclusion use of oral contraceptive in patient wa indicated to increase the risk of breast cancer longer the duration of using oral contraceptive tend to have higher the risk of breast cancer

processed_title: singlevisit approach of cervical cancer screening see and treat in indonesia
processed_abstract: background we performed a crosssectional study in indonesia to evaluate the performance of a singlevisit approach of cervical cancer screening using visual inspection with acetic acid via histology and cryotherapy in lowresource setting method woman having limited access to healthcare facility were screened by trained doctor using via if the test wa positive biopsy were taken and when eligible woman were directly treated with cryotherapy followup wa performed with via and cytology after 6 month when cervical cancer wa suspected or diagnosed woman were referred the positivity rate positive predictive value ppv and approximate specificity of the via test were calculated the detection rate for cervical lesion wa given result screening result were completed in 22 040 woman of whom 927 had never been screened visual inspection with acetic acid wa positive in 44 the ppv of via to detect cin i or greater and cin ii or greater wa 587 and 297 respectively the approximate specificity wa 981 and the detection rate for cin i or greater wa 26 conclusion the singlevisit approach cervical cancer screening performed well showing see and treat is a promising way to reduce cervical cancer in indonesia

processed_title: the relationship between ethnicity and health seeking behavior for colorectal cancer in east java indonesia a case study of arek mataraman and pendalungan ethnic group
processed_abstract: objective the rising incidence of colorectal cancer crc in east java ha highlighted the need to investigate interethnic causality previous study have examined the relationship between ethnicity and health behavior in relation to crc in east java province but it is important to explore healthseeking behavior among crc patient within the arek mataraman and pendalungan ethnic group a these group may have different behavioral pattern due to limited literacy method this crosssectional study included 230 respondent with 86 from arek 72 from mataraman and 72 from pendalungan data were collected from august 1 to october 30 2022 and analyzed using structural equation modeling with smartpls application analysis result the pvalues for the direct path between culture and healthseeking behavior wa 0009 indicating a statistically significant relationship similarly the pvalues for the direct path between selfhealth awareness and health seeking behavior is 0000 indicating a very strong and statistically significant relationship pvalues for the direct path between health accessibility and health seeking behavior wa 0257 suggesting that the relationship wa not statistically significant conclusion cultural value and selfhealth awareness are suggested a important predictor of healthseeking behavior among crc patient in east java the study highlight the need for tailored healthcare service for different ethnic group overall these finding can help healthcare provider in addressing the specific need of crc patient in east java

processed_title: psychological impact of bladder cancer insight from 219 patient and caregiver in indonesia using dass21 20192023
processed_abstract: background bladder cancer bc is a common disease worldwide low survival rate and high recurrence lead to the risk of mental disorder this study analyzed 219 patient with bladder cancer using the indonesian version of the 21item depression anxiety and stress scale dass21 and related factor material and method this crosssectional study included 219 patient diagnosed with bladder cancer during 20192023 in a referral hospital in indonesia data were collected using a questionnaire that assessed the characteristic of the patient and a dass21 questionnaire result some patient and caregiver experienced depression stress and anxiety the percentage of caregiver who experienced anxiety wa higher than for patient 479 v 457 statistical analysis showed that age income and marital status were associated with the incidence of depression p0000 p0001 and p0000 respectively anxiety p0000 p0012 and p0001 respectively and stress p0000 p0007 and p0000 respectively route of patient admission p0043 respectively and employment status p0005 respectively were associated with the incidence of depression in patient p0043 respectively employment status wa also associated with stress in patient p0038 respectively statistical analysis of caregiver found that route of patient admission and marital status were related to the incidence of depression among caregiver p0036 and p0007 respectively conclusion monitoring and providing support for patient and caregiver are needed to prevent poor prognosis due to psychological problem including paying attention to sociodemographic factor

processed_title: parent and healthcare provider perspective on side effect of childhood cancer treatment in indonesia
processed_abstract: background efficacy of childhood cancer treatment in lowincome country may be impacted by parent and healthcare provider perspective on chemotherapyrelated sideeffects this study explores prevalence and severity of sideeffects in childhood cancer and compare health belief about sideeffects between parent and healthcare provider and between nurse and doctor in indonesia material and method semistructured questionnaire were filled in by 40 parent and 207 healthcare provider in an academic hospital result parent exporessed a desire to receive more information about sideeffects 98 and worried about this aspect of treatment 90 although sideeffects were less severe than expected 66 the most frequent wa behavior alteration 98 and the most severe wa hair loss only 26 of parent consulted doctor about sideeffects more parent compared to healthcare provider believed that medicine work better when sideeffects are more severe p0001 and accepted severe sideeffects p0021 more healthcare provider compared to parent believed that chemotherapy can be stopped or the dosage altered when there are sideeffects p0011 more nurse compared to doctor stated that sideeffects were unbearable p0004 and made them doubt efficacy of treatment p0001 conclusion behavior alteration is the most frequent and hair loss the most severe sideeffect apparent discrepancy in health belief about sideeffects exist between parent and healthcare provider a sustainable parental education program about sideeffects is recommended healthcare provider need to update and improve their knowledge and communication skill in order to give appropriate information such measure may improve outcome of childhood cancer treatment in lowincome country where adherence to therapy is a major issue

processed_title: general dentist knowledge perception and practice regarding oral potentially malignant disorder and oral cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the most effective mean for reducing oral cancer oc mortality is by preventing latestage disease early diagnosis can be improved by increasing awareness among healthcare provider specifically general dental practitioner gdp therefore our study aimed to assess gdp knowledge of oc risk factor and perceived competence in performing conventional oral examination coe in routine dental practice material and method this wa a crosssectional study conducted in five province of indonesia namely aceh banda aceh ba bandung west java wj special district jakarta jkt jkt pontianak west kalimantan wk and sorong west papua wp the local dental association or faculty of dentistry invited the gdp to attend an education program and complete the survey result one hundred seventyseven gdp completed the survey wj n 63 ba n 44 jkt n 27 wp n 23 and wp n 20 a large proportion 164 out of 177 9266 of gdp felt they had received insufficient training to equip them to diagnose oc and a many a 226 n 40 did not refer to specialist when they found suspicious mucosal lesion notwithstanding the significant regional variation the majority of indonesian gdp selfreported inadequate knowledge and awareness of oc and scarce confidence in performing coe conclusion gdp knowledge of oc risk factor and coe is key to improving early diagnosis of oc at a community level therefore it is suggested that the lack of knowledge and confidence of gdp reported here should be addressed through the national dental curriculum in indonesia

processed_title: knowledge and acceptance towards mammography a breast cancer screening tool among yogyakarta woman and health care provider mammography screening in indonesia
processed_abstract: annual mammography remains the gold standard of asymptomatic breast cancer screening for woman starting at the age of 40 however indonesia ha not designated mammography a it national screening program to help policymakers decide whether mammography should be introduced into a national program it is important to comprehensively understand the knowledge and acceptance of both consumer and provider a total of 25 subject including a range of woman and health care professional hcps in yogyakarta province were recruited using purposive maximum variation sampling and then interviewed indepth the interview were recorded and all data were taken and transcribed from the audio recording which were subsequently translated to english and analyzed thematically almost all of yogyakarta woman had heard about the term of mammography however only few of them have let themselves be screened mainly because of their perceived lack of urgency to screen for asymptomatic breast cancer another important reason wa the high cost of mammography meanwhile several hcps believed that breast cancer ha not been a priority for the government and hence the government limited mammography screening access and excluded it from the national insurance coverage most woman in yogyakarta have a good understanding about breast cancer screening but their acceptance of mammography a a breast cancer screening tool is significantly influenced by high cost limited access and lack of urgency

processed_title: measuring the symptom experience of patient with cancer in indonesia crosscultural adaptation and validation of the memorial symptom assessment scaleindonesian version
processed_abstract: context little is known about cancerrelated symptom in term of prevalence severity and distress among patient with cancer in indonesia because of a lack of a valid and reliable scale objective to translate and validate the memorial symptom assessment scale msas among cancer patient in indonesia method two procedure consisting of forwardbackward translation and validation were conducted the validation process including pretesting involved 34 cancer patient and the psychometric testing of the indonesian version of msas msasi involved 207 cancer patient internal consistency testretest reliability construct and concurrent validity of the msasi were established result cronbachs alpha coefficient for the total scale and subscales of the msasi ranged from 075 to 087 the interclass correlation for testretest reliability ranged from 080 to 089 a twofactor structure in the msasi wa produced by exploratory factor analysis and the two factor accounted for 2834 of the cumulative variance in addition the concurrent validity wa demonstrated by the significant association between the subscales of the msasi and their corresponding subscales in the european organization for research and treatment of cancer quality of life questionnairec30 with r 025 to 065 all p 0001 conclusion the msasi present a valid and reliable scale for assessing symptom frequency severity and distress among patient with cancer in indonesia implication for nursing the msasi can assess physical and psychological symptom during cancer treatment in addition the msasi may facilitate in measuring the effectiveness of symptom management strategy

processed_title: advance care planning in indonesia current state and future prospect
processed_abstract: indonesia is a lowmiddle income country in southeast asia a well a the world fourth most populous and largest archipelagic nation indonesia ha approximately 1300 ethnic group that speak 800 different language and are typically collectivist and religiously devout with an aging population and an increasing number of cancer patient palliative care in the country remains scarcely available disproportionally distributed and underfunded all of these factor economic level geographical and cultural landscape and palliative care level of development pose a considerable impact on the adoption of advance care planning in indonesia nonetheless recent advocacy initiative promise some hope in advance care planning in indonesia furthermore local study suggested opportunity to implement advance care planning particularly through capacity building and a culturally sensitive approach to it this article describes the present situation of advance care planning in indonesia including it challenge and opportunity

processed_title: building on health security capacity in indonesia lesson learned from the covid19 pandemic response and challenge
processed_abstract: a an active member country of the who international health regulation and global health security agenda indonesia the world fourthmost populous and largest archipelagic country ha recorded the secondhighest covid19 case in asia with over 18 million case in early june 2021 this geographically and socially diverse country ha a dynamic national and subnational government coordination with decentralized authority that can complicate a pandemic response which often requires nationally harmonized policy adaptability to subnational context and global interconnectedness this paper analysis and review covid19 public data regulation guidance document statement and other related official document to present a narrative that summarizes the government covid19 response strategy it further analysis the challenge and achievement of the country zoonotic disease preparedness and response and lastly provides relevant recommendation finding are presented in four section according to the global health security agenda capacity namely epidemiological surveillance detect capacity laboratory diagnostic testing respond capacity data management and analysis enable capacity and the role of subnational government the covid19 pandemic ha been a catalyst for the rapid transformation of existing surveillance system interrelated stakeholder coordination and agile development from the prepandemic health security capacity this paper offer several recommendation on surveillance laboratory capacity and data management which might be useful for indonesia and other country with similar characteristic beyond the covid19 response such a achieving longterm health security zoonosis and pandemic prevention a well a a digital transformation of their governmental capacity

processed_title: translation and validation of eortc qlqc30 into indonesian version for cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective quality of life study in indonesia are still uncommon this research wa aimed to validate the european organization for research and treatment of cancer quality of life questionnairec30 in indonesian version the standard procedure of forwardbackward translation wa adhered to in the translation procedure the validity procedure included reliability convergent and discriminant validity knowngroups validity factor analysis and external convergent validity method data were collected from cancer patient in the oncology department of sardjito hospital yogyakarta indonesia who were treated with cisplatin at the dosage 50 mgm2 a monotherapy or in combination the short form36 wa used to assess the external convergent validity of our translated questionnaire result one hundred and twentyeight patient were recruited from march 2009 to november 2009 the internal consistency with value of 070 wa observed in the indonesian version of the european organization for research and treatment of cancer quality of life questionnairec30 scale all item in the questionnaire met the criterion of convergent and discriminant validity except for item 5 both of the european organization for research and treatment of cancer quality of life questionnairec30 and the short form36 showed that different diagnosis were associated with a similar impact on quality of life factor analysis showed that only the role function and social function loaded onto the second factor together correlation between the indonesian version of both questionnaire were moderate between 018 and 048 for the physical emotional social fatigue and pain domain conclusion the indonesian version of the european organization for research and treatment of cancer quality of life questionnairec30 can be used a a questionnaire to assess quality of life in indonesian cancer patient with highemetogenic treatment

processed_title: pattern of complementary medicine utilization in patient with breast cancer and colorectal cancer a crosssectional study at a tertiary referral hospital in yogyakarta indonesia
