processed_abstract: purpose the utilization of complementary medicine cm in patient with cancer brings substantial challenge to optimal cancer care by posing a risk of side effect and drug interaction and might delay cancer care delivery we aimed to characterize the pattern and predictor of cm utilization in patient with breast cancer bc and patient with colorectal cancer crc and the impact on presentation and diagnosis interval method we interviewed patient with bc and patient with crc using a semistructured questionnaire to gather sociodemographic clinical presentation and diagnosis interval and cm utilization data the domain of cm used were categorized according to the classification of the national institute of healthnational center for complementary and integrative health result one hundred fortytwo patient with bc and 227 patient with crc n 369 were included the prevalence of cm utilization wa 699 with biologically based therapy being the most commonly used type younger age higher educational attainment and a greater number of health facility visit before diagnosis were significantly associated with higher odds of cm utilization odds ratio or 205 95 ci 119 to 354 p 010 or 107 95 ci 102 to 111 p 007 respectively the diagnosis interval wa significantly longer in patient who used cm compared to nonusers incidence rate ratio irr 274 95 ci 177 to 426 p 001 a greater number of cm modality used were significantly associated with longer presentation and diagnosis interval irr 168 95 ci 106 to 266 p 027 irr 162 95 ci 104 to 252 p 033 respectively conclusion a significant portion of the local patient with bc and patient with crc used cm cm utilization wa associated with age education number of health facility visit and prolonged diagnosis interval these finding underscore the need for cm disclosure among patient for better patient education and monitoring

processed_title: what contributes to palliative care practice in cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background palliative care ha an important role in cancer treatment it ha been established in indonesia for year however palliative care doe not give significant improvement which may due to the numerous component of palliative care objective this research aim to identify factor affecting palliative care in indonesia method this article is a literature review which wa conducted through a systematic search from four online database cochrane pubmed embase ebscohost the search revealed 45 study then selected using prisma 2020 algoritm leaving 8 study to be analyzed the factor affecting palliative care in indonesia were then grouped into three point of view the patient and caregiver healthcare provider further divided into healthcare personnel and system a well a healthcare system by knowing these factor it is expected that we can achieve optimal implementation palliative care in indonesia especially in cancer patient result the factor influencing palliative care in indonesia can be grouped into patient healthcare provider and healthcare system conclusion palliative care improvement in indonesia can be enhanced to achieve optimal implementation in cancer treatment

processed_title: risk assessment of aflatoxin b1 exposure from maize and peanut consumption in indonesia using the margin of exposure and liver cancer risk estimation approach
processed_abstract: aflatoxin b1 afb1 is a secondary fungal metabolite product widely found in many foodstuff and considered a public health concern worldwide due to it genotoxicity and carcinogenicity tropical climate and inappropriate food safety practice in indonesia are the favorable condition for afb1 contamination of foodstuff despite these challenge there ha been a limited number of risk assessment of afb1 conducted in indonesia therefore this paper aimed to gather all available occurrence data of afb1 in maize and peanut originating from indonesia and used the occurrence data to evaluate the risk of exposure to afb1 using the margin of exposure moe and the quantitative liver cancer risk approach established by efsa and faowho respectively risk assessment using both the moe and quantitative liver cancer risk approach revealed that afb1 exposure from maize and peanut consumption in indonesia is of concern the moe value derived from consumption of maize and peanut originating from indonesia were generally below 10000 and for several occurrence data were even below 1000 the estimated number of liver cancer case associated with afb1 exposure generally wa above the 01 cancer cases100000 individuals75 year altogether the evaluation reveals the urgency for risk management of afb1 in indonesia

processed_title: healthcare provider and parent perspective on complementary alternative medicine in child with cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: background complementary alternative medicine cam use in child with cancer is widespread health care provider hcp need to acknowledge and address this need this study explored and compared perspective on cam of hcp and parent of young patient with cancer in indonesia material and method we conducted a crosssectional study using semistructured questionnaire in hcp and parent of childhood cancer patient at an indonesian academic hospital result a total of 351 respondent participated 175 hcp response rate 80 and 176 parent response rate 80 parent were more likely than hcp to think that chemotherapy can cure cancer 80 compared to 69 p0013 nearly half of all parent 46 and hcp 45 doubted whether cam can cure cancer parent were more likely than hcp to think that cam can be helpful in childhood cancer treatment 54 compared to 35 p0003 the most recommended cam by hcp wa selfprayer 93 reason for recommending cam were hope for improvement of the child condition 48 patient want to stop treatment 42 most discouraged cam by hcp wa by oldsmart people 70 the reason being lack of evidence for usefulness 77 lack of cam knowledge 75 the proportion thinking that patient were unlikely to raise the cam topic if they perceived that doctor were skeptical wa higher in parent than in hcp 52 versus 1 p0001 most hcp 71 and parent 77 acknowledged that their knowledge about safety and efficacy of cam wa inadequate pns the proportion that wanted to learn or read more about cam wa higher among parent than hcp 48 compared to 31 p0002 conclusion hcp and parent have different perspective on cam use in child with cancer hcp should enhance their cam knowledge and encourage open communication about cam with parent if doctor skepticism is perceived parent are unlikely to raise cam a a topic

processed_title: comparing healthcare provider perspective on complementary and alternative medicine in childhood cancer between netherlands and indonesia
processed_abstract: background use of complementary and alternative medicine cam is common among patient with childhood cancer healthcare provider hcp should address this need properly geographical and cultural difference seem likely this study explores perspective on cam of hcp involved in the care of child with cancer in netherlands and indonesia health belief component of cam encouraging or discouraging cam and knowledge about cam were assessed procedure we conducted a crosssectional study using semistructured questionnaire at a dutch and indonesian academic hospital result a total of 342 hcp participated 119 dutch response rate 80 and 223 indonesian response rate 87 chemotherapy can cure cancer according to more dutch than indonesian hcp 87 v 53 respectively p 0001 combination of chemotherapy and cam is the best way to cure cancer according to more indonesian than dutch hcp 45 v 25 p 0001 dutch and indonesian hcp recommend and discourage cam use differently most dutch 77 and indonesian hcp 84 consider their knowledge about cam to be inadequate p n fewer dutch doctor than other hcp want to learn more about cam 51 v 76 p 0007 whereas there is no significant difference in eagerness to learn about cam between indonesian doctor 64 and other hcp 72 conclusion indonesian hcp have more positive view about cam than their dutch colleague both dutch and indonesian hcp consider their knowledge about cam to be inadequate therefore education program about cam tailored to the need of hcp are recommended knowing that cam is used frequently

processed_title: evaluation of a 5year cervical cancer prevention project in indonesia opportunity issue and challenge
processed_abstract: aim the cervical and breast cancer prevention cecap project sought to develop a national model for cervical cancer prevention in indonesia based on visual inspection with acetic acid via to detect abnormal change in the cervix the purpose of this study wa to evaluate a pilot project introducing via and cryotherapy in indonesia and to identify lesson learned that could be applied to the national scaleup of cervical cancer prevention service material and method fiftyfour month july 2007 to december 2011 of service record at 17 health center were abstracted and analyzed the data were used to calculate the proportion of all woman aged 3050 who received via screening the viapositive rate the treatment rate and the interval between screening and treatment result the 45 050 woman screened during the project included 244 of the total female population in the target age group in the catchment area throughout the 5year project 831 of viapositive woman sought cryotherapy during the last 18 month of the project after data collection tool were revised to more accurately reflect when cryotherapy wa received 13 of woman were treated on the same day that they were screened among the 74 of woman treated within 1 month of screening the mean interval between screening and treatment wa 72 day conclusion a cervical cancer prevention service are scaled up throughout indonesia change in the service delivery model and program management are needed to increase screening coverage promote a singlevisit approach and ensure the quality of service

processed_title: association of kras mutation and clinical characteristic of colorectal cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background colorectal cancer crc remains a major burden worldwide ranking third and second in incidence and mortality respectively detection of biomarkers including kras mutation can help predict prognosis and response to therapy in crc thus this study evaluated the frequency of kras mutation among indonesian patient and their association with clinicopathologic characteristic method fiftythree crc sample were collected from january to september 2022 in the department of surgery dr hasan sadikin general hospital bandung indonesia kras mutation were analyzed using pcr followed by sanger sequencing association between kras mutation were evaluated using binary logistic regression analysis result kras mutation were detected in 528 of patient n28 of which 36 were pgly12ser n1 321 were pgly12asp n9 71 were pgly13asp n2 36 were pgln61his n1 36 were pasp126his n1 and 36 were plys169glu n1 the pasp73 polymorphism wa detected in 571 of the sample n16 kras mutation status did not differ significantly between the group based on the age of onset sex tumor location tumor histology stage and family history conclusion kras mutation are present in high frequency in this cohort of crc patient in a tertiary hospital in west java indonesia however kras mutation status is not associated with the age of onset sex tumor location tumor histology stage and family history

processed_title: laboratory readiness and response for sarscov2 in indonesia
processed_abstract: the laboratory diagnosis of sarscov2 infection comprises the informational cornerstone in the effort to contain the infection therefore the ability to leverage laboratory capacity in diagnostic testing and to increase the number of people being tested are critical this paper review the readiness of indonesian laboratory during the early month of the pandemic it discusses the success of crosssectoral collaboration among previously siloed national and subnational government institution international development agency and private sector stakeholder this collaboration managed to scaleup the covid19 referral laboratory network from one ministry of health nihrd laboratory in the capital to 685 laboratory across 34 province however this rapid growth within 12 month since the first indonesian case wa discovered remained insufficient to cater for the constantly surging testing demand within the world fourth most populous country reflecting on how other country built their current pandemic preparedness from past emergency this paper highlight challenge and opportunity in workforce shortage logistic distribution and complex administration that need to be addressed

processed_title: brca1 promoter methylation and clinicopathological characteristic in sporadic breast cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective the aim of this study wa to investigate the brca1 promoter methylation and clinicopathological characteristic in sporadic breast cancer patient in indonesia method in this cohort study we selected 90 patient with stage iiii who had definitive surgery at our institution in 20112014 demographic and clinical data regarding pathological stage breast cancer treatment outcome etc were collected from the medical record twelve patient had incomplete information on follow up and 18 sample had insufficient tissue for the experiment sixty patient with adequate cancer tissue and complete follow up record were analyzed only 56 patient were analyzed because 4 sample mrna expression could not be detected the mannwhitney u test for nonnormally distributed group were used to compare the level expression of brca1 mrna between methylated and nonmethylated sample chisquare test were used to compare methylation status brca1 mrna expression and clinicopathological characteristic p value 005 wa considered a statistically significant correlation data analysis wa held by using the graphpad prism 7 graphpad software inc usa result dna and rna were isolated from primary tumor tissue of 56 breast cancer patient brca1 promoter methylation wa detected in 48 of 56 patient 85 level of brca1 mrna expression wa associated with decreased methylation level in the brca1 promoter region suggesting the role of epigenetic silencing however there wa no statistically significant association among methylation level brca1 mrna transcript level with clinicopathological factor conclusion to our knowledge this is the first study investigating methylation status and level of brca1 mrna transcript among breast cancer patient in indonesia we found that the prevalence of brca1 promoter methylation is higher than other study from different population however further investigation involving larger number of patient is required

processed_title: asbestos in asia
processed_abstract: asbestos is a global killer despite lesson learned in the developed world on the use of asbestos and it hazardous pulmonary consequence it use continues to increase in asia although some country such a japan korea and singapore have curtailed the use of this mineral there are numerous country in asia that continue to mine import and use this fibre particularly china which is one of the largest consumer in the world numerous factor ranging from political and economic to the lack of understanding of asbestos and the management of asbestosrelated lung disease are key to this observed trend awareness of these factor combined with early intervention may prevent the predicted asian tsunami of asbestos disease

processed_title: estimating the burden of cancer and treatment cost related to alcohol consumption in indonesia a descriptive study
processed_abstract: background alcohol consumption ha become one of the most common cancer risk factor after smoking nowadays estimation of the burden of disease attributable to alcohol ha become standard in documenting the impact of health problem but it ha been rarely performed in indonesia the aim of this study wa to estimate treatment cost of cancer related to alcohol consumption among the indonesian population method this research design wa descriptive with a prevalencebased approach using secondary data proportion of cancer were calculated using an alcoholattributable fraction aaf formula treatment cost for eight type of cancer were assessed according to average treatment cost per patient from the national universal health coverage database for 2016 result the top three aafs for male were cancer of the pharynx esophagus and larynx 175 153 and 798 respectively while in female they were cancer of the esophagus pharynx and stomach 215 139 083 among the eight type of cancer studied the highest incidence in male wa noted for liver cancer 132 case while colorectal cancer wa the most common among female 31 case treatment cost for cancer related to alcohol consumption were highest for colorectak cancer followed by laryngeal and liver cancer 116083 98325 and 93253 usd respectively conclusion the expenditure for treatment of cancer related to alcohol consumption account for about 171 of total cancer treatment cost since cancer related to alcohol consumption can be considered having an economic impact in indonesia it becomes important for the government to control alcohol consumption so that related healthcare expenditure can be minimized

processed_title: investigation of the trend and associated factor of ovarian cancer in indonesia a systematic analysis of the global burden of disease study 19902021
processed_abstract: introduction ovarian cancer is one of the most lethal gynecological cancer despite diagnosis and treatment advance survival rate have not increased over the past 32 year this study estimated and reported the global burden of ovarian cancer during the past 32 year to inform preventative and control strategy method we examined ovarian cancer incidence mortality and disabilityadjusted life year dalys using agestandardized rate from the global burden of disease injury and risk factor study 2021 high body mass index and occupational asbestos exposure were linked with death and dalys data are presented a average with 95 uncertainty interval uis result indonesia had 13 250 8 57421 565 ovarian cancer case in 2021 with 5 296 3 5208958 death and 186 917 121 866309 820 dalys the burden increased by 23353 for new case 22195 for mortality and 20665 for dalys the agestandardized rate also increased from 1990 to 2021 ovarian cancer burden increased with age but declined in the 50 year age group according to the sociodemographic index the gross domestic product per caput and number of obstetrician and oncologic gynecologist in province showed different trend conclusion indonesian ovarian cancer rate are rising despite gynecologic oncologist in 24 of 34 province these finding will help policymakers and healthcare provider identify ovarian cancer prevention and control gap

processed_title: influencing womens action on cervical cancer screening and treatment in karawang district indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction the impact of cervical cancer prevention program depends on persuading woman to go for screening and if needed treatment a part of an evaluation of a pilot project in indonesia qualitative research wa conducted to explore the factor that influence womens decision regarding screening and treatment and to generate practical recommendation to increase service coverage and reduce loss to follow up method research wa conducted at 7 of the 17 public health center in karawang district that implemented the pilot project interview and focus group discussion were held with 20 woman 20 husband 10 doctor 18 midwife 3 district health official and 16 advocacy team member result free service and mobile outreach event encouraged woman to go for screening along with promotional effort by community health worker advocacy team and the mass medium knowledge and perception were the most important barrier to screening woman were not aware of cervical cancer risk did not know the disease wa treatable and were fatalistic factor facilitating treatment were social support from husband relative and friend and the encouragement and role modeling of health worker barrier to prompt treatment included limited access to service and the requirement for husband consent for cryotherapy conclusion a cervical cancer prevention service are scaled up throughout indonesia the finding suggest three strategy to expand screening coverage and ensure prompt treatment strengthening community mobilization and advocacy activity modifying the service delivery model to encourage a single visit approach to screening and treatment and working to gain men support

processed_title: forshex digital health intervention to improve the quality of life during chemotherapy among gynecological cancer survivor in indonesia a protocol for a pilot and feasibility study
processed_abstract: most indonesian gynecological cancer survivor have unmet supportive care need during chemotherapy which may lower their quality of life and discontinue the treatment digital health intervention can address this issue this pilot investigation aim to 1 examine the feasibility and acceptability of a fighting on distress selfefficacy health effect and sexual issue forshex intervention and 2 evaluate prospectively the impact of the study implementation on the level of distress selfefficacy side effect knowledge and management and sexual quality of life using the reaim reach effectiveness adoption implementation and maintenance framework this is a nonrandomized mixedmethods pilot study we will recruit woman diagnosed with gynecological cancer undergoing chemotherapy to participate in the forshex intervention consisting of ten week of social mediabased education and telecoaching we will evaluate the primary outcome of study feasibility and acceptability and the secondary outcome of study impact at three time point with quantitative and qualitative inquiry we anticipate a minimum of 30 participant to enroll in the study and complete the assessment we will disseminate result through conference and peerreviewed scientific journal this study will imply whether a definitive trial to evaluate the potential benefit of the forshex is viable and how it should proceed the protocol can aid researcher or nurse in implementing this approach in their study or practice trial registration clinical trial registration number isrctn13311651

processed_title: gastrointestinal cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: background report on cancer incidence in indonesia wa presented in relative frequency to lower the bias the report ha been presented in age standardized cancer ratio ascar the report wa a department of pathology based cancer registration the ascar of gastro intestinal cancer in indonesia ha some variation between pathologic centre the incidence of rectal cancer in jogjakarta wa higher than colon cancer and stomach cancer is very low the risk factor of stomach cancer are h pylorus infection and food consumption especially salt and the risk factor of colorectal cancer is food consumption purpose the article will discus the ascar of stomach and colorectal cancer in indonesia the histopathologic of stomach and colorectal cancer in jogjakarta will be presented from the view point of pathology method stomach and colorectal cancer data from 13 pathologic diagnostic centre in indonesia were collected the pathogenesis of stomach and colorectal cancer will be discussed in correlation with the cancer prevention result the incidence of stomach cancer in many centre in the year of 1996 are very low from 000 024 for the most lowest incidence and 222 560 for the highest incidence the higher incidence of stomach cancer wa in medan 19 male 56 10 female 222 palembang 7 male 475 1 female 011 surabaya 18 male 138 7 female 035 denpasar 12 male 297 1 female 024 and jakarta 55 male 4 28 female 139 the incidence of colorectal cancer is almost equal in every pathologic diagnostic centre it is interesting that the incidence of rectal cancer wa higher than colon cancer in jogjakarta the histopathological feature of stomach cancer wa predominated by poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma while colorectal cancer wa predominated by well differentiated adenocarcinoma conclusion the low incidence of gastric cancer in indonesia in relation with h pylorus and food consumption and the high ratio between rectal and colon cancer in correlation with the food consumption and it pathogenesis need further investigation

processed_title: early detection of breast cancer in indonesia barrier identified in a qualitative study
processed_abstract: background the lack of early detection in breast cancer management ha been identified a the primary factor contributing to the high mortality rate the introduction of bpjs kesehatan indonesia national health insurance wa intended to ensure the provision of adequate health service for breast cancer patient this study aimed to investigate the current state of health service in indonesia concerning the early detection of breast cancer following the implementation of bpjs kesehatan introduction method the study wa conducted in 2017 in yogyakarta indonesia subject were recruited using a purposive sampling technique with maximum variation the sample comprised breast cancer patient health care professional hcps and healthy woman from the general population with no history of breast cancer the subject experience and knowledge of health service regarding the early detection of breast cancer were investigated through indepth interview thematic analysis wa used to synthesize the result from interview with 25 participant result this study identified several issue that hinder the timely detection of breast cancer the lack of both screening and diagnostic procedure emerged a a prominent obstacle in breast cancer management the study identified the following barrier 1 limited community knowledge about early detection 2 lack of urgency among patient to seek medical treatment 3 limited access to health facility and 4 inconsistent adherence among health care professional to guideline for both screening and diagnostic procedure conclusion this study revealed multiple factor contributing to the delay in breast cancer detection in indonesia leading to suboptimal management of the disease it is crucial for the government to prioritize the improvement of enabling factor across all level of care for early detection these factor include initiative to increase public awareness improve access to health service strengthen the referral system and enhance health facility

processed_title: oral contraceptive use and breast cancer in indonesia
processed_abstract: a hospitalbased casecontrol study wa conducted in ujungpandang indonesia to determine the association of breast cancer and current and former oral contraceptive oc use this study included 119 newly diagnosed histologicallyconfirmed breast cancer case who were admitted to the four largest referral hospital in ujungpandang from 19901991 control were 258 woman admitted to these same four hospital with diagnosis unrelated to breast cancer or oc use thirty case 32 and 55 19 control reported having ever used ocs the odds ratio for ever using ocs and breast cancer wa 18 95 confidence interval 1230 after adjustment for age age at first pregnancy and family history of breast cancer increasing duration of oc use did not increase risk of breast cancer no latency trend of increasing year since first oc use among case wa observed however a younger age at first oc use wa associated with increasing breast cancer risk a significant recency effect wa observed woman last using ocs within five year of study enrollment were at greatest risk of breast cancer or 49 95 ci 21114 this first study of breast cancer and oc use in indonesia doe not provide consistent data to indicate an increased risk of breast cancer associated with oc use although breast cancer case were 80 more likely to have ever used ocs neither duration nor latency of oc use were associated with cancer risk the significant recency effect suggests that a detection bias might explain the observed relationship between ever oc use and breast cancerabstract truncated at 250 word

processed_title: nurse knowledge and attitude toward complementary and alternative medicine for adult patient with cancer in bandung west java indonesia a qualitative study
processed_abstract: the aim of this study wa to explore nurse knowledge and attitude toward the use of complementary and alternative medicine cam among cancer patient in a palliative care setting a descriptive qualitative approach wa used in this study semistructured interview were conducted with 10 nurse recruited using purposive sampling the data were analyzed using an inductive semantic approach thematic analysis identified that nurse possess limited knowledge of cam nurse were skeptical toward cam and less confident to recommend it use four main theme and two subthemes emerged understanding of cam hesitative attitude personal experience and preference in learning about cam there is a need to integrate cam topic into nursing education program in order to develop nurse knowledge and build positive attitude toward cam use sufficient knowledge and positive attitude toward cam would support safety and quality of care in management of patient with cancer who use or are contemplating using cam

processed_title: economic and humanistic burden of hpvrelated disease in indonesia a qualitative analysis
processed_abstract: the burden of human papillomavirus hpv and hpvrelated cancer and genital wart is increasing in developing country including indonesia the objective of this study wa to qualitatively explore the humanistic and economic burden of these hpvrelated disease in patient in indonesia in 2021 indepth interview and focus group were conducted with patient n 18 with hpvrelated disease and healthcare professional hcps n 10 specialised in treating these patient interview explored the physical mental social and economic burden of hpvrelated disease patient emphasised the psychological and social burden of hpvrelated disease which negatively impacted their mental state and close relationship treatment for hpvrelated disease wa also associated with a substantial cost which health insurance only partially alleviated hcps understood the physical negative impact of hpvrelated disease but some understated patient social psychological and financial burden this research underscore the substantial economic and humanistic burden of hpvrelated disease that could be prevented by vaccination in addition it highlight the need for novel intervention to reduce negative psychosocial consequence of hpvrelated disease in indonesia increased hcp education of the broader humanistic impact of hpvrelated disease may improve patient support and increase awareness for preventive strategy

processed_title: the incidence and mortality of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia in indonesia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background the incidence of childhood all in indonesia is still largely unknown the widely mentioned statistic from other country turn out to be only estimated figure other data do not specify the type of leukemia and are not specifically focused on child therefore this study aim to pool incidence and mortality statistic from available study in indonesia method we searched five different academic database including pubmed medline cochrane library science direct and google scholar three indonesian database such a the indonesian scientific journal database isjd neliti and indonesia one search were also utilized incidence wa expressed a per 100000 child we used the newcastleottawa scale no to assess the quality of cohort study the inclusion criterion are cohort study published in the language of english or indonesian for this analysis we define child a 018 year old finding the incidence rate for childhood all wa found to be 432 per 100000 child 95 ci 265599 with a prediction interval of 198 to 942 per 100000 child the incidence rate is higher in male with 245 per 100000 child 95 ci 198291 and a prediction interval of 190 to 316 per 100000 child a for female the incidence rate is 205 per 100000 child 95 ci 152277 with a prediction interval of 152 to 277 per 100000 child the mortality of childhood all range from 044 to 53 death per 100000 child while the cfr is 358 with varying true effect size of 284 to 452 interpretation with 795 million child living in indonesia in 2018 this mean that there were roughly 3434 new case of childhood all an organized effort between multiple sector is needed to improve the registry of childhood all in indonesia

processed_title: colorectal cancer screening in semarang indonesia a multicenter primary health care based study
processed_abstract: colorectal cancer crc is a major public health problem in indonesia it rank among the top four cancer with high mortality rate crc screening is expected to improve early diagnosis that can reduce mortality and morbidity rate primary health carebased crc screening in indonesia ha not yet been performed this study wa conducted to obtain information about prevalence adenoma detection rate and public compliance for crc screening in semarang indonesia this crosssectional study wa done across 10 primary health care center in semarang during apriloctober 2021 the screening method used immunochromatography faecal occult blood test ifobt a the primary test patient with positive ifobt result would be referred to kariadi hospital for colonoscopy and histology examination a total of 221 patient were included 661 were female mean age wa 5938 748 year participation rate wa 63 37 patient 167 were ifobt positive 26 patient 7027 underwent colonoscopy colonoscopy compliance rate wa 7027 the colonoscopy result were haemorrhoid 308 polyp 308 malignancy 192 colitis 77 diverticulosis 77 and normal 38 the adenoma detection rate wa 269 bmi abnormality overweight and obese or 10968 95 ci 2335155 and family history of malignancy or 18800 95 ci 5136885 increased the risk of colorectal cancer and adenoma and respectively the prevalence of ifobt positive in primary health care center is high the crc screening program based on primary care should be considered public awareness education should be considered to increase colonoscopy compliance

processed_title: comparison of breast cancer in indonesia and malaysiaa clinicopathological study between dharmais cancer centre jakarta and university malaya medical centre kuala lumpur
processed_abstract: introduction the age standardised incidence rate asr of breast cancer in malaysia which is a high middle income country is similar to indonesia a low middleincome country globocan 2008 it is however unknown whether the presentation of breast cancer differs between these two country objective we compared the stage age at presentation and pathological characteristic of breast cancer between two tertiary hospital in indonesia and malaysia dharmais cancer centre dcc which is the national cancer referral centre in indonesia and university malaya medical centre ummc which is an academic hospital with established breast oncology service in kuala lumpur one thousand one hundred and fourteen consecutive woman 477 in ummc 637 in dcc who were newly diagnosed with breast cancer between january and december 2010 were included patient age tnm stage at presentation and pathological characteristic were compared estrogen receptor er and progesterone receptor pr were considered positive if 10 or greater of invasive cell nucleus were stained while her2 wa considered positive with an immunohistochemistry staining intensity of 3 logistic regression analysis were performed to identify difference result median age at diagnosis wa 52 year in ummc and 47 year in dcc whereby patient in dcc were more likely to be very young at diagnosis aged 35 year compared to their counterpart in ummc odds ratio or 209 95ci 132331 approximately one third of patient in ummc presented with tnm stage iii or iv compared to 63 in dcc patient in dcc were three time more likely to present with metastatic breast cancer compared to patient in ummc or 301 95 ci 202448 the percentage of low grade tumour in dcc wa higher than in ummc 28 v 11 respectively and the difference persisted even after multivariate adjustment although the frequency of er and pr positivity appeared to be higher in ummc 65 and 55 respectively compared to dcc 48 and 40 respectively these difference were not statistically significant following adjustment for age stage her2 status and grade the frequency of her2 positivity wa 45 in dcc compared to 26 in ummc and remained significantly higher even after multivariate adjustment multivariate or176 95ci125247 in dcc compared to ummc the proportion of triple negative breast cancer wa however similar in the two centre 19 in ummc v 21 in dcc conclusion indonesian woman with breast cancer seem to present at a younger age and at later stage compared to malaysian woman their tumor were more likely to be of low grade and her2 positive even after adjustment for other factor while hormone receptor positivity proved similar in the two group the higher her2 positivity rate in indonesian patient warrant further study

processed_title: determinant of cancer screening awareness and participation among indonesian woman
processed_abstract: background cancer screening awareness and participation may be lower in low and middleincome country that lack established national screening programme compared with those that do we evaluated potential determinant of awareness about and participation in breast and cervical cancer screening and breast selfexamination bse in woman using survey data from indonesia method from the fifth indonesian family life survey 20142015 a total of 5397 woman aged 40 and older without any history of cancer who responded to questionnaire concerning pap smear mammography and bse were included multilevel modelling wa used to assess potential determinant in relation to awareness about pap smear and mammography and participation in pap smear and bse practice multivariable analysis were performed to identify independent predictor of cancer screening result of the 5397 respondent 1058 20 woman were aware of pap smear of which 297 had never had the procedure only 251 5 participant were aware of mammography a total of 605 12 of woman reported they performed bse higher education and household expenditure were consistently associated with higher odds of awareness about pap smear and mammography eg odds ratio or of being aware of pap smear and mammography 782 95 ci 630970 and 770 619958 respectively for high school graduate compared to woman with less educational attainment in the multivariable model and participation in pap smear and bse we also identified enabling factor linked with greater cancer screening awareness and participation including health insurance shorter distance to health service and social participation conclusion there are socioeconomic disparity in cancer screening awareness and participation among indonesian woman our finding may help inform targeted health promotion and screening for cancer in the presence of limited resource

processed_title: predictor of complementary and alternative medicine use by breast cancer patient in bandung indonesia
processed_abstract: background the study aimed to assess complementary and alternative medicine cam use and their associated factor with breast cancer patient in bandung indonesia material and method in total 330 breast cancer patient were administered questionnaire on their cam use and cam predictive factor including sociodemographic parameter clinical data and quality of life trust in physician trust in hospital satisfaction and informational need data were analyzed using univariate analysis and multivariate log regreesion analysis result overall 333 of patient reported use of cam lower income lower education presence of metastasis prolonged diagnosis less trust in physician were found to be highly associated with cam use conclusion cam use by breast cancer patient can be interpreted a an attempt to explore all possible option an expression of an active coping style or expression of unmet need in the cancer care continuum physician need to openly discus the use of cam with their patient and identify whether they have other unmet supportive need

processed_title: brca1 gene mutation screening for the hereditary breast andor ovarian cancer syndrome in breast cancer case a first high resolution dna melting analysis in indonesia
processed_abstract: specific pattern of the hereditary breast and ovarian cancer hboc syndrome are related to mutation in the brca1 gene one hundred unrelated breast cancer patient were interviewed to obtain clinical symptom and sign pedigree and familial history of hboc syndrome related cancer subsequently data were calculated using the breast and ovarian analysis of disease incidence and carrier estimation algorithm boadicea risk prediction model patient with high score of boadicea were offered genetic testing eleven patient with high score of boadicea 2 patient with low score of boadicea 2 patient family member and 15 control underwent brca1 genetic testing mutation screening using pcrhrm wa carried out in 22 exon 41 amplicons of brca1 gene sanger sequencing wa subjected in all sample with aberrant graph this study identified 10 variant in the brca1 gene consisting of 6 missense mutation c1480ca c2612ct c2566tc c3113ag c3548 ag c4837 ag 3 synonymous mutation c2082 c t c2311 t c and c4308tc and one intronic mutation c13435 gt all variant tend to be polymorphism and unclassified variant however no known pathogenic mutation were found

processed_title: dealing with symptom and issue of hospitalized patient with cancer in indonesia the role of family nurse and physician
processed_abstract: objective patient with cancer often face physical psychological social spiritual and emotional symptom our aim wa to study symptom and issue of hospitalized patient with cancer in indonesia a country with strong family tie and how family member nurse and physician deal with them method in 2011 150 hospitalized cancer patient in 3 general hospital in indonesia were invited to fill in a questionnaire which wa based on the validated problem and need of palliative care short version questionnaire descriptive statistic were performed result of 119 patient 79 who completed the questionnaire 85 stated that their symptom and issue were addressed according to these patient financial 56 autonomy 36 and psychosocial 34 issue were most often addressed by the family alone physical symptom 52 and spiritual issue 33 were addressed mainly by a combination of family nurse and physician conclusion hospitalized patient with cancer in indonesia felt that most of their symptom and issue had been addressed and the family wa highly involved the strong family tie in indonesian culture may have contributed to this family role more research is needed to clarify how this influence patient outcome quality of care and quality of life of both the patient and their family along with the degree of partnership between family and professional this information might help answer the question what advantage and disadvantage the family role in caring for a hospitalized patient with cancer generates for the patient the family and professional caregiver

processed_title: profile and survival of tongue cancer patient in dharmais cancer hospital jakarta
processed_abstract: background tongue cancer is still a major health problem in most developing country around the world statistic shown the number of tongue cancer especially in early age to be increasing with poor survival objective to analyze the characteristic profile of tongue cancer patient in indonesia a well a the survival rate material and method a cross sectional study wa conducted in dharmais national cancer hospital by collecting general clinical and survival data of tongue cancer patient from medical record for january 2009 to april 2012 result tongue cancer incidence increased year by year the average age of tongue cancer patient wa 475 year and male predominated accounting for 645 of case most patient presented at an advanced stage 696 the histopathology type wa squamous cell carcinoma in the vast majoriy 968 the therapy applied were surgery 456 radiation 636 and chemotherapy 576 the survival rate after one year is 606 and after two year wa 121 in addition median survival of tongue cancer patient wa 20 month 95 confidence interval 907309 the significant factor affecting survival wa size of tumor with a hazard ratio of 318 95 ci 102993 p 0046 for largest versus smallest category conclusion in each year the number of tongue cancer incident in indonesia is increasing the age of tongue cancer patient in indonesia is younger compared to other country moreover the survival rate are not high

processed_title: adrenal incidentaloma
processed_abstract: adrenal incidentaloma is an adrenal tumor which is unidentified before the imaging procedure conducted for an abnormality which is initially unforeseen a an adrenal disease symptom andor clinical sign of adrenal tumor do not have to be present prior to a diagnosis adrenal incidentaloma can be divided into nonhypersecreting adrenal adenoma hypersecreting tumor primary adrenal carcinoma other adrenal mass and metastasis the majority of adrenal tumor is nonhypersecreting adrenal adenoma but it is always considered a hypersecreting tumor until proven otherwise some condition that can be found due to hormonal activity of adrenal incidentaloma is subclinical cushing syndrome pheochromocytoma aldosteronoma conns disease and several tumor which secrete androgen and sex hormone diagnostic approach of adrenal incidentaloma is focused on two main problem which are whether the lesion is hormonally active even though lacking characteristic clinical sign and whether the lesion is benign or malignant thus it need hormonal and radiologic evaluation even a fine needle biopsy the management for adrenal incidentaloma includes surgical removal for hormonally active adrenal tumor or inactive tumor with size less than 4 cm monitoring of tumor hormone level and size are necessary for nonhypersecreting tumor without surgical removal

processed_title: populationbased cancer registration in indonesia
processed_abstract: cancer is a major public health problem in indonesia becoming the 7th largest cause of death based on a national survey in 2007 accounting for 57 of all mortality a cancer registry wa started in 1970 but it wa partial and wa stopped mainly because no government body wa responsible realizing the above situation the indonesian government established the sub directorate of cancer control within the ministry of health with responsibility for developing a national cancer control program including a cancer registry a sustainable cancer registry wa then started in 2007 within jakarta province first hospitalbased but then expanded to be populationbased step of cancer registration in jakarta are data collection data verification data validation data management and analysis and data publication data collection is conducted by health facility hospital laboratory primary health center at the districtmunicipal level with report to the provincial level data are collected passively by holding meeting every three month in the districtmunicipality verification of data is the responsibility of the medical doctor or pathologist in each data source data validation is conducted by a team in the cancer registry consisting of districtmunicipalprovince health officer pathologist and registrar data management and analysis are conducted by a cancer registry team at the provincial level assisted by the national team we use software named indonesian cancer registry system srikandi which is adopted from canreg4 iarc data from the populationbased cancer registry in jakarta province showed the leading cancer among female in 20052007 to be breast cancer cervical cancer ovarian cancer colorectal cancer and among male are bronchus and lung cancer colorectal cancer liver cancer pharyngeal cancer and prostate cancer the leading childhood cancer are leukaemia and retinoblastoma

processed_title: fiveyear cancer epidemiology at the national referral hospital hospitalbased cancer registry data in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose in 2016 there were 1308061 case of cancer being treated in indonesia with 22 trillion rupiah spent amounting to 486960633 in u dollar purchasing power parity 2016 the high burden of cancer in indonesia requires a valid data collection to inform future cancerrelated policy the purpose of this study is to report cancer epidemiological data from 2008 to 2012 based on hospitalbased cancer registry hbcr data from cipto mangunkusumo hospital indonesia method this wa a descriptive study with crosssectional design data were collected from cipto mangunkusumo hospital hbcr 20082012 demographical diagnostic stage of cancer and histopathological type of cancer data were extracted result after screening 18216 case were included a total of 12438 patient were older than 39 year of age 683 with a femaletomale ratio of 95 most patient have cancer at advanced stage stage iii and iv 102 the most common site of cancer were cervix uterus 2878 case 158 breast 2459 case 135 hematopoietic and reticuloendothelial system 1422 case 78 nasopharynx 1338 case 74 and lymph node 1104 case 61 conclusion from this hbcr cancer incidence in female wa almost twice the incidence in male largely because of the burden of cervical and breast cancer the cervix uterus a one of the top five cancer site based on this hbcr 20082012 are still approximately consistent with global cancer incidence mortality and prevalence 2018 which portrayed that indonesia ha been severely afflicted by cervical cancer case more than any other association of southeast asian nation country the hbcr could serve a a robust database of epidemiological data for cancer case in indonesia

processed_title: availability and accessibility of primary care for the remote rural and poor population of indonesia
processed_abstract: background adopting universal health coverage for implementation of a national health insurance system jaminan kesehatan nasional jknbadan penyelenggara jaminan sosial or the indonesian national social health insurance scheme bpjs target the 255 million population of indonesia the availability accessibility and acceptance of healthcare service are the most important challenge during implementation referral behavior and the utilization of primary care structure for underserved ruralremote region population are key guiding element in this study we provided the first assessment of bpjs implementation and it resulting implication for healthcare delivery based on the entire insurance dataset for the initial period of implementation specifically focusing on poor and remote population method demographic economic and healthcare infrastructure information wa obtained from public resource data about the jkn membership structure performance information and reimbursement were provided by the bpjs national head office for analysis an anova wa used to compare reimbursement index for primary healthcare phc and advanced healthcare ahc the usage of primary care resource wa analyzed by comparing clustered province and utilization index differentiating poor penerima bantuan iur pbi membership and nonpoor population nonpbi factorial and canonical discrimination analysis were applied to identify the determinant of phc structure result remote region cover 278 of districtsmunicipalities the distribution of the poor population and pbi member were highly correlated r2 08 p 0001 three cluster of province remote highpoor n 13 remote lowpoor n 15 nonremote n 5 were identified a discrimination analysis enabled the 82 correct cluster classification of infrastructure and human resource of health hrhrelated factor standardized hrh nurse and general practitioner gp availability showed significant difference between cluster p 001 whereas the availability of hospital bed wa weakly correlated the usage of phc wa 2fold of ahc while nonpbi member utilized ahc 4 to 5fold more frequently than pbi member referral index r2 094 p 0001 for pbi nonpbi and ahc utilization rate r2 053 p 0001 were highly correlated conclusion human resource of health availability were intensively related to the extent of the remote population but not the number of the poor population the access point of phc were mainly used by the poor population and in remote region whereas other population group nonpbi and nonremote preferred direct access to ahc guiding referral and the utilization of primary care will be key success factor for the effective and efficient usage of available healthcare infrastructure and the achievement of universal health coverage in indonesia the shortterm development of jkn wa recommended with a focus on guiding referral behavior especially in remote region and for nonpbi member

processed_title: dietary pattern and risk of oral cancer a factor analysis study of a population in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: a matched casecontrol hospitalbased study of oral cancer wa conducted in jakarta population the sample included 81 case and 162 control the purpose of this study wa to determine the association between dietary pattern and oral cancer in a jakarta population using factor analysis dietary data were collected using food frequency questionnaire and factor analysis wa performed on 15 food group resulting in four principle factorscomponents being retained the first factor preferred wa characterized by fast food fermented food canned food snack high in fat and sugar cooked and raw vegetable and seafood the second factor labeled combination wa loaded by the intake of dairy product red meat white meat and fruit the third factor labeled chemical related wa loaded by processed food and monosodium glutamate and the fourth principle component consisted of drink and grain wa labeled a traditional the conditional logistic regression wa done using stata 8 to obtain the odds ratio or of highest tertile of each component retained from factor analysis and the or were then adjusted with risk habit the consumption the highest tertile of the preferred pattern increased the risk of oral cancer by twotimes compared to the lowest tertile of consumption adjusted odds ratio aor217 95 confidence interval ci105450 the chemical related pattern showed higher risk of about threefold aor256 95 ci118554 while the traditional pattern showed an increased of risk by twofold aor204 95 ci101441 in contrast the combination pattern displayed protective effect in relation to oral cancer aor050 95 ci024100 this finding suggests that factor analysis may be useful to determine the diet pattern of a big set of food type and establish the correlation with oral cancer

processed_title: association between family support coping strategy and anxiety in cancer patient undergoing chemotherapy at general hospital in medan north sumatera indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aim to test the association between family support and coping strategy and anxiety at dr pirngadi general hospital medan method the study wa a correlational descriptive study with a crosssectional approach the sample were 102 cancer patient undergoing chemotherapy who were selected through purposive sampling technique data wa collected using a family support questionnaire instrument developed based on the concept of the house and friedman theory a coping strategy questionnaire modified from the revised way of coping questionnaire by folkman and lazarus and an anxiety questionnaire modified from the hamilton anxiety rating scale hama bivariate analysis wa conducted using the product moment correlation coefficient to test the association between family support coping strategy and anxiety multivariate analysis wa conducted using the logistic regression test to investigate dominant variable associated with coping strategy and anxiety result the result of the bivariate analysis showed a significant positive association p0001 and strong correlation r0612 between family support and problem focused coping pfc strategy while there wa a significant negative association p0001 and moderate correlation r0462 with the emotion focused coping efc strategy a significant negative association p0001 and strong correlation r0646 wa found between family support and anxiety the multivariate analysis showed a dominant association p 0001 between family support with pfc strategy or 122 efc or 0142 and anxiety or 0039 conclusion based on the result it can be concluded that there wa an association between good family support and effective coping strategy and lower anxiety level in cancer patient undergoing chemotherapy these result can be an input for health service to increase family support for cancer patient undergoing chemotherapy in combination with effective coping strategy to decrease anxiety level

processed_title: indonesia status of cancer pain and palliative care
processed_abstract: indonesia is a large archipelago with an estimated 203000365400 new cancer case a year most case present in the advanced stage pain is the chief complaint in 89 of the patient of the palliative care unit at dr soetomo hospital the program is a communitybased familyoriented and culturally adapted home care widely applicable throughout the country the service and medication should be affordable simple and available the who threestep ladder ha been adopted a the method of choice in cancer pain relief facility supportive for the program are the existing healthcare delivery system and nonformal support system indonesian cancer foundation and organization for family welfare promotion pkk the chief constraint for program implementation are the geographical and population problem lack of resource and funding for the training of healthcare worker and limited availability of oral morphine

processed_title: human papillomavirus type 16 e6 e7 and l1 variant in cervical cancer in indonesia suriname and the netherlands
processed_abstract: objective human papillomavirus type 16 hpv 16 ha several intratypic variant and some are associated with enhanced oncogenic potential for risk determination a well a for future vaccine development knowledge about variant is important regarding the geographical distribution of hpv variant and the lack of data from indonesia and suriname we studied the prevalence of hpv 16 variant in cervical cancer in these high incidence country data were compared with the netherlands a lowrisk country method dna sample from 74 formalinfixed paraffinembedded hpv 16positive cervical carcinoma from indonesia java n 22 suriname n 25 and the netherlands n 27 were amplified using primer specific for the e6 e7 and part of the l1 region product were sequenced and analyzed result a specific javanese variant with mutation 666a in e7 and 6826t in l1 wa found in 73 of the indonesian sample 56 having an additional mutation in the e6 open reading frame orf 276g giving the predicted amino acid change n58s this javanese variant wa also found in three surinamese sample which reflects what could be expected from migration of javanese people to surinam other noneuropean variant were identified in indonesian surinamese and dutch sample in 14 28 and 19 respectively conclusion the majority of the hpv 16positive cervical cancer in indonesia are caused by a specific intratypic variant that wa rarely found before in other country

processed_title: economic evaluation of trastuzumab in her2positive early breast cancer in indonesia a costeffectiveness analysis
processed_abstract: background trastuzumab ha significantly enhanced the survival and prognosis of individual diagnosed with human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 her2positive early breast cancer considering it relatively high cost we aimed to examine the costeffectiveness of trastuzumab plus chemotherapy compared with chemotherapy alone in her2positive early breast cancer from an indonesian healthcare payer perspective method a markov model wa developed to project the lifetime health benefit and cost associated with trastuzumab treatment for a cohort of woman with her2positive early breast cancer efficacy data and baseline characteristic in the basecase analysis were primarily derived from the 11year result of the hera trial cost were based on verified reimbursement data from indonesia health and social security agency bpjs kesehatan of the year 2020 a scenario analysis wa conducted with efficacy data based on the joint analysis from the nsabp b31 and ncctg n9831 trial allowing for subgroup analysis by age at diagnosis univariate and probabilistic sensitivity analysis were conducted to assess the influence of parameter uncertainty result in the basecase analysis the result indicated that the lifetime cost for trastuzumab plus chemotherapy and chemotherapy alone were us33744 and us22720 respectively resulting in substantial incremental saving of us11024 per patient for the former trastuzumab plus chemotherapy also led to higher total qualityadjusted life year qalys and life year gained lyg resulting in incremental costeffectiveness ratio icers of us6842 per qaly and us5510 per lyg in scenario analysis the subgroup with an age at diagnosis 40 year old reflected the most costeffective subgroup both the basecase and scenario analysis demonstrated costeffectiveness with a willingnesstopay threshold of threetimes gross domestic product gdp sensitivity analysis confirmed the robustness of the finding and conclusion conclusion in indonesia trastuzumab plus chemotherapy can be considered costeffective compared to chemotherapy alone at a willingnesstopay threshold of three time gdp and it is likely most costeffective in woman 40 year of age

processed_title: microbiota composition hsp70 and caspase3 expression a marker for colorectal cancer patient in aceh indonesia
processed_abstract: aim to investigate the relationship between microbiota composition with hsp70 and caspase3 expression in colon tissue a an initial study to develop the candidate for early detection of colorectal cancer for indonesian patient method this is a crosssectional study on 32 patient undergoing colonoscopy 16 patient of colorectal cancer crc while the other 16 patient are not colitis and internal hemorrhoid the composition of microbiota in stool sample wa examined using 16 rrna denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis ddge while expression of hsp70 wa examined by immunohistochemistry and caspase3 by using haematoxylineosinhe staining to determine the morphological change in colon tissue result analysis of pcrddge show a different composition of microbiota between patient with crc and noncrc all crc patient showed disappearance of dominant band from bifidobacterium group histological observation based on inter class correlation icc test from all slide showed a high score 5292 in crc patient and low score 1724 in noncrc patient hsp70 expression wa increased significantly in crc patient with the highest percentage of 84 while expression of caspase3 decreased with the highest percentage of 21 statistical analysis showed that the incidence of colorectal cancer wa associated with the expression of hsp 70 p0001 and caspase 3 p0001 conclusion bifidobacterium is an important indicator for colorectal cancer patient that show disappearance of dominant band while expression of hsp70 increased and the caspase3 expression decreased significantly

processed_title: human papillomavirus type 18 and other risk factor for cervical cancer in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: infection with human papillomavirus hpv ha now been established a a necessary cause of cervical cancer indonesia is a country with a high cervical cancer incidence and with the world highest prevalence of hpv 18 in cervical cancer no information exists about the prevalence of hpv 18 or other hpv type in the indonesian population we conducted a hospitalbased casecontrol study in jakarta indonesia a total of 74 cervical carcinoma case and 209 control woman recruited from the gynecological outpatient clinic of the same hospital were included all woman were hpv typed by the line probe assay and interview were obtained regarding possible risk factor for cervical cancer hpv wa detected in 959 of the case and in 254 of the control in the control group 134 wa infected with a highrisk hpv type hpv 16 wa detected in 35 of the case group and in 19 of the control group and hpv 18 wa identified in 28 of the case group and in 24 of the control group suggesting that the oncogenic potential of hpv 16 and hpv 18 in indonesia are similar in addition to hpv infection young age at first intercourse having a history of more than one sexual partner and high parity were significant risk factor for cervical cancer within the control group we did not identify determinant of hpv infection we hypothesize that the high prevalence of hpv 18 in cervical cancer in indonesia is caused by the high prevalence of hpv 18 in the indonesian population

processed_title: overview of helicobacter pylorus infection in indonesia what distinguishes it from country with high gastric cancer incidence
processed_abstract: helicobacter pylorus infects more than half the human population however the prevalence in indonesia is low a is the prevalence of gastric cancer hence it could be instructive to compare these prevalence rate and their determining factor with those of country that have high gastric cancer incidence ethnicity and genetic characteristic of h pylorus are important determinant of the h pylorus infection rate in indonesia the infection rate is higher in bataknese papuan and buginese than in javanese the predominant ethnic group ethnicity is also an important determinant of the genetic characteristic of h pylorus analysis of caga in the epiya segment showed that the predominant genotype in papuan bataknese and buginese are abb abdand abctype caga respectively meanwhile in the country with high gastric cancer incidence almost all strain had east asian type caga an antibiotic susceptibility evaluation showed that the standard triple therapy can still be used with caution in several city there is a very high rate of resistance to secondline regimen such a levofloxacin and metronidazole recent study have shown that furazolidone rifabutin and sitafloxacin are potential alternative treatment for antibioticresistant h pylorus infection in indonesia rather than focusing on early detection and eradication a in country with high gastric cancer prevalence country with low gastric cancer prevalence should focus on screening the several group that have a high risk of gastric cancer

processed_title: survival analysis and development of a prognostic nomogram for bonemetastatic prostate cancer patient a singlecenter experience in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to analyze predictive clinical factor of survival in bonemetastatic prostate cancer and to develop a prognostic nomogram for patient with this condition method the present study included 392 patient with bonemetastatic prostate cancer treated with androgen deprivation therapy pretreatment parameter were analyzed using the cox proportional hazard model to identify the predictor of overall survival covariates which showed statistical significance on multivariate analysis were used to develop a nomogram a linear predictor model wa utilized to develop the nomogram result the median overall survival wa 403 month 95 confidence interval 322485 univariate analysis showed that clinical t stage gleason score initial prostatespecific antigen value and the number of metastatic lesion were independent prognostic factor for overall survival these predictor remained significant a independent prognostic factor for overall survival after analysis using the multivariate cox regression model the nomogram constructed from those prognostic factor showed good discrimination for predicting the 5year overall survival with an area under the curve of 069 acceptable agreement of the observed and predicted probability wa observed in the calibration plot conclusion the present prognostic nomogram might be a useful tool for predicting overall survival in pretreatment bonemetastatic prostate cancer specifically among indonesian patient further study are required to provide external validation to support the utilization of this nomogram

processed_title: mirna21 a high potential prostate cancer biomarker in prostate cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to explore the diagnostic performance of mirna21 to differentiate between prostate cancer pca and benign prostatic hyperplasia bph patient in indonesia method urine sample were collected from each pca and bph patient mirna21 relative expression against the reference gene wa analyzed and compared between the two mirna expression wa then analyzed using the comparative quantification method to find the fold change mir21 validity in identifying pca patient wa performed by quantifying the sensitivity and specificity using sample in this study result the result of this study indicated that mirna21 relative expression against mirna16 in pca and bph showed 1295 difference in fold change moreover using prostate biopsy a the gold standard to differentiate pca and bph mirna21 cq expression ha 100 sensitivity and 75 specificity in differentiating the two conclusion mirna21 relative expression can be used to discriminate pca from bph by using a urine sample furthermore the expression of mir21 ha higher sensitivity than psa therefore mir21 ha a high potential to be analyzed and developed further for clinical diagnosis of prostate cancer

processed_title: stress management for breast cancer survivor in south sulawesi province indonesia
processed_abstract: objective cancer is still a health problem serious based on the ministry of health report cancer is the second leading cause of death in the world by 13 after cardiovascular disease approximately 30 of cancer patient had adjustment problem and 20 were diagnosed with depression method a qualitative design with an ethnographic and phenomenological approach with a total of 10 participant result based on the result of the interview breast cancer sufferer experience stress and depression when they first find out the diagnosis from the doctor however they carry out strategic in order to get rid of excessive anxiety such a reading book dzikir meeting fellow survivor and still trying to sincerely undergo all series of treatment conclusion support from family work environment friend relative fellow breast cancer survivor and treating doctor and fellow survivor greatly contributes to effort to prevent stress and depression fellow survivor have community and group to provide information and education a well a sharing related to breast cancer

processed_title: cancer survivor experience with and preference for medical information disclosure and advance care planning an online survey among indonesian cancer support group
processed_abstract: purpose to understand the experience and preference of indonesian cancer survivor regarding medical information disclosure and advance care planning method on the basis of systematic review of the scientific literature qualitative study and expertpanel input we developed an online survey that wa distributed to nine cancer survivor support group in indonesia result a total of 1030 valid response were received most participant were younger than 60 year 92 female 91 married 78 muslim 75 diagnosed with breast cancer 68 highly educated 64 and more than one year beyond diagnosis of their cancer if diagnosed with a lifelimiting illness participant wished to be informed about their diagnosis 74 disease severity 61 estimated curability 81 expected disease trajectory 66 and estimated life expectancy 37 between 4669 of the participant wished to discus four topic of advance care planning endoflife treatment resuscitation health care proxy and what matter at the end of life 2142 had done so of those who wished to discus these topic 3679 preferred to do so with their family member the most important reason for not being willing to engage in advance care planning were the desire to surrender to god will and to focus on here and now conclusion in a group of cancer survivor most of them were highly educated young female and diagnosed with breast cancer their preference for medical information and advance care planning varied with the majority wishing for information and involvement in advance care planning culturally sensitive advance care planning involves health care professional eliciting individual preference for medical information disclosure and discussing different topic in advance care planning conversation

processed_title: sexual and social adjustment of indonesian male partner of gynecological cancer survivor
processed_abstract: objective this study explores the sexual and social adjustment of the partner of gynecological cancer survivor in indonesia method phenomenological research interviewed seven male participant whose spouse sought gynecological cancer treatment at the army hospital in jakarta from july to august 2020 the collected data were transcribed and thematically analyzed result the male partner described their loss of sexual desire and intimacy they indicated a constructed sexual and social adjustment including having sexual distraction alternative sexual activity and performing extended role in the family after their partner diagnosis and treatment conclusion these research finding suggest that oncology and family nursing intervention should mitigate the gynecological cancer survivor and partner sexual and social distress to enhance the couple relationship and wellbeing after a gynecological cancer diagnosis

processed_title: unveiling bone metastasis exploring histological subtypes of breast cancer in indonesia tertiary referral hospital
processed_abstract: introduction the histological grade of a tumor is an important prognostic indicator in both primary breast cancer and metastatic we aimed to show the distribution of bone metastasis location across different histological subtypes of breast cancer and how they relate to each method the cohort retrospective study comprised 65 patient diagnosed with boneonly metastatic breast cancer all female the secondary statistic for 2014 to 2022 were derived from breast cancer registration data collected to determine the relationship between pattern of bone metastasis site and histopathological grading in various histological category result the average age wa 4428980 year 2562 year with 38 patient 585 diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma idc and 27 patient 415 with invasive lobular carcinoma ilc grade iii were found in 34 patient 508 grade ii in 31 patient 477 and grade i in one patient 15 the most common site of bone metastasis are costa followed by femur vertebra and pelvic vertebra and costa metastasis are significantly correlated with histological grading and breast cancer pathology p 0027 and 0033 respectively conclusion there is a considerable difference between vertebra and costa metastasis in term of histological grading and breast cancer pathology which indicates the higher grade contains a greater variety of bone metastasis site

processed_title: determinant of breast cancer screening practice among woman in indonesia a nationwide study
processed_abstract: background breast cancer remains the leading cause of death for woman globally including in indonesia breast cancer screening play a vital role in reducing death caused by breast cancer however breast cancer screening rate is still low and study on determinant for breast cancer screening is limited in indonesia this study aimed to identify the determinant of breast cancer screening among woman in indonesia method this populationbased study wa conducted among 827 woman who lived in either rural and urban area using a stratified sampling design where were based on province and locality combination data were analysed using a binary logistic regression model to assess the association between independent and dependent variable result a many a 827 woman with an average age of 2991 1114 year old participated in this study the overall breast cancer screening among woman wa 1874 knowledge of breast cancer risk factor sign and symptom adjor 175 95ci 120 256 age of 35 to 39 year old adjor 152 95 ci 102 226 and household income of 6000000 idr 457 usd adjor 519 95ci 1431884 were associated with breast cancer screening attendance in contrast christian woman had a significantly lower breast cancer screening rate that woman from other religion adj or 045 95ci 024 085 conclusion the overall breast cancer screening attendance wa poor among indonesian woman population age household income religion and knowledge of breast cancer risk factor were identified a the determinant factor for breast cancer screening

processed_title: the effectiveness of play therapy in child with leukemia a systematic review
processed_abstract: problem leukemia is the most common form of childhood cancer worldwide child living with leukemia experience various problem because of the disease progression harmful effect of treatment and prolonged hospitalization process to increase their wellbeing and alleviate their problem these child require ongoing support one solution that both parent and professional can use is play therapy this systematic review aimed to identify the type and effectiveness of play therapy in child living with leukemia eligibility criterion we searched pubmed scopus sciencedirect and proquest database additionally we performed manual search on google scholar google web and grey literature inclusion criterion comprised 1 study that implemented play therapy on leukemia child 2 fulltext article available in english or indonesian language from january 2000 to december 2021 and updated until july 2023 and 3 intervention study employing quasiexperimental or randomized controlled trial rct design sample from 1099 article 16 study were selected several form of play therapy were found including pretend music art and sand play therapy result of the sixteen study in this systematic review fifteen demonstrated beneficial effect on psychological issue particularly anxiety despair stress and physical problem fatigue and pain conclusion play therapy effectively alleviates some physical and psychosocial problem in child living with leukemia implication nurse can utilize play therapy a an intervention for child living with leukemia additionally comparative research is recommended with a similar research strategy concerning study with the same design systematic review registration prospero crd42022318549

processed_title: delay in diagnosis and treatment of childhood cancer in indonesia
