processed_abstract: background emphasizing timely diagnosis and treatment of cancer are important theme in pediatric cancer management a delay adversely impact survival this study explores various delay type among child with cancer and determines factor that influence delay method this crosssectional study wa conducted at an indonesian academic hospital parent of newly diagnosed patient were interviewed between october 2013 and september 2014 using semistructured questionnaire patient physician diagnosis treatment healthcare system hcs and total delay were analyzed result parent of 145 child response rate 89 with cancer were interviewed median total delay wa 70 day range 54055 patient delay median 5 day range 0189 wa significantly shorter than hcs delay median 49 day range 44025 p 0001 diagnosis delay median 58 day range 34015 wa significantly longer than treatment delay median 3 day range 189 p 0001 older age at diagnosis significantly lengthened patient delay p 0044 using alternative treatment wa associated with significantly longer patient and total delay p 0025 0024 respectively cancer type significantly influenced physician diagnosis treatment hcs and total delay p 0001 p 0004 p 0001 p 0001 p 0001 respectively neurological tumor had the longest delay whereas hematological tumor had the shortest sex parent education or income level disease stage at diagnosis health insurance status distance from hospital and first attended healthfacility type did not significantly impact the length of any delay type conclusion healthcare provider need training to improve recognition of cancer symptom and speed up subsequent diagnostic process using alternative treatment increased patient and total delay community campaign to encourage family to seek conventional cancer treatment are recommended

processed_title: global retinoblastoma presentation and analysis by national income level
processed_abstract: importance early diagnosis of retinoblastoma the most common intraocular cancer can save both a child life and vision however anecdotal evidence suggests that many child across the world are diagnosed late to our knowledge the clinical presentation of retinoblastoma ha never been assessed on a global scale objective to report the retinoblastoma stage at diagnosis in patient across the world during a single year to investigate association between clinical variable and national income level and to investigate risk factor for advanced disease at diagnosis design setting and participant a total of 278 retinoblastoma treatment center were recruited from june 2017 through december 2018 to participate in a crosssectional analysis of treatmentnaive patient with retinoblastoma who were diagnosed in 2017 main outcome and measure age at presentation proportion of familial history of retinoblastoma and tumor stage and metastasis result the cohort included 4351 new patient from 153 country the median age at diagnosis wa 305 interquartile range 183459 month and 1976 patient 454 were female most patient n 3685 847 were from low and middleincome country lmics globally the most common indication for referral wa leukocoria n 2638 628 followed by strabismus n 429 102 and proptosis n 309 74 patient from highincome country hics were diagnosed at a median age of 141 month with 656 of 666 985 patient having intraocular retinoblastoma and 2 03 having metastasis patient from lowincome country were diagnosed at a median age of 305 month with 256 of 521 491 having extraocular retinoblastoma and 94 of 498 189 having metastasis lower national income level wa associated with older presentation age higher proportion of locally advanced disease and distant metastasis and smaller proportion of familial history of retinoblastoma advanced disease at diagnosis wa more common in lmics even after adjusting for age odds ratio for lowincome country v uppermiddleincome country and hics 1792 95 ci 12942480 and for lowermiddleincome country v uppermiddleincome country and hics 574 95 ci 430768 conclusion and relevance this study is estimated to have included more than half of all new retinoblastoma case worldwide in 2017 child from lmics where the main global retinoblastoma burden lie presented at an older age with more advanced disease and demonstrated a smaller proportion of familial history of retinoblastoma likely because many do not reach a childbearing age given that retinoblastoma is curable these data are concerning and mandate intervention at national and international level further study are needed to investigate factor other than age at presentation that may be associated with advanced disease in lmics

processed_title: impact of universal health coverage on childhood cancer outcome in indonesia
processed_abstract: background starting from 2014 the indonesian government ha implemented universal health coverage uhc with the aim to make healthcare service accessible and affordable to all indonesian citizen a major reason for childhood cancer treatment failure in low and middleincome country particularly among family with low socioeconomic status s is abandonment of expensive cancer treatment our study compared childhood cancer treatment outcome of the overall low and high s population before and after introduction of uhc at a large indonesian academic hospital method medical record of 1040 patient diagnosed with childhood cancer before 20112013 n 506 and after 20142016 n 534 introduction of uhc were abstracted retrospectively data on treatment outcome s and healthinsurance status at diagnosis were obtained finding after introduction of uhc the number of insured patient increased from 38 to 82 p 0001 among low s population insurance coverage increased from 40 to 85 p 0001 and among high s population from 33 to 77 p 0001 in the overall population treatment abandonment decreased from 36 to 22 p 0001 eventfree survival estimate at four year after diagnosis of overall population improved from 16 to 22 p 0001 hazard ratio for treatment failure wa 126 ci 107148 p 0006 for uninsured versus insured patient in the low s population treatment abandonment decreased from 36 to 19 p 0001 eventfree survival estimate at four year after diagnosis of low s population improved from 14 to 22 p 0001 interpretation introduction of uhc in indonesia contributed significantly to better treatment outcome and eventfree survival of child with cancer from low s family

processed_title: paediatric cancer stage in populationbased cancer registry the toronto consensus principle and guideline
processed_abstract: populationbased cancer registry generate estimate of incidence and survival that are essential for cancer surveillance research and control strategy although data on cancer stage allow meaningful assessment of change in cancer incidence and outcome stage is not recorded by most populationbased cancer registry the main method of staging adult cancer is the tnm classification the criterion for staging paediatric cancer however vary by diagnosis have evolved over time and sometimes vary by cooperative trial group consistency in the collection of staging data ha therefore been challenging for populationbased cancer registry we assembled key expert and stakeholder oncologist cancer registrar epidemiologist and used a modified delphi approach to establish principle for paediatric cancer stage collection in this review we make recommendation on which staging system should be adopted by populationbased cancer registry for the major childhood cancer including adaptation for lowincome country wide adoption of these guideline in registry will ease international comparative incidence and outcome study

processed_title: antimullerian hormone and puberty development in girl and adolescent who underwent cancer treatment
processed_abstract: background high survival rate of child diagnosed with cancer have led to a growing population of woman with premature ovarian failure pof due to chemotherapy and radiotherapy the pof process occurs due to the disruption of the hypothalamicpituitary and gonadal axis followed by the delay of puberty development evaluation of reproductive function in child with cancer is essential to determine the fertility preservation plan this study aimed to describe reproductive function in child and adolescent with cancer who received chemotherapy based on tanner stage evaluation menstrual cycle and antimullerian hormone amh examination using electrochemiluminescence immunoassay kit result twentythree girl aged 1218 year old and had menarche who underwent cancer therapy in januaryaugust 2019 in dr sardjito general hospital were included in the study among them 61 had low amh level and were defined a diminished ovarian reserve dor two subject with dor experienced delayed puberty regular menstrual cycle wa reported in 652 of subject and irregular menstrual cycle in 348 while 217 with irregular menstrual cycle encountered secondary amenorrhea conclusion chemotherapy exposure affected dor occurrence in 609 of patient with childhood and adolescence cancer moreover it also altered menstrual regularity in 348 and delayed puberty development in 87 subject

processed_title: healthcare provider perspective on traditional and complementary alternative medicine of childhood cancer in kenya
processed_abstract: purpose traditional and complementary alternative medicine tcam use is rising globally in many african country tcam ha been a way of life a the first and last resort remedy for many ailment including cancer healthcare provider hcp should address this need properly this study explores hcp perspective on tcam in kenya method this crosssectional study used questionnaire hcp involved in the care of child with cancer at a kenyan academic hospital were interviewed result in total 155 hcp response rate 79 participated only 18 of hcp were positive about tcam use however most hcp 85 use tcam themselves more doctor 90 than other hcp 56 think that chemotherapy can cure cancer p 0001thirtythree percent of hcp believe a combination of tcam and chemotherapy is the best way to cure cancer while 56 think that usefulness of tcam is underestimated in conventional medicine selfprayer is regarded a most effective 58 and safe 76 most harmful is witchcraft 80 most hcp 71 think their knowledge about safety and efficacy of tcam is inadequate hcp think that their cancer patient use tcam 97 and that it is important that parent inform them about this 97 however only 5 of hcp always openly discus tcam with parent conclusion hcp need to improve their knowledge of tcam and facilitate open communication about tcam with family so parent feel safe to discus their interest in it

processed_title: development of paediatric nonstage prognosticator guideline for populationbased cancer registry and update to the 2014 toronto paediatric cancer stage guideline
processed_abstract: populationbased cancer registry pbcrs generate measure of cancer incidence and survival that are essential for cancer surveillance research and cancer control strategy in 2014 the toronto paediatric cancer stage guideline were developed to standardise how pbcrs collect data on the stage at diagnosis for childhood cancer case these guideline have been implemented in multiple jurisdiction worldwide to facilitate international comparative study of incidence and outcome robust stratification by risk also requires data on key nonstage prognosticator nsps key expert and stakeholder used a modified delphi approach to establish principle guiding paediatric cancer nsp data collection with the use of these principle recommendation were made on which nsps should be collected for the major malignancy in child the 2014 toronto stage guideline were also reviewed and updated where necessary wide adoption of the resultant paediatric nsp guideline and updated toronto stage guideline will enhance the harmonisation and use of childhood cancer data provided by pbcrs

processed_title: socioeconomic status play important role in childhood cancer treatment outcome in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the influence of parental socioeconomic status on childhood cancer treatment outcome in lowincome country ha not been sufficiently investigated our study examined this influence and explored parental experience during cancer treatment of their child in an indonesian academic hospital material and method medical chart of 145 child diagnosed with cancer between 1999 and 2009 were reviewed retrospectively from october 2011 until january 2012 40 caretaker were interviewed using semistructured questionnaire result of all patient 48 abandoned treatment 34 experienced death 9 had progressive relapsed disease and 9 overall eventfree survival prosperous patient had better treatment outcome than poor patient p00001 oddsratio for treatment abandonment wa 33 95ci 1481 p0006 for poor versus prosperous patient parent often believed that their child health wa beyond doctor control and determined by luck fate or god 55 cause of cancer were thought to be destiny 35 or god punishment 23 alternative treatment could 18 or might 50 cure cancer most parent 95 would like more information about cancer and treatment more contact with doctor wa desired 98 income decreased during treatment 55 parent lost employment 48 father 10 mother most of whom stated this loss wa caused by their child cancer 84 father 100 mother loss of income led to financial difficulty 63 and debt 55 conclusion treatment abandonment wa most important reason for treatment failure treatment outcome wa determined by parental socioeconomic status childhood cancer survival could improve if financial constraint and provision of information and guidance are better addressed

processed_title: cisplatininduced nephrotoxicity in childhood cancer comparison between two country
processed_abstract: background various definition used to describe cisplatin nephrotoxicity potentially lead to difference in determination of risk factor this study evaluated incidence of kidney injury according to commonly used and alternative definition in two cohort of child who received cisplatin method this retrospective cohort study included child from vancouver canada one center and mexico city mexico two center treated with cisplatin for a variety of solid tumor serum creatininebased definition kdigo and pediatric rifle prifle electrolyte abnormality consisted of hypokalemia hypophosphatemia and hypomagnesemia based on ncictcae v5 and an alternative definition altaki were used to describe nephrotoxicity incidence with different definition definitional overlap and interdefinition reliability wa analyzed result in total 173 child 100 from vancouver 73 from mexico were included in the combined cohort altaki criterion detected more patient with cisplatin nephrotoxicity compared to prifle and kdigo criterion 827 v 636 v 445 respectively nephrotoxicity and all electrolyte abnormality were significantly more common in vancouver cohort than in mexico city cohort except when using kdigo definition the most common electrolyte abnormality were hypomagnesemia 889 vancouver and hypophosphatemia 242 mexico city the kdigo definition provided highest overlap of case in vancouver 100 mexico 986 and the combined cohort 994 moderate overall agreement wa found among altaki kdigo and prifle definition kappa 018 95 ci 01027 in which kdigo and prifle showed moderate agreement kappa 048 95 ci 036060 conclusion compared to prifle and kdigo criterion altaki criterion detected more patient with cisplatin nephrotoxicity prifle is more sensitive to detect not only actual kidney injury but also patient at risk of cisplatin nephrotoxicity while kdigo seems more useful to detect clinically significant kidney injury a higher resolution version of the graphical abstract is available a supplementary information

processed_title: epidemiologic clinical and serum marker may improve discrimination between bacterial and viral etiology of childhood pneumonia
processed_abstract: background discrimination of bacterial and viral etiology of childhood communityacquired pneumonia cap is often challenging unnecessary antibiotic administration expose patient to undue risk and may engender antimicrobial resistance this study aimed to develop a prediction model using epidemiological clinical and laboratory data to differentiate between bacterial and viral cap method data from 155 child with confirmed bacterial or mixed bacterial and viral infection n 124 and viral infection n 31 were derived from a comprehensive assessment of causative pathogen partnership for enhanced engagement in researchpneumonia in pediatrics peerpeppes conducted in indonesia epidemiologic clinical and biomarker profile hematology and inflammatory marker were compared between group the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve auroc for varying biomarker level wa used to characterize performance and determine cutoff value for discrimination of bacterial and mixed cap versus viral cap diagnostic predictor of bacterial and mixed cap were assessed by multivariate logistic regression result diarrhea wa more frequently reported in bacterial and mixed cap while viral infection more frequently occurred during indonesia rainy season white blood cell count wbc absolute neutrophil count anc neutrophillymphocyte ratio nlr creactive protein crp and procalcitonin pct were significantly higher in bacterial and mixed case after adjusting for covariates the following were the most important predictor of bacterial or mixed cap rainy season aor 026 95 ci 008090 p 0033 crp 570 mgl aor 471 95 ci 1181874 p 0028 and presence of fever aor 526 95 ci 1072591 p 0041 the model assessed had a low rsquared nagelkerke r2 0490 but good calibration p 0610 for hosmer lemeshow test the combination of crp and fever had moderate predictive value with sensitivity and specificity of 6228 and 6552 respectively conclusion combining clinical and laboratory profile is potentially valuable for discriminating bacterial and mixed from viral pediatric cap and may guide antibiotic use further study with a larger sample size should be performed to validate this model

processed_title: childhood cancer early diagnosis and appropriate referral an educational initiative of the international society of paediatric oncology siop in collaboration with international pediatric association
processed_abstract: a long prediagnostic interval is reported to be a significant challenge in childhood cancer particularly in low and middleincome country lmics where advancedstage disease at diagnosis result in poor survival the international society of paediatric oncology and the international pediatric association launched the childhood cancer early diagnosis and appropriate referral cedar project in 2022 a educational webinars on the six index childhood cancer of the world health organization global initiative for childhood cancer to improve awareness of healthcare provider hcp pediatrician family practitioner and community nurse involved in diagnostic workups and patient referral participated n 2737 webinar attendance indicated strong hcp global engagement overall

processed_title: healthcare provider perspective on childhood cancer treatment in manado indonesia
processed_abstract: background childhood cancer survival in lowincome country is low objective our study investigated healthcare provider perspective on childhood cancer treatment in indonesia their health belief and attitude toward parental financial difficulty protocol adherence parental education and communication were explored method a selfadministered questionnaire wa filled in by 222 healthcare provider 156 doctor 51 nurse 6 social worker 9 administrator result health of child with cancer is beyond doctor control and determined by luck fate or god according to 35 of healthcare provider 30 were uncertain about this statement and 35 disagreed combination of chemotherapy and alternative treatment is best to achieve cure according to 15 of healthcare provider 50 were uncertain and 35 disagreed prosperous parent adhere better with treatment 67 doctor adhere better with cancer treatment for prosperous patient 55 when dealing with poor family less elaborate explanation is given 62 more difficult vocabulary is used 49 and less cooperation is offered 46 reason for nonadherence with treatment protocol were a follows financial difficulty parent 82 sideeffects 77 lack of motivation parent 75 and inadequate drug supply at pharmacy 70 information about cancer and treatment make parent more afraid or depressed about future and parent prefer not to know according to 27 of healthcare provider 20 were uncertain and 53 disagreed communication with parent is hindered by difference in status and social hierarchical structure 83 conclusion healthcare provider belief about childhood cancer treatment are characterized by much uncertainty and contradiction this likely affect adherence of healthcare provider parent and childhood cancer treatment outcome

processed_title: childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia four year evaluation of protocol 2013 and 2016 in a single center in indonesia a lowermiddleincome country
processed_abstract: background the prognosis of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all in indonesia a lowermiddleincome country lmic is lower than in high income country hics the indonesian all2013 protocol resulted in too many toxic death 21 and abandonment 11 therefore we drafted an adapted protocol all2016 main change no anthracyclines in standard risk sr prednisone replaced dexamethasone at induction in high risk hr and anthracyclines and cyclophosphamide were rescheduled in hr procedure patient aged 118 year were stratified into sr and hr hr wa defined a age over 10 year leucocyte count over 50 x 109 l central nervous system cns involvement mediastinal mass tcell phenotype testicular involvement or poor prednisone response result all2013 included 174 patient 106 sr and 68 hr and all2016 188 91 sr and 97 hr although the number of hr patient wa significantly higher in all2016 516 v 391 p 017 the outcome of all2016 improved over all2013 4yearprobable overall survival po 601 v 500 p 042 and 4yearprobable eventfree survival pefs 495 v 368 p 018 all2016 showed a nonsignificant advantage for sr patient 4yearpefs 560 v 472 p 220 and 4yearpos 703 v 613 p 166 but less toxic death 7 v 20 p 011 in hr group the outcome were significantly better in all2016 4yearpefs 433 v 206 p 004 4yearpos 505 v 324 p 014 especially due to less relapse 31 v 62 p 001 isolated cns relapse went down from 18 to 8 in hr p 010 and 11 to 5 in sr p 474 both sr and hr showed lower number of abandonment in all2016 6 v 14 p 039 conclusion overall all2016 result improved over all2013 modest change in protocol resulted in less initial toxicity and abandonment

processed_title: parental factor contribute to childhood cancer abandonment treatment during covid19
processed_abstract: factor influence a person health seeking behavior related to abandonment rate on pediatric oncology treatment during this pandemic is unknown the aim is to identify factor influencing abandonment rate in early pandemic this wa a crosssectional study during early pandemic and analyze factor in parent whose child had treatment for malignancy contribute to their childrens abandonment treatment rate through guided interview using questionnaire the characteristic related significantly with treatment abandonment is maternal education it is found that patient whose mother had education less than secondary school wa 1315 ci 10131707 having risk experience abandonment treatment parental perception related to impact of covid19 wa significantly related to treatment abandonment rate with rr 0202 ci 0860471 patient whose parent have positive perception how abandonment treatment affect their child outcome believe that doctor ha taken step to prevent covid19 transmission during treatment and receive information about covid19 having less risk being abandonment treatment

processed_title: parental experience with chemotherapyinduced alopecia among childhood cancer patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: background this study assessed parental experience with chemotherapyinduced alopecia among child with cancer treated at an indonesian academic hospital material and method fifty parent of childhood cancer patient were interviewed using semistructured questionnaire result the moment that hair fell out wa the moment that parent 84 had to admit their child had cancer alopecia wa a traumatizing painful experience 46 active strategy to hide alopecia mainly hat were used by 66 of child while 34 never covered their bald head if money had not been an issue 40 would use another strategy alopecia made child limit outdoor daily activity 78 and engagement with others 60 significantly more child from higheducated 95 than loweducated 60 parent received sympathy from other people p0012 significantly more christian 29 than muslim 0 family confirmed that alopecia lowered the quality of life p0046 most parent 82 had no prior plan about alopecia management yet for significantly more girl 26 than boy 0 such plan existed p0044 parent received most information about alopecia from other parent 66 parent 92 needed more alopecia education from doctor of all schoolattending child 53 were bullied and 47 did not want to attend school due to alopecia significantly more higheducated than loweducated family received pity from teacher and pupil 94 v 0 p0004 and acceptance by pupil 81 v 0 p0021 conclusion alopecia is a severe farstretching sideeffect of chemotherapy with physical psychological and social consequence for child and parent parent should be better informed about occurrence and impact of alopecia extra attention is required to facilitate childrens return to school health care provider should facilitate optimal supportive care through open dialogue and provision of educational material for parent child and their community

processed_title: survival and treatment outcome of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia in a lowmiddle income country a singlecenter experience in west java indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose this study aimed to determine the survival rate and treatment outcome of patient with childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all in a singlecenter study at indonesia patient and method factor contributing to the relapse and survival of all in bandung indonesia were evaluated data were collected from the medical record and the indonesian pediatric cancer registry ipcar subsequently univariate and multivariate analysis were evaluated using cox proportional hazard regression and kaplan meier wa used for survival analysis an analytic observational study wa conducted on newly diagnosed child aged 118 with all from january 2019 to december 2022 result a total of 137 child were included in the analysis 30 219 were dropped out during treatment and 605 died during the study period most of the death occurred after relapse in 32 385 with a high early relapse 705 occurring mainly during the maintenance phase 424 at the oneyear mark the observed overall survival o rate wa at 36 while eventfree survival efs wa lower at 19 univariate cox regression analysis showed that the leucocyte count at diagnosis p0005 and response to induction phase p 0008 wa associated with the death of all furthermore a response to induction phase wa significant hazard ratio 467 ci 95 1641329 p 0004 in the multivariate analysis conclusion in conclusion this study underscored the persistent challenge of high treatment discontinuation rate and the occurrence of very early relapse in low to middleincome country lmics which significantly impacted the o of child diagnosed with all

processed_title: xenobiotic and folate pathway gene polymorphism and risk of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukaemia in javanese child
processed_abstract: xenobiotic and folate metabolic pathway are important for the maintenance of genetic stability and may influence susceptibility to the development of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukaemia all in this study we investigated 10 polymorphism in 6 gene gstm1presentnull gstt1presentnull gstp1 1578a g nqo1 609c t mthfr 677c t mthfr 1298a c mthfd1 1958g a 3tyms 1494 6bpdeletioninsertion 5tyms 28bptandem repeat and slc19a1 80g a in a cohort of 185 javanese child with all and 177 healthy control in all patient none of the polymorphism demonstrated a statistically significant association with all after correcting for multiple comparison genderstratified analysis showed that in girl gstt1null genotype wa associated with increased all risk or 220 p 0027 while gstp1 1578ag genotype wa associated with reduced risk or 043 p 0031 strong linkage disequilibrium between the mthfr 677c t and 1298a c polymorphism wa observed d 10 r2 0072 the haplotype 677c1298c and 677t1298a were associated with a reduced risk of all or 068 and 064 respectively genderadjusted global p 0028 classification and regression tree cart analysis wa employed to identify potential highorder genegene interaction and cluster subject into susceptibility group slc19a1 80g a emerged a the predominant polymorphism associated with risk of all individual simultaneously carrying mthfr 1298aa 3tyms 6bp deletion and slc19a1 80aalleles were at higher disease risk or 221 p 0001 on the contrary simultaneous possession of mthfr 1298cc 3tyms 6bp homozygosity and slc19a1 80aalleles conferred lower risk or 025 p 0004 carriage of nqo1 609callele amongst slc19a1 80gg genotype wa associated with lower risk or 047 p 0003 in conclusion our study ha demonstrated the importance of gender and genegene interaction within the xenobiotic and folate pathway in modulating childhood all susceptibility

processed_title: comparing childhood leukaemia treatment before and after the introduction of a parental education programme in indonesia
processed_abstract: setting previously treatment and the result of treatment for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukaemia all in indonesia differed significantly between poor and prosperous patient poor patient received less individual attention from oncologist and access to parental education and donated chemotherapy wa lacking intervention a structured parental education programme for both poor and prosperous parent wa introduced in january 2004 to improve access to parental education and donated chemotherapy the programme consisted of a video presentation an information booklet dvd audiocassette a statementofunderstanding for donated chemotherapy and a complaint procedure informed consent wa also sought objective our study compared childhood all treatment outcome before and after the introduction of the parental education programme design the medical record of 283 child with all diagnosed before 19972002 n 164 and after 20042006 n 119 the introduction of the education programme were reviewed data on treatment result and parental socioeconomic status were collected result after the introduction of the education programme treatment refusal decreased from 14 to 2 and eventfree survival increased from 13 to 29 significantly among poor patient treatment dropout increased from 0 to 13 significantly among prosperous patient overall toxic death from 23 to 36 increased significantly but there wa no significant difference in eventfree survival conclusion after introduction of the programme treatment refusal decreased and eventfree survival increased significantly among poor family however improved knowledge skill and communication are still required to combat the high rate of toxic death and treatment dropout treatment intensity should be accompanied by improved supportive care

processed_title: radiotherapyassociated sensorineural hearing loss in pediatric oncology patient
processed_abstract: during the radiotherapeutic treatment of pediatric oncology patient they would be at a latent risk of developing ionizing radiationinduced ototoxicity when the cochlea or auditory nerve is located within the radiation field sensorineural hearing loss snhl is an irreversible late complication of radiotherapy and it incidence depends on various factor such a the patient hearing sensitivity total radiation dose to the cochlea radiotherapy fractionation regimen age and chemoradiation importantly this complication exhibit serious challenge to adult survivor of childhood cancer a it ha been linked to impairment in academic achievement psychosocial development independent living skill and employment in the survivor population therefore early detection and proper management can alleviate academic speech language social and psychological morbidity arising from hearing deficit in the present review we have addressed issue such a underlying mechanism of radiationinduced snhl audiometric finding of pediatric cancer patient treated with radiotherapy and management and protection measure against radiationinduced ototoxicity

processed_title: impact of physician dual practice on a pediatriconcology outreachprogram
processed_abstract: objective physician dual practice pdp can be defined a doctor combining clinical work in public and private healthsector this study explores the impact of pdp on a longterm pediatriconcology outreachprogram between large referral hospital in the netherlands indonesia and kenya method this crosssectional descriptive study used a selfadministered semistructured survey the most senior doctor from each partner site wa interviewed in june 2022 the survey contained 70 closedended and 7 openended question and took 3045 minute to complete closedended question were evaluated on 25 point rating scale informed consent wa acquired and respondent endorsed the final report result in the netherlands an estimated 020 of senior doctor combine work in public and privatesector while 6080 do so in indonesia and kenya according to the respondent in indonesia and kenya most of doctor are involved in pdp to augment low government salary impact of pdp on pediatriconcology care is minimal in the netherlands but detrimental in indonesia and kenya shortage of experienced doctor limited supervision of junior staff slow diagnostics and delay in chemotherapy administration ultimately lead to undermining of the quality of care and adverse patient outcome conclusion pdp adversely impact patient care at the indonesian and kenyan partner site of a pediatriconcology outreachprogram strategy addressing pdp in resourcepoor setting are required to improve treatment outcome and survival of child with cancer

processed_title: impact of covid19 measure on a paediatric oncology outreachprogram
processed_abstract: paediatric oncology outreachprograms have been effective development intervention to reduce inequality in healthcare between highincome country hic versus low and middleincome country lmic little is known about their sustainability during time of a pandemic this study assesses the impact of covid19 government measure on a paediatric oncology outreachprogram between three large referral hospital in netherlands hic indonesia lmic and kenya lmic covid19 government measure have impacted childhood cancer care at all three hospital however disruption in service are more prominent at partner site in lmic increasing existing inequality covid19 government measure have adversely affected the wellbeing of child with cancer in both hic and lmic and the chance of survival of child with cancer in lmic government leader and policy maker should take collateral damage of their covid19 policy and local setting into account to protect child with cancer in lmic

processed_title: exploring treatment decisionmaking at diagnosis for child with advanced cancer in low and middleincome country
processed_abstract: purpose global childhood cancer survival outcome correlate with regional contextual factor yet upfront treatment decisionmaking for child with advanced or poor prognosis cancer in low and middleincome country lmics is not well understood this study aimed to 1 characterize the landscape of contextual factor that shape physician decisionmaking at diagnosis for these child in lmics and 2 describe physician rationale for ifwhen to offer treatment with noncurative intent including how they define poor prognosis during treatment decisionmaking method an international panel of pediatric oncologist practicing in lmics participated in two focus group structured for the collaborative generation of factor influencing treatment decisionmaking including consideration of noncurative treatment pathway at diagnosis thematic analysis of qualitative data wa conducted followed by member checking result eleven pediatric oncologist participated representing all global region defined by the world health organization participant identified a broad range of factor influencing decisionmaking across multiple level including the individual hospital health system community and country level all participant agreed that treatment with noncurative intent could be offered at diagnosis in certain context and diverse definition for poor prognosis were described conclusion upfront treatment decisionmaking for child with advanced or poor prognosis cancer in lmics is variable and challenging difficulty with decisionmaking in lmics may be amplified by inconsistent definition of poor prognosis and underrepresentation of the factor that influence treatment decisionmaking within existing decisionmaking framework or childhood cancer treatment guideline future research should explore decisionmaking approach preference and challenge in depth from the perspective of pediatric cancer patient family and multidisciplinary clinician

processed_title: treatment refusal and abandonment in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia in indonesia an analysis of cause and consequence
processed_abstract: background treatment refusal and abandonment are common cause of treatment failure in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all in many developing country in most study reason for abandonment were based on the opinion of healthcare provider hcp very few study have focused on the parental pointofview aim of the study were to analyze the parent reason of abandonment and to ascertain the fate of child who abandoned treatment in a pediatric oncology centre in yogyakarta indonesia method we conducted homevisits to interview family of all patient diagnosed between january 2004 and august 2007 who refused or abandoned treatment result from january 2004 to august 2007 159 patient were diagnosed with all of which 40 child 25 refused or abandoned therapy thirtyseven 93 of these child were homevisited reason for abandonment were complex most parent mentioned several reason financial and transportation difficulty were not the only or even the main reason for abandonment belief of all incurability experience of severe side effect and dissatisfaction with hcp were also important consideration most patient 64 abandoned treatment during the diagnosticevaluation or remissioninduction phase of the 37 patient who refused or abandoned treatment 26 70 child died and 11 30 child were still alive 2 of them more than 2 year after abandonment conclusion reducing treatment abandonment of childhood all in developing country requires not only financial and transportation support but also parental education counseling and psychosocial support during therapy improvement of qualityofcare and adequate management of side effect

processed_title: burden of disease scenario by state in the usa 202250 a forecasting analysis for the global burden of disease study 2021
processed_abstract: background the capacity to anticipate future health issue is important for both policy maker and practitioner in the usa a such insight can facilitate effective planning investment and implementation strategy forecasting trend in disease and injury burden is not only crucial for policy maker but also garner substantial interest from the general populace and lead to a betterinformed public through the integration of new data source the refinement of methodology and the inclusion of additional cause we have improved our previous forecasting effort within the scope of the global burden of disease injury and risk factor study gbd to produce forecast at the state and national level for the usa under various possible scenario method we developed a comprehensive framework for forecasting life expectancy healthy life expectancy hale causespecific mortality and disabilityadjusted lifeyears dalys due to 359 cause of disease and injury burden from 2022 to 2050 for the usa and all 50 state and washington dc using the gbd 2021 future health scenario modelling framework we forecasted driver of disease demographic driver risk factor temperature and particulate matter mortality and year of life lost yll population and nonfatal burden in addition to a reference scenario representing the most probable future trajectory we explored various future scenario and their potential impact over the next several decade on human health these alternative scenario comprised four risk elimination scenario including safer environment improved behavioural and metabolic risk improved childhood nutrition and vaccination and a combined scenario and three usaspecific scenario based on risk exposure or attributable burden in the bestperforming u state improved high adult bmi and high fasting plasma glucose fpg improved smoking and improved drug use encompassing opioids cocaine amphetamine and others finding life expectancy in the usa is projected to increase from 783 year 95 uncertainty interval 781785 in 2022 to 799 year 795802 in 2035 and to 804 year 798810 in 2050 for all sex combined this increase is forecasted to be modest compared with that in other country around the world resulting in the usa declining in global rank over the 202250 forecasted period among the 204 country and territory in gbd from 49th to 66th there is projected to be a decline in female life expectancy in west virginia between 1990 and 2050 and little change in arkansas and oklahoma additionally after 2023 we projected almost no change in female life expectancy in many state notably in oklahoma south dakota utah iowa maine and wisconsin female hale is projected to decline between 1990 and 2050 in 20 state and to remain unchanged in three others drug use disorder and low back pain are projected to be the leading level 3 cause of agestandardised dalys in 2050 the agestandardised daly rate due to drug use disorder is projected to increase considerably between 2022 and 2050 195 69341 our combined risk elimination scenario show that the usa could gain 38 additional year 3640 of life expectancy and 41 additional year 3943 of hale in 2050 versus the reference scenario using our usaspecific scenario we forecasted that the usa could gain 04 additional year 0306 of life expectancy and 06 additional year 0508 of hale in 2050 under the improved drug use scenario relative to the reference scenario life expectancy and hale are likewise projected to be 0405 year higher in 2050 under the improved adult bmi and fpg and improved smoking scenario compared with the reference scenario however the increase in these scenario would not substantially improve the usa global ranking in 2050 from 66th of 204 in life expectancy in the reference scenario to 63rd64th in each of the three usaspecific scenario indicating that the usa bestperforming state are still lagging behind other country in their rank throughout the forecasted period regardless an estimated 124 million 113135 death could be averted between 2022 and 2050 if the usa were to follow the combined scenario trajectory rather than the reference scenario there would also be 14 million 0722 fewer death over the 28year forecasted period with improved adult bmi and fpg 21 million 1329 fewer death with improved exposure to smoking and 12 million 0915 fewer death with lower rate of drug use death interpretation our finding highlight the alarming trajectory of health challenge in the usa which if left unaddressed could lead to a reversal of the health progress made over the past three decade for some u state and a decline in global health standing for all state the evidence from our alternative scenario along with other published study suggests that through collaborative evidencebased strategy there are opportunity to change the trajectory of health outcome in the usa such a by investing in scientific innovation healthcare access preventive health care risk exposure reduction and education our forecast clearly show that the time to act is now a the future of the country health and wellbeingas well a it prosperity and leadership position in science and innovationare at stake funding bill melinda gate foundation

processed_title: factor influencing time to diagnosis and treatment among pediatric oncology patient in kenya
processed_abstract: early diagnosis and start of treatment are fundamental goal in cancer care this study determines the time lag and the factor that influence the time to diagnosis and start of treatment study participant were parent of childhood cancer patient diagnosed between august 2013 and july 2014 in a hospital in kenya patient physician diagnosis treatment health care system and total delay were explored using a questionnaire demographic and medical data were collected from the patient medical record parent of 99 childhood cancer patient were interviewed response rate 80 median total delay wa 102 91021 day median patient delay 4 day wa significantly shorter than health care system delay median 87 day p 001 diagnosis delay median 94 day wa significantly longer than treatment delay median 6 day p 001 day lack of health insurance at diagnosis and use of alternative medicine before attending conventional health service were associated with a significantly longer patient delay p 041 and p 017 respectively the type of cancer had a significant effect on treatment delay p 020 the type of health facility attended affected only patient delay p 03 gender age at diagnosis stage of disease parent education level or income and distance from hospital did not have a significant effect on the length of any type of delay training on childhood cancer should be included in the curriculum for medical training institute inservice workshop should be held for the health worker already working family must be obligated to get health insurance family should be encourage to attend conventional health facility and informed on symptom of cancer through mass medium

processed_title: influence of socioeconomic status on childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective a major reason for poor survival of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia in developing country is treatment refusal or abandonment this can be associated with parental socioeconomic status and attitude of health care provider our study examined the influence of 2 socioeconomic status determinant parental income and education on treatment in an indonesian academic hospital method medical chart of 164 patient who received a diagnosis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia between 1997 and 2002 were abstracted retrospectively data on treatment result and parental financial and educational background were collected open interview were conducted with parent and health care provider result of all patient 35 refused or abandoned treatment 23 experienced treatmentrelated death 22 had progressive or relapsed leukemia and 20 had an overall eventfree survival treatment result differed significantly between patient with different socioeconomic status 47 of poor and 2 of prosperous patient refused or abandoned treatment although poor and prosperous patient used the same protocol the provided treatment differed poor patient received less individualized attention from oncologist and less structured parental education strong social hierarchical structure hindered communication with doctor resulting in a lack of parental understanding of the necessity to continue treatment most poor patient could not afford treatment access to donated chemotherapy also wa inadequate treatment refusal or abandonment frequently resulted there wa no followup system to detect and contact dropout health care provider were not fully aware that their own attitude and communication skill were important for ensuring compliance of patient and parent conclusion childrens survival of acute lymphoblastic leukemia in developing country could improve if problem that are associated with parental financial and educational background and medical team attitude to treatment and followup could be addressed better

processed_title: immunophenotypic pattern of childhood acute leukemia in indonesia
processed_abstract: background immunophenotyping a suggested by who may improve diagnosis of childhood leukemia since it offer a better classification of the hematopoietic lineage of malignant cell a compared to morphology therefore we aimed to determine the proportion of the immunophenotypic subtypes of acute leukemia in indonesian child method sample were obtained from patient 014 year of age in 4 hospital in indonesia we analyzed 541 suspected leukemia sample presented over a 4year period march 2006 july 2010 by flow cytometry immunophenotyping allowed classification into acute myeloid leukemia aml and all blineage and tlineage all result of 541 sample 136 were tested using a single color method and 405 with a threecolor method concordance with morphology wa very good 082 using the threecolor method with a panel of 15 monoclonal antibody n387 a relatively high percentage of acute leukemia wa classified a aml 23 of the all sample 83 were blineage all and 17 t lineage all nine out of 239 morphological all were labeled aml and 1279 morphological aml were in fact all conclusion immunophenotyping in a multicenter study proved feasible and appears particularly important for prognostic assessment of childhood leukemia in low income country such a indonesia

processed_title: the practice of paediatric radiation oncology in low and middleincome country outcome of an international atomic energy agency study
processed_abstract: aim childhood cancer survival is suboptimal in most low and middleincome country lmics radiotherapy play a significant role in the standard care of many patient to assess the current status of paediatric radiotherapy the international atomic energy agency iaea undertook a global survey and a review of practice in eight leading treatment centre in middleincome country mics under coordinated research project e33031 paediatric radiation oncology practice in low and middle income country a patternsofcare study by the international atomic energy agency material and method a survey of paediatric radiotherapy practice wa distributed to 189 centre worldwide eight leading radiotherapy centre in mics treating a significant number of child were selected and developed a database of individual patient treated in their centre comprising 46 variable related to radiotherapy technique result data were received from 134 radiotherapy centre in 42 country the percentage of child treated with curative intent fell sequentially from highincome country hics 82 to lowincome country 53 increasing deficiency were identified in diagnostic imaging radiation staff number radiotherapy technology and supportive care more than 923 of centre in hics practice multidisciplinary tumour board decision making whereas only 655 of centre in lmics use this process clinical guideline were used in most centre practice in the eight specialist centre in mics approximated more closely to that in hics but only 52 of patient were treated according to nationalinternational protocol whereas institutionbased protocol were used in 41 conclusion quality level in paediatric radiotherapy differ among country but also between centre within country in many lmics resource are scarce coordination with paediatric oncology is poor or nonexistent and access to supportive care is limited multidisciplinary treatment planning enhances care and development may represent an area where external partner can help commitment to the use of protocol is evident but current international guideline may lack relevance the development of resource that reflect the capacity and need of lmics is required in some lmics there are already leading centre experienced in paediatric radiotherapy where patient care approximates to that in hics these centre have the potential to drive improvement in service training mentorship and research in their region and ultimately to improve the care and outcome for paediatric cancer patient

processed_title: resilient health care in global pediatric oncology during the covid19 pandemic
processed_abstract: background in the face of unprecedented challenge because of coronavirus disease 2019 interdisciplinary pediatric oncology team have developed strategy to continue providing highquality cancer care this study explored factor contributing to health care resilience a perceived by childhood cancer provider in all resource level setting method this qualitative study consisted of 19 focus group conducted in 16 country in 8 language seven factor have been previously defined a important for resilient health care including 1 in situ practical experience 2 system design 3 exposure to diverse view on the patient situation 4 protocol and checklist 5 teamwork 6 workarounds and 7 tradeoff rapid turnaround analysis focused on these factor result all factor of health care resilience were relevant to group representing all resource setting focus group participant emphasized the importance of teamwork and a flexible and coordinated approach to care participant described collaboration within and among institution a well a partnership with governmental private and nonprofit organization hierarchy were advantageous to decisionmaking and information dissemination clinician were inspired by their patient and explained creative tradeoff and workarounds used to maintain highquality care conclusion factor previously described a contributing to resilient health care manifested differently in each institution but were described in all resource setting these insight can guide pediatric oncology team worldwide a they provide cancer care during the next phase of the pandemic understanding these element of resilience will also help provider respond to inevitable future stressor on health care system

processed_title: monitoring of highdose methotrexate mtxrelated toxicity and mtx level in child with acute lymphoblastic leukemia a pilotstudy in indonesia
processed_abstract: the administration of highdose methotrexate hdmtx requires an accurate monitoring of blood mtx level to determine the regimen of leucovorin rescue and urine alkalinization to prevent toxicity however it is technically and logistically challenging to screen patient routinely in limitedresource setting this study aimed to evaluate blood mtx level at 24 and 48hours from start of infusion in relation to clinical toxicity in childhood all method a prospective cohort study wa conducted on 32 consecutive child with acute lymphoblastic leukemia all who had received at least one cycle of 1 gm2 hdmtx intravenous infusion a a part of consolidation treatment based on the 2013 indonesian all protocol in total 68 cycle were evaluated serum mtx concentration were measured using enzyme immunoassay mtx toxicity wa categorized using common toxicity criterion ctcae 30 version the association between mtx level and clinical toxicity wa assessed by nonparametric analysis result the 24hours mtx level wa median 298 ngml 0065 micromoll iqr 813906 with a modest decrease in 48hours mtx serum level in all cycle median 283 ngml and 0062 micromoll iqr 035287 p 005 the two most common toxicity were hepatotoxicity 322 and neutropenia 309 nephrotoxicity and febrile neutropenia occurred in 88 and 58 of patient respectively with low percentage of mucositis 43 and thrombocytopenia 56 recorded no statistically significant association wa found between mtx level and clinical toxicity except for liver toxicity conclusion serum mtx level at 24hours and 48hours are low followed by only 44 grade iiiiv hepatotoxicity and 264 grade iiiiv neutropenia there is no significant association between the clinical toxicity and mtx level at the two point of measurement an attempt to increase the mtx dose andor to introduce a loading dose should be considered in subsequent all protocol a supported by further pharmacokinetic mtx study in the indonesian population

processed_title: fetal retinoblastoma
processed_abstract: fetal tumor are sporadic entity and in some case can be diagnosed prenatally a team approach incorporating the skill of obstetrician radiation therapist pediatric medical oncologist and hematologist neonatal surgeon rehabilitation specialist and social worker is imperative to ensure that the patient receives the best treatment retinoblastoma is a relatively uncommon tumor of childhood that arises in the retina the estimated annual incidence is between 1 in 15000 and 1 in 34000 although it may occur at any age it most often arises in younger child with 80 of case diagnosed before the age of 5 year we report a case of prenatally diagnosed fetal retinoblastoma

processed_title: incidence of childhood leukemia in yogyakarta indonesia 19982009
processed_abstract: background in most developing country incidence data for childhood cancer are less reliable because very few populationbased registry exist the aim of this study wa to present the epidemiology of childhood leukemia in the dr sardjito hospital dsh region which catchment area extends beyond the boundary of the yogyakarta special province ysp procedure health record of child 014 year of age who were diagnosed with leukemia between january 1998 and december 2009 were reviewed diagnosis of leukemia wa confirmed by morphological and histochemical examination of marrow sample result the estimated average annual incidence rate aair of childhood acute leukemia in dsh wa 462 per million per year interestingly the annual incidence rate air of childhood acute leukemia from the catchment area of dsh significantly increased from 35 in 1999 to 70 in 2009 anova p 0003 the ysp population data analyzed separately showed an increase in air from 157 to 329 anova p 0325 and an aair of 288 remarkably a relatively high frequency 255 in dsh and 277 in ysp of child with aml wa found in the group of acute leukemia conclusion the dsh incidence calculation may be overestimated due to an underestimation of the population number since the population count for ysp is more precise the data of ysp were used for comparison with developed country aair of all 208 is relatively low compared to western country 224379 the aair of aml 80 is similar to western country 5080 resulting a relatively high percentage of aml versus all 277 in ysp

processed_title: creb signaling activity correlate with differentiation and survival in medulloblastoma
processed_abstract: while there ha been significant progress in the molecular characterization of the childhood brain cancer medulloblastoma the tumor proteome remains less explored however it is important to obtain a complete understanding of medulloblastoma protein biology since interaction between protein represent potential new drug target using previously generated phosphoprotein signalingprofiles of a large cohort of primary medulloblastoma we discovered that phosphorylation of transcription factor creb strongly correlate with medulloblastoma survival and associate with a differentiation phenotype we further found that during normal cerebellar development phosphorylated creb wa selectively expressed in differentiating cerebellar granule neuron progenitor cgnp cell in line we observed increased differentiation in cgnps treated with forskolin bmp6 and bmp12 gdf7 which induce creb phosphorylation lastly we demonstrated that inducing creb activation via pkamediated creb signaling but not bmpmekerk mediated signalling enhances medulloblastoma cell sensitivity to chemotherapy

processed_title: chemotherapyrelated side effect in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia in indonesia parental perception
processed_abstract: noncompliance with prescribed medication ha been associated with increased chance of relapse and poor outcome side effect may be an important cause of noncompliance fiftyone parent of child with acute lymphoblastic leukemia in a tertiary care hospital in indonesia were interviewed about their perception of side effect and their impact on treatment noncompliance and daily activity a symptom checklist assessing 13 common symptom wa used to examine side effect during chemotherapy childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia patient suffered from psychological a well a physical side effect the most frequent side effect reported by parent wa behavior alteration 92 second and third in frequency were increased appetite and infection reported by 88 and 83 of parent respectively the most severe side effect were leg weakness increased appetite and behavior alteration the overall frequency of side effect wa weakly correlated to noncompliance reducing the impact of side effect may increase compliance with the treatment

processed_title: parental experience of childhood leukemia treatment in indonesia
processed_abstract: in our study we examined socioeconomic treatmentrelated and psychologic experience of parent during the acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment of their child in an academic hospital in indonesia child were treated with the wkall2000 protocol and received donated chemotherapy from november 2004 to april 2006 51 parent were interviewed by psychologist using semistructured questionnaire the family income had decreased 69 since the start of treatment parent lost their job 29 of father and 8 of mother most of whom stated that this loss of employment wa caused by the leukemia of their child 87 of father and 100 of mother treatment cost resulted in financial difficulty 78 debt 65 and forced parent either to postpone or withdraw from part of treatment 18 parent mentioned needing more information 86 from and contact 77 with doctor the parent organization did not pay any visit 69 during hospitalization nor did they give information 59 or emotional support 55 we have concluded that the socioeconomic impact of leukemia treatment wa profound communication between parent and doctor requires improving the role of the parent organization wa insignificant and must be ameliorated

processed_title: factor influencing treatmentseeking behavior among caregiver of child with cancer a scoping review
processed_abstract: background the survival rate for child with cancer particularly in developing country remain low a key factor contributing to these poor survival rate is the late diagnosis of pediatric cancer which is often due to insufficient treatmentseeking behavior by parent this study aimed to explore the factor that influence the treatmentseeking behavior among caregiver of child with cancer method this study employed a scoping review approach data wa gathered from three source pubmed cinahl and medline the search protocol adhered to the prisma guideline for scoping review using the term child or childhood and cancer or malignancy and factor or cause and healthseeking behavior or treatmentseeking behavior and treatment delay selected study were based on original research utilized either a crosssectional or qualitative approach focused on caregiver of child diagnosed with cancer and were published in the last ten year 20132023 result a total of nine article met the criterion for inclusion seven were crosssectional study while two were qualitative study the age of the child ranged from 1 to 18 year caregiver included parent mother father or both uncle sibling and cousin the number of respondent varied from 12 to 200 the finding of the study indicate that a range of complex and interrelated factor affect parental behavior which includes childrelated factor parentrelated factor knowledgerelated factor perceptionrelated factor access to health service and level of social support conclusion this study highlight that caregiver behavior in seeking treatment for child with cancer is influenced by various factor that all contribute to delay in the treatment we advocate for increased health promotion initiative by the government and policymakers aimed at enhancing parent knowledge and awareness regarding childhood cancer and it early detection expanding the cancer service network in developing country could improve public access to pediatric cancer service

processed_title: factor associated with psychological wellbeing among child under 18 year old with cancer a scoping review
processed_abstract: background cancer diagnosis and treatment can have severe psychological impact on child that can affect various aspect of their emotional social and cognitive functioning many child with cancer experience longterm psychological distress the psychological wellbeing pwb is a critical aspect of their overall health understanding the factor that influence their psychological state can help in developing effective intervention to support them purpose this scoping review aimed to identify and summarize the factor associated with pwb among child with cancer method this study applied a scoping review using the guideline outlined in the prisma extension for scoping review prismascr a comprehensive literature search wa conducted across multiple database including pubmed cinahl taylor and francis and scopus inclusion criterion were included by keywords psychological wellbeing or psychological and child or child or pediatric or childhood and adolescent or teenager or youth and cancer or neoplasm or tumor or malignancy or cancer survivor and predictor or factor or determinant study were included if they investigated psychological wellbeing in child aged 018 year with cancer the arksey and omalley framework for scoping review guided the methodology including study selection data extraction and thematic analysis the quality of the evidence wa evaluated using the joanna briggs institute jbi and the mixed method appraisal tool mmat critical appraisal checklist result 12 article met the inclusion criterion and were included in the review the factor most frequently reported in several category are age sociodemographic psychological function individual factor age at diagnosis health and history parent attachment and school status environmental factor conclusion this review found several aspect that describe the pwb of the article reviewed these aspect consist of anxiety depression distress wellbeing and selfesteem from these aspect many predictor were obtained which were classified into four category of factor related to the pwb of child with cancer

processed_title: a concept for international societally relevant microbiology education and microbiology knowledge promulgation in society
processed_abstract: executive summary microbe are all pervasive in their distribution and influence on the functioning and wellbeing of human life in general and the planet microbiallybased technology contribute hugely to the supply of important good and service we depend upon such a the provision of food medicine and clean water they also offer mechanism and strategy to mitigate and solve a wide range of problem and crisis facing humanity at all level including those encapsulated in the sustainable development goal sdgs formulated by the united nation for example microbial technology can contribute in multiple way to decarbonisation and hence confronting global warming provide sanitation and clean water to the billion of people lacking them improve soil fertility and hence food production and develop vaccine and other medicine to reduce and in some case eliminate deadly infection they are the foundation of biotechnology an increasingly important and growing business sector and source of employment and the centre of the bioeconomy green deal etc but because microbe are largely invisible they are not familiar to most people so opportunity they offer to effectively prevent and solve problem are often missed by decisionmakers with the negative consequence this entrains to correct this lack of vital knowledge the international microbiology literacy initiativethe imiliis recruiting from the global microbiology community and making freely available teaching resource for a curriculum in societally relevant microbiology that can be used at all level of learning it goal is the development of a society that is literate in relevant microbiology and a a consequence able to take full advantage of the potential of microbe and minimise the consequence of their negative activity in addition to teaching about microbe almost every lesson discusses the influence they have on sustainability and the sdgs and their ability to solve pressing problem of societal inequality the curriculum thus teach about sustainability societal need and global citizenship the lesson also reveal the impact microbe and their activity have on our daily life at the personal family community national and global level and their relevance for decision at all level and because effective evidencebased decision require not only relevant information but also critical and system thinking the resource also teach about these key generic aspect of deliberation the imili teaching resource are learnercentric not academic microbiologycentric and deal with the microbiology of everyday issue these span topic a diverse a owning and caring for a companion animal the vast range of everyday food that are produced via microbial process impressive geological formation created by microbe childhood illness and how they are managed and how to reduce waste and pollution they also leverage the exceptional excitement of exploration and discovery that typifies much progress in microbiology to capture the interest inspire and motivate educator and learner alike the imili is establishing regional centre to translate the teaching resource into regional language and adapt them to regional culture and to promote their use and assist educator employing them two of these are now operational the regional centre constitute the interface between resource creator and educatorslearners a such they will collect and analyse feedback from the endusers and transmit this to the resource creator so that teaching material can be improved and refined and new resource added in response to demand educator and learner will thereby be directly involved in evolution of the teaching resource the interaction between educatorslearners and resource creator mediated by the regional centre will establish dynamic and synergistic relationshipsa global societally relevant microbiology education ecosystemin which creator also become learner teaching resource are optimised and all playersstakeholders are empowered and their motivation increased the imili concept thus embrace the principle of teaching societally relevant microbiology embedded in the wider context of societal biosphere and planetary need inequality the range of crisis that confront u and the need for improved decisioning which should ultimately lead to better citizenship and a humanity that is more sustainable and resilient abstract the biosphere of planet earth is a microbial world a vast reactor of countless microbially driven chemical transformation and energy transfer that push and pull many planetary geochemical process including the cycling of the element of life mitigate or amplify climate change eg nature review microbiology 2019 17 569 and impact the wellbeing and activity of all organism including human microbe are both our ancestor and creator of the planetary chemistry that allowed u to evolve eg life engine how microbe made earth habitable 2023 to understand how the biosphere function how human can influence it development and live more sustainably with the other organism sharing it we need to understand the microbe in a recent editorial environmental microbiology 2019 21 1513 we advocated for improved microbiology literacy in society our concept of microbiology literacy is not based on knowledge of the academic subject of microbiology with it multitude of component topic plus the growing number of additional topic from other discipline that become vitally important element of current microbiology rather it is focused on microbial activity that impact usindividualscommunitiesnationsthe human worldand the biosphere and that are key to reaching informed decision on a multitude of issue that regularly confront u ranging from personal issue to crisis of global importance in other word it is knowledge and understanding essential for adulthood and the transition to it knowledge and understanding that must be acquired early in life in school the 2019 editorial marked the launch of the international microbiology literacy initiative the imili here we present our concept of how microbiology literacy may be achieved and the rationale underpinning it the type of teaching resource being created to realise the concept and the framing of microbial activity treated in these resource in the context of sustainability societal need and responsibility and decisionmaking and the key role of regional centre that will translate the teaching resource into local language adapt them according to local cultural need interface with regional educator and develop and serve a hub of microbiology literacy education network the topic featuring in teaching resource are learnercentric and have been selected for their inherent relevance interest and ability to excite and engage importantly the resource coherently integrate and emphasise the overarching issue of sustainability stewardship and critical thinking and the pervasive interdependency of process more broadly the concept emphasis how the multifarious application of microbial activity can be leveraged to promote humananimal plant environmental and planetary health improve social equity alleviate humanitarian deficit and cause of conflict among people and increase understanding between people microbial biotechnology 2023 166 10911111 importantly although the primary target of the freely available cc bync 40 imili teaching resource is schoolchildren and their educator they and the teaching philosophy are intended for all age ability and cultural spectrum of learner worldwide in university education lifelong learning curiositydriven webbased knowledge acquisition and public outreach the imili teaching resource aim to promote development of a global microbiology education ecosystem that democratises microbiology knowledge

processed_title: disease and treatmentrelated morbidity in adolescent with perinatal hiv infection in asia
processed_abstract: background perinatally hivinfected adolescent phiva are exposed to a chronic systemic infection and longterm antiretroviral therapy art leaving them susceptible to morbidity associated with inflammation immunodeficiency and drug toxicity method data collected 2001 to 2016 from phiva 1019 year of age within a regional asian cohort were analyzed using competing risk timetoevent and poisson regression analysis to describe the nature and incidence of morbidity event and hospitalization and identify factor associated with diseaserelated treatmentrelated and overall morbidity morbidity wa defined according to world health organization clinical staging criterion and u national institute of health division of aid criterion result a total 3448 phiva contributed 17778 personyears median age at hiv diagnosis wa 55 year and art initiation wa 69 year there were 2562 morbidity event and 307 hospitalization cumulative incidence for any morbidity wa 517 and hospitalization wa 100 early adolescence wa dominated by diseaserelated infectious morbidity with a trend toward noninfectious and treatmentrelated morbidity in later adolescence higher overall morbidity rate were associated with a cd4 count 350 cellsmicrol hiv viral load 10000 copiesml and experiencing prior morbidity at age 10 year lower overall morbidity rate were found for those 1519 year of age compared with 1014 year and those who initiated art at age 59 year compared with 5 or 10 year conclusion half of our phiva cohort experienced a morbidity event with a trend from diseaserelated infectious event to treatmentrelated and noninfectious event a phiva age art initiation to prevent immune system damage optimize virologic control and minimize childhood morbidity are key to limiting adolescent morbidity

processed_title: epidemiology of communityacquired pneumonia among hospitalised child in indonesia a multicentre prospective study
processed_abstract: objective to identify aetiology of childhood communityacquired pneumonia cap based on a comprehensive diagnostic approach design partnership for enhanced engagement in researchpneumonia in paediatrics peerpeppes study wa an observational prospective cohort study conducted from july 2017 to september 2019 setting government referral teaching hospital and satellite site in three city in indonesia semarang yogyakarta and tangerang participant hospitalised child aged 259 month who met the criterion for pneumonia were eligible child were excluded if they had been hospitalised for 24 hour had malignancy or history of malignancy a history of longterm 2 month steroid therapy or condition that might interfere with compliance with study procedure main outcome measure causative bacterial viral or mixed pathogen for pneumonia were determined using microbiological molecular and serological test from routinely collected specimen blood sputum and nasopharyngeal swab we applied a previously published algorithm peerpeppes rule to determine the causative pathogen result 188 subject were enrolled based on our algorithm 48 255 had a bacterial infection 31 165 had a viral infection 76 404 had mixed bacterial and viral infection and 33 176 were unable to be classified the five most common causative pathogen identified were haemophilus influenzae nontype b n73 388 respiratory syncytial virus rsv n51 271 klebsiella pneumoniae n43 229 streptococcus pneumoniae n29 154 and influenza virus n25 133 rsv and influenza virus diagnosis were highly associated with indonesia rainy season novembermarch the pcr assay on induced sputum is specimen captured most of the pathogen identified in this study conclusion our study found that h influenzae nontype b and rsv were the most frequently identified pathogen causing hospitalised cap among indonesian child aged 259 month old our study also highlight the importance of pcr for diagnosis and by extension appropriate use of antimicrobial trail registration number nct03366454

processed_title: healthcare provider compliance with childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia protocol in indonesia
