processed_abstract: background noncompliance with childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all protocol is an important determinant of poor treatment outcome noncompliance with protocol may not only concern parent or patient but may also concern healthcare provider hcp our study examines the accuracy of leukemia risk classification and attitude of hcp toward protocol compliance in indonesia procedure a combined retrospective study of medical record mr and a crosssectional questionnaire study with hcp were conducted accurate all risk classification in mr wa assessed hcp knowledge of risk classification and their attitude toward protocol compliance were examined result a total of 164 mr patient with all were assessed and 97 hcp were interviewed the protocol criterion for highrisk hr were not complete in 82 mr 50 of 97 hcp 95 did not mention all five protocol criterion for hr both in the mr a well a in the questionnaire lymphoblast count on day 8 of chemotherapy a early response to treatment wa the most frequently missed item missing in 35 of mr and 85 of questionnaire only 14 of respondent actually checked with parent whether they administered the prescribed medicine conclusion our study show that hcp should improve their knowledge and assessment of childhood all risk classification especially lymphoblast count on day 8 of chemotherapy proper risk classification and subsequent correct treatment may enable more child to be cured of leukemia

processed_title: relationship between bax and bcl2 protein expression and outcome of induction phase chemotherapy in pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia
processed_abstract: background overexpression of the antiapoptotic protein bcl2 cause apoptosis to stop and conversely the increased expression of the proapoptotic protein bax make lymphoblast easy to destroy the baxbcl2 ratio play a role in the balance of apoptosis immortality resistance and outcome of chemotherapy we analyzed the relationship between the baxbcl2 ratio and the outcome of induction phase chemotherapy in pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia all method this research wa conducted with a prospective observational study on pediatric all aged 118 year who were newly diagnosed based on bone marrow aspiration morphology and immunophenotyping at dr soetomo general hospital surabaya on october 2020 to march 2021 expression of bcl2 bax and baxbcl2 protein ratio wa measured by the flow cytometry method from lymphoblast on bone marrow aspirate sample before and after induction phase chemotherapy according to the 2018 childhood all indonesian protocol the outcome evaluated were survival and remission rate lymphoblast in the bone marrow less than 5 we used the mannwhitney u test and wilcoxon signed rank test to analyze the difference between protein expression with p005 for a twotailed test result we included 1726 pediatric all consisting of 88 male 94 llal1 76 b cell all and 24 t cell all mean expression of bax bcl2 and baxbcl2 protein ratio before chemotherapy among pediatric all who alive n11 and dead n6 were not significantly different p005 all child who completed the induction phase of chemotherapy went into remission bax and bcl2 expression before and after chemotherapy showed no difference p005 the baxbcl2 ratio increased from 174sd 1846 to 6174139 with p0021 conclusion expression of bax bcl2 and baxbcl2 protein ratio at the beginning of diagnosis did not affect the survival of pediatric all after the induction phase of chemotherapy the baxbcl2 protein ratio increased 35 time in pediatric all with remission outcome indicating proapoptotic dominance

processed_title: congenital midline spinal hamartoma in a 5monthold infant
processed_abstract: background congenital midline spinal hamartoma is a very rare tumorlike proliferation that mostly occurs during childhood it consists of mature welldifferentiated ectodermal and mesodermal element that present in an abnormal location and are mostly associated with neurofibromatosis type 1 and spinal dysraphism case description a 5monthold male patient presented with complaint of a bump over the lower back the bump wa already present since birth with the size of approximately 3 cm in diameter and slow growth there were no other associated symptom besides the bump on the lower back in the physical examination we found a subcutaneous mass with associated skin dimple located on the midline of the lower back computed tomography scan of the spine showed a mass that arose from inside the dura and a closed spinal dysraphism from l3 vertebra to the sacrum a subtotal resection wa performed and the histopathology feature showed fat cell cartilage skeletal muscle fiber nerve and blood vessel after 6 month followup no symptom or neurologic deficit were present and no further growth wa shown on the latest computed tomography scan conclusion congenital midline spinal hamartoma is very rare and seldom addressed most patient present with a cosmetic defect and rarely with associated symptom tissue biopsy is still the best modality to definitively diagnose hamartoma and to exclude other diagnosis surgical excision of the tumor is still the mainstay treatment especially for patient who are not neurologically intact and to correct the cosmetic skin defect

processed_title: a case report of a childhood scurvy musculoskeletal manifestation radiologic finding and diagnostic implication
processed_abstract: scurvy is an infrequent pathological condition resulting from a sustained dietary vitamin c deficiency radiology becomes pivotal because the diagnostic process for scurvy can be intricate given it resemblance to bone neoplasm a 6yearold boy reported persistent pain and swelling in the right thigh for 2 month prior to hospitalization clinical examination revealed a mass localized in the right thigh and anemia a radiograph of the right femur demonstrated extensive osteopenic change trummerfeld zone frankel line pelkin fracture wimberger ring sign and paraepiphyseal subperiosteal hematoma the absence of any such case in our institution over the preceding decade emphasizes the uniqueness of this presentation histopathological evaluation yielded atypical result prompting further radiographic assessment of the left femur and thorax the subsequent finding corroborated the classic scorbutic rosary presentation indicative of scurvy the patient symptom gradually resolved with highdose supplementation of vitamin c scurvy predominantly present with musculoskeletal manifestation plasma vitamin c level assessment is the gold standard for the diagnosis but it is currently inaccessible in our nation consequently radiographic evaluation reveals pathognomonic feature of the disorder in thoracic radiograph the scorbutic rosary presentation is evident in contrast long bone exhibit hallmark of scurvy diffuse osteopenia frankel line trummerfeld zone pelkin fracture wimberger ring sign and paraepiphyseal subperiosteal hematoma prompt intervention with vitamin c thwart the progression to severe complication radiology is an indispensable tool in diagnosing pediatric scurvy especially in developmental country where the assessment of vitamin c serum level is inaccessible

processed_title: infantile fibrosarcoma in older child at right lower leg a case report
processed_abstract: background infantile fibrosarcoma ifs is a rare tumor the highest prevalence is in the first 2 year of life case typically manifest in the extremity with rapid initial growth are nontender and are a poorly delimited mass that vary in size or consistency and lack sensitivity the treatment for ifs is a multimodal approach and surgical excision ha become the main treatment this report aim to present the result of our work on ifs case case report a 4yearold girl wa admitted to our hospital with a chief concern of a mass in the right lower leg that first appeared 3 year ago physical examination showed a single mass with denserubbery consistency tenderness and limited range of motion plain radiography wa performed and a softtissue mass wa seen on the anterior 13 distal cruris of the right side ct angiography showed a bulging softtissue mass solid 38 hu with size 28x31x47 cm mri examination revealed an aggressive superficial softtissue mass in the cutaneoussubcutaneous compartment biopsy and immunohistochemistry were performed and the result were consistent with ifs a local excision wa made to assess for pathological anatomy conclusion infantile fibrosarcoma ifs is an uncommon tumor in early childhood it tends to mimic other tumor which may interfere with the correct diagnosis which may contribute to it rarity local excision is the first treatment choice with a good prognosis for ifs

processed_title: implementation of medication safety practice in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment
processed_abstract: objective medical safety practice msp is a safe procedure in medication process it is important to investigate the use of msp among childhood cancer patient because pediatric oncology is a highrisk area for potentially harmful adverse event the purpose of this study is to determine the effect of the implementation of msp in chemotherapy on the incidence of medication error in childhood all patient at dr sardjito hospital including in 1 transcribing 2 administering 3 monitoring 4 the incidence of adverse drug event ade method the study design is a quasiexperimental study with pre and postintervention without control the sample consists of all patient who are taken care of at an academic hospital in indonesia from 2012 to 2013 the sample wa consecutively collected during the period of study the data were collected through medical record research form observation and discussion with the nurse the intervention given is training and implementation of medical safety practice in chemotherapy result based on the analysis of the effect of the implementation of msp 75 and 106 medical record of pre and postintervention it is obtained 1 the adherence of chemotherapy transcribing postintervention increase significantly compared to preintervention p005 2 the adherence of chemotherapy administering increase significantly in almost every aspect p005 except in preparing drug by two different health worker patient confirmation of ade management and verification of drug expired date 3 the adherence of chemotherapy monitoring improved significantly postintervention p005 4 adverse drug event ade decreased significantly postintervention p005 from 521 to 305 conclusion the implementation of msp decreased the incidence of medication error in all patient at dr sardjito hospital in ordering dispensing transcribing administering and monitoring chemotherapy it also reduced the incidence of ade related to chemotherapy specific training for nurse are needed in order to improve the knowledge and skill especially for medication error and skill in patient care

processed_title: transfusiondependent anaemia of undetermined origin a distinctive syndrome in paediatric medical tourism
processed_abstract: introduction the underlying diagnosis of severe anaemic illness in child may not be easy to identify at time especially when regular blood transfusion ha been started material and method international child patient attending a haematology clinic for diagnostic evaluation were identified retrospectively if they had to receive repeated blood transfusion with an undiagnosed illness or an incorrect diagnosis their demographic data presenting feature and eventual diagnosis were described result twelve child including 7 boy were enrolled from march 2007 to august 2011 five came from vietnam 2 each came from bangladesh and indonesia and 1 each from hong kong myanmar and ukraine their illness started at a mean age of 15 year 01 to 66 and they had been receiving blood transfusion for a mean duration of 25 year 01 to 99 year prior to the evaluation thalassemia major wa the fi rst diagnosis in 5 case one had been treated for autoimmune haemolytic anaemia while the rest had not been given a diagnosis after the evaluation 4 child were diagnosed with diamond blackfan anaemia 3 were diagnosed with hereditary spherocytosis and one each with hereditary pyropoikilocytosis congenital sideroblastic anaemia congenital thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura transient erythroblastopenia of childhood and autoimmune myelofibrosis associated with human immunodeficiency virus infection conclusion a definitive diagnosis can be identified in this cohort of child on medical tourism with severe anaemic illness requiring repeated transfusion with diagnostic approach that circumvent the interference of transfused cell

processed_title: exploring recommendation for an effective smoking prevention program for indonesian adolescent
processed_abstract: background the present qualitative study assessed the need acceptability and appropriateness for implementing effective and culturally appropriate smoking prevention program for adolescent in school in indonesia method snowball sampling wa used to recruit participant the study sample comprised a mixture of staff in the education department junior high school teacher and individual who had taught junior high school student in aceh province indonesia data were collected through one hour indepth face to face or telephone interview and analyzed using a descriptive content analysis procedure result school teacher and policy maker in education firmly supported the implementation of a schoolbased smoking prevention program in aceh an appropriate intervention for smoking prevention program in school in aceh should involve both health and islamic based approach and be provided by teacher and external provider potential barrier to the program included smoker teacher and parent time constraint of student andor teacher lack of teacher ability increase in student load the availability of tobacco advertising and sale and lack of tobacco regulation and support from community and related department to increase program effectiveness involvement of and coordination with other relevant party are needed conclusion the important stakeholder in indonesian childhood education agreed that schoolbased smoking prevention program would be appropriate for junior high school student an appropriate intervention for smoking prevention program for adolescent in school in indonesia should be appropriate to participant background and involve all relevant party

processed_title: healthcare provider perspective on healthinsurance access waiving procedure and hospital detention practice in kenya
processed_abstract: background patient at kenyan public hospital are detained if their family can not pay their medical bill access to health insurance and waiving procedure to prevent detention may be limited this study explores the perspective of healthcare provider hcp on healthinsurance access waiving procedure and hospital detention practice procedure a selfadministered structured questionnaire wa completed by 104 hcp response rate 78 involved in childhood cancer care result the perspective of respondent were a follows all child with cancer should have health insurance according to 96 of hcp after parent apply for health insurance it take too long before treatment cost are covered 67 agree patient with childhood cancer without health insurance have a higher chance of abandoning treatment 82 agree hospital should waive bill of all child with cancer when parent have payment difficulty 69 agree waiving procedure take too long 75 parent are scared by waiving procedure and may decide never to return to the hospital again 68 poor family delay visiting the hospital because they fear hospital detention and first seek alternative treatment 92 when poor family finally come to the hospital the disease is in advanced stage already 94 parent sometimes have to abandon their detained child at the hospital if they can not pay hospital bill 68 detention of child at the hospital if parent can not pay their medical bill is not approved by 84 of hcp conclusion hcp acknowledge that access to health insurance need improvement and that waiving procedure contribute to treatment abandonment by far most hcp disapprove of hospital detention practice these factor warrant urgent attention and adjustment

processed_title: risk factor of daunorubicine induced early cardiotoxicity in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia a retrospective study
processed_abstract: background daunorubicine a type of anthracycline is a drug commonly used in cancer chemotherapy that increase survival rate but consequently compromise with cardiovascular outcome in some patient thus preventing the early progression of cardiotoxicity is important to improve the treatment outcome in childhood acute lymhoblastic leukemia all objective the present study aimed to identify the risk factor in anthracyclineinduced early cardiotoxicity in childhood all method this retrospective study wa conducted by observing alldiagnosed child from 2014 to 2019 in dr soetomo general hospital there were 49 patient who met the inclusion criterion and were treated with chemotherapy using indonesian childhood all protocol 2013 echocardiography wa performed by pediatric cardiologist to compare before and at any given time after anthracycline therapy early cardiotoxicity wa defined a a decline of left ventricle ejection fraction lvef greater than 10 with a final lvef 53 during the first year of anthracycline administration risk factor such a sex age risk stratification group and cumulative dose were identified by using multiple logistic regression diagnostic performance of cumulative anthracycline dose wa evaluated by receiver operating characteristic roc curve result early anthracyclineinduced cardiotoxicity wa observed in 5 out of 49 patient the median cumulative dose of anthracycline wa 143697268 mgm2 thirtythree patient experienced a decreasing lvef the factor associated with early cardiomyopathy were age of 4 year pr 1128 95 ci 10151254 p 0001 high risk group pr 1135 95 ci 10161269 p 0001 and cumulative dose of 120 mg m2 ci 1161 95 ci10191332 conclusion age of 4 year risk group and cumulative dose of 120 mgm2 are significant risk factor for early cardiomyopathy in childhood all

processed_title: approach to identifying causative pathogen of communityacquired pneumonia in child using culture molecular and serology test
processed_abstract: determining the causative pathogen of communityacquired pneumonia cap in child remains a challenge despite advance in diagnostic method currently available guideline generally recommend empiric antimicrobial therapy when the specific etiology is unknown however shift in epidemiology emergence of new pathogen and increasing antimicrobial resistance underscore the importance of identifying causative pathogen although viral cap among child is increasingly recognized distinguishing viral from bacterial etiology remains difficult obtaining high quality sample from infected lung tissue is typically the limiting factor additionally interpretation of result from routinely collected specimen blood sputum and nasopharyngeal swab is complicated by bacterial colonization and prolonged shedding of incidental respiratory virus using current literature on assessment of cap cause in child we developed an approach for identifying the most likely causative pathogen using blood and sputum culture polymerase chain reaction pcr and paired serology our proposed rule do not rely on carriage prevalence data from control we herein share our perspective in order to help clinician and researcher classify and manage childhood pneumonia

processed_title: healthrelated quality of life assessment in indonesian childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia
processed_abstract: background most study on healthrelated quality of life hrqol in child with cancer were conducted in developed country the aim of this study were to assess the hrqol in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all patient in indonesia and to assess the influence of demographic and medical characteristic on hrqol method after cultural linguistic validation a crosssectional study of hrqol wa conducted with childhood all patient and their guardian in various phase of treatment using the pediatric quality of life inventory pedsql 40 generic core scale and the pediatric quality of life inventory pedsql 30 cancer module result ninetyeight guardian and 55 patient participated the internal consistency of both scale ranged from 057 to 092 hrqol of indonesian patient wa comparable with those in developed country there were moderate to good correlation between selfreports and proxyreports however guardian tended to report worse hrqol than patient child of the 25 yeargroup significantly had more problem in procedural anxiety treatment anxiety and communication subscales than in older group p 005 in the nonintensive phase hrqol wa significantly better than in the intensive phase both in patient selfreports and proxyreports conclusion younger child had more problem in procedural anxiety treatment anxiety and communication subscales therefore special care during intervention procedure is needed to promote their normal development psychosocial support should be provided to child and their parent to facilitate their coping with disease and it treatment

processed_title: attitude of healthcare provider toward childhood leukemia patient with different socioeconomic status
processed_abstract: background treatment result differ significantly between poor and prosperous child with leukemia in indonesia the objective of this study wa to determine whether parental socioeconomic status influence belief attitude and behavior of healthcare provider hcp treating childhood leukemia in indonesia procedure a selfadministered semistructured questionnaire wa filled in by 102 hcp 69 doctor 28 nurse 2 psychologist 2 hematology technician 1 administrator result most hcp 98 asked parent about their financial situation the decision to start treatment wa influenced by parental socioeconomic status 86 motivation of parent 80 and motivation of doctor 76 healthcare provider stated that prosperous patient comply better with treatment 64 doctor comply better with treatment for the prosperous 53 most patient can not afford to complete treatment 58 less extensive explanation are given toward poor family 60 and communication is impeded by difference in status 67 when dealing with prosperous family a minority of hcp stated that they pay more attention 27 work with greater accuracy 24 take more interest 23 and devote more time per visit 22 most hcp denied difference in the quality of medical care 93 and the chance of cure 58 between poor and prosperous patient conclusion belief attitude and behavior of hcp toward poor versus prosperous patient appeared to differ these difference may contribute to the immense dropout rate and slight chance of survival among poor patient with leukemia in developing country

processed_title: aberrantly expressed brutons tyrosine kinase preferentially drive metastatic and stem celllike phenotype in neuroblastoma cell
processed_abstract: purpose neuroblastoma a common childhood tumor remains one of the most elusive disease to treat to date highrisk neuroblastoma is associated with low survival rate to address this novel and more effective therapeutic strategy must continue to be explored method we employed a bioinformatics approach corroborated with in vitro and in vivo data sample from neuroblastoma patient were retrieved and immunostained for brutons tyrosine kinase btk to evaluate it effect on cellular function btk expression in sknbe2 and shsy5y neuroblastoma cell wa downregulated using gene silencing or inhibition with ibrutinib or acalabrutinib xenograft mouse model were used to investigate the in vivo role of btk in neuroblastoma tumorigenesis result we found that btk wa highly expressed in primary neuroblastoma sample preferentially in mycnamplified neuroblastoma case and wa associated with a poor prognosis immunohistochemical staining of tissue from our neuroblastoma cohort revealed a strong btk immunoreactivity we also found that neuroblastoma sknbe2 and shsy5y cell were sensitive to treatment with ibrutinib and acalabrutinib pharmacologic or molecular inhibition of btk elicited a reduction in the migratory and invasive ability of neuroblastoma cell and ibrutinib considerably attenuated the neurosphereforming ability of neuroblastoma cell both inhibitor showed synergism with cisplatin in vivo assay showed that acalabrutinib effectively inhibited neuroblastoma tumorigenesis conclusion from our data we conclude that btk is a therapeutically targetable driver of neuroblastoma

processed_title: unraveling copy number alteration in pediatric bcell acute lymphoblastic leukemia correlation with induction phase remission using mlpa
processed_abstract: objective acute lymphoblastic leukemia all is the most common malignancy occurring in child copy number alteration cna like pax5 cdkn2a2b par1 region etv6 ikzf1 btg1 and rb1 gene deletion are important genetic event that define and prognosticate bcell all thus this study aimed to evaluate association of cna with induction phase remission status in childhood bcell all method this study wa observational with a crosssectional design at the dharmais cancer hospital harapan kita mother and child hospital and tangerang regional public hospital we evaluated 74 pediatric bcell all case with 118yearolds genomic dna wa analyzed by multiplex ligation dependent probe amplification assay mlpa this study used the p335 allikzf1 panel kit which contains several allrelated gene the patient clinical and laboratory characteristic were collected from medical record from january to december 2019 result we observed gene copy number alteration in child with bcell all pax5 wa the most commonly observed gene deletion followed by cdkn212b etv6 ikzf1 btg1 rb1 and par1 region based on gene mutation only the pax5 had a significant association with the remission status of pediatric bcell all pvalue 005 or 391 it showed that patient with pax5 gene mutation have 39 time the risk of no remission andor relapse compared to those without pax5 gene mutation conclusion patient with mutation in the pax5 gene have a higher chance of not achieving remission andor experiencing relapse than those without such mutation the mlpa method can be utilized for examining copy number alteration which is valuable for achieving more precise stratification in diagnosis further research is needed to expand upon this finding

processed_title: geocultural difference in preschooler sleep profile and family practice an analysis of pooled data from 37 country
processed_abstract: study objective to examine 1 multidimensional sleep profile in preschooler 36 year across geocultural region and 2 difference in sleep characteristic and family practice between majority world region pacific island subsaharan africa eastern europe northeast asia southeast asia south asia the middle east and north africa and latin america and the minority world the western world method participant were 3507 preschooler from 37 country nighttime sleep characteristic and nap duration accelerometer n 1950 and family practice parental questionnaire were measured mixed model were used to estimate the marginal mean of sleep characteristic by region and examine the difference result geocultural region explained up to 30 of variance in sleep characteristic a pattern of short nighttime sleep duration low sleep efficiency and long nap duration wa observed in eastern europe northeast asia and southeast asia the second pattern with later sleep midpoint and greater nighttonight sleep variability wa observed in south asia the middle east and north africa and latin america compared to the minority world less optimal sleep characteristic were observed in several majority world region with mediumtolarge effect size mid rdmid r048235 several majority world region reported more frequent parental smartphone use during bedtime routine northeast asia southeast asia 077099 unit and were more likely to have electronic device in childrens bedroom eastern europe latin america south asia or 5971657 and cosleeping arrangement asia latin america or 7054986 compared to the minority world conclusion preschooler sleep profile and related family practice vary across geocultural region which should be considered in sleep health promotion initiative and policy

processed_title: bilateral giant renal angiomyolipoma in a patient with tuberous sclerosis complex a case report
processed_abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc ha several renal manifestation including angiomyolipomas aml and renal epithelial neoplasm a bilateral giant renal aml is extremely rare we report a case of giant bilateral aml and discus the diagnosis and treatment of it the 22yearold man wa admitted due to bilateral flank pain gross hematuria and abdominal fullness he had history of epilepsy mental retardation and delayed development during childhood he had angiofibroma on his face since 10 year ago abdominal ct and mri revealed large lobulated heterogeneous mass with fatty content based on those finding we diagnosed the patient with bilateral giant renal aml we gave conservative management for the patient and planned to total nephrectomy on the left kidney if the continued bleeding occurred aml associated with tsc occur more frequently a multiple lesion and grows to larger size than idiopathic aml bilateral giant aml which is very rare could be treated with conservative management if no significant hemorrhage occurred

processed_title: lasparaginase longterm result of a randomized trial of the effect of additional 3 dos during consolidation treatment in the indonesian wkall2000 protocol
processed_abstract: we conducted a randomized trial to compare the influence of 3 additional dos of lasparaginase on clinical outcome of newly diagnosed childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia all patient were treated using indonesian wkall2000 protocol between 1999 and 2005 and randomized to receive 3a arm n61 or not to receive 0a arm n56 an additional 3 weekly dos of 6000 ium2dose of escherichia coli lasparaginase during consolidation treatment on top of 2 dos standardrisk patient or 5 dos highrisk patient event after remission included relapse 376 death 162 and abandonment of therapy 154 there wa no significant difference in relapse between the 2 arm patient in arm 3a versus 0a tended to have a lower 5 year diseasefree survival 47479 v 51779 p072 and lower 5 year eventfree survival 29558 v 35764 p061 we conclude that in our setting the use of 3 additional dos of lasparaginase during consolidation therapy did not result in survival advantage contrariwise adverse effect from this drug included higher treatment cost and systemic toxicity

processed_title: a medication diarybook for pediatric patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia in indonesia
processed_abstract: background eventfree survival of pediatric patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia all in yogyakarta indonesia wa low 20 the aim of the study wa to evaluate the effectiveness of using a medication diarybook on the treatment outcome of childhood all procedure a randomized study wa conducted with 109 pediatric patient with all in a pediatric oncology center in yogyakarta indonesia both intervention and control group received a structured parental education program and donated chemotherapy the intervention group received a medication diarybook to remind parent and family to take oral chemotherapy and present for scheduled appointment or admission eventfree survival estimate efs at 3 year wa assessed result among pediatric patient with all with highly educated mother senior high school or higher the efsestimate at 3 year of the intervention group wa significantly higher than the efsestimate at 3 year of the control group 62 v 29 p 004 among pediatric patient with all with loweducated mother no significant difference wa found in the efsestimates at 3 year between the intervention and control group 26 v 18 p 086 conclusion we conclude that a medication diarybook might be useful to improve the survival of pediatric patient with all in resourcelimited setting particularly in patient with highly educated mother

processed_title: global regional and national level of neonatal infant and under5 mortality during 19902013 a systematic analysis for the global burden of disease study 2013
processed_abstract: background remarkable financial and political effort have been focused on the reduction of child mortality during the past few decade timely measurement of level and trend in under5 mortality are important to assess progress towards the millennium development goal 4 mdg 4 target of reduction of child mortality by two third from 1990 to 2015 and to identify model of success method we generated updated estimate of child mortality in early neonatal age 06 day late neonatal 728 day postneonatal 29364 day childhood 14 year and under5 04 year age group for 188 country from 1970 to 2013 with more than 29000 survey census vital registration and sample registration datapoints we used gaussian process regression with adjustment for bias and nonsampling error to synthesise the data for under5 mortality for each country and a separate model to estimate mortality for more detailed age group we used explanatory mixed effect regression model to assess the association between under5 mortality and income per person maternal education hiv child death rate secular shift and other factor to quantify the contribution of these different factor and birth number to the change in number of death in under5 age group from 1990 to 2013 we used shapley decomposition we used estimated rate of change between 2000 and 2013 to construct under5 mortality rate scenario out to 2030 finding we estimated that 63 million 95 ui 6066 child under5 died in 2013 a 64 reduction from 176 million 171181 in 1970 in 2013 child mortality rate ranged from 1525 per 1000 livebirths 13061774 in guineabissau to 23 1829 per 1000 in singapore the annualised rate of change from 1990 to 2013 ranged from 68 to 01 99 of 188 country including 43 of 48 country in subsaharan africa had faster decrease in child mortality during 200013 than during 19902000 in 2013 neonatal death accounted for 416 of under5 death compared with 374 in 1990 compared with 1990 in 2013 rising number of birth especially in subsaharan africa led to 14 million more child death and rising income per person and maternal education led to 09 million and 22 million fewer death respectively change in secular trend led to 42 million fewer death unexplained factor accounted for only 1 of the change in child death in 30 developing country decrease since 2000 have been faster than predicted attributable to income education and secular shift alone interpretation only 27 developing country are expected to achieve mdg 4 decrease since 2000 in under5 mortality rate are accelerating in many developing country especially in subsaharan africa the millennium declaration and increased development assistance for health might have been a factor in faster decrease in some developing country without further accelerated progress many country in west and central africa will still have high level of under5 mortality in 2030 funding bill melinda gate foundation u agency for international development

processed_title: global regional and national progress towards the 2030 global nutrition target and forecast to 2050 a systematic analysis for the global burden of disease study 2021
processed_abstract: background the six global nutrition target gnts related to low birthweight exclusive breastfeeding child growth ie wasting stunting and overweight and anaemia among female of reproductive age were chosen by the world health assembly in 2012 a key indicator of maternal and child health but there ha yet to be a comprehensive report on progress for the period 2012 to 2021 we aimed to evaluate level trend and observedtoexpected progress in prevalence and attributable burden from 2012 to 2021 with prevalence projection to 2050 in 204 country and territory method the prevalence and attributable burden of each target indicator were estimated by age group sex and year in 204 country and territory from 2012 to 2021 in the global burden of disease injury and risk factor study gbd 2021 the most comprehensive assessment of cause of death disability and risk factor to date countryspecific relative performance to date wa evaluated with a bayesian metaregression model that compare prevalence to expected value based on sociodemographic index sdi a composite indicator of societal development status target progress wa forecasted from 2021 up to 2050 by modelling past trend with metaregression using a combination of key quantity and then extrapolating future projection of those quantity finding in 2021 a few country had already met some of the gnts five for exclusive breastfeeding four for stunting 96 for child wasting and three for child overweight and none met the target for low birthweight or anaemia in female of reproductive age since 2012 the annualised rate of change arc in the prevalence of child overweight increased in 201 country and territory and arc in the prevalence of anaemia in female of reproductive age decreased considerably in 26 country between 2012 and 2021 sdi wa strongly associated with indicator prevalence apart from exclusive breastfeeding r046086 many country in subsaharan africa had a decrease in the prevalence of multiple indicator that wa more rapid than expected on the basis of sdi the difference between observed and expected arc for child stunting and wasting were 05 and 13 respectively the arc in the attributable burden of low birthweight child stunting and child wasting decreased faster than the arc of the prevalence for each in most lowincome and middleincome country in 2030 we project that 94 country will meet one of the six target 21 country will meet two target and 89 country will not meet any target we project that seven country will meet the target for exclusive breastfeeding 28 for child stunting and 101 for child wasting and no country will meet the target for low birthweight child overweight and anaemia in 2050 we project that seven additional country will meet the target for exclusive breastfeeding five for low birthweight 96 for child stunting nine for child wasting and one for child overweight and no country are projected to meet the anaemia target interpretation based on current level and past trend few gnts will be met by 2030 major reduction in attributable burden for exclusive breastfeeding and anthropometric indicator should be recognised a huge scientific and policy success but the comparative lack of progress in reducing the prevalence of each along with stagnant anaemia in woman of reproductive age and widespread increase in child overweight suggests a tenuous status quo continued investment in preventive and treatment effort for acute childhood illness is crucial to prevent backsliding parallel development of effective treatment along with commitment to multisectoral longterm policy to address the determinant and cause of suboptimal nutrition are sorely needed to gain ground funding bill melinda gate foundation

processed_title: doe aid reach the poor experience of a childhood leukaemia outreachprogramme
processed_abstract: previously we found that the access to donated chemotherapy for childhood leukaemia patient in indonesia wa limited only 16 of eligible family received donation after the introduction of a structured parental education programme we examined the access of parent of child with leukaemia to donated chemotherapy in an indonesian academic hospital the programme consisted of a videopresentation in hospital informationbooklet audiocassette dvd procedure for informedconsent statement of understanding for donated chemotherapy and a complaintsmechanism of 72 new patient 51 parent 71 were interviewed by independent psychologist using questionnaire parent of 21 patient 29 did not participate because their child droppedout n10 or died n11 before an interview took place four patient had health insurance and did not need donated chemotherapy access to donated chemotherapy wa improved 4647 patient 98 received donation structured parental education improved the access to donated chemotherapy outreachprogrammes may benefit from this approach this may enable more patient from poor socioeconomic background in the developing country to receive aid and achieve cure

processed_title: acute lymphoblastic leukemia in the department of child health school of medicine university of north sumateradr pirngadi hospital medan 19801988
processed_abstract: a retrospective study on acute lymphoblastic leukemia all wa conducted to assess the pattern of childhood all at the subdivision of pediatric of hematology school of medicine university of north sumateradr pirngadi hospital medan in a period of 8 year 19801988 there were 120 case consisting of 63 525 male and 57 475 female by the fab classification bennett 1976 775 were found a fab l 1 25 208 a fab l 2 and 2 17 a fab l 3 the youngest wa 4 month old the majority of sign and symptom appeared in the form of pallor 102 85 fever 84 70 hemorrhage 52 433 hepatomegaly 64 533 splenomegaly 54 45 and lymphadenopathy 18 15 on first admission 76 6333 case were with a leukocyte count of less than 20000microliters and 72 60 with hb content of less than 5 gdl twenty one case died in the first year the received cytostatic protocol 11 5238 were treated regularly and first remission were found in 8 7273 case the average of admission per year for the age group of 28 year wa higher than the age group of 02 year and 816 year p less than 005

processed_title: the minderoomonaco commission on plastic and human health
processed_abstract: background plastic have conveyed great benefit to humanity and made possible some of the most significant advance of modern civilization in field a diverse a medicine electronics aerospace construction food packaging and sport it is now clear however that plastic are also responsible for significant harm to human health the economy and the earth environment these harm occur at every stage of the plastic life cycle from extraction of the coal oil and gas that are it main feedstock through to ultimate disposal into the environment the extent of these harm not been systematically assessed their magnitude not fully quantified and their economic cost not comprehensively counted goal the goal of this minderoomonaco commission on plastic and human health are to comprehensively examine plastic impact across their life cycle on 1 human health and wellbeing 2 the global environment especially the ocean 3 the economy and 4 vulnerable populationsthe poor minority and the world child on the basis of this examination the commission offer sciencebased recommendation designed to support development of a global plastic treaty protect human health and save life report structure this commission report contains seven section following an introduction section 2 present a narrative review of the process involved in plastic production use and disposal and note the hazard to human health and the environment associated with each of these stage section 3 describes plastic impact on the ocean and note the potential for plastic in the ocean to enter the marine food web and result in human exposure section 4 detail plastic impact on human health section 5 present a firstorder estimate of plastic healthrelated economic cost section 6 examines the intersection between plastic social inequity and environmental injustice section 7 present the commission finding and recommendation plastic plastic are complex highly heterogeneous synthetic chemical material over 98 of plastic are produced from fossil carbon coal oil and gas plastic are comprised of a carbonbased polymer backbone and thousand of additional chemical that are incorporated into polymer to convey specific property such a color flexibility stability water repellence flame retardation and ultraviolet resistance many of these added chemical are highly toxic they include carcinogen neurotoxicants and endocrine disruptors such a phthalates bisphenols per and polyfluoroalkyl substance pfas brominated flame retardant and organophosphate flame retardant they are integral component of plastic and are responsible for many of plastic harm to human health and the environmentglobal plastic production ha increased almost exponentially since world war ii and in this time more than 8300 megaton mt of plastic have been manufactured annual production volume ha grown from under 2 mt in 1950 to 460 mt in 2019 a 230fold increase and is on track to triple by 2060 more than half of all plastic ever made ha been produced since 2002 singleuse plastic account for 3540 of current plastic production and represent the most rapidly growing segment of plastic manufactureexplosive recent growth in plastic production reflects a deliberate pivot by the integrated multinational fossilcarbon corporation that produce coal oil and gas and that also manufacture plastic these corporation are reducing their production of fossil fuel and increasing plastic manufacture the two principal factor responsible for this pivot are decreasing global demand for carbonbased fuel due to increase in green energy and massive expansion of oil and gas production due to frackingplastic manufacture is energyintensive and contributes significantly to climate change at present plastic production is responsible for an estimated 37 of global greenhouse gas emission more than the contribution of brazil this fraction is projected to increase to 45 by 2060 if current trend continue unchecked plastic life cycle the plastic life cycle ha three phase production use and disposal in production carbon feedstockscoal gas and oilare transformed through energyintensive catalytic process into a vast array of product plastic use occurs in every aspect of modern life and result in widespread human exposure to the chemical contained in plastic singleuse plastic constitute the largest portion of current use followed by synthetic fiber and constructionplastic disposal is highly inefficient with recovery and recycling rate below 10 globally the result is that an estimated 22 mt of plastic waste enters the environment each year much of it singleuse plastic and are added to the more than 6 gigatons of plastic waste that have accumulated since 1950 strategy for disposal of plastic waste include controlled and uncontrolled landfilling open burning thermal conversion and export vast quantity of plastic waste are exported each year from highincome to lowincome country where it accumulates in landfill pollutes air and water degrades vital ecosystem befouls beach and estuary and harm human healthenvironmental injustice on a global scale plasticladen ewaste is particularly problematic environmental finding plastic and plasticassociated chemical are responsible for widespread pollution they contaminate aquatic marine and freshwater terrestrial and atmospheric environment globally the ocean is the ultimate destination for much plastic and plastic are found throughout the ocean including coastal region the sea surface the deep sea and polar sea ice many plastic appear to resist breakdown in the ocean and could persist in the global environment for decade macro and microplastic particle have been identified in hundred of marine specie in all major taxon including specie consumed by human trophic transfer of microplastic particle and the chemical within them ha been demonstrated although microplastic particle themselves 10 microm appear not to undergo biomagnification hydrophobic plasticassociated chemical bioaccumulate in marine animal and biomagnify in marine food web the amount and fate of smaller microplastic and nanoplastic particle mnps 10 microm in aquatic environment are poorly understood but the potential for harm is worrying given their mobility in biological system adverse environmental impact of plastic pollution occur at multiple level from molecular and biochemical to population and ecosystem mnp contamination of seafood result in direct though not well quantified human exposure to plastic and plasticassociated chemical marine plastic pollution endangers the ocean ecosystem upon which all humanity depends for food oxygen livelihood and wellbeing human health finding coal miner oil worker and gas field worker who extract fossil carbon feedstock for plastic production suffer increased mortality from traumatic injury coal worker pneumoconiosis silicosis cardiovascular disease chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and lung cancer plastic production worker are at increased risk of leukemia lymphoma hepatic angiosarcoma brain cancer breast cancer mesothelioma neurotoxic injury and decreased fertility worker producing plastic textile die of bladder cancer lung cancer mesothelioma and interstitial lung disease at increased rate plastic recycling worker have increased rate of cardiovascular disease toxic metal poisoning neuropathy and lung cancer resident of fenceline community adjacent to plastic production and waste disposal site experience increased risk of premature birth low birth weight asthma childhood leukemia cardiovascular disease chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and lung cancerduring use and also in disposal plastic release toxic chemical including additive and residual monomer into the environment and into people national biomonitoring survey in the usa document populationwide exposure to these chemical plastic additive disrupt endocrine function and increase risk for premature birth neurodevelopmental disorder male reproductive birth defect infertility obesity cardiovascular disease renal disease and cancer chemicalladen mnps formed through the environmental degradation of plastic waste can enter living organism including human emerging albeit still incomplete evidence indicates that mnps may cause toxicity due to their physical and toxicological effect a well a by acting a vector that transport toxic chemical and bacterial pathogen into tissue and cellsinfants in the womb and young child are two population at particularly high risk of plasticrelated health effect because of the exquisite sensitivity of early development to hazardous chemical and childrens unique pattern of exposure plasticassociated exposure are linked to increased risk of prematurity stillbirth low birth weight birth defect of the reproductive organ neurodevelopmental impairment impaired lung growth and childhood cancer earlylife exposure to plasticassociated chemical also increase the risk of multiple noncommunicable disease later in life economic finding plastic harm to human health result in significant economic cost we estimate that in 2015 the healthrelated cost of plastic production exceeded 250 billion 2015 int globally and that in the usa alone the health cost of disease and disability caused by the plasticassociated chemical pbde bpa and dehp exceeded 920 billion 2015 int plastic production result in greenhouse gas ghg emission equivalent to 196 gigatons of carbon dioxide co2e annually using the u environmental protection agency epa social cost of carbon metric we estimate the annual cost of these ghg emission to be 341 billion 2015 intthese cost large a they are almost certainly underestimate the full economic loss resulting from plastic negative impact on human health and the global environment all of plastic economic costsand also it social costsare externalized by the petrochemical and plastic manufacturing industry and are borne by citizen taxpayer and government in country around the world without compensation social justice finding the adverse effect of plastic and plastic pollution on human health the economy and the environment are not evenly distributed they disproportionately affect poor disempowered and marginalized population such a worker racial and ethnic minority fenceline community indigenous group woman and child all of whom had little to do with creating the current plastic crisis and lack the political influence or the resource to address it plastic harmful impact across it life cycle are most keenly felt in the global south in small island state and in disenfranchised area in the global north social and environmental justice sej principle require reversal of these inequitable burden to ensure that no group bear a disproportionate share of plastic negative impact and that those who benefit economically from plastic bear their fair share of it currently externalized cost conclusion it is now clear that current pattern of plastic production use and disposal are not sustainable and are responsible for significant harm to human health the environment and the economy a well a for deep societal injusticesthe main driver of these worsening harm is an almost exponential and still accelerating increase in global plastic production plastic harm are further magnified by low rate of recovery and recycling and by the long persistence of plastic waste in the environmentthe thousand of chemical in plasticsmonomers additive processing agent and nonintentionally added substancesinclude amongst their number known human carcinogen endocrine disruptors neurotoxicants and persistent organic pollutant these chemical are responsible for many of plastic known harm to human and planetary health the chemical leach out of plastic enter the environment cause pollution and result in human exposure and disease all effort to reduce plastic hazard must address the hazard of plasticassociated chemical recommendation to protect human and planetary health especially the health of vulnerable and atrisk population and put the world on track to end plastic pollution by 2040 this commission support urgent adoption by the world nation of a strong and comprehensive global plastic treaty in accord with the mandate set forth in the march 2022 resolution of the united nation environment assembly uneainternational measure such a a global plastic treaty are needed to curb plastic production and pollution because the harm to human health and the environment caused by plastic plasticassociated chemical and plastic waste transcend national boundary are planetary in their scale and have disproportionate impact on the health and wellbeing of people in the world poorest nation effective implementation of the global plastic treaty will require that international action be coordinated and complemented by intervention at the national regional and local levelsthis commission urge that a cap on global plastic production with target timetable and national contribution be a central provision of the global plastic treaty we recommend inclusion of the following additional provisionsthe treaty need to extend beyond microplastics and marine litter to include all of the many thousand of chemical incorporated into plasticsthe treaty need to include a provision banning or severely restricting manufacture and use of unnecessary avoidable and problematic plastic item especially singleuse item such a manufactured plastic microbeadsthe treaty need to include requirement on extended producer responsibility epr that make fossil carbon producer plastic producer and the manufacturer of plastic product legally and financially responsible for the safety and endoflife management of all the material they produce and sellthe treaty need to mandate reduction in the chemical complexity of plastic product healthprotective standard for plastic and plastic additive a requirement for use of sustainable nontoxic material full disclosure of all component and traceability of component international cooperation will be essential to implementing and enforcing these standardsthe treaty need to include sej remedy at each stage of the plastic life cycle designed to fill gap in community knowledge and advance both distributional and procedural equitythis commission encourages inclusion in the global plastic treaty of a provision calling for exploration of listing at least some plastic polymer a persistent organic pollutant pop under the stockholm conventionthis commission encourages a strong interface between the global plastic treaty and the basel and london convention to enhance management of hazardous plastic waste and slow current massive export of plastic waste into the world leastdeveloped countriesthis commission recommends the creation of a permanent science policy advisory body to guide the treaty implementation the main priority of this body would be to guide member state and other stakeholder in evaluating which solution are most effective in reducing plastic consumption enhancing plastic waste recovery and recycling and curbing the generation of plastic waste this body could also assess tradeoff among these solution and evaluate safer alternative to current plastic it could monitor the transnational export of plastic waste it could coordinate robust oceanic land and airbased mnp monitoring programsthis commission recommends urgent investment by national government in research into solution to the global plastic crisis this research will need to determine which solution are most effective and costeffective in the context of particular country and assess the risk and benefit of proposed solution oceanographic and environmental research is needed to better measure concentration and impact of plastic 10 microm and understand their distribution and fate in the global environment biomedical research is needed to elucidate the human health impact of plastic especially mnps summary this commission find that plastic are both a boon to humanity and a stealth threat to human and planetary health plastic convey enormous benefit but current linear pattern of plastic production use and disposal that pay little attention to sustainable design or safe material and a near absence of recovery reuse and recycling are responsible for grave harm to health widespread environmental damage great economic cost and deep societal injustice these harm are rapidly worseningwhile there remain gap in knowledge about plastic harm and uncertainty about their full magnitude the evidence available today demonstrates unequivocally that these impact are great and that they will increase in severity in the absence of urgent and effective intervention at global scale manufacture and use of essential plastic may continue however reckless increase in plastic production and especially increase in the manufacture of an everincreasing array of unnecessary singleuse plastic product need to be curbedglobal intervention against the plastic crisis is needed now because the cost of failure to act will be immense

processed_title: praziquantel a the preferred treatment for schistosomiasis
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis caused by schistosoma trematode worm represents a significant global health challenge this review offer a thorough examination of the disease epidemiology transmission dynamic diagnostic modality and treatment option diagnostic technique encompass direct parasitological method immunological assay dnarna detection and biomarker utilization each with distinct advantage and limitation there is an urgent need for improved diagnostic tool with enhanced sensitivity and specificity praziquantel remains the cornerstone of treatment exhibiting efficacy against all schistosoma specie while the potential of artemisin derivative in combination therapy is also explored in this review we focus on the importance of praziquantel administration a the central aspect of schistosomiasis treatment highlighting ongoing effort to optimize it utilization for improved patient outcome

processed_title: review of 2022 who guideline on the control and elimination of schistosomiasis
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis is a helminthiasis infecting approximately 250 million people worldwide in 2001 the world health assembly wha 5419 resolution defined a new global strategy for control of schistosomiasis through preventive chemotherapy programme this resolution culminated in the 2006 who guideline that recommended empirical treatment by mass drug administration with praziquantel predominately to schoolaged child in endemic setting at regular interval since then schoolbased and communitybased preventive chemotherapy programme have been scaledup reducing schistosomiasisassociated morbidity over the past 15 year new scientific evidencecombined with a more ambitious goal of eliminating schistosomiasis and an increase in the global donated supply of praziquantelhas highlighted the need to update public health guidance worldwide in february 2022 who published new guideline with six recommendation to update the global public health strategy against schistosomiasis including expansion of preventive chemotherapy eligibility from the predominant group of schoolaged child to all age group 2 year and older lowering the prevalence threshold for annual preventive chemotherapy and increasing the frequency of treatment this review written by the 20182022 schistosomiasis guideline development group and it international partner present a summary of the new who guideline recommendation for schistosomiasis along with their historical context supporting evidence implication for public health implementation and future research need

processed_title: the present situation and towards the prevention and control of neurocysticercosis on the tropical island bali indonesia
processed_abstract: neurocysticercosis ncc which is caused by accidental ingestion of egg of the pork tapeworm taenia solium wa common in bali indonesia until the early 1990s however improved education on hygiene and sanitation a move to keeping pig indoors and improvement of economic and living condition have substantially reduced the occurrence of ncc in bali since 2011 t solium tapeworm carrier t solium taeniasis and heavily infected pig and dog have exclusively been detected from village in mountainous region of northeastern bali where ncc and ocular cysticercosis occ case have also been identified in response to this continued area of high infection a oneday workshop wa convened to discus how to prevent and control this potentially lethal zoonotic parasitic infection in bali this review present an overview of the current status of t solium taeniasis and cysticercosis in indonesia and proposes a strategy for the prevention and control of this zoonosis in bali

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor of soiltransmitted helminthiasis among school child living in an agricultural area of north sumatera indonesia
processed_abstract: background soiltransmitted helminth infection sth is one of the neglected tropical disease that affect approximately 2 billion people globally school child represent the age group that is most commonly infected with sth resulting in poor school performance impaired cognitive function and many other detrimental effect the transmission of sth is determined by many factor such a hygiene and sanitation understanding the factor that influence disease transmission in a particular area is key to effective sth control the objective of this study wa to determine the prevalence of sth in north sumatera and to identify the associated risk factor among school child method a crosssectional study wa carried out among primary school child in suka village tigapanah subdistrict stool sample were processed using a single katokatz method the potential risk factor analyzed were parent education and occupation hand washing habit latrine usage footwear usage and contact with soil the chisquare test wa performed to identify an association between risk factor and parasitological result logistic regression analysis wa used to measure the strength of association result we enrolled 468 school child between 6 and 12 year of age among those child 268 child 5724 were positive for one or more sth infection approximately 6239 of child played with soildirt every day and only 50 regularly washed their hand after activity most of the child wore shoesslippers when going outside 8782 and used a latrine for defecation 8504 playing with soildirt have been shown to increase the risk of sth infection 753 time while hand washing habit and latrine usage decreased the risk of sth infection 016 time each conclusion the prevalence of sth infection in school child in suka village tigapanah subdistrict is still high playing with soildirt increased the risk of infection while hand washing habit and latrine usage decreased the risk of infection the combined strategy of improving the personal hygiene of child and biannual deworming can reduce the risk of sth infection in school child in suka village tigapanah subdistrict

processed_title: taeniasis and cysticercosis in bali and north sumatra indonesia
processed_abstract: it ha been reported that three human taenia specie are distributed in indonesia taenia solium taenia asiatica and taenia saginata t asiatica is well known in north sumatra especially on samosir island in lake toba t solium and t saginata are known from bali t solium is most serious public health issue in papua former irian jaya in this report we briefly review the present situation of these three human taenia specie mainly in bali and north sumatra for community based epidemiological survey we have adopted and applied questionnaire microscopic observation of egg coproantigen test coprodna test mitochondrial dna analysis and morphology for isolated specimen serology for cysticercosis and taeniasis for detection of taeniasis case of both t saginata and t asiatica questionnaire by expert doctor is perfect to detect worm carrier corpoantigen test developed for detection of taeniasis of t solium is also highly reliable to detect taeniasis carrier in the community epidemiological data from these two island 20022005 are reviewed with background of historical culture religion and custom

processed_title: taeniases and cysticercosis in indonesia past and present situation
processed_abstract: the main aim of this study is to overview the past and present situation of human taeniases and cysticercosis in indonesia and including future perspective through joint project from 1996 we have confirmed the occurrence of taenia saginata beef tapeworm in bali of taenia solium pork tapeworm mainly in papua and sporadically in bali and of taenia asiatica in north sumatra these taeniases were caused through eating uncooked pork and pig viscera for t solium and t asiatica respectively and beef for t saginata the distribution of these tapeworm in indonesia is basically highly restricted by the traditional cultural and religious background in each island t saginata is relatively common in bali although people consume pork lawar more than beef lawar taeniases due to t saginata or t asiatica and t solium and cysticercosis due to t solium have also been sporadically reported in some other island among these specie t solium is exceptional since human can be infected not only by larval stage cysticerci in pork but also by egg released from human tapeworm carrier cysticercosis ha been confirmed in indonesia in human pig and even dog

processed_title: tropical pulmonary disease
processed_abstract: the term tropical refers to the region of the earth lying between the tropic of cancer and the tropic of capricorn located between these equatorial parallel demarcating the torrid zone are several underdeveloped and developing country thailand the philippine malaysia singapore indonesia southern india sri lanka brazil cuba ethiopia sudan and nigeria to name but a few considered to be tropical the climate in most of these country is characterized by high temperature and high humidity the tropical climate and general state of socioeconomic underdevelopment in such country provide an ideal environment for pathogenic organism their vector and intermediate host to flourish furthermore the cultural habit and educational background of the people living in such country expose them to pathogen and when these people become infected they readily become reservoir for or carrier of those organism ultimately the adverse socioeconomic condition of underdeveloped country impede attempt to eradicate or control tropical disease

processed_title: a critical review of anisakidosis case occurring globally
processed_abstract: a review wa conducted to identify the most common causative agent of anisakidosis the method used for identification of the causative agent and to summarize the source of infection and patient demographic a total of 762 case 409 article inclusive of all language were found between 1965 and 2022 the age range wa 7 month to 85 year old out of the 34 country japan spain and south korea stood out with the highest number of published human case of anisakidosis respectively this raise the question why are there few to no report of anisakidosis case in other country such a indonesia and vietnam where seafood consumption is notably high other than the gastrointestinal tract parasite were frequently found in internal organ such a liver spleen pancreas lung hiatal and epigastric hernia and tonsil there are also report of the worm being excreted through the nose rectum and mouth symptom included sore throat tumor bleeding gastricepigastricabdominalsubsternallower backtesticular pain nausea anorexia vomiting diarrhea constipation intestinal obstruction intussusception blood in feces hematochezia anemia and respiratory arrest these appeared either immediately or up to 2 month after consuming rawundercooked seafood and lasting up to 10 year anisakidosis commonly mimicked symptom of cancer pancreatitis type iii kounis syndrome intussusception crohn disease ovarian cyst intestinal endometriosis epigastralgia gastritis gastroesophageal reflux disease hernia intestinal obstruction peritonitis and appendicitis in these case it wa only after surgery that it wa found these symptomsconditions were caused by anisakids a range of not only mainly marine but also freshwater fishshellfish were reported a source of infection there were several report of infection with 1 nematode up to 200 more than one specie of anisakids in the same patient and the presence of l4adult nematode the severity of symptom did not relate to the number of parasite the number of anisakidosis case is grossly underestimated globally using erroneous taxonomic term assumption and identifying the parasite a anisakis based solely on the yshaped lateral cord in crossed section of the parasite are still common the yshaped lateral cord is not unique to anisakis spp acquiring a history of ingesting rawundercooked fishseafood can be a clue to the diagnosis of the condition this review emphasizes the following key point insufficient awareness of fish parasite among medical professional seafood handler and policy maker limited availability of effective diagnostic methodology and inadequate clinical information for optimizing the management of anisakidosis in numerous region worldwide

processed_title: nonnutritional and diseaserelated anemia in indonesia a systematic review
processed_abstract: nonnutritional anemia the second most common type of anemia worldwide after nutritional anemia includes the anemia of inflammation ai and that due to helminthiasis in this review we examine the contribution that nonnutritional anemia make to incidence in indonesia anemia due to helminthiasis is a common problem in indonesia and contributes to prevalence particularly in child under 5 year we conducted a systematic literature review based on google scholar and pubmed for nonnutritional anemia we supplemented this with hemoglobin and chronic disease data in makassar where prevalence and type of anemia were available to effectively reduce anemia prevalence in indonesia intervention should address both nutritional and nonnutritional contributing factor including infection and genetic predisposition

processed_title: current status of parasite infection in indonesia a literature review
processed_abstract: indonesia and south korea have become inseparable in various respect since the 2 country established diplomatic relation in 1973 indonesia is a tropical region that stretch across the equator comprised of 5 main island java kalimantan sumatra sulawesi and papua and 4 archipelago riau bangka belitung nusa tenggara and maluku a most population of eastern indonesia sulawesi papua and nusa tenggara amp maluku live in poor area it is expected that there will be many parasite nevertheless little is known about the status of parasite in indonesia this study examines the prevalence of malaria and lymphatic filaria which are prevalent in indonesia a well a those of soiltransmittedhelminths sth a a result the plasmodium falciparum and p vivax case load are almost equal the current prevalence of p vivax is uniformly low lt5 in all age group and annual parasite incidence api showed decreasing tendency a 084 per 1000 population in 2016 however more than 65 million people still live in malaria epidemic region lymphatic filariasis remains an important public health problem and 236 city were classified a endemic area in 514 citiesdistricts in 2017 it is difficult to ascertain the current prevalence rate of sth in indonesia although west sumba and southwest sumba in east nusa tenggara reported prevalence rate of more than 20 the study also considers the sero prevalence of other parasite identified in indonesia this report should be useful not only to parasitologists but also to traveler and people with business in indonesia

processed_title: transmissionblocking vaccine against schistosomiasis japonica
processed_abstract: control of schistosomiasis japonica endemic in asia including the philippine china and indonesia is extremely challenging schistosoma japonicum is a highly pathogenic helminth parasite with disease arising predominantly from an immune reaction to entrapped parasite egg in tissue female of this specie can generate 10002200 egg per day which is about 3 to 15fold greater than the egg output of other schistosome specie bovine water buffalo and cattle are the predominant definitive host and are estimated to generate up to 90 of parasite egg released into the environment in rural endemic area where these host and human are present here we highlight the necessity of developing veterinary transmissionblocking vaccine for bovine to better control the disease and review potential vaccine candidate we also point out that the approach to producing efficacious transmissionblocking animalbased vaccine before moving on to human vaccine is crucial this will result in effective and feasible public health outcome in agreement with the one health concept to achieve optimum health for people animal and the environment indeed incorporating a veterinarybased transmission vaccine coupled with intervention such a human mass drug administration improved sanitation and hygiene health education and snail control would be invaluable to eliminating zoonotic schistosomiasis

processed_title: ascariasis hostpathogen biology
processed_abstract: ascaris lumbricoides is one of the most common intestinal parasite in human daily global contamination of the soil by a lumbricoides egg is enormous approximately 9 x 1014 eggsday physical factor particularly temperature and moisture are critical in determining the maturation of egg to the infective stage and their survival transmission of the infection to human on the other hand depends more on various socioeconomic factor in theory ascariasis is preventable it is indeed on the way to disappearing completely in developed society where there is a high standard of sanitation ascariasis remains a problem in developing country however where method of disposal of human excreta are inadequate the intensity of invasion is regulated by specific and nonspecific response of the host to migrating a lumbricoides larva whether or not ascariasis becomes symptomatic depends on the intensity of the infection the nutritional and immunologic status of the host and the possible complication that may arise host response to a lumbricoides are brisk during the larval migratory stage in which hypersensitivity reaction may become clinically manifest whereas people are rather tolerant of intestinal infection with adult worm the role of ascariasis in the prevalence of allergic asthma still remains unclear complication due to migration of adult worm into the biliary duct system and to intestinal obstruction are the major cause of acute morbidity and mortality in ascariasis

processed_title: intestinal helminthiasis nutritional status and their relationship a crosssectional study in urban slum school child in indonesia
processed_abstract: in a study of urban slum school child 276 boy and 231 girl in ujung pandang indonesia parasitological and anthropometric exam were crosssectionally performed to assess prevalence and intensity of helminth infection and nutritional status prevalence of ascaris trichuris and hookworm wa 92 98 and 14 respectively 91 child had both ascaris and trichuris infection about half of the ascaris and trichurisinfected child 46 and 58 respectively had moderate infection stunting wa seen in 55 of the child while wasting wa observed in 10 boy had lower nutritional status than girl p 0001 based on weightforage wa and heightforage ha zscores age had an inverse relationship with wa and ha zscores p 00004 a relationship between helminth infection and nutritional status wa observed between log trichuris egg count and wa and ha zscores after controlling for age sex and log ascaris egg count p 0048 for ha zscore and p 0058 for wa zscore the relationship wa also found when trichuris infection wa categorized into mild moderate and severe infection p 0017 and p 0001 for ha and wa zscores respectively scheffes test for multiple mean comparison showed that trichurisinfected child with above 1000 egg per gram feces had significantly lower nutritional status than lower epg or noninfected child p 0001 and p 005 for ha and wa zscores respectively

processed_title: effect of preventive chemotherapy for neglected tropical disease in indonesia from 1992 to 2022 a systematic review and metaanalysis
