processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to describe the prevalence of lymphatic filariasis lf soiltransmitted helminthiasis sth and schistosomiasis sc in indonesia before and after pc implementation through a systematic review and metaanalysis method embase medline pubmed scopus web of science and google scholar were searched for article published between 1 january 1992 and 31 december 2022 reporting lf sth and sc in indonesia using the ministry of health list of district receiving pc program we identified whether data collection wa conducted before or after pc implementation in that particular district a metaanalysis wa performed with a randomeffects model applied to pool pre and postpc prevalence of lf sth and sc result overall 195 study were included the pooled prevalence of lf wa 972 95 ci 5561387 the prepc pooled prevalence of lf wa 1148 95 ci 5521745 the prevalence decreased after pc implementation and the pooled prevalence wa 712 95 ci 1791244 the overall prevalence of sth wa 3516 95 ci 30363996 the prepc prevalence of sth wa 3629 95 ci 30374220 the postpc prevalence of sth decreased at 3193 95 ci 24253962 although the difference between before and after pc wa not significant p 0379 only nine study investigated the prevalence of sc based on the randomeffects model the pooled prevalence wa 2190 95 ci 4883892 owing to the scarcity of study we could not perform the funnel test for publication bias and moderating variable of the pooled prevalence for sc conclusion the prevalence of lf and sth decreased after pc implementation although it wa not significant the difference for sc could not be assessed because of limited postpc data the uneven distribution of research and the lack of standardised sampling method may not fully capture the situation

processed_title: implementation of taenia solium control measure in bali indonesia survey finding and a historical overview
processed_abstract: historically cysticercosis case caused by infection with the larval stage of the taenia solium tapeworm have occurred sporadically in bali with taeniasis carrier found primarily in village located in the kubu subdistrict of karangasem a bali is a wellknown tourist destination living standard are relatively high on the island except for an area located beneath the northeast slope of the active volcano mt agung alt 3031 m which includes kubu over the last 30 year pig originating from this area have been found with t solium cysticerci whereas pig from other part of the island have not been shown to be infected out of 108 individual screened via fecal sample examination in kubu during 2019 3 case of t solium taeniasis 28 were identified there wa no significant difference in taeniasis prevalence from survey conducted in 20112016 10 111089 p 0123 out of 110 human and 140 pig tested serologically in kubu during 2019 no case of cysticercosis were identified this is in contrast to a seroprevalence of 41 421025 in human during 20112016 and a seroprevalence of 131 43329 in pig during 20112013 over the last decade improved drinking water and sanitary system have been employed in addition to health education targeting primary school child including emphasis on washing hand before eating and after defecation this review provides previously unpublished survey data and a historical overview of t solium infection in bali and offer guidance on best practice to ensure that remaining pocket of transmission are addressed

processed_title: intestinal permeability before and after albendazole treatment in low and high socioeconomic status schoolchildren in makassar indonesia
processed_abstract: intestinal helminth are highly prevalent in lowses child and could contribute to poor health outcome either directly or via alteration of the gut microbiome and gut barrier function we analysed parasitic infection and gut microbiota composition in 325 child attending high and lowses school in makassar indonesia before and after albendazole treatment lactulosemannitol ratio lmr a marker of gut permeability ifabp a surrogate marker of intestinal damage a well a inflammatory marker lbp were measured helminth infection were highly prevalent 656 in lowses child lmr and ifabp level were higher in lowses child geomean 95ci 403 367442 v 322 291357 p adj 0001 and 157 142174 v 125 113138 p adj 002 respectively while lbp level were lower compared to the highses 1939 17092201 v 2274 20072612 padj 001 albendazole reduced helminth infection in lowses and also decreased lmr with 11 reduction but only in helminthuninfected child estimated treatment effect 089 padj 001 following treatment ifabp decreased in high 091 padj 0001 but increased 112 padj 0004 in lowses child albendazole did not alter the level of lbp microbiota analysis showed no contribution from specific bacterialtaxa to the change observed intestinal permeability and epithelial damage are higher while peripheral blood inflammatory marker is lower in child of lowses in indonesia furthermore treatment decreased lmr in helminthuninfected only

processed_title: review and advance in diagnostic research on schistosoma japonicum
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis is an acute and chronic parasitic disease caused by blood fluke trematode worm of the genus schistosoma schistosoma japonicum s japonicum infection ha decreased significantly in prevalence and intensity of infection in china however this disease still remains a serious public health problem in some endemic area of the philippine and indonesia thus more accurate and sensitive method are much needed for further control of this disease here we review the research progress in technique for the diagnosis of s japonicum infection

processed_title: model validation for a knowledge and practice survey towards prevention of soiltransmitted helminth infection in rural village in indonesia
processed_abstract: the rate of soiltransmitted helminth sth infection is estimated to be around 20 in indonesia health promotion and health education are costeffective strategy to supplement sth prevention and control program existing study suggest that quantitative tool for knowledge attitude and practice kap are important to monitor effective communitybased sth intervention however evidence is limited regarding the applicability of such tool this study aim to identify the sociodemographic predictor for sthrelated knowledge and practice and validate the quantitative tool in population use a crosssectional study design wa conducted among resident of 16 village in central java indonesia adult and child respondent were interviewed to assess general knowledge and practice in relation to sth two mixed effect model identified the significant factor in predicting knowledge and practice score the model predicted knowledge and practice score were compared with the observed score to validate the quantitative measurement developed in this study participant sociodemographic variable were significant in predicting an individual sthrelated knowledge level and their hand washing and hygiene practice taking into account householdlevel variability model validation result confirmed that the quantitative measurement tool were suitable for assessing sth associated knowledge and behaviour the questionnaire developed in this study can be used to support school and communitybased health education intervention to maximize the effect of sth prevention and control program

processed_title: fit for school a schoolbased water sanitation and hygiene programme to improve child health result from a longitudinal study in cambodia indonesia and lao pdr
processed_abstract: background the fit for school fit programme integrates school health and water sanitation and hygiene intervention which are implemented by the ministry of education in four southeast asian country this paper describes the finding of a health outcome study which aimed to assess the twoyear effect of the fit programme on the parasitological weight and oral health status of child attending school implementing the programme in cambodia indonesia and lao pdr method the study wa a nonrandomized clustered controlled trial with a followup period of two year the intervention group consisted of child attending public elementary school implementing the fit programme including daily group handwashing with soap and toothbrushing with fluoride toothpaste biannual schoolbased deworming a well a construction of group handwashing facility control school implemented the regular government health education curriculum and biannual deworming per school a random selection of six to sevenyearold gradeone student wa drawn data on parasitological infection anthropometric measurement dental caries odontogenic infection and sociodemographic characteristic were collected at baseline and at followup 24 month later data were analysed using the chi2test mann whitney utest and multilevel logistic and linear regression result a total of 1847 child mean age 67 year range 6080 year participated in the baseline survey of these 1499 child were available for followup examination 478 486 and 535 child in cambodia indonesia and lao pdr respectively in all three country child in intervention school had a lower increment in the number of decayed missing and filled permanent teeth between baseline and followup in comparison to child in control school the preventive fraction wa 24 at average the prevalence of soiltransmitted helminth infection which wa unexpectedly low at baseline the prevalence of thinness and the prevalence of odontogenic infection did not significantly differ between baseline and followup nor between intervention and control school conclusion the study found that the fit programme significantly contributed to the prevention of dental caries in child this study describes the challenge learning and moreover the importance of conducting reallife implementation research to evaluate health programme to transform school setting into healthy learning environment for child the study is retrospectively registered with the german clinical trial register university of freiburg trial registration number drks00004485 date of registration 26th of february 2013

processed_title: origin of the pork tapeworm taenia solium in bali and papua indonesia
processed_abstract: global distribution of zoonotic pathogen have been strongly affected by the history of human dispersal and domestication of livestock the pork tapeworm taenia solium is distributed worldwide a the cause of neurocysticercosis one of the most serious neglected tropical disease t solium ha been reported in indonesia but only endemic to restricted area such a bali and papua previous study indicated the distinctiveness of a mitochondrial haplotype confirmed in papua but only one isolate ha been examined to date in this study genetic characterization of t solium and pig in bali and papua wa conducted to clarify the distributional history of the parasite mitochondrial haplotype network analysis clearly showed that indonesian t solium comprises a unique haplogroup which wa the first to diverge among asian genotype indicating it single origin and the fact that it wa not introduced in the recent past from other area in asia in which it is endemic although phylogenetic analysis based on the mitochondrial dloop revealed multiple origin of pig in bali and papua the majority of pig belonged to the pacific clade which is widely dispersed throughout the island southeast asia isea and oceania due to neolithic human dispersal given the result of our network analysis it is likely that the pacific clade pig played a key role in the dispersal of t solium the data suggest that t solium wa introduced from mainland asia into western indonesia including bali by modern human in the late pleistocene or in the early to middle holocene along with the pacific clade pig introduction into new guinea most likely occurred in the late holocene through the spread of pacific clade pig over time t solium ha been eradicated from most of indonesia through the middle to modern age owing to religious and cultural practice

processed_title: soiltransmitted helminth infection and taeniasis on samosir island indonesia
processed_abstract: soiltransmitted helminth sth infection are important cause of morbidity in poorer area of developing country with high endemicity in southeast asia human are most often exposed to the infective form of sth in area with substandard sanitation the number of sth infection globally wa estimated at 15 billion in 2018 in indonesia the prevalence of sth infection range from 25 to 620 sth and taeniasis infection were evaluated on samosir island north sumatra indonesia field survey were conducted in january 2003 february 2005 and february 2006 in simanindo subdistrict with a subsequent survey conducted in the subdistricts of simanindo and ronggurnihuta in september 2015 a total of 371 individual were screened between 2003 and 2006 and 368 were screened in 2015 314 from simanindo and 54 from ronggurnihuta fecal sample were collected and examined microscopically by the katokatz technique the prevalence of sth infection in simanindo for the year 2003 2005 2006 and 2015 wa 414 522 557 and 468 respectively the 2015 prevalence of sth infection in ronggurnihuta wa 667 taenia asiatica taeniasis prevalence wa 34 and 22 for the year 2003 and 2005 respectively with no case detected in 2006 or 2015 the prevalence of sth infection in simanindo and ronggurnihuta wa similar to other sth prevalence value reported for indonesia countrylevel value have not changed substantially from those reported in the 1980s and 1990s where prevalence ranged from 40 to 70 improvement of personal hygiene and environmental sanitation for control of sth infection on samosir island will require collaboration among multiple sector

processed_title: taenia solium cysticercosisthe lesson of history
processed_abstract: human taeniasis a well a porcine and human cysticercosiscaused by the pork tapeworm taenia soliumare ancient disease the fact that pig were considered impure in the ancient greece and that the koran prohibited the consumption of pork were likely related to the knowledge that cysticercosis may affect swine evidence suggests that human cysticercosis wa also present in the ancient egypt and rome during the renaissance the causative agent wa properly identified and human case were recognized confirmation that both taeniasis and cysticercosis were caused by the same parasite wa provided during the 19th century by german pathologist during the 20th century bout of human cysticercosis in nonendemic region left u valuable lesson on the mechanism of disease acquisition and spread these included a large series of neurocysticercosis case in the united kingdom that occurred after the return of troop stationed in india which demonstrated that symptom may occur year after infection the epidemic of cysticercosisrelated epilepsy in the ekari people of papua new guinea occurring after the gift of pig with cysticercosis received from indonesia demonstrating the fast establishment of endemic transmission and the impact of cysticercosis in epilepsy frequency and the occurrence of neurocysticercosis among member of an orthodox jewish community of new york city related to latin american taenia carrier working in their house highlighting the fact that cysticercosis transmission do not require the presence of infected pig these lesson of history have significantly contributed to our current knowledge on this disease

processed_title: helminthinduced ige and protection against allergic disorder
processed_abstract: the immune response against helminth and allergen is generally characterized by high level of ige and increased number of th2 cell eosinophil and mast cell yet the clinical outcome with respect to immediate hypersensitivity and inflammation is clearly not the same high level of ige are seen to allergen during helminth infection however these ige response do not translate into allergy symptom this chapter summarizes the evidence of the association between helminth infection and allergic disorder it discusses how helminth infection can lead to ige crossreactivity with allergen and how this ige ha poor biological activity this information is important for developing new diagnostic method and treatment for allergic disorder in lowtomiddleincome country

processed_title: schistosomiasis japonica control and research need
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis japonica a chronic and debilitating disease caused by the blood fluke schistosoma japonicum is still of considerable economic and public health concern in the people republic of china the philippine and indonesia despite major progress made over the past several decade with the control of schistosomiasis japonica in the aforementioned country the disease is emerging in some area we review the epidemiological status and transmission pattern of schistosomiasis japonica placing it into a historical context and discus experience and lesson with national control effort our analysis reveal that an integrated control approach implemented through intersectoral collaboration is essential to bring down the prevalence and intensity of schistosoma japonicum infection and diseaserelated morbidity and to sustain these parameter at low level the need for innovation and a sufficiently flexible control approach to adapt intervention in response to the changing nature and challenge of schistosomiasis control from the initial phase of morbidity control to the final state of elimination is emphasised the aim of the presentation and the analysis is to inspire researcher and disease control manager elsewhere in asia africa and the america to harness the experience gained and the lesson presented here to improve the control and eventual elimination of schistosomiasis and parasitic disease

processed_title: gastrointestinal helminth cestoda chabertiidae and heligmonellidae of pogonomys loriae and pogonomys macrourus rodentia muridae from papua indonesia and papua new guinea with the description of a new genus and two new specie
processed_abstract: piece of cestode not indentified further and 12 specie of nematode including 1 new genus 3 new specie and 7 putative new specie from the family chabertiidae and heligmonellidae were collected from the digestive tract of 16 pogonomys loriae and 19 p macrurous murinae hydromyini from papua indonesia and papua new guinea the chabertiid cyclodontostomum purvisi and the heligmonellid odilia mackerrasae have been described previously from endemic murids hasanuddinia pogonomyos n sp can be distinguished from it congener by the number of ridge in the synlophe length of spicule and having a vagina with a dorsal diverticulum odilia dividua n sp is larger than it congener ha a longer oesophagus relatively shorter spicule and larger egg pogonomystrongylus domaensis n gen n sp differs from all other genus in the heligmonellidae in the character of the synlophe 710 ridge oriented sub frontally with a single left ventral ridge hypertrophied specie richness of the nematode assemblage of p loriae and p macrourus are comparable to those of abeomelomys sevia chiruromys vates and coccymys rummleri when number of host examined are considered specie composition wa distinctive with 12 including the 7 putative specie of 14 specie presently known only from specie of pogonomys similarity between the nematode fauna of endemic rodent host from indonesia and papua new guinea were noted

processed_title: shadow puppet and neglected disease evaluating a health promotion performance in rural indonesia
processed_abstract: rama and the worm is a shadow puppet production targeting neglected disease in central java it is an entertainmentbased intervention study to promote health by reducing the impact of parasitic disease such a soiltransmitted helminth sth the study us traditional javanese shadow puppetry wayang kulit a a vehicle in village community to disseminate health message and promote behaviour change to prevent disease caused primarily by inadequate sanitation and poor hygiene the health education message contained in the play although using traditional character and theme required the creation of a completely new narrative script using character and plot line familiar to the wayang kulit repertoire but placing them in new situation that relate specifically to health promotion objective the intervention wa piloted in a village in central java indonesia using a prepost design with both qualitative and quantitative analysis a total of 96 male and female villager aged between 7 and 87 year provided both baseline and follow up data participant knowledge and behaviour related to gastrointestinal and helminthrelated disease were assessed before and after the intervention through a questionnaire administered by interview result revealed statistically significant improvement in both knowledge 486 preintervention score v 628 postintervention score p 0001 and behaviour 774 v 806 p 0004 related to gastrointestinal and helminth disease finding of the study indicate the wayang kulit performance is an effective health education tool the result provide proof of concept with scaling up the next step forward the wayang kulit production provides a significant additional component for an integrated comprehensive approach to reduction and elimination of sth infection

processed_title: mapping schistosomiasis risk in southeast asia a systematic review and geospatial analysis
processed_abstract: background schistosomiasis is a waterborne parasitic disease estimated to have infected 140 million people globally in 2019 mostly in subsaharan africa within the goal of eliminating schistosomiasis a a public health problem by 2030 in the world health organization who roadmap for neglected tropical disease other region can not be neglected empirical estimate of the disease burden in southeast asia largely remain unavailable method we undertook a systematic review to identify empirical survey data on schistosomiasis prevalence in southeast asia using the web of science sciencedirect pubmed and the global atlas of helminth infection from inception to 5 february 2021 we then conducted advanced bayesian geostatistical analysis to assess the geographical distribution of infection risk at a high spatial resolution 5 x 5 km using the prevalence number of infected individual and dos needed for preventive chemotherapy result we identified 494 schistosoma japonicum survey in the philippine and indonesia and 285 in cambodia and lao for s mekongi the latest estimate suggest that 225 95 credible interval cri 168285 thousand in the endemic area of southeast asian population were infected in 2018 the highest prevalence of schistosomiasis wa 386 95 cri 340431 in lao whereas the lowest wa 029 in cambodia 95 cri 022036 the estimated number of praziquantel dos needed per year wa 199 million 95 cri 192203 million for the entire population in endemic area of southeast asia conclusion the burden of schistosomiasis remains far from the who goal and our estimate highlighted area to target with strengthened intervention against schistosomiasis

processed_title: doe treatment of intestinal helminth infection influence malaria background and methodology of a longitudinal study of clinical parasitological and immunological parameter in nangapanda flores indonesia immunospin study
processed_abstract: background given that helminth infection are thought to have strong immunomodulatory activity the question whether helminth infection might affect response to malaria antigen need to be addressed different crosssectional study using diverse methodology have reported that helminth infection might either exacerbate or reduce the severity of malaria attack the same discrepancy have been reported for parasitemia methodsdesign to determine the effect of geohelminth infection and their treatment on malaria infection and disease outcome a well a on immunological parameter the area of nangapanda on flores island indonesia where malaria and helminth parasite are coendemic wa selected for a longitudinal study here a doubleblind randomized trial will be performed incorporating repeated treatment with albendazole 400 mg or placebo at three monthly interval household characteristic data anthropometry the presence of intestinal helminth and plasmodium spp infection and the incidence of malaria episode are recorded in vitro culture of whole blood stimulated with a number of antigen mitogen and toll like receptor ligand provide relevant immunological parameter at baseline and following 1 and 2 year of treatment round the primary outcome of the study is the prevalence of plasmodium falciparum and p vivax infection the secondary outcome will be incidence and severity of malaria episode detected via both passive and active followup the tertiary outcome is the inflammatory cytokine profile in response to parasite antigen the project also facilitates the transfer of state of the art methodology and technology molecular diagnosis of parasitic disease immunology and epidemiology from europe to indonesia discussion the study will provide data on the effect of helminth infection on malaria it will also give information on anthelminthic treatment efficacy and effectiveness and could help develop evidencebased policymaking trial registration this study wa approved by the ethical committee of faculty of medicine university of indonesia ref194pt02fketik2006 and ha been filed by ethic committee of the leiden university medical center clinical trial number isrctn83830814 the study is reported in accordance with the consort guideline for clusterrandomized study

processed_title: a longitudinal study of allergy and intestinal helminth infection in semi urban and rural area of flores indonesia immunospin study
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of asthma and atopic disease ha been reported to be low in low income country however helminth infection are likely to be high among these community the question of whether helminth infection play a role in allergic disease can best be addressed by intervention study none of the study so far have been based on a large scale placebocontrolled trial methoddesign this study wa designed to assess how intestinal helminth infection can influence the immune response and atopic and allergic disorder in child in indonesia the relation between allergic outcome and infection and lifestyle factor will be addressed this study wa set up among schoolage child in semi urban and rural area located in ende district of flores island indonesia a randomized placebocontrolled anthelmintic treatment trial to elucidate the impact of helminth infection on the prevalence of skin prick test spt reactivity and symptom of allergic disease will be performed the child living in these semiurban and rural area will be assessed for spt to allergen before and after 1 and 2 year of treatment a the primary outcome of the study the secondary outcome is symptom asthma and atopic dermatitis while the tertiary outcome is immune response both antibody level to allergen and cellular immune response discussion the study will provide information on the influence of helminth infection and anthelmintic treatment on immune response atopy and allergic disorder trial registration current controlled trial isrctn isrctn83830814

processed_title: the present situation of human taeniases and cysticercosis in asia
processed_abstract: three human taenia specie taenia solium taenia saginata and taenia asiatica are endemic in rural region of asia with these specie sympatrically distributed in part of thailand and china the pork tapeworm t solium is the most pathogenic to human causing cysticercosis and neurocysticercosis ncc due to it public health impact t solium taeniasiscysticercosis is one of 17 neglected tropical disease ntds prioritized by the world health organization in this review the current status of taeniasis and ncc in several asian country will be presented a will possible prevention and control strategy among the known t solium endemic area in asia bali indonesia is of high importance due to the risk of tourist becoming infected therefore special attention will be given to ongoing control initiative in bali

processed_title: soiltransmitted helminth infection anemia and malnutrition among preschoolage child in nangapanda subdistrict indonesia
processed_abstract: background soiltransmitted helminth sth infection are still prevalent in indonesia with roughly onethird of infected population being preschoolage child psc which are generally at higher risk of morbidity such a malnutrition and anemia this study aimed to investigate the association of sth infection with nutritional status and anemia among psc in nangapanda subdistrict ende east nusa tenggara method a crosssectional survey involving psc ranging from 12 to 59 month old from nangapanda subdistrict ende district east nusa tenggara wa performed sociodemographic breastfeeding and complementary feeding information wa obtained from structured questionnaire while nutritional and anemia status wa determined from anthropometry and hemoglobin measurement respectively anthropometric zscores were calculated based on the world health organization 2006 standard and stool sample were examined using katokatz method result a total of 393 psc randomly selected from 22 village were examined the prevalence of underweight stunting wasting and anemia were 331 402 171 and 603 respectively sth infection predominated by ascaris lumbricoides wa found in 160 588 psc single sth infection but not multiple infection wa independently associated with a lower risk of anemia odds ratio or 0320 95 confidence interval ci 01260809 p 0016 similar association with anemia wa also found on mild sth infection or 0318 95 ci 01140887 p 0029 on the other hand younger child were found to have a higher risk of anemia and stunting none of the examined variable were independently associated with underweight and wasting conclusion sth infection a well a anemia and malnutrition were prevalent in this region however in this study current sth infection seemed to have minimal negative impact on childrens nutritional status

processed_title: the gastrointestinal helminth of rattus niobe rodentia muridae with description of two new genus and three new specie nematoda from papua new guinea and papua indonesia
processed_abstract: cestode to be identified elsewhere the acanthocephalan moniliformis moniliformis and 15 specie of nematode including 2 new genus a new specie and 2 putative new specie from the family heligmonellidae and oxyuridae a well a juvenile and a putative heligmonellid that could not be fully identified were collected from the digestive tract of 34 rattus niobe muridae murinae rattini from papua indonesia and papua new guinea the ascaridid toxocara mackerrasae the chabertiid cyclodontostomum purvisi the heterakid heterakis sp the spirurids protospirura kaindiensis and p muricola the subulurid subulura andersoni and the trichurids eucoleus sp and trichuris muris have been reported previously from endemic rattus spp syphacia syphacia niobe n sp wa distinguished from it congener by a combination of character including a round cephalic plate the lack of cervical and lateral ala a longer male tail and an attenuated female tail nugininema titokis n gen n sp differs from all other genus in the heligmonellidae in the character of the synlophe 1017 ridge orientated subfrontally at mid body and 2 right ventral ridge hypertrophied anteriorly rodentanema aenigma n gen n sp differs from all other genus in the heligmonellidae in the character of the synlophe 67 ridge at mid body not symmetrical in relation to frontal axis specie richness of the nematode assemblage wa similar to that reported for rattus leucopus in papua new guinea with about 90 of possible specie found a indicated by bootstrap analysis specie composition included 6 specie unique to r niobe and 7 specie reported from at least one other specie of rattus indigenous to new guinea a well a juvenile worm probably ascaridids

processed_title: community perception and acceptability of mass drug administration for the control of neglected tropical disease in asiapacific country a systematic scoping review of qualitative research
processed_abstract: background preventative chemotherapy and mass drug administration have been identified a effective strategy for the prevention treatment control and elimination of several ntds in the asiapacific region qualitative research can provide indepth insight into the social dynamic and process underlying effective implementation of and adherence to mass drug administration program this scoping review examines published qualitative literature to examine factor influencing community perception and acceptability of mass drug administration approach to control ntds in the asiapacific region methodology twentyfour peer reviewed published paper reporting qualitative data from community member and stakeholder engaged in the implementation of mass drug administration program were identified a eligible for inclusion finding this systematic scoping review present available data from study focussing on lymphatic filariasis soiltransmitted helminth and scabies in eight national setting india indonesia philippine bangladesh lao american samoa papua new guinea fiji the review highlight the profoundly social nature of individual interpersonal and institutional influence on community perception of willingness to participate in mass drug administration program for control of neglected tropical disease ntd future ntd research and control effort would benefit from a stronger qualitative social science lens to mass drug administration implementation a commitment to understanding and addressing the social and structural determinant of ntds and ntd control in complex setting and effort to engage local community a equal partner and expert in the codesign of mass drug administration and other effort to prevent treat control and eliminate ntds conclusion for many country in the asiapacific region the low hanging fruit ha been picked in term of where mass drug administration ha worked and transmission ha been stopped the setting that remainsuch a remote area of fiji and papua new guinea or large highly populated multicultural urban setting in india and indonesiapresent huge challenge going forward

processed_title: reduce disease burden of human schistosomiasis in asia through biological control
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis is a chronic parasitic disease caused by a trematode blood fluke of the genus schistosoma that belongs to the schistosomatidae family it is a neglected disease in different region of asia in this review 218 article between 2000 and 2017 related to the topic were collected from pubmed and google scholar and reviewed after thoroughly reading collected article due to irrelevant topic requirement 94 article were excluded article that have data associated with asian region are considered in asia the disease is prevalent in china philippine indonesia yemen nepal and lao etc while in pakistan india and bangladesh the disease is not endemic and very few case were reported the disease wa eliminated from japan and iran the current review highlight the geographical distribution among asian country transmission pattern diagnosis control strategy based on the use of anthelmintic plant and management practice implemented in asia for the control of schistosomiasis however new implementation to treat schistosomiasis in human should be proved to eliminate the disease finally in the future this review emphasizes the biological control of schistosomiasis for the eradication of the disease from asia in the near future

processed_title: an open label randomized clinical trial to compare the tolerability and efficacy of ivermectin plus diethylcarbamazine and albendazole v diethylcarbamazine plus albendazole for treatment of brugian filariasis in indonesia
processed_abstract: improved treatment for lymphatic filariasis lf could accelerate the global elimination program for this disease a triple drug combination of the antifilarial drug ivermectin diethylcarbamazine dec and albendazole ida ha been shown to be safe and effective for achieving sustained clearance of microfilariae mf of the filarial parasite wuchereria bancrofti from human blood however the triple drug combination ha not been previously been evaluated for treatment of brugian filariasis which account for about 10 of the global lf burden this hospitalbased clinical trial compared the safety and efficacy of ida with that of the standard treatment dec plus albendazole da in person with brugia timori infection on sumba island indonesia fiftyfive asymptomatic person with b timori mf were treated with either a single oral dose of ida 28 subject or with dec plus albendazole da 27 subject participant were actively monitored for adverse event ae for two day after treatment by nurse and physician who were masked regarding treatment assignment passive monitoring wa performed by clinical team that visited participant home village for an additional five day microfilaremia wa assessed by membrane filtration of 1 ml night blood at baseline at 24h and one year after treatment ida wa more effective than da for completely clearing mf at 24 hour 2528 89 v 827 30 p 0001 by 12 month after treatment only one of 27 ida recipient had mf in their blood 4 v 10 of 25 40 in person treated with da p 0002 approximately 90 of participant had antibody to recombinant filarial antigen bmr1 at baseline antibody prevalence decreased to approximately 30 in both treatment group at 12 month about 45 of person in both treatment group experienced ae such a fever muscle ache lower back joint and abdominal pain these were mostly mild and most common during the first two day after treatment no participant experienced a severe or serious ae this study showed that ida wa welltolerated and significantly more effective for clearing b timori mf from the blood than da larger study should be performed to further assess the safety and efficacy of ida a a mass drug administration regimen to eliminate brugian filariasis trial registration nct02899936

processed_title: morphology of taenia asiatica simalungun indonesia
processed_abstract: background one of the method to identify taenia specie that infect human morphologically is microscopic examination of the gravid proglottid and the scolex by counting the number of uterine branch in a gravid proglottid the specie of taenia can be identified according to literature the number of uterine branch of proglottid varies between 11 31 and the scolex ha a rostelum and apical pit without hooklet objective the aim of this study wa to identify the morphology of scolex to see the presence of rostelum hooklet oral sucker and apical pit using sem method we investigated 19 gravid proglottids of t asiatica from simalungun district north sumatra province using dissecting microscope examination and one scolex using light microscope and scanning electron microscope sem result the finding showed that the number of uterine branch of the gravid proglottid wa 16 and neither rostelum nor apical pit in the scolex wa found however a curved shape at the apex of the scolex wa identified and named a snout conclusion the number of uterine branch of t asiatica that wa found in simalungun district north sumatra province wa 16 and the morphology of the scolex wa slightly different from that wa reported previously we suggest that the morphology of taenia asiatica should be further reviewed probably of the difference in morphology of taenia asiatica according to it endemic area

processed_title: prevalence of soiltransmitted helminth infection schistosomiasis and lymphatic filariasis before and after preventive chemotherapy initiation in the philippine a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective to estimate the impact of preventive chemotherapy on the prevalence and intensity of soiltransmitted helminth sth infection schistosomiasis and lymphatic filariasis in the philippine using systematic review and metaanalysis method we included report reporting prevalence of sth infection schistosomiasis or lymphatic filariasis in the philippine published until 31 march 2021 peerreviewed study were identified in electronic database grey literature report by the university of the philippine and the department of health were also included pooled infection prevalence before and after the initiation of preventive chemotherapy stratified by age group wa calculated using the inverse variance heterogeneity model finding a total of 109 report were included in the review and metaanalysis overall prevalence of moderateheavy intensity ascaris lumbricoides 66 and trichuris trichiura 27 infection after initiation of preventive chemotherapy were significantly lower than the prevalence prior to initiation 236 for a lumbricoides and 122 for t trichiura prevalence reduction were also found in school and preschoolage child for a lumbricoides and t trichiura study conducted after preventive chemotherapy initiation had significantly lower overall prevalence of moderateheavy intensity schistosomiasis 31 v 02 and of schistosomiasis in schoolage child 305 v 1 pooled prevalence of lymphatic filariasis prior to preventive chemotherapy initiation wa 32 across 12 province while currently only two province still have prevalence of more than 1 there were no published study reporting prevalence of lymphatic filariasis after initiation of preventive chemotherapy heterogeneity wa high with i2 mostly above 90 conclusion the burden of sth infection and schistosomiasis in child were significantly lower in study conducted following the initiation of preventive chemotherapy eliminating morbidity and interrupting transmission however may require expanded control initiative including communitywide treatment and improved water sanitation and hygiene lymphatic filariasis burden ha decreased since the implementation of preventive chemotherapy with all but two province having reached the elimination of lymphatic filariasis a a public health problem

processed_title: polyparasitism and it impact on the immune system
processed_abstract: parasitic infection are common in many tropical and subtropical region of the world and concomitant infection polyparasitism is the rule rather than the exception in such area at the immunological level different parasite induce quite different response characterised for example by protozoa that polarise response towards th1 whilst helminth are strong th2 and regulatory t cell inducer the question of how the coexistence of such parasite within the same host might influence the immunological response to each specie and more importantly whether such interaction affect resistance susceptibility or clinical outcome need to be addressed in welldesigned study of sufficient power the current paper discusses what we know a well a the gap in our knowledge of polyparasitism

processed_title: epidemiological survey of and research on soiltransmitted helminth in southeast asia a systematic review
processed_abstract: soiltransmitted helminth sth infection of human fall within the world health organization who grouping termed the neglected tropical disease ntds it is estimated that they affect approximately 14 billion people worldwide a significant proportion of these infection are in the population of southeast asia this review analysis published data on sth prevalence and intensity in southeast asia over the time period of 1900 to the present to describe age related pattern in these epidemiological measure this is with a focus on the four major parasite specie affecting human namely ascaris lumbricoides trichuris trichiura and the hookworm necator americanus and ancylostoma duodenale data were also collected on the diagnostic method used in the published survey and how the study were designed to facilitate comparative analysis of recorded pattern and change therein over time pubmed google scholar embase isi web of science cochrane database of systematic review and the global atlas of helminth infection search engine were used to identify study on sth in southeast asia with the search based on the major key word and variant on soiltransmitted helminth ascaris trichuris hookworm and the country name a total of 280 study satisfied the inclusion criterion from 11 southeast asian country brunei cambodia indonesia lao people democratic republic lao pdr malaysia myanmar philippine singapore thailand timorleste and vietnam it wa concluded that the epidemiological pattern of sth infection by age and specie mix in southeast asia are similar to those reported in other part of the world in the published study there were a large number of different diagnostic method used with differing sensitivity and specificity which make comparison of the result both within and between country difficult there is a clear requirement to standardise the method of both sth diagnosis in faecal material and how the intensity of infection is recorded and reported in future sth research and in monitoring and evaluation me of the impact of continuing and expanding mass drug administration mda programme

processed_title: schistosomiasis in indonesia past and present
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis is endemic in indonesia in two isolated area lindu valley and napu valley both located in the province of central sulawesi in 1940 a prevalence survey wa initiated in lake lindu which indicated a schistosoma japonicum infection prevalence of 56 among the population of anca tomado and langko village another survey wa conducted in 1973 in napu valley and very high infection prevalence of up to 72 were found among the population in winowanga village since then comprehensive study on the epidemiology and the effect of control have been carried out in 24 endemic village in both area over the past six decade schistosomiasis control ha been implemented and the average prevalence is now much lower than before the control programme wa launched in 2006 it wa 049 in 7 village in lindu valley in napu valley the average infection prevalence among the population of 17 village wa 108 in the same year again in 2006 the prevalence of infection in snail ranged from 0 to 134 and from 0 to 91 in napu and lindu valley respectively the highest prevalence among snail wa found in dodolo village the prevalence of s japonicum in the reservoir host rattus spp ranged from 0 to 20 and the highest prevalence wa again found in dodolo village contemporary data suggest that transmission of schistosomiasis is still ongoing in indonesia despite regular surveillance and control activity covering the whole endemic area

processed_title: what is asian taenia
processed_abstract: asian taenia is a human tapeworm which wa first recognized in taiwan aborigine and subsequently from asian country korea indonesia vietnam and china it wa originally described a t asiatica eom and rim 1993 based on the morphology in it adult and larval stage a taxonomic disagreement on whether it is specie or subspecies level is mainly due to the morphological similarity of this tapeworm with t saginata but a sympatric distribution of these two tapeworm is also known in china the life cycle is quite distinct from t saginata in using the pig a intermediate host and parasitizing visceral organ such a liver lung and omentum a long unresolved question in asian country concern the inconsistency between worm ratio and the food preference wa clarified with this viscerotropic tapeworm molecular biological differentiation is possible with dna technique and a complete genome of mtdna wa sequenced recently which may provide a resource for comparative mitochondrial genomics and systematic study of parasitic cestode this is a young parasite discovered most recently with many research question yet to be clarified

processed_title: the gastrointestinal nematode of paramelomys lorentzii and mammelomys spp rodentia muridae with description of a new genus and three new specie heligmonellidae from papua new guinea and indonesia
processed_abstract: unidentified cestode and 14 specie of nematode and larva that could not be placed to family level were collected from the digestive tract of 27 individual of paramelomys lorentzii four of mammelomys lanosus and a single m rattoides from papua new guinea and papua indonesia of these three were new specie hughjonestrongylus woolleyae sp nov can be distinguished from it congener in having up to 26 ridge in the synlophe and a dissymmetric dorsal ray parvinema bafunminensis gen nov sp nov can be distinguished from all other genus in the family by the combination of feature in the synlophe with a carene up to 17 ridge and the pattern of ridge size parvinema helgeni sp nov differs from p bafunminensis in the length of the spicule and the number of egg in the uterus the nematode assemblage of p lorentzii had similar specie richness to and wa also dominated by heligmonellids a that of paramelomys rubex although the two assemblage differed in specie composition

processed_title: the prevalence of human trichuriasis in asia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: trichuriasis is one of the most common soiltransmitted helminth sth infection affecting population globally the condition is particularly prevalent in tropical and subtropical area with low level of sanitation and poor living condition the objective of this systematic review and metaanalysis wa to evaluate the prevalence of trichuris trichiura infection in asia at the country and region level multiple databasesacademic search engine web of science pubmed proquest scopus and google scholar were searched for literature on t trichiura prevalence in asia published through january 2021 pooled prevalence wa determined using the metapackage in r version 361 out of 13836 article 226 study 5439500 individual from 26 country met the inclusion criterion of the 226 study 151 were communitybased study that included individual across the age spectrum while 75 study focused on school child typically in the 516 year age range the overall t trichiura pooled prevalence wa 153 95 ci 124191 with a pooled prevalence of 133 95 ci 100171 for the community study and 209 95 ci 147279 for the study only including school child for study including all age group individual in the 115 year age group had the highest pooled prevalence at 234 95 ci 17494 there wa a significant difference found in overall pooled prevalence by sex p 0001 and community type rural versus urban p 0001 although prevalence appears to be decreasing study finding suggest that t trichiura infection continues to be a public health problem in asia therefore control program focused on atrisk individual in endemic area are needed

processed_title: multidisciplinary integration of networking through the rna research on other target disease
processed_abstract: in 2005 the network decided to increase it number of target disease to include other helminthic zoonosis such a fascioliasis clonorchiasis opisthorchiasis paragonimiasis and cysticercosis and in the process expanding membership to include south korea vietnam thailand and japan ntds were eventually included a awareness is heightened on these disease affecting poor and developing country research on clonorchiasis and opisthorchiasis unravel the mechanism by which these disease eventually predispose to cholangiocarcinoma the liver cancer associated with these liver fluke infection necessitate the need to clarify the global burden of disease of these infection the magnitude of these liver fluke disease in endemic country like china vietnam lao cambodia and thailand is described success in elimination of lymphatic filariasis in pr china and cambodia is highlighted to show how intensified multisectoral collaboration and strong political become strong ingredient in elimination of parasitic disease like lf new advance are presented that clarify specie and strain difference in fasciola spp paragonimus spp taenia spp and echinococcocus spp conventional diagnostic technique are compared with new serologic technique that are being developed new control strategy such a the lawa model are presented

processed_title: taeniasis and cysticercosis in asia a review with emphasis on molecular approach and local lifestyle
processed_abstract: taeniasis is an important parasitic condition in asia especially since all three humaninfecting taenia spp taenia solium taenia saginata and taenia asiatica are found in this region these three specie are believed to be sympatrically distributed with the largest disease burden found in remote and rural area where people raise pig and cattle in a traditional manner recent study revealed that t asiatica and t saginata are geneticallyrelated sister specie that are not completely reproductively isolated from each other current evidence indicates that most t asiatica adult worm are hybridderived descendant moving forward nuclear dna analysis will be critical in further assessing the specie circulating locally lifestyle choice such a the consumption of undercooked meat are important in maintaining the life cycle of these parasite in addition poor hygiene and sanitation in highly endemic area make disease control difficult resulting in the need for sustainable education program an overview of the present situation of taeniasis and cysticercosis in asia is provided followed by a discussion of molecular approach to specie assessment and the impact of human lifestyle on parasite transmission

processed_title: treatment of brugia timori and wuchereria bancrofti infection in indonesia using dec or a combination of dec and albendazole adverse reaction and shortterm effect on microfilariae
processed_abstract: filariasis caused by brugia timori and wuchereria bancrofti is an important public health problem on alor island east nusa tenggara indonesia to implement a control programme adverse reaction and shortterm effect on the microfilaria mf density were studied following a divided dose of diethylcarbamazine dec 6 mgkg body weight 100 mg on day 1 and the rest on day 3 or a single dose of dec 6 mgkg body weight on day 3 and albendazole alb 400 mg in order to define the most appropriate regimen 30 person infected with b timori were treated in the hospital and result were compared with those obtained from the treatment of 27 person infected with w bancrofti adverse reaction consisted of systemic reaction such a fever headache myalgia itching and local reaction such a adenolymphangitis fever experienced by a number of patient in both treatment group generally occurred 1224 h after drug administration and lasted up to 2 day adenolymphangitis tended to occur later and wa resolved within 4 day the number of w bancrofti patient suffering from adverse reaction wa lower and the reaction were milder than those of the b timori patient there wa no difference in adverse reaction between dec alone and decalb treatment for either infection the geometric mean mf count decreased on day 7 in the b timori infected patient from 234 mfml in the dec group and from 257 mfml in the decalb group to 7 and 8 mfml respectively the mf density of the w bancrofti infected patient decreased on day 7 from 214 mfml in the dec group and from 559 mfml in the decalb group to 15 and 14 mfml respectively our data indicate that the microfilaricidal effect of the drug is achieved more rapidly for b timori which is associated with more adverse reaction than w bancrofti in addition 111 b timori infected person were treated in the community with decalb in one selected village the adverse reaction and the reduction of mf density wa similar to the finding of the hospitalbased study in this group there wa a strong correlation of mf density with the frequency and severity of adverse reaction the addition of alb resulted in no additional adverse reaction compared with dec treatment alone and can also be used for the treatment of b timori infection in indonesia where the prevalence of intestinal helminth is high the use of a combination of dec and alb to control lymphatic filariasis may also have impact on the control of intestinal helminth

processed_title: differential human gut microbiome assemblage during soiltransmitted helminth infection in indonesia and liberia
processed_abstract: background the human intestine and it microbiota is the most common infection site for soiltransmitted helminth sth which affect the wellbeing of 15 billion people worldwide the complex crosskingdom interaction are not well understood result a crosssectional analysis identified conserved microbial signature positively or negatively associated with sth infection across liberia and indonesia and longitudinal sample analysis from a doubleblind randomized trial showed that the gut microbiota responds to deworming but doe not transition closer to the uninfected state the microbiomes of individual able to selfclear the infection had more alike microbiome assemblage compared to individual who remained infected one bacterial taxon lachnospiracae wa negatively associated with infection in both country and 12 bacterial taxon were significantly associated with sth infection in both country including olsenella associated with reduced gut inflammation which also significantly reduced in abundance following clearance of infection microbial community gene abundance were also affected by deworming functional category identified a associated with sth infection included arachidonic acid metabolism arachidonic acid is the precursor for proinflammatory leukotrienes that threaten helminth survival and our finding suggest that some modulation of arachidonic acid activity in the sthinfected gut may occur through the increase of arachidonic acid metabolizing bacteria conclusion for the first time we identify specific member of the gut microbiome that discriminate between moderatelyheavily sthinfected and noninfected state across very diverse geographical region using two different statistical method we also identify microbiomeencoded biological function associated with the sth infection which are associated potentially with sth survival strategy and change in the host environment these result provide a novel insight of the crosskingdom interaction in the human gut ecosystem by unlocking the microbiome assemblage at taxonomic genetic and functional level so that advance towards key mechanistic study can be made

processed_title: current status of schistosomiasis in indonesia
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis japonica is currently endemic in three very isolated area in central sulawesi province indonesia integrated schistosomiasis control programme implemented in the lindu and napu valley during the period of 19822005 have successfully reduced the prevalence of schistosomiasis from 37 to 1 in napu valley and from 37 to 06 in lindu valley human prevalence survey reveal that the prevalence tended to increase during the period of 20082011 the average prevalence fluctuated between 03 and 48 in napu valley and between 08 and 32 in lindu valley during this period the percentage of rat that were infected fluctuated between 79 and 182 in napu valley and between 67 and 98 in lindu valley the average percentage of infected snail wa 26 and 21 in the napu and lindu valley respectively in 2008 schistosomiasis wa also found in a separate but adjacent place ie bada valley the prevalence of schistosomiasis in endemic village in this area wa 08 in 2008 and 59 in 2010 while the percentage of infected snail wa 1 in 2010 these contemporary data clearly indicate a trend of increasing schistosomiasis prevalence in the three endemic area in central sulawesi

processed_title: current status of schistosomiasis control and prospect for elimination in the dongting lake region of the people republic of china
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis japonica is an ancient parasitic disease that ha severely impacted human health causing a substantial disease burden not only to the chinese people but also resident of other country such a the philippine indonesia and before the 1970s japan since the founding of the new people republic of china p r china effective control strategy have been implemented with the result that the prevalence of schistosomiasis japonica ha decreased markedly in the past 70 year historically the dongting lake region in hunan province is recognised a one of the most highly endemic for schistosomiasis in the pr china the area is characterized by vast marshland outside the lake embankment and until recently the presence of large number of domestic animal such a bovine goat and sheep that can act a reservoir host for schistosoma japonicum considerable social economic and environmental change have expanded the oncomelania hupensis hupensis intermediate snail host area in the dongting lake region increasing the potential for both the emergence of new hot spot for schistosomiasis transmission and for it reemergence in area where infection is currently under control in this paper we review the history the current endemic status of schistosomiasis and the control strategy in operation in the dongting lake region we also explore epidemiological factor contributing to s japonicum transmission and highlight key research finding from study undertaken on schistosomiasis mainly in hunan but also other endemic chinese province over the past 10 year we also consider the implication of these research finding on current and future approach that can lead to the sustainable integrated control and final elimination of schistosomiasis from the p r china and other country in the region where this unyielding disease persists

processed_title: current status of the efficacy and effectiveness of albendazole and mebendazole for the treatment of ascaris lumbricoides in northwestern indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to investigate the efficacy and effectiveness of albendazole and mebendazole in the treatment of ascaris lumbricoides a lumbricoides in the northwestern indonesia method 229 primary school child who were positive for a lumbricoides in their stool were recruited in the study 123 child received singledose of 400 mg albendazole and 106 child received singledose 500 mg of mebendazole after 1 week their stool were examined for the cure rate cr and egg reduction rate err egg culture wa also performed and observation wa made on week1 3 4 result have shown a nonsignificant difference in cr 967vs 100 and err of 993vs 1000 for albendazole and mebendazole group respectively p005 invitro egg culture ha shown trend of decrease in the percentage of the unfertilized egg and in 2 cell egg in both treatment group p005 the embryonated egg from the albendazole group ha shown an increase from 73 on week1 to 138 on week4 whilst the mebendazole group ha shown a constant increase during the whole 4 week of culture from 75 to 283 p001 conclusion no evidence of drug resistance is noted so far from the area of northwestern part of indonesia in addition although both drug showed incomplete ovicidal effect singledose albendazole is better than mebendazole in sterilizing a lumbricoides egg

processed_title: geographical distribution of taenia asiatica and related specie
processed_abstract: geographical information of taenia asiatica is reviewed together with that of t solium and t saginata current distribution of t asiatica wa found to be mostly from asian country the republic of korea china taiwan indonesia and thailand molecular genotypic technique have found out more country with t asiatica from japan the philippine and vietnam specimen used in this paper were collected from around the world and mostly during international collaboration project of korean foundation for parasite control activity 19952009 in developing country

processed_title: distribution and prevalence of taenia hydatigena taenia multiceps and mesocestoides spp in mongolian sheepdog
processed_abstract: gastrointestinal parasite infection in livestock and companion animal in mongolia have not been investigated sufficiently this study aimed to determine the prevalence of cyclophyllid cestode taeniidae and mesocestoididae in mongolian sheepdog using coprodna analysis sheepdog fecal sample n 1242 were collected from five ecological zone mountain taiga foreststeppe steppe desertsteppe and desert and four geographical region western khangai central and eastern within 20 of the country 21 province among the 1242 sample 201 162 tested positive for mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase subunit 1 cox1 and ribosomal 12 rrna encoding gene of cyclophyllid cestode prevalence in the mountain taiga foreststeppe steppe desertsteppe and desert zone wa 292 154 151 201 and 91 respectively prevalence in the western khangai central and eastern region wa 199 186 121 and 128 respectively taenia hydatigena taenia multiceps and two mesocestoides specie mesocestoides sp1 and mesocestoides sp2 were identified t hydatigena wa found in the sample from all 20 province all five zone and four region while t multiceps wa detected in the sample from 19 province all five zone and four region mesocestoides sp1 infection wa detected in the sample from all zone except desert and region it wa detected in 14 province mesocestoides sp2 infection wa detected in the sample from all zone except mountain taiga and region and found in seven province cyclophyllidea infection in sheepdog is highly prevalent across mongolia representing a zoonotic risk implementation of a surveillance program for sheepdog and their owner and the wild animal in all ecological zone should be considered in addition control measure including public awareness campaign especially for sheepdog owner and periodic deworming of sheepdog are warranted

processed_title: taeniasiscysticercosis in papua irian jaya indonesia
processed_abstract: report showed that an important parasitic zoonotic disease caused by taenia solium taenia saginata and taenia asiatica is found endemic in several area of indonesia including papua bali and north sumatra at present it is known that the highest prevalence of taeniasiscysticercosis in indonesia caused by t solium is among the indigenous community in papua formerly irian jaya in the early 1970s 89 of stool sample from the enarotali hospital paniai district irian jaya were found positive with taenia egg the sample were from member of the ekari kapauku ethnic group stool sample from the moni ethnic group living east of surrounding lake were egg negative cysticerci of t solium were discovered in pig during the year 19731976 case of burn increased and were ultimately found to be primarily associated with epileptic seizure induced by neurocysticercosis case among 257 case of burn 88 case 628 were suffering from epileptic seizure before or during hospitalization in the year 1981 t solium seropositive person were mostly 16 found in the endemic obano village in 1997 the parasite wa discovered in jayawijaya district which is located approximately 250 km east of paniai district during 19911995 a local health center in assologaima jayawijaya district reported 1120 new case with burn and a further 293 new case of epileptic seizure among 15939 inhabitant the histopathologic appearance and mitochondrial dna analysis found the cyst to be similar to those of t solium from other region of the world sensitive and specific serological diagnostic method were used and improved cysticerci were detected in dog a well a in pig a coproantigen test for detection of adult tapeworm in patient wa carried out medical treatment with praziquantel for taeniasis and albendazole for cysticercosis with prednisone and sodium phenytoin treatment in case with neurocysticercosis wa undertaken lifestyle religion and socioeconomic aspect are important issue in the perpetuation and enhancing the endemicity of t solium taeniasis and cysticercosis in papua indonesia

processed_title: effect of anthelmintic treatment on serum free igf1 and igfbp3 a clusterrandomizedcontrolled trial in indonesia
processed_abstract: in child soiltransmitted helminth infection have been linked to poor nutritional status and growth retardation in association with lower level of igf1 in adult igf1 ha an anabolic and metabolic function and is related to nutritional status here we assessed the impact of helminth infection on free igf1 and it major binding protein igfbp3 in adult the level of igf1 and igfbp3 were measured in 1669 subject aged 16 year before and after receiving four round of albendazole 400 mgday or matching placebo for three consecutive day helminth infection status wa assessed by microscopy katokatz and pcr serum free igf1 level wa significantly lower in helminthinfected subject mean difference and 95 ci 0068 0103 0033 p 0001 after adjustment for age sex body mass index and fasting insulin level there wa no difference in igfbp3 level between helminth infected versus noninfected subject in the whole study population albendazole treatment significantly increased serum free igf1 level estimate and 95 ci 0031 0004 0057 p 0024 whereas no effect wa found on the igfbp3 level our study showed that helminth infection in adult is associated with lower free igf1 level but not with igfbp3 and albendazole treatment significantly increase free igf1 level in the study populationclinical trial registration httpswwwisrctncomisrctn75636394

processed_title: genetic characterization of strongyloides spp from captive semicaptive and wild bornean orangutan pongo pygmaeus in central and east kalimantan borneo indonesia
processed_abstract: orangutan pongo spp asia only great ape are threatened in their survival due to habitat loss hunting and infection nematode of the genus strongyloides may represent a severe cause of death in wild and captive individual in order to better understand which strongyloides speciessubspecies infect orangutan under different condition larva were isolated from fecal material collected in indonesia from 9 captive 2 semicaptive and 9 wild individual 18 captive group of bornean orangutan and from 1 human working with wild orangutan genotyping wa done at the genomic rdna locus part of the 18 rrna gene and internal transcribed spacer 1 its1 by sequencing amplicons thirty isolates including the one from the human could be identified a s fuelleborni fuelleborni with 18 rrna gene identity of 985100 with a corresponding published sequence the its1 sequence could be determined for 17 of these isolates revealing a huge variability and 2 main cluster without obvious pattern with regard to attribute of the host the its1 amplicons of 2 isolates were cloned and sequenced revealing considerable variability indicative of mixed infection one isolate from a captive individual wa identified a s stercoralis 18 rrna and showed 99 identity its1 with s stercoralis sequence from geographically distinct location and host specie the finding are significant with regard to the zoonotic nature of these parasite and might contribute to the conservation of remaining orangutan population

processed_title: prevalence and distribution of intestinal parasitic infection in taeniasis endemic area of north sumatera indonesia
processed_abstract: a group of helminthic and intestinal protozoa cause intestinal parasitic infection ipis affecting more than 25 billion people worldwide ipis are disease closely associated with poor hygiene and sanitation concentrated in underdeveloped region and among population with low socioeconomic status consequently most prevalence is in subsaharan africa and asia with local habit or risk factor that could affect it prevalence the aim of this study wa to determine how hygienic practice sanitation and local behavior of eating raw meat hinasumba contributed to the prevalence of ipi a crosssectional study wa conducted in the simalungun district of north sumatera province involving 428 people of batak simalungun there were 15 village randomly selected across the district based on the local registry which consequently nonpurposive sampling wa conducted facetoface interview assessed various risk factor such a demographic characteristic water source traditional raw meat consumption or hinasumba a local risk factor hygienic practice and sanitation the finding indicated that an overall prevalence rate of ipi wa 429 consisting of 875 with helminthic infection and 125 with protozoal infection more than half of ipi case were associated with taenia sp infection 218 followed by hookworm infection with a 61 positivity rate based on multivariate analysis farming and consuming traditional delicacy namely hinasumba increased the likelihood of ipi occurrence among the population by 17 and 3 time respectively it can be concluded that the high prevalence of taeniasis in the study area wa associated with local behavior and hinasumba consumption which may contribute to determining the dominance of specific ipi specie

processed_title: epidemiology and genetic diversity of taenia asiatica a systematic review
processed_abstract: taenia asiatica ha made a remarkable journey through the scientific literature of the past 50 year starting with the paradoxical observation of high prevalence of t saginatalike tapeworm in nonbeef consuming population to the full description of it mitochondrial genome experimental study conducted in the 1980s and 1990s have made it clear that the life cycle of t asiatica is comparable to that of t saginata except for pig being the preferential intermediate host and liver the preferential location of the cyst whether or not t asiatica can cause human cysticercosis a is the case for taenia solium remains unclear given the specific condition needed to complete it life cycle in particular the consumption of raw or poorly cooked pig liver the transmission of t asiatica show an important ethnogeographical association so far t asiatica ha been identified in taiwan south korea indonesia the philippine thailand southcentral china vietnam japan and nepal especially this last observation indicates that it distribution is not restricted to southeastasia a wa thought so far indeed the molecular tool developed over the last 20 year have made it increasingly possible to differentiate t asiatica from other taeniids such tool also indicated that t asiatica is related more closely to t saginata than to t solium feeding the debate on it taxonomic status a a separate specie versus a subspecies of t saginata furthermore the genetic diversity within t asiatica appears to be very minimal indicating that this parasite may be on the verge of extinction however recent study have identified potential hybrid between t asiatica and t saginata reopening the debate on the genetic diversity of t asiatica and it status a a separate specie

processed_title: immunolocalization and functional analysis of opisthorchis viverrinim60like1 metallopeptidase in animal model
processed_abstract: host mucin have crucial physical role in preventing the parasitic establishment and maturation and also in expelling the invading parasite however some parasite utilize mucinase enzyme to facilitate the infection recently we have identified a mucinase enzyme of the liver fluke opisthorchis viverrini ovm60like1 which exhibit metallopeptidase activity against bovine submaxillary mucin substrate here we aimed to study the localization of this enzyme in o viverrini and the bile duct of hamster using immunohistochemistry and functional analysis by mucin digestion in hamster and mouse tissue the result showed that ovm60like1 wa detected strongly in the tegument tegumental cell vitelline gland and mature egg with miracidium expression in the gut ovary and testis of the parasite wa moderate while parenchyma showed slight colour intensity in addition the mucinase wa also detected in the host biliary epithelial cell and goblet cell surrounding the worm the mucinase assay revealed that the ovm60like1 could digest neutral mucin in the parenchyma testis and seminal receptacle but not the mucin in the tegument tegumental cell and vitelline gland of the worm the enzyme can also digest mucin in the cholangiocytes and modified the mixture type in the bile duct goblet cell of the infected hamster a susceptible host in contrast the enzyme wa unable to digest neutral acid and mixture mucin in the bile duct of the mouse a nonsusceptible host these finding indicate that ovm60like1 may have function in both housekeeping task and hostparasite interaction especially in modification of host susceptibility

processed_title: filariases
processed_abstract: it is apparent that there are many similarity among the various filariae besides a common life cycle with an arthropod vector and human host there are similarity in the disease that they produce this clinical picture take one of two main course 1 characteristic disease produced by the presence of adult nematode in their target tissue which distinguishes typical case for each of the filariae and 2 the systemic hypersensitivity reaction to the circulating microfilaria which tend to be similar the characteristic feature of wuchereria bancrofti is genital disease with funiculitis and hydrocele and less often elephantiasis for brugia malayi it is elephantiasis of the distal leg or arm usually leaving the knee or elbow uninvolved with normal contour brugia timori restricted to just a few island of indonesia produce elephantiasis similar to that of brugia malayi but with it characteristic descending lymphadenitis loa loa is best known for the calabar swelling or angioedema that it produce although other filariae can induce similar reaction both loa loa and dirofilaria tenuis cause macroscopic subconjunctival eyeworms clinical disease from onchocerciasis take four predominant form eye disease lymphadenitis subcutaneous nodule onchocercomata and a pruritic hypopigmented or hyperpigmented papular dermatitis

processed_title: elimination of lymphatic filariasis in southeast asia
processed_abstract: approximately 15 million people with lymphatic filariasis lf live in southeast asia wuchereria bancrofti transmitted by the mansonia and anopheles vector brugia malayi and brugia timori both transmitted by culex quinquefasciatus are the filarial specie in this region the endemic country are cambodia lao people democratic republic the philippine indonesia thailand and timorleste which have all agreed to eliminate transmission of the disease by 2020 the public health intervention with respect to lf are based on the 1997 world health assembly resolution wha 5029 which recommends elimination of the disease through mass drug administration mda using diethylcarbamazine dec and albendazole the drug are generally donated and a government contribute 6090 of the operational cost mda is deemed to be comparatively inexpensive for local administration in relation to other public health programme so far elimination ha been accomplished only in the people republic of china pr china and this achievement is therefore described here in some detail resurgence have occurred but they have been successfully dealt with historically the endemic area in pr china covered 16514 township or urban subdistricts situated in 864 county or city in 14 province or autonomous region or municipality the total population at risk of infection in all endemic area of pr china wa originally 342 million

processed_title: challenge for control of taeniasiscysticercosis in indonesia
processed_abstract: taeniasiscysticercosis ha been reported from several province of indonesia papua former irian jaya bali north sumatra east nusa tenggara south east sulawesi lampung north sulawesi
