jakarta west kalimantan and east java the highest level of endemicity of taeniasiscysticercosis ha been found in papua recent survey in jayawijaya district of papua in 2000 and 2001 showed that 5 of 58 local people 86 harbored the adult tapeworm taenia solium whereas 44 of 96 people 458 50 of 71 pig 704 and 7 of 64 local dog 109 were seropositive for t solium cysticercosis current survey in bali and samosir district north sumatra during 20022005 revealed that taenia saginata taeniasis ha increased in incidence whereas t solium cysticercosis is now rather rare compared to onetwo decade ago in bali taenia asiatica taeniasis is still common in samosir district data from other province of indonesia are very limited or unavailable control of these disease is not a priority in the health or veterinary service neither at central or local government level however limited effort toward control of the disease have been implemented such a training of health personnel community education on disease prevention and provision of anthelminthic a working group for control of the disease in indonesia and an international collaboration have been established among ministry of health indonesia university of indonesia and asahikawa medical college asahikawa japan since 1996 future goal include implementation of active case finding active surveillance and treatment of tapeworm carrier sustainable public health education establishment of a system to check the quality of beefpork and determine the distribution of infected animal and strengthening of laboratory capacity effort to motivate province and district should be implemented in developing the strategic plan to control of the disease given the considerable difference in culture religion level of education socioeconomic level daily habit and behaviour etc control programme must be adapted to the local situation

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor associated with zoonotic gastrointestinal helminth transmitted by cat in jabodetabek indonesia
processed_abstract: background intestinal helminth infection in cat are often neglected major zoonosis spread from pet to human worldwide aim this study evaluated the prevalence and identified risk factor associated with zoonotic gastrointestinal helminth infection in different cat population in the most populous megapolitan area of indonesia jakarta bogor depok tangerang and bekasi jabodetabek method fecal sample from the shelter stray and household owned cat were analyzed using sugar flotation technique intestinal helminth egg were detected microscopically based on structural and morphometric characteristic risk factor for the occurrence of helminth infection were identified through statistical analysis of cat ownership breed migrant status management practice caging feed type and deworming medication used human case of worm larva infestation identified during the interview were reported result analysis of 354 fecal sample revealed that 379 134354 of examined cat were infected with toxocara sp 226 80354 with ancylostoma sp 254 90354 with uncinaria sp 31 11354 with strongyloides sp 2 7354 with diphyllobothrium sp and 06 2354 with dipylidium sp infection with roundworm and hookworm wa associated with a variety of factor including introduction of new animal management practice cage cleanliness feed type use of deworming medication routine deworming and contact with other animal a human case of cutaneous larva migrans wa due to hookworm ancylostoma spuncinaria sp infection conclusion the prevalence of important zoonotic gastrointestinal nematode hookworm and roundworm is high in cat in jabodetabek indonesia to reduce the risk of transmission to other animal or human adequate measure to control manage and prevent zoonotic helminth infection are required this study present important baseline information that provides a basis for future epidemiologic study and the development of strategy to manage zoonotic gastrointestinal helminth in cat in the region

processed_title: occurrence and molecular identification of anisakis dujardin 1845 from marine fish in southern makassar strait indonesia
processed_abstract: anisakis spp nematoda anisakidae parasitize a wide range of marine animal mammal serving a the definitive host and different fish specie a intermediate or paratenic host in this study 18 fish specie were investigated for anisakis infection katsuwonus pelamis euthynnus affinis caranx sp and auxis thazard were infected with high prevalence of anisakis type i while cephalopholis cyanostigma and rastrelliger kanagurta revealed low prevalence the mean intensity of anisakis larva in k pelamis and a thazard wa 497 and 56 respectively a total of 73 anisakis type i larva collected from k pelamis and a thazard were all identified a anisakis typica by pcrrflp analysis five specimen of anisakis from k pelamis and 15 specimen from a thazard were sequenced using its158sits2 region and 6 specimen from a thazard and 4 specimen from k pelamis were sequenced in mtdna cox2 region alignment of the sample in the it region showed 2 pattern of nucleotide the first pattern genotype of anisakis from a thazard had 100 similarity with adult a typica from dolphin from usa whereas the second genotype from a thazard and k pelamis had 4 base pair different in its1 region with adult a typica from usa in the mtdna cox2 region anisakis type i specimen from a thazard and k pelamis showed similarity range from 94 to 99 with a typica ab517571dq116427 the difference of 4 bp nucleotide in its1 region and divergence into 2 subgroup in mtdna cox2 indicating the existence of a typica sibling specie in the makassar strait

processed_title: towards the international collaboration for detection surveillance and control of taeniasis cysticercosis and echinococcosis in asia and the pacific
processed_abstract: both cysticercosis and echinococcosis are potentially among the most serious helminth zoonosis threatening human health worldwide however due to the lack of reliable tool for confirmation or identification of patient or infected animal epidemiological data are expected to be underestimated conversely sometimes such data are over estimated due to the lack of specificity the most important issue for doing field survey is that they use evidence based science in this communication advanced immunological and molecular tool for detection of individual infected with either metacestodes or adult tapeworm are briefly overviewed and the application of such tool for epidemiological survey in indonesia china and other country are introduced a immunological tool are based on antigenantibody response there may exist some crossreactions therefore immunodiagnostic tool are expected to be useful for primary screening and should be combined with confirmation of direct parasitological evidence morphology or dna and imaging technique for cyst a a risk factor for human cysticercosis is the presence of tapeworm carrier detection of taeniasis case and differentiation of the three human taenia specie taenia solium t saginata and t asiatica in asia and the pacific requires consideration similarly in northwest china echinococcus granulosus and e multilocularis are coendemic and differentiation of these specie is required in human and definitive host it is stressed that combination of several tool for identification of the parasite and for confirmation of disease is important for obtaining highly reliable data before consideration of control of these zoonosis recent project coordinated by asahikawa medical college have concentrated on immunological and molecular diagnostic technique transferable to colleague from endemic region of asia and the pacific and on organization of two international symposium to establish a platform for further collaboration in the future

processed_title: human tapeworm from simalungun indonesia
processed_abstract: a 46yearsold man from indonesia resides in nagori dolok village silau kahaean subdistrict simalungun district sumatra utara province had of spontaneous discharge of tapeworm segment proglottids from anus almost every day for ten year there were 15 segment which can move actively discharge per day although he feel embarrassed about the condition no significant symptom were found and physical examination wa within normal limit clinical diagnosis of taeniasis wa made on october 20 2017 and subsequently received oral praziquantel 600 mg tablet single dose and 5 mg of oral bisacodyl four hour later the patient wa defecated the stool wa collected in plastic and filtered with a filter device to collect any tapeworm segmentsa full segment of tapeworm a long a 286 meter were found microscopic examination wa done to identify the egg worm proglottids and scolex dye substance wa injected into a mature gravid proglottid through the genital pore and pressed in two objectglasses to identify the reproductive organ microscopic examination 400x magnification of this sample revealed that the number of uterine branch and testis in a proglottid were 16 pair the number of uterine branch in t solium are 812 pair and t saginata are 1832 pairsthe filtered stool wa moved into a container and carefully observed a soft yellowishwhite material of 15 mm in diameter wa found which turned out to be the head of the tapeworm called scolex microscopic examination of scolex revealed that the rostellum wa absent a segment called snout wa found at the apex the function were probably a a sense of smell and vacuum organthe patient wa lived in simalungun north sumatera some tribe in that area ha a long tradition of culinary called hinasumba consist of raw pork liver and meat and naiholat consist of poorly cooked porkeven though pig wa determined a an intermediate host the type of tapeworm wa not consistent with tsolium the patient had the long history of infection but never had sign or symptom of neurocystecercosis based on etnogeographical condition the patient wa infected by tasiatica microscopic examination of the uterus and scolex indicate that the tapeworm had most similarity to tasiaticaamin et al8 from bangladesh in 2009 reported a case of t asiatica in human with total strobila length wa 15 meter macroscopic morphology lengthwidth of gravid proglottid segment of tsaginata is 31 t solium 151 the tapeworm that we discovered had 1151 ratio 25 cm length and 2 cm widthsome feature of the tapeworm no rostellum present of the snout and fix number of theuterus in every proglottid were not found in three existing type of taenia specie further microscopic and molecular study should be done to determined type or subtype of the tapeworm a case of taeniasis asiatica who had completed treatment wa reported macroscopic and microscopic wa done to support the clinical diagnosis

processed_title: comparison of the impact of annual and semiannual mass drug administration on lymphatic filariasis prevalence in flores island indonesia
processed_abstract: we compared the impact of annual and semiannual mass drug administration mda on the prevalence of brugia timori and wuchereria bancrofti in flores island two village paga b timori only lewomada coendemic received annual mda with diethylcarbamazinealbendazole and a larger village pruda coendemic received semiannual mda infection parameter microfilariae mf antibody to recombinant filarial antigen bmr1 brugia rapid br and a test for w bancrofti antigenemia immunochromatographic test ict were assessed before and after treatment the crude mf prevalence in pruda decreased after five semiannual treatment from 142 to 12 whereas the mf prevalence in the other two village decreased after three annual treatment from 39 to 0 and from 5 to 03 respectively ict positivity prevalence in pruda and lewomada decreased from 229 and 65 to 7 and 08 respectively whereas br antibody prevalence in pruda lewomada and paga decreased from 289 317 and 125 to 36 41 and 18 respectively logistic regression analysis indicated that that mf br and ict prevalence decreased significantly over time and that for the mf and ict outcome the semiannual treatment had higher odds of positivity modeladjusted prevalence estimate revealed that apparent difference in treatment effectiveness were driven by difference in baseline prevalence and that adjusted prevalence declined more rapidly in the semiannual treatment group we conclude that in this setting annual mda wa sufficient to reduce mf prevalence to less than 1 in area with low to moderate baseline prevalence semiannual mda wa useful for rapidly reducing mf prevalence in an area with higher baseline endemicity

processed_title: prevalence estimate of opisthorchis viverrini and clonorchis sinensis infection in the greater mekong subregion a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background opisthorchiasis and clonorchiasis caused by opisthorchis viverrini and clonorchis sinensis respectively are significant yet neglected foodborne trematodiases in the great mekong subregion gm despite the reporting of the prevalence of these human liver fluke in the region over the past decade there ha been a lack of a comprehensive and systematic consolidation of this data therefore we aimed to conduct a thorough systematic review and metaanalysis to synthesize and analyze timetrend prevalence estimate of both o viverrini and c sinensis across the gm for the past 30 year method this study undertakes a systematic review using a comprehensive search for published article in pubmed embase scopus cochrane and thai journal online database until early 2023 the pooled prevalence of o viverrini and c sinensis infection wa analyzed through a randomeffects metaanalysis with metaregression analysis used to quantify association with study characteristic subgroup analysis wa conducted whenever comparison data were available to assess the risk of o viverrini and c sinensis infection in each gm country heterogeneity among study wa assessed using the q statistic and quantified by using the i 2 index result from a total of 2997 article 155 article comprising 218 datasets and 751108 participant were included for review the gm prevalence of o viverrini wa 2111 45083260237 95 confidence interval ci 17742447 pooled prevalence estimate were highly observed in lao 3406 95 ci 26854126 followed by thailand 1819 95 ci 13862251 and cambodia 1048 95 ci 5521545 myanmar and vietnam had limited data source for calculation clonorchis sinensis infection in gm wa 2533 95 ci 18323234 with guangxi china exhibiting the highest prevalence rate at 2689 95 ci 18343543 while vietnam had a prevalence rate of 2030 95 ci 9133147 o viverrini prevalence decreased significantly over time whereas c sinensis infection appeared to be stable consistently over time in both china and vietnam conclusion this comprehensive study drawing from the largest datasets to date offer an indepth systematic prevalence review of human liver fluke in the greater mekong subregion it underscore the imperative for systematic surveillance data collection and the implementation of intervention and control measure for these infectious disease of poverty

processed_title: a comparison of two test for filarial antigenemia in area in sri lanka and indonesia with lowlevel persistence of lymphatic filariasis following mass drug administration
processed_abstract: background filarial antigen test are key tool for mapping the distribution of bancroftian filariasis and for detecting area with persistent infection following mass drug administration mda a recent study showed that the new alere filariasis test strip ft ha better analytical sensitivity than the binaxnow filariasis card test card test for detecting circulating filarial antigen and the ft detected more positive result than the card test in a field study performed in a highly endemic area in liberia method the present study compared the performance of the ft and the card test in community survey that were conducted in southern sri lanka and in indonesia central java in area with lowlevel persistence of lf following multiple round of mda with diethylcarbamazine plus albendazole the study were performed in densely populated semiurban area where wuchereria bancrofti is transmitted by culex quinquefasciatus result antigenemia rate by ft were 138 higher in the sri lanka study 43852 v 18852 and 21 higher in the indonesia study 50778 v 41778 than antigenemia rate by card test antigenemia rate were significantly higher in male than in female and higher in adult than in child in both study site although overall antigenemia rate and test score were significantly higher by ft than by card test in both study area rate in young child were similar with both test in both area conclusion these result extend the previously reported superior sensitivity of the ft to area with low residual infection rate following mda and this could affect mapping and postmda survey result in adult however our finding suggest that result of transmission assessment survey ta performed in schoolaged child are likely to be similar with both test

processed_title: community deworming alleviates geohelminthinduced immune hyporesponsiveness
processed_abstract: in crosssectional study chronic helminth infection have been associated with immunological hyporesponsiveness that can affect response to unrelated antigen to study the immunological effect of deworming we conducted a clusterrandomized doubleblind placebocontrolled trial in indonesia and assigned 954 household to receive albendazole or placebo once every 3 mo for 2 y helminthspecific and nonspecific wholeblood cytokine response were assessed in 1059 subject of all age whereas phenotyping of regulatory molecule wa undertaken in 121 schoolaged child all measurement were performed before and at 9 and 21 mo after initiation of treatment anthelmintic treatment resulted in significant increase in proinflammatory cytokine response to plasmodium falciparuminfected red blood cell pfrbcs and mitogen with the largest effect on tnf response to pfrbcs at 9 moestimate 95 confidence interval 037 021053 p value over time ptime 00001 although the frequency of regulatory t cell did not change after treatment there wa a significant decline in the expression of the inhibitory molecule cytotoxic t lymphocyteassociated antigen 4 ctla4 on cd4 t cell of albendazoletreated individual 0060 0107 to 0013 and 0057 0105 to 0008 at 9 and 21 mo respectively ptime 0017 this trial show the capacity of helminth to upregulate inhibitory molecule and to suppress proinflammatory immune response in human this could help to explain the inferior immunological response to vaccine and lower prevalence of inflammatory disease in low compared with highincome country

processed_title: redescription and resurrection of bertiella satyri cestoda anoplocephalidae parasitizing the orangutan pongo abelii in indonesia
processed_abstract: the tapeworm specie bertiella satyri from a semiwild sumatran orangutan pongo abelii ponginae is redescribed and the sequence of it 18 rdna is presented the tapeworm parasitizing the genus pan pongo homo and hylobates from museum national dhistoire naturelle paris and from museum d histoire naturelle geneve are also presented the validity of b satyri is confirmed b satyri bsa differs from the most similar specie bertiella studeri bstu in the following characteristic 1 testis number bstu 300400 bsa 116124 2 genital opening bstu regularly alternate bsa irregularly alternate 3 cirrussac bstu short 02500320 doe not reach excretory duct bsa long 0630 x 0495 reach excretory duct 4 egg size bstu 00530060 bsa 00300051 5 host bstu pan troglodyte africa bsa pongo pygmaeus p abelii indonesia borneo sumatra both specie differ according to our material and the name b satyri blanchard 1891 is resurrected

processed_title: schistosomiasis model with treatment habitat modification and biological control
processed_abstract: schistosomiasis is a parasitic disease caused by schistosoma worm infection some specie of snail can serve a the intermediate host for the parasite numerous intervention have been performed to repress the snail population one of them is the use of molluscicide nevertheless it is debated that molluscicide intervention ha negative impact on the ecosystem to investigate the impact of more environmentally friendly intervention we develop a schistosomiasis model with treatment habitat modification and biological control the biological control agent examined in our model is a snail predator moreover to investigate the impact of snail habitat modification we assume that the snail population grows logistically we show that all solution of our model are nonnegative and bounded we also study the existence and stability condition of equilibrium point the basic reproduction number are determined using the nextgeneration operator linearization combined with the routhhurwitz criterion is used to prove the local stability condition of diseasefree equilibrium point bifurcation theory is applied to investigate the local stability condition of the endemic equilibrium point to examine the global behavior of our model we use asymptotically autonomous system theory and construct a lyapunov function we perform several numerical simulation to validate and support our deductive result our result show that early treatment can reduce the basic reproduction number and schistosomiasis case in addition modifying snail habitat and releasing the snail predator at the snail habitat can reduce schistosomiasis prevalence we suggest using snail predator which can hunt and kill snail effectively a a biological control agent

processed_title: epidemiology and risk factor of strongyloides stercoralis infection in papua indonesia a molecular diagnostic study
processed_abstract: strongyloides stercoralis is a parasitic worm that is of considerable clinical relevance indeed it may persist asymptomatically for many year but can lead to potentially fatal dissemination when the host immune status is impaired a commonly employed stool microscopy technique eg katokatz thick smear fail to detect s stercoralis the epidemiology is poorly understood in 2013 we conducted a crosssectional household survey in the district of mimika in papua indonesia a total of 331 individual aged 1 month to 44 year had a single stool sample subjected to realtime polymerase chain reaction pcr for s stercoralis diagnosis the prevalence of s stercoralis infection wa 320 106331 individual higher than any of the three main soiltransmitted helminth ascaris lumbricoides 239 trichuris trichiura 184 and hookworm 172 amongst the s stercoralisinfected individual 736 were concurrently infected with another helminth with hookworm being the most frequent coinfection 274 fourteen percent of the s stercoralis infection had low cycle threshold value on realtime pcr which may indicate a higher infection intensity multivariate logistic regression analysis revealed that age 5 year adjusted odds ratio or 58 95 confidence interval ci 31108 wa significantly associated with s stercoralis infection there is a need for indepth clinical and diagnostic study to elucidate the public health impact of s stercoralis infection in indonesia

processed_title: chemical and physical feature of biological fluid in treatment of hydatid disease
processed_abstract: the aim of this paper is to better understand the dynamic of crystallogenic and starting activity in biological fluid of patient throughout surgery and the late postoperative phase in alveococcosis sample of saliva from 22 individual with alveococcosis were included in the research biological fluid sample were taken at the time of admission and before the patient wa discharged following that slide were made utilizing the teziocrystalloscopy method which incorporates the investigation of the crystal forming activity of mixed saliva with it starting characteristic using a 09 percent sodium chloride solution a the foundation ingredient using our own set of criterion we evaluated the outcome of crystalloscopic and tezigraphic experiment specrophotometric examination of tezigraphic and crystalloscopic facies wa done using a powerwave x microplate spectrophotometer at wavelength of 400 350 and 300 nm to augment the result from ocular morphometry of dried saliva micro slide surgical therapy result in a partial normalization of physical and chemical parameter a well a the composition of the patient biological fluid after the patient is discharged from the hospital

processed_title: towards a cysticercosisfree tropical resort island a historical overview of taeniasiscysticercosis in bali
processed_abstract: taeniasis and cysticercosis are known to be endemic in several indonesian island although relatively little recent epidemiological data are available a most indonesian people are muslim taeniasiscysticercosis caused by the pork tapeworm taenia solium ha a restricted presence in nonmuslim society and is endemic only among some hindu community on the island of bali bali ha long been known to be endemic for taeniasiscysticercosis almost a century ago level of cysticercosis of 2030 were described in cattle and 23 in pig few study of taeniasiscysticercosis were undertaken in bali prior to a series of research program commenced since the 1990s both taenia saginata and t solium continue to be endemic in bali molecular study have revealed that all t saginatalike tapeworm detected in bali are t saginata no evidence ha been found for the presence of taenia asiatica in bali economic sanitary and education improvement across much of the island over the past decade have been associated with a decline in the amount of transmission of t solium such that the parasite now seems to be restricted to the eastern part of the island a small area on the northeastern slope of mt agung the highest mountain in bali the living environment including sanitation and hygiene condition in this endemic area remains relatively poor especially during the halfyear dry season and pig continue to roam freely in this review historical record and ongoing project towards elimination of taeniasiscysticercosis in bali are reviewed to provide a better understanding of the present situation of taeniasiscysticercosis in bali towards a future cysticercosisfree tropical resort island

processed_title: the burden of opisthorchiasis and leptospirosis in thailand a nationwide syndemic analysis
processed_abstract: opisthorchiasis caused by the foodborne trematode parasite opisthorchis viverrini is coendemic with leptospirosis in the greater mekong subregion socioeconomic determinant occupational risk factor and reservoir host interact with the disease in the threat to human health but the situation ha not been explored we therefore studied the interaction between the disease and their associated risk using a syndemic approach with nationwide data for thailand method included bayesian mapping principal component analysis pca and nested correlation analysis to analyze the data for 2009 and 2014 bayesian mapping demonstrates that opisthorchiasis act in a synergistic manner to massively alter the risk of leptospirosis at the provincial level particularly in area of opisthorchiasis endemicity in northeast thailand socioeconomic and occupational factor significantly influence the disease syndemic with moderate effect size of 04 and 05 respectively p0001 these effect are most remarkable in the northeastern region which ha not only the highest poverty level but also the highest proportion of occupational risk p0001 cat and dog play crucial role in maintaining the syndemic rvalue 7 and 6 with p0001 the study show that opisthorchiasis and leptospirosis become syndemic especially in northeast thailand socioeconomic and occupational variable are positively syndemic a they are representative of neglected tropical disease the role of reservoir host underline the value of an interdisciplinary approach such a one health for sustainability disease control

processed_title: approach to the control of fasciolosis in ruminant
processed_abstract: approach to the control of fasciolosis in ruminant are compared for developed country and for developing country with particular reference to region growing irrigated rice in all environment problem definition and investigation are based on one or more of observation abattoir survey faecal egg count tracer animal and snail study in developed country each husbandman graz a large number of animal control access to pasture and water and market high value product strategic and tactical treatment control fasciolosis in these circumstance and will continue to do so while anthelmintic remain effective in many developing country subsistence family possess small number of animal feed and water source are shared by many family and the product are mainly draft power fertiliser and meat for local consumption consequently the agricultural cycle and the life cycle of the parasite and intermediate host are closely interrelated and there is some scope for controlling infection by modifying husbandry practice anthelmintic are not affordable recent observation of a major fasciola resistance gene with substantial dominance in indonesian thin tail sheep infected with fasciola gigantica suggest that parasite control by breed substitution or crossbreeding and selection is feasible such control would be inexpensive to implement and sustainable

processed_title: helminth infection in population undergoing epidemiological transition a friend or foe
processed_abstract: helminth infection are highly prevalent in developing country especially in rural area with gradual development there is a transition from living condition that are dominated by infection poor sanitation manual labor and traditional diet to a situation where burden of infection is reduced infrastructure is improved sedentary lifestyle dominates and processed food form a large proportion of the calorie intake the combination of some of the change in lifestyle and environment are expected to result in alteration of the landscape of disease which will become dominated by noncommunicable disorder here we review how the major helminth infection affect a large proportion of the population in the developing world and discus their impact on the immune system and the consequence of this for other infection which are coendemic in the same area furthermore we address the issue of decreasing helminth infection in many part of the world within the context of increasing inflammatory metabolic and cardiovascular disease

processed_title: first bovine vaccine to prevent human schistosomiasis a cluster randomised phase 3 clinical trial
processed_abstract: objective schistosomiasis is a neglected tropical parasitic disease caused by blood fluke of the genus schistosoma schistosoma japonicum is zoonotic in china the philippine and indonesia with bovine acting a major reservoir of human infection the primary objective of the trial wa to examine the impact of a combination of human mass chemotherapy snail control through mollusciciding and sjctpi bovine vaccination on the rate of human infection method a 5year phase iiia cluster randomized control trial wa conducted among 18 schistosomiasisendemic village comprising 18221 resident in northern samar the philippine result overall bovine vaccination resulted in a statistically significant decrease in human infection relative risk rr 075 95 confidence interval ci 069 to 082 across all trial followup the best outcome of the trial wa when bovine vaccination wa combined with snail mollusciciding this combination resulted in a 31 reduction rr 069 95 ci 061 to 078 in human infection conclusion this is the first trial to demonstrate the effectiveness of a bovine vaccine for schistosomiasis in reducing human schistosome infection the trial is registered with australian new zealand clinical trial registry actrn12619001048178

processed_title: relationship between carotid intima medium thickness and helminth infection on flores island indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to examine the association between helminth infection and atherosclerosis background chronic helminth infection which can lead to poor nutritional status and antiinflammatory response might protect against the development of atherosclerosis method a crosssectional study wa performed in flores indonesia an area highly endemic for soiltransmitted helminth sth stool sample from 675 participant aged 1880 year were collected and screened for trichuris trichiura by microscopy and for ascaris lumbricoides necator americanus ancylostoma duodenale and strongyloides stercoralis by qpcr we collected data on body mass index bmi waist to hip ratio whr blood pressure fasting blood glucose fbg lipid high sensitive creactive protein hscrp total immunoglobuline tige and escherichia coli lipopolysaccharide stimulated cytokine tumor necrosis factor and interleukin10 in a subset of 301 elderly adult 40 year of age carotid intima medium thickness cimt wa measured result participant with any sth infection had lower bmi kgm2 mean difference 066 95ci 126 006 whr 001 002 000 total cholesterol mmoll 022 043 001 and ldlcholesterol mmoll 020 039 000 than uninfected participant after additional adjustment for bmi the association between helminth infection and total cholesterol mean difference 017 95ci 037 003 a well a ldlcholesterol 015 033 004 wa less pronounced bmi whr and total cholesterol were negatively associated with number specie of helminth coinfections participant with high tige an indicator of exposure to helminth had lower fbg tc and hdl the association between tige and tc and hdl remained significant after adjustment with bmi no clear association wa found between sth infection or tige and mean cimt conclusion this crosssectional study present evidence that helminth infection were negatively associated with risk factor for cardiovascular disease an association at least partially mediated by an effect on bmi the significance of this finding need to be determined

processed_title: using knowledge attitude and practice kap survey on lymphatic filariasis to prepare a health promotion campaign for mass drug administration in alor district indonesia
processed_abstract: we report the result of two survey of people knowledge attitude and practice kap regarding lymphatic filariasis lf in alor district eastern indonesia the result of the survey were used to prepare and evaluate the social mobilization component of a pilot mass drug administration mda in five village in the study area the filarial parasite brugia timori and wuchereria bancrofti are highly endemic frequent and severe adverse reaction after mda may occur especially in area endemic for b timori and therefore a special communication strategy wa designed to inform and to educate community about lf and it control the first kap survey wa conducted a a baseline premda with diethylcarbamazine and albendazole and the second a a postintervention evaluation in order to obtain information on the impact of the communication campaign before the information campaign and the subsequent mda 54 of the study population had heard of one of the three main term for lf whereas after health education and mda 89 had heard of at least one of the three term similarly premda 21 reported having had previously taken the treatment for filariasis while postmda 88 reported having taken the treatment during the pilot treatment period the historical fear and traumatic experience associated with past lf treatment campaign in indonesia were averted since both the communication campaign and the mda were designed appropriately for and together with the community a a result compliance wa sufficient in the first round to successfully begin the elimination process

processed_title: taenia solium taeniosiscysticercosis in asia epidemiology impact and issue
processed_abstract: several report of patient with cysticercosis from many country in asia such a india china indonesia thailand korea taiwan and nepal are a clear indicator of the wide prevalence of taenia solium cysticercosis and taeniosis in these and other asian country however epidemiological data from community based study are sparse and available only for a few country in asia cysticercosis is the cause of epilepsy in up to 50 of indian patient presenting with partial seizure it is also a major cause of epilepsy in bali indonesia vietnam and possibly china and nepal seroprevalence study indicate high rate of exposure to the parasite in several country vietnam china korea and bali indonesia with rate ranging from 002 to 126 rate of taeniosis a determined by stool examination for ovum have also been reported to range between 01 and 6 in the community in india vietnam china and bali indonesia an astonishingly high rate of taeniosis of 50 wa reported from an area in nepal populated by pig rearing farmer in addition to poor sanitation unhealthy pig rearing practice low hygienic standard unusual custom such a consumption of raw pork is an additional factor contributing to the spread of the disease in some community of asia undoubtedly cysticercosis is a major public health problem in several asian country effecting several million people by not only causing neurological morbidity but also imposing economic hardship on impoverished population however there are wide variation in the prevalence rate in different region and different socioeconomic group in the same country it is important to press for the recognition of cysticercosis a one of the major public health problem in asia that need to be tackled vigorously by the government and public health authority of the region

processed_title: genetic characterization of nodular worm infection in asian ape
processed_abstract: parasitic nematode of oesophagostomum spp commonly known a nodular worm are emerging a the most widely distributed and prevalent zoonotic nematode oesophagostomum infection are well documented in african nonhuman primate however the taxonomy distribution and transmission of oesophagostomum in asian nonhuman primate are not adequately studied to better understand which oesophagostomum specie infect asian nonhuman primate and determine their phylogeny we analysed 55 faecal sample from 50 orangutan and 5 gibbon individual from borneo and sumatra both microscopy and molecular result revealed that semiwild animal had higher oesophagostomum infection prevalence than free ranging animal based on sequence genotyping analysis targeting the internal transcribed spacer 2 of rdna we report for the first time the presence of o aculeatum in sumatran ape population genetic analysis show that there is significant genetic differentiation between bornean and sumatran o aculeatum population our result clearly reveal that o aculeatum in freeranging animal have a higher genetic variation than those in semiwild animal demonstrating that o aculeatum is circulating naturally in wildlife and zoonotic transmission is possible further study should be conducted to better understand the epidemiology and dynamic of oesophagostomum transmission between human nonhuman primate and other wild specie and livestock in southeast asia

processed_title: intestinal parasite of endangered orangutan pongo pygmaeus in central and east kalimantan borneo indonesia
processed_abstract: faecal sample from 163 captive and semicaptive individual 61 sample from wild individual and 38 sample from captive group of bornean orangutan pongo pygmaeus in kalimantan indonesia were collected during one rainy season november 2005may 2006 and screened for intestinal parasite using sodium acetateacetic acidformalinconcentration safc sedimentation flotation mcmaster and baermann technique we aimed to identify factor influencing infection risk for specific intestinal parasite in wild orangutan and individual living in captivity various genus of protozoa including entamoeba endolimax iodamoeba balantidium giardia and blastocystis nematode such a strongyloides trichuris ascaris enterobius trichostrongylus and hookworm and one trematode a dicrocoeliid were identified for the first time the cestode hymenolepis wa detected in orangutan highest prevalence were found for strongyloides individual 37 group 58 hookworm 41 58 balantidium 40 61 entamoeba coli 29 53 and a trichostrongylid 13 32 in reintroduction centre infant were at higher risk of infection with strongyloides than adult infection risk for hookworm wa significantly higher in wild male compared with female in group the centre themselves had a significant influence on the infection risk for balantidium ranging pattern of wild orangutan overcrowding in captivity and a shift of age composition in favour of immatures seemed to be the most likely factor leading to these result

processed_title: lymphatic filariasis and brugia timori prospect for elimination
processed_abstract: brugia timori is a pathogenic filarial nematode of human replacing the closely related specie brugia malayi on some island in eastern indonesia recent study on alor island show that locally b timori is still of great public health importance causing mainly acute filarial fever and chronic lymphedema pcrbased assay to detect parasite dna in addition to assay for detecting specific antibody that have been originally developed for b malayi can be used efficiently a diagnostic tool for b timori in the framework of the global program to eliminate lymphatic filariasis a single annual dose of diethylcarbamazine in combination with albendazole wa found to reduce the prevalence and density of microfilaraemia persistently therefore elimination of b timori appears to be achievable

processed_title: detection of adult brugia malayi filariae by ultrasonography in human in india and indonesia
processed_abstract: in bancroftian filariasis ultrasonography usg is a suitable tool to monitor infection by the detection of adult filariae in addition to antigen detection test ict og4c3 however in brugian filariasis ultrasound examination in human have so far failed to detect adult worm and no antigen test is available to verify infection in patient who are carrier of adult worm but amicrofilaraemic in this study we describe the feasibility of detection of adult brugia malayi filariae by usg worm nest were detected in 4 of 32 patient in india and indonesia located in the breast the thigh the calf and an inguinal lymph node the study show that adult filariae of b malayi in human can be detected by usg but the technique is limited by the fact that worm nest seem not to be stable over time in human a is the case in bancroftian filariasis

processed_title: echinococcosis and cysticercosis in asia evaluation of the modern technology for epidemiological study
processed_abstract: the recent emergence of zoonotic parasitic disease of public health importance represents a growing global concern among zoonotic helminthic disease both echinococcosis and cysticercosis are the most serious disease threatening human life neurocysticercosis ncc caused by ingestion of egg of the pork tapeworm taenia solium is spreading worldwide and not rare even in muslim or jewish community alveolar echinococcosis ae caused by the proliferation of metacestodes of the fox tapeworm echinococcus multilocularis is the most potentially lethal parasitic infection of the nontropical northern hemisphere whereas cystic echinococcosis ce caused by the proliferation of metacestodes of the dog tapeworm e granulosus ha rather a cosmopolitan distribution a the life cycle of t solium e multilocularis and e granulosus are completed through predatorprey interaction including human it is crucial to interrupt the cycle for control of these zoonotic cestodiases both ncc and ce are expected to be eradicable since the principal life cycle of t solium and e granulosus are maintained between human and pig and between dog and herbivorous domestic animal respectively in contrast ae is perhaps not eradicable since the life cycle of e multilocularis is maintained between wild fox and rodent modern technology including imaging immunology and molecular biology have been applied for epidemiological survey in the present review we introduce such technology applied in japan china and indonesia and point out the problem that need to be solved for control of these three zoonotic cestodiases

processed_title: surveillance and selective treatment of brugia malayi filariasis eleven year after stopping mass drug administration in belitung district indonesia
processed_abstract: brugia malayi is the major cause of lymphatic filariasis lf in indonesia zoophilic b malayi wa endemic in belitung district and mass drug administration mda with diethylcarbamazine dec and albendazole ceased after five annual round in 2010 the district passed three transmission assessment survey ta between 2011 and 2016 a part of the posttas3 surveillance of the national lf elimination program we collected night blood sample for microfilaria mf detection from 1911 subject more than 5 year of age in seven village a b malayi mf prevalence ranging from 17 to 59 wa detected in five village only 2 5 of the total 40 mfpositive subject were adolescent aged 18 and 19 year old and 38 95 mfpositive subject were 21 year and older microfilarial density in infected individual were mostly low with 60 of the subject having mf density between 16 and 160 mfml tripledrug treatment with ivermectin dec and albendazole ida wa given to 36 eligible mfpositive subject adverse event were mostly mild and treatment wa well tolerated one year later 35 of the treated mfpositive subject were reexamined and 33 94 had cleared all mf while the antibm14 antibody prevalence remained almost unchanged result indicate that in b malayiendemic area posttas3 surveillance for mf in the community may be needed to detect a potential parasite reservoir in adult selective treatment with ida is highly effective in clearing b malayi mf and should be used to increase the prospect for lf elimination if mda is reintroduced

processed_title: questionnaire survey and prevalence of intestinal helminthic infection in barru sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: a questionnaire survey with parasitological study wa carried out on the inhabitant of 4 village in barru district sulawesi indonesia from 1994 to 1995 the questionnaire dealt with life style and sanitary condition in 482 house in the 4 village interview for the item of the questionnaire were conducted with the owner housekeeper and child of the same family in pancana and lalolang 377 and 50 respectively of man inhabitant surveyed were fisherman while in lompo riaja and pattappa 386 and 655 respectively were farmer the highest proportion of official worker wa 337 in lompo riaja educational level wa low 884 in pancana 904 in lalolang 621 in lompo riaja and 912 in pattappa had elementary or below elementary school education in lompo riaja 308 of the inhabitant graduated from senior high school or university the percentage of family having their own latrine wa 303 in pancana 132 in lalolang 319 in pattapa and 60 in lompo riaja the people without latrine usually defecated in rice field seaside or riverside a total of 654 fecal sample wa examined by the modified katokatz thick smear method five nematode specie ascaris lumbricoides trichuris trichiura necator americanus strongyloides stercoralis and unidentified rhabditoids of freeliving nature were detected cestode hymenolepis nana infection wa confirmed all the hookworm examined by the modified haradamori culture technic were necator americanus trichuris infection wa most common followed by hookworm and ascaris infection both in young aged 414 and older aged over 15 age group the prevalence of hookworm infection wa significantly higher in male than in female of older age among the older age group the prevalence of trichuris infection wa significantly lower in lompo riaja while hookworm infection wa the highest in pattappa among all the inhabitant examined for parasite infection 174 had 3 kind of nematode ascaris trichuris and hookworm however egg count revealed that most of the inhabitant with trichuris or hookworm had light infection the inhabitant with higher education background had significantly lower infection rate of ascaris and trichuris the prevalence of hookworm infection wa not significantly different between the inhabitant owning latrine and without it but the prevalence of ascaris and trichuris differed significantly

processed_title: high prevalence of taenia saginata taeniasis and status of taenia solium cysticercosis in bali indonesia 20022004
processed_abstract: an epidemiological survey of taeniasiscysticercosis wa carried out in one semiurban and two urban village in three district of bali indonesia in 2002 and 2004 in total 398 local people from 247 family were diagnosed by anamnesis and clinical examination and 60 resident were suspected to be taeniasis carrier among 60 suspected carrier 56 person expelled a total of 61 taeniid adult worm after praziquantel treatment from 398 resident 252 stool sample were available for analysis of taeniid egg coproantigens or coprodna for identification of taeniid specie and 311 serum sample were available for detection of antibody against taenia solium cysticercosis taeniasis prevalence were highly variable among three village 11275 and only one case of cysticercosis due to t solium infection wa detected all expelled tapeworm were confirmed to be taenia saginata by mtdna analysis there wa no taenia asiatica human case in bali case control analysis of 106 family chosen at random from 179 family in 2004 and another 106 family from nonendemic area revealed that risk factor of t saginata taeniasis for family were level of education p001 consumption of beef lawar p001 and the source of lawar p001

processed_title: relationship between different specie of helminth and atopy a study in a population living in helminthendemic area in sulawesi indonesia
processed_abstract: background the association between allergen skin sensitization and helminth infection ha been debated for year here we sought to estimate the prevalence of atopic sensitization of resident living in area endemic for lymphatic filariasis and intestinal helminth and to investigate the association between these different specie of helminth with allergen skin test reactivity to allergen method five hundred and eightythree individual living in an area endemic for brugia malayi and for intestinal helminth were skin prick tested using 3 allergen microfilariae were enumerated by filtration of 1 ml nocturnally collected blood and 442 stool sample were examined for the presence of intestinal helminth egg result the prevalence of skin prick test positivity to any allergen wa 235 to cockroach 206 to house dust mite 62 and to grass pollen 12 individual with b malayi infection had a significantly reduced risk for atopic reactivity to cockroach adjusted odds ratio 056 95 ci 035088 in the same population no association wa found between the presence of intestinal helminth and any skin test reactivity conclusion in a general population across all age in a rural area of indonesia the prevalence of skin test reactivity to house dust mite is a low a in other nonaffluent country and infection with b malayi appears to reduce the risk of skin reactivity to cockroach on the other hand we found no association between infection with intestinal helminth and skin test reactivity to aeroallergens

processed_title: multiple genotype of taenia soliumramifications for diagnosis treatment and control
processed_abstract: mitochondrial dna sequence of taenia solium have fully been analyzed analysis of the full length of cytochrome c oxidase subunit 1 1620 bp and cytochrome b 1068 bp gene of t solium isolated from asia china thailand indonesia and india from latin america mexico ecuador bolivia peru and brazil and from africa tanzania mozambique and cameroon ha revealed that the two phylogeny obtained were similar to each other regardless of the gene examined the isolates from asia formed a single cluster whereas those from latin america combined with those from africa to form an additional cluster it wa estimated that these two genotype emerged approximately 48 x 105 year ago these result together with recent study of the ancient of human taeniid cestode emerged several mya in africa historical data on swine domestication distribution of pig and colonization pattern suggest that t solium wa introduced recently into latin america and africa from different region of europe during the colonial age which started 500 year ago and that t solium of another origin independently spread in asian country perhaps from china why did not t solium of european origin invade or spread into asia during the colonial age analysis of t solium distribution must include other taenia specie especially t saginata and t asiatica which can not be differentiated from each other morphologically bess tbase analysis for differentiation of all human taenia specie including the two genotype of t solium and t saginata and t asiatica ha also been characterized bess tbase analysis differentiates african isolates from latin american isolates a well but more sample should be analyzed for obtaining conclusive evidence for the latter serological analysis of cyst fluid of t solium cysticerci obtained in china and indonesia and from mozambique and ecuador indicates geographical difference in their banding pattern these difference are discussed in the light of possible difference in pathology of t solium worldwide a it ha been speculated that the ancient t solium emerged several million year ago in africa it is necessary to analyze more isolates from africa such working hypothesis may be evaluated combined with symptomatology and serology when we get additional dna data from such area since there are some variety of manifestation of neurocysticercosis with or without subcutaneous cysticercosis and of antigen of cyst fluid of t solium from asia and from africa andor america transfer of technique of molecular identification and sero and immunodiagnoses between researcher and technician from endemic country using their own material should be promoted with the aim of better international cooperation for the control of cysticercosis

processed_title: impact of six round of mass drug administration on brugian filariasis and soiltransmitted helminth infection in eastern indonesia
processed_abstract: background the lymphatic filarial parasite brugia timori occurs only in eastern indonesia where it cause high morbidity the absence of an animal reservoir the inefficient transmission by anopheles mosquito and the high sensitivity to decalbendazole treatment make this specie a prime candidate for elimination by mass drug administration mda methodologyprincipal finding we evaluated the effect of mda using dec and albendazole on b timori and soil transmitted helminth sth in a crosssectional study of a sentinel village on alor island annually over a period of 10 year premda the microfilaria mf prevalence wa 26 and 80 of the resident had filariaspecific igg4 antibody in 2010 34 month after the 6th round of mda mf and antibody rate were only 017 and 64 respectively the mda campaign had also a beneficial effect on sth baseline prevalence rate for ascaris hookworm and trichuris were 34 28 and 11 respectively these rate were reduced to 27 4 and 2 one year after the 5th round of mda unfortunately sth rate rebounded 34 month after cessation of mda and approached premda rate however the intensity of sth infection in 2009 wa still reduced and no heavy infection were detected conclusionssignificance mda with decalbendazole ha had a major impact on b timori mf and igg4 antibody rate providing a proof of principle that elimination is feasible we also documented the value of annual decalbendazole a a mass deworming intervention and the importance of continuing some form of sth control after cessation of mda for filariasis

processed_title: taeniasis and cysticercosis in asia and the pacific present state of knowledge and perspective
processed_abstract: several topic on taeniasis and cysticercosis in asia and the pacific are overviewed in asia and the pacific three human taeniid specie have been recognized taenia solium taenia saginata and taenia asiatica the first topic is on evolution of t solium mitochondrial dna polymorphism of t solium worldwide are discussed with emphasis of two specific genotype americanafrican and asian the second topic is recent major advance in sero and moleculardiagnosis of t solium cysticercosis in human pig and dog the third is the present situation of t solium taeniasiscysticercosis in papua irian jaya indonesia the forth is the present situation of t solium cysticercosis and t saginata taeniasis in bali indonesia the fifth is the present situation of t asiatica taeniasis in asia and the pacific and in north sumatra indonesia the sixth is on the debate of the exact definition of t asiatica because t asiatica can not be differentiated from t saginata morphologically it is time to reevaluate t saginata in asia and the pacific new and broadbased survey across this region are necessary from epidemiological and public health perspective based on evidence

processed_title: expert consensus on holistic skin care routine focus on acne rosacea atopic dermatitis and sensitive skin syndrome
processed_abstract: background treatment cleansing moisturizing and photoprotection are four major component of holistic skin care for dermatological condition while treatment t is recognized a a key component in the management of dermatological condition there is a lack of practical guidance on the adjunctive role of cleansing moisturizing and photoprotection cmp limited patient knowledge confusion over product selection and lack of guidance on how to choose and use cmp skin care product in conjunction with pharmacological therapy are the main barrier to establishing a holistic skin care routine for dermatological condition aim this study aimed to review current clinical evidence identify gap and provide practical guidance on conceptualization and implementation of cmp routine in the management of sensitive skin due to underlying acne atopic dermatitis or rosacea including condition with idiopathic cause referred to a idiopathic sensitive skin syndrome method an expert panel comprising of 10 dermatologist from australia china hong kong taiwan india indonesia philippine singapore south korea and thailand convened to develop consensus statement on holistic skin care in acne rosacea atopic dermatitis and idiopathic sensitive skin syndrome using the delphi approach result consensus wa defined a 80 of panel rating statement a 8 or median rating of 8 the final statement were collated to develop consensus recommendation on holistic skin care conclusion a dermatologistguided holistic skin care routine is essential to improve patient confidence and reduce confusion over product selection the consensus recommendation presented here highlight the importance of cleansing moisturization and photoprotection in holistic skin care and how it can be utilized a a communication tool for physician and patient to achieve overall better patient compliance satisfaction and treatment outcome

processed_title: pressure ulcer the core care and cure approach
processed_abstract: pressure ulcerinjury remains a significant health problem in the community requiring comprehensive care nurse are involved in the management and prevention of pressure injury however to date study focusing on applying nursing theory to pressure ulcer care have been limited in the present study the three dimension of lydia hall 1964 theorycore care and cureare extensively discussed and linked with the practice of pressure injury management it is hoped that this review will help community nurse understand the application of this nursing theory to the prevention and management of pressure injury

processed_title: burden of skin and subcutaneous disease in indonesia 1990 to 2019
processed_abstract: is missing short communication

processed_title: scabies update on treatment and effort for prevention and control in highly endemic setting
processed_abstract: scabies is a contagious parasitic skin disease caused by sarcoptes scabiei infestation which can be transmitted through direct or indirect contact who classified scabies a a neglected tropical disease the prevalence of scabies is high in certain country ranging from 321 to 74 especially in crowded condition such a prison boarding school and orphanage indonesia is one of the most heavily affected country worldwide scabies might cause great impact on patient which includes decreased concentration and academic achievement at school social stigma sleep disturbance and decreased economic productivity in community management of scabies with antiscabies need to be carried out appropriately accompanied with treatment for all contact mass treatment with permethrin cream or ivermectin can be given directly to patient prevention is conducted by providing medical treatment and breaking the chain of transmission source elimination and disinfection of fomite is very important participation of nonmedical personnel such a teacher cadre and parent together with the local health worker primary health care is highly recommended using checklist or application can aid nonmedical personnel to determine suspected case thus contributing to scabies elimination cooperation between patient patient family health worker and other nonmedical personnel will greatly reduce the prevalence of scabies and ultimately improve patient quality of life the aim of this review is to provide an update on scabies treatment and effort for prevention and elimination with focus on the situation in indonesia

processed_title: pattern of skin disease prompting biopsy before and during the covid19 pandemic in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction less biopsy were expected when large scale social restriction were enforced during covid19 pandemic aim to compare the skin disease prompting biopsy before and during the covid19 pandemic material and method a retrospective study of skin disease wa performed the skin problem were then grouped into major histopathological reaction result a total of 229 biopsy were performed before the covid19 outbreak whereas only 160 biopsy were done during the pandemic before versus during the outbreak the proportion of major reaction were granulomatous 2052 v 2188 neoplasm 1747 v 20 psoriasiform 1485 v 10 vesiculobullous 961 v 875 others 1092 v 750 interface dermatitis 699 v 10 vasculopathy 699 v 563 spongiotic 655 v 813 panniculitis 349 v 375 and superficial and deep dermal infiltrate 262 v 438 conclusion a decreased total number of patient prompting less biopsy were reported during the covid19 outbreak however the three largest percentage of major histopathological reaction were still similar namely granulomatous neoplasm and psoriasiform

processed_title: guideline for the diagnosis treatment and longterm management of cutaneous lupus erythematosus
processed_abstract: cutaneous lupus erythematosus cle is an inflammatory autoimmune disease encompassing a broad spectrum of subtypes including acute subacute chronic and intermittent cle among these chronic cle can be further classified into several subclass of lupus erythematosus le such a discoid le verrucous le le profundus chilblain le and blaschko linear le to provide all dermatologist and rheumatologist with a practical guideline for the diagnosis treatment and longterm management of cle this evidence and consensusbased guideline wa developed following the checklist established by the international reporting item for practice guideline in healthcare right working group and wa registered at the international practice guideline registry platform with the joint effort of the asian dermatological association ada the asian academy of dermatology and venereology aadv and the lupus erythematosus research center of chinese society of dermatology csd a total of 25 dermatologist 7 rheumatologist one research scientist on lupus and 2 methodologists from 16 countriesregions in asia america and europe participated in the development of this guideline all recommendation were agreed on by at least 80 of the 32 voting physician a a consensus diagnosis of cle is mainly based on the evaluation of clinical and histopathological manifestation with an exclusion of sle by assessment of systemic involvement for localized cle lesion topical corticosteroid and topical calcineurin inhibitor are firstline treatment for widespread or severe cle lesion and or case resistant to topical treatment systemic treatment including antimalarial and or shortterm corticosteroid can be added notably antimalarial are the firstline systemic treatment for all type of cle and can also be used in pregnant patient and pediatric patient secondline choice include thalidomide retinoids dapsone and mtx whereas mmf is thirdline treatment finally pulseddye laser or surgery can be added a fourthline treatment for localized refractory lesion of ccle in cosmetically unacceptable area whereas belimumab may be used a fourthline treatment for widespread cle lesion in patient with active sle or recurrence of acle during tapering of corticosteroid a for management of the disease patient education and a longterm followup are necessary disease activity damage of skin and other organ quality of life comorbidities and possible adverse event are suggested to be assessed in every followup visit when appropriate

processed_title: malassezia virulence factor and their role in dermatological disorder
processed_abstract: malassezia is a commensal fungus that constitutes normal skin microbiota however in certain condition and individual it may transform into a pathogenic yeast with multiple associated dermatological disorder and various clinical manifestation this phenomenon is influenced by a unique hostagent interaction that trigger the production of several virulence factor such a indoles reactive oxygen specie azelaic acid hypha formation and biofilm formation this review article discusses malassezia virulence factor that contribute to the transformation of malassezia from commensal to pathogenic a well a their role in dermatological disorder including pityriasis versicolor seborrheic dermatitis malassezia folliculitis atopic dermatitis and psoriasis

processed_title: facial skin characteristic and concern in indonesia a crosssectional observational study
processed_abstract: background facial skin characteristic and appearance vary according to ethnicity while much of this knowledge is derived from the caucasian population lately there have been effort to gain such understanding in various region in asia in this paper we have built an understanding of such feature in indonesia in indonesia a section of female wear a traditional veil hijab to cover the scalp and part of face the influence of the hijab on facial skin attribute wa also investigated method in a crosssectional observational study design involving 419 female volunteer in jakarta indonesia facial skin attribute colour radiance hydration transepidermal water loss tewl wrinkle fine line pore and sebum level and condition melasma postinflammatory hyperpigmentation pih solar lentigo senile lentigo seborrheic keratoses and acne were assessed by trained operator and dermatologist using standard validated instrument and scale result with age facial skin colour showed darkening in cheek forehead on the other hand showed slight lightening the skin evenness and radiance decreased substantially aging attribute measured in term of line wrinkle and undereye dark circle showed deterioration with age the decline wa progressively faster than colour change facial image data analysis corroborated these finding skin hydration remained similar across the age group even though the skin barrier function measured in term of tewl improved with age sebum level in the skin were similar up to the age of 50 but declined in the next group of 5060 year pore severity increased with age melasma seborrheic keratosis and pih showed a high prevalence approximately 50 at the young age group 2030 year itself melasma prevalence attained 100 in the age group of 4150 year and onwards and it severity similarly showed a steady rise with age pih on the other hand showed a steady decline with age solar lentigo prevalence approximately 30 did not change much across age group and the severity score were similar in age group up to 50 year but increased substantially in 5160year age group seborrheic keratosis wa similar approximately 47 in age group up 2040 year but steadily increased in upper age group it severity wa similar in the age group of 2030 year and 3140 year but showed a twofold increase in subsequent age group acne wa 10 in the age group of 2030 year and declined gradually to 07 in the 5160year age group hijab wearer showed slight protection in skin colour darkening and improvement of evenness and radiance but were similar on aging fine line and wrinkle on crow foot under eye and perioral area marker to nonwearers in general in majority of agegroups hijab wearer showed a higher prevalence of melasma solarsenile lentigo seborrheic keratosis and pih

processed_title: annular infectious dermatosis
processed_abstract: annular configuration is conspicuous in the clinical manifestation of many skin disease and can be helpful for the diagnosis and differential diagnosis variation may include arciform ringform annular circinate serpiginous gyrated polycyclic targeted or figurate form in different color size and number with various texture and surface in infectious dermatosis the annular reaction can be specific or nonspecific while the underlying mechanism remain largely unknown in the specific reaction caused by direct invasion of the pathogen the contest between the centrifugal outspread of the infectious agent and the centripetal impedance of the host immune response is supposed to determine the final conformation example include erythema infectiosum orf erythema multiforme and pityriasis rosea of viral origin bacterial infection that may display annular lesion include erythrasma erythema chronicum migrans of lyme borreliosis secondary syphilis cutaneous tuberculosis and leprosy superficial mycosis such a dermatophytosis candida intertrigo tinea imbricata and subcutaneous mycosis such a chromoblastomycosis and algae infection protothecosis are characterized by annular progression of the skin lesion the creeping serpiginous extension is an alarming sign for the diagnosis of cutaneous larva migrans a better understanding of the virulence and pathogenicity of the pathogen and the way and type of immune response will help to clarify the pathogenesis

processed_title: a review of genotrichoses and hair pathology associated with inherited skin disease
processed_abstract: genetic hair disorder also known a genotrichoses are characterized by abnormality of hair structure growth or differentiation giving rise to a spectrum of phenotype such a hypertrichosis hypotrichosis and atrichia these disorder may present a isolated phenotype or be part of more complex phenotype including abnormality in skin or other organ genetic discovery for hair disorder have been recently augmented with the advent of nextgeneration sequencing ng technology we reviewed the literature and summarized diseasegene association for inherited hair disorder a well a genodermatoses presenting with hair abnormality discovered by ng technology we identified 28 nonsyndromic hair disorder involving 25 individual gene and four unidentified gene we have also discovered that approximately 30 of all the genodermatoses that were identified by ng approach demonstrated hair abnormality a part of their phenotype this review underscore the huge impact of ng technology in disclosing the genetics of hair disorder and the potential these discovery provide for future translational research and new therapy

processed_title: occupational skin hazard and prevalence of occupational skin disease in shoe manufacturing worker in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose shoe manufacturing worker are exposed daily to an extensive range of potential physical and chemical occupational hazard shoe manufacturing in indonesia is one of the industrial sector that ha shown sustained growth amongst the newly industrialized country nics in this study we investigated the possible potential exposure of the worker to physical and occupational hazard and determined the prevalence of occupational skin disease at a shoe manufacturing factory in indonesia method a crosssectional study on the observation of the working process and an inventory and risk assessment of exposure to the chemical used classification of chemical a potential sensitizersirritants and qualitative assessment of these chemical were done worker were examined and interviewed using the nordic occupational skin questionnaire2002long result the risk of occupational skin disease osd at the shoe factory wa mainly related to the exposure of the worker skin to potential physical and chemical hazard in hot and humid environmental condition from a total of 514 worker 85 reported current osd and 48 reported a history of osd occupational skin disease were diagnosed in 29 of the worker by dermatologist and 76 had an occupational contact dermatitis ocd of the 39 worker with contact dermatitis 33 consented to being patch tested 14 3 worker showed a positive result and considered a having an occupational allergic contact dermatitis oacd and 25 49 had an occupational irritant contact dermatitis oicd conclusion we observed a repeated and prolonged exposure of the worker to numerous physical and chemical skin hazard at this factory

processed_title: cosmetic application of bee venom
processed_abstract: bee venom bv is a typical toxin secreted by stinger of honeybee worker bv and bv therapy have long been attractive to different culture with extensive study during recent decade nowadays bv is applied to combat several skin disease such a atopic dermatitis acne vulgaris alopecia vitiligo and psoriasis bv is used extensively in topical preparation a cosmetic and used a dressing for wound healing a well a in facemasks nevertheless the safety of bv a a therapeutic choice ha always been a concern due to the immune system reaction in some people due to bv use the documented unfavorable impact is explained by the fact that the skin reaction to bv might expand to excessive immunological response including anaphylaxis that typically resolve over numerous day this review aim to address bee venom therapeutic us in skin cosmetic

processed_title: microclimate and development of pressure ulcer and superficial skin change
processed_abstract: this study aim to evaluate the microclimate and development of pressure ulcer and superficial skin change a prospective cohort study wa conducted in an acute care ward in indonesia risk factor for pressure ulcer and superficial skin change were identified based on the bergstrom braden conceptual model microclimate data were collected every 3 day for 15 day while the development of pressure ulcer and superficial skin change wa observed every day pressure ulcer and superficial skin change were developed in 20 of the 71 participant total mean difference in skin temperature wa higher for patient with pressure ulcer and superficial skin change 09 06 degree c compared with control 06 08 degree c p 0071 binary logistic regression predictor value for pressure ulcer and superficial skin change were 0111 for type of sheet and 0347 for braden scale result in conclusion difference in skin temperature seems to be a predictor for pressure ulcer development and superficial skin change while synthetic fibre sheet are able to maintain a beneficial microclimate

processed_title: a populationbased prevalence survey of skin disease in adolescent and adult in rural sumatra indonesia 1999
processed_abstract: skin disorder are one of the most common presenting health problem and pose a considerable public health problem in developing and developed country a populationbased survey n 917 wa conducted in october and november 1999 to determine the prevalence of skin disease in 3 rural village in indonesia riau province sumatra the overall individual response rate wa 96 household interview were conducted to obtain information on skin condition basic sociodemographic factor and lifestyle habit trained doctor performed a thorough clinical skin examination of each subject in the household the overall prevalence of skin disease in the 3 village wa 282 95 confidence interval 246318 the prevalence of fungal infection 120 wa twice a high a dermatitis 51 a skin condition are common in rural indonesia it is advisable to improve the training of nurse and doctor in the prevention and treatment of skin disorder

processed_title: teledermatology to improve access to and quality of skin care in eastern indonesia
processed_abstract: skin disease are a major public health concern in indonesia although access to specialized care in remote area is limited we initiated a lowcost teledermatology service in sumba a remote island in eastern indonesia eighteen healthcare worker hcws at five primary healthcare center received training to manage common skin disease and submit clinical case beyond their expertise to an online platform submitted case were reviewed by at least one dermatologist diagnostic agreement between hcws and dermatologist wa calculated the hcws participated in a satisfaction survey 2 year after project initiation since october 2020 of 10384 patient presenting with skin complaint in a 24month period 307 3 were submitted for a teledermatology consultation the most frequent skin disease were infection and infestation n 162 528 and eczematous 85 277 and inflammatory 17 55 condition fiftythree patient 173 were diagnosed with a neglected tropical skin disease including leprosy and scabies dermatologist advice wa provided within a median of 50 minute interquartile range 18255 minute with 919 of consultation occurring within 24 hour the diagnostic agreement level between hcws and dermatologist significantly improved over time from 469 in the first 6month period kappa 045 95 ci 037054 to 772 in the last 6month period kappa 076 95 ci 067086 global p 0001 the hcws reported that the teledermatology service wa extremelyvery useful in supporting daily practice 100 and improved their knowledge of skin disease tremendouslya lot 92 teledermatology can improve accessibility and quality of skin service in medically underserved area providing opportunity for scalability and knowledge transfer to frontline hcws

processed_title: skin microbial composition and genetic mutation analysis in precision medicine for epidermolysis bullosa
