processed_abstract: epidermolysis bullosa eb is an inherited skin disease representing a spectrum of rare genetic disorder these condition share the common trait that cause fragile skin resulting in the development of blister and erosion the inheritance follows an autosomal pattern and the array of clinical presentation lead to significant physical suffering considerable morbidity and mortality despite eb having no cure effectively managing eb remains an exceptional challenge due to it rarity and complexity occasionally casting a profound impact on the life of affected individual considering that eb management requires a multidisciplinary approach this sometimes worsens the condition of patient with eb due to inappropriate handling thus more appropriate and precise treatment management of eb is essentially needed advanced technology in medicine and health come into the bioinformatics era including treatment for skin disease omicsbased approach aim to evaluate and handle better disease management and treatment in this work we review several approach regarding the implementation of omicsbased technology including genetics pathogenic mutation skin microbiomics and metagenomics analysis for eb in addition we highlight recent update on the potential of metagenomics analysis in precision medicine for eb

processed_title: panasian adapted esmo clinical practice guideline for the diagnosis staging and treatment of patient with metastatic breast cancer
processed_abstract: the most recent version of the european society for medical oncology esmo clinical practice guideline for the diagnosis staging and treatment of patient with metastatic breast cancer mbc wa published in 2021 a special hybrid guideline meeting wa convened by esmo and the korean society of medical oncology ksmo in collaboration with nine other asian national oncology society in may 2022 in order to adapt the esmo 2021 guideline to take into account the difference associated with the treatment of mbc in asia these guideline represent the consensus opinion reached by a panel of asian expert in the treatment of patient with mbc representing the oncological society of china csco india ismpo indonesia ishmo japan jsmo korea ksmo malaysia mo the philippine psmo singapore sso taiwan tos and thailand tsco the voting wa based on the best available scientific evidence and wa independent of drug access or practice restriction in the different asian country the latter were discussed when appropriate the aim of these guideline is to provide guidance for the harmonisation of the management of patient with mbc across the different region of asia drawing from data provided by global and asian trial whilst at the same time integrating the difference in genetics demographic and scientific evidence together with restricted access to certain therapeutic strategy

processed_title: risk factor of occupational skin disease among traditional batik manufacturing worker in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: objective batik is one of the indonesian traditional art made by decorating fabric using the resist dyeing technique currently batik manufacturing serf a an important source of livelihood in indonesia however the production process of traditional batik involves a range of chemical and some repetitive physical movement making batik production inseparable from physical and chemical hazard which increase the risk of developing occupational skin disease osd this study aimed to identify the risk factor related to osd including occupational contact dermatitis ocd among traditional batik manufacturing worker in yogyakarta indonesia result the study demonstrated that working duration 8 h daily and type of work wet process only were statistically significant a risk factor for developing osd while for ocd our result found that gender male history of atopy and type of work all and wet phase only were risk factor for ocd development among traditional batik manufacturing worker

processed_title: skin property of itching without symptom and associated factor among older adult in longterm care facility
processed_abstract: since itching without rash frequently among older adult population study about skin property of itching without rash is important to develop prevention method therefore this study explored the skin property related to itching without rash and the factor associated with them a correlation predictive design study wa conducted at indonesian longterm care ltc facility skin property including skin barrier function and skin inflammation were examined by photograph macroscopic and microscopic stratum corneum sc hydration skin potential of hydrogen ph and skin blotting itching experience and skincare behavior were obtained by questionnaire the itchingrelated skin property and associated factor were analyzed a total of 405 resident participated in this study with mean age wa 74 year the prevalence of itching on the whole body wa 691 and 503 of those manifesting itching on the left forearm involved itching without macroscopic abnormality itching without rash sc hydration skin ph albumin and nerve growth factor beta ngfbeta were associated with itching without rash p 0007 0012 0001 and 0001 respectively additionally factor associated with skin property were age sex sun exposure experience skincare and hygiene care in the linear regression analysis measurement of skin biomarkers using skin blotting wa a possible objective measurement of itching skin property without rash regardless of the environmental condition

processed_title: hospitalacquired skin and skinstructure infection in covid19 infected patient with prolonged hospitalization
processed_abstract: acute bacterial skin and skinstructure infection absssi is defined in 2013 by the u food and drug administration a a bacterial cellulitiserysipelas major skin abscess and wound infection the infectious disease society of america idsa in 2014 classifies skin and softtissue infection ssti a either nonpurulent which includes cellulitis erysipelas and necrotizing infection or purulent including furuncle carbuncle and abscess among hospitalized patient with ssti healthcareassociated infection account for 735 of all case notably skin and skinstructure infection caused by pseudomonas aeruginosa a common hospital pathogen wa reported to cause higher total cost and longer hospital length of stay compared to nonp aeruginosa case despite causing only approximately 57 of all healthcareassociated sstis infection with p aeruginosa should always be considered in nonhealing skin infection in patient with prolonged hospitalization and antibiotic exposure tissue culture preferably taken by surgical debridement should be promptly performed and when hospitalinfection is suspected appropriate antibiotic should be started along with removal of all devitalized tissue and to promote skin and soft tissue healing expedited discharge should be considered when possible with adequate antibiotic treatment and follow up for definitive wound treatment

processed_title: prevalence and characterisation of staphylococcus aureus causing communityacquired skin and soft tissue infection on java and bali indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to define the role of staphylococcus aureus in community setting among patient with skin and soft tissue infection ssti in indonesia method staphylococcus aureus were cultured from anterior naris throat and wound of 567 ambulatory patient presenting with ssti the meca gene and gene encoding pantonvalentine leukocidin pvl lukfpv and lukspv and exfoliative toxin et eta and etb were determined by pcr clonal relatedness among methicillinresistant s aureus mrsa and pvlpositive s aureus wa analysed using multilocus variablenumber tandemrepeat analysis mlva typing and multilocus sequence typing mlst for a subset of isolates staphylococcal cassette chromosome mec sccmec wa determined for all mrsa isolates moreover determinant for s aureus ssti and pvletpositive v pvletnegative s aureus were assessed result staphylococcus aureus were isolated from ssti wound of 257 453 patient eight 31 of these were mrsa gene encoding pvl and ets were detected in 218 and 175 of methicillinsusceptible s aureus mssa respectively pvlpositive mrsa wa not detected nasopharyngeal s aureus carriage wa an independent determinant for s aureus ssti odds ratio or 18 primary skin infection or 54 and previous antibiotic therapy or 35 were associated with pvlpositive mssa primary skin infection or 22 wa the only factor associated with etpositive mssa mlva typing revealed two more prevalent mssa cluster one st1mrsasccmec type iv isolate and a cluster of st239mrsasccmec type iii were found conclusion communityacquired ssti in indonesia wa frequently caused by pvlpositive mssa and the hospitalassociated st239mrsa may have spread from the hospital into the community

processed_title: inventory of the chemical and the exposure of the worker skin to these at two leather factory in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose tannery worker are exposed to hazardous chemical tannery work is outsourced to newly industrialized country nics where attention into occupational health hazard is limited in this study we investigated the skin exposure to hazardous chemical in tannery worker and determined the prevalence of occupational skin disease osds at tannery in a nic method a crosssectional study on the observation of the working process and an inventory and risk assessment of the chemical used classification of chemical a potential sensitizersirritants and a qualitative assessment of exposure to these chemical worker were examined and interviewed using nordic occupational skin questionnaire2002long result the risk of osds at the investigated tannery wa mainly related to the exposure of the worker skin to chemical in hot and humid environmental condition in 472 worker 12 reported a current osd and 9 reported a history of osd in 10 of all case an osd wa confirmed by a dermatologist and 74 had an occupational contact dermatitis ocd we observed that personal protective equipment ppe used wa mainly because of skin problem in the past and not a a primary protection against osd conclusion we observed a high frequency and prolonged exposure to many skin hazardous factor in tannery work although ppe wa relatively easily available and which wa generally used a a secondary preventative measure the observed pointprevalence in this study wa at the same level a that reported for other highrisk osds in western country and other tannery in nics however the observed pointprevalence in this study wa lower than that reported in india and korea the result of our study and those of other study at tannery from other nics were probably influenced by healthy worker survivor effect hwse

processed_title: phenotype and genotype correlation of inherited epidermolysis bullosa in indonesia
processed_abstract: background inherited epidermolysis bullosa eb is a group of genodermatoses with considerable clinical and genetic heterogeneity clinical diagnosis of the eb subtypes is frequently imprecise and requires confirmation with genetic testing there is still limited study using genetic testing to identify eb subtypes in indonesia this study aim to identify the pathogenic variant of inherited eb patient at the department of dermatology and venereology universitas padjadjarandr hasan sadikin general hospital in bandung west java indonesia and to describe the correlation between the phenotype and genotype of our patient method twelve patient clinically diagnosed with eb were included in this study genetic testing wa performed in collaboration with kk womens and childrens hospital singapore result pathogenic variant were identified in the col7a1 gene in seven patient namely dominant dystrophic eb ddeb with mutation type c5945gt c6218ga recessive dystrophic eb rdeb c2005ct c6081dup c1268ct c1784ct which are all known mutation novel mutation were found in the col7a1 gene in two patient namely ddeb c6253gt and rdeb c6740ct two eb simplex eb patient showed mutation krt14 gene a c356tc c373ct which are known mutation in addition a novel mutation in lama3 gene c2649del wa found in one junctional eb jeb patient conclusion the molecular diagnosis of 12 indonesian eb patient were identified of which three were novel pathogenic variant concordance between the initial clinical diagnosis and genetic testing wa only 33 this demonstrated the importance of early genetic testing for accurate diagnosis prognostication management and genetic counselling

processed_title: identification and characterization of staphylococcus argenteus from indonesia
processed_abstract: background in 2015 staphylococcus argenteus wa reported for the first time a a novel specie of the staphylococcus aureus complex while s argenteus ha been found in many country it presence in indonesia ha not been reported yet our aim is to confirm s argenteus presence in indonesia describe it characteristic and analyze it genomic diversity method the s aureus isolates used in this study were collected from patient with skin and soft tissue infection in indonesia between july 2009 to february 2010 randomly selected isolates were recultured from 80 c degree stock and analyzed using matrixassisted laser desorptionionization time of flight malditof isolates identified a s argenteus s roterodami or s schweitzeri and s aureus with a low score in the malditof analysis were analyzed by a realtime pcr targeting the nuca gene able to identify true s argenteus isolates identified a s argenteus were further characterized by whole genome sequencing vitekr2 biomerieux wa used for antimicrobial susceptibility testing result fifteen isolates were identified a s argenteus with the majority belonging to st2250 two pair of isolates proved to be identical by core genome multilocus sequence typing analysis most isolates were susceptible to all antibiotic tested except for seven isolates 467 that were resistant to benzylpenicillin and one isolate wa resistant to tetracycline 67 the presence of resistance gene blaz and tet45 correlated with these finding notably the sey enterotoxin gene wa prevalent in 80 of the isolates other virulence factor gene were less prevalent plasmid replicon type in s argenteus were also known to s aureus conclusion our study reveals the occurrence of s argenteus in indonesia the diversity within indonesian s argenteus match the global diversity of s argenteus identical isolates between patient indicate potential transmission event a lower prevalence of a broad panel of virulence factor suggests that s argenteus is less virulent than s aureus

processed_title: hazard identification and the prevalence of occupational skin disease in indonesian batik worker
processed_abstract: batik a resistdyeing technique to decorate a special cotton fabric ha been practiced for century in indonesia unfortunately a an informal enterprise batik industry activity lack work safety and health regulation this study aimed to identify potential health hazard including inventorying the chemical to which the worker are exposed the ppe profile and investigating the prevalence of occupational skin disease osd in the batik industry a crosssectional study and an inventory of exposure to the chemical were done in traditional batik workplace in 5 district in yogyakarta province indonesia the chemical were classified a potential sensitizersirritants and the worker were examined and interviewed using the nordic occupational skin questionnaire2002long of 222 traditional batik worker osd were diagnosed in 61 275 worker with occupational contact dermatitis wa the most common osd encountered n 2361 377 allergic contact dermatitis n 723 irritant contact dermatitis n 1623 a smaller portion of other osd wa also encountered including callus miliaria and nail disorder 9 63 and 59 respectively during each step of the traditional batik manufacturing process the worker are exposed to substance that act a irritant andor a potential contact allergen however only onefourth of the worker used ppe regularly particularly during the coloring process and wax removal wet process traditional batik manufacturing process expose the worker to various physical and chemical hazard resulting in a high prevalence of occupational skin disease especially contact dermatitis among the employee

processed_title: inherited skin disorder presenting with poikiloderma
processed_abstract: poikiloderma is a skin condition that combine atrophy telangiectasia and macular pigment change hypo a well a hyperpigmentation it is often mistaken for mottled pigmentation by general practitioner or nondermatology specialist poikiloderma can be a key presenting symptom of rothmundthomson syndrome rts dyskeratosis congenita dc hereditary sclerosing poikiloderma hsp hereditary fibrosing poikiloderma with tendon contracture myopathy and pulmonary fibrosis poiktmp xeroderma pigmentosum xp bloom syndrome b kindler syndrome k and clericuziotype poikiloderma with neutropenia pn in these condition poikiloderma start early in life usually before the second or third year they may also be associated with photosensitivity and other significant multiorgan manifestation developed later in life poikiloderma could indicate the presence of a genetic disorder with potentially serious consequence poikiloderma almost always precedes more severe manifestation of these genodermatoses prompt diagnosis at the time of presentation could help to prevent complication and mitigate the course of the disease this review discusses these to help the practicing clinician manage patient presenting with the symptom to further facilitate early recognition this paper also proposes a simple diagnostic algorithm

processed_title: the frequency and clinicopathological significance of nra mutation in primary cutaneous nodular melanoma in indonesia
processed_abstract: background melanoma is a lethal skin malignancy with a high risk of metastasis which prompt a need for research on treatment target and prognostic factor recent study show that the presence of neuroblastoma ra viral oncogene homolog nra mutation can influence cell growth in melanoma the nra mutation which stimulates the mitogenactivated protein kinase mapk signaling pathway is associated with a lower survival rate however evidence from indonesia population is still very rare further understanding of the role of nra mutation in indonesian melanoma case will be crucial in developing new management strategy for melanoma patient with nra mutation aim to explore the frequency of nra mutation and their clinicopathological association in patient with primary nodular cutaneous melanoma in central java and yogyakarta indonesia method and result fiftyone paraffinembedded tissue sample were collected from primary nodular skin melanoma case between 2011 and 2019 from the two largest referral hospital in yogyakarta and central java indonesia the nra mutation status wa evaluated using qualitative realtime polymerase chain reaction qrtpcr the association of nra mutation wa analyzed with the following age gender location lymph node metastasis ulceration mitotic index tumorinfiltrating lymphocyte tils necrosis tumor thickness lymphovascular invasion lvi and tumor size nra mutation were detected in 10 196 sample and predominantly observed 60 in exon 2 g12 these mutation were significantly correlated with lymph node metastasis p 000 however they were not associated with other variable analyzed in this study conclusion the prevalence of nra mutation in primary nodular cutaneous melanoma case from indonesia is consistent with previous study and is significantly associated with increased lymph node metastasis however the predominant mutation detected in exon 2 g12 is different from previous study conducted in other country this suggests that melanoma case in javanese people have different characteristic from other ethnicity

processed_title: validity of skin blot examination for albumin and nerve growth factor beta to detect itching of the skin in indonesian older adult
processed_abstract: aim itching a common skin disorder impact the quality of life of individual itchy skin occurs more with increasing age and the prediction of itchy skin prognosis is necessary to provide good skincare this study validated biomarkers in skin blotting to identify and measure itching sensation a well a conventional method to measure skin barrier function material and method from a crosssectional study conducted in longterm care ltc facility in indonesia itching symptom were obtained through a questionnaire skin condition were assessed using photograph stratum corneum sc hydration skin ph and skin blotting for biomarkers albumin interleukin 2 il2 nerve growth factor beta ngfbeta and thymic stromal lymphopoietin tslp association of skin measurement with the presence of skin blotting and trend analysis were conducted result altogether 564 ltc resident average age 70 year participated the sc hydration skin ph albumin and ngfbeta were associated with the presence of itch p value 0001 0001 0001 and 0001 respectively the signal level of skin blotting biomarkers were higher in itch group than in the nonitch group additionally the higher quantile of sc hydration wa significantly associated with a lower intensity level of ngfbeta and tslp p value 0005 0003 respectively the lower quantile of skin ph better skin condition wa significantly associated with lower albumin ngfbeta and tslp p value 0048 0035 and 0001 respectively conclusion the albumin ngfbeta and tslp could be a candidate for measurement of itchy skin among older adult with disrupted skin barrier function and local skin inflammation

processed_title: the role of moisturizers in addressing various kind of dermatitis a review
processed_abstract: moisturizer is a major component of basic daily skin care particularly in presence of epidermal barrier alteration and reduced epidermal water content it is an important part of a dermatologist strategy to maintain skin health a well a treating various dermatosis which coexist with skin dryness and are linked to impaired skin barrier function such a in atopic disorder a well a other type of dermatitis mastering the knowledge regarding mechanism of action application dosage adverse effect a well a specific clinical usage of moisturizers is a must for a dermatologist in order to support their use particularly for evidencebased therapeutic purpose this review discusses the use of moisturizer both for skin health maintenance a well a a definitive or adjuvant therapy for many kind of dermatitis

processed_title: quercetin a a therapeutic agent for skin problem a systematic review and metaanalysis on antioxidant effect oxidative stress inflammation wound healing hyperpigmentation aging and skin cancer
processed_abstract: quercetin is abundant in plant and ha notable pharmacological property for skin health this review aim to comprehensively evaluate the effect of quercetin on skinrelated issue adhering to the prisma guideline and analyzing study from sciencedirect web of science scopus and pubmed of the 1398 study identified 65 study met the criterion for metaanalysis the metaanalysis indicated that quercetin had powerful antioxidant property protecting against oxidative stress by significantly lowering level of mda zscore 251 ro zscore 381 and lpo zscore 446 and enhancing enzyme of gsh zscore 546 cat zscore 520 and sod zscore 437 quercetin acted a an antiinflammatory by significantly suppressing protein regulator such a nfkappabeta ap1 and mapks erk and jnk cytokine of tnfalpha il6 il1beta il8 and mcp1 and enzyme of cox2 inos and mpo while upregulating the cytokine il10 additionally quercetin significantly suppressed il4 zscore 316 and ifngamma zscore 376 cytokine involved in chronic inflammation of atopic dermatitis quercetin also supported wound healing by significantly decreasing inflammatory cell zscore 560 and enhancing fibroblast distribution zscore 598 epithelialization zscore 857 collagen production zscore 420 and angiogenesis factor of mvd zscore 566 and vegf zscore 386 furthermore quercetin significantly inhibited tyrosinase activity zscore 195 resulting in a significantly reduced melanin content zscore 256 a significant reduction in dna damage zscore 327 melanoma cell viability zscore 297 and tumor formation wa also observed to ensure the promising activity of quercetin for skin issue this review highlight quercetins potential a a multifaceted agent in skin care and treatment

processed_title: potential cosmetic active ingredient derived from marine byproduct
processed_abstract: the market demand for marinebased cosmetic ha shown a tremendous growth rate in the last decade marine resource represent a promising source of novel bioactive compound for new cosmetic ingredient development however concern about sustainability also becomes an issue that should be considered in developing cosmetic ingredient the fishery industry eg fishing farming and processing generates large amount of leftover containing valuable substance which are potent source of cosmeceutical ingredient several bioactive substance could be extracted from the marine byproduct that can be utilized a a potent ingredient to develop cosmetic product those bioactive substance eg collagen from fish waste and chitin from crustacean waste could be utilized a antiphotoaging antiwrinkle skin barrier and hair care product from this perspective this review aim to approach the potential active ingredient derived from marine byproduct for cosmetic and discus the possible activity of those active ingredient in promoting human beauty in addition this review also cover the prospect and challenge of using marine byproduct toward the emerging concept of sustainable blue cosmetic

processed_title: role of centella asiatica and ceramide in skin barrier improvement a double blind clinical trial of indonesian batik worker
processed_abstract: objective batik dye contain irritant chemical that increase the risk of skin barrier disruption this study aim to determine the effect of centella asiatica and ceramide in transepidermal water loss tewl hydration of the stratum corneum and skin acidity ph method this wa a double blind clinical trial of 30 indonesian batik worker who suffered from skin dryness but had no clinical manifestation of contact dermatitis subject were given cream containing c asiatica or ceramide that formulated and randomly labeled by manufacturer pt paragon technology and innovation both subject and researcher were blinded to the type of the cream cream wa applied to the hand and arm twice a day biological function of the skin tewl stratum corneum hydration level and skin acidity wa examined by cutometer dual mp580 baseline wa recorded in the first examination followed by second and third examination at two and four week after treatment result after four week treatment there were significant improvement of c asiatica application in evaluation of corneometer palmar p0007 ci 95 corneometer dorsum p0001 ci 95 and skin acidity dorsum p0017 ci 95 ceramide application also gave significant improvement of corneometer palmar 0038 ci 95 skin acidity palmar p0001 ci 95 tewl dorsum p0023 ci 95 corneometer dorsum p0002 ci 95 and skin acidity dorsum p0011 ci 95 there were no significant difference of c asiatica effectiveness compared to ceramide in skin barrier improvement conclusion c asiatica and ceramide can improve skin barrier hydration in order to prevent the risk of contact dermatitis in batik worker

processed_title: survivor experience in fighting breast cancer
processed_abstract: considering that breast cancer diagnosis affect a woman physically and emotionally treatment during the therapy phase requires enthusiasm therefore this study aim to explore breast cancer survivor experience with treatment a qualitative methodology wa used while the data were collected with indepth interview and analyzed using interpretative phenomenological analysis the study sample included up to five individual who met the inclusion criterion of having stage iii breast cancer for longer than 5 year without metastasis and were obtained using the purposive sampling technique two theme emerged from the interview data namely the past event and the psychological state of breast cancer patient there were four subthemes under the overall theme of the event including risk factor for breast cancer symptom extensive therapy and preventing metastasis meanwhile the psychological state theme contained six subthemes including rejection and anger against diagnosis despair embracing the disease selfconcept and stress before beginning treatment patient implicitly expect clinician to provide them with a thorough explanation of how chemotherapy work based on the result it can be concluded that supporting and empowering breast cancer patient is a struggle for caregiver and healthcare professional

processed_title: effect of interface pressure and skin surface temperature on pressure injury incidence a turning schedule pilot study
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to evaluate the interface pressure and skin surface temperature in relation to the incidence of pressure injury pi using three different turning schedule method this wa a pilot study with a threearmed randomised clinical trial design participant at risk of pi and treated in the high dependency care unit in a regional hospital in makassar indonesia participated in this study patient were repositioned at three different turning schedule two three and fourhourly interval interface pressure measurement and skin surface temperature were measured between 1400 and 1800 every three day the incidence of pi wa assessed during the twoweek observation period result a total of 44 participant took part in the study a oneway anova test revealed no difference in interface pressure among the three different turning schedule group within two week of observation day zero p056 day four p095 day seven p056 day 10 p063 and day 14 p092 although the average periumbilical temperature and skin surface temperature were not significant p005 comparison between these observation site wa significant on all observation day p005 regarding the incidence of pi the proportional hazard test for the development of pi in the three group wa considered not different hazard ratio 146 95 confidence interval 043487 p054 conclusion no difference in interface pressure and incidence of pi on the three turning schedule wa observed however there wa a potential increase in skin surface temperature in comparison with periumbilical temperature for all three turning schedule

processed_title: alarming burden of triplenegative breast cancer in india
processed_abstract: breast cancer is the most prevalent cancer among woman worldwide among the different breast cancer subtypes triplenegative breast cancer tnbc which is more prevalent among younger age woman is the most aggressive form numerous clinicopathologic study performed throughout the world strongly support the utterly poor prognosis and high recurrence rate of tnbc the present report detail a thorough data survey from google and pubmed on the burden of tnbc worldwide and other associated factor with special emphasis on it ever increasing incidence among indian woman our analysis revealed that the proportion of tnbc range from 67 to 279 in different country with the highest reported percentage in india among all followed by indonesia algeria and pakistan most of the other country netherlands italy london germany had a tnbc incidence less than the mean level ie 15 the high incidence of tnbc in the indian population is associated with vivid risk factor which primarily include lifestyle deprivation status obesity family history high mitotic index and brca1 mutation the treatment of tnbc is greatly hampered due to the lack of targeted therapy hence it requires earnest attention towards extensive research for the prevention and development of treatment modality with high efficacy

processed_title: prevalence of the hlacw6 genotype and zinc deficiency in psoriasis vulgaris patient in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction psoriasis vulgaris is an immunemediated inflammatory disease influenced by genetic and immunologic factor including micronutrient deficiency the hlacw6 gene and zinc level have been separately studied in psoriasis patient yielding inconsistent finding a descriptive study regarding hlacw6 allele expression zinc level and their direct correlation in indonesia is lacking method this prospective casecontrol study involved 33 psoriasis patient and 33 age and sexmatched control patient at the dermatology clinic affiliated with hasanuddin university in south sulawesi in 2021 case were classified into mild moderate and severe psoriasis according to psoriasis area and severity index pasi score an edta tube wa used to take a 5 ml blood sample followed by analysis for pcr of the hlacw6 allele and a colorimetric assay to measure zinc level statistical analysis wa performed to determine the association between hlacw6 and zinc level and psoriasis disease severity result among the 33 psoriatic patient enrolled in this study three 91 of the case were classified a mild psoriasis 10 303 were classified a moderate psoriasis and 20 606 were classified a severe psoriasis the hlacw6 allele wa detected in 939 of psoriasis case and in 3 of control patient p 0001 the hlacw6 allele wa detected consecutively in 667 900 and 100 of mild moderate and severe psoriasis patient respectively zinc level were lower in psoriasis patient compared to control 1685 355 v 1374 378 mumoll severe psoriasis patient exhibited the lowest average zinc level 1476 140 mumoll 1548 420 mumoll and 1272 356 mumoll in mild moderate and severe patient respectively the mean zinc level in hlacw6positive patient wa 1368 mumoll and 146 mumoll in hlacw6negative patient p 0495 conclusion the study revealed the presence of hlacw6 allele expression and decreased serum zinc level in psoriasis patient compared to control both factor demonstrated association with psoriasis disease severity

processed_title: skin disease profile in geriatric inpatient at a tertiary referral hospital
processed_abstract: background elderly people are susceptible to various skin disease to monitor disease trend in the geriatric population epidemiologic data on skin disease are essential however study on skin disease in geriatric patient in indonesia particularly those who are hospitalised are limited therefore this retrospective study aim to determine the skin disease profile in geriatric patient at a tertiary referral hospital in indonesia method the subject were all geriatric inpatient who were consulted at the department of dermatology and venereology dr cipto mangunkusumo national general hospital between 2017 and 2019 the patient were analysed according to sex age and comorbidities they were divided into 15 group according to the disease chisquare test or fisher exact test wa used to compare categorical variable result the most common skin disease were infection 358 dermatitis 218 ulcer 128 agerelated skin change 84 and vascular disease 53 dermatitis wa significantly more common in male p 005 whereas infection were significantly more common in female p 005 conclusion consistent with previous study our inpatient data showed that infection were significantly more common in female whereas dermatitis wa significantly more common in male the data collected may contribute to epidemiologic data on skin disease in the geriatric population

processed_title: clindamycin and cloxacillin compared in the treatment of skin and softtissue infection
processed_abstract: the subject were 61 patient with skin or softtissue infection treated at the cipto mangunkusumo general hospital in jakarta indonesia the patient aged 15 to 59 year 40 female 21 male were randomly assigned to receive 300 mg of clindamycin or 500 mg of cloxacillin orally thrice daily for seven day on day 8 the infection were cured in seven of the 31 clindamycintreated patient and in three of the 30 cloxacillintreated patient on day 15 27 of the clindamycin group and 18 of the cloxacillin group were cured four clindamycintreated patient and 11 cloxacillintreated patient were improved and one cloxacillintreated patient failed the betweengroup difference were not statistically significant pretreatment positive culture were obtained in 40 patient including staphylococcus aureus in 24 group a betahemolytic streptococci in five and a combination of s aureus and betahemolytic streptococci in four side effect were reported by three clindamycintreated patient gastric upset nausea and headache and one cloxacillintreated patient nausea abnormal change in laboratory test result from before to after treatment were noted in both patient group and were probably not attributable to either drug it is concluded that clindamycin is a safe and effective agent in the treatment of skin and softtissue infection

processed_title: risk factor for sebaceous gland disease and their relationship to gastrointestinal dysfunction in han adolescent
processed_abstract: sebaceous gland disease are a group of common dermatological disease with multiple cause to date a systematic report of the risk factor for sebaceous gland disease in adolescent ha not been published the aim of this study wa to assess the prevalence and risk factor for certain sebaceous gland disease seborrhea seborrheic dermatitis acne androgenetic alopecia and rosacea and their relationship to gastrointestinal dysfunction in adolescent from augustoctober 20022005 a questionnaire survey wa carried out to obtain epidemiological data about sebaceous gland disease using random cluster sampling 13 215 han adolescent aged 1220 year were recruited from four country or district macau guangzhou china malaysia and indonesia the statistical software spss ver 130 wa used to analyze the data the prevalence of seborrhea seborrheic dermatitis acne androgenetic alopecia and rosacea wa 2827 1017 5103 165 and 097 respectively based on multivariate logistic regression analysis the risk factor for sebaceous gland disease included age duration of local residency halitosis gastric reflux abdominal bloating constipation sweet food spicy food family history of acne late night sleeping on a daily basis excessive axillary body and facial hair excessive periareolar hair and anxiety there wa a statistically significant difference in the prevalence of gastrointestinal symptom halitosis gastric reflux abdominal bloating constipation between patient with and without sebaceous gland disease chi2 150743 p 0000 gastrointestinal dysfunction is an important risk factor for disease of the sebaceous gland and is correlated with their occurrence and development

processed_title: depression and anxiety in patient with type 2 diabetes in indonesia and malaysia do age diabetes duration foot ulcer and prescribed medication play a role
processed_abstract: patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm are susceptible to mental health issue impacting medication adherence and diabetes control this study aimed to evaluate factor associated with depression and anxiety among t2dm patient in indonesia and malaysia a crosssectional study wa conducted in indonesia and malaysia from october 2022 to april 2023 among t2dm patient the study utilised an instrument with patient and disease data and three validated tool to assess depression anxiety and medication adherence statistical analysis including binary logistic regression wa performed using spssr version 28 software a study of 606 t2dm patient revealed that 565 were at risk of depression while 416 were at risk of anxiety older patient with t2dm had lower rate of depression aor 041 025068 and anxiety than younger patient normalweight patient were less likely to experience depression and anxiety aor 044 027072 than overweight patient patient without diabetic foot ulcer had a lower risk of depression aor 034 021055 and anxiety than those with foot ulcer patient with a shorter duration of diabetes had a higher risk of depression aor 327 170630 and anxiety than those with a longer duration patient on insulinbased regimen had higher rate of depression and anxiety aor 228 120430 than those on metforminbased regimen nonadherent patient were more likely to experience depression and anxiety aor 430 222832 than patient who adhered to their medication the prevalence of depression and anxiety is concerning and influenced by factor such a age diabetes duration the presence of diabetic foot ulcer and the prescribed medication regimen further effort are necessary to enhance the mental health of t2dm patient and improve management outcome

processed_title: ginger potency on the prevention and treatment of breast cancer
processed_abstract: background cancer is a type of disease caused by the uncontrolled growth of abnormal cell that can destroy body tissue the use of traditional medicine naturally us plant from ginger with the maceration method the ginger plant is a herbaceous flowering plant with the zingiberaceacea group method this study us the literature review method by reviewing 50 article from journal and database result a review of several article namely ginger ha bioactive component such a gingerol ginger is used a a treatment in complementary therapy using plant ginger is a strategy with many benefit and function a a nutritional complement to the body this benefit ha shown the effect of antiinflammatory antioxidant and anticancer against nausea and vomiting due to chemotherapy in breast cancer conclusion anticancer in ginger is shown by polyphenols associated with antimetastatic antiproliferative antiangiogenic antiinflammatory cell cycle arrest apoptosis and autophagy therefore consuming ginger regularly affect natural herbal therapy with the prevention and treatment of breast cancer and serf a a prevention against the effect of chemotherapy

processed_title: the use of autologous serum in dermatology
processed_abstract: autologous serum is a component taken from patient blood after centrifugation to be used for the same patient lately growth factor gf found in plateletrich plasma prp ha been widely used a an alternative therapeutic modality in various medical field the benefit of using autologous serum effectively include reduced risk of hypersensitivity or allergic reaction a well a the reduced risk of transmission of infectious disease however in practice the availability of product with gf is still limited this study aimed to review the latest evidence of using autologous serum therapy in dermatology we searched and screened the study paper of past 5 year 2015 2020 through pubmed medline for the following topic risk and benefit of autologous serum in the field of dermatology the initial search obtained 333 paper of which only 14 met the inclusion criterion these included five paper on dermatology seven on ophthalmology and one paper each on plastic surgery and orthopedics prp serum contains gf vitamin hormone and other component gf contained in prp is an effective therapeutic modality to be used in dermatology for wound healing skin rejuvenation acne scar and androgenic alopecia skinmed 20222097104

processed_title: correlation between interstitial lung disease morphology score based on highresolution computed tomography chest and skin fibrosis degree based on modified rodnans skin score on systemic sclerosis
processed_abstract: background systemic sclerosis ssc is a systemic autoimmune disease involving a multisystem modified rodnans skin score mrs is a gold standard for measuring skin fibrosis in ssc in ssc lung fibrosis disorder especially interstitial lung disease ild are the leading cause of mortality and often late in diagnosis highresolution computed tomography hrct chest scan is a gold standard for evaluating ild morphology but it availability is limited the degree of skin fibrosis based on mrs in ssc can predict the presence of ild in several study but ha not been widely studied in indonesia this study aimed to determine the relationship of the ild morphology based on thoracic hrct scan with the degree of skin fibrosis based on mrs in ssc method this study is a retrospective analytic observational study with a crosssectional design the subject of this study are ssc patient who had data of mrs and hrct chest scan from july 2019 to march 2020 statistical analysis us spearmans correlation test result there were 42 study subject consisting of 41 woman 976 and one man 24 with an average age of 3950 year old age range of 19 year to 60 year old correlation test result based on spearmans show a moderate correlation between the morphological score of ild with mrs with r 0429 which is significant p 0005 conclusion there is a significant moderate correlation between the morphological score of ild based on hrct chest and the degree of skin fibrosis based on mrs in ssc

processed_title: disentangling the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus close tie between immunological genetic and environmental factor
processed_abstract: systemic lupus erythematosus sle is a systemic autoimmune disease that attack various organ system with a variety of clinical implication ranging from mild skin and mucosal manifestation to severe central nervous system manifestation and death case of sle have been documented nearly two century ago when scholar used the term erythema centrifugum and seborrhea congestiva to describe the discoid skin lesion and the butterfly or malar rash in sle since then knowledge about this disease ha developed rapidly especially knowledge related to the underlying pathogenesis of sle to date it is known that immune system dysregulation supported by genetic and environmental predisposition can trigger the occurrence of sle in a group of susceptible individual various inflammatory mediator cytokine and chemokines a well a intra and intercellular signaling pathway are involved in the pathogenesis of sle in this review we will discus the molecular and cellular aspect of sle pathogenesis with a focus on how the immune system genetics and the environment interact and trigger the various clinical manifestation of sle

processed_title: application of forward selection strategy using c45 algorithm to improve the accuracy of classification data set
processed_abstract: the purpose of this study is to improve the classification accuracy of the c45 algorithm utilizing the forward selection technique breast cancer from the uci machine learning repository is the dataset utilized there are 286 record in the dataset with nine attribute and one class label the suggested model wa evaluated with two existing classification model c45 and naive bayes using the rapidminer program the procedure consists of multiple stage the first of which consists of selecting the dominant trait using the feature selection technique weight by information gain the second step is forward selection based on the outcome of feature selection before processing the dataset is separated into training and testing half where the ratio of comparison are 7030 8020 and 9010 the final step is examining the output the experimental result demonstrate that the forward selection methodology employing the c45 c45 f method outperforms the c45 and naive bayes classification technique c45 f split data 7030 ha an accuracy value of 7674 c45 f split data 8020 ha an accuracy value of 7895 c45 f split data 9010 ha an accuracy value of 7857 c45 split data 7030 ha an accuracy value of 6512 and naive bayes split data is 7030 ha an accuracy value 8555 in comparison to typical classification algorithm c45 and naive bayes the average accuracy value increased by 1297 and 832 respectively in term of precision recall and fmeasure the forward selection strategy utilizing the c45 method beat all other classification technique achieving 7984 9250 and 8555 respectively in addition the result demonstrated an increase in the average area under curve auc from 0628 to 0732 therefore it can be inferred that the forward selection strategy can be applied to the breast cancer data set in order to increase the accuracy value of classification method c45

processed_title: ethnobotanical us of neem azadirachta indica ajuss meliaceae leaf in bali indonesia and the indian subcontinent in relation with historical background and phytochemical property
processed_abstract: ethnopharmacological relevance neem azadirachta indica meliaceae is widely known for it cold pressed seed oil mainly used a insecticide but also for cosmetic medicinal and agricultural us the seed oil is widely employed in the indian subcontinent and the leaf seem to have a lower relevance but the ethnobotanical information of bali indonesia considers the utilisation of leaf for medicinal property aim of the study we report ethnopharmacological information about current us of neem in particular of the leaf besides the insecticidal one we discus on the historical background of their us material and method ethnobotanical data were collected using both literature and scientific reference and semistructured interview with 50 informant age ranged between 14 and 76 year old through the snowball method in thirteen aga indigenous balinese village following ethic code procedure the informant were asked to specify which part of the plant wa used and how that plant part wa used plant specimen were collected identified and made into herbarium voucher in consideration of the high variability and complex chemical constituent of neem a hptlc analysis of neem leaf coming from both the indonesian island of bali and the indian subcontinent wa carried out result the data on the medical use of traditional preparation from leaf of neem display a wide spectrum of application in the indian subcontinent neem leaf are used to treat dental and gastrointestinal disorder malaria fever skin disease and a insect repellent while the balinese used neem leaf a a diuretic and for diabetes headache heartburn and stimulating the appetite difference in utilisation can not be related to chemical difference and other constituent besides limonoids must be investigated and related to the multipurpose activity of neem conclusion this study revealed that neem leaf are believed to treat diabetes in both balinese and indian community limonoids can not be considered the only responsible of digestive property further research would be the validation of this report by enzymatic test and the identification of active constituent

processed_title: the catalogue of the westhoff collection of chinese materia medica c 1870 evidence of interaction between a chinese medicine practitioner and the dutch in indonesia
processed_abstract: ethnopharmacological relevance the westhoff collection of chinese materia medica c 1870 at the utrecht university museum in utrecht the netherlands contains an original handwritten catalogue which wa putatively ascribed to a chinese medicine practitioner it provides a detailed record of the chinese name plant part preparation and application of the specimen contained in glass bottle which probably reflects the physician personal interpretation of chinese medicine in indonesia at the end of the 19th century such individual catalogue can reveal historical change and regional variation in the use of traditional chinese medicine which can lead to a better understanding of the history and development of this field aim of the study we addressed the following question 1 what are the content of the westhoff catalogue 2 what medicinal preparation and application were recorded in the catalogue and which one are dominant 3 how similar is the use of chinese materia medica in westhoff catalogue compared to the modern chinese pharmacopeia 4 what other specific information is contained in the westhoff catalogue material and method the catalogue had been digitized previously and all handwritten dutch text ha been transcribed and translated into english the information for each entry wa summarized and analyzed the medicinal application were compared to modern chinese pharmacopeia or other monograph on chinese materia medica result the catalogue contains 436 entry for which 395 corresponding specimen still exist in the westhoff collection of chinese materia medica each entry contains a serial number a chinese name a phonetic dutch transcription of the chinese name a description of the plant animal or mineral origin of the medicinal product the preparation method and the medical indication for which it should be used the dominant preparation method is decoction 79 of the entry the most frequently mentioned application are fever skin disease strengthening and wound around 80 of the medicinal application in the catalogue were also listed for the same cmm in modern monograph the catalogue also shed light on typical characteristic of popular medicine their geographic origin and social aspect of traditional chinese medicine in indonesia around 1870 conclusion the westhoff catalogue is a valuable record of chinese materia medica and it practice in a specific time and space it reflects an individual physician interpretation of chinese medicine show the difficulty in the interpretation of culturalbound health issue between the dutch and the chinese and provides evidence that traditional chinese medicine spread not only in east asia but also to the distant western world

processed_title: braf and nra mutation and the association with prognosis of acral lentiginous and nodular melanoma in indonesia
processed_abstract: background melanoma are rare yet the most aggressive skin cancer among asian clinical presentation risk factor and the underlying molecular mechanism are strikingly different from cutaneous melanoma in caucasian method mutation pattern of braf and nra gene were examined from dna derived from primary melanoma tumor tissue fresh tissue or formalinfixed paraffinembedded sample using pyrosequencing result a total of 63 patient consisting of acral lentiginous melanoma n22 349 and nodular melanoma n41 651 were included in this study most patient were diagnosed at stage iiiiv n49 778 breslow thickness more than 4 mm n51 809 presence of ulceration n35 556 diameter larger than 6 mm n61 968 regional node infiltration n41 778 braf and nra mutation were found in 28 444 and 8 127 respectively braf and nra mutation were significantly associated with older melanoma patient or 6075 95ci 201318333 dan or 13263 95ci 1518115901 respectively braf mutation were associated with lower overall survival median survival were 165 v 314 month logrank test p0001 nra mutation were not significantly associated with lower overall survival conclusion in this study melanoma patient are largely diagnosed at the late stage with ulceration and involvement of regional lymph node braf mutation are associated with lower survival of cutaneous melanoma patient

processed_title: chronic kidney diseaseassociated pruritus in patient undergoing hemodialysis xerosis and topical therapy
processed_abstract: chronic kidney diseaseassociated pruritus ckdap is a common and distressing symptom for patient with ckd and a difficult challenge for nephrologists and dermatologist recent result showed the multifactorial nature of the pathophysiology and therapeutic trial were only successful in certain subset of patient the clinical manifestation are varied with xerosis being the most common dermatological manifestation and correlated with the intensity of ckdap a better understanding of the pathophysiology of xerosis in ckdap and appropriate topical treatment could correct xerosis to reduce the intensity of ckdap and improve the patient quality of life

processed_title: southeast asia study alliance guideline on the management of acne vulgaris in southeast asian patient
processed_abstract: the management of acne in southeast asia is unique a asian skin and local variable require a clinical approach unlike that utilized in other part of the world there are different treatment guideline per country in the region and a group of leading dermatologist from these country convened to review these guideline discus current practice and recent advance and formulate consensus guideline to harmonize the management of acne vulgaris in the region emphasis ha been placed on formulating recommendation to impede the development of antibiotic resistance in propionibacterium acne the group adopted the acne consensus conference system for grading acne severity the group recommends that patient may be treated with topical medication including retinoids benzoyl peroxide bpo salicylic acid a combination of retinoid and bpo or a combination of retinoids and bpo with or without antibiotic for mild acne topical retinoid with topical bpo and a oral antibiotic for moderate acne and oral isotretinoin if the patient fails firstline treatment a 6 or 8week trial of combined oral antibiotic and topical retinoids with bpo for severe acne maintenance acne treatment using topical retinoids with or without bpo is recommended to prevent the development of antibiotic resistance topical antibiotic should not be used a monotherapy or used simultaneously with oral antibiotic skin care comprised of cleansing moisturizing and sun protection is likewise recommended patient education and good communication is recommended to improve adherence and advice should be given about the characteristic of the skin care product patient should use

processed_title: analysis of internet search using google trend to measure interest in sun protection and skin cancer in selected southeast asian population
processed_abstract: background analysis of internet search trend ha been performed to evaluate interest in sun protection artificial tanning and skin cancer among the public particularly in western country this observational study aimed to investigate the relative popularity of search term relating to sun protection sunburn skin cancer and tanning used in google trendsr in three southeast asian country malaysia singapore and indonesia method the relevant search term were queried using the google trendsr in each location and worldwide the search volume index were compared between location and over a time period from january 1 2004 to january 31 2019 correlation between sunblock and sunburn a well a sunblock and search term relating to skin cancer skin cancer melanoma basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma were evaluated result the favored search term relating to sun protection in this region wa sunblock despite the term itself being a misnomer the relative popularity of search for sunblock also showed an increase over time and wa generally higher compared with interest in sunburn skin cancer and artificial tanning practice positive correlation were noted between sunblock and sunburn in malaysia and sunblock and melanoma in singapore conclusion insight into search trend may assist public health promotion to raise awareness regarding sun protection and skin cancer in the region by targeting commonly used term for each geographical location

processed_title: panasian adapted esmo clinical practice guideline for the diagnosis treatment and followup of patient with early breast cancer
processed_abstract: the european society for medical oncology esmo clinical practice guideline for the diagnosis treatment and followup of patient with early breast cancer were updated and published online in 2023 and adapted according to previously established standard methodology to produce the panasian adapted paga esmo consensus guideline for the management of asian patient with early breast cancer the adapted guideline presented in this manuscript represent the consensus opinion reached by a panel of asian expert in the treatment of patient with breast cancer representing the oncological society of china csco indonesia ishmo india ismpo japan jsmo korea ksmo malaysia mo the philippine psmo singapore sso taiwan tos and thailand tsco coordinated by esmo and ksmo the voting wa based on scientific evidence and wa independent of the current treatment practice drug access restriction and reimbursement decision in the different asian region represented by the 10 oncological society the latter are discussed separately in the manuscript the aim is to provide guidance for the optimisation and harmonisation of the management of patient with early breast cancer across the different region of asia drawing on the evidence provided by both western and asian trial whilst respecting the difference in screening practice molecular profiling a well a the age and stage at presentation attention is drawn to the disparity in the drug approval and reimbursement strategy between the different region of asia

processed_title: exfoliative dermatitis due to dermatophytosis
processed_abstract: exfoliative dermatitis ed or erythroderma is defined a diffuse erythema and scaling of the skin involving more than 90 of the total body skin surface which can be caused by variety of systemic and cutaneous disease such a infection including dermatophytosis dermatophytosis is a superficial fungal infection of keratinized tissue caused by dermatophytes there are only few case report of ed due to dermatophytosis in literature a 39yearold male present with history of diffuse erythematous macule and scale almost on entire body due to dermatophytosis wa reported the diagnosis of dermatophytosis wa confirmed by direct microscopic examination fungal culture and histopathological examination patient wa treated with 2 ketoconazole shampoo and two pulse of 1week of 200 mg itraconazole twice a day for each month clinical improvement wa showed on the 7th day of observation characterized by decreasing of erythematous macule and scale mycological and clinical improvement were obtained on the 29th day of observation the etiology of ed should be determined in order to give an appropiate treatment

processed_title: vogtkoyanagiharada syndrome
processed_abstract: background vogtkoyanagiharada syndrome is rare in the netherlands however in asia it is one of the most common cause of panuveitis the syndrome is characterised by a combination of panuveitis pleocytosis in cerebral spinal fluid with or without neurological function loss alopecia and depigmentation of body hair case description a 40yearold male with no previous medical history visited the emergency department with unexplained bilateral visual symptom and optic disc swelling in addition to the latter further test only showed pleocytosis in cerebral spinal fluid in the month following the initial presentation vision wa restored but the patient developed panuveitis extensive depigmentation and loss of body hair on further investigation the patient reported having a greatgrandfather from indonesia conclusion vogtkoyanagiharada syndrome should be considered in patient of asian descent presenting with panuveitis alopecia and depigmentation of body hair early diagnosis and treatment can prevent permanent visual injury

processed_title: combination of adiposederived stem cell conditioned medium and minoxidil for hair regrowth in male androgenetic alopecia a randomized doubleblind clinical trial
processed_abstract: introduction treatment for aga have yet to produce satisfactory outcome and may cause intolerable side effect recent study have reported that adipose tissuederived stem cell conditioned medium adsccm could induce hair growth and regeneration objective to investigate the efficacy of adsccm combined with minoxidil for hair regeneration therapy in male aga method this study lasted for 6 week subject were divided into two group concentrated and nonconcentrated adsccm scalp wa divided vertically in half before intradermal injection wa administered from the frontal region of the scalp toward the vertex with a 30g needle spaced about 1 cm apart treatment side received 2 ml of adsccm the other side wa given 2 ml of nacl 09 a placebo patient applied 5 minoxidil twice daily postinjection improvement were assessed using photograph and trichoscan every 2 week result hair count hair density and mean thickness increased significantly on both side after 6 week while vellus rate decreased proportionally with the increase of terminal rate no statistically significant difference between treatment group were found minimum side effect were reported and subject were satisfied with the result conclusion combination of adsccm and minoxidil could be a potential agent for hair regrowth followup research with extensive population longer duration and different study design may be required to confirm the exact mechanism of adsccm on hair growth trial registration clinicaltrialsgov nct05296863 registered 25 march 2022retrospectively registered httpsclinicaltrialsgovct2shownct05296863

processed_title: awareness of sun exposure risk and photoprotection for preventing pigmentary disorder in asian population survey result from three asian country and expert panel recommendation
processed_abstract: background in this article we review and discus the photoprotection behavior of asian based on the literature along with a subanalysis of an original online survey and make recommendation to optimize photoprotection for asian population to prevent photoaging and pigmentary disorder method an international panel of eight dermatologist from asia china korea japan singapore indonesia and vietnam met to discus sunscreen photoprotection for asian patient additionally a subanalysis of an online survey by 3000 respondent from three asian country china indonesia and japan investigated general public awareness and attitude to sun exposure result a premeeting survey of the eight expert from asia showed key concern of asian patient consulting dermatologist are pigmentary disorder especially actinicsenile lentigo postinflammatory hyperpigmentation melasma vitiligo and horis nevus the survey subanalysis of participant from china indonesia and japan with predominantly fitzpatrick skin type fst ii to iv revealed that they are particularly concerned about sun exposure causing photoaging and pigmentary disorder most of the respondent indicated they have limited knowledge on sunlight radiation and appropriate sunscreen protection factor only 22 13 and 3 for china indonesia and japan respectively systematically use multiple protective measure using sunscreen avoiding midday sun staying in the shade wearing a hat protective clothing and sunglass when exposed to the sun conclusion further education is needed for asian population on the importance of comprehensive daily photoprotection including broadspectrum sunscreen with high uva and visible light protection to reduce and prevent photoaging and pigmentary disorder

processed_title: cutaneous anthrax what is the hallmark
processed_abstract: a 71yearold man complained of a blackish wound under his left eye which began with fever and reddish spot after helping to slaughter a cow and cut it meat the fever occured especially in the afternoon to evening and is not accompanied by chill and sweating on day 4 of fever onset the fever diminished and the spot progressively widened with swelling on day 7 the lesion on the skin became open wound that were not purulent and did not bleed on day 9 a blackish painless layer appeared over the wound and widened further covering their surface upon presentation the patient general condition wa good with normal vital sign and temperature he presented with a solitary ulcer accompanied by edema sized 1 cm x 3 cm not hyperemic firm border flat edge and covered with blackish eschar blood test revealed normal level of hemoglobin leukocyte platelet kidney and liver function the antianthrax protective antigen antipa igg level is found to be seropositive with a level of 85 uml gram staining of the tissue underneath the eschar found grampositive rod bacteria in reddishpurple color the patient wa clinically diagnosed with probable cutaneous anthrax and wa treated with amoxicillin 500 mg orally tid for three day and paracetamol 500 mg if fever developed the tissue sample wa sent to a laboratory with bio safety level 3 facility for microbiological culture with the result of bacillus anthracis growth on day three after antibiotic administration the wound wa smaller 05 cm x 15 cm firm border flat edge with a bit of edema above it the eschar wa thickened painless not purulent nor bleeding antibiotic administration is continued for another three day with amoxicillin 500 mg orally tid on day 6 of antibiotic administration the eschar began to peel off and antibiotic were stopped on the 10th day the eschar peeled off entirely without leaving a mark early diagnosis is crucial in preventing the spread that may lead to more case clinical and serological examination are the spearhead of early detection of anthrax case prompt and appropriate management largely determines the success of therapy

processed_title: effluent from a pulp and paper mill a skin and health survey of child living in upstream and downstream village
processed_abstract: objective a health survey of three village upstream village rantau baru and two downstream village sering and pelalawan in the vicinity of a pulp and paper mill along the kampar river in the province of riau indonesia wa conducted to find whether exposure to the effluent from the mill wa related to skin condition and ill health method a cross sectional survey wa carried out of child living in the three village result common skin condition such a dermatitis fungal infection insect bite and miliaria were found no significantly increased risk of dermatitis or any illness in general wa found with increasing level of exposure to river water for downstream village when compared with the upstream village however there wa an increased risk of diarrhoea in sering especially with drinking water directly from the river prevalence rate ratio prr 49 95 confidence interval 95 ci 04 to 639 an increased risk wa also found within the upstream village rantau baru prr 23 95 ci 09 to 58 and downstream village sering prr 14 95 ci 04 to 52 when child who drank water directly from the river were compared with those who never did analysis of the river water also showed physical and chemical variable within the acceptable range except for faecal coliforms 6 mpn100 ml found in the sample taken from sering conclusion the effluent from the mill is unlikely to be causing skin condition and ill health diarrhoea may be due to faecal coliform contamination of the water because all raw sewerage is deposited in the river community health outreach programme are being implemented based on these finding

processed_title: body image a a mediator between gender and quality of life among patient with diabetic foot ulcer in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction foot ulcer cause woman in indonesia to lose opportunity to participate in religious and cultural activity due to the inability to wear certain footwear this study examined body image a a mediator in the relationship between gender and quality of life qol among patient with diabetic foot ulcer dfu in indonesia method a crosssectional design with convenience sampling wa used to recruit participant at the surgical outpatient department and wound care clinic in bali indonesia the diabetic foot ulcer scaleshort form and the body image domain of the body investment scale were administered result we found gender difference in participant n 201 qol and body image p 05 body image fully mediated the effect of the relationship between gender and qol b 668 95 confidence interval 314 1052 and explained 3913 of the variance discussion health care provider should consider patient religious belief in dfu education and consider womens body image issue diabetes foot ulcer may prevent woman from performing religious ritual thus influencing their qol protective strategy to prevent dfu among woman in indonesia warrant further development

processed_title: pathophysiology of microcirculation in venous disease
processed_abstract: microcirculatory disturbance lead to chronic ulceration of the leg and this symptom is a sign of a chronic venous insufficiency cvi caused by increased leg vein pressure and continous change in vein pressure which need medical treatment and if a chronic capillary reaction present treatment by applying a graduated compression bandage of the leg is mandatory subcutaneous tissue hypoxaemia and interstitial edema lead to worsening of the ulcer and need intensive and systematic wound care because unhealed chronic wound with trophic change of the skin is the major cause of further cvi change of the leg a chronic venous disease ha complex etiologic basis it need diagnostics and treatment modality based on various approach and that microcirculatory pathophysiological approach should be considered in all kind of the treatment of chronic venous insufficiency microcirculation pathology should be used a an approach in the treatment regiment of cvi whilst the basic pathophysiology of the venous disease which is known a one of the cause of cvi this approach will give better result of treatment and other pathologic disturbance which were caused by chronic vitious circle chain process

processed_title: potential cutaneous carcinogenic risk of exposure to uv nail lamp a review
processed_abstract: the increased use of ultraviolet uv nail lamp in recent year ha generated safety concern of this device a uv nail lamp is a source of artificial uva radiation often used to dry harden and cure the nail at home and in the salon uva radiation is known to be mutagenic and can cause damage to the dna resulting in cutaneous malignancy currently there are only a few study that have evaluated uv nail lamp irradiation and it potential carcinogenic risk we review the literature on uv nail lamp it safety effect on nail and hand and the potential role in increasing the risk of cutaneous malignancy based on available data the carcinogenic risk is low nonetheless the use of a broad spectrum sunscreen with spf 30 before uv nail lamp exposure is recommended

processed_title: potential prognostic value of pdl1 and nkg2a expression in indonesian patient with skin nodular melanoma
processed_abstract: objective biomarker mrna level have been suggested to be predictor of patient survival and therapy response in melanoma case this study aimed to investigate the correlation between the mrna expression level of pdl1 and nkg2a in melanoma tissue with clinicopathologic characteristic and survival in indonesian primary nodular melanoma patient result thirtyone tissue sample were obtained two were excluded from survival analysis due to breslow depth of less than 4 mm the median survival of upregulated and normoregulated pdl1patients were 15800 2345 and 28945 4126 month respectively however this difference wa not significant statistically p 0086 upregulated and normoregulated nkg2a patient differed very little in median survival time 25943 7415 v 26470 3854 month p 0981 expression of pdl1 and nkg2a were strongly correlated r 0787 p 0001 no clinicopathologic association with pdl1 and nkg2a mrna level were observed these result suggest that pdl1 may have potential a a prognostic factor although an unlikely prognostic factor nkg2a may become an adjunct target for therapy the strong correlation between pdl1 and nkg2a suggests that antipd1 and antinkg2a agent could be effective in patient with pdl1 upregulation the mrna level of these two gene may help direct choice of immunotherapy and predict patient outcome

processed_title: the translational potential of inflammationinduced skin blister human model in exploring the pathogenesis of periodontitis and it systemic health implication
processed_abstract: periodontitis is a highly prevalent chronic disease despite decade of extensive research on the topic a complete understanding of it immunopathogenesis especially when linked to other inflammatory comorbidities is lacking ex vivo human and in vivo animal experiment have shown the host inflammatory response crucial role in both the disease onset and it systemic implication these approach however remain questionable when translating these finding into realworld scenario linked to periodontitis a clear need for new in vivo human model is discussed especially within the context of understanding the host response to key pathogen linked to periodontitis such a porphyromonas gingivalis p gingivalis therefore a skin blister model wa employed to describe the stage of the host immune response in human after challenge by microbial andor sterile insult a novel human challenge model using uvkilled p gingivalis hold promise in producing new evidence and bridging the gap of the host response to periodontitis and it link with other common chronic disease

processed_title: identification of malassezia specie from pityriasis versicolor in indonesia and it relationship with clinical characteristic
processed_abstract: pityriasis versicolor pv is a chronic superficial fungal disease caused by malassezia spp the incidence is a high a 3040 in tropical climate previous study indicate that the geographic factor ha influence on the main specie isolated from pv our aim wa to identify malassezia spp from pv patient in indonesia and their correlation to clinical characteristic isolates of malassezia were collected from 98 pv patient 62 male and 36 female identification wa based on morphological observation and biochemical evaluation leeming notman agar wa used a isolation culture medium the biochemical evaluation consisted of specimen culture onto sabouraud dextrose agar cremophor el esculin dixons agar at 37 degree c and catalase reaction the isolates found were malasseziafurfur 429 m sympodialis 275 m globosa 133 m slooffiae 77 m obtusa 77 and m restricta 22 and 714 specimen were unidentified there wa no statistically significant association between malassezia spp and demographic characteristic and clinical characteristic of the patient unlike report from temperate climate country this study in indonesia found m furfur a the most frequently isolated malassezia spp in pv patient

processed_title: covid arm a a common cutaneous manifestation after mrna1273 vaccination a systematic review
processed_abstract: background by august 2022 coronavirus disease2019 covid19 had caused 600 million illness and 65 million fatality globally a massive vaccination program is being implemented worldwide to suppress this condition several work of literature stated that mrna covid19 vaccination specifically with the mrna1273 vaccine is followed by clear evidence of the covid arm effect associated with this vaccine objective to analyze the latest evidence of covid arm a a common effect of mrna1273 vaccination with the ultimate goal of improving vaccine counseling to help healthcare professional and reassure patient method a comprehensive search wa performed on topic that assess the covid arm a a cutaneous manifestation following mrna1273 vaccination from inception up until july 2022 result eighteen study with a total of 1129 participant after the first and second dose of mrna1273 vaccination reported that most participant had covid arm following the first dose administration the characteristic of the patient were a mean age of 438 year old and female represented 50 in most study with a mean onset of 69 day after the first dose administration symptom resolved within seven day following the treatment and were harmless conclusion this study found that the covid arm condition is most common following the first mrna1273 vaccination in the female and middleaged group the correlation between demographic variable and covid arm risk elucidates that the reaction is a type iv allergic skin reaction
