processed_title: association between health service system and pressure injury problem of individual with chronic spinal cord injury in malaysia indonesia and thailand a crosssectional study
processed_abstract: objective the aim of the study is to determine whether a health service system is an independent influencing factor of having pressure injury problem in individual with chronic spinal cord injury living in three country design this is a crosssectional study method data from the international spinal cord injury community survey were analyzed the pressure injury problem were assessed using the spinal cord injury secondary condition scale dichotomized to having problem and not having problem health service system were categorized a an inpatientoriented spinal cord injuryspecialized system and a primary careoriented system a directed acyclic graph wa applied to create a multivariable logistic regression model to determine the independent influencing factor of pressure injury problem result of 790 included participant 277 35 had pressure injury problem being recruited from country with inpatientoriented spinal cord injuryspecialized system model 1 and visiting rehabilitation medicinespinal cord injury physician at least once a year model 2 is an independent negative correlating factor of pressure injury problem odds ratio 0569 95 confidence interval 03740866 and 0591 95 confidence interval 04050864 respectively conclusion spinal cord injuryspecialized health service system might be a protective factor of pressure injury problem in middleincome country context this result suggests the importance of having spinal cord injuryspecialized service in middleincome country to reduce the prevalence of pressure injury problem to claim cme credit complete the selfassessment activity and evaluation online at httpwwwphysiatryorgjournalcme cme objective upon completion of this article the reader should be able to 1 identify the best strategy for managing pressure injury problem in people with spinal cord injury 2 describe common method for determining health service utilization and evaluating secondary health condition in people with spinal cord injury 3 discus the advantage of having a scispecialized rehabilitation system in middleincome country a a protective factor from having pressure injury problem level advanced accreditation the association of academic physiatrists is accredited by the accreditation council for continuing medical education to provide continuing medical education for physiciansthe association of academic physiatrists designates this journalbased cme activity for a maximum of 10 ama pra category 1 credit physician should only claim credit commensurate with the extent of their participation in the activity

processed_title: microrna a a diagnostic tool therapeutic target and potential biomarker in cutaneous malignant melanoma detectionnarrative review
processed_abstract: melanoma is the most serious type of skin cancer causing a large majority of death but accounting for only 1 of all skin cancer case the worldwide incidence of malignant melanoma is increasing causing a serious socioeconomic problem melanoma is diagnosed mainly in young and middleaged people which distinguishes it from other solid tumor detected mainly in mature people the early detection of cutaneous malignant melanoma cmm remains a priority and it is a key factor limiting mortality doctor and scientist around the world want to improve the quality of diagnosis and treatment and are constantly looking for new promising opportunity including the use of micrornas mirnas to fight melanoma cancer this article review mirna a a potential biomarker and diagnostics tool a a therapeutic drug in cmm treatment we also present a review of the current clinical trial being carried out worldwide in which mirnas are a target for melanoma treatment

processed_title: the role of adjuvant therapy in the management of chronic urticaria
processed_abstract: recent guideline on the management of urticaria recommends secondgeneration h1antihistamine a the firstline therapy with dose increase of up to fourfold if inadequately controlled however the treatment of chronic spontaneous urticaria csu is often disappointing so additional adjuvant therapy are needed to increase the effectiveness of firstline therapy especially in patient who are refractory to the increase of antihistamine dos recent study recommend various adjuvant therapy modality for csu such a biological agent immunosuppressant leukotriene receptor antagonist h2antihistamine sulfones autologous serum therapy phototherapy vitamin d antioxidant and probiotic this literature review wa made to determine the effectiveness of various adjuvant therapy in managing csu

processed_title: transcriptomicsdriven drug repositioning for the treatment of diabetic foot ulcer
processed_abstract: diabetic foot ulcer dfus are a common complication of diabetes and can lead to severe disability and even amputation despite advance in treatment there is currently no cure for dfus and available drug for treatment are limited this study aimed to identify new candidate drug and repurpose existing drug to treat dfus based on transcriptomics analysis a total of 31 differentially expressed gene degs were identified and used to prioritize the biological risk gene for dfus further investigation using the database dgidb revealed 12 druggable target gene among 50 biological dfu risk gene corresponding to 31 drug interestingly we highlighted that two drug urokinase and lidocaine are under clinical investigation for dfu and 29 drug are potential candidate to be repurposed for dfu therapy the top 5 potential biomarkers for dfu from our finding are il6st cxcl9 il1r1 cxcr2 and il10 this study highlight il1r1 a a highly promising biomarker for dfu due to it high systemic score in functional annotation that can be targeted with an existing drug anakinra our study proposed that the integration of transcriptomic and bioinformaticbased approach ha the potential to drive drug repurposing for dfus further research will further examine the mechanism by which targeting il1r1 can be used to treat dfu

processed_title: skin problem after a tsunami
processed_abstract: background on december 26 2004 the biggest earthquake for 40 year measuring 90 on the richter scale triggered a tsunami that pounded the coastal area of south asia and east africa the effect of the tsunami on skin condition have not been evaluated objective to determine the influence of the tsunami on skin condition by evaluating the skin problem of patient presenting at hospital after the tsunami method between 5 and 25 january 2005 two dermatologist evaluated patient who complained of skin problem at an outpatient clinic and emergency room of a general hospital in banda aceh aceh province indonesia result the total number of patient that presented during the study period wa 235 131 male and 104 female and they had a total of 265 skin problem in term of age distribution most subject were in their fourth decade 230 followed by the third 226 and fifth decade 166 the most prevalent skin problem were infectionsinfestations 325 followed by eczema 298 and traumatic skin disorder 294 in male traumatic skin disorder were most common the great majority of infectioninfestation case involved superficial fungal infection contact dermatitis accounted for threequarters of eczema case and mainly involved the arm 400 and leg 271 the majority of traumatic skin disorder were laceration puncture and penetration and the foot 447 and hand 188 were most frequently affected conclusion unhygienic condition exposure to a hazardous environment and contact with various object during and after the tsunami probably increased the prevalence of infectionsinfestations traumatic skin disorder and contact dermatitis to prevent these problem and associated secondary bacterial infection healthrelated education and early medical management are required

processed_title: infant malnutrition in indonesia
processed_abstract: infant malnutrition resulting frequently in the death of child of preschool age is a problem requiring urgent solution in indonesia child suffering from malnutrition show a variety of symptom the most characteristic being emaciation growth retardation liver change dyspigmentation of skin and hair other skin lesion oedema muscular wasting anaemia and xerophthalmia the indicative value of xerophthalmia which often lead to the development of keratomalacia in the diagnosis of malnutrition is stressed by the author further research is required to determine the causesand particularly the part played by dietof the clinical difference observed in malnutrition case far greater interest in the problem of malnutrition must be shown by the entire medical profession in indonesia if treatment is to be carried out successfully the specific symptom xerophthalmia is easily curable with codliver oil general malnutrition can be prevented only if sufficient amount both quantitatively and qualitatively of protein vitamin a and calorie are provided for every child the indonesian must be taught by practical example the necessity of adequate feeding and be encouraged to make maximum use of locally available food it is hoped that the centre to deal with malnutrition envisaged by the ministry of health will provide both curative and preventive treatment and facility for propaganda and research

processed_title: comparison of vitamin d level in diabetes mellitus patient with and without diabetic foot ulcer an analytical observational study in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: diabetic foot ulcer dfu is a form of chronic wound which becomes a serious complication in diabetes mellitus dm recently the role of vitamin d on t cellmediated immunity pancreatic insulin secretion and it mechanism on cell growth and healing process have been reported this study aim to compare the vitamin d level of dm patient with dfu and without dfu to assess the duration and severity of dfu and it correlation with vitamin d level the sociodemographic characteristic and dfu duration were documented the severity wa examined in accordance with pedis classification 25hydroxyvitamin d 25ohd wa analysed using invitro chemiluminescent immunoassay clia statistical analysis wa performed and the pvalue 05 wa considered a statistically significant the vitamin d level in dm patient with and without dfu were 890 ngml 6521090 and 1625 ngml 131959 respectively with p 001 there wa no correlation between the duration of dfu and dfu severity by pedis score with vitamin d level vitamin d level in dm patient with dfu are lower than those in patient without dfu however there wa insufficient evidence to conclude that there is no correlation between the dfu duration and dfu severity by pedis score with vitamin d level

processed_title: stem cell a a therapeutic choice in dermatological disorder
processed_abstract: stem cell are known for their extraordinary property mainly their potency selfrenewal and clonality in recent year we have witnessed notable advancement in the field of cell therapy due to it remarkable property and versatility this cuttingedge therapy ha now become a potentially promising cure for many disease stem cellbased therapy have been utilized to treat various dermatological condition for instance autoimmune skin disorder atopic dermatitis skin aging wound healing scar treatment and many others this article aim to serve a an overview of cellbased therapy current application in dermatology field

processed_title: physical activity and quality of life in breast cancer survivor
processed_abstract: objective we reviewed the literature on breast cancer patient physical activity and quality of life this paper should urge health service and breast cancer survivor to continue appropriate physical activity and assess it advantage design a systematic review wa conducted data source this systematic review used online database pubmed web of science scopus and google scholar a search from the beginning of 20182024 wa conducted review method medical subject heading mesh were used for keyword selection along with other target keywords such a quality of life breast cancer chemotherapy treatment side effect patient experience psychosocial wellbeing physical functioning emotional distress and supportive care we reviewed and included all englishlanguage publication a narrative synthesis wa conducted to present the result of the study result the search using the keywords yielded a total of 135 study each result wa filtered again according to the inclusion and exclusion criterion resulting in a final total of 15 study to be included in the systematic review conclusion the evidence support the benefit of physical activity in enhancing the quality of life for breast cancer survivor indicating that further prospective and intervention study are needed

processed_title: effectiveness of topical hyaluronic acid of different molecular weight in xerosis cutis treatment in elderly a doubleblind randomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: dry skin is a common dermatological condition that frequently affect the elderly a contributing cause to dry skin is a reduced concentration of hyaluronic acid ha in both the epidermis and dermis the effectiveness of moisturizer containing ha a a therapy for dry skin is impacted by it specific molecular weight low molecular weight ha lmwha is believed to be more effective in replenishing skin hydration in aging skin compared to high molecular weight ha hmwha due to it ability to penetrate the stratum corneum however there is a lack of clinical research supporting this claim a doubleblind randomized controlled trial wa conducted on 36 resident of a nursing home in jakarta the participant aged between 60 and 80 year had been diagnosed with dry skin each test subject wa administered three distinct randomized moisturizing lotion lmwha hmwha or vehicle to be topically applied to three separate site on the leg skin capacitance scap transepidermal water loss tewl and specified symptom sum score srrc were measured at week 0 2 and 4 after four week of therapy area that wa treated with lmwha showed greater scap value compared to the area treated with hmwha 5637 au v 5237 au p 0004 and vehicle 5637 au v 4901 au p 0001 all group did not show any significant difference in tewl and srrc score no side effect were found in all group the application of a moisturizer containing lmwha to the dry skin of elderly resulted in significant improvement in skin hydration compared to moisturizers containing hmwha and vehicle furthermore these moisturizers demonstrated similar safety in treating dry skin in the elderly clinicaltrialsgov identifier nct06178367 httpsclinicaltrialsgovstudynct06178367

processed_title: the effectiveness of galactomyces ferment filtrate dexpanthenol and centella asiatica combination serum in the treatment of postacne hyperpigmentation in subject with skin of color
processed_abstract: postacne hyperpigmentation pah occurs secondary to acne vulgaris and may cause significant adverse effect although may occur in any skin type pah ha been found to be more common and severe in people with colored skin this study aimed to assess the effectiveness of combination serum containing galactomyces ferment filtrate gff dexpanthenol and centella asiatica for treating pah this randomized controlled clinical trial involved fitzpatrick skin type fst iv and v patient with pah subject were equally divided into treatment group who received three drop of combination serum twice daily for 8 week and placebo group the melanin index mi and lightness l score were assessed every 2 week out of 51 subject the l score of the treatment group in subject with fst v wa significantly higher on the 4th and 6th week compared to the placebo group p 005 the mi of subject with fst iv wa significantly lower compared to the placebo group after 8 week p 005 the treatment group showed consistent increasing and decreasing trend in l score and mi respectively r 09 p 005 combination serum containing gff dexpanthenol and c asiatica may be effective in treating pah in subject with colored skin by accelerating lessening of pah

processed_title: diphtheria outbreak in jakarta and tangerang indonesia epidemiological and clinical predictor factor for death
processed_abstract: background in 2017 a diphtheria outbreak occurred in several province in indonesia the aim of this study wa to identify predictor of mortality outcome of pediatric patient with clinical diphtheria method a retrospective cohort study wa conducted using patient medical record at five referral hospital in the province of jakarta and one in tangerang district banten province during january 2017 to 31 august 2018 all child in the age group of 118 year old discharged with diagnosis of clinical diphtheria formed the study group all anonymized patient data were evaluated for demographic issue clinical feature immunization status complication laboratory profile and outcome result a total of 283 patient with clinical diphtheria were included in the study group with case fatality rate of 35 all mortal patient had the complication of myocarditis regression analysis revealed factor for predicting mortality incomplete primary diphtheria toxoid immunization stridor bull neck leukocytosis 15 x109 cellsl and thrombocytopenia 150 x109 cellsl in each combination for 2 predictor modeling were correlated with death conclusion we report key predictor of mortality in pediatric patient with clinical diphtheria the presence of these feature when admitted to the hospital must be taken into account because they can lead to fatal outcome

processed_title: the outbreak of diphtheria in indonesia
processed_abstract: diptheria is commonly caused by the aerobic grampositive bacteria corynebacterium diphtheria we herein report an unusual case of diphtheria outbreak in indonesia in 2017 and it possible cause and current management

processed_title: comparison of diphtheria case in child before and during the pandemic era in surabaya indonesia a study of sixyear data
processed_abstract: introduction indonesia ha a high incidence of diphtheria especially in child surabaya ha become a government regional reference center a it is the capital of east java province which ha the highest rate of diphtheria across the 38 region the aim of this study is to report our sixyear pediatric diphtheria data focusing on comparison between before and during the pandemic era method this surveillance report wa collected from community health center and hospital throughout surabaya from january 1 2017 to december 31 2022 collected data included demographic characteristic clinical and laboratory aspect the health center immunization history and management a per indonesian guideline the diagnosis of diphtheria in this country requires a positive microbiological culture or approval from the national expert on diphtheria committee result in total there were 112 case of which 89 were found before the pandemic era although the number of case declined during 20202022 the predominant age group the immunization status and the most common type of diphtheria remained consistent with prepandemic trend most case had incomplete immunization or unimmunized child 678 with the age group of 512 year old 446 and with tonsillar diphtheria 83 the case fatality ratio wa 18 regarding the biovar of corynebacterium diphtheriae gravis is the most frequent finding conclusion the incidence of diphtheria case in child in surabaya wa significantly lower during the pandemic although immunization coverage wa not better preventive measure during the pandemic may have played a role most patient did not have complete immunization history during the study period and the predominant type wa tonsillar diphtheria since the trend in 20212022 increased routine surveillance is essential

processed_title: diphtheria serology in adult in central java and east java indonesia the importance of continuous diphtheria vaccination
processed_abstract: background vaccination increase immunity against diphtheria yet will decrease by aging therefore booster are needed to be done regularly objective this study aim to determine the immunity to diphtheria for the population of 16 year old and above method the sample of study were 295 collected blood serum by riskesdas project in 2013 the criterion wa above 15 year of age and originating from the province of central java or east java inclusively immunity assessment wa based on antibody titer igg against diphtheria using vero cell cytotoxicity test statistical analysis wa performed using the x2 test result the full protective igg titer 01 iuml at the age of 1620 year included 75 sample with a geometric mean titer gmt of 019 iuml yet at the age of 2160 year and 60 year full protective igg titer only cover 455 and 333 sample with gmt respectively 006 iu ml statistical analysis showed the relationship between age and immune status with pvalue 0003 otherwise no relationship between the status of immunity with sex and residency with pvalues of 016 and 043 conclusion the immune status against diphtheria at the age of above 15 year decrease with aging

processed_title: diphtheria epidemiology in indonesia during 20102017
processed_abstract: background in recent year diphtheria ha reemerged in several country including venezuela yemen bangladesh and haiti similarly indonesia also showed an increased number of diphtheria case in 20102017 despite the diphteria tetanus pertussis dtp immunization program applied in indonesia for child this study aimed to evaluate the epidemiology of diphtheria case which occurred in indonesia during 20102017 method this wa a retrospective study of diphtheria case in indonesia the following source of data about diphtheria disease burden and vaccine coverage wa obtained from ministry of health republic of indonesia indonesian pediatric society and world health organization south east asia regional office result the number of diphtheria case in indonesia were distributed across 30 province with a total of 811 case in 2011 1192 case in 2012 296 case in 2014 and 939 case in 2017 based on age group the highest number of case fatality rate were in age group of 59 year old diphtheria immunization coverage in indonesia among child wa fluctuated reported a 677 in 2007 619 in 2010 756 in 2013 and 613 in 2018 in addition to that the organization of internal medicine ha recommend booster of dpt immunization every 10 year for those child that had received complete dpt vaccination during childhood however this wa not applied a the countermeasure towards this trend the ministry of health implemented three round of outbreak response immunization ori targeted for the age group of 016 month old and 118 year old in 2017 and tailor approached for adult that had exposed to case banten dki jakarta and west java were the first three province to implement this program considering their condensed population and high risk of disease transmission conclusion in indonesia there wa dramatic increase of diphtheria case in 20102017 where immunization in child should be reinforced by increasing coverage more than 95 and adult boosted vaccination approach should be initiated to prevent the spread of these fatal diphtheria disease in indonesia

processed_title: st534 the new sequence type of corynebacterium diphtheriae causing diphtheria in jakarta and surrounding area indonesia
processed_abstract: backgroundaim the aim of this study wa to find out characteristic and pattern of the spread of corynebacterium diphtheriae isolated from jakarta and the surrounding area using the whole genome sequencing wgs technique and multilocus sequence typing mlst approach material and method the study sample consisted of 86 c diphtheriae isolates which were isolated from diphtheria patient and close contact of patient the dna sequencing wa carried out using the wgs technique data conversion applied the ugene software molecular typing wa conducted through the mlst approach then followed by online data analysis result the result showed that a many a 43 50 of all sample examined were new type with the same allele profile namely 91 134334 new sequence type c diphtheriae is registered in the mlst global database a st534 based on the allele profile the tox gene analysis in 43 isolates with st534 indicated that there were three mutation position all of which were silent mutation conclusion the main cause of diphtheria in jakarta and the surrounding area is a new sequence type of c diphtheriae registered a st534

processed_title: adult diphtheria vaccination
processed_abstract: low adult vaccination coverage in indonesia may contribute to a recent outbreak of diphtheria in indonesia although well known a a pediatric vaccine diphtheria vaccination should be administered a booster to adolescence and adult for longer prevention adult vaccine differs from pediatric vaccine but have similar protection additionally there is special recommendation to vaccinate pregnant woman and elderly people aged 65 year or more

processed_title: seroprevalence and determinant of immunity to diphtheria for child living in two district of contrasting incidence during an outbreak in east java indonesia
processed_abstract: background in 2012 an ongoing outbreak of diphtheria in indonesia wa focused in the province of east java there wa a need to assess vaccine coverage and immunity gap in child method we conducted a crosssectional seroprevalence and vaccine coverage survey of child 115 year of age in 2 district of east java one of high incidence on the island of madura and one of low incidence on the mainland from each district we sampled 150 child 10 child per year of age serum and throat swab were taken to determine immunity and carriage status immunity wa defined a 01 international unitml of antibody to diphtheria toxin result a total of 297 child were selected to participate in the study coverage of three dos of combined vaccine for diphtheria tetanus and pertussis wa significantly lower p 0001 in the high incidence district compared with the low 57 95 confidence interval ci 3678 v 97 95 ci 93100 despite this higher vaccine coverage seroprevalence of immunity wa lower in the low incidence district compared with the high 71 95 ci 6380 v 83 95 ci 7690 immunity in the high incidence district wa associated with increased age increased prevalence of toxigenic corynebacterium diphtheriae carrier and with receipt of multiple and likely more recent booster conclusion significant variation exists in vaccine coverage and seroprevalence of immunity to diphtheria in east java immunity in high incidence district is likely because of natural immunity acquired through exposure to toxigenic c diphtheriae booster vaccine are essential for achieving protective level of immunity

processed_title: what is the true burden of diphtheria tetanus pertussis and poliovirus in child aged 318 year in asia a systematic literature review
processed_abstract: objective in recent year outbreak and a rising incidence of diphtheria tetanus and pertussis have occurred in asia particularly in older child method a systematic search of medline and embase wa conducted from january 2000 to october 2020 to identify the epidemiology of diphtheria tetanus pertussis and poliomyelitis in child and adolescent aged 318 year in asia the result were then related to vaccination schedule booster coverage rate pertussis source of infection and booster immunogenicity a identified by a pragmatic review the international prospective register of systematic review prospero registration crd42020222445 result a total of 35 study were included in this review limited data were reported on the epidemiology of diphtheria tetanus pertussis and poliomyelitis data from study reporting the incidence of diphtheria and pertussis exemplify the shift in epidemiology to older childrenadolescents seroprevalence data suggest that immunity to pertussis and diphtheria is below the level of herd immunity in several asian country in this population conclusion the true burden of diphtheria pertussis and tetanus in child aged 318 year in asia is unknown because of weak or absent nationwide surveillance system the available evidence highlight the inadequacy in immunity either by gap in a recommendation or suboptimal booster coverage supporting the public health need for booster vaccination in this population

processed_title: genetic characterization of diphtheria tox b to evaluate vaccine efficacy in indonesia
processed_abstract: background and objective blocking the attachment of diphtheria toxin to host cell through the intact receptor binding site tox b wa the initial mechanism of action of the diphtheria vaccine diphtheria outbreak in population with good vaccination coverage can be caused by mutation or change in the genetic structure of the tox b protein the aim of this study wa to characterize the tox b protein produced by corynebacterium diphtheriae isolated from 2018 to 2019 in patient in jakarta who had already received the diphtheria vaccine material and method of the 89 throat swab specimen of patient with a clinical diagnosis of diphtheria 10 were positive for diphtheria and toxin pcr wa used to amplify the tox b dna fragment in the 10 positive isolates dna sequencing wa conducted with overlapping primer and the dna sequence were analysed by using seqscape v27 result of the 10 isolates nine isolate showed a dna mutation g30a but the mutation did not change the amino acid encoding arginin silent mutation our finding indicate that the efficacy of the diphtheria vaccine used in indonesia ha not decreased because of mutation in the tox b gene not change the amino acid conclusion overall there are no amino acid change in the tox b protein indicating that the outbreak are not affected by mutation in tox b another possible mechanism overexpression of the toxin is likely responsible for causing diphtheria in patient who have a complete history of immunization in indonesia

processed_title: assessing geographic overlap between zerodose diphtheriatetanuspertussis vaccination prevalence and other health indicator
processed_abstract: the integration of immunization with other essential health service is among the strategic priority of the immunization agenda 2030 and ha the potential to improve the effectiveness efficiency and equity of health service delivery this study aim to evaluate the degree of spatial overlap between the prevalence of child who have never received a dose of the diphtheriatetanuspertussiscontaining vaccine nodtp and other healthrelated indicator to provide insight into the potential for joint geographic targeting of integrated service delivery effort using geospatially modeled estimate of vaccine coverage and comparator indicator we develop a framework to delineate and compare area of high overlap across indicator both within and between country and based upon both count and prevalence we derive summary metric of spatial overlap to facilitate comparison between country and indicator and over time a an example we apply this suite of analysis to five countriesnigeria democratic republic of the congo drc indonesia ethiopia and angolaand five comparator indicatorschildren with stunting under5 mortality child missing dos of oral rehydration therapy prevalence of lymphatic filariasis and insecticidetreated bed net coverage our result demonstrate substantial heterogeneity in the geographic overlap both within and between country these result provide a framework to assess the potential for joint geographic targeting of intervention supporting effort to ensure that all people regardless of location can benefit from vaccine and other essential health service

processed_title: triage in the time of diphtheria
processed_abstract: introduction a diphtheria outbreak occurred in 2017 in jakarta indonesia during which our hospital wa appointed a a referral hospital where patient with upper respiratory tract symptom were sent for confirmation of the diagnosis and medical intervention in this study we review the implementation of the emergency department ed triage process and patient flow management during the diphtheria outbreak no previous study in indonesia ha provided a detailed report on the triage process during infectious disease outbreak method we modified our preexisting hospital triage method according to the identify isolate and inform principle we developed novel criterion for triage to identify triagesuspected case and also a diphtheria package to simplify the diagnostic process four separate room were modified to isolation space to enable medical staff to observe these patient we obtained data from the ed outbreak registry and electronic health record result of 60 case of triagesuspected diphtheria six were classified a suspected diphtheria the mean time from identify to isolate wa 35 minute and from isolate to inform wa 10 minute mean ed length of stay for probable diphtheria wa 2446 hour no medical personnel in the ed showed any sign of diphtheria 30 day after the outbreak had abated conclusion the modified criterion can help triage officer detect suspected diphtheria case and measure the triage response time use of the diphtheria package and four separate room in the ed could act a an infection control procedure and facilitate the improvement of the diagnostic process

processed_title: wholegenome sequencing data of corynebacterium diphtheriae isolated from diphtheria outbreak in indonesia
processed_abstract: corynebacterium diphtheriae c diphtheriae is the causative agent of diphtheria the main virulence factor of c diphtheriae is diphtheria toxin which is encoded by the tox gene and regulated by the dtxr gene the tox and dtxr gene are used a genetic marker to identify bacteria causing diphtheria by pcr here we present the wholegenome sequencing wgs data of 18 c diphtheriae isolates from diphtheria outbreak in different region in indonesia we used these data to identify single nucleotide polymorphism snp associated with the tox and dtxr gene to verify the accuracy of the pcr assay and performed molecular typing with a multilocus sequence typing mlst approach the data can be used for further analysis such a antimicrobial resistance and bacterial virulence factor

processed_title: determinant of mortality in relationship between clinical and laboratory characteristic with the outcome of child with diphtheria a crosssectional study at a national hospital of sumatra region in 2020 2023
processed_abstract: in 2017 diphtheria outbreak occurred in several province in indonesia however the epidemiological data in the country is limited the aim of this study wa to determine the association between clinical finding and laboratory parameter associated with mortality of child with diphtheria a retrospective cohort study wa conducted at haji adam malik general hospital medan indonesia covering diphtheria patient from january 2020 to december 2023 all patient aged 118 year clinically diagnosed with diphtheria were considered eligible the association between demographic characteristic clinical feature immunization status complication and laboratory profile with mortality were determined using fisher exact test and the odds ratio or with a 95 confidence interval 95ci wa calculated our data indicated that the clinical characteristic of myocarditis p0005 and airway obstruction p0003 were associated with mortality there wa also a significant association between thrombocytopenia p0020 and mortality in diphtheria patient patient with airway obstruction were 13 time more likely to have an increase in mortality compared to patient without airway obstruction this study highlight that clinical and laboratory characteristic could be associated with inhospital mortality of diphtheria case and therefore pediatrician should be aware of the presence of those characteristic to prevent the mortality of the patient

processed_title: assessing the impact of booster vaccination on diphtheria transmission mathematical modeling and risk zone mapping
processed_abstract: the covid19 pandemic caused significant disruption in the healthcare system affecting vaccination and the management of diphtheria case a a consequence of these disruption numerous country have experienced a resurgence or an increase in diphtheria case west java province in indonesia is identified a one of the highrisk area for diphtheria experiencing an upward trend in case from 2021 to 2023 to analyze the situation we developed an sir model which integrated dpt and booster vaccination to determine the basic reproduction number an essential parameter for infectious disease through spatial analysis of georeferenced data we identified hotspot and explained diffusion in diphtheria case cluster the calculation of r0 resulted in an r0 117 indicating the potential for a diphtheria outbreak in west java to control the increasing case one possible approach is to raise the booster vaccination coverage from the current 6484 to 7515 a suggested by simulation result furthermore the spatial analysis revealed that hot spot cluster were present in the western central and southern region posing a high risk not only in densely populated area but also in rural region the diffusion pattern of diphtheria cluster displayed an expansioncontagious pattern understanding the rising trend of diphtheria case and their geographic distribution can offer crucial insight for government and health authority to manage the number of diphtheria case and make informed decision regarding the best prevention and intervention strategy

processed_title: the immunogenicity safety and consistency of an indonesia combined dtphbhib vaccine in expanded program on immunization schedule
processed_abstract: background who recommended incorporation of haemophilus influenzae type b hib vaccination into immunization program indonesia would adopt hib a a national immunization program in 2013 we aimed at analyzing immunogenicity safety and consistency of a new combined dtphbhib diphtheriatetanuspertussishepatitis bhaemophilus influenza b vaccine method a prospective randomized double blind multicenter phase iii study of bio farma dtphbhib vaccine conducted in jakarta and bandung august 2012 january 2013 subject were divided into three group with different batch number healthy infant 611 week of age at enrollment were immunized with 3 dos of dtphbhib vaccine with interval of 4 week after birth dose of hepatitis b vaccine blood sample obtained prior to vaccination and 28 day after the third dose safety measure recorded until 28 day after each dose result of 600 subject 575 96 completed study protocol after 3 dos 1000 and 960 had antiprp concentration 015 and 10 mugml antidiphtheria and antitetanus concentration 001 iuml detected in 997 and 1000 while concentration 01 iuml achieved in 840 and 974 protective antihbs found in 993 the pertussis vaccine response rate wa 849 none serious adverse event saes considered related to study vaccine or procedure conclusion the 3dose of dtphbhib wa immunogenic well tolerated and suitable for replacement of licensedequivalent vaccine based on immunologic and safety profile trial registration nct01986335 october 30th 2013

processed_title: safety and immunogenicity of combined diphtheriatetanuspertussis whole cell and acellularhaemophilus influenzaeb conjugate vaccine administered to indonesian child
processed_abstract: a randomized doubleblind trial wa conducted to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of vaccine comprised of diphtheria d and tetanus t toxoid combined with either a whole cell p or an acellular ap pertussis component and haemophilus influenzae type b polyribosylphosphate prp tetanus toxoid conjugate prpt in indonesian infant three dos of either dtap dtapprpt or dtpprpt were administered to 930 infant approximately 23 month of age and at 2 month interval thereafter a booster dose of either dtpprpt or dtapprpt wa administered at 1518 month of age both local and systemic reaction occurred at a significantly p 00010026 higher rate in the group that received whole cell pertussis vaccine versus group which were immunized with ap containing vaccine there wa no significant difference p 005 in the rate of adverse event between group immunized with dtap or dtap prp t one month after the third dose of vaccine 99 of subject had achieved or 01 iu of antid and antit antibody per ml of serum the geometric mean titer gmt to d wa significantly p 0001 higher in the group immunized with dtap versus the other two group whereas the antit gmt wa significantly p 0006 higher for the group immunized with dtpprpt both the antipertussis toxin pt and antifilamentous hemagglutinin fha antibody level were significantly p 0001 higher in recipient of acellular versus whole cell pertussis vaccine in contrast the antib pertussis agglutinating antibody response wa significantly p 00001 higher in the group immunized with whole cell pertussis vaccine the antiprp gmt microg antibodyml at 7 month were 0096 335 and 611 for group immunized with dtap dtapprpt and dtpprpt respectively the gmt for those immunized with dtpprpt wa significantly p 0001 higher compared to recipient of dtapprpt the percent of child who attained or 015 or or 1 microgml after immunization wa 18 and 2 for the dtap group 93 and 76 for the dtapprpt group and 97 and 88 for the dtpprpt group at the or 1 microgml level the difference between the dtapprp0t and dtpprpt group wa significant p 001 child immunized with either dtap dtapprpt or dtpprpt were reimmunized with dtapprpt whereas a portion of child immunized with dtp prp t where also boosted with this vaccine at 1518 month of age there wa a vigorous anamnestic response to the d and t component with all child possessing or 01 iuml there wa also a substantial increase in antipt antifha and b pertussis agglutinating antibody the poorest antipt response wa seen among child receiving dtpprpt for both primary and reimmunization while the highest agglutinating antibody response followed receipt of 4 dos of dtpprpt greater than 80 of child immunized with either dtp prp t or dtapprpt possessed or 015 microgml before boosting versus 38 for those vaccinated with dtap p 0001 primary immunization with dtpprpt resulted in a significantly p 005 higher percentage 72 maintaining or 1 microgml compared to those immunized with dtapprpt 46 prior to reimmunization the antiprp gmt wa significantly p 0005 higher for child immunized with 3 dos of dtpprpt versus dtapprpt subsequent to reimmunization or 95 of subject attained or 1 microgml

processed_title: the improvement of adaptive immune response towards covid19 following diphtheriatetanuspertussis and sarscov2 vaccination in indonesian child exploring the role of heterologous immunity
processed_abstract: background routine childhood vaccination eg for diphtheria tetanus and pertussis dtp might provide additional protection against sarscov2 infection this concept of heterologous immunity wa explored in healthy child receiving both dtp and inactivated sarscov2 vaccine method a crosssectional study wa performed on 154 healthy child aged 68 year old in jakarta indonesia their vaccination status for the dtp including a diphtheriatetanus booster vaccine at 5 year old and coronavac from 6 year old vaccine were recorded peripheral blood sample were collected from all participant in which antidiphtheria toxoid igg and antisarscov2 srbd antibody and t cellderived ifngamma were measured result the study participant with complete dtp vaccination had significantly higher titer of antidiphtheria toxoid igg than the one without median 09349 versus 02113 iuml p 00001 upon stratification based on dtp and coronavac vaccination status the participant with complete dtp and coronavac vaccination had the highest titer of antisarscov2 srbd antibody median 1196 uml and the highest concentration of sarscov2specific t cellderived ifngamma median 5609 miuml among all the group conclusion healthy child aged 68 year old with complete dtp and coronavac vaccination exhibited stronger sarscov2specific t cell immune response this might suggest an additional benefit of routine childhood vaccination in generating protection against novel pathogen presumably via heterologous immunity

processed_title: elevenyear report of high number of diphtheria case in child in east java province indonesia
processed_abstract: a high incidence of diphtheria case in child in east java province indonesia ha been observed since the beginning of this century despite many effort the outbreak continue this study aim to explain the high incidence of diphtheria in child in east java province since 2013 this crosssectional surveillance reportbased study used data from 38 district in east java since 1 january 2013 collected data included demographic clinical information additional examination immunization history and close contact management over eleven year there were 4009 diphtheria patient of whom 2921 7286 were under 18 year of age boy 5977 outnumbered girl and the most common age category wa 60144 month 5166 most case had incomplete or zero immunization 7616 tonsillopharyngeal diphtheria wa the most common type 6960 the five top district with the most case were surabaya sidoarjo kabupaten blitar kota malang and kabupaten malang the elevenyear case fatality rate cfr wa 236 692921 this study show that diphtheria case in child and adolescent in east java have consistently been high and low immunization coverage might still be the leading cause there ha also been a shift in the district distribution diphtheria outbreak require complete and sustainable effort not just outbreak response immunization

processed_title: risk factor for diphtheria outbreak in child aged 110 year in east kalimantan province indonesia
processed_abstract: background diphtheria remains a health problem especially in developing country in november 2017 the indonesian ministry of health stated that there wa a diphtheria outbreak in indonesia east kalimantan is one of the province that experienced this disease outbreak this study analyzes the risk factor for diphtheria outbreak in child aged 110 year method a casecontrol study wa conducted on 37 respondent research variable consist of immunization status against diphtheria pertussis and tetanus dpt nutritional status child mobility source of transmission physical home environment natural lighting ventilation area occupancy density wall and floor type knowledge of diphtheria and attitude towards the diphtheria prevention program result we found that the most of the child who had diphtheria had been immunized against dpt additionally the nutritional status of child p0049 mobility p0000 and the source of transmission p0020 were significantly associated with diphtheria conclusion childparent mobility or8456 is the main risk factor for diphtheria outbreak it is recommended to limit the mobility of child to travel to area that are experiencing increased case of diphtheria improve the nutritional status and further research on the effectiveness of diphtheria vaccine

processed_title: impact of a threedose diphtheria outbreak response immunization in east java indonesia 6 month after completion
processed_abstract: several outbreak of diphtheria have occured in the east java province of indonesia since 2011 the last effort to stop the outbreak in the province wa a three round outbreak response immunization ori in 2018the aim of the this study wa to evaluate the impact of the 2018 ori in east java province 6 month following the completion of the program surveillance data wa collected for 6 month period from january to june 2019 the source of data wa the district health office hospital community health center and private physician and paramedic practice the data included demographic characteristic involved health facility patient immunization history clinical sign and symptom some laboratory test result and other additional examination all case were evaluated by the east java provincial diphtheria expert committee and not based on the individual physician decision during the 6 month period there were 97 diphtheria case which approved by the diphtheria expert committee the report came from 36 of 38 district one patient died denoting a case fatality rate of 1 the majority were 19 year of age or less with uncomplete immunization patient above 19 year were 24 compared with 2017 438 case and 2018 310 2019 saw a significant reduction in the number of reported case only 4 positive culture result were collected positivity rate 413 two patient had mitis subtype and the other two had gravis subtype diphtheria ori in east java had a significant impact during the first 6 month of 2019

processed_title: state of inequality in diphtheriatetanuspertussis immunisation coverage in lowincome and middleincome country a multicountry study of household health survey
processed_abstract: background immunisation programme have made substantial contribution to lowering the burden of disease in child but there is a growing need to ensure that programme are equityoriented we aimed to provide a detailed update about the state of betweencountry inequality and withincountry economicrelated inequality in the delivery of three dos of the combined diphtheria tetanus toxoid and pertussiscontaining vaccine dtp3 with a special focus on inequality in highpriority country method we used data from the latest available demographic and health survey and multiple indicator cluster survey done in 51 lowincome and middleincome country data for dtp3 coverage were disaggregated by wealth quintile and inequality wa calculated a difference and ratio measure based on coverage in richest quintile 5 and poorest quintile 1 household wealth quintiles excess change wa calculated for 21 country with data available at two timepoints spanning a 10 year period further analysis were done for six highpriority countriesie those with low national immunisation coverage andor high absolute number of unvaccinated child significance wa determined using 95 ci finding national dtp3 immunisation coverage across the 51 study country ranged from 32 in central african republic to 98 in jordan within country the gap in dtp3 immunisation coverage suggested prorich inequality with a difference of 20 percentage point or more between quintiles 1 and 5 for 20 of 51 country in nigeria pakistan lao cameroon and central african republic the difference between quintiles 1 and 5 exceeded 40 percentage point in 15 of 21 study country an increase over time in national coverage of dtp3 immunisation wa realised alongside faster improvement in the poorest quintile than the richest for example in burkina faso cambodia gabon mali and nepal the absolute increase in coverage wa at least 20 percentage point per year with faster improvement in the poorest quintile substantial economicrelated inequality in dtp3 immunisation coverage wa reported in five highpriority study country dr congo ethiopia indonesia nigeria and pakistan but not uganda interpretation overall withincountry inequality in dtp3 immunisation persist but seem to have narrowed over the past 10 year monitoring economicrelated inequality in immunisation coverage is warranted to reveal where gap exist and inform appropriate approach to reach disadvantaged population funding none

processed_title: immunogenicity of monoclonal antibody cause consequence and control strategy
processed_abstract: antibodybased treatment wa first used in 1891 for the treatment of diphtheria since then monoclonal antibody mabs have been developed to treat many disease such a cancer and act a vaccine however murinederived therapeutic mabs were found to be highly immunogenic and caused antidrug antibody ada reaction reducing their efficacy and causing severe infusion reaction fully human humanised and chimeric antibody were then introduced for better therapeutic efficacy with the introduction of immune response associated with mabs immunogenicity this review explores the immunogenicity of mabs it mechanism contributing factor and it impact on therapeutic efficacy it also discusses immunogenicity assessment for preclinical study and strategy for minimising immunogenicity for effective therapeutic treatment in various disease finally predicting immunogenicity in drug development is essential for selecting top drug candidate a lot of method can be implemented by the researcher and developer to reduce the development of ada while simultaneously minimising the immunogenicity reaction of mabs

processed_title: profile of diphtheria case hospitalized at tertiary referral hospital in indonesia 10 year experience
processed_abstract: this is a report about child diphtheria case profile in cipto mangunkusumo hospital jakarta from 2006 to 2017 occurrence wa the highest in 5yearsold age group 677 with male predominance 588 thirty five point three percent case had no immunization history and 382 case had incomplete booster history pseudomembrane occurred in all case mostly found in pharynx 676 and tonsil 618

processed_title: immunogenicity reactogenicity and igemediated immune response of a mixed wholecell and acellular pertussis vaccine schedule in australian infant a randomised doubleblind noninferiority trial
processed_abstract: background in many country infant vaccination with acellular pertussis ap vaccine ha replaced use of more reactogenic wholecell pertussis wp vaccine based on immunological and epidemiological evidence we hypothesised that substituting the first ap dose in the routine vaccination schedule with wp vaccine might protect against igemediated food allergy we aimed to compare reactogenicity immunogenicity and igemediated response of a mixed wpap primary schedule versus the standard aponly schedule method and finding optimum is a bayesian 2stage doubleblind randomised trial in stage one infant were assigned 11 to either a first dose of a pentavalent wp combination vaccine dtwphibhepb pentabio pt bio farma indonesia or a hexavalent ap vaccine dtaphibhepbipv infanrix hexa glaxosmithkline australia at approximately 6 week old subsequently all infant received the hexavalent ap vaccine at 4 and 6 month old a well a an ap vaccine at 18 month old dtapipv infanrixipv glaxosmithkline australia stage two is ongoing and follows the above randomisation strategy and vaccination schedule ahead of ascertainment of the primary clinical outcome of allergistconfirmed igemediated food allergy by 12 month old here we present the result of secondary immunogenicity reactogenicity tetanus toxoid igemediated immune response and parental acceptability endpoint serum igg response to diphtheria tetanus and pertussis antigen were measured using a multiplex fluorescent beadbased immunoassay total and specific ige were measured in plasma by mean of the immunocap assay thermo fisher scientific the immunogenicity of the mixed schedule wa defined a being noninferior to that of the aponly schedule using a noninferiority margin of 23 on the ratio of the geometric mean concentration gmr of pertussis toxin ptigg 1 month after the 6month ap solicited adverse reaction were summarised by study arm and included all child who received the first dose of either wp or ap parental acceptance wa assessed using a 5point likert scale the primary analysis were based on intentiontotreat itt secondary perprotocol pp analysis were also performed the trial is registered with anzctr actrn12617000065392p between march 7 2018 and january 13 2020 150 infant were randomised 75 per arm ptigg response of the mixed schedule were noninferior to the aponly schedule at approximately 1 month after the 6month ap dose gmr 098 95 credible interval 077 to 126 probability gmr 23 099 itt analysis at 7 month old the posterior median probability of quantitation for tetanus toxoid ige wa 022 95 credible interval 012 to 034 in both the mixed schedule group and in the aponly group despite exclusion the result were consistent in the pp analysis at 6 week old irritability wa the most common systemic solicited reaction reported in wp 65 88 of 74 versus ap 59 82 of 72 vaccinee at the same age severe systemic reaction were reported among 14 19 of 74 infant after wp and 8 11 of 72 infant after ap there were 7 saes among 5 participant within the first 6 month of followup on blinded assessment none were deemed to be related to the study vaccine parental acceptance of mixed and aponly schedule wa high 71 97 of 73 versus 69 96 of 72 would agree to have the same schedule again conclusion compared to the aponly schedule the mixed schedule evoked noninferior ptigg response wa associated with more severe reaction but wa well accepted by parent tetanus toxoid ige response did not differ across the study group trial registration trial registered at the australian and new zealand clinical 207 trial registry actrn12617000065392p

processed_title: access to dtpbased combination vaccine in asiapacific country between 2019 and 2022
processed_abstract: the asiapacific country are highly diverse in health and economic condition that may impact vaccine access and uptake our study aimed to characterize pattern of health access to dtpbased combination vaccine in 10 country from 2019 to 2022 using the iqviamidas database the availability affordability and accessibility were compared across country by national health and economic performance indicator using spearmans rank correlation coefficient our finding showed that the three aspect of access to dtpbased vaccine varied substantially in the asiapacific region with higher level in country with better health and economic performance affected by the covid19 pandemic vaccine accessibility fluctuates significantly in lowerincome country with dtp coverage rate falling by more than 14 in the philippine and indonesia between 2019 and 2021 for availability and affordability singapore and malaysia from highincome group were largely affected which may be related to health expenditure a a percentage of gross domestic product coefficient 039 p 003 our study indicates that greater attention need to be paid to national health expenditure and routine immunization service to improve vaccine disparity and increase the robustness and resilience of the vaccine supply chain during public health emergency

processed_title: seroprevalence of igg antibody against diphtheria antitoxin among migrant worker in singapore 20162019
processed_abstract: background since the last local case of diphtheria in 1992 there had not been any case in singapore until an autochthonous case wa reported in 2017 this fatal diphtheria case of a migrant worker raised concern about the potential reemergence of locally transmitted toxigenic diphtheria in singapore we conducted a seroprevalence study to assess the immunity level to diphtheria among migrant worker in singapore method residual serum from migrant worker who hailed from bangladesh china india indonesia malaysia myanmar and the philippine were tested for antidiphtheria toxoid immunoglobulin g igg antibody these migrant worker previously participated in a survey between 2016 and 2019 and had provided blood sample a part of the survey procedure result a total of 2176 migrant worker were included in the study their overall mean age wa 271 year standard deviation 50 range wa 2043 year the proportion having at least basic protection against diphtheria antitoxin titre 001 iuml ranged from 779 95 confidence interval ci 728 823 among migrant worker from bangladesh to 967 95 ci 925 986 in those hailing from malaysia the proportion showing full protection antitoxin titre 010 iuml ranged from 101 95 ci 65 154 in chinese worker to 230 95 ci 171 303 in malaysian worker there were no significant difference in the proportion with at least basic protection across birth cohort except for those from bangladesh where the seroprevalence wa significantly lower in younger migrant worker born after 1989 conclusion the proportion having at least basic protection against diphtheria in migrant worker from five out of seven asian country india indonesia malaysia myanmar and the philippine were higher than 85 the threshold for diphtheria herd immunity seroprevalence survey should be conducted periodically to assess the level of immunity against diphtheria and other vaccine preventable disease in migrant worker population so that appropriate intervention such a booster vaccination can be implemented proactively to prevent sporadic outbreak

processed_title: incidence of myocarditis associated with diphtheria tetanus and pertussis vaccine a rare case series
processed_abstract: myocarditis induced by diphtheriatetanuspertussis dtp vaccination is extremely rare accounting for only two case thus far hence to supplement knowledge regarding it pathogenesis and treatment we reported two case of myocarditis associated with dtp vaccination in adult two patient a 40yearold female and a 43yearold male presented with mild symptom and were hemodynamically stable in both patient the dtp vaccination wa given 4 and 6 day before admission both patient had prolonged corrected qt interval qtc poor left ventricular function and high troponin level at admission however numerous st segment depression wa only noted in the first case bacteriology and virology study result were negative for any pathogen no atherosclerotic lesion were observed by coronary angiography cardiac magnetic resonance imaging wa only performed in the second case which confirmed the diagnosis of myocarditis initial therapy wa administered with a betablocker angiotensinconverting enzyme inhibitor and intravenous methylprednisolone nonetheless in the first case rapid clinical deterioration and sudden cardiac death occur within 3 day of hospitalization learn from the first case a highdose intravenous immunoglobulin ivig treatment wa initiated in the second case which resulted in an improvement in left ventricular function and clinical symptom a well a a significant reduction in qtc interval and troponin level rapid diagnostic testing and early recognition of the fulminant course is mandatory allowing clinician to aggressively treat the patient with highdose intravenous immune globulin thus obtaining a better outcome

processed_title: new approach for the identification of potentially toxigenic corynebacterium sp using a multiplex pcr assay
processed_abstract: in diphtheria laboratory examination the pcr test can be applied to isolates and clinical specimen this study aimed to develop a pcr assay to identify the specie and toxigenicity of diphtheriacausing bacteria including the prediction of some nttb type seven reference isolates four synthetic dna sample 36 stored isolates and 487 clinical sample used for pcr optimization the pcr result wa confirmed by dna sequence analysis the result of the pcr examination of the 7 reference isolates and 36 stored isolates were similar to the result obtained using conventional method a gold standard both for diphtheriacausing and nondiphtheriacausing bacteria the validation of the pcr result using dna sequence analysis showed that there wa no mispriming or misamplification the multiplex pcr assay developed in this study could correctly identify the specie and toxigenicity of diphtheriacausing bacteria including the prediction of some nttb type not yet covered by established pcr method

processed_title: expression sarkosyl solubilization dnase activity purification and spr binding affinity of recombinant diphtheria toxoid rcrm197ek expressed in escherichia coli bl21de3
processed_abstract: crm197ek is a derivative of diphtheria toxoid crossreactive material197 crm197 with twopoint mutation k51e and e148k to improve it property for a vaccine conjugate and drug delivery a previous study ha shown that intracellularly expressing crm197ek in escherichia coli e coli host formed inclusion body that need a complicated purification and refolding step protein purification from inclusion body can be overcome by solubilization of inclusion body by using nlauroyl sarcosine sarkosyl in this work recombinant crm197ek rcrm197ek wa expressed in e coli bl21 de3 a inclusion body then solubilized using sarkosyl to form a soluble rcrm197ek without the need for a renaturation process furthermore rcrm197ek wa purified using the ninta column characterized by sdspage and western blot and it biological activity wa assayed through it dnase activity moreover it binding affinity with antidiphtheria toxin dt antibody wa measured using the surface plasmon resonance spr the result showed that solubilization with sarkosyl form soluble rcrm197ek 6161 kda wa confirmed by sdspage and western blot with a yield of 28 mgml rcrm197ek show dnase activity and the spr assay show that it can interact with an antidt antibody with a binding energy of 92 kcalmol

processed_title: detection of toxinproducing corynebacterium diphtheriae from throat swab of diphtheria patient using duplex realtime pcr
processed_abstract: background and objective diphtheria is a potentially fatal disease caused by toxigenic bacterial infection particularly from corynebacterium diphtheriae c diphtheriae isolation of c diphtheriae is technically lacking in sensitivity and eleks test to detect toxin production ha several difficulty associated with it application duplex realtime pcr to throat swab of suspected diphtheria patient can detect both bacteria and toxinencoding gene simultaneously faster with higher sensitivity and specificity material and method a total of 89 consecutive throat swab from suspected diphtheria patient were collected from sulianti saroso infectious disease hospital jakarta during 2018 to 2019 two pair of primer and probe targeting the rpob gene of c diphtheriae and the asubunit of the diphtheria toxin gene were used in this study parameter including annealing temperature concentration of primer and probe inhibitor crossreaction and detection limit were all optimized eleks toxigenicity test and clinical data were analyzed for comparison result the optimum annealing temperature wa 55 degree c the concentration of cd primer tox primer cd probe and tox probe were 04 06 05 and 0625 microm respectively dna elution and template volume were 50 microl and 5 microl the detection limit wa 2 cfuml no crossreaction with other microorganism wa observed of the 89 sample duplex realtime pcr gave better result than the standard test with 19 213 and 10 112 patient diagnosed with diphtheria respectively conclusion duplex realtime pcr increase the rate of laboratory diagnosis of diphtheria compared to the standard method to detect potentially toxigenic c diphtheriae

processed_title: exploring parent reason for incomplete childhood immunisation in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction immunisation is one of the most successful intervention for controlling infectious disease but relies on continuous high coverage parental vaccine refusal and logistical barrier to access are threat to the success of immunisation program with resultant population immunity gap leading to outbreak of vaccinepreventable disease in indonesia coverage of childhood vaccine is suboptimal with poor coverage of diphtheriatetanuspertussis vaccine leading to a large diphtheria outbreak in 2017 method to explore the underlying parent reason for incomplete childhood immunisation in indonesia semistructured interview were conducted in tangerang selatan banten province indonesia sixteen purposively selected primary carers of partially and unimmunised child were interviewed transcript were coded and analysed using inductive thematic analysis result parental reason were categorised into three interrelated theme of belief barrier safety concern and issue of trust and misinformation stark difference were evident in reason provided by carers of unimmunised child compared to partially immunised child for parent of unimmunised child islamic belief belief in the strength of natural immunity and the use of alternative medicine strongly influenced behaviour safety concern issue of trust including distrust in the government misinformation and trust in information obtained through social network were also prominent in contrast concern about mild sideeffects and logistical barrier outweighed belief among carers of partially immunised child conclusion our finding highlight the complexity in decision making for parent who decide not to vaccinate their child in the indonesian context public health education and engagement of religious leader to bridge the gap between religious belief and vaccine acceptance are needed to address vaccine refusal future research on the influence of social network on vaccine hesitancy in the indonesian context is also warranted for parent of partially vaccinated child intervention should focus on barrier of access to community health staff to encourage timely schedule completion

processed_title: firstline antibiotic susceptibility pattern of toxigenic corynebacterium diphtheriae in indonesia
processed_abstract: background diphtheria ha been reported a an outbreak in some region in indonesia most especially in east java province resistance to penicillin erythromycin and other antibiotic single or multiple ha been reported in several study this study aim to evaluate the firstline antibiotic susceptibility pattern of toxigenic corynebacterium diphtheriae isolates method this descriptive observational study wa performed from august to november 2018 c diphtheriae isolates were collected from diphtheria patient and carrier in east java from 2012 to 2017 and kept at the balai besar laboratorium kesehatan daerah surabaya or the public health laboratory of surabaya sample selection wa done by random cluster sampling the sensitivity test by etestrof the five antibiotic penicillin oxacillin erythromycin azithromycin and clarithromycin wa done to determine the minimum inhibitory concentration mic the clinical and laboratory standard institute m45a 2015 corynebacterium spp for penicillin and erythromycin wa used a standard result from 114 targeted isolates 108 were viable and toxigenic the etest wa performed on the viable isolates the majority of the host were male 583 with median range age of 65 114 year half of the sample were from the 1 to 5yearold age group the isolates were acquired much more from patient 787 than carrier 213 and from pharyngeal swab 741 most of these isolates were from madura island 472 and the northern and eastern part of the province horseshoe area mitis isolates were the major variant 769 the susceptibility pattern of c diphtheriae to erythromycin wa better than that to penicillin the etest result for penicillin wa 6852 susceptible 3148 intermediate and 0 resistant mic range 0016 to 2 mugl and for erythromycin mic range 0016 to 256 mugl wa 852 susceptible 12 intermediate and 28 resistant the mic range for oxacillin wa 1 to 96 mugl while for both azithromycin and clarithromycin were 0016 to 256 mugl conclusion the susceptibility rate of c diphtheriae to erythromycin is higher than that to penicillin the regular update of antibiotic selection to the national guideline is recommended the mic reference standard to azithromycin and clarithromycin is also needed

processed_title: medical student positive perception towards vaccination is strongly correlated to protective diphtheria antibody after td vaccination
processed_abstract: negative perception towards vaccination is one of the reason for low coverage of diphtheria immunization in indonesia perception which is difficult to change is related to stress level possibly influence outcome of disease and also vaccination this study aim to identify the correlation between perception of diphtheria vaccination and antibody response after vaccination this study used secondary data from two unpublished study on 30 medical intern in hasan sadikin hospital bandung west java after diphtheria outbreak from june to july 2019 antibody level after diphtheria emergency vaccination wa measured using elisa and perception towards vaccination wa measured using a questionnaire perception towards vaccination wa expressed a perception score and wa divided into 4 component perceived threat benefit barrier and cue to action higher perception score indicated more positive perception towards vaccination diphtheria antibody level wa grouped into reliable protection 010 iuml or unreliable protection 010 iuml statistical correlation analysis wa done with graphpad prism version 70 most of our subject were female median age wa 22 2024 year old median time elapsed between vaccination date and measurement of antibody level wa 18 618 month median antibody level wa 028 009347 iuml twentythree subject 821 had reliable protection subject with reliable protection had more positive perception compared to unreliable protection perception score 806 54 v 690 18 p 00001 subject with reliable protection had less perceived barrier for vaccination 156 21 v 130 18 p 00083 perception score showed strong positive correlation to reliable protection against diphtheria r 0705 p 0001 perceived barrier and threat showed positive correlation to reliable protection r 0489 p 0008 and r 0402 p 0034 in conclusion perception towards diphtheria vaccination is strongly correlated to protective antibody improving perception of vaccination are needed to overcome vaccine hesitancy

processed_title: evaluation of a multinational multilingual vaccine debate on twitter
processed_abstract: background public confidence in an immunization programme is a pivotal determinant of the programme success the mining of social medium is increasingly employed to provide insight into the public sentiment this research further explores the value of monitoring social medium to understand public sentiment about an international vaccination programme objective to gain insight into international public discussion on the paediatric pentavalent vaccine dtphepbhib programme by analysing twitter message method using a multilingual search we retrospectively collected all public twitter message mentioning the dtphepbhib vaccine from july 2006 until may 2015 we analysed message characteristic by frequency of referencing other website type of website and geographic focus of the discussion in addition a sample of message wa manually annotated for positive or negative message tone result we retrieved 5771 message only 31 of the message were reaction to other message and 866 referred to website mostly news site 707 other social medium 98 and healthinformation site 95 country mention were identified in 704 of the message of which india 354 indonesia 183 and vietnam 139 were the most prevalent in the annotated sample 63 of the message showed a positive or neutral sentiment about dtphepbhib peak in negative and positive message could be related to countryspecific programme event conclusion public message about dtphepbhib were characterized by little interaction between tweeter and by frequent referencing of website and other information link twitter message can indirectly reflect the public opinion about major event in the debate about the dtphepbhib vaccine

processed_title: the role of dexmedetomidine in airway management for tracheostomy in pediatric patient with obstructed airway due to diphtheria a case report
processed_abstract: introduction diphtheria is an infectious disease caused by exotoxinproducing corynebacterium diphteriae and wa a leading cause of death in childhood during the prevaccine era this toxin is usually localized in the upper respiratory tract and may cause fatal airway obstruction many have used orotracheal intubation to secure the airway in diphtheria case however the efficacy of tracheostomy under sedation while maintaining spontaneous ventilation and analgesia using transtracheal and superficial cervical block remains to be elucidated case presentation a 6yearold presented to the emergency room with respiratory distress and wa diagnosed with diphtheria a thick membrane in the oropharyngeal area and chest xray showed infiltration indicative of pneumonia the patient successfully underwent emergency tracheostomy under sedation using a combination of sevoflurane and dexmedetomidine to achieve prompt sedation and transtracheal injection and bilateral superficial cervical block a analgesia for the intratracheal and the incision the patient condition deteriorated the next day and the bronchoscopy showed that the carina and main bronchus were covered by a pseudomembrane obstructing the airway below the tracheostomy the patient eventually died two day after admission conclusion dexmedetomidine ha minimal impact on ventilatory function and antisialagogue property while sevoflurane ha minimal effect on respiratory depression this case presentation showed that a combination of sevoflurane and dexmedetomidine with spontaneous assisted ventilation could be helpful in tracheostomy procedure in pediatric patient with airway obstruction due to diphtheria along with the use of transtracheal and superficial cervical block a the analgesia this report also indicates that being vigilant in rapidlyprogressing and fatal pediatric diphtheria case is vital

processed_title: homebased record and vaccination appointment sticker a parental reminder to reduce vaccination dropout in indonesia a clusterrandomized controlled trial
processed_abstract: introduction limited evidence is available about the effectiveness of strategy to remind caregiver when to bring child back for future vaccination in low and middleincome country setting we evaluated the effectiveness of two reminder strategy based on homebased vaccination record hbr in indonesia method in this clusterrandomized controlled trial involving 3616 child 1 year of age 90 health facility were randomly assigned to either a control group or one of two intervention group 1 hbronly group where healthcare worker provided an hbr to any child without an hbr during a vaccination visit and instructed the caregiver to keep it at home between visit or 2 hbr sticker group where in addition to hbr provision healthcare worker placed vaccination appointment reminder sticker on the hbr the primary outcome wa receipt of the third dose of diphtheriatetanuspertussiscontaining vaccine dtpcv3 within 7 month and the secondary outcome wa receipt of a timely dtpcv3 dose result control group dtpcv3 coverage wa 81 in intentiontotreat analysis neither intervention group had significantly different dtpcv3 coverage compared with the control group rr 094 95 confidence interval ci 087 102 for hbronly group rr 097 95 ci 090 104 for hbr sticker group by study end however child in the hbr sticker group were 50 more likely to have received a dtpcv3 vaccination rr 146 95 ci 102 209 within 60 day of dtpcv1 vaccination compared with child in the control group child in the hbronly group were not more likely to have done so rr 105 95 ci 071 155 discussion reminder sticker had an immediate effect on coverage by improving the proportion of child who received a timely dtpcv3 dose but no effect on the proportion who received dtpcv3 after 7 month coupling reminder sticker with strategy to address other reason why child do not return for vaccination visit should be further explored

processed_title: immunogenicity and safety of four different dos of haemophilus influenzae type btetanus toxoid conjugated vaccine combined with diphtheriatetanuspertussis vaccine dtphib in indonesian infant
processed_abstract: widespread use of haemophilus influenzae type b hib conjugated vaccine in industrialized country ha resulted in a dramatic decline in the incidence of invasive hib disease but the
