vaccine cost ha prevented it inclusion in basic immunization program in developing country to overcome this problem combination with diphtheriatetanuspertussis dtp vaccine or reduction in the dose of hib vaccine ha been proposed to evaluate the immunogenicity and adverse reaction from lower dos of hibpolyribosylphosphate prp conjugated with tetanus toxoid prpt a doubleblind study wa conducted in jakarta indonesia and it suburb a total of 1048 infant 6 week to 6 month of age received three dos of dtp vaccine combined with the usual 10 microg dose or with a reduced dose of 5 25 or 125 microg of prpt at twomonthly interval antibody were measured prior to the first dose and 46 week following the third dose adverse reaction were similar among all four group the only significant difference wa a higher rate of irritability p002 and of temperature elevation 38 degree c p0009 after dos 1 and 2 in the lowest dose group 125 microg prpt compared to the other group all participant tested had a 4fold increase in antibody against all dtp antigen in addition after a fourth booster dose of hib 996 of infant produced or015 microgml of antibody to hibprp and 964 showed level or10 microgml after primary immunization level that correlate with short and longterm immunity respectively antibody titer to the prp antigen showed no significant difference among dosage group with the exception of the 50 microg group which had a significantly higher gmc than the 125 microg group p0012 this study demonstrates that primary vaccination with half onefourth or oneeighth of the usual dose of prpt combined with dtp vaccine produce protective immune response and ha side effect that are comparable to dtp vaccination alone in these lower dosage prpt conjugate vaccine can lower vaccine cost to a level that is affordable for infant immunization program in developing country

processed_title: secondary metabolite and antipyretic effect of maja crescentia cujete l in feverinduced mouse
processed_abstract: objective fever is a condition when the body experience an increase in average body temperature above normal level maja fruit crescentia cujete l contains chemical compound including alkaloid flavonoid saponin and terpenoid suspected a potential antipyretic method the study aimed to determine the antipyretic activity of ethanol extract of maja fruit a total of 25 male white mouse of the ddy strain 2030 g these treatment divided into three group with a dose extract of 125 250 500 mgkg bw standard group of ibuprofen 400 mgkg bw and control group of cmcna 1 mouse were injected intraperitoneally with 01 cc of dpt vaccineinduced observation were made by measuring the rectal temperature of mouse using a digital thermometer before dpt vaccine injected or average temperature at 0 min after dpt vaccine injected 60 120 180 and 240 min after administering the test material the difference between the positive control group test group and the negative control group were compared using statistical analysis using oneway variance analysis anova the result were considered statistically when the value is p005 result the above phytochemical screening result showed that alkaloid flavonoid and saponin were present in the maja fruit powder and extract c cujete l based on the result of the statistical analysis obtained ie group ii wa not significantly different from group iii and group iv p005 and wa significantly different from group i and group v group i wa significantly different from group ii group iii and group iv and wa not significantly different from group v p005 conclusion the study showed that maja fruit mices antipyretic behavior at dos of 125 250 and 500 mgkg bw wa confirmed a a result in reducing the body temperature of male mouse the 500 mgkg bw dosage of maja fruit extract c cujete l effectively reduced fever

processed_title: tetracycline resistance of corynebacterium diphtheriae isolated from diphtheria patient in jakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: of 133 corynebacterium diphtheriae isolates from diphtheria patient in jakarta indonesia 86 were resistant to greater than or equal to 32 microgram of tetracycline per ml all isolates were sensitive to ampicillin cephalothin chloramphenicol clindamycin penicillin erythromycin and kanamycin the general resistance of c diphtheriae to tetracycline in this part of indonesia appears to be unique compared with resistance reported in study done in other part of the world

processed_title: diphtheria or streptococcal pharyngitis a case report highlighting the diagnostic dilemma in the postvaccination era
processed_abstract: diphtheria is an acute highly infectious toxigenic and vaccinepreventable disease that commonly affect child under 12 year of age the incidence of diphtheria have significantly dropped due to vaccination with diphtheria pertussis tetani dpt recently there is an increasing trend in report of diphtheria throughout the world and specifically from developing country according to a world health organization who report more than 80 of the global diphtheria case in the postvaccination era were from india and indonesia this could probably be signaling it reemergence which may be attributed to several factor that include incomplete immunization pharyngitis caused by group a streptococcus is most frequently seen in child and can be clinically similar in presentation to diphtheria we share our experience of managing a case of an eightyearold child who wa clinically suspected to be suffering from diphtheria

processed_title: diphtheria toxinmediated transposondriven poly atrapping efficiently disrupts transcriptionally silent gene in embryonic stem cell
processed_abstract: random gene trapping is the application of insertional mutagenesis technique that are conventionally used to inactivate proteincoding gene in mouse embryonic stem e cell transcriptionally silent gene are not effectively targeted by conventional random gene trapping technique thus we herein developed an unbiased poly a trap upatrap method using a tol2 transposon which preferentially integrated into active gene rather than silent gene in e cell to achieve efficient trapping at transcriptionally silent gene using random insertional mutagenesis in e cell we generated a new diphtheria toxin dtmediated trapping vector dtrap that removed cell through the expression of dt that wa induced by the promoter activity of the trapped gene and selected trapped clone using the neomycinresistance gene of the vector we found that a doubledt the ddt vector dominantly induced the disruption of silent gene but not active gene and showed more stable integration in e cell than the upatrap vector the ddt vector disrupted differentiated cell lineage gene which were silent in e cell and labeled trapped clone cell by the expression of egfp upon differentiation thus the ddt vector provides a systematic approach to disrupt silent gene and examine the cellular function of trapped gene in the differentiation of target cell and development

processed_title: humoral immune response to tetanusdiphtheria vaccine given during extended use of chloroquine or primaquine malaria chemoprophylaxis
processed_abstract: immune suppression resulting from prolonged chemoprophylaxis and potential drugvaccine interaction were investigated within the context of a randomized placebocontrolled trial that compared daily primaquine or weekly chloroquine administration for malaria prevention after 11 month of prophylaxis adult male subject received a tetanusdiphtheria td vaccination prophylaxis continued 4 week longer antitetanus and antidiphtheria antibody level were measured by elisa at baseline and at 1 3 7 and 14 month after td vaccination all group were comparable at baseline immunization triggered significant increase in antitetanus and antidiphtheria igg level over each group pretd baseline level and those of an unvaccinated control group geometric mean antitetanus titer gmt in the primaquine group were significantly higher than those of the placebo group at 1 3 and 14 month antitetanus gmt in placebo and chloroquine group declined over 14 month to level comparable to those of unvaccinated control but level in the primaquine group remained significantly higher than in control

processed_title: dtwphbhib antibody persistence after a primary series immune response and safety after a booster dose in child 1824 month old
processed_abstract: background the new combination of dtwphbhib vaccine ha been developed in indonesia following world health organization who recommendation and integrated into national immunization program the aim of the study were to measure 1 antibody persistence 1218 month after a primary series 2 immune response and safety after a booster dose of dtwphbhib method this wa a multicenter openlabeled prospective interventional study subject who had received complete primary dose of dtwphbhib vaccine from the previous phase iii trial were recruited in this trial subject were given one dose of dtwphbhib pentabior booster at age 1824 month old diphtheria tetanus pertussis hepatitis b hemophilus influenza type b antibody were measured before and after booster to determine antibody persistence and immune response vaccine adverse event were assessed immediately and monitored until 28 day after the booster recorded with parent diary card result there were 396 subject who completed the study increased proportion of seroprotected subject from prebooster to postbooster were noted in all vaccine antigen 745 to 997 for diphtheria 100 to 100 for tetanus 404 to 955 for pertussis 902 to 995 for hepatitis b and 977 to 100 for hib common systemic adverse event aes were irritability 23725 and fever 399452 local aes such a redness swelling and induration were significantly less common in the thigh group 77 113 and 71 than in the deltoid group 289 307 and 25 p 0001 most aes were mild and resolved spontaneously within threeday followup period conclusion booster of dtwphbhib vaccine at age 1824 month is required to achieve and maintain optimal protective antibody the vaccine is safe and immunogenic to be used for booster vaccination trial registration nct02095314 retrospectively registered march 24 2014

processed_title: diphtheria transmission prediction by extended kalman filter
processed_abstract: diphtheria transmission in west java becomes our concern in this paper the finding of this article are implementation of isolation and estimation technique of parameter using extended kalman filter on the model of diphtheria transmission from the eigenvalue of next generation matrix the basic reproduction number is obtained then the implementation of using extended kalman filter provides the trend of the basic reproduction number of the diphtheria model with several case dpt only booster only and a combination of dpt and booster based on the value of rmse nrmse and mape the extended kalman filter method provides significant result in estimating the basic reproduction number on actual data of diphtheria case in west java we also studied the quarantined population in this article because the rate of isolation ha a significant impact on the profile of the susceptible infected quarantined and recovered population based on the result obtained dpt only give the smallest number when compared to booster only and the combination of dpt and booster this is likely when dpt only is given the body form an immune system so giving booster only doe not provide significant result in reducing the level of effectiveness of diphtheria transmission reducing the basic reproduction numberthis paper purpose to get the prediction of diphtheria transmission by using extended kalman filterthe basic reproduction number is also studied for the dpt only booster only and the combination of dpt and boosterthe extended kalman filter show the good performance based on the rmse nrmse and mape

processed_title: assessing the impact of the expanded programme on immunization the example of indonesia
processed_abstract: the early impact of the expanded programme on immunization epi in reducing morbidity from diphtheria wa evaluated in the province of yogyakarta java indonesia since 1980 coverage of two dos of diphtheriatetanuspertussis dtp immunization ha been greater than 60 in yogyakarta the morbidity rate for diphtheria for child aged 04 year decreased from 43 per 100 000 population in 197879 to 17 per 100 000 in 198182 a reduction of 60 in contrast the morbidity rate for child aged 59 year remained relatively constant over the 5year period the epi programme ha therefore had a demonstrable effect on 04yearolds in yogyakarta

processed_title: complete genome sequence of bordetella pertussis pelita iii the production strain for an indonesian wholecell pertussis vaccine
processed_abstract: pt bio farma the sole world health organizationapproved indonesian vaccine producer manufacture a wholecell whooping cough vaccine wp that a part of a pentavalent diphtheriatetanuspertussishepatitis bhaemophilus influenzae b dtphbhib vaccine is used in indonesia and many other country we report here the wholegenome sequence for bordetella pertussis pelita iii pt bio farmas wp production strain

processed_title: oral iodine supplementation doe not reduce neutralizing antibody response to oral poliovirus vaccine
processed_abstract: iodine deficiency is a major cause of impaired mental development goitre and cretinism in many part of the world because existing immunization programme can be used to deliver oral iodized oil oio to infant at risk it wa important to know whether oio could adversely affect the antibody response to vaccine such a trivalent oral poliovirus vaccine opv a randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled clinical trial wa conducted in subang west java indonesia in which 617 eightweekold infant received either oio or a placebo poppyseed oil during a routine visit for their first dose of opv a part of the expanded programme on immunization epi the infant received two booster of opv at 4week interval after the first dose and were followed up when 6 month old neutralizing antibody titre to poliovirus serotypes 1 2 and 3 were compared in serum sample that were taken from 478 of these infant just before the first dose of opv and at 6 month it wa found that oral iodized oil did not reduce the antibody response to any of the three serotypes of opv these result indicate that oral iodine may safely be delivered to infant at the same time a oral poliovirus vaccine according to current epi immunization schedule

processed_title: immunogenicity and safety profile of a primary dose of bivalent oral polio vaccine given simultaneously with dtwphbhib and inactivated poliovirus vaccine at the 4th visit in indonesian infant
processed_abstract: in this study we aimed to evaluate the immunological protectivity of infant following four dos of bivalent oral polio vaccine bopv bio farma which were given simultaneously with dtwphbhib pentabior along with one dose of inactivated poliovirus vaccine ipv at the fourth visit a total of 143 newborn infant who fulfilled the inclusion criterion were enrolled and completed the study subject received the first dose of bopv at birth on day 60 90 and 120 bopv wa given simultaneously with pentabior on day 120 one dose of ipv wa also administered serum sample for serology analysis were collected before the first dose of bopv at day 0 before the second dose of bopv at day 60 and 30 day after the last dose of bopv in addition the intensity duration and relationship of each adverse event to the trial vaccine were assessed seroprotection rate after the fourth dose of bopv were 100 916 and 993 for poliovirus p1 p2 and p3 respectively seroconversion rate after the fourth dose of bopv were 1000 933 and 100 for poliovirus p1 p2 and p3 respectively there were no severe adverse event and systemic reaction were generally mild during the 128 day postvaccination period collectively our finding indicate that bopv given simultaneously with pentabior and one dose of ipv at the 4th visit wa immunogenic and well tolerated

processed_title: incidence of vaccinepreventable haemophilus influenzae type b pneumonia and meningitis in indonesian child hamletrandomised vaccineprobe trial
processed_abstract: background most study of haemophilus influenzae type b hib disease in asia have found low rate and few asian country use hib vaccine in routine immunisation programme whether hib disease truly is rare or whether many case remain undetected is unclear method to estimate incidence of vaccinepreventable hib pneumonia and meningitis among child younger than 2 year in lombok indonesia during 19982002 we undertook a hamletrandomised controlled doubleblind vaccineprobe study 818 hamlet child were immunised who schedule with diphtheria tetanus pertussis dtp or dtpprpt hib conjugate vaccine vaccinepreventable disease incidence were calculated a the difference in rate of clinical outcome between dtp and dtpprpt group analysis included all child who received at least one vaccine dose finding we enrolled 55073 child 28147 were assigned dtpprpt and 26926 dtp the proportion of pneumonia outcome prevented by vaccine ranged from less than 0 to 48 calculated incidence of vaccinepreventable hib disease per 105 childyears of observation for outcome category were substantial alveolar consolidation or effusion less than zero 43 95 ci 185 to 98 all severe pneumonia 264 95 ci less than zero to 629 all clinical pneumonia 1561 270 to 2853 confirmed hib meningitis 16 14 to 31 meningitis with cerebrospinalfluid finding consistent with a bacterial aetiology 67 22 to 112 and admission for suspected meningitis or presenting to a clinic with convulsion 158 42 to 273 interpretation hib vaccine did not prevent the great majority of pneumonia case including those with alveolar consolidation these result do not support a major role for hib vaccine in overall pneumoniaprevention programme nevertheless the study identified high incidence of hib meningitis and pneumonia inclusion of hib vaccine in routine infant immunisation programme in asia deserves consideration

processed_title: depressed immune response to tetanus in child with vitamin a deficiency
processed_abstract: a randomized doublemasked placebocontrolled clinical trial wa conducted with 236 preschool child age 36 y in indonesia to assess immune status in mild vitamin a deficiency the immune response to tetanus immunization wa used a a measure of immune competence clinically normal child n 118 and child with mild xerophthalmia n 118 were randomly assigned to receive oral vitamin a 60000 microgram retinol equivalent or placebo treatment for a total of four study group two week after treatment child were immunized with diphtheriapertussistetanus vaccine the immunoglobulin g igg response to tetanus at baseline and 3 wk following immunization were measured by elisa after adjusting for previous tetanus immunization clinically normal and xerophthalmic child receiving vitamin a had a significantly greater igg response to tetanus than clinically normal and xerophthalmic child receiving placebo p less than 005 these result suggest that child with mild vitamin a deficiency have a relative immune depression compared with child who have been supplemented to normal vitamin a level

processed_title: lymphocyte response to tetanus toxoid among indonesian men immunized with tetanusdiphtheria during extended chloroquine or primaquine prophylaxis
processed_abstract: immune suppression a potential side effect of longterm chemoprophylaxis wa evaluated a part of a randomized placebocontrolled trial that compared daily primaquine against weekly chloroquine for malaria prevention in the last month of the yearlong trial baseline in vitro lymphoproliferative response to tetanus toxoid were measured and a tetanusdiphtheria td immunization wa administered proliferative response to tetanus toxoid in each tdimmunized group increased significantly over pretd baseline and those of the unvaccinated control highest initial response were measured in the primaquine group the proportion of responder and the magnitude of proliferation wa consistently low in the chloroquine group and end point response in this group were significantly below those of the placebo these result suggest that the development and duration of the cellular response to tetanus immunization wa impaired by longterm weekly chloroquine prophylaxis while daily primaquine prophylaxis over the same time period had no inhibitory effect

processed_title: participation effect from water project on epi
processed_abstract: it ha been hypothesized that in addition to the direct health and amenity benefit of an improved water supply there are other more subtle benefit to community who participate in communitybased water supply project a detailed empirical comparison of village with and without communitybased water project in indonesia and togo suggests that such indirect benefit are substantial between 25 and 30 more child are immunized in village with communitybased water project than in comparison village which either have benefitted from nonparticipatory water project or have had no water project from a comparison between the activity of villager and worker in external agency involved in water project in the two country it is concluded that successful participatory water project are best characterized a a partnership between the community and the external agency such project require substantial input of time resource skill and persistence from both the community and the external agency these input must be sustained by both party in all phasesplanning construction and maintenanceif this partnership is to result in lasting improvement in water supply and other aspect of community life

processed_title: silica gel a transport medium for corynebacterium diphtheriae under tropical condition indonesia
processed_abstract: silica gel wa confirmed a a useful transport medium for corynebacterium diphtheriae in the investigation of diphtheria case in which there is no ready access to laboratory facility

processed_title: expanded programme on immunization epi immunization schedule in the who southeast asia region 1995
processed_abstract: there are 10 country in this region bcg is given at birth and up to 1 week of life in 5 country bangladesh democratic people republic of korea india indonesia and nepal table 1 in 3 other country bcg is given from birth up to 1 year of age bhutan myanmar and thailand and in the remaining 2 country bcg is offered from birth to 3 year of age maldives and to 5 year of age sri lanka

processed_title: antidiphtheric toxin antibody in healthy child in kindergarten using the immunoenzymatic assay method
processed_abstract: although the immunization program for child in indonesia follows the who recommendation in some area high diphtheric morbidity rate still occur for child under 5 year of age this study deal with the elisa for immunoglobulin g antibody against diphtheric toxin in healthy child in kindergarten to determine the immunity status one hundred and ninety eight sample of serum were collected from child of 18 kindergarten in west east and south denpasar district and were investigated for igg diphtheria using the elisa method history of immunization wa obtained from the patient immunization card and an interview by the doctor it wa assumed to be immune when the igg level wa above 001 iuml eighty one out of 95 85 child from the control group who had never had basic immunization had igg level above 001 iuml and 81 out of 83 976 child from the group who had completed basic immunization 3 injection had igg level above 001 iuml it seemed that natural infection played still a major role to develop immunity in those child

processed_title: immunization in the well baby clinic of dr pirngadi hospital medan
processed_abstract: a retrospective study on an immunization programme wa carried out in the well baby clinic child health department school of medicine university of north sumatera dr pirngadi hospital medan from january to december 1986 of the 5951 total visit an average of 495 visit each month 3960 were primary and 1991 secondary visit most were first child in the family 399 of which 376 were from one child family of 3275 live birth 576 were immunized with bcg immediately after birth the average bcg immunization visit to the well baby clinic wa 17 visitsday when compared with dpt i and polio i visit we recorded a decrease of 271 for dpt ii 479 dpt iii 274 polio ii and 491 polio iii respectively daily coverage of measles immunization visit wa 46 complete immunization among the underoneyearold child wa 57 of which 449 were of the 912 month old group the simultaneous immunization bcg dpt polio measles comprised 05 of all visit 41 of all visit were not immunized of which 365 wa because they were beyond the immunization schedule

processed_title: risk factor associated with childhood stunting in indonesia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background and objective in indonesia stunting is one of the most public health concern this study aim to systematically review and metaanalyze childhood stunting risk factor in the country method and study design we did a systematic review and metaanalysis of observational crosssectional and longitudinal study on stunting risk factor published between 2010 and 2021 based on available publication in online database of pubmed proquest ebsco and google scholar the quality of the publication wa evaluated using the newcastleottawa quality assessment scale and organized according to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis publication bias wa examined using egger and beggs test result a total of 17 study from the literature search satisfied the inclusion criterion with 642596 subject the pooled stunting prevalence wa 309 95 ci 250368 child born with low birth weight por 239 207276 female por 105 103108 and did not get the deworming program 110 107112 are the primary child characteristic that contributed to stunting meanwhile maternal age 30 year por 233 223244 preterm birth por 212 215219 and antenatal care 4 time por 125 111141 were among mother characteristic consistently associated with stunting the primary household and community risk factor for stunting were food insecurity por 200 137292 unimproved drinking water por 142 126160 rural residence por 131 120142 and unimproved sanitation por 127 112144 conclusion a diverse range of risk factor associated with childhood stunting in indonesia demonstrates the need to emphasize nutrition program by scaling up to more on these determinant

processed_title: a review of child stunting determinant in indonesia
processed_abstract: child stunting reduction is the first of 6 goal in the global nutrition target for 2025 and a key indicator in the second sustainable development goal of zero hunger the prevalence of child stunting in indonesia ha remained high over the past decade and at the national level is approximately 37 it is unclear whether current approach to reduce child stunting align with the scientific evidence in indonesia we use the world health organization conceptual framework on child stunting to review the available literature and identify what ha been studied and can be concluded about the determinant of child stunting in indonesia and where data gap remain consistent evidence suggests nonexclusive breastfeeding for the first 6 month low household socioeconomic status premature birth short birth length and low maternal height and education are particularly important child stunting determinant in indonesia child from household with both unimproved latrine and untreated drinking water are also at increased risk community and societal factorsparticularly poor access to health care and living in rural areashave been repeatedly associated with child stunting published study are lacking on how education society and culture agriculture and food system and water sanitation and the environment contribute to child stunting this comprehensive synthesis of the available evidence on child stunting determinant in indonesia outline who are the most vulnerable to stunting which intervention have been most successful and what new research is needed to fill knowledge gap

processed_title: prenatal and postnatal determinant of stunting at age 011 month a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background childhood stunting remains the most challenging consequence of undernutrition because it is associated with suboptimal brain development and the subsequent increased risk of metabolic disease and decreased earnings in adult life the samba district in indonesia ha a high prevalence of stunting 284 followed by underweight 255 and wasting 144 among child a well chronic energy deficiency 27 and anemia 62 among pregnant woman the present study sought to determine significant factor in childhood stunting with a focus on maternal and child nutrition and prenatal and postnatal determinant method this prospective repeat crosssectional study investigated factor associated with stunting among 559 infant age 011 month in samba district indonesia anthropometric measurement were performed by trained enumerator data from a 2016 survey of pregnant woman and a 2017 survey on mother and their child were used for postnatal data collection to quantify the prevalence of stunting at age 011 month using 20 potential predictor of stunting categorized by household characteristic maternal characteristic antenatal care service and child characteristic logistic regression analysis wa conducted to assess the adjusted association between stunting and these factor result of 559 child analyzed 208 were stunted in the model with low birth weight lbw a predictor for stunting the odds of stunting increased significantly among child who weighed 2500 g at birth child who had diarrhea in the past 2 week and child who had incomplete basic immunization coverage a infant age 911 month in model without lbw the odds of stunting increased significantly among child who had preterm at birth short maternal stature and child who had incomplete basic immunization coverage for 911 month infant conclusion postnatal factorspreterm birth low birth weight diarrhea and complete basic immunization coveragewere associated with infant stunting in samba district indonesia the prenatal factor such a short maternal stature were significant in the multivariate model policy maker especially in the government should recommend measure focused on those prenatal and postnatal factor to prevent stunting in child and to avoid the sequela of childhood stunting in adult life

processed_title: the effect of the physical factor of parent and child on stunting at birth among newborn in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study examined stunting at birth and it association with physical factor of parent and child in indonesia method this study analyzed secondary data from the national crosssectional indonesian basic health survey 2018 conducted across 34 province and 514 districtscities birth length data were available for 756 newborn univariable bivariable and multivariable logistic regression analysis were performed to determine association between the physical factor of parent and child and stunting at birth result in total 102 of child aged 0 month were stunted at birth 107 of male and 95 of female stunting at birth wa associated with the mother age at first pregnancy parity parent height parent age and gestational age child from mother with short stature height lt1450 cm and father with short stature height lt1619 cm had an almost 6 time higher likelihood of being stunted at birth adjusted odds ratio 593 95 confidence interval 553 to 636 a higher maternal age at first pregnancy had a protective effect against stunting however other variable firstborn child preterm birth and both parent age being lt20 or gt35 year corresponded to a 2fold higher likelihood of stunting at birth compared to the reference conclusion these finding provide evidence that intervention to reduce stunting aimed at pregnant female should also consider the parent stature age and parity particularly if it is the first pregnancy and if the parent are short in stature or young robust program to support pregnant female and monitor childrens height from birth will help prevent intergenerational stunting

processed_title: predictor of stunting wasting and being underweight in indonesia a literature review
processed_abstract: parent often perceive that stunting wasting and being underweight in their child are solely influenced by nutritional intake in reality various factor contribute to these outcome the objective of this study wa to identify the factor associated with stunting wasting and being underweight in indonesia the design wa a systematic literature review using the prisma procedure the researcher applied a keyword search to database collected via science direct pubmed proquest sage and emerald to find relevant article published in english from 2016 to 2021 the result of the study found 17 relevant article and revealed several factor associated with stunting wasting and being underweight in indonesia all factor related to stunting wasting and underweight do not stand alone a the only predictor instead they interact and contribute collectively to the occurrence of these condition

processed_title: beyond personal factor multilevel determinant of childhood stunting in indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is still a major public health problem in low and middleincome country including indonesia previous study have reported the complexity associated with understanding the determinant of stunting this study aimed to examine the household subdistrict and provincelevel determinant of stunting in indonesia using a multilevel hierarchical mixed effect model method we analyzed data for 8045 child taken from the 2007 and 2014 wave of the indonesian family and life survey ifls we included individual familyhousehold and communitylevel variable in the analysis a multilevel mixed effect model wa employed to take into account the hierarchical structure of the data moreover the model captured the effect of unobserved household subdistrict and provincelevel characteristic on the probability of child being stunted result our finding showed that the odds of childhood stunting vary significantly not only by individual child and householdlevel characteristic but also by province and subdistrictlevel characteristic among the childlevel covariates included in our model dietary habit neonatal weight a history of infection and sex significantly affected the risk of stunting household wealth status and parental education are significant householdlevel covariates associated with a higher risk of stunting finally the risk of stunting is higher for child living in community without access to water sanitation and hygiene conclusion stunting is associated with not only childlevel characteristic but also family and communitylevel characteristic hence intervention to reduce stunting should also take into account family and community characteristic to achieve effective outcome

processed_title: determinant of malnutrition among child a systematic review
processed_abstract: objective child undernutrition is a major public health problem globally in 2020 149 million child 5 y of age were estimated to be stunted too short for age 45 million to be wasted too thin for height and 389 million were overweight the aim of this review wa to examine previous study to determine the factor associated with malnutrition and contribute to the existing body of evidence needed for the formulation of effective intervention method this systematic review wa conducted using the 2020 preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysis guideline the google scholar database wa used to search the study conducted between 2012 and 2021 the included study were searched by using some combination of keywords and saved in mendeley desktop for review and referencing result of 2150 article retrieved from the google scholar database 37 met our inclusion criterion of the 37 study reviewed 13 were conducted in india 5 in ethiopia 3 in bangladesh 2 in ghana 2 in nepal 2 in developing country and 1 each in bolira benin netherland columbia pakistan malaysia africa egypt ecuadorian and indonesia conclusion the most consistent factor associated with child malnutrition were maternal education household income maternal nutritional status age of the child availability of sanitation facility at home size of family birth order in the family and child birth weight breastfeeding and caring practice cooking area and the fuel used sex and socioeconomic status of the child also contribute toward child malnutrition

processed_title: childhood stunting and cognitive effect of water and sanitation in indonesia
processed_abstract: close to 100 million indonesian lack access to improved sanitation while 33 million live without improved drinking water indonesia is home to the second largest number of open defecator in the world behind india repeated exposure to fecal pathogen especially common in area where open defecation is practiced can cause poor absorption and nutrient loss through diarrhea and poor gut function leading to undernutrition growth stunting and irreversible impairment of health development learning and earnings the effect of which outlast a lifetime using data from a sample of over six thousand child in the indonesia family life survey ifls a household socioeconomic panel representative of over 80 percent of the indonesian population we examine the relationship between poor household and community water and sanitation service and childhood stunting and cognitive development we find that child living in household that have access to improved sanitation when they are under 2 year of age are approximately 5 percentage point less likely to end up being stunted community rate of sanitation are also important child living in open defecation free community during this critical development window are more than 10 percentage point less likely to be stunted than child in community where all other household defecate in the open further cognitive test score are adversely affected by open defecation these finding suggest that owning a toilet and living in a community where most of one neighbor own a toilet are important driver of child growth and development

processed_title: household structure and concurrent stunting and overweight among young child in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective to examine the association of household type and household composition with concurrent stunting and overweight in young child from urban and rural indonesia design this study is a secondary data analysis using a nationally representative crosssectional survey household structure wa analysed a household type household size number of working adult number of dependent adult and child and household head gender we defined concurrent stunting and overweight a heightforage zscore 2 and weightforheight zscore 2 based on who growth standard multivariable logistic regression to test the aforementioned association wa performed separately for urban and rural area setting data were from indonesia basic heath research 2013 participant child aged 25 year n 45 050 result the prevalence of concurrent stunting and overweight child wa 56 in rural area this prevalence differed significantly by household type and the highest prevalence wa among child in nuclear twoparent household 68 in rural area child in extended household had lower odds of concurrent stunting and overweight than those from nuclear household or 073 95 ci 059 092 in urban area household size and number of working adult were significantly associated with the decreased odds of concurrent stunting and overweight in child conclusion household structure wa associated with childrens concurrent stunting and overweight in urban and rural region of indonesia the pattern of the association might differ between urban and rural region but no significant interaction term wa found

processed_title: stunting among child under two year in indonesia doe maternal education matter
processed_abstract: background measuring height for age is one of the essential indicator for evaluating childrens growth the study analyzes the association between maternal education and stunting among child under two year in indonesia method the study employed secondary data from the 2017 indonesia nutritional status monitoring survey the unit of analysis wa child under two year and the study obtained weighted sample of 70293 child besides maternal education other independent variable analyzed in this study were residence maternal age maternal marital status maternal employment childrens age and gender in the final stage the study occupied a multivariate test by binary logistic regression test result the result show the proportion of stunted child under two year in indonesia nationally is 201 mother in primary school and under education category are 1587 time more likely than mother with a college education to have stunted child under two year 95 ci 15761598 meanwhile mother with a junior high school education have a chance of 1430 time more than mother with a college education to have stunted child under two year 95 ci 14201440 moreover mother with education in the senior high school category have 1230 time more chance than mother with a college education to have stunted child under two year 95 ci 12221238 conclusion the study concluded that the maternal education level wa associated with stunting child under two year in indonesia the lower the mother level of education the higher the chance of a mother having stunted child under two year

processed_title: impact of stunting on development of child between 13 year of age
processed_abstract: background stunting occurs due to chronic malnutrition and is a major problem for child in developing country it is important to evaluate the impact of stunting on the development of child this study aimed to investigate the impact of stunting on the development of child between 13 year of age method this crosssectional study wa conducted from july 2020 to march 2021 in surabaya indonesia a questionnaire and growth assessment were done following the development measurement to stunted and nonstunted child who met the inclusion and exclusion criterion development wa measured by the denver developmental screening test ii ddstii and cognitive adaptive testclinical linguistic auditory milestone catclams scale result three hundred child are included in this study consisting of 150 stunted and 150 nonstunted child stunted child had a higher risk to be suspected of delayed development compared to nonstunted child the crude odd ratio wa 298 424 475 with the pvalue 0006 0001 and 0001 respectively the adjusted odd ratio wa 034 024 021 with pvalue of 0008 0001 and 0001 respectively conclusion stunting is associated with suspected development delay among child 13 year of age initiative related to prevention need to be established and nutrition advice need to be provided

processed_title: determinant of socioeconomic and ruralurban disparity in stunting evidence from indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction stunting continues to be a prominent health problem in indonesia stunting prevalence is higher in child from poor family or living in rural area however there ha been a lack of information on predictor of stunting disparity and stunting risk factor by socioeconomic status s and location of residence rural or urban this study aim to examine the factor associated with stunting by s and ruralurban status and to assess determinant of stunting disparity by s and ruralurban status in indonesia method this study analysed data from the indonesian family and life survey ifls wave 5 conducted in 2014 data for 3887 child aged 059 month including individual family and community variable were analysed stratified logistic regression wa conducted to assess difference in determinant of stunting by household expenditure poor or nonpoor representing s and ruralurban status the oaxacablinder decomposition method wa used to assess determinant of stunting disparity by household expenditure and ruralurban status result the analysis showed difference in factor associated with stunting among child in rural versus urban area or child in poor versus nonpoor household mother short stature and low education level increased the odds of stunting across all group however in child of family with a higher household expenditure unhealthy snack were a significant predictor of stunting adjusted odds ratio aor 123 95 confidence interval ci 104147 this finding wa not found in other group good sanitation significantly reduced stunting in child in family with higher household expenditure and child from urban community nutrition service were significantly associated with stunting in poor child and child from urban area the decomposition analysis showed that difference in characteristic explained 5535 stunting disparity by household expenditure meanwhile ruralurban disparity wa mostly explained by difference in response 5620 with low birth weight and unexplained variable a predominant contributor conclusion there were slight difference in stunting determinant by household expenditure and ruralurban status in indonesia stunting disparity were attributed to difference in characteristic and response between the less and more advantaged population to improve the effectiveness of stunting reduction program specific intervention tailored to address the difference between the more and less advantaged population are needed

processed_title: stunting and it association with education and cognitive outcome in adulthood a longitudinal study in indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is associated with adverse outcome in adulthood this article specifically aim to analyse the relationship between childhood stunting and education a well a cognitive outcome for adult in indonesia method pooled data from wave one 1 and two 2 of the indonesia family life survey ifls in 1993 and 1997 identified a subsample of 4379 child aged 05 by their heightforage haz to be compared for their difference in educational outcome and cognitive ability in 2014 haz wa used to proxy relative height to determine stunting status based on 2006 who child growth standard education and cognitive ability outcome include year of schooling age of school entry grade repetition and score for cognitive and math test the study employ estimation model of pooled regression and instrumental variable iv to address problem of endogeneity and bias from omitted variable result stunting and relatively small stature had significant association with cognitive development and they worked a intermediary to cognitive developmental barrier a manifested in reduced educational outcome a lack of one sd in haz wa associated with 06 year shortened length of the school 3 higher chance of dropout from secondary school and 010023 sd lowered cognitive and numerical score similarly stunting is associated with decrease cognitive test score by 05608 sd compared to nonstunting two year less schooling and 04 year of delayed entry to school a for cognitive ability stunting is associated with lower cognitive and numerical ability by 038082 zscores conclusion growth retardation during childhood in indonesia wa associated with lower cognitive ability particularly during school age and this correlation faded a individual grew up subsequently growth retardation is significantly linked to lower educational outcome impaired growth ha implication for reduced lifetime earnings potential mediated by diminished cognitive capacity and lower educational attainment the finding suggests that development in indonesia during recent decade ha not provided an adequate environment to enable child to achieve their potential educational outcome

processed_title: parental stature a a risk factor for stunting in indonesia a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: stunting is defined by height of more than two standard deviation below the world health organization who child growth standard median it is a significant nutritional problem in developing country where in 2021 indonesia recorded a stunting prevalence at 244 slightly higher than the global prevalence 22 reducing the prevalence of stunting ha been the focus of the current administration in the indonesian government a delineated in the 20202024 national mediumterm development plan globally many study have addressed parental stature a a risk factor of stunting however systematic review that summarized and critically appraised the relationship between parental stature and the incidence of stunting in indonesia wa scarce this systematic review aimed to assess parental stature a a risk factor for stunting among indonesian toddler study were searched through pubmed medline google scholar and mendeley study on indonesian toddler under five year old living in indonesia were included the quality of the included study wa assessed using joanna briggs institute jbi critical appraisal tool data were extracted using a standardized data extraction form and were analyzed using cochranes revman 53 twentyseven prospective and retrospective cohort casecontrol and crosssectional study were included with a total 4041 child out of 27 included study eight were found to be of low seven of moderate and twelve of high quality the result showed that parental stature wa associated with the incidence of stunting among toddler in indonesia either the mother only odds ratio or 192 95 confidence interval 95ci 171215 the father only or 521 95ci 1711586 or both parent or 301 95ci 241375 however study on father and both parental stature suffered from substantial heterogeneity imprecision and mixed quality therefore they should be cautiously interpreted

processed_title: cigarette smoke exposure and stunting among underfive child in rural and poor family in indonesia
processed_abstract: cigarette smoke exposure in mother and child is highly prevalent in asia especially among rural and poor family secondhand smoke exposure might affect the nutritional status of child despite the emerging double burden of malnutrition and the very high prevalence of smoking in indonesia few study have examined the effect of parental smoking on childrens nutritional status this study aim to measure the relationship between family smoking behavior and the occurrence of stunting in child under 5 year this crosssectional study used a purposive sampling technique with 221 household with child aged 0 to 59 month from poor area in indonesia exposure to cigarette smoke is assessed using the secondhand smoke exposure scale questionnaire the outcome measured is child stunting heightforage zscore the prevalence of stunting wa estimated at 145 656 child living with smoking parent were counted for 157 71 and most smoking exposure come from father 147 674 the predictor of stunting in child under 5 year were a smoker father with aor 18 95 ci 12814641 both parent are smoker increasing the risk of stunting with cor 3591 95 ci 167377 being exposed of smoke for more than 3 hour a day increase the risk of stunted child cor 205 95 ci 12143629 and using traditional cigarette or kretek expand the risk of stunting aor 319 95 ci 113967785 the finding demonstrate the negative impact of parental smoking on childrens growth reinforcing the importance of reducing smoking prevalence by imposing a smokefree home policy in the stunting prevention strategy

processed_title: household dietary diversity and child stunting in east java indonesia
processed_abstract: background and objective more than onequarter of underfive child in the developing world are stunted and those with poor nutrient intake are at risk of irreversible cognitive impairment the purpose of this study wa to determine the relationship between dietary diversity and child stunting in an indonesian context method and study design dietary diversity wa assessed using a maternalreported checklist of 12 food group summed a a household dietary diversity score stunting wa defined a 20 heightforage zscore by whoanthro 2005 trained interviewer administered the household dietary diversity questionnaire to 768 household with child aged 5 year in east java indonesia logistic regression model were constructed to test the association between dietary diversity and child stunting result the prevalence of child stunting wa 394 and the percentage of household consuming food group high in protein and calcium like dairy product 41 and meatpoultry 65 wa lower compared with other food group the unadjusted model revealed that higher dietary diversity score were associated with lower likelihood of child stunting or089 95 ci080098 this relationship remained significant after adjustment for family size maternal literacy food expenditure breastfeeding energy and protein intake or089 95 ci080099 conclusion the dietary diversity score wa moderate with consumption of dairy product and meatpoultry lowest among 12 food group hence population intervention should focus on promoting food group currently lacking in maternal and child diet including those rich in growthpromoting nutrient like dairy meatpoultry these result from an indonesian context confirm the widely observed protective relationship between dietary diversity and child stunting

processed_title: the association of sociodemographic nutrition and sanitation on stunting in child under five in rural area of west java province in indonesia
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of stunting in indonesia ha decreased gradually the strategy to reduce stunting is currently prioritized on improving socioeconomic level fulfilling food intake and sanitation condition this study aim to analyze the association between sociodemographics nutrition and sanitation on stunting in rural west java province in indonesia design and method a crosssectional study wa conducted in mayaugust 2022 among 247 motherchildren pair selected by systematic random sampling from a rural area of west java province in indonesia the sociodemographic characteristic were measured using a structured questionnaire the nutritional status of the child under five wa assessed by lengthheightforage haz and wa calculated using who anthro software sanitation is assessed using observation and interview with a structured questionnaire result the prevalence of stunting in child under five wa 207 53 severely stunted and 154 stunted binary logistic regression analysis using spss version 220 show that mother height a the dominant factor associated with stunting in child under five aor 345 95 ci 112467 p 0008 in addition childrens age aor 0250 95 ci 01040598 p 0002 balanced diet practice aor 157 95 ci 0965256 p 0069 and building material aor 1869 95 ci 087400 p 0108 are also related to stunting in child under five conclusion effort to improve maternal nutrition need to be carried out from the period before pregnancy to the first 1000 day of life education on healthy home indicator especially the use of this type of building material for house need to be done to improve sanitation a an effort to prevent stunting in child under five

processed_title: problem nutrient and foodbased recommendation for pregnant woman and underfive child in highstunting district in indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting and anemia in pregnant woman and underfive child remain a challenge in developing country including indonesia one of the significant contributor to these problem is inadequate nutrient intake objective the aim of the study wa to identify using a linear programming lp approach problem nutrient and optimized foodbased recommendation for underfive child and pregnant woman in 10 stuntingprioritized district in indonesia method lp analysis wa done using the optifood tool on dietary data collected using single 24h dietary recall in the national monitoring of nutrient consumption pemantauan konsumsi gizi conducted by the ministry of health from 10 stuntingprioritized district in indonesia problem nutrient and nutrientdense food were identified and all alternative foodbased recommendation or complementary feeding recommendation were compared to identify which recommendation will best contribute to fulfill dietary adequacy result the number of problem nutrient in each district ranged from 0 to 7 nutrient for underfive child and 1 to 6 nutrient for pregnant woman the top 3 problem nutrient were iron zinc and folate for child aged 611 mo zinc folate and calcium for 1223moolds and 2435moolds folate zinc and vitamin criboflavin for 3659moolds and iron folate and calcium for pregnant woman the finding showed that problem nutrient identified using lp were in line with nutritional problem in underfive child stunting and anemia and pregnant woman anemia foodbased recommendation fbrscomplementary feeding recommendation were developed that best meet dietary adequacy for the nutrient conclusion despite the similarity in stunting prevalence across the district there wa variation in number and type of problem nutrient the developed fbrs that promoted nutrientdense food suited to the problem nutrient in each area need to be promoted to improve nutrient intake of underfive child and pregnant woman in these area with high stunting prevalence

processed_title: comparison of high and low stunting reduction group using ifeefe matrix analysis in central java province indonesia
processed_abstract: background the result of the 2021 indonesian nutritional status study studi status gizi indonesia ssgi showed a 68 declining prevalence of stunting in central java from 2019 to 2021 however the prevalence decrease in the regency level of central java varied from 01 to 203 this study aimed to analyze the external and internal factor that influenced the stunting reduction prevalence in central java province indonesia method this qualitative study wa conducted over 2 month from april to may 2022 indepth interview were used to explore the supporting factor external internal and strategy and the challenge internal external and solution in implementing stunting reduction acceleration program the supporting factor and challenge were compared between the group with high gro sra kla and pek gskp and low sur mag teg and pat smtp reduction prevalence data were analyzed using internal factor evaluation ife and external factor evaluation efe result in quadrant ii the highreduction group gskp had ife and efe score of 261 and 276 respectively in quadrant iv the lowreduction group smtp had ife and efe score of 186 and 162 respectively the highreduction group gskp wa better than the lowreduction group smtp in using external opportunity and internal strength by avoiding external threat and minimizing the weakness in the stunting reduction acceleration program in each area the existence of superior program and innovation were the strength that differentiated the high and low group conversely the lowstunting reduction group struggled to overcome major challenge especially lacking leadership capacity from the outside lack of program sustainability at the village level and budget restraint were the threat found in both group conclusion compared with the lowstunting reduction group the high group could maximize their strength and use the opportunity to implement stunting reduction program

processed_title: factor affecting the knowledge and motivation of health cadre in stunting prevention among child in indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose stunting is a public health problem in indonesia with a relatively high incidence thereby making it prevention a priority for the indonesian government it potentially cause short and long effect on the quality of human resource a well a the productivity of stunted child when they grow up therefore prevention and early detection effort are needed by health professional and cadre earlier study have identified complexity associated with the determinant factor of stunting this study aim to examine the association between sociodemographic factor a well a the knowledge and motivation of health cadre in stunting prevention in west java method a correlational study with a crosssectional approach wa conducted on health cadre sample from 8 districtscities in west java province namely karawang tasikmalaya garut bandung subang sukabumi cianjur and west bandung a total of 363 health cadre participated and the sampling technique used is the stratified method the data were collected using a questionnaire developed specifically for this study and were analyzed using a correlation with chisquare test and presented in the form of a frequency distribution result the result showed the majority of health cadre namely 8127 had good knowledge which wa significantly influenced by education level and marital status with a pvalue 005 meanwhile approximately half of the respondent had moderate motivation with 4766 while onethird or 3912 had high motivation this motivation wa significantly influenced by education level marital status and age with p 005 conclusion based on the result it wa concluded that the role and function of health cadre need to be improved in the prevention and early detection of stunting in west java by providing continuous guidance stunting prevention training and award presentation

processed_title: the association of childrens blood lead level and prevalence of stunting in tin mining area in indonesia
processed_abstract: background metal mining and smelting activity are regarded a major source of heavy metal such a lead mercury arsenic and cadmium in the environment and in human living at the surrounding area among others lead can enter and accumulate in the human body and be very influential in childrens growth and development objective this study aim to assess the association between childrens blood lead level and stunting in a mining area in indonesia method a crosssectional design wa implemented by involving 193 child living in surrounding tin mining in bangka island indonesia venous blood wa drawn and blood lead level wa measured by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry icpms stunting status wa measured by anthropometry standing height and converted to sexand agespecific zscores based on world health organization who growth reference childrens dietary intake wa assessed using 24hour dietary recall method statistic of chisquare test and multiple logistic regression were performed for the analysis finding the geometric mean of blood lead level blls wa 55 microgdl 26 microgdl 95 ci 5159 the interquartile range of blls and height for age zscore haz were 30 mugdl and 15 respectively the data revealed that 233 of child were stunted haz 2 the multiple logistic regression model suggest that elevated blls were an independent predictor of the stunting the odds stunted blood lead concentration wa elevated about 10times higher adjusted odd ratio aor 975 95 confidence interval ci 31307 p 0001 in comparison to the odds of normal bllsthe blls of child at age two to nine year were found associated with stunting after controlling of the mother education residence and the intake of energy protein zinc vitamin a calcium and phosphorus conclusion the study suggested that living in surrounding tin mining wa dangerous for childrens health and their development

processed_title: the influence of mother employment family income and expenditure on stunting among child under five a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: introduction it is widely acknowledged that the socioeconomic circumstance of a family income are correctly reflected in that family expenditure the dietary habit of family are influenced by socioeconomic circumstance that may affect stunting therefore this study aim to investigate the household economic predictor stunting mother employment family income and family expenditure in child under five method this study used a crosssectional design six district and city have been chosen a study area based on the area with the highest incidence of stunting in west java indonesia this study conducted specifically from october to december 2018 data were examined using descriptive statistic frequency distribution and a spearman rank bivariate test a logistic regression wa employed to determine the element that serve a predictor of stunting result a total of 731 woman with child under five participated in the study a bivariate analysis showed that mother employment had an association with stunting among child under five p 0014 meanwhile family income and expenditure are not statistically significant associated with stunting p 005 a multivariate analysis showed that mother employment wa a stunting predictor with odd ratio or 1810 p 0017 the or value mean that mother who do not work have a 1810 chance for their child to experience stunting compared with mother who have work however family income and expenditure have negative projected value p 0580 and p 0398 respectively conclusion child under five who are stunted are potentially predictive with mother employment with a chance is higher in mother who do not work however family income and expenditure are not predictive of stunting

processed_title: intestinal parasitic infection and nutritional status in child under five year old a systematic review
processed_abstract: intestinal parasitic infection are common infectious disease causing many health problem and impaired growth and physical development child under five year old are the most vulnerable to infection due to their immature immunity and feeding and exploratory behaviour this systematic review aimed to assess the relationship between intestinal parasitic infection and undernutrition among child under 5 year old fifteen study met the inclusion and exclusion criterion and were classified a highquality study twelve parasite were reported including ascaris lumbricoides cryptosporodium spp entamoeba histolytica enterobius vermicularis giardia lamblia hookworm hymenolepis nana strongyloides sterocalis taenia spp and trichuris trichuria ascariasis is the most reported infection with a prevalence ranging from 1077 in ethiopia to 5714 in malaysia and is correlated with stunting or 217 95 ci 114 413 p 002 giardiasis is the second most reported infection with a prevalence ranging from 443 in ethiopia to 6633 in the central african republic and is related to an increased risk of stunting or 234 95 ci 107 510 p 003 wasting or 290 95 ci 112 749 p 003 and being underweight or 153 95 ci 102 229 p 004 the third and fourth most prevalent infection are t trichiura and hookworm infection intestinal parasitic infection can occur very early in life and cause significant growth retardation it is important to understand the prevalence and effect of infection based on the parasite specie in order to implement therapeutic intervention and prevention control

processed_title: implementation outcome of national convergence action policy to accelerate stunting prevention and reduction at the local level in indonesia a qualitative study
processed_abstract: the study aim to explore the implementation outcome variable of indonesia national policy convergence action in the stunting reduction intervention at district subdistrict and village level the study design wa qualitative with an implementation research approach at district cirebon indonesia data were collected through indepth interview focus group discussion study document and 6 month of participant observation we recruited 172 respondent the assessment instrument used wa formed on wa implementation outcome variable data were analyzed through coding categorizing and thematic content analysis based on a predetermined theme comparative cross district activitysite analysis wa applied between subdistricts and village the implementation outcome variable for the convergence action policy were performed well at the district level in line with the central government adequate regulation control and budget meanwhile the subdistrict and village level only performed aspect of acceptability appropriateness and coverage for specific intervention the acceptability level in the village wa only partially running the barrier at the subdistrict and village level were issue of commitment staff capacity and poor coordination superficial understanding and capacity weakness drove the convergence of the stunting reduction responsibility back into the burden of the health sector at the forefront local politics also colored the implementation in the village

processed_title: correlation between gut microbiota composition enteric infection and linear growth impairment a casecontrol study in childhood stunting in pidie aceh indonesia
processed_abstract: background gut microbiota is pivotal in maintaining childrens health and wellbeing the ingestion of enteric pathogen and dysbiosis lead to environmental enteric dysfunction eed which is essential in stunting pathogenesis the role of gut microbiome and enteric infection have not been explored comprehensively in relation to childhood stunting in indonesia this study aimed to determine the correlation between gut microbiota composition enteric infection and growth biomarker insulinlike growth factor 1 igf1 in stunted child from pidie aceh indonesia method this study wa a casecontrol study involving 42 subject aged 24 to 59 month comprising 21 stunted child for the case and 21 normal child for the control group the igf1 serum level wa quantified using elisa the gut microbiome profiling wa conducted using 16 rdna amplicon sequencing the expression of enteric pathogen virulence gene wa determined using quantitative pcr qpcr assay the correlation of observed variable were analysed using suitable statistical analysis result the result showed that the igf1 serum level in stunted were lower than those in normal child p 0001 the abundance of firmicutes 50 wa higher than bacteroidetes 34 in stunted child the gut microbiome profile of stunted child showed enriched genus such a blautia dorea collinsella streptococcus clostridium sensu stricto 13 asteroleplasma and anaerostipes meanwhile the depleted genus comprised prevotella lactococcus butyrivibrio muribaculaceae alloprevotella akkermansia enterococcus terrisporobacter and turicibacter the abundance of water biological contaminant such a aeromonas stappiaceae and synechococcus wa also higher in stunted child compared to normal child the virulence gene expression of enteroaggregative escherichia coli aaic enterotoxigenic e coli esta enteropathogenic e coli eaea shigellaenteroinvasive e coli ipah3 and salmonella enterica ompc in stunted wa higher than in normal child p 0001 which negatively correlated to height and level of igf1 conclusion the present study showed the distinctive gut microbiome profile of stunted and normal child from pidie aceh indonesia the gut microbiota of stunted child revealed dysbiosis comprised several proinflammatory metabolic abnormality and highfatlowfiber dietrelated taxon and expressed virulence gene of enteric pathogen these finding provide evidence that it is imperative to restore dysbiosis and preserve the balance of gut microbiota to support linear growth in child

processed_title: stunting super app a an effort toward stunting management in indonesia delphi and pilot study
processed_abstract: background currently 30 million child are experiencing acute malnutrition and 8 million child are severely underweight objective this study aimed to develop a stunting super app a onestop app designed to prevent and manage stunting in indonesia method this study consisted of three stage stage 1 used a 3round delphi study involving 12 expert in stage 2 4 expert and a parent of child with stunted growth created an android app containing stunting educational material in stage 3 a pilot study involving a control group wa conducted to evaluate parent knowledge about stunting prevention through the app and standard intervention result in the delphi study 11 consensus statement were extracted arranged in three major theme including maternal health education child health education and environmental education and applied in the form of the sistem evaluasi kesehatan anak tumbuh ideal sehati app this app wa assessed using a content validity index with a cumulative agreement of 80 among the 5 individual the pilot study showed an increase in the knowledge of mother of toddler with stunted growth before and after the educational intervention p001 conclusion the sehati app provides educational content on stunting prevention that can increase the knowledge of mother of toddler with stunted growth

processed_title: family household characteristic and stunting an update scoping review
processed_abstract: stunting remains a public health concern in developing country factor related to stunting have been categorized using various framework family play an important role in providing nutrient for child however no review specifies this aspect for identifying family characteristic related to stunting this study aimed to identify family household characteristic related to stunting among child aged less than 5 year a scoping review wa undertaken with source from pubmed cinahl and scopus using the keywords family characteristic and growth inclusion criterion were 1 correlational study 2 published between 2018 and 31 july 2022 3 family with child under the age of 5 year and 4 independent variable any measure of stunting factor from family and household factor of 376 article only 20 met the inclusion criterion of the study the family household characteristic included individual factor sex age history of diarrhea and birthplace family factor family headship primary caregivermother socialcultural orientation and family system factor and environmental factor various child variable family factor and environmental factor the type of home floor type water access source of drinking water and household electricity were identified a being associated with stunting therefore these factor should be evaluated to prevent and control stunting and they should be incorporated into health program targeting stunting

processed_title: safe drinking water sanitation and mother hygiene practice a stunting risk factor a case control study in a rural area of ciawi subdistrict tasikmalaya district west java indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is associated with disorder of the small intestine caused by environmental factor and poor hygiene practice prevention of stunting should be conducted in the first 1000 day of life namely from conception until the child is two year old this research aimed to analyze the relationship between environmental risk factor and maternal personal hygiene with the incidence of stunting in child aged 623 month method this study wa conducted using a casecontrol design with a total sample of 212 106 case and 106 control enrolled purposively data were collected through interview using a questionnaire the analysis used chisquare test and multiple logistic regression result the result of multivariate analysis showed the independent variable that have a significant association on the incidence of stunting are access to safe drinking water and maternal hygiene practice the external variable that have a significant relationship is birth length and feeding practice conclusion having no access to safe drinking water not proper sanitation and poor maternal hygiene practice have a higher risk of stunting in child aged 623 month the implication of this research include the need for increased access to a safe environment and improvement of mother behavior a essential effort to prevent stunting

processed_title: stunting and gut microbiota a literature review
processed_abstract: stunting a condition characterized by impaired growth and development in child remains a major public health concern worldwide over the past decade emerging evidence ha shed light on the potential role of gut microbiota modulation in stunting gut microbiota dysbiosis ha been linked to impaired nutrient absorption chronic inflammation altered shortchain fatty acid production and perturbed hormonal and signaling pathway all of which may hinder optimal growth in child this review aim to provide a comprehensive analysis of existing research exploring the bidirectional relationship between stunting and the gut microbiota although stunting can alter the gut microbial community microbiota dysbiosis may exacerbate it forming a vicious cycle that sustains the condition the need for effective preventive and therapeutic strategy targeting the gut microbiota to combat stunting is also discussed nutritional intervention probiotic and prebiotics are among the most promising approach to modulate the gut microbiota and potentially ameliorate stunting outcome ultimately a better understanding of the gut microbiotastunting nexus is vital for guiding evidencebased intervention that can improve the growth and development trajectory of child worldwide making substantial stride toward reducing the burden of stunting in vulnerable population

processed_title: understanding the role of village fund and administrative capacity in stunting reduction empirical evidence from indonesia
processed_abstract: the indonesian government launched various program to handle stunting case including village fund this paper examined the effect of village fund program and village apparatus capacity to combat stunting based on aggregate data at the district level in indonesia using descriptive data analysis and fixed effect panel regression we observed that village fund program could significantly reduce indonesia stunting prevalence especially outside java it also revealed that the increasing education of regional leader doe not necessarily positively impact leader skill in handling stunting at the same time the number of village official ha a statistically significant influence on reducing stunting prevalence it advised that the village budget fund can support national priority in tackling the prevalence of stunting furthermore it is essential to build the capacity of the village head for increasing awareness of health activity especially early prevention of stunting in addition to an adequate number of official

processed_title: determinant of concurrent wasting and stunting among child 6 to 23 mo in indonesia
