processed_abstract: objective concurrent wasting and stunting wast in a child is a health problem that lead to detrimental effect however to our knowledge there is limited research regarding the prevalence and determinant of wast including in indonesia the aim of this study wa to analyze the prevalence and determinant of wast in child 6 to 23 mo of age method this crosssectional study wa conducted with data set from the indonesia nutritional status survey ins data wa collected between january and december 2021 about 15 641 child age 23 mo were included a chi2 analysis examined the association between the dependent and independent variable a multivariate test analyzed the risk for the independent variable to the dependent seen through the adjusted odds ratio aor result the prevalence of wast wa 24 higher odds for wast were seen in the following boy 215 time 95 confidence interval ci 172268 child age 12 to 23 mo 315 time 95 ci 233425 those with low birth weight 311 time 95 ci 233415 those with small birth size 2 time 95 ci 159254 baby born from mother 35 y of age 15 time 95 ci 119189 child who experienced infection 143 time 95 ci 116176 child not using the integrated health and nutrition service posyandu 117 time 95 ci 129227 child from middle income families254 time higher odds 95 ci 17537 and child from rural area 137 time 95 ci 11171 conclusion wast is associated with multiple factor in indonesia hence policymakers need to address this problem comprehensively

processed_title: impact of an integrative nutrition package through home visit on maternal and child outcome finding from locus stunting in yogyakarta indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting ha been a public health problem in several developing country including indonesia one of the strategy to reduce stunting wa family assistance this study wa aimed to estimate the effect of family assistance by using an integrative nutrition package through home visit on the growth and development of stunted child method this wa an experimental study using pretest posttest with control group design conducted in yogyakarta indonesia on march to may 2022 the intervention group wa provided an integrative nutrition package inp including maternal education behavioral change through home visit a well a monitoring childrens outcome while the control group wa asked to read and follow child care procedure in the maternal and child health mch book a a standard procedure both group were visited by trained health volunteer and had a complementary feeding cf package weekly for four week the outcome of this study were the maternal outcome knowledge and behavior on childrens growth monitoring cgm childrens development monitoring cdm and infantyoung child feeding iycf a well a childrens outcome including body weight bw body height bh and child score development csd this study used generalized estimating equation gee to estimate the difference in difference did of the impact of intervention compared with control group and compared among three different time baseline fourth and eighth week result there were 60 stunted child under five year in this study ie 30 in intervention group and 30 in control group from the gee analysis it wa found that the regression adjusted did showed statistically significant increase of all outcome including childrens development score cd the adjusted did effect 95 ci on 8th week for childrens weight height and development score were 031 025037 041 013068 and 040 059021 respectively among the intervention group conclusion inp through home visit successfully increased maternal and childrens outcome compared witsh standard procedure the effect of intervention wa found to be consistently significant in the fourth and eighth week after intervention we recommend the local government to apply inp through home visit especially in highprevalence stunting area

processed_title: sociodemographic and healthcare factor associated with stunting in child aged 659 month in the urban area of bali province indonesia 2018
processed_abstract: stunting is a worldwide public health concern including in indonesia even when living in an urban area with urban characteristic it is still possible for child to be at risk of stunting the aim of this study wa to determine the sociodemographic and healthcare factor associated with stunting in a province experiencing tourism growth namely bali crosssectional data on bali province from the indonesian basic health research survey riskesdas 2018 were used a the basis for the research analysis a total of 846 respondent under five year of age were analyzed indicating a stunting prevalence of 190 multivariate logistic regression demonstrated low maternal educational attainment adjustedor 192 95 confidence interval 124297 the inadequate consumption of iron tablet during pregnancy adjustedor 156 95 confidence interval 108224 and no extended family adjustedor 155 95 confidence interval 107226 a being significantly associated with stunting according to these finding sociodemographic and healthcare factor are associated with stunting in urban bali improving womens education ensuring sufficient iron tablet are consumed during pregnancy and encouraging the involvement of the extended family in childcare are recommended

processed_title: international standard growth chart overestimate stunting prevalence in nabire and jakarta indonesia compared to the indonesian national growth chart
processed_abstract: childrens height in indonesia is increasing slowly and unevenly across the country with urban area growing faster than rural area thus international growth chart may be ineffective for monitoring the development of indonesian child we conducted an analytical crosssectional study on 1829 child aged 6 to 12 in nabire and 1283 child in jakarta anthropometric measurement were obtained and plotted on the center for disease control and prevention cdc growth chart and indonesian national growth chart to determine which chart is more suitable for monitoring childrens growth in indonesia nabire child were shorter and had lower body mass index bmi than jakarta child with a mean height difference of 703 cm in boy and 689 cm in girl p 0001 and a mean bmi difference of 166 in boy and 139 in girl p 0001 despite their short stature more nabire child had a normal bmi indicating a healthy nutritional status using the indonesian national growth chart fewer child were classified a stunted or wasted most of the short stature observed in nabire child wa not due to stunting the child showed no sign of malnutrition the indonesian national growth chart represent the growth of indonesian child more accurately than the cdc growth chart

processed_title: epigenetic study in child at risk of stunting and their parent in india indonesia and senegal a ukri gcrf action against stunting hub protocol paper
processed_abstract: introduction in 2020 an estimated 150 million child under the age of 5 year were stunted stunting result from earlylife adversity and it is associated with significant physical and cognitive deficit lifelong socioeconomic disadvantage and reduced life expectancy there is a need to understand the cause of stunting and it effect in order to develop strategy to avoid it and to mitigate the consequence once stunting ha occurred epigenetics is an important mechanism through which earlylife factor are thought to influence biological function with longterm consequence we describe a series of epigenetic study designed to understand how earlylife adversity result in stunting and to inform the development of practical tool such a predictive marker and therapeutic target this work is part of the ukri gcrf action against stunting hub method and analysis the projectin india indonesia and senegalcomprises an observational study of mother father and offspring n500 spanning the first 1000 day of life and an intervention study in each country epigenetic status dna methylation is determined in saliva from baby collected within 1 month of birth and again at 18 month of age and from mother and father around the time of birth epigenomewide analysis is carried out using the illumina epic array augmented by highdefinition sequencing approach statistical analysis is carried out at the level of candidate genesregions higher dimensional epigenetic state and epigenomewide association data analysis focus on the determinant of stunting the effectiveness of intervention population comparison and the link between epigenetics and other thematic area which include anthropometry microbiome gut health parasitology cognition nutrition food hygiene and water sanitation food system and the home environment ethic and dissemination this study ha been approved by the relevant ethic committee in indonesia india and senegal and the uk research data will be published and posted in public repository

processed_title: association between maternal anemia and stunting in infant and child aged 060 month a systematic literature review
processed_abstract: objective maternal anemia is a worldwide health issue and a common pregnancy complication it lead to consequence including infant mortality low birth weight preterm birth unrecoverable or partially reversible neurobehavioral and cognitive deficit and short birth length however the relationship between maternal anemia and stunting in child is not well defined this systematic literature review sought to determine whether maternal anemia wa associated with height or length and stunting condition in infant and child age 060 mo in cohort casecontrol and crosssectional study carried out in several country method a systematic review wa performed on article published from 20142021 related to maternal anemia and stunting the electronic database used were sciencedirect pubmed scopus proquest google search and ajog american journal of obstetrics and gynecology the literature search wa performed up to december 7 2021 result twelve study were included nine study examined the correlation between maternal anemia and length or weight in child seven of the nine study showed an association between maternal anemia and stunting in child the others showed an association between maternal anemia and birth length three study found no association between maternal anemia and stunting in child under age 5 y conclusion the current review emphasizes that stunting in child may be associated with maternal anemia specifically in developing country this implies that it is crucial to prevent anemia in adolescent girl and woman before and during pregnancy a a part of program to eliminate stunting in child

processed_title: assessment of the role of gut health in childhood stunting in a multisite longitudinal study in india indonesia and senegal a ukri gcrf action against stunting hub protocol
processed_abstract: introduction childhood stunting ha a complex aetiology with poor gut health being an important contributor this study will assess interrelationship between maternal and infant gut health index and infant linear growth interrelationship between gut health index systemic inflammation and growth hormone in early childhood will also be assessed method and analysis a longitudinal observational study of cohort of 600 newborn and their mother in india indonesia and senegal will be conducted woman will be recruited during pregnancy and their child followed up to age 24 month stool urine and blood sample will be collected from the woman and child for assessment of helminthic and protozoal parasite bacterial pathogen faecal microbiota taxon biomarkers of environmental enteric dysfunction systemic inflammation and growth hormone child anthropometric measurement will be collected at birth and at age 3 6 9 12 18 and 24 month the gut health index will be integrated with cohort data from other action against stunting hub aash workstreams for interdisciplinary analysis of childhood stunting and the development of a new typology of stunting discussion this study will advance scientific understanding of the role of gut health in childhood stunting and will contribute to a broader knowledge of the complex aetiology of this condition a part of the interdisciplinary aash research to reduce the global burden of childhood stunting ethic and dissemination this study ha been approved by the relevant ethic committee in senegal india and indonesia and lshtm the result will be submitted for publication in peerreviewed journal

processed_title: measurement of cognition and profiling early learning environment in india indonesia and senegal a ukri gcrf action against stunting hub protocol paper
processed_abstract: introduction childhood stunting is associated with poorer child health growth and development including diminished cognitive ability mapping out the link between child stunting and early childhood education and development is critical to increasing understanding of the cause and effect of childhood stunting and for programme and policy development the aim of this study is to investigate and compare the development and educational environment across india indonesia and senegal and to identify the multifactorial driver and impact of childhood stunting to inform a new typology method and analysis this current study is part of an interdisciplinary observational research study where woman are recruited during pregnancy and motherinfant pair followed prospectively up to 24 month after birth eight measure will be used to profile childrens early development and learning environment in two sample cohort a child aged 12 and 24 month born to the woman recruited during pregnancy ie 500 pregnant mother per country and b a preschool casecontrol cohort of sibling from the main cohort aged between 36 and 56 year of age where anthropomorphic measure will be collected to assess degree of stunting profiling of the development and learning environment in the country will include both parentcaregiver selfreported and local staff enumerator direct assessment of child and setting ethic and dissemination this study wa approved by the institutional ethic committee of all partner institution in india indian council of medical researchnational institute of nutrition hyderabad in indonesia ethic committee of the faculty of medicine university of indonesia and in senegal national ethic committee for scientific research in senegalthe finding of the study will be disseminated in national and international meeting seminar conference and peerreviewed journal

processed_title: creating culturallyinformed protocol for a stunting intervention using a situated valuesbased approach wevalue insitu a double case study in indonesia and senegal
processed_abstract: international development work involves external partner bringing expertise resource and management for local intervention in lmics but there is often a gap in understanding of relevant local shared value there is a widespread need to better design intervention which accommodate relevant element of local culture a emphasised by recent discussion in global health research regarding neocolonialism one recent innovation is the concept of producing cultural protocol to precede and guide community engagement or intervention design but without suggestion for generating them this study explores and demonstrates the potential of an approach taken from another field named wevalue insitu to generate local culturallyinformed protocol wevalue insitu engages stakeholder group in meaningmaking process which crystallize their envelope of local shared value making them communicable to outsidersour research context is understanding and reducing child stunting including developing intervention carried out at the senegal and indonesia site of the ukri gcrf action against stunting hub each national research team involves eight health discipline from micronutrition to epigenetics and extensive collection of sample and questionnaire local culturallyinformed protocol would be generally valuable to preinform engagement and intervention design here we explore generating them by immediately following the group wevalue insitu crystallization process with specialised focus group discussion exploring what local life practice potentially have significant influence on the environment affecting child stunting and which cultural element do they highlight a relevant the discussion will be framed by the shared value and reveal linkage to them in this study stakeholder group like father mother teacher market trader administrator farmer and health worker were recruited totalling 83 participant across 20 group theme found relevant for a culturallyinformed protocol for locallyacceptable food intervention included specific gender role social hierarchy health service access challenge traditional belief around malnutrition and attitude to accepting outside help the concept of a grounded culturallyinformed protocol and the use of wevalue insitu to generate it ha thus been demonstrated here future work to scope out the advantage and limitation compared to deductive culture study and to using other formative research method would now be useful

processed_title: anthropometric biochemical dietary morbidity and wellbeing assessment in woman and child in indonesia india and senegal a ukri gcrf action against stunting hub protocol paper
processed_abstract: introduction child stunting ha a complex aetiology especially in the first 1000 day of life nutrition intervention alone have not produced expected impact in reducingpreventing child stunting indicating the importance of understanding the complex interplay between environmental physiological and psychological factor influencing child nutritional status this study will investigate maternal and child nutrition health and wellbeing status and associated factor through the assessment of 1 anthropometry 2 biomarkers of nutrition and health status 3 dietary intake 4 fetal growth and development 5 infant morbidity 6 infant and young child feeding iycf and 7 perinatal maternal stress depression and social support method this study will be conducted in a prospective pregnancy cohort in india indonesia and senegal pregnant woman will be recruited in the second indonesia senegal and third india trimester of pregnancy and the mother and infant dyad followed until the infant is 24 month of age during pregnancy anthropometric measure will be taken venous blood sample will be collected for biochemical assessment of nutrition and health status dietary intake will be assessed using a 4pass24hour dietary recall method mp24hr fetal ultrasound for assessment of fetal growth after birth anthropometry measurement will be taken venous blood sample will be collected mp24hr will be conducted infant morbidity and iycf practice will be assessed and a sample of breastmilk will be collected for nutrient composition analysis perinatal maternal stress depression social support and hair cortisol level stress will be measured the result from this study will be integrated in an interdisciplinary analysis to examine factor influencing infant growth and inform global effort in reducing child stunting ethic and dissemination ethical approval wa granted by the ethic committee of the london school of hygiene and tropical medicine 17915rr17513 national institute of nutrition icmrministry of health and family welfare government of india cr04i2021 health research ethic committee university of indonesia and cipto mangunkusumo hospital ket887un2f1etikppm00022019 and the comite national dethique pour la recherche en sante senegal protocole sen1978 the royal veterinary college urn sr20200197 and the international livestock research institute institutional research ethic committee ilriirec202033 result will be published in peerreviewed journal and disseminated to policymakers and participating community

processed_title: the impact of iron supplementation during pregnancy and change of consumption among stunting child aged 624 month during the covid19 pandemic in indonesia
processed_abstract: background during the covid19 pandemic stunting is estimated to increase 24 time higher it seems that some information is missing here because the usage of the word higher hint at a comparison with some other statistic or please consider making the following change in the statement stunting is estimated to be 24 time higher than the normal trend which can increase mortality morbidity and cause economic loss in the future this study aim to identify the risk factor for stunting during the covid19 pandemic method an unmatched casecontrol study wa conducted to compare the exposure of stunted case and nonstunted control child there were 127 child aged 624 month 43 case and 84 control result the probability of stunting wa two time greater in child who experienced good change in the consumption of tofutempeh p 0047 adjustedor aor 2296 95 ci 10135205 and fourtimes greater in child who have a mother that did not receive iron supplementation during pregnancy p 0030 aor 4344 95 ci 115416355 conclusion based on the above result increasing access to nutritious food and the delivery of service and information related to maternal and child health service during the pandemic need to be intensified by using innovative lowrisk platform

processed_title: the interlink between chrononutrition and stunting current insight and future perspective
processed_abstract: stunting is the one factor that is responsible for the irretrievable damage to childrens mental and physical health stunting imitates chronic undernutrition throughout the most extreme critical stage of growth and development of a child in their early life and due to that stunted child doe not completely develop and are too short for their age stunting is mainly linked with brain underdevelopment along with lifelong damaging consequence comprising weakened mental and learning capacity deprived performance in school during childhood and enhanced risk of nutrition linked to chronic longlasting ailment such a diabetes hypertension diabesity and obesity in the future in this review the author mainly summarize the latest study related to chronic nutrition and how it is related to stunting optimal nutrition particularly during pregnancy and the first 24 month of a child life is crucial in preventing stunting circadian rhythm play a significant role in maternal and fetal health affecting outcome such a premature birth and stunting maintaining a balanced diet avoiding latenight carbohydrateheavy meal during pregnancy and promoting breastfeeding align with the body biological clock which can benefit newborn in various way providing dedicated space for breastfeeding in public place is important to support infant health

processed_title: analysis of traditional feeding practice and stunting among child aged 6 to 59 month in karanganyar district central java province indonesia
processed_abstract: background traditional feeding practice are widespread in indonesia therefore using traditional feeding practice commonly used among mother this study examined the association between these practice and stunting along with other relevant factor ie sociodemographic factor feeding practice vaccination status and place of residence method this crosssectional study wa conducted in karanganyar district central java province data from a total of 706 child aged 6 to 59 month 352 child with stunting and 354 child without stunting were obtained from the medical record of 10 primary health care unit phcus in 9 subdistricts descriptive analysis and binary logistic regression blr were performed to explore the association between the dependent stunting and independent variable result the blr result from child 6 to 59 month indicated that child of mother with food restriction during pregnancy aor 587 95 ci 303 1138 child with prelacteal feeding aor 427 95 ci 216 841 and child with food restriction aor 774 95 ci 122 4916 were more likely to experience stunting those from child 6 to 23 month revealed that food restriction during pregnancy aor 1755 95 ci 286 10780 and prelacteal feeding aor 1058 95 ci 206 5441 were related to stunting the reason for traditional feeding practice were related to cultural belief for example mother believed that red meat could cause high blood pressure thus the consumption of red meat could trigger miscarriage or bleeding during delivery in addition this study showed that low sociodemographic status inappropriate feeding practice incomplete vaccination and residence in rural area were related to stunting conclusion the finding reflect the importance of education for mother to correct misconception of traditional feeding practice the government should strengthen counseling service in phcus to improve mother knowledge of and attitude toward appropriate feeding practice additionally public relation practice through the mass medium should continue for family member especially senior member a they influence mother autonomy in decisionmaking regarding feeding practice in indonesia

processed_title: driver of stunting reduction in yogyakarta indonesia a case study
processed_abstract: background chronic malnutrition in child is a severe global health concern in yogyakarta the number of child who are too short for their age ha dropped dramatically over the past few decade objective to perform an analysis of trend policy and program and an assessment of government community household and individual driver of the stunting reduction in yogyakarta indonesia method using a mixedmethods approach there were three type of research 1 analysis of quantitative data 2 evaluation of stunting policy and 3 focus group discussion and indepth interview to collect qualitative data result the prevalence of stunting ha decreased from year to year mean heightforage zscores haz improved by 022 sd from 2013 to 2021 male and female toddler aged 20 month have relatively the same body length a the who median but it is lower for child 20 month old the covid19 pandemic ha contributed to an increase in stuntingconcurrent wasting nutritionspecific and sensitive intervention have been carried out with coverage that continues to increase from year to year although in 2020 or at the beginning of the covid19 pandemic the coverage of specific intervention decreased the government ha committed to tackling stunting by implementing the five pillar of stunting prevention and the eight convergent stunting action a the driver of stunting reduction national and community stakeholder and mother at the village level cited a combination of poverty reduction year of formal education prevention of early marriage access to food enhanced knowledge and perception and increased access to sanitation and hygiene conclusion nutritionspecific and sensitive sector improvement have been crucial for decreasing stunting in yogyakarta particularly in the area of poverty reduction food access preventing child marriage sanitation education and increasing knowledge and perception

processed_title: modeling environmental interaction and collaborative intervention for childhood stunting a case from indonesia
processed_abstract: child stunting is a significant problem in indonesia and requires special attention even though the government ha implemented various program to overcome it the formulation of this study is 1 how is the management of stunting handling based on the government perspective 2 what is the role of party involved in the prevention and handling of stunting 3 what is an effective stunting management model the objective of this research are 1 the implementation of local government stunting handling policy 2 analyze crosssector collaboration and active participation of all stakeholder and 3 formulate an integrated model for handling stunting and the implementation of system synergy the design of this study us a qualitative approach with a phenomenological which wa carried out in the period from january 2023 to september 2024 in indonesia the informant interviewed in this study were 60 people recruited using the purposive sampling method also involving focus group discussion fgd the result of this study identify that the success of stunting reduction effort depends on effective collaboration between various stakeholder the study highlight that social capital which consists of social network collective norm and trust play an important role in strengthening stunting reduction effort further research is needed to explore the specific impact of social capital in other context in indonesia and to develop more adaptive intervention model to local social and cultural dynamic

processed_title: stunting underweight and overweight in child aged 2049 year in indonesia prevalence trend and associated risk factor
processed_abstract: objective the double burden of malnutrition affect many low and middleincome country this study aimed to a determine temporal trend in the prevalence of underweight stunting and at risk of overweight overweight or obesity in indonesian child aged 2049 year and b examine associated risk factor design a repeated crosssectional survey this is a secondary data analysis of wave 1 2 3 and 4 1993 1997 2000 and 2007 of the indonesian family life survey which includes 13 out of 27 province in indonesia height weight and bmi were expressed a zscores 2006 who child growth standard weightforagezscore 2 wa categorised a underweight heightforagezscore 2 a stunted and bmizscore 1 2 3 a atrisk overweight and obese respectively result there are 938 913 939 and 1311 separate child in the 4 wave respectively the prevalence of stunting decreased significantly from wave 1 to 4 from 508 to 367 a did the prevalence of underweight from 345 to 214 the prevalence of atriskoverweightobesity increased from 103 to 165 all p001 stunting and underweight were related to lower birth weight being breastfed for 6 month or more having parent who were underweight or had short stature and mother who never attended formal education stunting wa also higher in rural area being atrisk or overweightobese were closely related to being in the youngest age group 229 year or male having parent who were overweightobese or having father with university education conclusion the double burden of malnutrition occurs in indonesian child development of policy to combine the management of chronic undernutrition and overnutrition is required

processed_title: the bidirectional relationship between growth stunting and early childhood caries a rapid review
processed_abstract: objective this review aim to determine the twoway relationship between stunting and ecc in developing country worldwide method the procedure in this study wa carried out using the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalysisrapid review protocol article search were carried out using database cochrane and pubmed in addition search were also carried out using backward and forward snowballing technique to identify article that were not detected through database search result nine observational epidemiological article were found in child aged six month to six year published in 20152020 five article discussed the feature of ecc in stunted child and the other five discussed stunting in child with caries in their primary teeth conclusion several study found association between severe ecc and stunting with ecc and stunting a both independent and dependent variable suggesting a bidirectional relationship also supported by literature on the physiological relationship between oral health and nutrition

processed_title: child stunting reduction in aceh province challenge and a way ahead
processed_abstract: introduction indonesia rank the fifth highest in child stunting among asian country aceh a westernmost province in indonesia recorded the highest prevalence of stunting in child under two year old in the nation our study investigated the current government effort on child stunting reduction activity since the introduction of governor regulation no 142019 method the study investigated the current effort of aceh government and relevant actor on child stunting reduction using indepth interview document review and focus group discussion result thirtyfive 35 respondent including policy maker were interviewed four focus group discussion 15 each group were conducted and various official document were reviewed various challenge for reducing child stunting in aceh were identified inadequate knowledge and skill of posyandu cadre on child stunting reluctance to consume iron and folic acid ifa and supplementary food pmt bumil by many pregnant woman due to perceived annoying effect and unappetizing taste work engagement insufficient breast milk production and inadequate support from husband failing to achieve exclusive breastfeeding among nursing woman inadequate provision of complementary fortified food for child 623 month lack of clean water waste management and wash practice conclusion the intervention on both nutritionspecific and nutritionsensitive factor wa found to be insufficient in aceh although wash water sanitation and hygiene practice are the most important contributor to child stunting only the health agency play a singular role in reduction effort by focussing on specific factor coordination between relevant agency to address both factor is required to achieve the effectiveness of child stunting reduction and prevention in aceh

processed_title: water sanitation and hygiene vulnerability in child stunting in developing country a systematic review with metaanalysis
processed_abstract: objective this study aimed to perform a systematic review and metaanalysis to assess the scientific evidence of the relationship between vulnerability to access to safe drinking water sanitation and hygiene wash practice on stunting in child aged 5 year in developing country study design this is a systematic review and metaanalysis article to assess the relationship between underfive stunting and wash vulnerability in developing country method the systematic review with metaanalysis wa performed according to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma protocol methodology the following database were used lilac medline via pubmed scielo web of science sciencedirect scopus and embase all original study identified that related wash vulnerability to stunting in child aged 5 year in developing country wa included three author performed independently the selection and extraction of data from the article the statistical software stata version 11 wa used cochran q test and chisquare test i2 with 95 significance were used to assess the heterogeneity of the study result the search resulted in the initial identification of 2047 article after reading the abstract followed by the full article 14 article were included in the systematic review and eight article were included in the metaanalysis the study selected for the systematic review were published between the year 1992 and 2021 and conducted in eight country namely ethiopia india indonesia bangladesh tanzania peru china and lesotho the study assessed vulnerability to access to wash on the growth of child aged 5 year there wa a significant difference when relating wash vulnerability to childrens height the metaanalysis of this study showed that the impact of wash on child stunting is significant when it come to lack of sanitation in 72 of the study conclusion the study found that wash vulnerability contributes to stunting in child aged 5 year in developing country based on our finding we recommend incorporating wash strategy especially sanitation into the formulation of intervention integrating with health promotion policy for healthy early childhood development

processed_title: understanding stunting impact cause and strategy to accelerate stunting reductiona narrative review
processed_abstract: stunting is a major global health concern particularly in low and middleincome country due to it persistently high prevalence it often originates from chronic malnutrition during the critical first 1000 day of life maternal and child nutrition are critical determinant of a child growth and development this article aimed to explore the impact cause and evidencebased strategy to accelerate the reduction of stunting incidence worldwide this review wa undertaken with source from pubmed scopus google scholar science direct and medline from october 2024 to january 2025 this review wa undertaken with source from pubmed scopus google scholar science direct and medline from october 2024 to january 2025 using the keyword stunting cause of stunting stunting impact stunting intervention and stunting prevention the finding highlight the multifactorial cause of stunting including maternal malnutrition inadequate breastfeeding and complementary feeding poor sanitation and socioeconomic factor stunting is associated with impaired linear growth cognitive deficit gut dysbiosis endocrine disruption anemia and increased risk of chronic disease later in life addressing stunting demand multisectoral strategy focusing on maternal and child nutrition infection prevention improved wash water sanitation and hygiene practice and socioeconomic support the evidence presented may guide policy development and targeted intervention to prevent stunting and it longterm effect

processed_title: unveiling the dynamic of stunting a qualitative exploration of parenting pattern and toddler aged 659 month in bejiharjo indonesia
processed_abstract: purpose this research wa conducted to explore the experience of mother in raising stunted toddler aged between 659 month it also examined the perception of parenting style shaped by sociocultural context and time constraint affecting the nutritional status a well a growth in bejiharjo village java indonesia method a qualitative method wa used and data were collected through indepth interview diary recording and focus group discussion with mother of toddler stakeholder and healthcare professional transcript data from recorded interview were processed using qualitative content analysis result the result showed that there were four emergent theme namely toddler parenting pattern family and environmental health eating pattern and consumption habit of toddler a well a literacy and understanding of parenting and child health furthermore eight related theme cluster were yielded from the analysis of parenting experience difference between stunted and nonstunted toddler in parenting pattern and daily activity were recorded interaction between toddler and mother a well a productive activity had a shorter average duration conclusion mother experience various challenge and limitation in raising toddler with the risk of stunting therefore increasing understanding and knowledge about the importance of healthy parenting and good nutrition are necessary to prevent stunting

processed_title: prevalence and predictor stunting wasting and underweight in timor leste child under five year an analysis of dhs data in 2016
processed_abstract: stunting wasting and being underweight are indicator of malnutrition in a country the high status reflects the poor nutritional and health status of child under five we analyzed data from the demographic and health survey conducted in timor leste from 2009 to 2016 to identify the prevalence and predictor stunting wasting and underweight the variable analyzed were the mother education mother age mother bmi mother height number of anc visit birth weight sex of a child sex of head household type of residence wealth index toilet facility source of drinking water and province the sample in this study wa 3723 toddler prevalence of stunting 444 underweight 375 and wasting 253 in the bivariate analysis the variable statistically significantly associated with stunting underweight and wasting wa mother education sex of a child type of residence wealth index and province improving the nutritional status of child in timor leste requires various nutrition and health intervention

processed_title: addressing health illiteracy and stunting in cultureshocked indigenous population a case study of outer baduy in indonesia
processed_abstract: this research aim to determine the factor impact and solution for health literacy in the outer baduy hamlet of kanekes village indonesia the method used in this research is qualitative which produce an indepth explanation of the existing problem data were collected through interview and documentation interview were conducted with key figure including two female baduy resident with stunted child one retainer the head of the ngo sri a midwife who work in the baduy village and the head of the lebak social service apart from that secondary data in the form of recording of community service talk show conducted by the university of indonesia to overcome stunting in baduy were also analysed the result show that the factor associated with the low health literacy of the baduy community are literacy writing and reading taboo on eating certain food people spending too much time in the field people learning by imitating their parent demanding access to village lack of consistency from external party in providing health program and gender segregation in baduy society the impact of the low health literacy of the baduy community is fatalism high maternal and child mortality rate and high health cost the proposed strategy for increasing the health literacy of the baduy community based on the finding of this research include developing health literacy by targeting community leader managing informationtechnologybased healthinformation group and always presenting at least one health worker among the resident who provides an example of healthy living encouraging collective reflection when health case occur and balancing gender communication

processed_title: low intake of essential amino acid and other risk factor of stunting among underfive child in malang city east java indonesia
processed_abstract: background the lack of energyprotein intake ha been shown to increase the risk of stunting in underfive child the quality of protein in food is assessed by the completeness of amino acid content this study aim to determine the amount of essential amino acid eaas intake and other risk factor of stunting among underfive child design and method a descriptive casecontrol study wa performed in the work area of kedungkandang health center malang the subject were 2459 monthold child with a total of 23 stunted heightforage zscore haz 2 sd and 57 normal child haz 2 sd furthermore the data were collected using anthropometric measurement validated and pretested questionnaire which were analyzed using multiple logistic regression result the intake of all the nine eaas in stunted child wa lower than that of nonstunted child however only histidine isoleucine and methionine were significantly different p005 the significant risk factor of stunting include a family income per month fewer than the regional minimum wage or1206 95 ci 1837953 being underweight or711 95 ci 1493393 breastfeeding of less than 6 month or534 95 ci 1282220 and the lack of eaa methionine intake or014 95 ci 003067 conclusion stunted child may not receive sufficient dietary intake of eaas in their diet furthermore the lack of eaas intake especially methionine alongside low family income underweight lack of breastfeeding and variety in food consumption were the risk factor of stunting among underfive child in a selected health center in malang city indonesia

processed_title: policy intervention and management in addressing stunting in child a systematic review
processed_abstract: stunting is a chronic malnutrition problem caused by a lack of nutrient over a long period this lead to problem later in life resulting in difficulty in achieving optimal physical and cognitive development this study analyzes policy intervention and address of child stunting in asian african and american country through a systematic review the design used is a systematic review article are collected using electronic database such a sciencedirect springerlink proquest pubmed and sage from 20192023 using the keywords policy management and stunting a the result of the literature review to reduce stunting rate stunting policy and program focus on food security decentralization of the health system availability of health service and access to health service maternal education access to water hygiene sanitation maternal nutrition and poverty alleviation appropriate policy implementation result of holistic and comprehensive policy formulation stunting prevention requires crossprogram and crosssector collaboration and is carried out comprehensively

processed_title: complementary feeding practice among young child in china india and indonesia a narrative review
processed_abstract: under and overnutrition are coexisting health issue in several country across asia poor complementary feeding cf is a significant determinant of malnutrition in child and a major cause of morbidity and mortality the purpose of this narrative review is to summarize the most recent evidence regarding the cf practice in 3 country with a high prevalence of stunting and overweight and currently undergoing rapid economic and nutritional transition china india and indonesia we focused particularly on the adequacy of cf based on the who feeding indicator 2021 regarding timing frequency diversity a well a the consumption of specific food group according to the finding the majority of infant in the 3 country are introduced to cf at an inappropriate time either too early particularly in urbanrural area of china and indonesia or too late india compared with the who recommendation furthermore in all country diet are characterized by a low variety and frequency of cf and consist mainly of staple food with poor nutritional quality such a rice cereal or noodle nutrientdense and proteinrich food such a food of animal origin are either inadequately consumed rural area of china and india or introduced too late urban area of china and indonesia in the diet of child in all country the consumption of fruit and vegetable especially during the early cf period is poor in contrast a significant proportion of both urban and rural child particularly in indonesia and india are consuming energydensenutrientpoor snack and sugary drink during the cf period the described practice may pose a significant risk for the development of energy andor nutrient gap magnifying the double and triple burden of malnutrition present in these country further research is warranted to understand the significance of the observed practice for stunting andor overweightobesity risk

processed_title: prevalence and risk factor for stunting and severe stunting among underfives in north maluku province of indonesia
processed_abstract: background adequate nutrition is needed to ensure optimum growth and development of infant and young child understanding of the risk factor for stunting and severe stunting among child aged less than five year in north maluku province is important to guide indonesian government public health planner to develop nutrition program and intervention in a post conflict area the purpose of the current study wa to assess the prevalence of and the risk factor associated with stunting and severe stunting among child aged less than five year in north maluku province of indonesia method the health and nutritional status of child aged less than five year wa assessed in north maluku province of indonesia in 2004 using a crosssectional multistage survey conducted on 750 household from each of the four island group in north maluku province a total of 2168 child aged 059 month were used in the analysis result prevalence of stunting and severe stunting were 29 95ci 260322 and 141 95ci 117170 for child aged 023 month and 384 95ci 359410 and 184 95ci 161209 for child aged 059 month respectively after controlling for potential confounders multivariate analysis revealed that the risk factor for stunted child were child age in month male sex and number of family meal per day or2 time for child aged 023 month and income poorest and middleclass family child age in month and male sex for child aged 059 month the risk factor for severe stunting in child aged 023 month were income poorest family male sex and child age in month and for child aged 059 month were income poorest family father occupation not working male sex and child age in month conclusion programme aimed at improving stunting in north maluku province of indonesia should focus on child under two year of age of male sex and from family of low socioeconomic status

processed_title: geographic and socioeconomic disparity in child undernutrition across 514 district in indonesia
processed_abstract: background globally in 2020 45 million child were estimated to be wasted and 149 million child under five year of age were estimated to be stunted undernutrition make child in particular much more vulnerable to disease and death our study aim to examine geographic and socioeconomic disparity in child undernutrition across 514 district in indonesia method employing both geospatial and quantitative analysis descriptive statistic and ordinary least square regression we analyzed the disparity in the prevalence of underweight severe underweight wasting severe wasting stunting and severe stunting among district child undernutrition data were from indonesia basic health survey riskesdas 2018 which included a sample of 93620 child under five year socioeconomic data were from the world bank result we found a relatively large geographic and socioeconomic disparity in child undernutrition in indonesia by region district in the papua region including maluku and nusa tenggara had a significantly higher prevalence of underweight and wasting than those in the java region including bali district in papua had 44 121 38 and 57 higher prevalence of underweight severe underweight wasting and severe wasting respectively similarly the poorest district had a significantly higher prevalence of underweight wasting and stunting than the wealthiest district the poorest district had 30 83 16 21 and 74 higher prevalence of underweight severe underweight wasting stunting and severe stunting respectively these result were similar among rural district conclusion there is a significant disparity in child undernutrition across district in indonesia the government need to prioritize the reduction of child undernutrition especially in rural area district outside of java and bali and the poorest and least educated area

processed_title: monitoring and evaluation of childhood stunting reduction program based on fish supplement product in north sumatera indonesia
processed_abstract: the government of serdang bedagai regency initiated a supplementation program to reduce the high prevalence of stunting in the area by delivering extra supplementation which were nutritious biscuit from national government and fishbased supplement produced from local resource a 6month study from april 2022 to september 2022 wa conducted to monitor and evaluate the government program that involved 219 under5yearold child with heightforage zscore hazscore below 2 we observed the stunting prevalence reduction by 3700 where 81 child recovered from stunting hazscore 2 furthermore the mean hazscore and whzscore weightforheight zscore were monitored to significantly improve by 097 145 pvalue 174e14 and 100 218 pvalue and 240e8 subsequently the most significant improvement in hazscore wa monitored among child receiving fishbased supplement with 104 144 improvement pvalue 659e17 then a significant whzscore improvement wa reported from child consuming fishbased supplement and a combination of fishbased supplement with nutritious biscuit pvalue 232e8 and 548e5 by 104 229 and 083 184 respectively the result of the observation become evidence that the program could effectively reduce the prevalence of stunting in child below five year old especially among child who received locally produced fishbased supplement

processed_title: problem nutrient in diet of underfive child and district food security status linear programming analysis of 37 stunting priority district in indonesia
processed_abstract: background in indonesia food security and dietary pattern varied by region this might lead to difference in problem nutrient pn and should be considered in developing localspecific foodbased recommendation fbrs for stunting prevention objective this study aim to identify pns in diet of underfive child in selected 37 stunting priority district in indonesia and assess whether the number of pns wa associated with district food security status method linear programming analysis lp using optifood wa done using single 24hour dietary recall data ministry of health 2016 food consumption survey pn wa defined a nutrient which did not meet 100 recommended nutrient intake rni based on indonesianrni in the 2bestdiets scenario district food security status wa determined using food security vulnerability atlas 2018 result the top three pns amongst underfive childrenwere iron folate vitamin b12 611mo folate calcium zinc 1223mo folate calcium vitamin c 2435mo and calcium folate vitamin c 3659mo there were no significant difference in number of pns based on food security status after integrating the nutrientdense food into fbrs the number of district with dietary inadequacy decreased for the top3 problem nutrient in each age group with the exception of iron for infant conclusion our finding showed that problem nutrient and dietary inadequacy were prevalent in diet of underfive child even in foodsecure area promoting locally available nutrientdense food through fbrs nutritionspecific intervention and ensuring availability and access to these food nutritionsensitive intervention are recommended additional intervention particularly for iron in infant are required

processed_title: association between basic immunization status and stunting in toddler aged 12 to 59 month in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective immunization ha been identified a a specific nutritionrelated intervention to address the direct cause of stunting this study examines the association between basic immunization status and stunting among toddler in indonesia method we conducted a crosssectional analysis using data from the 2021 study of indonesia nutritional status a total of 70267 toddler aged 12 to 59 month were examined cox regression wa employed to calculate prevalence ratio pr with their 95 confidence interval ci result the prevalence of stunting among child aged 12 to 59 month in indonesia wa 231 while 7492 of child under 5 year old had complete basic immunization status multivariable analysis revealed a statistically significant association between basic immunization status and the incidence of stunting relative to toddler with complete basic immunization those with incomplete partial immunization were at a 118 time higher risk of stunting adjusted pr 118 95 ci 115 to 122 furthermore toddler who had not been immunized at all faced an even greater stunting risk adjusted pr 127 95 ci 117 to 137 this association persisted after adjusting for variable such a maternal education economic status and the child birth weight conclusion basic immunization status influence the incidence of stunting in toddler aged 12 to 59 month thus parent must ensure that their childrens immunization are completed according to the recommended schedule additionally it is crucial to increase parental awareness regarding health service utilization disease prevention and the nutritional need of toddler

processed_title: the coverage of indicator of sensitive and specific intervention program and prevalence of stunting underfive child a crosssectional study in aceh province indonesia
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of stunting child underfive in aceh province is still high due to multiple factor including the suboptimal coverage of intervention program aim this study aimed at finding out the correlation between the coverage of indicator of sensitive and specific intervention program with prevalence of stunting in aceh method a crosssectional design analyzed secondary data from the indonesia nutritional status survey and program coverage data in 13 regenciescities in aceh province the dependent variable wa the prevalence of stunting meanwhile the independent variable covered 20 sensitive and specific intervention program indicator we apply stata 16 to analyze the correlation between sensitive and specific coverage and stunting prevalence result the coverage of indicator of pregnant woman with chronic energy deficiency ced receiving supplementary feeding young child with diarrhea receiving zinc supplementation parent taking parenting class and participation in the health insurance program had a significant correlation with prevalence stunting in aceh r 057 r 050 r 065 and r 060 conclusion intervention measure to avert childhood stunting in aceh should include strengthening supplementary feeding program for mother and toddler supplementation to prevent toddler diarrhea and counseling parent on parenting and health insurance

processed_title: obesity a the sequel of childhood stunting ghrelin and ghsr gene polymorphism explained
processed_abstract: stunting or short stature in child is a significant nutritional problem in developing and underdeveloped country stunting during childhood might affect brain development and impair development cognitive function additionally this condition associated with the increased risk for obesity during adulthood several study have shown that the increment risk of obesity and overweight in child with a short stature wa due to their metabolic efficiency child with stunting have lower resting energy expenditure compared to non stunting child additionally stunted child ha higher respiratory quotient and carbohydrate oxidation but lower fat oxidation compared to nonstunting child these result might explain why stunted child easily become obese which is due to lower fat oxidation and leading to tendency to store fatthis review discussed the current status on study in the nutrigenetic aspect of the relationship between stunting in the childhood and obesity in adulthood i hypothesized that stunted child are more likely to become obese in their later life because they have lower metabolic rate and higher tendency of fat storage there are several candidate gene and pathway involved in obesity and i suspected that ghrelin and it receptor growth hormone secretague receptor ghsr were responsible

processed_title: effect of maternal and child factor on stunting partial least square structural equation modeling
processed_abstract: background stunting is affected by various factor from mother and child previous study assessed only one or more influencing variable unfortunately nor the significant influence of maternal and child factor nor the indicator contributing to maternal and child factor that affect the stunting incidence have ever been analyzed purpose this study analyzed the effect of maternal and child factor on stunting and the significant indicator that shape the maternal and child factor that impact stunting method this wa a casecontrol study overall 132 stunted child and 132 nonstunted child in purbalingga regency central java province participated in the research direct interview and medical record review were conducted to assess the studied variable the research data were tested using the partial least square structural equation with a formative model result maternal factor directly affected the occurrence of stunting t3527 p0001 with an effect of 303 maternal factor also contributed a significant indirect effect on stunting through child factor t4762 p0001 with an effect of 282 child factor affected the occurrence of stunting t 5749 p0001 with an effect of 498 the child factor wa influenced by maternal factor with an effect of 567 t10014 p0001 the moderation analysis result demonstrated that maternal and child factor were moderate predictive variable of stunting occurrence conclusion child factor have more significant and direct effect on stunting than maternal factor but are greatly affected by them

processed_title: factor driving and inhibiting stunting reduction acceleration program at district level a qualitative study in west sumatra
processed_abstract: stunting prevalence varies significantly across indonesian province and districtsmunicipalities including west sumatra this research aim to identify the driving and inhibiting factor for implementing the stunting reduction acceleration program at the district level in west sumatra the research wa conducted in 2022 with a qualitative study design and a case study approach data were collected through i group interview with key informant involving policymakers and program manager at the provincial district subdistrict and village level and ii indepth interview with mother of stunted child two district were selected a research site one district represents an area that ha yet to be developed district a or failed district the other district ha seen a significant reduction in the prevalence of stunting district b or successful district we found several driving and inhibiting factor that affect the reduced prevalence of stunting such a the need for the relevant agency to play a strong role a the leading and responsible sector for stunting convergence action another important factor is paying close attention to improving the quality of stunting data and providing adequate funding support high commitment from public health center to maternal health through class for pregnant woman infant and child under the age of five can also have an impact furthermore properly performing duty by assigned actor in specific and sensitive program and integrated monitoring and evaluation of program implementation and outcome can influence stunting prevalence recommendation for accelerating stunting reduction include improving communication and coordination establishing stunting prevalence reduction a a performance indicator among the related district government and it various agency and assisting the village administration with planning and budgeting to support stunting prevention

processed_title: relationship of deworming drug consumption and animal protein intake with stunting
processed_abstract: by the end of 2022 the nationwide incidence of stunting remained high including in lampung province where it wa 158 above the target of 14 to be achieved by 2024 since 2019 stunting ha become a national priority due to suspected factor such a low nutrition intake especially from animal protein source high rate of worm infection and low compliance of underfives in consuming deworming drug therefore this research aimed to analyze the relationship between deworming consumption adequacy of animal protein intake and stunting incidence in child aged 1259 month in bandar lampung in 2022 this research used an analytic survey with a crosssectional approach to analyze the relationship between deworming consumption adequacy of animal protein intake and stunting in underfives at two priority stunting handling neighbourhood in bandar lampung namely way gubak and karang maritim the sample consisted of 262 under five and their mother who visited the integrated health post in the selected neighbourhood from november to december 2022 and the data obtained were analyzed using logistic regression the result revealed a relationship between the consumption of an deworming and varying animal protein consumption with stunting incidence this indicated a need to promote the importance of consuming deworming and adequate consumption of animal protein with variation to prevent stunting in child in bandar lampung

processed_title: correction prenatal and postnatal determinant of stunting at age 011 month a crosssectional study in indonesia
processed_abstract: this corrects the article doi 101371journalpone0254662

processed_title: macronutrient intake in stunted and nonstunted toddler in jember indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is a condition of toddler who experience growth failure due to chronic nutrient deficiency that must be addressed immediately if child lack nutrient continuously it can affect their nutritional status and will cause child to be shorter than their age the purpose of this study wa to determine the difference in macronutrient intake in stunted and nonstunted toddler in jember indonesia design and method type of analytical observational research with case control design sampling technique using simple random sampling the number of subject needed in each group is 66 stunting toddler and 66 nonstunting toddler with total subject used are 132 toddler result there are difference in macronutrient intake energy protein fat and carbohydrate between stunted and nonstunted toddler with a higher average value of food intake per day for nonstunted toddler than for stunted toddler conclusion there are difference in macronutrient intake between stunted and nonstunted toddler in jember indonesia with a pvalue 0000 005

processed_title: comparison of cognitive function in child with stunting and child with undernutrition with normal stature
processed_abstract: background stunting is the impaired growth and development that child experience from poor nutrition repeated infection and inadequate psychosocial stimulation child are defined a stunted if their heightforage is more than two standard deviation below the who child growth standard median according to the indonesia basic national health survey 2013 indonesia stunting prevalence reached 372 various study have shown that impaired cognitive development is found in child with stunting and undernutrition this study aim to determine cognitive development in stunted and undernutrition with normal stature child using the bayley scale of infant development iii bayleyiii method a crosssectional study on 51 child aged one month to 3 year who fulfilled the inclusion criterion and who visited the outpatient clinic of dr cipto mangunkusumo national general hospital from june 2017 to january 2018 wa performed cognitive development wa assessed using the bayley scale of infant development third edition bayleyiii result 26 child with stunting and 25 child with undernutrition with normal stature participated in this study there wa a statistically nonsignificant trend toward lower median score percentile in the stunted group compared to that in the undernourished with normal stature group in the motor median range 1 0175 v 4 079 p0183 cognitive 125 0175 v 16 01999 p0550 and adaptive behavior 7 0175 v 12 0158 p0657 domain conclusion there is a trend toward lower cognitive motor and adaptive behavior ability in stunted child compared to undernourished child with normal stature which need further study in addition child with undernutrition have belowaverage ability across all domain even before stunting ha occurred

processed_title: micronutrient deficiency and stunting were associated with socioeconomic status in indonesian child aged 659 month
processed_abstract: micronutrient deficiency and stunting are known a a significant problem in most developing country including indonesia the objective of this study wa to analyze the association between micronutrient deficiency and stunting with socioeconomic status s among indonesian child aged 659 month this crosssectional study wa part of the south east asian nutrition survey seanuts a total of 1008 indonesian child were included in the study anemia iron deficiency vitamin a deficiency vitamin d deficiency and stunting were identified in this study structured questionnaire were used to measure s difference between micronutrient parameter and anthropometric indicator with the s group were tested using oneway anova with posthoc test after adjusted for age area resident rural and urban and sex the highest prevalence of anemia stunting and severe stunting were found to be most significant in the lowest s group at 456 293 and 545 respectively child from the lowest s group had significantly lower mean of hb ferritin retinol and haz severely stunted child had a significantly lower mean of hb concentration compared to stunted and normal height child micronutrient deficiency except vitamin d and stunting were associated with low s among indonesian child aged 659 month

processed_title: risk factor and nutritional profile associated with stunting in child
processed_abstract: purpose to analyze risk factor and various nutrient associated with stunting among child aged 660 month method this is a casecontrol and crosssectional study between 40 stunting case and 40 control data on possible risk factor associated with stunting were obtained through direct interview and using a questionnaire examination of vitamin d zinc albumin and ferritin level wa performed on both group data were analyzed using ibm spss statistic for window version 230 ibm co armonk ny usa to determine risk factor for stunting and to assess the relationship between nutritional level and stunting result the incidence of stunting wa highest in child aged 1236 month child with low weight and very low weight for age comprised of 55 and 225 respectively of the study participant the highest mother educational level wa junior high school 40 history of low birth weight lbw wa more commonly observed in the stunting group than that in the control group 250 and 75 respectively p0034 odds ratio 0310 95 confidence interval 01220789 approximately 75 of case had premature birth exclusive breast feeding wa found to be not correlated with stunting the mean zinc level in the stunting group wa 3417 ngml which wa different from that in the control group 5083 ngml p0023 blood ferritin vitamin d albumin and calcium level were not strongly correlated with stunting conclusion lbw is the main risk factor contributing to stunting and is strongly associated with low zinc level

processed_title: relationship between iron deficiency anemia and stunting in pediatric population in developing country a systematic review and metaanalysis
processed_abstract: backgroundobjectives iron deficiency anemia ida and stunting are prevalent global health issue particularly in developing country where previous study have suggested a potential relationship between them this systematic review aim to analyze the relationship between iron deficiency anemia and stunting in pediatric population in developing country method literature search were conducted on pubmed embase cochrane library and ebsco host the primary outcome wa the association between ida and stunting risk of bias wa assessed using the newcastleottawa scale no for cohort study and the effective public health practice project ephpp for other observational study metaanalysis wa performed with a randomeffects model and heterogeneity assessment a grading of recommendation assessment development and evaluation grade assessment wa performed to determine the certainty and importance of the study result out of 19095 article 15 study were included in the systematic review and 4 study were included in the metaanalysis encompassing 21936 subject aged 0 to 12 year ida prevalence ranged from 36 to 588 while stunting prevalence varied from 66 to 445 nine article supported a significant relationship between ida and stunting revealing that stunted child had a 1316785 time higher risk of developing ida the odds ratio of child with ida to be stunted wa 227 95 ci 130395 all study exhibited a moderate risk of bias grade assessment suggested that the evidence certainty is low but important conclusion the high ida prevalence in developing country including indonesia is associated with stunting in child suggesting a synergistic relationship

processed_title: development and validation of prediction model for fetal growth restriction and birthweight an individual participant data metaanalysis
processed_abstract: background fetal growth restriction is associated with perinatal morbidity and mortality early identification of woman having atrisk fetus can reduce perinatal adverse outcome objective to assess the predictive performance of existing model predicting fetal growth restriction and birthweight and if needed to develop and validate new multivariable model using individual participant data design individual participant data metaanalyses of cohort in international prediction of pregnancy complication network decision curve analysis and health economics analysis participant pregnant woman at booking external validation of existing model 9 cohort 441415 pregnancy international prediction of pregnancy complication model development and validation 4 cohort 237228 pregnancy predictor maternal clinical characteristic biochemical and ultrasound marker primary outcome fetal growth restriction defined a birthweight 10th centile adjusted for gestational age and with stillbirth neonatal death or delivery before 32 week gestation birthweight analysis first we externally validated existing model using individual participant data metaanalysis if needed we developed and validated new international prediction of pregnancy complication model using randomintercept regression model with backward elimination for variable selection and undertook internalexternal crossvalidation we estimated the studyspecific performance cstatistic calibration slope calibrationinthelarge for each model and pooled using randomeffects metaanalysis heterogeneity wa quantified using tau2 and 95 prediction interval we assessed the clinical utility of the fetal growth restriction model using decision curve analysis and health economics analysis based on national institute for health and care excellence 2008 model result of the 119 published model one birthweight model poon could be validated none reported fetal growth restriction using our definition across all cohort the poon model had good summary calibration slope of 093 95 confidence interval 090 to 096 with slight overfitting and underpredicted birthweight by 904 g on average 95 confidence interval 379 g to 1429 g the newly developed international prediction of pregnancy complicationsfetal growth restriction model included maternal age height parity smoking status ethnicity and any history of hypertension preeclampsia previous stillbirth or small for gestational age baby and gestational age at delivery this allowed prediction conditional on a range of assumed gestational age at delivery the pooled apparent cstatistic and calibration were 096 95 confidence interval 051 to 10 and 095 95 confidence interval 067 to 123 respectively the model showed positive net benefit for predicted probability threshold between 1 and 90 in addition to the predictor in the international prediction of pregnancy complicationsfetal growth restriction model the international prediction of pregnancy complicationsbirthweight model included maternal weight history of diabetes and mode of conception average calibration slope across cohort in the internalexternal crossvalidation wa 100 95 confidence interval 078 to 123 with no evidence of overfitting birthweight wa underestimated by 97 g on average 95 confidence interval 1543 g to 1738 g limitation we could not externally validate most of the published model due to variation in the definition of outcome internalexternal crossvalidation of our international prediction of pregnancy complicationsfetal growth restriction model wa limited by the paucity of event in the included cohort the economic evaluation using the published national institute for health and care excellence 2008 model may not reflect current practice and full economic evaluation wa not possible due to paucity of data future work international prediction of pregnancy complication model performance need to be assessed in routine practice and their impact on decisionmaking and clinical outcome need evaluation conclusion the international prediction of pregnancy complicationsfetal growth restriction and international prediction of pregnancy complicationsbirthweight model accurately predict fetal growth restriction and birthweight for various assumed gestational age at delivery these can be used to stratify the risk status at booking plan monitoring and management study registration this study is registered a prospero crd42019135045 funding this award wa funded by the national institute for health and care research nihr health technology assessment programme nihr award ref 1714807 and is published in full in health technology assessment vol 28 no 14 see the nihr funding and award website for further award information

processed_title: maternal and child health handbook and under6 child overweight in greater jakarta indonesia a crosssectional webbased survey
processed_abstract: background in indonesia the double burden of child overnutrition and undernutrition is a public health concern the nationally distributed maternal and child health mch handbook provides child nutrition information to caregiver we aimed to find mother information source regarding child nutrition including the internet and the mch handbook and to explore the association between overweight and use of the mch handbook method a crosssectional webbased survey wa conducted among mother with child under 6 year old in greater jakarta during 2019 bivariate and multivariate logistic regression examined the association between child nutrition status and use of the mch handbook result data were collected from 233 child overweight underweight wasting and stunting were identified in 364 226 268 and 376 respectively 625 of mother used the mch handbook and 882 used the internet via a mobile phone significantly more case of overweight were observed among child whose mother used the mch handbook adjusted or aor 5829 95 confidential interval ci 161820999 whereas no relationship wa observed between mch handbook use and child undernutrition significant association with child overweight were found for mother education tertiary aor 0294 95ci 00980885 employment type fulltime aor 0185 95ci 00610562 watching television more than 1 h aor 4387 95ci 164811678 and recognition of child overweight by mother yes aor 3405 95ci 1051103 conclusion these result indicate the need to support mother of child exhibiting overnutrition and undernutrition the mch handbook should be modified to address this issue

processed_title: effectiveness of food fortification in improving nutritional status of mother and child in indonesia
