processed_abstract: food fortification program have been conducted in several country to overcome micronutrient deficiency and related problem with various degree of effectiveness available information regarding the success of food fortification program in some developing country including indonesia is still limited thus this study conduct a systematic review of the effect of food fortification of mother and child using biochemical and anthropometric measure focusing on linear growth three database were used in the literature search namely pubmed science direct and google scholar fifteen article were included for analysis from 517 study found consisting of indonesian and english article published from 2000 to june 2020 fortification of iron vitamin a and iodine can increase the level of hemoglobin serum ferritin and serum retinol and median urine iodine excretion especially in toddler and schoolchildren however multinutrient fortification intervention were associated with various effect on hemoglobin serum ferritin and serum retinol but a positive association wa found with linear growth indicator in the form of body length for age the effectiveness of food fortification in reducing the prevalence of stunting still need more and stronger evidence through study with large sample size and longer duration

processed_title: climate exposure and child undernutrition evidence from indonesia
processed_abstract: global climate change ha the potential to disrupt agricultural system undermine household socioeconomic status and shape the prevalence and distribution of disease each of these change may influence childrens nutritional status which is sensitive to food availability access and utilization and which may have lasting consequence for laterlife health and socioeconomic outcome this paper contributes to the emerging literature on climate and child health by studying the effect of temperature and precipitation exposure on childrens height and weight in indonesia drawing on five round of the indonesian family life survey ifls implemented between 1993 and 2015 we estimate fixedeffects regression model of heightforage hfa and weightforheight wfh among sample of child age 2459 month and 023 month respectively we test for heterogeneity in these effect across subpopulation expected to vary in their vulnerability result show that delay in monsoon onset are consistently associated with worse child health outcome delay in monsoon onset during the prenatal period are associated with reduced child height among child age 24 year the weight of young 2 year child is adversely affected by delay in the most recent monsoon season and this relationship is particularly strong among resident of java overall our result underline the need for intervention that protect childrens nutrition and underlying health against the effect of climate change

processed_title: consumption of micronutrientfortified milk and noodle is associated with lower risk of stunting in preschoolaged child in indonesia
processed_abstract: background stunting is highly prevalent in developing country and is associated with greater morbidity and mortality micronutrient deficiency contribute to stunting and micronutrientfortified food are a potential strategy to reduce child stunting objective to examine the relationship between the use of fortified powdered milk and noodle and child stunting in a large populationbased sample of indonesian child method consumption of fortified milk and fortified noodle wa assessed in child 6 to 59 month of age from 222250 family living in rural area and 79940 family living in urban slum area in indonesia result the proportion of child who consumed fortified milk and fortified noodle were 340 and 220 respectively in rural family and 424 and 485 respectively in urban family the prevalence of stunting among child from rural and urban family wa 518 and 488 respectively child from rural and urban family were less likely to be stunted if they consumed fortified milk in rural area or 087 95 ci 085 to 090 p 0001 in urban area or 080 95 ci 076 to 085 p 0001 or fortified noodle in rural area or 095 95 ci 091 to 099p 02 in urban area or 095 95 ci 091 to 101 p 08 in multiple logistic regression model adjusted for potential confounders in both rural and urban family the odds of stunting were lower when a child who consumed fortified milk also consumed fortified noodle or when a child who consumed fortified noodle also consumed fortified milk conclusion the consumption of fortified milk and noodle is associated with decreased odds of stunting among indonesian child these finding add to a growing body of evidence regarding the potential benefit of multiple micronutrient fortification on child growth

processed_title: stunting a a synonym of social disadvantage and poor parental education
processed_abstract: socially economically politically and emotionally sepe disadvantaged child are shorter than child from affluent background in view of previous work on the lack of association between nutrition and child growth we performed a study in urban schoolchildren we measured 723 child 583 to 1383 year kupang indonesia three school with different social background we investigated anthropometric data clinical sign of malnutrition physical fitness parental education and household equipment subjective selfconfidence wa assessed by the macarthur test the prevalence of stunting wa between 85 and 468 clinical sign of under or malnutrition were absent even in the most underprivileged child there wa no delay in tooth eruption underprivileged child are physically fitter than the wealthy the correlation between height and state of nutrition bmi_sds skinfold_sds muac_sds ranged between r 069 p 001 and r 043 p 001 in private school child and between r 007 n and r 032 p 001 in the underprivileged child maternal education interacted with height in affluent r 020 p 001 and in underprivileged child r 020 p 001 the shortness of sepe disadvantaged child wa not associated with anthropometric and clinical sign of malnutrition nor with delay in physical development stunting is a complex phenomenon and may be considered a synonym of social disadvantage and poor parental education

processed_title: water pollution and sanitation in indonesia a review on water quality health and environmental impact management and future challenge
processed_abstract: a an archipelagic tropical developing country indonesia is characterized by vast expanse of rural and isolated area this review aim to discus water pollution and sanitation existing condition health and environmental impact alongside it management and challenge in indonesia the systematic review approach wa utilized to ensure transparency and replicability following the preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma criterion many water source in indonesia are contaminated by various pollutant such a heavy metal microplastics pesticide and endocrinedisrupting chemical edcs moreover the existing water and wastewater treatment plant can not completely remove pollutant including bacteria that cause waterborne disease the lack of proper sanitation facility including toilet and latrine is not only reported in rural area but also in periurban region of indonesia this situation force many to rely on unimproved water source such a river water for their daily use and engage in open defecation which may increase the risk of direct exposure to waterborne contaminant insufficient sanitation ha been linked to significant public health issue in indonesia including maternal health complication childhood stunting and an increased incidence of waterborne disease such a diarrhea based on the finding of this review indonesia still need to improve it sanitation and water treatment facility a well a reduce pollution of the aquatic environment this condition not only illustrates the condition of water and sanitation in indonesia but can also be used a an illustration of how developing country face various pollution and sanitation problem during the massive development and industry

processed_title: improved sanitation and cooccurrence of anemia and stunting in indonesian child a retrospective cohort study
processed_abstract: anemia and stunting are major public health concern in low and middleincome country including indonesia with significant impact on child development morbidity and mortality the aim of this study wa to assess the effect of improved sanitation on the cooccurrence of anemia and stunting ca in indonesian child using pooled data from the indonesian family life survey ifls across three wave from ifls 3 in 2000 ifls 4 in 2007 and ifls 5 in 2014 the sample included 839 child aged 15 year with complete anthropometric and hemoglobin data measured in 2000 a the baseline cohort and followed across subsequent wave the main independent variable wa improved sanitation and other covariates included maternal and child characteristic parental factor and socioeconomic status multinomial logistic regression wa used to assess the impact of sanitation over time the prevalence of ca wa 3075 in 2000 608 in 2007 and 429 in 2014 stuntingonly prevalence increased from 1621 in 2000 to 2741 in 2007 but decreased to 1931 in 2014 anemiaonly prevalence decreased from 3123 in 2000 to 1025 in 2007 and slightly rose to 1692 in 2014 the analysis found that child with unimproved sanitation were at significantly higher risk of ca crude relative risk ratio rrr 249 95 confidence interval ci 192323 which decreased after adjusting for confounding factor adjusted rrr 155 95ci 112214 similarly the risk for anemia wa higher in child with unimproved sanitation adjusted rrr 1 43 95ci 107190 however the risk for stunting wa not statistically significant after adjustment this study underscore the importance of improved sanitation in reducing anemia and stunting but also highlight the need to address other factor such a nutrition maternal health and socioeconomic inequality through comprehensive public health policy

processed_title: comparison of indonesian growth reference chart and world health organization child growth standard in detecting stunting a systematic review and metaanalysis of 15874 child
processed_abstract: recognition of an overestimation of stunted child in indonesia when using the world health organization child growth standard whocgs led to the creation of the indonesian growth reference chart igrc in 2005 with further improvement in 2018 this systematic review aimed to determine whether there is a difference in the diagnosis of stunting when using these two chart this systematic review is registered in the prospero database crd42021259934 literature research wa performed on pubmed science direct medline scielo medrxiv research square ssrn and biorxiv to identify study published from 2018 onwards that examined the comparison of igrc and whocgs in detecting stunting three study were included in this review pooled analysis showed that igrc resulted in a lower prevalence of stunted and severely stunted child risk ratio rr 028 95 confidence interval ci 015051 p00001 i297 comparison between igrc and whogcs for prevalence of normal height child showed that there wa no difference and this finding wa not significant rr 156 95 ci 092266 p01 i2100 and the comparison for prevalence of tall child also showed that there wa no difference when using igrc or whogcs and this finding wa also insignificant rr 202 95 ci 078520 p014 i298 this metaanalysis showed that stunted and severely stunted indonesian child are overrepresented using whocgs the difference between igrc and whocgs ha occurred because of the sample population a igrc includes child from all 33 province in indonesia better reflecting the growth of all child in indonesia

processed_title: pesticide exposure and stunting among child in agricultural area
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of growth disorder among schoolaged child in indonesia is high 307 pesticide have been massively used in indonesian agricultural area objective to determine if exposure to pesticide is associated with stunting among child in agricultural area method this casecontrol study included 160 child 48 case and 112 control aged 812 year exposure to pesticide wa measured based on the history of the exposure since perinatal period infancy and childhood of the participant stunting wa determined a a height for age zscore haz 2 sd other variable measured were level of thyroid stimulating hormone tsh insulinlike growth factor1 igf1 hemoglobin zinc albumin nutrient adequacy level energy and protein and history of infection lowbirth weight lbw and mother height result there were no significant difference between the case and control in term of in the baseline characteristic except for the median igf1 level it wa significantly p0001 lower in the case 6673 ngml than the control 11257 ngml high level of pesticide exposure p0029 and low igf1 level p0001 were significantly associated with stunting after adjusting for confounding variable these variable were found to be independent risk factor for stunting in child aor 390 95 ci 115 to 1326 and aor 835 95 ci 365 to 1914 respectively conclusion pesticide exposure could be a risk factor for the occurrence of growth disorder in child living in agricultural area necessary action should be taken to protect child living in agricultural area from exposure to pesticide

processed_title: use of technology for monitoring the development of nutritional status 1000 hpk in stunting prevention in indonesia
processed_abstract: objective this study is reviewed about the use of technology to monitor the nutritional status of the first thousand day of life 1000 hpk a program in indonesia to prevent stunting method in this study which is looking for journal used in the literature review journal used in literature review obtained through the database of international journal provider such a google scholar pubmed and proquest researcher wrote the appropriate keywords namely nutritional status of 1000 hpk stunting and application the year limit used is ten year from 2010 to 2020 result nutritional status in the first thousand day of life 1000 hpk which is 270 day during pregnancy and 730 day in the baby first life is critical because the consequence are permanent and irreparable pregnant woman and toddler who are less attentive about their food intake will impact nutritional problem or nutritional status that will then affect their development in the future the level of optimal nutritional status will be achieved if nutritional need are met but on the contrary unbalanced nutrition can cause several disease including stunting monitoring the development of toddler is very important to know the existence of growth disorder early on by taking weight measurement a the best way to assess the nutritional status of pregnant woman and toddler every month so that the child growth will be monitored one tool for measuring nutritional status is to use application and technological advance have now undergone rapid development application is a multifunctional product with all it sophistication which can help human in various way conclusion from some journal can be concluded that the use of application in monitoring the nutritional status of 1000 hpk facilitates parent midwife and other health worker in working to monitor the nutritional development of pregnant woman and the growth of infant and toddler for stunting prevention

processed_title: information exposure and growth monitoring favour child nutrition in rural indonesia
processed_abstract: background and objective malnutrition is a health problem among underfive child in indonesia the mother knowledge on nutrition and health in addition to growth monitoring program are essential component that may influence nutritional status of child underfive the objective wa to observe the importance of maternal information exposure along with growth monitoring program to the nutritional status of child in rural area method and study design a cross sectional study of 233 randomly selected mother of underfive child from different geographical rural setting in indonesia were interviewed and observed a to their exposure to nutrition and health information growth monitoring program and nutritional status of the child result the prevalence of underweight stunting and wasting wa 505 180 and 284 respectively the mean of heightforage z score wa similar across village however the mean of weightforage p0039 and weightfor height p0047 were significantly lower in kenduren compared with karangrejo village the possession of a growth monitoring card in kenduren wa significantly lower compared with karangrejo p0001 or buko village p0001 the prevalence of underweight p0001 or stunting p0021 wa higher among child who did not possess a growth monitoring card the prevalence of stunting wa higher among child who did not routinely go to posyandu integrated health post in the last 3 month p0018 conclusion maternal exposure to nutrition and health information along with growth monitoring program contribute to the prevalence of underweight and stunting among rural child who are underfive year old

processed_title: the importance of interprofessional collaboration ipc guideline in stunting management in indonesia a systematic review
processed_abstract: background indonesia stunting prevention program have shown limited effectiveness and scalability interprofessional collaboration ipc is crucial for preventing and treating pediatric stunting this study aimed to investigate the role of primary health center and ipc in addressing stunting in indonesia method a systematic review wa conducted searching pubmed embase web of science proquest and google scholar for study up to november 2023 two reviewer independently screened and included fulltext article that examined ipc and stunting focusing on prevalence policy implication healthcare role community role preventive measure and challenge result the review included 52 article ipc wa found to be critical in reducing stunting prevalence training improved the knowledge of health cadre aiding in the early detection and prevention of stunting the study emphasized ipcs positive impact on stunting reduction across various region policymakers are encouraged to adopt a comprehensive strategy involving collaboration financial support and effective program implementation conclusion this study highlight ipc a essential in reducing stunting in indonesia integrating stunting management into primary healthcare is recommended with a call for developing guideline to standardize and optimize the approach to this public health issue

processed_title: stunting a a risk factor for asthma the role of vitamin d leptin il4 and cd23
processed_abstract: stunting which result from chronic malnutrition is common in child from low and middleincome country several study have reported an association between obesity and asthma however only a handful of study have identified stunting a a significant risk factor for wheezing a symptom of asthma although the underlying mechanism remains unclear this article aimed to review possible mechanism underlying asthma in stunted child overall change in diet or nutritional status and deficiency in certain nutrient such a vitamin d can increase the risk of developing asthma vitamin d deficiency can cause linear growth disorder such a stunting in child with lower level of 25ohd found in underweight and stunted child stunted child show a decreased lean body mass which affect lung growth and function low leptin level during undernutrition cause a th1th2 imbalance toward th2 resulting in increased interleukin il4 cytokine production and total immunoglobulin e ige study in stunted underweight child have also found an increase in the proportion of the total number of b cell with lowaffinity ige receptor cd23 cd23 play an important role in allergen presentation that is facilitated by ige to t cell and strongly activates allergenspecific t cell and the secretion of th2driving cytokine stunted child present with low vitamin d and leptin level impaired lung growth decreased lung function and increased il4 and cd23 level all of these factor may be considered consequential in asthma in stunted child

processed_title: determinant of stunting in child under five year old in south sulawesi and west sulawesi province 2013 and 2018 indonesian basic health survey
processed_abstract: background the prevalence of stunting in south sulawesi and west sulawesi province is relatively high study reveal various household parental and child factor are associated with stunting this paper aimed to determine the determinant of stunting among child under five in south and west sulawesi province using the 2013 and 2018 indonesia basic health survey method this study wa a secondary data analysis using the 2013 and 2018 indonesian basic health survey the unit of analysis wa child under five year and the study obtained 3641 and 4423 child in south sulawesi province from the 2013 and 2018 indonesia basic health survey respectively and 804 and 1059 child from the 2013 and 2018 indonesia basic health survey in west sulawesi province respectively the multivariable poisson regression model wa conducted to determine the determinant of stunting result the result showed that the mean age of child in south sulawesi and west sulawesi province wa 311 month and 308 month respectively on 2013 survey compare to 296 month and 291 month on the 2018 survey the determinant of stunting in child under five in south sulawesi province in 2013 survey were household with two child under five apr124 95 ci 1113 pvalue 0006 maternal bmi apr 11 95 ci 10311 pvalue 0001 maternal weight apr 09 95 ci 094097 pvalue 0001 child aged 1223 month apr 22 95 ci 1727 pvalue 0001 child aged 2459 month apr 22 95 ci 1827 pvalue 0001 birthweight apr 19 95 ci 1525 pvalue 0001 in the 2018 survey the determinant were maternal weight apr 09 95 ci 098099 pvalue 0005 mother with no education or with education in primary school apr 15 95 ci 1319 pvalue 0001 mother with education in middle school apr 13 95 ci 1116 pvalue 0014 mother with a height less than 151 cm apr 13 95 ci 1531 pvalue 0001 mother with a height of 151160 cm apr 13 95 ci 1116 pvalue 0014 child aged 1223 month apr 22 95 ci 1728 pvalue 0001 child aged 2459 month apr 25 95 ci 2032 pvalue 0001 birthweight apr 15 95 ci 1219 pvalue 0001 the determinant of stunting in child under five in west sulawesi province in 2013 survey were child under five year living in poor household apr 19 95 ci 1133 pvalue 0021 child under five who lived in a household with three or more child under five apr18 95 ci 1227 pvalue 0002 child aged 1223 month apr 18 95 ci 1226 pvalue 0006 child aged 2459 month apr 19 95 ci 1327 pvalue 0001 on the 2018 survey the determinant were maternal bmi apr 102 95 ci 101103 pvalue 0004 maternal weight apr 09 95 ci 095098 pvalue 0001 mother with no education or with education in primary school apr 19 95 ci 1327 pvalue 0001 mother with education in middle school apr 19 95 ci 1327 pvalue 0001 mother with education in high school apr 18 95 ci 1226 pvalue 0004 child aged 1223 month apr 21 95 ci 1430 pvalue 0001 child aged 2459 month apr 26 95 ci 1936 pvalue 0001 male apr 12 95 ci 10114 pvalue 0035 and acute respiratory infection ari apr 16 95 ci 10425 pvalue 0030 conclusion the determinant of stunting in child under five in south sulawesi province are number of child under five in the household maternal education maternal weight maternal height maternal bmi child age and birthweight meanwhile the determinant of stunting in child under five in west sulawesi were wealth maternal education maternal weight maternal bmi child age child sex and history of acute respiratory infection hence intervention on household and child level a well a maternal sociodemographic factor need to be addressed

processed_title: the difference in development between stunting and normal child at the age of 372 month
processed_abstract: introduction globally there were around 22 of child under the age of 5 suffer from stunting the asian region contributes around 218 of the world stunting case this study aim to looked at the difference in development between stunted and normal child at the age of 372 month material and method this type of research used an analytic observational approach with a crosssectional design the research variable were the child development and stunting the sample were 130 respondent data were analysed with chisquare test result the result showed that stunted child were 5525 time more at risk of getting deviateddoubtful development screening result than normal child or 5525 95 ci 248812268 pvalue 0001 conclusion it can be concluded that there were developmental difference between stunted child and normal child

processed_title: association of maternal education with nutritional outcome of poor child with stunting in indonesia
processed_abstract: the consequence of poverty and food insecurity can indirectly contribute to obesity longterm effect of stunting child may be the risk factor for overweight and obesity in the poor in indonesia the role of parental education is also associated with overweight and obesity in child this study aimed to observe the risk of stunted child becoming overweight and obese based on maternal education among poor people in indonesia this study involved three cohort design cohort 1 is a 14year cohort and two 7year cohort for cohort 2 and 3 we used secondary longitudinal data from indonesian family life survey ifls 3 2000 ifls 4 2007 and ifls 5 2014 after stratification by high maternal education and economic status of the family there is an increased risk of stunting child becoming overweight and obese with a risk ratio of 2 in cohort 1 and 169 in cohort 2 these result showed that stunted child with higheducation mother and lived in the lowincome family have a 169 to 2 time higher risk of becoming overweight and obese thus the importance of primary education and health education for woman to increase childrens health in the future

processed_title: path analysis model for preventing stunting in dryland area island east nusa tenggara province indonesia
processed_abstract: background the problem of stunting is still a fundamental problem in indonesia human development east nusa tenggara province is an archipelago dryland area where in 20072021 it ha contributed to the highest number of stunting child prevalence in indonesia this study aim to determine the relationship of variable in individual household and district level with the prevalence of stunting method this type of research is observational study with a cross sectional design this study used individual secondary data from the indonesian nutritional status survey in 2021 consisting of 7835 toddler and national social economics survey 2021 result this research found that both specific sensitive intervention program had an influence in accelerating the decline in stunting prevalence higher score on z score result also revealed the positive influence of the food access variable on nutritional intake the result of the path analysis test showed that sensitive intervention program variable have a positive effect on food access variable and environmental variable environmental sanitation such a the habit of open defecation and healthcare there wa significant relationship on disease history environment and intake to height for age haz score conclusion in conclusion direct and indirect factor have important role to prevent stunting sensitive and specific intervention program food access macro determinant and environment are the indirect indicator which contribute significantly to the stunting the risk of child under five year old experiencing malnourished nutritional status increase with a history of infectious disease diarrhea ari worm the risk of child under five year experiencing malnourished nutritional status decrease with adequate nutritional intake it is hoped that there will be a special model of stunting control intervention at the individual level and at the family household and district level that are integrated and of high quality through multisectoral cooperation in the dryland area of the island of east nusa tenggara province

processed_title: maternal feeding practice and it relationship with stunting in child
processed_abstract: the incidence of stunting in child is a crucial problem that remains challenging to tackle and is caused by multiple factor this study aimed to determine the relationship between maternal feeding practice and the incidence of stunting in child in depok indonesia the study design wa a correlation analysis with a crosssectional approach including applied heightforage zscore table from the world health organization who and a feeding practice and structure questionnaire fpsq 28 the study involved 262 participant who were selected using a cluster random sampling technique in 11 district health center in depok the result suggest that there wa no significant relationship between maternal feeding practice and the incidence of stunting in child in depok p005 in addition feeding practice performed by mother wa rather nonresponsive the study result are expected to provide benefit for nurse and health professional in order to improve health education and promotion program related to stunting and responsive feeding practice

processed_title: eating behavior and caries experience in child with growth stunting
processed_abstract: objective stunting is the impaired growth and development child experience from chronic malnutrition and repeated infection that cause longterm damage malnutrition for a long time will affect the shape and composition of bone and teeth making child more vulnerable to dental health problem preschooler with sufficiently active consumption can choose the food they like delightful food so that it can increase the risk of caries based on data from the bandung city health office in 2019 161 toddler 2543 in sukawarna village experienced stunting this study analyzed the relationship between eating behavior and caries experience in stunting child in sukawarna village sukajadi district material and method this study us a quantitative descriptive research method with a secondary data analysis approach from the documentation of the universitas padjadjaran academic leadership grant data with the title aspect of jaw growthdevelopment and family approach in early detection and prevention of stunting sampling used purposive sampling specifically for preschool child with a sample size of 80 respondent the data obtained will be processed and then analyzed using the spearman rank correlation statistical test result sixtythree percent of respondent have poor eating behavior and the majority 8035 have cavity due to caries decay spearman rank correlation coefficient is 0145 and significance is 00983 conclusion overall eating behavior is related to the caries experience in stunting child consumption of cariogenic food influence the caries experience

processed_title: maternal complication during pregnancy and risk factor for stunting
processed_abstract: background stunting can be prevented by early detection when the mother is pregnant early detection can be carried out by looking for risk factor of stunting during pregnancy so that intervention can be early detected this study aim to assess complication during pregnancy disease and infection and risk factor associated with stunting material and method the type of research wa observational analytic with a casecontrol design on 450 mother who were selected with simple random sampling 150 mother who have stunting baby aged 02 month and 300 mother who have not stunting baby aged 02 month in malang regency indonesia this study used secondary data by looking at medical record namely laboratory examination in the mother book and cohort record at the public health center this study wa conducted from december 2021 to august 2022 bivariate analysis with chisquare and multivariate logistic regression wa carried out to determine the variable that most influenced the incidence of stunting result the result of multivariate analysis with logistic regression of maternal complication during pregnancy which are a risk a a factor causing stunting are sexually transmitted infection stis odds ratio or 636 95 confidence interval ci 2971362 coronavirus disease 2019 covid19 accompanied by pneumonia or 512 95 ci 18714052 human immunodeficiency virusacquired immunodeficiency syndrome hivaids or 463 95 ci 1101959 hepatitis b or 397 95 ci 125312565 preeclampsia or 388 95 ci 181830 and heart disease or 3373 95 ci 0991140 conclusion after recognizing the maternal factor that cause stunting intervention should immediately be carried out on pregnant woman with disease preeclampsia and heart disease and infection sti covid19 pneumonia hivaids and hepatitis b to prevent stunting early

processed_title: malnutrition in early life and it neurodevelopmental and cognitive consequence a scoping review
processed_abstract: the negative impact of stunting and severe underweight on cognitive neurodevelopment of child is well documented however the effect of overweightobesity is still unclear the 2018 global nutrition report reported that stunting and overweight concurrently affect 189 million child worldwide a existing review discus undernutrition and overweightobesity separately this scoping review aim to document the impact of mildmoderate and severe underweight stunting and overweightobesity among child aged 060 month on their cognitive neurodevelopmental trajectory twentysix article were analysed to extract significant information from literature retrieved from pubmed and cochrane database published from 1 january 2009 to 31 october 2019 length gain is associated with cognitive neurodevelopment in normonourished and stunted child aged under 24 month among stunted child it seems that cognitive and neurodevelopmental deficit can potentially be recovered before 8 year of age particularly in those whose nutritional status ha improved the impact of overweightobesity on cognitive neurodevelopment appears to be limited to attention gross motor skill and executive control parental education level birth weightlength breastfeeding duration and sanitation level are some identifiable factor that modify the impact of undernutrition and overweightobesity on cognitive and neurodevelopment in conclusion underweight stunting and overweightobesity have a significant impact on cognitive neurodevelopment multidimensional approach with various stakeholder should address all issue simultaneously such a improving sanitation level assuring parental job security and adequate social welfare and providing access to adequate nutrient for catchup growth among underweight or stunted child and to affordable healthy food for those who are overweightobese and from low socioeconomic status

processed_title: chicken liver and eggshell cracker a a safe and affordable animal source food for overcoming micronutrient deficit during pregnancy and lactation in indonesia a doubleblind randomised placebocontrolled trial sistik growth study
processed_abstract: background indonesia rank fifth in term of the number of stunted child and there ha been little change in the stunting prevalence in the last decade in earlier observational study conducted in 20142015 we identified several key underlying problem with the potential to impact stunting in sumedang district west java indonesia deficit in intake of growthlimiting micronutrient were observed most notably calcium iron zinc and vitamin a emphasizing the need for a foodbased intervention to overcome these micronutrient deficit in the diet of mother and their infant method a doubleblind placebocontrolled cluster randomised trial comparing the effect of daily consumption of 75 gram of locally produced micronutrientenriched cracker mec intervention group compared to placebo cracker control group by mother at twotime interval i from the 814 week of pregnancy to delivery ie 2834 week of consumption of mec on birth length and ii from the 814 week of pregnancy to 5 month postpartum on attained linear growth and linear growth velocity of breastfed infant a total of 324 pregnant woman from 28 cluster village located in 3 subdistricts in sumedang district west java indonesia will be randomly assigned to either intervention n14 village or control n14 village discussi on this will be the first study in indonesia to use cracker based on powdered eggshell and chicken liver in a form which is acceptable safe and ha a long shelf life if daily consumption of mec for 6 month during pregnancy can enhance birth length or their continued daily consumption for 5 month postpartum improves both attained and incremental linear growth at 5 month of age then scalingup in indonesia may be considered trial registration httpsclinicaltrialsgovct2shownct04564222 25 th september 2020
